Address: 1168 Hamilton Street Unit 104 Vancouver, BC V6B 2S2 Canada
Review: Busy place - strongly suggest a reservation. Great Happy Hour menu, good service. Fish was nicely prepared, and paella had lots of seafood in a very small portion.

Address: 1168 Hamilton Street Unit 104 Vancouver, BC V6B 2S2 Canada
Review: I recommend Squid is the best part. I ordered garlic bread to eat with Mussel dish was nice. Only the Risotto not impress, can put more flavour/texture is not reached. Overall is great!

Address: 1168 Hamilton Street Unit 104 Vancouver, BC V6B 2S2 Canada
Review:
I really enjoyed my lunch at this cozy little place in beautiful Yaletown, Vancouver today!
They have a great selection on their menu and their lunch prices are reasonable. What really stood out for me was their warm, attentive and professional service. From the beginning to the end. The host made us feel very welcome and our server took very good care of us the whole time. Due to the winter wonderland feel and all the snow I felt I need to start things off with a nice cup of coffee. I loved the coffee. It was JJ Bean and piping hot and served in a sparkling cup.....exactly the way I like it.

We had the Pulled Pork Sandwich and the Chicken cutlets.
I loved the pulled pork, juicy and well seasoned with a nice crisp fresh ceasar salad and a slice of gherkin with the meal which was a nice touch. I love gherkins!

I also tried the Chicken cutlet which was beautifully cooked. Tender with the batter seasoned just on point and the mash was a perfect pairing.
"I MEAN WHO DOESN'T LIKE GREAT MASH?!"

Next time I'm going for the muscles! ;)

Address: 1168 Hamilton Street Unit 104 Vancouver, BC V6B 2S2 Canada
Review:
Ambiance is great with a great mixture of wood and metal, light and dark, hard and soft. To drink I had their homemade ginger beer which was tangy and a hint sweet. For dinner, I ordered the short rib with a side of the corn. Both were outstanding! The short rib was served with the bone marrow which was an interesting touch. I didn't care for the marrow alone, but when I added a little piece to the meat, it was a brilliant combination! The corn was superb too .... sweet, but spicy due to the jalapeños. Definitely fresh corn too because I had to pull a string from my teeth :-)  Would definitely recommend this place!

Check it out, Vancouver!

Address: 1168 Hamilton Street Unit 104 Vancouver, BC V6B 2S2 Canada
Review: We went to the Flying Pig for dinner last night and were so impressed by the incredible food and service that we went again for dinner tonight. Whilst travelling through Canada for the past weeks this was most definitely the BEST meals we have had! The menu is outstanding and so is the quality of the food and drinks. Bailey was our server both nights and is an absolute delight. She was warm and genuine and has an excellent knowledge of the menu. Definitely a place we would highly recommend to everyone!

Address: 871 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: During my 5-day stay in Vancouver, I couldn't resist visiting the lovely Japanese restaurant not once, but twice. Its authentic flavors, serene ambiance, and impeccable service left an indelible mark. A fusion of traditional and contemporary elements made it a standout experience in Vancouver's vibrant culinary scene.

Address: 871 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: The restaurant caught our attention when we walked by the restaurant around 11:50am - people were lining up for the restaurant to open at noon. We were lucky to get the bar seating. It’s not a huge restaurant and some tables were reserved for customers who made advanced reservations. We ordered hot green tea, Stone-Grilled Beef Tongue, Beef Tenderloin Steak Bowl, Sizzling Stone Pork Kakuni Bowl, and all of them were delicious! Great meat quality and well prepared dishes. It’s a restaurant running by Japanese with great foods and services. I highly recommend this place with advanced reservation.

Address: 871 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: It was my first time visiting the Japanese restaurant Kingyo, the food was absolutely good, and the service was no problem. Only one thing they limited table time to just one hour, my friends and I just had a quick drink, quick eating. Everything kinda super rushes, like eating fast food.

Address: 871 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: Was excited to come due to good reviews however was very disappointed. It is definitely overrated. The food is so so. Pictures look good but not the taste. We spent about $200 3 adults and 1 kid. dinner menu is diff then lunch. A lot of food are not available during dinner. I wouldn’t want to come back enough said.

Address: 871 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: We ordered four items as shown in the photos. The salad is the best. The sashimi is the second. The ramen was not bad. Just that the beef was a bit chewy. The pressed salmon sushi wasn’t very good. Too much rice and the rice was not fresh. The place was packed. Fun environment.

Address: 200 Granville Street Suite 70 Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4 Canada
Review:
Wow... Wow... Wow... bite after bite was a sublime experience in what Japanese fine dining can be.  Miku is a five star experience that deserves your visit.

The modern restaurant is beautiful, clean, and perfectly maintained.  We recommend sitting on the patio where you can either people watch or gaze over the harbour.  Inside tables offer window views or a view of the open kitchen.  It's all beautiful and adds to the experience.

Service is professional, friendly, and gracious.  We followed our server's recommendations and that was the right choice.  A team of people keeps the meal moving along and provides explanations of what you are eating.

However, the food is the star here and that is how it should be.  The flavors are carefully paired here and you will want to give those flavors a chance to delight your palette.  This is NOT sushi to be dunked in soya sauce.  I think you will also be delighted by how their cocktails complement the food choices.

Put Miku on your "special meal out" list and make an evening of it.  This is one of Vancouver's dining gems and certainly the best Japanese cuisine I have eaten.  I think you will agree.

Address: 200 Granville Street Suite 70 Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4 Canada
Review:
It is the most elegant sushi I had. The fish melts in your mouth! What an amazing culinary experience!
The service was friendly and the Sake recommandation was spot on… not cheap, but since the meal was so refined it called for a lush and polished taste.

Address: 200 Granville Street Suite 70 Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4 Canada
Review: I came here with my parents. Had an amazing experience. Steak and sushi were so good!!! Desert was delicious. Recommend the green tea opera desert!!    Servers were so nice as well. 5 star worthy!!!

Address: 200 Granville Street Suite 70 Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4 Canada
Review: Super awesome restaurant with really great staff. We ordered the tasting menu and it was amazing, but maybe one course too long. It was a lot of very delicious food but after the 4th course it just became a lot, and we didn’t end up eating some of the dishes because we were so full. The atmosphere in the restaurant is amazing and the fish artwork on the wall is beautiful. Super great cocktails and wine list.

Address: 200 Granville Street Suite 70 Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4 Canada
Review: Upon entering the restaurant for a evening dinner date, it was quite spacious and I saw a sign that the restaurant was one of the nominees for a Michelin star. The lighting in the room isn't very flattering if you take pictures of your group but at least the food had decent lighting. The server we had was friendly and knowledgeable about recommendations. We ended up getting the platter, sashimi, salad, and brussel sprout appetizer to share between 2 people. When the food arrived, the portion size was really small but it was to be expected of a upscale restaurant.  The taste was fresh but I felt like other Japanese restaurants I've tried were above in quality and taste so it was really nothing special that jumped out at me. Perhaps only the sashimi presentation was unique with the cool ice mist. I guess I should've ordered more because I was left feeling hungry still but my date had a budget and I didn't want to scare him away with my huge appetite. Next time I'd like to try the lunch menu instead.

Address: 1128 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1B2 Canada
Review:
The restaurant is known for its authentic Korean cuisine, which is prepared with the freshest ingredients and cooked to perfection. The dishes are bursting with flavor and have a unique blend of spices that will tantalize your taste buds. From traditional Korean BBQ to savory stews and soups, there is something for everyone on the menu.

In addition to the delicious food, the service at Kosoo is excellent. The staff is friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu, providing an exceptional dining experience for guests. However, as the restaurant is quite popular, it is recommended to make a reservation in advance to avoid any disappointment.

Overall, Kosoo Korean restaurant is an excellent choice for those who love Korean cuisine and are looking for a high-quality dining experience. The food is exceptional, the service is top-notch, and the atmosphere is lively and enjoyable. It's a must-try for anyone visiting Vancouver, Canada.

Address: 1128 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1B2 Canada
Review:
We had the beef brisket skillet, and it was absolutely amazing, made many lettuce wraps and enjoyed it with rice.
It was all delicious and there's little room for improvement because it was pretty much perfect!
Would go again and would highly recommend this place.

Address: 1128 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1B2 Canada
Review:
Had a great experience here, the beef brisket skillet was amazing, fried chicken was crispy and crunchy, yet sauced and flavourful, the miso soup was refreshing, and the beef gimbap was great value.
Rose tteokbokki was good, subtle flavour with a lot of cheese.
Improvements I'd suggest would be how the fried chicken shell was a little thick, sides could've been presented in bigger dishes for less refills, and the gimbap didn't taste the most fresh, though it was still good.

Address: 1128 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1B2 Canada
Review: Excellent experience we had here at this restaurant.  Tasty food and good portion size.  Service was quite decent as well.  We especially appreciated the taste of Korean style sausage.  Also the broth of army stew was rich.  Parking is available behind the building for $3 an hour.  We will return soon to try their other dishes.  Overall, this is a pretty nice Korean restaurant to try if you are in the area.

Address: 1128 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1B2 Canada
Review:
First off, I have to say that the fried chicken at Kosoo is absolutely delicious. The batter is perfectly crispy and crunchy, while the meat inside remains tender and juicy. They offer a variety of flavors, including original, soy garlic, spicy, and honey butter, so there's something for everyone. I particularly enjoyed the soy garlic flavor, which had just the right amount of sweetness and savory garlic flavor.

In addition to the fried chicken, Kosoo also offers a variety of other Korean dishes that are equally delicious. The bibimbap is a standout, with a flavorful mix of rice, vegetables, and protein that is sure to satisfy. The side dishes, such as the kimchi and pickled radish, are also great.

The service at Kosoo is friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere is casual and cozy. The restaurant is relatively small, so it can get quite busy during peak hours, but the wait is usually not too long.

Overall, I highly recommend Kosoo for anyone looking for delicious Korean fried chicken and other Korean dishes in Vancouver. The food is top-notch, the service is excellent, and the atmosphere is welcoming.

Address: 1719 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C8 Canada
Review:
Quality: 4
Quantity: 4
Price: 4
Taste: 4
Service: 4

I loved this place. We may have ordered a bit too much food, but we really wanted to get a good spread of the menu. I had come in once years ago and can confirm it was just as good as I remember it.

I’d recommend coming in with friends if possible, as the dining can accommodate it easily and it’s best to get a variety of meals. I’d say 1.5 orders per person is probably the ratio to go with. Anything more, and you might be bussin out of your pants.

I’d recommend to check it out

Address: 1719 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C8 Canada
Review: Average taste but they give small portions. The soup dumplings are the smallest I have seen. Excellent friendly service.

Address: 1719 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C8 Canada
Review: More than a dumpling restaurant. Everything I ordered taste great. Definitely will come back.

Address: 1719 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C8 Canada
Review:
We had rolls, dumplings, xiao long baos, fried rice and some rice rolls, which was fantastic.

Though I dont recommend shiumai  in particular, the food was amazing.

Be mindful there is an intermission at 2:30, where you’re not allowed to br inside the restaurant.

I would still come again since I respect the house rule and like the food.

Address: 1719 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C8 Canada
Review: There's a reason why it's packed and there's a line up outside! My first time and I went because I read out their Soup Dumplings being the best in the city. To my surprise it wasn't actual soup with Dumplings in it haha but actual Dumplings filled with soup. They were so good and why they are listed as #1 in Canada. I also had the wonton in hot and sour sauce and my stomach was very happy..and warm! Just go to this place. Everyone around you is just taken back by how fast the service is but more so how amazing the food is!!

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review:
The pork, chicken, shrimp katsu is very juicy and tender on the inside. The outside is crunchy and not oily. The sauce is great but sprinkling salt and sesame seems to bring out meat taste more. Do not recommend the white fish as it was slightly soggy at the bottom and the fish was quite tough in the middle. Other white fish I had before is very fluffy and light with a gentle sweetness to it. This one was briny only.

Presentation of the food is great. Seating is wonderfully spacious. Service is quite attentive and friendly.

All in all it was a very pleasant experience. Slightly on the expensive side.

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: Decided to come here for a late lunch, but even then, the place is still packed. Very popular and I could see why. We got the Zenbu set and it was a lot of food for 2 people. It was so good though. Esp the fatty pork and scallop. Also have to mention the salad. Seems very simple but the dressing is amazing. Service was just fine but the atmosphere was really nice. Will come back for sure.

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: I am absolutely smitten with the culinary delights offered at this remarkable Japanese restaurant. However, what truly sets it apart is the exceptional team of individuals who work here. The waitstaff exhibited unmatched friendliness, going above and beyond by attentively checking on my friend and me throughout the dining experience. Their genuine care and attentiveness truly left a lasting impression. Kudos to this establishment for fostering such a warm and caring environment!

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: Very pleasant and friendly.  Food was fantastic. The chicken breast was prepared very well, hot and tasted fresh.    The soft drink was a bit of novelty but tasted good (strawberry).   The waiter we had was always smiling and very pleasant.  The place was quite as most patrons despite the place being full most of our visit spoke in low voices.

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: Nice little quaint place. Staff were super friendly and service was fast. Free refills on the salad , rice, and soup though we didn’t need it. Our water was always refilled and they did such a tremendous job while we dined there. Katsu was so juicy and tender! I love how they have the gravy baits too. I’d highly recommend.

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: The food here is amazing however the Broadway location is not equipped for large parties. We had 9 people and was told we would be able to sit together but on separate tables. Unfortunately the tables were really far apart and those on the ends of the table could not talk to each other until after dinner. Aside from that, our dinner itself was good. I ordered the cheese Katsu with a side of curry to share with my husband. Miso soup and salad is refillable and we ordered it twice. Add the curry, you won't regret it :)

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: I really enjoyed my meal here. Everything part of the dish was very delicious and so intricate with detail. Simple but tasty. Friendly servers. Price point was on the higher side for the full meals but the taste and portion is well worth the total at the end. You can get unlimited sides too I believe.

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: Saku is certainly worth trying! We ordered the chicken breast katsu with curry and the regular chicken breast katsu - both were great and the service is top notch. The curry was unique and they provide a generous amount which you can share with your party. The side salad and miso soup were perfect additions to the deep fried main dishes, and they’re also unlimited which was nice. The staff are super friendly and the prices seemed fair given the portions.

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review:
I've been to Saku Broadway and Saku Robson, and both restaurants are a 10/10 for me. The cheese katsu is immaculate, and it comes with all these little extras like soup, salad, flavoured salt, mustard. The extras are u limited too! So if you want more soup or salad just ask for it! 😋 The salad dressing they have is delicious too. 🥗

The servers at the Broadway location were incredibly helpful they would come by our table every 5-10 minutes to ask if we wanted more food or to refill our water. 💧

The price is quite expensive but that's the price of living in Vancouver these days. You do get a good amount of food for the price you're paying. 👍

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: First time trying Nabe Katau at Saku. I prefer the regular (Rosu/Hire) katsu more than this soup-y dish. Anyway it’s good for my throat when I needed something warm and not oily.

Address: 1698 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C7 Canada
Review: Went here on for a Saturday lunch and it wasn’t super busy. The ambiance was quiet and cozy. As for food, we got a few dishes to share. The tuna tataki was a bit of a letdown as it didn’t taste fresh. But pleasantly surprised by the beef tendon curry.

Address: 1698 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C7 Canada
Review: Always an amazing time here. Been coming here for over a decade. Super to see them survive this long and still going strong. Great good, staff, service, food and drinks. What more do you want. Always fun and energetic ambience. Always busy too. Like I said, been coming here for a long time and I plan to keep coming back. Highly recommend

Address: 1698 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C7 Canada
Review: Came here for some tapas before we went to the beach. Service was quick & friendly, and the food was fast & delicious! We ordered a few things here we haven’t tried before and a couple of our usuals. The grilled pork cheek was my favourite. Presentation could be a little better & the seats outside were a bit dirty (grease from what I assume to be previous customers were not wiped off) but it’s an Izakaya so not a ton of marks taken off there.

Address: 1698 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C7 Canada
Review: An authentic slice of the Rising Sun in British Columbia, Guu with Garlic is located in downtown Vancouver B.C. at the north end of trendy Robson Street. Walk inside and immediately feel like you're in a Tokyo neighborhood restaurant. Hungry for sushi? Look elsewhere. This place serves authentic Izakaya style small plate cooked delights like Takoyaki, Yaki-Udon, Kara-age chicken, Tuna Tataki, etc. High quality ingredients, friendly, patient, professional & helpful service; highly recommended! Support your local small businesses & restaurants 👍 😋

Address: 1698 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C7 Canada
Review: Small establishment. It was quite busy so my friend and I sat at the corner of the “bar” next to the wall. It was a bit of a squeeze. Thankfully they have hangers on the wall behind to hang coats. Could be a hassle going in and out depending where you are sitting because everyone will have to get up. Anyway, EVERY item ordered was delicious! Started off with the Assorted Oden w/ Soup. It was quite cold outside so I found it quite comforting and the soup was light. I had never had boiled daikon before. It was quite delicious. I wasn’t too crazy about the hard boiled egg though. It was over cooked because the yolk was green and very dry. I thought the Kimchi Cucumber was going to be red and spicy. But not at all. Perhaps I’m ignorant to the fact that not all kimchi means spicy? It was ok. Mildly sweet and sour. The Kakuni Stewed Pork Belly was absolutely amazing. The meat was so tender and came with another boiled/stewed daikon which I ate to myself 😅 The poached egg was good. The soy sauce gave it a nice flavor. As for the Assorted 5Kinds sashimi plate, I really enjoyed the Yellowtail. The scallops were good also. Actually tasted the sweetness and I’m no sushi connoisseur. The Carbonara Udon was interesting. I have never had carbonara before but I did enjoy it with udon noodles. It just tasted like a creamy sauce over udon noodles. I didn’t get a chance to try it before the egg was mixed in. I enjoyed it nonetheless. The final dish, Pan Fried Pork Intestines. I really enjoyed this dish and so did my friend. She ate 3/4 of the plate to herself!! It would have been nice if we had rice. This dish I highly recommend! I found out that each Guu has their own specialty which I thought was interesting. I would love to come back to this one for the other menu items before going to the other locations. I highly recommend this place. Probably not good for large parties though.

Address: 1944 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review: Food here was pretty delicious for the most part, I really liked the beet tartare and the gnocchi with pork belly. My boyfriend ordered the medium rare duck and it had an interesting flavor. Drinks were pretty good too, we ordered a st.patricks day sour with charcoal which was really tasty. Also our server was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu, really great service here! This restaurant is a bit on the expensive side though

Address: 1944 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review:
Try the house-made mocktails! Best I've had - "No-groni" was complex, aromatic, and refreshing. The pineapple-gin-spritz was flavorful, not sweet, with a peppery finish.
The Butcher's cut was already beautifully seasoned with herbs that really enhanced the flavor, but then the "pepper jam" ginger reduction was absolutely to die for - rich, sticky flavor explosions with every mouthful. The bok choy greens and miso potatoes were the perfect accompaniment. Both desserts were wonderful - rhubarb with strawberry curd in blueberry-balsamic ice cream melded amazing flavors together under a toasted meringue top, while the bittersweet chocolate orange with graham cake was a satisfying and rich blend without being heavy or too sweet.

Address: 1944 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review:
This is an acclaimed restaurant located in the Kitsilano area, has been awarded the prestigious Michelin Bib Gourmand. Renowned for its farm-to-table concept, Fable Kitchen is committed to utilizing locally sourced, sustainable, and seasonal ingredients. The restaurant's cozy and rustic space exudes a warm and inviting atmosphere. Perfect for casual hangout to a romantic date night.

The menu at Fable Kitchen is a culinary delight, featuring a diverse range of dishes that celebrate the natural flavors and freshness of the ingredients. Recently, they have launched new items with creative twists and unique flavors that are sure to tantalize the taste buds.

Beyond the food, Fable Kitchen also boasts an extensive wine list featuring both local and international wines, as well as craft cocktails and locally brewed beers.

Address: 1944 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review: Has the ambience of a diner and a popular restaurant. That’s pretty unique. Loved watching the live kitchen do their thing while eating my breakfast. They were kind enough to cater substitutes for my dairy allergy. Streak bacon was delish, highly recommend it with your eggs. As someone who never ate yolks (raw or runny) and always loved it mixed in (scrambled/cooked in/over hard), I have no remorse for all you patrons who enjoy Bennies. They did however look extremely appetizing.

Address: 1944 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review: Brunch time on a Saturday is really busy in Kitsilano so it was good that we made a reservation in advance. Food was good, I loved my dish which was one of the daily features, don't remember the name but it had hash potatoes with mushroom, chorizo sausage, Swiss cheese, 2 poached eggs and bread. Prices go with the market. Service left behind my expectations, the server was not taking notes of the orders and like we were imagining she forgot some items. Not a bad experience but for sure not a remarkable one.

Restaurant_name: Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market
Address: 762 Cambie St Vancouver, BC V6B 2P2 Canada
Review: A few years back, I had a truly enjoyable lunch at Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market. The oysters were the highlight, remarkably fresh and reasonably priced. The staff were helpful and friendly, making the entire dining experience even better. Overall, it was a great meal that left a lasting impression. I'd recommend Fanny Bay to anyone looking for quality oysters on a budget.

Restaurant_name: Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market
Address: 762 Cambie St Vancouver, BC V6B 2P2 Canada
Review: After checking online for the best seafood we found the reviews of this place good. But when we reached there & had one of the BEST SEAFOOD we will definitely go there again. Service is great Shana was a gem of a person with whom we talked long & her friend guided us through what to choose & have. White wine was great worth every penny. As a tourist we want food which will touch our heart & carry sweet memories back… this was one of it.

Restaurant_name: Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market
Address: 762 Cambie St Vancouver, BC V6B 2P2 Canada
Review:
Absolutely impeccable service. I was welcomed immediately and straightforward to my seat at the bar. Then came the oyster education. Awesome. I had three minutes until happy hour was up. The server generously said that I shouldn’t worry, they would have my order in within the happiest of hours.

Delicious, fresh, ocean fragrant oysters!

Get the fish tacos. Best anywhere.

Be here for happy hour. It’s the best in the city. Just make sure you’re here before three minutes to six!!! I simply had to order a second round.

Restaurant_name: Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market
Address: 762 Cambie St Vancouver, BC V6B 2P2 Canada
Review: This place- 5 stars all around. Amazing food. Period. But even better is the staff. Andrew and Adanary are among the top people I've ever encountered at a restaurant anywhere on earth. The seafood is fresh, and they literally sell live prawns. Oysters are a must here and happy hour is a steal. Sit at the bar and meet the local crew. Seldom do I find a place where I am greeted and treated as family. Pro tip to the owner- you've hired amazingly.

Restaurant_name: Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market
Address: 762 Cambie St Vancouver, BC V6B 2P2 Canada
Review: A hidden gem. Have driven by this location quite often and had no idea what was behind this unassuming exterior. Nice modern interior, excellent friendly staff. We came here for the dine-out experience and had a delicious meal. Each of the appetizer, main, and desert selections was very tasty. The seafood was fresh, the oysters had a nice fresh taste, even the lettuce was fresh and crisp which is more difficult during January. Also a big surprise was the size of each portion. Usually during the dine-out events, the serving portions are more like for a tasting menu. The portions they served were large, probably their normal serving size. So a very good meal at an excellent value.

Address: 4172 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P7 Canada
Review: Had a wonderful meal last night at this restaurant. Their menu was very extensive. We ordered a few familiar items and they were amazing. Everything was perfectly seasoned. Service was good and we didn’t feel rushed on a Saturday night.

Address: 4172 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P7 Canada
Review: Ordered 2 starters, one curry, garlic naan and a side rice and everything exceeded my expectations. Although the atmosphere inside was really nice, we opted to sit on the street patio and loved it. The servers were very attentive and all the food was so fresh and flavourful! 11/10 recommend, will definitely be back!

Address: 4172 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P7 Canada
Review: We decided to order from Sula on Main.  The food was delicious.  Garlic and potato naan picked up the sauces well.   The lamb and chicken were tender and the spicy level good.  Food arrived hot.  Highly recommend!

Address: 4172 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P7 Canada
Review:
First time dining at Sula on Main Street with my family. We had family visiting from California with us. They wanted to have Indian food on their last night in Vancouver, so we took them here.
I'm so glad Sula was able to accommodate a last minute reservation for 7 people.

The food is amazing! We had Tandoori Wings, Vegetable Pakoras, and Paneer Fingers as appetizers. We shared 2 pitchers of Rose Sangria.

We had Lamb Korma, Chicken Biryani, Chicken Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken, Saag Paneer and Coconut Rice for our main dishes.

For dessert, we ordered Gulab Jamun and the Ras Malai Cake.

Everything was presented beautifully. The food tasted  fantastic! Everything was perfectly seasoned and spiced.  The curries were rich and creamy.

Oh and that Garlic Cheese Naan is divine! We actually ordered more of that to go.

Our relatives were so impressed. They said the food they had at Sula was better than the Indian food  they had in California.

We sat out on their covered patio which was very nice and comfortable. The interior of the restaurant is lovely too.

The service was very good and attentive.
I'll definitely be back.

I highly recommend this restaurant!

Address: 4172 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P7 Canada
Review:
Food was pretty good, however the service was disappointing.
Took 20 minutes for a waits-person to approach our table, another 30 minutes for the food, no one checked up on us for the next 30 minutes eventhough we wanted to order more stuff.
We were initially offered a plate with a bug on it, which grossed me out and isnt acceptable as we were one of the only 2 tables of customers in the store ( would have been ok if it was busy, but it wasnt)
Took over 10 minutes for catch the attention of someone to get new plates. They replaced the plates & offered no apology.

Overall, the foods good but it isnt worth the waiting and the lack of service.

We've previously ordered through online platforms, but the food arrived bland and messy , however, in in-person dining, the food tasted good. Would probably recommend one of their other locations over this one.

Address: 244 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7 Canada
Review: Visited about 3 weeks ago on vacation with family. Service was great, we didn't make a reservation but probably should have. The hostess was very helpful, seated us when the table was ready, helped take our orders and helped us decide what to order when we were torn between a few items. The food came out quickly and everything was delicious. The pork chops were flavorful, fried chicken wings were really good, and the rest of the food did not disappoint!

Address: 244 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7 Canada
Review:
Always amazing food at Phnom Penh! The chicken wings are to die for, it's a MUST when you come here to eat. I usually get a large order of wings for each person. That's how good these are.

The butter beef is another must order here. It's so good on its own.

Beef Luc Lac is another must try dish here. You can order it with white rice. This time I tried it with fried rice and it's seriously delicious. Fried rice, with fried egg on top. You have to have to try it.

I think everyone knows by now that this place is a must try, whether you're a foodie or not. I've been coming here for years and they never disappoint!

Food is always amazing, service is always great, and this time we didn't even have to line up to get a table, which is a huge bonus!!

Address: 244 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7 Canada
Review:
We got in at 11am when it’s open. The restaurant is filled quickly within the first 15 minutes. Food quality is a lot better than takeout - the deep fried chicken wings with lemon butter sauce can retain the crispness. The lemongrass pork tastes great and the combination C offers a variety of choices. Overall, very good food and will visit again.
Warning - I feel very thirsty the afternoon after dining there. They might have used MSG in their food.

Address: 244 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7 Canada
Review: A friend took us here to this restaurant when we visited Vancouver and it was quite the treat. The food was excellent all around and my whole family really enjoyed the durian milkshake. The chicken wings were my favourite. They also had a few stir fried options for the vegetarians as well (lotus stems, snow pea tips, etc...)

Address: 244 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7 Canada
Review:
All the good was perfect, no complaints here. Went with mostly all the house favourites. And tried some of the other items. Definitely recommend try the
-Beef butter marinate(sweet soy sauce with onions, ginger, a lot of cilantro/parsley)
-Phnom Pheh pho was also good
-Deep fried chicken wings. A nice sweet and crispy but also came with a good size portion of lemon pepper sauce to dip your wings in.

Address: 1095 Hamilton St Vancouver, BC V6B 5T4 Canada
Review: Celebrated a birthday dinner with my boyfriend and it was an impeccable experience! Antoine was a fantastic server, he was very knowledgeable and attentive at the right times. He answered all our questions and helped us choose oysters too. Best service I have ever experienced. Food was very delicious too!

Address: 1095 Hamilton St Vancouver, BC V6B 5T4 Canada
Review:
Went for dinner last night and was absolutely blown away by the service. While the food was amazing, the service was incomparable! My friends and I had the pleasure of dining with Tara and her colleagues and this was by far my best dining experience in the city (and I'm a local)!

Tara was knowledgeable, attentive and just a pleasure to be around. From the moment we arrived we were warmly greeted and never once did we have to try and seek her attention as she was always checking in. Any time someone left the table, her and her team were quick ensure settings and napkins remained tidy and presentable upon our arrival back. Tara explained the menu in detail and was quick to recommend food and beverage pairings that we were all pleased with. The food was beautifully presented, tasted great and everyone was satisfied.

While I don't have photos of everything we ordered, the raw oysters were fresh and sweet, prawns were plump and juicy, and sashimi was fresh and paired with an in house soy sauce. I ordered the beef tenderloin and asked for it to be cooked between medium rare and rare and it was cooked to perfection. It was tender, seared crisp on the outside and juicy on the inside. I also ordered the truffle fries as a side and will say you have to try them!

Tara is a gem and I want to thank her and the staff for creating such a welcoming atmosphere that was paired with amazing food! I don't know how it took me so long to come here but can definitely say I will be back.

Make your reservation now and thank me later!

Address: 1095 Hamilton St Vancouver, BC V6B 5T4 Canada
Review: The best thing about this restaurant is the ambiance and the service: lights dimmed to focus on the people you are eating with. As for food, my mixed ceviche was tender but needed a little bit more of lime, you could tell the quality of the sea food was excellent but needed more acid to make it more interesting. My chicken, with potatoes, was a bit undercooked and under seasoned, it also needed to build more flavour. Overall, it was a good enough experience.

Address: 1095 Hamilton St Vancouver, BC V6B 5T4 Canada
Review: A delicious dinner with excellent service from Liam. A great place to celebrate my wife’s birthday. The seafood plateau was a tasty appetizer sized just right for 2 people. Just love the special fork they have to aid diners with the assorted oysters, mussels, clams, and other tasty treats. The halibut was firm and juicy, and although the steak was medium rather than the medium-rare we requested, it was still juicy and very tasty. We didn’t leave much room for desert, so settled for tasty strawberry & raspberry lemon tarts. Highly recommended for a memorable night out.

Address: 1095 Hamilton St Vancouver, BC V6B 5T4 Canada
Review: Everything was phenomenal, but the sablefish was impeccable - the best fish we’ve ever tasted. It was cooked beautifully. In the past,the scallops and those are magnificent as well. I’m addition to the food, the service is professional and kind - we’re always well taken care of. I rarely give out five stars but this place never fails to impress us.

Address: 3388 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3M7 Canada
Review: A very unique and modern take on Vietnamese cuisine! The interior decor and outdoor patio are both really nicely decorated. Definitely feels different from the run of the mill pho joint. There's an expansive menu of different Vietnamese dishes. The items I tried were the shaken beef dish and the beef short rib rice, both of which were super tasty and had amazing presentation. Portions are decent and pricing is slightly higher, but that's to be expected given the quality and refined ambiance. Their mixed drinks were also tasty. Service was friendly and attentive. Would definitely come back to try their other dishes

Address: 3388 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3M7 Canada
Review: First time coming here,didn't book a table in advance to my demise. Staff are very friendly, great service all around. Waiter was very helpful with his recommendations. Starter was delicious and very well presented the prawn cakes. I risked it going for the spicy beef soup which was tasty and lots of meat/broth and my partner got the deconstructed vermicelli noodles which were very tasty and again, big portion!  Will go back again as vibe in there was cool and food is worth trying.

Address: 3388 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3M7 Canada
Review: Love the Vietnamese vibe here. The servers are energetic and friendly. The mango salad and Fresh Saigon Roll are so refreshing . Perfect choices during summer! The wok fried noodles and number 37 are highly recommended as well. The skin of the lemon chicken is crispy but not oily. All the sauce perfectly matches with the main dishes. However, the portion of each dish is not large. Those with big appetite may have to order more.

Address: 3388 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3M7 Canada
Review: I love their covered patio setup. It was nice to get some sun while eating even though it was cold outside. Food was good! I enjoyed everything we ordered. Our server was new so the service was a little slow. We had to wave her down multiple times… but understandable.

Address: 3388 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3M7 Canada
Review:
Anh and Chi was an excellent experience, we did have to wait for about 20 minutes but it wasn't a big deal as we just purused down the street and admired all the other exciting looking restaurants for next time.
We ordered crispy spring rolls, amazing, crispy prawn cakes, delicious, and chicken wings, fabulous. The wings especially were nicely cooked, crispy exterior and moist and tender inside. The sauce was excellent. They all exceeded expectations and were full of flavor without being too greasy and heavy. We ordered the curry with a side of rice, which was excellent, and the Pho Hoang, a recipe from the original establishment that has been around for almost 40 years - and you can see why. The flavor was just wonderful. We also had the beef and watercress salad - the only thing I have to say could be improved is the salad was maybe a bit dry, you definitely need to eat the vegetables with portions of meat in each bite otherwise it's just not soft or wet enough. More dressing, or a soft vegetable, something, was missing. The service was good, although we did get better service from a waitress who wasn't actually assigned to our table. Our own waitress seemed a bit bored, but she was still polite, attentive, and answered all of our questions.
I would absolutely recommend this restaurant and if visiting Vancouver would come again. Loved, loved it!

Address: 1038 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9 Canada
Review:
Amazing food and service. Our waiter Brendan was great and guided us in our dining/drinking adventure.

As there were so many amazing options on the menu we decided to go with A La Carte in order to try more of the menu since we are from out of town.

Everything tasted amazing and they even split some of the dishes for us in order to make it easier to eat. I could recommend everything that we ate. Drinks also did not disappoint, very tasty and unique.

I think this was my favourite restaurant of this trip and we went to quick a few nice restaurant (including a Michelin star restaurant). Highly recommend it if you are able to try it.

Street parking is reasonable, plan for 3 hours though.

Address: 1038 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9 Canada
Review:
5 starts for everything undoubtedly.

The food testing menu with level 2 wine pairing was phenomenal!
Every wine and meal was an experience.
It is certainly a pricy experience but, we would do again for sure. You won't regret.
Cheers

Address: 1038 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9 Canada
Review: Absolutely an upscale restaurant, good food, good atmosphere, good service. However rating it in comparison with other restaurants I have been to would put it in the middle of the pack. I actually just added one more star for atmosphere, due to the fact that you can clearly see the kitchen. It is quite entertaining to watch the head chef and his minions crafting the dishes.

Address: 1038 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9 Canada
Review:
An exquisite dining experience! Came in for brunch with no reservation. Luckily, after a 10-minute wait, someone canceled.
Service was brilliant, food and drinks tasted delicious, and the vegan dessert was amazing!
The brunch was under $90 with tips included. Fantastic spot for a date. Highly recommend reservations!
I will be back 100% thank you!

Address: 1038 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9 Canada
Review:
A staple of upscale dining in Vancouver. The cocktails are some of the best in the city that is awarding winning.

Top notch service.

The food can be a bit of a hit and miss as it changes quite a bit with the season. The 3 dishes we had were tasty, but just not memorable that leaves you wanting more. The octopus was a bit on the chewy side and the scallop was buried under all the sauce that took away from the delicate textures and flavour of the sea. The salad was my favourite of the night as it had a great textures from the bee pollen and acid from the dressing.

Address: 1300 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C5 Canada
Review:
My friend and I shared the salmon Benedict and the French toast. It was incredible! And the prices are super reasonable too.
Big shout out to our server and the staff here. We got asked if we wanted more coffee every 15 mins and felt like the staff really knew what they were doing. 100/10 will come back here when I'm back in Vancouver.

Address: 1300 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C5 Canada
Review: Spent a few days at the Listel Hotel and Forage was recommended to me by several folks. The restaurant has a nice modern feel, the staff were welcoming and helpful in their recommendations. If you are into locally sourced and sustainable foods, Forage might be up your alley! I should also mention…. Their sourdough pan bread is an absolute treat and definitely a must if you visit (it’s great as an appetizer or dessert!).

Address: 1300 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C5 Canada
Review:
Had a great Easter brunch with the family.  Was able to get a reservation for 6 without issue (we did book a week in advance). Due to the holiday they did request we be done in 75 minutes for the next party.

Great drinks and food. I had the whiskey latte and the pork belly Benedict. Highly recommend. Family also had the pancakes, which they loved as well.

Address: 1300 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C5 Canada
Review: We got the mushrooms entree, bison steak, and cast iron bread. The mushrooms were ok. The cast iron bread was very very very oily so I only ate one piece. The major + was the bison which was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious.

Address: 1300 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C5 Canada
Review:
Overall, I think the food is nice and above average, but I expected more given the prices charged and the fame of this restaurant.

For starters, the seared tuna and oysters were freshly served. But I think there were too much tuna paste on the tuna which overtook the freshness of the seafood. The miso itself was too rich and my tongue got carried away.

For main, I ordered the grilled octopus and pork chop. Again, the use of miso paste in both dishes were too significant and I found the flavour too repetitive. The pork chop, in particular, was drowned in different sauces. I wasn’t too sure what the chef was trying to present.

Knowing the chef-in-charged is a Chinese, I was hoping to see some Chinese cooking method / elements in the dishes. Unfortunately, there weren’t any…

Address: 213 Carral Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2 Canada
Review: Some of the most delicious brunch food I've had while eating out. I was especially impressed that they make in-house gluten-free toast that can be subbed with most of their dishes (minus the French toast and one other item). Their French press coffee is also delicious and generously portioned. I would definitely come here again to try their egg bennies or something else.

Address: 213 Carral Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2 Canada
Review:
My group came here for lunch on a Friday around 1pm and were able to be seated right away.

Right away, I was captivated by the unique decor. They had standing mixers filled with plants as centerpieces. That was super neat.

The staff was really friendly and also gave us some great recommendations for things to do in Vancouver.

My only complaint was the menu felt a bit limited. They serve brunch for most of the afternoon and then switch to dinner at 5 I believe. I wish there were some more dishes on the menu that didn’t include eggs.

I did order the fruit salad and scones. It was honestly the best fruit salad I’ve ever had. I would order it again.

This is definitely a great choice for breakfast/brunch!

Address: 213 Carral Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2 Canada
Review: One of the best brunches I’ve had! We got lucky and didn’t have to wait more than 10min for a spot at the counter. All the staff were friendly and attentive. Most importantly, the food was so good (we got the croque monsieur and French toast)! Loved the attention to detail with the menu and how they made elevated versions of classic dishes. Very reasonably priced for the quality, location and service that you receive and a great place to bring a date

Address: 213 Carral Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2 Canada
Review:
Uniquely designed brunch recipes are amazing in taste. Both sweet & savoury options are available. Menu is not so vast but serves the purpose of a brunch restaurant. Both alcoholic & non alcoholic drinks are available but in coffee only French press option is available.
Atmosphere of this place is unmatchable. Most desiring location under the sun and in the city’s most happening area. There is indoor seating as well. Staff is great too.
We ordered French toast which was definitely a big portion served with some fruits n maple syrup but so delicious. Our other dish was savoury topped with perfectly poached eggs served with a naan bread , olives & some hummus.

Address: 213 Carral Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2 Canada
Review:
Outstanding brunch and drinks. The food portion was more than generous. I ordered the eggs Benny and it was unreal it’s a shame we’re heading back home I would love to have had it again. The wait staff was super nice and helpful in guiding us though the menu and more importantly the drinks… get the Caesar!
Lastly the music selection according to my wife was top notch. If your into pop music and are born in 90 give or take a few years you’ll have a blast listening.

Address: 630 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2G5 Canada
Review: One of the best Chinese food experiences of all time. Despite being a hole in the wall place with very little ventilation and no air conditioning, I’d go back there to eat any dish from this place in a heartbeat. Hand-crafted noodles were outrageously awesome and spicy pork dumplings were equally addictive. A place like this is precisely why you travel and explore city streets.

Address: 630 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2G5 Canada
Review: I love this place, the food and my beautiful place. It's a cute little restaurant with great food. They have a great selection of food. My favorite is the chicken soup with handmade noodles. I liked it so much that I went there more than twice in 3 weeks. I think that says enough. In my opinion, it is the little secret restaurant in Vancouver. (The portions are huge, so go there with an empty stomach)

Address: 630 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2G5 Canada
Review: Tried out this noodle house as it was close to our hotel and looked like a lot of people inside. It's a small Restaurant, with only fans and no air conditioning, so it was quite stuffy inside. Ordered some hot chilli wontons, xiao long bao steamed buns and two types of noodles. Big portions which are enough to share between two. Food came out quickly. The chilli dishes are quite spicy

Address: 630 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2G5 Canada
Review: Wonderful family run place in downtown Vancouver.  I’ll definitely be going back again and again.  The noodle soups are INCREDIBLE— had the pork bone noodle soup which is amazing.  Also had dumplings, curried tofu noodles, fried spicy eggplant, and spicy won ton.   It’s all good and I wish they were open later.  Highly recommend this resto.  Prices are very reasonable, quantities are good, just a great place to go.

Address: 630 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2G5 Canada
Review: Highly recommend this little restaurant. The flavors and the service was on point! By far the most surprisingly delicious dish was the beef roll, a must try. The chili oil wontons definitely have a kick so be prepared if you don’t usually order spicy food. Fantastic job by the servers, super attentive and friendly. Cheers!

Address: 869 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2R7 Canada
Review:
Another day, another Italian Restaurant. Browsing through numerous restaurant candidates, I came upon Lupo, a heritage house restaurant offside to my usual Robson area, right by the Vancouver Public Library. One of the things that struck me about the place was the fact that their menu is shockingly small.

Each course from their Antipasti to their Primi to their Secondi boast not more than six options per heading, so I'm guessing that they curated the best of the best. I was intrigued because, in my mind, that meant they had really perfected these dishes and wanted to showcase their culinary prowress with the thoughtful handling of select dishes, so I was expecting a stellar meal.

I don't think I've ever had the pleasure of dining in a heritage house, so there was already an air of charm surrounding the evening as we walked up the steps. I was immediately struck by the eclectic decor, an odd mix of wine bottles, photographic prints, abstract paintings, unusual lighting, and segmented ombre metallics. I'm not sure it necessarily all worked together, but it was definitely eye~catching.

The food was simply fantastic. We started with the popular Focaccia Bread, a puffed vegetarian wonder which, if you didn't know any better, would think was a miniature pizza. My girlfriend had the Octopus Mosaic, which was a work of art, and I had the Wagyu Beef Carpaccio, which had a lot of reggiano shavings. Both were delicious.

Mains consisted of the Taglierini and Fettucine, where the portions were more than generous. My only complaint about my Fettuccine was that there were way too many peas, otherwise, both pastas were al dente and very flavorful.

I'm happy to say that all the reviews about Lupo were correct, as it was one of the best Italian Restaurants I've been to in a while, and I would definitely go back. Service was attentive and professional, so you really couldn't ask for more.

There are plenty of Italian eateries downtown, but you can say Arrivederci to them all. Lupo stands out as one of the places you need to visit if you want authentic and tasty Italian food. Make a reservation, you won't be disappointed.

Address: 869 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2R7 Canada
Review:
I had a great evening at Lupo thanks to our server Cristina and the great food.

The food was well presented,  well seasoned and delicious.  The wine menu was very good with a wide range of selection of local and international wines.

The pasta was super greasy with lots of oil left on my plate after I finished my pasta.

The restaurant is very romantic,  but there is no privacy as tables are very close to each other.

Address: 869 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2R7 Canada
Review:
Great intimate dinner spot.

Good selection of wine, they had a special burrowing owl + lupo wine which was really good.

Which was good. Had the special burrata which was nice and refreshing. The special black olive truffle was yummy but the gnocchi bolognese was delicious. They have good portion sizes for the price! I would come again and forgot to mention that they have great service.

Tiramisu was good!

Address: 869 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2R7 Canada
Review: Pasta here was pretty good. I ordered the fettuccine and I was surprised with how big the portion was. We also ordered the taglierini which was also quite substantial and tasty. The desserts were great, the almond cake wasn't too sweet and had a lightness to it. The creme brulee was smooth and the bitterness of the hardened sugar on top complimented well with the sweetness of the custard. Service was decent, and the fact that the restaurant is in a heritage house, definitely makes for an interesting experience. A little bit on the pricey side, but a good place to go for a special occasion.

Address: 869 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2R7 Canada
Review: The pasta was tasty, however clearly inauthentic. Portions were HUGE and flavourful, however the presentation was lacking (feels like I was just given a heaping pile of food). The chicken was not tender, it was clearly overcooked. I did not enjoy the focaccia. The beet salad with goat cheese was alright, but I would never think about it again. The atmosphere of the restaurant was a bit stuffy and serious; I wouldn't return.

Address: 2054 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9 Canada
Review:
Love dinning here with my friends!
The food is always delicious and artistic! Love how they support local farmers and have unique high quality ingredients.

When I was poor college student, I usually got the okonomiyaki or one of the stone bowls, one caterpillar roll, and 1 dessert and that was enough to satisfy me and my friend. I usually got something that was high in carbs that way it fills me up. That way it doesn't go over my budget.

Now, I get anything from their special menu, it's always different depending on the seasons. I am never disappointed what I am about to taste.

The service is good and friendly!

The atmosphere there is calming, chill, classy. The music in that restaurant is very relaxing in my opinion.

Also, the tables are always clean and same with the dishes and cutlery.

Tip: This place is quite popular so the wait time to get a table might take long (1hr +). So I suggest you make a reservation, come at 5pm, or eat a small snack before you go but that depends on your eating schedule.

Address: 2054 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9 Canada
Review:
This place only opens in the evening. We came around 5:40pm and was told the waiting time would be around 1hr. The wait was worth it tho.

We ordered 2 kinds of oshi which were incredibly delicious but a bit smaller than I expected. Nonetheless, the flavour in each bite were amazing.

The veggie okonomiyaki was surprisingly good even if it's filled with just onions, cabbages and mushrooms. Looks can be deceiving so don't judge this okonomiyaki till you try it.

Address: 2054 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9 Canada
Review: Fantastic little Japanese restaurant in Vancouver. Reminded me a lot of our days in Kyoto. The sashimi was fresh and delicious. My daughter loved her Unagi bowl, given that she's very picky. The Mushroom Agedashi Tofu was the best that I have ever had. Highly recommended. We will definitely come back.

Address: 2054 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9 Canada
Review: Very Very good food but service was so poor. we got an appetizer and 4 rolls. everything came at different times I saw delivery and people coming after us getting their food while our food was not fully ready yet.

Address: 2054 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9 Canada
Review: Loved the food here! You go here to eat. That's it. Didn't try drinks but looked authentic. Had the eel (unagi) rolls. Amazing. The smoked sushi was just ok. Would not get again. Fresh and tasty. A bit pricy, so only go if you appreciate good sushi.

Address: 840 Howe Street Suite 190 Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S9 Canada
Review: Came here when it was udon season, and the tempura was delicious. They gave us a plate to put our tempura in so it wouldn’t get soggy when you pour the sauce/soup on top of your rice/noodles. The flavours were good, and I loved the tempura soft boiled egg. I wish the tempura was a bit crispier, but overall, I was happy with my meal.

Address: 840 Howe Street Suite 190 Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S9 Canada
Review: Excellent experience! The tempura udon is really good with a cool presentation. Loved the salmon salad topping and steamed egg as well. The melon milk is way too sweet though.

Address: 840 Howe Street Suite 190 Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S9 Canada
Review:
So crunchy tempura come with spicy sauce …ohhhh I’ve loved Japanese foods in Canada already. Not only that,I’ve had better days because of this Strawberry Cheese Cake. Awesome cheesecakes. Not too thick or sparse. Flavours aren’t spot on cloyingly sweet. I can't get enough of their Cheese cake. The staff is really nice and well trained.

The miso soup is wonderful too.

Address: 840 Howe Street Suite 190 Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S9 Canada
Review: A Vancouver must have! If you like tempura, of course. If that's not your thing-- we can't be friends. The egg is mindblowingly delicious! They have udon too now. Specialty drinks are really special.  Great for a date, hang out, families, friends, friends who want to date but haven't have that conversation yet! You know the ones.

Address: 840 Howe Street Suite 190 Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S9 Canada
Review:
quick efficient service in a modern yet cozy setting.
really enjoyed the bowl, was filling and not too greasy unlike some other places. chawanmushi was perfect for a cloudy day

Address: 2340 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1 Canada
Review:
This is definitely one of the highest quality sushi restaurants in Vancouver. The price of each meal may not appeal to everyone. However, if I ever wanted to share a solid sushi meal with someone new in town or maybe even a business meal, I would definitely bring them here.

I came here with my wife and kids and the service was excellent. The toro is some of the best I’ve ever had.

This may not be a place that I’d come back to often simply due to affordability, however, If I ever want to celebrate and enjoy high quality sushi, I will come back for sure.

Address: 2340 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1 Canada
Review:
It’s a pretty fantastic Japanese restaurant that focuses on high quality ingredients. We had a large party so we had to put in the order ahead of time. The atmosphere was really nice and the staff were busy but still friendly.

I had the deluxe seafood bowl which was not cheap but the ingredients and the quality of the overall food made it feel like it was worth the hefty price tag.

Other food was generally delicious but if you want the best bang for your buck, I would suggest the katsu.

The cocktails were also quite tasty. I had the yuzu flavoured drink with the yuzu infused ice cream which was perfect on the hot summer evening.

I highly recommend this place for any occasion, but especially birthdays because it seemed like almost every other table was celebrating their birthday. I know this because the staff would come up and sing you a song with a nice dessert. Overall I had a great experience and would come again to try other menu items!

Address: 2340 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1 Canada
Review: This restaurant has consistently been amazing. Excellent service, high-quality dishes, fresh ingredients, all wrapped up in a beautiful restaurant setting. I never hesitate to recommend this gem of a Japanese restaurant. Bonus: they are so family-friendly and serve the best children’s meal

Address: 2340 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1 Canada
Review:
Definitely one of the best Japanese restaurants in Vancouver.
Food and service were great.
The menu is big.
The rating is also based on the fact that parking is not very convenient and we did not see access for handicapped individuals (maybe we missed it!).
We will try it again and this time we will try reserving in advance the lunch/dinner/bento boxes.

Address: 2340 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1 Canada
Review: Highly recommend this restaurant - food was fresh and delicious (looked great too!) at a reasonable price, the decor made me feel like I was transported out of North America, and staff were friendly and attentive. Brought my friends here, and they thoroughly enjoyed their experience too!

Address: 305 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1C4 Canada
Review:
Intimate space with tremendous food.
The Luigi’s Meatballs were delicious, with a strong tomato sauce and a generous serving. Only comment here would be it leaned acidic from the strong tomato sauce.
The mushroom and truffle pasta special highlighted the fresh local mushrooms and homemade pasta.
The lamb ragu had incredible depth, demonstrating the effort involved in flawlessly executing this dish.

Address: 305 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1C4 Canada
Review: Our spot to try for our staycaytion. We arrived a few minutes after 12pm. We were quite lucky to get seated immediately. Megan our server was friendly, amazing and knowledgeable. Full of smiles and ready to answer any of our questions. We went with the specials. The burrata salad with pistachios and asparagus. Delicious! Right amount of seasoning and flavoring. I ordered the lamb ragout. My wife ordered the cacio pepe. You'd think they weren't enough to eat! Wow they were so generous. The portions were perfect.  The lamb was so flavorful to the very last bite. I couldn't get over how good these meals were. My wife asked that her cacio pepe not be too peppery and they were able to accommodate her request. She loved the dish. It was creamy, cheesy with the right amount of pepper. We both noted that their pasta must've been made in house. The perfect chew of the al dente noodles provided a beautiful experience. We topped it off with the Panna cotta which had the stewed plums and crumbly biscotti. Perfect way to end a wonderful dining experience. They are recommended by the Michelin Guide. They are a bit on the pricey side but they are well worth it. This is one of those date night or day places. Quaint and intimate. We absolutely loved our visit here. Thank you Ask for Luigi and to our server Megan, thank you so very much.

Address: 305 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1C4 Canada
Review: It was my first time here and everything didn't disappoint. From the food, service, to the ambience of the restaurant, it was very good. We went on a weekend and we didn't realize they were only serving  the brunch menu. Nonetheless, the food were still great. I would recommend taking an uber or drive going here because it's a bit sketchy if you'll walk outside.

Address: 305 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1C4 Canada
Review: Located just a few blocks off the end of gastown, this quaint Italian restaurant offers delicious homemade pasta for a very reasonable price. Reservation is available with a $30 hold (refunded at sign in). My friend and I went for brunch Sunday at 10:30am and it's not very busy. There's a parking lot out back and street parking all around. Our server is very communicative and attentive to our needs. Their cappuccino was delicious (according to my friend) and we thoroughly enjoyed the flavor of our meals. The total came out to be around $60 for the two of us. We also noticed a healthy portion of the menu is vegetarian friendly, and the pasta can be substituted for a gluten friendly version. All in all, a very pleasant visit to this gem of a restaurant.

Address: 305 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1C4 Canada
Review: Great place. Simple menu with incredible original Italian taste. The Brunch experience is more “fun” than dinner in my opinion. The olive oil cake 🫒 🍰 I could eat this on a daily basis. To die for. Price is fair due current economy circumstances.

Address: 780 Richards Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3A4 Canada
Review: Not your normal breakfast place,  but that's why it's great.  A little eclectic,  but nothing over the top. From the coffees, to the main courses, to the waffles at the end.  We all tried something different and they were all hits. Definitely a go to spot every time we're in town.

Address: 780 Richards Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3A4 Canada
Review: FINALLY, got a chance to try this place after making reservations ($10/person booking where it gets donated).  It's nice to just walk in and not have to wait.  After taking a first bite of the waffle, I know what all the fuss is about and why it's always so busy!  The food was all very delicious, our server was patient and very attentive and food was so pretty and delicious.  The ambience is cute, cozy and airy and I will 100% come back again!

Address: 780 Richards Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3A4 Canada
Review: Wonderful breakfast spot in downtown Vancouver. Came here two days in a row while being in the city. The service was wonderful and quick. The atmosphere is a plus and gives it a lively yet homey feel. The menu items are all carefully crafted to ensure that all flavours compliment one another. Items are fairly priced but if you’re looking to get a good meal for under 20$ I recommend going with the avocado toast, adding an egg and either adding the sausage or breakfast potatoes to your plate. If you want to spend a little more, I recommend coming for their happy hour 6$ Mimosa’s and Fricassée dish. As a cherry on top you can request their house made waffles either to go or to enjoy while sipping your mimosa. Highly recommend for anyone visiting downtown Vancouver!

Address: 780 Richards Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3A4 Canada
Review:
Waffles- slightly crispy with the caramelized sugar and pairs well with the pistachio rose white chocolate and berry compote (not too sweet).

The paella is spicy, yummy and filling. Enough for two people.

Best lavender latte I've had! It's actually has a strong lavender flavor.

Service was very efficient. We came on a Tuesday morning around 9 and got seated right away at the bar.

Address: 780 Richards Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3A4 Canada
Review: My favourite place for brunch in Vancouver. The menu is unique and food is delicious. I love the waffles and got 2 bags of them for later. Service and atmosphere are great and we waited around 40 minutes for our table. There are plenty of things to do around and they text you when your table is ready.

Address: 6345 Fraser Street Vancouver, BC V5W 3A3 Canada
Review:
We had the Hot pot which was great.. we also tried the seafood pancake and steak, which were a bit on the fatty side.. but still had decent flavor.

Tried some Korean sake too, which was somewhat sweet and packed a kick.

Definitely worth a visit, staff we also friendly

Address: 6345 Fraser Street Vancouver, BC V5W 3A3 Canada
Review: Lots of tables were available at 11:30 for lunch, but within the hour many were occupied. Food came out relatively quickly. Had the Beef Bulgogi Lunch Combo; I appreciated a non-spicy option with the "chef's special sauce." We received the usual shareable tasty banchan, of which we could have seconds. The bulgogi was flavourful and satisfied our Korean food cravings! Our team was topped up regularly by their staff. Good option for a meal with an average price point. There is pay parking along Fraser Street or in the lot behind, as well as some 2-hour parking in the residential areas.

Address: 6345 Fraser Street Vancouver, BC V5W 3A3 Canada
Review:
I went to this restaurant sometime in 2019 and had the hot pot. It was great! Really enjoyed it but for some reason completely forgot about the restaurant until 4 years later when I came back.

With the previous food experience so good, I almost ordered everything off the menu! I sampled a variety of dishes with my partner: the deep fried dumplings, the seafood pancake, beef bulgogi, and bibimbap. All were delicious as I expected. The side dishes and the sauces were great accompaniment to the dishes.

Having said that, I thought the bulgogi had too much beef in it, which I’m not sure it is a bad thing but I was hoping to have more of those delicious glass noodles!

Would definitely come back, this time sooner.

Address: 6345 Fraser Street Vancouver, BC V5W 3A3 Canada
Review:
Food is good overall. Seafood pancake is one of the better ones (sufficiently thick, which I like) I have tried, although I felt there weren't enough octopus pieces (hello inflation). For me, House of Tofu still makes the best seafood pancake I've ever had.

Kimchi tofu soup was decent and the portion was fair. The service was a bit subpar as I usually don't like it when I have to ask for tea refill especially when it isn't even that busy.

Overall, it's a decent and I would say above average Korean restaurant in Vancouver.

Address: 6345 Fraser Street Vancouver, BC V5W 3A3 Canada
Review: It is a cozy Korean restaurant with great food and friendly service. I ordered the medium-spicy Gam Ja Tang, and it was flavorful. The Bulgogi was tasty as well. The staff was knowledgeable and attentive, and the atmosphere was welcoming.

Address: 551 Seymour Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3H6 Canada
Review:
I've had the same mazesoba at their restaurants in Tokyo and this place definitely achieves the same standard.
The flavours of the sauce and toppings mixed together give strong flavours that make you want more! And having the free rice mixed at the end helps you get every last bit in the bowl.
Definitely eat here if you want to try something that packs a lot of savoury flavour into the noodles.

Address: 551 Seymour Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3H6 Canada
Review:
I visited Kokoro recently and had a delightful experience. The standout dishes for me were the tomato ramen and the spicy ramen. Both were incredibly delicious, and the flavors were well-balanced. The ingredients used in the ramen seemed to be fresh and well cooked, which made the experience way better.

For those with a big appetite, I highly recommend going for the large size. It's perfect for hungry individuals who want a good portion of ramen. The staff at the restaurant were polite, although there wasn't anything exceptional about their service & the general items price feelt to be a bit high, but overall affordable.

The restaurant itself had a fast food setup, ensuring quick service. The spacious and cool ambiance made it an ideal spot for a pleasant evening dinner.

I would definitely suggest giving this place a try, especially if you're a ramen lover looking for a satisfying meal in a comfortable setting.

Address: 551 Seymour Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3H6 Canada
Review: Many mixed feelings about this place. The gyoza is probably the best I have ever had at any place. Super tender and FULL of flavor. The karaage bao bun was spicy and flavorful and a perfect little bite. However, the ramen was not great. It didn't have much flavor at all. Everyone else in my party got mazesoba and loved it though. I would definitely go back but would try something other than ramen next time.

Address: 551 Seymour Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3H6 Canada
Review:
Definitely the best place in town for Mazesoba. It's packed with flavour and umami.
Good portion with decent price. Service is also good and fast. One of the place that I always go to whenever I'm in Vancouver

Address: 551 Seymour Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3H6 Canada
Review: Soooooo good!!! OMG. I have to come back to try the other dishes! I had the cheesy one and it was bomb!! And I especially loved how they give you a scoop of rice to eat the rest of the sauce!!! 👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻 I will definitely be back!!

Address: 1137 Marinaside Crescent Vancouver, BC V6Z 2Y3 Canada
Review: Went around 11AM on a Thursday for brunch, the restaurant was packed with people. The staff was friendly and cheery, however the wait for the food was over 30 minutes which can be a little bummer. The food was BEYOND delicious, it was juicy and flavourful. We tried the chicken and gold digga poutine with runny poached eggs. It was hot and tasty, it came in a bowl, which is more than fulfilling. Most of the menu items revolve around eggs, as it’s a brunch place. We also got flight mimosas which was delicious, including flavours such as mango, grapefruit and orange. The restaurant was lively with people. It has both indoor and outdoor seating.

Address: 1137 Marinaside Crescent Vancouver, BC V6Z 2Y3 Canada
Review: Came for brunch on a Sunday and made sure to get on the wait list ahead of time. For a table of 4 we had to wait 2 hours, which we expected. Our server was so helpful and had great recommendations. My favourite thing to get is the Croque Madame - it's rich and has a nice earthiness from the truffles. It's also huge(!) and very filling. Definitely a must-try if you like truffles!

Address: 1137 Marinaside Crescent Vancouver, BC V6Z 2Y3 Canada
Review: Great breakfast spot with a great view of the marina.  Kids inhaled their food, which is always a good sign of a great restaurant for us a family.  Lobster crepe was very good, avocado toast was excellent, omelette was filling and the Belgian waffle was perfection.  Will definitely be coming back to this spot!  Staff was very attentive and quick to get our order put through.

Address: 1137 Marinaside Crescent Vancouver, BC V6Z 2Y3 Canada
Review: Amazing location right by the water and delicious food. There are a lot of options and waitresses are very friendly. We had dietary restrictions and asked for recommendations, they were very knowledgeable about the dishes. Only thing I wish was better is that the portions are on the smaller/lighter side and I wish they had more shade on the patio.

Address: 1137 Marinaside Crescent Vancouver, BC V6Z 2Y3 Canada
Review:
We ordered croque madame and duck confit. I wanted my egg to be overcooked because I’m pregnant and it came exactly the way I wanted it.
The employees are very energetic and smiling. The service is fast, the food is delicious and the ambiance is very nice. Everything was awesome. Thank you!

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review:
The pork, chicken, shrimp katsu is very juicy and tender on the inside. The outside is crunchy and not oily. The sauce is great but sprinkling salt and sesame seems to bring out meat taste more. Do not recommend the white fish as it was slightly soggy at the bottom and the fish was quite tough in the middle. Other white fish I had before is very fluffy and light with a gentle sweetness to it. This one was briny only.

Presentation of the food is great. Seating is wonderfully spacious. Service is quite attentive and friendly.

All in all it was a very pleasant experience. Slightly on the expensive side.

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: Decided to come here for a late lunch, but even then, the place is still packed. Very popular and I could see why. We got the Zenbu set and it was a lot of food for 2 people. It was so good though. Esp the fatty pork and scallop. Also have to mention the salad. Seems very simple but the dressing is amazing. Service was just fine but the atmosphere was really nice. Will come back for sure.

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: I am absolutely smitten with the culinary delights offered at this remarkable Japanese restaurant. However, what truly sets it apart is the exceptional team of individuals who work here. The waitstaff exhibited unmatched friendliness, going above and beyond by attentively checking on my friend and me throughout the dining experience. Their genuine care and attentiveness truly left a lasting impression. Kudos to this establishment for fostering such a warm and caring environment!

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: Very pleasant and friendly.  Food was fantastic. The chicken breast was prepared very well, hot and tasted fresh.    The soft drink was a bit of novelty but tasted good (strawberry).   The waiter we had was always smiling and very pleasant.  The place was quite as most patrons despite the place being full most of our visit spoke in low voices.

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: Nice little quaint place. Staff were super friendly and service was fast. Free refills on the salad , rice, and soup though we didn’t need it. Our water was always refilled and they did such a tremendous job while we dined there. Katsu was so juicy and tender! I love how they have the gravy baits too. I’d highly recommend.

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
