Review: The food here is amazing however the Broadway location is not equipped for large parties. We had 9 people and was told we would be able to sit together but on separate tables. Unfortunately the tables were really far apart and those on the ends of the table could not talk to each other until after dinner. Aside from that, our dinner itself was good. I ordered the cheese Katsu with a side of curry to share with my husband. Miso soup and salad is refillable and we ordered it twice. Add the curry, you won't regret it :)

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: I really enjoyed my meal here. Everything part of the dish was very delicious and so intricate with detail. Simple but tasty. Friendly servers. Price point was on the higher side for the full meals but the taste and portion is well worth the total at the end. You can get unlimited sides too I believe.

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: Saku is certainly worth trying! We ordered the chicken breast katsu with curry and the regular chicken breast katsu - both were great and the service is top notch. The curry was unique and they provide a generous amount which you can share with your party. The side salad and miso soup were perfect additions to the deep fried main dishes, and they’re also unlimited which was nice. The staff are super friendly and the prices seemed fair given the portions.

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review:
I've been to Saku Broadway and Saku Robson, and both restaurants are a 10/10 for me. The cheese katsu is immaculate, and it comes with all these little extras like soup, salad, flavoured salt, mustard. The extras are u limited too! So if you want more soup or salad just ask for it! 😋 The salad dressing they have is delicious too. 🥗

The servers at the Broadway location were incredibly helpful they would come by our table every 5-10 minutes to ask if we wanted more food or to refill our water. 💧

The price is quite expensive but that's the price of living in Vancouver these days. You do get a good amount of food for the price you're paying. 👍

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: First time trying Nabe Katau at Saku. I prefer the regular (Rosu/Hire) katsu more than this soup-y dish. Anyway it’s good for my throat when I needed something warm and not oily.

Address: 556 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: Jam has plenty of options for vegetarians. Our favorite was the Veggie Bowl. The serving sizes here are also very generous and can easily feed two people. The pancakes are a little tough, but other than that everything was great. Great service and atmosphere too!

Address: 556 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: We visited this place for a weekend brunch. As expected there was a line and we had to wait for around 30 minutes. we got a table outside. It was a bit smaller for a group of five, but we were able to manage. We ordered the French toast and I also tried one of their bowls with hashbrowns and pulled chicken. I loved the food , it was so flavorful and had the perfect quantity. It was a perfect beginning to my day and worth the wait. We also had mimosas with litchi, which was quite a surprise, and it tasted quite good.

Address: 556 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: Took my visiting cousins into Vancouver as they had told me about this breakfast place they had heard about. "The Jam" on Beatty street. so we packed up early to beat the line up and got in right away Sunday morning made the orders..... and the aroma from each meal was mouth watering as our server placed each order. I had the Apple cinnamon waffles and they were crazy amazing and hard to finish the whole dish but I managed. I do recommend this breakfast spot to everyone too. 2 thumbs up and thank you Jam

Address: 556 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: This breakfast was stellar! Though we were initially worried that we would be standing in line waiting for a long time, we ended up getting in pretty quickly, and sat at the bar. Our server was super personable, and the restaurant manages to seat quite a few parties, despite the smaller space. The fried chicken benedict was wonderful: moist, crispy, chicken, savory little kernels of corn… It was delicious. But the real star of this meal was a cinnamon roll pancake: absolutely, incredible!! Little crunchy bits of buttery, pancake, with a perfect amount of cinnamon and frosting… It truly was one of the best pancakes I’ve ever had. I would absolutely go again for that pancake alone!

Address: 556 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: Possibly the best brunch I've had in my life. The food was absolutely incredible and the atmosphere was 10/10. We visited both locations which were lovely but preferred the kits location. Our server was an angel and super friendly! The menu has so many interesting options and elevated classics!

Address: 1829 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 3E4 Canada
Review: We received an invitation to a birthday dinner celebration at this restaurant, and we were pleasantly amazed by the exceptional quality of the food. Despite its location, the restaurant tends to be bustling, particularly during dinner hours. Without a doubt, we will return here in the future when the chance arises.

Address: 1829 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 3E4 Canada
Review:
Visited here for date night and it was so delicious!

We were seated in the patio and the atmosphere was lovely. I appreciated the cushions and throws available as well.

We ordered the fresh burrata with proscuitto, a daily special proscuitto antipasto, Rigatoni Pork Ragu, and the Brick Chicken.

You have to get the proscuitto & fresh burrata - they really do it well. The bread is not too toasted and the burrata is fantastic!

We loved the rigatoni. The pasta had the perfect aldente bite and the sauce was packed with flavour.

The brick chicken was incredible!!! I’ve never tasted a sauce like the one it was served it before - I wished I had bread to soak up all that was leftover. I think it might be my favourite dish of the meal.

Tavola has got classic italian food right! Everything was a hit and a really laidback and romantic atmosphere. Well worth a visit!

Address: 1829 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 3E4 Canada
Review: Great service and wonderful location close to Stanley Park. The restaurant atmosphere is cozy and in the summer they have a nice street patio. The burrata, anchovies on top of eggs, and rigatoni pork ragu pasta were delicious!

Address: 1829 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 3E4 Canada
Review:
Fantastic dinner in Tavola tonight with family and friends.
We shared 2 crostinis (Walnut/Gorgonzola; Chicken liver pate) and one each of the brusettas. Gorgeous.
Mixed mains, we shared the Ragu and meatballs. Gorgeous again.

Very tasty food and great service by Kenton. Good portion sizes.

The restaurant is very well laid too too, not at all over crowded. We had one end of the long table and were very comfortable.

Highly recommend.

Address: 1829 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 3E4 Canada
Review: We loved this Italian restaurant with a beautiful ambiance. It was our first time visiting it and we thoroughly enjoyed the romantic vibe it offered. The food was flavourful especially their potato gnocchi with egg plants, olives, basil and tomatoes and "Cod" fish of the day from their daily specials. Chickpea crostinis were delicious as well. Our server was friendly and recommended the perfect wines to pair with our food. I definitely recommend it.

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review: The vibe of the place is simply amazing. We were seated inside which was so convenient as you can enjoy the atmosphere and stay warm in the cool nights. The server was so helpful with his suggestions. The food is so tasty! Full of flavor, properly served and you will be waiting for the next bite to indulge on the combination of flavors. The dessert is simply prefect, not too sweet yet memorable! We went late night so there were out of paella on a busy Sunday night yet it looked so good and I would definitely recommend giving it a try!

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review: Very attentive staff! Very good food and a wonderful atmosphere! Had the daily paella, and the patatas bravas, both were exceptional!! Slightly expensive but definitely worthwhile if youre uncertain :)

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review:
The seafood in the daily Paella was so fresh and delicious! I thought I would pack some to go, as it's a portion for 2, but I couldn't stop eating it.. Tinto de Verano was exactly the same as I had it in Spain! I definitely will be coming back to try more dishes.
It's a romantic date spot, especially in the summer!
The service was fantastic, thank you, ladies!
See you soon!

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review:
Food is fantastic and service is great!
I love chicharrones so much!! Paella is on point as well! Paella is good for two people.

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review:
Great little place, enjoyed the food and the sangria,  the paella was quite good and not overly salty like some other places.
Busy place better make a  reservation before u go.

Address: 568 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: Visited Chambar with our company and it was a great experience. Had a great table by the window and service was outstanding. Lots of attention to detail. All the appetizers were very tasty and well presented. Great chill atmosphere as well. Only negative really was the bay closing early on a Sunday. But we bounced next door to the pub to enjoy our last rounds. Great spot and the signature lamb dish was amazing. Enjoy!

Address: 568 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: An unforgettable dining experience! Chambar Restaurant impressed me with its delectable cuisine and charming ambiance. The menu offers a delightful mix of traditional and innovative dishes, and their attention to using locally-sourced ingredients is commendable. The staff's passion for food and top-notch service made the evening even more enjoyable. If you're a food enthusiast looking for a standout gem, Chambar is the place to be!

Address: 568 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review:
Absolutely amazing food. They were also very good with my food allergies. Not only was I accommodated I had flavorful and amazing food. Went for brunch, which is hard to get my egg, dairy, and gluten allergy accommodated but it was amazing.

They have an amazing gluten free bread, without egg and dairy.

Their bacon and apple side was the most incredible bacon I’ve had in forever. Must get.

Was told their dinner menu is extremely gluten free, dairy free, and egg free friendly.

Address: 568 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review:
My aunt and uncle were visiting and I think I couldn’t have booked a better place. I, of course, was drawn by the reviews and the positive feedback of other patrons’ experiences, but these were not fluff marketing ploys.

The food was absolutely amazing! The dishes were unique in both presentation and taste. If you want something DIFFERENT and novel, then this is the place. It may sound corny, but the medley of ingredients that were activating my taste buds was incredible. I’m really curious what the other dishes taste like and that’s why it’s worth revisiting.

The vibe was upbeat and you are made to get into that personable mindset, as the staff members seem to be - from the reception to the initial greeting at the table and the overall service. I would have preferred the tables and seats to be a bit farther apart for more semi-privacy, but packing in that many patrons also made business sense.

It was my uncle’s treat and I think the servers already got the cue from that considering he was the more senior at our table and staff members were engaging him more, but the servers also were not short of properly addressing us when it was our turn to say something. Acknowledgement of presence was never short and I loved it about their service. They’re absolutely attentive and also steadfast. If the water levels on glasses were low, someone was on it and they had that open-hands stance about their demeanor in engaging us. Someone would swing by every now and then to check in on us and the staff members were not snoots. This is probably the best experience I’ve had in a while.

The restaurant is worth a try EXPERIENCING.

Address: 568 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: I cannot say enough about the service. We found out our server was only in her role for two weeks. She was professional, presentable and knew the menu inside out. You can tell the staff there is cohesively working as one unit and that they really loved being part of the team. When our server was not able to come to our table I believe the general manager popped by - he already knew that we had dietary restrictions. This place is a staple and absolutely one of my favourite places in Vancouver.

Address: 777 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3V5 Canada
Review:
I was told by my informant that this is John Cena's favourite restaurant in Vancouver, however...I CAN'T SEE HIM. 🖐👋✋

If you want the best fresh oysters in town, this is the establishment for you. Just make sure you go during happy hour so you can save 💸 as it can be pretty pricey.

My friend and I ate here during happy hour and ordered mostly happy hour items. My friend did however order a steak which he thought was ok, but quite expensive.

I really enjoyed the fresh oysters and I think I'll be coming here just for the oysters, the other items in the happy hour menu were pretty good as well but value could be a bit better.

Service here is amazing. Our server was great, I forgot her name but she was friendly and provided good service.

Overall, I would recommend this place to oyster lovers especially during happy hour. 🦪🍻

Address: 777 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3V5 Canada
Review: Very nice interior and vibes, if you want to take some photo, sit inside. If you just want to chill, try rooftop. I also like what the servers wear. Food is excellent, service is good. Seafood platter is top notch. Really enjoyed the dining experience here!

Address: 777 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3V5 Canada
Review: Had a lovely birthday brunch here with my husband! We didn’t realize Saturdays was brunch only… but still food was still great! They were very accommodating to my dietary needs. Heidi our sever was outstanding. So kind and accommodating. She even brought us an extra dessert for my birthday with a cute custom chocolate! Very impressed by the service :)

Address: 777 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3V5 Canada
Review: Had gone for a quiet dinner as it was highly recommended by Tom Ford Store owner. One feels good when as a tourist good eating joints are recommended by the locals. Michael our server was so sweet, kind & helpful to suggest the best of the dish & wine. We ended up talking long as we were the last of the customers to leave. Sea food platter was awesome & we had a great time. Tiramisu.. TOP NOTCH.. thanks Michael 🍀

Address: 777 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3V5 Canada
Review: By far the best Happy Hour Menu in Downtown! I would recommend going here if you are in the area. The seafood tower for the price is enough for 2 people. The beef carpaccio was so good! Service was quick, and our server was nice. I highly suggest you book ahead if you want to try their Happy Hour without waiting in line.

Address: 11320 Steveston Hwy Unit 110 Richmond, BC V7A 5J5 Canada
Review: I ordered the udon soup and beef rice set menu. Everything tasted amazing. I enjoyed the flavorful soup and tender beef. The only issue was how slow the food service was. It took around 20 mins for the food to come. Otherwise, this place is definitely worth trying!

Address: 11320 Steveston Hwy Unit 110 Richmond, BC V7A 5J5 Canada
Review:
I do like the atomosphere and service, BUT!

The food doesn't feel fresh. My friend ordered the unagi a week ago and said that it was very fishy to the point she pushed it away after the first bite.

I ordered the beef bowl and the taste was great- only problem was that the beef was rubbery hard. Hard to chew like rubber, hard to swallow. With my friend's comment about this place and my current experience...

I don't think the food is very fresh.

I think this is for a person's personal experience. Perhaps the beef was meant to be like rubber because of its cooked methods.

And I haven't been to this place for all its food so it's hard to comment. But my first impression of it was not so good. I would say that one can give this place a chance, but that person might meet the same experience that my friend and I had.

The sauce and appearance of the dish was very good though.

Food: 3.5/5
Price: $
Cleanliness: 5/5

Comeback rate: 10%

Address: 11320 Steveston Hwy Unit 110 Richmond, BC V7A 5J5 Canada
Review: Small restaurant with about 6 tables. They were able to accommodate us as a table of 6. They have 6 different sets of meals. You order at the counter first and they bring the food out to your table. The food was decent. It’s nice they come with a variety of side dishes. The meal was $16. I also ordered the mango or passion fruit soda and it was pretty good.

Address: 11320 Steveston Hwy Unit 110 Richmond, BC V7A 5J5 Canada
Review: Home away from home!  Delicious, Japanese style healthy meals in a clean hospitable environment.  Love this place.  Would strongly recommend!  Do not forget about the delicious chicken!   Must try!

Address: 11320 Steveston Hwy Unit 110 Richmond, BC V7A 5J5 Canada
Review: Accidentally came across this japanese bento joint when we were in the area. We tried the beef curry and the foie gras chicken teriyaki bento. Chicken was perfectly cooked, juicy with charred bits. The sides were good too. Seating is limited. Highly recommend.

Address: 1017 West Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C4 Canada
Review: A delicious experience. We sat on the upper floor with a view of the kitchen. We loved how energetic it was up here. The maple fried chicken and meatballs were a standout. The pizza and dessert were also tasty. We were met with great service throughout the evening.

Address: 1017 West Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C4 Canada
Review: We just landed and wanted a couple of drinks and a snack before a late dinner.  I read good things, and we decided to stop in.  It was great - the hostess was nice and bartender was friendly and fantastic.  The meatballs and "pizza bread" hit the spot.  We're definitely interested in trying it for dinner the next time we come back to Vancouver.

Address: 1017 West Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C4 Canada
Review:
I've been to Nightingales probably 3-4 times now and each time it's been pretty good.
We came for happy hour this time. We had the fried chicken, fries, pepperoni pizza and the Margherita pizza.
The pizza was thin and chewy. Lots of toppings. Just the right amount of savouriness.
The fries were probably my favourite. Could be a bit crispier. The spice on the outside gives it a bit of sourness which makes it somewhat addicting.
I get the fried chicken every time I come. They sweetness balances off everything nicely and the pickles are just the cherry on top.
Every time I come, the service is always very nice and friendly and this time was no exception. If you want to go somewhere to hang out with friends with okay food and drinks and a laid back atmosphere with decent service. This would be my choice downtown

Address: 1017 West Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C4 Canada
Review: Service was excellent! Food was delicious, the place is really cute, we were there for a late lunch and it was not too busy. Our waitress forgot to put our last dish in, so we never got it, luckily we had ordered plenty of food it wasn’t needed.

Address: 1017 West Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C4 Canada
Review: Found this place for lunch and enjoyed the beet salad (fantastic, simple, and flavorful!) with the fried chicken.  Was so good I came back for dinner and had the margarita pizza (5☆) and the asparagus.   Food quality was all top notch and the service was also exceptional.  The bar was gorgeous.

Address: 1938 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review:
An excellent spot for enjoying Thai cuisine, offering a delightful and reasonably priced dining experience. The quality of the food is exceptional, particularly the dumplings, vegetarian green curry, and coconut soup, which we found to be incredibly delicious. Similar to many establishments in Vancouver, this place caters to a diverse range of dietary preferences, ensuring that even vegans have at least one suitable choice. Additionally, their happy hour drinks are highly enjoyable.

One aspect that stood out to us was the variety of options available on the menu. Whether you were a meat lover, a vegetarian, or a vegan, there were numerous choices to suit every palate. It was refreshing to see a restaurant that prioritized inclusivity and catered to different dietary needs without compromising on taste or quality.

During our visit, we decided to explore the happy hour offerings, and we were not disappointed. The selection of drinks was impressive, with a range of creative and well-crafted cocktails, along with other beverage options. It was a fantastic opportunity to try something new and indulge in refreshing concoctions that complemented the flavors of the food perfectly.

Address: 1938 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review: Wow !! What can I say? Food was absolutely phenomenal, the snacks at the beginning were small but we're packed with punches of flavour!! We had a reservation and did the tasting menu about $80 a person and we definitely left with full bellies! My aunt was visiting from out of town and she was absolutely blown away! Street parking on 4th was expensive so try and find parking in the residential areas!

Address: 1938 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review: Everything was perfect! I don’t remember the name of the food but the food was gorgeous and tasty!!! The atmosphere was stunning. Moreover, the staff are all nice and friendly. My friend and I really had a good time and enjoyed the food and service here. thank you thank you. 💕

Address: 1938 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review:
We had a wonderful dining experience.
The flavors were incredible and the staff were very attentive.
We had the price-fixed menu with the wine pairing and it was amazing! Extremely delightful and knowledgeable chef. Exquisite, artistic and delicious dishes with fresh ingredients prepared from scratch. Distinctive and well-balanced flavor and teste.
Love Thai cup cake at first bit. usually I always let my camera eat first but this meal I enjoyed it so much completely forgot to shoot photos
Wine pairing both options (BC & French flight )are prefect pair with food and dessert I ordered them twice as perfect match !
Highly recommended

Address: 1938 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review:
Note that Maenam only does tasting menu if you reserve. This was not clear on their website or during reservations, even if you read it now, it doesn't say a la carte is only available for walk ins.

Besides that the food overall was good but nothing wow'd us which I was expecting for a Micheline guide recommended restaurant.

$88pp for 4 courses ( menu said for an overall 11 dishes - FYI the appies were 4 hours derve sized bites which accounted for 4 dishes)

Appies - 4/5, loved all of them but nothing over the top special

Bison Salad- 0/5 it was soo salty it tasted bitter

Halibut coconut sour soup - 2/5
Didn't quite give us the kick expected
It jusy tasted like a coconut broth

They offered us the shrimp salad after which we enjoyed ,the shrimp was definitely undercooked, you can still see the raw center but I trust that it's sashimi grade and ate Nothing special ( taste more like a Viet dish) 3/5

Sablefish curry - 5/5 fish was cooked perfectly, more very flavourful and perfect with rice

Pork belly pad cha - 3/5 good but nothing special

Desert- Hazelnut cake and coconut jelly 2/5
Hazlenut cake got soggy from the sauce but I loved the brulee on top
Coconut jelly was super dense, I think they might have used too much agar agar, but it wasn't too sweet and had a lot of ( what felt like) fresh coconut meat.

Overall a good dining experience but missed the mark for us on many things. We probably won't be back.
For comparison, we really enjoy Sawasdee for Thai food, taste is on point and authentic but obv they're atmosphere and plating is not compatible.

A little dissapointed since we had high hopes

Address: 1046 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W9 Canada
Review:
One of the best meals I’ve had in a while. We got the $50 family style dinner. Everything was cooked extremely well and was fresh. The use of fresh herbs makes a difference here.
Steak was cooked to perfection and the three layer dessert was a perfect blend. Would definitely come back.

Address: 1046 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W9 Canada
Review: The reservation is needed. Such a great spot to have Vietnamese food in Victoria dr. Excellent service , Alice was very friendly and helpful about the service and the menu detail. And we end up with 8 dishes for 2 people. We seem like very dish quite interesting. The steak is very tender and soft and serve with watercress salad  so so good. The pho noodle is yummy very concentrated in flavor and clear broth. Octopus with lime sauce is refreshing and go very well with seafood. The prawn fritters is eatable till trail . The bone marrow does not have much substance, maybe we aren’t lucky this time, it’s mostly bone. Spring rolls were fantastic, when you bite into it, you can feel a mouthful of ingredients exploding in your mouth, highly recommend this place !!  We will come back again. And the Pandan desserts is amazing good combination with ice cream!!

Address: 1046 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W9 Canada
Review:
Cảm ơn
My first time trying this local bustling joint, I had hesitated as it seemed a bit more western and mainstream. However, I was massively incorrect.
The grub here is PHOnomenal, super yummy, dope plentiful portions of authentic Vietnamese grub at its finest with reasonable prices for the area. I hauled a portion of Mixed Vegetables and Fried Tofu, perfect I loved it and wolfed it down. The joint is super cool, love the asethetics and a fantastic vibe. There's also a bunch of really nice outdoor benches to park your bit in the sun whilst having a chow down.
I'm stoked to return, this was a rad experience of many and an awesome feast.
Support local businesses!

Address: 1046 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W9 Canada
Review: Booking a reservation involved setting alerts for an opening and it finally happened!  On coming in at the time assigned to us, seating was quick. Our server was excellent and helped us put together a meal off the menu (where everything was sounding good).  We ordered the garlic fried noodles, bone marrow, stir fried vegetables, and steak. The bone marrow was tasty and fun to eat. The noodles were flavourful with a good bite to them but a tad dry. The vegetables were nice and not your usual mix. Finally, the steak was good but we had pretty high expectations coming in.  We ordered the sticky rice cake ice cream and it was marvellous!

Address: 1046 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W9 Canada
Review:
Visiting from Chicago. My Lord. Make this a stop if you want fun, interesting food. Started off with this octopus, don’t sleep on this green sauce it’s a little spicy and a whole lot of delicious. The bone marrow was decadent and balanced out with the lime. I also had an interesting Cod dish that was served over a fire. I didn’t love the sauce it was served with but Alex was quick to offer another suggestion for a garlicky fish sauce thing that was amazing.

Both Alex and the other female bartender were great. Normally you just get one of the two bar tenders to give you attention. They were a great tag team helping everyone at the bar.

Probably about 15 minutes away from my hotel. Well worth the Uber to get outside of the touristy spots outside of the Stanley park area.

Address: 774 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C9 Canada
Review: While the restaurant is cute, in a very good location and the food looked pretty, I found its taste is below my expectation. The waitress advised us that the share plate would be good to share among 4 people but it was pretty small so we called it a light lunch. If you love dim sum, I don’t think this place will satisfy you

Address: 774 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C9 Canada
Review: Pretty cool restaurant for dumpling, first time having different flavoured soup dumplings, gave me an unique experience. Went with friends, all loved it, have a great experience of Chinese cuisine. Signature 7 is definitely recommended. We also liked their mains, orange chicken and  sweet & sour pork, their flavours are great!

Address: 774 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C9 Canada
Review: Tried the different colored bao and it did not disappoint.  Not all flavors are to my taste but it was worth trying.  The food was great and the service was even better.  Parking might be hard to find during weekends so great time to visit would be weekdays.

Address: 774 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C9 Canada
Review:
Excellent food! We were seated in a place where we could see them making our food.
Good prices and excellent service. Our waitress was kind and answered all our questions.
I highly recommend Jingle Bao. Their 7 different flavors baos were excellent. The fried tofu and shrimp dumplings as well.

Address: 774 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C9 Canada
Review: We tried their sampler and although some of the dishes were not our favorites, we enjoyed the experience nonetheless. Three of us shared the sampler (lots of food). We all really enjoyed the Jingle Bao's (multi coloured/assorted flavors), however, I personally would have been happy with just the classic, but we were game for trying new things. The chicken was good and the edamame and a few other things but I don't remember what theybwere called. One of the tables had some napkins on the floor that one of the waitresses missed picking up but everything else was clean and we were seated quickly and served promptly.

Address: 163 Keefer Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1X3 Canada
Review:
I enjoyed our dining experience at Bao Bei, but found the cuisine a bit confused. We asked the server for recommendations and she suggested half the menu, so of course we obliged.

We got marinated eggplant as an appetizer, prawn dumplings, pea shoots, prawn fried rice, and halibut. The star of the meal was definitely the pea shoots and the strangest was likely the fried rice, which tasted like a fusion of Korean and Indian, which was a bit unexpected considering the traditional Chinese menu.

The vibe was cool, dimly lit, and sat small and large tables. We had quick service and left full. The entire meal may have been a bit expensive, but we're glad we tried it once.

Address: 163 Keefer Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1X3 Canada
Review: Recently came back to visit and now I remembered why I don’t come here often. The food takes a very very long time to arrive. It was an average Tuesday, yes it was busy but I’ve never been to busy restaurant where it takes 2 hours to get “fried rice” and some “ Wagyu meat”. The staff was nice keeping us updated but dam, we waited a long time. On a more positive note, I love their cocktails. I recommend the Nai Nai punch and in a hot day the Tokyo Long Island Slushi.

Address: 163 Keefer Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1X3 Canada
Review: The name seems like a Chinese restaurant but the food tastes doesn’t like local Chinese food. Western people may like it cuz it’s for their taste to cook but if you are Asian don’t go there you won’t be satisfied with their food! Overall, they did really good job on their vibe and food and every Chinese elements

Address: 163 Keefer Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1X3 Canada
Review: Family owned and delightfully chic bistro with spectacular food. We went for the chefs choice menu and were not disappointed. Stars were: crispy fried silken tofu, cold eggplant with ginger, bao, peashoots. Wonderful selection of mocktails and cocktails with delightful service. Just a really solid place built on family traditions and a love for fresh local ingredients prepared perfectly.

Address: 163 Keefer Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1X3 Canada
Review: Absolutely fantastic 😍 well balanced dishes and great atmosphere. There $55 per person option is more than worth it and nearly every dish is 5/5. Fast service, kind staff, and overall enjoyable night. Perfect for a group of 2-3 for relatively quick bite.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: This restaurant offers stunning views of the water and city skyline. The food is absolutely delicious, with a menu that offers plenty of options to choose from. But what really sets this restaurant apart is the atmosphere - it's the perfect spot to catch up with friends over a meal and drinks. The staff are friendly and welcoming. Overall, I highly recommend checking out this restaurant for a memorable dining experience in Vancouver.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
I recently dined at Cactus Club Restaurant and wanted to share my thoughts. Although there was a delay in receiving our food, the staff was incredibly friendly and made us feel welcome throughout our visit. The restaurant itself had a great ambiance and provided a pleasant environment for our meal.
One area of improvement would be the selection of non-alcoholic drinks, which was somewhat limited. It would be nice to see a wider variety of options in that regard. On the other hand, I must commend the kitchen on the fantastic calamari. It was cooked to perfection and had a delicious flavor that left me wanting more.
However, I found the ravioli with shrimp to be a bit too sweet for my taste. While it may appeal to those who enjoy sweeter flavors, I personally would have preferred a more balanced taste.
Overall, my experience at Cactus Club Restaurant was positive, with the standout being the delightful calamari. Despite the minor setbacks, I would still recommend visiting for a friendly atmosphere and memorable dining experience.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
A very large restaurant with gorgeous views over the harbour! The staff was very kind and the food was great, though my chicken sandwich was better than the tofu bowl (which lacked sauce and was a bit dry). Really good fries! The cocktail menu was large and the cocktails themselves were very tasty, too.

While the views were lovely, the restaurant was VERY loud and it could be difficult to hear the person sitting across from you!

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: It’s not a fancy 5 star restaurant, but for what it is, it was awesome. I had salmon for dinner and it was delicious. I sat in the dining room with a water view. Most people wore sunglasses because the sun was bright and bold at 8pm at night! My waiter was awesome. I wish I remembered his name. It’s a crowed place, so make reservations early. They have outside eating and since it’s right on the water side, it’s a great place to take a stroll afterwards.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: Great food, great environment/vibe, and reasonable prices. Food was a bit slow to come out and service was somewhat lacking, but overall I really enjoyed my evening there. A reservation ahead of time will make it much easier to get seated.

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: I came here last week for happy hour. The happy hour prices are reasonable. The food was good and came out pretty quick. Staff were friendly. Half of the outside patio was closed on a hot day so we had to sit inside but overall decent experience.

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
Came here with my partner during happy hour, we were really happy with the happy hour menu. The prices were reasonable for what we ordered and the service was great! We ordered the
blackened creole chicken, it was delicious. We loved the mashed potatoes that came with it. We also got the tuna poke bowl, it was fresh and all the ingredients worked super well together. Excited to come again!

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
The food was absolutely amazing, especially the delicious Avocado salad. I tried Baja Fish Tacos for they very first time and it was a little spicy but incredibly delicious.
Everything was perfect.

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: One of the only places not short staffed. What a pleasure, the food was amazing and they couldn't do enough for us

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
First off, Nicci our server was awesome. The drinks, appys and dinner was amazing.
Thank for a nice evening to help celebrate our 29th anniversary. When making our reservations it asked if it was a special occasion l, and it was put in that it was our anniversary, so we were bit disappointed that there was no mention of it.

Address: 157 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1B8 Canada
Review:
Arrived early to a large group dinner and were thoughtfully greeted. Loved the bourbon cocktail to start and the poutine add bacon was unbelievably delicious. Chickpea flour fried chicken wings has the best flavour and dinner tacos just as yummy.

Everyone was delighting in the food amidst the vintage atmosphere.

Address: 157 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1B8 Canada
Review:
This is my first time here, and we had a great time . We sit by the bar, and we l
enjoyed it. Our servicer, Blaize, was very knowledgeable and friendly.  She knows everything about the beer and the food . We were amazed by how much she knew about everything on the menu.  She is super nice and outgoing.  We ordered  craft beer , a couple flights.  The wings we ordered were delicious and loved our beer.  We will definitely invite our friends and come back again.

Address: 157 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1B8 Canada
Review: We had such a lovely time at Alibi Room last night - great service, didn’t feel rushed, good happy hour menu & beer selection. I had the fried chicken sandwich which was tasty & the other had pork belly which he raves about. Whatever you eat try the onion mayo!  Appreciate being able to walk into a place on a Friday night in Vancouver & have a lovely little leisurely dinner. Will be back :)

Address: 157 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1B8 Canada
Review: I’ve been meaning to try to this place and DAMN was I not disappointed. We came for their happy hour and it delivered. Snack size poutine was delicious. There tacos were probably some of the best I’ve ever had which is saying a lot. Pretzel buns and cheese sauce was not too bad. We each got a flight of their beers and each one had a unique flavour. Highly recommend checking this place out. The vibe is amazing and the people are super friendly. We’ll be back forsure.

Address: 157 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1B8 Canada
Review: This is an awesome location within a charming and historic building. The seating options are diverse and the atmosphere is fantastic. Their menu of food and drinks offers a wide range of impressive choices. I decided to try something new and ordered the pork belly burger, which was absolutely delicious. Additionally, the fries were cooked to perfection and had an excellent flavor. The service was prompt and friendly. Overall, a superb place in Gastown that I'll definitely return to in the future.

Address: 1175 Davie St Vancouver, BC V6E 1N2 Canada
Review: A great spot on Davie St. for sushi! Service was quick and attentive. I really enjoyed their nigiri sushi and their special rolls. My friend got their yakiudon and said it tasted good as well. The presentation was nice and the restaurant wasn’t too busy at 1pm on a Saturday.

Address: 1175 Davie St Vancouver, BC V6E 1N2 Canada
Review:
One of our favourite sushi spots in Vancouver! So delicious.  I hate when sushi has too much sauce, but the sauce to rice to fish ratio here is just perfect.

Our group ordered take out and they took our phone number, however we waited for a text or call back for pick up and they never contacted us!! We also stood by the door but never saw our food bags come to the front. They also never came out to tell us our food was ready. Quite annoying giving how long we had to wait until we asked them.

Address: 1175 Davie St Vancouver, BC V6E 1N2 Canada
Review: Great dining experience. There was a bit of line up but wasn’t bad considering it was Saturday noon in downtown. Their sushis are very good. The volcano roll is a must try! Also love the vegetable tempura. Service is friendly and speedy. The parking is a bit hard to find.

Address: 1175 Davie St Vancouver, BC V6E 1N2 Canada
Review: Enjoyed this sushi restaurant a lot - excellent food and the service was also really good. A bit slow because of how busy it was, but not intrusive or bothersome by any means. Portions were generous and great for sharing and the prices were really good. Expect to wait for about an hour or more to get a table as this is a small restaurant that is very popular. Our table spent about $25 per person for 1 appetizer and 7 rolls to share.

Address: 1175 Davie St Vancouver, BC V6E 1N2 Canada
Review: The sushi here is delicious. Rolls are a good size and have interesting flavours. The sashimi is so fresh and melts in your mouth. Amazingly inexpensive for the quality. Additionally to the sushi, get the cheese loin Katsu and thank me later. Service is always good but definitely prepare to wait, they don't take reservations. We went on a Saturday afternoon, just past lunch time and waited 30mins - worth it for the experience. The restaurant itself is pretty small so prepare to wait longer for parties bigger than 4

Address: 1809 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8 Canada
Review: One of the top restaurants in Vancouver. Great food, service and atmosphere. The reservation is hard to get and it’s a bit pricey but you get what you paid for. We did wine pairing on our visit and discovered a few great wines. The only downside the wine portions were quite small for the price and also additional caviar was not worth the price. Overall highly recommended to get there at least once.

Address: 1809 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8 Canada
Review:
This is a wonderful restaurant located on West 1st, close to the beach, and a wine store next door. Very awesome space, the food and service definitely match up to it.

It’s one of the Michelin star restaurants in Vancouver and it’s definitely earned its reputation. The food was absolutely delicious and carefully crafted. Every bite was perfect and everything just seemed to work well.

The cocktails were also delicious and matched well with the dishes.

The dessert was fresh and gave a palette cleansing experience - definitely another highlight from an already amazing dinner.

If you’re worried about being hungry after the tasting menu, you won’t be. It definitely will fill you. I don’t think you even need to opt for the add ons, but I found it filling.

Don’t worry about parking either as there is plenty of paid parking in the area. We got lucky and found one right outside the restaurant but cars come and go quite often enough.

I would highly recommend coming here, but book well in advance as they fill up quickly.

Address: 1809 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8 Canada
Review:
The first time I have visited AnnaLena and I can say it truly deserves the Michelin start that it got last November.

The servers are extremely knowledgable about their menu, and their memory is impeccable. Every dish was served in unison and the balance of flavours is perfect with every dish.

There was not a single dish we did not like but the torn bread was definitely the highlight of the night. All of us left satisfied and full (rare for a restaurant like this).

5-stars for a 5-star restaurant

Address: 1809 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8 Canada
Review:
We were at AnnaLena during Chapter 63. Super attentive service. The food was creative and had well-balanced flavours. There were interesting decorative bits reminisce of the 90s.

We could only get bar seats, and the corner we sat was kinda dark. We couldn't see the dishes clearly or take good pics of it. Thankfully, our taste buds could still savour them. Recommended!

Address: 1809 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8 Canada
Review: A very nice experience trying out the dining menu #62. We definitely get to try somethings that we otherwise wouldn’t order. The bread in the clam sauce was a highlight. I also liked very much how the scallop and beef was cooked and seasoned. Some other dish fell flat for me, but was still pleasant surprises.

Address: 130 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T3 Canada
Review: We had to check out the Chinatown scene! As someone visiting from Chinatown in the south, we needed authentic Chinese food before we boarded a 7 day cruise. This place did not disappoint and dare I say, it was our best meal in Vancouver and on our vacation! We got the mixed BBQ plate- and everything was cooked perfectly. The pork in Canada is better...I'm not sure why.. but it's not as salty as in the states, so the Chinese bbq pork has a more subtle sweet flavor here. I loved that they gave the ginger scallion sauce with the soy sauce chicken. Excellent salted egg that matches beautifully with well cooked rice. The tea was perfect- wonderful floral notes matches perfectly with the BBQ. We ate everything and wished for the remainder of the trip that we had ordered some food to go too! If you can, go early to avoid a wait. And, it's a great value!!!

Address: 130 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T3 Canada
Review: Greeted by a roast rack packed to the brim with finely cooked Chinese BBQ within a clean, old Chinatown themed experience. This is the most authentic BBQ within Vancouver’s Chinatown. They do not go overboard on the seasoning and salt, allowing the natural flavors of the meat to shine. It is still imperative to pair the BBQ with a neutral side dish, such as rice or noodles to complete this experience.

Address: 130 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T3 Canada
Review: An absolutely delicious plate of food, the Three Treasures gave us the perfect sampling of what Chinatown BBQ has to offer. The flavors were hearty and well-balanced. The service is a cut above the rest here; they educate you about the menu items and are very friendly and accommodating.

Address: 130 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T3 Canada
Review: Our server was so nice and really attentive to our needs and mostly the food was really great highly recommend the crispy pork!! and the serving was fast too. The ambience was nice and clean it feels like your in modern hongkong style restaurant and their washroom was very clean.

Address: 130 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T3 Canada
Review: My dine-in experience is long overdue! I came back after a long absence but pleased the same outstanding quality of their roasted pork (sui yok) is still there. The restaurant is comfortably lit (lighting is soothing, not overly bright). Clean, retro styled decor. The servers are courteous and friendly. Server Ian is outstanding! I'm coming back for more. 😊

Address: 3068 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: Nice selection of food shown in a beautiful menu. They taste as good as they look too. The seafood cabbage cake (okonomiyaki) was one of our favorites, and the salmon tempura was a good unique appetizer. Everything was flavorful but light, a very nice balance. The decor and ambience was modern casual, good for both families and hipsters alike. In fact, we saw several families with young kids devouring plates of sushi rolls happily :)

Address: 3068 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: Everything was so fresh! The chef roll tasted so good and unique, I would highly recommend if you like sashimi to try this roll with many fish inside. It's a bit pricey, but the quality is very good here! The "Zombie Brain" (fried avacado with spicy tuna and crab salad was also good)

Address: 3068 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: Servers can explain any dish we do not know. Service is fast but not rushed. We were able to sit comfortably and eat without interruption, around 9 pm. Great atmosphere, low light setting. We got the hamachi carpaccio, salmon carpaccio, cheese katsu, miso eggplant, and beef sushi that I don't recall the spelling of. All were amazing, I wish I could eat miso eggplant like this at home! Would love to be back next time we are in Vancouver.

Address: 3068 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: It’s hard to give them 4stars as the food is amazing, but the service was lacking. Hopefully they can improve on serving customers better.

Address: 3068 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: Went here for a friend's birthday and it wasn't very busy but we went on a week night so that's probably why. Some food tasted really good and some were ok. Service was not bad and the atmosphere was fun!

Address: 909 Burrard Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2N2 Canada
Review:
The food is incredible. We have not had food this good since Europe.
Everything is delicious,even flavors that you think don't go together, this chef makes them work in a delicious way.
Incredible food and service. If you are in Vancouver, try this restaurant.

Address: 909 Burrard Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2N2 Canada
Review:
Absolutely phenomenal food and service every time! I recently celebrated a birthday here and brought my own cake. The hostess advised that there would be a plating fee of $4.50 per person. Fair enough, it is a hassle for the restaurant to deal with this. They plated the cake and used piping to decorate the plates with chocolate and caramel swirls. They also garnished the plate with mint and whipped cream! Wow! So impressed.

The food of course was fantastic.

Address: 909 Burrard Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2N2 Canada
Review: I visited this restaurant to celebrate my birthday, and it was an excellent choice. Every dish had a special and unique taste, and our server, Brian, provided me with friendly food explanations and top-notch service throughout the meal. His service, escorting me out after the meal, was a really nice touch and the best service I've ever received. He was professional, and I was genuinely happy. I hope to receive this kind of service again on my next visit.

Address: 909 Burrard Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2N2 Canada
Review: We attended recently for the Alsatian night after many years. I like the place, calm and subdued atmosphere. Simple decoration it is comfy. Staff very good and helpful. Food was excellent and done well. Expensive wine list the cheapest one around $90 I thought they need to have more affordable wine around $60 to $75.

Address: 909 Burrard Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2N2 Canada
Review: Fantastic place with top-notch service. Since the moment we entered until we left, everything was great. We visited at the first time of the evening and it looked like they had an issue in the kitchen, which was quickly and gently solved by the staff offering some appetizers to the whole restaurant. We tried the mushroom soup, the braised lamb, a featured turbot fish with pasta, orange creme brûlée and profiteroles. They were all exceptional, except for the fish that we felt it missed something. But still not enough to not give a 5 star to this place.

Address: 1428 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1N2 Canada
Review:
Incredible food, lovely drinks and great service all in a really beautiful space.

We were delighted to get a reservation here for Valentine's Day. Even on a night where you would expect it to be super busy, the service was still dialled in! All of the staff were super friendly and efficient, food came quickly and the whole dining area was nice and spacious. We never felt like we were too close to other guests or that it was ever too loud.

Linh Café has done a really great job in every way, this is what hospitality is all about!

Address: 1428 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1N2 Canada
Review:
Food was great but service was poor.

First of all, the restaurant does not accept reservations for a party smaller than 6 or 8 (can’t remember exactly but we have 5 ppl). Therefore, we purposely arrived earlier for dinner which was around 5:20pm. We were immediately told by the host that we need to finish our dinner by 7:15pm in order to let the next reserved party sit down. That sort of rubbed us in the wrong way to begin with but we accepted the challenge.

Then more issues with our waitress. She was very polite but I think this is more of a training issue for her. She was filling our glasses with a Red Sangria but it was dripping all over the table then it dripped on my friend’s light color dress! She was apologetic and helped my friend to clean it. Then once again, she reminded us we will need to finish dinner by 7:15pm. During the whole dinner, she was constantly interrupting our conversation by collecting empty dishes or even unfinished dishes! At one point, she collected all of our utensils and plates but there was still food left to eat! We were already quite annoyed by that. It feels like the kitchen was out of dishes and plates that they needed to collect them as soon as the customers are somewhat done with the food.

Finally, we were paying the bill and our waitress brought over the credit card machine but basically walked right up to our friend’s back and leaned over against him. That’s the reason why we believe all of this is more of a training issue. She needs to learn to give space and privacy to their customers (and how to pour properly)! This is a higher end Vietnamese restaurant and the service certainly did not feel that way.

Address: 1428 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1N2 Canada
Review:
Never disappointed in this restaurant.

They don’t take reservations you have to go early to write down your names and line up. The line can be long from 30 minutes up to an hour or so.

Make sure you go there early so you can get the mussels before it sold out. It was the best mussels I ever had before. Too bad we couldn’t order this time. The snails is really rich and tasty. I could eat a whole bread with the snails sauce. The lobster benny is pretty good, but the portion a bit small compared to the price. Clam is good but we were too busy with the snails.

Address: 1428 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1N2 Canada
Review:
Based on a recommendation from a YouTuber review, my friend and I decided to try LINH CAFE, a French-Vietnamese fusion restaurant in town. The sleek and modern building immediately caught our attention as we walked in. The interior is chic and comfortable - perfect for a girls' get-together or a selfie session.

After perusing the extensive menu, we decided to try a variety of dishes. We started with the YELLOWFIN TUNA TARTARE, which had a strong sesame oil flavor that overpowered the dish. However, the homemade potato chips served alongside it were exceptionally crispy with a bold potato flavor. We wished we could have ordered the chips alone as a snack.

Next, we had the NEM - CHẢ GIÒ - SPRING ROLL, which my friend loved. While I found it to be a bit salty for my liking, the filling was delicious and well-seasoned.

The CHICKEN LIVER was served with a creamy dijon mustard sauce that complemented the dish well. However, we felt it could have been even better if the liver had been marinated prior to cooking.

The FRIED FROG LEGS were a standout dish for us. Seasoned with garlic, butter, chili flakes, and fresh herbs, the frog legs were incredibly tender and perfectly complemented by the garlic butter. I highly recommend trying it!

The DUCK BREAST wasn't as impressive as we had hoped. While it was served with glazed apples and grapes, we found the fruits to be the highlight of the dish. The duck breast itself seemed overcooked and lacked the desired tenderness.

Lastly, we tried the PHỞ BÒ with braised beef brisket, rice noodles, and bone marrow. We were blown away by the rich and flavorful beef bone soup base and the perfectly cooked rice noodles. The bone marrow, however, wasn't to our liking.

To end our meal on a high note, we indulged in the restaurant's delicious bread. It was so good that we each finished an entire loaf!

Overall, LINH CAFE offers a unique and delicious dining experience with a beautiful atmosphere. Some dishes may need minor adjustments, but the quality of the food and the attentive service make it worth checking out.

Address: 1428 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1N2 Canada
Review:
Always wanted to check out this place and finally did today.

There was a line up to get in.  It was busy but the space inside is huge.

Menu didn’t have any vegetarian options therefore I asked my server.  She recommended noodles with vegetables which is not on the menu.

It was delicious, very flavourful.  And huuuge!  And quite pricey 💵💵💵
BUT no protein 😬

Address: 3825 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P2 Canada
Review: Really enjoyed the cod fish and chips. Loved that their fries are fresh handcut fries. The fish was very fresh - looking forward to trying other fish types and items. We ate on the bench outside with our dog and it was the perfect casual dinner.

Address: 3825 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P2 Canada
Review: After a long and rewarding stroll from downtown to the Bloedel conservatory, I enjoyed one of the best , if not the best, fish and chips of my life. I was recommended to try the halibut and, oh boy! Heavenly, not oily at all, crispy and light, seasoned to perfection. A generous serving of fish on a bed of fantastic fries, coleslaw and tartar dip. Super friendly staff, cool and laidback interior, with some seating by the window. Really really recommended, as they focus on local, seasonal and sustainable seafood. Really awesome!

Address: 3825 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P2 Canada
Review:
Its usually halibut, salmon, or cod managed to veer off my typical menu choices and explore the Arctic Char for my Fish and Chips order.

From the onset, the service representative demonstrated a commendable level of hospitality and eagerness to cater to this unique request since it was not on the menu that was very nice of them.

Now, onto the main event - the Arctic Char Fish and Chips. To say it was superb would be an understatement. The perfectly fried Arctic Char exceeded all my expectations. It was succulent and full of flavour, pairing harmoniously with the crispy chips. This dish struck a perfect balance between the delicate fish and the satisfyingly crunchy chips. Its like a perfect balance between trout and salmon in taste.

This was, without a doubt, the best Arctic Char Fish and Chips I have ever had in Canada. Their tartar sauce is also to die for they now sell it in mason jars great choice.

Rating: 5/5 Stars

Address: 3825 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P2 Canada
Review: A very cool local spot with gluten free fish and chips!!! So amazing. Fries and halibut chips were outstanding and cooked in a separate safe frier. Worth the trek. Also got the dairy free clam chowder!

Address: 3825 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P2 Canada
Review: We are repeat customers!  This is the best fish and chips shop in the city and I am very sure it is not close. Loved it all today!  And a big fan of the new scallop bites.  Fun!

Address: 1626 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6J 1X6 Canada
Review: Just discovered this amazing restaurant! Beautiful decorated inside, it’s a huge location inside, and the food is super delicious! Loved the crispy chicken and the pasta dish. The spicy 🌶 squid octopus 🐙 with the seaweed chips! Can’t wait to come celebrate 🎊 my birthday 🎂 here!

Address: 1626 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6J 1X6 Canada
Review: Dined here this week and didn’t have reservation ahead so we had to wait 20minutes before we were seated. The place was very busy on a Monday evening and noticed they had a few birthday shout outs happening back to back. They bring out a cake or dessert of some type with a light up apparatus accompanied by drums and singing and the music volume is turned up and all the staff yells happy Birthday!! As soon as we were seated, the server greeted us, brought out waters and menus right away! Awesome! I was hungry already smelling all the delicious dishes all around me! Since they were busy the server asked if it was okay to bring the food as they come! Everything was so delicious! The oxtail Ramen broth was exactly as I imagined. Heads up, this does not come with a lot of meat so must be ordered on top of your main dish! The Blue fin Toro belly melted like butter- it was so good! The salmon carpaccio was very light and flavourful and not as fishy as I thought. My husband loved taco wasabi. It is definitely for someone who loves seafood and spicy food. We also ordered chestnut dessert and it was surprisingly delicious! Can’t complain! Over all it was a delightful experience! Will definitely be visiting again and highly recommended.

Address: 1626 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6J 1X6 Canada
Review: We celebrated our friend's birthday here which was really fun! Our server was attentive and friendly. The food was made so that you can share out amongst the group or to yourself. I loved their chicken karaage and ebi mayo! I liked that they had a great selection of drinks. Would come back again!

Address: 1626 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6J 1X6 Canada
Review: We've been going to Suika for many years and it's a consistently excellent Japanese izakara restaurant. Terrific sashimi & seafood, there's always creative new dishes & specials and the service is great. Highly recommended!

Address: 1626 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6J 1X6 Canada
Review:
The food and service were phenomenal. Loved the genuine hospitality of the servers.

I got the Chirashi Set which was amazing in every bite. They also accommodated my shrimp allergy by making sure to use different utensils to prepare the dish.

One of the best/most authentic izakaya you can find in Vancouver.

The servers went above and beyond to even open the door for us as we exited. Super Japanese hospitality!

Address: 2430-8260 Westminster Highway Richmond, BC V6X 1A7 Canada
Review: If you’re craving for rice rolls, this is the spot to go. Great texture and flavours that combine well together to give you a satisfying and full stomach after eating. Although it is located in the Richmond Public Market food court, don’t let it fool you you as wait times can peak beyond an hour. There was a 20min wait ordering at 11am on a Saturday morning, but quickly jumped to a 45min to 1 hour wait by the time we finished. Beef rice roll was comparatively better than the shrimp rice roll which had lacklustre shrimp.

Address: 2430-8260 Westminster Highway Richmond, BC V6X 1A7 Canada
Review:
As far as rice rolls ago, I quite enjoyed this place. The congee was great too, although there was an aftertaste to the pork, so it properly wasn’t super fresh.
But overall, I would come back here for the rice rolls although there is a long wait. It was a 50min wait for our order, but the line never died down. So that was understandable and I had a chance to do some shopping as I waited, it was not a huge issue.

Address: 2430-8260 Westminster Highway Richmond, BC V6X 1A7 Canada
Review:
Great place for congee and rice roll. Well worth the 30 min wait.

Ordered the Hei Style Sampan Congee and Preserved Vegetable & Pork Rice Roll combo. Got $2.50 off with the combo. Both were equally tasty.

The Osmanthus and Fermented Rice Fresh Soy Milk was also very good.

Will definitely be coming back.

Address: 2430-8260 Westminster Highway Richmond, BC V6X 1A7 Canada
Review:
Nostalgic silky rice noodles!! (Pls like👍👍👍)
This place makes the rice noodles by scraping it off the instead of rolling itx emphasizing texture and silkiness. We got the pork, beef, and schrimp, and the pork and beef rice rolls. The soysauce is also to die for! Good prices for a nice cheap lunch located in a historic and cozy foodcourt. Unfortunately, by the time we went, the congee was sold out so didn't get to try that.

Address: 2430-8260 Westminster Highway Richmond, BC V6X 1A7 Canada
Review: There is an emphasis of trying this spot because of the texture (silkiness and thinness) of the rice rolls. It was very well done and in the style where it's not wrapping the toppings. It does get relatively busy here even on a weekday but took about 15 mins from ordering to get the food. The congee and rice roll combo is a decent deal at around $14 (dependent on type of rice roll you choose as some are more premium). Congee is thick and has a lot of content. This spot does not accept card and it's cash only or via WeChat/Alipay. Worth going here to grab a meal. Best to eat fresh. There was about 9 shrimps in the rice roll; a reasonable amount.

Address: 415 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7 Canada
Review:
WOW. Location is a bit sketchy to say the least.....notwithstanding, the minute you enter you're welcomed by passionate and knowledgeable staff. If you are a foodie this is a MUST TRY location. Best option is the, "I WANT IT ALL" option ($85/person). It's a 12 course tapas share option, of delicious pallet popping delights, where you get to try the entire Chef's Creations. Only catch is you need a minimum of 4 people to try this. So get your double date on and try this place. You'll thank me later.  CHEERS!!!

PS- There is also a very creative signature cocktails menu if you so desire.

Address: 415 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7 Canada
Review: Absolutely delicious food and great service! Each dish was beautifully decorated, accompanied by delicious sauce. Chicken of the sea is a must eat. Lamb tartare was not smelly at all, flavoured with lemon and capers. Trout was fluffy and seasoned well. Quite pricey for the portion but recommend this place to everyone for quality food.

Address: 415 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7 Canada
Review:
Amazing service and great food inside a very unassuming exterior. The Mackenzie Room somehow manage to land a very interesting vibe that feels very welcoming and casual all the while delivering a great fine dining experience.

Would definitely come back!

Address: 415 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7 Canada
Review:
I came in for Dine out this past Sunday and was impressed. We sat at the bar and our server gave us great service.

The food was delicious in my opinion. The stand out dishes were the chicken of the sea and the pork dish. I also ordered a non alcoholic ginger beer for $5 which I thought was a great price for the taste . Overall I thought for the food and service, the price we paid was fair.

I would definitely come back with 4 people to try the full tasting menu.

Areas for improvement would be check the chairs/stools to make sure they're level as mine was wobbly. Not a huge thing but it's a small fix that I think would improve the experience.

Also I would recommend Ubering as the area is unfortunately very sketchy. If you are going to walk, I'd recommend parking in the neighborhood with houses more south and then walking.

Address: 415 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7 Canada
Review:
Fabulous food, tastes better than The Published. Good ambience and wait staff were professional, courteous and welcoming.

Dessert could be a little bit better. The flan was a bit too sweet and dense. Great overall experience and would rate the restaurant as a solid 9/10 or 4.5 out of 5.

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: Absolutely legendary. Fries were still crisp under the copious amount of gravy. Lots of squeaky cheese curds. Great smoked meat sandwich too. Service was a little whatever when we went though, maybe funner at night

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review:
I recently visited La Belle Patate and tried their BBQ Poutine, it was absolutely delicious! The combination of crispy fries, savory gravy, and flavorful BBQ sauce was just perfect. I loved every bite of it!

Apart from the food, the interior decor of the restaurant was also very unique and eye-catching. It gave off a cozy and welcoming vibe, making me feel right at home. I especially loved the wall art and the cozy seating arrangements.

Overall, I would highly recommend La Belle Patate to anyone who loves great food and a cozy ambiance. It's definitely a must-visit spot in town! I'm already planning to come back and try some of their other menu items, and I can't wait to see what other surprises they have in store.

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: First evening out in Vancouver, and I headed straight here. So glad I did, the laidback atmosphere as if you were at home. A small place packed with a friendly and relaxed attitude, but most of all poutine! I got a medium-sized traditional poutine and it was just so incredibly good. Not greasy, not too salty, just perfect! Paired with a light beer, couldn’t ask for more.

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: I love this place so much! I have come here both times I’ve been on vacation to Vancouver and I am always so happy with what I order. I order the traditional and it is always enough food. It comes out quick and the atmosphere is so great!

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: Great food in a convenient location. I was looking forward to the poutine from this spot and it did not disappoint! I got the breakfast poutine which was delicious. Others in my group were very pleased as well. The gravy is the star of the meal, so I recommend getting a poutine with gravy.

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: A must for visitors (like us from Colorado) and locals alike. If you want delicious, authentic poutine look no further. Plus, the service was immaculate and the owner is so so friendly ! Definitely try the spruce beer (non-alcoholic, think ginger beer or root beer), and you won’t be disappointed. The poutine is the best and the steamie is a perfect little hot dog with all the toppings. Don’t miss this awesome place !

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: Thee best hamburgers and poutine délicieuse in the city!! Don't even mess with rest. Fresh local ingredients. Friendly, passionate staff/good positive vibes. 😇

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: I highly encourage supporting this local business! The poutine options are great. I personally enjoy the loaded steamie along with fries & gravy. Make sure you get their in-house made Spruce Beer (a French Canadian pop). So yummy!! The owner has always been so welcoming to us  :)

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review:
I'd been meaning to try this place for longer than I can remember, and upon finally stopping in, I wish I'd done so much sooner.

Having seen La Bella Patate recommended countless times, it lived up to the hype completely. The staff were quite friendly, creating a relaxed atmosphere, and the food was great. I ordered a small classic poutine and a spruce beer (if you're on the fence, try the beer) and look forward to returning in order to try a hotdog next.

Overall this is a very fairly priced and tasty gem in Esquimalt. Solid 10/10.

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: The poutine was delicious. One side note they do have a pay phone in case you need to call someone in 80’s.

Address: 3096 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: Dinner on a Saturday night. Was surprised that the restaurant was quite empty. Is it that maybe cozy comfort food is not as popular during the hot summer?  We had mixed reviews of the food. Two of us were not excited about our meals (Beef Bourguignon and the Smoked Salmon Salad) whereas the other two loved their dishes (Chicken Parmesan sandwich & Afterschool special).  Our server was great though!  Thank you!

Address: 3096 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: Hit it 👍🏿! This is such a Vancouver staple. They have many locations and have been so consistent for years. I like the one on main Street because it has a patio and a good vibe. It definitely can get busy and they do take reservations. So call ahead if you don't want to wait. They should probably advertise this more but they are NUT free kitchen.

Address: 3096 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review:
For a father's day it wasn't packed until we left. We totally forgot it was father's day... Oops
We showed up at noon and there was a nice cozy both for us all to sit , including a walker.
We ordered the gooey grilled cheese, the jambalaya, and the jerk chicken wings.
All visually pleasing and all very delicious in taste.
My first time here. We will be back.

Address: 3096 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: The restaurant provides home style food that really delivers. The macaroni and cheese is really worth it along with the deserts and don’t forget them because they leave me satisfied each time I visit.

Address: 3096 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: Comfort food place with lots of good options. Last time the had muled wine and it was perfect. Everything we tried was good so I think you can go wrong. Staff is friendly and atmosphere is cozy. Also outside area has heaters for cold weather.

Address: 1109 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
The ambiance of this place is perfect, along with the impeccable garnish and taste of the food.

Every aspect is thoughtfully designed to ensure an amazing night for your special occasion. From the staff’s behavior to the presentation and flavors of the dishes, everything is top-notch.

You won’t feel rushed to leave the place, allowing you to truly enjoy your dining experience.

The dessert was absolutely amazing and delicious, while the steak was prepared exactly as we requested.

I highly recommend trying this restaurant for a memorable and delightful experience.

Address: 1109 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
Fantastic experience! Very knowledgeable staff, incredible quality and a good variety of cuts and origins for their meats while still having a fully fleshed out menu outside of the steaks.

Alicia served our table and was so attentive and caring. She asked if there was any occasion, and after learning it was our anniversary brought us complimentary bubbly and dessert to celebrate. Brought a beautiful selection of curated wines to the table to find the best one for us.

We ended up staying for longer than we usually would as each dish was rich, but perfectly balanced and we savoured every bite.

Will be back to explore the menu!

Address: 1109 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review: The best steakhouse in town, high quality of meat I can tell, the excellent service and the server is knowledgeable and very friendly. Busy restaurant all night but the food arrived very quickly. Overall, amazing and will definitely go again!! Reservations recommended

Address: 1109 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review: Elisa boasts a modern atmosphere that exudes contemporary charm. One of its standout features is the extensive range of wine selections available to satisfy even the most discerning palate. When it comes to the menu, the tomahawk steak steals the spotlight with its succulent flavors and impressive presentation, leaving a lasting impression on diners. However, while the overall culinary experience at Elisa is commendable, it must be noted that the preparation and execution of other dishes tend to follow more conventional approaches, lacking the same level of innovation and excitement. Nevertheless, the inviting ambiance and the exceptional tomahawk steak make it a worthwhile dining destination.

Address: 1109 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review: Really first class establishment. Amazing steaks,  a really good and extensive wine list and wonderful service to back it all up. Ryan truly was an amazing host, thank you Sir, a gentleman you are and full of great knowledge to back up his recommendations. Highly recommend. A proper extensive bar too, anything you could think of!

Address: 269 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G3 Canada
Review: This is the last restaurant I had the privilege of eating at before leaving Vancouver. To my taste, and liking it was easily the best. The atmosphere is wonderful, a small warm, classy dining area filled with jubilant conversations and savory smells. Sparkling water is served complimentary which is a nice touch. The service is intimate and friendly. Now, let me get to the food. Everything they served was absolutely magnificent. It started by taking me for a ride, and each progression of the meal just continued to up the ante. It left me wanting more and only disappointed that it all had to come to an end.

Address: 269 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G3 Canada
Review:
It's definitely not our favorite French restaurant. We are a bit shocked it was a michelin Star restaurant.

What we do like is the service. Decent service.

[Note:] When you book online, you are forced to pay 20% tip.

Parking: Paid side street parking

☆ The only dish we really recommend was their honey sorbet dessert (off menu). Great taste with different texture toppings that went perfectly together.

Unfortunately, everything else was too sweet or wasn't the best we ever had.. or lacked flavor.

Address: 269 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G3 Canada
Review: Everything was soooo good. Honestly I am not a big fan of french food in general but I was pleasantly surprised at how good the food and service was here. I’m normally very picky with the way my dishes are cooked but my first visit was very impressive that I went back and celebrated my birthday here. I will definitely be back again as their menu locates very frequently!

Address: 269 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G3 Canada
Review:
One of the most memorable dining experiences we have had in a long time! The seven course meal was carefully crafted with meticulous attention to every item on our plate. Service was non pretentious but professional. The restaurant is warm and inviting with hints of nostalgia adorned on its walls.
If you are lucky enough to get a reservation, consider yourself one of the winners of a ‘Golden Ticket

Address: 269 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G3 Canada
Review: St. Lawrence has been on my bucket list for a few years now and I was happy to see them win a Michelin star. My husband booked this place for my birthday and it ended up being pretty mediocre food, and then when you factor in the price we paid ($312.50 including a mandatory 20% gratuity that you pay when you reserve, for two people), it was really not great and I would not recommend coming here. The highlights for me were the cod and side stripe shrimp appetizer, the pork rinds, and then foie gras amuse bouche. Everything else was just… okay or not good. The halibut main was dry and on the bland side. The desserts (panna cotta and the raspberry pistachio Mille feuille) were either way too sweet or too bland.
