Between St Lawrence and Published on Main, I prefer the food at Published. The service was pretty good, they were attentive at removing plates and refilling waters. It was also really nice to sit in front of the chefs at the chefs counter, watching them cook the food. I personally wouldn’t go back here though. Oh and the portion sizes are not great either. My husband left hungry and had to go home and eat other things.

Address: 2546 E Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V5K 1Z3 Canada
Review: Passed by many times and decided to try with Indian friends. Laksa very spicy. Butter chicken had lots of chicken. Roti canai must have been good as never got a piece. Would have tried deep fried banana but no time

Address: 2546 E Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V5K 1Z3 Canada
Review: Haven’t been here since they changed ownership. Nothing changed in terms of decor. The laksa was delicious. It had a nice creamy coconut curry broth. Very flavourful. The Hainan Chicken and Satay Chicken were pretty solid as well. Really wish they could fix their kitchen ventilation though. My hair and clothes smelled like the kitchen after the meal.

Address: 2546 E Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V5K 1Z3 Canada
Review: Had the Laksa, hainan chicken, and roti. Laksa was not too thick and nicely balanced, more on the spicier side but very flavourful. Hainan chicken was nicely marinated and nice flavour, sauce enhances the flavour of the chicken and rice. Roti was a really good appetizer, fluffy and crispy and the sauce added a nice little curry flavour, not too strong.

Address: 2546 E Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V5K 1Z3 Canada
Review: Great food, thicker soup base on the laksa is a preference, but it wasn't runny.   The Pad Thai was the bomb as was the roti.    Atmosphere was the old Frenchie's 60era drive through decor...   So abysmal.    But let's be honest you came for the food.

Address: 2546 E Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V5K 1Z3 Canada
Review:
Terima kasih!! Best Laksa I ever had, period.
Dope home cooking style Malaysian food in a take-out style open-plan kitchen setting. This place is super busy and always bustling with locals and is a tribute to how authentic the food is. A great menu with plenty of vegetarian and vegan options or alternatives without sacrificing any of the yum!
We both opted for the traditional Singapore Laksa 新加坡特色叻 which was super yummy, plentifully packed with a large portion and variety of proteins. The broth itself is a perfect balance of coconut and aromatic spices, I actually got mine with the 'spiciest or hottest' modification which was really good and nicely took some of the creamy edge off, however it really wasn't that spicy at all to be honest. I tried my partners which was the default mild and without the extra chilli paste would have been way too creamy for me.
The Fish Cakes (bebola ikan) were phenomenal and worked as a great compliment to the meal! Extremely fresh, home made and no fuss grub with solid ingredients and flavors.
There isn't a lot of Malaysian food around Greater Vancouver, this place is a gem worth heading too. Everything was cooked with awesome precision, presented well and cooked with exciting ingredients and flavors.
Support local businesses!

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: MUST TRY! Worth the wait, must try, great simple ramen. The line ups can take over an hour at time but it’s worth it. Customer service is great, food is amazing and the atmosphere is welcoming and clean. Even with such a long line up, the staff are always so friendly and clean up after every guest so carefully to ensure the best experience for the next guest. Love this place!

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: You want Ramen in Vancouver? There are many options. This is no-nonsense delicious Ramen. Yes, Ramen, like Art, is subjective, but I can't imagine a scenario where a bowl of this could be sent back. Danbo is more consistent than the rain in this fair city for its ability to deliver an all around great bowl of Ramen. If you don't want to quibble about semantics and just have a delicious bowl, accept no substitute. I eat at a variety of Ramen joints, this one just hits every time. No Question.

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: Had to wait a while in queue to eat there, but it was well worth the wait. Hands-down the best vegan ramen I’ve ever had. The customization options are great, the broth is delicious and the service is fast & friendly. Would easily recommend this place (as well as the Seattle location).

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: Truly worth the wait. Incredible. Note the ramen doesn’t come with toppings so you have to add -on everything including egg

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: Absolutely wonderful, Ramen! This was my first time having ramen, and it all tasted delicious. The environment and atmosphere were great, and even with a line outside for seating, it did not take long to get in. Highly recommended!

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review:
This is one of my favourite place for Vegan Ramen!! As I prefer to have vegetarian/vegan Ramen, its very difficult to find a place that offers multiple options! And Danbo is one of them! Try them out and I am sure it won’t be disappointment for you! I was impressed with its flavourful broth and service! Dining space is quite small but well-managed. Make sure to book a seat via yelp before reaching there.
A must-visit for delicious plant-based options and attentive service.

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: Absolutely some of the best ramen I’ve had in all of Van, and easily top 5 I’ve had outside of Japan itself. The Rekka is a great spicy option, albeit they could still turn up the heat more from extra spicy. The wait can be quite long so don’t expect to just arrive & sit down. But the broth is full & very tasty, the noodles are delicious & I like that they let you pick firmness. The pork chashu is well cut & takes on flavour well. Can’t recommend this place enough.

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: This is one of my favorites spots in Vancouver. The ramen is always on point and I have great memories coming here. However, when we visited on July 11th, our team of 5 had to wait for 2 hours to get inside. What made it worse was that smaller teams who had hardly waited got to go before us. I would have preferred if they had at least asked us first if it would be alright for us to sit separately. A team of four that came after us got to go in before us just because they had one less person. I’m not sure who is managing the queue but the waitlist seemed useless. I would suggest implementing a time limit for bigger groups as two big groups before us took their sweet time while they saw a huge line. What was more infuriating was that when we finally came in, they put together two smaller tables for us and added a stool on the side. I couldn’t help but wonder if they could have done that sooner instead of letting in couples who’d come after us finish their meal and then put the two tables together for us. I’m not sure if I want to come here again as long the customers in line are not treated seriously.

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: Ramen Danbo gets my vote for some of the best ramen in Vancouver. Because there is limited seating inside, there is often a long waitlist to get seated, depending on your group size. Came during the week and for a larger group, there was about a hour long wait to get seated. Once seated the food came out very quickly and the both the ramen and broth was delicious. Love how you can order extra noodles too in case you have extra broth leftover. Prices are very reasonable as well. Will definitely have to come by here again

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: There’s always a wait so I was intrigued and decided to finally put my name down & try it. Small space inside but it wasn’t stuffy at all. Service is okay, they were really slammed with online orders all the way up to closing time. The ramen was good but I think you could have the same experience somewhere else with less wait.

Address: 433 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1B2 Canada
Review: After attending a concert at Roger Arena, we decided to stop by this place for a late dinner. We were pleased to find that it opened quite late and was conveniently located just a block away from our hotel, Marriott. To our surprise, the food here turned out to be exceptionally good. The service provided went above and beyond our expectations, and the prices seemed reasonable. If you're looking for a great atmosphere, delicious food, and friendly service, this place is the spot to be. I highly recommend trying their chicken dish if you're a fan of spicy flavors; it truly had a wow factor!

Address: 433 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1B2 Canada
Review: Went here late on a random Wednesday night and it was so good, I'm adding it to my Vancouver must eat list. The DanDan noodles and Korean fried chicken are a must try. The noodles were SO flavourful and filling. We got the chicken 2 ways; sweet& spicy and Hanoi glazed. The chef came out and explained which pickled veggies to eat with each flavour and wow. It was so flavourful and tender, the pickled veggies complimented it beautifully, would highly recommend these two flavours. Overall good vibes, great atmosphere, cool decor. Some options to play games by a lounge area in the front too

Address: 433 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1B2 Canada
Review:
What an amazing experience we had!
The server and the owner were a blast to be surrounded by. The food was outstanding - the menu is curated and Christian really puts his heart and soul into the food he serves.
Recommended this place to all my friends and we will definitely be going again soon!
Spicy Szechuan Korean Fried Chicken is a must try! Great quantity of food!

Address: 433 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1B2 Canada
Review:
We had lunch at Holy Chow and it was great. The restaurant is very cozy.
The waiter was very nice and attentive. He even informed us that it would take a little longer for our food to come that day because there was not enough staff in the kitchen.
We ordered Dandan noodles (vegetarian and with chicken). We enjoyed both very much.
We would recommend coming here.

Address: 433 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1B2 Canada
Review:
Short layover (4h) at YVR, enough time to skytrain to waterfront to chow down some holy chow.

The order was ready in 10 mins on a tuesday night at 10:30. Amazing service, booomb food, the spicy sechuan KFC blew our faces off, but we asked for it!
Pork spring rolls were probably the best we ever had and slaw was great too.

Thank you to the staff that greeted us. Great people!

We will be back!

Address: 718 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1B6 Canada
Review: Love the place for fresh cut fries. I found the food was a bit salty and seems like portion got little smaller but still good flavour. They use cheese curd that is very fresh. I would get regular fries next time not the poutine.

Address: 718 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1B6 Canada
Review:
First time getting poutine in Canada.

Poutine with smoked meat ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️: double fried fries which means super crispy fries. My favorite part is them making sure that there are toppings throughout the bowl. Most fry places put everything on the top and then you just have plain soggy fries near the bottom.

Address: 718 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1B6 Canada
Review:
First time trying poutine... and this place set my standards pretty high. We got the poutine with bacon, if I remember correctly. Absolutely delicious! I would definitely come back.

Fast, friendly service, and pretty affordable for a lot of value. I actually prefer this little hole in the wall a bit more over another more popular option we tried in the area. This place also layered the poutine so you don't have to mix it, which would've been hard since our cup was piled high. The small poutine was plenty for 2 people as an appetizer or snack.

One minor downside, the tables here aren't the best for eating at (they're low, and maybe only 1-2ft/30-60cm in diameter) so I found it more comfortable to take things to-go. I otherwise appreciated the fun decorations on their wall :)

Address: 718 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1B6 Canada
Review: Fritz probably has the best poutine in Vancouver. The fries are crispy and there are plenty of cheese curds and gravy. The shop is very small though and seating is limited, but you can just walk a bit and eat it on the benches along False Creek for a better view

Address: 718 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1B6 Canada
Review: My go-to spot now! While I'm from Washington, I'll find ways of convincing myself to travel over the border to get some poutine from Fritz European Fry House! I've only had the regular, but I am excited to "spice things up" on my next visit with a few new additions. Anytime we have friends or family visit, this is where we take them, and they always love it!

Address: 1505 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1E8 Canada
Review: Spectacular fish and chips and other delicacies (fish tacos and burgers) at this modest shack near Granville Island. The cod is fresh and super tasty, perfectly cooked! The chips (French fries) are excellent, the tuna taco is worth a trip. With CAD 10 per person you eat like a king. Best food in a long time! The service is super friendly. The accommodation is a bit rustic but hey… you can take the goodies out and eat it in your own castle!

Address: 1505 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1E8 Canada
Review: The captain of our zodiac boat trip recommended Go Fish! for lunch and told us that it was one of the best places to get fish and chips. He was right. It's basically a shack that you walk up to and put in your order. Nothing fancy. Simple and really good. We found a table by the side of the restaurant so we could  look over the bay.

Address: 1505 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1E8 Canada
Review:
The perfect way to end your day visiting Granville Island. This fish and chips shack is worth the walk over from the main market area. The staff here is super friendly and the food is cooked to order.

We got the cod fish and chips basket, and it tasted so fresh and high quality! The portions here are huge so honestly one plate is big enough to share between two people. The dish also comes with an amazing sesame tasting slaw on the side.

Don’t skip this place!

Address: 1505 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1E8 Canada
Review:
I recently dined at Go Fish Restaurant on Granville Island and I must say, the fish and chips was amazing! Cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor. The coleslaw they serve as a side dish was also exceptional with a unique taste that really complemented the fish.

However, I was disappointed with the lack of friendliness from the staff. While the food was great, the service left something to be desired. Also, the seating area was outside only, which may not be ideal for some customers.

Overall, if you're looking for delicious fish and unique coleslaw, Go Fish Restaurant is definitely worth a visit.

Address: 1505 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1E8 Canada
Review:
This is the legit place for fish and chips. Fresh line-caught fish and amazing flavour at a fair price in a great location.
My partner got their grilled salmon sandwich and it was epic, just the right seasoning and sauce. My fried halibut was a good portion and perfectly battered. The fries were incredible, but I into the age-old problem of my girlfriend stealing half of them.
Last but not least, the staff were all amazing! The cashier and cooks were the nicest people. Their quality of work proves they care, and I loved their taste in music.

Address: 1616 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1A6 Canada
Review: rare 5 star review. cheese board with fruit was excellent. expensive but great atmosphere. upbeat bar area and relaxing vintage seating. good lighting at night. staff professional yet casual, really good at checking in without being overbearing. bit out of the way of most vancouver sites but worth it. higher level creative bar menu.

Address: 1616 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1A6 Canada
Review: I came here alone on a Monday around 5pm to grab a quick drink. I was seated at the bar and the bartender (I'm sorry I forgot his name) gave a nice welcome. He asked me what kind of cocktails I liked, and I told him mezcals and sprit forward drinks. He then asked if I was okay trying a cocktail he created. The drink ended up being incredibly delicious and the rest is history. Overall, I had a fantastic experience and look forward to being back again.

Address: 1616 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1A6 Canada
Review: I am very impressed with this place. It’s such a hidden gem with AMAZING cocktails. I highly recommend stopping by. Best part, the bartender has so many off-menu cocktails they can make for you. I highly recommend the off-menu espresso martini. It’s one of my favorite  cocktails and this place just nailed it. Supper impressed looking forward to coming back!

Address: 1616 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1A6 Canada
Review: A hidden gem if there ever was one. Everything clicks here. The aesthetic, the food, the cocktail program are all top marks. The burrata salad and house made gnocchi are a must. I love burgers. The burger here is perfectly fine, but not a top recommendation in the city. The cocktail program has many classics and Tiki drinks. I tried my first VIEUX CARRÉ here and I now make it home!

Address: 1616 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1A6 Canada
Review: The food was excellent! The portions were big enough for the price and high quality of the food. I had chicken from the oven with seasonal vegetables which were delicious. The server was friendly and courteos. Definitely coming back!

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: Price point definitely higher than average. Burrito lacks core flavours critical to Mexican and Latin American cuisine. Meat chunks are a bit dry/hard with the lack of salsa and sour cream. Pico de gallo is barely there. No option for hot sauce. The overall flavour is flat/plain with an overwhelming amount of rice and lack of the rest.

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: La taqueria is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Vancouver. The tacos and burritos are very tasty, but a bit expensive. The workers are nice and the location is perfect.

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review:
Had Baja (Fish), Asada (Beef) Carnitas (Pork) Burritos. Delicious. Very filling. Friendly service, helpful even for us novices.
Great food, and prices are reasonable.
Exactly as it says on the tin, roof.
Around $15 ea

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: Stepping off the train into the city centre leaves you within throwing distance of some of the best tacos and burritos in the city. We grabbed a few tacos and a burrito before heading down to the water and had a nearly spiritual experience devouring them. Highly recommend the Baja taco, it will create a new level of expectation for any taco you have in the future. Also, their tortillas are A+.

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: This is truly a hole in the wall taco stand. We tried their special of the day, fish, chicken and beef tacos. Our favourite were the fish and the special of the day. They were absolutely amazing! We ordered all of them at the same time but I would recommend getting tacos as you eat as they taste best fresh! It’s a must try if you are in Vancouver!

Address: 3307 Dunbar St Vancouver, BC V6S 2B9 Canada
Review:
It had been a few years since my wife and I ate at La Notte so we decided to come back for a meal. And as always, we were not disappointed. I always like the spaghetti pescatore but decided on the regular spaghetti Bolognese. And the taste was amazing. My wife had another pasta dish which was also very tasty. We invited some friends and they went for the pizza margherita.
To wash it down my wife had red wine and I had an iced tea. The servers were very nice and prompt with the service even though the restaurant was really busy.
We had a good time and definitely will come back to try many other dishes on the menu. I highly recommend la notte for a good meal. The portions are big enough and you can have leftovers for home.
Try La Notte, you won't be disappointed.

Address: 3307 Dunbar St Vancouver, BC V6S 2B9 Canada
Review: We took our niece here for a dinner to celebrate her graduation from university. It is a very classic local restaurant. I found it very loud, and although the piano player was a nice touch, it just made it louder. I had the eggplant parmesean which was delicious. Service was basic, but friendly.

Address: 3307 Dunbar St Vancouver, BC V6S 2B9 Canada
Review:
Amazing service, the guys who served was amazing !
I had a long day at work I wanted a nice Italian pizza, I went half meat / half 4 cheese, the cheese was cheap ! The flavours were like any cheap (Costco cheese ) or bulky cheese, greasy and without flavour…
The pizza sauce same 👎🏾 not bueno , it was a $20 pizza and $10 glass of wine, but I was expecting a delicious pizza flavoured tomatoes sauce, the place had live PIANO and I thought, this might be very traditional.
Great for a romantic night , you might wanna try the pastas instead?

Bill$32 and just me , I don’t think I will be back.
☹️
Recommend using better cheese quality, better sauce , more salt, definitely I will
Change the wine glass 🍷 not the ikea kinda  ones (cheap look).
The love piano is greaaaaat!
Keep that!
Keep the great service.
I will google some Italian pizza recipes and will improve my pizza.

Address: 3307 Dunbar St Vancouver, BC V6S 2B9 Canada
Review:
Overall, the food was good. Definitely worth it considering the price. The service was good...they gave us so much cheese for the pasta (you really can't complain).

The vibe of the place is cozy. Feels like a family own/run business. Servers are super chill and friendly. Warning, they will joke around with you...so if you got 0 humour, good luck.

They also have specials that aren't on the menu, so it's a surprise each time you go.

What are the cons? In my opinion, it's not a place where I see myself coming often. Mainly because I'm someone who wants to try something new and exciting. Something that is unique. Other reason is because I live 1h drive away.

Do I recommend? Yes! It really helps fills the pasta cravings.

Tip: the food is better eaten fresh at the restaurant and not as takeout.

Address: 3307 Dunbar St Vancouver, BC V6S 2B9 Canada
Review: Stopped in early on a Friday.  Lovely piano player going and I tried the Veal Ossobucco.  Omg it was DELICIOUS!!!  Definitely try it out.  Next time I will get the linguine clams that sounds amazing too.  Very attentive and friendly staff.  Def be back!

Address: 1716 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5N 2S4 Canada
Review:
This small restaurant offers authentic and tasty Singaporean dishes at an affordable price.

It is still a relatively young, newly opened place as I believe they opened only 2-3 years ago.

The restaurant is served sort of like a canteen - order, pay first and then they will bring the food up to your table.

A hidden gem in my opinion, come give them a try, you will not regret it!

Address: 1716 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5N 2S4 Canada
Review: Love love love. Family-run super authentic Singaporean food. The flavours are just perfect, nothing is too spicy. The curry puffs are flaky and I like the addition of the boiled egg. The laksa has everything you would want--tofu puffs, shrimp, fish cakes, etc. Food is more affordable than most places in Vancouver and came out fast.

Address: 1716 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5N 2S4 Canada
Review:
Best: chicken satay and chicken curry.

Meh: the other things I ordered.

I like the name of the restaurant(even though most Westerners can't pronounce it). IFKYK ;)

Address: 1716 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5N 2S4 Canada
Review:
heads up - you need to order, pay + tip before they will seat you.
No issues paying up front, but they ask you for tip when you pay. This is before you even sit down, eat, or have a chance to experience their overall service.

In terms of food, the taste is good. We ordered the Laksa, Nasi Lamak, and Satay.

Service was fine as well, someone came periodically to re-fill our water.

Overall, I would probably return again if a friend wanted to visit.

Address: 1716 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5N 2S4 Canada
Review: This Singaporean restaurant is surprisingly authentic. The owners (Susan and PJ) personally served us and was extremely friendly and service oriented. We had Otak (Malay fish cake) and Chwee Kueh (steam rice cake with preserved radish topping) for appetizers. For main dish, we had Mee Siam ( spicy/sweet/ sour vermicelli) and Nasi Lemak (coconut rice). For dessert, we had Pulot Hitam (black glutinous rice with coconut cream). It was all delicious and we wanted to try every menu item but couldn't. We succumbed to order curry puff, Kaya (coconut/pandan jam) and more Nasi Lemak to go. A must try if you are curious about Singaporean cuisine!

Address: 3014 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6H 1H6 Canada
Review: Breakfast Table is definitely my most frequented brunch place. The service is always great; the staff is super friendly and attentive. I always get the vanilla iced latte, and it’s my favourite coffee in the city. The food is super delicious and flavourful, and I would recommend the garlic miso salmon eggs Benedict. Can’t wait for my next brunch here.

Address: 3014 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6H 1H6 Canada
Review:
This is hands down one of the best customer service experience I've had in Vancouver, the waitress always noticed if my friends had half a coffee cup left. Also, genuine smile and conversation.

The food portions look small but don't be fooled, they are super filling and you'll be rolling out the door. I had the Breakfast Ratatouille and Thai Honey Milk Tea, super delicious. I had that at 11:30, it's now 8pm and still full. Thank you!

Address: 3014 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6H 1H6 Canada
Review: First time visiting this establishment. Service was good and so was the food. Long wait times for a table and their online wait system is totally broken. Would return if there wasn't much of wait time.

Address: 3014 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6H 1H6 Canada
Review: Food was fantastic. Absolutely no negatives. As was the service. Team was pleasant and courteous. The cute patio added just the right amount of atmosphere. The only reason I gave it a 4 star instead of 5, if I were to really give constructive feedback is that if you’re going to have digital menus, then you must offer WiFi to customers. I’m a visitor to the city and didn’t have WiFi to see the menu so had to check the menu from my guest’s phone. Other than that it was a lovely experience.

Address: 3014 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6H 1H6 Canada
Review:
Amazing service and delicious food. Loved the eggs Benedict and the inventive drinks!
The service was excellent.

Address: 4127 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review:
I always love coming here; the food is delicious, prices are great and the serving sizes are huge. I ordered the laksa which was very filling and is probably about two meals worth of food.

The restaurant is small and is always busy so you might be hard pressed to find somewhere to sit.

Address: 4127 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review:
love this place!! the staff are nice, I like how they don't provide table service cause I just wanna watch YouTube and eat in peace sometimes

I'd do the dry noodles over the laksa tbh, the fried kuey teow and mee goreng was sooooo good.

the fried fritters are good too but their portions are big so I'd eat those first then eat the mains cause they're easier to pack home, that being said, I did take one of the fritters home to bake cause it was lowkey kinda sogged up from the vinegar sauce (which is so delicious)

Address: 4127 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: A must visit when you have a craving for delicious Malaysian food. No need for further convincing.. go try it!

Address: 4127 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review:
Sorry, this is a pass for me.

Mee sota was just a chicken soup + noodles, nothing special

Laksa was lacking flavor, the broth is thin like a ramen broth instead of the thick rich coconut curry broth that laksa should have.

I feel like I could have made both dishes at home better.

The restaurant is very small, good for quick meals or ordering takeout. They only accept cash/debit card, or you can pay extra and order pickup through Uber Eats/doordash ($14 CAD). Price is more than I’d expect considering the atmosphere and quality of food

Address: 4127 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: If you're looking to try Singaporean and Malaysian cuisine for the first time, this restaurant is a good place to start. The restaurant is small and the decor is a bit outdated, but the food is authentic and delicious. I ordered the Laksa, which was flavorful but a bit too spicy for my taste. While I was eating, I didn't realize that there was a small heater right next to me, which made me sweat through my meal. I also ordered some Hainan chicken to go and it was very tasty. The prices here are the cheapest you'll find in Vancouver and the portion sizes are fair. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant for takeout but not for dining in.

Address: 1833 Anderson Street Suite 202 Vancouver, BC V6H 4E5 Canada
Review: If there was a way I would have given them 10 stars, the food is absolutely perfect, the lamb shoulder was my favourite, one of the best ones I had in Vancouver. The staff are so kind and friendly it’s like you have been invited to their home not their restaurant. One of the best places to have a birthday party. Definitely coming back.

Address: 1833 Anderson Street Suite 202 Vancouver, BC V6H 4E5 Canada
Review:
I love the atmosphere with draped clothes and the private booths or two traditional floor seating dining rooms. Dinner for two was enough for three with leftovers.
I was sad to skip dessert as menu looked amazing but I had too much food!

Address: 1833 Anderson Street Suite 202 Vancouver, BC V6H 4E5 Canada
Review:
Delicious food with friendly staff. They were really accommodating and explained the menu items for us. It was my first time trying lamb shoulder and it was fabulous. The rice was full of different spices such as cinnamon, turmeric, and cumin with a little sweetness from the carrots and raisins. About the other dish I need to say I usually don’t find vegetarian dishes at restaurants super tasty and it wasn’t an exception. I didn’t like it much. It was good but not for me :)))
Next time I’ll get the lamb shank.

Address: 1833 Anderson Street Suite 202 Vancouver, BC V6H 4E5 Canada
Review:
We sat at the cushion room for the experience and it was fun!! (Not so much if your legs aren’t flexible)

The Platter for Two was sooo filling, definitely can feed at least 3 people!

The portions were really generous. The appetizer of dips, salad, and bread was already quite filling.

The lamb in the platter was so tender and definitely was the highlight for me.

I really appreciate how much variety was included in the platter. Definitely recommend!

Address: 1833 Anderson Street Suite 202 Vancouver, BC V6H 4E5 Canada
Review:
This place far exceeded my expectations!

I went in expecting good food, and the first thing you notice is the place has a slick vibe.  When our meals came, just wow - it was all soooooo good.  We repeatedly complimented our meals to the staff, and the staff were very pleasant to chat with as they served our meals and checked in on us.

This place is worth the short walk from Granville Island if you are hungry and want a great meal!

Address: 780 Bidwell Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2J6 Canada
Review: Oh my, what a gem! I was super lucky to show up on a quiet weekday evening, I was seated immediately and greeted by a really friendly guy. We picked a drink and made the order, that was brought to the table almost immediately. I am not a chicken person but this is a whole different level. The broth is so flavorful, yet so delicate and light. The pork was perfection, as well as the egg! The noodles had the perfect consistency and texture. All in all, a great dish, paired with a great store-branded pale ale on draft. Really really recommended!

Address: 780 Bidwell Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2J6 Canada
Review: The vegetarian ramen was incredible. It’s the exact type of comfort food you’d want to eat on a rainy day. I usually cannot finish a full bowl of ramen by myself, but maybe it was the thin noodles or the light broth, I happily finished my entire bowl without feeling stuffed. Although there was a lineup even during midday on a Monday, the service was fast & servers were friendly.

Address: 780 Bidwell Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2J6 Canada
Review: My ramen knowledge is still developing but I can attest that the broth was silky smooth with rich flavor, the chilli pepper paste was fresh and aromatic and the noodles did not absorb much of the flavor, as another reviewer indicates. The pork was also fresh, even though very thinly cut, bur surely very tasty. The egg was the best I ever had in taste, texture and color, more like an ember color in the yolk. I would visit again.

Address: 780 Bidwell Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2J6 Canada
Review:
This place is tied for my favorite ramen in all of Vancouver. Their ingredients are always simple and fresh with consistently good results (and no MSG, even more impressive). Service is always efficient since they’re used to long line-ups. Their ramen egg is a must-try—so delicious and a cut above the usual ramen egg.

I recommend the Chashu-Tamago ramen/classic Tamago ramen, and definitely add an egg to your order if there isn’t one!

Address: 780 Bidwell Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2J6 Canada
Review: Maruhachi Ramen offers a unique twist on traditional Japanese ramen with their chicken-based soup. While most ramen places use pork-based broth, Maruhachi's broth is made with chicken, resulting in a rich and flavorful white creamy broth that will leave you amazed. They also offer the option to add extra noodles for just $2, making it a great value. Along with their delicious ramen, their selection of beer is also worth trying. Don't miss out on this incredible chicken-based ramen experience!

Address: 1043 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B Canada
Review: This restaurant is awesome! We ended up going during happy hour for a quick pre dinner snack and drink! We were not expecting much but we were blown away by the food and customer service! We ordered the dip platter and it was so so good, it came with a lot of pita for dipping. The spanakopita was delicious and freshly made! Definitely will be returning to try out their dessert :)

Address: 1043 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B Canada
Review:
First time Customer alert ⚠️ 📢
My boyfriend took me here for Valentine Day and I loved it!!
I LOVE GREEK FOOD, so I'm going to be picky.

Pro:
- Atmosphere is very nice, and the music and vibe definitely set the tone.
- During valentine they had red roses in front, which was very nice 🌹
- The music was bumpin and definitely was a chill vibe. 🎶
-  The light bulbs is a nice touch to the restaurant. 💡
- The structure of the restaurant was built well. I was able to hear my partner perfectly fine even with the music louder than usual.
- The table placement was what I enjoyed. It was separated well that it didn't seem to be close to anybody. 👌🙆‍♀️🙆‍♂️

Food/Service:
- Had the Lamb Platter and Side of Calamari.
- The Lamb platter looked small but after awhile it does fill you up.
- For 2 people and a side is sufficient to make you quite stuffed.
- The Lamb fell off the bone and was well seasoned around.
- Waitress was super friendly and nice! She personality made it easier to pick dishes and small champagne wine to celebrate the occasion !

Improvements:
- The overall dishes from Calamari to Lamb Plattter had too much lemon and same with the tzakiki. A bit less would of been better.

Address: 1043 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B Canada
Review: **ordered through Uber eats** ordered a salad from this restaurant, paid 20 CAD and received a very small salad, you can hold it in your palm. Not worth the money paid. The box is 2/3 full. Shame as we dined at this restaurant and our salad was a lot bigger.

Address: 1043 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B Canada
Review:
I had such high expectations for this place. I love greek food and go out for greek often, but this place left me very disappointed and unimpressed.

My friend and I had a lunch reservation. Upon entering the restaurant, we waited over 5 minutes before someone even acknowledged our presence, mind you, they weren't even busy.

We sat down and ordered the Calamari to start, then the Country Lamb for me, and the Pork and Chicken Thigh Souvlaki for my friend.

The Calamari was really plain (I wouldn't recommend), my friend said her Souvlaki was well-seasoned and enjoyable. My lamb was cooked well, but they didn't have any mint sauce or mint jelly to go with my lamb, which I was surprised and heavily disappointed by.

Overall the food was mediocre.

The food was a 3/5, but the experience was a 2/5.
Would maybe be willing to give this place another try for dinner or at its Gastown location.

Address: 1043 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B Canada
Review:
A sunny, unfortunately windy soon-after, typical Vancouver, day out on the patio had a great time catching up with a friend while enjoying awesome Greek food and awesome service.

If you want to skip the menu and know what to order like a pro, saganaki, lamb chops, calamari.
You are welcome.

Address: 207 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1K6 Canada
Review: Got the mixed grill and cold platters and both were excellent. Best Lebanese cuisine I’ve had in Vancouver so far. The hummus was great and the grilled meats were excellent. It would have been a bit better if they had more than just cauliflower as the only vegetable in the mixed grill platter although it was a meat focused dish.

Address: 207 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1K6 Canada
Review:
I was able to book easily online! Parking was a bit of a pain.
The atmosphere was very cozy.
Service was not bad.
We went at 4pm, so we were bummed to know we can only order from their lunch and drink menu. Dinner is at 5pm!

We ordered:
Baba Ghanouj - eggplant dip with pita bread
> Not bad. Tasted very fresh. Wished it was seasoned more.

Mezze grilled sampler(min 2 person pay per person) - sample of their meats, shrimp, sauces, and dips
> recommend! Great grill flavor. All the sauces were super flavorful. The protein was great. The grilled vegetables were my favorite. This isn't enough food for two people. Definitely order more!

Total (+18%tip) : +$90
Parking : +$12 (1.5hrs)

Address: 207 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1K6 Canada
Review: I ordered the lunch pate with chicken shish tawok and it was delicious. I loved the garlic sauce. Just wished the pita was made fresh or at least not so dry.

Address: 207 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1K6 Canada
Review: Everything we ate was amazing! Highly recommend the dip platter with the hummus, baba ganoush, etc. It comes with plenty of soft pita bread. The cauliflower dish was so yummy too and the cocktails were nice and balanced.

Address: 207 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1K6 Canada
Review: We got the Grille Mezze Sampler and added some flatbread on. It was sooooo delicious. We scraped up every last bit off of the plate. It was the perfect amount of each item, I can’t even say what my favourite item was in the sampler because everything was equally tasty. If you haven’t been here before, I think the sampler was the way to go for sure.

Address: 1014 Main Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1 Canada
Review:
Delicious food and drinks! We had the Octopus and Short Ribs. Took a star off because our octopus was way smaller of a portion than in other photos. Portion didn’t match the price
Highly recommend both of those!
Paella was also delicious.
Great and quick service!

Address: 1014 Main Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1 Canada
Review:
The food and their vibe were very good. We enjoyed our time there. However unfortunately, my friend ordered a non-alcoholic drink since she can't drink alcohol, but the drink WAS alcoholic. After the first sip, she thought it had some alcohol, so we even checked with the waitress, and they said it was unseen non-alcoholic, but after a few minutes, her face started getting very red and she started feeling very dizzy. After telling the waitress about the symptoms, she admitted that one ingredient in the "non-alcoholic drink" contains a little bit alcohol. I really don't think any alcohol should be in the "non-alcoholic drink"😑
When a customer orders a non-alcoholic drink, I truly hope they double-check that the drink is non-alcoholic drink since some people simply cannot take it at all.

But again, other than this particular incident, everything was great!

Address: 1014 Main Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1 Canada
Review:
This meal and the mixed paella I tried was sooo delicious!
Absolutely this is the one of my favorite restaurant in Vancouver area.The severs have good knowledge of menu and nice atmosphere for chilling dining out!
Definitely come back to the restaurant for having romantic eating out!

Address: 1014 Main Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1 Canada
Review:
It is quite a decent Spanish restaurant.
I have personally never been to Spain, so I can't comment about the authenticity, but their foods are so delicious. Overall, food menus are a little bit expensive considering the amount of food, but I liked them.
Paellas are a little salty, but if you have them with other foods like fried eggplants or beef tongue, they go really well together. You would not regret it.
It was my second visit and my first time to experience downstairs. It was somewhat more private, but it seemed like I was in a tavern or something even though the bar was upstairs.
All in all, it is always fun to dine here, as we could laugh at each other watching lips colored with squid ink paella.

Address: 1014 Main Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1 Canada
Review: We ordered mixed paella, garlic prawns, fried mushrooms, beef tongue, and sangria that day. All the dishes were delicious. I especially liked the beef tongue. It was tender and seasoned really well. Seafoods in the paella were large in size and number. Servers were pretty nice, and the restaurant had great atmosphere. Overall it was a wonderful experience having lunch here.

Address: 1049 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L4 Canada
Review: First time trying this place! We loved the food there, the service was quick, food was decently priced, and quite authentic. I had enchiladas for the first time here, it was delicious. The tortilla was crispy, and the cheese held the tortillas together quite well! However, I must say that it’s a heavy meal! I personally couldn’t eat this regularly, but for times when I crave Mexican flavours, I am totally down to come back again!

Address: 1049 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L4 Canada
Review: My first time here and I can’t wait to come back! I’m from California and miss authentic Mexican food from back home. This place is the real deal and brought me back to my old neighbourhood restaurants in the Mission. We had the chips and salsa, the tacos WITH CHEESE!, and a chimichanga. All were so, so yummy and very filling. Price is right, staff was lovely, flavours on point. Definitely give it a try!

Address: 1049 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L4 Canada
Review: It was overall a great place for some delicious Mexican food. The place was clean and had a very kind staff. I had the Pollo tacos and Nachos and it was delicious. The place was nearby to me and I would definitely suggest to try this place for a nice afternoon lunch. :)

Address: 1049 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L4 Canada
Review:
A hidden gem in downtown Vancouver!
Very authentic Mexican food.
The environment is relaxed and the servers are friendly.
Food comes very fast and in great temperature.
I tried the beef tongue tacos for the first time. It is hot, tender and delicious!
Good place for family or date.

Address: 1049 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L4 Canada
Review: First time being here and the food was so good! If you're visiting from another city (like I am) I would definitely recommend that your try stopping by here to eat 😊 Lots of vegetarian options as well

Address: 1161 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C6 Canada
Review: The quality of Chinese food here is top notch, which is high compliments in Vancouver where there is a lot of competition but Mott32 is definitely a level above the rest. The wine and drinks program is extensive and well tailored as well.  I try to at least do 2 meals here on every trip!

Address: 1161 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C6 Canada
Review: Lovely ambience and a good overall experience. The smoked black cod and the frog legs were the standout dishes overall and definitely would recommend ordering them if you go. The Peking duck was okay overall; I expected something a bit more special for the price point and experience, but it was still good. Would consider going back in the future to try a different variety of dishes as the standouts above were wonderful.

Address: 1161 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C6 Canada
Review: It was our last restaurant that we visited in Vancouver. You get Asian food on a high level. Fine dining in a nice atmosphere. The food is great and also the cocktails are great. The service was very friendly.

Address: 1161 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C6 Canada
Review: Mott 32 was quite atmospheric with their old Shanghai style interior design, playing up their posh and boujee feel. Didn't have a chance to try their duck as you will need to reserve a duck the day before dining. Their dishes were, of course, definitely on the pricey side but nonetheless tasty and flavourful. Would recommend their short rib and their signature lobster fried rice. The style is more fusion in my opinion, not quite the traditional Chinese taste.

Address: 1161 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C6 Canada
Review:
A group of 6 of us had dinner here recently and we received very good service from the wait staff to the sous chef who carved up our Peking Duck dish.

This restaurant is right beside the Paradox Hotel entrance, formerly the Trump Hotel for this who do not know the West Georgia address of the place.

I will say this is one of the most expensive dim sum dishes restaurants in Vancouver. We were going to try some dishes but let's put it this way I know Maine Lobster is expensive, but $32 for a so gle piece of Maine lobster Siu Mai?

We also had the smoked black cod, crispy rice with dried prawns in soup, beef and flat noodles, Stir fried broccoli with tofu, and a free range chicken dish. I would say the dinner was good with the Signature Smoked black cod being the best dish even ahead of the Peking duck.

Was plenty of room at the table to sit and they had an okay selection of cocktails and wines.

Nice to try for a holiday dinner.

Address: 820 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J8 Canada
Review: The portions are generous, and the flavors are simply divine. The interior is tastefully decorated, creating an inviting ambiance. Must-tries include the garlicky beans, flaky roti, and succulent beef satay. Don't miss the beautifully presented fried rice served in a pineapple bowl. The service is outstanding, adding to the overall dining experience. Prepare to be transported to the flavors of Malaysia in this delightful culinary haven.

Address: 820 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J8 Canada
Review: I enjoyed every dish we ordered, particularly the pineapple fried rice and eggplant. Food is beautifully presented with a raise of callers and delicious sauces. Service is reasonably good and I didn't care too much for the atmosphere because it was so dark inside. Overall, It's a great restaurant to visit if you're up for Malaysian food.

Address: 820 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J8 Canada
Review:
I must say the restaurant really impressed me, since I'm completely new to this cuisine. I found a lot of similar flavors with latinamerican cuisine.

We had this 9-dishes menu and it was really nice. The fried calamari were nice but missed more frying. The sweet rice pudding was my favorite part. The service was also friendly and attentive.

Address: 820 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J8 Canada
Review: This is a must try for people who love good Asian food! The fresh young coconut is AMAZING, almost as good as the ones you can get in Asia! The Hainanese chicken and the BBQ skewers are to die for. Try it, and you taste buds will definitely thank you!!!

Address: 820 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J8 Canada
Review:
Great place for any occasion with friends/family or even for a meal on your own. We had the 12 course dinner tonight (minimum 2 people) and it was $59 per person. There was an option for 9 course meal for $49, but we decided to go for the bigger portion because we skipped lunch.

It included: papaya mango salad (with peanuts), roti cani with a dip, three satay chicken skewers, three deep fried whole oysters with a dip, a bowl of steamed mussels, three scallops (cooked to perfect), shrimp/mango/tomato/bell pepper stir fry, three lobster tails, deep fried fish, green beans with shrimp, beef rendang, and lastly their delicious deep fried banana with vanilla ice cream.

Seafood was fresh and the portion between three people was perfect! The rendang was slightly dry, but still edible. They still have the plexiglass in between each party which is great to see that they are still being cautious.

Great service and attentive servers. Thank you for this experience!

Address: 755 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3 Canada
Review:
Five stars for you Burger Crush! Well done!

Burger Crush has a simple menu with veg options and both non and alcoholic beverages. Prices were higher than the Golden Arches or competitors but reasonable given the quality and service.

I went with the single patty cheeseburger and fries. Delicious burgers, delicious fries. Perfectly messy. Perfectly cooked burger and fries. Excellent.

Presentation was above what you’d expect from a burger place. Washrooms were clean, accessible and gender neutral. Dining area was frequently cleaned by staff as soon as people were finished and leaving.

I have no complaints and no areas to offer improvements, however, I did visit at 2:00pm on a Friday, your experience may differ depending on timing!

Enjoy!

Address: 755 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3 Canada
Review: •June 2023• this is us truly a finger licking good mess in and around your mouth. Tried the vegan cheese burger and the beef cheeseburger. I was surprised at just how amazing they both were. The vegan one is easily the best vegan burger in town. The cheesy fries were also really good. Won’t be long till I come back again.

Address: 755 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3 Canada
Review: I like to try new places for burgers, smash burgers are my new fave. Keep hearing of this place. So decided to check it out. Overall a pretty decent burger. I did like the fries. Maybe i should have got a milk shake. Although the burger was decent, it didn't reach a standard such as a in and out or shake Shack! Just saying. But I i did love the fries. Crispy and thinly sliced. Good with your burger.

Address: 755 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3 Canada
Review: Super pricey for something that is just covered in a cheap cheese sauce. The first few bites of the burger and poutine are great, and then the cheese sauce just gets to be too much. For the price I paid, it’s not worth it. I would suggest going to Juicy Joe’s over Burger Crush.

Address: 755 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3 Canada
Review: I CRUSHED that juicy delicious burger 😍 I loved the vegan orange milkshake! My husband got a regular milkshake and I tried them both, vegan was definitely better as it was a bit less thick and easier to drink. My lactose-intolerant butt appreciates it. I got my burger lettuce wrapped too and I enjoyed every bite! Great service and prompt. Arrived at about 5:30pm on a Wednesday. Will definitely come back

Address: 120-4751 Garden City Road Richmond, BC V6X 3M7 Canada
Review:
If you’re looking for the best sweet and sour dish, I would highly recommend this restaurant!!! Their sweet and sour fish was cooked to perfection. Fish tastes fresh, juicy and delicious. The sauce was the perfect balance of sweet, tangy and savoury. Vegetables were not over cooked.

We ordered the combo for two and it was worth it! The deep fried squid was delicious. Crispy on the outside but tender on the inside.  This combo came with a  few side dishes, pork intestine, cucumber, and pigs ears.

We will have to come back next time to try other dishes like shaved ice, braised beef and more.

Amazing customer service too! Very friendly and attentive staff.

Address: 120-4751 Garden City Road Richmond, BC V6X 3M7 Canada
Review:
I think your experience here depends on what you order as some of their food is hit or miss. I absolutely love their “nuggets”, which are essentially Taiwanese popcorn chicken and honestly some of the best I’ve had. It’s super crunchy and sliced thing, would definitely recommend. The braised pork ear and the sweet and sour fried fish are also super delicious, not too much breading, perfect texture and amount of sauce.
I do not recommend their soup, it had that pork intestine flavour to it that I really did not love. Their Thai chicken is great in terms of how it’s cooked, but I did not like the flavour.
Place is clean and service was good, menu was a tad confusing. But overall, I would come back again.

Address: 120-4751 Garden City Road Richmond, BC V6X 3M7 Canada
Review:
Comfortable seating and very friendly service.
Free parking outside. But don’t forget to register your license plate with restaurant after 6pm.
Very limited selections on the menu. Ran out of pearls 3 in the afternoon. Very disappointed. My spicy noodle was not spicy at all. The flavour was very good though! Overall we were happy with our lunch.

Address: 120-4751 Garden City Road Richmond, BC V6X 3M7 Canada
Review:
The restaurant has various selections to choose from small hot pot to deep fried dishes. We ordered deep fried popcorn chicken, scallion beef, Taiwanese braised dish, rice and milk tea. The serving speed was incredibly fast and we got all our meals in just a few minutes. We have noticed that they greet all the customers amiability when they step into the store. It was a great experience with all the foods and services.

Overall:
Food quality: ★ ★ ★ ★ ☆
Environment: ★ ★ ★ ★ ★
Service: ★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Address: 120-4751 Garden City Road Richmond, BC V6X 3M7 Canada
Review: Good ambience and very fast service. Food was good. Portions were average for individual dishes but the braised pork rice was well-sized. The sweet and sour chicken was my favourite. The fried chicken did not have enough flavour. Affordable and good for groups. $22 a person after tips.

Address: 615 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5 Canada
Review: This popular Italian theme restaurant located in east Vancouver on Kingsway, parking is basically on the street, lucky after 6pm you can park without issues, food quality is good, tasty and unpretentious, not your normal 🍕 parlor but more earth tone dishes, i like this type of cooking, i recommend to try the garlic pull bread, the thick noodles with tomato sauce, chicken liver pate with sourdough,the pork chop which is juicy and delicious, highly recommended. The server is knowledgeable and friendly, reservation is required because they only open for dinner. The table for six is kind of tight, otherwise everything is great. Will return. Recommended

Address: 615 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5 Canada
Review: A wonderful dining experience with delicious food, great service and a buzzing atmosphere. We did the family style menu which was picked by the chefs based on a few questions. It was perfect and so much food; plenty of value. We celebrated a birthday and we had a complimentary glass of champagne ready for us when we arrived plus a cute birthday dessert. Highly recommend.

Address: 615 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5 Canada
Review:
I reserved a single seat at the bar reservation for 5:00 p.m.  I was quite fortunate to be given a seat on the patio because the restaurant wasn't that busy; it was a serene and beautiful setting!  Along with passing out the standard menus, the waitress read out the day's specials.

I selected the lemony tortellini from the normal menu, along with the featured arugula salad.  I also had a glass of water for starters.  Together, the food was delicious, and the serving sizes were perfect.  Additionally, the waitress was cordial, attentive, and made sure my service experience was excellent.

I had a wonderful, exceptional eating experience, which much improved my evening after a difficult birthday night the day before.  I'd love to revisit Savio Volpe to try their Alla Famiglia and/or their green spaghetti sometime.

Address: 615 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5 Canada
Review: Got the option to have items chosen for our family and it was more than worth it, and much better than picking individual items. Recieved way more food than we expected and everything was great. Service was excellent. The pork and polenta were definitely the highlights. We also all loved our server and randomly shared dog photos with him.

Address: 615 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5 Canada
Review:
My family and I are from out of town and booked our table a few months in advance. We had heard it was amazing and it 100% lived up to the hype.

We did the tasting menu for our table of 4. The food just kept coming! We were shocked to have so much food continuously come to the table. It was my first time trying a few of them items served and they exceeded expectations.

For $79 you definitely get your bang for buck and a wonderful experience! The wait staff was also fantastic. As soon as you took a sip of water, someone was there to refill it. Cleared and wiped tables between courses too!

We will be back!

Address: 1525 Yew Street Vancouver, BC V6K 3E4 Canada
Review:
The pizza was incredible! The flavors were amazing and the dough was soft and crunchy where it needed to be. We got the mushroom pizza and Cacio Pepe pasta to share.

The pasta was a bit disappointing in my opinion: too salty and not flavorful other than a lot of pepper corn they added.

Overall, I recommend this place for pizzas and a few drinks!

Address: 1525 Yew Street Vancouver, BC V6K 3E4 Canada
Review: I have never written a Google review for a restaurant in my life but oh my gosh did I love this place. Food: 10/10. Ambience: cool classy jazzy. Staff: awesome, fun, lovely, quirky (or maybe it’s a Vancouver thing because everyone here is kinda fun, and I feel spoiled coming from the east coast). Either way, love this place.

Address: 1525 Yew Street Vancouver, BC V6K 3E4 Canada
Review:
Great atmosphere, I felt like I was on holiday.
The person serving was good fun, up for a laugh. The food was amazing, I had pasta conarelli cacao pepe which had a tower of cheese. My husband had a vegetarian pizza. There was so much pasta I had to take some home (tomorrow’s lunch) and they gave us a complimentary coffee cake desert, which was so kind! I will definitely be returning. And the wine was also excellent

Address: 1525 Yew Street Vancouver, BC V6K 3E4 Canada
Review: The food was delicious and came in a timely manner. I highly recommend the special crostini!! Our server Leah (Kristy) was very welcoming, knowledgeable and friendly. Had a great evening

Address: 1525 Yew Street Vancouver, BC V6K 3E4 Canada
Review: Been there a couple days ago, the service was amazing! Came into the store with warm welcome and the service is great. Food is awesome and tasty, will go there very soon 👍

Address: 1137 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
Having worked there many times, I can confidently say that it is a great place to hold such an important event as a wedding. The venue boasts of unique architectural details and character that adds to the ambiance of the occasion.

One of the standout features of this venue is the friendly and helpful staff. They are always on hand to offer assistance and ensure that everything runs smoothly. The location is also fantastic, with close proximity to a waterfront and green spaces that provide excellent opportunities for a photo session.

And of course, the food is simply amazing. From the pan-seared scallops to the fresh fruit sorbet, everything on the menu is a delight to the taste buds. These dishes are among my personal favorites and are sure to impress even the most discerning palates.

Overall, I highly recommend this venue for anyone looking to host a wedding. The combination of stunning architecture, excellent service, picturesque location, and delectable cuisine makes it a standout choice that is sure to leave a lasting impression on all who attend.

Address: 1137 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review: This restaurant is perfect for a romantic date. We were lucky to sit in the courtyard on the second floor, just like having a date in a beautiful garden. As for the food, we ordered shrimp and fried cauliflower salad for appetizers, and they were both stunning. The flavors were rich and delightful. The steak and chicken for the main course maintained the high standards of a great restaurant

Address: 1137 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
Went here few days ago for my birthday. Staff were super friendly and nice, the food was perfect (we had steak, and it was one the best steaks I've had).

One thing that I didn't like was the fact that I was expecting a dessert with happy birthday on it, but that didn't happen lol. Also, the atmosphere is not what we see in the pictures, way smaller. But I would still go back :)

Address: 1137 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
Wanted to really like this place what with the nice reviews and photos of the restaurant.  Below are things that left a bad taste in the mouth:
1.  Made reservations online weeks ago, and when we get there we get a high top table when there was a booth spot.  Hostess made the change after I made a request.
2.  Server was pushing the special and adding lobster tails at every interaction.  She was pretty aggressive with her recommendations as if she gets commission for every lobster tail that gets ordered. When we wanted to share entrees and app, that's when the level of service really decreased.  She barely came by after taking our order, and I think we waited over half an hr before the food came.  The restaurant was not busy, so not sure what took so long for the food and there was no reassurance from her food was coming.
3.  The food was ok...the 22oz. steak we shared was bland and the server said the chef recommends having it "medium", but there were parts of it that were rare.  The lobster tails were bland and doesn't look appetizing.

Honestly, I shouldn't have given her the 18% gratuity (that's the 1st button on the keypad), but I was there with girlfriends for a Bachelorette party.  It took so long to get our food we didn't even get a chance to order dessert, bc we had reservations for drinks somewhere else.

The ambience is nice, but no I would not come back here again - OVERRATED.

Address: 1137 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
Brix and Mortar is a restaurant that offers a memorable culinary adventure, leaving a lasting impression on its guests. My dining experience at this establishment was a combination of impressive highlights and a few areas that could be improved upon.

The ambiance at Brix and Mortar is undeniably charming. The interior design exudes elegance and sophistication, creating a welcoming atmosphere.

The service provided by the staff (Savannah?) was attentive and courteous, ensuring that our needs were met throughout the evening. The servers were knowledgeable about the menu and offered insightful suggestions.

However, there was a moment when I informed the waiter of a small hair on the ramen egg of the Ahi Tuna Salad (I think you can see it on the picture). Since I have already split the salad with my family members, I wasn't expecting anything other than a follow up. The waiter said "let me check with the kitchen", took away the egg, and never came back with an apology or any follow up.

The menu at Brix and Mortar offers a diverse range of dishes, showcasing the creativity and skill of the culinary team. We ordered the Ahi Tuna Salad, Burrata Di Puglia, Wild Sockeye Salmon, Lamb Neck, and Steak. The flavors were generally well-balanced, and the presentation was visually appealing. All the dishes were exceptional aside from the Steak, which was satisfactory, but not outstanding. The cocktails we ordered (Stregarita, Sakura Blossom, and Basil Exposition) were delicious as well.

Overall, Brix and Mortar is a restaurant that offers a memorable dining experience with its refined ambiance, attentive service, and creative menu. Although there were a few minor areas for improvement, the overall experience was enjoyable and left a positive impression.

Atmosphere and Environment: 5/5 Lovely!
Service: 4/5 Minor incident that had occured.
Food: 4.5/5 All the dishes were great and exceeded expectations aside from the Steak.
Drinks 4.5/5

Address: 663 E 15th Avenue Vancouver, BC V5T 2R6 Canada
Review:
Food was good. Very fairly priced for a Vancouver restaurant. Nice classic French bistro menu and vibes.

Hostess was nice, we made a mistake with our reservation but luckily was able to fix it and have us seated. Our server, Dave, was very friendly and helpful through the service.

Squid was very super tender and tasty.

Duck Confit was pretty good, the goat cheese salad under was great and was a very generous portion.

Hanger steak and frites was nice. I prefer the mustard butter over the red wine jus. Very generous portion of fries too.

Would come back to try more.

Address: 663 E 15th Avenue Vancouver, BC V5T 2R6 Canada
Review: Excellent service. Our waitress was attentive and friendly. However the dishes tasted pretty standard. Actually the beef tartare was a bit disappointing. It was mixed in with so much spice and sauce that you could hardly taste the beef at all. Made you wonder the quality of the beef itself. The dining room was too hot/stuffy, I was pretty much sweating by the end of the meal. I would suggest not to come in the summer especially before 8pm

Address: 663 E 15th Avenue Vancouver, BC V5T 2R6 Canada
Review: the beef tartare was good. i don’t recommend the charcuterie board unless you can appreciate a bitter taste (there is no fig jam). its prices were pretty good for a french restaurant - you get what you pay for. the steak was tender but i personally think it should’ve been served with mashed potatoes to complement the steak. there are better restaurants.

Address: 663 E 15th Avenue Vancouver, BC V5T 2R6 Canada
Review: Delicious! Good service and wonderful food. Fairly reasonably priced as well, for these economic times. The grilled squid was fabulous and super tender.

Address: 663 E 15th Avenue Vancouver, BC V5T 2R6 Canada
Review:
We came here as a walk-in at 8pm on Saturday. The reservations were full until 9:45 so we decided to risk it. Thankfully we were seated right away! It looks like the bar is reserved for walk-in guests.

The ambiance of the place was lovely with dim lighting. I really enjoyed the music (jazz?).

Everything was delicious. The only complaint was that the entrée took an hour to get to our table after our appetizers.

For starters, we got the Onion Soup and the Beef Tartare. The portions were quite large, almost equivalent to our entrées. We really enjoyed both of them.

It was my first time having a Coq Au Vin so I was excited. Although I didn’t enjoy it very much. I don’t think it was a problem with the restaurant, maybe just not a fan of the dish itself.

The steak was cooked perfectly according to our preference and it was delicious.

All-in-all a lovely and romantic place for date night. I would definitely come back!

Address: 904 W King Edward Avenue Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2 Canada
Review: I passed by here every day and wasn't aware of the restaurant until I first had dinner here. It was surprisingly tasty. I will come more and try more food here.

Address: 904 W King Edward Avenue Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2 Canada
Review: It's nice to have this Hong Kong cafe in this area. It's slightly pricey than a typical one but that's the West side for you. My curry fish rice was a pleasant lunch!

Address: 904 W King Edward Avenue Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2 Canada
Review: Amazing find on the west side, tucked away in a strip mall. Hong style cafe food that was delicious and served quickly. As to substitute carbs for vegetables and was very happy with the portion and taste. The Hong Kong style coffee was perfect and the lunch deal was filling. Certainly be back and try more food as these types of restaurants are getting rare.

Address: 904 W King Edward Avenue Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2 Canada
Review: Slight higher than average priced Hong Kong style cafe. Food was good, though the rice noodles were a bit bland. Service was fast, parking is plentiful. Seems to have a good neighbourhood following. The set dinners are a decent deal.

Address: 904 W King Edward Avenue Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2 Canada
Review: The lunch combo you get soup, main dish, and a drink. Food taste good but nothing spectacular. The lunch combo is a bit expensive as well (over $20). Staff members are very quick and efficient.

Address: 1510 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 2Y7 Canada
Review: I booked Sopra Sotto for a family dinner because it was on the same block as my favourite ice cream place, and it was a great choice! Only the cocktails were really pricey, all other items were an expected price for the area and cuisine. Atmosphere was nice with the patio and natural lightning and decorations. Service was alright, a little slow and absent sometimes. We tried everything from drinks, appetizer board, pizzas, pastas, cartoccio on special. The pizza and board were the highlights in my opinion, I would recommend those in your next visit.

Address: 1510 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 2Y7 Canada
Review:
Came here for lunch on a Saturday and had such a wonderful experience. The host let us choose our table and brought us water right away. We ordered the meatballs that came with focaccia bread that was so perfect we had to order more. We got Caesar salad and the Diavola pizza. Everything was tasty.
Also the environment is just so much more comfortable than all of the other Italian restaurants I’ve been to in the city. Everything felt bright and clean and modern.

Address: 1510 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 2Y7 Canada
Review:
A great location for a modern Italian restaurant with a wood fire oven!

The space is clean and open and aromatic. On Sundays they have live piano music with a pianist named Bruno.

The low star ratings is due to the fact that I am a little disappointed in their food.

We ordered a focaccia but it was more like pizza crust in that it was thin, very hard and chewy instead of thick and soft. Usually focaccia is a dimpled, soft bread with Italian seasonings, similar to pizza bread. We also ordered the pizza and it had what seemed like the same bread base as the "focaccia". /:

The tagliatelle ragu is a little bland.

The eggplant and homemade sausage Margarita Pizza wasn't that good... The eggplant didn't lend any interesting depth or flavor. I wish the sausage was more spiced!

I tried the chili oil and it's not spicy, just oil, to me.

The best dish was the truffled mushroom pasta.

Address: 1510 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 2Y7 Canada
Review:
Loved it! Great ambiance, quality food 🤌🏻. Servers were attentive without rushing us. Good cost-quality match 👍🏻
Definitely give it a try and enjoy!

*Note: This is something I recently noticed in Vancouver's restaurants, where you feel like you're in a dining match and rushed to leave. I've added this aspect to my recent reviews 🫤

Address: 1510 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 2Y7 Canada
Review:
Everything was excellent. Gabriel service was great, he was super nice,  he took the time to give us recommendations and to accomodate for my mother's allergies. The pizza and pasta we ordered were amazing and they came very fast.
We sat next to the kitchen bar and it was a very good experience. We got to see how Jose and Rodrigo prepared our dishes to perfection. We got to talk with Rodrigo and Jose and they are super nice people.
Definitely recommend!

Address: 263 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8 Canada
Review: Absolutely a wonderful tasting experience. The combinations of flavours were exactly right. The fish tasted very fresh and the sauce on top puts the whole dish together. The highlight is definitely the truffle omelette— the most perfect omelette I’ve ever had in my life. The truffle was aromatic, paired with creamy eggs. I just felt that my table was a bit squishy and the table felt very full.

Address: 263 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8 Canada
Review:
Good food with amazing service. Everything was done perfectly and there was nothing that we didn't like. Went with the omikaze and the recommended sweet spot for pricing of approximately $170 - $200pp. We weren't too hungry so the waiter went more for higher quality food rather than quantity. The waitress asked a series of questions in order to tailor the menu to us a little which was nice.

You'll want to make a reservation if you want a better chance at getting a seat. Walk-ins are possible but fill up quick. Paid street parking is available and relatively cheap (couple of dollars for the 2-3h duration we were there).

Definitely a nice experience and worth trying at least once if you get the chance, but it is quite pricey. For the total price you could eat at a few nice restaurants instead, but life's short and you can't take your money with you so as long as the wife is happy, you'll be happy.

Address: 263 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8 Canada
Review:
Loved Kissa Tanto since they opened, really happy to see them receive a Michelin star, though that does mean prices have gone up a bunch. (Corkage is now $75 and the truffle omelette was nearly $80). All that said, food is still excellent. Flavors were well balanced and fun. Would definitely keep coming back.

Atmosphere-wise, the restaurant itself is a bit loud and the solo chairs can be a bit uncomfortable.

Address: 263 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8 Canada
Review:
Haven’t been back since they had the ‘miso bread’.  To my dismay this dish is cancelled which to be honest was the only dish I remembered from my last meal here.

Service was exceptional, and every dish was a delight except I would skip the rib eye.   Nothing wrong but for the price / taste my preference would be either Elisa or Victor and prepared traditionally.

Address: 263 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8 Canada
Review:
While I recognize that my three-star rating may seem low for such an extraordinary restaurant, the most important factor for me is value for money. As a Michelin-starred restaurant, I expected an extraordinary experience, but what I received was a decent restaurant, albeit a bit too noisy, with good service and okay food. Nothing was particularly extraordinary, except for the price. We ordered the entire menu, and while the octopus dish and spaghetti were incredible masterpieces, the rest was just passable.

To sum it up, the food is good, but it neither deserves its price nor its Michelin star.

Address: 350 Carrall Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J3 Canada
Review: First time I tried a tasting menu and it did not disappoint. We tried the regular tasting menu for a birthday celebration. I forgot the name of the food but it was divine. Definitely will try the chef’s station tasting menu for another experience. We did the food and wine tasting. We will definitely go back and we have been recommending this place to out friends

Address: 350 Carrall Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J3 Canada
Review:
All the food was sooo good!
Everything we tried was awesome and service was great too.
This was just a really good culinary experience.

Only thing to note is that the area immediately outside isn't super inviting. 😅

We would definitely come again.

Address: 350 Carrall Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J3 Canada
Review: We had the pleasure of dining here based on a friend's recommendation, and we are thrilled we took their advice. The service surpassed our expectations. Our server, Jordan, was not only incredibly knowledgeable but also engaging and delightful to converse with. If you are in the area, worth checking it out although would be mindful of walking down Hastings Street which felt very uncomfortable to walk down given the crowd.

Address: 350 Carrall Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J3 Canada
Review: The cheese filled tempura morels, unpictured scallop tartare amuse bouche, and the asparagus green pea scape salad were amazing. Went for the chef's table experience which was worth it. We left with our tummies filled just the right amount.

Address: 350 Carrall Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J3 Canada
Review:
It’s a Michelin recommended restaurant and it’s easy to see why. It’s a great fusion of Asian and western cuisine and all the dishes were carefully curated.

We had the tasting menu and a virgin cocktail and it’s not for a full meal - it’s only to highlight the dishes and the restaurant.

If you order separate dishes, I highly recommend the scallop and bison dish! It can be a bit pricy but I think it’s worth the price and the wait based on my experience.

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review: I enjoyed the food here with my family 😊 portions are good. I just wish they could have more non spicy food for kids. They do charge a 15% service fee if your group has more than 6 people, which is like a tip, so it is reasonable.

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
At SURA Korean Restaurant, one can anticipate a truly unique dining experience that perfectly melds traditional Korean flavors with a modern, sophisticated ambiance. From the moment you walk in, the welcoming atmosphere, resplendent with warm lights and comfortable seating, sets the tone for an excellent culinary journey.

The menu at SURA is a vibrant palette of Korean gastronomy, showcasing the rich, hearty flavors that the cuisine is known for. The Bulgogi, tender and succulently marinated, is an absolute must-try, as is the Bibimbap, served in a hot stone bowl, which creates an irresistible crispy rice layer at the bottom. The seafood pancake, brimming with fresh ingredients, is an ideal start to the meal.

Vegetarians and vegans aren’t left out either. SURA’s Japchae, a dish of stir-fried sweet potato noodles and vegetables, is an example of their commitment to catering to diverse dietary needs without compromising flavor.
