One aspect that particularly stands out is the quality of their ingredients. The freshness of the vegetables, the quality of the meats, and the aromatic spices, all come together in a symphony of flavors that leaves one yearning for more.

Service at SURA matches the high standard set by their food. The staff is attentive, helpful with suggestions, and ensures a smooth dining experience.

In addition, the restaurant’s adherence to safety and hygiene protocols in these challenging times further enhances the overall experience, making you feel safe and comfortable.

Overall, SURA Korean Restaurant in Vancouver is a destination not just for those with a palate for Korean food but anyone who appreciates good food, well served. Highly recommended!

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
We got there around 1 pm on a Sun and had a 1/2 hr wait. Well worth it. We walked down the street while we we’re waiting and this was one of 2 spot that had a wait. I guess we now know why 😀

We found a parking lot for $3 / hr across the back door in the street behind the restaurant. They have 4 free spots behind the back door but they were full.

We get the lunch set menu and got to try different things, all of which were good. Kids got a dumpling soup and kimchi fried rice. Portions were just right to fill us up.

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
You can’t go wrong with ordering any food at this restaurant. The food is flavorful and the service is great. I actually felt like our server cared about our experience at Sura.
The only thing to consider is they don’t take reservations and there is usually a wait list at this place.
Overall a “must try” for Korean food in Vancouver.

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
What a great place on Robson St for authentic Korean eats!

We actually tried coming here before but the line-up was too long of a wait. Fortunately we came again during foul weather earlier this month (December 2021) & yay, we got a table without delay. Had to call the restaurant to let them someone know we were outside, as patrons are required to stay outside until a staff member came out to assist. I appreciate the covid protocol (they do check for vax i.ds).

Their great ratings do not lie - the food is comforting and delicious. Portions are good considering the cost. The decor is light and minimal. Their staff are all excellent in friendliness, attentiveness and speed.

The potato pancakes had perfect crisp to it and were very flavourful on their own ~ no sauce really needed. The vegetarian japchae was so satisfying, that we didn’t even miss the meat.

I loved the grilled mackerel the most, not overly cooked, with a softly cooked interior while maintaining a crispy skin. It even came with a small Doenjang Jjigae ~ super flavourful soup broth with bits of beef.

All the ‘appies’ (kimchi, beans, potato salad) were a perfect sample taste. I wonder if I could have asked for more?

The staff were hospitable  and quick to serve and clear away.

Decor is modern, minimalistic yet relaxed.

I’m SO looking forward to coming back again!

Find me on Instagram @aida.loves

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: I love Korean food and this place doesn't disappoint. They have a wide menu of classic Korean dishes, there BBQ is amazing and a lot of fun. Only down side is that the food is quite expensive, no matter the dish.  I would highly recommend going with a bunch or people who love to share food and laughs.

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: The service is very good and the people is so nice. The food is good. The place has a good atmosphere.

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
Went to Sura for lunch and tried a variety of dishes. All the selections were great and tasty.

The staff was friendly and always kept our pitcher of water filled. Like how they gave us individual condiments rather than the traditional “communal style” condiments.

Was disappointed that their seasonal Buckwheat cold noodle was well ... out of season.

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: Delicious food, reasonably priced, and very well packaged. They also included free kimchi on the side as well.

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: Both dishes were a real flop. I had taken a bibimbap because I had heard that it was a very good dish, but I honestly didn't like it! I honestly think it's not the dish itself but the way the restaurant makes it. The tastelessness was really bad, as was the chow mein, the service was mediocre and the atmosphere of the restaurant is really depressing.

Address: 88 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1R3 Canada
Review: Great Indonesian food in a food court on the second floor. The owner suggested me to get the beef and chicken rice which comes with vegetables (eggplants or mushrooms). The owner is very friendly. The food court is clean and spacious. Great to drop by after going to China Town museums.

Address: 88 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1R3 Canada
Review: That was absolutely amazing. This has got to be one of my best food experiences in Vancouver. What just happened? That was insane. I ordered the beef rendang and egg balado with vegetables served alongside turmeric coconut rice. I can’t remember the last time I felt this sad taking my last bite of food. I have been converted to the church of Bali Thai. I will be coming here as often as I can.

Address: 88 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1R3 Canada
Review: Delicious and authentic. I grew up in Indonesia and its a rare treat to find Rendang Sapi and a good sambal sauce. Wonderful service and food.

Address: 88 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1R3 Canada
Review:
Delicious Indonesian food with very friendly service. I had the two meat combo with beef rendang and spicy Balinese chicken, served with turmeric coconut rice, eggplant and veggies. The owner recommended some of her homemade chili sambal she called
‘911 spice’ to add some heat and it was delicious. Such a great spot in the International Marketplace food court!

Address: 88 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1R3 Canada
Review: I’m Indonesian and I’m so glad that Bali Thai exists! I have visited multiple times. Their food never disappoint me. When I miss Indonesian food, Bali Thai is the place I go. Great service, lovely food and the best 911 super spicy sambal (chili sauce).

Address: 867 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review:
Went during dinner time around the weekend at 6pm and was able to get seated. I got to try their toppoki, rose toppiki and their spicy pork bulgogi.

Despite the name suggests, the spicy pork bulgogi just has the right amount of kick that enhances the taste. Given the price, the meat to rice portion is actually more compared to other Korean places that serves little rice pots like this.

The regular toppoki is standard nothing too special about it and is spicy (as usual). The rose toppoki on the other hand has the same ingredients as the regular toppoki, just added with sausages and mushrooms, but the sauce used is different. It's milder and not spicy as far as I recall. So, if you crave for toppoki but prefer creamier and milder option, then rose toppoki is recommended.

Address: 867 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: The food was absolutely delicious and amazing and the staff we're really kind and helpful offering suggestions. Will definitely go back soon🙂

Address: 867 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: It's the best korean restaurant I've had recently. Gamjatang is the best on a cold day. But my favorite food is short ribs. Everything is delicious. Please order everything and eat it.

Address: 867 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: Damso has been our goto place for hearty Korean dinner that never fails for many many years! Our all time favourites are beef soy bean paste soup, and grilled pork belly! But honestly all of their food is pretty darn solid! Their deep fried chickens are super crispy and I really liked their tacos with Korean twist! Can't wait to go back again 🤤🤤🤤

Address: 867 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: One of the best Korean Restaurants in town🙌🏻The atmosphere is cozy and relaxing. The staff were very nice and friendly! We ordered their signature 48hr slow cook short ribs, Pork Belly Korean BBQ,Spicy Tofu Soup and Chestnut Makguli~I love the juicy ribs and the pork belly was paired with fresh lettuces that took away the oily feeling of the pork. It was our first time trying Makguli in an unique chestnut flavour: nutty and delicious, which balanced well with the food😊

Address: 4121 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: I got the Locus Skillet with duck confit and was shocked with how fantastic it was. Each bite was so full of rich flavours and you could taste the quality of the ingredients. Service was excellent too and the coffee was great! Highly recommend this awesome spot 👍👍👍

Address: 4121 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: Friendly staff and a nice little cafe to get in out of the rain.  I wouldn’t call the decor gothic necessarily, but it does have an eclectic feel.   The food was a hit with the family.

Address: 4121 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: This is a wonderful place for brunch. I had the summer ratatouille breakfast hash. It was delicious! I will definitely be back. Service was attentive.

Address: 4121 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review:
Wasn’t really planning to dine here but we saw the restaurant and it looked interesting so we gave it a try.

What a fantastic decision!! Food and drinks are tasty. My favorite dishes had to be the Two-ways squid and Seafood risotto! As for the drink, the server recommended The Railbird, which was a home run!

The services was lovely, the vibes in the restaurant were interesting but very pleasant. We had a great night and definitely would go back!

Address: 4121 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: Interesting choice of ingredients and unconventional dishes. Good for a quiet dinner night. The cocktails are the star of the place, IMO. Tercio makes the best old fashioned I’ve had in Vancouver. Super friendly guy and makes up for the gloominess of the place. 100% recommend.

Address: 39 Smithe Street Vancouver, BC V6B 0R3 Canada
Review:
Had a nice Friday brunch at Honey Salt (my first visit to the restaurant). They were kind enough to let me order their Sweet Potato Pancakes, usually available for weekend brunch; this was arranged before my visit. They were delicious and quite filling, although the almond butter was quite dense and sticky to the teeth. The Honey Salt Market is a great sharing dish, with a good amount of dips to go around for the veg and chips. Today, we were given guacamole, a spinach dip, and a sweet potato dip. My guest had their Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sandwich. The fried chicken inside was so tender and moist, and the batter had a solid crunch.

We were celebrating a birthday and they brought out a small brownie cake with ice cream and a candle. Such a nice way to end a filling meal. Staff were kind and wished my guest a happy birthday as they introduced themselves and at the front desk. Our server was Janine and she was fantastic! On a Friday for brunch it wasn't very busy, but I imagine it will get busier at night or on the weekends. Chic and comfortable aesthetic inside.

Address: 39 Smithe Street Vancouver, BC V6B 0R3 Canada
Review: My husband I came here for lunch. We had such a great time here. The service was fast. The atmosphere here is a ten out of ten for sure. It's so beautiful inside the restaurant.  The food here was so delicious and tasty.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant  for everyone.  Five out of five for sure.  Definitely try their avocado toast and fish and chips, so good.

Address: 39 Smithe Street Vancouver, BC V6B 0R3 Canada
Review: Vibes were on point, the decor was great! However my dish was quite small for the price and I felt that under the egg there was one piece of meat and a very small amount  of spinach and mushroom. The spinach and mushrooms tasted fantastic while the rest of the dish not covered in egg or the rest tasted dry and boring. None of us were very impressed by the food but the decor was great.

Address: 39 Smithe Street Vancouver, BC V6B 0R3 Canada
Review: The service was good and food did have good taste but I’m giving only 3 stars because we got the seafood boil and the shrimp weren’t peeled and the crab legs were very hard to open, not pre cracked at all. It got quite messy. I added the lobster tail so the dish was $80. I think if paying that much for a dish it shouldn’t be so hard to eat. I also had 6 oysters for $24 and 2 of them had pieces of shell in them. Would expect better quality and ease to eat for such a high price.

Address: 39 Smithe Street Vancouver, BC V6B 0R3 Canada
Review: The place is so beautiful! Highly recommended for breakfast. We tried eggs benedict and pancakes! A little bit overprice in my opinion, but the food was really good (quality and size).

Address: 2958 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1R4 Canada
Review:
Pre dinner snack before our late night hot pot, that’s why we didn’t order that many dishes

Dim sum is my favourite cuisine, I was curious how this modern restaurant would stack up against the traditional ones.

The green tea sesame balls were super tasty, but the other dishes were just average among other dim sum restaurants in greater Vancouver. We tried the golden corn dumplings, even Lux in Langley made a better version than them.

Maybe I have high standards regarding dim sum, I do think that they are making an effort to let more people try dim sum.

Unfortunately, for us traditional dim sum lovers we won’t be back

Address: 2958 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1R4 Canada
Review: The Scallop taro puffs inside curry sauce were good match. The Chive & shrimp dumplings were delicious. The Vegetable Siu Mai were not my expectations. The BBQ Pork had some sand inside.

Address: 2958 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1R4 Canada
Review:
I grew up in HK and Shanghai, so I hold most dim sum to a pretty high regard. Some dishes have a fusion take to them, but for the most part the taste of each dish is pretty authentic. I’d rate it an 8.5/10 for authenticity, with the best places in Richmond ranking ~9 on my scale. The accompanying sauces were a mix of old classics and new interesting takes (wasabi mustard), but I didn’t really use them much. In my opinion, the taste aligns more with the younger demographic, it’s definitely more flavorful and stronger. I find other dim sum places to be on the bland side (sometimes to cater to the elderly), and constantly find myself drowning my food in sauces. I really liked the shrimp corn dumplings and the fried wontons. Not my usual go to at dim sum and I was pleasantly surprised. I would’ve taken better photos but the food was too good.

Yes, there’s better dim sum to be had in Van for cheaper, but those places have “bad service”🧐. Most top tier dim sum restaurants also turn into fancy Chinese dining at night, so Little Bird is a solid alternative option. This place is a little more elegant and date friendly. Great spot to go to after a day hanging around in the area.

Lots of the reviews point to the price, which is understandable. Our table was 50$ a head (42$ food, 8$ alcohol), so really not that bad in comparison to a dim sum bill in Richmond. We had a lot of leftovers too.

Address: 2958 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1R4 Canada
Review: Love the idea of dim sum for dinr with drinks and Little Bird delivered except for tight space as tables were about an inch apart. I like Haywire Pinot Noir which they serve with light dim sum fair which we enjoyed. Their fried items were crispy and tasty and steamed dumplings and sticky rice were fresh. The portions were smaller than conventional dim sum places as the orders came in a pair or 3s which means if 4 top someone's gonna miss out on the dumpling. They do advise upon arriving of their strict time limit for dining in but we found it sufficient as the food came out promptly and small bites take little time to inhale lol. Hope to return with a larger group so that we try everything else on the menu alongside some craft beers.

Address: 2958 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1R4 Canada
Review:
The dim sum is good and very filling. 3 items per person is a good rule of thumb, as we went 4 and it was too much.
The Scallop Taro Puff was a particular standout.
The Steamed BBQ Pork Bun was a little disappointing in the bun to pork ratio.

Address: 900 Canada Place Way Vancouver, BC V6C 3L5 Canada
Review:
Food,service,location are great.
Definitely worth it coming and experience it.
We went for all inclusive weekend brunch and had great time.
They have vegetarian and vegan substitutes

Address: 900 Canada Place Way Vancouver, BC V6C 3L5 Canada
Review: This hotel & restaurant was across from our hotel. Emilee was a great host! She was honest &  told us what was good to eat  here at Arc & gave us other nearby restaurants to visit. We wanted a light snack. The chicken wings & fried cauliflower were yummy! We also had a drink.

Address: 900 Canada Place Way Vancouver, BC V6C 3L5 Canada
Review: Was there the other day, and had a good time. The service was a a bit slow to start, but overall it was good. I was graciously seated by the manager I believe. I had the four course set menu from local fresh ingredients, and it did not disappoint (albeit the seeds in the strawberry orange salad - though the flavour was good).The risotto was amazing and had rich flavour, the duck was very tender and the bean/bacon was a good addition - I only hoped for a bit more, such as mashed potatoes or a little something. Loved the lavender atop the honey gelato and strawberry/rhubarb compote. I think I described that right..lol. Was impressed with one male expediter/busser, who was gentle kind and professional (can't remember his name but I think it was something like Mora/Omar?, I could be way off base). Loved the rooftop honey with my tea.

Address: 900 Canada Place Way Vancouver, BC V6C 3L5 Canada
Review:
Blahhh Brunch

When you go to brunch at ARC you have two choices going for the order brunch menu and the a la cart menu. The all you can eat menu looked heavy so we went for the a la cart.

In short nothing stood out as me as special for the price we paid. The coffee though organic tasted burnt. The pancakes fluffy didn’t have a crunch or caramelization for that heightened experience. The crab egg Benny was pleasant but plain. The $9 bacon was mostly fat.

Address: 900 Canada Place Way Vancouver, BC V6C 3L5 Canada
Review: I've been following Arc Dining on Instagram for 2 years now and finally got the chance to go yesterday with my mom and sister.  We all LOVED it!!  Fantastic view, service and food!!  I actually couldn't think of anything that would make it any better!!  Ok maybe if the price was lower but it IS worth every penny!  I'll definitely go back and recommend it to anyone who wants to listen ;)

Address: 5750 Oak Street Vancouver, BC V6M 2V9 Canada
Review: The food was amazing, we tried the falafel, hummus , Shakshuka and salmon shawarma , the best middle eastern food in Vancouver . Service was very friendly.

Address: 5750 Oak Street Vancouver, BC V6M 2V9 Canada
Review: Best hummus ever, in a falafel plate, which happens to be vegan. So creamy! Shakshuka pizza a clever twist, on a freshly baked, airy crust that is perfectly executed. Yolks still runny! Service impeccable.

Address: 5750 Oak Street Vancouver, BC V6M 2V9 Canada
Review:
I was looking for a place to eat Falafel, and my friend recommended me this hidden gem in the corner of Oak and 41st ave. I order the falafel plate a coffee and some pastries. Falafel plate was amazing, gluten friendly so my gf was able to eat from it. Pastries and coffee were also very tasty.
I will totally recommend this place.

Address: 5750 Oak Street Vancouver, BC V6M 2V9 Canada
Review: The best falafel and hummus I’ve tried in Vancouver. The shakshuka plate was super tasty as well . Service was super friendly.

Address: 5750 Oak Street Vancouver, BC V6M 2V9 Canada
Review: The food looks overcooked. We waited for our order for about 25 minutes. Even after every customer who came after us, including two Jewish customers who arrived five minutes later and two others who arrived ten minutes later, had their food before us. I wondered if it was because we are Asian.

Address: 261 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2Z1 Canada
Review: Amazing. Really. Everything we tried (and we sampled just about everything on the menu) was amazing. The service is also incredible. Our waitress Kristina was very knowledgeable and gave us so much information and ideas on what to try. I highly, highly recommend this restaurant if you are in Vancouver. The reviews are not lying. This place is all that!

Address: 261 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2Z1 Canada
Review: I enjoyed a birthday celebration here before going to a concert at the Rickshaw.  The service was top notch.  When the server presented the food she explained what the dish was and how it was made. The had great recommendations and the timing was perfect.  The food was very fresh tasting and cooked to perfection. I would not hesitate to recommend this place. Of course the area is a bit dodgy but inside you feel safe, privileged and well looked after.

Address: 261 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2Z1 Canada
Review: We loved every dish we got. The environment is lively, loud, and could be fun for those that enjoy active bars. We enjoyed our servers, they were attentive and cleaned our small table often. The area/neighborhood is dilapidated, run down, and scattered with public drug use.

Address: 261 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2Z1 Canada
Review:
Everything was delicious and sooooo filling
The tacos were so unique.
The cornbread was very interesting, its a must try! I think more micro greens were needed to help balance the richness of it.
Got 6 tacos (each order has 2 tacos): skirt steak polenta (the best one imo. Beef was cooked perfectly, blueberry was so interesting, and the polenta was really good in it), lamb (this was like solid meat, I didn’t enjoy it but my partner did), and the chicken (this was sooooo good! I heard this is a seasonal item but it should be kept around!! Taste was so good. Very heavy, I’d love to have more celery sticks even if it was on the side).

Was so full after this, but would love to taste the churros next time!

Address: 261 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2Z1 Canada
Review: We've been going here for years, and unlike many small restaurants, their standards have remained consistently high. The food is excellent, the drinks are unique, and the atmosphere - inside an old brick building - is warm and cozy. It's located in the Downtown Eastside, which may make some people nervous at night, but we've never had any problems.

Address: 2280 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B6 Canada
Review:
I come here regularly for the cauliflower meal.  It's the best. Choice of dips and you can go all veggies or half rice, it'll fill you up!

You have to try it and you'll understand what I mean.  I've had other cauliflower at other restaurants around town but this one is the best in my opinion.

Address: 2280 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B6 Canada
Review: Lovely atmosphere, great service amazing food. My friend and I went in for dinner and shared the cauliflower, the board, and the beets. 10/10 on everything, will definitely be back as there were a couple things we wanted to try but they were sold out for the night. Highly recommend!

Address: 2280 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B6 Canada
Review: Just had the most beautiful meal with my bf at jamjar, the atmosphere was cozy, the staff were lovely and the food was fabulous, I always find it hard to find good veggie food that's actually filling and that was 11/10. The prices are very reasonable. Would 100% recommend and we will be back again!

Address: 2280 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B6 Canada
Review: I came in for an early supper, I ordered the Tabblieh and a cider (bandity), food was really fresh and flavourful, absolutely loved it. The cider was awesome too, it went great with the meal.

Address: 2280 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B6 Canada
Review: Fantastic food and service at the Commercial Drive location. Great flavours, shareable dishes, warm and casual atmosphere. All of this at a very reasonable price. Good place to meet up with friends

Address: 1127 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P2 Canada
Review: This was a highlight of my visit to Vancouver. The Bruschetta Caprese was a fantastic and refreshing start to our meal. I had the lobster and crab stuffed ravioli which sounded amazing but far exceeded my expectations. My dining partner enjoyed the risotto with braised meet which he said was absolutely stellar. Everything was delightfully flavorful and the atmosphere was exceptionally pleasant. The service? Impeccable as well!

Address: 1127 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P2 Canada
Review: It was Saturday night, and a busy night. It was a small restaurant, good service fr Irene. Food were all really good and  cocktail drinks and wine were also good. We were five people in a table, only problem here was if you were seated inside the restaurant and near the kitchen it was uncomfortable, and hot too. Also on a Saturday night, you only have 2 hours seating, even if you are still enjoying your drinks, you have to pay and leave, which was understandable for a small restaurant like this. But thank you Irene for a good service with a smile, chef for our good food, and bartender for our good cocktail drinks. Might come back, but not on a weekend for sure.

Address: 1127 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P2 Canada
Review:
***UNFAIR MANDATORY TIP POLICY IMPOSING ON A GROUP OF FIVE ***

I am deeply disappointed with my recent visit. Not only did they enforce a mandatory 20% tip, but they also insisted on applying it to my group of five, even though the policy clearly states it is for groups of six or more.

First, the server nor anything on the reservation page informed us about the mandatory 20% tip. And I was shocked when she insisted that we had to pay the 20% tip, despite having only five people in our group. According to their own policy, this tip should not have been applied to us.

What made matters worse was the server's complete lack of concern or understanding. She made it clear that she had no intention of rectifying the situation or offering any sort of compromise. Her dismissive and rude attitude only added to the frustration we felt as paying customers.

She stated that since we made a reservation of 6 people, this mandatory tip policy applied to us because she SPENT HER TIME RESERVING THE TABLE for us. However, I mentioned that they were going to seat us a 6-people table regardless. And she can inform us beforehand.

Springing it on us at the end of the meal, especially when it doesn't even apply to our group size, is both unfair and deceptive.

I believe that a restaurant's success lies not only in the quality of its food but also in the way it treats its customers. Unfortunately, this restaurant failed to deliver on both fronts. The mandatory tip policy and the server's poor attitude have left me with a negative impression that I cannot ignore.

In conclusion, I would caution others considering dining here to be wary of their unfair mandatory tip policy. If you value transparency and fair treatment as a customer, I recommend seeking alternatives where your dining experience is valued and respected.

Address: 1127 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P2 Canada
Review:
We did the date night and think it was an amazing deal. We priced it out before going and it was 100 bucks off. Seems like most people did the date night even if it was clearly just friends.

The food was unbelievable. Carpaccio was absolutely phenomenal. My spouse ordered the lobster and crab ravioli, and he loved it. I ordered the red gnocchi and was very impressed. Both were served hot and we were asked if we wanted fresh pepper and Parm. By the time desserts came we were beyond full.

I wasn't overly fond of the tiramasu, but spouse loved his mousse.

We plan to return for date night the next time we return to Van.

Address: 1127 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P2 Canada
Review:
We had the date night special which consisted of 2 starters, 2 mains, 2 desserts and a bottle of wine.

The portions were surprisingly big. Everything we ordered was outstanding. Will definitely be back soon to try the other dishes.

Address: 1622 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3Y4 Canada
Review: Such a great Mexican restaurant! Stumbled upon this and decided to give it a go, and instantly added it to our favorites. Great drinks, friendly staff & delicious food. We went to Mexico last year and were pretty disappointed in the resort food - but this is what we were hoping for! From what I can tell it‘s authentic - and definitely really flavorful.

Address: 1622 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3Y4 Canada
Review:
Love this place!! We stopped by on our way to Roger Arena, great location, great food. I can’t wait to go back again.

The happy hour menu is amazing!  There were 5 of us. We shared 4 appetizers and it was plenty of food.

Address: 1622 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3Y4 Canada
Review:
Popular spot, very busy, and somewhat small. Recommend reserving. Great tasting food. Service was good, a little hard to hear or communicate at some times with how loud and busy it is. We ordered the special drink(watermelon jalapeño slush type drink), and the server misunderstood or didn't hear us order 2... we had to ask a second time.

Overall, it was great service, friendly, and knowledgeable.

Address: 1622 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3Y4 Canada
Review: Great spot, great service, delicious food. The horchata is so refreshing. There is a great feeling in the space. I was there in the day time, but it looks like it can get bumping at night.

Address: 1622 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3Y4 Canada
Review: Wow wow wow! Amazing elevated Mexican food, I can say their food tastes amazing, and their mezcal drinks are awesome, I got the brunch complete breakfast which brings a little bit of everything, and I got some tacos at happy hour which starts at 2, on top of everything customer service was 10/10. Definitely would recommend this restaurant.

Address: 952 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W7 Canada
Review: French food and wine!  Need I say more? We were excited to try this place as we were missing authentic French food. We came here for a birthday dinner. This bistro brought me back to France. It’s a nice, intimate cozy place. We sat outside as it was such a warm day! The food was good. We ordered price fixe meal-which consists of a starter, entree and dessert. (You can also order starter and entree only) The portions were a good size-we almost wished we ordered the starter and entrée only. The service was slow, but we did not mind as we enjoyed ambiance and saw she was playing dual roles of server and hostess. Overall we would definitely come back.

Address: 952 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W7 Canada
Review:
Me and my frd came to Absinthe Bistro for my birthday. We had their set menu which offers good selection of meat and vegetarian dishes. I picked the foie gras as appetizer, it was rich and flavourful and that's what u would expect from foie gras from most places. Beef tartare was well seasoned, it was smooth and fragrant. The lamb rack was good in portion, a little too raw for my liking but I know authentic French lamb rack suppose to be medium rare. I likely asked the server if they can cook them for me for a little more, she gladly took it in and  it came back perfectly cooked to my liking with beautiful grill marks. When the server became aware of my birthday she offered to take a Polaroid pic for us. Super cute and personable service.

Ambiance was simple and open. I like how tables were well spaced out so it's not crowded.

Address: 952 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W7 Canada
Review:
My gal pals and I had an amazing meal. They have a set menu "fixe prix" menu 2 or 3 course. I chose the crab cakes starter, duck confit main and chocolate cake.  Michelan quality presentation, generous portions and amazing ingredients. I would highly recommend this restaurant for foodies. Had a taste of scallops, foods grois, halibut, creme brulee from my friends. All very delicious!
Friendly service, cute decor with absinthe vintage posters & chandelier patio seating.

I'll be back for a special dinner. Thanks Absinthe!

Address: 952 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W7 Canada
Review:
I didn’t know what to expect when I chose to come here, but I knew that if they had a rotating, limited menu, the chef would have to know what they are doing. And did they ever!

For $65 per person, this place is so fairly priced. We ordered one of each thing on the menu that night and everything was PERFECT. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vancouver now, and for anyone that loves French food, you gotta come here. I can’t wait to come back!

Address: 952 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W7 Canada
Review:
My Fiancé and I dined here in celebration of our 1 year anniversary and my birthday. We met in France while studying, and dining here allowed us to re-live the French dining experience in such a sweet way!
The staff were professional, but friendly. The food was incredibly tasteful and you can tell they made sure to present it as such. We especially enjoyed one of the side dishes which was grapefruit with cracked pepper—shockingly delicious!
At the end of the night our server took a Polaroid picture of us to keep! We used it to document the experience in our date journal❤️

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: MUST TRY! Worth the wait, must try, great simple ramen. The line ups can take over an hour at time but it’s worth it. Customer service is great, food is amazing and the atmosphere is welcoming and clean. Even with such a long line up, the staff are always so friendly and clean up after every guest so carefully to ensure the best experience for the next guest. Love this place!

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: You want Ramen in Vancouver? There are many options. This is no-nonsense delicious Ramen. Yes, Ramen, like Art, is subjective, but I can't imagine a scenario where a bowl of this could be sent back. Danbo is more consistent than the rain in this fair city for its ability to deliver an all around great bowl of Ramen. If you don't want to quibble about semantics and just have a delicious bowl, accept no substitute. I eat at a variety of Ramen joints, this one just hits every time. No Question.

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: Had to wait a while in queue to eat there, but it was well worth the wait. Hands-down the best vegan ramen I’ve ever had. The customization options are great, the broth is delicious and the service is fast & friendly. Would easily recommend this place (as well as the Seattle location).

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: Truly worth the wait. Incredible. Note the ramen doesn’t come with toppings so you have to add -on everything including egg

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: Absolutely wonderful, Ramen! This was my first time having ramen, and it all tasted delicious. The environment and atmosphere were great, and even with a line outside for seating, it did not take long to get in. Highly recommended!

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review:
This is one of my favourite place for Vegan Ramen!! As I prefer to have vegetarian/vegan Ramen, its very difficult to find a place that offers multiple options! And Danbo is one of them! Try them out and I am sure it won’t be disappointment for you! I was impressed with its flavourful broth and service! Dining space is quite small but well-managed. Make sure to book a seat via yelp before reaching there.
A must-visit for delicious plant-based options and attentive service.

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: Absolutely some of the best ramen I’ve had in all of Van, and easily top 5 I’ve had outside of Japan itself. The Rekka is a great spicy option, albeit they could still turn up the heat more from extra spicy. The wait can be quite long so don’t expect to just arrive & sit down. But the broth is full & very tasty, the noodles are delicious & I like that they let you pick firmness. The pork chashu is well cut & takes on flavour well. Can’t recommend this place enough.

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: This is one of my favorites spots in Vancouver. The ramen is always on point and I have great memories coming here. However, when we visited on July 11th, our team of 5 had to wait for 2 hours to get inside. What made it worse was that smaller teams who had hardly waited got to go before us. I would have preferred if they had at least asked us first if it would be alright for us to sit separately. A team of four that came after us got to go in before us just because they had one less person. I’m not sure who is managing the queue but the waitlist seemed useless. I would suggest implementing a time limit for bigger groups as two big groups before us took their sweet time while they saw a huge line. What was more infuriating was that when we finally came in, they put together two smaller tables for us and added a stool on the side. I couldn’t help but wonder if they could have done that sooner instead of letting in couples who’d come after us finish their meal and then put the two tables together for us. I’m not sure if I want to come here again as long the customers in line are not treated seriously.

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: Ramen Danbo gets my vote for some of the best ramen in Vancouver. Because there is limited seating inside, there is often a long waitlist to get seated, depending on your group size. Came during the week and for a larger group, there was about a hour long wait to get seated. Once seated the food came out very quickly and the both the ramen and broth was delicious. Love how you can order extra noodles too in case you have extra broth leftover. Prices are very reasonable as well. Will definitely have to come by here again

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: There’s always a wait so I was intrigued and decided to finally put my name down & try it. Small space inside but it wasn’t stuffy at all. Service is okay, they were really slammed with online orders all the way up to closing time. The ramen was good but I think you could have the same experience somewhere else with less wait.

Address: 838 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1W2 Canada
Review: I ordered various meals, beer, sake and also desserts, everything was tasty. Also atmosphere was great too.  Just one thing the service was,, just fine compare to their reputation in Robson area. Overall , All was satisfying

Address: 838 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1W2 Canada
Review: 🍜 Tasty udon 🍲 and yummy takoyaki! 🇯🇵 The whole restaurant feels like Japan! 🏮 But, unfortunately, the sashimi 🍣 isn't the freshest.  However, it's still worth the price 💰 and the best part is we didn't have to wait at all! ⌛️😄

Address: 838 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1W2 Canada
Review:
1. Wonderful place to spend an evening
2. Varieties of Japanese cuisine
3. We had octopus, fish items, beer etc
4. Hot and happening place
5. Recommended for Japanese cuisine (don't expect Sushi, they don't have any)

Address: 838 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1W2 Canada
Review: It has been a long while since my last visit Guu Original at Thurlow. Simple menu with delectable choices. The flesh of the grilled saba fish was a bit on the harder side. Good value for the set at $13.80. Very pleasant dinning experience.

Address: 838 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1W2 Canada
Review: Probably the best restaurant experience I've had in a while. Every dish we ordered was absolutely delicious but I particularly reccomend the kimchi udon, deep fried fish cakes, smoked salmon with onions, and unagi over rice. The atmosphere in the restaurant was on point and the service was very accommodating.

Address: 216 Abbott Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2K8 Canada
Review: Great food and atmosphere. Every dish is well executed, the duck confit had a crispy skin and moist fall off the bone meat. We also shared the escargot and calamari, the escargot definitely stood out better.

Address: 216 Abbott Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2K8 Canada
Review: Since we couldn’t go back to France this year, we decided to try a little bit of France here. This restaurant did not disappoint. Although not exact duplicates due to availability of French-produced ingredients (we miss Normandy butter!), it was still very good. Escargot was very good, foie gras was good, lobster bisque was excellent, steak frites with peppercorn sauce was cooked perfectly. Service was excellent and the room was charming. We’ve been to restaurants where dishes were Instagram-worthy but lacking in taste, this restaurant focused on taste. We will be back!

Address: 216 Abbott Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2K8 Canada
Review: Romantic and chic spot with amazing food.  Try the duck confit!  Local and fantastic music for happy hour.  The wine selection is also fantastic.  I also had the french onion soup which was great.  The fresh rolls were flawless.

Address: 216 Abbott Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2K8 Canada
Review: Absolute hidden gem. So cozy and warm inside and makes me feel like I’m a cute little bistro in Paris. Happy hour dishes are amazing, great value and delicious. Also ordered the prime rib burger and duck confit - a wee bit on the saltier side but still really good. Great wine selections too.

Address: 216 Abbott Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2K8 Canada
Review:
If you happen to be in Gastown, Vancouver, this little bistro is worth visiting during its Happy Hour sessions which I think start at 1430 hrs. The place exhibits a cozy feel, service is so-so, food is acceptable but during Happy Hour -> oh, so affordable and worth it.

For whatever we ordered which was 3 “mains” plus 1 X 6 oz White Wine, we paid less than CAD50.00 (before tax).

Address: 1329 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C6 Canada
Review: The food was mediocre.  The baby octopus 🐙 was very rubbery.  It retained it shape even after I chew it for 1 min. 🤣 But the most annoying thing is the little flies flying around my table.

Address: 1329 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C6 Canada
Review: I always order malatang here late at night. The advantages of this place are delicious malatang and the most delicious tangsuyuk(sweet&sour pork) in Vancouver. I recommend malatang, but sweet and sour pork is super good, trust me! But this store has a big drawback: it takes a really long time to make food and often forget the ingredients and food. I think there is not enough manpower because this restaurant is open even at dawn. I think the overall quality will improve a lot if the shortage of people is covered.

Address: 1329 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C6 Canada
Review: The Tantan tonkotsu is literally the best thing ever on this menu! I really wished they had it available during the daytime. I’m not really a late night eater but, also there was this lemon ginger pork too they had, I really miss that, was it removed from the menu?

Address: 1329 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C6 Canada
Review: A place I found because I missed Korean jjajangmyeon.. The conclusion was successful.. Delicious food and friendly service.... The only regret I found was that the restaurant was a bit narrow.

Address: 1329 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C6 Canada
Review: Malatang was nice, it would be 4 stars if “level 1 - mild” wasn’t so spicy.

Address: 656W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1G1 Canada
Review: Stopped by for a late lunch and was not disappointed. Place was pretty empty so was sat right away. Menu had lots of tasty options but opted for the spicy beef fried rice. Food was pretty fast and very tasty. I also ordered a Mango frost off of the drink menu which turned out to not be a drink but a dessert. It was super tasty and I want another one already. Now I want to try everything on the menu. Highly recommend.

Address: 656W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1G1 Canada
Review:
My friend and I originally came here to try their new shaved ice menu and it didn't disappoint. 👍 We also may have gotten too excited in trying out their food that we ordered much more than we could eat, but that's okay, we got to take them home to eat the next day.

Price wise, it's reasonable if you think of how many servings these could feed. So remember to bring friends to share the greatness of this place!

If you'd like to try an assortment of appetizers, I do recommend their appetizer trio. It has fish cake, squid, and their signature chicken nuggets. It is a bit on the saltier side so beware of that. For rice, you can't go wrong with their spicy beef fried rice. It's packed with lots of meat and their meat is really soft and tasty. Their tiger prawn however is alright. Nothing too special about it in my opinion.

For the two drinks we got, they're a bit disappointing. The lychee tea mostly tasted like regular tea and it was quite diluted. Their nitro guava black tea was okay.

Address: 656W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1G1 Canada
Review: Food was ok, drink was good, not bad but no surprising flavors. Service was great,  servers are friendly and helpful when recommending dishes, clearing out dishes. Environment is good, pretty clean and spacious. Would be a good place for a regular day comfort food lunch or dinner, though price is kinda high for this type of food.

Address: 656W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1G1 Canada
Review: As a Taiwanese, I’ve always enjoyed exploring Taiwanese food. The food is pretty authentic. You can even find the street food”oyster pancakes “ here. That really surprised me!! But I find the food a bit pricey and the service wasn’t really good. But it’s still worth to try

Address: 656W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1G1 Canada
Review:
Night out menu is great for January and February

The Taiwanese food is very peppery (pepper, not spicy). It was delicious and a good change to what I usually eat. They also keep the food relevant so it doesnt get boring if you visit often. I would recommend. The restaurant is very popular for good reason. We got a reservation, but even then it's still busy. Place is great for special occasions with friends or taking dates

The server said the chef and owner are still working on getting desserts on the menu. That would be appreciated, cross my fingers. Dessert is the only thing missing from this flawless menu

Address: 128-11782 River Road Richmond, BC V6X 1Z7 Canada
Review: The food was nice, we enjoyed the meal. The staff were super nice, they prepared the food and send it upstairs by an elevator. The biggest problem was that the dining area was filled with smoke which came from grilling in the kitchen. I would try the food again but definitely for a take out. The chicken was tasty and tender, Lahmajoun had a sour taste to it which was not bad but it was strong.

Address: 128-11782 River Road Richmond, BC V6X 1Z7 Canada
Review:
The food and service here are absolutely fantastic. The man who runs the place is always so kind and friendly and has a huge smile whenever I see him. The food they made is fantastic. The bread is super thin and crispy but also stretchy too. The chicken was super moist and very flavourful as well.

I have to say my favorite part though was the dessert. The napolean cake is made with light crispy pastry layers surrounding layers of cloud like sweet cream. It's SO good.

Lastly, the food elevator is very novel and kind of fun.

Address: 128-11782 River Road Richmond, BC V6X 1Z7 Canada
Review: Oh man. Do yourselves a favour and come here. The service was OUTSTANDING - super friendly, warm, and personable, and all of our questions about the menu were patiently answered. The food was great and very reasonably priced. A super unassuming location with seating on the second floor. A must-try, and we will be returning whenever we are in the area!

Address: 128-11782 River Road Richmond, BC V6X 1Z7 Canada
Review: Delicious, unpretentious Armenian/Georgian restaurant, tucked away in Richmond. Happened upon it with some time to kill before flying and was pleasantly surprised! Loved the cheese pide. I will be back!

Address: 128-11782 River Road Richmond, BC V6X 1Z7 Canada
Review:
We ate here two years ago while traveling around BC and still say this was one of the most delicious meals we've EVER had. What a hidden gem !

You'll never regret eating here.

Andrew & Jo

*posting now in 2023 but this review was from our visit in 2021. Totally forgot to write a review back then.*

Address: 2149 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B3 Canada
Review:
It was our first with Ethiopian cuisine and this restaurant ambience was the best giving a traditional touch in the way dishes were displayed.

Peanut soup tasted amazing! Platter portion had a little bit of everything for both veg and non veg. They even offered choices of curries for the non veg platter where we could choose some of the dishes we liked as we do not consume beef.

Injera was highly sour in taste and not sure if that is how it usually tastes and that was the only traditional bread available. The sour taste was not that appealing to few of us.

The portion size is very small compared to price. Over all an okay experience.

Address: 2149 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B3 Canada
Review: Great taste and very authentic! Honey wine is not overly sweet and home made. We had Kitfo and shared a one person's chief special. Great times! Definitely my go to place for Ethiopian food!

Address: 2149 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B3 Canada
Review:
My friends and I recently had the opportunity to dine at Harambe Ethiopian Restaurant, and I must say it was a disappointing experience. We had high hopes for this place, but unfortunately, we encountered a few issues that left me with a bad taste in my mouth, quite literally.

First and foremost, the injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, was not up to par. It had a rather unpleasant sour taste, which took away from the overall enjoyment of the meal. One of the spinach side dishes too was sour and I stayed away from a second helping of that dish.

To make matters worse, one of my friends found a fly in their drink. Attached is the picture of it. This was not only unappetizing but also a major hygiene concern. It's unacceptable for a restaurant to serve beverages with insects in them, and it definitely affected our dining experience. Worst part, the waitress initially argued that it wasn't a fly until she saw it herself.

But the most disturbing incident occurred when our waitress dipped her finger tip into our drink to scoop something out. This was a complete breach of basic food handling practices and left us feeling extremely uncomfortable. It's essential for the staff to maintain proper hygiene standards, and this incident was a glaring violation.

Given these experiences, I regret to say that I would not consider returning to Harambe Ethiopian Restaurant. The issues we encountered were too significant to overlook, and they greatly impacted our overall impression of the place. I value cleanliness, quality, and attentive service when dining out, and unfortunately, this restaurant failed to meet these expectations.

I hope the management of Harambe Ethiopian Restaurant takes these concerns seriously and works towards improving their food quality and hygiene practices. Until then, I would advise potential diners to exercise caution when considering this establishment for a meal.

Address: 2149 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B3 Canada
Review: I love this restaurant! Especially the fish platter! It melts on you tongue. I also like their tea very much. And that they displqy art on the walls. I got inspired by it!

Address: 2149 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B3 Canada
Review: My first time having Ethiopian food. The restaurant had good ambiance and bonus points for good lighting at the table! Service was friendly, but not attentive - took multiple asks to get water and it was slow. Food was good, I just don’t think it’s my palette. Dumaskli Soup was my favourite - a sweet soup with a little kick to it. Chef’s Choice Combination Platter for Two People was a great way to sample different dishes, I liked this. The Ye Assa Tibs (fish) reminded me of Chinese fish dishes. The Injera is like a less mild sourdough made into a steamed tortilla with bread consistency - not my favourite but I believe it’s personal taste as my friends liked it. Our meal came to $93 after tips for 3 people.

Address: 1032 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6 Canada
Review:
Our first time in Vancouver BC and after a heavy days shopping we visited this restaurant, having passed it earlier in the day, for a quick drink. We initially sat outside at street level only to be directed to the roof terrace accessed by a lift - this was a fortunate move for us that was well received.

Briefly; a stunning roof terrace with the kitchen open to the seating area. Not much of a view but the cool vibe, smooth fixtures and furniture and chilled sound track more than made up for this. Our drink quickly turned into a meal and several drinks. The food was excellent and not as pricey as the surroundings would lead you to believe. The waiting staff were as alert and attentive than any that I have encountered. A lush experience. I fully recommend a visit.

Address: 1032 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6 Canada
Review: I like the atmosphere here, always good vibes around. We tried dine out 2023, the appetizer I chose scallops and bacon, I liked it. The main steak I ordered as medium rare, inside was perfect, but bit overcooked outside for me….it was hard. The sauce was good as well the side. I wish I had a more variety of salad thou. The dessert crème brûlée was bit sweet to me. Overall, it was good, but not the best this year.

Address: 1032 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6 Canada
Review: My girlfriend and I love this place!! We come here for happy hour and it has always been amazing! The staff are friendly - make sure you make a reservation before coming in just to guaranty a spot!

Address: 1032 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6 Canada
Review: This is a cool place for sure, but we went for Happy Hour and had better food in other places in Vancouver for sure. The Mac and cheese bites were good, but the wagyu brisket was over cooked. Overall it wasn’t bad, but def over priced for all the hype.

Address: 1032 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6 Canada
Review:
DON'T GO THERE! IT IS FULL OF MICE! Last Friday night (July 21st), my wife and I went to this restaurant for the first time, and it turned out to be a disaster! We were in the middle of our dinner when we spotted three mice running around on the floor. Yikes! We couldn't believe our eyes!
After we finished eating and paid the bill, we told the manager, whose name starts with 'P,' about the mice. But guess what? He acted like it was no big deal! He said it's totally normal to see mice in downtown restaurants and that we're just not used to it because we're from outside the downtown area. Like, seriously?!

We expressed our concerns about the hygiene and how it could put people's health at risk. Not to mention, all the utensils, food, and table settings would be exposed to potential contamination. But he just brushed us off and said it's none of our business to ask about what they're doing to address the issue. Can you believe the nerve?

Honestly, we felt so grossed out and upset by the whole thing. With his indifferent attitude, we decided to get out of there as fast as we could. It's so disappointing to experience this in a supposedly fancy restaurant. We won't be going back, that's for sure! This whole ordeal left us seriously questioning their quality and safety standards.
Reading other reviews, it seems it has been more than a month and they took no actions for resolving it.

Address: 775 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L6 Canada
Review:
I enjoyed the omakase here. My favorites were the Scallop, the Spot Prawn, any of the Bluefin, the Sea Urchin, and the King Salmon Otoro!

-Scallop from Hotate
-Sea-bream
-Spot prawn (shaoxing wine on top)
-Golden eye snapper
-Tachiuo /cutlass fish
-Nodoguro/black throat seaparch
-Katsuo/bonito
-Bluefin tuna chutoro
-Bluefin tuna slightly higher than chutoro but one step lower than otoro
-King salmon otoro
-Sea urchin with fish roe from Hokkaido
-Bluefin tuna negitoro

A bit pricey, but would recommend. It's a small restaurant, reservations is a must!

Address: 775 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L6 Canada
Review: From the Japanese minimalist interior to the thoughtfully orchestrated nigiri Omakase menu, Tetsu Sushi Bar is an experience having you booking again and again.

Address: 775 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L6 Canada
Review: An exceptional dinner experience! Thank you for the good service, fresh ingredients, and innovative creations. Will return in future!

Address: 775 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L6 Canada
Review: Awesome omakase dinner. You can feel the real taste of fine japanese with good selection of sake. The price is hiked with covid inflation, $200/p ends up $300/p after adding specials & sake bottle. Not sure how to say on value these days as everything get hiked. I enjoyed very much the special day dinner. This small place only can take 4 groups about 10ppl total, could talk pleasantly and quietly, surrounded by modern classic guitar sound.

Address: 775 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L6 Canada
Review: One of my must visit restaurants during my visits to Vancouver. This place is hands down the best sushi place! I discovered the place by accident, wandering the East End looking for a sushi restaurant. Found this Gem and have never looked back. You can get some of the best imported seafood from Japan, along with fresh local wares. But my favorite is probably the Foie Gras Donbori. They pair just enough rice and sauce to make it delicious down to the last grain of rice without diluting the aroma of the Foie Gras.

Address: 2815 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G1 Canada
Review:
Great Mexican spot! I wish it was more advertised

Spotless restaurant and has friendly staff. Has a variety of options and vegetarian items.

I tried the cheese quesadilla, fish taco and nachos; they were delicious. I really enjoyed the taco bread - it’s freshly made and melts in the mouth

Address: 2815 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G1 Canada
Review: Came here for a quick bite and realized that it was 15 mins before closing and despite that I was greated very warmly. I had a vegan taco and it was flavored beautifully, just needed a little fat in it like avocado. THE SHRIMP AND PINEAPPLE TACOS ARE FROM THE GODS!

Address: 2815 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G1 Canada
Review: Really enjoyed the house made corn tortillas! Super soft and light. I really enjoyed my tacos!

Address: 2815 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G1 Canada
Review:
This is a nice little spot, chill, good for a family or a couple. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I gave it a 4 because the lamb taco was not available today. The other items we got however arrived quick, were fresh and well made.
Definitely give them a try.

Address: 2815 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G1 Canada
Review: Highly recommended spot for burritos and tacos. The portions here are incredibly generous. I recommend trying their chicken mole and the lamb burritos. The chicken mole is my absolute favourite and typical go to. Their burritos are packed full and the meats are super flavourful! You can't go wrong with their tacos either, 3 should be more than enough for one person based on the portion size.This has definitely become one of my new favourite burrito and tacos places in Vancouver.

Address: 4250 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: Long standing Thai restaurant in the community. Their curry is creamy and flavourful and their Tom Yum soup is a must order, it's hard to find Tom yum that is so bold with flavour and acidity. Pad see ew has been good too but might be on the slight saltier side. Service always has been great. Their hours is tough though as they only open for 4 hours daily now.

Address: 4250 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: Honestly this is the best Thai food I've ever had. My gf and I came in and every dish we ordered was phenomenal. I personally don't know how anyone could give this place less than 5 stars. Great picks are Oyster Beef, chicken saute, green curry and pad pew.

Address: 4250 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: Hit it 👍🏿! One of my favorite Thai places in the world. The food here is very consistent and always delicious. I love how it's been family run since I started going here almost 10 years ago. It's hard to recommend anything on the menu because it's all so good. The only thing I would warn you is that it can get quite busy so make sure you make reservations.

Address: 4250 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: All of the dishes are delicious, and I highly recommend trying their braised pork and cauliflower. For drinks, the Thai-style milk tea is a must-try. The prices are also very reasonable, averaging around 15-20 dollars per person, and you can have a very filling meal. Plus, you can also take some leftovers home with you.

Address: 4250 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: I walked into this store by accident and found that this is the best Thai restaurant I have ever been to. They were very busy but the service was fast. I ordered four dishes, all of them were really good. I strongly recommend the pineapple fried rice. And the Chi Chi cocktail was amazing as well.

Address: 1392 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5V 3E4 Canada
Review:
Great vegetarian food - amazing flavour and texture in all the dishes that is pretty close to their non-vegetarian counterparts.  Definitely get the spring rolls, coconut rice cakes and banh xeo for starters!

Service was attentive and quick while the atmosphere in the restaurant was fitting and chic.

Address: 1392 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5V 3E4 Canada
Review:
First time.
Excellent service, delicious foods and good price.
Moonsoo roll you need to try it. Fresh and delicious. The pineapple sauce I wish I could have a bottle of it.
The Uncle Hings wings very delicious.
My friend had vegan prawn curry and I had Lemongrass tofu. Very very tasty. Definitely recommend this place and I will go back♥️

Address: 1392 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5V 3E4 Canada
Review:
Reviewing as a meat eater, I would eat this type of food regularly.

Curries were very fragrant, spiced to perfection but like a few others noted, slightly on the sweet side. They also skimped on the fake meat. I'd like to see a bit more fake shrimp.

I didn't care for the crepe salad dish. It's dominated by greens and beans sprouts.

Appetizers like spring rolls and coconut rice things were good.

Seating is spacious. I like that they don't cram diners into the row of booth seating.

Address: 1392 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5V 3E4 Canada
Review: The food is truly impressive, and I am not a vegetarian. Not even close! We tried a variety of offerings and none of them disappointed! If I dined alone, I will start with the Diakon Cakes and have Desert Island Noodles as the main. I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant.

Address: 1392 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5V 3E4 Canada
Review: It's a Vietnamese restaurant specializing in vegetarian food (the meaning of the restaurant name Do Chay). We had the vegetarian pho, banh khot (mini pancakes) and banh tieu (fried bread) which was stuff with cooked young jackfruit. The pho was pretty good and the mini pancakes were very rich in coconut cream, a bit too much for my taste. The banh tieu was ok, kinda bland to me although my aunt really liked it. I applaud the creativity.

Address: 12 Water Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1A5 Canada
Review: Their butter chikken was pretty good, but I didn’t really like the salad come with it. Mine friend got burger with fries and she enjoyed it. The portion is perfect, not too big so I can finish everything. I would come back to try other dishes

Address: 12 Water Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1A5 Canada
Review: Loved it! I’m not vegan or vegetarian lover and didn’t even knew its vegan place before visiting. We ordered sweet spicy cauliflower, Thai noodly and burger! Everything tasted great! If you are not found of sweet noodle, skip the thai noodles. It was good but had sweet taste! Also, their ginger elixir is must have in cold weather! Besides that, service and ambience is top notch. Give it a try and you will like it as much as I did :)

Address: 12 Water Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1A5 Canada
Review:
Nice vibe in the restaurant. Trendy music and modern urban decoration is exactly where you want to come for a drink with friend or date night.

I ordered fresh soup with sundries tomato ( daily soup is different), cheesy pesto spinach dip, and Thai noodle with tofu and veges. I would definitely come again. Warm welcome and great service.

Address: 12 Water Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1A5 Canada
Review:
We went to Gastown location. We are a vegetarian family and look for options when we visit places. My daughter found this and I am so glad she did. We had brunch - steak tostadas, waffles, sunshine benny and gnocchi. All the items were delicious and drinks were very refreshing too. Not often you find so much variety and good quality vegetarian/vegan food. Our server Astrid (think) was very friendly too.
Highly recommended!!

Address: 12 Water Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1A5 Canada
Review:
The location is super appealing, outdoor seating in like a covered courtyard kinda. I'm not vegan, but it makes it easy to find things for my partner and this place by far blew other locations we ate at in the area out of the water.

Don't knock vegan food until you try it!

Address: 1517 Anderson St Vancouver, BC V6H Canada
Review:
Our server was fantastic - Gabrielle.
The reception lady was rather indifferent.

Nice atmosphere.  Do sit outside on a Sunday day. Feel the vibes. They get happy hour - limited choices on selected drink and food.

Order some oysters - quite small in size but sweet

Address: 1517 Anderson St Vancouver, BC V6H Canada
Review: It’s my first time dinning in here.  Our server, Brenna, was quick and attentive.  Food tasted great.  Drinks tasted great.  My son and I enjoyed our time together.  The only dissatisfaction I have was the portion size.  It was on the smaller size for the price I paid.

Address: 1517 Anderson St Vancouver, BC V6H Canada
Review:
A swish yet casual restaurant next to a marina. It was a good choice for chilling out with friends on the patio while catching the early evening sun. (There are blinds to shade you if it's in your eyes!)

The fish and chips were excellent with top notch presentation and taste. A friend had a dozen oysters and was pleased with them.

It was quite busy and that gave the restaurant a buzzy atmosphere, helped along by the happy hour drinks.

Service was quick, efficient and formulaic.

Overall,  a very nice way to spend a couple of hours in the evening.

Address: 1517 Anderson St Vancouver, BC V6H Canada
Review: The service was very good. Our server was great !  Attention to detail. The food was delicious.  Oysters were okay. Halibut was very moist. My seafood linguine was fair.  Overall, it was a nice dining experience.

Address: 1517 Anderson St Vancouver, BC V6H Canada
Review:
Went there after a few years. Has a nice patio with good service. Everything tasted fine. Scallops were a bit over priced. $42 for a dish with 5 scallops.
Happy hour beer and wine is a great deal.

Address: 820 Burrard St Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X9 Canada
Review:
We stopped by JOEY Burrard for a quick bite to eat on a Sunday. We were seated on the patio right away.
We ordered an Ahi Tuna Club (Salmon substitute) and a lettuce wrap with Chicken. The salmon club was pretty good.
So was the lettuce wrap. However, there was no peanuts in the mix for the lettuce wrap. Not even one.
Service was amazing. I wish I had asked our server’s name. He was attentive, helpful and professional.

Address: 820 Burrard St Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X9 Canada
Review: One of favorite places to come for celebration dinners and we've been to most of their locations in the Lower Mainland.  Our menu favorites include: the sliders for the starters menu, chicken katsu salad, and the lava cake.  A really nice touch was that when starters or desserts were ordered to share between 2, they plated the portions separately. Best for small groups of 4-6.  Although we made our recent reservation well in advance & confirmed details over the phone several times, our party of 9 was seated at a booth which seats 4-5 comfortably with a table pushed up to it for 3 more. Only when paying the bill was I informed by our server there's another space by the wine bar groups can request.

Address: 820 Burrard St Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X9 Canada
Review: Nice presentation and tasty food beside relaxing place for a afternoon chitchat.. love my drink. The tofu wrap was incredible although was difficult to manage hahahah.. our server was nice and made ever minute more enjoyable ( if I m not mistaken, her name was Brook)

Address: 820 Burrard St Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X9 Canada
Review:
This was our first time here and it was amazing!  We started off with a crunchy potato roll that the waiter recommended, and it was delicious and unique.

I got the steak & sushi dish - the steak was so tendy and flavorful, and the sushi was delicious.  My husband got the steak frites, and loved the steak and entire dish.

The waiter was also very friendly, the atmosphere was cozy, and the prices were fair.  We had no complaints and would definitely recommend this place!

Address: 820 Burrard St Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X9 Canada
Review: I'm not a fan of chain restaurants however Joey is the exception.  I'd never been to this restaurant.  I was not disappointed... fabulous food (I had the Mediterranean bowl), exceptional service and a cozy booth.  My other 3 friends loved their meals too.  The Joey 75 champagne cocktail was so good I took a picture of the ingredients to replicate it at home. Thanks Joey!

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review: I ordered a Flat White and it was the best coffee I’ve had so far. The food is tasty and the raspberry tart is nice. Staff are so friendly. The cafe is small but it still could cater for around 14 people. It’s a very nice place to have a lunch and coffee in a cozy afternoon.

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review:
Today I visited them for the 4th time since they had opened the place, and was quite disappointed with the menu and taste. They used to have smoked salmon with scrambled egg, croque madame, french toast, .. but none of those existed on the menu this time.
We got the fig and prosciutto, and the eggs Benedict with bacon. Both had basic taste. The fig and parma ham definitely needed a sauce to tie them together. The poached egg was broken.
Also, you would see these comments in the store and on the menu a lot “Politely decline to warm pastries”, “politely decline to  make any changes to the menu item”, “politely decline to let you seat anywhere if you only order drinks and pastries”. They won’t even replace fried egg on the menu with scrambled eggs.
I get that the chef probably takes a lot of pride in designing and changing the menu often but if they continue doing so and removing their popular item, they will be closing in a few years.
Outside area only has one umbrella and the photos I’ve attached show how empty the place is at around 1pm on a Saturday!
I remember that you used to wait for sometime to get a table in the past, but the degradation in food quality has caused the place to be quite empty.

Their pastries are still good. We had the fig danish and it was delicious.

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review: The brunch here is exceptional. Without a doubt, the hollandaise sauce is the finest I've ever tasted. The ambiance is simply delightful, reminiscent of the beautiful southern region of France. Furthermore, the staff are incredibly kind and hospitable. If you're in Vancouver, you simply must come here. This is a charming location to enjoy Sunday brunch. The quality of the ingredients is excellent, and the washroom is beautifully designed. Despite the focus on French cuisine, there are also vegan choices available.

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review:
Mon Pitou is perfection. The ambience is so carefully thought out and fun, the coffee is spectacular and full of flavor, and the food is outstanding! You really can’t ask for more, Vancouver is lucky to have a French cafe of this quality.

I got the ham and cheese danish and a cortado and couldn’t have been more pleased. Can’t wait to come back to try more things. The music and atmosphere is so relaxing 🙏🏽 🇫🇷

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review: The food is always fantastic, and the staff are so great. My husband and I often stop by for their breakfast sandwiches, but their actual brunch is really good. Pricey, but all brunch places are getting to be pricier these days, so it isn't really surprising or unexpected.  My only complaint is that it feels a bit cramped when it gets busy, but it can't be helped given the constraints of the location.

Address: 801 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6C 1P7 Canada
Review: We ordered the 3-course lunch menu. Extremely small portion which reflects on price. Elegant presentation. Delicate taste. Attentive service. Overall a good place for business networking lunch or friends get together. Will likely visit again.

Address: 801 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6C 1P7 Canada
Review: Food was amazing, service was great as well. Although my table wasn't ready and had to wait at the lounge for about 10 -15 minutes, not a big deal. What bothered me was the atmosphere and ambiance of the restaurant. It was loud, noisy, huge table of 10+ sitting by tables of 2s. Last time I was here was more than 8 years ago but I remembered it as more intimate/romantice atmosphere. But nonetheless, food was delicious!

Address: 801 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6C 1P7 Canada
Review:
I always have a great time here. Food tasted delicious as usual. Drinks are very yummy. Service always top notch.

The "taste of hawksworth" is a rotating 3 course menu. Delish as usual

Address: 801 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6C 1P7 Canada
Review: Hawksworth Restaurant used to be one of our go-to dining establishments. It boasts a luxurious decor and is conveniently located on the ground floor of my beloved Rosewood Hotel. The prime location and impeccable service contribute to a memorable dining experience. However, it is regrettable that the menu options have become somewhat conventional and lack innovation in recent times.

Address: 801 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6C 1P7 Canada
Review: An enjoyable experience with tasty food. Our server, Quinn, provided phenomenal service during our visit. The fried cauliflower appetizer was a delight to eat. And their flat iron steak was well presented with plenty of flavour. We'll come back in the future.

Address: 401-999 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
I was here celebrating Mother's day on the weekend.  We made the right decision to come one week before otherwise we wouldn't have been seated by the window.

The view of coal harbour and the snow topped mountains were incomparable and serene.  The ambiance and decor was also excellent.

Our server was attentive and welcoming.

We ordered the $65 pp high tea service which came with a small selection of tea.  Certain choices required additional cost. We also ordered a la cart caviar.  The variety and portions of food was perfect.  We even had left overs!

I would've given 5 stars if the tea selection was larger.

Overall I'd recommend visiting this restaurant and would definitely come back for other special occasions.

Address: 401-999 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
Five sails is one of the best fine dining places in Vancouver. Dining here will be an unforgettable event. You enjoy  the exceptional waterfront views and the beauty of sunset. The menu is exquisite with unique options of duck, several kinds of fish and steak. Every dish is unique and pairing with drinks and wine is perfect.

The staff is brilliantly charming and lovely. We had our server who is a student at UBC doing her masters! You cannot find this kind of experienced and professional staff anywhere else. We were offered an experience of Devil's Coffee,only two people know how to make it and one of them is here at Five Sails. Check out the video of how he makes coffee that you have never heard of or tried before. Will cherish this coffee taste forever.

10 out of 10 for this fine dining place  for experience, staff and unique menu.

Address: 401-999 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: We went to Five Sails to celebrate our 3rd year anniversary. Our table was ready as soon as we arrived and the hostess accommodated my reservation requests and gave us a great table with the most amazing view of the harbour. Shawn was our Waiter who was very friendly and attentive all evening. Shawn went above and beyond to make sure we both had a memorable anniversary. They surprised us at the end with a happy anniversary dessert. I would highly recommend Five Sails!

Address: 401-999 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: Had a birthday celebration and opted for the Dine Out Vancouver 2023 menu and it was fantastic! The view was spectacular. The ambience at lunch was sophisticated and relaxing. The entire service team was top notch. The food was amazing- flavour, texture, presentation was done to perfection. It was such a happy experience and Five Sails topped it off with a complimentary birthday honey cake that was so delicious and cute. Thank you for the great time. We will be back!

Address: 401-999 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
We went to Five Sails for dinner. First time at Five Sails. My girlfriend has a number of food allergies and the restaurant was very very very accommodating! Food was great, atmosphere was very pleasant.
Best of all was our server, Raymond. He was incredibly attentive and a gentleman! He was literally the best server I've ever had to deal with in Vancouver!!
We both really enjoyed the restaurant! We will definitely go back again.

Address: G3-888 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H1 Canada
Review: I've heard amazing things about this place and I'm happy I was able to expect it myself. The service was excellent. I have a food intolerance and the servers handled it so well making sure to tell us which plates I needed to avoid. The food was really tasty. I liked how clean the restaurant is considering each table has its own grill built in.
