That grill definitely gets hot so make sure you're dressed in something short sleeve or you'll be sweating up a storm 😅. I'll dine here again for sure, thank you!

Address: G3-888 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H1 Canada
Review:
The restaurant's ambience is inviting and offers an unparalleled dining experience. With a contemporary Japanese aesthetic, its a truly nice place to dine.

The quality of the meats, whether flavorful beef, marinated chicken or seasoned seafood are exceptional. The DIY cooking approach adds a unique interactive touch, making the experience fun.

Their vegetarian options and variety of side dishes are really great; Garlic Spinach, steamed broccoli, mushrooms, spicy cabbage salad and more..

The staff were attentive, and so helpful, but I had an expert with me, who made the experience more tasty! 😋
They helped us with the grill on the spot, changed the surface from time to time, they’re amazing!!

Address: G3-888 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H1 Canada
Review: First time there & will be returning.  Very friendly & efficient staff who welcome all the guests as they walk to their table. Clean tables & grills. They change the grill part way through the meal. We had the Value Course and it was enough for the 2 of us. Meats are fresh and bright. Vegetables are fresh and crisp.  Rice is a good consistency and each person gets their own bowl. Salad was fresh and crisp. I would like the large leafs cut smaller, but it stays crisper with the big leafs. Tasty dressing.  They gave us complimentary ice cream with delicious chocolate sauce for being 1st time guests. Overall, anexcellent experience!

Address: G3-888 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H1 Canada
Review:
The food was great. The marinated meats were full of flavour without the need for the sauces but were a bit too salty for us. I liked the enoki mushroom and garlic mushroom more than the assorted vegetables which were plain except the corn.

The service was decent. The server constantly walked by. She liked to adjust the heat setting on our grill, but after most of the first batch of pork belly went burnt in the first two minutes (the Grill Guide said 3-5 minutes), we would re-adjust the heat after she left. I understand that the suggestion of longer cooking times is to prevent food borne illnesses.

The kitchen and the rest of the restaurant were playing different music. We could hear both from where we sat, it was noisy and eventually got annoying, even if I liked both music tracks. For example, the kitchen was playing Bruno Mars’s “Locked Out of Heaven” while the other side was playing Whitney Houston’s “I Will Always Love You.”

All in all, I liked the food and our server’s attitude and attentiveness but not so much the ambiance and the indoor dining environment. They do have an outdoor eating area.

Address: G3-888 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H1 Canada
Review: The food and service are fantastic here! The portions are big and the quality of the meat is amazing - it’s such great value especially if you go during happy hour! I recommend the kalbi beef and toro beef, as well as the garlic noodles and cold tofu with kimchi.

Address: 108 Cambie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8 Canada
Review:
While visiting Vancouver in 2018, we stopped at the corner of Water Street & Cambie and the Gastown Steam Clock. After taking some of the usual tourist photos & waiting for the steam to blow the whistle, we found our way to the Black Frog Eatery. Settling in at 1 pm we were warmly welcomed and quickly seated. From our table we had an excellent view of the Steam Clock. I watched tourists posing with the clock as we awaited our order.

We weren’t very hungry and decided to share a club sandwich.  I’m happy to say that it was made with real meat—none of that sliced processed poultry!  The fries were good too, and I washed it all down with a local award-winning Kokanee lager.

The ambiance of the Black Frog is definitely that of a pub-style eatery and the decor accentuates that feel.  That’s a good thing, and to me, very comforting. Lot’s of wood, brick, and pub-style elements all around. This is absolutely the type of place I’d have lunch at if I’d worked in the area.  Their menu has a good selection to satisfy everyone’s tastes. Prices are on par with other restaurants offering similar fare.  The type of place that I call “no nonsense and basic good eating”. Service was prompt, efficient, and the staff knew their menu well. When we find our way back to Vancouver, I will certainly plan on coming back.

Address: 108 Cambie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8 Canada
Review:
Delicious food with reasonable price and excellent customer service! I would recommend trying their buffalo cauliflower. I don’t drink so didn’t check out their beverage menu.
You can have steam clock view from patio.

Address: 108 Cambie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8 Canada
Review: Amazing spot! Great owner, great people. The food is wonderful and beers are flowin’ just right. Make sure to stop in and get the poutine and “Creepy Uncle Dunkle”. I love this place. Right by the steam clock too!

Address: 108 Cambie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8 Canada
Review: A cute spot right near the Steamclock! Reasonably priced but mediocre food. Staff was nice and friendly and the atmosphere was cool and welcoming! Enjoyed what we ordered but nothing to write home about. A good spot for a quick meal.

Address: 108 Cambie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8 Canada
Review: Wow, found the Black Frog, tucked away behind the steam clock in Gas town after a stop at a few other establishments, with 10 hours to kill waiting for a flight….  Amazing staff and customer service and a great atmosphere with all the right options on the drink and food menu!    Thanks to the owner and the great staff (Nemo, Sally and Taylor) for making me feel welcome from the start.  I only wish I found it earlier, it would have saved me on my quest for a super cool place to hang and waste away an afternoon in Vancouver.   I WILL be back!!

Address: 580 West Pender Downtown Vancouver, BC V6B 1W7 Canada
Review: Place is very accommodating. Good happy hour menu(daily fr 3-6pm). Hey Buckaroo is a refreshing drinks, fried chicken poutine is another good appie, and red wine is OKV $6.50 for 6oz. Good deal for drinks and appetizer. Service is very nice!!! Place is clean and very trendy and very relaxing! Music  and lighting is very chillaxing! Will be my to go to for chillin!

Address: 580 West Pender Downtown Vancouver, BC V6B 1W7 Canada
Review: Stopped by this place for dinner with a few friends and thoroughly enjoyed our time here. The food was really delicious and the staff were quite wonderful

Address: 580 West Pender Downtown Vancouver, BC V6B 1W7 Canada
Review: The customer service was super slow. Our server seemed like she was in a bad mood. The food took too long to arrive even though it wasn’t busy at all. I had to go to the front desk to ask for the bill after waiting for half an hour because our server kept ignoring us. Won’t be coming back. Food was good but the dessert tasted so bad.

Address: 580 West Pender Downtown Vancouver, BC V6B 1W7 Canada
Review:
The beer list is long and accessible by a QR code on the menu - it's extensive and a bit daunting, but the waiter was very helpful when I told him what I *dont* like.

Ahi tuna salad is great - good tuna that has been (just) cooked to perfection.

Address: 580 West Pender Downtown Vancouver, BC V6B 1W7 Canada
Review: I had tacos, they were spicy! Very delicious though.  My Brother had potato skins and Caesar salad, he enjoyed both. My sister in law had the beef dip and said it was delicious.

Address: 938 Helmcken Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S5 Canada
Review:
I was very excited to try this place! As many of you know, they have a strong social media marketing team showing off their delicious noodles and soups.

I had the Tom Yum seafood noodles (pictured below), and the price came out to $27.77 including a 15% tip. The flavor was certainly above average, and the waitstaff was very friendly and accommodating! I would say value is a bit of a weakness here, as the meal was rather light and I noticed the soup in the bowls were not filled all the way (might seem like a small thing, but it felt like the soup proportion was off throughout the meal).

Tip: If you don’t know your noodles, ask the waitstaff! They have you customize your noodles for almost all the soup options, but some noodles are more suitable than others for certain types of broth.

Overall, solid 4 stars- not the best, but certainly good.

Address: 938 Helmcken Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S5 Canada
Review: Wow! What a lovely discovery this place is. I enjoyed my Khai Soi Chicken so much I could have licked the bowl! So tasty. We got there in the nick of time because as we were leaving there was a small line up waiting to get in to the cozy restaurant.

Address: 938 Helmcken Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S5 Canada
Review:
Awesome place for a bowl of noodles. Wish we had a fat mao in Toronto! I ordered the braised beef bowl which was delicious. Our table also got the tuna ceviche and the roti curry appetizer which were both very good.

All four of us were very happy with our meals. The wonton egg noodles are really good here. I will say this restaurant is definitely more on the pricey side, as just a bowl of noodles is $23. But it was very good.

It is also a little bit of a smaller restaurant, not really the most accommodating for larger groups. Would recommend it for pairs though.

Address: 938 Helmcken Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S5 Canada
Review: stopped by this place for dinner with friends .We ordered Tom Yum Goong , Khao soi chicken curry,Thai Ice tea and Roti with curry. The food was ok but for the price of small portions,  they are kinda over priced . The Thai ice tea is plain , not recommended.

Address: 938 Helmcken Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S5 Canada
Review:
This is absolutely an authentic place for Thai noodles. At first, my Thai boyfriend was shocked to know they serve Thai food here, because it seemed to be more of a Chinese restaurant from the outside look. Interior decor was on point, perfect with the giant mirror, but the light was pretty weak to have a good picture here. The space is kind of small, not that many tables so if you come at lunch or dinner time, you might have to wait in a line. Last time when we came, we waited for around 15 minutes, but the food was worth it.
We ordered “Khao Soi” and “Braised Beef Noodles”. “Khao Soi” was well seasoned, creamy and savory, sweet enough. “Braised Beef Noodles” tasted okay but not that impressive as I expected.
Service was great, most of the servers were Thai, they had great English. I like their welcoming and helpful attitude.
My boyfriend is really picky towards Thai food but he totally approved this place.
However, the price is a bit high, I feel like it is a bit overpriced.
Worth a comeback.

Address: 217 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z6 Canada
Review:
I visited Fat Mao today and was pleased with my experience.

We started off with the Roti and the Mapo Tofu and both dishes were BANGERS! Then I slurped down the Hot and Sour pork bowl with Shanghai noodles and it was perfect
I am very happy with my experience and totally look forward to visiting again.
Star of the show might have been the $5 Roti, sooooo good!

Address: 217 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z6 Canada
Review:
Come hungry but don't wear white! Amazing food with even better portion sizes.

Staff are extremely friendly and even gave me a tide stain stick when I couldn't keep the food off my shirt.

If you're a tourist in China Town it's a definite must stop

Address: 217 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z6 Canada
Review: Fat Mao Noodles, nestled in the heart of Chinatown, Vancouver, is an unmissable culinary gem. The star of my recent visit was undoubtedly their signature chicken noodles, accompanied with thick, luscious Shanghai wide noodles. The broth was a symphony of flavors, masterfully balanced and seasoned, leaving a rich and savory imprint on the palate. Its taste was enveloping and satisfying, a testament to Fat Mao's nuanced understanding of noodle artistry. Equally impressive was the Thousand Year Egg appetiser; a dish that was fascinatingly complex and yet, astoundingly straightforward. Its texture, the harmony of flavors, everything was an elegant dance that added depth to the overall culinary narrative. The exceptional service was the icing on the cake, making the dining experience as delightful as the food itself. Fat Mao Noodles unquestionably excels in delivering an authentic and satisfying noodle experience that is worth every moment spent there. This is a destination that proves time and again, the transformative power of food when crafted with precision and passion. Highly recommended.

Address: 217 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z6 Canada
Review: Small hole-in-the-wall shop with fast and friendly service. I made the mistake of snacking before coming here, thinking I'd be fine and it wouldn't be that much food anyways. WRONG! Come here hungry! The food is packed with flavor and is served fresh. Seating is pretty limited so be careful if you have a big party or if you see that it's super busy. I feel bad because I couldn't finish my food nor take it to go since my lodging doesn't have a place for me to store it. I need to come here once more before I fly back home, for sure!

Address: 217 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z6 Canada
Review:
5/5 service - our server very friendly, never let us run out of water, and took the time to tell us all about their dishes and the history of the restaurant.

5/5 food - we ordered the Spicy Boat Noodles. Quite spicy but not to the point where it takes away from the flavour. Like I said, it’s all about the broth. It’s phenomenal.

3.5/5 vibe - not really coming here for the vibe though. You’re coming here to get a masterfully well balanced bowl of noodles.

Address: 903 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L Canada
Review: I tried the soup and it had a great balance of sourness and spiciness. The pork in the was tender and juicy, and the soup portion size was a little small for my liking. The sauce had a bit of a kick, which some people may find too spicy, but I thought it added a nice flavor to the dish. The fried rice was also good, but I found the sauce to be a little too salty. Overall, I recommend pairing the meal with some water or tea to balance out the flavors.

Address: 903 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L Canada
Review: Kin Kao offers a modern and inviting atmosphere where you can indulge in a remarkable culinary experience. Their menu features standout dishes such as the flavorful Pad See Ew, refreshing Papaya Salad, succulent Pork Neck, and an array of delicious stir-fried options. Each dish is prepared with care and expertise, showcasing a harmonious blend of flavors and high-quality ingredients. From the moment you step into Kin Kao, you are transported to a world of delectable Thai cuisine, leaving you craving more of their exceptional offerings.

Address: 903 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L Canada
Review: There are two restaurants. Kin Kao Song on Commercial Drive is the test kitchen and seating is first-come-first-serve. Song on Broadway is the one that requires reservations. I had initially made a mistake by making the reservation at Song (which I thought was Kin Kao). After checking the menu one day prior to the actual meal, I realized that Song did not have some of the menu items I had intended to try. Fortunately, I was able to cancel my reservation in time. We were the first to arrive at Kin Kao on Commercial drive – just to make sure we can get a table. Since I have garlic allergies, there were only specific items we can order. We were able to request no garlic for the Green Papaya Salad. The Chicken Satay does not have garlic in the ingredients. We really wanted fish instead of beef, so, we selected Grilled Fish even though it was marinated with garlic. For carbs, we ordered sticky rice. The Green Papaya was very aggressive. I had a hard time finishing this dish as the dressing was so strong. I did not enjoy the 'fight'. The chicken satay was very tender. We both liked the texture of the grilled fish and did not detect the garlic. Emboldened by that, I ordered a small portion of chicken wings as I was really craving it plus I am not a chicken breast person. That was a mistake. Although the flavour of the chicken wings was interesting, I liked the crispiness and the fact that it was not flour-dipped, the garlic left a disgustingly strong taste in my mouth that I had to live with all night. Although I cold have used some chocolate ice cream to remove the flavour, I did not trust my body to be able to endure the garlic, so we rushed home without stopping for chocolate ice cream. We really enjoyed the sticky rice though. Overall, this place has a more interesting menu than most of the Thai place we've been to. The execution was more creative and fusion. Next time though, I will be sure to selecting items that we not marinated in garlic.

Address: 903 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L Canada
Review:
Enjoyed a fantastic meal at Kin Kao.  One of the most authentic and best Thai restaurants in Vancouver. The quality of the food is beyond our expectations.  It always spicy umami and delightful flavours.

Portion wise the restaurant was vaso ery generous  tnbend to wife.  Service impeccable. We ordered a spread of green papaya salad, pork jowl skewers, chicken satay, Thai crispy pork belly, drunken noodles, Thai red curry, Thai fermented sausage and iconic mango sticky rice. We were so stuff after the meal.

Address: 903 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L Canada
Review:
cozy spot, really enjoyed the papaya salad and the satay, as well as the pad see ew.

would love to come back and try the cocktails next time!

Address: 88 W Pender Street Unit 1005 Vancouver, BC V6B 6N8 Canada
Review:
Great food, great service.
Amazing options for vegans.
We took vegan lasagna and vegan burrito, it was very tasty

Address: 88 W Pender Street Unit 1005 Vancouver, BC V6B 6N8 Canada
Review: I've been waiting to try this place for months and it didn't disappoint! So many gluten free, keto options! I couldn't pick just one! Super chill staff! Can't wait to explore the savory dishes! Must try this place!!

Address: 88 W Pender Street Unit 1005 Vancouver, BC V6B 6N8 Canada
Review: We have been coming here for years. Always refreshing with quality ingredients. The owners are genuinely nice people and their staff too. Thankful for this healthy eating gem.

Address: 88 W Pender Street Unit 1005 Vancouver, BC V6B 6N8 Canada
Review:
We ordered 4 dishes:
1) ordered the beet salad which had a picture that showed mostly beets with some cheese and lettuce. However, the item I received was a lot of lettuce with a small amount of beets. The taste was fairly bland. I would rate the salad a 6-7 out of 10.

2) My 8 year old order the personal pizza. The cheese and sauce was delicious but the crust was very different and not good.

3) My husband ordered the Butter Chicken. It was a large amount of food but the taste was average. He rated it an 8 out of 10.

4) My 15 year ordered the Hamburger and loved it. She gave it a 9 out of 10.

It wasn’t too busy on a Sunday afternoon and we found a place to sit inside with no problem. However, it’s not the nicest place in terms of decor and vibe.

Address: 88 W Pender Street Unit 1005 Vancouver, BC V6B 6N8 Canada
Review:
This place left a very good impression on me. At first, I thought it was just a keto restaurant, but there are also non-keto options and plenty of choices for vegan and GF diets. I don't follow any of these diets, but the person taking my order made sure that I was aware of everything in my order in case I needed to know. He was super friendly! I went back and forth on whether I wanted hummus in my platter and apologized for being indecisive, and he just laughed it off with me.
I had a Tandoori Jackfruit Feast Platter. The feast platters are very customizable: you can choose your protein, sauces, type of rice (basmati or cauliflower), the veggies you want in your salad, and if you want to add any hummus and/or tzatziki dip. I was super happy with the platter I built! The tandoori sauce was as flavourful as I hoped for (and pretty spicy, but that might've just been the jalapeños I added) and the cooling tzatziki went really well with it. It was also very filling!
For dessert, I tried the Keto New York Cheesecake. Mixed experience with this. The cheesecake had a very light texture similar to some no-bake cheesecakes, but with the full-bodied tangy flavour of a baked cheesecake, and I really liked how unique it was. But I think it was frozen in the middle and the biscuit crust was a little dry in a freezer-burnt way. There was a dollop of what looked like whipped cream on top but tasted like and had the thickness of butter, which I had to discard because it was too rich for me and didn’t have any flavour to contribute.
I asked about decaf coffee/espresso when I ordered, and they don’t carry it, but tea was suggested as an alternative, so I ordered a green tea. The bag wasn’t labelled but it tasted like a sencha which is one of my favourites.
Order and pay at the counter and the food is brought to your table. Space is a little tight in the cafe but it’s kind of cozy and I found the atmosphere to be welcoming.

Address: 1118 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N1 Canada
Review: super respectful and friendly staff, food is pretty good not the best Mexican food I had tho. 3 stars is mainly for the price, 6 tacos and a soup ended up being 50 bucks. that’s not great value for a in-and-out place.

Address: 1118 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N1 Canada
Review:
Visiting from Winnipeg & first time
at this taqueria. To be honest….It was okay, I wish they put cilantro and onions to enhance flavours and provided hot sauce, salsa verde etc. Tacos were bland and small. 4 small tacos for $15 was kinda steep. In Winnipeg we can get 3 tacos for $5-$7 and even 3 quesadillas for $8 at BMC Taqueria.

Address: 1118 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N1 Canada
Review: The shop itself is basic but I got tacos al pastor and they were amazing. The tortillas were smaller but they were doubled up and didn’t rip which is very important for me. There were too many fillings for these smaller tortillas but picking at the fallen fillings afterwards was a second meal in itself!

Address: 1118 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N1 Canada
Review: Great vibe and amazing food that came so quick! The perfect lil place on Davie street! 🌮🏳️‍🌈

Address: 1118 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N1 Canada
Review: Staff was great, service was fast, food was delicious. The kids enjoyed the cheese quesadilla (it was huge). We all devoured our tacos. The lengua (beef tongue) was my favourite, it was so flavourful. My husbands favourite was the Chicken Pastor, the onions, cilantro and sauce make for the perfect bite. The meal for the 5 of us came to just over $70.  We all left very full.  We love the location as well, you get to sit inside and people watch or sit at their outside street patio. Now that it is summer they should add some umbrellas to their outdoor seating to make it more comfortable under the sun.  It is definitely our favourite new restaurant in our neighbourhood.

Address: 1551 West 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1S1 Canada
Review: Absolutely delicious food. Everything we tried was amazing. Mussels and frites, asparagus-vegetable soup, salmon omelette and the baguette is fresh. Service was attentive and professional. Highly recommend.

Address: 1551 West 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1S1 Canada
Review: The real deal!! Authentic fresh french food!! I had a great experience. It felt like traveling to France without the airfare expense. Attentive and friendly service. The escargots were the best ones I ever had. Even the French fries are made in house. The wine by the glass is spot on what I need. Bon appetit 🥂

Address: 1551 West 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1S1 Canada
Review: We came here on a sunny, warm Saturday afternoon for brunch. This is our favourite French restaurant in town. The service and food was excellent as it always was! We had spinach and crab benny, croissant benny with lobster meat, and mussels with fries.

Address: 1551 West 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1S1 Canada
Review: I finally found my type of French restaurant!  There is more creativity and quality in the food than in some fine French restaurants. I liked the French atmosphere as well. The servers were friendly and helpful.

Address: 1551 West 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1S1 Canada
Review: Ordered a set dinner consisting of a salad, seafood trio with salmon, halibut and scallops and cheese cake dessert plus a regular order of mussels and escargots. The regular size of mussels was more than the two of us could finish and tasted fresh whereas the escargot was disappointing as it tasted same as the ones from a can. Received excellent service from our Japanese waitress.

Address: 3416 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6R 2B3 Canada
Review: I usually go to the Lougheed location and this is the first time I came to Kitsilano. The restaurant is small so the wait is long to get seated, to order and to get food. Service is not the best as they seemed under staffed because we were out of water but there was no refill several times. Food was delicious when it arrived, just hopefully not after almost 30min of ordering next time.

Address: 3416 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6R 2B3 Canada
Review: We ordered some from delivery before, this time was our first time to have Oshi at their restaurant. This time the sushi rice was not as good as what we expected even the flavor was really good. Except that everything was perfect and all servers there were friendly and helpful.

Address: 3416 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6R 2B3 Canada
Review: Small but comfortable setting, clean, great staff (ask for James!). Food is AWESOME…authentic Japanese cuisine. Try the snapper tempura (comes with delicious greens). Fresh sushi, and best aburis in town. You will not be disappointed and also get your value for money!

Address: 3416 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6R 2B3 Canada
Review: We got 4 rolls and sashimi. The scallop and salmon rolls were great, solid aburi rolls. If you’re looking for a solid veggie option, the eggplant roll was great. Food is definitely a little expensive, as it was over $100 including tip for two people to dine.

Address: 3416 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6R 2B3 Canada
Review: This was really good! The sushi was not what I was expecting, but it was scrumptious! Before this, I’d never had Oshi style sushi, and I was pleasantly surprised! It was very different than what I’ve had before at local sushi restaurants, but it was great! I especially loved the Crispy Roll. We got the Green Leaf-Amily For 3 Combo and it was super tasty! The miso soup was perfect as well - not too salty. Overall great place! 😊

Address: 4328 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: Came here from Ontario for the first time and let me tell you this place was amazing. From the service to the food to the atmosphere it was amazing. Special thanks to one of the chefs Ian for recommending some pretty incredible eats. Will definitely be back.

Address: 4328 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review:
We ordered beef and Arctic Char as entrée, and caramelized onion tart and Halloumi French Toast as starters. Absolutely fantastic food.
We finished everything on the plates and were way too full to have deserts.

Address: 4328 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review:
Came here tonight , highly recommend you make reservations so that you have a table when you arrive. We ordered the duck and lamp mains , I can confidently say we were impressed with the quality of food.

One thing that was a bit odd was that the staff came over and said they need the table in the next 1.5 hours. Not a big deal but the food came out slow , by the time it arrived we only had 45 min to eat . I didn't really enjoy the feeling of being rushed to eat and leave . Other than that the food and drinks was good.

Address: 4328 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: Do not miss out on the halloumi French toast, crab fried rice and cannelloni. Fast efficient super friendly service.

Address: 4328 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: I would begin by saying that the experience is mind-blowing. The soup of the day, and not to mention the French toast which was my favourite, immediately raised our expectations for the rest of the meals. The seared scallop was delicious and light. I like how the rice that came with it has a lot of veggies and a spark of spiciness and juiciness when bit into. The pork belly was cooked so well that it was crispy and the fat just melted in my mouth like a dream. It will take too long to describe every dish but every dish didn’t disappoint and this is the type of food that you could feel the chef’s ingenuity and creativity. We were really pleased. It is a rather small restaurant but definitely a hidden gem.

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review: I visited this restaurant several times already and I really like the food and drinks they serve, and the service provided in this place. The interior is very modern and nice. So if you are interested to taste a Ukrainian food prepared with some modern flavour then this is one of the best places to go in Vancouver.  You can also purchase some very nice bread and home made cookies there as well!

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review:
This is the perfect place to go to have a nice dinner with friends! The restaurant is busy but not too full (reservations available), the staff are quite friendly, the food is very pleasant and the atmosphere is comfortable.

We had the chicken kyiv and cabbage rolls (the rolls were juicy and stoodout most).

The real showstopper was the bakery! So fresh and delicious. We really enjoyed the double chocolate chip cookie, the pistachio chocolate chip cookie and the BABKA dark chocolate slice. Absolutely delightful. We will get the full babka loaf for a family special occasion!

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review: Delicious food and very attentive employees. My family and I had a wonderful experience trying the diffrent Ukrainian foods they had to offer. I would totally recommend the beet salad and the mushroom & chicken crepes. Overall it was a great experience.

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review:
A fantastic restaurant, genuine European food. Good selection of beers and wine fantastic cocktails.  They have a bakery onsite and delicious cakes.

Great area with Irish pubs and bars nearby. And a very stylish interior.

Highly recommended  I visited twice!

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review:
The food was extremely delicious. We usually make Gulash at home, but always wanted to try Borsch and it was fantastic.

Rita, our waitress, was very nice and attentive. Service was excellent and fast.

The desserts are to die for.

You must try it. You won't be dissapointed

Address: 1130 West pender st Vancouver, BC V6E 4A4 Canada
Review:
Small place for Indian food. 3 mins walk from Marriott pinnacle downtown. Nice little buffer and a LA carte is available.
We tried out Aloo samosa and Chai. Enjoyed it. Ample seating area.

Address: 1130 West pender st Vancouver, BC V6E 4A4 Canada
Review:
I recently dined at Indian Delicacy Restaurant, conveniently located near Pinnacle Harbourfront Vancouver. I was in the mood for some flavorful and authentic Indian cuisine, and this restaurant did not disappoint.

The menu at Indian Delicacy Restaurant offers a wide range of dishes, including vegetarian and non-vegetarian options.

Overall, I would recommend Indian Delicacy Restaurant to anyone looking for tasty and authentic Indian cuisine in Vancouver. The food is excellent, the service is friendly, and the location near the Pinnacle Harbourfront Vancouver makes it a convenient spot for visitors to the city. Thank you to the staff for a great dining experience.

Address: 1130 West pender st Vancouver, BC V6E 4A4 Canada
Review:
I spent the day in downtown Vancouver and was happy to find this restaurant hidden away from the Main Street down a narrow path at the side is a hi rise. People please if you like Indian , please , please go here . It’s delicious.I’d travel 17 hrs all the way From Saskatchewan again to taste more of the items on their menu. We were there for lunch and needed to be in and out so had the buffet. Standard dishes as in most restaurants, but they come out on top for quality and taste .and one one more thing that no other restaurant in down town Vancouver can touch. And that was the price 20$ lunch buffet . Can you imagine that . Think about it people average parking lot in downtown Van is 16-25$ for the time you need to run around and do your business. Value for your cash is definitely there. Go enjoy you won’t be disappointed, except you picky people. You can’t be helped lol
Leonardo S. Saskatoon Sk

Address: 1130 West pender st Vancouver, BC V6E 4A4 Canada
Review: It is our second day here of eating out. Their food is appetizing and staff is welcoming. They were working really hard making sure their customer’s needs are met. Love how Pushpa made us feel at home!

Address: 1130 West pender st Vancouver, BC V6E 4A4 Canada
Review:
Amazing value in the middle of downtown. It's all you can eat for $20 and they include some garlic naan, I go to taste a variety of Indian dishes.
The value was there, but quality was a little lacking. Food was a little greasy, garlic naan wasn't great, butter chicken was dry and flavour was average. The fried potatoes were good, Tandoori chicken was cooked well but also was lacking in flavour.
Everything was mild in spice, which is to be expected because everyone is taking from the same buffet tray.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: This restaurant offers stunning views of the water and city skyline. The food is absolutely delicious, with a menu that offers plenty of options to choose from. But what really sets this restaurant apart is the atmosphere - it's the perfect spot to catch up with friends over a meal and drinks. The staff are friendly and welcoming. Overall, I highly recommend checking out this restaurant for a memorable dining experience in Vancouver.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
I recently dined at Cactus Club Restaurant and wanted to share my thoughts. Although there was a delay in receiving our food, the staff was incredibly friendly and made us feel welcome throughout our visit. The restaurant itself had a great ambiance and provided a pleasant environment for our meal.
One area of improvement would be the selection of non-alcoholic drinks, which was somewhat limited. It would be nice to see a wider variety of options in that regard. On the other hand, I must commend the kitchen on the fantastic calamari. It was cooked to perfection and had a delicious flavor that left me wanting more.
However, I found the ravioli with shrimp to be a bit too sweet for my taste. While it may appeal to those who enjoy sweeter flavors, I personally would have preferred a more balanced taste.
Overall, my experience at Cactus Club Restaurant was positive, with the standout being the delightful calamari. Despite the minor setbacks, I would still recommend visiting for a friendly atmosphere and memorable dining experience.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
A very large restaurant with gorgeous views over the harbour! The staff was very kind and the food was great, though my chicken sandwich was better than the tofu bowl (which lacked sauce and was a bit dry). Really good fries! The cocktail menu was large and the cocktails themselves were very tasty, too.

While the views were lovely, the restaurant was VERY loud and it could be difficult to hear the person sitting across from you!

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: It’s not a fancy 5 star restaurant, but for what it is, it was awesome. I had salmon for dinner and it was delicious. I sat in the dining room with a water view. Most people wore sunglasses because the sun was bright and bold at 8pm at night! My waiter was awesome. I wish I remembered his name. It’s a crowed place, so make reservations early. They have outside eating and since it’s right on the water side, it’s a great place to take a stroll afterwards.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: Great food, great environment/vibe, and reasonable prices. Food was a bit slow to come out and service was somewhat lacking, but overall I really enjoyed my evening there. A reservation ahead of time will make it much easier to get seated.

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: I came here last week for happy hour. The happy hour prices are reasonable. The food was good and came out pretty quick. Staff were friendly. Half of the outside patio was closed on a hot day so we had to sit inside but overall decent experience.

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
Came here with my partner during happy hour, we were really happy with the happy hour menu. The prices were reasonable for what we ordered and the service was great! We ordered the
blackened creole chicken, it was delicious. We loved the mashed potatoes that came with it. We also got the tuna poke bowl, it was fresh and all the ingredients worked super well together. Excited to come again!

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
The food was absolutely amazing, especially the delicious Avocado salad. I tried Baja Fish Tacos for they very first time and it was a little spicy but incredibly delicious.
Everything was perfect.

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: One of the only places not short staffed. What a pleasure, the food was amazing and they couldn't do enough for us

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
First off, Nicci our server was awesome. The drinks, appys and dinner was amazing.
Thank for a nice evening to help celebrate our 29th anniversary. When making our reservations it asked if it was a special occasion l, and it was put in that it was our anniversary, so we were bit disappointed that there was no mention of it.

Address: 975 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G Canada
Review: Just walked by this cafe by chance. I dont generally love pies that much, but this was a very fun experience. we tried two different pies, one with leek and chicken, and the other was Kangaroo. I liked them both. The pastry was just done perfectly, and the stew inside was delicious. I am curious to go try more flavors!

Address: 975 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G Canada
Review: My first time trying these cute delicious mini pies! So many different and tasty flavours available, best option for brunch or small bites. Chicken mushroom and butter chicken were fabulous! Inside is clean and nice. Staff are super friendly and welcoming.

Address: 975 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G Canada
Review: We tride 4 different types of pies. It was our second time. I recommend The Hopper (kangaroo meat), Chunky Steak & Mushroom, Steak Bacon & Cheese. Butter Chicken was very spicy for us.

Address: 975 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G Canada
Review:
Hidden gem!

We tried their Rise + Shine and butter chicken pie along with flat white. It was delicious. Tried Australian pies for the first time and loved them.
Definitely a must try.

Address: 975 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G Canada
Review: Love this place! This is the only place I know of in Vancouver that does Australian food which is very cool. They have many choices for meat pies but also a few great options for vegetarians - the vegetarian Mentil Lentil pie and vegan Vegetable Medley pie (had this one at the other location but the experience at both seems consistent) are both delicious and hearty. Although the pies are premade and heated when you order, they taste fresh and flakey out of the oven. The pies are definitely the highlight, but the desserts aren't bad. The miningtons are a great light dessert with a lovely balance between the thin chocolate coating and fluffy sponge cake. The other dessert I've tried, the vanilla slice, is one of those desserts that's just indulgently sweet, but that was what my heart desired when I ordered, so I was happy with it. I haven't tried the espresso drinks because they don't have decaf, but I'm happy with their teas - the chai latte and London fog are very good even if they're a little on the sweet side for my taste. The prices are fair, certainly cheaper than the same meal would likely be at a full-service restaurant, but pretty much just as good.

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: Price point definitely higher than average. Burrito lacks core flavours critical to Mexican and Latin American cuisine. Meat chunks are a bit dry/hard with the lack of salsa and sour cream. Pico de gallo is barely there. No option for hot sauce. The overall flavour is flat/plain with an overwhelming amount of rice and lack of the rest.

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: La taqueria is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Vancouver. The tacos and burritos are very tasty, but a bit expensive. The workers are nice and the location is perfect.

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review:
Had Baja (Fish), Asada (Beef) Carnitas (Pork) Burritos. Delicious. Very filling. Friendly service, helpful even for us novices.
Great food, and prices are reasonable.
Exactly as it says on the tin, roof.
Around $15 ea

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: Stepping off the train into the city centre leaves you within throwing distance of some of the best tacos and burritos in the city. We grabbed a few tacos and a burrito before heading down to the water and had a nearly spiritual experience devouring them. Highly recommend the Baja taco, it will create a new level of expectation for any taco you have in the future. Also, their tortillas are A+.

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: This is truly a hole in the wall taco stand. We tried their special of the day, fish, chicken and beef tacos. Our favourite were the fish and the special of the day. They were absolutely amazing! We ordered all of them at the same time but I would recommend getting tacos as you eat as they taste best fresh! It’s a must try if you are in Vancouver!

Address: 506 Fort Street Suite 102 Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: Excellent bar with sophisticated cocktails. Perfect fancy date night bar. As a tourist, I went out of my way to find a non-tourist cocktail bar and they delivered. They have an eclectic and extensive assortment of spirits. Knowing it was dedicated to historic bar masters I had high hopes, but it truly exceeded my expectations. Anytime I'm back in Victoria I'll be visiting again.

Address: 506 Fort Street Suite 102 Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review:
Good, not great. The menu didn’t match what was posted on their website so we showed up and were immediately disappointed.

We got the tuna tar tar which was fine and split the burger, which was also fine (buns should be toasted on a $30 burger).

GF got the marshmallow drink, she described it as having a strange flavor combination

It was an average dining experience with above average cost.

Address: 506 Fort Street Suite 102 Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: Nice cocktails and friendly service. Would have loved to try their tartare but they ran out. The mushroom pate was delicious -earthy and rich. The vongole was not what I expected but was a delicious balance of tomatoes and clam flavour. The seafood soup with the fish was wonderful -the fish was not just poached but panseared so it still had a nice crust. Mussels and clams were fresh and juicy.

Address: 506 Fort Street Suite 102 Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: Excellent service and good quality meals. They specialize in a few dishes so chocies are limited, the reason for only 4 stars is that we went for dinner and they ran out of spaghetti and steak which was what I wanted and the expensive cocktails are tiny! I almost started chuckling when I received my Mononoke, pretty much a fancy shot for $20. Somethings on their menu are justified with the prices (like the wagyu beef burger!) but definitely not the cocktails nor the tuna tartare (very small amount of tuna with filler). Took almost 50 mins to get out burgers but service was top notch and atmosphere was decent, not as romantic as other reviews mebtioned, especially when it's busy!

Address: 506 Fort Street Suite 102 Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review:
Came here to celebrate me taking my nursing exam. This place is the bomb!! We shared the little Jumbo burger which was soooooo good. It comes with Parmesan fries. We also had the short rib which was some of the best I've had. The meat was very soft and fatty and I loved the unique flavors it was paired with. There were blueberries, deep fried polenta, and I think some mayo. It was so good!!!

The ambience inside is super nice and intimate. We sat at the bar and had the pleasure of chatting with the bartender Clayton who was so so nice. I had a lemonade but my boyfriend had a very smokey mai tai cocktail which was really good. Will definitely come back!

Address: 1006 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T4 Canada
Review:
Delicious, unforgettable flavors. The hour or so we waited for our food was well worth the wait and this place’s hype is well earned. Small hiccup when the staff got our order wrong but it’s understandable.

Easily one of the best fish and chips I’ve ever had. You need to get the chowder as well.

Address: 1006 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T4 Canada
Review:
The food was excellent. We had tacones, chowder and the (misnamed) cod dog.
Soup was delicious, not a traditional clam chowder and all the better for that. Tacones were well balanced with fish fillings cooked just right. The battered cod in a fresh roll with tartar, pickles and slaw was tasty. Chips/fries were really good: crispy outside and fluffy centres.
The meal was definitely fair value for money.
Long line up for counter service style ordering though, we waited nearly 30 minutes to order (hence the 4 star rating). But once we ordered the food came up pretty quickly with none of this sitting around under heat lamps.
Worth the wait. Delicious meal. And very filling, we couldn't finish it all.

Address: 1006 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T4 Canada
Review: Open air take-out style Fish & Chip shop that offers more than just deep fried items.  Grilled salmon is moist and flavourful, and the seared tuna is generous in portion size. Fresh local ingredients paired with friendly staff, what's not to love? Meal times are usually busy, but the food is worth the 30 min line up for order (then about 10 min for freshly made food).

Address: 1006 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T4 Canada
Review: Neat little food truck by the harbour. There is always a line up all day long.  The Fish & Chip is delicious. Crispy but not oily. The chipotle coconut chowder is very tasty. We were lucky to get a table with a view of the harbour.

Address: 1006 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T4 Canada
Review: By far the best Fish n Chips I've ever had. The wait line was 30+ minutes but well worth the wait. I think my only feedback is to move into another building and hire more staff to help with the high popularity of the food. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Victoria

Address: 739 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
I rarely provide 5 star reviews due to something always being off. Whether that be the food, service, or the environment. But this was impeccable. Very rarely did you find such fluidity and cooperation between serving staff and the kitchen.

The food was very delicious and surprisingly quick. Having fast service is usually a red flag for me, wondering if the food was fresh or made with quality, but without a doubt, it was made well.

Our waitress was very polite and nice to talk with. She always responded to our "thank you" with a "you're welcome" she had the perfect balance of attention and checkups to not annoy people with constant checks but didn't leave you wondering if you were going to be served. It was the perfect balance.

The restaurant is small, which does make the noise travel quite far, on the louder side, but being at the bar was a saving grace as volume seemed to be lower there.

All in all it was a very nice experience and the next time we are in Victoria we will definitely be returning for another meal.

Address: 739 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review: Well executed Japanese tapas: All ingredients and cuts were very fresh, with excellent presentation. Our group sampled a mix of classic and modern rolls with atypical flavors, as well as several small plates. The maguro tartare with taro chips was quite lovely, as well as the kara-age, which was incredibly juicy and tender. Drinks were well balanced and the servers all phenomenal.

Address: 739 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
This place is bustling! Expect a wait for dinner time. It will take some time to get a seat, order and get the bill as I experienced. So come with a patient attitude. Otherwise the waiters/resses  have their hands very full.

Otherwise the food is great! My favorite dish was the tomato curry karage. The curry was mildly sweet and they were generous with the karate. I also recommend the Tofino - an assortment of scallop, shrimp and white fish tempura.  It was absolutely delicious: crispy on the outside and so flavorful and tender in the inside.

Address: 739 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review: Delicious food and great service. We enjoyed some great sushi rolls as well as their unagi bowl. The service was also quick and friendly, despite it being a busy evening for dinner. The food was high quality and I was glad to see they had a few Japanese beer options as well.

Address: 739 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review: Went here after a recommendation from a friend. I was happy with what I ordered but my folks were less so. Octopus was good, and the avengers roll was fantastic. The chicken kara-age was a miss. Overall, just okay.

Address: 555 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M2 Canada
Review: What a great find, hidden away in a back alley in Victoria, the food was great and the atmosphere is warm and inviting, tables are spaced enough that your not having to listen to overbearing conversations at the next table. Service was a bit slow, and we felt neglected at times. I understand that it's tough to find good service in the hospitality sector these days. Hopefully, this will not be a forever thing. I would still recommend giving this place a try, and I would not hesitate to return.

Address: 555 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M2 Canada
Review: Had a wonderful anniversary dinner at Il Terrazzo. Considering how big the seating is, the place was packed yet we didn’t feel rushed or crammed in. The atmosphere was very inviting. Our bread and oil were so yummy and soft, and the crushed olives were a nice add. Everything was perfect, though I will say I was pleasantly surprised by the choice of mango in my linguine Marco. Would definitely come back.

Address: 555 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M2 Canada
Review: Really enjoyed the food and the service. The portions were generous.  Definitely a must go if you are in Victoria

Address: 555 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M2 Canada
Review: Easily the best and most authentic Italian cuisine on the island. Fantastic menu, fabulous service, and a truly incredible wine selection. I recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Victoria. We have been many times and always have a great experience alongside friendly and attentive service

Address: 555 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M2 Canada
Review: It’s a great restaurant. It’s romantic and cozy. Also Very yummy. Portions are huge. Make reservations with time. I’ll definitely recommend this restaurant. However I did miss from their menu a more Italian style pasta.

Address: 716 Burdett Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 3G2 Canada
Review:
We had dinner to celebrate our anniversary during our weekend in Victoria from Toronto.    Hubby made an amazing choice in this restaurant.

We were welcomed at the entrance with very pleasant professional personnel.  I was immediately impressed with the ambiance - it feels like a restaurant in Greece. Very spacious with lovely artwork and blue/white look everywhere.

Dimitri assisted us with our order - we loved all the appetizers, dinner, wine and the best part was the spectacular service and attention to details.

We’ve eaten at many Greek restaurants over the years which meet our expectations however this one went above and beyond.

We highly recommend it and will be back! Thank you for a wonderful night to everyone at Ithaka.

Address: 716 Burdett Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 3G2 Canada
Review:
Excellent service! The food was very delicious, and it was definitely a niche on the market for a great Greek restaurant! Absolutely fantastic ambiance, loved the color decor that matched Greece vibes 😍 👌
Prices were quite high, but the whole experience is definitely worth a visit!

Address: 716 Burdett Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 3G2 Canada
Review:
Beautiful location, friendly staff
Drinks were amazing I had Ithaka Sour and  new drink of the month Kackie-O  refreshing and perfect for summer
Meals. Calamari and the Lamb Souvlaki platter

Our waitresses:       awesome service Thea and Genile made us feel welcome

Address: 716 Burdett Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 3G2 Canada
Review: We loved our meal and the ambiance is spectacular! Also it is family friendly it's a must while you're here for authentic Greek meal!

Address: 716 Burdett Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 3G2 Canada
Review: We had our staff Christmas party here this year and everyone loved it!  The food was fantastic and genuine cooked perfectly!  The staff were very attentive and friendly, but did not bother us too much while we enjoyed our meals.  The cocktails were delicious and the bartender made a lot of great suggestions for each patron.  The building and interior atmosphere looks great.  We will all come back here again for sure!

Address: 1210 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A4 Canada
Review: I heard great things and decided finally to treat myself ... I was not disappointed.  The house G & T was beautiful and divine! Paired with the Bay Scallop & Cod Fish Ceviche was amazing. Perfectly balanced, soft, and delicious! I will definitely be coming back!

Address: 1210 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A4 Canada
Review: Excellent food. The soup was super good, pepper and coconut. I took the trio platter to try a little of everything. I did expect more for the price ($15) however, it was very tasty. I would recommend to just go with a full dish instead of the trio, you get more for your money. Finishing touch, a nice espresso. I will be back.

Address: 1210 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A4 Canada
Review: This place is awesome! Fabulous tapas, you can’t seem to go wrong with anything on the menu! Everything is perfectly curated. Beef carpaccio is love at every bite, same with gambas al ajillo. Even the baguette and the focaccia bread as sides to the meals were fresh and delicious. Portions are fair for the price. Wine list is pretty good, the few wines we had were great. Even the Sherry list is pretty good if you’re into that. Service is awesome, and finally the atmosphere is really nice. Cool lighting inside, and a beautiful open bar.

Address: 1210 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A4 Canada
Review: Excellent food, creative menu, great service-- what a fun and happy place!  We will definitely be back.

Address: 1210 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A4 Canada
Review: The service was wonderful, everyone was so sweet, and the food was amazing. Our waitress helped us with wine pairings and the gluten free bread was perfect!

Address: 805 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review:
Indian-French bistro with SOUL FOOD! I.e. food that is so nourishing and full of flavour, it comforts your soul 🫰I couldn’t pick a favourite but would definitely suggest the mussels and fisherman’s chowder.

Also, if you’re like my husband and are hardcore about tasting the potato flavour in fries, better to think of the fishhook poutine as a curry with fries in it - the curry is thick and luxurious and flavourful, but it was too saucy for his expectations 😂 would still recommend though, it was delicious!

Address: 805 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: This is quite honestly some of the best seafood I’ve heard on the West Coast thus far. There are combination of spices, flavors, and impeccable service will keep me coming back for more. You need to try the hot pot is absolutely amazing. The amount of seafood you receive as well as the endless baguette is to die for. I highly recommend coming here.

Address: 805 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review:
The very positive reviews we read about the restaurant while planning our Victoria trip had our expectations high. We had it on our to-do list on our Victoria visit. We were glad to make it there for lunch just before our return trip from Victoria. Fishhook went beyond our expectations. We had ordered the Biriyani and The Pondicherry. The flavours were unique and perfectly blended. Never before had we loved salmon so much.
Looking forward to our next visit.

Address: 805 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: Great food. Loved the poutini and catch of day. Pondicherri fish was good as well. I wish I had a chance to eat inside and enjoy fresh n hot flavors instead of take to ferry

Address: 805 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: The food and the service were excellent. We had the mussels, Biryani, Katch of the day and the fish chowder. They were all exceptional. I recommend reserving a seat ahead. We went during peak hours so parking in Fort Street was difficult.

Address: 919 Fort Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8V 3K3 Canada
Review: Amazing breakfast spot in Downtown Victoria. When we go early in the morning already had line up so can see how popular it is. It’s featured in so many articles about the breakfast you have to try in Victoria. Actually at beginning we are little skeptical but it turns out it’s very good. The portion is huge and they are generous on putting ingredients the plates are full :). We are super full after eating that we skip the lunch. We highly recommend this to if you want to try traditional breakfast in this beautiful city

Address: 919 Fort Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8V 3K3 Canada
Review: They are usually pretty busy and there was a wait for us to get in, but definitely worth it. The food was very yummy and very large portions for the price, I would definitely recommend. One plate would’ve honestly been enough for both my friend and I. The decor and ambience is also very nice, service is quite attentive. Although a tad slow because of how busy they were. I would definitely come again.

Address: 919 Fort Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8V 3K3 Canada
Review: One of those rare times the lineup wasn't very long so we took advantage.  It's a busy spot but the service was efficient and the food came out quickly.  I had the Angel Eyes Eggs Benny.  The eggs were perfectly cooked.  The homefries were crispy.  Didn't find it had oodles of flavour, but of course that has more to do with my choice of order.  My friend had the Moroccan Chicken Club which he really liked.  Will go back, but likely not when it's lined up.

Address: 919 Fort Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8V 3K3 Canada
Review: Really good dishes! I tried the Fox’s grill and it was really delicious. We waited 1hour 30min to get in. It was surely worth it. Very good serving, you get full real fast! Great breakfast!

Address: 919 Fort Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8V 3K3 Canada
Review: There was a line up outside the door, but luckily it moved fairly quickly. Service was quick, and the portions were huge. The food was delicious, we were very happy with our meals! I would definitely come back for breakfast again.

Address: 769 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
Best food experience on our trip to Victoria!!
We ordered Kung Pao Tofu and Special Fried Rice, both the dishes were delicious. For Kung Pao Tofu, one would imagine that Tofu was the star of the dish (which it was), but for me it was the crispy fried broccoli which took the dish to another level.. chefs kiss !!
Food quantity and the service was pretty good. I can't wait to go back and try other things on their menu.

This place is a must visit if you are in Victoria.

Address: 769 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: Definitely recommend!  Just what we needed on a rainy afternoon.  They totally delivered on the street food promise with the bonus of getting out of the rain.  Red Curry reminded me a lot of actual curry in Thailand - lots of different veggies and a rich, not overpowering curry flavors.  Really good food!

Address: 769 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
Dishes are well served, really nice quantities. We ordered 3 dishes and we had to take 1 in a box (2 adults and 2 kids). This place is delicious. They cook your plate on the spot, pretty fast too. The people there are very friendly and will consider go back on our next visit!
I personally recommend the Caramel Chicken when visiting this place. Good luck!

Address: 769 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
The crispy ginger pork was an explosion of flavor in my mouth. I would definitely recommend it. The spice level was just right for me.

My wife got the famous caramel chicken which she enjoyed. Both dishes are delicious. The potstickers though were just average fried pork dumplings. Their meat serving  was plentiful that we had to ask for a to go box for some leftovers.

Prices were reasonable considering it already includes taxes. Service was fast.

Address: 769 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: We decided to try Foo Asian Street Food for dinner and it was phenomenal! We got the Saag Paneer, which is served with fry bread and streamed rice. The Tofu Kung Pao bowl is a medley of vegetables that comes with steamed rice. Both dishes were flavourful, delicious and well-done! They have a great menu as well. Love their concept! Excellent and friendly service from the host as well. Thank you! Highly recommend! We shall return 😊

Address: 546 Fisgard St Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review:
ONE OF THE BEST NOODLES I’VE HAD IN MY LIFE!

Not only it was a great experience of serving ourselves the noodle mix, the taste is incredible. The waitress is also very nice, very fast service.

Their pork ribs is also a must try, and their pork belly is also good.

Definitely coming back when visiting victoria & its chinatown.

Address: 546 Fisgard St Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: Nice restaurant located in Victoria Chinatown near the Fan Tan Alley. Their feature is cross bright noodle soup from Yunnan. To be honest not the worst but not the best either. Feels like the soup base add a lot MSG because very savoury. The portion is not big each ingredient like only one or two bites. Noodle doesn’t feel fresh it’s pre-cooked. If just for simple dinner that’s okay but don’t expect too much fancy.

Address: 546 Fisgard St Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: Food was great!   Wonton needs a bit more favour.  Soup was very hot for cross bridge noodle but after adding the ingredients, it becomes warm.  Overall, it is very good!

Address: 546 Fisgard St Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: A rare find of 过桥米线 (“crossing-the-bridge noodles”) served in the traditional way! Guess it’s part of the fun to put small plates of a variety of meat and veggies into the boiling chicken broth in a sensible order and let the final cooking be done right in front of you. The rich broth with fresh ingredients and smooth rice noodles couldn’t be more satisfying and heart warming. The tofu and kelp salad side dishes were tasty as well.

Address: 546 Fisgard St Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: Amazing food, great service, great restaurant. I was not expecting much, but it was absolutely delicious. The fried dumplings are absolutely exquisite, and the wifi and service was even better. It was a fast,simple, delicious dine-in-dinner in ChinaTown, and I loved it. There was only one waitress working, and while it took a while for the menus to arrive, the food came very quick, and anyone who doesn't go here is missing out. Great design, great everything!

Address: 611 Courtney Street Victoria, BC V8W 1B7 Canada
Review:
10 acres delivers! the food is delicious, looks great and all from their own farm.
Make sure to make a reservation so you get a great table.
We had the chicken and mussels,  I feel it was a mistake. Should have stuck with one theme. Either seafood. Or no seafood.
The chicken was very very good.
I’d have it again.

Address: 611 Courtney Street Victoria, BC V8W 1B7 Canada
Review:
Lovely atmosphere! Nice staff and quality food!
Incredible dishes and well designed menu! Had been there for breakfast and lunch, loved it both.

Address: 611 Courtney Street Victoria, BC V8W 1B7 Canada
Review: A farm to table restaurant. We walked in on a Saturday night and were seating right away. The restaurant is very big. There was a section with a bar with a younger ground, another sections with larger groups and family and then another area that seemed to be more intimate. Everything that we ordered was delicious- gnocchi, lasagna, and pumpkin cheesecake. Highly recommend the pumpkin cheesecake (without the apple compote and lemon-those flavours didnt go well together for my palate) I would say it’s the best I’ve had. Service was great. I would definitely go back!

Address: 611 Courtney Street Victoria, BC V8W 1B7 Canada
Review: Stopped in without resos for lunch, we were seated on the “indoor patio” which has a great vibe. Came in for an app and aperol spritz. Excellent atmosphere. Food was good, fresh and unique. They had a mix up with their bar order so they were out of Prosecco, which is fine..sh!t happens! Def coming back!

Address: 611 Courtney Street Victoria, BC V8W 1B7 Canada
Review: We just ordered some drinks. Beautiful interior design! I loved how they incorporated plants into their outside patio. Most of their drinks include alcohol so it is not so much friendly for those who are avoiding alocholic drinks.

Address: 1001 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T6 Canada
Review: Delicious! Took my boyfriend here for the first time and he absolutely loved it. We both got drinks which were good. We shared a calamari which was a little bit small for $20. My boyfriend has the steak and he likes it done rare and he was so happy with how it turned out. I had the fish and chips and the fish was so crispy and very good. I will add the fries are not good, they are very soggy. Will come back but I would love to see the fries change.

Address: 1001 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T6 Canada
Review:
An incredible restaurant and definitely priceworthy!

We had a nice place outside, in the shade and with a fresh breeze and our waiter was extraordinarily friendly and courteous.

The dishes, the burger as well as the fish, tasted delicious, were nicely plated and a good size. The self-made drinks were very tasty as well.

The experience overall was great in any case, the atmosphere was very harmonious, the dishes tasted superb and were worth their price.

Address: 1001 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T6 Canada
Review:
Food:
Burger is juicy and tasty.

It came with burnt, refried-tasting fries.

I am sensitive to re-used oil. The calamari wasn't only greasy but also smelled like it was cooked in re-used oil.

The service is good though.  I was attended frequently and welcomed well.

Address: 1001 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T6 Canada
Review: We went to Nautical Nellies not once, but two weekends in a row for brunch. All the dishes were amazing, packed with large chunks of seafood and were really good portions, especially for sharing! My favourites are the lobster and crab salad (large enough for 2-3), the lobster and crab French toast, lobster roll, and last but not least, the brioche French toast! The French toast is so good it should be illegal, especially at only $10. As a Victoria local, I am always trying different restaurants in town and I have to say this place is one of the best. Don’t miss this place the next time you are in Victoria!

Address: 1001 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T6 Canada
Review: First time in Victoria for some time! Parked our car and started walking. Googled seafood, and found Nautical Nellie's! It was very cold out that day, and we were looking for some warm coffee and some seafood. The service was impeccable and the food was amazing! We had the lobster dip, the lobster mac and cheese, and the seafood chowder. All of it was delicious! We'll go back next time we're in Victoria for sure!

Address: 512 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 2Z6 Canada
Review: Heard about this place from a friend of mine and decided to bring my parents here. I was not impressed with the quality of the food. We ordered a half original fried chicken, a half sweet and sour, assorted fries (regular fries, yam fries, and onion rings), and the spicy chicken soup. The chicken that we ordered was warm and super dry. The meat was not tender at all, you can tell it's been sitting in the back for a bit. The fries were alright, it was also dry and oily, not much salt to it. The spicy chicken soup was good but a bit too spicy for our taste. The service was good, our servers were super nice and accommodating.

Address: 512 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 2Z6 Canada
Review: I have been to Chimac a few times now and to be completely honest, it’s ok. Their Fire Gopchang (Beef Intestines) is really good! I would definitely recommend that if you’re willing to try something new. Although sometimes when I order it it’s grainy which happens sometimes. The nice thing about Chimac is that they have a lot of different flavours to choose from for their Chicken. The only reason why I think it’s ok is because the chicken isn’t as crispy as it once was. However, I do like their Boneless Padak because of the pile of green onions that comes with it. I wouldn’t recommend getting the Fish Cake Soup as it’s quite bland. The Seafood Udon is ok but I wouldn’t order it again. I just feel like there are better places for Chicken but if you are Downtown and are craving Korean Fried Chicken here’s an option.

Address: 512 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 2Z6 Canada
Review:
💵: A bit pricey but you'll make sure to go back a few times a month to get your Chicken Fix

🍜: We ordered
🍡:Fried Fish Balls
They taste good. Perfect match with Ketchup and Mustard
🍗 Spicy Chilli Chicken - Boneless 5⭐
Not that spicy, just a very little kick
Spice - 🌶️
🍗 Sweet and Sour Chicken - Boneless 5⭐
It also has pineapples 😩 I also love their presentation 👌
🍗 Honey Mustard Chicken - Boneless 5⭐
This is the one I like the most. Although, Honey Mustard is quite a popular flavor, it goes well with the chicken ❤️
🥔: Poutine 4⭐
Not the tastiest but it's okay. Big portion, too! 😂

🍱: The portion  of the big one looks like it's for your 1 week meal 😂 it's our first time and we didn't expect the serving to be this massive. Price to Portion ratio is superb ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

⌛: The wait time is average. Around, 10-20mins I think

👥: Service, is quite good. They ask what ever you need more and communicates.

Tip your servers 🥰

Address: 512 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 2Z6 Canada
Review:
Pa dak was not good for us.  Firstly they did not have boneless chicken available, so they offered bone-in chicken as an alternative. The chicken lacked the desired crispiness, and the batter was a bit bland. Additionally, the sauce had an unpleasant taste, reminiscent of nail polish, so we decided to return it after sampling just one piece. Despite this, we were still charged for the entire dish.

On a positive note, the dumplings and assorted fries were delicious, providing the only redeeming aspect of the meal.

Address: 512 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 2Z6 Canada
Review:
Quite underwhelming if you are looking for korean fried chicken, the chicken is not very crispy and there was entirely too much green onion in the dish, although the meat was very tender. We also got the pork stew and that was pretty delicious in terms of the pork being stewed properly and fell apart. I did not feel like the broth was very authentic tasting though and there was a lot of pepper.
The resturant is quite busy and there is a waitlist for spots if it is a weekend. The service is not bad, although they did run out of rice when I wanted to order some to go. Overall not bad, but I wouldn't come here for the chicken.

Address: 225 Quebec Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W2 Canada
Review: One of the best breakfasts I’ve had based on quality of the food and ambiance. Very reasonably priced, well worth the food alone. Add to that dining a 10 minute walk along the harbour from the center of the tourist district, efficient service and very comfortable seating in a historic house. We arrived a few minutes before opening at 9am, with about five groups in line in front of us and were seated 10 minutes later. We finished breakfast and were out the door before 10am. We were not rushed at all - we just had places to go.

Address: 225 Quebec Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W2 Canada
Review: Amazing flavorful + healthy food, great vibe, and stunning cozy upstairs lounge. The staff was so chill and kind. This has got to be my new favorite breakfast place in Victoria.

Address: 225 Quebec Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W2 Canada
Review: This is better than any brunch place I've had in Seattle. New York level in terms of quality and ingredient selection. Small menu which I prefer. Everything is on point. Can you guys open a location in Seattle please?

Address: 225 Quebec Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W2 Canada
Review: Small menu but all the items are tasty! For someone like myself who can't make up my mind with a lot of choices the small menu was great. I had the frittata and the eggs were cooked to perfection. The bread and butter on my plate was the best toast I've had.

Address: 225 Quebec Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W2 Canada
Review: Great new addition to the casual fine dinning scene in James Bay. Delicious elevated casual dishes thoughtfully prepared with fresh, local ingredients.

Address: 626 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R6 Canada
Review: Best Ramen I have had. In 2018 we found this restaurant and have come back ever since. My daughter loved the Ramen Tofu back then and this started her journey exploring different types of food. For Muslims: don’t let the pig on the door turn you off: the vegan vegetarian dishes are incredible. Our whole family loves the vegan/ Vegetarian Tan Tan Men. The tofu is crunchy and delicious. I wholeheartedly recommend Bao. I look forward to it all year and it is a big reason why we all love coming to Victoria so much.

Address: 626 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R6 Canada
Review: I'm gluten free and vegetarian. I can't remember the last time I was able to have Ramen! It was more of a pho with rice noodles however it was so delicious. Spicy and lots of different textures. Very generous portion sizes and a very fair price. Food came very quickly. I had the tan tan Ramen and iced Vietnamese coffee. Absolutely loved it! Went with my brother and we both agreed it was fabulous!

Address: 626 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R6 Canada
Review: One of the few restaurants open late night on a weekday. Decided to try a couple of their baos during our stay in Victoria. Ordered Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Chinese BBQ, Mala 5 Mushroom, and the Taiwanese Classic (from left to right). It was 4 for $16. They were cute tiny baos, good for an appetizer and the flavors were on point. I wished they were full sized though! The Mala 5 mushroom had a good spicy kick to it.

Address: 626 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R6 Canada
Review: LOOK NO FURTHER! This is the best place to eat in China Town, hands down! For starters, hubs and I are in our 40's, parents of teenagers, restaurant owners, and brought our large vacationing family to Bao from other blogger recommendations. We couldn't be happier that we tried it out!! Everything we tried was amazing, the 13 year olds loved theirs as well! Small, quaint, clean, fast, friendly, and absolutely delicious! We can't wait to visit Bao next time we go to Victoria!

Address: 626 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R6 Canada
Review: Have been in Victoria a few times, but hadn’t gotten the chance to stop at Bao, until the other day. What a disappointment. The bao buns we tried were Taiwanese Classic, Buttermilk Fried Chicken and Mala 5 Mushroom. The classic was the best flavour and it was just okay, the rest were bad. The Tan Tan Men was just bad, could barely eat it. And the Kara Miso Ramen was subpar, something about it was off. The Vietnamese ice coffee on the otherhand was yummy. You seat yourself and pay at the counter when you arrive, so there isn’t much service. Overall not nearly close to the 4.5 rating it has on google more like a 3.0.

Address: 1001 Douglas Street Unit G2A Victoria, BC V8W 2C5 Canada
Review: My partner and I came in to a fun filled kitchen/seating area for

Address: 1001 Douglas Street Unit G2A Victoria, BC V8W 2C5 Canada
Review:
I just went to Victoria for the first time and looked at a lot of restaurant choices before choosing Hanks.  My friends and I were thrilled we did!  We shared the Today's Best Things, which consisted of a watermelon salad so could you could take a bath in it, the Duck Bolognese with homemade pasta, tender duck and an incredible sauce, Beets with dandilion greens. Omg. The flavors, the spice, perfection, and a steak that was perfection with a salad that I could eat, literally, every single day.  Dessert was a cornbread cake with blueberries, piatachios, and some kind of cream cheesy whipped creamy pillow that sealed the deal.

A+ 1000% reccommend, and we are so sad its a six hour trip to get back there!

Tiny place, excellent service, cool, chill atmosphere.

Thank you for the incredible meal!

Address: 1001 Douglas Street Unit G2A Victoria, BC V8W 2C5 Canada
Review:
Anti-fine dining - fine dining by a rag tag gang of young bad-asse's cooking like wizards of old. A stripped down, almost unrefined atmosphere stands confidently in the awareness that its' dark cathedral walls host a different kind of church.
These guys are an absolute thrill to watch in their element as they dance around their tiny, open kitchen, slinging seriously excellent food and drink into the mouths of worship.
Well don chaps!

Your passion is carving a unique path, keep refining your process and you will ascend into the ranks of infamy.

To any fortunate enough to find themselves at this bastion of excellence, let these Young Guns show you FLAVOUR, no white tablecloth symphony here - Hanks is a rock concert - and they don't miss  a beat.

Bravo!

Address: 1001 Douglas Street Unit G2A Victoria, BC V8W 2C5 Canada
Review:
I remember clearly as a small
