child that the “best” things came in small packages. If you are one of the lucky ones to get inside this Victoria Gem called  “Hank's *A Restaurant” , then you’ve just won the lottery of an experience like no other.

We ordered and shared the Walnut and Arugula pesto & the Cheeseburger with potato fries . Each bite was like the first time you experienced Disneyland for the first time . Clark , the Culinary Artist  and part owner,  personally checked to see how our meals were. His attention to detail and passion for his craft is why we will return to experience many of the other incredible menu items .

We hadn’t even finished our first meal experience, and we were already talking  about what we’d order next time.

A true Victoria Gem definitely worth experiencing !

Address: 1001 Douglas Street Unit G2A Victoria, BC V8W 2C5 Canada
Review:
There aren't really any new words that I can add other then you need to visit this place. Note that it's small (3-4 tables and about 8 bar seats so resos are recommended), the food is made from scratch in front of you so expect a bit of a wait. I can't believe that my plate was only $25, this was a gourmet execution of a simple concept, and it was big enough to serve 2!

Apparently the Victoria foodie scene is really good and Hank's is one of the places that you need to go to.

Address: 542 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S5 Canada
Review:
Get ready for the hyperbole that isn't. The Blackstone Benny was by far the best eggs Benedict I have ever had. The bacon alone is worth 5 stars.
The service was top notch and it's fun to just look around in this restaurant. Go and you will see what I mean.

Address: 542 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S5 Canada
Review:
Great food! Huge sizes! We tried different things pork belly eggs Benedict, veggie bowl and french toast and they were all awesome!
Eggs Benedict are great and big for one person, but I would say bowls are for two, they're huge!
French toast is a mots I would say, we tried the apple one and it was unbelievable!
The waiting times are a bit long but I would say they are worth it. It would be better if you could write your name down and come back, but still is good.
Buttermilk biscuits are very good and special too.
Definitely a great place for breakfast/brunch!

Address: 542 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S5 Canada
Review:
Great service and great food! I tried John's Place, Blue Fox Cafe, and Jam Cafe in the span of 3 days. Service and menus were great at all 3. With a similar type of cuisine, you can't go wrong with any of the 3 places.
We tried the Herald Omlette and the later tater bowl at Jam and both were great. I liked the seating at Jam cafe, as well as the Chicken Apple Sausage! Id recommend any of the 3 places for breakfast/brunch, but go early or you're waiting in line for a while.

Address: 542 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S5 Canada
Review: Great breakfast place I got waffles and sausage patties. So good.  Everything our table got was delicious as were the drinks. Very popular there were about 10 ppl in line ahead of us but we only waited about 15 minutes.  We sat outside, they had blankets for the customers to put on their laps. I thought that was so thoughtful. Would definitely go back if in the area.

Address: 542 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S5 Canada
Review: I LOVE their pancakes, their bowls are great too! Jam is a breakfast fave amongst my friends and I. Only downside is the restaurant is small, tables are close together, and you almost always have to line up for a long tome to get a table. If you have the time, I do really recommend it because it’s worth it.

Address: 1325 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 0B5 Canada
Review:
I stopped at Superbaba for lunch, and it didn’t disappoint. They make fresh pita breads daily, and that’s key. You can see them baking the bread in a hot oven. The pita bread is soft and slightly chewy. I got the falafel wrap, and it was delicious. The chickpea fritters were crispy. I enjoyed the fresh and crunchy vegetables in the wrap. The flavours are exquisite. I love their aesthetics with modern flair.

Additionally, I also decided to try the turmeric cookie. Along with the turmeric, I appreciated the rose water. The rose water adds a distinct and unique floral which, in my opinion, is very unique. The cookie had a good texture, with a slightly crisp outer shell and a soft and chewy middle. Highly recommend. Next time, I shall order ahead.

Address: 1325 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 0B5 Canada
Review: Chicken Wrap with two extra falafel balls on the side. Definitely filling a niche that needs filled and I’m so glad it’s around whenever I need it! Thanks!

Address: 1325 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 0B5 Canada
Review:
I had a chicken wrap last week and it was not awful taste. It was full of cabbage and hardly find chicken inside though it was chicken wrap. Instead chicken I got too much fries.
Hope will take care next time.

Address: 1325 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 0B5 Canada
Review: Ordered the spicy falafel bowl for lunch. It took a bit of time but was worth the wait. Fantastic flavour and a good slow burn when finished. Add this to the go-to list for lunch! Next time I'll order ahead.

Address: 1325 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 0B5 Canada
Review: There is a reason this restaurant is always busy. So delicious! I only wish they would ask if you need a fork when getting food to go because I assume it’s in there & then end up eating my salad/chicken bowl with my fingers @ the park 🤓 tasty tuom, pita chips and ice cream sandwich & also love the lemonade. I will never tire of the sauerkraut pickles & blackened chicken. YUM

Address: 807 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: This Mediterranean styled tapa bistro seems to be a hidden gem at a time when many sub-standard restaurants are requiring paid reservations and add restrictions to your time to enjoy being out. Not here. Rich flavoured food, and a great selections of drinks. We had the grilled cauliflower, grilled Humboldt squid, special spot prawn dumplings, dry aged chorizo (it’s in the name - just order some!) and churros. He had a couple HH wines for $6 and cocktails. This is a restaurant you should put on repeat!

Address: 807 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: Great food. I had a grilled Humboldt squid and  roasted potatoes for starter. The grilled Humboldt squid was terrific, neither chewey nor too fishy at all. The starter with potatoes was also great. Staff was kind. Want to try other dishes on my next visit.

Address: 807 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review:
The food was exceptional. Olives, fancy potatoes, meatballs, paella, scallops, and an assortment of deserts. Everything was remarkable and sooo tasty!  The prices were completely reasonable and the service was right on time.
10/10 - will definitely come again.

Address: 807 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: What a find !! Super delicious little restaurant with great service. Excellent wine selection with a couple of very good Spanish white wines. Paloma cocktail was excellent. We had salt cod, croquettes, the meatball, grilled bread, and anchovies. Everything was so good. So nice to have things not slathered in cream and cheese. The meatballs were like a soft cloud - so delicious. Nothing over-salted and no heavy sauces …amazing.

Address: 807 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: Thé paella was sooo good. The seafood was seasoned perfectly and fresh. I loved the sauce on the rice and it brought me back to Spain. The owner (man at the Bar?) was also super friendly. We sat in front in the patio and had a lovely dinner. I would definitely come again to try their other tapas!

Address: 680 Montreal Street Victoria, BC V8V 1Z8 Canada
Review:
The quality of food and service  is pretty good, for sure.
But the portion is smaller than smaller. Also, I’m not a fan of the coffee (written as espresso but served as normal black coffee), a lot of spaces for improvement.

Address: 680 Montreal Street Victoria, BC V8V 1Z8 Canada
Review: Great Western omelette and Aura Benedict! We enjoyed our stay in the hotel as well as our breakfast at Aura waterfront restaurant. We were also with 3 toddlers and they were kept busy with the provided drawing supplies which was nice.

Address: 680 Montreal Street Victoria, BC V8V 1Z8 Canada
Review: Spent a lovely night with good friends/fellow chefs thanks to the aura for supplying a amazing dining experience. The food was some best I've ever had in my life. Especially the tuna and the pork belly. Muah 👌. The plates are were all small and shared between two people yet by the end I was stuffed despite a big appetite. To conclude, for the price of only 65$ per person and eating such delectable food till a full belly I'd definitely recommend either this menu or single plates off it.

Address: 680 Montreal Street Victoria, BC V8V 1Z8 Canada
Review: The Aura benny taste really good! Didn’t expect the kimchi blend so well with hollandaise. With the view of inner harbor, peaceful dinning environment, and attentive service, really nice place for breakfast.

Address: 680 Montreal Street Victoria, BC V8V 1Z8 Canada
Review: Highly recommend seating on the patio, where you can enjoy delicious food and a beautiful view simultaneously

Address: 620 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review:
One of the best places to enjoy a casual meal at Commons. We enjoyed tacos, wine, beer and cocktails during the happy hour. The menu may be limited but pretty ok for the price and happy hours. Chicken tacos are delicious. Flat breads are perfectly made and a good enough portion for a quick snack. The house wines, red and white are average but not too bad for the price.

The place has nice modern funky decor so won't feel the place as a boring restaurant. Fun place overall for happy hour

Address: 620 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: I can’t give it a five star review because they messed up my daughter’s sushi and put onions all over it when we had very specifically ordered it plain. Then they didn’t ask if we wanted another one…She sort of just asked if we could pick the onions off and walked away. Also, I ordered my steak rare, and it came very medium if not well done. Food was pretty good though, especially the field greens, which seemed extremely fresh! My bloody Mary was also very very tasty.

Address: 620 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: The location of this restaurant is great. I went with my 12 year old daughter. We ordered the clam chowder, calamari and tuna salad. The clam chowder and calamari were good. The tuna was dry and the potatoes undercooked. And strangely, at the end of our meal the server asked us if we wanted separate bills which made us think, how common is it that a 40 year old and their 12 year old friend dine there and pay separately?

Address: 620 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: Good ceviche, a bit pricey. The prawn tacos were amazing. The meat tacos were really good but we preferred the prawn ones. The drinks are always 👌 the server gave us more chips for the ceviche, which is great

Address: 620 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: Great place for dinner with some of the best views in downtown Victoria. The lasagna in particular was amazing. Servers checked in at a great pace, so we felt quite spoiled throughout the night!

Address: 1 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 0B2 Canada
Review:
These were the best muscles ive ever had in my life. They were sweet and flavorful and not a tiny grain of sand in the entire thing. Absolutely worth $19. The halibut tacos were also fantastic. The halibut fish and chips was the disappointment of the group but still okay.
I would absolutely go back for the muscles and might even come back before our trip is over. Highly recommend.
I would give 5/5 but I just don't give 5s for hardly anything.

Address: 1 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 0B2 Canada
Review:
A female kitchen staff yelled guests because we were looking for the place for throwing garbage.
We don’t know because we are tourists. Do local come here and not know where are the trash cans?
The cashier was very nice and recommended food. A male chef is also nice! I would like to give the two staff 5 starts!
Just fast food taste but restaurants change, so they are expensive. The food in the area seem for tourists.
I give 5 stars for the atmosphere!

Address: 1 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 0B2 Canada
Review: Our harbour taxi guide recommended this spot as the fried items have a lighter batter than other places on Fisherman’s Wharf. They have happy hour specials on oysters. Chowder with 3 types of salmon was great.

Address: 1 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 0B2 Canada
Review: Delicious oyster tacos. Halibut taco was a bit dry, but still good. Three way salmon chowder was delicious!  Be prepared to get messy. Was in Victoria for three nights and went twice!  It was worth the return visit.

Address: 1 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 0B2 Canada
Review:
Super tasty B.C. Halibut taco & salmon chowder! The view is great, the server is helpful (it was all her recommendation and it’s all good), too bad we couldn’t try the shrimp yet because it wasn’t ready and we had to leave.

Definitely coming back again, it’s real fresh and good seafood!

Address: 1692 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: Tasty healthy food. They don’t use MSG but the food is flavourful and all the ingredients ate well cooked and fresh. We had the cozy place chow mien, the veggies are sweet and the portion is fulfilling for one person.

Address: 1692 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Victoria 💕 It feels really cozy inside, like the name of the restaurant! All the food I had here was amazing! The price of the foods here is reasonable. I hope everyone in Victoria knows this Cozy Place😊

Address: 1692 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: Surprisingly well managed husband and wife team created a Comfy, cozy place to dine alone or with your love ones.   I ordered the simple but difficult to master scramble eggs with tomato sauce.   The eggs were cooked separately so the flavors and texture of each ingredients were properly celebrated.  My second dish is the slow braised pork spare ribs that was cooked to perfect then it was tossed in with a tang-ee soy based black pepper sauce.  Both dishes were served with generous portion and I had left over to take it to my hotel.  Out of the 5 days on the island, this little place captured my heart with its simple but highly satisfying dishes.   I will come back to try other dishes and to continue my conversation with the owner couple!

Address: 1692 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: The restaurant has a cozy atmosphere as described, and the food is absolute delicious, fresh, and full of flavour with great vegan options.

Address: 1692 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: We loved this place. Some of the most authentic Chinese food I’ve had outside of China. The couple running the place were very kind, and everything was fresh and made to order.

Address: 633 Courtney Street Suite 22 Victoria, BC V8W 1B9 Canada
Review: We love this place. Currently only order for pick up. Such a hidden gem! Fish is so fresh! They use fresh ingredient and locally source organic veggies. We order once a week!

Address: 633 Courtney Street Suite 22 Victoria, BC V8W 1B9 Canada
Review:
This is an authentic shokudo food. You should not compare to a pricey omakase, but you can expect comfort and satisfactory meal. The grilled sockeye collar and the mackerel were wonderful. We are happy to try this place during our visit.

The only complain that I have was the rice, which could be better.

Address: 633 Courtney Street Suite 22 Victoria, BC V8W 1B9 Canada
Review:
This was hands down our favorite and best find in Victoria. We ordered a tuna and salmon lunch, and picked it up the next day to eat at Philips brewery.

Since they are not doing dine in currently, you have to order the lunch the night before online at ~7PM, and then pick it up the next afternoon. We actually got a little lost looking for it, but loved the experience searching for it.

The food itself was fantastic - loved the shredded egg, thought that was pretty unique touch, and the sashimi was fresh, thick and just all around amazing. Would recommend this place to anyone!

Address: 633 Courtney Street Suite 22 Victoria, BC V8W 1B9 Canada
Review:
If you miss the pre-COViD uchida and have avoided supporting them or leave a low star rating because there is no dine-in option… you are missing out on this gem. I was a long time customer who had his early dates (with my now wife) here.. always loved going there for their dine-in experience.  I am guilty of not going in the last couple years because of not wanting to takeout the amazing food in portable packaging.  I ran into the chef socially in the last couple months and kept saying “I’ll see you soon”.. but today I really pushed myself in using their online ordering system and picking up takeout for a car date with my wife. The number of times I kept saying “wow” as I sat in my car holding the paper box… it’s astounding how much care and love the chef puts into this food. For it to taste this good even in a portable form.. I am embarrassed now to feel that I was waiting for them to resume dine-in to go support this amazing eatery.

Please experience Uchida and let this chef express this talents.  As of this review in Nov 2022, you do you have to order online and pickup at their door.  Trust me, it’s not the same takeout food you are used to. I ate every grain of rice, not to waste a single element of the meal made personally for me.

Address: 633 Courtney Street Suite 22 Victoria, BC V8W 1B9 Canada
Review: Exceptionally delicious and fresh. Order the night before for a stellar take out lunch. Perfect if you’ve got a busy day of meetings or if you’re just visiting and are looking for a healthy picnic to enjoy while touring around our fine city.

Address: 721 Government St Victoria, BC V8W 1W5 Canada
Review: A must do while visiting Victoria! High tea in an historic hotel rich in decor and traditions. The food is gorgeous and the service is top notch! Go there hungry, you will be really full once you get through all three tiers of the high tea!

Address: 721 Government St Victoria, BC V8W 1W5 Canada
Review:
Stayed at the Empress for 2 nights and looked forward to breakfast at the Q every morning. The food was fresh, prepared well, and tasted, well, like food should taste. It wasn't greasy, overly seasoned or overly salted.

Service was professional but friendly and the atmosphere was wonderful. The restaurant was clean and the Christmas decorations were very tastefully done.

I ordered the tater bowl which was very good. It wasn't oily and felt "clean". The fully loaded oatmeal was fruity and had a good mix of flavors from the berries, banana and brown sugar, cream for the oats. My partner had the French toast which she really enjoyed. The granola, we were curious what a 14 dollar granola tasted like, it was just granola with fruits. It was good, but not with the money. There were better options to be had.

Overall, I loved breakfast and look forward to returning again.

Address: 721 Government St Victoria, BC V8W 1W5 Canada
Review: The food was excellent, the restaurant beautiful and the staff wonderful. The tenderloin was great, the pavlova to die for. Loved it and want to go back as soon as possible!

Address: 721 Government St Victoria, BC V8W 1W5 Canada
Review: Fine dining at it's best. Food was spot on. Our waiter knew every little detail about their menu. Fancy interior. Perfect place for your date night. Highly recommend.

Address: 721 Government St Victoria, BC V8W 1W5 Canada
Review:
Since we regularly visit the Fairmont Empress, we can say with confidence that it never dissatisfies. Every detail is correct. They have it all dialled!

We adore coming here for some cocktails, beverages, and their cuisine. It's wonderful for lunch, brunch, afternoon tea, cocktails and dinner. Q at the Fairmont Empress is a genuine pleasure. It’s a nice location.

The bartenders are nice, friendly and really knowledgable. At all occasions, the hosts provided excellent service. The drinks and cocktails are outstanding. We have had the Empress Lemonade, Empress, Old Fashioned, Martini Royale. Plus, their popcorn is tasty, unique and produced in-house!

In addition, it is incredible that the Empress Gin, that's their speciality, is made in Victoria! Live music and fantastic vibes can be found at Q at the Fairmont Empress. If you're seeking for an upgraded and elevated experience, I highly recommend this location as you will not be disappointed! Thank you. We shall return. 💯

Address: 602 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review:
BeaverTails is undoubtedly one of Canada's most iconic and delicious pastries, originating in Ottawa and spreading across the country. However, I can understand why some people may only try it once due to its indulgent nature. The pastry is made of fried dough and topped with a variety of toppings, including cinnamon sugar, chocolate hazelnut, and maple butter, among others. While it's undoubtedly a treat for those with a sweet tooth, the sugar content may be too much for some.

That being said, for those willing to indulge, BeaverTails is a must-try pastry. It's perfect for a special occasion or as a sweet treat on a lazy afternoon.

Address: 602 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: I was told president Obama visited Beavertail in Ottawa so we wanted to try their food while visiting Victoria.  It was neat and fun.  Good tasty desert.  Don’t expect seatings though as there is only couple of outdoor tables and a few chairs.

Address: 602 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: Beaver tail and the Poutine was delicious, place was packed and we had to wait but it was worth it.

Address: 602 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review:
This place is like a hole in the wall, and absolutely delicious.
I'd have to say the wait for me wasn't that long. The staff were very friendly. I'd have a garbage can on site to put your waste in after eating at the outdoor tables. They serve mostly ice cream and dessert style pastry, but they do have a poutine one and some wrapped hot dogs.
I definitely like this place. If you haven't been there before you should at least try it once.

Address: 602 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review:
Price experience score (pes) 8.5/10

service ok
Food good
Ambiance takeout

Address: 515 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K7 Canada
Review:
Fiamo is a cozy yet chic Italian restaurant.  Inside the restaurant is romantic, dark, and moody: perfect for a date night, evening cocktails, or having an intimate night to yourself.  They have a closed patio as well as an open-aired one though unfortunately it wasn't open when I visited.

Leah was our server who was methodical in how she went about the steps of service.  Amy also stands out to me in her role as a support staff/host.  Overall, the staff were quality: laid back but also seemed to care for their work.

I came for a Sunday night dinner so regrettably, the pasta dishes weren't available reducing the choices in entree.  However, their rotating specials of the day were a nice addition ensuring greater variety.  This also implies they utilize seasonal ingredients and come up with new dishes in addition to the set menu-- probably more fun for the kitchen staff too!

I ordered their special of the day: Eggplant Parmesan ($26) which was delectable.  I loved the addition of roasted vegetables (including potatoes, broccolini, sweet peppers, and carrots) to brighten up the otherwise heavy dish.

I would recommend this place for those in Victoria and craving a good Italian meal with a charming atmosphere :).

Address: 515 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K7 Canada
Review:
This place offers an exceptional experience that encapsulates the essence of Italy within Victoria. Fiamo consistently delivers satisfying and flavorful dishes, making it a reliable choice for those seeking high-quality cuisine. During my recent visit, I had the pleasure of savoring their delectable chicken parmesan, which flawlessly embodies the essence of Italian gastronomy in every bite. The chicken was impeccably cooked, ensuring it remained moist, while the sauce boasted a delightful and irresistible flavor. My dining companion opted for the classic Italian-American dish of spaghetti and meatballs, which pays homage to the culinary traditions of Southern Italy. According to their assessment, Fiamo did justice to that particular region's cuisine.

However, the absolute standout of the evening was our server. While her name escapes me, her distinctive long blond hair will undoubtedly serve as a recognizable characteristic when you visit this esteemed establishment. She consistently exuded exceptional warmth and friendliness, going above and beyond to engage us in meaningful conversation and cater to our every need with remarkable attentiveness. Her unwavering positive attitude and radiant smile, which stretched from ear to ear, left an indelible impression on us. If you have a craving for authentic Italian cuisine, Fiamo is unequivocally the place to be!

Address: 515 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K7 Canada
Review: We ate dinner outside on a beautiful day. The evening can be chilly but we sat right under the heater. It was perfect! My husband had their beet salad and loved it. We shared some brussel sprouts and they were soooooo good...very crispy on the outside and very flavorful. We shared a pepperoni pizza and the meaty one (can't remember the name) Both were delicious but the meaty one had a nice spice to it. A great dinner to end the day.

Address: 515 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K7 Canada
Review: Fabulous dining experience. Having never been in Victoria, we combed through lots of reviews and dinner suggestions. Fiamo exceeded our best hopes. Everything from the very nice menu, quiet atmosphere, excellent wine list and outstanding specials made deciding on a choice a challenge. Fortunately, we had a top notch server in Leah to guide us every step of the way. Her wine choice was spot on, like all of her recommendations. We are only in town 2 nights, we may just have to go back. You will not be disappointed in this wonderful establishment.

Address: 515 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K7 Canada
Review: Service was great, but the charcuterie board was sad. ☹️It felt like they had transferred sliced meat from a Costco platter to a $28 cheese board. With all of the incredible local meets and cheese around, this platter missed the mark. Brussels sprouts were great though and I’ve been back since this original review - pumpkin ravioli is a hit!

Address: 530 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N6 Canada
Review: I've come here often and have ordered via skip to my home. I've always had amazing food experiences here. I have tried all the pizzas on the menu and quite a few of the monthly features. They have all been amazing. The staff have all been really amazing as well. Great service and great manager. Also, they have a patio behind the restaurant where we were to have our dog with us. Oh ya the ice cream is seriously awesome too.

Address: 530 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N6 Canada
Review: This is the best vegan pizza I’ve ever had! 🍕 They know what they’re doing and you can taste it! It was my first time here. I loved that they have huge booths in the main area and seats back in their garden patio. I decided to go for the classic Margherita pizza. The pizza was delicious and tasty. To be honest, you don’t really miss the dairy/cheese on the pizza. The pizza’s crust was amazing and not soggy at all. The service was good. Additionally,  I got the vanilla bean ice cream pint to go and it was phenomenal. All in all, I highly recommend Virtuous Pie and I shall return to try other pizzas and items off their menu. 💯

Address: 530 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N6 Canada
Review: Tasty Italian Salad (candied walnuts were the best) and detroit style pizza, service was quick and we had our choice of seating. Vegans and non-vegans will enjoy the delicious pizzas. Mocktails were fantastic!

Address: 530 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N6 Canada
Review: I've gone here numerous times for pizza (5⭐ btw), but tonight we stopped in for their vegan ice cream. Luckily Nic was serving us and talked us in to trying the ballpark popcorn. I actually said no first and they suggested I try a sample. Best decision ever. So good. Thanks for the exceptional service and unique ice cream. ❤️ (The raspberry cheesecake was also good but if you have both, eat it before the popcorn one!)

Address: 530 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N6 Canada
Review: Some of the best vegan food I’ve had and definitely the best vegan Mac and cheese. We had the Mac and cheese skillet, the stranger wings pizza (which was quite spicy) and the pesto cbr. The service was great and we highly recommend

Address: 199 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 1A2 Canada
Review:
The Bistro is in a great area next to the famous Dallas road, close to Ogden point. The service is ok, not bad, not great. The waiters just didn't seem to care much but were still polite. I had a Mac and Cheese and it was so bland that I was shocked 😲 I couldn't taste the cheese at all ???!!! So I can tell it's not real cheese but rather some kind of powdery cheese ( or fake cheese like Velveeta) and there was no salt at all 😑. For $13 and for the tiny quantity, I expected at least a regular Mac and Cheese. And how on earth can you be a Chef and mess up Mac and Cheese? 🤔

Only a cheesecake for desert... not even ice cream or a second option 😕

Overall, it is a place with so much potential, but just not there at all. They probably don't care since it's a tourist trap.

Address: 199 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 1A2 Canada
Review: Excellent food!! Friendly staff, wonderful atmosphere and vibe and of course a fabulous view. I wish they had more menu items and seating; it's a little pricey but that doesn't stop me from going back. Fish and chips are good and seafood chowder is also delicious. The cocktails are really good too. Highly recommend!

Address: 199 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 1A2 Canada
Review: This a great place to have dinner, coffee or desserts after a walk on Victoria s Dallas rd waterfront. Good menu selections at reasonable prices. Great nachos. Tonight we had a glass of Grafigna Malbec with chocolate tart.Mmmm. Personnel is very friendly. The view of the pier and the cruise boat terminal is very nice.

Address: 199 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 1A2 Canada
Review: The first place I ate when I visited Victoria for the first time two years ago. Excellent scenery, fantastic ocean view patio, delightful menu options and drinks. Now that I live here it’s become one of my favourite spots!

Address: 199 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 1A2 Canada
Review: Lovely place, feels like a dream. Drinking lavender cocktail in front of the blue ocean and snow mountain far away, it’s so unreal.

Address: 1025 Cook St Victoria, BC V8V 3Z7 Canada
Review:
I’ve been in this restaurant twice: once sat outside and once inside.
Pros: food is delicious and healthy,
Service is nice and friendly,
Decor and furniture is modern and relaxing colours,
Outside patio with heater,
Some beautiful and cute merchandise.

Con: there is something wrong with audio insulation of the restaurant that makes it very noisy. So if you need a cosy and quiet place that you can chat easily with friends, it’s better to sit outside.

Address: 1025 Cook St Victoria, BC V8V 3Z7 Canada
Review: Our friends have been urging us to try this place. But we had a ferry to catch and didn't want to be stuck downtown. However, after Google guided us to a less-than-appealing cafe in Christchurch, we decided that we might as well try Bear and Joey. I was dressed in sensible 'ferry-traveling-and-hiking' garb and we didn't have a reservation, the maître d' wasn't thrilled but seated us anyway. One of the original reason I hesitated in coming was the menu. But once we were there, the menu made a lot more sense and we actually had a hard time choosing. My weakness was breakfast sandwich, but at the last minute, I ordered the pork belly sandwich. My partner ordered the fresh toast, of course! We think this place should get a Michelin Star for sure. From ingredients to execution, the food was amazing. I usually only eat salad because it is healthy but actually hating it. But the Bear and Joey kohlrabi and picked cabbage salad was AMAZING, not boring at all. I couldn't stop eating it and finished the salad before attacking the fennel and orange pork belly sandwich. The bread was extra crusty which was quite enjoyable. The pork belly had enough fat to melt in my mouth. Consuming this was a wondering experience. There was a lot of 'mmm' sounds and smiles coming from across the table while my partner enjoyed the french toast. There was a lot more variety of fruit on the french toast that were not mentioned on the menu. If this place was in Vancouver, I imagine it might take us a while to get a reservation. Well done!

Address: 1025 Cook St Victoria, BC V8V 3Z7 Canada
Review:
The location is great. Patio is open, and has heaters. Service was great. Food was absolutely amazing ! Thanks to the server for the French toast recommendation. If you think you have had better French toast, you would be wrong. All their dishes are transformed. The flat whites are also better than the Bucks
Thank you for a wonderful experience 👍

Address: 1025 Cook St Victoria, BC V8V 3Z7 Canada
Review: We came for brunch on Mother's day and we had such a great experience! Food was amazing. Recommend the french toast... staff and owner very friendly... love the atmosphere and location.

Address: 1025 Cook St Victoria, BC V8V 3Z7 Canada
Review: I have eaten here multiple times with different groups of people (dine in and take out) and I’ve never had a bad experience. I’ve tried the bread pudding and it was really different since it was savory, but it was hands down the best item I’ve had there. I’ve also tried the French toast (photo below), the breakfast sandwich, and the salmon Benny which were all delicious. Their coffee is great and they have decaf options. The only reason I would not give this five stars is because it can be a little pricy.

Address: 146 Kingston Street Victoria, BC V8V 1V4 Canada
Review: Boy, were we happy! I am from Alberta and rarely get the best fresh seafood. I called last minute asking for a reservation, and they managed to fit us right in. Ordered the Crab Cakes and Halibut, and the lady got chicken. Everything was delicious, and we couldn't have asked for a perfect final date night on the island. I'm definitely coming back next holiday. Thank you!

Address: 146 Kingston Street Victoria, BC V8V 1V4 Canada
Review: We were staying near by while on vacation in Victoria and really wanted to have a seafood dinner, after reviewing a bunch of different places we decided on blue crab, the menu looked quite good and the restaurant offered really nice views of the local harbor. We started with an order of the chowder,  fresh oysters and a local Hazy IPA on tap. The chowder was quite nice and had a good broth with rich flavors,  my partner enjoyed the oysters but wasn't a huge fan of the in house hot sauce. As for mains I ordered the local Dungeness crab and my partner ordered the steamer pot. The crab was fairly good the legs were a decent size,  the head piece is just for show as they remove all material from the head, I enjoyed the crab but still wonder if I should have ordered the Alaskan crab legs. As for the steamer pot we found it to be sadly a bit on the average side the sauce was alright and the assortment of seafood didn't seem as fresh as other places we tried while in the area. The restaurant isn't too bad and the views are quite nice.  If your staying in the area for a few days give this place a try for dinner

Address: 146 Kingston Street Victoria, BC V8V 1V4 Canada
Review: The atmosphere was nice, staff were great. A tad on the expensive side if you were to compare other restaurants with the same quality of food and service.

Address: 146 Kingston Street Victoria, BC V8V 1V4 Canada
Review: Nice restaurant, with a really nice view. Food was nice. Servers were nice too. Remember to bring your paid parking ticket and they’ll take it off your bill as part of the service to guests.

Address: 146 Kingston Street Victoria, BC V8V 1V4 Canada
Review:
An amazing dining experience tonight!  After 11 years of visiting this outstanding restaurant   the dining and service  experience is still great!  The Dungeness Crab was PERFECTLY prepared and the chef's selection of seasonal offerings was superb.  Kudos to our server Dava, for het attentive and thoughtful service and advice,  and herknowledge of the ice wines and Ports inthe rsstaraunts  cellar.

An excellent dining experience supplemented  with knowledge, courtesy and attention to detail.  Thank you Blue Crab for a memorable dining experience!

Address: 500 Oswego Street Victoria, BC V8V 5C1 Canada
Review: Wonderful meal ... AGAIN!! The selections are always tasty and well presented.  Never disappointed and we were happy to bring two couples with us this time. The "first-timers" were as impressed with their selections as well.  There is an accessible washroom (single room) which I believe is part of the hotel.  Unfortunately, there are a few things that need to be improved to make it friendlier.  The hook mounted on the door is too high for someone in a wheelchair as is the towel dispenser which requires hand motion to activate it.  These things could be easily fixed by adding a lower coat hook and lowering the towel dispenser.  The room is a good size and the there is an assist bar mounted beside the toilet.

Address: 500 Oswego Street Victoria, BC V8V 5C1 Canada
Review: LOVE going to the Bar 500 for jazz nights. Its a cozy atmosphere and not too crowded. The menu is small and the food is delicious. Our only request/recommendation is to add a few monthly dining features to change things up a bit. We would come more often then. All in All, a GREAT venue.

Address: 500 Oswego Street Victoria, BC V8V 5C1 Canada
Review: Really enjoyed the pasta. Great texture on the noodles. Creative sauces and accompaniments. Tasty dessert. Wish the bread was grilled/warm. You can taste the quality of the ingredients and everything was well-made.

Address: 500 Oswego Street Victoria, BC V8V 5C1 Canada
Review: Excellent service and good food. Portions were on the smaller side for the prices but the food was creative and prepared well. We brought our dog and sat in the outdoor patio area.

Address: 500 Oswego Street Victoria, BC V8V 5C1 Canada
Review: We visited in the evening for the Dine around town menu.  The mushroom chowder was amazing and creamy.  We had the sablefish entree which consisted of outstanding different flavours.  I hope they consider adding the sablefish dinner to their permanent menu.

Address: 893 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H7 Canada
Review: Very nice little place, friendly staff, fast service, great food. We ordered the non-spicy Ocean on the Land for kids and Thai Spicy Green Curry Chicken for adults, both came out exactly how we liked! Fresh sea food, authentic Thai curry! Recommended!

Address: 893 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H7 Canada
Review:
This is really good Thai food for a fair price in the center of Victoria BC!
If you like Thai food?
This is the place to be!
Great service, excellent food, good price and delicious flavours.
Sookie always welcomes you with a smile.

There is a lot of choice.
And they also have their own spicy pepper sauce for 12,50.
Try it and buy it!
You can find it also in stores in Victoria.
The best!!

Address: 893 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H7 Canada
Review: We ordered 5 dishes, they looked great but all were too salty for us. But I love the atmosphere here.

Address: 893 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H7 Canada
Review:
Being in a relationship with a Thai partner presents a delightful challenge when it comes to finding Thai restaurants that evoke a sense of nostalgia and familiarity. Interestingly, this particular establishment effortlessly meets all of his stringent criteria. As he savored each bite, he couldn't help but wonder about the chef's background. To his astonishment, the chef hailed from China but had dedicated time to master his craft in the northern regions of Thailand, precisely where my partner originates. Such unexpected alignment only heightened his appreciation for the culinary offerings.

With utmost confidence, I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to those seeking an authentic Thai dining experience. The food itself is a testament to its genuineness, while the ambiance exudes a quintessential Thai atmosphere with whimsical touches that add a touch of enchantment. Furthermore, the staff's warmth and affability further enhance the overall dining experience. Rest assured, selecting this establishment will undoubtedly result in a memorable and gratifying culinary journey.

Address: 893 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H7 Canada
Review:
Wow!! Amazing quality of food and a really exotic palette of flavors… Thai food this good is hard to come by. Truly artesanal in craftsmanship both visually and in taste. Also, plentiful serving sizes!

The servers were nothing but friendly and had wonderful suggestions. The only complaint I had was that with menu offerings at these prices, it seems a bit gimmicky to charge extra for things like plain rice… while I understand charging for it, I think it should come with the larger curry dishes, especially considering the already steep pricing.

Nonetheless, a really memorable restaurant experience and this place is often packed to the tee - expect a long wait and come hungry!

Address: 239 Menzies Street Victoria, BC V8V 2G6 Canada
Review: A local hidden gem and one of my go-to sushi places. Delicious food with fair pricing and the staff are always considerate and friendly! I don't frequent the James Bay area much these days, but I will go out of my way to come here whenever I can.

Address: 239 Menzies Street Victoria, BC V8V 2G6 Canada
Review:
Great spot for quick food.
Very nice personnel and tasty food.
Miso soup is the same size as in combo.

Address: 239 Menzies Street Victoria, BC V8V 2G6 Canada
Review: Went their for a lunch date with my 5 year old and the lunch bento boxes were great quality and value. Sashimi and rolls were fresh and tasty, so were other items and the prices very reasonable. The only downside here is the place is quite small and doesn't have much seating but the service and food makes up for it :)

Address: 239 Menzies Street Victoria, BC V8V 2G6 Canada
Review: This was our granddaughter's first experience with sushi and the entire time was momentous! Excellent and courteous staff and delicious food!

Address: 239 Menzies Street Victoria, BC V8V 2G6 Canada
Review: I finally got around to trying sushi from Matsuri and it was amazing. Everything was freshly made (and you can taste the difference), the staff were wonderful, and the prices were fair. They have quite a variety of gluten free items which can be hard to find for sushi. They were also very knowledgeable and let me know what was and wasn't safe for celiacs. Definitely will be going back!

Address: 760 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review: I have been here so many times now and also ordered take-out many times as well. Absolutely love tacofinos tacos. My favorite is by far the yam taco and burrito. I love how crunchy the yam taco is all that cabbage and a very simple tasty dressing. Everything that I've eaten here has been amazing. This place is almost always busy, so come early or order ahead. Staff is always very friendly and helpful, and I also love the side pick-up window. Which is separate from the front till order area, so you dont have to wait in line with everyone who is ordering their meals. The one downside is where the till/order area is, it is a huge bottleneck and can be very crowded at times.

Address: 760 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
Incredible Tacos!
Found myself pulled here by my sister while visiting her this weekend. Popped in line (there often is a short line I hear), and had our order taken, then delivered shortly thereafter. A number tag and bottle of water with a cute blue cap is handed to me before we head to our table. The server recommended the crispy chicken taco. My sister swore to me that the steak taco was the best I’d ever have. The former was great, but the latter was indeed true. Get a steak taco.
Bonus points for local Phillips Brewery on tap. Modern aesthetic and low key vibe brought it all together.
Highly recommend checking this place out.

Address: 760 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
So damn good 🤤

Nice vibes in a convenient spot downtown for some killer Mexican food. The offerings might not be “authentic” but they’re reaaaaally good - get over it. Loved everything I had here, and even the margarita delivered! Hot sauces have my mouth-watering at the memory of them…

Definitely a spot I’ll be coming back to!

Address: 760 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
Eating at Tacofino on Canada day was a awesome experience!
It was my first visit & the employees created a terrific vibe. It was so keen to watch the employee prepare the burrito 🌯!  It was a very satisfying meal. Burrito was a bit messy to eat hence why napkins are in abundance.

I definitely will return to this restaurant.

Address: 760 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
1st time here. My favourite place in YYJ :)
The sirloin taco is amaaaaaaaazing so tasty :) Great service and staff!! Good music too!! Will be back to try some more! Reasonable price! Quality ingredients!

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: This restaurant offers stunning views of the water and city skyline. The food is absolutely delicious, with a menu that offers plenty of options to choose from. But what really sets this restaurant apart is the atmosphere - it's the perfect spot to catch up with friends over a meal and drinks. The staff are friendly and welcoming. Overall, I highly recommend checking out this restaurant for a memorable dining experience in Vancouver.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
I recently dined at Cactus Club Restaurant and wanted to share my thoughts. Although there was a delay in receiving our food, the staff was incredibly friendly and made us feel welcome throughout our visit. The restaurant itself had a great ambiance and provided a pleasant environment for our meal.
One area of improvement would be the selection of non-alcoholic drinks, which was somewhat limited. It would be nice to see a wider variety of options in that regard. On the other hand, I must commend the kitchen on the fantastic calamari. It was cooked to perfection and had a delicious flavor that left me wanting more.
However, I found the ravioli with shrimp to be a bit too sweet for my taste. While it may appeal to those who enjoy sweeter flavors, I personally would have preferred a more balanced taste.
Overall, my experience at Cactus Club Restaurant was positive, with the standout being the delightful calamari. Despite the minor setbacks, I would still recommend visiting for a friendly atmosphere and memorable dining experience.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
A very large restaurant with gorgeous views over the harbour! The staff was very kind and the food was great, though my chicken sandwich was better than the tofu bowl (which lacked sauce and was a bit dry). Really good fries! The cocktail menu was large and the cocktails themselves were very tasty, too.

While the views were lovely, the restaurant was VERY loud and it could be difficult to hear the person sitting across from you!

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: It’s not a fancy 5 star restaurant, but for what it is, it was awesome. I had salmon for dinner and it was delicious. I sat in the dining room with a water view. Most people wore sunglasses because the sun was bright and bold at 8pm at night! My waiter was awesome. I wish I remembered his name. It’s a crowed place, so make reservations early. They have outside eating and since it’s right on the water side, it’s a great place to take a stroll afterwards.

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: Great food, great environment/vibe, and reasonable prices. Food was a bit slow to come out and service was somewhat lacking, but overall I really enjoyed my evening there. A reservation ahead of time will make it much easier to get seated.

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: I came here last week for happy hour. The happy hour prices are reasonable. The food was good and came out pretty quick. Staff were friendly. Half of the outside patio was closed on a hot day so we had to sit inside but overall decent experience.

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
Came here with my partner during happy hour, we were really happy with the happy hour menu. The prices were reasonable for what we ordered and the service was great! We ordered the
blackened creole chicken, it was delicious. We loved the mashed potatoes that came with it. We also got the tuna poke bowl, it was fresh and all the ingredients worked super well together. Excited to come again!

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
The food was absolutely amazing, especially the delicious Avocado salad. I tried Baja Fish Tacos for they very first time and it was a little spicy but incredibly delicious.
Everything was perfect.

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: One of the only places not short staffed. What a pleasure, the food was amazing and they couldn't do enough for us

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
First off, Nicci our server was awesome. The drinks, appys and dinner was amazing.
Thank for a nice evening to help celebrate our 29th anniversary. When making our reservations it asked if it was a special occasion l, and it was put in that it was our anniversary, so we were bit disappointed that there was no mention of it.

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: The meals we ordered were awesome, but man, it took forever for our food to arrive. I was starving and totally forgot to snap a pic! 🤣 But hey, it was absolutely delicious, no complaints there. The restaurant had such a cool vibe, and my kids had a blast posing with all the animal decorations for pictures.

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: What a great spot for some breakfast! Welcoming staff, cozy atmosphere, great coffee and cappuccino, staff go above and beyond to accommodate customizations and time accommodations. All their shredded hash breakfasts are absolutely delicious and packed with nutrition, I personally ask for well done hash so it’s nice and sharp when they flip it over.

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review:
Came in for breakfast with a group of 11 and kids, we requested separate tables as we were going to pay separately, but they offered 1 big table together as they were quite empty. First issue, kids were not prioritized even though we mentioned that they were hungry and adult can wait. Server only took drinks order then prioritized smaller table to get their meal order as it will take short time to do so compared to our table regardless they were seated after us. Last thing was they added gratuity to our bill without prior information which left us no choice but to pay. That's was the main reason we wanted separate table and being charge for service that we considered not there.
Other than those issues that left us disappointed, food taste was incredible, freshly prepared ingredients with jam, sauce,everything taste amazing. Worth to visit for food only.

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: You definitely gotta try this out!! We knew this diner has a special history which I can tell why locals keep coming back. Mesmerizing decor and menu is extensive; it was hard to decide where to sit and what to order. We tried their delicious breakfast menu. Generous portion and we were so full that we needed to walk it out. The staff was humble and all their recommendations were spot on. Must try !!

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review:
This just may have been the best breakfast I've ever ordered at a restaurant. We ordered the berry waffles and the poutine benny and my oh my were they delicious. The contrast between the sweet and savory meals was delightful (my wife and I shared our meals). The waffles were honestly the best waffles I have ever eaten. Each bite nearly brought a tear to my eye from being so tasty. The only complaint is that I live about 1000 miles away from The Ruby 😞. This restaurant alone tempts me to uproot my family and move to Victoria just to eat breakfast here every week.

A side note, we were with our 17 month old baby and the staff was sooo kind and accommodating with him.

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: What a great find! Such great service, fun atmosphere and OMG the food!!! I think I have found a new breakfast favourite when in Victoria! A must try is the lavender latte! So many delicious dishes to choose from. We didn't see 1 unhappy customer while here and we loved every moment!

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: The service was fantastic, and food was incredible! Great place for the whole family even the wee ones! There's is something for everybody without a doubt! Going back for seconds real soon! Hope everyone enjoys some food, with family n friends! Enjoy

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: Tacos, chicken and waffles, duck hash and the meal or the day ! Very good, but a long wait. You must be patient if you want to come here, can take 30-40 min wait. But it has a nice sitting area. Good food though, was worth the wait.

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review:
What an awesome little gem hidden in plain sight, lol! Didn't have to wait too long for a table. Service was top notch, friendly, and prompt. I'm a Waffle 🧇/ Pancake 🥞 girl and The Ruby did not disappoint me. Caramelized bananas 🍌, roasted pecans and bourbon syrup, on top of a stack of mouth watering waffles 🧇. Hubby had an omelet with bacon 🥓, mushrooms 🍄, and cheese 🧀.
Thank you Ruby!!!! ✌️

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: Went here for brunch. The food was amazing & the portions were huge! The potatoes are the perfect crispy fluffy ratio. The duck just fell off the bone & the sauce that same with it paired perfectly well. Would definitely go back & recommended. Only downside is that it's small so not lots of seating, but still worth a visit. The staff were also helpful & friendly :)

Address: 556a Pandora Ave Pandora St. Victoria, BC V8W 1N7 Canada
Review: A quaint place with a few tables for unique Thai cuisines like pork belly and lemongrass chicken dumplings. Little buns stuffed with crispy chicken is a must-try. The delicious spicy sauce adds just the right heat.

Address: 556a Pandora Ave Pandora St. Victoria, BC V8W 1N7 Canada
Review:
Very polite staff, quick service. Ordered one order of pork belly dumplings & one special dumplings which was lemongrass chicken. The hot sauce they use is so overpowering I can't really taste the different between the actual flavor of the fillings in the two types of dumplings. Didn't know they were going to be served deep fried; has a very westernized spin on the dish. This is my fault for not doing research prior to walking in the establishment.

It's fine for a quick in and out appetizer, not filling for a meal at all.

Address: 556a Pandora Ave Pandora St. Victoria, BC V8W 1N7 Canada
Review: Decided to stop in here to grab a quick bite while exploring around Victoria. I'm glad we did, they had a great special that was dumplings and a beer and it was a warm day. We got the order of pork belly dumplings and the beer. I haven't really had dumplings like this before but my wife had, so I was pretty excited. This place didn't disappoint. The chili oil that was on these and gave them a pleasant kick. They were nice and full and cooked so nicely. They held their shape and they didn't get soggy. The filling was delicious and juicy. It was a great little shop with friendly people and a great special. I wish we could have bought some of the dumplings to take back with us, but we didn't have a cooler.

Address: 556a Pandora Ave Pandora St. Victoria, BC V8W 1N7 Canada
Review:
Ordered the chicken bao & chicken dumplings and they were delicious! The sauce served with both were just as good.

Only issue is the wait time for take out however the wait was worth it.

Address: 556a Pandora Ave Pandora St. Victoria, BC V8W 1N7 Canada
Review:
It was our first time at Dumpling Drop and will certainly not be the last! The dumplings and the chilli sauce were amazing. We came here for lunch we ordered the vegan dumplings and the Yuzu Brussels sprouts. Honestly, we weren’t expecting the dumplings to be fried but we really enjoyed them.

The dumplings were crunchy and packed with great flavours. This place is excellent for a quick stop and bite. In my opinion, it’s more of a take-out spot as there are limited seating inside but nonetheless, I appreciated the charm of this place. It’s cute and comfortable. They also had some cute Dumpling Drop Merch that you can buy. The hostess at the cashier was friendly and brought our foods quite fast once we ordered. Additionally, they have a large selection of frozen dumplings to buy and take home.

All in all, I’d come back again! I would totally recommend eating here and go for some appetizing dumplings 🥟

Address: 2656 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8T 4E4 Canada
Review: Overall great experience! Started with a condensed milk shaft that I absolutely loved and every dish that followed was great. I ordered the pork and the texture was perfect, very soft and dissolved in your mouth. The broccoli and the cheesecake were also super tasty. I ordered three dishes to share, one cheesecake, and one cookie and it was more than enough for two people so I recommend sharing. Service was great, we sat at the bar and they were very attentive and helpful when explaining portion size etc. I would definitely recommend this place!

Address: 2656 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8T 4E4 Canada
Review: This has got to be the best fried chicken sandwich I’ve ever had! It was juicy and crispy and the sauces were all finger licking good! The menu changes often too so I can’t wait to come back when it does!

Address: 2656 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8T 4E4 Canada
Review: Completely delicious with layered flavors. Wife said the cheese cake was true best she ever had. Treat your self.

Address: 2656 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8T 4E4 Canada
Review: Following the high rating on Google I made my way to this inconspicuous little gem in the Quadra Village of Victoria. It’s easy to pass it on the street so keep looking if you miss it first time. The food is some of the best I’ve ever tasted. I got there in time for happy hour and tasted two amazing appetizers for $8 total. One was made from only chickpea flour and deep fried to perfection served with a delicious spicy sauce. The second delicious piece was grilled pork belly. The flavour was fabulous. I ordered the Kalettes veggie main course and again the flavours didn’t disappoint. Rich and unusual while being amazing. My server strongly recommended the chocolate dessert which I cannot say enough about. It was sweet, salty, creamy and decadent without being overpowering. Overall the meal was 5 star. The vibe of the place is calm and smooth while being friendly and relaxed. I will definitely be back.

Address: 2656 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8T 4E4 Canada
Review: Delicious food with an intimate atmosphere. The Kamut chicken slider and the wasabi fries were unexpected highlights. There definitely were more blistered peppers in two orders than four people could tackle, so I’d start with one order next time. The pork belly bite had amazing flavours but was more of a jerky than other pork belly dishes I’ve had before. The Parisian gnocchi main was delicious but extremely heavy - we thought it might have been deep fried. Fun little place for a girls night out.

Address: 944 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: Absolutely incredible meal - from service, to atmosphere, to quality of the fare. We had the lamb, fish of the day, steak, and cured meats (which are made in house), and cheeses. Everything was fresh, well balanced, and very flavourful. One of our new favourite staples in Victoria

Address: 944 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review:
No surprise that the food and service was amazing. A medium sized menu with a nice variety of choices. Most have the option to get half portions so you try a few different dishes easily enough. I assumed the full portion would be smaller due to being a fancy joint but it was very filling.

I had the pork cutlet which was mouth watering. I tried the beat salad and carbonara pasta as well - both amazing.

The only thing to complain about, and you can probably tell from the photos, is the lighting! If it's so dark your wait staff carry flashlights to read the menu... It's probably too dark.

Would be happy to return!

Address: 944 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: My husband and I enjoyed several beautiful meals at Cafe Brio when we lived in Victoria 15 years ago. While visiting the island this past weekend we decided to go back. This place remains just as exceptional as we remember. The food and wine is outstanding, the atmosphere is perfectly moody and interesting, but it's the service that really sets it apart. It truly feels like every staff member is committed to making your experience great. Our favourite restaurant in Victoria. We will be back again and again.

Address: 944 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: Reservations recommended. Went with the brio family style shared dinner @ $67 per person, chef’s choice, 6 dishes overall. Since it’s random, I’ll speak to what we were served: clam chowder cup (meh, soup on the lighter side, New England style). Romaine lettuce salad (ok, garnished with crumbs, garlic, sharp cheese) charcuterie board with pate (good), bresaola (good) rabbit terrine (delicious) sausage (good). Mains: gnocchi (good) duck with beets (yum) fish with pancetta(?) and fingerling potatoes (yum). Party of 4 + bottle of wine = $380 not including tips. Overall, I’d stick with ordering charcuterie + individual mains, though the variety was nice. Service…our waitress was good though didn’t bring the requested balsamic vinegar and olive oil.

Address: 944 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: This place was great. The atmosphere perfect. The bartender was friendly and made my friend a custom drink. The boards are delicious…the duck with the Brie and quince jelly was a 10/10 combo. My only regret was not getting the bartender’s name to put in the review because he was both authentic and kind.

Address: 769 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1G9 Canada
Review: We had steamed rock fish and eggplant with ground pork. Both are very authentic and tasty. Service was very good and got good recommendations. We highly recommend this place!

Address: 769 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1G9 Canada
Review: What a wonderful surprise ❣️. Fantastic tasty fresh food, of good proportions, cooked by a 30 year experienced Beijing chef.  Service was fabulous, with a very humble, kind, gracious, friendly and gentle server.  Didn’t have to wait at all for food to be prepared hot and fresh, even though they were busy with a constant stream of online delivery orders, and dine-in patrons. Humble environment, which only makes the experience more of an amazing meal. $$$

Address: 769 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1G9 Canada
Review: Amazing food and service. The special fish is so unique and tasty. I really recommend it.

Address: 769 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1G9 Canada
Review:
Good service. But the food was done incorrectly. Some dish done with wrong sauce, or cut vegetable in a wrong way that completely not washed, or meat under cooked.

According to the  menu, some dishes are pro-level and not regular home chief can handle. But the food we got today is not up to average chinese parent level.

The food quality is hard to justify these high score reviews, maybe something went wrong with their chief or management.

Address: 769 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1G9 Canada
Review: Awesome Chinese restaurant with authentic food from North East China. Love the dumplings and steamed fish!

Address: 911 Yates Street Suite 180 Victoria, BC V8V 4X3 Canada
Review:
Can’t tell enough how good this place is. The burger is half price after 9 pm with drink purchased such a good deal! Kids friendly restaurant with kids menu.
We always take kids for the kid’s meal and treat ourselves to beer and burger. Even with their regular price is still worth it! I love the Tuna burger “off the hook” it’s so yummy. My husband loves their Big Dipper burger with Wagyu beef.
The after 9 deal you have to be there and put your name in the waitlist….wait to get in….wait for burgers…end up you gotta be there for at least more than an hour…. It’s good when you go hang out I’m with friend. Not suggest yo ho with kids for late night deal!

Address: 911 Yates Street Suite 180 Victoria, BC V8V 4X3 Canada
Review: I had a very disappointing first experience with the food. I wanted to come back for happy hour and enjoy the outdoor terrace with my dog ​​(service dog). The waitress didn't want my dog ​​to go on the Patio! It's the only patio in town where your dog (service dog or not) is not welcome, I won't set foot here again, as much for the welcome, the service as the food! I do not recommend this establishment at all.

Address: 911 Yates Street Suite 180 Victoria, BC V8V 4X3 Canada
Review:
Amazing burger!!  #59, being bison and chorizo, with lots of goodies on it.  Onion rings were great.  Chicken and waffle chef's special ordered by my spouse was very, very good.
I LOVE THIS PLACE!😄😄

Address: 911 Yates Street Suite 180 Victoria, BC V8V 4X3 Canada
Review:
Visiting from the lower mainland. Got the “spender” burger with half side salad (pralines and blue cheese) and bin 4 fries…

Absolutely awesome. So many flavours and couldn’t be more impressed. The fact that you can get a gourmet side salad with this burger is impressive. The burger itself was great. Fresh vegetables and tasty meat.
Moist and delicious. We also tried the red onion rings. Very good also.  Impressive amount of options. My wife had the Ahi tuna burger which she loved. I would highly recommend you try this restaurant.

Address: 911 Yates Street Suite 180 Victoria, BC V8V 4X3 Canada
Review:
Ordered the "Black and Blue" burger w/potato crisps, and jalapeno dip (this dip is awesome!).
- you may need an extra napkin, burgers kinda a messy.
- use knife and fork to finish of the last morsel, burger falls apart towards the end.

Staff was friendly, professional, and responsive. Still, were not obtrusive; I appreciated that.

COVID protocols in place and not arduous; respectfully requested my contact details.

My fourth visit to this location; my best burger choice to date.

Address: 1414 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G1 Canada
Review: We had such a nice night.  We came for a comedy night and while we had to buy tickets they were very reasonably priced.  The food was pretty good, drinks were good too.  I ordered a cocktail I didn't like and they happily exchanged it for another.  The atmosphere and service were awesome.  Great job The Mint team with Ok, Dope.

Address: 1414 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G1 Canada
Review:
I recently dined at The Mint in downtown Victoria and I must say, I was thoroughly impressed! The guest skills of the staff were exceptional and made me feel welcome and appreciated from the moment I walked in. 👍👏

As for the food, I highly recommend the tofu dish - it was simply delicious! 🌱🍲 The dish was perfectly cooked and had a nice blend of flavors that left me wanting more. The chef truly knows how to work their magic in the kitchen. 🤤

The ambiance of the restaurant is also worth mentioning - it was cozy, warm, and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a night out with friends or a romantic dinner. 🕯️❤️

Overall, I highly recommend The Mint to anyone looking for an exceptional dining experience in downtown Victoria. With friendly and attentive guest skills and mouth-watering dishes like the tofu, it's a must-visit destination for foodies and those seeking a memorable night out. 🍽️👌

Address: 1414 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G1 Canada
Review: Really nice ambience and lovely vibe. Especially love the convenience of the location and characterful entrance! Nonetheless, nothing stood out to me when it came to food or drinks. Quite overpriced for what it turned out to be, in my opinion. But kuddos to the lovely staff who work here who were nothing but kind to us!

Address: 1414 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G1 Canada
Review: Food was very presentable but hard to order with unusual (to me) names. The drinks were amazing

Address: 1414 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G1 Canada
Review:
Imagine this: it's a Friday night at 11pm - and as much as Victoria is a cute town, there really isn't that many places to get any food late night that isn't fast food or pizza.

Enter The Mint. A full curry menu through late night!! Incredible. Ordered the lamb curry plate and it was delicious.

Address: 614 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2H4 Canada
Review:
I’ve been to this place a few times already and enjoyed every one of my visit. It is extremely busy so I highly recommend you make reservations ahead of time. You likely won’t be able to get in without reservation because you have to go thru security like the airport and they won’t even open the locked door if you don’t have reservation.

The menu items are plentiful with a wide range of choices to satisfy all different dietary needs. The price is also cheap compare to other restaurants. The staff there were all very nice and accommodating. The building itself has over a hundred years of history. Inside the restaurant they have some rather interesting old photos hanging on the wall. Make sure you ask the staff there about some of the more unique photos.

Address: 614 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2H4 Canada
Review: Service was pretty slow, but the wait is worth it. The food is excellent and the prices are more than reasonable. Definitely get reservations ahead of time. They do not accept Discover or American Express cards for payment. This information was not available to me ahead of time. Be advised that you need to go through security screening and surrender your identification card while you eat.

Address: 614 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2H4 Canada
Review:
Best kept secret in Victoria. Reservation recommended.

The food was excellent, and the service was amazing. Great food and low prices. What more could you ask for.

We went there for lunch one day and breakfast another day. Both meals were perfect and under $20.

Be sure you plan extra time to walk around the building and see all the beautiful stained glass windows.

Address: 614 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2H4 Canada
Review: I had breakfast there a couple of days ago while visiting visiting Victoria. Both the food and service (so professional!) were very good. Prices were extremely reasonable - excellent value!  I wish there were more places like that. It’s nice to sit at a table with proper tablecloth and special tableware designed specially for them. It was a lovely experience.

Address: 614 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2H4 Canada
Review:
Wonderful food, reasonable prices, and a great location. I had Scotch Eggs and Mushroom and Onion soup. The Scotch Eggs were mildly spicy, crispy on the outside, gooey yolks on the inside (the way I like them). The Mushroom Onion soup was creamy and gently spiced. Service was friendly and fast. Reservations recommended. White tablecloths and napkins.

Will definitely return next time I'm in town.

Address: 536 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K8 Canada
Review: Really enjoyed the tapas experience. It is wonderful having so many different types of food. All the dishes were really delicious and  very different. The service was very good and the atmosphere  was interesting. The one thing that  they need to do is  get more  comfortable chairs.  I will be back to try try some more dishes.

Address: 536 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K8 Canada
Review: This place is a gem. It's intimate and cozy with a beautiful dark ceiling, brick walls and old Victoria charm. The staff are lovely. The food is really good. I enjoyed a cocktail and a glass of red wine. I was able to ask for differences between wines to make a great choice. The food specials were tasty. They work around allergies. I'm happy here!

Address: 536 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K8 Canada
Review: Without question the most incredible dining experiences I have had. We did the tapas for two and WOW!!!! 9 courses of tapas so bring your appetite. The variety is just amazing, and you just cant miss the warm bacon wrapped dates, in fact we ate those before we remembered to take a photo. they have a happy hour a great selection of drinks and its a nice atmosphere. I will never visit Victoria again without coming here for a meal. The Tapas for 2 is a great value as well in my opinion. Highly recommend coming here.

Address: 536 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K8 Canada
Review: Super COVID friendly and insanely delicious. We ordered basically the whole menu plus cocktails and wine and paid less than $150 for an epic feast for 2 people. Extremely yummy + highly recommended.

Address: 536 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K8 Canada
Review: Food was very good, highly recommend. Service was very quick. Lovely atmosphere and decor.

Address: 768 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z1 Canada
Review: What a great, quirky little spot for drinks. The name makes sense. It's a dark, cool spot downstairs and is totally like a cenote. It was recommended by a bartender in the city for good cocktails and a relaxed vibe and they were right. We had such a great time and the bartenders made great drinks for us. Some classics and a few custom cocktails. Inexpensive as well which is always a bonus. We didn't eat so we can't comment on the food but the menu looked super fun.

Address: 768 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z1 Canada
Review:
The house salad was under-dressed/dry with little flavour. The baked brie, bread, jam, olives and roasted garlic was all delicious but wasn’t exactly made to be eaten together.

Appreciated the gluten free bread option but likely wouldn’t go back.

Address: 768 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z1 Canada
Review: This is a fabulous hole in the wall for small plates to share and unique drink specials. My favorite lately is their double gin and tonic (especially happy hour). Good non-alcoholic options available too!

Address: 768 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z1 Canada
Review: Cozy little bar tucked away under the stairs in the heart of downtown. tasty cocktails and great atmosphere. Jess was our server and she went above and beyond to make sure we're having a great time. Great place for a date or to catch up with a friend.

Address: 768 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z1 Canada
Review:
Friendly staff, delicious food, large portions, and reasonable prices. All the things you’ll find at Cenote.

The interior is cozy and makes for a great place to get together with friends for an after work drink and dinner.

Their hotdogs are a delicious option for lunch as well. Lots of tables, large space and well laid out.

Food was served quickly. Drinks were topped up reasonably.

Definitely recommend and will return.

Address: Market Square 140-156 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: Truly a hidden gem in Victoria. As an Indonesian, this place is quite authentic but the menu is pretty limited. Everything was prepared skillfully and incredibly tasty. A bit of warning for those who has a low heat tolerance, everything is a tad spicy. I will definitely be back next time I’m in Victoria.

Address: Market Square 140-156 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
Has to be my favourite
Food in Victoria so far! It tasted amazing but it’s very spicy! We had the green curry and the spicy hard boiled egg dish and wow… we will be coming back soon!!! Good prices (13-20$/dish)and great location. The owner/cook is very kind too! I would recommend to anyone

Address: Market Square 140-156 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: Good indonesian dishes. Green Cury w/ Prawn is a Lodeh dish, yummy. My son had a Chicken Satay, he loves it. Gado2 Wrap is good as well (picture attached). Look for previous review for parking guide if you come here just for Ayo Eat like myself. The place is facing inside of the entire building. 2nd floor. Eat anywhere on the open courtyard bottom floor. TY Chef Bana for good dishes. PS: You can add any extra meat, extra egg, just tell the chef. Cheers Mate !

Address: Market Square 140-156 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: The best meal I've had while visiting Victoria. I took the spring roll and satay chicken. They were absolutely amazing. Very flavorful. The included rice was out of this world. 100% recommend this hidden gem.

Address: Market Square 140-156 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
I really like this place.
Delicious meal, reasonable price, the owner is super nice, good atmosphere.
They can get busy quite quickly around lunchtime, I recommend planning ahead

Address: 680 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C9 Canada
Review:
I really enjoyed this place. Very authentic, with a nice family run vibe. Food was healthy and delicious, plus the little buns served with the dish were exceptional.

Well worth a visit

Address: 680 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C9 Canada
Review:
Love it, love it, love it! I have been a regular customer here for the last 5 years and came with different friends - we were never disappointed!

I love pork momos  - so delicious!

Their meat is supplied by local island farms. All curries are cooked with cream of cashew, are gluten free an dairy free.

Nice calming atmosphere. Dalai Lama’ quotes on the walls are a very nice touch.

Next to a lot of parking spots - never had an issue.

The staff is always friendly and attentive.

Address: 680 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C9 Canada
Review:
Pathetic experience, no water asked, no cutlery given - you would have to stand up and go to their plates section to get cutlery.
Asked for momo- they present you a plate of oil and that to broken and raw pieces.
In reply you get an feedback- that’s how it is.

Address: 680 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C9 Canada
Review:
