Tried calling to the restaurant to make an advance order before stopping by at noon; got answering machine stating closed dates for Dec 2021 🤯 which is weird for a first time customer in late Oct 2022? Didn't leave a message figuring it probably won't make too much of a difference. Not going to bother with delivery services as nowadays it costs way more to use them when my temp job is one block away.

Came in, server is quite prompt taking my order as soon as she took orders from customers before me which is fair. Food came in reasonable time considering it looks like one server & one cook in the establishment. I could have done takeout but like the unique ambiance of the place & wanted to try a dine in lunch experience.

Lunch lamb curry was amazing, packed a delicious punch in flavor. Medium spice heat I ordered is quite up there & was close to my level limit; wondered how spicy hot is?

(I'm laughing mentally because my ex-boyfriend with absolute zero heat tolerance would not thrive unless the restaurant offers a zero heat option?) On a serious note, if anyone has a severe lack of spicy heat tolerance, please triple check with the server upon ordering.

Server was free enough to walk around with a water pitcher but never stopped by to check upon me for first taste or anything else. 😭 Did tell her when I walked to the till to get my bill to pay about compliments to the chef & my gratitude for the tasty & filling meal that was obviously made with humble TLC.

The meal is a real winner, good value, & the spice did well to clear my nasal congestion & nagging post-common cold cough. Definitely will become my go to lunch spot whenever I neglect to pack a filling meal to work & will recommend for dinners too.

Address: 680 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C9 Canada
Review:
Prepare to be dazzled by the unforgettable experience at the Tibetan Kitchen Cafe! From the moment you step foot inside, you'll be transported to the enchanting streets of Lhasa. The alluring aromas and authentic flavors will awaken your senses and evoke cherished memories of Tibetan cuisine.

The culinary journey begins with a symphony of flavors that dance harmoniously on your palate. Each dish is a masterpiece, carefully crafted to capture the essence of traditional Tibetan fare. I haven't encountered such delectable Tibetan food that closely resembles what you'd savor within the country itself. It's a true culinary revelation!

But hold on, it gets even better! The exceptional service provided by the wait staff adds an extra touch of brilliance to the entire experience. During our visit for a delightful lunch, my dining companion, who was new to Tibetan cuisine, was guided through the menu with such grace and expertise. The attentive server patiently explained each dish, ensuring he made an educated selection that perfectly suited his preferences.

The lamb curry was a revelation - an explosion of flavors that left us craving for more. In fact, my dining companion enjoyed it so much that he couldn't resist requesting a second bowl of rice to savor every last drop of the exquisite sauce.

As for my choice, the Tiger Prawn Shaptak, it was a divine revelation. Each succulent prawn was generously coated in a tantalizing blend of spices that delighted my taste buds with every single bite. The dish was an impeccable balance of bold and harmonious flavors.

While we didn't try the various flavored momos ourselves, we couldn't help but notice the blissful expressions on the faces of fellow diners as they savored these delicate treats. Their joyous reactions were a testament to the sheer magnificence of Tibetan Kitchen Cafe's culinary offerings.

If you crave a thrilling dining adventure with a spicy foreign flare, Tibetan Kitchen Cafe is an absolute must-visit destination. The authenticity, warmth, and richness of the experience will leave you with lasting memories and a desire to return for more. So don't hesitate - embark on this gastronomic voyage and be enchanted by the magic of Tibetan cuisine.

Address: 1234 S Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review:
A place that DOESN'T serve French fries!!

And I enjoyed my visit!

Highlights:
Reasonable prices
Nice patio view
Dog friendly patio
Pretty tasty food
Roomy, Accessible washrooms

Consider:
Could get busy because of the nice location if pursuing patio seating
Fewer washrooms

Friends and I went on a Sunday, at noon- it opens at noon, and we had no problem grabbing a table for four. The menu is a good size- definitely give it a look. Two of my friends got the nachos- with added protein. They usually like their nachos over-done, and my friends were pleased with their food. I had a bite of nachos with the added chicken- I highly recommend that, for sharing or solo! The chicken was quite reasonably sprinkled over the nachos with some love, not just lightly. It was tasty, not too salty for me.

Now please excuse my photos- the blue umbrella really adds a colour filter, and everything looks so blue! I had potato salad as a side to my chicken wings- it was a normal potato salad. Absolutely enjoyed the Louie Blue flavour of the wings though, which had a very slight heat- my friend that is sensitive to spicy flavors could tolerate it well. It was very flavourful. My only complaint (all comes down to preference?) Is that the generous and lovely sauce removed the crispness of the chicken wings. But the sauce made it up for the lack of crisp. Server was wonderful, able to check in on us as the customers started arriving more and more.

I would come again, to sample the pizza- it looked appetizing!

Address: 1234 S Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: Had the prawns with coconut curry and it was the best. Our waitress was amazing. So helpful and knowledgeable. She understood celiac disease and cheerfully told us they have a designated fryer! Parking was right next to it and so easy to pay.

Address: 1234 S Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: Delicious food, awesome staff and views! When we went for dinner here, they were short staffed and yet the staff were friendly and kept things moving. A very enjoyable dinner!

Address: 1234 S Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: The nachos were simply delicious and hearty. Very friendly service but took a little extra time to order and get food. Dog friendly!  It overlooks the harbour. Delicious cocktails- the orange margarita was great!

Address: 1234 S Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: Artisan-style pizza and lots of choice of pizzas, great views of the water - we even saw a seal whilst we were eating! We had the mushroom pizza which was delicious and the servers were very friendly and accommodating. Four stars only because the food was a little slow and the ambience inside was slightly dingy.

Address: 609 Yates St Victoria, BC V8W 1L1 Canada
Review: Very much enjoyed a recent visit and service. Odd that they ran out of white wine (early) that night.  Somewhat disappointed by inconsistent sear on pierogies and extremely tough exterior to otherwise tasty meatballs (maybe intentional?). Sauerkraut bland (I've actually made better at home). Apparently we missed news of the sour cream shortage; we were allotted a few thimbles full.  Confusing menu; many ways to order the same thing but at different prices.  Pierogi flavors very successful. Caesar cocktail very good.

Address: 609 Yates St Victoria, BC V8W 1L1 Canada
Review: Great poutine (we got the Basic Bee - loved it!). Had the pierogi sampler and loved trying the different flavors. Fun classic bar ambience.

Address: 609 Yates St Victoria, BC V8W 1L1 Canada
Review:
Ordered the Pierogi Sampler, Dude Where's My Diner?, Pierogi Poutine, Borscht, and the Hulk Smash Pierogis. Every single bite of all the dishes was fantastic.

The pierogi sampler was delicious, a little bit of everything for the indecisive or curious, like myself. The hulk smash pierogis were so tasty I had to order more! A little spice with every bite

Dude where's my diner? was everything French toast, buffalo chicken, pierogis could be. The bacon confit was a beautiful touch, the cream cheese complimented everything nicely, and the jalapeño-bacon chutney tied it all together. I cannot say enough good things about this dish

The borscht was to die for. It was rich and smooth, the cabbage and beets played beautifully together and every bite was a treat.

Finally, the poutine was also very good

I highly recommend a stop here for whatever tickles your fancy!! My only complaint was sold out hats! I was very much looking forward to being a tourist and promoting my favorite pierogi bar! Oh well, this works too!!

Address: 609 Yates St Victoria, BC V8W 1L1 Canada
Review: First time at this restaurant - the perogies were delicious as well as the Sulty meatballs - the beet & kale salad was ok as the beets were a tad on the hard side. Definitely enjoyed the drinks!  Will be coming back to try other items - good value for the money.

Address: 609 Yates St Victoria, BC V8W 1L1 Canada
Review: Quick good service. The food was good. We got the tin tater poutine large in size to share. 2 of us.  It was the perfect size.

Address: 620 Trounce Alley Victoria, BC V8W 1K3 Canada
Review: We had dinner there and we had no regret about it. Food was delicious specially the pasta was a pleasure. The service was so nice. Definitely a must go at Victoria Island.

Address: 620 Trounce Alley Victoria, BC V8W 1K3 Canada
Review:
Starting off with the appetizer of Papas Bravas was okay, the tomato sauce was slightly a bit too much and the potatoes weren’t as fried to standard, so it wasn’t quite crispy. The Fritos was really really good (highly recommend); especially the fried Jicama was a unique touch. The Moroccan chicken was good (nothing special though, slightly bland chicken). This chicken dish had couscous base was well done and seasoned. The gambas con coco  came
with focaccia, it was a 7/10 (good), the sauce was delicious.

Address: 620 Trounce Alley Victoria, BC V8W 1K3 Canada
Review: Had a divine time here. My partner and I shared the tapa platter for two and it was the perfect amount of food. We left feeling refreshed and satiated..the service was equally as good, as were the drinks. Definitely would recommend this spot for a delicious Spanish meal!

Address: 620 Trounce Alley Victoria, BC V8W 1K3 Canada
Review: On recommendation from front desk at our hotel, decided to go to the Tapa Bar, Saturday late afternoon.    Sat at the bar,  had drinks and an appetizer.  Bartender was a very attentive lady; friendly and professional.   Had such a fun time decided to have dinner there on Sunday. Had margarita pziza and chicken cubanette.  Both very tasty.  Drinks as well.  Fun spot to enjoy a drink and some food!

Address: 620 Trounce Alley Victoria, BC V8W 1K3 Canada
Review:
Trounce alley is a neat little evening destination.  Tapa Bar was buzzing this Saturday evening.  There were even diners sitting in the patio.  Music was loud but not too much that you can’t have a conversation, the lighting was pleasantly dim to set the ambiance, fire will from time to time light up the corner in the open kitchen, and there was a candle in each table.
Our host and server were very friendly and made you feel at ease, all around good vibes with the staff.
We ordered the papás with both sauces, the mixed olives with focaccia, the fried fish bites and the roasted eggplant in marinara.
Also had a nice Spanish beer to wash it down.  Everything was on point and delicious.  The four tapas were enough for the 2 of us to share this evening.
Would go there again to try the other dishes and the desserts!

Address: Market Square 1435 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
I had a rare Monday off and we happened to be downtown so we popped in here for brunch. I'd heard good things and my expectations were exceeded. From the friendly attentive service, fresh coffee and timely refills, helpful menu recommendations. Everything sounded so good. We finally narrowed down our choices. My wife had the Fuego Benny and I went with the Fried Chicken and Cornbread French Toast with side of blueberry coulis.
The flavours and textures and presentation are spot on.
It was all just so good and we left happy and very full.
Special thanks to our server Michelle for excellent service.
Can't wait to come back!

Address: Market Square 1435 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
I decided to try the harvest breakfast and it did not disappoint! It was a tasty dish with a hint of spice that gave it an extra kick. I also loved the homemade salsa sauce - it was so good that I ended up buying a bottle to take home with me.

The service was also very friendly and fast. The atmosphere of the restaurant was cozy and welcoming, and it was right next to the sea which.

For dessert, I decided to try the churros pancakes which were simply delicious. However, I must say that they were a bit too sweet for my taste.

Additionally, there were plenty of parking spots available right in front of the restaurant which made it very convenient. Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a tasty breakfast with a great view and friendly service.

Address: Market Square 1435 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: Very few Mexican restaurants have the right touch and atmosphere. This is an incredible gem right on Victoria harbour. Food is amazing and the decor is fantastic with priceless huge posters of the Mexican revolution and old town feel.  I always come when I visit Victoria. Try the Divorciados eggs and corn bread. They are superb!

Address: Market Square 1435 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: Great place. The food was excellent. They have a really cool courtyard in the back. The food was very filling and tasty. The breakfast burrito was amazing. The staff seemed a bit annoyed and short with us. Otherwise it would have been a 5 star rating.

Address: Market Square 1435 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: Amazing food. I got the chiliqueles which pulled pork. Sooo good. Had to try the cornbread which was fantastic. Great overall dining experience. I'm coming back for the chimichanga

Address: 1200 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Y3 Canada
Review:
Ordered the Cod Fish & Chips, Crab Bisque, and Shepherd's Pie, only one was worth writing home about. The fish & chips was a large portion, but, the batter was very greasy and the fries were soggy. The fish itself was decent, but the subpar batter was disappointing to say the least. The shepherd's pie was a little overpriced, all things considered. While it was okay, it wasn't very memorable; it felt thrown together and rushed. However, the crab bisque and included bread were absolutely incredible. The bisque itself was rich and creamy, little pieces of crab floating around, it had a nice kick to it and overall was very good.

The service was very good considering how busy they were, and the atmosphere was also very inviting and comfortable. However, all together, I wouldn't necessarily recommend coming here. It was okay for a one time experience, but wouldn't return.

Address: 1200 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Y3 Canada
Review:
I had the Shepherd’s Pie here for about 22 CAD. It tasted pretty good, I just wish the portion size was a little larger.

Men’s bathroom could be cleaned better, water and toilet paper was strewn all over the floor. I don’t know if this is a normal pub thing or not considering I can’t drink in most countries yet. Other than that I quite liked the interior of the restaurant.

Service was great, a waiter came to check on us during the meal and we didn’t have to wait long to get the bill.  All in all, I might come back when I visit Victoria again.

Address: 1200 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Y3 Canada
Review: Loved everything about this place! The food was delicious, the service was outstanding, and it's in a cool historic building. I had the poutine and Times salad, both were great. Our server was incredibly friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this pub!

Address: 1200 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Y3 Canada
Review:
Irish man visiting Victoria, had Guinness and a breakfast.

Our server Megan was so so nice and genuine, made us feel right at home!

I must say the breakfast was pretty close to what we make back home, and the hash browns are the best I’ve had possibly ever. Only flaw… not enough black pudding!

Address: 1200 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Y3 Canada
Review: Mid-afternoon stop, and just the ticket. Fun spot to hang for a while and recharge the batteries. By that, I mean enjoying a Guinness! Though we did not eat during this visit, very inviting looking food serving trays passed us by often, held aloft as they were hefted up from the cellar kitchen. Lost count of all the smartly uniformed staff working here - bartender (female) was very sharp and attentive but left us alone doing our thing. Huge selection of spirits and drafts.  Will be back!

Address: 1010 Yates Street Suite 1 Victoria, BC V8V 3M6 Canada
Review:
Conveniently located, this establishment offers delicious food and a friendly staff.

While there was a minor issue with finding a hair in my sister’s drink, they promptly replaced it, demonstrating thoughtfulness. However, they didn’t remove it from the bill as a gesture.

Overall, the ambiance and service were good.

If you’re visiting Victoria, it’s worth a try, but be cautious about the hair incident.😉

Address: 1010 Yates Street Suite 1 Victoria, BC V8V 3M6 Canada
Review: Being a chain restaurant, I really didn't have high expectations. I was very pleasantly surprised by the whole experience! Nice clean atmosphere, great wait staff, and surprisingly delicious food. I had the spicy chicken sandwich with truffle fries, and would definitely come back again for more. Is it the most unique restaurant I've ever been to? No. But the consistency of food and service would certainly bring me back again!

Address: 1010 Yates Street Suite 1 Victoria, BC V8V 3M6 Canada
Review: I've only been here once so far. I was a fairly warm day, so it was nice to find a beautiful patio to have some drinks and eats. I would strongly suggest sitting in the oudoor patio area. It is totally secluded from the street, can't really see or hear the street noise. The food was also very good, and the customer service was very good and attentive. Would definitely go back, just to hang out on the patio...what a gem.

Address: 1010 Yates Street Suite 1 Victoria, BC V8V 3M6 Canada
Review: After a very successful first experience in this restaurant for dinner, I reiterated my experience with a delicious cocktail (passion fruit mai tai) which, moreover, was really cheaper and better than elsewhere! I really recommend this place, the interior is pretty and comfortable, the outdoor patio accepts dogs but it is also really pleasant since it is half sunny, half shaded and also has a sofa and trendy music! 😎😍

Address: 1010 Yates Street Suite 1 Victoria, BC V8V 3M6 Canada
Review:
Ordered off a deliver app and the ribs I got were a bit dry. I called moxies and asked if anything could be done. They gave me a few options and remade my meal. It’s delicious and the ribs are perfect!

They went above and beyond with their customer service and even added a brownie bite I was not expecting.

Thank you moxies for the great customer service and really good food! I will be back :)

Address: 435 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T4 Canada
Review:
Firstly, this place is located in a nice quiet neighbourhood.  Bathrooms are clean and space is very bright.   There’s also a patio that’s great for a summer day.

Food - had potential and looked very pleasing at first but was over cooked and lacked taste.  Potatoes and fries felt it was warmed up.

And finally service - well, our server when they finally came was fine.  I have to admit I felt I was inconveniencing them by asking for a menu after sitting down for 10 min was.

Probably a great place to go for drinks!

Address: 435 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T4 Canada
Review: Came here based on Google reviews and we were NOT disappointed. Probably the best tasting Ceasar salad I've had in years. Falafel burger was super tasty as well.

Address: 435 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T4 Canada
Review: We ate here 2 days in a row! It was convenient located in the heart of James Bay. Atmosphere was wonderful, menu items were plentiful and food was over the top! Live music twice a week people! Great little place to visit and will now be our go to place for eats!!!

Address: 435 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T4 Canada
Review:
My recent visit to this restaurant left me with some disappointment. The noise level inside the establishment was so high that having a conversation became quite challenging. It created an uncomfortable and chaotic dining experience.

Furthermore, the food did not meet my expectations. Specifically, the chicken in the chicken burger lacked flavor and tasted predominantly like bread. The absence of a distinct chicken taste was disappointing. To enhance the flavor, we had to request hot sauce to dip the chicken in.

While this restaurant has room for improvement, it's important to consider that individual experiences can vary.

Address: 435 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T4 Canada
Review: I absolutely love Heron Rock! Best Chicken and Waffles Eggs Benny in town. Tucked away in James Bay with a warm friendly atmosphere and the loveliest staff, definitely worth a visit! I would highly suggest brunch, they serve all week until 3pm. Chefs Choice Triple Benny is a great way to explore the menu or for people who can't decide and like a surprise. The chef will make you three different Benny's of their choosing and it's been super yummy every time! If you're feeling like a Cesar or Mimosa, Heron Rock has a fantastic list of all kinds of Cesar's to try as well as their "Manmosa".

Address: 1725 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8T 3P4 Canada
Review:
Great staff, and one of the few BBQ restaurants in Victoria that can actually prepare some decent meats like pork and brisket. We visited on a Friday early noon, which isn't as busy as the evenings and weekends. The staff were very welcoming and informative on what's in their dishes and the ingredients. The restaurant manager was also very open and actively interacting with customers when we were served and eating. The overall environment of the place is clean, with neat little decorations and an organized self-serve section for cutlery and drinks. The prices are a bit on the higher end, but for the place and service it's worth it.

I highly recommend any BBQ lovers to visit Jones BBQ!

Address: 1725 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8T 3P4 Canada
Review: I was recommended Jones bar-b-que for their amazing meats. They did not steer me wrong, I ordered the pulled pork poutine, and it was great! I would go back in a heartbeat for their other items.

Address: 1725 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8T 3P4 Canada
Review: Amazing restaurant with delicious smoked meats and stunning jalapeño margarita. One of the best smoked BBQ ribs I got. Highly recommended. Friendly prices.

Address: 1725 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8T 3P4 Canada
Review: First timer. I always judge a BBQ joint by the brisket…a challenging cut to cook and hold. They did a perfect job, tender and moist! The sausage was a pleasant surprise as well. I’ll be returning for sure!

Address: 1725 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8T 3P4 Canada
Review: Tonight was our first night trying this place after eyeing it for awhile. We ordered the pork butt sandwich and the Big Crunch poutine and had no complaints. The meat was tender, the food was well seasoned, and the poutine was the perfect consistency. We all agreed that the only downside to the meal was the cornbread which was a little dry and small considering it’s $4. We will definitely be going back!

Address: 1019 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
I had ordered takeout so I can't judge the service from inside the restaurants.
On the other hand it is the first time that I receive a boxing so well presented!
The springtide roll is crazy, hearty for the price and perfect balance between flavors and melting and crispy consistency in the mouth!
The mac when to him is a killer! 😅 it's perfectly rich, exquisite flavors with lots of vegetables and nuts, perfectly seasoned too!
I recommend this restaurant!

Address: 1019 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review: Excellent Customer service. Took us in 15 minutes before our 630 appointment. The waitress was very friendly and kind. The food were amazingly plated. The smoothies were a treat. However I didn’t appreciate the spring burger and the sandwich we ordered. The bread and the veggie patty and tempeh were too dry for our liking. The buns were too crumbly, dry and dense. My excitement for coming back  here went down. Im pretty sure their other menu selections are tasty.

Address: 1019 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review: Seriously delicious. We were there early and the place was quiet, so the service was excellent. The food was outstanding, especially the gluten free bread on the sandwich and the Mezze in particular. I thought the tacos lacked a little punch and would have liked a touch more flair or flavour in them, but that in no way detracts from a well deserved five star vegan lunch. The roast potatoes were so perfect too. Yum! Excited to take my family when they visit.

Address: 1019 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
I wish I could give more starts! This is easily one of the best
Meals I have ever eaten… and it was plant based and vegan. I wish they had a cookbook. We ordered two appetizers ( Nori Fresh roll and Tacos) and has the seasonal gnocchi and the spinach Roti and split the chai cheesecake.  Each item was great. The roti and the tacos were so soft and chewy that I wondered how they could be gluten free. Please make a cookbook!!!

Address: 1019 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
Stopped by for some lunchtime soup and was not disappointed!!

This gem of a restaurant in downtown offers extraordinary vegetarian meals… I’m not a vegetarian but I’d gladly eat here any day! The soup of the day on our visit was Potato Leek soup and it was hearty, filling, and so delicious. Definitely a spot worth coming back to!

A worthy mention - lovely staff that prioritize a comfortable dining experience above all. Thanks for the great meal!

Address: 1002 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E1 Canada
Review:
I wanted to rave about my experience at The Palms restaurant in the Rialto! I was VERY impressed with the amount of options and quality of vegan dishes!!!

They have multiple vegan options, and even dessert!! We ordered vegan dumplings, a DELICIOUS wrap, beet ravioli, and raspberry cheesecake (with VEGAN RICOTTA!!!) SO GOOD!!!

They have such cool cocktails with cool names, ours were delicious!

There were still two vegan mains we didn’t get to try yet!! Such a lovely experience! 😍🩷

Address: 1002 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E1 Canada
Review:
One of the best places hands down I had visited in Victoria during my vacation!
The service was impeccable, the food was beyond what my taste buds could handle, and the decor was astonishing!
I felt welcomed and the service was fast, sweet, and they were able to handle our dietary concerns (no seafood).

The drinks are very well made and the flavours were absolutely scrumptious.

I highly recommend this place for your next birthday dinner, or fancy date night!

Address: 1002 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E1 Canada
Review: Celebrated our 12 year anniversary there. Our waitress was very helpful, the food was great and the atmosphere was welcoming. I got the stuffed poblano peppers.  It was very flavorful and filling with a bit of a spicy kick. Also, got a goddess cocktail. I also recommend the oysters and the deconstructed apple pie. ❤️

Address: 1002 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E1 Canada
Review:
🤤 I love this place! The spaghetti squash is in another level!
We were short of time and wanted to eat something before taking the bus to the ferries… they brought all our food on a timely manner as well as the drinks!
Service was wonderful
The next time I come to Victoria, will definitely eat at this place!!

Address: 1002 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E1 Canada
Review: Had a lovely happy hour. They have some great food and cocktail options. The food and drinks were great, as well as the service was 5/5.

Address: 1012 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K4 Canada
Review: I live so close and yet hadn't been here until now.  Kind of easy to miss spot on Fort St, but if you are craving Chinese food this is a good spot.  Food was incredibly quick to come out, and was served hot.  Spicy Beef Satay was my favorite, also tried the Cashew Chicken which was a bit mushroom heavy for my taste.  I didn't think the dishes listed as spicy were very spicy at all.  I will return, great value!

Address: 1012 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K4 Canada
Review:
This restaurant serves delicious Chinese food at low prices. Also, the food is served very quickly. My favorite dishes at this restaurant are the House Special Fried Rice and House Special Chow Mein. You should try them when you visit this restaurant.
By the way, it is recommended to make a reservation for dinner on Fridays and Saturdays as it gets very crowded.

Address: 1012 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K4 Canada
Review: It was my first time here and I was not impressed with the food. The service was fine, they were nice but the food was lacking. My friend and I ordered the pork chow mein and the tofu eggplant vegetable dish. The noodles for the pork chow mein was not what we were expecting, it was crunchy and stale. I was expecting normal chow mein noodles but that was not the case. The dish was overly sauced too, there wasn't any other flavour other than the sauce itself. The pork was cut very small and thin. It was the same thing for the tofu eggplant dish. It was drenched in sauce, there was nothing special about it. The sauce was super salty too. The vegetables in both dishes were fine but it wasn't good for what it was worth.

Address: 1012 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K4 Canada
Review:
I don’t give a five star very often, but this place blew me away. First off for anyone else that’s Gluten Free or Celiac, the absolute peace of mind that you can order something made in a GF kitchen and not be stressed out about problems is phenomenal.

Secondly their GF menu is a second standalone which was nicely flushed out with a mixture of dishes. i’ve read other reviewers talking about the cost and yes it is a bit over average but I guess the dishes I ordered were just on the mark. all three were very large servings and good ingredients. Plus you know when you are used to gluten-free lifestyle you unfortunately get used to very high prices -so this seemed reasonable for me.

Go to be honest it was my first sit down since the pandemic so I was pretty excited, but the whole experience was great. Didn’t wait long for a table, had excellent and attentive service, very open to answer questions and make suggestions. No awkward having to explain being gluten-free or asking about ingredients in substitutions. It was just easy. I had a nice seat facing the street in the window for some people watching.

The food did not take long and filled my entire table! I guess because it’s been a long time since I’ve eaten out , but I was shocked at how much food there was on my plate. My three dishes lasted me 3 1/2 meals. And If you haven’t read my reviews before, I eat big!

OK let’s talk about the food.
I did shoot a great video of it but unfortunately you can’t upload it so check out my pictures.

I had a combination of standard chinese dishes and one fun dish being the tofu eggplant hot pot -which came so hot it was bubbling for a good five minutes!
So you get entertainment and a meal ;). Nice balance of hot, sweet and sour, a little bit too much thin sauce for my liking and I would’ve liked some shiitake mushroom in there , but that’s a personal choice.

The other dishes were your standard Chinese fare. The first was mixed greens with prawn which had the standard Chinese take away flavor. One which I hadn’t had since before glueing gluten-free so that was pretty fantastic. MSG enhanced? Highly likely. However I didn’t have the response to it so maybe not.

And the last was the recommendation by my server for the garlic ginger beef with snow peas. I’m still shocked at how much beef was on that plate - seriously look at the pictures. Very well seasoned, the beef was surprisingly tender considering it’s not a high-quality cut which means they braised it properly. veggies were perfect colour and crunchy texture   Could’ve done with a bit less oil but otherwise nice.

Obviously had a lot leftover to take away and they were great with the whole experience. no awkwardness. No fuss.  They brought really decent quality eco take away containers ( 🙏 ) then gave me the time and space to put my food the way that I wanted.

I had a happy belly, a very happy state of mind, good and ample leftovers and a great memory which will bring me back the next time I visit town.

Address: 1012 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K4 Canada
Review:
💵: A bit pricey but just few of the places that offer quite good Chinese Foods

🍜: We ordered
🍚 House Special Fried Rice 4⭐
A little oily but can't get enough of 😋
🍤 Salt and Pepper Prawn 4⭐
Quite good
🍗 Sweet and Sour Chicken 3⭐
Chicken's a little chewie

🍱: The portion  of the big one is just for 2pax

⌛: The wait time is quite fast, to be honest.

👥: Service, I think it's fine. But, nothing out of the ordinary.

Address: 809 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B9 Canada
Review: Browns is always a nice place to go for lunch. My mom enjoys their veggie burgers and I enjoy their selection of drinks. The service at Browns is always good and staff is always friendly. I decided to try their new brunch options and was a little disappointed however they are new and they might need time to perfect brunch.

Address: 809 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B9 Canada
Review:
Super yummy food! I loved the butchers block burger. Crispy and tasty, not too messy. I upgraded to yam fries. We also got the southwest bowl which was good! The desserts were ok but not the best.

The one thing is, it wasn’t busy or anything but I felt the service was very slow. Took a long time for them to come around to us. But the food is great ! The patio portion is heated and enclosed which is cool.

Address: 809 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B9 Canada
Review: Went looking for a place to have brunch. Had immediate seating which was a bonus on a Sunday morning in Victoria. Food was good and plentiful, but the potatoes were undercooked. Server was very nice and attentive.

Address: 809 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B9 Canada
Review: My friend and I ordered through the website, and when we came in to pick it up, a very friendly server got it for us right away. While she was fetching our order, another very friendly server greeted us and offered to seat us! Very fast, amazing food (best chicken fettuccine alfredo I've ever had), and the atmosphere we saw was very nice. They even wrote a little "Enjoy" note on the bag :)

Address: 809 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B9 Canada
Review: Met a friend for happy hour. It would have been nice to have another choice of seating. So busy and plenty of hub-bub noise close to the service area and kitchen. Social white wine, gluten free dry ribs and chips and guacamole. Yummy The server was great. The bathrooms were clean. ✔️

Restaurant_name: Fire & Water Fish and Chop House
Address: 728 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z5 Canada
Review:
I've been very fortunate to be able to try a wide variety of menu options and everything seems to be excellent quality.

The crab cakes eggs benny is a must try!
Very flavorful crab cakes topped with sliced avocado and a perfectly poached egg, tasty potatoes on the side and a creamy and zesty hollandaise sauce to pour over top.

Buffalo chicken wings were thickly breaded and really delicious.

The seafood chowder was filled with yummy bites.

The french toast was amazing! It had so much flavour on it's own but then it was paired with fruits and a cinnamon whip on the side, you hardly have a need for any syrup.

The Reuben was juicy and not overly salty as others can be.

The calamari was a bit odd and the least flavorful thing I tried.

The steak was my absolute favourite dish, perfectly cooked with a delicious flavoured butter and nice crust on the outside and rich sauteed mushrooms.

The fish and chips were exactly what you'd expect and they do have good fries.

The cappuccino chocolate terrine dessert was nice and rich without being overly sweet, despite it missing the raspberry sauce as advertised. The chocolate was smooth and the almond bark on top was crunchy. I'm not actually sure where the cappuccino flavour is meant to be but I'm an espresso addict so I tend to not be able to taste coffee flavours unless they are overly pronounced.

Restaurant_name: Fire & Water Fish and Chop House
Address: 728 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z5 Canada
Review: Dropped in for a nightcap and between my husband and I we had 6 delicious drinks.  I asked for a espresso martini which was not on the menu and they delivered it with a smile. Sandeep was very knowledgeable about the drinks that was served and made us feel at home. The bartender really is outstanding at his profession as well as quick.  And the restaurant itself is very clean, cozy, and esthetically pleasing to the eye.

Restaurant_name: Fire & Water Fish and Chop House
Address: 728 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z5 Canada
Review: This was an incredible experience and I thoroughly enjoyed myself and so did my company. You must try this. Fun for all ages. I wish them all the success . What an amazing concept

Restaurant_name: Fire & Water Fish and Chop House
Address: 728 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z5 Canada
Review:
M Club lounge was closed at Victoria Marriott Inner Harbour during our 2 nights stay. We were provided breakfast at Fire & Water Restaurant located within the hotel.

The staff recommended “Crab Cake Eggs Benedict.” We both went with her recommendation. Wow, she was on point! Rich, tasty and melt in your mouth. Hubby loved it so much he ordered it again the next morning. The next morning I ordered “All Canadian breakfast” as I love scrambled eggs and chose rye bread, bacon and substituted potatoes with fruit.

I have to say the staff is amazing - attentive, genuine and down-to-earth.

Great breakfast to fuel us for the day full with walking. We ended up needing to walk off the wonderful meal along the harbour. Not a bad start to a day, eh!

Restaurant_name: Fire & Water Fish and Chop House
Address: 728 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z5 Canada
Review: Came in for lunch and a glass of wine or two. The food was surprisingly good. Much better than you'd expect of a hotel bar. Very reasonably priced as well. The wine list was pretty basic but the pricing was good. The room is kind of what you'd expect at a Marriot. Nothing to write home about but nice enough. The service was pretty bad though. Inattentive server and they weren't really able to answer any wine, drink or food questions. Too bad because the food was excellent.

Address: 517 Pandora Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: My first impression was the bar is well put together and atmosphere was awesome for downtown Victoria. I enjoy the somewhat open kitchen concept. You have to come up to the bar to order your food. The food is a hit/miss, the potatoes was a 3/10 very dilly. The Beef Tongue Reuben was a 7.7/10. First time trying beef tongue so it was good. The craft beer I ordered was okay. After you order your food, they don’t really check up on you and ask if you need anything else.

Address: 517 Pandora Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: Such a tasty meal in a great atmosphere. We ate outside in the marketplace square and shared the baba ghanouj and a pork belly sandwich. Each was big enough to serve two people so it's a good deal. We also had a flight of beers and I loved the Dinosaur stone fruit sour. So delicious. We'll definitely be back..

Address: 517 Pandora Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: Great selection of beers; interesting menu and some wonderful selections. The grilled cheese with kimchi is a favourite. The nitro porter was one of the most enjoyable beers I’ve had on tap. … came back again for my birthday; same positives and staff was awesome in accommodating a cake brought for me. Excellent atmosphere.

Address: 517 Pandora Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
The Flensburger dunkle dark lager was very good. The cider was too hoppy for me I prefer a slightly sweeter cider. It tasted like grapefruit juice.
You serve yourself at the bar then take it outside.

Address: 517 Pandora Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: So disappointed! I ordered a cheese board, and it was a bread board with TWO MISERABLE SMALL SLICES of really simple, dry, and untasted cheese and a small fresh cheese cup. You cannot call this a cheese board when there's almost no cheese. I told the manager, and she didn't do anything. By the way, the young server girl from Peru was excellent. But I am still so disappointed.

Address: 658 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S7 Canada
Review:
An anchor to the contemporary French fine dinning experience in Victoria. Visually inspirational for every dish we ordered. A mixture of different textures and tastes for each ingredient as those explode in mouth. Recommend their medium rare steak and seasonal berries as dessert.

Our return visit for we love the atmosphere and the waitress is approachable and friendly. Waiter and waitress know their dishes well. My only side suggestion is to approach the diners with questions while they’re not having a moment (Eg. laughing). Our conversation came to a hilarious end, as we try to hold on our laughter the waitress came dropping us with a question. Our moment of climatic enjoyment got cut off/ short since we had to quickly recover to respond. Here their timing is key.

Address: 658 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S7 Canada
Review: We went there for the 1st time tonight and were blown away-service was incredible and sadly forgot the receipt to remember her name. Food was absolutely incredible! Most outstanding dish for us was the pork belly appetizer! Everything else was so beautifully presented and all the flavors were on point making it a full on sensory experience -highly recommend👌👍👍

Address: 658 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S7 Canada
Review:
We've been to Saveur a few times now.  Thought I'd post a review.

Prices are definitely on the higher side and portions are smaller as well, but the quality of food is excellent.

Started off with the soba noodles and rosti.  The soba noodles are to die for, although the portion was 1/4 of the size compared to when we ordered them which was a bit disappointing.

My fiancee got the tuna and I had the burger.  Everything was fantastic as usual.

We finished off by sharing lemon pudding which was amazing.

Service was outstanding (and was the two prior times we dined here).  Victoria doesn't have a plethora of fine dining experiences.  If you're looking for a fancier spot for a special night out, I'd highly recommend Saveur.

Bon appetit!

Address: 658 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S7 Canada
Review: Great food and wonderful service! The flavours were delicate and well balanced, yet super flavourful and unique. The presentation was beautiful. The service was great; We took our time and didn't feel rushed.

Address: 658 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S7 Canada
Review:
Worth the splurge!!!  Yes it's expensive. And yes it was amazing! Good things are worth spending money on and if you've never had a fine dining meal, this should be on your local list to try! Service was attentive and on point. The meals were paired wonderfully with reds and whites appropriately. We started off with a super fun creative chai inspired whiskey sour! If James has it available, order it!!! When they say their tenderloin is like butter, it's true. And yes, you should pair wine with your dessert!
It's a small venue, with small tables but the service keeps on top of your table helping to avoid clutter. Thanks Chef, James, and Ryan for the great time!

Address: 1005 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V7 Canada
Review:
Our "go to" sushi restaurant for special occasions and casual lunch with friends. Freshness and taste of the sushi are just amazing! Very friendly and attentive staff. Rei is exceptionally welcoming and helpful. Our new absolute favorite is "Baked Salmon Roll", just melts in your mouth!
Highly recommend Gozen Sushi Bar Izakaya!

Address: 1005 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V7 Canada
Review:
If you're looking for a sushi place in Victoria I highly recommend this place. We went in 30-40min before closing because we had arrived in town later than expected, but their service was wonderful. Some places will show their frustration when you walk in late, I get it, but the servers here were professional, very friendly & helpful. I was trying to order everything all at once since they were taking last call but they have a wide selection so I was having a hard time choosing so the server helped recommend some items. Our waitress checked on us multiple times to make sure we were good.

Food also tasted very fresh & delicious. Sashimi pieces were nice & thick :) one of my favorite was the Tako Wasabi, will definitely wake you up. I'll definitely return when I visit the town again :)

Address: 1005 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V7 Canada
Review: I've had the pleasure of dining at Gozen a few times now. The service is always excellent and fast. The sushi is always excellent, and so is the atmosphere. Would highly recommend this place. This is definitely the best sushi place I've eaten at in Victoria. Thank you.

Address: 1005 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V7 Canada
Review: Great selection for both the go to classics and some new takes for people weary of fresh seafood. Overall food quality was in line with top in Canada (except the top ends for triple the price point). Overall great food and value

Address: 1005 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V7 Canada
Review: Prices seem a bit steep, but the portion sizes for the rolls are quite good. Noodles and rice bowls are a bit disappointing. I would stick to the sushi rolls. Also would recommend skipping the takoyaki

Address: 1609 Store St Victoria, BC V8W 3K3 Canada
Review: The service was great, I ordered vegetarian Ramen which was alright. Maybe not my taste but the portion was huge. The cocktail was really good. My recommendation would be, if you can't eat much and you go during happy hours, order a single person portion from the happy hours menu. It's more than enough to fill you up.

Address: 1609 Store St Victoria, BC V8W 3K3 Canada
Review: I was wanting to try a ramen joint while I was on the island and I'm happy to say this place didn't disappoint! The atmosphere is very cool my girlfriend and I both loved the aesthetic layout of the restaurant. The service was great and so was the food and drinks. We went during happy hour so we got to try a couple things at a very affordable price. I'll definitely be back when I next visit Victoria!

Address: 1609 Store St Victoria, BC V8W 3K3 Canada
Review:
Atmosphere and menu were super cute! The staff were really friendly, but service was kinda slow. Took a while before some came and took our order and had to wait a bit before food came out.

But the food was definitely worth the wait! We ordered the Shio Tonkotsu, Tori, and Shoyu Gyokai! Soup was very flavourful and the sous-vide chasu was amazing. My favourite part was the egg, it was perfectly cooked!! Yolk was nice and soft boiled.

Address: 1609 Store St Victoria, BC V8W 3K3 Canada
Review: Walked by and decided to try it. Nice atmosphere. Food was okay. Drink price was inaccurate, charged higher than the menu. When we asked them about it they claimed the menu price was for the happy hour, but we looked at the full menu and that drink is not listed anywhere else in the whole menu. So it's listed in only one place, but in the end they will charge you more than that menu price.

Address: 1609 Store St Victoria, BC V8W 3K3 Canada
Review:
Had heard a lot of great things about Ghost Ramen and had to try it out while on vacation in Victoria.
Absolutely did not disappoint!!
The atmosphere was welcoming, calm and perfect temperature.
The Ramen was mindblowing, the broth was delicious and hot, noodles were absolutely perfect (I'm still dreaming of them) and the egg was cooked perfectly.
Desserts were also delicious along with the Lime Ginger Cherry Soda.

If ever in Victoria again, I am definitely going back!!!

Address: 759 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: Went there to watch the second half of World Cup final. It was very crowded but they still had a few tables to accommodate us. Nice and relaxed atmosphere. We ordered Chorizo & Egg Taco and Eggs&toast. Our server, Elaine, was really nice and helpful. She helped to change the food a bit. They did not have any deserts in their morning menu, since we craved some sweet stuff she managed to serve us chocolate truffle cake which was nice. Pleasant experience.

Address: 759 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: We stopped in before a movie at the Odeon. I ordered the heat seeker burger, but when it arrived, it had no crispy jalapeños as advertised on the menu. I waited over 10 mins for the waitress to come back to the table, and I let her know the burger was missing items. She brought it back to the kitchen and came back to our table with literally one single crispy jalapeño on it (see photo). We had ordered calamari as well when the waitress originally took my burger back to the kitchen, and when it showed up less than 10 mins later, it had a bunch of the crispy jalapeños! Lol. At least it was a good laugh, but seriously, how petty does the chef have to be here.

Address: 759 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: Service was friendly and had a nice casual atmosphere. Important to note that the happy hour menu listed on their website is NOT the happy hour menu you are given in-person! It seems they also now have Taco Tuesdays, so all of the tacos were 3.50ea. Good value at that price, but I imagine I would have been underwhelmed had I paid full menu price 😬

Address: 759 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
Place permanently closed.

Source: I was personally there on their last day of operations.

====================================

I have now visited this place so many times that I can leave a solid review about it. In my heart this place is the true definition of a 4★ experience.

Beer selection, solid, nothing fancy, you gonna find something you like for sure. Are you going to find that special beer you've been looking for? Most likely not.

Food, solid. Whenever we are in a big group with multiple dietary restrictions, we come here as we can always find something for everyone. Yet none of the menu items alone stand out as the best in town for their category.

Service, solid. This of course changes depending on the server, how busy the place is and/or if there's an event going on. But overall I had 95%+ positive experiences. Yet none of them truly memorable.

A big thing they get is different nights for events, like sports events, trivia night and others things of the sort.

Address: 759 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: Came here last Thursday and everyone was so friendly. There were 2 people at the host desk that were very nice. I sat at the bar and the bartender was really nice. I think there was a shift change happening at some point and the next bartender I got was super friendly and helpful as well. I got his awesome recommendation on a really tasty sour beer and I asked his recommendation on a good patio to check out. I would definitely come back here.

Address: 230 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3X3 Canada
Review:
Am the luckiest person in this world, because I live two blocks from this amazing restaurant, Am very picky when it's about pizza, And I tried all the pizza's here and all of them are amazing and every time am there I don't know what to eat this time.
I really high recommend this place, and try all the options available.

Address: 230 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3X3 Canada
Review: Except for the coworker showing up and sitting one table away the last time, every time I come here I have the best pizza of my life. The pizza is better than any of the pizza you can find in Italy or anywhere in the Mediterranean or for that matter anywhere outside the Prima Strada locations. Ultimately you'll save money because having pizza anywhere else will just feel banal and second-best. You'll save it for occasions to go to one of the Prima Strada locations. Also, they carry anchovies like any serious pizza place would.

Address: 230 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3X3 Canada
Review: I came here for a quick bite with my mom and oldest son after his band recital. The servers were busy but they were sweet. The food was hot and quick! We also ordered a pizza but we ate it prior to me getting a picture of it! Highly recommend. Great for a family night for pizza, a date night or a girls night!

Address: 230 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3X3 Canada
Review: We really enjoyed this place and the pizza was one of the best we ever had. Freshly made and perfect service.

Address: 230 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3X3 Canada
Review: Closest thing to real Italian pizza in town. Thin crust, fire oven, simple but delicious ingredients. If you know, you know. I’ve also been informed that they are a socially conscious group doing the work, so that’s nice. I’ve equally heard that some of the treatment of their employees could be better. I hope that gets better. Join their email list and find out when the good deals are. It’s not often but it’s worth it.

Address: 1109 McKenzie Avenue Victoria, BC V8V 2W1 Canada
Review:
It was the first time I tasted Ethiopian food and I was really disappointed ... it's bland and lacks flavor, I felt like I was eating canned spinach, potatoes ground in water, in short, only canned or vacuum-packed ingredients that have been reheated and have the same taste as at the school canteen...
Nothing interesting for my taste buds unfortunately.
If this is Ethiopian food, then I won't eat it again in my life.

Address: 1109 McKenzie Avenue Victoria, BC V8V 2W1 Canada
Review: Absolutely LOVE this place! 😍 The food is so tasty, and reasonably priced for the portions. I love the vegetarian combo plate or the beef combo plate. Hours can vary (I’ve gone and they have been closed randomly) so make sure you call ahead or have a back up plan. Definitely must try this hidden gem! ✨

Address: 1109 McKenzie Avenue Victoria, BC V8V 2W1 Canada
Review: First time trying Ethiopian food! I got the vegetable combo and it was awesome! The price on their menu was very affordable. The lady preparing the food was very courteous. This place was really good and it was a great meal!

Address: 1109 McKenzie Avenue Victoria, BC V8V 2W1 Canada
Review: Soooo happy to have stumbled upon this little spot in cook street village. Located in a small strip of several restaurants, seating and ambience is very casual. Had the combination plate and the food was super quick, price was right, flavours were amazing. Very glad to find an Ethiopian place in Vic!

Address: 1109 McKenzie Avenue Victoria, BC V8V 2W1 Canada
Review: The restaurant is located in the “Cook Street Village Food Court”, at the far end. The women making the food was really friendly and wonderful to chat with. Delicious vegetarian platter, I totally recommend it!

Address: 1307 Gladstone Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1R9 Canada
Review: Terrific food, amazing service, really nice ambiance. Great menu options. The bartender is very knowledgeable too, and offers lots of nice vermouth and absinthe cocktails. Highly recommend for a sophisticated night out!

Address: 1307 Gladstone Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1R9 Canada
Review: We really enjoyed our dinner here and also top it with great glasses of wine. We picked chef choice dish. It turned out fantastic. Server super friendly. Parking was okay. A bit walking but best after dinner. Too much good food we needed to walk it off back to our car. We would definitely visit again in the future.

Address: 1307 Gladstone Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1R9 Canada
Review: Coming back to this restaurant after a great first impression last trip. The food is so delicious here and the smell of the charred bread is divine. Our server, Anna, is so great! Love all her suggestions for food in both Victoria and Vancouver. She is also just super friendly to chat with. Lovely vibe as the evening progressed and had more people come in.

Address: 1307 Gladstone Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1R9 Canada
Review:
This is the most disappointing meal we have ever had on this island, we came to this restaurant with high expectations, the vibe of the restaurant is pretty good,  it the food is incomprehensible, we ordered feast set meal for 5 people, because the server said this is chef's choice, if we are very hungry, we can try it.

First, we got three pieces of burned bread and two kinds of cheese, and canned clams. The second dish was a plate of vegetable salad :)The third dish was a plate with two pieces of halibut, which tasted fine. When the fourth course two chocolate cake was served, we were shocked, paying $325 and getting this, After such an experience, we talked with server, he said about the price of the ingredients because of inflation, of course we know that everything is going up in price, but paying $325 for such 4 courses meal is unreasonable, I believe if we order all the food on the menu, it will not exceed this price.

In the end, our discussion did not have any results. The server dropped a machine with amount and said if you don’t wanna pay the tips, that’s is fine. Horrible night.

Address: 1307 Gladstone Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1R9 Canada
Review: Very good experience but since it was my first time there and we only got tapas to share. I don't want to give full 5 stars yet until I've tried their actual meals. Overall very cool place. 😊

Address: 1020 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3Z5 Canada
Review: Great local eatery. Lunch menu prices are really reasonable, generous portions and include soup and a spring roll. My partner did a fried egg add-on for an additional cost and it was great on the rice dish. Thai iced tea was decent, a little bit on the sweet side but not bad. Their pad Thai sauce is a little on the sour side for me and their mild seems a bit spicy (I would personally get no spice in my future visits). Hence the 4 stars.

Address: 1020 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3Z5 Canada
Review: I loved the Tom Kha Coconut Thai soup with prawns. The best ever! All ingredients fresh and the soup wad seasoned perfectly. The host was super friendly.

Address: 1020 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3Z5 Canada
Review: It's a small but great place to eat Thai food. Jared is also very helpful and friendly. Careful when ordering Thai original spiciness, I thought western food can never be spicy but they are truly as spicy as chili padi.

Address: 1020 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3Z5 Canada
Review: What a beautiful place set in a little cute area of town in Victoria. After purposefully getting lost in locating a little place for dinner, I was pleasantly greeted by a very professional and polite and welcoming young man. I was happy to hear him welcome me and when I asked for take out he politely handed me I menu and took my order. After I sat he professionally offered me some water and even poured it for me which shows the etiquette of serving tables as being very impressive. I was delighted and felt at home immediately as I waited for my food. Upon returning home and opening my food I was eager to taste the flavors for I had asked for as spicy as possible. As I enjoyed my food I realize that this was a wonderful meal that had rich flavors, spiced and the right amount of temperature in spice as well as temperature of food. I would recommend this place and would only caution that though it is a small establishment it is huge in flavor and good quality food. My compliments to the chef.

Address: 1020 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3Z5 Canada
Review: This small Thai restaurant on Cook Street tells a big story in their cooking. Lunch is a treat, with delicious flavorful soup and a spring role with every choice. And there are lots of excellent choices! I had the Gaeng Massaman Gai, which was filling and fresh and very delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant,  for lunch or dinner.

Restaurant_name: Sakura Sushi, Grocery and Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1213 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8W 2K6 Canada
Review:
Great little place that offers fresh made sushi, rice bowls and bento boxes.

I've had their ramen, it was flavourful with excellent noodles. Their new new curry bowl items are really tasty and generously portioned. The Karaage Don is also an excellent lunch option.

They're definitely under new management - lots of new faces and a much improved customer service experience. They also have a new expanded menu with more variations of each type of dish. Sakura has solidified it's place in my lunchtime rounds.

Restaurant_name: Sakura Sushi, Grocery and Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1213 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8W 2K6 Canada
Review:
I love their sushi and other hot meals. However the last time I went there we ordered food for dine in at their outdoor table. I requested one of the ladies if they could reheat the cold meals that were on display since we were supposed to eat it there and she said it’s not possible. Seriously, why isn’t it allowed?? So we ended up eating the very cold takoyaki and other dish on display. I never came back after this, very disappointed.

Additional comment: with all due respect, but we also ordered hot meals and ate it on the outdoor table of your restaurant. So are you saying that even if we order hot meals we cannot have the additional grab and go food reheated in your microwave? How is that helping your customer, half the order is hot and half the order isn’t allowed to be reheated because it’s to go? If we knew about this in the first place we wouldn’t have ordered any to go with the hot meals.

I was a fan of your restaurant since we ate here multiple times, it wasn’t the first time. But to tell your customer to go eat somewhere else because reheating is a big deal shows the value you place on your once loyal customers. :( again we won’t mind if there’s a sign saying this.

P.s.

It might help to place a sign on the cold section that the food here cannot be reheated EVEN if customer orders hot meals, in that way it avoids confusion.

Restaurant_name: Sakura Sushi, Grocery and Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1213 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8W 2K6 Canada
Review: They have fresh affordable sushi to go and it’s delicious! Service is so nice and makes you feel welcomed. 10/10 will be returning soon :)

Restaurant_name: Sakura Sushi, Grocery and Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1213 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8W 2K6 Canada
Review: I never been here before but I ordered a sushi tray delivered to me today. It was great that I was able to build my own tray and only pick what I want. The waiting time was reasonable and food were packed nicely. Sushi are good, a bit too much vinegar in the rice I think. I would come to the store one day for groceries.

Restaurant_name: Sakura Sushi, Grocery and Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1213 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8W 2K6 Canada
Review: Very good place to have sushi. Service is very attentive and they are happy to accommodate your wishes. It's a simple place but very clean and the quality of sushi and complexity are rather high. Prices are moderate. The place contains the restaurant and a small store.

Address: 721 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R8 Canada
Review: We ordered take out at a very busy time (6pm on Saturday) but our order was ready on time and it came in nice containers that don't leak!😁 You know how sometimes you get home and gravy or whatever has leaked out? Nope ! Not with this order!! Food was yummy! Would order from here again.😃

Address: 721 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R8 Canada
Review: We enjoyed our dim sum! They were tasty and soo good! We'll definitely coming back when we visit Victoria again.

Address: 721 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R8 Canada
Review:
THE BEST DIM SUM IN VICTORIA

I love their sui mai - it's #1 in Canada
And peanut pork dumpling, rice rolls, har gow, oh, the daikon cakes as well! 💯
Honestly everything was above and beyond the expectation.
Please keep this good business ongoing 😋

Address: 721 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R8 Canada
Review: Busy day here as it's the Chinese New Year. glad we made reservations. We had all vegetarian dishes minus one they put shredded scallops on so we just didn't eat it, but we didn't complain about it was too busy to bother. This place looks dated so the outside does not reflect the inside😉

Address: 721 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R8 Canada
Review:
Ordered from Golden city using their online system and enjoyed the convenience. I ordered vegtable chowmein with only beansprouts and two egg rolls. Golden city correctly made my order which I was worried about because I just wrote the "only beansprouts" into the comments. This showed me they pay attention to detail. The chowmein was a good large portion had great flavor and was a resonable price. The egg rolls were lackluster without much flavor and the wrapping was a bit thick for my liking.

Overall good meal and I would order again (just provide not the egg rolls next time).

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review: I enjoyed the food here with my family 😊 portions are good. I just wish they could have more non spicy food for kids. They do charge a 15% service fee if your group has more than 6 people, which is like a tip, so it is reasonable.

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
At SURA Korean Restaurant, one can anticipate a truly unique dining experience that perfectly melds traditional Korean flavors with a modern, sophisticated ambiance. From the moment you walk in, the welcoming atmosphere, resplendent with warm lights and comfortable seating, sets the tone for an excellent culinary journey.

The menu at SURA is a vibrant palette of Korean gastronomy, showcasing the rich, hearty flavors that the cuisine is known for. The Bulgogi, tender and succulently marinated, is an absolute must-try, as is the Bibimbap, served in a hot stone bowl, which creates an irresistible crispy rice layer at the bottom. The seafood pancake, brimming with fresh ingredients, is an ideal start to the meal.

Vegetarians and vegans aren’t left out either. SURA’s Japchae, a dish of stir-fried sweet potato noodles and vegetables, is an example of their commitment to catering to diverse dietary needs without compromising flavor.

One aspect that particularly stands out is the quality of their ingredients. The freshness of the vegetables, the quality of the meats, and the aromatic spices, all come together in a symphony of flavors that leaves one yearning for more.

Service at SURA matches the high standard set by their food. The staff is attentive, helpful with suggestions, and ensures a smooth dining experience.

In addition, the restaurant’s adherence to safety and hygiene protocols in these challenging times further enhances the overall experience, making you feel safe and comfortable.

Overall, SURA Korean Restaurant in Vancouver is a destination not just for those with a palate for Korean food but anyone who appreciates good food, well served. Highly recommended!

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
We got there around 1 pm on a Sun and had a 1/2 hr wait. Well worth it. We walked down the street while we we’re waiting and this was one of 2 spot that had a wait. I guess we now know why 😀

We found a parking lot for $3 / hr across the back door in the street behind the restaurant. They have 4 free spots behind the back door but they were full.

We get the lunch set menu and got to try different things, all of which were good. Kids got a dumpling soup and kimchi fried rice. Portions were just right to fill us up.

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
You can’t go wrong with ordering any food at this restaurant. The food is flavorful and the service is great. I actually felt like our server cared about our experience at Sura.
The only thing to consider is they don’t take reservations and there is usually a wait list at this place.
Overall a “must try” for Korean food in Vancouver.

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
What a great place on Robson St for authentic Korean eats!

We actually tried coming here before but the line-up was too long of a wait. Fortunately we came again during foul weather earlier this month (December 2021) & yay, we got a table without delay. Had to call the restaurant to let them someone know we were outside, as patrons are required to stay outside until a staff member came out to assist. I appreciate the covid protocol (they do check for vax i.ds).

Their great ratings do not lie - the food is comforting and delicious. Portions are good considering the cost. The decor is light and minimal. Their staff are all excellent in friendliness, attentiveness and speed.

The potato pancakes had perfect crisp to it and were very flavourful on their own ~ no sauce really needed. The vegetarian japchae was so satisfying, that we didn’t even miss the meat.

I loved the grilled mackerel the most, not overly cooked, with a softly cooked interior while maintaining a crispy skin. It even came with a small Doenjang Jjigae ~ super flavourful soup broth with bits of beef.

All the ‘appies’ (kimchi, beans, potato salad) were a perfect sample taste. I wonder if I could have asked for more?

The staff were hospitable  and quick to serve and clear away.

Decor is modern, minimalistic yet relaxed.

I’m SO looking forward to coming back again!

Find me on Instagram @aida.loves

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: I love Korean food and this place doesn't disappoint. They have a wide menu of classic Korean dishes, there BBQ is amazing and a lot of fun. Only down side is that the food is quite expensive, no matter the dish.  I would highly recommend going with a bunch or people who love to share food and laughs.

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: The service is very good and the people is so nice. The food is good. The place has a good atmosphere.

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
Went to Sura for lunch and tried a variety of dishes. All the selections were great and tasty.

The staff was friendly and always kept our pitcher of water filled. Like how they gave us individual condiments rather than the traditional “communal style” condiments.

Was disappointed that their seasonal Buckwheat cold noodle was well ... out of season.

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: Delicious food, reasonably priced, and very well packaged. They also included free kimchi on the side as well.

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: Both dishes were a real flop. I had taken a bibimbap because I had heard that it was a very good dish, but I honestly didn't like it! I honestly think it's not the dish itself but the way the restaurant makes it. The tastelessness was really bad, as was the chow mein, the service was mediocre and the atmosphere of the restaurant is really depressing.

Address: 940 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: Fantastic restaurant, great food, exemplary service. We will definitely be back again, a lot of great things on the menu. Some of the atmosphere slightly dated, but that adds to the charm.

Address: 940 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review:
It's a good Japanese food place in Victoria. Love the vibe and atmosphere. Service was great but a bit slow which was understandable since they were super busy.
The main dishes and sushi rolls are okay. Special rolls are really good👌 there were no sits available so we sat at the sushi bar. But it was okay since the bar table was bigger than normal.
overall a 4.5 experience and recommended 👌

Address: 940 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: First time I went to this restaurant and I couldn’t suggest a better place to get sushi! The menu has a wide variety of food choices and amazing drink selection, our server was a very kind and professional man who made the experience even better and was lovely to talk too! And as someone who has worked in a sushi restaurant this was such a great experience and the atmosphere was a very comfortable space to be in and has lots of beautiful artwork to admire while eating! My boyfriend and I got the takoyaki, miso soup, negitoro maki, dynamite roll, BC roll and the karage Roll and it was all so good!!! We will most definitely be coming back :)

Address: 940 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: Really excellent sushi! I was impressed by the beautiful plating. The fish is well selected and fresh, so tender and delicious. What was most delightful was how well built their rolls are. Perfectly balanced flavors and no danger of it falling apart!

Address: 940 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: Haven’t been here since 2017, I ordered hot house sake, cold chicken udon, ebi tempura roll, and spicy agedashi tofu (although it’s not spicy at all for me tho😂) overall the food and service was good. Recommended, will definitely go back.

Address: 500 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E5 Canada
Review: Decided to celebrate my anniversary with my boyfriend at the keg and the experience was amazing. Everyone was so nice and the food was spot on. The bread that they gave us was so good, it pairs really well with the French Onion soup! My boyfriend and I both got the Keg Classics and the portions were really filling. We did over ordered because we were quite hungry but we left with two takeout boxes with some of our food. Despite being really full they offered us complementary dessert because we were celebrating our anniversary! Our server was super kind and packed it up for us to eat later! For someone who has never been to The Keg before I’d definitely recommend the twice baked potatoes and escargots! The steaks are really good too, especially the prime rib! I would definitely come back again for a special occasion because everyone was really nice :)

Address: 500 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E5 Canada
Review: Excellent Food and Service,   and Harbour view seating.  My Wife and I loved our dinner.  We Highly recommend this Steakhouse restaurant,   The Keg .  We will be back many times.

Address: 500 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E5 Canada
Review: Fantastic food as always. Steaks are always done perfectly as we ordered. Service was too notch and atmosphere is very peaceful & romantic.

Address: 500 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E5 Canada
Review: The Keg is frankly the best steakhouse one can go to for reliably great steak.  I have been to Kegs at least dozen times over the last 10 years and I have never been disappointed.  Steak is cooked to perfection, sides are yummy, choice of potato, and even a delicious wedge salad.  Service has always been tiptop, and the price is right... Not too pricey, just right for a special night out.

Address: 500 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E5 Canada
Review: The service was great. The young waiter treated us really well and made the night really enjoyable after a rare celebration for the family. Steak was cooked accurately and was nice a rare. All around great experience.

Address: 1019 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: My family and I decided to stop in for brunch and we were all surprised at how delicious the food and coffee was. The staff were very friendly, the atmosphere was nice and they had good music playing too!

Address: 1019 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review:
Ordered the congee.

As a biased person being Asian, it was not the congee I expected especially visually. This one was outstanding with colors and textures. The bold ingredients were sitting atop a bed of thick brown rice. The rice was not too viscous and also not as fluid as Asian congee would be generally.  It might be close to the viscosity of oats where it will still fall out of your spoon if you tip it over but not immediately.

The temperature also is quite different.  I'm guessing this was about 50°C / 122°F.

So eating the congee, the ingredients were grouped together and arranged quite thoughtfully. I thought of mixing everything together just like you generally would in an Asian congee, but my senses at this point whispered otherwise.

So I went about my dish picking the ingredients, often combining 2-3 at a time as I was scouring away from the bed of viscous rice underneath. I found that eating it this way gives an easier time to distinguish and appreciate the flavors and textures as compared to having everything mixed together.  This made the dish quite engaging as you try different combinations of the ingredients. It was light yet felt.
Different from Asian congee and unique in it's way.

Address: 1019 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: Picnic is a fave for a reason. They have unique and fun food that everyone can enjoy. We've used Picnic to cater multiple events and everyone is always so happy with whatever they bring. Sometimes they do such a fabulous job with presentation it looks too good to eat. The cafe is also amazing, portions are filling, staff are friendly, and the environment is laid back and relaxing.

Address: 1019 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: Came here for breakfast sandwiches and loved the cozy laid back vibes.  The breakfast sandwiches we got were sooooo tasty 🤤  I got the Owen and my partner got the Weekender, both amazing.  The kind of delicious where you zone out while eating it because you're just lost in the flavours.  YUM!

Address: 1019 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: My dad and I were visiting Victoria on our way to shop RVs for my parents across the island. Dad ate the Vegan Hash, which he said was so delicious, large portion and very filling, while I shopped a few stores nearby. As I finished, I returned for a Chai Tea Latte with oat milk and it was also well done; flavorful, smooth and creamy. Would visit again next trip!

Address: 1551 Cedar Hill Cross Road Suite 215 Victoria, BC V8P 2P2 Canada
Review:
I only went here twice when I lived in Victoria. I had the beef don the first time and ramen the second time. Both were good. My friend has said that this was the best ramen he's ever had, so make of that what you will lol

I wish I could have come here more often, but whenever I tried to stop by they were always closed by coincidence, unfortunately. Hopefully I'll get to eat here again, one day.

Address: 1551 Cedar Hill Cross Road Suite 215 Victoria, BC V8P 2P2 Canada
