Review: Good ramen. Bad service. Could use more staff to help with the tables and to do cleaning. We were sat at the entrance under the a/c and close to the entrance and when asked to be moved to a booth we were told no (rudely), even when there were three booths empty.

Address: 1551 Cedar Hill Cross Road Suite 215 Victoria, BC V8P 2P2 Canada
Review: To me, it’s best ramen place in town, the size of the portion is good, taste of ramen, broth and toppings are all delicious. The server was super friendly.

Address: 1551 Cedar Hill Cross Road Suite 215 Victoria, BC V8P 2P2 Canada
Review: I came usually every week for a salt ramen, came again this week and was served soy instead of salt, gyoza tooks 20+ min and even came after the ramen. When I pointed out that the ramen soup is wrong they just took it back throwaway thr soy soup and pour salt in. Do u really think I cant see the soy color floating on my salt ramen or do u think the soy taste can just vanish? I understand that it can get busy during lunch hour but this is not what I can accept.

Address: 1551 Cedar Hill Cross Road Suite 215 Victoria, BC V8P 2P2 Canada
Review: I have been eating here for years and this was the worst experience. Miso soup and  Gyoza were made by an older woman. The soup she gave me was only enough for half a bowl. The bottom of the dumplings were all mushy and tasted bitter.

Address: 812 Wharf St Victoria, BC V8W 1T3 Canada
Review:
My recent dining experience at Milestone restaurant in Victoria was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment we stepped in, we were captivated by the very beautiful view of the water, which set the perfect ambiance for a delightful meal.

The service at Milestone was impeccable, with attentive and friendly staff making us feel welcome and well taken care of throughout the evening. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and offered excellent recommendations, adding a personal touch to the overall dining experience.

Speaking of the menu, the food at Milestone was simply outstanding. Each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavors. We tried a variety of dishes, but the one that stood out the most was the beef taco. It was a delectable combination of tender beef, fresh ingredients, and a perfectly balanced seasoning that left our taste buds delighted.

In addition to the beef taco, the menu offered an array of mouthwatering options to suit different palates, and each dish was crafted with precision and creativity.

The restaurant's waterfront location not only provided a stunning view but also added a soothing atmosphere to the dining experience. We enjoyed watching the sun setting over the water while savoring our scrumptious meal.

Overall, I highly recommend Milestone restaurant for a memorable dining experience in Victoria. The combination of the picturesque waterfront view, excellent service, and delightful food, especially the beef taco, made our visit truly memorable. Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner or a gathering with friends, Milestone is the perfect place to indulge in a memorable culinary journey.

Address: 812 Wharf St Victoria, BC V8W 1T3 Canada
Review:
Restaurant looked super busy but was able to be sat in less than 5 minutes. Fast service and food was delivered in a reasonable amount of time.

Fish Tacos with Fries, Sweet & Fire Cauliflower, Margarita, Peach Bellini were all delicious.

Food was fresh and drinks were strong!  Plenty of outdoor seating. Family friendly, close to the water. Highly recommend if your in the area.

Address: 812 Wharf St Victoria, BC V8W 1T3 Canada
Review:
We were seated on the Deck, which is more seafood focused and menu is more limited.

Food continues to be very good and service is attentive.   We cleaned our plates!

But let’s be honest, the highlight is the people watching you do!

Address: 812 Wharf St Victoria, BC V8W 1T3 Canada
Review: Great location amazing atmosphere and delicious food. Could not have asked for more. Starting from summer drinks,starters to main course all the dishes was appealing and tasty. Really loved the Baby back ribs. Excellent customer service. Would have loved to have dined outdoor, it is a busy summer time. Next time definitely.

Address: 812 Wharf St Victoria, BC V8W 1T3 Canada
Review:
The staff were attentive to our large group despite it being a busy night for them, and the food was some of the best restaurant food I've had in awhile. I had my baby with me and they were able to provide a high chair and bring water for his bottle when I needed it.
This restaurant has some really fun cocktails and lots of choice on their menu for a special night out. The view of the harbour was a lovely addition to a great meal. This restaurant would be a good choice for a party or date.

Address: 470 Belleville Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W9 Canada
Review: Silly us, we overestimated how warm it would be at night. Our food was amazing and the view can't be beat, we were just so cold even when they moved a heater close to us. The seafood platter more than feeds 2 adults. I had the top sirloin steak and it was cooked to perfection at medium rare. We were with friends and the other meals were steamed mussels and clams, fish and chips and pepperoni pizza. Everyone left full and happy. I'd say this was more spendy than many other restaurants in the area but totally worth it.

Address: 470 Belleville Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W9 Canada
Review: I came here with ten people. Unfortunately, we were all disappointed. Terrible service is an under statement. The food took over 45 mins to arrive. The food portions are small. The calamari which says is for two people isn’t enough to fill one person up. We were waiting for water for at least 15 mins. We were sitting outside and had no heaters next to us and they had none available. I left the restaurant still hungry. Overall, I am extremely disappointed.

Address: 470 Belleville Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W9 Canada
Review: The fish and chips were good but the clam chowder was like soup and tasted bland. They also got the kind of salad wrong. When another person in the group ordered a vegan burger and asked about the fries being cooked in the same oil as the meat and then ordered a salad. When the salad came it had cheese on it and other non vegan things. We also ordered sparkling water that never came to the table.

Address: 470 Belleville Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W9 Canada
Review: We had a great dining experience here with friends.  It was a busy Saturday night but we had a table that was off to the side overlooking the deck and it seemed quite there. Good food and good service.  We had the Tuna Poke Bowl, the Chicken Boom Boom Bowl and the Salmon Bowl. All were good!

Address: 470 Belleville Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W9 Canada
Review: Dinner time was busy, be prepared to be waiting.  Beautiful waterfront view and food were delicious and healthy too. We had harvest bowl (V) and mixed seafood.

Address: 2950 Douglas Street Unit 222 Victoria, BC V8T 4N4 Canada
Review: AMAZING. So excited to have authentic Japanese ramen in town. I had the Tan Tan Men, and the broth was so rich and incredible. Probably didn't need the extra noodles but I couldn't resist! Service was very friendly, polite and efficient. Will be returning forever :)

Address: 2950 Douglas Street Unit 222 Victoria, BC V8T 4N4 Canada
Review: Excellent food. Black arashi tan tan was fantastic. The chicken karaage was also great. It's a very good restaurant. The ramen was $17 and the appetizer was $7.50, and I felt it was worth it.

Address: 2950 Douglas Street Unit 222 Victoria, BC V8T 4N4 Canada
Review: It was not dissapointed as a forst customer. I think people really love their food. Great taste, especially the noodles/ramen so chewy. Love it. The flavour in my opinion is authentic, generous toppings as well. Ordered Takoyaki as an appetizer and taste amazing!! A great visit for lunch!

Address: 2950 Douglas Street Unit 222 Victoria, BC V8T 4N4 Canada
Review:
I have traveled across Canada and have had ramen at many restaurants. Ramen Arashi is the best I’ve had by far, and I cant get enough of their spicy tonkatsu. The broth is very flavorful and the chashu just melts in your mouth.

The restaurant works like a well oiled machine. All staff are well trained and good at what they do. Its a busy place and the staff handle it with grace. Thank you for great food and service!

Address: 2950 Douglas Street Unit 222 Victoria, BC V8T 4N4 Canada
Review: Hard to choose the best bowl, but the Spicy Tonkotsu ramen is always a treat. Nice to go on a Wednesday evening when there’s less of a crowd. No better ramen in Victoria.

Address: 2024 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1E4 Canada
Review: Our go-to neighbourhood fish and chips shop. We love any of the fish meals, popcorn shrimp, oyster po-boy and the Cesar salad. Ordering online is simple and their gluten free batter is crispy and delicious

Address: 2024 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1E4 Canada
Review: Oakbay Seafood  is truly a gem when it comes to offering a top-notch takeout experience! You can tell they are committed to offering only the freshest and highest quality products.   Tuesday taco is one of our favorite. Can't wait to place our next order and savour their oceanic delights once again.

Address: 2024 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1E4 Canada
Review: The chef and the crew were helpful to explain the menu and gave me a pasta salad to sample as well.  Very hospitable to me and my wife. Pasta salad is a must try and the fish and chips are great too..

Address: 2024 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1E4 Canada
Review: I had the shrimp sandwich, and it was pretty good. The bun was a little stale and dry, but the shrimp salad inside was good. I just expected a little more I guess. Staff was very pleasant and kind.

Address: 2024 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1E4 Canada
Review: I highly recommend this seafood shop as it serves the best and freshest halibut fish and chips ever!. The staff are very friendly, the decor is cheerful and the seafood selection, both fresh and frozen, is great. The fried fish was very crisp, flaky and favourable and the chips are fresh, firm and hand cut. I will be back for more!!!!! Thx Folks

Address: 1010 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V8 Canada
Review: The salad role was the best I have ever had. They have this crunchy thing in the middle that is a game changer. We had the bun and it was all really, really delicious, except the chicken. It was a bit soggy and tasteless. I would definitely eat here again but I would get something else.

Address: 1010 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V8 Canada
Review:
We had the spicy beef soup (spicy beef pho) and mom's special (dry noodle dish). Both were so flavourful. Very delicious. The lemongrass flavour is what really kicks it up a notch.

We're from Vancouver, and we have great Vietnamese restaurants. This place is as good, if not better, than places back home. That's a huge compliment! Congrats Victoria, you have a winner!

Address: 1010 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V8 Canada
Review: Love all we ordered !!! The curry, the skewers and the fresh veggie roll...they are all good. Oh ! You should try yheir Green Papaya Salad as your starter...sooo good !!!

Address: 1010 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V8 Canada
Review:
Friendly server and okay food.
Restaurant interior is very outdated has no acoustic insulation.  I could hear everything what the other 3 tables around me were saying. It was very loud or maybe they were loud people 🤔

Address: 1010 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V8 Canada
Review: We loved the Vietnamese grilled lemongrass chicken with the spring roll. The spring roll was a very generous portion, it was super big from being deep-fried. Very cozy and comfortable atmosphere. One note: do not order the spicy meatball soup unless you eat very spicy! It is actually spicy (and my friend couldn’t handle it haha) but very delicious flavors nonetheless. But they do mean it when they say spicy! :) Highly recommend.

Address: 1199 Government Street #100 - Bay Center Victoria Victoria, BC V8W 3M9 Canada
Review: Sleek and sophisticated dining experience; not quite royal as some of the restaurants competition around, but still excellent choice for late night food nonetheless. The sushi roll is not good, however the truffle fries are to die for. I had better Salmon at Vista 18, but Earls is really really good too, big portion and juicy, cooked right- however Earls should work on their rice that they use for sushi/mains. Presentation and side combinations are well thought; the sushi and fries could use a bit more of included sides, but you can always ask for more if the default portion isn’t enough. Non Alc beers are on the expensive side.

Address: 1199 Government Street #100 - Bay Center Victoria Victoria, BC V8W 3M9 Canada
Review: Earls has one of the best Happy Hours here in Victoria! I really like their drink selections, I would highly recommend their Sangrias. The Watermelon Slush is really good too! Although their happy hour menu has changed I really liked their Calamari and Kale and Mushroom Pizza! The Clam Chowder is really good too! I highly recommend getting the Truffle Fries and Spinach Dip as appetizers. Their chicken tacos are also pretty good too! Dessert wise I really like their Toffee Chocolate Pudding. Overall my experience at Earls has been 10/10!

Address: 1199 Government Street #100 - Bay Center Victoria Victoria, BC V8W 3M9 Canada
Review:
The cocktails are really very good, there is a choice and the menu changes regularly.
The food is good but not exceptional and it does not justify the price charged : $25 for a salad and the same price for a basic bacon burger!
The terrace is nice, I was able to go there with my dog.

Second experience more than satisfactory, top cocktails (hawaiian mai tai, marylin monroe, blue hawaian) and seafood tower ($120) excellent and perfect for 2 people!
It's one of the best places to enjoy a good cocktail in victoria (many are either not dosed enough in alcohol, or tasteless or too many ice cubes)

Address: 1199 Government Street #100 - Bay Center Victoria Victoria, BC V8W 3M9 Canada
Review: Everything was great as usual. I just wished they wouldn’t take away the shrimp spaghetti. It was a personal favourite and alot of other customer’s too (as I overheard).

Address: 1199 Government Street #100 - Bay Center Victoria Victoria, BC V8W 3M9 Canada
Review:
Not the best earls I’ve been to but still good food! There’s not a lot open late in Victoria so this is a good option for a decent selection. The rare steak was very good, the truffle fries were really good. The rest was just OK.

The new truffle ravioli was disappointing and I got it with the prawns but they were pathetically small and underwhelming (not worth the extra $). The ravioli was good but felt a bit undercooked, the sauce was a bit watery and didn’t adhere to the pasta well.

The Cajun chicken was tasty and not dry, the ribs were a little dry. It came with potato salad which was kind of bland.

The atmosphere in here is nice and decent service! Good location, but if you’re driving since it’s downtown you need to take a bit of time to park.

Address: 1600 Government Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8W 1Z3 Canada
Review: 3 stars for food as I didn’t quite like the dal tadka, coconut rice and Kale potato curry. Samosas were good as expected. Naan is soft and well cooked. Service is great. Spacious place too.

Address: 1600 Government Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8W 1Z3 Canada
Review:
Visited the place few days back with my friends. I must say this is simply amazing... right from the staff to the taste of food and drinks. Biryani, chicken, kofta.... all were mouth watering delicious.
Surely coming back.

Address: 1600 Government Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8W 1Z3 Canada
Review: excellent and tasty food. we tried biryani and chicken wings..Arshad was a great host and a friendly personality. We thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience here..

Address: 1600 Government Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8W 1Z3 Canada
Review: I can not attest to how authentic the food is as I am not indian, but it was pretty yummy to me. The braised lamb curry was super tender and I don't eat super spicy, they were very accomadating with making the curry mild for me and it tasted just right. Although I've had better naan bread elsewehre, the ones here were not bad. The resturant is very spacious and the service was decent, I would not mind coming back here again.

Address: 1600 Government Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8W 1Z3 Canada
Review: We had checked in this afternoon for lunch in Varsha Indian kitchen Victoria island the food was amazing but felt if they had added more meat pieces that would be great but the taste was fantastic and the waitress over was nice and suggested the items to try she is a professional.. if anyone wants to have mild flavours I would recommend to go with spicy then the taste would be apt as mild that was my thought overall great food and had an amazing time and nice ambiance..🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤 I would recommend this as to go place in Victoria BC😉😉😉

Address: 1813 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8T 4K5 Canada
Review: Had yet another amazing take out dinner from this cute little authentic Thai restaurant!! Everything was super fresh, perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious😋!! The house made spring rolls are the best we’ve ever had, super crispy without being greasy and the filling is so good! We also ordered a container of their in-house made peanut sauce for home use, which is unlike any other peanut sauce we’ve tried…it’s the perfect thickness, made with actual peanuts (unlike most out there that are just watered down sweetened store bought peanut butter). It’s a must try if you love peanut sauce!! 🥜😋

Address: 1813 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8T 4K5 Canada
Review: Really nice, cozy spot for some excellent Thai food.. spring rolls are best I've had in Victoria. I went with green curry/prawns/coconut rice and medium spice... they nailed it!!! My gorgeous date went with pad thai and pawns and seems to enjoy it 😉... correction she does enjoy it ...looks like I'll get a second date outta the deal 🤙

Address: 1813 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8T 4K5 Canada
Review:
First visit and had great experience. Employees are so friendly and cooperative. Food was amazing with great price. I had my best fried rice so far.
Will come back for sure.

Address: 1813 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8T 4K5 Canada
Review: I love their Yen Ta Four Noodle. It’s tasty like thai style. The owner and staffs are super friendly and helpful.  I would love to come back and try other menus.

Address: 1813 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8T 4K5 Canada
Review: Best Thai food in Victoria! The restaurant run by a Thai lovely family. Free coconut ice cream shows how sweet they are 💕. Their foods were amazing. We all love Thai fried rice. Their weekly special Pink noodle soup was authentic and tasty. Every dish cook one by one so we could choose the spice level. The dinner portion is generous. The decorations are very lovely.

Address: 784 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L4 Canada
Review: Tried the Drunk Mushroom pizza and it was great.  A bit of a different kind of pizza but I'm happy I made the choice. There were lots of tempting choices on their pizza menu and I had a hard time narrowing it down. Prices were entirely reasonable. Staff was friendly and helpful. I'd go back here.

Address: 784 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L4 Canada
Review: Great pizza!  Good luck catching them when they are open though. Literally, at least 50% of the time I go there, they are randomly closed. I don’t think they even have set hours.

Address: 784 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L4 Canada
Review:
Looking for fantastic, flavorful, well topped pizza in downtown Victoria? Check out Brickyard Pizza! Perfect crispy, thin crust...topped just right and packed with flavor! Dine in or take out... the atmosphere is very chill and laid back. They only make one size of pizza which is a 14" (large)... the menu has something for everyone, and the price is really decent especially for the quality of the pizza!

We had the Brick and a 4-cheese!

Address: 784 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L4 Canada
Review: Only giving this place a 5 Star rating because of Logan! Best server I’ve had and such a hard worker! She’s so friendly and amazing, made so many amazing suggestions for sightseeing. Absolute superstar, if I owned the place she would deserve top dollar! Thank you Logan!!!

Address: 784 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L4 Canada
Review: Usually, just pop in for a slice but it's also a good place to eat-in with friends and have a drink. Stopped in with a friend for a sit-down and wasn't disappointed.

Address: 120 - 735 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
Not only is the food great here, but the customer service is some of the best I have ever seen.

The owners are so nice and courteous, and provide detailed attention to each customer.

I got the grilled chicken roll and it was so fresh and delicious. You can tell they use good ingredients here, and really know how to make proper Japanese Sushi.

I definitely will be back to this great establishment.

Address: 120 - 735 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: Incredible food with the friendliest hospitality! I was amazed that the owner knew so many of her customers by name. My favorite is the Unagi roll

Address: 120 - 735 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: Great counter service and lots to choose from! I ordered avocado rolls, a Philly roll and a Teriyaki Noodle Box with Veggies and Tofu. They've been here for 9 years!

Address: 120 - 735 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
Truly the best sushi I have ever had in my life. I’m from Vancouver & was in town for business and decided to give this place a try based on its reviews.

The grilled chicken roll and salmon avocado roll was so fresh and delicious, the couple that own the restaurant are extremely kind hearted and accommodating. I wish them nothing but success 🙏.

I will keep on coming back whenever I am in town!

-Sunny

Address: 120 - 735 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: The owners made a huge impression with their sweetness.  Then, the food was incredible.  We ordered the seafood udon, nigiri, rolls, and the avocado poke salad.  It was all thoughtfully presented and of the highest quality.  They use free range eggs and only wild caught salmon.  The environment was also most pleasant in an air conditioned area.

Address: 1018 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H5 Canada
Review: This is an amazing place for ramen. It's definitely my favorite place in Victoria. I've mostly ordered from home, but since I feel more comfortable now about eating in restaurants again, I figured that I should stop by for a visit finally. Everything tasted fresher and hotter than compared to ordering for home. The service was fantastic, the staff was fantastic. Everything was very clean. I was very impressed and will definitely be back. Thank you.

Address: 1018 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H5 Canada
Review: A must-try! Minimalist ambience. The creamy broth of the Menbow ramen has a roasted garlic flavor. The chicken karaage is the best in town.

Address: 1018 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H5 Canada
Review: I’ve been wanting to try this Ramen place for a while and I was pretty surprised with how many options they had! I ordered the Tantanmen and it was pretty good! I liked how there was bean sprouts and the iconic swirly fishcake and of course bok choy. The only thing I would say tho is I felt like the broth was a little too salty. But overall it’s a pretty good ramen. I also ordered the shrimp tempura, which was really yummy too! I would come back to try their Black Garlic Ramen.

Address: 1018 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H5 Canada
Review: We are visiting Victoria from Washington and decided to go to try the ramen here. It was good. I ordered shio ramen it was good, not too salty but it's ok. ( I like salty and hard ramen noodles ). The taste is almost the same as ramen in Japan. Will come back when we visit Victoria again.

Address: 1018 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H5 Canada
Review:
A well-thought out ramen restaurant. Restaurant is clean and tidy with attentive waitresses. The menu shows a variety of ramen options such as pork, chicken, or clear (vegan?) broth base. There are ones without broth such as tantan, stirred, or rice available. There are also side dishes to compliment to the order or not.

Miso pork broth ramen is delicious. The bowl comes with large cuts of BBQ pork, bamboo shoots, finely diced green onion, corn nibs, half of an marinated egg, nori sheet, Japanese seasoning, and a couple more. It isn’t salty. Overall there’s a lot going on with each bite a diner wont be bored of it.

On to the didn’t meet expectation part. I may be off but I guess the noodle is generic noodle kind one could purchase from market. Not sure if this has anything to do with the food but I felt super thirsty about two hours after dinning.

In general, this place is a nice option for downtown dining.

Address: 100 Harbour Road Victoria, BC V9A 0G1 Canada
Review: Overlooking the harbor, this restaurant offers a stunning view that captivates. Too bad the rest wasn't the same. While the service was fine but not great, the food falls short of inspiration or taste.  Nonetheless, the picturesque location may still appeal to those seeking a scenic dining experience with average culinary offerings.

Address: 100 Harbour Road Victoria, BC V9A 0G1 Canada
Review: Some of the most creative food we have had in a while. The combination of flavours was great. Fantastic views of the harbour. Easy parking at the hotel, which is free if dining there. Great night out.

Address: 100 Harbour Road Victoria, BC V9A 0G1 Canada
Review:
Ambiance was great. Stablefish and crab cakes were amazing. The chefs seared and crisped up the skin on the fish perfectly.
Lindsey our server was sweet and attentive. All staff in the restaurant have been amazing since our stay.
Definitely recommend!

Address: 100 Harbour Road Victoria, BC V9A 0G1 Canada
Review:
UPDATE: Hanson is an excellent bartender. Hope he’s there when you grab a drink at the bar. 🍻

Here for Happy Hour in the bar. Great prices for both drinks and food. Bartenders are extremely friendly and helped us plan our weekend stay in town.

Address: 100 Harbour Road Victoria, BC V9A 0G1 Canada
Review: Let’s start with the positive. View is extraordinary, you get to see the inner harbour from a very good angle. Staff are friendly and helpful. Now the terrifying part is the food which is a hit and miss. Chicken wings were amazing. Burger, sandwich, and fish and chips were horrifying. It’s hard to screw up fish and chips on the island. So many other places do it so well. The batter was very thick AND soft. Thick batter we have seen, but soft thick uncooked batter is weird. As for the the burger and sandwiches, bacon was very hard, patty all you taste is salt, and the buns were quite burned. Fries, some were not folly cooked. Manager was quick to address our experience. People here are nice, but I don’t know if I would risk the chance for the food though.

Address: 607 Oswego St Victoria, BC V8V 4W9 Canada
Review: 4/5 and 4/6/23:  It’s not often good cuisine meets stellar service and wonderful atmosphere!  As a solo diner, I didn’t feel slighted and was seated at a window table.  I had the spaghetti bolognese on day 1 and returned to have steak & prawns with the house salad on day 2.  I was a happy grandma.  Thanks, Julie!

Address: 607 Oswego St Victoria, BC V8V 4W9 Canada
Review: Celebrated my husband's birthday in this quaint and home style atmosphere. Waitress was attentive. Food was very good. Been in business for 40+ years. Would eat here again

Address: 607 Oswego St Victoria, BC V8V 4W9 Canada
Review: Absolutely impeccable food. The best oysters Rockefeller I've ever had anywhere, and I've tried it everywhere! Ordered take-out, and my orders were ready not more than 15 mins after calling them in - insanely quick given the quality of the cuisine! This will become a regular stop for me whenever I find myself in Victoria again. First class!

Address: 607 Oswego St Victoria, BC V8V 4W9 Canada
Review: Service was good. But non-alcoholic cocktails contain alcohol. 5 months ago, I had gastric cancer surgery. so absolutely alcohol is dangerous to me. also, my friend's food has a kitchen iron brush. My birthday dinner has become a risky meal.

Address: 607 Oswego St Victoria, BC V8V 4W9 Canada
Review: What a fabulous meal and experience!  The best server ever (not sure if his name was James)-good advice regarding choices, engaging with folks at all tables-including us, perfect sense of humour, very accommodating and upbeat.  Happily it was a quiet beautiful place with wonderful jazz playing in the background. The seafood was yummy!

Address: 766 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H2 Canada
Review: Great place for some great tacos 🌮 😋 We have dined here several times now, and as of late, for the Happy Hour menu. Tacos are big and filling and priced well. They are well presented and put together. We had the Fish, Cauliflower, Carnita and Bean tacos, delightful. The Guacamole and chips are yummy too, the chips are nice and crunchy with the right amount of seasoning. Definitely recommend. It's our favorite place for tacos any day of the week 😋

Address: 766 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H2 Canada
Review: Aye yaye yaye! Lunch was everything we could ask for. Fast service and really yummy meals. We had the fried chicken burrito, fish baja tacos, beef burrito and of course the very tasty and chilled Miss Hibiscus Margarita. Definitely coming back to try more tacos and special drinks!

Address: 766 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H2 Canada
Review: I've been a loyal patron of this Victoria Taqueria for years whenever I visit from California. The service has consistently been outstanding, deserving a 5-star rating, and the inviting atmosphere never fails to impress. The food has always been a delightful experience, offering truly authentic Mexican cuisine that tantalizes my taste buds on every visit. However, today I was greatly disappointed. The food was prepared poorly, with overcooked dishes and an excessive use of cooking oil. The tacos lacked any distinct flavor, overwhelmed by the taste of oil, and were noticeably overdone. On a positive note, the beverages were excellent, the service remained fantastic, and atmosphere of the restaurant has a great vibe. Considering the price I paid for lunch, I expected a far superior experience reminiscent of my previous visits. I'm pretty sure this was my last visit to this restaurant.

Address: 766 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H2 Canada
Review: The tacos were super delicious!  I’m super happy I tried this place.  The tacos were a bit pricey but I will come back. And I would love to see what they have for their happy hour.  Highly recommend!

Address: 766 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H2 Canada
Review: Don’t say you serve signature homemade guacamole when it’s clearly packaged. It was whipped and had a weird texture like the stuff you get out of bags. It was unappetizing. Ordered 4 tacos and they were all soggy and had hardly any filling. I absolutely love Mexican food and am shocked that this place is so popular. Had really high hopes. Not to mention service was sooooo slow, took them 20 minutes just to take our order.

Address: 703 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B4 Canada
Review: Used to eat here back in the late 90s long before Google existed. But came here tonight to meet up with one of my acquaintance. The food's alright but service was only satisfactory. Still a good place to chill and have a good hang. Food value seems decent.

Address: 703 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B4 Canada
Review: I was very impressed that they could accommodate a table of 8 at 5:30 on a Friday so quickly. The restaurant is huge so I understood more as we were seated. The design of the restaurant was good but fairly basic and comfortable. It was very busy but I felt like they did a great job getting food and drinks to us. The value of the food was pretty good and they have a great food and beverage selection. The kids meals were generous and tasty. I had the seafood fettuccine Alfredo and I found it quite watery and bland. My sister has the manicotti and she thought it was good. A good family restaurant with mid to high prices.

Address: 703 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B4 Canada
Review:
This place is one of the greatest!
Good value for money.
I’ve been to all this franchise and Gas town and this location are the best.
Evan, bar manager, is friendly and he knows how to practice greatest customer service and build a strong rapport with guests.
Recommend this place to everyone.

Address: 703 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B4 Canada
Review: Good price. Good services. Nice people!!! Everyone is so so so patient and kind to us when we taking photos indoor. will recommend to friends.

Address: 703 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B4 Canada
Review: Gosh! I tell you their spaghetti is awesome. I don’t take a picture of my food but, because I was so starving that evening so, I forgot to take some pictures. Everything was absolutely delicious and amazing supper. Their warm bread with whipped garlic butter were top notch! Keep asking them to refill and they bring it up on the table. Always make reservation before otherwise you will be waiting for a long time to get your table. And because they are busy, just be patience and be kind to the waitress. They serve you really well.

Address: 206-2250 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: This is a very unique place! Oldest building in Oak Bay. A YUGE menu, which can be daunting to get through, but everything we had was quite tasty! Fair prices, electric crowd, warm service. More than meets the eye!

Address: 206-2250 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review:
The interior is warm but if you are coming here for good service or good food..... GO ELSEWHERE!!
We waited for over 10 minutes before a waitress came to our table. She was rude, not helpful and dismissive. When we finally got our meal she forgot the cream for my tea and although I reminded her she didn't bring it. I finally asked another woman if I could have some.
I also asked 3 times for the jam I had told her I wanted when I gave her my original order. Although she said yes twice, it never appeared. One of the worst breakfasts I've had and the Welsh rarebit that my partner had was not edible. After all this when we asked for the check she didn't bring it. We finally went to the bar to pay it. Needless to say with no tip, which rarely happens with us. We are 20% tippers.
I would never eat here again......nor should you 😂

Address: 206-2250 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review:
Love this place. We have been twice in our first four days here on the island. Friday night for fish and chips and French onion soup, then on Monday for Full Tea and the Original Burger and fries. The place is a nice old fashioned pub, with a white exterior and large black beams. Inside is full of great old tables and chairs.
Our food was wonderful every time we went.
I had been looking for a place with the English pub feeling and Afternoon Tea at a fair price. They have several Tea choices, full tea was only $28!

Address: 206-2250 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: That his our first visit since it had been the Blethering Place! We came for afternoon tea which was quite enjoyable. The wait staff were very efficient and also quite casual. It wasn’t bad at all, just not the tearoom experience we were expecting. It felt a bit like having afternoon tea in a snug, pub or bar.

Address: 206-2250 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: Went there on a Sunday, just me. They took forever to seat me. I ordered a coffee and the shortrib eggs benny, the first mug she gave had a lipstick mark on which was replaced when asked. The eggs benny there was plenty of shortrib but lacking of flavor and salt! I don't usually add extra salt after food is served but I had to. The only tasty thing was their parmesan potatoes! I would try a dinner to give them another chance.

Address: 990 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H3 Canada
Review:
Good service. Not too crowded. Excellent service. The waitress and host were very attentive and friendly.

I shared the Omakase with one other person which was enough.  It's not really an omakase but it plated quite appealingly and I like the novelty.

There were some questionable items however. I wasn't a big fan of the shrimp dumplings ha gow and the bao bun as they seemed to me very put of place. Both were very underwhelming in taste and texture.

The  yuzu sauce paired perfectly with the raw oysters however.  Takoyaki and squid skewer were unremarkable but tasty nonetheless.

I'd probably not recommend the omakase as items are hit and miss.

Address: 990 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H3 Canada
Review:
Cool little bar we found while looking for a place to have a late meal (11pm) and drink on a Sunday night. Pretty comprehensive sake selection which you can see they take seriously, with menus telling you about the level of polish on the rice.

We had the chef's sashimi platter which was really nice. Staff were all great too.

They have a nice range of Japanese whisky too, and they do flights :)

Address: 990 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H3 Canada
Review: Having been fortunate to experience a large number of Japanese restaurants, this one ranks in the top 3. Massive selection of sake, one of the largest is Canada. Every dish we tried was amazing. Finally, the service was spot on. Highly recommend.

Address: 990 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H3 Canada
Review:
Came here on a Thursday night and they had a lot of tables available with attentive and friendly service. Got the Shokado bento box, which features 9 small dishes of raw and cooked food curated by the chef. This is great for sharing with 1 other friend.

This traditional bento box contains gorgeous dishes; the 9 dishes consisted of: 2 types of sashimi, sushi roll, tuna tataki salad, fresh oysters, shrimp dumplings (har gow), fried mini octopus skewers, shrimp bao, and takoyaki. My favourite is the tuna tataki salad - delicious tuna and dressing. Even though cute, the har gow seemed out of place since I associate that with Chinese cuisine and I've definitely had better at dim sum restaurants.

Address: 990 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H3 Canada
Review: Looking for the best sushi in Victoria? Well look no further. Ene is THE PLACE to go for unique cocktails, fresh sashimi, and delicious food. Chef Eric & his team are super passionate about creating the best guest experience and keep things fun and interesting with feature drinks and dishes. Don’t sleep on the Moriawase 126, Jackie Chan oshi, Oroku Saki roll, and Bulgogi Pasta (my favourites). Their happy hour is also a great time to try lots of small dishes and taste a wide variety of drinks. I come here almost every week to eat and post photos/reviews at @vicflavours

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
Best Poké I’ve had. And I’ve had a lot…

I got the Island Bowl and was seriously impressed… the fish just tastes so fresh and has an irresistible marinade coating. All the ingredients were bursting with flavor and worked together so well… was a bit steep at $15-20 per bowl but ended up being so good that I’d go again.

Definitely recommend trying this place!

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: Delicious poke with crunchy and umami toppings. Requested the tangerines on the side and the service kindly put the portion into small containers.

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
“When life gives you lemons… squeeze them, add salt, garlic, oils, honey, and create a marinade for cubed fish”…….this is what I imagine the owners think at Island Poke.

Very fresh and bright ingredients. I had the Ohana bowl for lunch. A great size and prepared by friendly staff. I will be back. Yum.

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: I can't say enough about how great this gem is. I go almost every day because the food is so good and affordable with hearty portions and delicious recipes. The staff are friendly, they remember your name, and always go the extra mile.

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
The food was exceptionally fresh and excellent tasting. I ordered a bowl 🥣.
All kinds of choices for your bowl. You can pretty much have it made the way you want it. The service was great we got to watch our food be made right in front of us. Stayed at the restaurant to eat, and this little place was cozy.
I'm not much for raw sushi type foods. I'll tell you one thing,, I was impressed and probably will go back.

Address: 1313 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2E9 Canada
Review:
Feels like coming home to your favourite aunt and uncles! Great bubble tea & Always friendly and fun atmosphere! Funky art and environment, the chairs walls and even the stairs have neat art.
A staple in Victoria that we are lucky to have - you must visit.

Thank you for your great service!

Address: 1313 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2E9 Canada
Review:
Decently authentic Cantonese food, ridiculously outstanding service!

I didn’t have high expectations of this restaurant given its location, but what a nice surprise!

Google review did not disappoint, the service was second to none, we honestly felt like having dined at a friend’s house. Everyone was so friendly, served us spring rolls on the house, gave my parents bubble tea samplers, took time to chat with us, and made sure to make the food extra soft for my senior parents.

The decor is quite charming, there is a world map where customers pin where they are from on the map, it’s almost full. :)

Address: 1313 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2E9 Canada
Review: My family enjoyed our experience! The service is outstanding, the food was clean and delicious! This is a must try! Try the bubble tea.

Address: 1313 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2E9 Canada
Review: Absolutely amazing!!! The food was delicious. We got some of the boba tea and the dinner for 4, and everything was delicious! We got the sweet and sour pork, szechwan beef, and some noodles and it was all so good. The owners were some of the most friendly people we met on our trip. If you are looking for a place to eat near china town, this is the place!

Address: 1313 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2E9 Canada
Review: I came here with my husband and 4 kids aged 21, 18, 15, and 11.  Our meal here was a highlight of our 5 day stay here in Victoria!  We ordered the meal for four plus an extra entree and with 3 hungry teenagers we had leftovers.  The food pleased the picky eaters and the food snobs alike in our big family.  We all got bobba tea and decided the real fruit tea was the best.  If the great food wasnt enough to make you happy, the joyful service and human love exuding from the service would make it a joyful family dinner as well.  If everyone were as kind and friendly as these wonderful people what a world it would be.  If only i lived here in Victoria, i would be a regular here!

Address: 950 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C6 Canada
Review:
Not sure why I don't come to this restaurant more often; I enjoyed the ambiance, location, food, and menu items.  It's a reasonable place to take someone for a date- however not too intimate, pretty casual for a setting.

Date dinner with the Hubby almost a month ago (haven't reviewed), didn't know it was two for one appetizer Saturdays. OF COURSE we ordered the two-for-one! Why not? It's there, if it wasn't something we enjoyed, we didn't have to order it or come back, so there was nothing to lose.

Had no regrets on the selection; ordered the wings with Apple BBQ flavour, and the calamari. Be warned, the calamari does have some spicy kick to it- and I like spicy. Still delicious. Wings were crispy, even with the sauce- just a personal preference.

For the entrees my husband ordered the Halibut burger - but somehow ended up with the two-piece halibut fish and chips- he went with it, and didn't have any regrets. The batter wasn't overly thick, and the fish was thankfully not dry. My own order was spicy prawn tacos, and they were lovely. nice, light, refreshing. It comes with a side, but thankfully I chose this, because the appetizers were filling enough. The fries were nothing remarkable, but I did enjoy them.

We arrived around 5:30pm, to which dinner was just getting started- the tables were about 90% full, and our food still arrived at a "reasonable time" (we were in and out in an hour, without rushing our order and dinner).  The atmosphere was overall good; didn't feel rushed, didn't feel like we were inconveniencing anyone when we asked for refills of our drinks. I will, of course, come back again. Even for a somewhat price-conscious person, I'm very satisfied with my visit.

Highlights for me:
Accessible washroom
Two-for-one Appetizer Saturdays (excluding a few items)
Easy parking
Good service and food

Take note:
No dog patio

Address: 950 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C6 Canada
Review: Loved the food, great place to bring our young kids. We saw a couple otters on the ramp on our way in and out. Service was OK but thinking back, maybe under staffed. Atmosphere was good, next time we will probably request to sit on the flight deck with patio.

Address: 950 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C6 Canada
Review: We sat in the patio and had a pilsener and an apple cider while we waited for our Caesar salad and halibut fish and chips. The food was great. some of the best fish and chips I'd had. I'd recommend a bit more dressing on the salad but the fried capers that it came with were a nice touch. Our server was attentive but not over bearing. Would go again.

Address: 950 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C6 Canada
Review:
Found this place while wandering aimlessly around Victoria. We loved the name and decided to give it a try. It was a little busy, but the hostess gave us the option to sit at the bar. I'm so glad we did. The Otter has an excellent drink selection, including local brews. We split an order of poutine (IYKYK) that was absolutely fantastic! We loved watching the activity on the docks as we ate, including one seagull that liked to look in the windows to see what people were eating.

The staff were amazing and friendly from the jump. They also worked incredibly well together, anticipating what others needed, which increased the level of customer care and service. They elevated the experience tenfold.

Address: 950 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C6 Canada
Review: A cute view of the harbour sitting at a high-top table. The chowder was very good. I had the salmon tacos with a salad on the side. If you're doing this, try a different side than salad. I don't recommend. The side salad on its own was fantastic but was basically the same ingredients in the salmon taco. There was no variation in my lunch. The salmon was a very small piece on a huge bed of salad. Couldn't really taste anything but salad. My partner had the fish and chips. The fries/chips were great and the fish was battered lightly and was fresh.  He had no tartar sauce given though. Isn't that a fish and chips staple? I left hungry and unsatisfied with the salmon taco. I have to go back to try again.

Address: 1701 Douglas Street Unit 6 Victoria, BC V8W 0C1 Canada
Review: This was my first stop on my first visit to the Public Market.  I had high hopes after reading the blurb on their website.  I went for porchetta and for meatballs, planning a take-out order for meal prep at home.  It was on a Monday, around noon, and the market was nearly empty.  At Roast I saw the porchetta on offer, and decided to pass on that.  I spoke to the server, and ended up settling for "a cup of balls", a container with some arrabiata and four meatballs.  The next day I made a meatball sub with part of my order, and this is what I found:  irregularly shaped meatballs, very crumbly, in a small amout of sauce which had a rather thick layer of solidified fat on top...out of the fridge, of course...and I used two meatballs for my toasted sandwich, which was okay.  I can cook, so I did a good job on the prep.  As I said, it was an okay sandwich.  Three stars.  My hopes were aimed higher, but I am glad I made the effort to check Roast out. I plan to keep on looking for good meatballs in Victoria!

Address: 1701 Douglas Street Unit 6 Victoria, BC V8W 0C1 Canada
Review: Delicious food and good service! Exactly what I want from a quick food restaurant. The chicken meatball sandwich was delicious, and if you've got a bigger appetite then try one of the bowls. Lots of fresh salad toppings if that's your thing. I'll definitely be back!

Address: 1701 Douglas Street Unit 6 Victoria, BC V8W 0C1 Canada
Review:
Went in for a meatball sub which they had no meat balls left, ended up getting a pork sandwich which was cold chunks of pork on a untoasted rock hard bun. The beef sandwich we got had a thick peice of broccoli on it that wasn't even done defrosting yet.
The side potatoes where cold aswell! Went back to look for the person manning the front to complain, and found no one there!

Address: 1701 Douglas Street Unit 6 Victoria, BC V8W 0C1 Canada
Review: I tried the beef sandwich there with chimichurri and onion jam - it was soo tasty and satisfying. I always say that bread can make or break a sandwich and they chose the perfect bread for it. It was so soft and fresh. I'm really happy I found this place :)

Address: 1701 Douglas Street Unit 6 Victoria, BC V8W 0C1 Canada
Review: Went here based off recommendation from Tasting Victoria to get their pulled pork sandwich, which looked really delicious in the photo. Unfortunately, they were not serving this sandwich today, so we tried the regular pork sandwich instead. The staff were pleasant but the sandwiches were disappointing especially for $14 a sandwich. The pork was cold, the bread was cold and the sandwich came smooshed and looked unappealing. It felt like something we could have slapped together at home for much cheaper. Based on the other reviews it seems like consistency is a challenge for this establishment and perhaps we came on the wrong day.

Address: 4136 Wilkinson Road Victoria, BC V8Z 5A7 Canada
Review: Dropped in for a quick bite. My favorite was the Dark Matter beer by Hoyne brewing.  The loaded tots were delicious and plenty for two to share. I love roasted carrots, and theirs did not disappoint, great flavor and perfectly spiced. Add smoked chicken to any dish to make it a perfect combination! I'm glad we stopped.

Address: 4136 Wilkinson Road Victoria, BC V8Z 5A7 Canada
Review: Very nice place. Food taste really good and fresh. Good selection for drinks and my kid eats free. 😍 Many things homemade. Coming everytime I visit Victoria with my family.

Address: 4136 Wilkinson Road Victoria, BC V8Z 5A7 Canada
Review:
The service was awesome, the atmosphere was quiet, the eggs Benny were great but wasn't impressed with the tater tots even though I ate them all, lol.
My Goose juice was delicious 😋!

Address: 4136 Wilkinson Road Victoria, BC V8Z 5A7 Canada
Review: I usually don’t complain, but this time I had to! The quality of the food was like it was cooked yesterday and heated in the microwave. The price points are simply way too high for the quality of the food. The service was HORRIBLE, there is clearly no standard here on how their servers should be treating customers. If you’re thinking about going here, I would highly recommend reconsidering and saving your money. There are much better places in the area!

Address: 4136 Wilkinson Road Victoria, BC V8Z 5A7 Canada
Review:
This is a cozy Restaurant that has a good menu and is reasonably priced. It was very busy when we visited and the staff were friendly and prompt. It took a while to get our food (25 mins) but we knew that when we ordered.

The food was good. I had the fried chicken sandwich and it was tasty. The side of poutine wasn't great, but it was serviceable.

I would go back again, maybe for their Trivia Night as it looked those folks were having a great time.

Address: 1017 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review: I visited day before yesterday. I love such a welcoming staff and friendly customer service. And on top of that food was so delicious. I am vegetarian and it is difficult to find tasty option in Victoria, but La Taquisa is one of the best place for veg people like me. I would highly recommend to try Tortila soup. 🫶🏼

Address: 1017 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
This is the place to go if you want delicious Mexican food! Excellent every time we go, I recommend the chicken mole burrito. Lots of spice levels and flavour profiles to choose from if you like a lot or a little.

The staff is absolutely great - friendly, helpful and patient.

Nice indoor eating space, but options to sit outdoors in the front on the street or in the courtyard at the back (we didn’t know it was there the first time we came!).

Address: 1017 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
Authentic Mexican food, like for real. I had a giant burrito with Beef Al Pastor. The meat was so soft and tasty, combined with marvelous beans and cheese that are nothing like you would ever experience at a Tex-Mex Americanized place.

Now the salsa, oh boy the green salsa, savory salsa made just right to be flavourful while still mild. I combined that with some sour cream, perfect match for me. I could eat a whole meal of just chips with this.

A friend of mine ordered their small quesadillas and they looked just as good, I can't wait to try some next time.

Address: 1017 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review: Thank you so much for catering our office luncheon today! The setup was very nicely done and the food was wonderful.  Everyone asked me where I ordered the food from.  For the first time out of all the monthly lunches, I didn't have any leftovers. Unfortunately, I couldn't take pictures of all the food but I managed to get a few. Look at that guacamole!!!

Address: 1017 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
We tried this place for the first time today and were excited, given reviews and the lovely service when we arrived. They were out of limes, which is fine as we thought the ones at home should work fine.

We ordered two 5 taco deals with a mix of beef, fish and shrimp to try them out. We came home and opened the box and were shocked by what we found. Tacos with barely any toppings, fish ripped to shreds, little to no seasoning or toppings on the beef and some of the tacos were under-cooked. They were basically tacos with a bit of some sauce and pieces of shredded lettuce. That too with unseasoned meat and ripped oily breaded fish. We were very disappointed, as I was personally looking forward to having tacos tonight. Bummer. Did like their salsas and Valentino sauce was nice and spicy, but the tacos themselves are underwhelming compared even to other places we’ve tried in the city. Again, bummer as the staff was nice.

Address: 1205 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review:
-Great location with harbour view from their beautiful patio.
-Food is okay with reasonable price
-Service is very very slow. We asked 3 times for water and at last my wife had to go herself to get it

Address: 1205 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: We went here on a gorgeous day in Victoria. The drinks were tasty. I had The Local Lemonade and my husband had a mojito. We stopped in for a snack and shared the Stanley Cup Poutine and a pound of hot wings. The wings were fried to perfection and the gravy on the fries was delicious! The service was wonderful as well. Everyone was working hard to make sure everyone had what they needed.

Address: 1205 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: Went for brunch with a friend. The service was good, as well as the ambiance. We ordered poutine and a sandwich, and the food was yummy and abundant. The waiters were friendly, and I recommend 👌 the place if you are close to the area.

Address: 1205 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review:
We came here during the semifinals of the world cup and the atmosphere was incredible. World cup aside, this place was recommended to us by other restaurants and we decided we had to try it.

The food, beer and service was all top notch and all of the staff we spoke to was exceptional. After the match we somehow ended up speaking to the owner, Jeremy, and he seemed as if he really cared about his pub and the people and the staff.

I couldn't rate the experience any better and next time we're in Victoria we'll definitely come back.

Thanks for the experience

Address: 1205 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: I went with a friend and my dog this weekend, and every aspect was so wonderful! It was busy but the service was still amazing, a super dog friendly patio, every server was so sweet about getting us water or anything we needed for the pup and the atmosphere of others around us was also amazing! Couldn’t recommend it more! And the food was great.

Address: 809 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2W8 Canada
Review: So delicious, best Thai food in Victoria, I ordered vegetable spring roll, crispy duck, bamboo red curry, they are super delicious, especially the Thai iced tea, it is the best Thai tea I’ve ever tried in Victoria.

Address: 809 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2W8 Canada
Review:
A great place to eat, with good service, and tasty food.
My only complaint is that they leave the tails on the shrimp when they serve them, but I’m sure you could ask for the tails off.

Address: 809 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2W8 Canada
Review: We went on June 21 for the first time.  It's friendly and comfortable.  The staff were kind and helpful.  We had Pad Thai with chicken, a red curry and coconut rice.  It was all delicious and generous portions, all gluten free. The decor is old but I don't mind that at all.  There were young families and seniors in the restaurant.  It had a great neighborhood vibe.

Address: 809 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2W8 Canada
Review: The lunch combo is so good. It is a good deal,  tofu green curry combo and Thai iced tea for around $18, excellent value and super delicious food.

Address: 809 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2W8 Canada
Review: Finally tried this place, it didn’t quite live up to the reviews. Spring rolls were great. The red curry & the cashew chicken weren’t bad. The chicken pad Thai was easily the worst I’ve ever had - No flavour and the saddest amount of chicken. I would have returned it if I lived closer.

Address: 123 Gorge Road E Victoria, BC V9A 1L1 Canada
Review: Hecklers is such a great spot. They have the best priced and best tasting wings on Island! You can't compete with all those flavour options! There daily specials are so enticing. And they make it super fun by offering free foosball, retro games, trivia... And comedy nights are hilarious! Our friend group loves hecklers ❤️

Address: 123 Gorge Road E Victoria, BC V9A 1L1 Canada
Review: Best place to get wings, $8 a pound on Wednesday with around 20+ choices of flavours between sauces and dry rubs. Quite a popular spot with really nice staff and ambiance. Went with 3 other friends and got 2 types each. Had a great time.

Address: 123 Gorge Road E Victoria, BC V9A 1L1 Canada
Review:
Went for one of their Saturday comedy shows! Didn’t buy tickets like they recommended but were fortunately able to squeeze us in.

We got to see 3 different sets from comics from around Canada who were all great! The host was also super funny and I enjoyed his presence.

Our server was quick and surprisingly didn’t forget to check in on us to offer more drinks throughout the show.

Highly recommend checking it out for a unique experience or date night!

Address: 123 Gorge Road E Victoria, BC V9A 1L1 Canada
Review: Went here for their wing Wednesday, these wings were the best wings I've ever had, I'd fly out to Victoria just for them

Address: 123 Gorge Road E Victoria, BC V9A 1L1 Canada
Review:
This place impresses me. Good service, good food, very fair prices. Jake was our bartender last night and treated us very well.
The only issue I have is that I've been living in the Gorge for 3 years now and haven't checked this place out sooner! Great job guys :)

Address: 1701 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Z4 Canada
Review: The cheese cake here is ridiculously good. We were passing by and decided to grab a cup of chai, so glad we stopped in.  I ordered the mini egg cheese cake and my partner ordered the salted caramel. No complaints at all,  what an amazing bakery in a coffee shop! Definitely worth a stop for a treat

Address: 1701 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Z4 Canada
Review:
I recently visited QV Bakery to order a cheesecake for my husband's birthday, and I just have to say - the experience was absolutely fantastic! From the moment I called to make the order, the staff was friendly and welcoming, and they helped me to choose the perfect cheesecake to suit my husband's tastes.

The cake itself was absolutely scrumptious - it was so creamy and rich, with a perfectly smooth texture and just the right amount of sweetness. The crust was also delicious, with a lovely crunch and a light, buttery flavor that complemented the cheesecake perfectly.

Overall, I was extremely impressed with the quality of the cheesecake and the level of care and attention that went into creating it. The team at QV Bakery clearly takes pride in their work, and it really shows in the finished product.

I would definitely recommend this bakery to anyone looking for delicious, high-quality baked goods - whether you're in the mood for a sweet treat like a cheesecake or something savory like a fresh-baked loaf of bread, you can't go wrong with QV Bakery. Thanks for making my husband's birthday so special!

Address: 1701 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Z4 Canada
Review: Great selection of cheesecakes! It's one of the cafes/bakeries that stays open later which is nice since so many cafes close early in Victoria.

Address: 1701 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Z4 Canada
Review: Another one of our go to Becfest hoints/baked goods yummiest!! Been coming back here for years, especially when around Canada's oldest China town neighborhood. ♤ Ghosts n Snuff 👻.. highly recommend, good food/ friendly vibes. QV Bakery!!😇

Address: 1701 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Z4 Canada
Review: Cute little place for some cheesecake and snacks. Cheesecake selection is vast and drink menu is decent. Plenty of seating either indoor or outdoor with good atmosphere.

Address: 450 Swift Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S3 Canada
Review: Craft has a lovely waterfront location with a great environment and tasty food. The only downside (or upside depending on the person) to the beautiful outside seating is sometimes the sea planes fly closely overhead. My table and I were personally not bothered by this and most of us thought it was cool. I opted to try a raspberry Moscow mule which I was pleasantly surprised by. It was not too sweet and in my opinion better than the regular. The waitress was very kind, bubbly, and knowledgeable. They were very cautious with any dietary restrictions and had plenty of options to substitute. I would strongly recommend the Laguna Beach Chicken Bowl. It was a great blend of flavors and the perfect size. I would've liked there to be more chicken but the pieces I did have were delicious. I didn't get a chance to go inside and see what it looked like but from the outside looking in, it looked fresh and modern with a very summer vibe to it where I could see my friends and I getting together and hanging out. All in all a great family dinner that we all enjoyed and the food left me wanting more!

Address: 450 Swift Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S3 Canada
Review: Atmosphere and ambiance was amazing! Great selection of good food and libations. Danielle was the best server and helped guide us on our lunch experience. 10/10 recommend

Address: 450 Swift Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S3 Canada
Review: During my visit to this place, I had an enjoyable experience overall. The food was decent, although I wished for a better menu selection. However, the beer selection was somewhat limited, which left room for improvement. Although the beers I tried were of good quality, the lack of variety on the flight was disappointing. With a broader selection, this place has the potential to become a go-to destination for beer enthusiasts. Nonetheless, the friendly staff and inviting atmosphere made the visit memorable. If you have the chance, don't miss the opportunity to enjoy their patio or balcony seating during the summer.

Address: 450 Swift Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S3 Canada
Review:
Even better than Vancouver one 😜
Great atmosphere, lots of options of craft local beer but also they got in-house brews, which are amazing. Their specials are made with 🤍 LOVE. Recommend 10/10! 🎉🥳🍻🍺🍔🥗🍟🍝

Address: 450 Swift Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S3 Canada
Review: Amazing view, great heated patio, beautiful place. The food was amazing, and our server was very funny and outgoing. I asked the server his two favourite menu items and chose the Arugula Prosciutto Pizza and it tasted like an authentic European pizza. He also recommended drinks for all of us and we loved each one. Will definitely be coming back!

Address: 50 Bastion Square Victoria, BC V8W 1J2 Canada
Review: The produce was really good but the eggs were over cooked and the had browns were burned. The vegan bowl was too oily and the sauce bland. The atmosphere was really nice.

Address: 50 Bastion Square Victoria, BC V8W 1J2 Canada
Review: Lots of light and fresh decor. Full range of vegitarian and vegan food selection. The 'Rueben' was made with marinated tempeh and beets - deliciius. 3 Sisters enchiladas very good. Andrea came by to see how the food was. 😃

Address: 50 Bastion Square Victoria, BC V8W 1J2 Canada
Review: I got the 3 sisters enchiladas - they were good! Unfortunately our experience was tarnished by the incredibly slow service. It look a half hour to get our drinks alone!

Address: 50 Bastion Square Victoria, BC V8W 1J2 Canada
Review: Lovely and lively lunch. I was visiting Victoria and decided to give Rebar a try. Even though it was past 1:00 pm, the place was busy and bright. Colourful table covers greeted me. I had the full Rebar salad that was both filling and delicious. The lemon square for dessert was just the right balance of sweet and acidic. Staff were friendly and efficient. Enjoy!

Address: 50 Bastion Square Victoria, BC V8W 1J2 Canada
Review: So glad we tried Rebar while in Victoria! The waitress was happy to point out the many gluten free & vegan options. The portion sizes are great. You won’t leave hungry. Lots of fresh flavours and veggies in the dishes. It would also be worth it to go just for the fresh juice. Delicious - it really hit the spot!

Address: 512 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: This is the closest to Thai food you get in Thailand.  Excellent service from ABC and her colleagues combined with tasty food.  We highly recommend.

Address: 512 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: I went here a few years ago and it was not good. A friend invited me here recently and I told him that I had a bad experience last time. He told me that the owners are new and the restaurant is much better now.  I am very picky about my Thai food, but I reluctantly agreed to go. And am I ever glad I did! This is very good Thai food in a very nice atmosphere. The service was good too. I'm glad the new owners have changed things. I'll be back!

Address: 512 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: The Prawn Fried Rice and Prawn/Tofu Noodles were super delicious. The portions are big and there are about 6 big juicy prawns per meal. I ordered on DoorDash and it arrived quickly, was well packaged and hot. I will definitely order again.

Address: 512 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: Had a great veggie pad thai lunch special! It was a very open and welcoming environment. Friendly staff, food came out hot and quick, big portions for a great price!! Takeout later was delicious!

Address: 512 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review:
The food was really good! First time trying this place, the vibe in here is so cute and it says it’s the first Thai restaurant in Victoria since 1990!
The papaya salad was nice balanced flavour with sour sweet and a bit hint of spicy. The green curry was soooo good! Creamy and not too rich or too sweet. The noodles was really good too! I like this better than pad Thai! Would definitely go back there and try more of their food
The coconut soup is so creamy and so good! Never had such rich soup before! It’s well balanced with lemon flavour in it

Address: 549 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R5 Canada
Review:
Well...This isn't Chinese food. An edible attempt, but not Chinese food. Food is meh. Decor is extremely questionable for an Asian restaurant, even an 'eclectic' one. Staff was accommodating and nice. Food came out with reasonable speed, with effort on  presentation. Portion sizes are large, but it's still very pricy, especially for mediocre food.

Description says they specialize in bubble tea but there was no bubble tea on the lunch menu (I looked). We ordered the ginger beef combo, one wonton soup, and the daily special (which is the same every day, by the way). I believe that was pork, fried noodles and fried shrimp on bean sprouts.

Wonton soup broth tasted exactly like chicken broth with more salt. Frozen wontons. So, so, disappointing. There might have been beef in the Ginger Beef or maybe it was just skinny strips of fried batter dunked in sweet sauce with ginger chunks. The fried shrimp had bland batter. Bean sprouts no flavor at all. Saving grace is sweet and sour pork as well as fried rice were were fine.

The staff came over to ask us if everything was OK... Well yeah, it was OK. So that's  what we said. I didn't think asking for home made broth simmered for hours, or more meat would be very feasible for the staff.

About the decor... The ceiling is literally spray painted black with extra holes punched in the ceiling for lights to look like stars? Maybe? But it looks bad in the daylight. The art is OK on its own, honestly, it just makes the whole thing look like an attempt at an avant-garde nightclub. Seats on the wall have tiny thin cushions to sit on. And it's kind of dirty. There was a napkin and crumbs on the floor left by a customer who ate there and left. No one cleaned it up, just started moving the tables for the next guests. Snapping the fan on this one.

Address: 549 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R5 Canada
Review: the sweet and sour pork was good and the service was great, the won ton soup was a little salty but tasted great😍

Address: 549 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R5 Canada
Review: Great food with a nice atmosphere right in the heart of Canadas oldest Chinatown. Went for lunch and really enjoyed the Spicy Lunch Combo it was flavorful but not overly spicy definitely recommend a stop if your walking around downtown Victoria.

Address: 549 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R5 Canada
Review: This place was pretty good! The food was very good for Chinese food though the pork for the sweet and sour chicken was a bit too fatty. The service here was awful. The server was rude and watched expectantly at the screen when we were giving the tip. She was also were snippy about everything. The atmosphere was alright and the bathrooms were nice. I might come back here again for the food but definitely only because of that. I would maybe recommend this place to others.

Address: 549 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R5 Canada
Review: The food was quite good. The won ton soup had a favorable brith and was full of good ingredients.  There is quite a difference in sizes. The medium is definitely a meal. I had the daily special & it was a good size. The breaded shrimp had a little too much breading. The noodles were delicious.  I just didn't like the black walls but at lunch it wasn't too dark. I would go again.

Address: 1028 Hillside Avenue Victoria, BC V8T 2A3 Canada
Review:
Maybe I'm ordering the wrong items, or my taste buds are wonky?

Highlights:
Great service
Atmosphere
Location
Saw a number of group tables which looked happy
Wheelchair accessible (looked like it to me, which is nice)

Extra things to consider:
Parking

My experiences won't really stop me from coming back. We have family dinners for peoples birthdays and we manage to rotate as best as we could around restaurants in Victoria, so I'm sure someone will choose this place as a venue again.

Overall, family members (party of 9) mostly were pleased with their meal. All of us was happy with the service. We didn't feel forgotten, or felt like we were inconveniencing them.  Atmosphere is always consistent and warm when you walk in. The outdoor patio looks comfortable.

My only complaint is the food... never seems to be enough in fries (ok sorry, I guess potatoes are going up in price). My husband ordered the strips and fries (strips are always good, with the honey mustard), but the fries portion keeps seemingly getting smaller every year we come back. My pizza was good, but just good; seemed more like a fancy flat bread. It felt like it was alright, but felt like something was missing. The Artichoke dip was flavourful, no complaints there- nicely cheesy, had good consistency, didn't feel like we were really saving on portions so much.

Since the place does get busy, it's good to maybe note that parking could get tricky. We had to park a little further down at the residential street.

Again, maybe I'm just nit-picking, but I'll probably be back. I will just say the service is always good.

Address: 1028 Hillside Avenue Victoria, BC V8T 2A3 Canada
Review: Natasha was so nice and her service was excellent.  One of the nicest servers ever.  I has the rotisserie chicken.  It's always delicious.

Address: 1028 Hillside Avenue Victoria, BC V8T 2A3 Canada
Review: Great and friendly service. Had a nice juicy burger after all. Love the atmosphere and the vibe

Address: 1028 Hillside Avenue Victoria, BC V8T 2A3 Canada
Review: Very much looking forward to coming here again. The atmosphere and decor were stellar. I had the 1/4 chicken and rib dinner and everything was delectable, including the coleslaw which usually never finds its way off the plate. The gravy was out of this world and everything on the menu was very reasonably priced.

Address: 1028 Hillside Avenue Victoria, BC V8T 2A3 Canada
Review: The lady who served me was absolutely wonderful! Check back in often, made sure I was comfortable and had my food served in a timely manner. Very well done, will be back again

Address: 810 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8T 5B1 Canada
Review: Terrible food and service. We had toast that look like bread sticks and the yogurt parfait tested expired. It was so sour. They said it was Greek yogurt but the taste was so sour we couldn’t eat a single spoon of it. They offered to replace the yogurt with a bagel and then they told us they would charge us for it.

Address: 810 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8T 5B1 Canada
Review: Expensive and not terrible, I paid $42 for two breakfast sandwiches. I had asked for an extra four dollar bacon for two or three small pieces. The sandwich is very small and not really well filled... I won't stop here

Address: 810 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8T 5B1 Canada
Review:
Wow!!! 5 Star Flavour at an incredibly affordable price - Did I say Wow?! Lol 😂 A medley of comforting delight (Sweet Potato Gnocchi) but with a mysterious twist! Radish, Peas, Roasted Apple, and a Beautiful Homemade Cream Sauce! Arugula Garnish on the side - Tasteful and blended perfectly.

On a rainy night, a wonderful local option and at 7pm open for dinner!!

My favourite coffee shop but now a dinner place? Amazing!

Address: 810 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8T 5B1 Canada
Review: This was the location attached to our hotel, which gave a gift certificate for our stay.   We would have gone anyway.   Weather was beautiful and we could eat outside, creating a particularly nice ambience.  Happy hour meals were quite good, as were drinks.   Service was attentive.   We would return.

Address: 810 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8T 5B1 Canada
Review: Terrible customer experience. I went here with a friend for a couple of lattes and sat down.. 5 minutes later, an employee comes over and hands us to go cups and says we can't stay in the cafe. I question the employee and he told me the "front of house manager" said you have to leave.. Liberal use of the title for a 5 seat coffee shop.. Anyways we leave and 100% will never be back. There are 50+ other options in Victoria for good artisan coffee; don't waste your time here.

Address: 405 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2V7 Canada
Review: Best classic juice Fired chicken in town. Best meat quality. They use Island Chicken. super tasty and fresh. I order it every month. I tried three different new fire chicken restaurants, they are no match. Chicken on the run still the best.

Address: 405 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2V7 Canada
Review: Ordered the Hungry man (6 pc chicken, with fries and coleslaw) for pick up. Plenty of parking. Staff was friendly. The fried chicken is juicy and the batter is tasty as is the chicken. Their home fry wedges are excellent. It's fried with what's like tempura batter. The coleslaw was okay. Would definitely order here again. Note that this place has only about 6 seats so it's more for either pickup or delivery.

Address: 405 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2V7 Canada
Review:
FOOD: This is the best fried chicken in town! Just like mom used to buy! Plus they also do milkshakes! Skip the fast food joint and have some local fried chicken instead. Delicious.

SERVICE: The staff are friendly and provide excellent service.

Accessibility: Ground level concrete entrance onto tile floor. No tables, a small 32 inch high counter seating with free-standing bar stools. Counter to order and pay is 48 inch high. No customer bathrooms.

Address: 405 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2V7 Canada
Review: This place has CRISPIEST and JUICIEST fried chicken I have ever had. I got a chance to try their ginger beef as well. It was delicious! highly recommended. Staff were wonderful! Will definitely go back there!!

Address: 405 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2V7 Canada
Review: I thought Chicken on the run and Crown Palace are two separate restaurants but turned out they’re one that makes it easier to order. Many people likes fried chicken here but for me they’re too salty. Even though the skin was thin and crispy but I couldn’t eat more than one piece. Their wedges were very good though. The other dish I order was ginger beef chow mein were just okay. Service was on time and friendly.

Address: 614 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review:
10 acres delivers! the food is delicious, looks great and all from their own farm.
Make sure to make a reservation so you get a great table.
We had the chicken and mussels,  I feel it was a mistake. Should have stuck with one theme. Either seafood. Or no seafood.
The chicken was very very good.
