I’d have it again.

Address: 614 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review:
Lovely atmosphere! Nice staff and quality food!
Incredible dishes and well designed menu! Had been there for breakfast and lunch, loved it both.

Address: 614 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: A farm to table restaurant. We walked in on a Saturday night and were seating right away. The restaurant is very big. There was a section with a bar with a younger ground, another sections with larger groups and family and then another area that seemed to be more intimate. Everything that we ordered was delicious- gnocchi, lasagna, and pumpkin cheesecake. Highly recommend the pumpkin cheesecake (without the apple compote and lemon-those flavours didnt go well together for my palate) I would say it’s the best I’ve had. Service was great. I would definitely go back!

Address: 614 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: Stopped in without resos for lunch, we were seated on the “indoor patio” which has a great vibe. Came in for an app and aperol spritz. Excellent atmosphere. Food was good, fresh and unique. They had a mix up with their bar order so they were out of Prosecco, which is fine..sh!t happens! Def coming back!

Address: 614 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: We just ordered some drinks. Beautiful interior design! I loved how they incorporated plants into their outside patio. Most of their drinks include alcohol so it is not so much friendly for those who are avoiding alocholic drinks.

Address: 1294 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A5 Canada
Review: Rise and Grind on Broad Street is easily my favourite go-to casual breakfast, brunch, and coffee destination in downtown Victoria. The food options are diverse and made to order, plus the brewed fresh Discovery Coffee is always a hit. Highly recommended, never disappointed.

Address: 1294 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A5 Canada
Review: the sandwiches were so good! we got the strawberry banana smoothie as well, which was really good. i got the chicken BLAT, which tasted really good too. i loved the avocado in there. we were able to sit inside, but there’s also outdoor seating and the atmosphere is nice and clean. restrooms available as well :)

Address: 1294 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A5 Canada
Review:
The girl taking my order was polite & friendly.
The food was definately sub-par. The toasted sandwich I ordered was barely warm... not crisp like toasted it should be. For $11 I expected a lot more of each filling described on the menu. If the owners spent 50 cents to make this I would be surprised. When my order was ready, I just got hollered at by a number. I had to get up twice as my drink and sandwich were ready seperately. My sandwich was wrapped in a foil bag & tossed on the counter with no word of thanks or even a smile. The staff were more interested in talking to each other than creating a friendly atmosphere. I had high hopes looking at your menu. I was willing to let the very worn floors & poor seating options slide for a good sandwich. Its just a sandwich after all.  Even Subway makes a better sandwich for less money. Have you seen a sandwich from The Red Barn? Step it up Rise and Grind! Take  look at what your competitors are doing.
I will not be back. Poor recommendation from me.

Address: 1294 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A5 Canada
Review: Finally after 2 years living downtown I have found a coffee shop that is absolutely wonderful. They have excellent breakfast, amazing/healthy lunch options and more. The staff are nice and welcoming, and not snobby or pretentious like many of the other coffee/breakfast spots downtown Victoria. Excellent location too!! Look forward to coming to Rise and Grind (almost) every morning. Thank you for your great cafe and service!!

Address: 1294 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A5 Canada
Review:
Wow amazing breakfast sandwich I had there. Their ingredients were super fresh and of high quality, the recipe and choice of ingredients were a perfect blend of flavor which delivered an harmonious taste experience. The portion was satisfying and the price decent.
I recommend.

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: The meals we ordered were awesome, but man, it took forever for our food to arrive. I was starving and totally forgot to snap a pic! 🤣 But hey, it was absolutely delicious, no complaints there. The restaurant had such a cool vibe, and my kids had a blast posing with all the animal decorations for pictures.

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: What a great spot for some breakfast! Welcoming staff, cozy atmosphere, great coffee and cappuccino, staff go above and beyond to accommodate customizations and time accommodations. All their shredded hash breakfasts are absolutely delicious and packed with nutrition, I personally ask for well done hash so it’s nice and sharp when they flip it over.

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review:
Came in for breakfast with a group of 11 and kids, we requested separate tables as we were going to pay separately, but they offered 1 big table together as they were quite empty. First issue, kids were not prioritized even though we mentioned that they were hungry and adult can wait. Server only took drinks order then prioritized smaller table to get their meal order as it will take short time to do so compared to our table regardless they were seated after us. Last thing was they added gratuity to our bill without prior information which left us no choice but to pay. That's was the main reason we wanted separate table and being charge for service that we considered not there.
Other than those issues that left us disappointed, food taste was incredible, freshly prepared ingredients with jam, sauce,everything taste amazing. Worth to visit for food only.

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: You definitely gotta try this out!! We knew this diner has a special history which I can tell why locals keep coming back. Mesmerizing decor and menu is extensive; it was hard to decide where to sit and what to order. We tried their delicious breakfast menu. Generous portion and we were so full that we needed to walk it out. The staff was humble and all their recommendations were spot on. Must try !!

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review:
This just may have been the best breakfast I've ever ordered at a restaurant. We ordered the berry waffles and the poutine benny and my oh my were they delicious. The contrast between the sweet and savory meals was delightful (my wife and I shared our meals). The waffles were honestly the best waffles I have ever eaten. Each bite nearly brought a tear to my eye from being so tasty. The only complaint is that I live about 1000 miles away from The Ruby 😞. This restaurant alone tempts me to uproot my family and move to Victoria just to eat breakfast here every week.

A side note, we were with our 17 month old baby and the staff was sooo kind and accommodating with him.

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: What a great find! Such great service, fun atmosphere and OMG the food!!! I think I have found a new breakfast favourite when in Victoria! A must try is the lavender latte! So many delicious dishes to choose from. We didn't see 1 unhappy customer while here and we loved every moment!

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: The service was fantastic, and food was incredible! Great place for the whole family even the wee ones! There's is something for everybody without a doubt! Going back for seconds real soon! Hope everyone enjoys some food, with family n friends! Enjoy

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: Tacos, chicken and waffles, duck hash and the meal or the day ! Very good, but a long wait. You must be patient if you want to come here, can take 30-40 min wait. But it has a nice sitting area. Good food though, was worth the wait.

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review:
What an awesome little gem hidden in plain sight, lol! Didn't have to wait too long for a table. Service was top notch, friendly, and prompt. I'm a Waffle 🧇/ Pancake 🥞 girl and The Ruby did not disappoint me. Caramelized bananas 🍌, roasted pecans and bourbon syrup, on top of a stack of mouth watering waffles 🧇. Hubby had an omelet with bacon 🥓, mushrooms 🍄, and cheese 🧀.
Thank you Ruby!!!! ✌️

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: Went here for brunch. The food was amazing & the portions were huge! The potatoes are the perfect crispy fluffy ratio. The duck just fell off the bone & the sauce that same with it paired perfectly well. Would definitely go back & recommended. Only downside is that it's small so not lots of seating, but still worth a visit. The staff were also helpful & friendly :)

Address: 560 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: Amazing char sui and rice! Got a large portion for about $20 😀 The red bean bun and egg tart were also amazing!!! It’s hard to find good Chinese bbq and buns in Victoria so this is really appreciated. Staff were very kind too. Can’t wait to come back and try the crispy pork.

Address: 560 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review:
Amazing place to enjoy Chinese food.
Bbq pork with wanton noodles soup is awesome. Kids love it, too.
Food server Kevin is very helpful in suggesting what dish is a must for our first time.

Address: 560 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: Some of the worst Asian food I have ever eaten.  Duck was mostly bones and had little taste. Beef flank Lo Mein had tasteless fatty meat with some corn starch sauce that also had an off taste.  Worst was the noodles which were not Lo mein but Singapore thin noodles that I have never seen offered in this dish. Service was pretty rude.  Don't bother with this nasty place.

Address: 560 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: Awesome experience! Delicious sweet and sour pork, tasty rice and good spicy soup. We’ll definitely return here💙

Address: 560 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: Great spot for authentic Hong Kong/Cantonese cuisine in Victoria. This place along with Don Mee (Dim Sum) are my two favorite restaurants in Victoria. They also have bakery and BBQ meat offering too. The food quality is top notch and the taste is just as good as the best from the mainland. Definitely the top 3 best Chinese restaurants on the Island.

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: This is the second time I've stayed here. I love it, the rooms are small and still use the old style hot water heating radiator so if it's cold in there it will take a bit to heat up. There is no AC so I'd expect it can get hot in the summer. The hotel has a colourful history and is over 100 years old. The hallways are adorned with Emily Carr Paintings (she died there) also the hotel supposedly is one of the most haunted in Canada although I haven't experienced anything while there.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you're into older style hotels that aren't just another boring place then this place is for you.

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review:
This is one of my favorite spots for dinner when in town.  I’ve tried almost everything on the menu and have yet to find something I didn’t enjoy.

In addition to the regular menu, they have specials each evening, which typically include a pasta and a main entree.  These can sell out quickly on busy nights.

The Caesar salad is amazing and I always get one!

There are several vegetarian options and the veggie burger is great.

Bar options are limited in the restaurant but you can enjoy beer or wine with your meal.

Service is always friendly and attentive and the atmosphere is cozy.

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: Overall good!  Food was good proportions generous,  tasted pretty good although my steak sandwich could use more seasoning and less cooking.  Service was excellent, atmosphere was excellent both restaurant and pub, prices very reasonable. Would like to try again.

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: Nice old place in the heart of James bay 10 min walk from down town no line up big and roomy  ordered a full candaron breakfast first bite amazing. Tastes like home made bread  vary happy with the size of the breakfast. The service is good. If you like a place for breakfast without a line up  this is your place parking is easy too

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: Can't say enough great things about this hotel! Immaculately clean. Roy at the desk was a gem. Dinner in the bar was great with friendly conversation, and they accommodated us when we said we needed our breakfast to be quick. Great location to visit the stunning Beacon Hill Park. Rooms are small, but that's to be expected for an historic hotel like this. Highly recommend!

Address: The Strathcona Hotel 919 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2C2 Canada
Review:
Old world charm meats big screen TV's.
Nice selection of both import and local brewery beer. I went with the wicket lager, it's brewed by Vancouver island brewery.
Menu is not overwhelming and it's easy to find something you want to try. Whether it be bangers and Mash, a burger or even mac and cheese.
The food is seasoned well and decent portions.
Staff were all welcoming and friendly.  We did find that one gentleman who brought the food to the table wore entirely too much cologne. It was to the point I would sneeze every time he walked past us.
Perhaps businesses need to bring back the no scent atmosphere for their customers convenience.
We will return.
Import beer is pricey

Address: The Strathcona Hotel 919 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2C2 Canada
Review: Steak was well cooked with delicious herb butter on top. Brussel sprouts were way undercooked, mashed potatoes were really salty. Mac and cheese is incredible, though - you can add chicken, broccoli, etc for an extra charge. Our server was nice, but only visited the tables on each side of us (not ours) in the last 20 minutes, so it took a long time to get our check. We never got a refill on water either, but maybe they figured the bottle of wine was adequate for us 😉 Be aware that there's a game room with pool etc, sports games on TV, so it can get a little loud if you're seated near it. Main dining room is relatively quiet otherwise, or it was when we went. Basically the food is good, service is alright, and they have a rooftop patio that looks great. The food was good enough that I'd give it another chance when I'm in town. It wasn't particularly busy, but maybe our server had more tables in another room that kept her busier than we were aware of?

Address: The Strathcona Hotel 919 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2C2 Canada
Review: Hanna was great! Sat in the actual sticky wicket (not the rooftop which has a cover, and no view, or the games room which seems to be more about watching sports). This is a confusing place. There are multiple bars and all of them have different taps and features but they kind of represent as one establishment except they aren't. Many of the menu items like the seafood boil for instance are only 2 days a month and only on the rooftop. I'm not sure if it's intentional deception or just bad marketing. Staff was friendly, service was good. Just a little confusing and frustrating. Nice margaritas and palmeos with Tajin rims (Mexican chilli lime salt). Beer selection is to limited as far as I'm concerned, no hazy or imperial IPA or sours.

Address: The Strathcona Hotel 919 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2C2 Canada
Review: Wish there were more vegetarian/vegan options, but for a traditional pub it was great! I had the Baha bowl with tofu and it was great. My friend had the bangers and mash and said it was ok.

Address: The Strathcona Hotel 919 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2C2 Canada
Review: Great food and service. Bar area was nicely maintained, and things weren't too busy on a Thursday night. Enjoyed hearing my parents' stories about this place from 25 years ago, the Sticky Wicket has a special place in my family's history!

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: Absolutely legendary. Fries were still crisp under the copious amount of gravy. Lots of squeaky cheese curds. Great smoked meat sandwich too. Service was a little whatever when we went though, maybe funner at night

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review:
I recently visited La Belle Patate and tried their BBQ Poutine, it was absolutely delicious! The combination of crispy fries, savory gravy, and flavorful BBQ sauce was just perfect. I loved every bite of it!

Apart from the food, the interior decor of the restaurant was also very unique and eye-catching. It gave off a cozy and welcoming vibe, making me feel right at home. I especially loved the wall art and the cozy seating arrangements.

Overall, I would highly recommend La Belle Patate to anyone who loves great food and a cozy ambiance. It's definitely a must-visit spot in town! I'm already planning to come back and try some of their other menu items, and I can't wait to see what other surprises they have in store.

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: First evening out in Vancouver, and I headed straight here. So glad I did, the laidback atmosphere as if you were at home. A small place packed with a friendly and relaxed attitude, but most of all poutine! I got a medium-sized traditional poutine and it was just so incredibly good. Not greasy, not too salty, just perfect! Paired with a light beer, couldn’t ask for more.

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: I love this place so much! I have come here both times I’ve been on vacation to Vancouver and I am always so happy with what I order. I order the traditional and it is always enough food. It comes out quick and the atmosphere is so great!

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: Great food in a convenient location. I was looking forward to the poutine from this spot and it did not disappoint! I got the breakfast poutine which was delicious. Others in my group were very pleased as well. The gravy is the star of the meal, so I recommend getting a poutine with gravy.

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: A must for visitors (like us from Colorado) and locals alike. If you want delicious, authentic poutine look no further. Plus, the service was immaculate and the owner is so so friendly ! Definitely try the spruce beer (non-alcoholic, think ginger beer or root beer), and you won’t be disappointed. The poutine is the best and the steamie is a perfect little hot dog with all the toppings. Don’t miss this awesome place !

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: Thee best hamburgers and poutine délicieuse in the city!! Don't even mess with rest. Fresh local ingredients. Friendly, passionate staff/good positive vibes. 😇

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: I highly encourage supporting this local business! The poutine options are great. I personally enjoy the loaded steamie along with fries & gravy. Make sure you get their in-house made Spruce Beer (a French Canadian pop). So yummy!! The owner has always been so welcoming to us  :)

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review:
I'd been meaning to try this place for longer than I can remember, and upon finally stopping in, I wish I'd done so much sooner.

Having seen La Bella Patate recommended countless times, it lived up to the hype completely. The staff were quite friendly, creating a relaxed atmosphere, and the food was great. I ordered a small classic poutine and a spruce beer (if you're on the fence, try the beer) and look forward to returning in order to try a hotdog next.

Overall this is a very fairly priced and tasty gem in Esquimalt. Solid 10/10.

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: The poutine was delicious. One side note they do have a pay phone in case you need to call someone in 80’s.

Address: 455 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T3 Canada
Review:
I've had ok pizza from here, and the staff are generally decent. Their thin crust is not good but regular crust is maybe a 6. We order from them sometimes because they are local and close.

I ordered delivery from them a week ago, and everything was delivered cold.

The worst part is that i tried something new, their cheese stuffed bread. The description:

"Fresh baked bread stuffed with garlic butter, villages mozzarella edam blend & cheddar cheese. Topped with parmesan cheese."

The reality:

It was cold, burnt, and inedible and after taking the picture it went directly in the garbage. Unfortunately no email address for customer service.

Very disappointed and on this basis alone, quite unlikely to order from them again.

Address: 455 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T3 Canada
Review:
This is there meat lovers I just bought for 25 dollars.  A tinny bit ground beef and some pepperoni. Yuck is all I can say. And my buddy who lives a block away warned me.
Better off buying a frozen pizza.

Address: 455 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T3 Canada
Review: Some days it’s very good. Other days the amount of toppings and cheese (even though I paid for extra cheese) is lacking. Crust is amazing though. Delivery drivers are top notch and super helpful!

Address: 455 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T3 Canada
Review: One of the best thick crust pizzas I've had in this city. Pep & Bacon slice for $4 really hit the spot! Friendly customer service too.

Address: 455 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T3 Canada
Review: We usually love Superior, but this past Friday we ordered and it was not good. The crust was thick and chewy, the cheese was barely melted, there was very little sauce. The mini brownies came in a Village's Pizza paper bag. If it's been taken over by Village's , it explains the downturn in quality. Time to find a new pizza place!

Address: 740 Burdett Avenue 18th Floor Victoria, BC V8W 1B2 Canada
Review: We had a wonderful dining experience here with great food and service and a fantastic view of the city. We had the fresh Oysters and Humboldt Squid as appetizers. Then the Sesame Tuna and Pork Tenderloin for our main course. Cheesecake and Three Truffles for dessert.

Address: 740 Burdett Avenue 18th Floor Victoria, BC V8W 1B2 Canada
Review: World class food, some of the best! Dinner server Michael left an impression nobody can ever live up to, what a service, such a caring gentlemen, treating diners like royalty. If not just for food, I’d come back just to be served by Michael again. Salmon and squid for dinner with a guava passion fruit juice was a very memorable combo, I’d have it again. Breakfast is great too, but service is just normal. Potato Green Apple soup with olive oil was the bomb for breakfast! The Artichoke Spinnach benny on their biscuit was really good, I packed one home too and it stays fresh and soft for long time. Wow wow wow! Great vegetarian and pescatarian options!

Address: 740 Burdett Avenue 18th Floor Victoria, BC V8W 1B2 Canada
Review:
This place always amazes me , never had a bad meal here!
They do have a happy hour till 6 (if I remember correctly), food is delicious and service is great. Highly recommend. Free parking if you go into the desk.

Address: 740 Burdett Avenue 18th Floor Victoria, BC V8W 1B2 Canada
Review: A wonderful treat with a very satisfying Dine Around menu! Kevin was a very attentive, friendly and professional waiter who clearly takes pride in his work. The food was fresh, delicious and well presented. Always a pleasure dining here and we'll definitely be back!

Address: 740 Burdett Avenue 18th Floor Victoria, BC V8W 1B2 Canada
Review: I love this place. It's unique because it's on the 18th floor and also I think it's a real treat. The drinks are incredible and so is the food. Staff are always so friendly and attentive.

Address: 1075 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: Randomly tried this spot on the weekend and the food was fantastic. All five in our group thoroughly enjoyed our meals. The pancakes were fluffy the fruit was fresh and service friendly. It took a little while for our food to come out but it was worth the wait. I would definitely recommend coming here for brunch and will be back! The prices are also very reasonable.

Address: 1075 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: Fantastic food and service!! Must eat here! Eggs Benny were delicious, pancakes light and fluffy and the skillet was incredibly tasty!! Did I mention the potatoes!?? They have got to be the best and most delicious potatoes ever!! Crispy outside, soft and tender inside, perfectly seasoned!!! Amazing they are all homemade! 10 stars!! Server was super attentive and kind! And great for Pokemonners since there's a stop out front and we made a new friend from the restaurant!

Address: 1075 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: My new favourite breakfast place. It’s a small greasy-spoon style diner, run by a family. The portions are large, the staff are amazingly friendly and the coffee is refillable. It was very busy the day we went and the staff/family was obviously struggling to keep up, but you could tell they were trying their best and everyone waited patiently. All around this place is amazing and I will go back many times.

Address: 1075 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review:
In Victoria for a quick vacation, and happened upon this little restaurant.
So IMPRESSED! Courteous service and astounding food. Wild Salmon & Avocado Benedict on the homemade bread was delicious!

Address: 1075 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: Decided to try this place out because my friend and I didn’t feel like waiting in line somewhere else. I’m so glad we came here instead, the food was perfect and the prices were amazing compared to some of the other brunch places in town! I had the smoked salmon and avocado benny and it was delicious. The potatoes were super crispy and their homemade bread was so good, as well as their homemade hot sauce! Service was awesome as well, and the atmosphere was very cozy and homey in the best way. Found my new favourite brunch spot!

Address: 1507 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 6P9 Canada
Review: Great wings and a decent price! They have some really delicious and interesting sauce options (highly recommend the creamy dill!! tossed with actual little pieces of pickle). The fries are also amazing. The house salad is also a great value for how much you get and is awesome to cut through the grease a bit with some veg.

Address: 1507 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 6P9 Canada
Review:
Unfortunately FartnPuke has gone way downhill since I used to frequent in 2015 and 2016 area. Recently coming back several times in the past two years. Always fairly underwhelming.
Last time I came here it seemed to be a
very high bill for a hotdog combo with 2 beers. ($40 or $50?)

I came today to get the garlic fries. Came to 11.60 altogether and they were very underwhelming. Charging an extra 3$ for no real sauce or flavour really is a new thing to add.

Address: 1507 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 6P9 Canada
Review: I'm 100% not a review person but as a gluten free vegan I have to post here to praise the vibe that is this restaurant. Perfect dive bar feelings with gluten free vegan wings and almost 20 vegan flavour/sauce options. Ask for the vegan tahini sauce for dipping your veggies and "wings". Brilliant. Hidden gem in the city for the best option for a night out with multiple people and lots of options. I've never been so full of and stoked on tofu.

Address: 1507 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 6P9 Canada
Review: Food was so so expensive, literally 2 dollars per wing in a 1/2lb order. Not worth it. Burgers were 12 bucks, and tiny for that price. Things tasted fine but not good enough to charge an arm and leg. The server was kind, the atmosphere seemed fine, but the prices were 3 dollars more than only a couple years ago. That's ridiculous even given the pandemic, and I won't be going back.

Address: 1507 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 6P9 Canada
Review: I have NEVER had a better smash burger or fries in Victoria. NEVER! Staff is fantastic, food and tunes were great along with a solid place! Need to go back and smash some of the best wings in Victoria a few years running now, but the burger already has my vote 🖤

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review:
1. chicken supreme
- so good! soft n tender, mushroom sauce and cabbage was right on the point 10/10!
2. lobster bisque
- amazingly good and i love the texture, could be more salty and richer though
3. french fries
- hot and crispy just perfecto

in general: very good service, there was a bit of waiting for the food but that’s fine, dinners good!

ratings: 9/10

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: This is a cozy little restaurant very warm atmosphere, the food is amazing we came for breakfast several times while on vacation in Victoria.

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: Very nice patio and two different menus options ( you can also order from The Penny Farthing menu). I only don’t give them a 5 star review because the menu doesn’t specify what the gluten free options or any other dietary options are. The service was good and they are pet friendly at the patio. I had a gluten free Brie pear prosciutto chicken burger. It was good but later on I realized that I could have opted for lettuce wrap and my server didn’t even mentioned anything. Anyway we enjoy our food and will definitely come back. 😊

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: First time dining here this weekend and was very pleasantly surprised it lived up to the hype! Best french onion soup I've ever had and escargot was fantastic. Will definitely be back!

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: Worse restaurant food ever. Very lukewarm service.  Pictures say a thousand words. The carrots were charred black and inedible, the duck leg was black and there’s a rat, named Remi, that makes better Ratatouille.  Believe it or not, we had to pay for this.  Very, very sad that we didn’t go to our favourite, Brasserie l’ecole.

Address: 604 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: Favourite sushi bar in Victoria. Great location to walk to if you’re downtown, near great shops off government street. Service is always excellent. The atmosphere is quiet and a great layout, not a huge place so at peak times you may have to wait for a table. I’ve purchased takeout as well and quality is still superior to other sushi takeout. A favourite place of mine for lunch. The food is top notch, always peak freshness, excellent presentation as well.

Address: 604 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: Make a reservation, because the fact that our reserved group of 6 (the max they'll reserve for) went on a Tuesday evening and the place was just packed, says it all. Really good food; really good service. If you love sushi, do not miss this opportunity. And if you have celiac disease, just ask for gluten-free options and they'll have you covered. I went there with my gluten-free Meetup and it was excellent. Reasonable prices too, considering the times we live in. A great date-night idea in the heart of downtown.

Address: 604 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: I have eaten at many sushi restaurants and this one definitely places among the very best. The fish was so fresh with a buttery texture, the green tea refreshing and well-presented, the service was excellent and the prices were good. If I lived here I would eat here at least once per week. Highly recommended!

Address: 604 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: We had an excellent experience, with friendly staff, great food and honest prices.

Address: 604 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review:
My work colleague rants and raves of this place all the time and had been bugging me to go all these months. I finally did somewhat reluctantly; I had a one-time unpleasant experience eating here with my dad when I was 16 (my older daughter is currently this age just to give you a time stamp) and had bad diarrhea afterwards, nearly missing my first Young Drivers appointment back in the day. 🙅🏻‍♀️

Food quality is okay. The sashimi is fresh but not that huge deal that it melts in your mouth and you must go here now that I read in other reviews. 🤔 As you can see, the presentation for their large assorted sashimi is very lacking; 15 pieces yes, but of very limited type and for the price? Not a good value to the eye of a sashimi connoisseur. My beef teriyaki was overcooked. They asked how I liked it done, I replied medium rare, but dish was medium borderline well done.

Service was there but quite slow; we were given the bill but took a very, very long time for them to come back for the POS. I mean, why bring the bill if you're not ready to accept payment right then and there, and made to wait? 🤷🏻‍♀️

No stomach upset this visit which is a plus but even ordering their two biggest entrees, I left the place hungry still and underwhelmed. I feel this place is overhyped, would only go back here with accompaniment, and would most likely order something completely else on the menu. 🙎🏻‍♀️

Address: 313 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V Canada
Review:
I’ve been here three times for the chicken soup with rice. I really enjoy it and its a great portion for the price.

Cute cafe and it’s a nice vibe for cozy.

Address: 313 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V Canada
Review: This is the perfect stop for a quick bite while you’re out running errands or doing homework. I tried the chicken pozole and a slice of the banana bread. The soup was absolutely amazing! I got a cup of the soup and you have an option for a side of bread or rice. I tried the bread and it was so fresh and went great with the soup. The banana bread wasn’t the best, it was a little tough to bite into, but I did order it in the afternoon. The cafe itself has only a few tables for mostly groups or two, but many seemed to be available when I went. Will definitely be stopping by again!

Address: 313 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V Canada
Review:
We weren’t sure if this is where we wanted to stop for lunch, but we were glad we did! The staff was very helpful and enthusiastic about our menu choices, and gave us a good timeframe for when we’d get our food.

The curried egg sandwich was fresh and light, made with their house-made bread. The salad was also really nice and very tasty. Glad we stopped in for a bite!

Address: 313 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V Canada
Review: It took me way too long to try some of the sandwiches here, but now I cannot be stopped. The Creamy Almond Veggie and Sweet Chili Chicken sandwiches are so fresh and delicious, it's everything you can ask for in a sandwich. The soup and salads look very yummy as well, so can't wait to try them. You will find me on the outside street patio with my dog on too many days of the week. Watch out around this time of year, the beautiful tree out front, will pelt you in the head with it's little spiky green acorn thingys.

Address: 313 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V Canada
Review: I come here 2+ times a week.  All the food is good, I have yet to find something I don't like.  The two regular menu soups (Chicken and a curry one) are fantastic, have them with the rice for a very filling meal.  Staff is always friendly.

Address: 1117 Blanshard St Victoria, BC V8W 2H7 Canada
Review: Excellent meal at Baan Thai.  Service was great and food came out quickly.  The Tom Yum soup was rich and delicious.  The Papaya salad was surprisingly spicy, in a good way.  The drunken rice and Panang Curry were both so flavorful.  I prefer Pad Thai elsewhere, but with so many great choices here, it's hard to go wrong. The key lime pie was amazing!

Address: 1117 Blanshard St Victoria, BC V8W 2H7 Canada
Review: Nice restaurant! Great ambience and friendly staff. The food was great as well. We will visit again when next we are in town.

Address: 1117 Blanshard St Victoria, BC V8W 2H7 Canada
Review: We had a delicious meal with another couple. Four of us enjoyed: spring rolls, Tom Yum soup (YUM!), papaya salad (YUM!), chicken satay, calamari (not very Thai, but someone wanted it, was good), for appetizers. For our mains we ordered Pad seeuw, Thai Garden, Macua phad Tofu, we also ordered a chicken dish, which I did not eat as I mostly eat plant based/vegan. We ordered the food mild, and it was very mild, but with many herbs and spices - it was flavourful. We all agreed it was delicious. We thought the food prices were reasonable. It's a new favourite restaurant!

Address: 1117 Blanshard St Victoria, BC V8W 2H7 Canada
Review: My drunken noodles were pretty good.  Husband didn't like his food at all. The atmosphere was nice.

Address: 1117 Blanshard St Victoria, BC V8W 2H7 Canada
Review: 10/10 food, I think I got pad see ew and it was soooo good. The service was wonderful as well. Our server (gosh I'm terrible with names) was super sweet and really went above and beyond for us. My friend and I had never been in canada and asked about the currency and she gave us a full tour of it all. Canada, I do not mean to mock your currency, it is beautiful, but I really thought she was kidding when she told us about loonies and toonies. Delicious and educational lunch

Address: 2000 Cadboro Bay Road Unit 104 Oak Bay, BC V8R 5G5 Canada
Review: Delicious food and speedy service. The place has a fairly cozy atmosphere and fair portion sizes, hands down the papaya salad was the best thing we had. It's been ages since we've had a good papaya salad with a proper spice to it. Martini was a touch bit on the strong side and don't bother with the coffee if you're looking for a caffeine slap. Overall will definitely be returning next time I'm in town!

Address: 2000 Cadboro Bay Road Unit 104 Oak Bay, BC V8R 5G5 Canada
Review:
Baan Thai service is amazing! The food is brilliant!

In Oak Bay, there's a place to dine,
Where cuisine is spectacular and so divine.

Baan Thai, you'll come to know,
As a flavoured journey that'll make you glow.

From savory curries to spicy soups,
Each dish is crafted with exotic roots.

With flavors that dance upon your tongue,
And aromas that leave you forever sprung.

Baan Thai, you'll come to know,
As a flavoured journey that'll make you glow.

Address: 2000 Cadboro Bay Road Unit 104 Oak Bay, BC V8R 5G5 Canada
Review: Baan Thai is a classic go to for Thai in Victoria. The food is consistently good and the space is calm and bright. Tonight though it was the service from Solomon that motivated a review. He was the best. Cheerful, attentive and friendly. Made our night.

Address: 2000 Cadboro Bay Road Unit 104 Oak Bay, BC V8R 5G5 Canada
Review: Best Thai food in Victoria! The food is exceptional and the service is flawless. Our server, Ella, was so friendly and offered us some great recommendations. Delicious food, relaxed ambience and super friendly staff keep us coming back regularly. I would highly recommend this restaurant!

Address: 2000 Cadboro Bay Road Unit 104 Oak Bay, BC V8R 5G5 Canada
Review: Not really traditional Thai food, way too sweet in every dish

Address: 637 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M7 Canada
Review: Tasty food and wonderful service. My son, who’s a picky eater, said that If there are more than 5 stars then he would give that to this place! We ordered coconut curry, Mango curry and butter chicken. All three of them are yummy and the latter is the best!

Address: 637 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M7 Canada
Review:
Didn’t take a lot of pictures but the food was very much on point. Absolutely amazing Tandoori fish sizzler, curries, cocktails and that dal tarka was just too good! 🤌🏽

Also, special mention for the hostess/server who was very accommodating with all our requests, kind, friendly and also suggested few good spots to check out in Victoria!

PS: went back the next day to get some take out. Lovely Indian food in Victoria that I hope everyone checks out if they’re craving some!

Address: 637 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M7 Canada
Review: This was the only place that was open and not busy on Family Day and I'm glad we chanced upon it. This place was wonderful and the food was delicious! I got the chicken tikka curry and my husband got the kharri curry. It was perfect for a cold February day. We will be back again.

Address: 637 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M7 Canada
Review: We had a fantastic dinner. The food was amazing — my husband said it was the best Indian he’s ever had! Kirn and her staff were friendly, engaging, attentive and helpful. We just wish we lived closer but we’ll be back whenever we’re in Victoria!

Address: 637 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M7 Canada
Review: This has become destination dining for us when visiting Victoria, for a number of reasons. The food is packed with flavor and consistently excellent, whether you take it mild or spicy. The drinks are inventive and delicious, and the bartender—who I believe either owns or co-owns the restaurant—improvised an off-the-menu version of a Manhattan for my wife that was as tasty as it was potent. Finally, the staff are attentive and welcoming, warm and knowledgeable. A hidden gem. Well worth a try, if you’re ever even remotely in the mood for Indian cuisine.

Address: 1425 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: I dropped by to order take out after their cut off time for take out orders. Ari was very accommodating, helped me with  choosing the dishes and the spicy sauces. Food was amazing, and it was only surpassed by the staff's service. Next time, I will try to dine in.

Address: 1425 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
Very good! The food was excellent, the chips were hot, and the salsa was tasty.
The service was okay, but they were trying so I won’t fault them for that.
I would come back again.

Address: 1425 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: Great authentic Mexican cuisine. And the staff are really friendly. I got into a long conversation with the manager about how they make pulled pork. He even shared the recipe so I could try to replicate it at home -- and recommended a pretty fantastic cookbook. A great place.

Address: 1425 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: Great place to chill and hang out. We got the churros, Mexican rice, and classic margarita. Everything was good!

Address: 1425 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
Great location, interesting interior and clean washrooms.
Good selection of legitimate Mexican food and drinks. Good local beer selection too.
I'll definitely be back soon.

Address: 141 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1A8 Canada
Review:
The Missus and I along with our travelling family members discovered Water Prince Corner Shop during our walk around Charlottetown. We took the only available seating on the outside for lunch. What a find!

The food and service were superb. The lobster roll was perfection. The fish and chips was also nicely done with a healthy portion of fish.

We all highly recommend and agreed "You Gotta Eat Here".

Address: 141 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1A8 Canada
Review:
Best lobster roll on the island (so far). Even saying that, it’s going to be hard to find better. Great family restaurant vibe. Friendly and helpful staff. Very clean. No wait time, although we came after peak lunch time.
The seafood chowder was very good. My wife got the chicken burger and it was also very good.
Left it up to the waitress for a local beer and she definitely didn’t steer me wrong. 100% would come back!

Address: 141 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1A8 Canada
Review:
Excellent local restaurant.  The best lobster roll I had during my stay.  Also ordered the fish cakes and onion rings.  Reasonably priced; about $75 including tax.

Ordered seafood to take home with me.  Great service.  They make it super easy to order and pack it well for travel.  Better product and cheaper than buying it at home.

Would definitely recommend as one of the restaurants to check out in Charlottetown.  Love that they have long hours.

Address: 141 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1A8 Canada
Review: Great place! The scallop burger and the lobster roll were so good. The scallop was slightly fried to perfection and the lobster was tender, slightly chewy, and fresh. I really like the buns of the lobster roll because it was toasted on the outside and very crispy. Compared to the other lobster rolls, this was the best. The oysters were very fresh and goes amazingly well with the sauce. Highly recommend and would come again 🦞

Address: 141 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1A8 Canada
Review:
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, WELL WORTH THE WAIT! We came back the next day instead of trying out other restaurants.
We ordered mussels, clams, oysters, seafood chowder, lobster roll, and halibut fish and chips (during the 2 visits). Food was beyond great!!! Both times, it did not disappoint! We're not a fan of oysters, we just wanted to try it again and the oysters were great too!
We did, eventually, try another restaurant's mussels but this place has the best mussels/food.
Extremely friendly staff!
When we came back, it was very busy.. we did have to wait long but it was well worth the wait!
Make a reservation or come in between meal hours for a better chance of getting a table. When we come back to Cahrlottetown, this will be one of the places we will definitely come back to!

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review:
I was very excited to eat here as I read that it was one of (if not the best) seafood restaurants in Halifax. It was underwhelming.

I ordered the oysters Rockefeller, which was probably my own fault for ordering. It was just cheese on a shell.

The halibut special was good, although the strawberry purée they served it with clashed a little. The potatoes were only okay.

I enjoyed the mussels that my friend got, some of the best I’ve had!

All in all, it is a good restaurant, the service is alright, and the food is pretty good. I would say it’s not worth the price though. I was tempted to give 4 stars, but at these price points, it’s a 3.

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review:
Quite enjoyed our food here, PEI oysters were absolutely amazing.
I had lobster risotto and my partner had seafood pasta, both were good. Not raving about either dish, but we weren’t disappointed either.
Small place inside so recommend reservations!

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: Excellent meal tonight. We started with some oysters and the shrimp tempura. Oysters were so delicious and the shrimp tempura had just the right spice. We both went with the special for the night which was a grilled halibut with a jerk spice sauce. Unreal meal!! Highly recommend.

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: What a delicious meal we enjoyed! The Rockefeller oysters were superstars!!!!!! The new potatoes were so buttery & cooked to perfection. A delicious meal, we would certainly recommend to anyone in PEI.

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: Charlottetown's best restaurant  did not disappoint. The seafood cakes and pasta were delicious!  Be sure to reserve a couple of days ahead, it's a small room.

Address: 151 Kent Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1N5 Canada
Review:
They were kind enough to give me the onion rings I ordered (not sure why I was given fries).
However, onion rings tasted very oily.  Yuck.

The dumplings were really good.

The chicken burger was good except it tasted very salty.  Did someone just dump salt onto it?

Lastly, the refills which came much later.  My cola tasted like moldy.   Not sure if it was ice cubes, glass or the actual cola.

The pictures online show well but food was substandard.

I really apologize for leaving this review but I was struggling with my meal.

Good luck to your business.  Zero tip.

Address: 151 Kent Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1N5 Canada
Review:
My family and I are so grateful we stumbled upon this place, the service was impeccable, atmosphere was lovely, and the food was absolutely delicious.
They change their menu each month which we think is super cool and as a family with a million allergies (celiac, seafood, nuts, dairy, soy, etc) we were delighted by the precautions taken and assurance that we were in the right hands.
I love my family, but we tend to be very stuck-up when it comes to trying new restaurants as we have high expectations this restaurant blew us out of the water!
We cannot wait to come back and are even more excited to try a whole new menu!
Trying this is a must, whether you just want a drink or are looking for a delectable meal the Hopyard is the place to be!

Address: 151 Kent Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1N5 Canada
Review: Sooooo good! It's worth stopping in here if you're ever in Charlottetown for sure. With an ever evolving menu, options for vegan, vegetarian, and gluten free, and amble beer selection you'll have to visit more than once to experience everything you would want to try here! 14/10 would recommend you go here now!

Address: 151 Kent Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1N5 Canada
Review: We had great service, and it was a nice environment. My only complaint was that the food we ordered was coated in so many different rich sauces and it was very salty. Having a sensitive tummy sometimes, all the sauce/salt made the food hard to eat - if I had known I would have requested lessss sauce. But I can see how people love this place.

Address: 151 Kent Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1N5 Canada
Review: Stumbled in here mostly by accident while looking for vegan food, we were both delightfully surprised by the menu; tons of great veggie options. My partner loved the vegan tacos, and the poke bowl was AMAZING. Lots of cool brews on tap; my light ale tasted more like a hoppy IPA, but… I am not a beer expert! Overall highly recommend, great spot.

Address: 126 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G4 Canada
Review:
Stop in for a drink in between meals while exploring Charlottetown. Great beer flight options. I’d recommend the ‘podium’ flight. My wife really liked the tropical popsicle.
Didn’t try any food but the menu looks like it’s worth checking out next visit. Very clean. Friendly staff. Interesting architecture.

Address: 126 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G4 Canada
Review:
A friend of mine from PEI - well actually he’s not my friend, he’s my husband’s friend, so my friend by association - recommended this place and we’re so glad he did.

Delicious fish cakes, tuna tartare and fish tacos. Our waitress was great and the service was excellent!

Highly recommend!

Address: 126 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G4 Canada
Review: Oysters on the half with choice of beer would have hit the spot.  Place was hopping and had I known we were going to be moved like cattle, I would have foregone the oysters. My husband wound up eating them after the entre . Delicious fish tacos and fish and chips!! Service was friendly and personable. Next time I won’t order the meals til we get the drinks and apps.

Address: 126 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G4 Canada
Review: Great place to have some fantastic beer and food. The pretzel and chilli cheese starters and fish and chips were delicious. Great venue, great service for a reasonable price. Would recommend.

Address: 126 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G4 Canada
Review: This very traditional pub has great atmosphere. Our group had Fish Cakes, Seafood Chowder, and the Ring Bearer Burger. The burger was a huge disappointment as the beef patty came burned.  We were puzzled that such badly cooked item could come from the same kitchen that has produced amazing food in past visits, and the great fish cakes & chowder.  Not to repeat anytime soon despite the great beer.

Address: 125 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K4 Canada
Review:
A great place to stop in for brunch with friends! This historic building is very quirky and modernized inside, with beautiful artwork displayed on the walls and nice dim lighting. Huge, well-stocked bar upstairs with a large variety of spirits to cater to all your cocktail needs.

The plating was a bit messy, but don't let that off-put you - the food was delicious and the dishes were quite large, everything was very filling. A bit on the pricier side overall, but worth it for a treat.

Address: 125 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K4 Canada
Review: Food is amazing, service is great as well. Music feels off with the atmosphere. Maybe instead of pop music jazz or blues would be better? Just a suggestion.

Address: 125 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K4 Canada
Review: Such great beer selection, delicious seafood chowder, and the warm brownie was to die for. Very fair prices and lovely servers.

Address: 125 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K4 Canada
Review: Went here with a group of 5 around 12pm and waited an hour and a half for our food. The waitress was very polite and friendly and continued to check on us throughout our wait. Though the food was good, the portions were relatively small for the price.

Address: 125 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K4 Canada
Review: Great place. Had the best calamari I've ever had here and the best halibut.

Address: 70 Grafton St Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K7 Canada
Review:
Great outdoor patio and great food. Had the chicken burger, fries, flat bread pizza and garden salad.
Flatbread pizza and the garden salad were plain. And I did not like the homemade salad dressing. However their homemade ranch is amazing. I highly recommend getting a side of ranch for your fries.
Chicken burger was a 10/10

Address: 70 Grafton St Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K7 Canada
Review: The Buddha bowl with shrimp is delicious.  Sangria was very good also. Our servers were  very sweet. One spilled one of our drinks, so we weren't charged for the drinks.  (We only each had a drink. ) We sat outside, and there was entertainment.  Very nice atmosphere outside.

Address: 70 Grafton St Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K7 Canada
Review:
A definite stop if you're in pei... The staff are super friendly and the food is delicious.

I ordered the ribs which were fantastic, the potatoes were amazing.

The restaurant itself was very clean and located in an old building with character.

Address: 70 Grafton St Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K7 Canada
Review:
We've been twice during our vacation and were not disappointed with a single one of our choices.  The food is delicious.
Budda bowl, fried chicken sandwich, wings, perogies and poutine burger were all delicious!
May just come back before we leave Charlottetown!

Address: 70 Grafton St Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K7 Canada
Review: Came in as a walk-in and wouldn't have had time to sit and eat due to it being a Friday night. In a rush to watch Anne & Gilbert in a little more than 1.5hrs. We ordered take out but then the manager (sorry, forgot your name) said a table opened up and if we chose, could sit and experience the restaurant instead. We chose to stay and found out it was the right move. From the beginning, the two greeters were amazing -helpful and friendly. Also our server who recommended the No Boats On Sunday Cranberry Cidar, Maddy. Atmosphere was lively and the food was great. Only thing better was the service and kindness by the staff. Go to Pilot House

Address: 39 Eden Street Unit 5 Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: The food was tasty and prepared as suggested.If you are craving for plain Indian food this is the place.They had nice chicken momo and have nice service and decent sitting area.We tried chicken curry,mix veg and it tasted good.We were tourist there and tried this restaurant based on the reviews and it worked well for us

Address: 39 Eden Street Unit 5 Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review:
This place is awesome and I love their food. Their chicken curry with rice reminded me of my maternal grandmother because the preparation and the spices had touches of Bengal. I also liked their dessert options and the beautiful Nepali music.

I strongly recommend this place 💯

Address: 39 Eden Street Unit 5 Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: Delicious Indian food. All curries had different flavours so very well understood that they don't share a 'common base' like many other restaurants. Lassi tasted very natural and glad tried both plain and mango. There are only limited seating options. Service was good. Will repeat given a chance.

Address: 39 Eden Street Unit 5 Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: Awesome place to eat out at! The prices are amazing and the portions are very good for the price. Vegetarian options are plentiful and the naan is great!

Address: 39 Eden Street Unit 5 Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: The food is always excellent here. My favourite is Chicken Tikka masala with rice or Naan. I also love their Mango Lassi. The servers were great and it's a nice quiet and calm atmosphere. I highly recommend it.

Address: 138 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: The food was tasty and prepared as suggested.If you are craving for plain Indian food this is the place.They had nice chicken momo and have nice service and decent sitting area.We tried chicken curry,mix veg and it tasted good.We were tourist there and tried this restaurant based on the reviews and it worked well for us

Address: 138 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
This place is awesome and I love their food. Their chicken curry with rice reminded me of my maternal grandmother because the preparation and the spices had touches of Bengal. I also liked their dessert options and the beautiful Nepali music.

I strongly recommend this place 💯

Address: 138 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: Delicious Indian food. All curries had different flavours so very well understood that they don't share a 'common base' like many other restaurants. Lassi tasted very natural and glad tried both plain and mango. There are only limited seating options. Service was good. Will repeat given a chance.

Address: 138 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: Awesome place to eat out at! The prices are amazing and the portions are very good for the price. Vegetarian options are plentiful and the naan is great!

Address: 138 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: The food is always excellent here. My favourite is Chicken Tikka masala with rice or Naan. I also love their Mango Lassi. The servers were great and it's a nice quiet and calm atmosphere. I highly recommend it.

Address: 86 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A7 Canada
Review: Fantastic! Had the filet mignon with the Gouda and a lobster tail. Mashed potatoes were wonderful. Also had the broiled oysters. Hubby had the ribeye. The atmosphere is amazing. Everything down to the restrooms is amazing. Our bartender server (sat at the bar) was great! Dined at 4 pm on a Tuesday. It was not crowded.

Address: 86 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A7 Canada
Review: We are on a road trip in the Maritimes. We've had meals in Montreal, Quebec City, Halifax, Peggy's Cove, Lunenburg, Digby, St. John and Saint Andrews by-the-sea. Do dinner we had that Sims Corner Steakhouse & Oyster Bar was by far the best. Hats off to the chefs and our server Sarah.

Address: 86 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A7 Canada
Review: Great service by our waitress. Never missing a beat and very good hospitality. The food was well served and prepared. I recommend the seafood chowder - wonderful flavor. And if you order biscuits, it comes with a sweet butter that is so delicious. The building is well designed in atmosphere, love the old chandelier.

Address: 86 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A7 Canada
Review: It’s a pretty dark restaurant. The furniture are heavy looking with all velvet chairs or velvet couches. Very mixed colors from bright pink to dark green chairs; not sure how my eyes felt. But I was comfortably sitting though. The service of our waitress was super slow but she was super nice. Example, it took her 20 minutes to bring us two bottles of wine. So you can imagine how long it took to take our orders and to receive our plates. I ordered seared Halibut with roasted vegetables. And green salad with candied walnuts, beet chips, goat cheese and raspberry vinaigrette. The salad was mind blowing. My halibut was good till you reach in the middle where flavor hasn’t penetrated inside, so it was very bland inside. Otherwise good experience with my amazing group. Even tough I didn’t pay, the prices are very steep for a tiny portion of meal.

Address: 86 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A7 Canada
Review: Fresh oysters. Excellent service! We ordered 2 dozen oysters and followed the waitress recommendation, all the oysters are fresh and delicious! We mentioned that the seafood chowder is a bit salty for us, the waitress immediately waived the bill for the chowder. I would like to say their service is a five star level, they let customer feel reliable and comfortable. I will recommend this place to my friends!

Address: 2 Lower Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review: We came here for supper with friends. One of us has a food allergy. They sat us, served drinks, and asked about our friend who had brought her own food. She acted as if everything was fine. She came back to take our orders. After about 10 minutes of getting our drinks and our friend halfway through eating her food, the manager came to us and asked us to leave. He said that they couldn't allow outside food into the restaurant. So, we left before actually getting our food. As we were walking in a couple was leaving because they weren't getting any service. No go...

Address: 2 Lower Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review: A wonderful patio!! Taylor and Carlos provided us with excellent service! Very reasonably priced. Great selection of beers and the pork tacos were some of the best we had!!! Only drawback was the county music the dj was playing….ugh. Enough crying about trucks and dogs and work😆.

Address: 2 Lower Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review: Great place off the water.. relaxed and great staff¡

Address: 2 Lower Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review: Had a wonderful experience here. Live music on the harbor and wonderful food. Fast and friendly service. My wife and I managed to finish the seafood boil that was supposed to feed 4, but we were hungry after a long day of travel.

Address: 2 Lower Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review:
Great place to bring your dog, their patio is essentially a dog park with chairs. Very cozy and casual.

Service was underwhelming. Waited 5 minutes to be seated, despite most of the patio area being empty.

Our order was taken promptly after we were seated and the food came in under 10 minutes.

We got fish and chips, it was a little greasy and not fresh, but that's to be expected. Good food overall, loved the fries.

It was quite a while before we saw our waitress again. Everyone at the table next to us stood up and flagged the staff down because they were tired of waiting for their bill. Eventually we had to do the same.

As the temperature began to drop, we noticed the staff bringing blankets to other guests, so that was nice for them.

TL;DR
Good food, slow service, got the impression that they were slightly understaffed and perhaps a bit inefficient, but it is by far the most dog friendly place in Charlottetown.

Address: 132 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review: Perfect dinner, especially when we went to the Hunter restaurant recommended by a friend just after the plane landed, and they didn't let us in.  Came to this lively and delicious restaurant.  The staff are very welcoming.  The staff helped me choose a very weak beer suitable for ladies.  I am very happy with my beer alas.  Serve with seafood pasta and seafood tacos.  Very satisfied listening to music and drinking wine.  The first day of our PEI trip ended perfectly.

Address: 132 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
The server was nice and I feel bad she had to take our Calamari back. That said what is the restaurant thinking? We love this island and have had great experiences across the board including culinary but this was a joke.

The beer and wine was fine and the beet salad was good albeit a little pricey for its size but the Calamari I can’t even lol…

Check the two pics first is what the tried serving us with no dip, lemon or anything. We did not have a bite. The second is what typical calamari for the price looks like.

Seriously, if you can’t make a dish up to par, don’t have it on the menu.

Shame that we picked this place and others were open. This was kinda a night killer but whatever I hope they use this review to get better or remove this item from their menu.

Oh yeah once again we did not take one bite of that plate lol.

Address: 132 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
All I've got to say is... *chefs kiss*

The bowl of chowder was a huge portion and was rich and hearty.
The seafood pasta had great ingredients,  steak bites were perfectly cooked and the pretzel bites was like the cherry on top!

Service from the bar was prompt in food and drinks,  and the drinks were flowing well!

Highly recommend for a stop in if you're visiting Charlottetown !

Address: 132 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
My wife and I just had our 2nd anniversary dinner here and we loved it! I had scallops, she had the haddock. It was all amazing.
One of the many friendly staff members took our picture with dinners presented.
Highly recommended!

Address: 132 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
I absolutely loved the Big Andy Burger. It was superb and made my tummy very happy. Just the right amount of spice and savory from that jalapeno aioli. My friend go the fish and chips which were also very nice, flakey, and cooked perfectly - the tartar sauce was good and flavorful.

The beer selection was very good! I was able to sample a few to see what I liked best and choose from those. The Gahan blueberry wheat beer was especially yummy. The beer could have been colder though, as I found it was a bit warmer when it was served but still appropriately cool; this was more of a personal preference.

Service was great too! Fairly normal wait time for a busy place, and the staff were very quick to help you out with a request. I'd certainly recommend this place to friends.

One last thing - the live music was a nice touch and they were great performances.

Address: 2 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
Great little spot! The vibe of this place was super positive - with lots of lovely outdoor seating - and the people working there were super lovely :)

Lobster roll with fries for only $22! Coming from Toronto, I was certainly expecting a higher price point, and was pleasantly surprised. The roll was a bit smaller than I would expect; BUT AGAIN, the price was at least 6$ cheaper than what I have seen elsewhere. And the food tasted great! Well seasoned lobster, buttery crispy exterior on the bun, and the fries were perfect!

I would come back again for sure :)

Address: 2 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
If you want something different this is the place.
The fish has some different batter, in a good way.
Fries seen to be the real ones had cut, and wild fish as well
Pulled pork poutine was good too
Good customer service .
We recommend it

Address: 2 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
Ordered the lobster roll, fish sandwich and a beer.  I believe the lobster roll was $24, the fish sandwich was $14 and the beer was $8.

Overall, the lobster roll was okay but didn't come with full chunks of lobster.  There were a few chunks with shredded lobster.  The bread used for the rolls was very good.  The fish sandwich was also okay, and the fries were tasty and very crispy.

The staff were very nice and the shack is located in a great spot.

Address: 2 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: I am missing seeing the owner who used to essentially live here. But it’s good to see that she can take a break every once in a while and trust her staff to do an excellent job just like her. Everyone was professional, friendly, and helpful. The food is great, the homemade french fries with their homemade garlic dip is a must. I’ve been here before and I will be back many many more times.

Address: 2 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: I’ve been here multiple times as I’m from Charlottetown. The owner is an amazingly high energy beautifully kind person. She has chosen her staff very wisely, and on the odd time when she’s not there they take over seamlessly. The food is amazing. The lobster roll is incredible. My absolute favourite is the homemade french fries with the yummy yummy garlic dip. Keep up the incredible work guys. Look forward to seeing you each year, I will be back over and over and over.

Address: 146 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A Canada
Review: I went there for dinner when we traveled to PEI. The restaurant was really good and clean, the experience was very pleasant, and there’s shows and music on that street. We ordered the seafood chowder and burger, they were delicious. Definitely worth the money and time and would go there again!

Address: 146 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A Canada
Review: We stopped in here for a much needed late lunch. It was quiet at the time. My wife had an excellent lobster roll. I had lobster poutine. There was just enough lobster to keep me satisfied.  My wife also had the chowder which was great as well. They have a handful of beers on tap as well too. A decent place to grab lunch after a long day for sure.

Address: 146 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A Canada
Review:
What can I say? Loved the place!
Nice ambience, fantastic food, and great service!
Our server Angela was super friendly, fun and entertaining, as well as kind enough to give us a crash course on dealing with our first whole lobster.
We decided to go all in and opted for the Church Main - a whole lobster, preceded by a chowder and a bowl of clams, and followed by a dessert.
The chowder was very smooth and creamy, with teragon being "the secret ingredient". The clams were great with their souse.
And the lobster - just delicious.
Turtle cheesecake in a jar was the cherry on top.
Not a cheap dinner, but the experience was well worth every dollar!

Address: 146 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A Canada
Review: After trying 3 different lobster rolls during my trip here... this place offers average lobster rolls with very high prices compared to most places. The flavor was lacking in the roll unfortunately - but the fries were very crispy and tasty. Service was great and attentive.

Address: 146 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A Canada
Review: Stopped twice for drinks. Friendly staff, but got a little attitude when we declined the food menu prior to a show we were going to. Took them more than 10 minutes to bring our drinks. On the other side, we had 2 nice waiters asking us if we were ok a few times ( not our waitress). As we were going for dinner on a Saturday night, because it was highly recommended, they were closed for inventory!  Why would you close on a Saturday during tourist season?

Address: 7 St Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N1 Canada
Review: The gluten free crust is chewy and thin-not the best combination. Toppings were generous, but the chicken was a tad dry. I did order delivery so I didn't have the freshest pizza, but I was expecting more for the price.

Address: 7 St Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N1 Canada
Review: Good pizza, little expensive but worth it. I would recommend you to try different pizza each time you visit for different flavours.

Address: 7 St Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N1 Canada
Review: We took our kids out tonight to try Famous Peppers for the first time and it was absolutely amazing we got 4 9inch pizzas to try and can't wait to go back and try some other ones out!!!

Address: 7 St Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N1 Canada
Review: Server was extremely friendly, pizza was good if you like different styles of pizza! The maple cream sauce was a bit confusing but it's good, it's more so like a whipped cream. Beer was good and cold. Only small complaint is the wait time but it wasn't to bad compared to some places.

Address: 7 St Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N1 Canada
Review: A nice variety of signature pizzas, with a great selection of hot sauces. Was kid-friendly and easily accessible.

Address: 45 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A4 Canada
Review: Great spot! I am not usually one for restaurant pizza but I couldn’t pass it up! I had the Americana and it was probably one of the best pizzas I have ever had. The staff was also great with accommodating my request for a singular arancini since no one would split an app with me.

Address: 45 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A4 Canada
Review:
Although all the food was excellent, my wife and I both believed that there was opportunities to step up the game. The all of appetizer could've been made excellent by getting some smoke flavour to the olives, as well as serving them warm with just a minimal amount of orange zest, grated on top.
My wife had an appetizer that was mozzarella cheese, wrapped in prosciutto with a marinara sauce. We both believe that the cheese ratio should've been higher as well as a pan sear on the prosciutto before putting into the marinara sauce with it elevated this dish. We both have the pizza different times, and it was excellent.

Address: 45 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A4 Canada
Review:
I was thrilled to stumble upon this delicious Italian oasis on a rainy and windy Sunday night in Charlottetown.

For those of you new to the east coast, myself included, you will quickly learn that pretty much everything is closed on a Sunday (and Monday and Tuesday)! But not this place!!!

The butternut squash soup was a great way to warm up from the cold, and the pizza was light and satisfying (we got the vegan pizza with real cheese, as was suggested by our waiter. He was, dare I say, a genius!)

Finished off the meal with tiramisu in a jar, cuz we’re cool like that.

Address: 45 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A4 Canada
Review:
Nested between the various shops and numerous restaurants crowding Queen Street in Charlottetown, the Piatto may be easily missed by the inattentive passerby in a hurry. From the outside, the venue has a low profile compared to many of the flashier eateries lining the street.

I went in blind, without prior knowledge of the place despite living quite nearby and passing it frequently. I entered the Piatto and was almost immediately welcomed and seated - there was a friendly ambiance and familiar vibe from the moment I set foot inside the restaurant.

My server Marlow introduced himself, and offered me the menu. I looked at the various options, but eventually decided to ask him for recommendations - he gladly obliged, and suggested some favourites, as well as something based on my preferences for something with many toppings. Marlow spoke passionately about each dish, and eventually I settled for a simple, delicious classic - the Siciliana.

The Siciliana was served surprisingly quickly, and looked beautiful. At first I thought that I might not be able to finish a 10" pizza by myself, but the pizza was light and refreshing, with a balance of fresh veggies and evenly spread proteins. Every bite introduced my taste buds to fresh peppers, tomatoes, and basil, all complemented by some light cheese. If you go in expecting your typical heavy, fat American pizza, you might want to reconsider. But if you are looking for a more authentic, fresh, handcrafted pizza, look no further than the Piatto.

Address: 45 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A4 Canada
Review: Great food - really great, in fact. Great service. Wonderful that they have vegan options my partner could enjoy. Could have done without the live music - too loud and not very entertaining. We were there to eat, not listen to some guy sing The Unicorn by the Irish Rovers. Overall, recommended.

Address: 186 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: I have been to this place multiple times over years when visiting Charlottetown. The dishes are delicious and the staff friendly. We have even ordered takeouts for 10 people this year. They say if we give them more advanced time they can prepare trays. But we ordered an hour ahead so it was all separate dishes. All good and all clear. They have a small Buddha hall upstairs. Check it out next time!

Address: 186 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: The best vegetarian/vegan restaurant in Charlottetown, hands down. The pricing is fair, service is great, and the atmosphere is always so calm and welcoming. Several times in the past, the staff have given out treats for special holidays as well which is always greatly appreciated. Don't miss out on trying this place if you're looking for some delicious veg food in town.

Address: 186 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: Nice menu selection and good vegan options. However, it seems like the spice we expect from this style of restaurant in other cities has been tamed down for Maritimes palates.

Address: 186 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: Stopped here for some vegan food for dinner — service was good if a bit slow. Food was fine, but nothing more; perhaps we had three dishes that were ‘misses’, but we weren’t super impressed with the flavours or quality. Overall a good enough experience, it seems that many people love this place so take what we say with a grain of salt.

Address: 186 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: My unique Taiwanese cousin in PEI . Sweet Tofu is delicious, Thai stir-fry eggplant is morelike Northeneast flavor. The only concern is the quantity of tofu is less than eggplant

Address: 189 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4L1 Canada
Review: Took a friend here for their Sunday afternoon jam so she could experience some Celtic music.  We had a really good time with great seats.  We shared the bacon wrapped scallops and the spinach dip.  The scallops were large and cooked perfectly.  My friend ordered the blueberry ale, which she loved.  Very attentive waitress and we appreciated that she told us that the spinach dip would take a bit longer and we were asked if we wanted the scallops first or to have them held to come out with the dip.  Definitely worth a return trip!

Address: 189 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4L1 Canada
Review: The food was very filling. One entree can fill you to the brim. We made the mistake of ordering appetizers. The food was too salty for me but good. Waitress was very kind and checked on us often. We ordered potato skins which was more nacho form with potato skins and a giant plate full. Then we ordered the steak n steak n colcannon and the Irish stew. The stew came with colcannon and Irish brown bread.
