I finished everything and am not proud to say that I proceeded to have the worst gas of my life. I think my entire intestine was inflated by the end of the night. My husband loved the food and for the first time in his life could not finish the second steak. I think if I were to go back, I’d have to order something smaller and not be so ambitious haha.

Address: 189 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4L1 Canada
Review: I love the Irish coffee. The platter was perfect to share with friends. There was Live-Music which makes good vibes.

Address: 189 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4L1 Canada
Review:
Half price appetizers Monday and Tuesday with the purchase of beverage, foods are fantastic, especially considering the price. Lots of choices of beer, both crafts and commercial brands.
Gunniess is 6 dollars on Tuesday.

Address: 189 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4L1 Canada
Review: We were very grateful they took us in at 9:40pm for dinner. Unfortunately I wasn’t the biggest fan of their food. I thought their shrimp pasta has far too much sauce and their chowder tasted meh. Their fried shrimp and service was great though.

Address: 330 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M4 Canada
Review: Really good Korean food. Not fast but that's probably a good thing. Not going to say the atmosphere is anything to write home about but if you are looking for good authentic bibimbap or kimchi while on Charlottetown this is your place.

Address: 330 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M4 Canada
Review: Ordered the fried chicken and I have one question... Do you not believe in seasoning??? It was so bland and boring and just  meh. Never had it but I think boiled chicken would still be seasoned better and that's some in a a whole league on their own and not a good one. Over priced and boring. Only pro was that the skin was a perfect crisp which at least it had texture. Not sure about the rest of their food but I hope they do better.

Address: 330 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M4 Canada
Review: Ideal location for a quick bite or takeout. Delicious famous Korean dishes and asian styled flavoring. Their shop is a little bit small so it might get crowded.

Address: 330 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M4 Canada
Review: Our favourite spot in town, everything we've tried is excellent. The menu is small so you don't have to spend an hour looking for something. Their dumplings are a must!

Address: 330 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M4 Canada
Review: Pricey for a rice dish however I love dolsot bibimbap! It's what I order at every Korean restaurant. Kinda an expert at this point. Always good food and good service!

Address: 23 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review:
Prior to moving to PEI, I tried the Merchantman (Patio) and had an underwhelming experience, poor service and poor presentation of my meal. Fast forward to last week when our family came to visit and they made a reservation, which worried me 😬, but thankfully my concerns were completely unfounded.  We sat in the restaurant, the service was okay, but the food was excellent, especially the “Island Seafood Boil”, our server advised the portion was large and suggested it was a meal for two! Thank goodness we took heed of his suggestion, it was huge and definitely a meal for 2, the scallops were cooked perfectly and lots of them,  as were the mussels, clams, shrimp and snow crab and lobster.  I now know where we can go for that special occasion and have a wonderful seafood feast, that we love so much.
I know a lot of people are are very critical of establishments and if they have one bad experience they won’t return, if we had subscribed to that philosophy, it would have been our loss. Thanks Merchantman for improving your game! 😀

Address: 23 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review:
Appetizers were great, the baked oysters especially. Would recommend.

The sangria was a good price for the size.

Disappointed in the meals. The beef was low quality and kinda tasted like wild meat. The lobster role came on a hot dog bun!!! Tasted very processed. Do not recommend.

Sat down at 8pm (reservation). We were going to order desert but was advised the kitchen closed at 9pm..... oddly, a table was seated after 9pm and still received food...???

Address: 23 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review:
We went here last week after strolling adorable downtown Charlottetown. They couldn't get us in to the main restaurant so we walked around to their patio area 'Next Door'. There was live music and sunshine so we had high hopes however after sitting we were ignored for quite a while, others who came after us were served drinks before we were acknowledged at all. Once we were served, the gin fizz I ordered wasn't at all as described in the menu so I mentioned it and he offered something else. I got a glass of wine instead. After the long delay plus some other mishaps with delivery of our appetizers (raw oysters with underwhelming presentation and scallops with pork belly that weren't gluten free due to the maple whiskey glaze for some reason) we decided to end it there rather than risk further disappointment. There also weren't many gluten free options.
We noticed later that they'd charged us for the higher priced gin fizz rather than the wine. A mistake or a grab for more money, either way poor form. Perhaps just bad luck that night but I wouldn't return or recommend.

Address: 23 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review: Merchantman - Fresh SeaFood, Great restaurant for fresh seafood. We had a wonderful dinner time. The food was super delicious. The lobster is a must try. The service is so good, the environment is wonderful and well maintained. The staffs are friendly and make the order perfect as requested. Had a great seafood dinner.

Address: 23 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review:
Loved all the foods!!
It was one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. I'm not a seafood person, but their buttermilk fish sandwich and seafood chowder were marvelous. I would highly recommend this place to others :D

Address: 128 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H7 Canada
Review: Travelled all over Canada and I would say for both me and my wife that Receiver has the best lattes we've ever had. The food was also great

Address: 128 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H7 Canada
Review: Perfect art of coffee done by barista even I ordered mocha. I love the vibes on being top corner table. The breakfast set is kind of healthy with own choice of eggs. See you again in future days. It’s perfect place for coffee.

Address: 128 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H7 Canada
Review: Pretty good lattes! Went here a few times because it turned out to be our favorite coffee spot in Charlottetown. Would also recommend Willow Cafe if you're out West!

Address: 128 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H7 Canada
Review:
Food is pretty good. Smaller portions than expected. Prices are higher than expected.

Wait time for just a coffee/latte is way too long. I work in an office nearby and the few times I've popped in to get a mid-afternoon coffee I've waited much too long. It appears only one person is ever able to make espresso based drinks which leads to a bottleneck and the wait for drinks being much longer than needed or expected.

Don't come expecting to grab a quick coffee.

Address: 128 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H7 Canada
Review:
What a great little coffee house. Found you after we landed in your lovely city. Airport, hotel and then you. First was a coffee. What a great coffee. Second was coffee and brownie. What a great brownie. Then was breakfast...OMG! Eggs cooked perfectly along with bacon that was crisp but chewy all at the same time, dam good home fries and brioche toast. But wait, it gets better... Banana bread french toast topped with bananas and candied walnuts. Outstanding!
We will be back next time we're in town. Thank you

Address: 178 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8W1 Canada
Review: Travelled all over Canada and I would say for both me and my wife that Receiver has the best lattes we've ever had. The food was also great

Address: 178 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8W1 Canada
Review: Perfect art of coffee done by barista even I ordered mocha. I love the vibes on being top corner table. The breakfast set is kind of healthy with own choice of eggs. See you again in future days. It’s perfect place for coffee.

Address: 178 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8W1 Canada
Review: Pretty good lattes! Went here a few times because it turned out to be our favorite coffee spot in Charlottetown. Would also recommend Willow Cafe if you're out West!

Address: 178 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8W1 Canada
Review:
Food is pretty good. Smaller portions than expected. Prices are higher than expected.

Wait time for just a coffee/latte is way too long. I work in an office nearby and the few times I've popped in to get a mid-afternoon coffee I've waited much too long. It appears only one person is ever able to make espresso based drinks which leads to a bottleneck and the wait for drinks being much longer than needed or expected.

Don't come expecting to grab a quick coffee.

Address: 178 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8W1 Canada
Review:
What a great little coffee house. Found you after we landed in your lovely city. Airport, hotel and then you. First was a coffee. What a great coffee. Second was coffee and brownie. What a great brownie. Then was breakfast...OMG! Eggs cooked perfectly along with bacon that was crisp but chewy all at the same time, dam good home fries and brioche toast. But wait, it gets better... Banana bread french toast topped with bananas and candied walnuts. Outstanding!
We will be back next time we're in town. Thank you

Address: 7 St. Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N3 Canada
Review: The staff was kind but almost to extremes.. coming over to see how things are every couple of minutes! I suppose they could just ignore you like the previous owners did but they could definitely slow down a little bit! The buffet was alright but the rice was sort of chemically tasting and the ribs had a bit too much fat compared to what I’m use too. All in all it was an OK experience!

Address: 7 St. Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N3 Canada
Review:
I dont often complain or feel the need to review experiences however tonight was unacceptable from a consumer standpoint.

I Ordered from door dash. Was hoping for a good chinese meal as a treat after a long week. What i got was nothing near what i expected.
I ordered the shrimp and mushroom dish. Kung Po Chicken, an order of chicken chow mein and an egg roll.
90% of what i ordered will not be eaten.

The kung Po chicken was by far the worst ive ever had. It was more of a spicy raw onion soup than it was anything even resembling Kung Po chicken.

The Mushroom Shrimp was alright, again, VERY watery and soup-ey. I was able to eat some of it but it very much lacked any flavor.

The chicken chow mein was basically steamed bean sprouts with very little chicken to be seen and absolutely no flavor.

If not for the egg roll, Which was delicious, this rating would have been 1 star.

Cherry on top? They use paper bags to deliver... it was left at my door with a SOAKED bottom. It all fell out when i lifted it up. Thank god i hadnt picked it all the way up or i wouldnt have got to eat anything. Not that it made much of a difference in the end...

Address: 7 St. Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N3 Canada
Review: The food tastes really good, and I would definitely get it again! However, the service was a little slow, but that's kind of expected for Mother's Day. Also, I found what looked to be a Claw. I'm not sure what from but I'm assuming maybe a chicken. One thing that I love about this restaurant is that they do so much good in the community! I rate Silver Streams a 3/5, and I will probably be back!

Address: 7 St. Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N3 Canada
Review: First time here while vacationing. It was awful. The chicken balls were so dry I couldn't cut through them. Any food with meat was really fatty, wontons were just chips, no meat at all, rice tasted burnt. Chicken wings were good though. My husband had a few bites but couldn't eat the rest. Restaurant was not very clean. Doors covered in finger prints, bathroom unclean. We won't be returning.

Address: 7 St. Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N3 Canada
Review: I called to place a food order for pickup for my grandparents to enjoy this evening. I asked the gentleman on the phone if he thought it was enough food for senior citizens or should I order more, and he said he would upsize the rice portion complimentary. It was a very kind gesture :). The owner also regularly cooks for the Upper Room Soup Kitchen which speaks volumes about his character.

Address: 188 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 2P7 Canada
Review: Wow! The food here is so authentic and delicious

Address: 188 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 2P7 Canada
Review: As usual, everything was delicious 🤤  my friend and I enjoyed our meals.

Address: 188 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 2P7 Canada
Review: I absolutely love this place!! My first choice when I crave Chinese food. It's the closest thing I had back home in Ontario for any of you CFA's out there looking for your fix😍

Address: 188 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 2P7 Canada
Review:
This has been our "Go-to" Chinese food restaurant for the last several years. Service is welcoming and friendly.
The food portions are generous and offer a large variety of choices. The cost is very reasonable and reflects the freshness and quality.
Thank you for always being so kind and thoughtful when answering our many questions as we try new items from your menu.
A gem of a restaurant operated by a thoughtful and caring family. See you next time!!!

Address: 188 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 2P7 Canada
Review: Great unique atmosphere and splendid service. Food is as expected and good, but a 5 star rating could easily be possible by integrating some uniqueness into their menu, something PEI. That's the only thing missing.

Address: 141 Great George Street Charllottetown, PE C1B 4K7 Canada
Review: Our first time.  We ordered the lobster burger with butter and the fried chicken sandwich. The lobster burger was great not excellent.  The roll used was too soft.  The chicken sandwich was just fried too thin, so dry.  It would have been better with fish or grilled chicken.  See photos.

Address: 141 Great George Street Charllottetown, PE C1B 4K7 Canada
Review: Really nice local restaurant in downtown Charlottetown! Mainly serving seafood but also burgers and such. Fish and chips portion is quite good and the fries are some of the best fries on the island. Also had veggie options (burger) which did not disappoint!

Address: 141 Great George Street Charllottetown, PE C1B 4K7 Canada
Review:
Very nice atmosphere with plenty of seating, and service was fast and friendly.
We were each going to get the 2 piece fish n chips but the owner assured us the pieces were large...and that was a good call, the 1 piece was plenty! It was cooked to perfection, the haddock was moist and flakey, and the batter crispy and golden.  They have an in-house tartar sauce that was also very nice!  Don't pass this place up if you're craving some fantastic sea food!

Address: 141 Great George Street Charllottetown, PE C1B 4K7 Canada
Review: My husband and I stopped for lunch today at Brits Fish and Chips. I was so happy to learn that they had a dedicated gluten-free frier. I have allergies to dairy, gluten, soy, eggs, and corn. They prepare the gluten-free fish with rice flour, some apple juice, salt, and pepper. Nice and safe for someone like me!! I added sweet potato fries, and it was all delicious. My husband had the standard one-piece haddock with fries, and he really enjoyed his as well. They have a great patio space that is dog friendly, but the weather today was not great for that, so we ate inside.

Address: 141 Great George Street Charllottetown, PE C1B 4K7 Canada
Review: Stopped by for lunch on a cool day in June, and it was well worth it. The staff was friendly and helpful, the mussels top notch, and the Haddock lightly breaded and fried just right. Pair this with a local pint and you are all set for the rest of the day.

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review:
The Olde Dublin Pub is an absolute gem of a place. From the moment you step inside, you're transported to a cozy, welcoming atmosphere that's steeped in history and tradition. The decor is classic and timeless, with wooden beams, exposed brick, and vintage Irish memorabilia adorning the walls.

But the real star of the show is the food and drink. The pub offers a wide selection of Irish and local beers on tap, as well as an extensive menu of classic pub fare with a modern twist. The fish and chips are some of the best I've ever had, and the shepherd's pie is hearty and flavorful. But the real standout is the Irish stew - it's a must-try!

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review:
It was highly-rated and praised, so we made our choice comfortably - thinking we would have quality food that’s affordable.

Alas, the oysters served were extremely dirty and badly presented. The oysters were laid on top of one another, causing the oysters below to be contaminated with the shell remnants of the oysters above them. Mignonette was promised alongside the lemons and cocktail sauce, but unfortunately none was served.
Many of the oysters weren’t even properly removed from their base (the adductor muscle). The oysters had SO much debris inside it was VERY obvious that they didn’t even bother purging them (soaking them for 10 mins in ice cold water so they can spit out the dirt from within).
It was a filthy and grainy experience that truly took away from our love for oysters.

BUT THAT IS NOT ALL!

The chowder. Oh my god. We ordered the chowder right after the oysters, and I was in complete shock at the state that it arrived in. I’ll insert a video below. The CONSISTENCY was HORRID. It was far from creamy. I am very, very rarely offended, and I felt personally insulted that the chef actually looked at these bowls and thought this was good enough to send out. Where are the standards?! It was bland, the seafood inside were severely overcooked, and it was the consistency of broth. After voicing our dislike for the chowders, they still charged us for them even though we didn’t even have a second bite! I’m absolutely mind blown. 🤯

We tipped the servers and didn’t take away from anyone’s hard work, but we didn’t feel equally appreciated as customers.

It was our first ever meal arriving in PEI, and what a disappointing experience it was. We stormed out, bellies hungry and our pockets significantly emptier, searching for another place to have dinner for the night after our long road trip there.

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: 4 of us eating all different meals , Shepard pie , steak sandwich, burger and Indian curry , all good eats , the beer is cold , the atmoshere and service awesome

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: We arrived late and the kitchen was almost closed but they did everything to accommodate us and we we’re able to order food which was absolutely delicious. Staff was incredibly friendly, owner took a moment to come chat with us. Lively ambiance. Highly recommended

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: Oysters were fine but mignonette wasn’t provided contrary to the menu. Cocktail sauce is very basic. Five ounce bacon wrapped filet was passable but stringy. Nothing special here. Fish with the fish and chips was outright terrible. Overcooked and didn’t have the consistency of quality fish. Try Churchill’s on Queen St instead. Much better. Service was okay but slow. $90 for a sub-par meals. Not recommended.

Address: 393  University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: Tasted great, but very poorly prepared and appears to be thrown together. Never usually have a problem but the zesty garlic sauce was in between all my tacos, and the soft shells were covered in the sauce making them impossible to pick up and hang on to without getting covered in sauce.

Address: 393  University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: This was the worst food experience for me in Charlottetown. Never going back again. The burrito was so bad no flavor at all. I had to force it down my throat because It is food regardless and I was hungry.

Address: 393  University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review:
My favourite place to go and eat.
People serving are always super nice!
Last person who waited on us was so amazing he even went out of his way to make us churros, I felt very special!

Food is so delicious 🤤🤤 100 percent would recommend

Address: 393  University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: Good and fast!

Address: 393  University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: Love the renovation, staff here are the best!

Address: 201 Buchanan Dr Charlottetown, PE C1E 2E4 Canada
Review: Stopped by here for a quick eat and was pleasantly surprised. The price was quite good for the portion. They have lots of variety from tacos, burritos, quesadillas, nachos, bowls, and churros. It was tasty and the topping/sauce options were plenty. Would come back here again 👌

Address: 201 Buchanan Dr Charlottetown, PE C1E 2E4 Canada
Review: Great business! I love trying different quick service restaurants that we don't have back home and this did not disappoint! Delicious and fresh ingredients, very helpful staff, and so many options to choose from! Will be back for sure!

Address: 201 Buchanan Dr Charlottetown, PE C1E 2E4 Canada
Review: Always amazing🤤 I can never finish my burritos because they’re always SO stuffed! Love.

Address: 201 Buchanan Dr Charlottetown, PE C1E 2E4 Canada
Review: Always delicious, but they never have the beef barbacoa, which is the best meat there in my opinion :(

Address: 201 Buchanan Dr Charlottetown, PE C1E 2E4 Canada
Review:
Lady messed up my order put super spicy sauce on my quesadilla instead of garlic and also didn't give me a receipt :(

Teach your employees to grab the right sauce you absolute monsters

(Pic is how I feel)

Bro at the front was super nice tho with the beard give him a raise

Address: 2 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8C1 Canada
Review: So we are new to the whole seafood so after some extensive research we settled on this gem. Located conveniently by the waterfront and docks,the view is breathtaking. I settled for the lobster roll as I would of locked myself if I didn’t at least try. It was mouth watering. I couldn’t believe I waited so long to try one. The service was impeccable as was the restrooms. Parking is possible on the street but better off using the parking lot that’s right next door.

Address: 2 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8C1 Canada
Review: Was a bit hesitant to try this place based on some of the harsher reviews but very glad we tried it.  The food was good and reasonably priced.  Had the lobster macaroni and cheese, crab cakes and fries  The macaroni and cheese was absolutely delicious!  The crab cakes were good but are very potato forward.  The fries are Cavendish fries and we're very tasty and crispy.  A bit over seasoned but still good.

Address: 2 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8C1 Canada
Review: We were here for dinner during our trip. We got excellent seating with great views. The server was super helpful and hospitable. The food was fresh and tasty. Really fresh mussels, lobster and other seafood here.

Address: 2 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8C1 Canada
Review: Wow wow wow. This restaurant superseded my expectations. I had been searching all over the place for lobster rolls! The staff were incredibly friendly, the food was delicious, presentation was beautiful, and I ate VERY well. I’ll 100% come back and I recommend this restaurant for any traveller or local seeking the ultimate seafood dining experience.

Address: 2 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8C1 Canada
Review: Great dinner at the Lobster on the Wharf Restaurant. The service was quick, to get seated and order. We were seated outdoors as it was a nice sunny day - nice overlooking platform. Had the seafood chowder to start, followed by the lobster mac n cheese - both prepared really well.

Address: 189 Kent St. Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: Holly molly I LOVE this restaurant so much! Their happy hours with good deal of food were AMAZING!! I’m a sport fan and they have TVs everywhere (big plus) super nice to go there for my first day in PEI!! Def will go back again soon! (Love their quesadilla and fish and chips! Their beer was so cheap too!) big big recommend to everyone!!

Address: 189 Kent St. Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: Delivery was about 10 min late, won't complain, just a reminder for people who want to order delivery. Spaghetti sauce kinda tasted like canned sauce, which is fine I guess. Meatball tasted quite good actually.

Address: 189 Kent St. Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: The vibe was great, the food was cold, the service was OK, and I  had to chase people down for things which isn't cool. The wine was good though

Address: 189 Kent St. Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: Fascinated place to entertain, especially karaoke every Thursday at 10 pm.

Address: 189 Kent St. Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: Loved this place! Great atmosphere.  Great service. Best garlic fingers ever! The meatza pizza was very yummy too.

Address: 660 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review:
Not a chance are all these amazing reviews legit.  The service was very prompt and friendly but that is absolutely where the positive ends!  The food was a 2/10 at the most generous!  We have never had totally bland Chinese food before but here it is!  Nothing tasted bad, because it would actually have to taste like something to begin with.  We have traveled a lot of countries and we can without a doubt award this place with a "world's most flavourless" trophy!
The caption on the bottom of the sign would be a travesty for Charlottetown if it's true!
First and Last time...save your money and go elsewhere!

Address: 660 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review: I recently visited King's BBQ Chinese Restaurant and I was thoroughly impressed. They had multiple choices of delicious dishes to choose from, and the atmosphere was very warm and inviting. The service was very polite and the prices were very good. The highlight of my meal was the sweet and sour pork (I forgot the exact name) and the eggplant - it was cooked to perfection. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great Chinese dining experience.

Address: 660 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review: Service is not that great. But the owner is really nice and approachable. We just waited long enough to finish the side dish before the rice came out from the kitchen. Maybe they could bring out rice and side dish at the same time so we can enjoy our meal.

Address: 660 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review:
Not authentic Chinese food. Too oily and saucy for authentic noodle. The ingredients used for wonton soup was also not authentic. Overall taste was ok.
They also had many photo displays for more authentic Chinese food but they cannot be ordered, “we haven’t make them in such a long time” I was told by the server as they served the wrong food to me.
I was looking forward to try this place but I am disappointed now.

Address: 660 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review:
They advertise duck.. No such thing... Been long time.. They say... Been driving around for 20 minutes.. FOR NOTHING

I ordered sweet and sour chicken they left the chicken out I'll lay in it out with a lot of broth and vegetables.....
I also got something I never ordered and I have no idea what those brown crispy things are.....

The barbecue pork was good

Address: 359 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M9 Canada
Review: Today, I had dinner at Swiss chalet with my friends. Harman Kaur was our server, and she was very pleasant and helpful. She quickly delivered our food.

Address: 359 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M9 Canada
Review: My family and I enjoyed a wonderful meal together in your restaurant.  It was really Jackie, our server, that made the experience more exceptional.  She was extremely attentive, very kind, shared a laugh with us and ensured that everything was just right with our meals.  Thank you for making our family meal a memorable one Jackie!

Address: 359 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M9 Canada
Review: Just keeps going downhill. Use to frequent here often now only once a month and after this experience I'm done. Frys are always soggy and not fried at all, basically just wet potatoes soaked in cold oil, chicken is missing the wing, skin is not on the breast and the chicken is dryer than a maple leaf in October. Please someone quality check what's coming out of your kitchen.

Address: 359 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M9 Canada
Review: Food was good. Our server, Kamal was phenomenal. We had a large group of people and she handled all of us very kindly and efficiently, all with a smile on her face! She was very intentional in making sure  we all had what we needed

Address: 359 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M9 Canada
Review: The customer service of my past review has been spoken to and I was very pleased with the outcome and the way the lady administered herself . We had a terrible experience last evening and it was made right today . I am appreciative of the lady I spoke with on the phone , an apology and some options were all that I expected . So thank you for your genuine understanding and customer service correction !

Address: 123 Grafton Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
Overall is ok.
Beautiful interior and a good atmosphere.
The dishes sold beautifully at Unreasonable high prices!!!
The portions are too small that they should be, especially for the main course.
"Srimps&Scalops" consist of 4 shrimps + 3 scallops, with a few baby potatoes with sauce for 45$. So..  it was not enough for my 13-een year son; he remained hungry..

I would not return to the restaurant a second time.

Address: 123 Grafton Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
I cannot begin to express how much my wife and I LOVED Redwater! The dining room was very comfortable and classy. Our server was a very nice, polite young fella that was very versed in the menu.

The mussels were phenomenal! My wife throughly enjoyed her burger and Yukon gold mash and I had the best mushroom risotto! So full of flavor. And the margherita and basil flatbread had an amazing crust. Tender-chew with a nice crunch. The pesto made the flavor pop off the plate! Just fanatic!

And, because we were celebrating our anniversary, they gave us a piece dark chocolate cheesecake with a Chantilly cream that was out of this world!! I mean, we could have eaten 2 of those bad boys! Such a thoughtful gesture on their part. We will DEFINITELY be returning to this gem!

We've been looking for a good place to eat in town and we finally found it, and then some!

Address: 123 Grafton Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
Went to the Redwater Rustic Grille for lunch today after an absolutely terrible experience at another restaurant nearby that we walked out of.  This experience was completely different.

First, our waiter was absolutely fantastic…knowledgeable, attentive, friendly.  The food was absolutely fantastic.  I had the soup of the day, a roasted red pepper soup to die for!  My main course was the Maple Chipotle BBQ Chicken stone baked flatbread.  DELICIOUS!  And to top it off, coffee and Sticky Toffee Pudding with rum sauce and chantilly cream.  Everything from the atmosphere, the incredible waiter and the awesome food was such a wonderful experience.  And the price was more than reasonable!  Highly recommended!

Address: 123 Grafton Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
Redwater Rustic Grille has a great menu with top quality food. I am a longtime fan of their grilled caesar salad with chicken. Unlike any others I have eaten, theirs has am amazing dressing flavored with jalapeños.

For the next few weeks it is part of the Winterdine festival where top restaurants offer specials for lunch and dinners, changing offerings each week.

This week they are offering chicken and waffles with chicken gravy and an incredible chipotle dipping sauce that tastes like an incredible honey mustard sauce.

The chicken was crispy, boneless and had some heat. It was accompanied by a perfectly dressed wild lettuce salad that cut the richness of the chicken and waffles.

My husband, not a fan of sauces, gravities or dips practically liked his chipotle cup clean and finished mine. :-)

I asked to meet the chef to tank him for a terrific lunch. Because of the promotion of Winterdine it was a bargain, with mint chocolate affogato with a brown butter shortbread cookie.

If you can, book a lunch while winterdine is in effect. Redwater Rustic Grille isn’t a cheap lunch normally, but worth it.

At $20 it’s bargain! A great time to become acquainted with one of the best restaurants in the Maritimes.

Address: 123 Grafton Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: Love the atmosphere - hate the food. Neither myself or my guest enjoyed the meals, the menu is limited, and the prices are too high for what's offered. The space itself is very cozy and nice.

Address: 136 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
Prior to moving to PEI, I tried the Merchantman (Patio) and had an underwhelming experience, poor service and poor presentation of my meal. Fast forward to last week when our family came to visit and they made a reservation, which worried me 😬, but thankfully my concerns were completely unfounded.  We sat in the restaurant, the service was okay, but the food was excellent, especially the “Island Seafood Boil”, our server advised the portion was large and suggested it was a meal for two! Thank goodness we took heed of his suggestion, it was huge and definitely a meal for 2, the scallops were cooked perfectly and lots of them,  as were the mussels, clams, shrimp and snow crab and lobster.  I now know where we can go for that special occasion and have a wonderful seafood feast, that we love so much.
I know a lot of people are are very critical of establishments and if they have one bad experience they won’t return, if we had subscribed to that philosophy, it would have been our loss. Thanks Merchantman for improving your game! 😀

Address: 136 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
Appetizers were great, the baked oysters especially. Would recommend.

The sangria was a good price for the size.

Disappointed in the meals. The beef was low quality and kinda tasted like wild meat. The lobster role came on a hot dog bun!!! Tasted very processed. Do not recommend.

Sat down at 8pm (reservation). We were going to order desert but was advised the kitchen closed at 9pm..... oddly, a table was seated after 9pm and still received food...???

Address: 136 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
We went here last week after strolling adorable downtown Charlottetown. They couldn't get us in to the main restaurant so we walked around to their patio area 'Next Door'. There was live music and sunshine so we had high hopes however after sitting we were ignored for quite a while, others who came after us were served drinks before we were acknowledged at all. Once we were served, the gin fizz I ordered wasn't at all as described in the menu so I mentioned it and he offered something else. I got a glass of wine instead. After the long delay plus some other mishaps with delivery of our appetizers (raw oysters with underwhelming presentation and scallops with pork belly that weren't gluten free due to the maple whiskey glaze for some reason) we decided to end it there rather than risk further disappointment. There also weren't many gluten free options.
We noticed later that they'd charged us for the higher priced gin fizz rather than the wine. A mistake or a grab for more money, either way poor form. Perhaps just bad luck that night but I wouldn't return or recommend.

Address: 136 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review: Merchantman - Fresh SeaFood, Great restaurant for fresh seafood. We had a wonderful dinner time. The food was super delicious. The lobster is a must try. The service is so good, the environment is wonderful and well maintained. The staffs are friendly and make the order perfect as requested. Had a great seafood dinner.

Address: 136 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
Loved all the foods!!
It was one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. I'm not a seafood person, but their buttermilk fish sandwich and seafood chowder were marvelous. I would highly recommend this place to others :D

Address: 131 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: Real great Italian restaurant that also serves your standard breakfast items. Came here pretty early ~730am, so had no issue sitting down and getting quick service. The coffee here was amazing - large portions, for both the lattes and cappuccino. The breakfast portions were amazing - had both the Casa Mia Eggs Benny and the Casa Mia Hash. Very tasty, well seasoned, and eggs prepared on point. Price range is also decent for the quality and size of food.

Address: 131 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are all amazing here. One of our favorite places in Charlottetown. We highly recommend making a dinner reservation on the busy summer weekends.

Address: 131 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review:
My friend and I came over here from Ontario to try some things and sightsee.
I found this restaurant from a video on tiktok and I’m so glad we came!!! The food, amazing! Our server Ernie was so attentive and warm. We had the fish & chips, muscles in white wine sauce, Siciliana pizza & bruschetta, sooo good!
They also make an amazing espresso martini. If you’re on the island, it’s absolutely worth the stop! 10/10 recommend!

Address: 131 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: The breakfast tacos were amazing!!! So filling, could share them. The side potatoes are sweet and delicious.

Address: 131 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: Really disappointed with this spot, the vegetarian options are really lacking. I ordered a croissant sandwich without meat, they put ham on it and it was sooo soggy. Was pretty gross to be honest. Coffee wasn’t anything special, prices were really high and the service left a lot to be desired. The decor is cute.

Address: 92 Queen St Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: I consider this place better than other sushi places in Charlottetown. I get really, really hungry sometimes and I think the ramen is tasty & hits the spot. The miso soup and glass noodles that come complimentary before the food are great! I like getting the veggie ramen. I wish there was more eel in the unagi but still tastes good

Address: 92 Queen St Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review:
If you are lucky enough to visit Ta Ke Sushi, either come on an empty stomach or be prepared to eat the leftovers the next meal you have. The portions are large and very filling. The menu had a variety of Japanese and Korean dishes able to satisfy whatever craving you may have. The servers were extremely attentive and prompt. Unsurprisingly, everyone around us seemed to also have nothing but rave reviews.

PS I believe they have a lunch special between 11-3 most days too! (Call to confirm prior)

Address: 92 Queen St Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: The service was great and the food was yummy. I had miso soup, Las Vegas roll and spicy tuna. It was all great.

Address: 92 Queen St Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: Best spot for Japanese on PEI. Their rolls are always really fresh and packed! They have a bunch of creative and really tasty vegetarian rolls - great rice to “innards” ration. The miso soup and noodles come with your meal, and the service is incredible. We love all the staff at Ta Ke. We are regulars here and always look forward to our meal. I highly recommend this spot!

Address: 92 Queen St Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: Food is always great and served quickly. Very small space so they can get busy pretty fast and it can feel a bit cramped.

Address: 73 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4J7 Canada
Review:
I’m giving this place a 3.5 rating because I really, really appreciate their effort to provide gluten-free options for their battered foods.  Unfortunately, there was a mix-up - just as the Skip driver was arriving, the restaurant called to say he had taken the wrong order and needed to return.  By the time I got my food, the fish batter was soggy on the underside.  The batter also did not stick to the fish so I ended up eating the two separately.  It also needed salt.

As you can see in the picture, it came with two very large pieces of haddock.  Also included an extra tartar sauce.

Next time I’m on the Island, I will dine in and hopefully be able to update my review.

Address: 73 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4J7 Canada
Review:
Oh. My. Goodness. GET THE FISH AND CHIPS!!! They will be the BEST fish and chips you EVER have! The fish was light noticeably fresh… cooked to perfection. HUGE portions too.

Special shout-out to our fabulous waiter, Phil. Talk about someone who can read their customer! Pop in for a visit.. you’ll know what I mean. Thanks for a 5 star meal with 5 star service!

Address: 73 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4J7 Canada
Review: Best fish and chips!! Fresh, crispy and delicious!! Notable mention to Phil (thanks for recommending the cod) for your service and hospitality. If you’re looking for quality food and great people - look no further! :)

Address: 73 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4J7 Canada
Review: Fabulous seafood in a cozy atmosphere. Jay and Phil took great care of me when I needed to step in out of the drizzle. The seafood chowder was outstanding and the mussels, incredible! A definite keeper, thank you!

Address: 73 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4J7 Canada
Review:
The food was on point and so tasty. The atmosphere was so welcoming and friendly. It makes me sad that I don't live there so I could make it my regular place.

If you are visiting for the Canada Games, make sure you visit before leaving.

Address: 123 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review:
Went there based on the reviews. Regretfully, it was a disappointment.

Not much flavor in the broth, very weak and watery. Bland noodles. Hearing microwave oven when waiting for your food at a restaurant is never a good sign. But here we are.

Not sure if I went there at a wrong time or the place is past it’s prime. Reviews more recent than mine will tell.

Address: 123 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: I approve this place! Food was great! Large portions and very yummy! I'll be back! 😊

Address: 123 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review:
Oh my god this was good.

I am from Vietnam and I can say that this was one of the closest to an authentic taste that I have here in PEI. Had the vermicelli with grilled pork and it was one of the best I ever had.

The owner was nice, I came in, order the food and came out hot, crispy. Ate a bite, and now coming back again for another bowl

If you want some good Vietnamese food, this is the place 🤤

Bonus point for the price being very affordable!

Address: 123 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: Honestly, not much expectation on this Viet restaurant at the beginning, but it gave me a good surprise. It is not the excellent one when compare to the good one in Toronto, but it definitely above average. Service also good. When you consider try Pho, this could be a nice choice in PEI.

Address: 123 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: After a few days visiting PEI I was craving pho. we stumbled by this restaurant and I couldn't be happier. Fried chicken was delicious and the pho hit the spot!

Address: 73 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A8 Canada
Review: We've been coming for takeout for years....quality has nosedived tho.  Last time fried rice was dry, eggrolls were underdone, chicken balls were a little hard and spareribs were great.  Feels like they are making too much food and it is sitting too long.  Too bad....used to love this place.

Address: 73 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A8 Canada
Review: Went there  last summer. Sadly, first and last time visiting. They state on the restaurant that they serve both Chinese and Canadian food, we asked about the hamburger platter and the waitress told us it was meant for sharing so we ordered one for the two of us (the price also indicated it was bigger than the individual hamburger). Once it arrived, in actually consisted of the smallest hamburger I've ever been served and a lot of french fries. The meat was so overcooked it was hard. My husband ordered another burger and the quality of the meat was so bad it had hard chunks in it that were impossible to chew and it was also overcooked. We were disappointed because the food also took so long to arrive we were already too hundry and had no other option but to eat it, but that wasn't a pleasant experience at all so even though we were hungry, we didn't finish our meal.

Address: 73 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A8 Canada
Review:
The service was okay, and the egg rolls are great, but otherwise I was a bit disappointed, as the food items weren’t as fresh as they could have been.

One reviewer described it as “Canadian Chinese food” and I would agree.

I’ll be back for more of the egg rolls though, as they are fantastic.

Address: 73 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A8 Canada
Review:
Really good service. Comes here for typical Canadian Chinese food.
Got a combo plate. Chicken Balls and rice were pretty good. Rice was acceptable and the egg rolls were awesome. However the ribs tasted bland and I couldn't put my finger on why but seemed like they could have been reheated. Not sure but something was up with them!

Address: 73 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A8 Canada
Review: HORRIBLE SERVICE!! I have been eating here for atleast the past 10 years and I will never again!! I live in the country now amd spent easily $20 in gas yesterday not to mention time to drive there and home for simply chicken balls chicken 4 extra fried rice and 3 eggrolls and they only filled the chicken ball order, naturally I called back and explained and after 20 minutes on the phone they agreed to redo the order and for pick up the next day (today). Called in today to make sure the order was ready for pick up and they sent a single order and then expected me to drive back in to show my recipete once again to get it rite!! Food was awful  chicken was way chewy and rice not great  chin balls over done and the one egg roll we actually for was not cooked properly.

Address: 365 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N2 Canada
Review: Food was great.  The service is rated lower as it took over 15 minutes for order of burger and fries to be made.  Was not expecting that much delay for the meal.  There was plenty of staff but they seemed more focused on the drive through and the ice cream orders.

Address: 365 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N2 Canada
Review:
If it's after 10pm, and you're looking for somewhere to dine-in, don't go here; they might kick you out earlier than expected.

So anyways, before I headed out, I checked the store's hours on the website. Says 10am-Midnight basically. No separate hours section for dine-in versus drive thru like say Wendy's or McDonalds do on theirs. I take a walk down hoping it's accurate. Get there around 10:45pm. I glance at the door on my way in; no hours sign. Need to hope the site is accurate.

Cashier takes my order, asking me dine-in or take-out, no mention of the dining room closing soon. A few minutes later my food comes out, still no mention of the dining room closing soon.  At 11:05 one of the staff comes to my table and tells me the dining room closes at 11pm and I have 5 minutes. I was alone so I doubt it was an excuse for something like being noisy. Maybe the cleaning staff just wanted to leave early and went rogue without management's knowledge.

Either way, seems their stated hours are just a suggestion or something. If you're looking to relax but it's late, pick somewhere else or you might get badgered out the door here.

Address: 365 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N2 Canada
Review: Went there for lunch for a chicken salad… they give you 1 dressing for a side salad, then when you get a large salad double the size they still only give you ONE dressing.. went to ask for a second and was told I had to pay an extra dollar for a second dressing because THEY don’t give you enough dressing for a full salad and want you to pay for an extra dressing! They were rude, the service was horrible! We had to wait 20 mins for kids ice cream my 3 year old was having a meltdown and I’m sure they made me wait because I was upset about having to buy a second dressing and having to put a dollar on my credit card. I’ll be heading to Wendy’s cause they don’t charge extra for condiments they give you more then you need.. I was scared they were going to charge me for a refill of pop too. 🤦‍♀️

Address: 365 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N2 Canada
Review: I ordered the salad.  My friends ordered burgers after me and got their food before I did.  The salad was delivered without dressing.  Also they have a rule that you have to ask a worker to unlock the bathroom before you can use it.  Their ice cream is great, but I will not be ordering the salad in future.

Address: 365 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N2 Canada
Review: I just finished the $8 value meal deal and it was so good. The service I received at the drive-thru was spot on.

Address: 403 Capital Drive Charlottetown, PE C1E 1Z3 Canada
Review: Really tasty burgers and amazingly fresh cut fries. Came here twice and was very satisfied both times. First time we tried the fries with sea salt and that was great. The second time we tried zesty pepper and it was very flavorful but became way too salty. The staff members were nice and the place was clean. Would come here again 👌

Address: 403 Capital Drive Charlottetown, PE C1E 1Z3 Canada
Review: I have an allergy to gluten and dairy I told them about this. I ordered my wife’s food then mine. My wife gets the zesty fries (which we were told it contains gluten or dairy at our last visit) and the works put all the fries in with my gluten free burger. So I can’t eat any of it, they offered to make my food over but my wife had an appointment so I didn’t have time for that. It also cost 50 dollars for two burgers which I was unable to eat. The employees told my that we always put all the fries with the allergy bag (which is the first time they have ever done it). Each order should have its own bag. So last time I’ll be going back. Use to eat there a lot

Address: 403 Capital Drive Charlottetown, PE C1E 1Z3 Canada
Review:
best BURGERS & FRIES on the ISLAND.
We love to dine on the lime green picnic tables

Address: 403 Capital Drive Charlottetown, PE C1E 1Z3 Canada
Review:
It's a pretty good burger and spot, with lots of options for your meal.
I had a burger, fries and drink. It's pricy for a brown bagged meal- But I do believe the quality is there.

The fries are always in an "overflow" style, which makes you feel like you received more than you paid for. Very similar to Five Guys in that way.

I think for the price I'd like a more formidable bun, but it is good flavour wise.

Address: 403 Capital Drive Charlottetown, PE C1E 1Z3 Canada
Review: The food is really good quality for fast food. It is a little pricey compared to other fast food places, but you don't get sloppy burgers falling apart. Expect to wait, but you'll enjoy your food when you get it.

Address: 96 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review:
Definitely worth the visit! Tried China Garden for the first time tonight, despite living only two short blocks away from the restaurant for the past four years; we were two for dinner this evening and selected one of the Combination Dinners - the #2, dinner for 2 - along with an order of crispy wonton chips from the Appetizer menu.

The staff is awesome, they're so warm and friendly and make you feel welcomed from the minute you open the door; it was take-out service only this evening, which suited us just fine, but China Garden would definitely be a really great place to enjoy a dine-in meal.

The service is polite, courteous, and lightening fast; after placing my order I went for a short twenty minute walk around the block and by the time I returned to China Garden to pick up the order it was all packaged up and waiting for me!

The food is super fresh and the portions are generous, there was plenty for the two of us and enough leftovers for lunch tomorrow. There was plenty of plumb, sweet and sour, and soy sauces included; if you require napkins and utensils and things of the sort, just ask the staff and they'll be more than happy to try their best to accommodate you. The prices are very reasonable and you get great value for your money.

I believe someone said in their own review that China Garden is a great end-of-the-night spot and that's definitely true, China Garden reminds me of some of the best hot spots back home in Toronto that were considered a mandatory stop at the end of the night.

Special shout out to Gordie for his excellent customer service this evening!

Sincerely,
Jon

Address: 96 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: While the food was tasty for Canadian/maritime Chinese food, I would recommend confirming exactly what you are ordering. I ordered chow mein and chop suey and the only difference between the two was one had mushrooms. When I called back to ask if there was a mistake he told me that they are made basically the same. Like I said food was good but I don’t understand why they would have two options on their menu that are the same but under different names.

Address: 96 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review:
We ordered combo 2 for 2 today, It was amazing, best eggrolls I have ever have. Everything was perfect with lots of flavor and hot.

Eileen & Tommy

Address: 96 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: They left sign on. their sign states they close at 9pm, was there at 8:50pm to pick up food (store person had called 5 minutes prior, we confirmed we’d be there in 5 minutes. Got there at time confirmed.  the door was locked and open sign still on and no one answered the phones.

Address: 96 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: My new go to for my basic yummy Chinese food, only have take out but that's all I want. Always friendly.

Address: 700 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E3 Canada
Review: Even though they have an area outside they put us way outside in the grass. Nice but not quite. It was us having dinner or the mosquitoes?

Address: 700 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E3 Canada
Review: Went here this evening and had a one phenomenal experience. The staff were very attentive and exceptionally friendly. My food came very fast (I was there at 6 pm). Would absolutely recommend!

Address: 700 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E3 Canada
Review: The staff were all friendly and polite, and did their jobs well. The food was decent. Had the new macaroni and cheese. It was good, but not amazing. The portion was smaller than I expected, although certainly enough for a meal. Overall, it's good food, but I'd probably order something else next time.

Address: 700 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E3 Canada
Review: We went to celebrate the end of the school yr. Even though it was very busy. We were seated and served fast. Britney R. Was amazing! She was kind, whitty, and engaging with us. Great job!

Address: 700 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E3 Canada
Review: Our server Andy was great! He had a good rapport with the table and even though we waited a little longer for food and such his service made up for it.

Address: 25 Hopeton Road Stratford, PE C1B 1T6 Canada
Review: If u want Chinese food and I mean good Chinese food just forget about this place not worth your money or the drive there ....food was cold and terrible  , so was the service. Thumbs down , place should be shut down

Address: 25 Hopeton Road Stratford, PE C1B 1T6 Canada
Review:
This was my second time eating here, the first time I didn't have a great experience. Though after hearing so many positive reviews I wanted to give them another go.

The food was tasty, the portions were a good size, and the staff were a delight, and very friendly. The only issue I had was that they must use a significantly more salt or MSG then other Chinese restaurants that I've eaten at. All of us had mouths that felt like the Sahara desert an hour after eating, and we spent the evening drinking water.

To clarify, the last time I ate here, half the food was partially raw. There must have been a new cook in the kitchen at that time, or some kind of significant error. Thankfully there were no issues like that this time, and all the food was well cooked.

Address: 25 Hopeton Road Stratford, PE C1B 1T6 Canada
Review:
Very disappointing not really worth the 1 star.
Food was cold but even hot it still would not have been good.  Lacked  any flavor, if you have had good Chinese food before. Be aware! because when you order a dish it is not remotely like what you have had before.  Chicken fried rice, spot the chicken, ginger beef extremely small portion and filled with veg and non tasting beef! Sweet and sour chicken still trying to figure that one out!  I could continue but I think you get the point.
$98.00 wasted.             So disappointing.

Address: 25 Hopeton Road Stratford, PE C1B 1T6 Canada
Review: Prefab chinese, frozen Walmart type chicken balls and egg rolls. Not authentic at all. Frankly 🤢! And to top it all off we were shorted the pops that were supposed to go with the meal. Very disappointed but decided they could keep their pop, it wasn't worth returning.

Address: 25 Hopeton Road Stratford, PE C1B 1T6 Canada
Review: Not good, cheap food at expensive prices. Not worth it. Picture of a $20 order of lemon chicken 😧

Address: 685 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review: Peaceful environment..

Address: 685 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review: I'm not particularly pleased with the wait times here, which is often 15-20 minutes per order. I understand that they're busy, but they aren't jam-packed, so I can't possibly fathom why...

Address: 685 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review: I went at subway around 5:00 pm we order and they make it like they ignore their job they do not like . They just spending their time for talking and do not care about customer order how to make properly . When we receive ours order its mess up . Really manager need to look forward about their employees how they serve the customers how they doing the job

Address: 685 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review: Taken out and they usually mess up our order..  even with their new digital order system.. going down hill quick especially the subway on st peters rd.. honestly same as that kfc just down the road........ If I take a day off of cooking as I cook for hours a day all week and take a day off when need to get groceries I dont expect great but DEFINATELY expect better at our go to places.. tho do want to add even on off days they have great chicken compared to majority Mostly unsatisfied with service!!!!! and how they put it together especially with specific instructions 👎

Address: 685 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review:
Don't go in drive-thru! They will mess up your order. Third time in a row I have received something completely different than my order.
However, the staff is nice, and are great when you order inside.

Address: 101 Grafton Street Unit C Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K9 Canada
Review: I used to work above this place and for all of you who think i was lucky and got to smell fresh backed bread all day you are wrong it gets sickening after about 30 minutes.

Address: 101 Grafton Street Unit C Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K9 Canada
Review:
Best employee of the subway kash deep gill.
She is very helpful girl.🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥 give her 10 star out of 10

Address: 101 Grafton Street Unit C Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K9 Canada
Review: I was surprised that this Subway was up and running at 11 :00 a.m.  Everything was diced and ready for me.  I ate my brunch and caught the next bus in time.  Lovely was to spend a day.  Everything clicking together.

Address: 101 Grafton Street Unit C Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K9 Canada
Review: Saddest veggie sub ever. This picture was taken after I went back to ask for more toppings.

Address: 101 Grafton Street Unit C Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K9 Canada
Review: Good service, there’s always space to take a seat comfortably, the sandwiches are good, I would recommend to put a protein plant-based option so vegetarians could have a full nourishing meal

Address: 650 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 1E3 Canada
Review: Had a really good experience at the Charlottetown location, it had been a while. Despite the new app failing me, the drive-thru order went smooth. Got the food and smoothie very quickly, everything was correct and tasty.  Good job 👍

Address: 650 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 1E3 Canada
Review: The Place is warmth but the area where the condiments are place is not good..they should know how to clean the area.

Address: 650 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 1E3 Canada
Review: The food was fine. They got a small part of the order wrong. I don't care about that. But you get to the counter, the cash attendant does her thing and ignores you for a few minutes while she does something, appears to be drive thru orders, i dont know. Wouldn't hurt to clean the urinal every now and then either. Makes me wonder how clean the kitchen is.

Address: 650 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 1E3 Canada
Review: Used to be my favourite but I believe they have new owners, no more soul out into the food. Fries have really been getting colder every time I go. I miss the way it used to be, best burgers in town. Very very expensive.

Address: 650 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 1E3 Canada
Review: In a word discusting!! Health department should be notified about this place. Gross. Go in a look around the dining room see if you still want to eat there before you go through the drive through. Asked to speak to manager about the state of the dining room, was told their was none. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT EAT HERE, if they are willing to let the customers see that in the dining room and are ok with it imagine what is happening in the kitchen. Also staff don't seem to care when I asked them about it. If this is the best you can offer shut it down, to the owner-go into a new business venture, you are not worthy of serving food to people.

Address: 10643 - 123 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 1Z1 Canada
Review: Very impressive!! All of the food was wonderful, especially the duck breast. The duck was stunning—obviously top quality meat, with really nice spicing and a good crust. Elk carpaccio and the wood-fired bread were standouts. My server, Rob, was great—super friendly and had excellent recommendations.

Address: 10643 - 123 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 1Z1 Canada
Review: The restaurant itself was lovely, however we had issues with the food and service. I think I got food poisoning from the bison. I ordered the bison and was told that it is cooked at the perfect point between medium rare and medium. When the bison steak came out it was definitely blue-rare (picture below). I was so disappointed because I cannot stand raw or extremely rare meat and had only ordered this because I had been told it would be between medium rare and medium. My partner’s steak (also pictured) is medium rare for reference. Mine should have been cooked even a bit more than his. I tried a bite anyway to see if there was anyway that it could work; but it was so raw and bloody I just couldn’t stomach it. I told our server about the meat being too undercooked and it was clear she didn’t believe me and I had to stand my ground to be taken seriously. The whole interaction felt condescending, but she did take it back to the kitchen. When she brought it out again, it was *maybe* cooked to rare, but at this point I felt too bad to say anything and I didn’t want to be belittled by the server again. I ate as much as I could, leaving the rawest pieces behind, but I wish I hadn’t as I had an extremely upset stomach when I got home and woke up sick enough to call off of work. This is the first time I’ve been sick in months and it feels clearly related to eating raw/extremely undercooked bison from this restaurant. It’s also concerning because we looked at reviews for this restaurant when we got home and there are many 1 star reviews describing receiving extremely undercooked bison.. I don’t understand why such an expensive restaurant would provide undercooked and potentially dangerous meat?

Address: 10643 - 123 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 1Z1 Canada
Review: Truly a farm-to-table experience! The food and service were excellent each time we've been. In particular, the housemade butter and bread, the ribeye and denver steaks, the charcuterie board and the earl grey crème brûlée with lavender shortbread. Reservations are a must. Highly recommend Rge Rd for elevated Canadian fare!

Address: 10643 - 123 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 1Z1 Canada
Review: Finally, I was able to enjoy the fantastic place!! The atmosphere perfectly sets the stage for a very enjoyable time for just a quick bite and drink or a beautiful meal! Much of their fare is locally sourced, and the open access view of the kitchen helped enhance my appreciation for this place. The food is exquisite and only surpassed by the service!!

Address: 10643 - 123 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 1Z1 Canada
Review:
We did the 5 course tasting menu and it was the most amazing experience... great inventive food and the staff made it so special.
Great cocktails and mocktails

Address: 10132-100 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N8 Canada
Review: A wide array of unique hand-crafted cocktails coupled with a food menu that fires on all cylinders. One of the best experiences I’ve had in the downtown core. It’s really refreshing to see a restaurant dare to be different, and succeeding in creating something magical. I highly recommend Woodwork. Shout out to Dylan - the cocktail master extraordinaire!

Address: 10132-100 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N8 Canada
Review:
Woodwork is a wonderful stop on 100 Street in downtown Edmonton. It may be a bit of a lesser known haunt as it doesn't have direct access with parking out front. Typically I park around the corner on Rice Howard Way. However, it's a super dining experience offering up smaller plates for sharing and larger ones if you want to go it alone. It's more modern fusion and it's delicious.

The space is very inviting and cozy.  Beautiful stylings make this a very wonderful setting. And the service is always great.

5 x 🍲🍲🍲🍲🍲

Address: 10132-100 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N8 Canada
Review: Enjoyed dinner and desserts with two others June 17/23.  Our combined comments are that this was the best dinner we’ve ever had in a fine dining restaurant!  Quodo’s to Chef Rick and staff Saturday evening. When in Edmonton again we will be back. Thanks for a wonderful evening of fine food and drinks. See photo’s. Right photo the special that night. WOW!

Address: 10132-100 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N8 Canada
Review: Great cocktails and delicious food. Reservation definitely recommended on weekends. The butternut agnolotti was 5 stars for me. Service was exceptional.

Address: 10132-100 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N8 Canada
Review: Great service, drinks, and food. Such a cool vibe. The steaks were cooked perfectly and had such good flavor.

Address: 10544 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z7 Canada
Review:
Came here after searching Google for Edmonton Xiao Long Bao. I usually go to Shanghai 456 but I'm so glad I tried this place because in my experience, it's the best Shanghainese restaurant in Edmonton for FLAVOR.

There's only 1 person working so don't expect 5 star service. She was doing her best given the circumstances but man oh man the food is outstanding!

We ordered the braised beef noodle soup, dan dan noodles, pan fried bao and xiao long bao.

The dan dan noodles were average, not enough pork and Sichuan peppercorn flavor.

The pan fried bao and braised beef noodles though were amoung the best I've ever tried. The noodles were of perfect texture, chewy and complimented the rich complex beef broth perfectly.

This is a small restaurant so expect to wait for a table but I can assure you it's well worth the wait.

I highly recommend this place.

Address: 10544 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z7 Canada
Review: Probably one of my favourite places to eat in Edmonton. The food is always amazing and the best soup dumplings I've ever had. The spring onion noodles are so tasty as well. The baos are also delicious. I tried to take a photo but my boyfriend ate his whole order of dumplings immediately (they were that good). In the photo fried mushrooms, soup dumplings, spring onion noodles and dandan noodles

Address: 10544 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z7 Canada
Review:
Good food and affordable. Only tried beef Bisket noodles soup 5/5
Dumpling Soup 5/5
BaoBun classic 3.5/5 it was a bit dry.

But overall its great. Will definitely come back and will try other food on their menu.

Update!
Went back two to three times after the first visit. I found the best baobun sandwich is the one with fried  chicken. And still the pork dumpling soup and beef brisket noodles are consistently good. Tried the beef BaoBun it was alright.

Address: 10544 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z7 Canada
Review: Stopped in today specifically for soup dumplings and cucumber salad. The food was very good. We also had the pan fried dumplings and shrimp bao. Everything was good and we will definitely be back!

Address: 10544 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z7 Canada
Review:
The food is honestly amazing here.
The service needs a bit of tweaking.
The water jug wasn’t very clean and they gave us tiny spoons because the soup spoons were all dirty which is something that shouldn’t happen since Chinese soup spoons are dirt cheap to avoid this.
The food more than makes up for it.
We still highly recommend it.

Address: 103-10359 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9 Canada
Review: This place was awesome, I’ve wanted to try the food here for so long and I can’t believe I waited. Food was amazing if you’re into Asian fusion you’ll love this place. The baos were awesome and the Indonesian fried rice which is nasi goreng was delicious and actually had a kick to it which was nice. We had some drinks and they were great too. The ube had a subtle but ube flavor and it was my favorite. I will definitely be going back for more!

Address: 103-10359 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9 Canada
Review: This was the first restaurant we tried in Edmonton, Alberta. It was highly recommended by a travel blogger. Location was great- very near the hockey arena. It looks like a bar inside, but they have patio seating with umbrellas for shade. They have a big selection of different cocktails. We had a great server. Food was hit and miss. We ordered the Deviled Tea eggs- and they were very salty- not edible.  The calamari was expensive, but quite ordinary. Be careful with the seasonings on top because it made the dish salty as well. We were getting quite disappointed with the food  until we tasted the  stirf-ried bok choy. It was perfectly cooked with different kinds of mushrooms and garlic ginger, soy sauce. The stems of the bok choy remained crunchy – just the way I like it. We also ordered the Nori Ramen Bowl with shrimp. It was also delicious. It came with cucumber, corn, salsa, red onions, mushroom, and scallions. There was an option to add pork or shrimp or tofu for additional cost. The restaurant was pretty pricey. We spent almost C$100 for two people.  We didn’t order any drinks.

Address: 103-10359 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9 Canada
Review:
I cringe at seeing "Asian inspired". The food here is like food made from a cookbook that was written by a tourist who traveled to tourist- oriented eateries and then the "chef" here at Baijiu decided halfway through his cooking to NOT follow the recipe and cover up the lack of authentic flavor with too much salt and mayonnaise... I would have had less expectations if the food wasn't labeled Asian inspired - cuz it's nowhere close to Asian Food.

The chicken tasted like it was made from carnival food batter and the onion balls tasted like a mini donut recipe - not close at all to Asian Food. Overall, I found the food overly salty, covered in too much mayonnaise, and lack nuances of Asian cooking. The food here is basically pub food.

I would have rated this at 2 stars but our bartender was fantastic. We were in the private room with our own bar, so he didn't have all the ingredients to make the menu drinks (which is odd btw). He did, however, made me an Old Fashioned to suit my palate - not-so-sweet cinnamon syrup with mango and Makers Mark. It was super fantasticly delicious. The scotch he suggested was also on point. We had it with ice on the side. The bartender was super accommodating, friendly, and knowledgeable and if we had to, the only reason we would come back to Baijiu would be because of him.

Address: 103-10359 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9 Canada
Review: Had the speakeasy room for a group celebration and the experience was amazing. Alex our bartender made delicious drinks for us all. The dumpling nachos are very good.

Address: 103-10359 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9 Canada
Review: The vibe here is amazing, food is bangin, and the drinks are original and delicious! Walk in only (unless you have a big party), so if it's busy, prepare to wait a bit. Insta gold photos to be had, and there's a speak easy!🤫

Address: 11405 95 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5G 1L3 Canada
Review: Amazing locally owned restaurant that serves sausages that are made in-house! They have great selections of sausages/sides that compliment each other perfectly. Plenty of drink options and there are patio seating outside during a nice summer day! Definitely a great place to visit!

Address: 11405 95 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5G 1L3 Canada
Review: So glad we discovered this little gem.  First time here and definitely won’t be our last. Great selection of delicious in-house made sausages and sides.  Friendly service and fabulous food.  Highly recommend.

Address: 11405 95 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5G 1L3 Canada
Review:
I'll admit immediately that we didn't have food but we'll definitely be back. We showed up today and found the restaurant closed because of a private event. The owner, instead of simply sending us on our way, bought us drinks and chatted with us. The drinks (a local prickly pear Moscow mule and a blackberry lemon non alcoholic beer) were delicious but it was the real care the owner took to make sure we were comfortable that made this such a beautiful experience. We'd had a less than stellar afternoon up to this point and I can confidently say that Otto turned it around. The owner was even going to recommend another place to eat but we went to the Italian Centre for sandwiches. Excellent people skills and a true care for the customer.

A week later: we went back to eat and it was stellar. The schnitzel was perfectly cooked, the fries were crisp, and the Brussels sprouts that my partner initially turned up his nose at were so good that I had to fight him for every bite. Great non alcoholic beer selection and excellent service. You can see the people walking in being treated like friends and family. Will definitely come back and eat here again. Thank you, Ed and Natalia, for a lovely evening.

Address: 11405 95 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5G 1L3 Canada
Review: Friendly and helpful staff, and a cozy atmosphere! This neighborhood gem is one of my favorite places to go to for beer and a hearty meal. I especially love the Otto Sausage, pickles, brussel sprouts, and the fish and chips.

Address: 11405 95 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5G 1L3 Canada
Review: Neat spot! Really enjoyed the food and the drink selection. The fries with curry ketchup were extra extra tasty.

Address: 10228 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B8 Canada
Review:
Had very high expectations from the place in terms of culinary experience but it turned out to be mediocre..As a vegetarian we had very limited options..
Food was not balanced and was either completely bland or lacking salt which was not expected..
And the food had repeated ingredients and taste was exactly similar between different dishes because of that..We ordered Parmigiano soup which was good but than we Ordered their famous Ravioli and it had exact same soup as the sauce on Ravioli with very little modifications..
Food was tasting very fresh which was good sign but again not enough for their 5 star price point..
Cocktails different taste but were not balanced....The two drinks that we ordered one was over spicy and the other one overpowering peach soju...
Their bar has potential but dirnks were very average for 21$ price tag...
Moving on to ambiance place has a nice decor but its very congested as they tried to fit in as many table as possible in a small space..At this price point they should reduce the table capacity to half..
There was no walking space left once everyone had seated..
Overall an over priced experience for a average place..

Address: 10228 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B8 Canada
Review: The broccoli dish was fantastic! We also tried the beets which were great and the bass which neither of us would order again, we just didn't like the flavours. Don't expect to be full unless you spend a small fortune, the portions were not very big as it is a tapas place. The cocktails were great though and service was good.

Address: 10228 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B8 Canada
Review: Super service and a nice interior with some outdoor seating available. But what sets this place at the top of the rankings, is the food. Every dish was a hit and beautifully presented. Have you had Parisian gnocchi? Well..  not made with potatoes, it was light, fluffy and I wanted more! The dessert, a lemon posset, so easy to make, yet so delicate and light. A great way to finish a dinner, the addition of the mint was perfect. As for the cocktails... Excellent!

Address: 10228 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B8 Canada
Review: We had a very enjoyable dinner here!  Great ambiance, smaller restaurant with good service.  We brought our 14 month old daughter and she loved the meal too.
