The food was amazing - humble ingredients with good flavor and unique sauces!  We absolutely loved the gnocchi and roasted cauliflower.  Yum!  If you like sharing dishes with friends then this is the place to go.

Address: 10228 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B8 Canada
Review: We were recommended this place by a friend of mine. We walked in ans they opened and it was empty and they said they were full but could accomodate us at the bar. Both my partner and I found it excellent. The service was great, ambiance was calm and the food was delicious. The flavors were great. We had the soup to start… I believe it was a mushroom soup but can’t remember it was a couple weeks ago, the gnocchi and the chicken and we all loved it. Had no more room for dessert. We expected smaller portion so we ordered a lot but the portion were also very generous for the amount we paid. The soup was honestly to die for. Wish I had room for dessert! Will be back!

Address: 8216 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review:
Welcome to "MEAT," where carnivorous delights await in wondrous varieties! Prepare to embark on a mouthwatering journey as the meats, tender and juicy, are served family-style on rustic trays, encouraging mixing, matching, and sharing. With their range of four different dipping sauces, the combinations are limitless!

Indulge in the skillet-fresh cornbread, a delectable treat that complements the magnificently flavored and beautifully seasoned macaroni & cheese, a dream come true for every child. My grandchildren, enticed by the promise of this dish, willingly postponed their snacks!

The brisket, oh, the brisket—truly to die for! And the cherry-glazed ribs? Out of this world, a symphony of flavors that will leave you spellbound.

Set amidst an informal picnic table setting, it's an atmosphere of fun and kid-friendly charm. The service, truly amazing! Ask for Taylore, whose spectacular service and smiles add extra delight to the dining experience.

In sum, "Meat" is a carnivorous paradise, where the meats are delectable, and the flavors unparalleled. An experience that promises to tantalize taste buds and leave diners with a truly memorable feast of meaty marvels!

Address: 8216 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review:
The cornbread and mac and cheese were really good! Would probably come here just for the sides and peach tea to be honest.

The cherry chili ribs were good. Glad they give you both lean and fatty pieces of brisket. I thought I didn't like BBQ but it turns out I just didn't like bad BBQ.

I like how the bathrooms have a step and pull door so you don't have to get your hands dirty leaving or trying to do some paper towel tech.

Address: 8216 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review: Our first time at MEAT was amazing. Hard to pick a beer from their beverage menu because it is so big and everything sounds so good. The server offered us samples since we couldn't decide. She was very friendly and walked us through the whole menu with every detail. Food was great and "half portions" of a little bit of everything we ordered were BIG. Very impressed. Can't wait to come back.

Address: 8216 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review: Hmm where to start, the ribs was a little bit tough and the garlic fries where was garlic. The pulled pork sandwich was pretty good along with  burnt pork belly ends. What I must say the service was great and the food came out pretty quick. The location is excellent with an outdoor patio.

Address: 8216 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review: Great place for southern style smokehouse meal, recommended the beef brisket especially in the earlier service hours, super juicy, also recommend the garlic fries, self service homemade  bbq sauce and mustard  on the side, this place also have am extensive bourbon menu. Highly recommended for anyone to try. Slightly on the expensive side.

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: Brunch was fantastic! We had the brunch special (lobster roll with potatoes today) and the crab eggs benedict. The food came in delicious, filling portions. The staff was amazing. Welcoming, friendly, and helpful. Thanks to Bailey for your wonderful service and suggestions. And thanks to the back of house staff! We definitely will be back to try the rest of the menu!

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: I had supper with a friend at their new location and it was amazing. 10/10 great food, vibes and service. The food was amazing I got the Seared Rainbow Trout. The fish was perfectly cooked and had a crispy salty skin and I was pleasantly surprised at how good the pearled couscous was. It had a really good lemon butter and the cherry tomatoes in it made it taste very fresh and light. I think the pearled couscous carried the trout very well. The Beef Ragù was also very good. My friend ordered it and she enjoyed it a lot. The new location is much bigger but the decor and atmosphere still felt very intimate and cozy. Our server was also very kind and attentive. 10/10 would come back again.

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: Finally got to try Pip and I gotta say the food and drinks were exceptional! Great cocktails for good price, the even made me an off menu blood orange negroni. Seared manchego cheese is a must, order a few for the table for sure. I had the tagliatelle also was great, really fresh pasta! Pip is a small intimate spot, great for dates or catching up with friends. 10/10 would reccomend!

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: our first time here in Edmonton and this place was the most pleasant experience we could start our trip with:D . AMAZING food, everything tasted so awesome and fresh and what made this experience even more amazing was our sweet wonderful server, Stephanie. She made this experience 100/10 for us. Thank you so much! I would definitely come back here on the next trip!!!

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: Went here for a lovely Sunday brunch with some girlfriends. Our waitress, food, and the atmosphere were amazing! I personally had the classic eggs benny with yummy dill hollandaise. My friends had a cappuccino afterwards and said it was great. The only downside i experienced is they don't take reservations for brunch, so we had to wait about an hour for a group of 5, and they were a bit slow on food service. Cute venue with lots of awesome options!

Address: 10550 82 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
Was really looking forward to dining here but was left a little underwhelmed with a part of my order to be honest. The service was good, wait time was a bit lengthy.

Loved the salmon sandwich. Only had good salmon sandwiches like that in Vancouver but this was better (my one complaint would be it had too much sauce) Garlic fingers was decent as well, however my fish tacos were so runny and soggy, I could barely enjoy the meal. I asked the server and was told it's because the slaw was freshly made. Not sure if that's a good reason. The fries were also cold,  overly salty and overdone.

I'm hoping the quality was a one off thing and I'm planning to return to another location and I'll try some other menu items and hopefully it will be a better experience.  Overall not a bad experience but it really didn't meet all my expectations.

Address: 10550 82 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
Blowers & Grafton on Whyte Avenue offers a culinary journey to the East Coast, but my recent visit was a mixed bag. The initial impression was marred by a long wait for seating and a less than warm welcome from the staff which extended to when we were ordering our drinks.

A significant issue was the restaurant's lack of cheese, a staple ingredient that resulted in a surprising number of unavailable menu items, including their pizzas, and nachos. Their dessert doughnuts as well as their cauliflower dish were also unavailable for order amoungst who knows what other dishes may have been subject to this fate. This was a considerable inconvenience and quite frankly, a bit absurd for a restaurant of this caliber.

However, the Fisherman's Feast was a redeeming factor, offering a delightful taste of the sea. The mussels, on the other hand, were let down by a sauce that leaned towards the bitter and sour side.

The staff's attitude improved over the course of the evening, and the bartender's offer of a $20 gift certificate to compensate for the food issues was a commendable gesture. However, the explanation for the shortages - a bicycle race - seemed a poor excuse for a restaurant that should anticipate and prepare for such events.

In conclusion, while Blowers & Grafton has potential, my experience was inconsistent. With improved preparation and customer service, it could truly shine as a beacon of East Coast cuisine in Edmonton.

Address: 10550 82 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review: Absolutely amazing experience wonderful time spent here not only was it our first time but it was the best experience great waitresses great music chill vibes and some of the best cocktails my husband and I have ever tried and we booked a reservation for the future for our anniversary in a month! Loved our experience definitely recommend!!

Address: 10550 82 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
Blowers and Grafton offers a wide range of Halifax Street Food, amazing for brunch, lunch, and dinner. It has been one of my usual spots to catch-up with friends.

What we ordered:
- Garlic Fingers: Perfect choice for appetizer and sharing. It is pizza dough with garlic butter and a generous amount of mozzarella cheese dipped with their signature sauce. Once you have a bite, you cannot stop😬
- Hali Cheesesteak Sandwich: Speechless just look how stuffed it is💯
- Sausage and Bacon Hash Bowl: Available on brunch menu. A filling dish with loads of flavors

One of the best sellers here is the mini lobster rolls, definitely have it the next time I go

Happy hour is from 3PM-6PM and 9PM-Close everyday. Don’t forget to check out their daily specials.

From the classic Halifax Donair to the addictive Garlic Fingers, they have nailed every dish with authentic flavors and a modern twist⭐️

Address: 10550 82 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
Had a great time and delicious food. Has a nice selection of beer to choose from (east coast beer)
The TNT Brothers pepperoni was very spicy.  The hot chicken nachos we're also delicious.

Jordyn, our server was fabulous, and thanks to Scott for playing some easy coast music for us.
See you soon for one of the Friday night parties!!!

Address: 10807 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 4A7 Canada
Review: Came for dinner with a friend. Service is always great, never any complaints, however the food was mediocre. Paying $32 for chicken parmigiana, the breading to the chicken should not be soggy due to the large amount of sauce, which also made it hard to taste the mozzarella. For starters we ordered the Cesar salad and the maple sausage crostini. The meat on the crostini tasted heavily processed and the flavours of the maple and ricotta did not make sense to the palate. The bread was also extremely hard to bite. For dessert we got the tiramisu, which was a 5/5! Overall I found the quality of the food did not align with the price. The menu also seems a bit outdated. 3.5/5.

Address: 10807 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 4A7 Canada
Review:
After a very long time, went back for family dinner to this Gem of a restaurant. First the pleasing welcome we encountered from none other than the Owner. In spite of having full house, our reserved seats were kept, even though we were a bit late on our arrival. The service was quick, the hostess was very pleasant and on top of it Chris coming and checking it out frequently, shows the passion & dedication of this very successful Man.
Kudos to him.

Our family thoroughly enjoyed each and every spread of the night, left the restaurant with our heart & tummy full.

Address: 10807 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 4A7 Canada
Review:
We enjoyed our experience, the food was amazing try the Caesar salad! Lunch time the pastas were only $10 which was amazing. Our server Justine was super helpful and kind.

Highly recommend!

Address: 10807 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 4A7 Canada
Review: Cafe Amore Bistro is a family-run JEWEL! Visiting family in the area we called ahead to see if we needed a reservation and the gentleman on the phone informed us at the time no reservation was necessary but asked us what we needed and got a table ready for us (three adults, a 3yr old, and a baby). The Server Allyn was amazing, perfect balance of attentiveness without being pushy. The food was the best Italian I've had. Next time I'm in Edmonton Cafe Amore Bistro is on my list of "must stops". The portions are generous and the flavour mind-blowing.

Address: 10807 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 4A7 Canada
Review: This was my first visit to this bistro. The servers were very attentive. They apologized a few times because it took them a few minutes to take our order. Our water tumblers were filled multiple times. I ordered Chicken Parmigiana. I chose linguine for my pasta choice. I have no complaint about the quantity. The pasta was nice and hot but the chicken was quite cold - at about room temperature. The chicken breast was overwhelmed with tomato sauce. I could hardly taste the Parmesan cheese. Because of the quality of the food, I’m opting for three stars; actually, it should be 3.5 stars. With the price of the food, I hoped that they would offer some buns. Many other restaurants do. This is something the establishment should consider.

Address: 6509 112th Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5W 0P1 Canada
Review: Steamiest, warmest, most perfectly crusted baguette and tasty tapas' that I've ever had in a reasonably-priced, cute city ambiance. And I've lived in France! Edmonton is beating France out it's niche here. Staff caring and heartwarmingly chatty A must-visit for Edmonton, if you haven't already!

Address: 6509 112th Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5W 0P1 Canada
Review: Food is great, a bit pricey though, and the sizes are small. Service is great. The atmosphere is average, space is too tight and was cold inside. Overall mixed feelings about this place.

Address: 6509 112th Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5W 0P1 Canada
Review:
As soon as I crossed the threshold into Bodega I felt like I was immediately transported to Catalunya or Santiago, or maybe Paris or New York. The lighting, the decor, the music, the ambiance and the warm greeting at the door embraced me with a promise of a wonderful evening. The menu reads like a cornucopia of culinary sophistication, each item more tempting than the next. The wine list alone is enough reason to come here, and the cocktails are creative and tantalizing. This could very well be my new favourite go-to place in Edmonton.

Update: summertime!! I just discovered Bodega Highlands has a wonderful little patio out back. Also, I neglected to mention above that this place has an AWESOME patio out back!

Address: 6509 112th Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5W 0P1 Canada
Review:
Went for an early dinner after a walk in the River Valley.
No problem getting a table- it is a very cozy atmosphere.
The service and food was delicious as always.
Love the Salted Cod fritters and the piri piri prawns always good. First time trying the Mussels in the saffron cream sauce it was absolutely delicious and nice that they gave a nice amount of bread to help soak up the sauce. Also had the Mushroom risotto was very good, quite salty. Luckily, I'm a fan of salt.

Address: 6509 112th Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5W 0P1 Canada
Review: So glad I found this place! Amazing food such bliss! Everything is sharable and quick to eat the staff were so friendly. Got the calamari (ate too fast to photo), grilled octopus, mushroom risotto, pork belly and meat and cheese board! I'm coming back soon

Address: 14413 115 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 3B8 Canada
Review:
A great spot in the 'diner' tradition (open 0900-1400 Mon.-Fri.)  We two had breakfast on a Tues. At 10:30.  We were the only customers!  The diner is in a commercial area and caters to the lunch trade.  One of us had the standard sausage, eggs (3), panfries, toast, and coffee.  The other had the farmers 3 egg omlette (includes bacon & panfries inside) with toast and coffee.  The food and service were great, with large portions. The coffee was good.  More people came in as lunchtime approached.   We did chat with the owner a bit -  who previously cooked at a well-known local German restaurant (now sadly closed).  It shows - since schnitzel and goulash are also on the menu!

Note: Cash or Debit Cards only; no credit cards.

We highly recommend this restaurant for breakfast or lunch.  5 stars all round.

Address: 14413 115 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 3B8 Canada
Review: Always amazing food, friendly and quick service , and great value. The portions are big, and cooked to order. Rotating hot specials are like eating home cooked meals! The burgers are massive and the fries are cooked + seasoned really well. Love coming here whenever we get the chance. We also really appreciate the space is like a time capsule, and always feels so familiar and comfortable.

Address: 14413 115 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 3B8 Canada
Review:
2023-02-16
Homemade cooking from Lunchbox Diner! Highly recommend if you like east European cooking. Homemade apple pie is to die for!

Address: 14413 115 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 3B8 Canada
Review: Friendly service, good food, classic dinner environment. Highly recommended.

Address: 14413 115 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 3B8 Canada
Review:
*Hidden little gem*The price was very reasonable & the food portions were generous. The hamburger patty was so juicy and full of flavor every bite taken juice would drip down.
The daily special was very delicious every bite taken was filled with wonderful flavors. Worth going back to this place

Address: 12223 156 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5V 1E6 Canada
Review: It was pretty good. I liked the fish tacos, but did not like the tamales. It was fine, but there are so many Mexican restaurants in Edmonton that are outstanding, so I probably won't go out of my way to return to this one.

Address: 12223 156 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5V 1E6 Canada
Review:
I went to this place for lunch and I have to say, I was really excited about it. The place itself is really nice and clean, and the staff is friendly. We tried quite a few dishes, but unfortunately, some were really salty and others were just flavorless. The Jamaica water was good, but the horchata tasted like milk and the dessert didn't taste good at all. It felt like it was really old and it was way too expensive for such a small portion. We also tried a torta, which was okay. The elote was good, but it was also pretty expensive. Overall, I would give this place 3 stars. It's a nice place to go for a drink, but I wouldn't recommend it for lunch or supper.
Bulldog was the best ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Address: 12223 156 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5V 1E6 Canada
Review:
We absolutely loved our meals at El Mero Mero.
We attended their 1 year celebration and enjoyed the festivities.
We ordered so many different dishes that I can't remember it all LOL.
But the one that sticks out is the Mole Chicken and the chips and salsa.
Delicious delicious delicious 🤤🌮

Address: 12223 156 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5V 1E6 Canada
Review:
My wife and I recently decided to give El Mero Mero Taqueria a try since it was conveniently located nearby. We opted for the sampler, which allowed us to choose five different flavors of meat. Among them, the Al Pastor and Fish Tacos stood out as my personal favorites. The Elotes were pretty good but if you're used to Taber corn it'll be different from that sweet soft texture.

We visited this taqueria for lunch and my initial excitement was well-founded. The restaurant itself has a pleasant ambiance and is kept clean. The staff members were friendly, although slightly busy during our visit. It seemed like they were in the midst of preparing their lunch special or something similar.

While enjoying our meal, we also decided to try their churros. Unfortunately, the inside of the churros seemed slightly undercooked, as the batter was still chewy.

El Mero Mero Taqueria is a fantastic place to experience authentic tacos with a wide selection in Edmonton. The restaurant's environment is cool and unique, featuring art that adorns the ceilings and floors. Before finalizing my review, I would like to try a few more menu items to get a better sense of their overall offerings. Nevertheless, as a newcomer in town, it's definitely worth a visit.

Address: 12223 156 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5V 1E6 Canada
Review: This is our new favourite Mexican restaurant in YEG! The atmosphere was welcoming, relaxed and fun - really cool artwork on the walls.  The service was fantastic, our drinks were never empty and everything was quick! The best part, the food! We started with gauc and chips…definitely the best of both I’ve had - I could have left just eating that and been happy.  Also started with the queso funido with chorizo, which was also fantastic…the cheese pull was top notch! We split the birria tacos and the pescado - both had beautiful presentations and out of this world flavours! I do have to pick favourites…the birria.  I could have drank that broth! Super tender and so flavourful - you guys take the cake in the city for the best! They had really tempting dessert options, but we were already stuffed, so that will be visit #2.

Address: 9570 - 76th Avenue Edmonton, AB T6C 0K2 Canada
Review:
Good tasting food and kind service.
The beef tartare was tasty and the bread that came with it was amazing. The cucumber salad was also one of my favourites.

Address: 9570 - 76th Avenue Edmonton, AB T6C 0K2 Canada
Review: Biera serves fresh twists on classic dishes. I especially love the new brunch menu. We tried the English breakfast and the ambrosia French toast, and both were delicious. The atmosphere is lively and friendly.

Address: 9570 - 76th Avenue Edmonton, AB T6C 0K2 Canada
Review: Great service, friendly and knowledgeable staff. Nice selection of beers. The Zestyzee is a must if you enjoy Gemanic or Belgian based wheat beers. The food was mostly good. I would definitely recommend the beef Tartare. The house bread is sublime. Unfortunately, our steak was overcooked.

Address: 9570 - 76th Avenue Edmonton, AB T6C 0K2 Canada
Review: I understand that the food is locally sourced and a lot is made in house, but the high cost did not translate to the best quality and my experience was okay at best. We got the Yellowfin Tuna and Beef Tartare. Normally Been Tartare's texture isn't my favourite, but it was surprisingly good. The fish however, was not. Although I love raw fish, the taste combination was not good, especially for $23. We left hungry and not even satisfied by the food. The service was okay.

Address: 9570 - 76th Avenue Edmonton, AB T6C 0K2 Canada
Review:
Have been here a couple times now and it's absolutely amazing. The food is great, the drinks are outstanding and the service is even better.
Their steak tartare is a must have and now that they are open for brunch it'll be a a new weekend favorite for us.
Try the French toast if you have a sweet tooth, you won't be disappointed.

Address: 10132 104 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review:
The very freshest seafood in the city bar none.  Black Pearl is in a little hole in the wall on the vibrant 104 Street in Edmonton.  There are other restaurants in the city that can do up fancy dishes with sauces and with varying presentations. But for just fresh seafood on a plate, Black Pearl is head and shoulders above all other seafood establishments.  The food is extremely fresh and you can taste the quality.

The space is very hip.  It's very chic but also blends elements of an eatery you might find in the Maritimes. There are two floors to this space so don't let the small footprint from outside fool you.

The service is incredible. The servers are extremely helpful and kind.

One note... The food is VERY EXPENSIVE. But you pay for what you get. And to be privy to such incredible seafood on the prairies is very special warranting the prices.

Make sure you make a reservation!

5 x 🦞🦞🦞🦞🦞

Address: 10132 104 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review: Service was terrific, and so was the food.  A gentleman, who I assume was the manager, came through with some amazing wine recommendations as well as some future recommendations. We did the buck a shuck, which was a lot of fun at a great value. Also tried the Calamari and the Lobster Flatbread. Not my first time visiting and certainly not my last.

Address: 10132 104 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review:
Popped in for a quick it of Oysters during a busy week. In for a conference the menu seemed so interesting I wanted to see the place.

Dark woods and fascinating atmosphere, Black Pearl indeed! Really great service and as an Oyster fan I must say, expertly shucked and a unique offering of sides too.

Can’t wait to get deeper into that delicious menu upon next visit to town…

Address: 10132 104 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review: Amazing!  Food quality 💯 %, atmosphere/ambiance perfection.  HIGHLY recommend, already looking forward to going back and tasting more dishes from the menu - so many to choose from.  The Atlantic Salmon was en Pointe as were the Brussel sprouts!

Address: 10132 104 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review:
The realistic sea decorated ambience with a subdued lightning, resembling candle light creates a relaxed and transporting atmosphere. The place has an adventurous and collectionist vibe proper of a pirate, it's simply fun just to be there. One can appreciate the amount of detail and care to create such timely scene yet they've also managed to make it look modern.
The place has a second floor for big reservations or special events, it gives them a lot of privacy.

Our waiter Tony did an amazing job creating cocktails for us upon request (non alcoholic) and he made us have a wonderful dinner experience all throughout. He noticed we were checking out the decorations and took the time to share with us the place is actually decorated with real ship items and ornaments. He was so nice and patient with us.

We had octopus, oysters, tea and crème brûlèe. They were beyond incredible and beautifully served.

I would totally recommend. I hope Tony and the chefs are appreciated amongst the staff as they were amazing.

Thank-you!

Address: 10406 Mayfield Road Edmonton, AB T5P 4P4 Canada
Review:
Stopped in before a Ball Hockey game as they have Happy Hour. Enjoyed a drink with a teammate before our game and some appetizers. We ordered their Sweet Potato Fries and Feftedakia (meatballs). Both were really good and I loved the Fetedakia!
Hope to invite more teammates for Happy Hour before a few of our games next season.

Address: 10406 Mayfield Road Edmonton, AB T5P 4P4 Canada
Review: A group of us met for lunch this week and I was impressed. A bit of a throwback menu and appearance but that's not why you go. Out of 7 of us, 6 had the smoked meat sandwich. I was the only one that changed it up a bit and had the club roll. The smoked meat guys all loved their choice but they also all wanted to see what was in my sandwich. Roast beef, smoked meat, turkey and salami. Best sandwich I've ever had. The service was great. The beer selection is a bit limited but it was a great price and a true pint in a nice big chilled beer glass. Definitely going back.

Address: 10406 Mayfield Road Edmonton, AB T5P 4P4 Canada
Review: GREAT experience! High piled Smoked Meat on warm, soft rye bread with nice, hot mustard - FANTASTIC! Jamie (who is now one of the greatest servers ever) did an absolutely phenomenal job, service was fast, made sure our food was hot - and when something wasn't "just so" for me - she made a point of rectifying the issue without me even having to ask! BAM! If you like Smoked Meat and great service - go to the Refinery Grill, and ask for Jamie. You won't be disappointed with either.

Address: 10406 Mayfield Road Edmonton, AB T5P 4P4 Canada
Review:
Three of us met for brunch at Refinery Grill and we were all most impressed! The restaurant is quite nice & clean and the service was excellent! The food was delicious and the coffee was topped up frequently!
We will be back and I highly recommend to anyone looking for a great atmosphere & meal!

Address: 10406 Mayfield Road Edmonton, AB T5P 4P4 Canada
Review: Beautiful little restaurant. Our server was very friendly and helpful. I ordered the western omelette with rye toast. Aside from one burnt piece of potato the dish was cooked perfectly and well plated. The atmosphere is welcoming and enjoyable. Overall an excellent breakfast for the right price.

Address: 9910 109th Street Edmonton, AB T5K 1H5 Canada
Review: This place has amazing service, super nice servers, and a really cool vibe! Lots of drinks on the menu, and the wings were great! 4 stars because the patio is quite noisy with the cars right next to it (also warning, LOTS of mosquitoes at night) and it’s hard to converse inside because the music is super loud.

Address: 9910 109th Street Edmonton, AB T5K 1H5 Canada
Review: This place has a very awesome atmosphere!! Romantic, relaxing and friendly!  The food is absolutely delicious!!! The only reason for losing a star is because what i wanted to order off the menu was discontinued!!! The crab cakes!  That’s ok the tacos and truffle potato cannelloni were superb.  Definitely a unique taste and experience and well worth the money.  The staff are super friendly and do go above and beyond!  Our waitress was super informative about the menu and was so great!!! The happy hour prices are amazing… Tuesday to Friday… 3:00 to 6:00 so worth it.  Food and beverage!!!

Address: 9910 109th Street Edmonton, AB T5K 1H5 Canada
Review: This is one of the best restaurants in Edmonton. I had the Stroganof and it was amazing. I will definitely be back again and whenever friends from out of town come to visit I will bring them here. I can't wait to go back again!

Address: 9910 109th Street Edmonton, AB T5K 1H5 Canada
Review: The Common offered a great patio experience! The interior of the restaurant seems super cool though! I ordered the prairie fish and chips and it was outstanding! fries were salted to perfection and crispy! The fish had a tasty batter and was tender with a crispy outside! Food came out extremely fast and s/o to our server who great and friendly!

Address: 9910 109th Street Edmonton, AB T5K 1H5 Canada
Review:
This was my second time eating here. The first time, the food was mind blowingly delicious but this second time we came the food was sub par, I had a burger and my girlfriend had a chicken sandwich. The burger wasn't anything special and the meat seems to be cooked weird and my girlfriend's sandwich wasn't the best.

However, we did order the charcuterie board which was really good and came with what I think was a dill cream cheese? I'd definitely order it again. We also ordered old fashioned which was decent as well.

Service was good and the staff was incredibly friendly, we will come back and try it again soon.

Address: 8115-104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E4 Canada
Review: Overall A Good Korean Restaurant in the neighbourhood. Service is great. The restaurant is small and neat. A Great place to eat on Whyte. The kimbap is sublime, bulgogi is delicious. Also, ask for tea, and was served Roasted Corn Tea. Something different but good.

Address: 8115-104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E4 Canada
Review: Probably the best place to eat on Whyte. The kimbap is sublime, bulgogi is delicious (you must get the ssam with it). They have a mushroom japchae that is really tasty too (and vegetarian). Also, ask for tea, I don’t know what the tea is but it is the best tea and I haven’t found it anywhere else.

Address: 8115-104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E4 Canada
Review:
Excellent service!
The staff are very friendly and approachable.
a little bit pricey, but hey! the food tastes delicious, I would say that what we paid for was worth it.
We had bulgogi jangeol, pork bulgogi, and bibimbap.
we will definitely come back again😍
.
.
And so we went back and tried different dishes today: budae jiggae, spicy o Sam, and kimchi bokumbap. Everything's delicious.😊

Address: 8115-104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E4 Canada
Review: First time dining here. Food was excellent. Great staff. Loved the continuous movie playing - no sound so doesn't impact your meal. We'll be back next time we're in Edmonton.

Address: 8115-104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E4 Canada
Review: Seafood pancake was very crispy though 파가 너무 많아요… Butter Bulgogi Deopbap was delicious because the beef and butter created a great combination. Servers were very nice and we had more 반찬 (kimchi and Daikon can be refilled). Worth a try!

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
Incredible food! I had the Nuevo burrito. Wasnt a hand held which took me by surprise but the flavour was incredible. I can honestly say this was one of the best meals of my life. The flavour combination was perfectly balanced! The menu and selection is not only organic and has lots of vegan options but is also really good. Made it hard to choose what to eat.
Highly recommend!
Great price for the quality you get, the proportions are perfect. Musics good here to. Staff was incredible too.

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
This review is based off a visit on 05/03/2023 and again on 05/04/2023. (Also, it was brought to my attention I posted this review for the wrong OEB location. How lucky for Edmontonians that you have THREE OEBs to choose from!)

I live in Toronto, and unless you're willing to stand in line for HOURS on a weekend (or manage to go on a weekday), you cannot get into the OEB in Liberty Village. So believe me when I tell you I was thrilled to discover an OEB in Edmonton during a recent visit.

My experience was so good on visit number one, we visited again the very next day.

First of all, the restaurant styling and theme is impeccable. Truly a gorgeous space with a clearly defined brand identity.

Second, the service is amazing. On both occasions, we were greeted and seated promptly, and our servers on each visit were bubbly, friendly, knowledgable about the menu, and attentive without being overbearing.

I'm normally a "sweets for breakfast" kind of person, but I couldn't resist the idea of a breakfast carbonara. I was not disappointed with my choice. The gnocchi was perfectly plush, surrounded by hearty chunks of bacon, and topped with a gorgeously orange fresh egg yolk. Every bite was perfection, and I could have eaten three more servings.

On visit two, I reverted back to my old habits and ordered the French toast trifle. Another delicious choice, featuring two slices of thick brioche, topped with a tart lemon curd, fresh strawberries, and toasted meringues. No need to add syrup!

The only downside of my visit to OEB is that we didn't have time in our trip's schedule to visit a third time.

Overall:

Pros:
- Gorgeous and quaint restaurant with amazing decor and design choices
- Incredibly friendly and helpful staff
- Wide variety of choices from savoury to sweet to please all taste buds
- Fresh ingredients combined in creative ways

Cons:
- Paid street or parkade parking only

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review: First time going.  Was not disappointed at all!  We are from out of town and the reviews kept popping up every time we were searching for best places to eat in Edmonton.  We have been trying to come a number of times. We ended up going to the city centre Kelly ramsay in Edmonton. Food was absolutely stellar and on the healthy side for a breakfast place.  Service was quick and top knotch.  All the servers helped each other out.  Justin and Sydney were excellent.  All the staff were happy, positive, smiling and personable.  They kept us topped up with everything.  They use Umbria coffee roasters which is of superb quality.  And we are fairly picky with our food.  We almost always won't post negative reviews but will only post the best of the best! Thank you OEB staff.  We will be back. Our new go to breakfast place in the city

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review: Ambiance and service were great. My blue crab benny was really good, but it was quite fishy tasting, so beware if you don't like strong fishy flavors. It's a bit too much for me personally. Would definitely go back to try other items on the menu.

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
AVOID.

Visiting Edmonton and spotted the reviews for this location so took a chance.

Party of two, we were greeted well as a walk in and promptly seated. The location was busy for a Saturday morning as to be expected and was well lit with refreshing colours and seating. Staff was very kind and friendly.

The food however was mediocre to gross. My partner ordered the ham with eggs, sourdough bread and potatoe wedges which came as ordered and was a typical ham and egg breakfast though at an elevated price. So it goes.

For myself I ordered the "Gold Digga" breakfast poutine which is made up of poached eggs, herb potatoes, Saint Cyrille curds, Berkshire roast pork, black truffles and brown butter hollandaise. To the staff's credit, I asked for my eggs soft and they confirmed that they would be runny. What I was not expecting once the meal arrived was firstly the smaller portion size and secondly that the mix of the egg yolks, whites, hollandaise sauce, oils and cheese would leave the bottom half of the bowl a symphonic mess of a soggy herb potatoe soup. This was contrasted with the overcooked Berkshire roast pork which more closely resembled last night's overcooked leftover steak cubed and refried for the next-day patron's. The seasoning was present but immediately overwhelmed by the soggy potatoe soup to be rendered pointless and the truffles were simply absent. All together the dish is worthy of a spot on Gordan Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares and were it not for having spent time in the Army eating whatever we were told to eat, I'm sure I would have rejected this out of hand.

Regardless, the location was clean and the staff were great. Maybe we'll return in the future but I simply cannot recommend these "breakfast poutines" which appear to be constructed without care or attention to detail.

1 star for the breakfast poutine mess +1 star because the cooks knew how to cook the ham and eggs served to my partner along with the good staff and atmosphere.

Address: 10349 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review: One of my favourite places in Edmonton. The food and cocktails are delicious, and the service is top notch. It does get busy so I recommend you reserve a table in advance, and then prepare to have a blast!

Address: 10349 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review:
*Food*

Wagyu Beef Carpaccio (10/10): an explosion of flavors. Fresh, juicy, and super delicious, this plate is their best appetizer. The meat melts in your mouth. Fold it and put it on the fresh bread they serve to have a must-try bite. It's so good!

Ricotta Gnudi (10/10): the Basil Pesto Genovese is made to perfection. It is soft and buttery. The ingredients are so fresh and the quality is simply top of the line. The addition of Roasted Pine Nuts and Arugula is marvelous.

Agnolotti (10/10): It's so creamy and tasty. The truffle makes it super tasty. One of my favorite dishes. The portion is a bit small, but the taste is just amazing. I love it!

Chocolate Budino (10/10): A dense, soft, thin top crust, excuisit piece of brownie. I usually don't like super chocolaty desserts, but this changed my mind. It's so fulfilling that you want to just indulge in it. It's their number one dessert.

*Service*

The staff is super friendly and helpful. The food came fast and fresh.

*Atmosphere*

The place is a bit cosy. Nevertheless, it's a perfect choice for a date, casual meeting, and/or business meeting. The ambiance is somehow calming. I love it!

Address: 10349 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review: Tasty little restaurant! The elegant atmosphere and amazing level of services support the great selection of food and alcohol. I loved their chared lettuce and olive cakes. Other menu we tried were gnocchi and arancini, and both of them were also pretty good. We also tried one of their daily specials, which was also amazing, but I don't remember the name of it, unfortunately. Highly recommend!

Address: 10349 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review:
***An Edmonton Must***. Probably the best Italian restaurant in Edmonton. Food was outstanding and they have a good collection of alcoholic drinks.
I ordered their full course meal.
- Their bread with duck fat and Ricotta cheese was mind-blowingly delicious. In my opinion a little too rich for an appetizer.
- Salad: Fresh, colorful and offered a variety of different textures. Very very light.
- Pastas: Fluffy gnocchi that was accompanied by a savory and earthy black truffle sauce. Was slightly disappointed with the texture of the meat balls and the overall flavor of their tomato sauce. The pastas were all somewhat salty (even for someone who likes their food salty).
- Fish: Grilled to perfection. Fresh, juicy, flaky and had a slight hint of smoke.

Address: 10349 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review: I recommend you order the Chef's menu.  A fantastic tour of the menu.  It's beautiful!

Address: 10922 88 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0Z1 Canada
Review: I had the chicken and waffles which was okay. Generous portion of chicken. The waffles were very sweet and crumbly. There was little watermelon salsa on top which was a bit disappointing. Also, the topping was not true ‘maple butter’ which was confusing. The cinnamon buns were very tasty!

Address: 10922 88 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0Z1 Canada
Review: Great brunch fare but lacking a tad in variety especially in healthier options. A local favourite that often requires a lengthy wait before being seated (does not take reservations). The breakfast sandwich is excellent and the pulled pork with hash and poached eggs receives great reviews whenever we stop by with friends.

Address: 10922 88 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0Z1 Canada
Review: My friends and I arrived early so there wasnt much of a wait. Our server was very friendly. We all ordered different meals so we could try everything. I ordered chicken and waffles and they were okay. Nothing special. It was a nice cute place for breakfast. The servings are pretty generous. We were pretty full after and we had to take out some of it.

Address: 10922 88 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0Z1 Canada
Review:
The Sugarbowl used to be lined up out the door with long lineups for breakfast or brunch. It's a legendary iconic spot in Edmonton that has stood the test of time. However, with so many new more innovative offerings in town, this spot is starting to age a little.

The rustic space is still quaint and has a great university vibe. The servers are amazingly positive and upbeat.

The food is good. It's no longer on par with the industry that is moving so much further forward in breakfast dining.  The chicken & waffles and the benny are decent.  However...good news...they still have the giant cinnamon roll on the menu that can serve a whole family.

4 x 🍳🍳🍳🍳

Address: 10922 88 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0Z1 Canada
Review:
The food at Sugarbowl is exceptional. I like to sample different restaurants in town. I am fond of their Chili and corn bread.
Service is great and food quality is top notch.

Address: 9707 110 St NW Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9 Canada
Review: We were treated very special for our anniversary dinner! Our server, Matt, knew when and when not to come by our table. They locally source most of their menu items! Beef tartare on sourdough and ahi tuna to start. Flavour explosions. They accommodated us by putting the avocado on the side for allergy reasons. We had the caviar plate next. Wow! Sustainably sourced and so delicious! Main courses were lamb and salmon with a side of pork belly. The salmon with the dill sauce paired perfectly and the rice side was such a great combo of citrus, tomato and leek. The lamb with meatballs was so tender with an incredible tomato jam that I have never tasted before! I need to buy that! The pork belly was cooked so well. Crisp and tender at the same time. For dessert, the vanilla panna cotta was a nice light finish. The chocolate cake was a bit harder than we expected while the mousse on top was a delicious crusted caramel. And we took home two macaroons! We had wines to go with every course and were not disappointed in choices recommended by Matt. Chef Scott came at the end to say hello and congratulate us on our anniversary. We had a nice chat learning about the restaurant. What a great fine dining experience! Highly recommended!

Address: 9707 110 St NW Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9 Canada
Review: I had the best brunch of my life here when they first opened, and had always wanted to go back. The menu changes often (perhaps seasonally), and I was very happy to see they finally added their prices to the online menu. They also stopped charging a $10 fee for reservations. If that’s prevented you from visiting, as it has for me, now is the time! The dinner is incredible. I savoured every bite. The beef was cooked to perfection and just melted in my mouth. The dessert was equally as incredible. One shareable, two mains, two desserts, and two non alcoholic bevies was $145 before tip. Highly recommend, and of course it’s a stunning view of the legislature and river valley.

Address: 9707 110 St NW Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9 Canada
Review: The best place for a fine dining. I had a wonderful experience and got a extraordinary service. Love the oysters and beefs!

Address: 9707 110 St NW Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9 Canada
Review:
The food here isn't anything special, I didnt taste it and say wow. Tiniest portions ever!! For how much I paid and how small amount of food I got, it should have been at least better than I can make at home.

I never order dessert, but I did at this place because I was still hungry after eating 2 strips of steak and 4 tablespoons of mashed potatoes. The dessert was straight up bad. Mousse on top of a "brownie" hockey puck. Sprinkled with a heinous amount of hard caramel pieces.

The mojito was good, the service not bad. Don't waste your time or money if you are considering this place to eat out.

Address: 9707 110 St NW Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9 Canada
Review:
My partner and I had absolutely great experience at Butternut tree from the start to finish. Phenomenal dining experience from service to the food. The tasting menu is seasonal and changes based upon the availability of local produce/protein.

Definitely will be coming back to enjoy another tasting menu. Also on a side note, you can order regular tasting menu and vegetable tasting menu together (not one over the other).

I also appreciated the attention to detail on the presentation of the food. They also use local ceramic dinnerware, which looked amazing.

Address: 10220 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 4A1 Canada
Review:
The seafood here is amazing! Everything we ordered was fantastic. Although they specialize in Portuguese cuisine, the Spanish fare here was amazing. They even have jamon Iberico bellota and Galician octopus!

The service left nothing to be desired. Our server was very prompt and she was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and provided excellent recommendations. A real pleasure to have her as our server.

Address: 10220 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 4A1 Canada
Review:
The restaurant is beautiful, the wait staff is attentive, there's multiple dining options ( tapas, on a limited menu) and sabor with a full menu. To start the bread and cheeses are amazing. The braised boar cheek 10/10 couldn't have done it better.

But when it came up to catch of the day, it seemed rather uninspired no sauce, my wifes salmon was undercooked. i also wasn't a huge fan of the lobster risotto it just tastes of tomato sauce. The lobster was also overcooked. It was kind of gross, to be honest. It looked rather unappetizing on the plate as well. The catch of the day was salmon and halibut together.

It made me really wish i had whoever was in charge of red meats cooking my mains that night, haha.

Address: 10220 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 4A1 Canada
Review: Wow! What an evening to remember while having fun with family members! We had the best meal of the year! The waiter was very professionally dressed. He maitained his positive attitude to all customers he was serving.  If you need a place where you can have the best meal,  "visit SABOR Restraunt". If you need to be   treated like a valuable customer..."visit SABOR Restraunt."  Do not hesitate...

Address: 10220 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 4A1 Canada
Review: Oh my, haven't been this satisfied with a meal in a long time. Especially loved the octopus and clams. Will definitely go back or try one of their sister Bodegas!

Address: 10220 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 4A1 Canada
Review: Best restaurant i have ever eaten at. We got the seafood platter, so much incredible food. We are beyond satisfied and our server cory went above and beyond! Its was the best dinning experience in my life!

Address: 12832 137 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 4Y8 Canada
Review: I tried this place a while back and their food was delicious. This time I tried chicken Tajeen which was good but not great. The veggies on it are delicious tho. Portions are really big. Loved the appetizers. Tea wasn’t free as opposed to what other reviews are suggesting

Address: 12832 137 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 4Y8 Canada
Review:
We were recently in Edmonton exploring that city’s vibrant restaurant scene. We’re huge fans of North African and Eastern Mediterranean cuisine so The Bedouins was high on our list of places to visit. And we are so glad we did.

The food here is fabulous and priced very, very fairly. The vibe is casual and unpretentious, and the staff are friendly (even when they are run off their feet when it's busy).

We wanted to try lots of dishes so as usual we ordered far more food than we could eat at one sitting.

We ordered two appetizers: Batata Mbuttana (spiced, minced meat between two layers of fluffy mashed potato, breaded then fried), and; Buraik (think vegetarian deep fried spring roll). While the Buraik was very good, the Batata Mbuttana was outrageously delicious, especially when dipped in the creamy garlic sauce that accompanied the dish.

We were going to order the Mashweeya Dip (essentially a roasted veggie tapenade), and the Bedouin Lamb Soup, but our server informed us that small orders of each were included with our mains so we didn’t have to order separately. Very cool!

As for the mains, we ordered Chicken Tajeen and Lamb Haneeth. Both were outstanding.

The Tajeen was a half-chicken (and not a small bird either) that had clearly been marinated in a medley of spices then baked to perfection. It was served on a generous bed of perfectly cooked yellow rice. Delicious!

The Lamb Haneeth is advertised as roasted lamb in a mix of herbs, creating a dish “you have never seen or tasted before” - and they’re right. We love lamb and order it whenever the opportunity presents itself, so we’re picky. This was some of the best lamb dishes we’ve ever had. Complex, rich and layered flavours accent a generous portion of melt-in-your-mouth tender lamb. Seriously, if you like lamb this is a must-order dish.

As for the accompanying small plates, the lamb and pasta soup was a revelation, and the lentil soup was almost as good. And the small plate of Mashweeya Dip & Hummus (served with a scrumptious warm bread) was a creamy taste delight. Heck, even the simple green salads were served up with a very tasty herbed olive oil dressing - so good!

Oh, and if you like a nice strong black tea infused with fresh mint leaves order up a pot - it’s so delicious!

All this for $95 (tax and generous gratuity included). Great value considering the quality and the fact that our boxed leftovers provided breakfast and a light lunch the next day.

Highly recommended!

Address: 12832 137 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 4Y8 Canada
Review: Came for dinner and left satisfied. We ordered the combo dinner for our table of 5 adults. The lamb and chicken dishes accompanying the combo were delicious. More than enough food for us and to be honest most likely would have fed up to 6. In addition to the fantastic food was the great service of the staff. The staff was prompt and checked to make sure everything was satisfactory. They even found time to crack a joke and put a smile on everyone's faces. The atmosphere was relaxed and definitely a place I would recommend to have a nice homestyle meal. I will definitely be back!

Address: 12832 137 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 4Y8 Canada
Review: The staff were incredibly friendly and we were given so much food along with our meals! The bread was freshly made and so delicious and the soup that was given was perfect. I got the shawarma plate and it had a lot of food, I even had enough for a whole lunch the next day, but it was absolutely delicious. Turkish coffee is also worth a try!

Address: 12832 137 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 4Y8 Canada
Review:
This restaurant has a great atmosphere and very nice staff. They also have a private room for large parties.

The food was good and came out quickly. Service is probably the best part. Aziz was our waiter and he made sure we were all taken care of. He was very kind and nice.

Delicious bread and hummus. The meals are very large portions, most people in our party couldn't finish their meals.

Will definitely come back again!

Address: 11978 104 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0T3 Canada
Review:
Tokiwa Ramen meets local expectations & is a must for Ramen lovers or first-time eaters.

My friend suggested this location after I mentioned I was craving some Ramen.

WOW! This place was fantastic. I have to apologize for the photos, because the food looked so good I had to dig-in right away.

Fresh ingredients, awesome customer service, delicious broth. This place lives up to the expectations!

During rush hour, just be prepared to wait in line.

Check out Tokiwa Ramen if you're in Edmonton, you will not regret it!

Address: 11978 104 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0T3 Canada
Review: Been trying to come to this place so many times, either they ran out of soup or it was just a crazy line up! Finally made it and certainly worth it. Waited 20 minutes in line. We had the Tokyo Tonkotsu and the Black Garlic ramen. So delicious! That broth was so flavourful. Also had the Bou Gyoza... Nice and crispy crunch to it and a different texture than the traditional Gyoza. Wish there were more than 4 pieces cause I could have had that all to myself. Service was good, they were busy so things moved quickly. We got our drinks and food promptly. There was still even a line up after 2pm. Overall, great place, highly recommended!

Address: 11978 104 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0T3 Canada
Review: A great addition to Edmonton, honestly the best ramen I’ve ever eaten at a restaurant. There are a variety of toppings and great broth flavours to choose from, I have been many times and every time it has been delicious! Beautiful presentation, and great noodles too, I just can’t say enough! The staff are friendly, it is a very small dinning space but that just adds to its appeal. You walk in, and get sat right away unless it’s busy (then it’s usually still only 15mins wait), the menus are QR codes on all of the tables, and you get your food super quick after ordering so a great place for lunch if you don’t have too much time. Definitely a favourite place of mine to go to eat, would recommend to anyone who likes soups. Very spicy to non-spicy options, all taste delicious!

Address: 11978 104 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0T3 Canada
Review: Here on a weekday around 1pm. It was busy, 15-20min wait. There were signs and the staff directed as well when it comes to wait times. Service was quick. The only thing is we didn't get a chance to chat and stay longer given that it was continuously busy and the tables were so close to each other. It is worth the wait when it comes to their food. Delicious Ramen, for sure!

Address: 11978 104 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0T3 Canada
Review:
Overall, the noodles are good but soup seems lacking. Definitely had interesting topping choices, no bamboo shoots but shoyu black fungus. The bowls are full of taste but lacking "aroma."
Black garlic tonkotsu - shoyu tare is heavy on shiitake mushroom taste and umami, has a roasted flavor from the black garlic oil
Yuzu shio chicken - super strong yuzu taste from the oil on top, light clear broth but not as good as other yuzu shio chicken soup ramen that I have had.
Small chicken rice bowl - standard, a bit on the sweet-umami side from the sauce, generous amount of green onion garnish
The table condiments include pickled chili sauce/oil and rice vinegar

Address: 3739 99 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review:
Terrific sushi, very polite staff, the food is great. My waitress Amy is super helpful at explaining the various dishes and that's a huge help. She's very polite and always has a smile.

I have eaten here over 10 times and each has been a terrific experience.

Address: 3739 99 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review: Best Izakaya experience in Edmonton! It was my wife's birthday and they made us feel like family. Terry was phenomenal and the food was out of this world. Each of the dishes left us speechless. Highly recommended!

Address: 3739 99 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review: havent gone back here in years because our first visit didnt leave a mark back in 2018. Not sure if they changed the menu or the chefs but everything we ordered this time tasted great. The portions were justifiable. The prices were not too expensive considering the inflation these days. Loved the traditional decor and calm ambiance. It was a busy rush hour and we didnt have a reservation. We had to be at the bar but didnt mind it since there was only two of us. We got to see the chefs make the food in live time. Will definitely visit again

Address: 3739 99 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review:
Updated:  We went there again tonight and all the food still tastes amazing. My number one choice of Japanese restaurant/Izakaya.

We ordered a lot and all tastes great!  Staff were friendly and reminded us a lot about Japan.  Will definitely going again!

Address: 3739 99 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review: Great food and friendly staff.  Be sure to have their Sake Cesar drink.  One of the best tasting Cesar's that I've ever had.  Carbonara Udon is always my go to dish there.

Address: 10310-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 4X1 Canada
Review:
Joey never disappoints with their food.  Always of high quality and the menu is always fresh.

Downtown has a super vibe with the post work crowd raising the bar on the cool factor.

Our hostess was a little inauthentic.  Too put on.  But the service was service-able.

Address: 10310-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 4X1 Canada
Review:
Great food with reasonable pricing. Most likely going to have to pay for parking if you drive here as it's in the ice district and parking is hard to come by but great vibes for a dinner out with friends.
Our waitress seemed very inexperienced though and didn't remember parts of our order. Is affogato not something Joey offers? I asked for one and explained what it was to our waitress but she served it already poured and was cold when I received it. I also didn't get a spoon and our waitress left before I had time to notice and didn't come back for a long time. I ended up eating the ice cream with the chopsticks served at the table...... My friend ordered one after me and the espresso came out 5+ minutes after the ice cream was served (again without a spoon even though I specifically asked for one this time).
If you are unsure what a customer is asking for please ask a more experienced staff member or Google it OR just say we can't make it. That was so ridiculous and unprofessional to me and it seemed like the waitress just didn't care.
I do think Joey's is a good place though and would go back.... I'm assuming most staff members are more present and professional.

Address: 10310-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 4X1 Canada
Review: I’ve heard service here was great but that wasn’t the case when me and a couple of friends decided to go here for my birthday. We were served so poorly and not only it made us feel unwelcome and by the time our food came the pasta to their so called chicken parmigiana was hard. The food was unappetizing. The only good thing was this drink called “she pretty”, but Joeys was just another typical white restaurant with uninviting customer service.

Address: 10310-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 4X1 Canada
Review: It wasn’t very busy which was nice. Our waitress (I think her name was Dani) was super friendly and made sure everything was perfect, and the food was delicious. She definitely deserves kudos as I’ve never had a server who was as nice and who cared so much compared to most. Definitely would go back if I’m ever in the city again.

Address: 10310-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 4X1 Canada
Review: Wonderful location with amazing hostesses! Gina was in charge of our table and she did an excellent job taking care of our needs! I believe I had the Bombay Butter Chicken and wow!!! It was so good I ordered an extra rice bowl. I had to pair it up with their Kendall Jackson 'Avant' Chardonnay. Prolly one of the best meals I’ve had this year so far! Will definitely drop by again!!

Address: 10548A 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review: BEST NEW ORLEANS FOOD IVE EVER HAD. This place is a perfect 10. From the outside, it's not crazy flashy. It has a nice diner retro vibe, but the food is probably the best food I've had in a long time. I've had jambalaya before and I thought I didn't like it, until I came here. PORTIONS are huge and worth every penny, and the flavours are honestly amazing. Come eat here if you're reading this.

Address: 10548A 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review: What a great restaurant! Really charming decor and atmosphere. An old school diner done properly, right down to the two-person booths and diner counter. The food was great! Their poboys are known for a reason! The service was fantastic and despite it being very busy we weren't neglected at all. I will absolutely be returning.

Address: 10548A 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
I had been itching to try this place out for weeks and was finally given the opportunity.

Firstly, I would recommend making a reservation if it's the weekend, as it can get very busy.

We had ordered the crab cake po'boy and breakfast po'boy and they were both absolutely fantastic. The crab cakes had a fantastic flavor and good coating, the bread didn't get soggy at all, and the Andouille sausage was very flavorful in the breakfast po'boy.

The service was also great and all the servers were very kind. Overall, this was a 10/10 experience and I will absolutely be coming back the next opportunity I have

Address: 10548A 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review: Everything we've had here has always been amazing!! Hot wings and ribs are also 10/10.

Address: 10548A 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
Food was wonderful. Staff were friendly. It was a nice night so sat outside on the patio.
Only complaint was that when we sat outside (after checking in inside), we waited for about 10 minutes to even be acknowledged and have drink orders taken. Once we flagged someone down, the service was quite fast and very friendly.

Address: 10135 100 Street NW The Westin Edmonton Edmonton, AB T5J 0N7 Canada
Review:
Review only based on drink take out.

Walked downstairs to order a wine to go.
Wines only come in 5oz/ 8oz/ bottle (no half bottles)
Friendly server staff, even made sure I did not have any nut allergies and gave me warm nuts to go with my wine as I walked it up to my room myself.

Dining area seems beautiful and clean.

Address: 10135 100 Street NW The Westin Edmonton Edmonton, AB T5J 0N7 Canada
Review:
Generally provides consistent quality of food but missed the mark on my most recent visit. However, they were able to rectify the situation, and I was satisfied with the resolution. In terms of pricing, they're slightly more expensive than similar grade hotels. The staff are pleasant, and they don't bother you too much, so you can enjoy your food in peace.

It's definitely worth visiting if you're staying at the Westin, especially since the winter temperatures here are unreasonably cold.

Address: 10135 100 Street NW The Westin Edmonton Edmonton, AB T5J 0N7 Canada
Review: We had a reservation. No one was there to seat us so my wife and I sat ourselves after waiting a bit. We then waited 15-20 minutes and no one served us so we walked out. The waitress totally ignored us (and others there too) and it wasn’t busy. We were both well dressed as we were going to the theatre after.

Address: 10135 100 Street NW The Westin Edmonton Edmonton, AB T5J 0N7 Canada
Review:
Food is meh, prices were very high. This restaurant is also in the hotel lobby, the ambience isn’t good.
Food ordered: duck tagliatelle = bad (pasta and duck very over cooked, sauce very bland).  Mushroom flatbread, Burger = fine, I guess. Crab cake = good!

Address: 10135 100 Street NW The Westin Edmonton Edmonton, AB T5J 0N7 Canada
Review: I visited Share Restaurant (of the Westin Edmonton hotel) for dinner one evening. I ordered the salad with the goat cheese, tomatoes, salmon, etc. It was pretty good. The server was okay. Coworkers of mine ate breakfast here and said that the food was good but quite pricey (e.g., $20-30/person). There is a bar to order drinks and a handful of TVs to watch sports.

Address: 10013 101A Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 0C3 Canada
Review:
There was another restaurant near by that wouldn't let my women in because she had no ID, She's 42 but yeah, this place let's us in. Thats why I give 5 stars

I been here a few times. I really like the decor. Staff was very nice to me.

Address: 10013 101A Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 0C3 Canada
Review: The place’s open till 2 offering wide variety of beer options, the beers are local beers and they are amazing. We went for raspberry beer which tasted splendid. We ordered ribs , pasta & mac n cheese.

Address: 10013 101A Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 0C3 Canada
Review:
Craft Beer Market in Edmonton is a fantastic spot for craft beer lovers. The atmosphere is lively and energetic, making it a great place to hang out with friends and enjoy a good drink. The restaurant offers a wide selection of craft beers from local and international breweries, as well as a delicious menu of food that is perfect for sharing.

One of the things I love about Craft Beer Market is the knowledgeable and friendly staff. They are always happy to offer recommendations and help you find the perfect beer to suit your taste. Whether you're a seasoned beer connoisseur or just starting to explore the world of craft beer, the staff at Craft Beer Market will make sure you have a great experience.

The food at Craft Beer Market is also top-notch. The menu offers a range of appetizers, entrees, and desserts that are all made with fresh and high-quality ingredients. I particularly enjoyed the pretzel bites, which were served warm and accompanied by a delicious beer cheese dip.

Overall, I highly recommend Craft Beer Market in Edmonton for anyone who loves craft beer and good food. The atmosphere, selection of beer, and quality of food are all outstanding, and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Whether you're looking for a casual night out with friends or a special occasion, Craft Beer Market is definitely worth a visit.

Address: 10013 101A Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 0C3 Canada
Review: First time trying Craft.  Food and service was great.  Excellent atmosphere on rooftop patio.  Great experience.

Address: 10013 101A Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 0C3 Canada
Review: The vibe is more inspiring than the food. That said, the beer is plentiful and perfect. Lots of choice. Great place to watch a hockey game and explore some delicious local craft brews

Address: 10205 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 3X8 Canada
Review: Great food and reasonable prices. We saw everyone ordering Karaage Chicken but it wasn’t all that great, way larger pieces of chicken than I typically enjoy, but the pressed sushi was great. Definitely worth a visit. The only other knock I have is that when it gets really busy some of the tables are in some pretty high traffic areas. Not much that the restaurant can do about this but be wary if you were hoping for a quiet night out.

Address: 10205 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 3X8 Canada
Review:
Unique and different tasting Japanese cuisine.

I do not eat sushi but had a Japanese version of fettuccine where upon noodles where used, the cream sauce was out out of the world tasting.

My dinner companions indicated  not a true tradition place to eat "sushi".  They had extremely tasty sushi-kind of options to eat that were very good regardless.

Servers were excellent!

Address: 10205 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 3X8 Canada
Review:
The food was amazing! Definitely reccomend any of the pressed sushis, we ordered more of them after. The cabonara udon is interesting and very creamy. Had the lychee cocktail which was really nice!

The server was very friendly and knowledgeable, explaining any questions we had. It was my friend's birthday and they were gifted a little free dessert with a sparkler!

The ambiance is nice and cozy, the washrooms were also well kept. Will come again!

Address: 10205 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 3X8 Canada
Review:
This has to be the absolute smallest beef tetaki I have ever received... and I live in Vancouver. 🤦‍♀️

This is the land of beef and you serve a portion so small and charge $15 for it?!?!?

For shame...

The tomato kimchi  is decent but for the price... very disappointed.

2 items for $27 - one item is smaller than the phone I am typing this on... sad

Chopsticks in picture are for size comparison

Address: 10205 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 3X8 Canada
Review:
It was my 10th marriage anniversary yesterday.
Pros:Food was served so fast. Bluefin tuna really fresh.
Cons: Ramen is a little bit salty. Beef tataki very salty!  I don’t like it! Fried chicken is fine but don’t compare with the professional fried chicken restaurant.
We ordered Yuzu Cider and Tokyo, both tasted so so. Food is overpriced with less amount.

Address: 10004  90th Street Edmonton, AB T5H 4P4 Canada
Review: Located in cute historical building. The ambience inside was great. Also the outdoor space seating was wonderful. Made for a wonderful experience outdoors to relax & have breakfast. Service friendly as well. Happy they had vegan option as well for breakfast:). Hope they include more in the future. Great place to visit.

Address: 10004  90th Street Edmonton, AB T5H 4P4 Canada
Review:
🤩 so delicious! Peaceful surroundings in the middle of the city. They have tent and patio seating, as well as inside the building.

Cappuccino was great and the earl grey tea in the London fog was definitely a star. We had the breakfast sandwich with potatoes and pulled pork sandwich. Everything was delicious and home style. The buns were soft and flaky, paired really well with the fillings. 5/5 stars experience!

Address: 10004  90th Street Edmonton, AB T5H 4P4 Canada
Review: It was the best place in Edmonton for the eggs Benny. Unfortunately it's not anymore. Last couple of orders the eggs were overcooked, almost hard-boiled. So sad... But coffee is still good and the staff are friendly. It's a nice and cozy dog-friendly place, I really enjoy being here. Hope they can make that amazing yolk-running eggs again!

Address: 10004  90th Street Edmonton, AB T5H 4P4 Canada
Review: Amazing coffee and drinks! The vegan hash was soooooo yummy, definitely recommend. Really pretty, chill atmosphere. It was pretty busy but still got a good spot.

Address: 10004  90th Street Edmonton, AB T5H 4P4 Canada
Review: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Edmonton and easily one of my top 5 favorite restaurants. The food quality is fantastic, portions are great, and the staff are very friendly. It’s located in a quiet neighborhood which adds to its charm, but because of the location parking might be limited. Definitely check this place out if you’re ever in town.

Address: 2 Athabascan Avenue Unit 8 Sherwood Park, AB T8A 4E3 Canada
Review: A great spot for clean and tasty Mexican cuisine. Decor was clean and comfortable. Service was quick and friendly. Food portions were good and fresh. The flan was huge and tasty; desserts are a highlight here!

Address: 2 Athabascan Avenue Unit 8 Sherwood Park, AB T8A 4E3 Canada
Review: Nice place with great feel. We came in on Canada Day late afternoon so it was starting to get busy but not quite yet. They gave us a lot of time before starting to serve the appetizer. The nachos was so delicious though. It did not have any cheese on top, but was super flavourful. I do prefer it without cheese despite being a cheese lover because sometimes restaurants put too much cheese on top and ignoring other ingredients also bring flavours to this dish. We also had the Suadero (brisket) and Al Pastor (pork) taco. The brisket was a bit dry to my taste but the Al Pastor was both flavourful and refreshing because of the pineapple bits on top. I also personally liked the rice better than the bean paste as it again can be a bit dry on its own. Maybe I don’t know the proper way to eat it. Churros with whipped cream was also good. Overall a good experience and great food.

Address: 2 Athabascan Avenue Unit 8 Sherwood Park, AB T8A 4E3 Canada
Review: First time here!  It was highly recommended by friends.  We are glad we did. I had the pork tacos and my hubby had the brisket.  Both very delicious.  We also started with the homemade chips with guacamole and fresh salsa. Everything was very fresh and well seasoned. Our  server was very good and helpful with picking menu items. We tried the 3 milk cake. It tasted good but you have to like soggy cake. The custard dessert was tasty but it was quite firm . Not bad just not like a brule. We will be back to try new things

Address: 2 Athabascan Avenue Unit 8 Sherwood Park, AB T8A 4E3 Canada
Review: What a gem! Very fresh ingredients. The melted cheese in a skillet appetizer was super tasty. Fish tacos were fresh and delicious. Very friendly and inviting service. 5 stars for overall experience!

Address: 2 Athabascan Avenue Unit 8 Sherwood Park, AB T8A 4E3 Canada
Review: Really good experience! First-timer in this restaurant and absolutely thrilled to see tostadas on the menu. Full House that must mean the food's really good and people always come back. I arrived on Wednesday about 1230, it was only open for an hour and a half into place was packed. Recommended make reservations for dinner. The Horchata is delicious too!

Address: 10236 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review: This place is fabulous! The service was wonderful, the food is awesome, and the location is super accessible. 10/10 recommend the beef satay soup, which was a perfect balance of rich and aromatic. The appies we got were the salad rolls and papaya salad. Both had delightful nuances, crunchy salty tempura bits in the salad rolls, and beef jerky in the salad. The staff were lovely and speedy... this my be my new spot for Vietnamese💛

Address: 10236 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review:
XO Bistro Downtown is an amazing fusion Vietnamese experience. All of their dishes are very creatively done and extremely tasty.  You'll recognize many of the favorites you traditionally get at Vietnamese restaurants including the soups and rice/vermicelli dishes. Except they add that extra flair and the dishes are fresh and inventive.

The space is very gorgeous with a stunning bar and their trademark giant pink tree overhanging the space.

The service is very good as well.

4 x 🍜🍜🍜🍜

Address: 10236 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review: the restaurants and bathrooms are very clean! decor is incredibly cute and minimalist, tastefully done. fair warning the booths in the back aren’t well lit. some outside paid street parking that is a bit scarce. the playlist is “fire” (as per the fiancé), and the affogato desert is ENORMOUS with quality espresso. many vegan options and the chicken is AMAZING, so juicy and well cooked. Loved the chicken satay and the pink daiquiri drink is highly recommended!

Address: 10236 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review: Great place, good bang for buck. Staff were super friendly and helpful. Definitely glad to find this place, especially for a late night bite to eat.

Address: 10236 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review:
Exceptional food and location. Beautiful decor and grilled Meats. It was super hot when we went is the only reason why atmosphere would've been higher as it seemed their AC may not have been working.
Definitely worth checking out!

Address: 5842 111 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6H 3G1 Canada
Review:
One of the best places around, the glass monkey is a wonderful place to have dinner.
The staff are amasing and all hard working and polite. very kid friendly and i saw 4 tonight. The place is hidden around a corner with a visible banner out the front and a rotating sign out the very front of the mall. Love the place and have been there almost 10 times so far. Love the food. I usually order something from the feature menu or the burger. The potato skins were delicious and so was the seafood chowder.
Will continue to visit this place as it is close and a wonderful little gem of a restraunt.

Address: 5842 111 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6H 3G1 Canada
Review: I've known about this restaurant for ages would have never been. It's one of the best restaurants I've ever been too.  Great food, amazing atmosphere , and the best part, knowledge and 'non scripted' service.

Address: 5842 111 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6H 3G1 Canada
Review:
Kaitlin was superb and gave me awesome service.

One of the best patios Rob and Jennine are the most fantastic owners and always treat us like family.

Would always recommend and keep coming back.

Address: 5842 111 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6H 3G1 Canada
Review:
It's a cute restaurant in the neighborhood that the quality of food and nice services are guaranteed. It's got that unique local friendliness. All staff were super friendly and nice including those who answered our phone, who sat us and who served us. We were very happy about the menu our server Rick recommended and services he provided. I am pregnant and wanted to have some nice virgin cocktail other than mojito and he offered sangria that is substituted with pomegranate juice and oh boy it was delicious!!
Also, all the food we ordered were delicious. You must try their mushroom pizza. The taste of the fresh ingredients with a touch of truffle oil was great. The pate and halibut fish cake were also great.
They have a nicely set up patio that we want to try next time. We originally went there to sit in their patio but we decided to stay inside since the inside set up was also very romantic and came with more comfy chairs.

Address: 5842 111 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6H 3G1 Canada
Review:
