Great wine selection and super friendly staff. Great food. I ordered their lamb shank and it was so really good, lamb was juicy and had amazing flavors. Highly recommend this place.

Went there again on Wednesday and this time I had half price wings and ordered the Fish Entree. Totally enjoyed my food. Amazing experience. Staff is so friendly and polite makes you feel so welcomed at this place.

Address: 10704 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H1 Canada
Review:
Chill atmosphere. Great place to hang out on a warm day and have some great food and drinks.

Chicken was hot, crispy on the outside and moist inside.

The mac and cheese was amazing. Definitely understand why it won awards.

We went on a Wednesday which has $2 pieces of chicken.

Loved the experience. Will go again.

Address: 10704 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H1 Canada
Review: Amazing food! Amazing service! This was my first time at Northern Chicken and it did not disappoint. The chicken was the crispiest and tastiest I’ve ever had in my life! The Dorito Mac and Cheese was life changing and the smashed potatoes were unbelievably good! We had the buttermilk pie for desert and I can’t believe how delicious such a simple thing can be. Every moment of my visit was amazing. I can’t wait to go back! Don’t miss out on eating at this Gem of a place!

Address: 10704 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H1 Canada
Review: Came here for lunch, the chicken was super tender and juicy, and the smashed potato’s were awesome! If I had to point anything out it’d be the coleslaw isn’t anything special. Other than that I had a good meal here.

Address: 10704 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H1 Canada
Review: Great local spot! Huge, delicious portions. Local beer on tap and super friendly service. Have ordered take out and table service here; great service each time.

Address: 10704 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H1 Canada
Review:
Chef you’ve outdone yourself once again.  I said in my tweet I was bringing nothing but my appetite and credit card.  This wasn’t exactly correct.  I brought a buddy and introduced him to the best fried chicken North of Gus’s.  I’m happy to report that you have a new customer.

The chicken was as juicy and tender as ever but the coating was [insert chef’s kiss emoji here].  My appetite was more than satisfied and so was that of the other fried chicken lovers that I brought the extra 10 pieces home for.

Sorry about the photo…should have a made a proper one.

Address: 10586 100 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2R6 Canada
Review: I visited this restaurant first time. The food and service are good here. Staffs were nice. You have to mix your own recipe sauce to eat with hotpot. This place is one of the best hotpots I've ever been in the city. Just Combo is enough for you.

Address: 10586 100 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2R6 Canada
Review: The food and service are great here. Their late night menu is a great deal for a late night snack.

Address: 10586 100 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2R6 Canada
Review: This restaurant has changed from being a very crammed and humid place to a much better ventilated dining spot over the years. They have decent quality and and a nice selection of food. They also provide quite a bit for their lunch special and sometimes they offer dessert for free. However, there was an incident where a friend found a fly in her veggie (~2.5 years back). We're unsure if the fly didn't get wash out of the vegetable or if it flew into the soup...but they offered her a free lunch.

Address: 10586 100 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2R6 Canada
Review: Staff were nice and accommodating although they forgot to give us out some of our stuff. This place is one of the best hotpots I've ever been in the city. A little bit pricey but you get to eat all you can. Overall, great experience!

Address: 10586 100 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2R6 Canada
Review: First time at a hot pot, portions were large, overall it was alright. Decor was out dated but seeming clean. Will go back to try other options for the dinner 5 item special as the lobster balls and shrimp were so so.

Address: 10408 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z3 Canada
Review:
Visit: July 2023, January 2023, December 2022

July 2023: Got the curry chicken rice bowl. It was okay, I wasn't really blown away by the flavours, and likely wouldn't get it again. There was a BOGO on bubble teas, so I got a strawberry Panna cotta with 30% sugar (definitely not sweet enough, and I don't like really sweet drinks) and the salted egg yolk milk tea (very unique flavours!)

I love Dagu Rice Noodle. They have a lot of great soup dishes and sides. If you go there, you know you'll be full when you leave.

When they had the offer for a VIP card, I knew I had to get it, and it was a good call for sure.

Their prices are very good for what you get, and on Mondays, they have $1 skewers which is pretty awesome!

Their soups are very flavourful and they don't skimp out on the ingredients. There's also unlimited noodles, so you can eat to your hearts content!

Overall, love Dagu and I usually think about coming back whenever I'm downtown

Address: 10408 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z3 Canada
Review:
Came here for lunch, first impression of the restaurant is very spacious, clean and newly renovated.

Ordered tomato soup based noodles soup. It was delicious, the tomato soup based is very thick and rich. There are a lot of spices and tomatoes in the soup, has the right flavour.

Service was not attentive, I had to wait a while before they seated even there’s no one waiting in line and less than 5 tables with 3 servers.

Address: 10408 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z3 Canada
Review:
AMAZING AND DELICIOUS RICE NOODLES, FRIED CHICKEN AND BUBBLE TEA!!! 5/5

Not only does Dagu Rice Noodle offer unique noodle dishes not found in many other stores in Edmonton, but the consistency and quality of the noodles, and the flavour of the broth is unmatched! It’s very fun to come with family and friends and spend time dipping the different ingredients in the hot stone bowl.

Other items on the menu I would definitely recommend are the salted egg bubble tea (I know- but TRUST ME it will blow your mind) and the fried chicken.

The staff are also very friendly, so I have become a repeat customer!

Address: 10408 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z3 Canada
Review:
My go to bubble tea place. They use all the real fruits. drinks are not overly sweet.

Mango sunrise is my favourite drink. I can have it everyday. All of their drinks are between $6-$8

Check out uber eats as they offer discounts often.

Address: 10408 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z3 Canada
Review:
We've been here a few times and I'm glad the food is still very good but service seems to have come down quite a bit. It took a long time to get the food and it was always very difficult to get the waitresses attention.

Aside from the service issue we started with the pigs feet which was delicious. Personally this is not a dish I enjoy due to the many bones but it was very authentic to the real stuff in China and the Sichuan pepper flavour was spot on. Definitely a great choice if looking for the real deal!

For the noodles I had the tomato crossing the bridge which was delicious. It's not spicy at all but the flavour of the booth is amazing. All of the "crossing the bridge" noodles come with a side tray of vegetables and if you get the beef slices or other meats they come on the tray like in a hot pot. I get the meatballs though instead which are really nice and they come directly in the soup. The other soup we had was the fish one which again the soup was amazing.

The noodles are technically all you can eat but the bowls are so large you don't really need a second bowl of noodles and they don't actually taste like anything. For us it's all about the broths. Their bubble teas are also very good but take quite a while to be made. So overall it's worth it just don't go if in a rush!

Address: 10923-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: I went for my cousin's birthday and I love sushi so the food was great. The fish was super fresh and melted in your mouth. My one problem was the slow service that night. Due to cov -19 they reduce the staff which make sense but to have one waiter on staff, come on. Even so I still had a grand time and had the best beer ever.

Address: 10923-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: This is by far the freshest sushi in the city.  I have never had a bad experience.  When we are able to eat in the restaurant, the staff is always amazing!  Can't wait to eat in restaurant again.  The atmosphere is always pleasant.  Highly recommended 👌

Address: 10923-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: Glad to see this place re-opened with new owner and brand new menu! Their Ramen is superb! Rich tasty broth and tender chashu! Don't really feel thirsty after drinking the soup, so I guess as they said no MSG added. Girl friends ordered some sushi and they are delicious and cute too! Love this place! Service was good too! Planning to try their donburi next time.

Address: 10923-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: Kiwado is an amazing Japanese restaurant! The service was excellent and prompt and the food came quite quickly. I thoroughly enjoyed the takoyaki and would happily have it again as an appetizer. The tonkotsu ramen was unreal. The broth was super flavourful and unlike anything I have ever had before. The pork was delicious and the entire dish was filling and delicious. I am tempted to try something else on my next visit but the tonkotsu ramen was just so good. They also gave us free mango pudding on the house which was also excellent. I highly recommend coming here.

Address: 10923-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review:
I've always wanted to try out this restaurant but every time I try they're always closed but today I finally had the chance and boy, it did NOT disappoint.

• M • E • N • U •

° Sampler Salad
° Gyoza
° Tonkotsu Ramen ☆
° Ta Lo Men (Kiwado Special Ramen)
° Kiwado Roll
° Lobster Roll ☆
° Tuna 'Toro' Sashimi (Tuna Belly) ☆

The Tonkotsu Ramen and Lobster blew my mind. Although for the Lobster Roll you have to pay a lil extra but I didn't mind. The jaw-dropping dish that had me salavating from first bite was the Toro Sashimi. Melts in your mouth foodgasm!

The staff went beyond as well. We came around 1:30 in the afternoon, a little bit close to their closing time around 2:30 but I wasdesperate to try it out. Once we were done they complimented us with a free dessert. We were very satisfied and relaxed we didn't even notice that we over stayed waaaay past 2:30 but they didn't rush us whatsoever. It was our bad but they didn't even bat an eyelash. I will be coming back here but hopefully I won't over stay as I feel bad for the staff that had to do overtime.

Thank you for the hospitality and fine cuisine! See you next time!

Address: 10181 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review:
Went here for lunch on Canada day with some Italian friends. It was perfect as it's not crowded. Of course, who can suggest the best food to try but  my Italian friends themselves. So we had the Arancini Siciliano as appetizer, the Italian rice balls was cooked in perfection! Crispy outside and so yummy inside with or without the dip. Then came the Ravioli con Aragosta I ordered. Man, I was in love at first sight! Just the way the ravioli looks, my eyes already told me it's delicious. The pasta is stuffed and cut neatly and looked very fresh. And as I taste it, wow, my eyes didn't lie to me! Al dente as it should be, the  pasta didn't overpower the umaminess of the lobster. The sauce has the lobster juice that makes it heavenly. Mmmm!
My friends had the Duck Confit Gnocchi and Bresaola & Arugula Pizza and they said it was great too! I had a bite each, mmmm, yeah it was yummy too but I'm proud to review my ravioli. Maybe next time I come back and really have the gnocchi and pizza for myself! We ordered the tiramisu for dessert, it was really good but it's not like the traditional tiramisu we know and my friends make.
I'm going to visit Italy in Sept and would be looking for these dishes as well.

Address: 10181 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review: Came in for dinner with a small group. The service was mediocre at best, felt a bit neglected by the server. We had a selection of cocktails which were tasty. The food was tasty but in my opinion overpriced.

Address: 10181 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review: Everything was delicious.  Had some appetizers to share for a nice lunch.  Food was fresh and hot and were good serving sizes.  A definite visit again.  Restaurant was properly respectful of the social distancing rules and the staff was appropriately geared.  Waitress was friendly and attentive.  Love the new sidewalk patio, its a wonderful touch to the general downtown atmosphere.

Address: 10181 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review: This was my first time and I quite enjoyed the food and the portion was a lottt! I wasn’t particularly impressed with the wait time, considering the restaurant was relatively empty when I arrived, although it filled out subsequently.

Address: 10181 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review: We had a fabulous dinner at Bottega 104 in downtown Edmonton.  The restaurant has a very positive vibe.  Tables are nicely spaced with modern furniture.  The staff is friendly and welcoming.  Service is appropriately attentive.  The great atmosphere is matched by the quality of the food.  Each dish is well prepared and presented.  The flavour is magnificent.  Over-all, a fantastic dinning experience.  Highly recommended.

Address: 10939-101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: Never had "northern Chinese food" before before coming here. It was a very satisfying experience and this became a frequently visited restaurant. The dumplings here are probably the best in Edmonton. Their fried dough was also quite good and the salty tofu was an interesting experience.

Address: 10939-101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: This place has the best Chinese long donuts in the city. They are freshly made and when it comes out they are so fluffy without any trace of baking soda or  ammonia bicarbonate taste. The pork and vegetable dumplings are very good too. Customer service is lacking, other than that it's a great place for long donuts, dumplings and handmade noodles soup.

Address: 10939-101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review:
I always come here for breakfast. If you wanna try authentic Chinese style breakfast, this is the place to go.
The only downside is their waitresses are so unprofessional. They always make mistakes taking our orders. One time they spilled half of the soup out when they were packing up noodles. Another time they mixed up our pack-to-go with someone else's. We didn't check until we got home so of course we ended up throwing everything away.
It is really frustrating after a couple times. Hopefully they can hire someone more reliable.

Address: 10939-101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: Food was 100% northern Chinese food. They offer breakfast food including Chinese donuts, sweet soy milk and Tofu jelly. They also have fresh made dumplings and Baozi! I would definitely go back.

Address: 10939-101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: Try the handmade green onion cake! So flaky and tender!

Address: 5324 75 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6S4 Canada
Review:
I met up with a couple of friends at Loft Thai for dinner recently. None of us have been there before, but we heard it was very good and that it's quite small inside, so we made reservations. The restaurant has 6 tables inside and was very clean and tidy. Our waitress was very attentive and friendly and offered up some suggestions for dishes to try.

We started off with some spring rolls, which were quite delicious and perfectly cooked (there were 5 spring rolls in total). Two of us ordered the Pad Thai and the other ordered the Chicken Cashew Nut. We all enjoyed our meals, but also commented that it wasn't anything special. I know I've had better Pad Thai elsewhere, but this was still very delicious.

I'd definitely return again to try some of their other dishes, like either the Thai Green Curry or the Thai Red Curry with their coconut rice, as well as the Zap wings which also sounded interesting.

Address: 5324 75 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6S4 Canada
Review:
Great authentic Thai ingredients and preparation. Presentation is nice, flavours are rich.

Give it a try. Duck confit is a must!

Place could use a little better work on the tables and utensils being sanitized and residue free.

Address: 5324 75 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6S4 Canada
Review: This time not so good. The curry pesto has no curry and no pesto taste to it. Just some heat. Hummm...

Address: 5324 75 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6S4 Canada
Review: One of best ambience restaurant in Edmonton. Great for friends meeting. Good try with curry beef, pad Thai, mussel soup. Small restaurant but good enough for clean tasty and have a great night with friends and family.

Address: 5324 75 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6S4 Canada
Review:
Really good food. I ordered a Rama Salad with Salmon. It was really good. The peanut ginger dressing was so good. My friends ordered from there lunch menu and everyone liked there food. I highly recommend their coconut rice.
One more thing if you planning to go there for lunch don’t be surprised by long wait ad the place is small and is super packed.

Address: 10522 124 St Edmonton, AB T5N 1R9 Canada
Review: Our first time at May on 124st. I had the Harissa Tomatoes which was delicious. It had a nice kick and the basted eggs were perfectly cooked. I highly recommend if you like a spicy dish. My wife had Chorizo Verde bowl which she  loved. They create amazing flavours using fresh locally sourced ingredients. I should also mention that the service was top notch.  We’ll definitely be back to try more of the menu items!

Address: 10522 124 St Edmonton, AB T5N 1R9 Canada
Review: Amazing!! Chef Bri makes her mark with stand out dishes full of flavor and creativity. The rolls, mushrooms, romaine and pork chop were stand outs. If you’re looking to support local, eat well and leave satisfied this is your go to Edmonton!

Address: 10522 124 St Edmonton, AB T5N 1R9 Canada
Review: Visiting from out of town, we were looking for a spot to rest our feet and fill our stomachs — May was the perfect place for this. The service was warm and friendly. The food added to the service as it was fresh and thoughtful. Each dish we tried felt and tasted intentional. We left feeling renewed and eager to come back. Additionally, the prices were really good for the quality of food that we received!

Address: 10522 124 St Edmonton, AB T5N 1R9 Canada
Review:
Delicious food and awesome service. If you like pork, you should definitely try the pork belly featuring now. The risotto is also a great option specifically with the braised ribs. I also loved their pickle Caesar.

Generous portions and lots of flavour. Will definitely come back.

Address: 10522 124 St Edmonton, AB T5N 1R9 Canada
Review:
Opened only a few months ago at the end of 2021, this restaurant is still not that busy.  I'd like to keep this as my own secret but at the same time I want it to also be successful and sustainable.

This super cool ambient upscale dining spot is attached to the Art Gallery. Lots of concrete in the infrastructure and beautiful paintings adorn the walls.

We have been here on both New Years for brunch and this past weekend for dinner. Their food is contemporary fusion with some Asian flair.  It's become one of our faves in YEG and we have a big list of establishments in town.  The food is creative, fresh and the room has such a good mood.

Make a visit. You won't regret it.

Addendum: Have dropped the food rating to a four star. The quality seems to have changed somewhat in recent months with the departure of their precious chef. Nevertheless...still worth a visit.

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
Incredible food! I had the Nuevo burrito. Wasnt a hand held which took me by surprise but the flavour was incredible. I can honestly say this was one of the best meals of my life. The flavour combination was perfectly balanced! The menu and selection is not only organic and has lots of vegan options but is also really good. Made it hard to choose what to eat.
Highly recommend!
Great price for the quality you get, the proportions are perfect. Musics good here to. Staff was incredible too.

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
This review is based off a visit on 05/03/2023 and again on 05/04/2023. (Also, it was brought to my attention I posted this review for the wrong OEB location. How lucky for Edmontonians that you have THREE OEBs to choose from!)

I live in Toronto, and unless you're willing to stand in line for HOURS on a weekend (or manage to go on a weekday), you cannot get into the OEB in Liberty Village. So believe me when I tell you I was thrilled to discover an OEB in Edmonton during a recent visit.

My experience was so good on visit number one, we visited again the very next day.

First of all, the restaurant styling and theme is impeccable. Truly a gorgeous space with a clearly defined brand identity.

Second, the service is amazing. On both occasions, we were greeted and seated promptly, and our servers on each visit were bubbly, friendly, knowledgable about the menu, and attentive without being overbearing.

I'm normally a "sweets for breakfast" kind of person, but I couldn't resist the idea of a breakfast carbonara. I was not disappointed with my choice. The gnocchi was perfectly plush, surrounded by hearty chunks of bacon, and topped with a gorgeously orange fresh egg yolk. Every bite was perfection, and I could have eaten three more servings.

On visit two, I reverted back to my old habits and ordered the French toast trifle. Another delicious choice, featuring two slices of thick brioche, topped with a tart lemon curd, fresh strawberries, and toasted meringues. No need to add syrup!

The only downside of my visit to OEB is that we didn't have time in our trip's schedule to visit a third time.

Overall:

Pros:
- Gorgeous and quaint restaurant with amazing decor and design choices
- Incredibly friendly and helpful staff
- Wide variety of choices from savoury to sweet to please all taste buds
- Fresh ingredients combined in creative ways

Cons:
- Paid street or parkade parking only

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review: First time going.  Was not disappointed at all!  We are from out of town and the reviews kept popping up every time we were searching for best places to eat in Edmonton.  We have been trying to come a number of times. We ended up going to the city centre Kelly ramsay in Edmonton. Food was absolutely stellar and on the healthy side for a breakfast place.  Service was quick and top knotch.  All the servers helped each other out.  Justin and Sydney were excellent.  All the staff were happy, positive, smiling and personable.  They kept us topped up with everything.  They use Umbria coffee roasters which is of superb quality.  And we are fairly picky with our food.  We almost always won't post negative reviews but will only post the best of the best! Thank you OEB staff.  We will be back. Our new go to breakfast place in the city

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review: Ambiance and service were great. My blue crab benny was really good, but it was quite fishy tasting, so beware if you don't like strong fishy flavors. It's a bit too much for me personally. Would definitely go back to try other items on the menu.

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
AVOID.

Visiting Edmonton and spotted the reviews for this location so took a chance.

Party of two, we were greeted well as a walk in and promptly seated. The location was busy for a Saturday morning as to be expected and was well lit with refreshing colours and seating. Staff was very kind and friendly.

The food however was mediocre to gross. My partner ordered the ham with eggs, sourdough bread and potatoe wedges which came as ordered and was a typical ham and egg breakfast though at an elevated price. So it goes.

For myself I ordered the "Gold Digga" breakfast poutine which is made up of poached eggs, herb potatoes, Saint Cyrille curds, Berkshire roast pork, black truffles and brown butter hollandaise. To the staff's credit, I asked for my eggs soft and they confirmed that they would be runny. What I was not expecting once the meal arrived was firstly the smaller portion size and secondly that the mix of the egg yolks, whites, hollandaise sauce, oils and cheese would leave the bottom half of the bowl a symphonic mess of a soggy herb potatoe soup. This was contrasted with the overcooked Berkshire roast pork which more closely resembled last night's overcooked leftover steak cubed and refried for the next-day patron's. The seasoning was present but immediately overwhelmed by the soggy potatoe soup to be rendered pointless and the truffles were simply absent. All together the dish is worthy of a spot on Gordan Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares and were it not for having spent time in the Army eating whatever we were told to eat, I'm sure I would have rejected this out of hand.

Regardless, the location was clean and the staff were great. Maybe we'll return in the future but I simply cannot recommend these "breakfast poutines" which appear to be constructed without care or attention to detail.

1 star for the breakfast poutine mess +1 star because the cooks knew how to cook the ham and eggs served to my partner along with the good staff and atmosphere.

Address: 10310 45 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6H 5K3 Canada
Review: Loved this place! Amazing food. Great service. Our server, Jeremy, was great! We felt his love for his job. We were so impressed by the food that we ordered two desserts for two of us (we typically order one and share). The best sticky toffee pudding I have ever had!

Address: 10310 45 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6H 5K3 Canada
Review:
Overall good experience. The food was tasty and very well balanced. We were able to substitute for vegetarian friendly options and also had the option of subbing marinara for alfredo sauce. Shout out to Emily, our server, who was really pleasant and was able to make recommendations from the menu. They didn't disappoint. Excellent customer service.
I asked for extra seasoning on my salmon but it really wasn't needed as it was quite tasty as is.
Portion size was perfect.

N.B Free dessert if you're celebrating a birthday :)

Address: 10310 45 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6H 5K3 Canada
Review: Lovely atmosphere. The service was topnotch the food was divine. I had to order the gnocchi poutine out of curiosity and was super glad I did! Highly recommend the mushroom risotto steak as well. It was cooked to perfection. The prices were reasonable as well. All in all, we will definitely be back many more times!

Address: 10310 45 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6H 5K3 Canada
Review: It was great experience overall. Enjoyed the food. They do have a few vegterian options too. I ordered caramelle and half vegterian pizza.

Address: 10310 45 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6H 5K3 Canada
Review: Pretty good food, their pasta was excellent, so was the fried breaded risotto ball. They had a special on lambshank wellington and that was excellent as well. Great service and nice decor, free parking. Very good drink menu.

Address: 10060 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1V9 Canada
Review: Very good Indian food! Very welcoming and great service. Very delicious and good price. It’s located at lower floor of the building.

Address: 10060 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1V9 Canada
Review: This is located inside the Scotia Place food court down one level inside the building. The food was good. The portions were large. I thought the butter chicken was slightly bland but it could have been due to the other items I ate. The salad was good and so was the naan. Definitely worth the 9.99 plus tax for 3 items. Will eat here again next time I'm in Edmonton.

Address: 10060 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1V9 Canada
Review:
The best Indian fast food in downtown Edmonton located at Scotia Place bldg.
My newest favourite is Chicken Biryani and
my all time favourite is their lamb curry and chickpeas with basmati rice.
the combo meal is reasonably priced
quick service and friendly staff

Address: 10060 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1V9 Canada
Review: Their Momo is great!! I have tried few other items and all of them were delicious. An amazing place to eat. Highly recommended

Address: 10060 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1V9 Canada
Review: Only open during the week at lunch. Not many places downtown you can get a good meal for under $10, this is one of them.

Address: 8232 Gateway Boulevard NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4B2 Canada
Review: We did a delivery order from here from a recommendation from a friend. I'm glad we listened!! The pizzas were fantastic - fresh, flavourful, and delicious! The garlic bites were good, which turned into great with the spicy marinara sauce.

Address: 8232 Gateway Boulevard NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4B2 Canada
Review:
Great pizza and a retro industrial dining environment.

Community has some great New York-style pizza, perhaps one of the better New York-style pizzas in town. This pizza has a great Rossa sauce, complemented by the crisp flavourful crust. Pizza tastes best when eaten folded and warm. The only downside Of this pizza was the grease. However, this is likely due to all the pepperoni on the pizza, and I will say it is less greasy than other pizzas of this type in the area.

The atmosphere of this restaurant is very relaxing and left me craving a craft beer (which they offer a wide selection of).

Pizza is a solid 4/5, which is quite good!

Address: 8232 Gateway Boulevard NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4B2 Canada
Review: Great pizza and nice service. My drink got knocked over they replaced it free of charge. Food service was slow the night we were there but this sounded like it was the exception and not the norm. The atmosphere and food you get definitely made up for it though! Great place to have a large group.

Address: 8232 Gateway Boulevard NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4B2 Canada
Review: Tried dine in once and now followed up with takeaway. Phenomenal, creative pizzas. Good crust and toppings. Friendly service, order was ready when promised. Just be aware that given the neighborhood that there is limited places to park to pick up.

Address: 8232 Gateway Boulevard NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4B2 Canada
Review:
Oh, my goodness. The New York style pizza was lovely, but the garlic bites are DIVINE. Like, I may never have eaten a bite more perfect in my life. The service was great too - very patient despite my questions, and they were great about my nut/ shellfish allergy.

Absolutely a must try if you're in the area. We were told The Next Act was the restaurant to beat (don't get me wrong, their burger was good), but I'd say that Community beats them cleanly!

Address: 10146 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review:
The place itself looked so nice and clean, it has a great vibe to the interior. For the food i’m giving it a 4 star as there was a bit of an off smell to the pork on the ramen I ordered, which was Gold Kome Ramen but the broth was good and the size was big for $13.75! 2 of my friends ordered Deluxe Ramen and yea they were huge we all did take out on our ramens.
We also had starters which was the sweet potato fries, I highly recommend this one. It was crunchy on the outside but soft on the inside and tasted great with the mild spicy sauce. We had Chicken Karaage as well, there was 7 small-ish sized pieces for around $10, it was pretty tasty but a bit pricey for the size and amount.
Now on to the service I would give it a 4 because we ordered at 4:00pm and got our food at 4:45 so it was quite a long wait for 5 Ramens. I gotta say they were busy preparing Online orders though so maybe that’s why it took long to get our food.
All in all I would come back to this place, super yummy starters and huge bowls for Ramen!

Address: 10146 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review: Great Japanese restaurant. Ramen tasted great. Broth was on point and noodles not mushy. Friendly service. Yakitori tasted amazing. Lots of stuff to choose on menu. Decent and clean interior. Would come back when in area. Highly recommend. Cheers

Address: 10146 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review: I got the vegetarian options last night. Veg gold kome miso ramen, agedashi tofu, mushroom skewer, miso egg, and kimchi. My most favourite dish was the mushroom skewer and it is also very inexpensive! The flavours are so great. Followed by the ramen and sides. The agedashi tofu was a bit bland for my liking, however it was light and enjoyable nevertheless. I really liked the service and the ambiance, and will definitely be a returning customer!

Address: 10146 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review:
Service is great, took a little while but it didn't disappoint so it was worth. Busy on lunch and I'm sure dinner service will be as well.. One of the best in Edmonton. Won't be disappointed.

An updated review: Misoya Ramen is a fantastic restaurant with great ramen dishes, a pleasant atmosphere, and excellent service.

It's always a good sign when a restaurant has standout dishes, and in this case, Misoya Ramen's silver shiro ramen is particularly noteworthy. Additionally, having a clean restaurant with nice decor can contribute to an enjoyable dining experience.

Perhaps one of the most important aspects of any dining experience is the service, and Misoya Ramen excels in this area. Friendly servers make the experience great and you can take your coworker or your wife for for a lunch date as the place is gorgeous. It makes a big difference in the overall experience of dining at a restaurant.

TLDR; Overall, Misoya Ramen is a great option for anyone looking for delicious ramen in a pleasant atmosphere with excellent service. Its probably close to authentic as I can't say since I've never been to Japan but I'm sure the flavors are spot on comparable.

Address: 10146 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review: This place turned out to be a great surprise. Edmonton doesn't have many places for good ramen, so I never thought of giving this place a try. I was pleasantly surprised by how good it was. Most ramen places only give you 2 pieces of cha siu and call it a day. My bowl has 3 and they were all thick cut. The tonkatsu ramen has good flavor. It is probably on the pricier side for ramen, but I would say it is well worth the small premium.

Address: 10065 - 100th Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N6 Canada
Review: What an amazing experience, the food is like nothing I've ever tasted in my life! Absolutely amazing!! Michelle was our server she was kind friendly and helpful! I ordered the avocado toast with a green smoothie and an egg on top and side of bacon. Our server also gave us some hollandaise sauce to taste, which was unreal! It just tasted fresh and buttery! Thank you Harvest Room for this experience!

Address: 10065 - 100th Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N6 Canada
Review:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at The Harvest Room restaurant, and I can confidently say it exceeded all expectations. From the moment I stepped inside, the magical ambiance transported me to another world. The restaurant's enchanting decor and panoramic views overlooking the river valley made me feel like I was in a different country. It was a visual feast for the eyes, setting the stage for an extraordinary dining experience.

Now let's talk about the food. Never before have I encountered such flavor and tenderness in beef. Every bite was a revelation, showcasing the culinary expertise and dedication to quality. The beef was beyond compare, and the buttermilk mashed potatoes were like a stroke of culinary magic. The creamy, fluffy texture and rich, buttery flavor were a perfect complement to the exquisite beef. It was a combination that danced harmoniously on my palate, leaving me in awe of the incredible flavors.

The attention to detail and the use of high-quality ingredients were evident in every aspect of the meal. The presentation was impeccable, and the flavors were perfectly balanced. The talented chefs at The Harvest Room truly know how to create a memorable culinary experience.

Adding to the overall allure, the attentive and friendly staff provided exceptional service throughout the evening. They were knowledgeable, accommodating, and ensured that every need was met, enhancing the overall enjoyment of the dining experience.

In conclusion, The Harvest Room is a shining  gem that offers an extraordinary blend of sensational cuisine and a mesmerizing ambiance. Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner, a celebration, or simply a memorable night out, this restaurant delivers on all fronts. Prepare to be captivated by the enchanting atmosphere, awe-inspiring views, and culinary masterpieces that will leave you with a lasting impression. It's a dining experience that should not be missed.

Thank you for making my mom's birthday dinner such an amazing experience!

Address: 10065 - 100th Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N6 Canada
Review:
I was lucky enough to have dinner and breakfast here during a staycation — both were incredible! The restaurant was cozy and romantic with a unique selection of cocktails and menu options.

We sat on the outdoor patio for brunch and it had an incredible view of the city. The servers were so friendly and attentive, even as the patio filled up during our visit. After we ate, we were able to walk around the gardens and enjoy the gorgeous tropical flowers/plants, breathtaking views, and historical charm.

Thank you to the staff at the Harvest Room — You made our stay so special!

Address: 10065 - 100th Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N6 Canada
Review:
Absolutely fabulous! Easily the best lunch we have had on our visit to Edmonton.

Our service Michelle was professional polite and suggested the perfect dishes.

The tomato coconut soup was out of this world as were the grilled Cauliflower.

I’ll be back

Address: 10065 - 100th Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N6 Canada
Review: This gives you the Paris-like ambiance when you are eating your breakfast. I recommend the croissants and their cold cuts. The view is so nice and staff are so friendly as well. Great to start your mornings.

Address: 10117 101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0T4 Canada
Review: I really enjoyed this meal! It was the first time checking it out & was pleasantly surprised by how well executed everything was. The concepts & flavours were very simple but the elegance in the simplicity it was sells this place. The service was great, the vibe was cozy European chic & the food was classic. I almost felt like I was eating on the set of Sound of Music haha. Overall very enjoyable experience. Will definitely be coming back for a lunch to try some of their cold plates next time!

Address: 10117 101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0T4 Canada
Review:
Nice and cozy restaurant with some good Central European food. We ordered the Escargot, steak tartare and goulash to start. The Escargot was baked in a dish with garlic and oil and served with some toasted bread. The texture was a little soft but the flavour was good! The goulash was served with some bread dumplings and a lot of tender braised beef. It could have used a little more salt but the meat was quite soft and easy to eat. The steak tartare was really good, we ordered a large portion and it came with enough to easily share between 4 people. The toast was incredibly crispy and had a nice subtle nutty flavour to it. The steak itself was soft and paired very nicely with the bread. I would definitely recommend the steak tartare.

For our mains, we each ordered a schnitzel. I had the Cordon Bleu schnitzel which came out piping hot with a side of potato salad. The schnitzel was super thin and had a lot of melted cheese oozing out of it when I cut into it. The schnitzel was fried perfectly and came out as a nice even golden brown and also came out pretty light with very little oil sticking to the breading. Overall a pretty good schnitzel, 8/10.

For dessert, I had an apple strudel with whipped cream and vanilla ice cream. The strudel came out hot and flaky. The strudel itself was not too sweet and was really good when paired with the   light and airy whipped cream. You can't go wrong with ice cream on the side either.

I would definitely come back for sure.

Address: 10117 101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0T4 Canada
Review:
Great food. The schnitzel was delicious as was the salad and potatoes. However the service was a bit disappointing considering the restaurant's reputation.

My server didn't check on me at all during my meal or offer to refill my water and seemed more interested in chatting with one of their regular customers. Considering that the restaurant was mostly empty and I paid almost $30 for an entree, this was kind of surprising.

Address: 10117 101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0T4 Canada
Review: Came in right as the kitchen was closing but managed to get a really good meal!! The server was super nice and the food was delicious! Will definitely come back and try more when it's not about to close :)

Address: 10117 101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0T4 Canada
Review: With a strong recommendation by a friend, we visited Bistro Praha.  The place was packed with a long wait time.  We decided to do a take-out.  The service was friendly and very accommodating.  The order was ready in 15 minutes, despite how busy their kitchen was.  The food was perfectly prepared and very delicious.  We will definitely visit Bistro Praha soon, but certainly with a reservation in advance.

Address: 11127 107th Avenue Edmonton, AB T5H 0X9 Canada
Review: The staff was very friendly! The food was excellent! Nachos were layered and piled high. Tacos were juicy and so flavourful. Cocktails were delicious! Relaxed atmosphere.

Address: 11127 107th Avenue Edmonton, AB T5H 0X9 Canada
Review: Love this place! The food is always amazing no matter which location you go to. We were there with a group of 14 people and they were very patient with splitting the bill and all of us ordering and they kept all of our orders straight which was impressive. The food also came out ridiculously fast which was fantastic. Even the atmosphere was great. We of course were a fairly loud and excited group as this was a pre wedding bridal party celebration and it was fun being a small space with different people who were also super positive and interacting with our group through our dinner in a positive way.

Address: 11127 107th Avenue Edmonton, AB T5H 0X9 Canada
Review: Went in for a quick meal and was not disappointed at all and warrants more visits in the future! The staff were just lovely! My friend and I tried the beef torta with the chicken tortilla soup, some horchatas, and churros to go! I really liked the salsa station i’m a fan of anything spicy so when they had some very spicy roasted habanero and some guacamole I already knew it was going to be good! The beef in the torta was perfectly marinated and seasoned. And the price per portion for the torta and the soup was good, worth it for sure as you get portions that are large in my opinion. I have a rule to always get tortilla soup if its on a Mexican restaurant’s menu and this was no exception! Don’t skip on the SOUP! It was really good! The horchatas were good as well! I was hoping the churros would be good but it was just ok, definitely needs the caramel sauce as it doesn’t stand on its own. I found parking on the street but be mindful that this might be a challenge if its busy. Overall, I would recommend this place for anyone looking for some good mexican food!

Address: 11127 107th Avenue Edmonton, AB T5H 0X9 Canada
Review: Affordable and delicious food, casual vibes, friendly staff. A great place to grab a quick meal. Can’t beat it! (A word of warning: Their salsa is actually spicy. Their medium salsa is a white people hot or extra hot 😅)

Address: 11127 107th Avenue Edmonton, AB T5H 0X9 Canada
Review: Delicious mexican food at decent prices. The enchiladas were amazing. Our party also had barbacoa, chicken, and steak tacos - all were a hit. The horchata is one of the reasons we keep coming back. Nobody spent more than $20 for their meal here, and we all left full. Get there early in the day if you want any of the home made desserts. They can sell out quickly sometimes.

Address: 10718 101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S3 Canada
Review: Fun, late Mother’s Day lunch. Nice and efficient service for our large group. Food was excellent but a bit pricey. Parking can be a challenge, but definitely worth going to!

Address: 10718 101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S3 Canada
Review: Fantastic heart-warming soups to help get you through those rough days. I've also never seen a soup place, so amazing at packing their soups for delivery. Great experience all around

Address: 10718 101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S3 Canada
Review: Great place and food is delicious. Menu doesn’t have pictures so sometimes hard to pick but everything is nice. Clean place too

Address: 10718 101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S3 Canada
Review: Service is slow and food is not very good. This place is not authentic at all. Bbh only had well done beef in it and was made with thin vermicelli.

Address: 10718 101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S3 Canada
Review:
Moldy Disgusting Tomato without any apologies or ask. We already ate some! The server just took away the dish and serving a new one later on without asking.
One star gives to pho. Honestly Pho taste very good and pretty fast food speed.

Address: 7 Saint Anne Street St. Albert, AB T8N 2X4 Canada
Review: One of my favorite places to go to for any occasion. Good food that’s always made fresh with the right amount of flavors to satisfy everyone. The servers go above and beyond to make sure everything is at your liking. The best part of the visit was the dessert.  It’s a must try with family or friends 👍🏻👍🏻

Address: 7 Saint Anne Street St. Albert, AB T8N 2X4 Canada
Review: Amazing authentic food   we also had frog legs and were delicious

Address: 7 Saint Anne Street St. Albert, AB T8N 2X4 Canada
Review:
We have been to the Cajun House a few times and thus I was surprised I have not done a review of this restaurant.

My son had the Chicken & Sausage Gumbo which was nice and hot, temperature-wise, and reasonable spicy. I tried it and we both enjoyed it.

For the main meal, my son had the Filet Mignon Ya-Ya which is described as broiled twin medallions of beef tenderloin which is served on a red current, port demi-glace sauce. My son said it was OK , but also above average quality. It is probably just not the type of steak we are used to having for supper.

I had the Breaded Veal Panne, which was veal escalopes, served with pasta tossed with basil cream sauce. To me, the sauce needed to be a bit more of it since the pasta soaked up most of it. The veal had little taste and when I asked my son; it surprised him since he thought it tasted like chicken, not veal. It was nice but not a lot of taste.

All in all, it was a good meal.  The Gumbo was the best part of the meal. The service was great. She was attentive and answered all our questions. We found it cold, we mentioned it to her, and she was able to increase the heat to make it palatable. Yes we would go back.

Address: 7 Saint Anne Street St. Albert, AB T8N 2X4 Canada
Review:
My first visit to this restaurant.
Mid week lunch break.
I ordered the Chicken Po-Boy - with spinach peppered pecan salad.
The sandwich was delicious, and the salad also was very tasty.
The service was excellent, very friendly server and prompt service.
A wise choice to share a dessert, we chose Banana Indulgence…generous serving, a large portion with enough sweetness for 2 people.
Thanks Cajun House!  See you next time I’m in St. Albert!

Address: 7 Saint Anne Street St. Albert, AB T8N 2X4 Canada
Review: The food was delicious, friendly waiter! The Gombo is to die for. The food was also fast and fresh. The only thing I’d say that needs improvement is their sliced bread that came with the smoked salmon appetizer ( it didn’t taste fresh). But overall nice ambiance and wonderful service! I’ll visit again!

Address: 10740 101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S3 Canada
Review: Absolutely the best vegetarian food I have eaten. Everything was fresh and flavourful, to the point where I forgot I was eating vegetarian food.  We ordered a good selection of Asian dishes and none of them were a disappointment. The dessert we had was vegan and was absolutely amazing.  Staff was very attentive and the restaurant itself is clean, modern, and had a very nice vibe.  Clearly a lot of pride from the ownership group. Will be back again for the ultimate test - my father in law who absolutely despises vegetables 😜

Address: 10740 101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S3 Canada
Review: This place offers a serene ambiance and serves some of the best food I've ever had. It's a must-try for new vegans, but I highly recommend it to non-vegetarians as well! Their cold coffee is simply classic! ☕🌱👌

Address: 10740 101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S3 Canada
Review: my absolute favourite restaurant in Edmonton! it’s family style portions and you must get rice on the side with your dishes! the iced lychee and pineapple drinks are so refreshing and sweet for the summer and the place is clean and bright! you wouldn’t even know it’s vegan food

Address: 10740 101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S3 Canada
Review:
Padmanadi is a legendary vegan restaurant in Edmonton. It was one of the first to represent the vegan lifestyle through food so creatively and tastefully.

Upon a recent visit, not much has changed. The same family pictures adorn the walls, the giant Buddha still sits where he always has, and the food is pretty much of the same standard.

The thought I share is that vegetarian and vegan food has moved forward in creativity rapidly over the last decade.  One visit to Vancouver on the west coast will demonstrate vegetarian food of wild and passionate creativity. I feel Padmanadi has a lot of room for growth there.

Our service was outstanding.  And the space is still effective. I just wish the food was a little more progressive given how far vegan food has come in its methods of delivery.

Overall, it's still a good visit.

4 x 🍜🍜🍜🍜

Address: 10740 101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S3 Canada
Review: I ate here yesterday and got the curry chicken,  the green bean bowl and rice. The food was mostly good. The atmosphere was great as well. The service was overall decent. They don’t offer alcohol. The food is a little over priced in my opinion but overall ok.

Address: 10606 - 97 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review:
What an absolute GEM!

A few friends & I went in for the first time & ordered a pound of BBQ pork (around $11-12) and a half pound of pig ear.

Wow!

The BBQ pork was so juicy, so flavourful, and had the right amount of lil' crispy bits on the end. It came with a BAG of sauce that we dumped over all & I wish I ate this with rice so we could soak up even more flavourful from those savoury juices.

This is one of the best things I've ever eaten in Edmonton. Incredible.

For pig ear, it was my first time. They ask you if you want the meat chopped up. Say yes, absolutely, just makes it easier to start eating right away. Very tasty pig ear.

We wanted to order squid but by 1pm it was sold out (which means you know it's tasty!)

Anywho, go support this small local business because their food is incredible.

Heads up, cash only.
And yes, it's worth making a trip to the bank to make this happen.

Address: 10606 - 97 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review: Love this little family-owned shop! They are very sweet and kind! Best Chinese BBQ duck in the city amongst a variety of other meats such as crispy Roasted pork, Hainan chicken, soy chicken, sausage and BBQ pork. They also have marinated squid and the freshest wonton noodles. Forewarning, call ahead to reserve if you can’t swing by in the morning-they sell out of duck pretty fast!

Address: 10606 - 97 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review: If you want good classic Chinese BBQ meats this is the go to. Ordered 1lb of roast pork and 1lb of BBQ pork (I Always ask for half fat/half meat) that way higher chance of it not being too fatty or dry.

Address: 10606 - 97 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review: order BBQ pork this week, it was bad, im so shock, usually never got food bad from here, but the prok is dry ans not really Tasty. I have to use some sauce, because its really hard to swallow. I feel sad, it was my favorite bbq store, was...

Address: 10606 - 97 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review: Best Chinese food in Edmonton! I love their BBQ pork and sausage. It’s not very convenient for me to go so I buy a lot and freeze some every time I go. Recommended to some friends, they’ll love this place.

Address: 8224 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review:
The atmosphere at this local spot is lively, with dim lighting that adds to its charm. The drink selection is commendable, offering a variety of choices to suit different palates.

The food, however, is a mixed bag. The Korean fried tofu sandwich and nachos were enjoyable, but the inconsistency in the quality of the fries was noticeable, varying from burnt to just okay across visits. The kitchen also seemed to struggle with accommodating food modifications for dietary restrictions, which could be a concern for those with specific dietary needs.

The service was fairly standard, neither exceptionally good nor bad. The restaurant was busy during the visit, indicating its popularity among locals.

The presentation of the food was nothing out of the ordinary, but the pricing was reasonable for the quantity and quality of food served.

While the food and service could use some improvement, the lively atmosphere and good drink selection make this place worth a visit. However, those with specific dietary restrictions might want to consider other options.

Address: 8224 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review: Had a nice dinner out at The Next Act. Enjoyed the Critic… bacon cheeseburger. It had a bit of kick… a creeping spiciness that was really good. Fries were good. The beer was nice and cold. There was a really good variety of beer choices. Service was excellent!

Address: 8224 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review:
The Next Act is a lively pub offering many different assortments of food. My friends and I went over for their Sunday brunch and were not disappointed! With spot on food, reasonable pricing, and a homey atmosphere (that also offers patio seating), this place is a must try.
My partner and I ordered the Traditional Eggs Benedict and Chicken Bacon Brie Sandwich. The Eggs Benedict had a creamy and tangy hollandaise sauce; however, the eggs were little over. This may be because we were not offered a choice on how we wanted our eggs, but the amazing tater tots offset this minor imperfection. The choice of tater tots over the more traditional hashbrowns really makes this place standout compared to other brunch spots. The Chicken Bacon Brie Sandwich was amazing! The chicken breast was juicy, the bread didn’t go soggy, and the garlic aioli added a nice creaminess to harmonize the sandwich perfectly.
The service is what you would expect from a lively pub. Our server was accommodating, pleasant, and very patient as our friends slowly poured in. He did go on break during our meal so we had to wait longer than usual for the bill, but his overall service was good.
Overall, The Next Act is a place I would recommend to my friends to try at least once. The homey atmosphere, great food, and kind service are the perfect recipe for a good experience.

Address: 8224 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review: Pretty good! I ate there for lunch with a couple of friends and the food was absolutely delicious! The service was a bit slow (likely due to it being peak lunch time hours) but the food made it worth the wait! The chicken bacon brie sandwich was so tasty and I liked how it came with a side of fries (every sandwich and burger comes with fries; my picture does not do it justice). I wasn't the biggest fan of the seating arrangement as it felt quite cramped especially with the mix of high and low tables, but because of the food, I will definitely be returning!

Address: 8224 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review: It looks like a very popular place! It was packed but in a good way. It had a very relaxed vibe. We went for a late night supper. I got the vegan Mac n cheese, which was very delicious. It tasted like homemade cooking. I added the jalapeños and diced tomatoes, which made it very spicy!

Address: 15215 111 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T5M 2R1 Canada
Review: Down to earth, comfy and homey restaurant. All of the schnitzel that we tried was delicious. Definitely enjoyed the great quality and generous portions! Definitely try the croquette!

Address: 15215 111 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T5M 2R1 Canada
Review:
Awesome! Amazing food, the schnitzel is awesome. Has a classy mom and pop feel with great staff and great decoration. Great German  beer as well! Try it out you will fall in love.

The odd restaurant that sell "schnitzel" is nothing compare to the quality schnitzel here. So fresh! Portions are good too.

Call ahead if you can, helps them keep it fresh.

You can tell they care about the detail and quality. The wife and myself have come numerous times and the food is always perfect.

A true gem in Edmonton, try it out you will enjoy!

Address: 15215 111 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T5M 2R1 Canada
Review:
A very nice German Restaurant, Real good German Food, Sausage and Schnitzel are really good, nice Staff, good German Beer,
A perfect place for a good dinner.

Address: 15215 111 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T5M 2R1 Canada
Review: Damn near perfect simple, European soul food done extremely well. Some guests might like it but I wish the music were a little louder for a fun atmosphere. I felt a bit worried not to bother other guests by talking too much or laughing too loud. But I loved it

Address: 15215 111 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T5M 2R1 Canada
Review: We went for schnitzel and weren't disappointed,  they have sooooo many choices. I choose plain with lemon so I could taste the true flavor of the schnitzel, it was fantastic. Everyone else had a different topping and each equally enjoyed theirs. They have a moderate beer selection which was cold, crisp and went down quite quickly. The only disappointment was in the dessert selection we were looking for some German sweets but there are none on the menu. This was the only thing missing, so if planning a visit and you're looking for dessert simply plan another stop after this one, but don't miss the schnitzel!

Address: 10133 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0L2 Canada
Review: I always love getting the dim sum here. Any visit to the passport office, I always run across the street to New Tan Tan for the best dim sum in the city!! I also love their waitress, she's so nice!

Address: 10133 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0L2 Canada
Review:
First time here, we ordered 5 items and tea for a total of 39 bucks which included a well deserved 20% tip.
So fresh so much and so good!
Our new favorite dim sum breakfast place.
Park on the street with city of ed for 3 bucks for 2 hrs because impark is 6 bucks per hour.
Cheers!

Address: 10133 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0L2 Canada
Review: Standards have fallen!  I used to love dimsum here but last experience was not good.  Most items were lacking flavor.  Pork in the dumplings were chewy/fatty bits.  Although not busy, service was still slow.

Address: 10133 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0L2 Canada
Review: Had the best steamed pork bun of my entire life here! The spring rolls and dumplings were also excellent.

Address: 10133 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0L2 Canada
Review: I was here the other day. I enjoyed the dim sum. The lady was very nice to me and my women. I been here a couple times already and I will come back.

Address: 7904B - 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6J 4C8 Canada
Review: Seoul Fried Chicken has to be the tastiest most flavourful fried chicken places I’ve ever been to! They definitely don’t disappoint! I ordered for pickup and the service was quick and ready as soon as I got there. I recommend the Cilantro Lime 5 piece set with Mac and Cheese pesto and a side of their home cut fries and corn fritters. Highly recommend eating here! 🤙🏼

Address: 7904B - 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6J 4C8 Canada
Review: Had the Big Seoul, came with 5 pieces of soy garlic chicken, thick cut fries, kale salad and a pop. Money to food wise it's one of the best value meals in the city. Soy garlic chicken was crispy,tasty and the soy garlic sauce they use is my favourite in the city. Dunking fries in left over sauce is delicious. My one complaint is all the other sides/side salads at SFC are just alright. I have tried most of the sides and most of them are fine but skippable

Address: 7904B - 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6J 4C8 Canada
Review: First time trying Seoul Fried Chicken. They had an interesting set up where you order on one end, and pick up at the end of a hallway. The food was worth the money. Will have to give it a try again in the future. Not a huge fan of the pesto macaroni salad? I think that’s what it was. It was a bit too green for my liking.

Address: 7904B - 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6J 4C8 Canada
Review: Order from Skip the Dishes, and must say excellent chicken for a very good price. Chicken tastes fresh, not old or reheated, breading is crunchy, light and not too heavy or oily, and my goodness the hand cut fries are to die for. They have generous portions, absolutely delicious and a great price - what more could you ask for?!

Address: 7904B - 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6J 4C8 Canada
Review: Literally the best chicken I have ever had, my personal favorite is the garlic soy, but I have enjoyed every flavor I have tried.  Go early though, because they make everything fresh they tend to run out of menu items as the night goes on, especially on weekends

Address: 10145 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review: Nice location downtown. Grabbed a Lil Seoul meal with a SFC BBQ chicken and a Caesar Salad and I have to say for the price it's phenomenally better than Pop Eyes or KFC and with the atmosphere of the setting dining in you actually feel like you're in a restaurant and not a fast food place. Will definitely have to go back and try some other flavors of chicken and their fries, seeing other customers eating them made me regret not getting fries aha

Address: 10145 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review:
Seoul Fried Chicken comes to downtown Edmonton.  The same quality chicken is delivered...crispy delicious Korean fried chicken in various traditional and new sauces.

The restaurant is extremely spacious and hip.  The service is very friendly and helpful.

The food is extremely generous and comes in a quasi pizza box.  You sometimes get an extra piece more than what you asked and it's loaded with French fries.

4 x 🍗🍗🍗🍗

Address: 10145 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review:
First time visiting this location and it was on the recommendation of a work colleague who resides downtown.

I can't say enough positive things about the cilantro lime chicken! To say it's delicious is an understatement.

The service I found to be a little lax especially when I asked about whether the business could accommodate a party of 20. I felt rushed and will have to make another visit for a true comparison.

If you're looking for great food which I think is great value, this is a place I would recommend.

Address: 10145 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review:
I didn't like the chicken at all. I used to love Seoul Fried Chicken at the Old Strathcona location when they first opened (although even they've gone downhill now), but the chicken at this downtown location tastes very different. The sauce is not good, and the chicken was soggy and not at all crispy. I wouldn't go back.

The restaurant itself is very cute, though. I like the murals and the painted pillars.

Address: 10145 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review: Nice place though I got takeout. Quick friendly service. I read a comment saying the 5 piece chicken only price is a steal, and it sure is. What a deal! 5 large pieces + sauce for under $10. Chicken was great too. I'll definitely order again.

Address: 10704 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L9 Canada
Review: The pork bone soup is a must try. It’s packed with flavour and spiciness that is so good. The deep fried chicken is a hit for our kids, as well as the vegetable pancake. The spicy rice cake is also good and the rest of the bibimbaps. Thumbs up! Parking was accessible and they have high chairs for kids.

Address: 10704 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L9 Canada
Review: I like to eat Korean noodles, but because I like to eat so much so I feel that the noodles are not enough to eat. This time I felt that there was too much oil in the pancake, so the taste was mediocre, not as good as last time, and there was super little seafood in it. I lost a lipstick in the store. I'm really upset.

Address: 10704 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L9 Canada
Review: I had a spicy tofu stew , damn really yummy , side dishes are yummy , great service , clean washroom , here is more likely fine dining restaurant with decent price by the quality , if you have never tried Korean foods , I recommend you to come to check here 🤙

Address: 10704 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L9 Canada
Review:
Really delicious and authentic Korean food. We ordered and shared a couple of dishes and left feeling full and satisfied 🤤 The pork bone soup hit the spot and the pork was tender. The spicy Korean rice cake was SUPER spicy holy cow but that was expected and we finished it all. The soy garlic Korean fried chicken was packed with flavour, crispness, and perfection.

We also received free small side dishes on the side which is the norm for Korean restaurants.

Address: 10704 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L9 Canada
Review:
Customer WiFi: no
Washrooms: yes
Power outlets: no
Pet friendly: no
Parking: Street

Food/Drinks: food was really good lots of bold flavors. Most of the dishes we got were spicy but not overly burn your mouth off. Side dishes were not too impressive. Noodles were really good thou.

Service: service at the press of a button. Use the button!

Atmosphere: very quaint and clean. Very simple and clear space

Address: 8103 127 Avenue NW Suite 9 Edmonton, AB T5C 1R9 Canada
Review:
While I post this review, I am enjoying the Sauer Leaf with Bacon Cabbage Rolls for supper, and am in heaven. This is the flavour I remember from when I was a kid in Regina heading over to Mosaic and visiting the Ukrainian pavillions.

Yo Baba's location is easy to access north just off the Yellowhead at 82nd Street - the strip mall behind the McDonalds on the corner.

Heading in for a quick pickup was easy. There is a cooler with items ready for pickup, and you can order off the menu as well. Love supporting local, and supporting Ukrainian!

Address: 8103 127 Avenue NW Suite 9 Edmonton, AB T5C 1R9 Canada
Review: Absolutely delicious Ukrainian food!  Best cabbage rolls in the city, either Sweet Leaf or Sauer Leaf. Be sure to try the Baked Pyrizhky pan fried with cream.  Mouth watering !

Address: 8103 127 Avenue NW Suite 9 Edmonton, AB T5C 1R9 Canada
Review:
First, I want to send as much holiday cheer towards John Semeniuk, who seems to need it. Bad days happen, and it sounds like he had a terrible one to have said so many horrible and inappropriate comments towards people. I hope he is able to find some kindness going forward. 🙏

Next, our entire experience with Yo Baba was amazing. The staff were friendly and answered our questions cheerily. The only downside was that they had run out of borscht while we were there. Everything else is amazing, and it's just like grandma used to make. We will definitely be making a tradition out of this. Thank you!

Address: 8103 127 Avenue NW Suite 9 Edmonton, AB T5C 1R9 Canada
Review: Omg best cabbage rolls I've ever tried!!! The dill perogies also bomb! Thanx Kim, I'm addicted now.....

Address: 8103 127 Avenue NW Suite 9 Edmonton, AB T5C 1R9 Canada
Review: 1st time ordering.  Was really worried because it was for Christmas dinner so I was worried on how it was gonna taste......IT WAS DELICIOUS 😋  HighlY Recommend!!! The portion sizes are  Good but trust me whatever your going to be double it! 2 of my family members hate  cabbage rolls They literally ate half of the Pan  Thank you so much for making our Christmas a very yummy one 💖

Address: 14456 - 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 2M5 Canada
Review:
This place is fabulous! Foods are delicious! This is the second time we tried this restaurant, recommended definitely!

The sesame dessert is very yummy with lots of fillings!

Love the steamed shiu lao bao here!

Spicy dumplings are very delicious as well!

would definitely recommended to my friends!

Address: 14456 - 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 2M5 Canada
Review: Something more unique in the west end, we love XLB (soup dumplings) and my toddler sips the soup with the dumpling like a champ. Fast service for the weekend

Address: 14456 - 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 2M5 Canada
Review:
A hidden gem on the west side. Known for their soup dumplings and other steamed dumplings. Homemade and fresh made everyday. Absolutely delicious and comforting.

Excellent service and friendly staff will definitely a repeat when we're in town again!

Address: 14456 - 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 2M5 Canada
Review: Very good soup dumplings/ Xiao long bao and Dan Dan noodles. I also recommend trying the crispy Radish and Ham Pastry. The beef buns are juicy and soft. If you go in a big group, just try different types of foods. Most of them are tasty. I haven't found a 2nd place that sell delicious soup dumplings in Edmonton. So this is where I go if you ask for soup dumplings.

Address: 14456 - 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 2M5 Canada
Review:
The restaurant is beautiful, clean, and the service was excellent. The food is delicious, well priced, and comes in big portions. We got the dinner for 2 and were very satisfied
Highly recommend coming here for some terrific Chinese food.

Address: 10220 103 Street Suite 109 Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review:
I finally made my way over to check out Bodega Tapas & Wine Bar by SABOR. It was one of the best experiences I've ever had.

The food were excellent, the wine was divine, and the service exceptional and friendly.

Ahi Tuna salad - The tuna was fresh and delicious, the cucumber and green salad was delicious, with a twist of curry in the sauce.

Tomatoes Bruschetta - Served with a crunchy baguette and a delicious tomato salad, don't miss out

I have to say the Octopus is a delicious dish that is perfectly prepared and is accompanied by a delicious olive tapenade. It melts in your mouth like butter!

Even though we were so full, the lobster risotto was the perfect end to a great meal

The wine menu was unique and there was a 50% discount on Wednesdays so we enjoyed excellent Spanish wines. Dry Rose & Verdejo

The kitchen will always substitute vegetables and food-sensitive/allergy options whenever possible. Make sure you try the artichokes!

Definitely one of my favorites!

Address: 10220 103 Street Suite 109 Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review: Was visiting here when I was up in Edmonton for work trip. It was a hit and a miss. Some were amazing - scallops, cesar salad and calamari. Some were complete miss - meat balls were sooo salty we had to send them back, flourless chocolate cake (gf) were soo dry. Yes it's GF, but I've had rich Moist GF cakes before. When we asked the server what flour was used, she just guessed her answer and didn't even bother finding out the exact answer either.

Address: 10220 103 Street Suite 109 Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review: The service was excellent, very friendly and helped explain things. The menu is big with lots of tasty items to try. I had the Lobster risotto and my friend the Seafood paella both were delicious and large serving’s.

Address: 10220 103 Street Suite 109 Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review: Incredible food and great cocktails! Great service too! Will definitely be coming back.

Address: 10220 103 Street Suite 109 Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review: Never coming back to this restaurant. Found a huge lettuce bug in our dish crawling around. Check your food before you eat it. All the restaurant did was take the plate away did not even offer to comp anything. Worst experience ever. Immediately lost my appetite and couldn't finish with the rest of dinner. Didn't even bother taking the left overs. If I could rate this zero stars I would.

Address: 7609 115 Street  NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0M2 Canada
Review: Had a great lunch today at Belgravia Hub. We shared the flatbread and corn fritters, so good!  They even had homemade ketchup and homemade jam! Vijay and Anna were lovely and offer amazing service 🙌. We can’t wait to go back!

Address: 7609 115 Street  NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0M2 Canada
Review: Wonderful place. Simple menu. The burger and fries were good, the chicken salad was okay, but the croutons things on the salad were great. The service was welcoming and helpful, while allowing plenty of space for a talk among the table. The atmosphere was just lovely.  Parking was available easily. Will go again and try other menu items.

Address: 7609 115 Street  NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0M2 Canada
Review: I stopped in on a whim while waiting for rush hour traffic to subside and was pleasantly surprised. The restaurant was about 1/2 full already. The wait staff took my order quickly but the best part was how how my food was. It's so nice when the food is brought to your table still piping hot. It was delicious with a cold beer in a hot day. Parking could prove challenging as there is a popular cafe next door as well. The owner seems to take great pride in his establishment, walking around and checking to see if the patrons food was alright.

Address: 7609 115 Street  NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0M2 Canada
Review:
Belgravia Hub, located in the heart of Belgravia, is a charming restaurant that has plenty to offer to food enthusiasts and those who appreciate local and authentic establishments. What sets Belgravia Hub apart is their versatile menu that caters to all tastes, ranging from savory beef and chicken dishes to flavorful seasoned salmon and veggie burgers.

The exceptional service at Belgravia Hub is also something I value greatly. Recently, I made a reservation to celebrate my birthday with a group of friends over dinner. Despite being the last ones to leave the restaurant, which was already 10 minutes past closing time, we felt warmly welcomed throughout our stay. We indulged in a wide selection of dishes, beverages, desserts, and coffee. While the food was good, it was the overall experience that truly stood out to us.

I will definitely come back and highly recommend this place.

Address: 7609 115 Street  NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0M2 Canada
Review: The food here is always tasty and the staff is friendly and welcoming. Today, however, I was very disappointed in my lunch. The dressing on my salad was delicious, lemon-dill, but for something advertised as a Summer Shrimp Salad, it should have more than 6 small shrimp on it, and for $18, it should DEFINITELY have more than 6 small shrimp on it.

Address: 10345 106 Street NW Suite 108 Edmonton, AB T5J 1H8 Canada
Review: Love this great place downtown for authentic Turkish cuisine. We especially like the pita bread with dip/spread choices as an appetizer.....and we think they should sell them as a "to-go" product! The meatball dish is delicious, and whenever we get back to Edmonton we try to fit a visit here into our dinner rotation.

Address: 10345 106 Street NW Suite 108 Edmonton, AB T5J 1H8 Canada
Review:
Amazing food selection, perfect ambiance, very beautifully decorated restaurant.
Very friendly staff and great service
The food tasted amazing
Nice overall dining experience! Will definitely be back

Address: 10345 106 Street NW Suite 108 Edmonton, AB T5J 1H8 Canada
Review: The food was great. The service was good too but I wished they gave water more frequently or gave a jar of it. Had to remind waiter to refill water after asking a few times already. It is sort of loud in the restaurant that I couldn't hear the person in front of me well either. Other than that the food is delicious.

Address: 10345 106 Street NW Suite 108 Edmonton, AB T5J 1H8 Canada
Review: Amazing, tasty, and delicious food. Service was a little slow but overall I would come back!!! Beautiful decor and ambiance :)

Address: 10345 106 Street NW Suite 108 Edmonton, AB T5J 1H8 Canada
Review:
Wow, I was so impressed with the food and service.
I highly recommend this restaurant.  Never having Turkish food before was surprising that I would enjoy EVERYTHING that our party is 12 had. The sharing platter meal is the way to go.
The wine was  Collossal, literally!
Go and see for yourself.  Thanks for the amazing taste sensation.
Pamela from the Clarins birthday party yesterday.

Address: 10660 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2N7 Canada
Review: Tau Bay serves only Pho, they don't even offer spring rolls as a side.  Their menu is focused on producing quality Pho and that's it and that's exactly what they do. I first went here 10 years ago? with some friends of mine and I've been back every now and then to enjoy their Pho. On my last trip I tried their Lemon Coke, which is basically a can of coke served with a glass that has ice and lemon juice? in it. Just add the coke yourself and its pretty tasty. I will say their Pho is delicious however the last time I was there the amount of meat I got was not much. I do wish they offered Vietnamese spring rolls, they are super delicious. Also they didn't have any chili oil for free (Think I had to pay extra for it???), that and the low amount of meat stopped it from being 5 stars.

Address: 10660 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2N7 Canada
Review: Good pho. Cash or e transfer only. I loved the pho but bigger portions would have been nice.

Address: 10660 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2N7 Canada
Review:
Tau Bay is a one of a kind place where they specialize in soups and they are phenomenal. I've had plenty of really good pho around Edmonton but Tau Bay is on another level that nobody else can compare to. I've been a long time customer since they used to be on 107ave and 113st and their pho hits just right every single time since I've first discovered them. If there's a list of must try places in western Canada, Tau Bay better be on it.
I'm not sure how to describe how delicious their pho is. I find each bowl to be perfectly balanced with meat, noodles and their umami rich broth. You are free to add hoisin, bean sprouts, hot sauce and a squeeze of lime if that's your preference but I like to enjoy it as is with one thai chili for a bit of heat. The broth alone is heavenly. Please note that it's soup only with beverages and some desserts. They take only cash or email transfers.

Address: 10660 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2N7 Canada
