Review: The Vietnamese pho is the most authentic I have ever had in Canada. It’s so tasty and not expensive. Fried rice is also my favourites.

Address: 10660 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2N7 Canada
Review:
Soup is good.  But if you are spicy person, I do not recommend here.
I asked for chili pepper, but they only give you 1.

It was same many years ago, and I visited again after few years hoping they would change.

Chili pepper cost so little, don't understand why they don't give it to customers.

And btw, they take cash only!!

Address: 10760 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A8 Canada
Review:
Tasty, messy food. Love all the options to get plantain!!

If you like cheese, their cheese sticks were so dense and wonderful, especially with the special green sauce they serve with it. The dry pork bite things were everything you want dry ribs to be. Meaty, salty, tear-apart-able.

Be ready and hungry though as I think everything in the menu is very filling.

Address: 10760 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A8 Canada
Review: The atmosphere, service, and flavours are spot on. You forget you’re in Edmonton and feel transported to Venezuela :) definitely will be back and highly recommend for vegetarian and meat eater folks. Oh and Abuelita's quesillo is a must!

Address: 10760 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A8 Canada
Review:
4/5
7th November 2022

I was a tourist in Edmonton and this was a place that came on the recommenddation list. So I had to try it.

I came here and the host suggested i go for the rice bowl with beef and the sugarcane lemonade.

The food was so tasty and so was the lemonade.
I would definitely recommend this place and would hopefully come back in the future to try more.

Address: 10760 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A8 Canada
Review: Their brunch is 10/10 delicious! I thought perhaps it wouldn’t be traditional enough (more mainstream) but I was wrong! Absolutely delicious Venezuelan style breakfast/brunch offerings, that include arepas. I ordered the Traditional, which I would highly recommend! Amazing place to try if you’re looking for a new brunch spot.

Address: 10760 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A8 Canada
Review:
Holy smokes. Talk about big flavour from a small restaurant. We walked in and asked for the server to choose our lunch and drinks for us and she picked perfectly. Try the passion fruit juice and the cheese sticks.

This is an excellent restaurant!

Address: 10721 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H2 Canada
Review: Decided to check this place out as we wanted to try something new. Food was really good and our server was fabulous! I highly recommend the lasagna and the penne with ground turkey sausage in a mushroom sauce (forgot the name and not on the menu).  We will definitely be back again to try more of their pastas!

Address: 10721 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H2 Canada
Review: Cozy little restaurant. Amazing service!! 🙌💯 Our server was so personable, and made us feel right at home. She offered suggestions, and the food was amazing. We had the Ravioli and the Penne alla Vodka with prawns for the main. Appetizers we had Cozze Pomodoro and Bruschetta.

Address: 10721 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H2 Canada
Review: I have to apologize that my pictures don't do any justice. The food here was beyond my expectations. Very well seasoned, good sized portions and service was excellent. It was my first time there, thanks to some friends. Highly recommend this place if you're craving pasta. We're coming back with big appetites again soon ☺️

Address: 10721 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H2 Canada
Review: My friend Anthony and I went to dine in at Nuevo Bistro and the food (appetizer and entrée) was delicious! The service was pleasant and our server was so lovely! I will definitely go there again whenever I'm craving Italian food! 😍🍝

Address: 10721 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H2 Canada
Review: My wife and I had a kid free evening last weekend and decided to explore the 124st area. Came across this small Italian bistro. No regrets. Our meals were delicious! The staff was unbelievable. We'll be back!

Address: 10111 Bellamy Hill NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1N7 Canada
Review: We had a wonderful dinner at La Ronde for our wedding anniversary. Our waiter, Colin, gave us extremely good service. He was friendly, professional, and attentive the entire time. The food was excellent and we were happy with the quality and taste! The view of downtown Edmonton and the River Valley was also fantastic. This is the second time we have been to La Ronde and both times we had a really nice experience. I would recommend trying out this restaurant to anyone looking for a lovely place to celebrate a special occasion or just to have a good fine dining experience.

Address: 10111 Bellamy Hill NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1N7 Canada
Review:
Beautifully appointed restaurant with a lovely view, good food, and exceptional service! I was in town exhibiting at K-days and decided to take a break from talking to hundreds of people at the convention and have a quiet, solo meal at a nice restaurant.

La Ronde was exactly what I needed!

The food was decent but not incredible. My bison steak was a little overcooked (I asked for medium rare and it was not even pink inside) and the creme brulee was not set properly so it kind of had the consistency of scrambled eggs...I did love the veggies and the flavor of the steak, and really appreciated that the mocktails were all ~$5/ea (as it should be).

The service honestly more than made up for any shortcomings with the food! Dean, my server, was SO nice and above and beyond charming and helpful. He really made me feel taken care of, and gave me some great travel advice.

The revolving aspect was also pretty interesting. A little vertigo-inducing at first but it was easy to adjust to and then it was just lovely to have views served to me throughout the course of the meal. Definitely would recommend this place!

Address: 10111 Bellamy Hill NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1N7 Canada
Review:
We arrived at 5:30 for a wonderful experience that lasted nearly two hours. We started by having cocktails, and between the three of us had two appetizers: the brisket in cheese sauce and the crab cakes. We also ordered one wild mushroom soup. The appetizers all arrived quite fast and were very good. Next time I would skip the crab cakes, but would definitely order the brisket and mushroom soup again!

The entrees we ordered are all pictured here.  We had the prime rib, NY steak, and the seafood stew. They arrived the same time as the fresh peppercorn offering.

We finished our meal with a cappuccino and mango cheesecake. Our server was pleasant, timely,  and professional with a dash of perfectly tasteful humor. What a treat! 👌

Address: 10111 Bellamy Hill NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1N7 Canada
Review: This was one of the greatest dining experiences I’ve ever had. In town for a tattoo convention, staying at the hotel, wanted an easy dinner. This turned into an entire event lasting two hours. The food was delicious, the view was spectacular but Dean, our wonderful waiter, made the entire night. Thank you for your lovely conversation and being so welcoming and engaging despite getting busy. Your kindness is so appreciated.

Address: 10111 Bellamy Hill NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1N7 Canada
Review:
Great food, great views, and overall a fantastic experience. Had the mushroom soup and it was the perfect amount of creaminess and savory flavor. The bison steak was also top notch.

Finally, the views of the city are phenomenal. My fiancé and I timed the rotation, and it goes all the way around in about 70 minutes. Will be coming back next time we’re in Edmonton!!

Address: 9940 106 Street NW Suite 100 Edmonton, AB T5K 2N2 Canada
Review:
In the heart of Edmonton, this place offers a stylish and sophisticated setting, with a great ambiance, which is perfect  for any kind of occasion; romantic, business or casual.

The menu features a variety of dishes that showcase fresh, seasonal ingredients. The presentation is simple and elegant, and the flavors are bold and memorable. You must try the Scallops, Grilled Octopus, entrecôte and everything else in the menu 😋

The atmosphere is sophisticated and inviting, with a mix of modern and traditional elements. The service is attentive, super friendly and knowledgeable, with a focus on making each guest feel welcome and well taken care of." 💪

Address: 9940 106 Street NW Suite 100 Edmonton, AB T5K 2N2 Canada
Review: Oh my gosh!! Everything about this place was perfect, such an amazing balance of class and elegance with comfort and relaxation. You don’t need to wear a suit or dress but if you want to you’re not out of place. The staff is genuinely friendly and knowledgeable, they explain the menu so well you have a hard time picking what to eat. The featured gin sour was refreshing and borderline dangerous with how quickly it can go down. From apps to mains everything was amazing, you can tell the food is prepared with love and the flavours are incredible. We would highly recommend The Marc to anyone and everyone.

Address: 9940 106 Street NW Suite 100 Edmonton, AB T5K 2N2 Canada
Review:
Our first time in downtown Edmonton, we decided to start exploring the downtown area to start out the day at this location.
We reserved in advance and was greeted with very friendly ladies who quickly accommodated us in a big bright window seat.
The seats are comfortable and the service was quick.
The portions of our order was very generous and our palate was greeted with light, smooth, crisp, fresh, warm, delicious flavors that filled us up.
The drinking water served was refreshing and clean tasting.
This was a really nice start of our day.

Address: 9940 106 Street NW Suite 100 Edmonton, AB T5K 2N2 Canada
Review: Staff was very accommodating, food was good but not as good as expected considering the hype. Presentation was very good though. Price was ok but a little over priced. Definitely needed more seasoning.

Address: 9940 106 Street NW Suite 100 Edmonton, AB T5K 2N2 Canada
Review:
Honestly this was an amazing lunch and the atmosphere was perfect. I would really recommend this place for business, family and any type of occasion.

From the moment you walk in, you are greatly greeted and looked after. Their menu is so good… I just wished I had more stomach to fit it all in.

Make sure to book a reservation, kids friendly, great food and fair prices. Make sure you check out their wine menu as well and some of their functions.

Hope you visit and let me know what you think. Keep on eating and have fun.

#chicosreviews

Address: 10347 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review: I like it, the menu is just long enough with many intriguing options to choose from. The service was on point and we got a seat in the back area which was cozy, but it was quite dark. Needs a little more light, it's especially an issue when trying to read the menu, not fun having to pull your phone out to use the flashlight. The food was tasty, but we did have a couple of plates where the kitchen was heavy handed with the salt (and I'm a person that really likes salt!). They did fix it and we overall enjoyed our meal

Address: 10347 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review:
Great great Hospitality...More cocktail options would make this place 5 stars for me ..they Have like 6 cocktails on the menu..we tried 4 and all were good...Perfectly balanced using fresh fruits and good choice of spirits...
Their food was a show stealer...balanced on flavors although we just had 2 options for vegetarians except salads..
Place has great potential..we would definitely recommend this place and return if they add more vegitarian dishes for us to try..
Great to see such places in Edmonton..

Address: 10347 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review: I will come back here again and again and again and I’m bringing friends. My first visit to Bar Bricco was for my mum’s 60th birthday and it was such a wonderful experience for us. The food is Incredible, the wine is excellent, the service is terrific. It is quite dark, which isn’t the best but it gives the place a certain ambiance. The raviolo al uovo is the absolute most delicious thing on the menu. The agnolotti is so perfectly cooked. Caparzo wine is hard to find in Alberta. Skip the truffle butter crostini.

Address: 10347 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review:
I have mixed feelings about Bar Bricco after dining there last night. I had decided to celebrate my birthday with my boyfriend there because I enjoyed the food the last two times I came.

The quality of the food was excellent - the same as I had remembered it - and our dishes arrived very quickly. If you are a pasta, butter and cheese lover, I would highly suggest ordering the Fonduta Agnolotti and the Egg Yolk Raviolo.

The service was okay. Our server asked if we had any questions about the menu and refilled our water without being asked. However, she did not seem warm or personable.

The atmosphere was uncomfortable for me. Honestly, I felt like I was eating in the dark - I even had to use the flashlight from my phone to read the menu. My boyfriend's voice was drowned out by the music and by the laughter of the 4 girls sitting next to us. By the time we finished our meal, my ears were ringing. I had zero desire to stay and enjoy my cocktail. We were in and out of the restaurant within an hour.

Address: 10347 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review: One of my favourite spots in Edmonton. I have tried most dishes on the menu at this point and they never disappoint.

Address: 10571 97 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L4 Canada
Review: My family’s FAVOURITE Chinese restaurant in Edmonton. We are from Calgary and often visit our family up here. Every time we come, we always come to Sai Woo for delicious Chinese food. Their calamari, fried fish, and garlic shrimp are unmatched. Never overcooked and perfectly crispy on the outside. The batter is nice and light and every bite is always delightful. Definitely come here for some solid Chinese food.

Address: 10571 97 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L4 Canada
Review: My last visit was 20 over years ago when my kids were still babies. Hubby and I decided to pay a visit recently and we just kept going back.   If you are looking for hearty , authentic Chinese ( cantonese style) food , this is definitely the place to be. The service is really good. Our server Anna is very friendly and helpful . The Deep fried calamari is the best in town in my opinion.  Fried to perfection!!! The fish maw soup has so much fish maw in it . It's not only tasty , it's great for the price. Deep fried fish is the bomb , it's crispy on the outside and the fish is not overcooked , it's fresh and tasty. I would highly recommend this gem in Chinatown. Their food really hits home.

Address: 10571 97 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L4 Canada
Review: After going out for dinner at two new restaurants and being disappointed with the meal at both, I just had to go to my favorite Chinese restaurant that I have been going to since I was a kid. I believe this may be the oldest running Chinese restaurant in Edmonton ( please correct me if I'm wrong). You can always count on this restaurant to be consistent with the quality of their food. Always fresh and they are so fast in serving each dish. Staff is friendly even when it's really busy. The deep fried calamari has got to be the most iconic dish that everyone orders. The batter is so light and crispy. Everything tastes good here. We order the dinner for six so we can have leftovers. The restaurant is old and could use some new upgrades but I take comfort in the atmosphere that still remains the same along with their amazing food that I've enjoyed with my family as a kid and now my own family gets to enjoy their food. Thanks Sai Woo staff for the wonderful meal and service.

Address: 10571 97 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L4 Canada
Review: My family has been coming here for many years and the staff even knows us. Danny, Alex, and Anna are all great. Danny even recommended some amazing dishes that we haven’t tried before! Great quality dishes and always delicious. They are also good with substitutions and allergies. My cousin can’t have gluten, so they were willing to make a noodle dish without soy sauce just for her. Overall amazing restaurant and tasty food! My family’s favourite Chinese restaurant in Edmonton!

Address: 10571 97 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L4 Canada
Review: The food was amazing  ! Very busy Friday  evening.  We will definitely go back !

Address: 10516 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 1X4 Canada
Review:
Food was good but that took longer than necessary. It was game night for the Oilers but the bar wasn't that busy. Waited more than an hour for a couple of burgers and a couple of wings.

Other than that, our server was super nice and apologetic. Kept checking up on us. And the manager at the time was good too.

Address: 10516 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 1X4 Canada
Review:
My first visit and it's absolutely perfect. Fun and unassuming atmosphere. Good music, good vibes. Staff is accommodating and friendly and the food... To die for! I had the crab cakes and chicken skewers (bacon wrapped, I might add) and oh... My... God.

If you haven't been here, just do it.

Address: 10516 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 1X4 Canada
Review: Nice place with mountainous theme. Got a patio area in the back but due to the rain the make shift tarp for protection wasn't working to well as water was falling through. Staff was accommodating. Didn't eat anything at the time but the Jasper cocktail was delicious.

Address: 10516 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 1X4 Canada
Review: Amazing first time at Rocky Mountain Ice house! Originally went to cask & barrel and the waitress recommended to go  here for the larger menu. our server was absolutely the best. they have the best crab cakes I've ever had! Not overcooked, not burnt or greasy and perfect portion for the price. I also had the pork belly with the smashed potatoes, holy smokes were they delicious! my date had the Southern fried chicken and the mac and cheese. the only thing I recommend is the mac and cheese needs to be cheesier! so nice to have a slice of watermelon on the side. the watermelon Caesar salad is also really really good!! Definitely coming back.

Address: 10516 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 1X4 Canada
Review: Have been there twice now. Dinner was average the first time. Second time, we came on a Sunday afternoon. Ordered 2 beers after waiting a few minutes. Waited 10 minutes before the server asked if we’d like a refill of our water. We were still waiting for the beers we ordered 10 minutes earlier. The place wasn’t exactly busy. Don’t waste your time.

Address: 10212 96 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2G7 Canada
Review: Awesome experience at Double Greeting, as always. The food and atmosphere is always top notch. You can find many HK inspired classic dishes here. The diner style booths are wide and comfortable. The newly renovated washroom is clean and well laid out. They appear to be slightly understaffed but not the extent that it would impact the overall experience. I would recommend ordering quickly once you arrive as it is quite busy around the lunch hour.

Address: 10212 96 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2G7 Canada
Review:
Not sure what to say about this... Food is ok with that size and price, wait is super long for food and take out
Will I go back, I'll not
I ordered take out after dine in and waited for 40 mins for only 1 appetizer and 1 fried rice
The fried flat noodles stick together and it taste so so
Service is slow as they clean tables instead of getting my order when I arrive
So I waited for 10 mins for server

Is it authentic? Yes
Is it like HK restaurant? Yes but is really those not up to par and those that you will not go back if u are in Asia. If it's in Asia, it will be a 2/10... But for here in Edmonton... I guess... You can't ask for more here but I'll still choose not to go back

Address: 10212 96 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2G7 Canada
Review: This is some of the Best Authentic Asian food in the Edmonton Downtown Area.  Like the location a little hard to get into but some of the best food you can find in the area.  Again this is authentic Chinese Food so if you are looking for the North American (Western) experience this may not be for you.  For anyone else there is a huge selection of food for you to order from and they will make the some menu items spicy to taste for those who are like the food a little more bold.

Address: 10212 96 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2G7 Canada
Review: I have been going to Double Greeting for as long as I can remember. The food quality has always been great! The prices have always been reasonable and the portion sizes are amazing. The dishes I aways order, one or all of the following: Ginger Beef, Shrimp & Pork Dumplings Noodle Soup and Silver Noodle Chow Fan. When going here, make sure to bring cash. They do not accept debit or credit. There is a cash machine but expect to pay a service fee.

Address: 10212 96 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2G7 Canada
Review: A real place to eat non-westernized Chinese dishes. Not only was the portion-to-price ratio superb, but it was tasty too. But more than anything, the beverages were the best. Case in point: the sago teas. Definitely going back again

Address: 11834 Kingsway Avenue Edmonton, AB T5G 3J5 Canada
Review: Tried it last night with my 5 year old son. The waitress was great and recommended chicken strips and fries for my son which she said was around $8. They were made from scratch and cooked to perfection, like perfectly moist. Their french fries were seasoned impeccably. I had a beef dip, the roast beef could have been higher quality. But the bun it was served on was fresh and delicious. The gravy that came with it was pretty good too. Thanks for the amazing service and really good food

Address: 11834 Kingsway Avenue Edmonton, AB T5G 3J5 Canada
Review: Ordered 8oz sirloin medium rare and it came well done, veggies "looked " great but were terribly undercooked. Partners chicken Cordon Blu tasted like sausage?, veggies were undercooked as well. Cooked another steak and nuked the veggies, chef??? cut into new steak to verify it was prepared right. Breakfast earlier that day was great so we went back for supper, waitresses were super and they did knock 15% off the supper bill...

Address: 11834 Kingsway Avenue Edmonton, AB T5G 3J5 Canada
Review: Served an over-cooked green steak with rubbery soggy vegetables, a freezer burned bun, and mushroom soup that came with a day (or two) old “skin” on the surface. Needless to say we didn’t eat any of it. Gross.

Address: 11834 Kingsway Avenue Edmonton, AB T5G 3J5 Canada
Review: Food was very delicious, vegetables were seasoned well. we got the chicken cordon bleu and sirloin super good. Super nice to us as we were the only other people in there. Would definitely be coming back.

Address: 11834 Kingsway Avenue Edmonton, AB T5G 3J5 Canada
Review: Very good service, staff was great and accommodating. Tried cheese burger and fries very good taste. Recommend This nice restaurant to anyone.

Address: 9650 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5N 4B2 Canada
Review:
staff: very warm and friendly. We forgot our left overs and had to back track to get it. Our server remembers and walked me back to the door.

service: it was a full house - and even so service was friendly and quick.

establishment: location is a bit small - felt a bit “cozy” or squished. There is a large parking lot outside.

food: amazing. Generous portions. Great flavour. We had left overs.

Address: 9650 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5N 4B2 Canada
Review: We had a great time! Romantic Italian restaurant, our server tanya was super knowledgeable about the menu and was incredibly attentive! Staff are awesome, they subbed out a cream sauce for marinara for my dairy allergy and the aperol spritzes were amazing!

Address: 9650 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5N 4B2 Canada
Review: Small restaurant that packed lots of good flavor, great appetizers, pastas, entres and dessert. Ordered the pescatore and it was delicious however the mussels were a bit sandy. Service was excellent. Relatively tight seating and full service, reservation recommended.

Address: 9650 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5N 4B2 Canada
Review: First-time visiting Edmonton and so glad we found this place based on positive Google Reviews. We showed up 3 minutes before they close but they were so kind to offer us to dine in. We had a delicious seafood pasta and the service was top notch. Highly recommended!

Address: 9650 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5N 4B2 Canada
Review:
First time going here. Service and food was great! I didn’t catch our server’s name but he was very friendly. You can tell the patrons love to come here because the servers all treat them like friends.

Pasta was delicious, with large portions and complimentary warm buns and butter before your meal. They also don’t cheap out when you order a glass of wine! It was a very healthy pour (which was enjoyed!)

Address: 10933 - 120 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 3R3 Canada
Review:
First time dining at Gravy, and it was an amazing experience!

Atmosphere was really cool with all the drawings and graffiti on the walls, tables and chairs.

Service was amazing, the employee whom I forgot his name, but he was very welcoming and friendly. We also got our food served fresh and quick too!

Last but not least, the food is delicious! I ordered the mushroom burger, and it was just a heavenly combination, from the toasted buttery bun, to the crispy onions, juicy patty and perfect balance of gravy, mayo, cheese and mayo!

Poutine was also perfect from the crispy fries, cheese curds and gravy on top.

I highly recommend going here, as it will be an experience you won't want to miss!

Address: 10933 - 120 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 3R3 Canada
Review:
I went in with breakfast (brunch) in mind. They serve breakfast options all day (Amazing! Hard to find in Edmonton). Once I got there and looked more at the menu, I had a lot of trouble deciding against my idea of getting breakfast or not. There were so many delicious options. I ordered the Bacon Brioche sandwich. It did not disappoint! I highly recommend this sandwich but I do warn you, it is messy. I will be returning asap to try some non-breakfast options and for sure will be returning for breakfast/brunch as well. The owner was great to chat with, very welcoming and personable. Neat and unique atmosphere with all the tables and walls covered in sharpie art -
no need to dress fancy XD.

Address: 10933 - 120 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 3R3 Canada
Review: The service here was really good! Atmosphere was fun. You can draw on the tables and walls. I had the diner burger and poutine. My husband had a breakfast burger and my daughter had the chicken burger. For our taste, we found the gravy too salty... However, if you like salty gravy! This is the place for you! I may come back and try something else. However, I made a poor choice of getting the diner burger, since it also has gravy on it. Whoops. I'd recommend sticking to one item with gravy for your first visit. And again, service was great! Everyone was super friendly.

Address: 10933 - 120 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 3R3 Canada
Review:
Gravy is the old Local Omnivore in the Queen Mary Park area in a new modern hip building. They serve up incredibly creative and innovative burgers and fries as Local Omnivore used to. So delicious!

The space is wild with graffiti all over the walls that have been written by the customers. What a vibe!

And the service is outstanding. The guys are so friendly.

All around 5 x  🍔🍔🍔🍔🍔

Address: 10933 - 120 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 3R3 Canada
Review:
It must have been an off night. The burgers were both so salty - the regular hamburger had so much burger sauce that it was pouring out.

The slushies tasted exactly the same - the orange had no hint of citrus, both tasted like the blue raspberry.

Hopefully my next experience will be better.

Address: 8712 150 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 5Y2 Canada
Review:
We have dinner today. The plates are well served and delicious.  I had Tokansu Cordon Blue (pizza). The meat was tender and crispy outside.
The ratio price/ quality is perfect.
The server is very polite and attentive.
The place is nicely decorated.
It's a good place to have dinner with friends.

Address: 8712 150 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 5Y2 Canada
Review: This place was recommended by a friend, finally got to try it out and we like the food. The Tonkatsu and chicken Katsu are both crispy and delicious, paired with a light salad is a good combo.

Address: 8712 150 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 5Y2 Canada
Review:
Nara is amazing. I highly recommend everyone to come here. I’ve had the chicken katsu and the beef bulgogi with noodles before. I had the beef bulgogi with noodles today and I was very satisfied with the portion and the taste!

There is something for everyone here and the price is well worth it.

5 Stars

Address: 8712 150 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 5Y2 Canada
Review: Absolutely amazing! Super friendly staff and delicious food. I highly recommend the Curry Tonkatsu and the bulgogi fries!

Address: 8712 150 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 5Y2 Canada
Review: I placed an order for pick up, few minutes later they contacted me to let me know that the potato korokke is sold out, I said it was fine, the lady replaced it ttkeboki and 2 bulgogi korokke instead! I was blown away! awesome service.. I ordered 2 cheese tonkatsu and omgggg its amazing!

Address: 10969 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2P7 Canada
Review: Cozy place to have dinner. We had their Giant Grouper special + a veggie dish and the peach shrimp. Peach shrimp sauce wise is a bit dry, but the shrimp was fresh. The giant grouper combo was fresh and well made into a soup and our choices of stir fry + soy bean sauce steamed. Overall impressed with our meal, would come again.

Address: 10969 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2P7 Canada
Review: Food is excellent.  Family owned and operated so all the comments about service, relax. Enjoy the food and experience traditional Chinese cooking. If you want fast, I’d recommend Panda Express

Address: 10969 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2P7 Canada
Review: They raise their own ducks for peking duck! We ordered the Peking duck set and it was the right amount for 5 adults and 2 kids.

Address: 10969 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2P7 Canada
Review: Great place for Chinese food. :-D

Address: 10969 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2P7 Canada
Review: The food was amazing! I loved their Won Ton Soup! Will be back for sure.

Address: 12411 Stony Plain Road Edmonton, AB T5N 3N3 Canada
Review:
Food. Atmosphere. Amazing Service!!
Jorge was absolutely wonderful and takes pride in his service🙏  My food hit the spot in a way a home cooked meal does and the hot sauce was drool worthy. It was worth the trip down! 25 stars❤

Address: 12411 Stony Plain Road Edmonton, AB T5N 3N3 Canada
Review:
staff: one server. Friendly. Family run business.

service: slow considering there were only 3 tables there at lunch time. Only one server but did not check in. Did not offer water or napkins etc.

establishment: nice central location. Parking in front or neighbouring streets.

food: the guacamole starter was delicious. The tacos looked amazing - they just lacked some flavour. I was expecting authentic Mexican flavour but it was all very bland.

Address: 12411 Stony Plain Road Edmonton, AB T5N 3N3 Canada
Review:
Although the food was good, it is quite pricey for the portion size. I'm confused with the 1.5 thin slices of lime, in addition to the single slice of radish, 2 slices of cucumber for 7 tacos. The guac and chips portion was also very small for $14. Unfortunately, I also think charging for every single thing like lime and sauces threw the experience off for me a bit due to the portions. However, I am cognizant the location may have played into the pricing.

Otherwise, the atmosphere is pleasant and esthetically cute.

Address: 12411 Stony Plain Road Edmonton, AB T5N 3N3 Canada
Review: Beautiful atmosphere, from the decor to the music this place is really sweet. The al pastor taco was delicious! Highly recommend.

Address: 12411 Stony Plain Road Edmonton, AB T5N 3N3 Canada
Review: Frida Urban Taqueria is so good! Love the vibe in the restaurant! Started off with the guacamole and chips! So flavourful and fresh! Then I had the gordita! So flavourful, wish I had more. The Carnitas tacos were to die for! Finally for dessert the churros were the best!

Address: 16336 – 111 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 4G3 Canada
Review:
I walked in with high expectations based on a rec from a client.  Service was friendly and prompt.  Definitely a nice, chill vibe to the place (6:30pm on a Tuesday afternoon).

I ordered the smoked chicken with the Lamplighter BBQ sauce, mashed potatoes, coleslaw and cornbread.  The entire meal was served to me in 7 minutes.
Thoroughly enjoyed the coleslaw and mashed; the cornbread was a little too dense for my liking but very tasty.  I found the smoked chicken to be very dry, and I wasn't a huge fan of the BBQ sauce.  I also ordered their Bluebeary Ale which I would definitely have again.

All in all, next time I'm in town, I'll give it another try.  Based on other reviews, I'm sure the other dishes on the menu are worth the try.

Address: 16336 – 111 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 4G3 Canada
Review:
Visit: April 2023
Got the full platter and it fed 2 of us. The food was pretty good, though I found the chicken to be quite dry. The sauces were also pretty tasty! Fries were well seasoned and very fresh. The atmosphere was great and the staff was very friendly. Food was a little bit pricey for what I felt like we received, but in the end we were relatively full

Address: 16336 – 111 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 4G3 Canada
Review:
Okay so a couple of my close friends and followers suggested I try this spot
As my rating goes this place has so much potential but it could be way better definitely wouldn’t eat here again
the moistness of the meat and fall apart aspect of it 10/10 the seasoning and Flavour aspect 1/10 was not there was not giving

Mac and cheese was a 0/10 was no flavour noodles weren’t even al dente they were hard

Mashed potatoes 10/10

The meat platter was 5/10
The five was the fall apart aspect and tenderness but the chicken was very dry
The sausage was amazing !

The barbecue sauces need to be blended a lot more if these are home made but as of those I’d give a solid 4

Burnt ends 8/10 !!

Brisket was 5/10

Cornbread 10/10

Ribs 2/10 was not giving what it needed was very dry and lacked flavour

Address: 16336 – 111 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 4G3 Canada
Review: Amazing BBQ place. Try the brisket, it is everything I love about brisket. Meaty, greasy, rich, and filling. Reasonable portions, good beer menu, and stunningly clean washrooms. I'll be back.

Address: 16336 – 111 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 4G3 Canada
Review: Wow!! What a hidden delight! Found this place by mistake and so glad that we did. My husband and I started with some burnt ends which I only got a picture of after we were halfway finished. Then we decided on the large smoked meat platter with sides of Mac & cheese and dill pickle spears to share. The platter came with a large serving of smoked pulled pork, another large serving of smoked brisket, a large piece of smoked chicken, about 4 or 5 large smoked ribs, a smoked sausage, two pieces of cornbread, and four bbq sauces, along with our two sides that we ordered. Everything was delicious!!! The coolest part was this was part of Princess Auto and the menu had a brief description of Princess Auto's history on the top - so neat. The atmosphere was a cozy industrial setting with lots of seating and the waitresses were friendly and attentive. We will definitely be returning!!!

Address: 10569 97th Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L7 Canada
Review:
My 2nd time here. I came back because the food was excellent the 1st time. However, this experience was so bad. I called at 4:30 for pickup and was told it would be ready at 5:30. Upon arrival the only thing that was ready were 2 appetizers. I ended up waiting until 6:30. I checked my order before the server packed it and 2 of the dishes were wrong. Then an argument ensued where I was told I had ordered red curry. I ordered Matsuman, etc. Finally, the server realized she was wrong and had to go back to the kitchen and re-order, thus more waiting. By the time I got the Massaman curry, everything else was ice cold. And then when we started eating, not only was everything cold, all of it was disgusting. Overcooked/ mushy, bland, oily and 1 order was still wrong. Plus, I paid extra for 2 coconut rice and got 2 steamed rice. Fried eggs mysteriously appeared on the #18 Pad-ka-pow; shrimp stir fry. What a fiasco. Doubt I will be returning. My observations while waiting were that the restaurant is lacking proper management, the kitchen is understaffed, the existing staff/ servers/ etc, are not trained, thus there is extremely poor efficiency.
Please see food photos: 1:  I'm not sure what this was supposed to be? It was overcooked shrimp & chicken floating in oil. 2: steamed rice. 3: Menu item #9: Yum; glass noodle salad with shrimp (it had no onions or shrimp or dressing, or peanut sauce dressing that is supposed to come with it) 4: oily spring rolls. 5: menu item #18; Pad Ka Pow. Overcooked, mushy and bland. 6: Matsuman Curry (this was good). This cost me $100, plus I left a 20% tip. Very disappointing!

Address: 10569 97th Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L7 Canada
Review: Their soup was very good. Great service as well. Healthy portions as we had tons of left over

Address: 10569 97th Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L7 Canada
Review:
My first Thai food experience was here at their previously smaller location in Chinatown over ten years ago. This location is much larger and beautifully decorated.

It was great to see Boualuong still in business after the pandemic where many others have not reopen. They are a mom and pop shop who quietly work diligently over the years dishing out some amazing food. Tonight, our group of friends had the privilege to enjoy another great spicy Tom yum soup, original Pad thai without ketchup, delicious green curry and a mango salad. The food was amazing and the portions were generous.

They were understaff with only one server but she and the owner were able to service our large group, plus two other large tables with a smile, grace and pride you would find in any South East Asian home.

When you walk around chinatown, you know the struggle these restaurant owners are going through. By me choosing to eat at this terrific restaurant despite what is going on in this neighborhood, that should tell you how much I enjoy the experience of eating here.

It is a gem for those who recognize this hole in the wall and it was busy as usual here at Boualuong.

Address: 10569 97th Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L7 Canada
Review: If I could give this place 10 stars I would, the service, the food. Out of this world. Laos and this food with so much flavor.  I can't think of a more delicious restaurant

Address: 10569 97th Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L7 Canada
Review: I had a great experience eating here. The green curry with the coconut rice was amazing and the gold bags were yummy yummy. Huge thank you to our server Carmen! She was extremely helpful and caring towards me and I will definitely be coming back.

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review:
I came to this restaurant for lunch, and it was an amazing experience! We sat at the bar, and were welcomed by our server working at the bar.

Service and atmosphere was amazing. Food was fairly good, I highly recommend getting the chips and onion dip for the sides.

We ordered the breakfast sandwich, and their beef dip. Both without any cheese.

Food was good, nothing too crazy. Next time, I will definitely be trying their chicken sandwich, because it looks amazing.

Overall a good place to try!

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review:
Pals is a really great spot! Their staff were super friendly and welcoming.

The sandwiches were great. The chicken sandwich and beef dip were both flavourful and made with quality ingredients. The cheesy fries were also great and filling!

The dill pickle soup was good, but a bit too spicy! It’s definitely worth a try if you like dill and spice.

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: This was by far one of the best sandwiches we've had here in Edmonton. We tried both the Cuban and the meatball sandwich. The Cuban was delicious with great toppings and the meat used was excellent. The meatball sandwich was also one of the best I've had. The meatballs were so good that I kinda wished they had spaghetti meatballs on the menu! The only thing that could be better would be to use a smaller bread. I found the bread too thick. Could have also used a bit of extra sauce. The sandwiches were $19 with side fries. The fries were also really good and a large portion too. For me personally I don't like when the fries are unpeeled so I didn't eat all of them but they were still really good.

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: First time Customer!  Had to try their Meatballs Sub with House Salad and Saskatoon Lemonade!  Presentation was spectacular, waiting was very minimal, and the experience was awesome!  Thank You Robbie for providing a mouthwatering delicious product!  A perfect lunch on a Sunday!  Get their as I highly recommend it!  Again, Thanks Robbie!

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: This is the place you go when you're seriously craving a good sandwich! We ordered their cheese fries, beef dip, hoagie, and s'mores pie. We both tried their craft saskatoon lemonade. They had a delicious soup of the day and their fries were solid. The lighting was intimate as we came an hour before close. Our server was great and he was telling us how they make the bread, soup, and meats from scratch! We were considering trying the Reuben but they had run out of that and their foccacia earlier on that day. We probably would ahve been more than fine just with soup and sandwich - but they did so well as leftovers. Looking forward to next time!

Address: 8026 118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5B 0R8 Canada
Review:
Good food and flavours. A little bit pricey but still good to try their Colombian and Venezuelan dishes. Friendly staff and clean place.
The Bandeja Paisa is big and worthy. The beef soup is a little bit expensive for the size and I was expecting a stronger flavour. The tequeños were too salty, I have tried them before there but this time was way too much salty. The empanadas are delicious and their salsas are marvellous

Address: 8026 118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5B 0R8 Canada
Review: This was my first time trying Venezuelan food and it was extremely delicious.  We had the arepas which were stuffed full and topped with cheese.  The service was excellent and by the time we had finished paying the table had been cleared and sanitized.

Address: 8026 118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5B 0R8 Canada
Review:
I been here about 4 times. I always get the tripe soup. Its really good. Staff are always nice to me.

Something about that soup I just love and staff are always nice 👌

Address: 8026 118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5B 0R8 Canada
Review: This place is wonderful! The food is delicious, the sauces, unbelievably tasty, the service is friendly, and nearly everything is gluten free! Thank goodness for serendipity - we found it quite by accident. ¡Gracias a díos!

Address: 8026 118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5B 0R8 Canada
Review: Excellent service, very clean and the food was so tasty!!  The arepas and fried cassava are a must try, and the platter can easily feed 4-5 people.

Address: 21F Kingsway Garden Mall NW Edmonton, AB T5G 3A6 Canada
Review: Awful, I  had food from here years ago and was quite good. I honestly can't believe how bad it was 2 days ago. A piece of soggy skinned chicken that was undercooked so I couldn't eat it. Cabbage rolls were dried right out and had a taste I can't identify. I ate 2 perogies off my almost 15 dollar plate. So disappointing as I had a quick craving for Ukrainian food. Never again. I'll make my own.

Address: 21F Kingsway Garden Mall NW Edmonton, AB T5G 3A6 Canada
Review: I used to live in Edmonton and my friends and I were talking about our favourite restaurants. When I brought up Shumka, everyone agreed! I lived on Jasper Ave and had to take 3 buses to get there, but it was well worth it. Now I live in the US and it would be several more buses I'd have to take, but I'll tell ya what: it would be worth it. The food is delicious, abundant and fresh. Someone is using their Baba's recipes and it shows.

Address: 21F Kingsway Garden Mall NW Edmonton, AB T5G 3A6 Canada
Review: Definitely could be better or easier ordering wise. But the nice lady helped me through and the food was delicious especially after only having the typical fast food for the past week. Went back for seconds. Highly recommend

Address: 21F Kingsway Garden Mall NW Edmonton, AB T5G 3A6 Canada
Review:
Came here this morning and got 4 items. I really enjoyed and lady was very nice to me. I been here many times and I always enjoyed it.

I liked the sausage and cabbage roll

Address: 21F Kingsway Garden Mall NW Edmonton, AB T5G 3A6 Canada
Review: Grew up on Ukrainian food, and this is a sad attempt at it. Confusing order options and maybe using cheemo perogies? Sausage also wasn't very good. Not at all happy with this whole experience and wouldn't order again.

Address: 10416 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2 Canada
Review: We went for drinks on a holiday weekend afternoon. The place wasn't too packed, we were sat right away. The waitress was very polite and checked in frequently. I had the chicken and waffles. It was delicious! Opt for tater tots as your side instead of fries, you won't be disappointed.

Address: 10416 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2 Canada
Review:
I had amazing baked salmon cake!!
It was way better than I expected but it could be little spicy for some people. The sauce was very tasty too.
My sister had chocolate cake and she said it was one of the best chocolate cake she ever had!
I wanted patio seat but it was too hot today so if I’ll visit here again to sit at the patio😂

Address: 10416 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2 Canada
Review:
Great spot.  The menu has great options, and the service is great.  If the Oilers are playing, it will be on live.
I like kick in my food, but for most, it would be a 5.  The Caesar salad I had was above average, and that's always a good thing.

Address: 10416 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2 Canada
Review:
Food was ok. Best food Super bowl & Ceasar sald fantastic 😋
Jack fruit sandwich & 🌮, french fries too much salt
Great server.

Address: 10416 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2 Canada
Review: My wife and I decided to try Malt & Mortar for our date night. We were greeted immediately by our server Jeffrey. He was attentive, helpful with advice and opinions, and friendly. I had the blackened chicken sandwich, which absolutely delicious, my wife had the chicken and waffles which she thoroughly enjoyed. The atmosphere was pleasant and the beer selection was top notch. Would highly recommend this establishment to anyone and will definitely be returning in the future. 10 out of 10.

Address: 10004 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1R3 Canada
Review: Fantastic place to eat after a long day! Service was so kind and friendly and the food was fantastic with great portions. Highly recommend!

Address: 10004 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1R3 Canada
Review:
There are no burgers here. Craft beers at a 16oz can be found.  It is pricey here the new $22 plate is the old $15 dollar plate.

Reservation made. Although we were missed on the first drink order as another table sat down after us and had their drink order taken before ours which we sat 5mins before them. Me a bit like okay thats why i do reviews.

Food. Seems or actually is very tasty. Made to perfection.  Portion sizes. Well small. The tenderloin buttery soft to cut with a butter knife.  Jamaican curry goat flavourful. But small 3-4 pieces of goat noticed.  Duck wings. Seemed dry but is that normal for duck wings. They did have flavour. Just had that dry bone and flavour to them.

Beer.  Well a great selection of crafts at a 16oz pour.

Women will love this place. Guys will walk away with i wish they had more food options. Take your dare here. But keep your own guy thoughts to yourself. And move on for guys.

Address: 10004 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1R3 Canada
Review:
What a place!! They make almost everything on their menu in-house (with exception to some ice cream flavours), which means everything you eat from the bread, to the sauces, to the green onion cakes, are all made here!
The food is mouth-watering just from reading the menu, and every bite is so good that we wound up licking the plates. Emphasis on plates. We came in for just a snack and wound up ordering more than we bargained for!
There are also a diverse amount of local Canadian brewed drinks. Great sour and porter menus, and various flight options to choose from.

They’re coming up on their 10 year anniversary and have truly mastered their crafts! 100% recommend popping in any time for a delightful experience!

Address: 10004 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1R3 Canada
Review:
Potentially the greatest bar experience I've ever had. Wasn't sure what to expect from this literally underground tap but they had amazing tasting beer from places throughout Canada, impeccable appetizers, delicious meals, and decadent desserts. Our host was super nice and even helped with some tough decisions on picking the best options!
10/10 will visit again

Address: 10004 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1R3 Canada
Review: Went for some dinner and drinks after work before a show and had a good time! The beer menu is extensive and had local options as well as other Canadian craft brewers. I had the ahi tuna bowl as a main, which was tasty, as well as a poutine and nachos to start. The Thursday special was nachos for $10, which was a good deal as they were quite big and very tasty. Our waiter was nice but told us some misleading info about happy hour, but nothing major (he said all beers were $6 when it is really only select beers for that price). Overall, a good experience at a Downtown pub!

Address: 3440 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 5X5 Canada
Review: Got there right when it opened at noon. Already a line to get in which is a good sign. A large selection of items. We ordered the sliced noodles with beef, rolling noodles in sour and spicy soup with pork, and the hand pulled noodles with beef and beef bone soup. The noodles were excellent quality and taste but the beef bone broth was basic if not a bit bland. The braised beef pieces were perfectly tender. It was the lunch rush and orders were slow coming out of the kitchen and mistimed at tables. Service was adequate.

Address: 3440 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 5X5 Canada
Review: I haven't been to northern China but now i am sure i could eat there very happily . They gave a free can of pop as it was their anniversary.  The noodles were delicious, chewy noodles with savoury pork in chile sauce, clearly a solid dish enjoyed by millions, it was perfection. The dumplings felt handmade, the wrap was thick enough to feel like i was eating noodles with the pork. The pork burger was a surprise hit, full of flavour and the bun looked thick but surprisingly light, clearly handmade.  Don't expect great service, its not about show here. It's clearly about the food, I wouldn't want it any other way. Great pricing.

Address: 3440 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 5X5 Canada
Review: Delicious, fresh homemade noodles that are bursting with flavour and legitly authentic Northern Chinese Noodles. There is no fusion here, this is as pure as it gets.

Address: 3440 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 5X5 Canada
Review:
Visit: February 2023

Been wanting to visit Noodle Feast for a very long time and finally had the chance. I was hoping to get the hand pulled noodles, but having arrived around an hour before closing, they were sold out 😭

Instead I got the cumin fried sliced noodles with beef. The dish was quite good and flavourful. I just feel like there was a little bit too much grease for myself personally (my other friends did not have this issue).

The restaurant and food had an authentic feel to it which was nice.

I'll have to go back to try more food there!

Address: 3440 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 5X5 Canada
Review: Visited Edmonton over the weekebd and decided to have some noodle for lunch. Great authentic dinning experience. Showed up at opening hour and already a Hugh lineup ahead of us waiting. I remembered it was just like that 10 years ago when they first opened up. Hard to believe they are still popular like this nowadays.

Address: 3735 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review: Beautiful spot with delicious food. Not only does the place look nice but the food is super tasty and delicious! Staff were friendly and ready to server at a moments notice! Great customer service! One of the best food I’ve tasted and will definitely come back!

Address: 3735 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review: Ordered take out, first time. Ever since moving from Toronto. This has got to be my first time experiencing good Korean food. Thank you for the delicious food. Will def order again soon.

Address: 3735 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review:
My recent dining experience at Hanjan's South location was pleasant. As soon as we entered, we were welcomed and seated within a few minutes into the tastefully patio-like decorated ambiance, with string lights and dimmed lighting.

The menu was extensive, with a variety of vegetarian options available that were just as tasty as the non-vegetarian ones (Look at the online menu for vegan options!). Personally, I would recommend their spicy rice cake, which consisted of chewy rice cakes and fish tofu. The crispy tofu with soy-ginger sauce is also a must-try option on their vegan online menu.

I also ordered a London fog tea; it was fragrant and soothing with the perfect blend of Earl Grey tea, vanilla, and steamed milk. I couldn't go without trying their mango bingsu. It comes with a copious amount of sweet and juicy mangoes, stacked over a bed of shaved ice and topped with condensed milk. It's perfect for anyone with a sweet tooth. The only downside of my experience was that at times I felt rushed by the service merely from the number of times the waister/waitresses visited my table.

Address: 3735 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review:
Visit: April 2023

Visited Hanjan for a party. The staff was quick and accommodating. The restaurant is also very nice and has great vibes, with nice decor that is very comforting.

Shared a lot of food between 3 of us:
- Kimchi Fried Rice is pretty standard, good flavour. Not a ton of meat, but price wise it's pretty decent
- Bulgogi Fries are amazing. Fries are very fresh, the sauce has good depth, and pairs well with the meat. Highly recommend this as a appetizer
- Grilled Pork Belly was good as well. When it comes to pork belly, this is one of the better places I've had it. The pieces are marinated and grilled well. There's a good amount there as well for the price (got the full size order)
- They provide Sides as well which include kimchi, bean sprouts, pickled radish, and a mashed potato. These pair well with some of the dishes
- Bulgogi Udon is pretty standard too like the kimchi fried rice, nothing too special here. But the noodles are cooked well and are flavourful with hints of beef
- Army Stew (budae jjigae). I love army stew, and this one is pretty good as well. They include instant noodles which is a nice touch. Good amount of meat in the mix too, but wish there was more tofu
- Cheese Corn was alright. For some reason I tasted a bit of Mexican spices/flavours in there which threw me off a little
- Tequila shots (patron) was surprisingly well priced in restsurant/bar standards at $4 a shot. Was smooth going down too

Overall everything above split between 3 people was about $48 before tip, which is pretty good considering what we got.

The prices here are a bit higher than other Korean restaurants I've been to, but is still quite good in general, and I find myself coming back from time to time

Address: 3735 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review:
The ambiance is great, the servers were friendly. Beef bulgogi was good, and as per my son, the rice is great! Until they served us our most awaited fried chicken, only to find out it was partially cooked. I think it's a cardinal rule to all restaurants to make sure the chicken is well cooked to prevent spread of diseases such as Salmonella. I was surprised and disappointed that they forgot about this. This is just a big no.
This happened during Mother's Day dinner, and it seems like they weren't prepared enough to how busy it will get. They should have anticipated it and not compromise the quality and safety of the food they serve.

Address: 16518 100 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5P 4Y2 Canada
Review: We had dinner on a Sunday and I would say coming in an hour before closing will be a tight call. It got busy but 10-20 minutes wait is manageable as long as you’re not hungry. By far, I love their service. Very friendly staffs. Even love their menus. First time trying their Japanese Cream Soda and it was just ok. Ordered to satisfy our curiosity. Their soups as always are superb. Very filling and served in a big bowl. I’ll keep coming back here. Price is reasonable too for the quantity and quality. Clean restaurant as well.

Address: 16518 100 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5P 4Y2 Canada
Review:
Not bad tonkotsu ramen.

The noodles were good, the meat was tasty, but broth wasnt up to par.

The broth wasnt bad per say, it could have been much better but it was ruined due to the abundance of beansprouts.
Every sip is an aftertaste of beansprouts.

They're also pretty cheap on toppings, the pork only had two thin slices and egg was only half of one? For this price?
The only generous topping was beansprouts, which again I say, ruined the broth.

However the resturant eastern atmosphere is very nice along with anime songs blasting, definitely how I would like to eat my ramen

Address: 16518 100 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5P 4Y2 Canada
Review: Food was great but it definitely seemed like they were understaffed as it took a really long time to be seated and have our order taken. I do recommend trying the ramen here. People were getting pretty upset about the wait time so that had an impact on the atmosphere. But I do think in normal circumstances when they are fully staffed that it would be a good atmosphere. I really like the decorations and you get sesame to grind up and put in your ramen which is cool.

Address: 16518 100 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5P 4Y2 Canada
Review: My husband and I loved our first visit here! We went right at the opening on a Saturday and the single front of house staff was amazing! We were seated right away, along with the other 10-15 customers and received our food within 10 minutes. We had the fried dumplings to start and both a bowl of ramen. The dishes were delicious and we will definitely go back to try more of their soups.

Address: 16518 100 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5P 4Y2 Canada
Review: The service is good, atmosphere is 3/5, food is 2/5. Although the service staff was friendly and fast I don't believe the food is up to par and the food is expensive for the portions you get.

Address: 10712 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 2A7 Canada
Review: Came here from reading all the great reviews online. It's good. Definitely a historic eatery in Edmonton. Walls are lined with articles, photos, and lots of memorabilia, definitely dig the old school vibe. The service is top-notch--staff is friendly and welcoming. Food and the value are decent. Was expecting bigger portions, but the prices are inexpensive. Definitely worth a visit. (For the Americans, the sign says they take Discover Card, but mine was declined!)

Address: 10712 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 2A7 Canada
Review: Absolutely amazing food and service here. Very cool atmosphere, old school diner feel. The servers are awesome, my server both times was Angie, and she’s so friendly and great customer service. Very authentic 🙌🏻😊

Address: 10712 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 2A7 Canada
Review: An Edmonton institution. It's a classic sort of diner that offers basic breakfast and lunch options for some of the lowest prices you'll see these days (although the prices have gone up along with everything else post-pandemic). I love the vibes here. Very unpretentious and welcoming place and they offer some kitschy but entertaining musical acts on the weekends. I feel like more of a true Edmontonian now that I've visited the Commodore!

Address: 10712 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 2A7 Canada
Review:
Our favourite greasy spoon. It took a while but Dave (the cook/owner) got my brekkie absolutely perfect. And I’m picky lol

Angie is our favourite server in the city and always makes us feel special. Everyone needs to eat at this time capsule.

Address: 10712 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 2A7 Canada
Review: Love this place. They had music playing when I went for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and the musician was really good! I had the Mushroom Swiss burger and it was delicious! I will definitely be back here!

Address: 10991A 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H9 Canada
Review: Such delicious and authentic food and for great prices. Also the staff were phenomenal! We went with a fairly high maintenance group of 8 and he took his time answering everyone's questions and orders. Also we loved the Latin food store in the back of the restaurant too! We will definitely be coming back.

Address: 10991A 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H9 Canada
Review: Been here many times for their taco Tuesday special ($2 a taco). Authentic Mexican tacos, they are seasoned well and flavourful. Great selection of salsa’s to try, from mild-extra hot. Service is ok, a bit slow. We were forgotten about a few times & our server would forget to refill our waters after asking a couple times.

Address: 10991A 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H9 Canada
Review:
Visit: April 2023

Visited El Mariachi and it was great! I got the enchiladas, which was pretty filling! It tasted pretty good as well, though the chicken was a bit dry.

I did also have some of the birria tacos (only available on weekends) and those were superb. Extremely hot, fresh, and crispy. The dipping sauce was also very flavourful, so I'd highly recommend it!

I also had the carne asada tortas which I bought home and ate the next day and wow was the carne asada meat amazing!! Extremely tasty and works well with the creaminess of the avocado.

When dining in, they gave some free chips with sauce. The service was a bit slow, but they made everything fresh.

The atmosphere is also great. There's so much decorations and everything just felt really unique and authentic! There's also a mini store inside where you xna purchase Mexican goods

Overall, highly recommend, especially the birria tacos and tortas

Address: 10991A 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H9 Canada
Review: Honestly, amazing authentic Mexican cuisine! I've never had real authentic Mexican food before, such as enchiladas and mole, and I was so amazed by the deliciousness of the food!! Totally blew me away. The prices were really great too, and the waiter told us about $2 tacos on Tuesdays (before 6pm)!

Address: 10991A 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H9 Canada
Review: I just had my first experience at this restaurant and let me tell you, it was amazing! The food was really close to authentic Mexican food and our waitress was super friendly. We ordered carne asada, tortas, and quesabirrias and everything was so delicious. It did take about 35 minutes to get our food, but the menu does mention that some dishes take longer to prepare. Overall, we are definitely going back. I'm excited to try more dishes and they even told us that on Tuesdays, all the tacos are only $2! Can't wait to go back and try more.

Address: 16907 127 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 0T1 Canada
Review: Visited this quite authentic place for dinner with another couple and we were recommended to share a platter "Memphis feast" which had plenty of choices and quantity of food for a solid leftover lunch for one person. Owner was great in creating laid back atmosphere and treating us with some amazing desert! I will definitely go back very soon!

Address: 16907 127 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 0T1 Canada
Review: Lunch was excellent. The service was outstanding and very pleasant, The restaurant is clean and the food was just the best 👍 I would recommend taking your family and enjoying the outside patio.

Address: 16907 127 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 0T1 Canada
Review:
Outstanding guys, super friendly.  Awesome food,  massive portions! And great atmosphere..... I'll Be Back!
A must "go to" in Edmonton

Address: 16907 127 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 0T1 Canada
Review: What a GEM! We’ve known this restaurant was here for years but never took the time to visit. We stopped for lunch and turns out it’s fantastic. The service is phenomenal! We were greeted immediately and provided with friendly, prompt, and passionate service. It’s clear the owners care about their product and customers very much! The food was amazing. The wings were on special and we had lunch features from the menu. Everything had that distinct smoky barbecue flavour you go for and the sides were incredible. You’ve got to try the fries! My child was treated so well by the staff. We will be going again for the food and the service. What a wonderful experience!

Address: 16907 127 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 0T1 Canada
Review: It was nice when we walked in, felt very welcome. Having not been for awhile I was very surprised with the prices. Lunch was good and the fries were excellent. You wait on yourself so you are up and down at times asking for what is not on the table, salt & pepper, ketchup. The brisket and rib ends were tender, BBQ sauce the best.

Address: 11806 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0C1 Canada
Review: I love their sushi. Their design for each roll and the taste were awesome. We ordered Dynamite, Cheesy dragon, Mango fry, TNT, and California roll and all of them were so delicious. But, I expect more friendly behaviour from the waitress!

Address: 11806 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0C1 Canada
Review:
Really nice place! Food was delicious and we had a great time there.
We order cold Sake and it was amazing too. Staff was really nice too. We’ll be back soon.

Address: 11806 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0C1 Canada
Review:
I frequent this restaurant quite a bit and I am always amazed by the quality of food.

Today we went for my sisters birthday and had an amazing time as usual! Today was particularly amazing due to our waiter, Aidan, who made us feel very welcomed and tended to! He made sure that everything was to our liking and made pleasant conversation that made the dinner feel welcoming.

The food was delicious and has great value for its price. Even when the place is busy, we still got served quickly and had a great time. I couldn’t recommend it enough.

Address: 11806 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0C1 Canada
Review: Low key family dinner. Food was excellent and our server, Logan was attentive and helpful. Had a relaxed night out. Took off one star for the bakudan roll, too much tempura bits and overshadowed the spicy tuna. New style sashimi, tuna tataki are highly recommended.

Address: 11806 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0C1 Canada
Review: Excellent fusion Japanese food in Edmonton! Great drinks, sushi, appys and dessert. Came on a week night and it was packed so reservation is recommended. I really liked the premium nigiri plate which consist of 3 pieces of blue fin tuna (akami, chutoro and otoro) and 3 pieces of aburi nigiri, other than that, wagyu beef was also very good and melts in your mouth after cooking table side, save room for dessert! $$$$ slightly on the pricy side about 100 dollars per person spent including drinks and dessert.

Address: 13727 127St NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review:
Service, atmosphere and food were all really good. We were greeted and seated promptly. The server explained the dishes we asked for. The food came quickly and everything was fresh and hot. Everything we ate tasted great.
The place has quite a bit of seating. We went there a bit early for dinner, so there weren't many people.
The washrooms were clean.

Address: 13727 127St NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: Absolutely delicious! Would definitely recommend for such a welcoming place! The food was all on point, and over the top amazing customer service.

Address: 13727 127St NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: The most weird and terrible restaurant EVER. I ordered the pork bone soup. Taste was basically super weird. If Koreans try this , they will know. Like the picture, I didn't even have soup at all. I just picked the meat out and ate it. and they didn't peel the potato off. On the top of that, employees were FIGHTING IN THE KITCHEN. The female server or kitchen staff kept SCREAMING OR CRYING. I don't think this was appropriate behavior in the restaurant where customers are. Or, I assume they made weird soup while they were fighting. It was seriously horrible experience in my life....... I don't actually understand why this restaurant has more than 4 stars rating on Google map. PLEASE DO NOT GO HERE. I want to remove this experience in my head to be honest............

Address: 13727 127St NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: We ordered soft tofu stew, beef bulgogi, rice cake and kid’s meal. We need to try the other dishes because we were not satisfied with the taste, maybe the other dishes are better.

Address: 13727 127St NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review:
Service was good but the food was just
OK for me. Everything was too heavy on the soy. The seafood pancake had a good amount of seafood but was strangley very egg-y in taste and texture.     I also was not impressed with how little banchan was provided, especially since you have to pay extra for it as it was not included with the meals. The picture I attached was how it was brought out, with 4 tiny pieces of radish in each dish. I did enjoy the corn cheese very much though.

Address: 4306-118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5W 1B2 Canada
Review: I wanted to update my review after visiting for a second time. The food here is amazing no matter what you order, everything is delicious. My personal favorite is the Swiss sandwich, the salty pretzel bun really adds so much flavor. This time I actually got to try the teacup cheesecake and although it was a bit smaller then expected it was sooo good. It has a sugar cookie bottom, with chocolate and cheesecake and also came with a fresh strawberry on top. Highly, highly recommend this place for lunch, dinner, a snack, anything. 😂😂

Address: 4306-118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5W 1B2 Canada
Review: This place is AMAZING!! I have a large family with young children and usually I walk into a cafe like this and I can hear the groans from the staff. Not here!!! We were welcomed literally with open arms!!! EVERYTHING here is scratch made to the highest standards and the food is TO DIE FOR!!! The cakes are truly European and just like Europe each item is sculpted with love and pride! The flavors were incredible and worth every penny we spent!! The coffee was also perfect I had a latte and it was exactly what I was looking for. My kids had the biscotti and although they were a little pricy they were huge lasted my kids 2 days so I can't grumble. Seriously though if you're in the area and want a coffee and a cake come here it's worth it!!!

Address: 4306-118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5W 1B2 Canada
Review:
I was so excited to visit Swiss 2Go Cafe last Sunday, finally I had a chance to go there. But it was disappointing.
I was expecting it to be busy on Sunday early afternoon, there were only a few people. The atmosphere wasn't welcoming. The employee wasn't friendly, he seemed impatient while I was browsing through the menu and bakery.
I heard of this cafe because of their famous cheesecake cup, so I ordered 1 to take home. I was shocked about the price, it was $20 for a little cheesecake?! Oh well, I still want to try and see why it's so famous.
That's the only one I bought, who knows how much it costs to buy other products.
I tried the blueberry lemon cheesecake, it tasted good, not super sweet like North America cheesecake. But it is dense and heavy, I only can have a few bites.  Then another few bites for the next day.
I think the products are over price, even tho they might be from oversea, but still.

Address: 4306-118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5W 1B2 Canada
Review: I have been coming here for the past 7 years since I was in high school lol best sandwiches in the city I love the female cook also has the same amazing energy every time I come in !! I got the Large Clubhouse with a Strawberry cheesecake so worth it and I’ll continue to eat here till I die or they close lol !!!

Address: 4306-118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5W 1B2 Canada
Review: The food here is always super impressive. The baking on display is amazing. Delicious sandwiches are 'out of the park' awesome. These sandwiches seriously defy gravity and logic. How can a sandwich piled so high with ingredients not become a mess on the plate? Everything holds together and i think the pretzel bun puts this meal on another level. I wish they still offered my favorite sandwich ( san rosa i think it was called ) that had swiss dry cured beef, hardboiled eggs, green apples and toasted nuts!! This is my shoutout in hopes of seeing it return😉 I love this place and go waaaaay out my local area to get swiss2go sandwiches. Special trips even🤣!! Cozy quiet shop to stop for a coffee and have one of the best sandwiches in the city.

Address: 10602 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review:
I have to be honest, the plan wasn't to eat here.  The original plan was to eat at a different hot pot place, but we didn't make reservations so couldn't get in.  At least that is what our friends said, they may have decided for us that this was the place to go.  We eat together quite often... I call them my taste buds.

I am glad we tried this place, and it is now on my list of excellent places to eat and chat.

Ambiance:
I'm not a fan of the big fans above each table - but I understand why they are needed, as it keeps the humidity down.  That much boiling liquid is bound to create humidity, but the air wasn't humid.  We could speak at a decent volume.

To the point:
Condiments:
The sesame sauce was pretty good.  It is a good indicator if the the food is going to good.

Soup base:
No one at the table complained.  I like spicy food, and the spicy base was perfect.  Flavorful with the right amount of heat.

Meat:
The lamb, pork and beef melt in you mouth.

Follow up:
I was worried I gave a glowing review and it was just a once off.  It wasn't.    It is my new go to place: day or night.

If you reading this and thinking where to eat, don't take my word for it... try it.

Address: 10602 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review:
I been regularly going there, this is the best hotpot place to go to hands down! As other mentioned in the reviews, don't let the exterior of the building deter you. Park and go inside, the atmosphere is completely a different one!

It is cozy inside, and there are a lot of options! Their staff are friendly. They bring you the menu and the options for your hotpot such as soup bases, noodles, meats, seafood, veggies, and more!

You cook your options right at the table, it is so much fun doing that! If you wanted more, you can always ask for more.

I tried other hot pot places, but this place still beats than any other ones!

Give this place a try! You won't be disappointed!

Address: 10602 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review: It was fun and delicious first experience with Chinese hot pot with my husband for his birthday. We don’t think we could eat a lot of food so we went for lunch instead of dinner. Price is reasonable per person and the potions are good size and well quality. Staffs are helpful and friendly. We definitely go back again! ( Photos are not all of what we get, I forgot to take the photo because I got excited! )

Address: 10602 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review: We had lunch here after driving up from Calgary and this place didn’t disappoint. Great value at $18 for lunch which comes with 6 items. That doesn’t sound like a lot but seriously most folks would have a challenge of finishing their meal. Powerful vents made a difference and since everyone gets their own hotpot it is a fun family experience.

Address: 10602 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review: Great place, hot pot was top notch! Love the all you can eat. I had the Szechuan broth which is never a miss. Only thing is they’re so busy if you need help with something it might be a little while until this notice you need help.

Address: 10011 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 0N8 Canada
Review: Ordered here last night for take out, and have been ordering or eating in for years. My must favorites are always peaches and shrimps, beef brisket in hot pot and soya sauce garlic chicken. The takeout service was fast after calling ahead of time. Price wise is decent, I suppose over the years prices have gone a bit up. I certainly will crave time and time again the food from here.

Address: 10011 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 0N8 Canada
Review:
Right next to hope mission ( women’s shelter place), the whole neighbourhood looks terrible, garage everywhere, homeless people sleeps on the street…

We ordered shrimp wonton soup, cantonese chow mein,thousand spicy chicken, they were very salty, and service is just ok. Definitely not going back. I’m done trying Chinatown. Disappointed every time!

Address: 10011 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 0N8 Canada
Review: DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE...For a $19.00 combo it comes with ginger beef and only 2, yes 2...non-edible chicken balls...literally hard as a rock with garbage meat.. then the rice is not even fried rice at all but just plain jasmine rice with a teaspoon of egg in it. Threw it all straight into the trash! 🤢

Address: 10011 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 0N8 Canada
Review: OG place for Chinese food, from one Asian to all the peeps! Well priced and well portioned and serve all my favourite traditional and more westernized Chinese dishes. They are open pretty late too so it’s always an option! They are located by the hope mission and some freaky people do come by, but the server aunties are really good at handling them and escorting them out, if they come in, in the most curt and fastest way so it’s really more of a people show than scary in my opinion. The gan chow niu he, stir fried flat rice noodles with beef, are so goood as well as basically any chicken dish and the beef brisket hotpot, curry or regular. Also you get this surprisingly delisciousss pork bone and vegetable soup to start for free. Do give it a try

Address: 10011 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 0N8 Canada
Review:
We had to have Happy Family when we stay in Edmonton. Food was fresh, hot and always tasty. We tried a couple new items today.
