Both were very good, the 'wok hay' on the beef chow fun was in believable. It's just a smell and taste you get if you are cooking in a traditional wok using Chinese cooking techniques.

I have to say we were impressed to say the least. So affordable, never fails All Happy Family rocks!

Address: 10582 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2W1 Canada
Review:
Lingnan serves up what I'd call old school Chinese food.  It's what I remember of American Chinese food from pre-2000.  They do it well. They also have the Edmonton famous "Hot and Dry Chicken" that went viral at their now closed sister outlet downtown called Chicken for Lunch.

The service is amazing. They're always so kind and helpful.

And the space is old... But in that dim space you can find such a sense of Chinese heritage adorning all the walls.

4 x 🍜🍜🍜🍜

Address: 10582 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2W1 Canada
Review: It's always lovely going to the Ling Nan. The service is always great, and the family is amazing. And the food is top notch with great serving sizes at a reasonable price. And I ALWAYS recommend the hot and dry spicy chicken!

Address: 10582 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2W1 Canada
Review:
First time at Lingnan! Just amazing, food and service. Amy herself came to chat and welcome us. When she heard I had celiac disease she made sure I knew to order instead of going for the buffet. She was as warm and cheerful as I remember from 20 years ago at Chicken For Lunch! The wait staff were all attentive, friendly and quick. The food was all amazing and our teens loved the buffet!

We were so busy enjoying we forgot to take food photos, so just have one of the Lego Lingnan near the door. Next time!

Address: 10582 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2W1 Canada
Review: Old school Chinese food in the capital city.   Classic menu dishes with fun cocktail list. Enjoyed the Lemon Chicken, Shanghai Noodles and House Special Fried Rice all with friendly and attentive service.  Definitely recommend for a fun family meal

Address: 10582 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2W1 Canada
Review:
A true hidden gem! You have to go to witness the real beauty of this place, at no point did I taste anything frozen and the buffet (5pm Fri-Sun) is only $30! Their drinks are also great and the enviroment is always friendly and eager to take those dirty dishes from the table haha.

Would 1000% recommend!

Address: 7230 Argyll Road Edmonton, AB T6C 4A6 Canada
Review: Wow wow wow food. Specially butter chicken and teriyaki chicken noodles 🍝

Address: 7230 Argyll Road Edmonton, AB T6C 4A6 Canada
Review: Service great. Food cold. Went for mothers day. $40 per adult. Reservation at 10. Buffet not ready. No eggs on buffet line only eggs Benedict on a made to order basis. English muffin made with a toaster on a made to order basis. Muffin overtoasted so hard as a rock! Ever hear of shafing dishes? No omelette station. Not worth the money. Will never go back.

Address: 7230 Argyll Road Edmonton, AB T6C 4A6 Canada
Review: I have been going here for 16 years.  I took my wife and mother in law here to celebrate Mothers Day, what a mistake.  The buffet was horrible, for a special event there was little effort put in to it.  All of the items were greasy and lacked any sort of flavour.  The bill for this was $140, we will not be returning. Thank you for making our day special.

Address: 7230 Argyll Road Edmonton, AB T6C 4A6 Canada
Review: This is now the Argyll Pub. Good food and friendly service. Daily specials.

Address: 7230 Argyll Road Edmonton, AB T6C 4A6 Canada
Review: The steak was delicious and chelsey is a delight to have as a server I always say the food is only as good as the service and both were excellent thank you chelsey for being such a nice happy server it was a wonderful experience !

Address: 12620E - 132 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5L 3P9 Canada
Review:
Decided to try this place because I'm a serious fried chicken fan.

Ordered a the three piece meal with fries and soy garlic dipping sauce.

*****Service gets five stars
*****Hot fresh fries get five stars
*****Coleslaw (creamy with a touch of sweet) gets 5 stars
***Fried chicken gets three stars

Two of my three pieces of chicken were hot and juicy and had good crispiness (drumstick and wing) but the centre breast piece was a bit dry. Overall my main criticism is that the chicken didn't have much flavour. I expected to taste the herbs and spices, but it was a bit bland. Without the very tasty dipping sauce the chicken was underwhelming.

How does the chicken stack up against other places I've tried in the Edmonton area?:

#1  Mary Brown's (chicken and taters are fabulous)
#2  Swiss Chalet (when they have fried chicken available)
#3 Coco Deef Fried Chicken (its good, with quality sides, but a bit bland without the dipping sauce)
#4Jolibee (salty, but crispy and juicy; it's ok)
#5 Churches Chicken (kind of plain tasting, sides are meh)
#6 KFC (ok if served fresh, but that's rarely the case)
#7 Popeyes (not very good)

I will give Coco another try when I'm in the area.

Address: 12620E - 132 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5L 3P9 Canada
Review: I love their chicken. Crispy in the outside and very moist in the inside. Chicken has always been my comfort food, and they did satisfy my craving.  Best of all, they serve rice :-) Parking won't be a problem. Maybe it needs work on the interior design of the place to make it more appealing and inviting to eat. A personal favourite is the Snow Cheese and Honey Buttered Chicken. Staffs of the restaurant are very accommodating. Two thumbs up.

Address: 12620E - 132 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5L 3P9 Canada
Review: I love the fried chicken here! At my last visit, the staff took my order quickly and I didn't have to wait long for it to be ready. This is consistent with previous visits too. The sauce flavours are delicious, I especially like the garlic soy, and the chicken is juicy and tender with a delicious crunchy coating. It's not close to me so I don't have it often, but when I'm in the area I definitely stop by. I was just there recently and nothing has changed

Address: 12620E - 132 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5L 3P9 Canada
Review: The chicken from here is delicious. The down sides are : majority of chicken pieces are drums & wings 9/12 pieces , large fries is small. It’s comparable to everyone else’s medium at best. And last, they want you to order through their own App which is a pain to use. You have to wait for a code to be text to you to finish your order. There is also a user fee. The service from the store is good. Waiting time is appropriate for fresh chicken. Ample parking.

Address: 12620E - 132 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5L 3P9 Canada
Review: We absolutely love their unforgettable chicken! It was so crispy and juicy and the flavour was great! We quite had a feast since me and my friend were so hungry before coming here. You would definitely satisfy your chicken cravings here. The staff were super friendly and they were quick in getting our orders. I like their chicken so much, coco deep has then become one of my favorite chicken places.

Address: 13823 127th Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: Food was ok but nothing special. Some lacked flavor some were better. Expensive for what it is

Address: 13823 127th Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review:
Last minute decision to eat Chinese and it was the only place open later than 9pm in the north end. Nice bonus that it's a HK style cafe. Unfortunately there was little to no HK cafe style food on the menu. So we refered to the online menu which had it all listed.
Our food was really tasty and portions a bit skimpy but the prices were ridiculously high. $17.95 each for fried rice and fried noodles and almost $13 for a noodle soup! The food was good but not good enough to justify those prices. This being the only legit Chinese restaurant in the north, I can see why the prices are what they are but this will only deter me from the northside for Chinese. I will stick to Chinatown to get great Chinese food at a fair price in the future.

Address: 13823 127th Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: We frequent Chinese restaurants, especially HK style ones and this was the worst experience we've had by far. Ordered the barbecue duck soup noodles and the duck was basically all bones... Asked about it and they cut off two tiny pieces off the rear end of the duck... Awful service and the worst noodles we've had in Edmonton.

Address: 13823 127th Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review:
One of the rare HK-style cafes located in the city. The seating and the atmosphere sort of makes you feel like you are in Hong Kong /Vancouver.

There is a huge selection on the menu which may take several visits to try. Price is fair and food quality is alright (can't compare to HK though).

The only drawback to this place was the service. They were a bit disorganized; the servers seemed confused at times, and we had to ask two different servers before our food finally came.

Bottom line: don't expect the servers to be extra friendly or personal. It might be a bit of a cultural shock to some, but the edgy serving style is actually quite normal among most Hong Kong style restaurants around the world.

Address: 13823 127th Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: Misinformation on the website regarding delivery. Note to anyone considering delivery: It is $50 minimum for delivery, not the $35 for free delivery as advertised. Pricing makes it very awkward to order for 1 person. No delivery available for distances above 5km and the staffs were very uninformed. Dine in is okay for some nostalgia. Food is not bad but price is high. However, I will never consider Little Bee for delivery in the future ever again.

Address: 9112 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 0M7 Canada
Review:
We ordered a some non alcoholic beverages, one called the Wannabe which used ginger beer as the base. There was some pomegranate syrup and Seedlip Groove 42 (a mediterranean style distilled non alcoholic spirit). Quite sour and extremely herbal. The second was Pulp fiction. This used grapefruit juice as a base with anise and cardamom syrup with a grapefruit moon garnish. Sweet, delicate and delicious.

Had the fries to start, the fresh ground pepper at table side was a lovely touch and I very much enjoyed the spicy house made aïoli.

For the main course we ordered the mushroom toast, house made spicy chicken soup, and breakfast with Tiffany (avacado toast with poached eggs).

The mushroom toast had an egg yolk on top of various pan fried mushrooms and seasonings. With the micro greens as a garnish I felt like I was transported to the forest floor. So beautifully earthy and wonderfully herbaceous. An absolute win!

The breakfast with Tiffany was filling and refreshing. A small mason jar of fresh fruit was a perfect palate cleanser.

Cool touch with the phone chargers tastefully hidden at the table.

Address: 9112 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 0M7 Canada
Review: Pizzas are made fresh in house and delicious. The Carbona was fantastic. Long list of good cocktails and plenty of beer on tap. Nice patio for sunny days. Highly recommend for dinner or drinks.

Address: 9112 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 0M7 Canada
Review: Easily one of my favorite places to eat at in Edmonton. I’ve been here several times and even chose to celebrate my birthday here. Each time the staff was super friendly, the food delicious, and the cast iron pie amazing. I definitely recommend checking this place out.

Address: 9112 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 0M7 Canada
Review: Rebel never disappoints! Great atmosphere, happy hours, and delicious menu with lots of variety. The best part however, is definitely their hospitality. We went there yesterday for a birthday with twin babies and a toddler - and the manager and staff were incredibly accommodating. So awesome to have the option to still go to cool spots in the city that welcome families and allow us to dine out with kids in tow. Will definitely be back (and will be getting another slice of the confetti cake - delicious!)

Address: 9112 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 0M7 Canada
Review:
This place was great. Outside is deceiving as you feel like it’s a strip mall but once you’re inside it’s a whole new experience.

The staff are very outgoing and friendly and make the dinking experience great.

The food was great and reasonably priced with a great menu.

I would recommend stopping here for your next meal asap.

Address: 8015 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5B 0R7 Canada
Review: First time visit to this legendary establishment in the Cromdale area and left as one happy customer who will certainly return again; Warm welcome at the door and exceptional service at this family owned business with an extraordinary ambience! Portions are large and can easily be shared. The  Bar is well stocked and staffed. Given the proximity to the Coliseum and Expo Center and with K-Days, it was busy. On Sundays they close at 8pm; A take-out service is also available. Plenty of Oilers photos/paraphernalia for hockey fans in #YEG

Address: 8015 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5B 0R7 Canada
Review: I always order thier beef ribs. One of the few places in the city to make them. They are so delicious and worth every penny! If you a lover of beef, this is a must have. Excellent service too, always super friendly staff in a homey atmosphere. They've been around a long time and you can easily see why.

Address: 8015 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5B 0R7 Canada
Review: Absolutely love the food here! Super fair prices and the staff here are incredible, all very friendly and the service is great! We both got steaks and they came out extremely fast and cooked perfectly! Also the atmosphere here is great, I love the old timey feel when you come to Coliseum Steak and Pizza! Will be back!

Address: 8015 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5B 0R7 Canada
Review: Stopped in for an early dinner last week.  Food came out fast and was fresh and hot.  Service was wonderful, waitress was attentive, professional and polite.  Ordered steaks and each one was cook to proper type.

Address: 8015 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5B 0R7 Canada
Review: They have always been such a great place to go for a steak! I’ve been coming here for many years and they never fail! My blue rare steak is always cooked to perfection since I’ve been a teenager! 😊

Address: 540 Queen St Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review:
Great place to have dinner in downtown Fredericton. Perfect place for a date. A little pricey but it’s worth it. Friendly staff and good music.
The food is amazing and if you still have room for dessert, try their chocolate cake!

Address: 540 Queen St Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review:
Mussels is chipotle coconut milk broth was amazing.

She had rack of lamb, I had steak with gorgonzola demi glace,  both were great.

Nice wine selection  - we'll be back  !!

Address: 540 Queen St Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review: The staff was very friendly and very helpful with questions about the menu. I love the cheesecake; a definite must if you eat here.

Address: 540 Queen St Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review:
Cocktails were great, especially the Laphroaig based drink (can't remember the name). Was busy on a Saturday night, and just a few dishes were out.

Started with the shrimp & grits, it was outstanding. Slightly sweet in spots, slightly acidic in others, juicy shrimp, crispy bits, it was a well executed dish.

The pork belly on the other hand was a bit of a miss. Now while the pork belly was perfectly tender and easy to eat, the skin was basted with what tasted of Cattlemans BBQ sauce and it was accompanied by what can only be described as bottle Caesar dressing. The white sauce needs to go. The little round cakes on the dish were very dry (for all 3 of us who ordered it out of our group of 7). Corn was fine.  Crispy puffy skin, no BBQ just flaky salt would have made this dish great....even just a little 5 spice seasoned salt on the meat.

Would definitely come back for the cocktail though.

Address: 540 Queen St Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review:
Great atmosphere and food presentation was great .
I'd definitely go back.
Staff were friendly and portions were great.
I wasn't a huge fan of the steam buns. Wasn't enough flavour for me, but I have higher standards for Asian food.

The ceasar salad was delicious!!!

Thanks

Address: 462 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: Absolutely amazing! My partner and both loved our plates. We took the dinner for two deal and everything was delicious. Highly recommend.the drinks were super tasty and service was great :)

Address: 462 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: Food was good. Drinks and service were decent. The overall issue though, the whole time seemed pretty rushed, like asking if you've decided on dinner choices before even been asked for a drink. We will definitely try it again another night.

Address: 462 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: Excellent food! It was the best scallop I’ve ever had! Loved the shrimp, super tender.

Address: 462 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: Very nice and pleasant place. The staff are great and caring about your experience at the Palate and the food is delicious.

Address: 462 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review:
I have been here on Friday night lately for a dinner with my supervisor and my friends at around 6 pm. My suggestion is that you should make a reservation before hand as the place can get very busy on Friday.

For lunch, I found it is quite busy from Monday to Friday as well. You may need to book a table ahead of time to avoid disappointment.

The food is good. They always have specials of the day, which is not on the menu. Ask for them, most of the time they are surprisingly very good.

The price is good for the food quality and services.

The parking can be tricky during during the day for Monday to Friday as you have to pay for street parking. If they are full, you have to drive one more block and use the city’s parking lot (paid) and walk back to the restaurant. The street parking is free after 5 pm from Monday to Friday and all day on the weekends and holidays.

Address: 100 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: We ordered calamari, a couple of pasta dishes, and mini doughnuts to top it all off. Food was incredible!!! I highly recommend this place. I plan to come back and try other dishes.

Address: 100 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: What a great surprise ! It's was sooo delicious. Definitely,  it's a n amazing restaurant to try. Service was impeccable,  food was really hot and sooo good. It's worth the 5 stars.

Address: 100 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review:
The food was exquisite, cooked to perfection, spiced to light up your tongue.
The service was kind, we do need a reservation as it is quite busy, but the food was worth it and good quality to price.
I recommend the brie & artichoke dip entree and the Salmon piccata main dish!

Address: 100 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: As an Italian whose moved to Fredericton, I can say this restaurant is the real deal. Homemade tomato sauce, perfectly cooked pasta, and delicious appetizers. This will be a staple for us.

Address: 100 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review:
The whole visit here was wonderful.  The arrancini balls with Pesto fried rice and house made marinara sauce were so good, then I was brought over Rosemary Focaccia bread, crispy at that, with balsamic vinegar and olive oil with herbs, a very nice free offering.
Finished off with the Mushroom Ravioli, it was amazing.
The server I had was wonderful.
Great Gibeon a Thursday night.
Definitely recommend this place.

Address: 79 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review: WOW! Amazing amazing amazing, that’s all I can say. Fabulous eats and amazing cocktails in a small but quaint setting. The chefs change up the menu a bit but if you can get the pork belly, roasted cauliflower, or carpaccio - go for it! The most original food I’ve had in a restaurant in a long time.

Address: 79 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review:
Update: still awesome, revised menu items keep this place fresh.

Absolutely brilliant experience. All the dishes we tried were perfect with wonderful conversation with our bartender. We will definitely return to try more plates.

Address: 79 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review: Best food experience I’ve had in Fredericton. A bit pricey but definitely worth the visit. Try to get a seat inside, the outside is a bit rough. Maybe they could put some patio cushions down outside to spruce it up.

Address: 79 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review: Wow! I’ve lived in the maritimes for about 8 years and first time in Fredericton I’m a little surprised to find the best restaurant I’ve yet been to out east! The staff were so lovely and truly went above and beyond, the owner Jenny was very generous with her time to chat with me and share a bit about the place and her inspirations for the cocktails, and the food… wow! Nothing else to say really. Stunningly delicious and very memorable, even the small bites. I had the taco special which was phenomenal and the regular menu beef tostadas which were divine. All in all, truly a great experience. I will be recommending this place to everyone I meet!

Address: 79 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review:
Had the best dinner with my family here, didn’t book a reservation but happy we got there early because people packed in as it got later.

Each dish was made from extremely fresh (often local) ingredients.

Highly recommend the house pickles, beef tostadas and the brassica for appetizers. The portions aren’t that big but the flavours are!

For mains: The steak was a dream, and the pasta was cooked to perfection. I really enjoyed the salmon too, the potatoes that came with it had great flavour.

The dessert was unique, out of the three, I’d say that the home made peanut butter ice cream was the best, but the olive oil cake came a close second. if you are too full for dessert, you’d have to get their coffee. We loved it.

Staff were friendly and helpful, and we had a great time. A must try in this small town!

Address: 723 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 5N8 Canada
Review:
Stopped by on a maritime road trip. Tasty lobster roll, with huge chunks of lobster! The fries were crispy and not greasy.

The location is very homey and filled with memorabilia. Staff was friendly and even hosted us right before closing time!

Address: 723 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 5N8 Canada
Review: It was a smaller diner than i expected but you could it was a place that the locals hang out as most knew each other by name. The decor was like stepping back in time.  I enjoyed the cabin and would go back. The guy at the table next to me ordered a pancake and one pancake was the same size as the dinner plate. It was good value for the price. I had the steak and eggs.

Address: 723 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 5N8 Canada
Review: Stopped in for the lobster roll... Had to take a couple pics. Was full of lobster... So much that some fell out onto my plate as I was eating. Delicious and worth every penny. One of the best I've ever had.

Address: 723 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 5N8 Canada
Review: Food was excellent. Good tasting and good size portions. Lobster pieces as big as my thumb. The Cabin is literally a cabin on the side of the road, license plates on the wall and old time music boxes at each table. A step back in history.

Address: 723 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 5N8 Canada
Review: It was good but nothing out of the ordinary. Big Stop Irving, much better. I heard great reviews about the place, but my experience was not so great.  Very friendly staff.  Very run down and dirty.  The bathroom had what appeared to be old chip fryer finger tip deep grease in the grout lines of the flooring. You could wipe it out with your finger like it was placed there on purpose.  Old cabin feel and run down 2 very different things.  This place needs a deep clean.

Address: 253 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2H8 Canada
Review: An absolute must to go eat at. Very friendly people, amazing tasting and presentful food, and good atmosphere.

Address: 253 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2H8 Canada
Review: I wasn't hungry enough to warrant a full buffet, so I opted for a combination plate. The Chinese food was okay, not the best I have ever had, but good. I didn't really like the ribs, so I wouldn't order them again. Nice selection of white wine, but not a great red wine list. Service was fantastic and our server was really friendly and helpful.

Address: 253 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2H8 Canada
Review: INCREDIBLE! Snow Crab in the buffet. My girlfriend loved the Curry noodles, I loved the wings. There is lots of variety for a Chinese buffet and the dessert at the buffet was incredible. Chinese

Address: 253 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2H8 Canada
Review:
Food was a lot, 3 or even 4 can order the "Dinner for 2" special, it is a lot of food, kids portion are huge too! Food is good, less sweet for the chicken balls might be nice. Staff was friendly our server was a very nice madame, she was very helpful and easygoing, provide info about the plates and suggested the plates for the kids. She was amazing. We visited about 4-5 after dinner we do not have anything else during that day and we even had leftovers. Food was a lot...

Must try their Ribs, really good.

Address: 253 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2H8 Canada
Review: 10/10 experience! The food was AMAZING, and huge huge portions! The staff were all amazing as well, fast and genuinely happy to serve all guests!

Address: 546 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E6 Canada
Review:
I'm so glad we came here for lunch while we were in Fredericton. This is one of the best meals of our trip. The mussels we started with were amazing!

They have many gluten free options, I wouldn't have guessed the pasta I had was gluten free, it was that good!! I asked about the spiciness level of the carbonara sauce and the waitress had them tone it back for me, it was perfect.

We packed up half of our entrees to go so we would have room for dessert, I'm so glad we did because the creme brulee was perfection.

Address: 546 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E6 Canada
Review:
Top dining in Fredericton.
Excellent service and perfectly prepared dishes. Flavours are excellently matched and presented.
Lamb, and duck are on the menu.
Good selection of wines and liqueurs, pairing is offered.
The restaurant is up a steep flight of stairs, and the restaurant is lighting is dim.
Street parking
Always and extra star for crème brule. 🌟

Address: 546 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E6 Canada
Review:
One of the best meals I've had! The carbonara linguini is amazing.

The bread came with butter molasses which I've never tried before, what a delicious surprise that was.

Finished off with the tasty apple turnover.

Yummm

Address: 546 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E6 Canada
Review: Excellent atmosphere and staff. I had the Brewbakers Spicy Pie which was a Korean flatbread pizza. The kimchi was spicy and perfect and the pork loin was a great addition to the overall dish.

Address: 546 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E6 Canada
Review: All-round enjoyable experience, friendly personable staff, second floor patio, amazing food and paired beverage suggestions.

Address: 1034 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review: This is my second time at the Hilltop and the staff there is incredible, always friendly and accommodating. I was served about an hour before closing by Alicia (Alisha?) and she regularly checked in on my table and was very friendly. The food was hot and very delicious! We were told it was a 45 minute wait but we definitely got served quickly regardless, much less than 45 minutes! I thank all the staff for making this a great experience.

Address: 1034 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review:
Good atmosphere and pleasant wait staff. Unfortunately, we ordered draft beer and it wasn’t cold. Wings were great but ordered the seafood soup and our bowls weren’t even half full and it lacked seafood, $15/bowl. When it was mentioned, we were told that that is a common complaint from other patrons.
Nothing was done to correct it, probably wouldn’t return.
Overall it was ok.

Address: 1034 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review: We love coming here! Never disappoints. Very large restaurant, with lots of seating. The food is always great and the portions we've always been happy with. Personal favourites are the lamb burger and the Goat cheese, Cranberry, and Pecan salad. I can't have goat cheese and they substitute it for feta no problem :)

Address: 1034 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review: The steak was delicious, garlic mash was unreal, and the service was excellent. Kiddo and Mama loved the place and the food. It was homey and comfortable, easy to get to on the way through if you're passing by. Definitely recommend it.

Address: 1034 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review: I ordered pan fried haddock with capers. It came with a nice medley of vegetables and probably the best mashed potatoes I’ve had in a while.   The veggies weren’t the usual frozen carrot and pea medley which was a pleasant surprise as well.  Full marks for the food but couldn’t give full credit as I found the price a bit steep.

Address: 1012 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B Canada
Review:
No.1 is amazing every time. The food is delicious and fresh, lots of flavour and always a great portion. The Tom yum soup is excellent, always get it with fatty brisket and noodles, my partner loves the curry noodles. The apps are incredible as well, hand made spring rolls and wontons and the sauces the pair with them are so good not your typical sweet and sour fair. I would recommend this place to any one who loves a warm, rich meal, little spice and a good size plate. The staff is so friendly and at this point now our orders and are so good to us.
Great for supper or lunch

Address: 1012 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B Canada
Review:
I can’t believe I haven’t eaten here before! Food was delicious and authentic. Nice portions. Only less one star bc staff took ages to bring or refill water, forgot to bring tea pot and extra cups- had to wait 15
mins to flag someone down to ask for extra tea cup. So- maybe they were new, but always good to make sure to follow up with customers mid meal not just come back at the end.

Address: 1012 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B Canada
Review: We had 2 main dishes and spring rolls delivered. The dinner was quite expensive-$67 plus tip. The dishes were good size with quite fresh ingredients but completely tasteless. Would not order again from them.

Address: 1012 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B Canada
Review:
Blatant discrimination from the boss woman. From stepping into the restaurant, to ordering, to having the food brought to my table, I was met with nothing more than a stern face and annoyed attitude, the small amount of eye contact i got were annoyed stares. Meanwhile, I'm sitting at the table observing how she acts with other guests (the two tables next to me, oh btw just happens to be white), and she's smiling, totally different tone of voice (softer), full eye contact, completely different demeanor. Note: I was not hostile or anything to her at any point in time.

The food is overpriced, and the taste is nothing compared to what I could get in Ontario, but not horrible. The place seemed clean.

Address: 1012 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B Canada
Review: Good food! Was surprised but happy to find this place while we stayed nearby. Definitely won’t blow your socks off, but really enjoyed the pho.

Address: 304 Union Street Fredericton, NB E3A 3L9 Canada
Review:
This is a fantastic little spot! It's in a house in town, so there's only 7 tables I think. Always make a reservation.

The food is awesome!
My Swiss friend who is in love with Schnitzel said it was definitely somewhere he's going again. Lol!

They ran out of Weiss beer, which was kind of sad, but otherwise, everything was excellent and service was good!

The Jäger Schnitzel is amazing, just putting that out there.  ❤️

Address: 304 Union Street Fredericton, NB E3A 3L9 Canada
Review: Authenticly German.   German music playing, nice homey atmosphere..  Waiter checking on us more then once, topping up water without being asked.   Very attentive...   Food was delicious and generous portion sizes.

Address: 304 Union Street Fredericton, NB E3A 3L9 Canada
Review: A magical place with a great vibe. The bathroom is Harry Potter themed! The food is delicious and prepared with love. Highly recommended.

Address: 304 Union Street Fredericton, NB E3A 3L9 Canada
Review: Just had my first visit, it was a wonderful experience. We were treated like good friends.  The service and food was excellent. Relaxed atmosphere, unhurried dining. Thank you for a lovely evening.

Address: 304 Union Street Fredericton, NB E3A 3L9 Canada
Review: The schnitzel parlour is your chance to experience great quality food. And it's delicious. This restaurant is one of a kind. My family loves coming back to this restaurant time and time again.

Address: 182 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C8 Canada
Review: My fiance introduced me to the Red Lantern. The food is so good! The staff are amazing! The owner is an absolute sweetheart! I can't say enough, how much I love going here with my family ❤️  🤤

Address: 182 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C8 Canada
Review: long wait to order...longer wait for food....we caught on that people that were there when we came in were also waiting...and the few plates that went past us...to the wrong table...didn,t look great...this place is a dinosaur....let it die. we left...40 minutes  ..for nothing

Address: 182 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C8 Canada
Review: Local hole in the wall. Great hangover breakfast. Had 5 star steak breakfast melt in your mouth beef. Quick service cheap beer.

Address: 182 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C8 Canada
Review: The pub has a cool atmosphere (hence, 2 stars), but, OMG, the food was disgusting. It was really bad, especially the meat. I just ate a baked potato with sour cream as the turkey sandwich was too revolting. My partner had a steak and it tasted awful.

Address: 182 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C8 Canada
Review: Had a bacon cheese burger platter it was top notch , Home made pattie, great fries and coleslaw. Gravey was suspect but I didn't come for gravey. Will be back.

Address: 86-88 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C2 Canada
86-88 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C2 Canada
86-88 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C2 Canada
536 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review: Tons of options to pick from and their Sushi tastes really good. Was a bit confused which one to order but everything I tried turned out to be good. The service was also good, the girl was friendly and prompt. I think this is the best place in Fredericton to try some Japanese cuisine. Would definitely repeat.

Address: 536 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review: This restaurant has service and food one step over the best one I previously had. Now it os the best. 👍🏻

Address: 536 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review: One of the most unique experiences I’ve ever had eating in Fredericton….and NOT in a good way. We had heard good things about this place, that it was a fancier option for sushi in Fredericton, and the price did reflect that, but what we received was not up to par and frankly odd and in some cases down right gross. I would steer clear of this spot, try Jay’s or Tamatachi….no one try to feed you whipped cream sushi.

Address: 536 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review: Came for a quick bite and that's what we got. Great food

Address: 536 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review: I recently dined at Naru restaurant and was blown away by the delicious food and excellent service. From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed by the friendly staff and immediately impressed by the clean and modern decor. The menu had a wide variety of options, and I ended up trying the sushi and it was some of the best I've ever had. The portion sizes were good and the prices were  reasonable. I would highly recommend Naru to anyone looking for a top-notch dining experience. I can't wait to go back and try more dishes on the menu.

Address: 99 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: I absolutely love this restaurant. I always get my food as take out but the inside always looks very clean, warm and welcoming as well. My usual choice is the Shawarma Combo platter which comes with both chicken AND beef shawarma, salad AND rice, garlic sauce AND hummus as well as a pita bread. The cost is around the $20 mark after tax and is of very good value. Some add on highlights for me are the pickled turnips and home made garlic sauce to really add a pop of flavor. I've never once been disappointed by the food here and would absolutely recommend it to anyone. I've lived in Fredericton for 15 years.

Address: 99 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: My favourite place in Fredericton for shawarma. Their staffs are very nice too 🙂

Address: 99 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: Great place. Would go again whenever I visit Fredericton again.

Address: 99 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: Delicious food! The garlic sauce is fantastic. Can't wait to come back and try more.

Address: 99 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: I have order fattoush but what I got it is a lettuce salad 😂. I order Falafel  they juat put frozen falafel wrap in a pita. Customer service bad. The person who got my order the way drive me like this is the one an only lebanese restaurant in this planet, if you want you can eat if not get out. I dont recommend this place. I have been to Lebanon I tried most of the foods. I was glad when I saw this restaurant and stop suddenly to have some lebanese taste again. But this is not the place for that.

Address: 440 Kimble Drive Fredericton, NB E3B 0K5 Canada
Review: Very large portions and huge chicken balls... I mean huge like baseballs - they were tasty and had lots of chicken in them. Pick up was on time and friendly. Food was hot and good overall. Slightly disappointed with General Tso chicken (a bit to much oyster sauce). Would order again.

Address: 440 Kimble Drive Fredericton, NB E3B 0K5 Canada
Review:
I recently ordered vegetarian food from Oriental Pearl and I must say, it was an exceptional experience! The restaurant offers a wide range of vegetarian dishes that are packed with incredible flavors. The ordering process was convenient, and the delivery was prompt, ensuring that the food arrived fresh and piping hot at my doorstep.

The quality of the vegetarian food was outstanding. Each dish was meticulously prepared with attention to detail, resulting in flavors that were both authentic and delightful. The menu boasted a diverse selection of vegetarian options, catering to different tastes and preferences.

I highly recommend trying their signature vegetarian dishes, such as the paneer tikka masala and the vegetable biryani. The paneer tikka masala was a perfect blend of succulent paneer and a rich, creamy sauce that was bursting with flavors. The vegetable biryani had fragrant, perfectly cooked rice with an exquisite mix of vegetables and aromatic spices, making it a true vegetarian delight.

The food was thoughtfully packaged, ensuring that it arrived in excellent condition. The portions were generous, and the prices were reasonable, considering the quality of the food and the excellent service.

Overall, Oriental Pearl stands out for its exceptional vegetarian dining experience, even when ordered for home delivery. The remarkable quality of the food, coupled with their warm hospitality, make it a true gem for vegetarian food lovers. I'm eagerly looking forward to ordering from Oriental Pearl again and exploring more of their delectable vegetarian menu. Highly recommended for all vegetarian food enthusiasts!

Address: 440 Kimble Drive Fredericton, NB E3B 0K5 Canada
Review:
Hello House of curry,
Thank you for the food & great hospitality.
It was sooooo delicious 😋 😋😋😋
all of your food 100 on 100
I must say...
what a packing!
what an quantity!
what an quality!
what a look like!
what a gravy!
what a test!
what a Naan!
what a paneer!
what a bance of sweet, sour and spices!😋😋😋😋😋😋😋
last but not on the list  it was so  clean and neat restaurant and added that best services.
Afteeeeerrrrt so long time i ate yummy & delicious food like INDIA.
Now we became ur regular customer for sure.😊😊👍🙏

Address: 440 Kimble Drive Fredericton, NB E3B 0K5 Canada
Review: Used to really like place years ago when I lived nearby.  Didn't realize it had changed ownership unfortunately.  Easily the worst Chinese food I've had in my life, huge waste of 16 dollars.

Address: 440 Kimble Drive Fredericton, NB E3B 0K5 Canada
Review:
Size is generous for the price. We can't order too much because both of us are full.
They also offered chocolates on top of fortune cookies, this is a nice touch!
There are not much Chinese restaurants around Fredericton and this is definitely a must try.

Address: 335 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2J2 Canada
Review:
TLDR: Avoid this place at all costs!

It took us 15 minutes to get water. Drink orders wouldn't come for 20 minutes. Overall, appetizers and two drinks took 2 hours. Absolutely shocking service. Drinks were overpriced. An 8oz single Caesar was $11. We ordered nachos and the red pepper dip at the same time but finished the nachos before the dip arrived. The nachos were well garnished but soggy. We didn't get a second sour cream as initially ordered. We mentioned it to the waitress and she confirmed but it never came. The red pepper and spinach dip comes in a two oz bowl. I was under the impression the dip was a side at first. The kettle chips were fried in old oil and were soggy.

After ordering appetizers our menus were taken and we were never offered mains.

It is a great place to watch the sun but the cheap poolside restaurant vibe is counter to the elegance of the Delta. It's a completely contrasted experience with the Stmr which we love.

Address: 335 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2J2 Canada
Review:
Beautiful spot overlooking the river on a perfect August night!
We enjoyed the clams (So fresh) with gluten free cheese toast - thank you!!
The clam chowder was one of the best we’ve ever had!
Our server was attentive and pleasant. It was a busy place and we can understand why!

Address: 335 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2J2 Canada
Review: This is one of my favourite spots in the city for a lunch date.  Not only do you get to enjoy the sunshine and a great view of the river.  You also get delicious poolside drinks, like the Strawberry Mango Daiquiri I thoroughly enjoyed.  AND a similar and equally delicious menu to that of STMR.36.  THEIR NACHOS, THO, PEOPLE. THEIR. NA. CHOS.  You can never go wrong with this spot.  An amazing team in an amazing hotel, serving up amazing F&B goodness!

Address: 335 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2J2 Canada
Review:
Very slow service.  It wasn't busy at all.
***Update***  (Removed 1 Star from 2, because there is no option for 0)  2nd visit again my judgement
However about 10-15 tables available They decline to sit us for couples of drinks & nachos because we had no reservations. What I gather is this do not drop by unless you have a reservation.
Funny i was able to get a table from STMR36 first they welcome my business & they accomodate me as I sat & watch the crowd at Dip 7-8 tables were still empty as I was leaving after having my  quick meal & a drink.  Unable to capture full pic on the other side due to umbrellas were in the way

Address: 335 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2J2 Canada
Review: Best place to get that down south feeling in New Brunswick. Beautiful outside pool with a DJ, great drinks and food and right on the Saint John River.

Address: 1111 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3Z2 Canada
Review: Hadn't had Greek since moving to New Brunswick in 2021. Was thrilled to find Yassou's. Elias is super friendly and took great care of us. The mixed meat platter on our first visit was awesome, the wraps on our second were daunting but delicious and the prices can't be beat. We'll be back often.

Address: 1111 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3Z2 Canada
Review:
We had take-out, and it was delicious as always. The staff are super friendly, they get to know their customers and try to give the best food and experience possible. Their friendliness and willingness to give us what we want is a big part of why we keep going back.
Thank you, we will continue to go there!

Address: 1111 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3Z2 Canada
Review: Great staff, every one of them were super friendly from the moment I walked in to the moment I walked out. Very easy to talk to and makes you feel as if you were part of the staff. My chicken souvlaki wrap was delicious! Would recommend 100%

Address: 1111 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3Z2 Canada
Review: Food was amazing! So kind and welcoming, I can’t wait to try more of what’s on the menu, as my daughter said it “10/10 would eat here again!” Absolutely! :)

Address: 1111 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3Z2 Canada
Review: Food is really good with good portion. They have their own salad dressing they sell at the counter. First we thought expensive. It is delicious and worth the price. Glad we tried it.

Address: 10 trinity drive Fredericton, NB E3C 0B8 Canada
Review:
They offer many different kinds of Asian cuisine (Chinese/Cantonese/Singapore, Japanese, Thai), so I was worried about the authenticity of the taste at first, but for the most part they were quite good. The portion size was good as well.

The place is very cute, with beautiful round lights hanging off a very tall ceiling.

Address: 10 trinity drive Fredericton, NB E3C 0B8 Canada
Review:
My husband and I visited Thai Manao Restaurant on a Monday for lunch (around 2.30 pm) and we were seated right away.

Food: We ordered ramen, sweet and sour pork stir & bibimap (with pork belly). Everything was flavourful and portion sizes are generous. We also got a Tao Chicken rice as a take away.

Service: our server was young and served quick.

Ambiance: With slow music and just enough light on the background, the restaurant has a calm atmosphere. The rest rooms are clean.

Address: 10 trinity drive Fredericton, NB E3C 0B8 Canada
Review:
Friendly staff.
Pepper beef was good.
Serving size for one person.

Address: 10 trinity drive Fredericton, NB E3C 0B8 Canada
Review:
An amazing place to try authentic Chinese / Asian dishes

It looks toa family business that makes you get a good family wise connection to the owners, they would simply offer you what the do best and fine tune it for your dietary request as possible.

Things get done fresh and hot.

Address: 10 trinity drive Fredericton, NB E3C 0B8 Canada
Review: server seemed like she didnt know much. Offered beer brands she didnt have.  Was confused by most questions. Brought me red wine instead of white. Asked for extra spice in my ramen got none. Had to basically go in the kitchen to flag her. Spice or no spice was so bland. basically just chicken broth... then a ton of chillis when i asked for spice with a over cooked egg and pork that was 80 percent fat. she forgot our chicken balls and didn't get any napkins. didn't cone to check if our food was ok. when we said it was not good at the ebd she didnt offer anything.  Wont be hoing back.

Address: 1230 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C2 Canada
Review:
It is bit expensive when you compared to other sports bar.

We liked wings with Thai chilli and hot sauce
Butter chicken Mac and cheese was good ( not great )
Lemonade and unicorn lemonade could have been better

We have been to these restaurant couple of time around 9.30~10 . Both the times they were understaffed

Address: 1230 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C2 Canada
Review: One of the best restaurants in Fredericton. The waiters are always very nice and ready to help. The food is always amazing, the portions are good, and the dessert is great.

Address: 1230 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C2 Canada
Review:
Emma and chevy deserve all the praise! We went there for a dinner and ordered some pizzas and asked for no bacon because I can’t eat bacon. Somehow, cooks made a mistake and made 2 pizzas with bacon. When the order arrived, I reminded her that i asked for no bacon and she was extremely sorry and took back the pizzas and got us new ones in a matter of minutes. The atmosphere and service was very nice so one little error like this can be neglected.
Cut to the end, when Emma brought the bill, she told us that her manger, Chevy took 3 pizzas off the bill which we didn’t even ask for. This is what you call good customer service and making sure that they leave with a happy face. Definitely recommend and will come back for sure!

Address: 1230 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C2 Canada
Review:
Very nice open atmosphere yet private booths available.  Our server was a very nice young lady with a ready smile and a great attitude.  Portions huge and oh My the food was awesome!!
Don't pass it up!!!

Address: 1230 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C2 Canada
Review: Good food! Slow service, a lot of waiting even when done waited over 15 mins for our bill...

Address: 91 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review:
They passed the pizza test...I tried a no thrills one-topping pepperoni pizza to check their baseline, and it was delicious!
Handmade, hefty toppings and they don't spare on the cheese. Excellent pizza

The only lousy review is by someone who ordered what was lying around the kitchen instead of getting a real pizza. The pic she posted even looks kinda good..
Get an actual pizza and taste for yourself 👍

Address: 91 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review: Hands down the best pizza in Freddy Beach in my opinion. Reminds me of old fashioned Montreal sloppy style pizza. Expect generous and copious amounts of toppings and a crust that’s always worth finishing.

Address: 91 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review:
I asked what kind of slices they had. They said meat or works. Little did I know they were already pre cooked and stored in the fridge ready to be pre-heated. I was very disappointed and was hoping for a fresh slice. They did say they are half cooked.

Very thick cheese, wasn’t the biggest fan. Bacon was sliced not balls.  But the slices were big and the pizza sauce was alright.

Address: 91 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review: A real "Pizzeria". Generous toppings, great crust, and good value. You'd have to buy 2 large pizzas from a chain to be as full as one large from Luna. Highly recommend.

Address: 91 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review:
Amazing pizza.

Don’t get me wrong the place looks like a total dive. But the quality of the food is out of this world.

The staff are nice and the place was clean. (And that’s saying something since it’s next to a bunch of night clubs and bars)

Lots of great special pizzas for any dietary need. (Unless your lactose intolerant like me. But the upset tummy I got was well worth it for this pizza)

Address: 469 Rue King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E5 Canada
Review: My husband and I visited a few weeks ago and were pleasantly surprised by this charming little cafe. We tried the stuffed grape leaves appetizer and absolutely loved it! We loved their salad dressing so much that we bought two jars to bring home. Their baklava was also fresh and delicious. And the lady who served us was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely go back to try out more menu items.

Address: 469 Rue King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E5 Canada
Review: Cozy cafe in Fredericton, offering amazing vegan menu. Ambience was beautiful and food was so comforting. Very kind people running this place. Sharing some photos from the visit. Would definitely recommend. #support local

Address: 469 Rue King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E5 Canada
Review:
What a gem of a restaurant. I should have come here sooner.

I've been living nearby for over two years now and have never gone in because of two main reasons. 1, there are many restaurants in the area, I'm still making the rounds. 2, like many meat eaters, vegan isn't my go-to. It's not that I don't like it, it's like jazz. I never hate it when it's around, but I'll never go to it on my own. Not going here was a mistake!

It's very well designed and the staff are supremely friendly, but the food is of course the gem here. I never would have guessed the food here could pack such incredible and diverse flavours into their dishes. From the vegan burger to the walnut stew and the baklava, everything had us clamoring for more.

Address: 469 Rue King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E5 Canada
Review:
Pretty incredible.  Food was excellent and traditional from my perspectIve of eating at authentic middle eastern restaurants.  The vegan twists to the dishes were excellent.  Tons of flavour and I suspect meat eaters would do well here too with the shawarma.

Update: My family has come here 3 years in a row as we road trip through Atlantic Canada. It is never a disappointment and seems to get better.  Below is the shawarma wrap,  the rice and green beans, and the tofu plate.  Super delicious,  as always.  This family run business includes very warm and inviting service. Pleasant people.

Address: 469 Rue King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E5 Canada
Review: Stopped by for dinner and we’re so glad we did. What a meal!  So nice to have a fully vegan menu - desserts and all! Highly recommend stopping in if you’re in Fredericton.

Address: 418 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: The escape room we did was the best escape room we’ve ever done it was so fun! And the food was super delicious. But man did the place ever stink. The entire place smelt bad, plus the washrooms (even the fake one in the escape room) smelt like they had sewage backup. The bathroom toilet was leaking everywhere. Also there’s no AC so it was so hot we had to leave. This also made the smell even worse. Also the music was so loud you can’t hear anything. Fix the atmosphere and the place would be great!

Address: 418 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: We go here frequently and love it each time! Great food, super friendly and knowledgeable staff, a fantastic selection of board games - not to mention the game nights they do to really build community. If I could give them 6 stars, I would!

Address: 418 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: We played the Escape Room with our son and daughter in law and had a blast, especially since we failed and the bomb exploded. 💣 🤣 It was our son's treat for us so I don't know what it cost.

Address: 418 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review:
Absolutely amazing place! Board games, escape rooms, friendly staff and great food! This is definitely a place to visit at least once if you're stopping in Fredericton!

If you've never tried mead before I can't recommend trying the sampler enough! Pay the $1.50 extra for all of them, although their own custom drink Scuttlebutt is definitely the best flavour so if you want to just try one definitely give that a go!

Address: 418 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: Fun little spot in Fredericton. Reasonably priced and staff is friendly. The virtual escape rooms are a lot of fun.

Address: 23 Ashton Court Fredericton, NB E3C 0H8 Canada
Review: I had the banana split on gluten free waffles, and it was so good! Some gluten-free food can be disappointing but there it's great and they have options for gluten-free bread, waffles and home fries! I also had the Belgian caffe mocha, I would come back just for that alone as it was the best coffee I've had, but everything was really good and great service, the staff is very friendly. We will definitely be back again!

Address: 23 Ashton Court Fredericton, NB E3C 0H8 Canada
Review:
I loved the atmosphere, it felt like a B&B in Europe! We ordered chocolate and 🍓Waffle and crepe! It was delicious. My favourite was the strawberry Waffles! And my Americano was divine!😅
The waffles are soft, let them know if you want them crispy!

Address: 23 Ashton Court Fredericton, NB E3C 0H8 Canada
Review:
First, I was greeted by the friendliest staff. They have a quick service set up so I was able to order within 5 minutes of arriving and my drinks were at my table less than 5 minutes later. I ordered a Mexicano and it looked and tasted amazing!!

Our food was hot and delicious. We got strawberry waffles, Belgian breakfast and a traditional breakfast. The portions were great.

Highly recommend this restaurant!!

Address: 23 Ashton Court Fredericton, NB E3C 0H8 Canada
Review:
I have gone to this restaurant for over 6 years. I visited about a year ago, and I couldn’t drink my coffee as it tasted like Maxwell House. I figured it must have been an off day at the restaurant, as I expect high end coffee from a restaurant known for Belgian waffles, delicious and beautiful food. The last time I visited, I asked prior ordering what coffee they brew and I was advised Maxwell House, the cheapest coffee I can find in the stores. Very disappointed to say no to coffee with my breakfast.
The service was not what it has been known for… Needing to order and pay for your meal prior to the service being rendered? Am I at a fast food restaurant now? I like to be seated, take my time while seated to order the food at my own pace without a lineup waiting at the door. I always give a second chance, but after being served the cheapest coffee, having to order and pay like a fast food restaurant and the food being okay, I unfortunately will not return. If the coffee can become delicious again, and the service can be rendered at the table, only then may I consider returning.

Address: 23 Ashton Court Fredericton, NB E3C 0H8 Canada
Review: It seems to me that this place is pass it's glory days. I have read good reviews, but our experience was mediocre. They only offer half service, which is not ideal. I have asked for fresh orange juice and California Benny. I got a small glass of the Tropicana juice, not freshly squeezed (for $6.5.....) so that was a bit of a disappointment. My poached egg was slightly overcooked and hollandaise sauce was not exactly to my taste. But some people might find it OK?....?

Address: 7 Brookmount Street Fredericton, NB E3B 2J4 Canada
Review: Home made food, healthy and delicious. Very nice staff. Good nice, Try Bennedy

Address: 7 Brookmount Street Fredericton, NB E3B 2J4 Canada
Review: We’ve been coming here for years and have loved the Sunshine Diner for a long time. Lately things haven’t been going well when we’ve been there. The last time we were there it took almost 60 minutes for our food to be delivered to our table after ordering. That was after waiting at our table to order for over 15 minutes. When we did get our food only two of the three of us got our food and the third person at our table had to wait another ten minutes to get their food. When the food was delivered it was not the plate we ordered. Our sever was very apologetic but then it took even more time for the rest of our table’s food to arrive. Our food was below expectation as well. Our sausages were burned (obviously had been rush cooked in an attempt to catch up) and the home fries with onions were substantially burned too and had been cooked way too high. These plates should not have left the kitchen under any reasonable watch. But we are it and didn’t complain simply because we had waited this long. We were missing toast and our eggs were way too dry. The thing was is the restaurant wasn’t busy when we were there- it was 10:30AM on a midweek day and there were plenty of empty tables (although they did have dirty dishes sitting on them for a long time). I think some attention needs to be given to how the ordering and cooking processes go and some effort needs to be made to make the dining experience a lot faster and better for patrons. Oh, and on top of everything else some of the staff were having a pretty heated argument in front of customers. We will be back I’m sure, we just hope things can improve.

Address: 7 Brookmount Street Fredericton, NB E3B 2J4 Canada
Review:
If I could give more stars I would.
The food is always home-cooked with love. The staff are always more than amazing. They are so hard working and happy. I've been coming here through all different stages of my life and The Sunshine Diner makes my heart feel like Sunshine. Thank you today for the wonderful cold plates I put in for take out. Thank you for making my day today as I sat there waiting for my order the smiles, the laughter, the love I could feel it all. I thank you for being you♥️🌞 You make the world a better place by being in it!!!!
If you haven't been please go see for yourself.

Address: 7 Brookmount Street Fredericton, NB E3B 2J4 Canada
Review: This clean and busy diner is busy with locals. But there were still seats  available at 9:30 on a week day. The special was ample portion to feed anyone. Service was quick and food was hot and tasty! We like the vibes here. Big group or small they do it all!

Address: 7 Brookmount Street Fredericton, NB E3B 2J4 Canada
Review:
Friendly staff and a quintessential diner experience.

I've been here a few times and it's always the same. Everything they make is comfort. Whether it's with family or just dining alone, their all day breakfast is great. I keep saying I'll get other things on the menu, and have once or twice, but their breakfasts are great.

This time around I had the Really Big Breakfast. Everything is what you would expect from an old school diner style restaurant. Nothing fancy, but all comfort and nostalgia. Couple that with all you can drink self-serve coffee and tea, and you can spend quite some time in here. It's also often busy so don't expect to rush in and out. It's the perfect lazy weekend morning kind of spot.

Address: 1187 Smythe Fredericton, NB E3B 3H4 Canada
Review:
They had a lot of empty tables when I went around 2.00 PM still waited for close to 10 minutes to get seated (God knows why). Food was good, enjoyed it and was tasty. Seafood chowder had less seafood and more lettuce but the waitress was kind enough to top it up with some shrimps and scallops so no complaints. They had good varieties on the menu so probably would repeat.

†******

Repeated. Service was really good and so were all the items ordered. The place was crowded and had to wait for 15 minutes before we could go in.  These guys should seriously think about setting up some space for their customers to wait rather than making them stand in queue in cold winter.

Address: 1187 Smythe Fredericton, NB E3B 3H4 Canada
Review: I ordered for a HOT CHICKEN and a Pineapple & Mango smoothie. although I didn’t know all the items in the food and I asked the lady to explain the difference to me and another sandwich that was on the menu but the food I got wasn’t appealing to the eye and the server who attended to us who I believe goes by the name Diane was quite dismissive & in a hurry. I also didn’t get my smoothie which was meant to go along with my food. I had to remind her after she brought the bill. I barely ate the food because it didn’t look good. I am completely disappointed with the service I got it was definitely a sub par.

Address: 1187 Smythe Fredericton, NB E3B 3H4 Canada
Review:
Excellent food and service.
Very delicious and fast service.
I would recommend any of their skillets and also waffles which were super fluffy.

Address: 1187 Smythe Fredericton, NB E3B 3H4 Canada
Review: Came in for a quick breakfast. Service was amazing. Great staff. Very pleasant. Food was served very quickly. Very good.

Address: 1187 Smythe Fredericton, NB E3B 3H4 Canada
Review: Good staff, yummy food, great service. The restaurant’s ambience is very dark which I don’t like which is why i love the outdoor seating they have on the upper floor.

Address: 154 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C8 Canada
Review: Whenever I'm in the area I stop in for the best Ethopian food ever !!! Always amazing service and tasty food. Wish we had this in Moncton !!! 👌👏 First experience was in the Northside Market. So happy to see you with your own location. Thanks for a great food experience! 🍛

Address: 154 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C8 Canada
Review:
So happy to have this place on the northside! Used to go to the market often but delighted that theres now a dedicated building.

The food is amazing with fresh ingredients and you can taste that its cooked with passion and love. I really like the ordering style where you can get 3 different dishes so you can try a little bit of everything!

The portions are generous and the prices are way way worth it, I always tip extra because I feel like its worth so much more:) It makes me happy to support someone local and so passionate about what they do.

See you soon and thank you so much Hana !

Address: 154 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C8 Canada
Review:
By far my favorite food in the city!! Bursting with flavor, and everything tastes amazing. Also extremely healthy and cheap,
and Hannah is sweet.

P.S. You should advertise on university campuses (e.g., flyers, etc.) because I would've eaten here almost daily throughout my degree, but I didn't know it existed because google restricts my search results -- and presumably those of other students -- to restaurants on the southside, unless I manually adjust the map.

Address: 154 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C8 Canada
Review:
So happy that we finally got to try this restaurant, it definitely lives up to the positive reviews.
We had a great experience the staff were friendly and efficient, the food was fantastic and reasonably priced.
My favorite definitely was the split peas and the lentils.
Will for sure be visiting this establishment again

Address: 154 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C8 Canada
Review: Good home cooking in a nice sit down restaurant, food is ready to go buffet style. Good portions and flavor and freshness. Owner is very kind

Address: 459 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E5 Canada
Review:
My first visit there, and tried Gimpab for the first time and loved it! I'll order take outs next time and watch my favourite
Kdrama with it🤩💖🐋

Address: 459 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E5 Canada
Review: My boyfriend and I love coming here! We always get the tteobokki and kimchi fried rice! The portions are great and the food is even better! The staff are also super nice! Would def recommend if you wanna try Korean food!

Address: 459 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E5 Canada
Review:
Overall a good place for some Korean food.

The we had the Beef Bibimbap and a Spicy Salmon roll.

The beef Bibimbap was spot on. Even proportions of beef veggies and a nice sunny side egg on top. I added the spicy red sauce on top to make it nearly perfect. The meal was filling and tasty.

Other nice touches were the wide metal bowl.

The sushi roll though was less than stellar. Not bad by any means but not good. Especially considering the price.

The location is a bit expensive as well considering the roll size and lack of Korean side dishes.

The restaurant itself is well kept and decor I found was pleasant. Location is good as well being located downtown.

Address: 459 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E5 Canada
Review: Wow. Brings back such fond memories of my years in Asia. As soon as I took the first bite of my Bibimbap with jeyuk, a spicy pork, it instantly took me back. I also had their kimchi jigae which is a kimchi soup. They even had the purple (black) rice that is well known in Korean dishes. Delicious, authentic Korean food. The portion was so large that I'll be able to have some for lunch tomorrow too! The food had just a bit of spice to it which added a nice kick. Such colourful and flavourful food and friendly staff. They currently only do delivery and pickup through Skip the Dishes.

Address: 459 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E5 Canada
Review: Service was quick, and food was delicious.

Address: 529 Dundonald Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1X5 Canada
Review: Hi, My first Greco donair order tonight.... It was DELICIOUS! Yum!! Guy who took my order by phone was polite and kind, delivery gentlemen was as equally kind. Delivery was fast. Nice that first experience is a positive one.... I will order again.

Address: 529 Dundonald Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1X5 Canada
Review:
Ordered take-out pizza for small party.

It was more convenient to order online and pick up when you are ready.

The parking is easy.

Address: 529 Dundonald Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1X5 Canada
Review: I don't want to give this business a bad review but it is needed from my latest experience within the business. I truly love the pizza but I am not a fan of rude employees and delivery drivers who bad mouth customers. This is my latest experience. If your delivery drivers are going to vent about the frustrations of their job don't allow them to do it rudely in front of paying customers. All i wanted was a pizza. Be more professional and perhaps someday i shall return. Have a great existence.

Address: 529 Dundonald Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1X5 Canada
Review: Seriously this is probably one of the best grecos in the province, if not in all of the Maritimes. The food is always hot and tasty, the toppings are always plentiful and well distributed; and the owners support the local car show and it's ongoing efforts to raise money for the hospital.

Address: 529 Dundonald Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1X5 Canada
Review: Nice place and good customer service

Address: Northside Market 311 Saint Marys Street Fredericton, NB E3A 2S4 Canada
Review:
Kelsey is one of the best servers ever that I’ve encountered with. She was very nice, patient, polite and helpful taking order. Her suggestions were very point on.
And talking about the place, it was a very delight-full experience to say the least. The pizzas tasted authentic and flavourful. The dipping sauce and cheesy bread was a cherry on the cake. Love the place and will definitely come back again for one of the best food in Fredericton. Definitely recommend everyone to try it

Address: Northside Market 311 Saint Marys Street Fredericton, NB E3A 2S4 Canada
Review:
Hands down the best food experience we have had in a long time. Everything was amazing!

Also, the Texas Chipotle burger needs to be entered in a burger competition. UNREAL!

Address: Northside Market 311 Saint Marys Street Fredericton, NB E3A 2S4 Canada
Review: I have always been pleased with Pizza Delight’s food until this Father’s Day. We ordered a party size pizza and garlic cheese fingers for takeout which cost $60 odd . Since I had never had an issue with their food I did not open the boxes to check prior to getting home. When we opened the box we were all unpleasantly surprised to see an over cooked partially burnt pizza. My husband, who says he has never had a bad pizza could only eat one piece. I will certainly think twice before ordering from Pizza Delight again. Very disappointed.

Address: Northside Market 311 Saint Marys Street Fredericton, NB E3A 2S4 Canada
Review: Pizza delight st Mary's street Fredericton. Only about 4 tables occupied and waited 25 minutes when we finally left because nobody cared to even take our order. Absolutely garbage service. 6pm Thursday July 6 2023. Guy with long hair was supposed to be our waiter. When confronted said he was busy helping colleagues.  DO NOT RECOMMEND wasting your time here.

Address: Northside Market 311 Saint Marys Street Fredericton, NB E3A 2S4 Canada
Review: It was very good. I had a pizza and nacho combo. Husband had the Donair sub we both enjoys our meal.

Address: 277 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1 Canada
Review: Amazing Food! Tom Yam Soup is perfect! Basil Rice Stir Fry with Chicken is super tasty. Perfectly seasoned and fresh. Love the Imperial Spring Rolls! Staff were super nice! Will be back!!

Address: 277 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1 Canada
Review: I have been enjoying Thai Spice for close to ten years now. Everything I have ordered has been delicious but the Pad Thai is my personal favourite, containing a savoury sauce and perfectly crunchy vegetables. I always ask for mine made extra spicy using chili oil. Owners are very friendly and now know my standard order. I refuse to order Pad Thai at any other restaurant because the Thai Spice version is simply unbeatable.

Address: 277 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1 Canada
Review: The Tom yam soup is literally the best soup I've ever had from any restaurant. So much flavour!

Address: 277 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1 Canada
Review: Tasty and quite authentic! So happy to have found this traditional Thai joint run by a friendly Thai couple. Can't go wrong with the Pad Thai or the Tom Yum soup loaded with tamarind flavour.

Address: 277 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1 Canada
Review: Nice little family restaurant. Reasonably priced and the food tasted great! Not a huge menu, but the food was very authentic. Makes me miss Khao San Road (Bangkok).

Address: 1381 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: As always, this place is delicious. It may be located in a food court, but definitely fresh and absolutely hot. Each meal is made to order right in front of the customer. I had the Chicken Pad Thai. No surprises about what you are getting. Classic to go container or open tray to eat in the food court. If you like Asian cuisine, you'll  be making the right choice ordering here. Thanks.

Address: 1381 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: Not a bad spot for a chain restaurant. The price is of course great and the flavours are good. The staff is nice and the food cooked fresh right on the spot. A nice addition to the food court.

Address: 1381 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: Had the Fish Pad Thai absolutely delicious. If you are in to see a movie or just shopping definitely worth a stop!

Address: 1381 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: Really nice place in the whole food court to grab a bite. The entire staff is so friendly and helpful. The food tasted so fresh and delicious. It was also a  big serving size when compared to other food chains in terms of quantity and price. Clean place and quick service too!

Address: 1381 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: Can never go wrong with their Thai-style Veg Fried Rice with extra rice and veg sauce.

Address: 22 Trinity Avenue Fredericton, NB E3C 0B8 Canada
Review: Absolutely loved my experience here! I had an incredible experience thanks to the amazing manager, Bianca. She went above and beyond to ensure that my St Burger was absolutely amazing. The staff were incredibly friendly, and I was impressed by the spotless cleanliness of the bathrooms. The icing on the cake was the cold and refreshing fruitopia (as it seems there’s a shortage everywhere else). St Hubert Express sets the bar high with their exceptional service and attention to detail. Kudos to Bianca and the entire team for creating such a wonderful dining experience!

Address: 22 Trinity Avenue Fredericton, NB E3C 0B8 Canada
Review: Absolutely disgusting restaurant! So many tables full of garbage. Most (not all) of the employees were rude and disrespectful. Food was overpriced. The benches, ground and tables were all dirty. I will never be returning to this absolutely awful establishment.

Address: 22 Trinity Avenue Fredericton, NB E3C 0B8 Canada
Review:
Very disappointed of that location. I have uploaded a picture so everyone can see how bad the food quality you get at this location.

First we ordered 2 “St-hubert poutine”. When we got home, there was NO cheese in both poutines. (So we added some square pieces at home). Second, the chicken was so dry, that even the WATERED DOWN gravy (that wasn’t gravy, just tasteless brown sauce), they give you couldn’t soften the batter. Lastly, the fries felt so old that even the microwave could make them softer.

I do not recommend this location to anyone. And it’s a shame for the prestigious St Hubert brand unfortunately.

Address: 22 Trinity Avenue Fredericton, NB E3C 0B8 Canada
Review: Excellent food, the Indian style chicken was absolutely delicious. Great service, very friendly staff! Staff checked on us multiple times to ensure that we were satisfied with our meal, you don’t get that often at fast food restaurants.

Address: 22 Trinity Avenue Fredericton, NB E3C 0B8 Canada
Review: Hands down the best catering/delivery service I have ever received. If you’re looking for lunch for a conference or staff party, look no further these folks have it handled. Whether it’s the wonderful attitude from the lady on the phone taking your order or the kind smile from the restaurant manager himself delivering it to you, they go above and beyond. To top it all off the meals are always delicious and never anything wrong or missing, they get it right.  Will definitely be ordering for lunch again and will definitely let anyone else I know looking for catering to head this way!!!

Address: 230 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C9 Canada
Review: Pizza chain, usually pretty good, have a tendency to burn the last couple pies we got there. The meat lovers is always good and the service is always friendly. Wings are good, the breadsticks with cheese and marinara are probably the best item, and a welcome break from garlic fingers!

Address: 230 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C9 Canada
Review: Fast and friendly every time. I would have given it a 3 for the pizza itself, but my delivery took only roughly 5 extra minutes and I received a sorry email with free breadsticks. An unexpected but pleasant surprise for something that didn't even bother me in the first place. Great service gave it the extra star. It's always great for those times when you just don't want to cook. Obviously not the healthiest option or the best pizza in town, but it's there when you need it and consistent. I suggest when ordering, using the app as you will be able to earn points for even greater deals.

Address: 230 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C9 Canada
Review: Our forever favorite pizza..nothing beats pizza hut for me and my family! Love their app and the buy 5 pizzas and get the 6th free deal; and their BOGO offer on doing customer satisfaction survey :) this particular branch has great and timely service :)

Address: 230 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C9 Canada
Review: I got home and realized they put the dip on the pizza again. This has happened a few times but this is the first time I went back and asked to exchange this pizza. The guy did exchange it, but gave me attitude about it first.

Address: 230 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1C9 Canada
Review: I really used to like their 5$ 5$ 5$ deal until they made you buy a 30$ (large) pizza for your first one. So, I decided to check out their new melts. Didn't get to try one - pretty much trying to charge you $8.99 for two slices of pizza. Box is HUGE! MELTS ARE tiny.
