To describe a "melt", it's a slice of pizza with toppings with a piece of pizza crust placed on top then "fried". I know..I know .. things are expensive - but some things I'll just walk away from. "MELTS" are one of them. (I think I may have done it for $6.99 - $5.99 for sure).

Address: 1180 Smythe Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3H5 Canada
Review: The Friday night special is not intended for vampires (garlic bits) or people not into greasy white sauce that pushes the toppings off the dough. Still the service was prompt and the cheese bread good. I think they can redeem themselves. I’ll have to try a night other than Friday.

Address: 1180 Smythe Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3H5 Canada
Review: Ordered the meat lovers melt and 5 boneless chicken bites and a Pepsi. The meat lovers melt is extremely delicious and packed full of meats and cheese and lets not forget to mention the parmesan cheese coating on the outer crust. Very filling and great value as well. Would recommend and will be back for sure.

Address: 1180 Smythe Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3H5 Canada
Review: Breadsticks overcooked and dry. Pizza almost overcooked and dry. I have had better quality of food there. We will order there again one more time and if no better we will not be back.

Address: 1180 Smythe Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3H5 Canada
Review:
I do miss the "dine-in" experience however I also do understand why it has remained "Take-out" due to covid.

This location has great, friendly staff and always welcoming and they make the best pizza,... well almost, I'm told I make the best "homemade" pizza! 😀

Address: 1180 Smythe Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3H5 Canada
Review:
It is the worst pizza place even after contact them in there website they said 3 to 5 days to contact my and still nobody contact and now it a month I got three pizzas two of them wrong
Update:
Thanks. They Give me 14$ as credited store but their food test is worse now not like year ago it was better

Address: 1055 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: Terrible food, I ordered a foot long meatball sub and ended up with a hard Black Brick... And no refund or money off 😡

Address: 1055 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: The absolute worst customer service I have ever experienced at a Subway. Ordered online for pickup, and all 4 subs were made incorrectly when we got home and opened them up.  Some excuse that they had no chicken, so made us a club instead.  Next visit and excuse,  we have no ham! Kid goes on to describe how he is not allowed to prep any ham 30 minutes before close because he has to fold all the pieces and fill a container. If you want consistent quality and experience, go to Prospect St.....do not waste your money here.

Address: 1055 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: Waited forever in line, they seemed to be understaffed. It was really unclean behind the counter and a lot of the food & veggies looked old. The real problem was the hair in my food!! so unsanitary and gross.

Address: 1055 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: Went in at 4:40 pm and asked if she had tuna, the girl working replied with "yeah we have it but it's not the best" I looked down to see crusty old tuna, she never offered to make more. She just shrugged it off and we opted out on eating there, if that's not up to date then what else is bad?. Gross. Not to mention there was only one other lady in front of us so she wasn't busy.

Address: 1055 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: I give 1 star because everytime i go the driveway line time estimated is the equivalent of going to a restaurant and sitting down. They need to open there doors.

Address: 349 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E4 Canada
Review: Worst Subway I have ever been to. I have never been treated so poorly in any restaurant. My significant other and I were tourists passing by the beautiful town of Fredricton thus had many bags with us. The Subway worker at the time immediately and without provocation, assumed we were homeless and was acting hostile as if we were attempting to loiter and or steal. If you as much as bring a single bag to this establishment they will treat you with very little to no respect, likely even hostility. Even after we had paid and eaten our food, and cleaned up after ourselves, the worker was staring us down with judgment as we exited. There are many amazing locally owned and ran restaurants in Fredericton, but NEVER go to this one. Definitely not worth even considering.

Address: 349 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E4 Canada
Review: Not one to usually complain, but I went to subway on king street this evening around 8, I was treated like a inconvenience,  my sub was thrown together , not even cut. I was told there was only spinach, tomato and lettuce for veggies ( I could see all of the containers full sitting on the back counter) everything was already being put away. Keep in mind they don't close until 9pm. It's a Wednesday evening still lots of people downtown.

Address: 349 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E4 Canada
Review: It's always my goto place and I think rare healthy option.

Address: 349 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E4 Canada
Review: Wish it was open after 9 pm at least until 10 pm.

Address: 349 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E4 Canada
Review: I feel bad for this Subway, I really do. The staff are friendly, for the most part, but they get overwhelmed easy. At lunch time, that place can pack up fast and it always seems like they’re understaffed. I would have given 5 stars if I could consistently go in and get quick service.

Address: 1111 Regent Street Unit 4 Fredericton, NB E3B 3Z2 Canada
Review: Terrible food, I ordered a foot long meatball sub and ended up with a hard Black Brick... And no refund or money off 😡

Address: 1111 Regent Street Unit 4 Fredericton, NB E3B 3Z2 Canada
Review: The absolute worst customer service I have ever experienced at a Subway. Ordered online for pickup, and all 4 subs were made incorrectly when we got home and opened them up.  Some excuse that they had no chicken, so made us a club instead.  Next visit and excuse,  we have no ham! Kid goes on to describe how he is not allowed to prep any ham 30 minutes before close because he has to fold all the pieces and fill a container. If you want consistent quality and experience, go to Prospect St.....do not waste your money here.

Address: 1111 Regent Street Unit 4 Fredericton, NB E3B 3Z2 Canada
Review: Waited forever in line, they seemed to be understaffed. It was really unclean behind the counter and a lot of the food & veggies looked old. The real problem was the hair in my food!! so unsanitary and gross.

Address: 1111 Regent Street Unit 4 Fredericton, NB E3B 3Z2 Canada
Review: Went in at 4:40 pm and asked if she had tuna, the girl working replied with "yeah we have it but it's not the best" I looked down to see crusty old tuna, she never offered to make more. She just shrugged it off and we opted out on eating there, if that's not up to date then what else is bad?. Gross. Not to mention there was only one other lady in front of us so she wasn't busy.

Address: 1111 Regent Street Unit 4 Fredericton, NB E3B 3Z2 Canada
Review: I give 1 star because everytime i go the driveway line time estimated is the equivalent of going to a restaurant and sitting down. They need to open there doors.

Address: 245 Bishop Drive Fredericton, NB E3C 1B1 Canada
Review: Thank you so much for the kind treat, hair is exactly what I ordered 💕💕

Address: 245 Bishop Drive Fredericton, NB E3C 1B1 Canada
Review: Love subs. I do try the new ones but still like my tried and true. Great fresh toppings.

Address: 245 Bishop Drive Fredericton, NB E3C 1B1 Canada
Review: It just seems like they don't care, and they always seem to put less and less meat on your sandwiches when you go there. I remember going there, and I get rotisserie chicken, and I swear to God. There was one tiny little scope on a twelve inch sub it wouldn't even go end on this sub.

Address: 245 Bishop Drive Fredericton, NB E3C 1B1 Canada
Review: Kind of a random location that I can't imagine walking to. The staff were very friendly and the food was carefully prepared.

Address: 245 Bishop Drive Fredericton, NB E3C 1B1 Canada
Review:
Fast, food is good, orders never get messed up. Have gone here multiple times recently with zero issues.
It is advisable to come here instead of the Prospect location, if you can. It is much faster and not that much further of a drive.
The only issue is that it is a bit out of the way, but that has nothing to do with the review.

Address: 185 Gabriel Drive Fredericton, NB E3A 5R8 Canada
Review: Hi I'm storm Barlow it is March 22 2023 the food it ok but I found 2 hairs in it and the cutlery is dirty and I didn't even use them cuz of it.

Address: 185 Gabriel Drive Fredericton, NB E3A 5R8 Canada
Review: Had the fish and chips and the fish was delicious and it was a nice big portion, would be nice to have a slice of lemon on the plate to go with the fish but I supposed I could've asked. Fries were not really crisp and could've used a pinch of salt but the portion was also plentiful. Very friendly staff and fast service. Dining room was very clean.

Address: 185 Gabriel Drive Fredericton, NB E3A 5R8 Canada
Review:
All food was cooked from frozen. Nothing is homemade and you can taste it.

Plates we had:
- spinach dip. Overcooked, cheese was dark brown on top. Decent flavour
- loaded potatoe skins. Grainy, dry, flavourless
- fish and chips. Fish was well battered and good. Fries had good texture but were not seasoned at all
- burger. Sauce was good. Patties were overcooked and not seasoned at all
- pie and ice cream. Not homemade and no ice cream despite the title
- all the dips or sauces come in individual plastic servings

Service: it took us 15 minutes to get water. We were offered lemons, they were forgotten. The waitress then noticed, said she'd grab some and didn't. Appetizers took 20 minutes to arrive then entrees only 5 minutes later. Pacing was poor and led to food stacking at the table in a half full restaurant. We had to ask for additional mayo for the fries three times. We had to place our dessert order twice.

To say this place is disappointing is an understatement. Bottom of my list for eats in Fredericton.

Address: 185 Gabriel Drive Fredericton, NB E3A 5R8 Canada
Review:
This time they served me burnt toast, burnt bacon. Didn't come back to check on me for refills. Numerous trips, same result.
My order has been sent back wrong in multiple occasions, even after mentioning it to staff.
I've had to reorder meals I've already ordered.
Going to stop recommending this spot from now on.

Address: 185 Gabriel Drive Fredericton, NB E3A 5R8 Canada
Review: Quick service, hot food, great prices, friendly staff, comfortable seating.

Address: 235 Main Street Main Street Plaza Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1 Canada
Review: Ordered a mama burger with cheese combo and onion rings and the burger was excellent - perfect condiments and that onion slice and pickles really hit the spot. They have the best onion rings in the city but they could reduce the salt throwing and still have a quality taste. And their Root beer should be sold in stores!

Address: 235 Main Street Main Street Plaza Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1 Canada
Review:
Today I had a terrible day. I was exhausted from long hours at work, starving, and found out that I can't even come close to affording my medication. I was feeling really low when I came to this A&W. The worker at the counter (I wish I caught her name but I remember that she was wearing a medical alert bracelet) was absolutely wonderful! She was polite, patient, and showed exemplary service. I hope this message makes it to her because she really turned my day around. Thank you for your positivity!

Additionally, the food was delicious and came quickly, the prices are very reasonable, the space is incredibly clean (even the bathroom!), and this location has a great layout as well.

Address: 235 Main Street Main Street Plaza Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1 Canada
Review: The food is pre-cooked.. who knows how long it sits there. When we went through the drive-thru it took no time for the person in there (looked as though there was only one person working)  to hand us our food.. he clearly didn’t cook it in the 30 seconds it took for us to drive to the window.  My son and I got food poisoning.

Address: 235 Main Street Main Street Plaza Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1 Canada
Review:
Worst ever A&W
I was there and waited in the line. Chinese looking cashier just went inside without serving us. And she was behind cleaning an equipment. How rude to avoid a comoletely unknown person who is standing to do business. And no one took our order untill I ask them to take our order. Finally I ordered got my burger (as in the picture) so low in quality, not a pleasent presentation. These kids who are working know nothing about customer service, food serving. The worst ever A&W restaurant I have been in these three years of my time here in Canada. I am not recommending this to anyone.
Further, Restaurant is not tidy at all.

Address: 235 Main Street Main Street Plaza Fredericton, NB E3A 1E1 Canada
Review:
Nice little spot. Food is pretty good. It's on the pricy side for fast food.

This location is right on the trail and has a bike rack, which I appreciate.  Makes it easy to bike over for a bite.

Address: 1018 Prospect Street Prospect Plaza Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review: I had a very good experience at this place. Natasha was amazing with her helpful attitude and welcoming gestures. She helped me decide as i have to limit my options due to some reason. Overall it’s a very nice place to dine in and have a good time. The staff keeps the place very clean. I was there for 25-30 minutes and they swept the floor twice even though it looked pretty clean.

Address: 1018 Prospect Street Prospect Plaza Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review:
Fabulous experience in a&w!!!service was amazing, and the bottled Dasani water was the most fulfilling, tastiest, nutritious and refreshing water I’ve ever had. No need to eat. Just drink the water and you’ll be fully satisfied. Really a fine dining experience.
Namaste

Address: 1018 Prospect Street Prospect Plaza Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review: Fabulous experience in a&w!!!service was amazing, and the water was the most fulfilling, tastiest, nutritious and refreshing water I’ve ever had. Was not hungry. Just drank the water and was fully satisfied. Really a fine dining experience.

Address: 1018 Prospect Street Prospect Plaza Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review: Average breakfast. The girl working was alone rocking the in store counter and drive through even though there was 2 other girls there. I wish I knew her name to give her a shout out. I got the classic breakfast with bacon. Eggs were slightly over cooked and toast under cooked, but maybe because I only saw one cook back there and it was busy. It’s a shame no one wants to work anymore so the people who are working are run dry.

Address: 1018 Prospect Street Prospect Plaza Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review:
Consistently screw up orders, and all they ever say is come back and we'll replace it. No offer to add anything or otherwise compensate for the hassle.
I like the food but it's not worth the headache.

Address: 1381 Regent Street Regent Mall (Food Court) Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: I had a very good experience at this place. Natasha was amazing with her helpful attitude and welcoming gestures. She helped me decide as i have to limit my options due to some reason. Overall it’s a very nice place to dine in and have a good time. The staff keeps the place very clean. I was there for 25-30 minutes and they swept the floor twice even though it looked pretty clean.

Address: 1381 Regent Street Regent Mall (Food Court) Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review:
Fabulous experience in a&w!!!service was amazing, and the bottled Dasani water was the most fulfilling, tastiest, nutritious and refreshing water I’ve ever had. No need to eat. Just drink the water and you’ll be fully satisfied. Really a fine dining experience.
Namaste

Address: 1381 Regent Street Regent Mall (Food Court) Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: Fabulous experience in a&w!!!service was amazing, and the water was the most fulfilling, tastiest, nutritious and refreshing water I’ve ever had. Was not hungry. Just drank the water and was fully satisfied. Really a fine dining experience.

Address: 1381 Regent Street Regent Mall (Food Court) Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: Average breakfast. The girl working was alone rocking the in store counter and drive through even though there was 2 other girls there. I wish I knew her name to give her a shout out. I got the classic breakfast with bacon. Eggs were slightly over cooked and toast under cooked, but maybe because I only saw one cook back there and it was busy. It’s a shame no one wants to work anymore so the people who are working are run dry.

Address: 1381 Regent Street Regent Mall (Food Court) Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review:
Consistently screw up orders, and all they ever say is come back and we'll replace it. No offer to add anything or otherwise compensate for the hassle.
I like the food but it's not worth the headache.

Address: 1189 Prospect St Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: This location is absolutely massive, and beautiful!! For being as large and as busy as it is it was surprisingly clean. The counter staff was super friendly helping me pick out donuts, and they made my coffee nice and quick. Only complaint was the state of their sidewalks, which were completely incased in snow and ice, making them impossible to use, but that of course is a seasonal issue!

Address: 1189 Prospect St Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review:
Inside was slow to slower. Lots of new people not strategically placed (at register not a good call for rush hour). This added to the 90% of open mouth breathers lined up within two to three feet of each other (less than 10% wearing masks, and none on employees).  Yes on the high stars because I got in before the long anti-maskers line and new isn’t a bad thing. It reflects poor management.

The food?  Well, the pictures tell all. Although missing some icing that I wasn’t going to lick off the paper for, the donut was decent. The wrap?  Ewww the sauce. The breakfast wrap would do well without any sauce, let alone the glob in the center…took that bite and sorry team, I’m not suffering for you and spit it out. The tea was HOT (don’t put between your legs people!!). I found the Apple Cinnamon quite unique and tasty with a tad of sugar.

Oh myy!  The inside line is wrapping into the dining area. That’s some addiction when the line is uber long inside.

Address: 1189 Prospect St Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review:
I don't know what happened, if you have new management, or an entirely new staff, but the coffee has been tasting burnt for the past few months.

And then, when telling staff there is a problem, they charge you for a new coffee...

Address: 1189 Prospect St Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: I had my usual coffee in a friendly atmosphere. I have always felt home in Tim Hortons.  Good food and good beverages  here never failed to make me feel good.

Address: 1189 Prospect St Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: This tim hortons is always out of something. I have never gone through a McDonald's or A&W or Wendy's or any other fast food place and have them tell me they are out of eggs or bacon or something within the sandwich I'm ordering. If it's 7am breakfast how can you not have eggs?! Anyways. All tim hortons are disappointments across Canada. Including this one.

Address: 1165 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: They were ready for me when i ordered. Took my order, correctly the first time. The food was also way better then any other kfc location in the city!! Great job kfc regent keep up the hard work!!

Address: 1165 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: Staff was quiet barely said a word except how overpriced it was. Chicken was teeny tiny and overcooked. Only one drum stuck and 4 wings in a 10 pc bucket one breast and some thighs.  Way to greasy never again customers lost

Address: 1165 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: Best KFC chicken in Fredericton! Had a family birthday celebration, placed a pickup order and everything was perfect! Sidney ( supervisor) made sure or meal was on time and made to perfection. Thanks for your outstanding service!

Address: 1165 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review: Not happy with the  service I got yesterday. The  girl on charge  was not willing  to help  with what I was asking. It use to be a good place to go and use to go there alot but after  yesterday  I will think twice. Customer  service  should  be the most important  thing for a business. No customers  no money.  Very disappointed  since this was  my favorite  kfc location  in fredericton

Address: 1165 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3B9 Canada
Review:
The last 3 times we have gone to this location for supper (around 7) , they have been out of chicken. I get it being an hour until close, but I worked fast food for a decade and would get in so much trouble if we turned away customers because we did not want to cook more food 5 minutes before close. Not that I agreed, but the point is more than 30 minutes before it closes I should be able to get food.
So very done with trying to get some at this point.  Very much am not impressed

Address: 283 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1E3 Canada
Review: My worst dinner I ever had. The staff is not friendly and the foods is not good as the money you paid. Never come again

Address: 283 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1E3 Canada
Review: Spent $40 dollars on a triple bucket that includes 6 pieces of chicken, 4 tenders and popcorn chicken and a large popcorn chicken and 4 dipping sauces. They forgot my bucket of large popcorn chicken which I had to inform them of. Also, the 6 piece bucket of chicken only had wings and drums in it. The chicken also looked like someone mangled it before putting in the box. The dipping sauce I requested was wrong. The quality of their product and the service at this location are extremely poor and I will no longer be given them my business. Zero stars.

Address: 283 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1E3 Canada
Review: Ordered a spicy big crunch, no lettuce. Waited 35 minutes to get a spicy big crunch covered in brown lettuce. Specifically asked for no lettuce twice when  ordering. Once before leaving. Luckily. They replaced the sandwich with a lettuce free one once I asked if it indeed had none. Told me to keep the other. Thanks I guess.

Address: 283 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1E3 Canada
Review:
I just had 4 piece chicken .
The chicken sandwich as well for other person.
The worst I ever had ...
Tasted like old chicken re heated
The fries were old ,stale and cold. No sauce
Everything was cold. Might as well get it from their garbage bin.
Take out around 4pm
.
I'd give it minus 5 stars if it was an option.
.
North side KFC is the worst ever

Address: 283 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 1E3 Canada
Review: Worst chicken I have ever got at  a KFC ever, fries were cold and discoloured. The one piece of chicken I tried before throwing out was dripping with grease falling apart and tasted strongly of lemon spices

Address: 154-1381 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: They were ready for me when i ordered. Took my order, correctly the first time. The food was also way better then any other kfc location in the city!! Great job kfc regent keep up the hard work!!

Address: 154-1381 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: Staff was quiet barely said a word except how overpriced it was. Chicken was teeny tiny and overcooked. Only one drum stuck and 4 wings in a 10 pc bucket one breast and some thighs.  Way to greasy never again customers lost

Address: 154-1381 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: Best KFC chicken in Fredericton! Had a family birthday celebration, placed a pickup order and everything was perfect! Sidney ( supervisor) made sure or meal was on time and made to perfection. Thanks for your outstanding service!

Address: 154-1381 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review: Not happy with the  service I got yesterday. The  girl on charge  was not willing  to help  with what I was asking. It use to be a good place to go and use to go there alot but after  yesterday  I will think twice. Customer  service  should  be the most important  thing for a business. No customers  no money.  Very disappointed  since this was  my favorite  kfc location  in fredericton

Address: 154-1381 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3C 1A2 Canada
Review:
The last 3 times we have gone to this location for supper (around 7) , they have been out of chicken. I get it being an hour until close, but I worked fast food for a decade and would get in so much trouble if we turned away customers because we did not want to cook more food 5 minutes before close. Not that I agreed, but the point is more than 30 minutes before it closes I should be able to get food.
So very done with trying to get some at this point.  Very much am not impressed

Address: 243 St Mary's Street Fredericton, NB E3A 2S5 Canada
Review:
Kelsey is one of the best servers ever that I’ve encountered with. She was very nice, patient, polite and helpful taking order. Her suggestions were very point on.
And talking about the place, it was a very delight-full experience to say the least. The pizzas tasted authentic and flavourful. The dipping sauce and cheesy bread was a cherry on the cake. Love the place and will definitely come back again for one of the best food in Fredericton. Definitely recommend everyone to try it

Address: 243 St Mary's Street Fredericton, NB E3A 2S5 Canada
Review:
Hands down the best food experience we have had in a long time. Everything was amazing!

Also, the Texas Chipotle burger needs to be entered in a burger competition. UNREAL!

Address: 243 St Mary's Street Fredericton, NB E3A 2S5 Canada
Review: I have always been pleased with Pizza Delight’s food until this Father’s Day. We ordered a party size pizza and garlic cheese fingers for takeout which cost $60 odd . Since I had never had an issue with their food I did not open the boxes to check prior to getting home. When we opened the box we were all unpleasantly surprised to see an over cooked partially burnt pizza. My husband, who says he has never had a bad pizza could only eat one piece. I will certainly think twice before ordering from Pizza Delight again. Very disappointed.

Address: 243 St Mary's Street Fredericton, NB E3A 2S5 Canada
Review: Pizza delight st Mary's street Fredericton. Only about 4 tables occupied and waited 25 minutes when we finally left because nobody cared to even take our order. Absolutely garbage service. 6pm Thursday July 6 2023. Guy with long hair was supposed to be our waiter. When confronted said he was busy helping colleagues.  DO NOT RECOMMEND wasting your time here.

Address: 243 St Mary's Street Fredericton, NB E3A 2S5 Canada
Review: It was very good. I had a pizza and nacho combo. Husband had the Donair sub we both enjoys our meal.

Address: 989 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 2T7 Canada
Review:
The food was burnt and the waitress was nasty. The 3rd photo is the first plate of nachos, the 2nd photo is the redo and the crust on that pizza was non existence. The nachos smelled so bad it mad you gag. I can not believe any restaurant would serve this food!!! Go to a different Pizza Delight!! Personally I think the board of health should thoroughly inspect the kitchen
The waitress was a b$#ch from the moment  we walked in the doors. Our family won't go back.

Address: 989 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 2T7 Canada
Review: Went for a date with the woman before our bab was born, and I wasn't impressed with the service by any means, the server hardly seemed very interested that we were there and didn't even check on us until it was time to collect the bill. The food was good as always. Part of the restaurant experience is receiving good service upon arrival until you leave and this visit was a disappointment. Hopefully the next will be an improvement.

Address: 989 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 2T7 Canada
Review:
This is my second time here .. lunch special
6" pizza and chicken Nachos absolutely delicious!!! Our server was one of the nicest people ever ... very friendly and very accommodating 100 x better then either location in miramichi thats for sure .

Address: 989 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 2T7 Canada
Review: Absolutely the worst pizza I have ever had in 40 years. Just moved to Fredericton and thought we would try it out. The sauce was a Ketchup/BBQ sauce watery mixture, and the toppings had absolutely NO flavor whatsoever. The meat looked & tasted like it was from one of those subs you get in a variety store and put in the microwave. We ate part of one, and threw the second one in the garbage. I can't believe people put up with this and actually eat their pizza. I had to give it a star just to post, otherwise I would have given it a -11 (that's negative eleven).

Address: 989 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 2T7 Canada
Review: Service and food was good. But the dining area was too hot to sit. They must have their Ac working properly.

Address: 102 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 9N6 Canada
Review: We ordered 3 medium pizzas over the phone for pickup, one was gluten free crust. The pizzas were well made with lots of toppings, and tasted really good. The pizza sauce was different but really yummy. The gluten free pizza crust wasn’t half bad either. We will definitely get pizza here again when we’re visiting Fredericton!

Address: 102 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 9N6 Canada
Review: The crew put effort into remembering names, favourite orders etc. Food is exactly as I request, and I always do special orders. Clean kitchen area and great food

Address: 102 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 9N6 Canada
Review: I order 2 donairs one wrap and burger and both came squested flat I called the store back and they're saying they shipped it normal and wouldn't replace them

Address: 102 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 9N6 Canada
Review:
No sense to preorder online if you have to wait 30 min after you arrive???

Do you know, The first Greco Pizza restaurant opened in 1977 in Moncton, New Brunswick as Greco Donair...and Pizza. In 1981, the franchise rights were sold to Grinner's Food Systems Ltd. of Truro, Nova Scotia.[1]

Many Greco locations in rural areas are known as "Greco Express" outlets; they are typically associated with a motel, convenience store, or other existing establishment. In some locations, the Greco franchise is associated with a Captain Submarine franchise, another of Grinner's properties.

Address: 102 Main Street Fredericton, NB E3A 9N6 Canada
Review:
Called to get a medium cheese pizza with flavored crust from this location. I called at 3:30 and they had it done in ten minutes. The guy was super nice and talked to me a bit before he gave me the pizza. Honestly super impressed with Greco. It also tasted great!

Talked to Greco customer service about an awful experience I had at captain sub on sunset drive. They sent me multiple emails apologizing and even sent me a gift card! The pizza was great and their customer service at the local and chain level are both immaculate. Greco really seemed to be stepping up their game

Address: 1713 Woodstock Rd Fredericton, NB E3C 1L4 Canada
Review: Terrible experience at this location today. Spent 20 minutes in the drive through with 3 people ahead of us…the first vehicle had a drink and sandwich, the next two had drinks only as did we. I can be patient when things are busy or staffing is short but the two at the window could not have demonstrated a poorer work ethic.. To the young fellow who told me it had only been 20 seconds….you’ve got a lot to learn about customer service.

Address: 1713 Woodstock Rd Fredericton, NB E3C 1L4 Canada
Review: Wanted to order a chicken wrap but they didn't have chicken, then tried to order chipotle steak wrap and they didn't have rice, then ordered a roast beef craveable and they made me pay an extra 70 cents for the bagel without telling me because they were out of the regular bread. I asked why they charged extra and it was because the bagel cost more but I wanted the regular bread. Didn't want to switch foods because I'm sure it wasn't available. The cravable was also poorly made. An excess of sauce was flowing out of the bagel hole and the beef was loosely coming out of the sides. Would give 0 stars if I could will go to hanwell or prospect Tim's instead.

Address: 1713 Woodstock Rd Fredericton, NB E3C 1L4 Canada
Review:
This is the worst TH I have ever visited!
Empty and no service for several minutes! Employees chatting to each other ignoring us!
Watery coffee! Wasted my money!

Address: 1713 Woodstock Rd Fredericton, NB E3C 1L4 Canada
Review:
I wish i could give -10 stars.
One car ahead of me and i waited for 10 minutes at the window to be told they dont have bread or chicken or anything on the menu .
Horrible experience.
I do not recomend stoping there at all.

Address: 1713 Woodstock Rd Fredericton, NB E3C 1L4 Canada
Review:
They didn't have buns or wedges. Didn't have the tim bit flavors requested.
Really a waste of time especially when the line is always so long.

Address: 1475 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z2 Canada
Review: Service was amazing; our server was friendly and attentive. Gave great recommendations which we happily followed. We ordered the lobster roll, shrimp pasta, fish cake, and a salad. All were made well and tasted delicious! The portions were great — didn't leave you wanting but you didn't feel overwhelmingly full. Dessert was decadent without it being too sweet. Overall a really great time here.

Address: 1475 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z2 Canada
Review: Probably the best overall restaurant experience I've had in a long time. The food was incredibly delicious. The pistachio crusted salmon was a hit! I'm not a big huge salmon lover but this dish just made me fall in love with salmon! From the succulent taste and moist flavour of the salmon to the crusty pistachio, the emotion and love put into this dish was truly amazing. My wife had the lobster pasta. If you could only see the emotion she had after the first bite, you could say that her food adventure journey into finishing this dish was just the beginning. We ended our dinner with dessert and that too blew our minds! I can't even get into the amazing dinner service we had! Joshua made us feel at home and made sure everything was perfect! Almost felt like he was family! That's how amazing this restaurant is... The vibe, the people, the food was truly incredible. My wife and I can't wait to come back! Truly an amazing experience! I would recommend this restaurant from here to the moon and back! Cheers! 🍻

Address: 1475 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z2 Canada
Review: Amazing food and really nice atmosphere as well as top level service. All the food has its own distinguished flavor but the most impressive is the rice with scallops. The rice is soft and kind of milky and the scallops are strong. If it is less salty then it will be the best main dish I have ever.

Address: 1475 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z2 Canada
Review: We stopped by during our Royal Caribbean cruise vacation. This place did not let us down. The food is spectacular and well seasoned. The portions are amazing and the quality and taste deserve a 5 star rating. We had mussels for the appetizer. For the main course we had the lobster pasta and the lobster roll. And for the dessert we had the butterscotch cake. We recommend them all. Great atmosphere too. It was a great day to sit outside.

Address: 1475 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z2 Canada
Review:
The food was amazing! It was the best beef short rib I've had. The dessert, scallops, and pasta we had were good too.
The drinks we well made and the table service were good. The location was great and right at the water.
My only criticism was that the bathroom looked like a tornado blew through it. There was no paper towel in the dispenser, the facial tissue was soaked and the floor/counter was soaked too. I made a mention of it when I used the washroom earlier in the meal, but it was not addressed for the whole meal. I expected more at the restaurant of this caliber.

Address: 217 Waverly Road Dartmouth, NS B2X 2C3 Canada
Review: Restaurant was very busy on a Monday night. Crystal provided great service! This is a very well run place. Food was quickly served and it was excellent!! Amazingly large menu which allowed every member of the party to order something different. Every table was filled when we arrived at 7pm and for good reason! This restaurant draws you in and then gives plenty of reasons to return again  and again!

Address: 217 Waverly Road Dartmouth, NS B2X 2C3 Canada
Review: We have been here a few times now and the friendly service and amazing food is what keeps us coming back for more to continue with our supporting locally owned businesses.   Tonites experience was by far one of our better experiences .   Our order was taken in a timely manner , our drinks and food were brought out promptly and the food was amazing as always.  Our waitress Kathleen was super and was always coming back to check on us and make sure that every bite was delightful .   We even made sure to save room for dessert because if you have not yet tried it their deep fried ice cream and their brownie ice cream dessert were amazing .    We will definitely be back for more again soon .

Address: 217 Waverly Road Dartmouth, NS B2X 2C3 Canada
Review: Had a good time with family and friends. Food was great, except for well-done steak, it wasn't consistent one was delicious & juicy and another was burnt a bit. My kid liked the cheese burger. Beef Gravy & Collard salad was amazing.

Address: 217 Waverly Road Dartmouth, NS B2X 2C3 Canada
Review: It was as a great place we discovered during our visit. The service was great and the food even better. Highly recommended. It's a busy restaurant, even during the middle of the week, call or reserve before you go

Address: 217 Waverly Road Dartmouth, NS B2X 2C3 Canada
Review:
You must bring your ID over 19 .
I registered already but waiting outside 20min. There are busy , crowed peoples,
But Food is Good . Donot recommended where is a quiet place this one.
noisy and waiting time .

Address: 2053 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B3 Canada
Review: Amazing experience. Food is absolutely a must try ( we had the half charcuterie board, the trout, the gnocchi and the sticky toffee cake). The cocktails are amazing and so unique, I would really recommend for any kind of occasions !

Address: 2053 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B3 Canada
Review: We had the pleasure of having Cora as our server. She was awesome and adorable. The food and atmosphere was warm and lively. A bit on the loud and festive side but very lively in the best ways.

Address: 2053 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B3 Canada
Review:
Incredible experience!
We had expected a lot from Edna as several of our friends had mentioned it for our trip to Halifax. Without a doubt, this place delivered. We were seated along the windows at the front of the restaurant, allowing us to watch the foot traffic on the lively street. The restaurant is long and has a wonderful wood and brass arch anchoring the room and housing the seated bar.
We started with tuna poke and fried oysters. Both were fantastic. We shared the scallops and striped bass for mains. Both completely amazing dishes. The scallops had squash of all kinds, prepared in a several different ways. Bringing some savoury to the dish was cubed, fried ham bits. The bass was the special and came together nicely with bok choy, creamed kale, and baby red potatoes. It was mouth-watering. Just incredible.
The portion size was sensible and we had little room for dessert. We managed to wrap our lips around a sticky toffee cake served with black sesame ice cream. Unreal.
Our server was extremely mindful and friendly. With great suggestions from the menu (and things to do around town), our experience was made complete by the outstanding service.
You must eat here if you are in Halifax.

Address: 2053 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B3 Canada
Review: This was honestly, the best dining experience I’ve had in years. We came in for lunch and the food was incredible all around. The service was friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating to my friend’s gluten intolerance. Not to mention this restaurant is GORGEOUS! Beautiful atmosphere. We were there during the day but I bet it’s really romantic at night. Can’t wait to come back!

Address: 2053 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B3 Canada
Review: This meal is absolutely the one to beat when it comes to our down east travels - we don’t think it can be topped!! We came in for an early dinner after a recommendation from a friend and we were not disappointed. The staff were all lovely and extremely attentive. Service was fast and we had food at the table very quickly which is appreciated when travelling with a little one. We enjoyed the steak tartare and crispy Brussels sprouts to start - loved them both, especially the vinegar in the Brussels. Our little one enjoyed the trout which was juicy and topped with a lovely parsley salad. The dish that stole the show and our hearts was the steak - wow. It was served with fingerlings, mushrooms and a pea purée. Absolutely delicious. We will be dreaming about this until our next visit. Thank you for a lovely and memorable evening!

Address: 22 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1G9 Canada
Review: What a great brunch! I have my daughter the choice between three of the top ten brunch places in the city. She picked The Canteen on Portland and everyone was happy. The Benny's were amazing. Get the lobster, it's worth it. The French toast was the best ever, not too sweet, just right. Everything was excellent. The food was complimented by the service which was just right. The atmosphere was ok, not great but we did like the art. We had a great experience and will be back.

Address: 22 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1G9 Canada
Review: Service was lovely. Options for gluten free. Server was lovely about requests to our order. Lunch special had lovely flavours and was truly well crafted. Lovely tea in a pot. Fabulous coffee  Atmosphere was a bit noisy up until after 1 pm. But regardless we will come back soon.

Address: 22 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1G9 Canada
Review: The Canteen is an absolute must on your "To Eat" list! Well worth the (quite enjoyable) ferry ride, the Canteen combines atmosphere, care, affordable prices and fine dining. 3 people suggested I take the short ferry ride from Halifax to eat here - and I now understand why! The brussel sprouts are simply heavenly, combining an orchestra of flavors that only gets better with  each bite. As a complete beginner with oysters, I was blown away with how fresh the Canteen's oysters were. Not 'slimy' in the slightest, I enjoyed them with a squirt of lemon juice, although the house mignonette was fantastic as well. My server, Mark, was immensely professional and deeply cared about providing a SENSATIONAL experience!! He offered fantastic pairing suggestions, created special cocktails and coffees based on my tastes, offered sound advice on the menu, and truly cared for the clientele. I wish I could give the Canteen 10 stars! A stop you simply cannot miss in Halifax, whether you are visiting for a few days or a local. *I highly recommend making a reservation!! The place is well- known all over the country for its fantastic dishes, but I was easily able to secure a table the morning of! The prices are quite reasonable, but I enjoyed an appetizer, entrée, dessert, 3 cocktails and a specialty coffee!

Address: 22 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1G9 Canada
Review: Food was fresh and delicious, albeit a bit pricey. Definitely worth a trip on a splurge day. Recommend reserving a table in as much advance as you can as you usually can't get one for the day of / walk-in, in my experience. They also don't open until 5pm for dinner so be mindful of the weather because you won't be getting in sooner.

Address: 22 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1G9 Canada
Review:
Two of us shared a crobster roll and the risotto with scallops and it was incredible!  Might give the slight edge to the crobster roll, but my wife chooses the risotto...  Just a sign that Everything on menu is worth ordering.

Server was very attentive but not overbearing. Parking was difficult for us, we were about 5 blocks away.

Address: 1533 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z4 Canada
Review: Our server, John, was fabulous, from greeting and seating, straight through to wishing us goodbye as we left. The food was Incredible! The Buttermilk biscuits with molasses butter was a beautiful appetizer. I had the Kale Caesar salad with chicken and I loved EVERY BITE. Both of these paired well with the Pop shop-inspired mixed drink I had. The dessert - maple creme brûlée - I could have married that. The atmosphere was fantastic, and the music wasn’t so loud that we couldn’t have a simple conversation. 100% recommend, and will return.

Address: 1533 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z4 Canada
Review:
First time time in Halifax and enjoyed my time at this restaurant. The burgers are great and fries are good.
The drinks are on average. Little priced higher on the drinks but then again I'm from out of town.

The overall atmosphere is good nothing to complain about. The waiters and waitresses are nice. Would come back in the future!

Address: 1533 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z4 Canada
Review: It was a blustery Halifax day, a few hours before a snow storm when we stumbled onto 2 Doors Down and decided to have an early supper. The ambiance of the restaurant is great, not overly bright, very clean, appropriate decor for a romantic night out or a lovely gathering with friends around food and wine. The food was delicious. My wife said it was one of the best gourmet burgers she's ever had. They have a fair selection of local libations to choose from at reasonable prices for this type of establishment. Our wait staff was great, Kyle in particular was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back.

Address: 1533 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z4 Canada
Review: We had a large group of 20 come in for dinner which the restaurant kindly accommodated. The service was prompt and the food came out in a timely manner despite the group size. The tacos were on point, the brisket was tender and melty, the lobster mac was creamy and flavourful, and the scallops hit the spot.

Address: 1533 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z4 Canada
Review:
The Old School burguer was one of the best burguers I've ever had. Perfectly seasoned and balanced, absolutely delicious. Very likely I will be coming back here for more. The cider on rotation the Perry recommended by our server was delicious and paired very well with the burguers.

Service was incredibly kind and prompt while not feeling rushed. Really enjoyed every aspect of this dinner.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: So we dropped in for lunch and decided to sit inside as it was still a little cool outside.  I grabbed a lager as we were deciding what to order.  My wife decided on the Thai bowl and I had the seafood chowder with molasses bread. The chowder was good and so was the beer.  My wife didn't finish her bowl because the flavor was just too overpowering. She struggled past the third bite. I was good, just too much of it. The servers seemed to be somewhat new, but they were good and made it an excellent experience. This is the second time we have frequented this location and will return for sure.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Visited 2 doors Down while in Dartmouth on the way to the airport to have dinner. We had the Old School Smash Burger and added bacon. We also had parm fries as the side and they were delicious. We also had the seafood chowder. The seafood chowder was really good.. with no shortage of seafood, which I appreciated! I’d definitely encourage anyone to have their smash burgers because they were amazing!! The service was also excellent.. our waiter was very attentive and helpful.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review:
Delicious. Did the dine around menu and it was superb! A little pricey, so didn't end up getting a cocktail. Will be back to try regular menu items as it was hard deciding between many entrees.
Was a little cold/drafty sitting by the window, so sitting farther in the back would have been more cozy.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Different kind of style of food. What I'm used to getting. Other than that was not too bad. Everybody there was nice and friendly and made us comfortable. Kids love mac and cheese

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Don’t be fooled by the unpretentious outside albeit with a nice patio, the foods great and service was excellent. I had the vegetarian noodle soup and my husband had the pork chop with glaze. Desserts were excellent - great Angel cake berry dessert and ice cream sandwich got a big thumbs up from the ice cream addict. Two thumbs up from me for the great selection of iconic music which will have you  tapping along.

Address: 171 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review:
Best Asian food I've had in a long time. Ordered the Dinner for Two (B) and every dish was amazing. The flavors were wonderful, it was much better than any other Asian restaurant I've been to recently. Wonton soup alone is worth coming back for. Servings were huge too.
The service was great, staff were very friendly and quick to refill waters.
Doesn't look like much from the outside, but once inside it has lots of traditional Asian art and decor. The fish tank was clean and not overstocked, which is great to see. The music was in Chinese (I think) which is another nice atmospheric touch.

Address: 171 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Honest hard-working Chinese family operates this restaurant, their older children help out with the cleaning of tables. Large portions, very reasonably priced and quick service. Would definitely come again.

Address: 171 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review:
I went to Modern Orchid because my friend recommended it, and I'm so glad she did! The cashew nut chicken was amazing, and it came with a perfect little spring roll and perfectly cooked rice. There was a bit of zip to the chicken and vegetables, but not too much that I couldn't enjoy the flavours. After my meal, they brought me a nice little bowl of chocolate ice cream, free of charge.
5/5 recommend.

Address: 171 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Overall a great, fresh-tasting meal! I ordered through skip the dishes and got the chicken lettuce wraps, a veggie spring roll, and a pork spring roll to try. The lettuce wraps were absolutely delicious and made a perfect lunch, but the filling was really liquidy so they were definitely messy to eat. The spring rolls were great as well- I would recommend the meat spring roll! The veggie spring roll was a little lacking in crunch and flavour but still nice. The sweet and sour sauce is yummy as well. I will definitely eat here again!

Address: 171 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: This is another great chinese restaurant in Dartmouth. staff is warm welcoming and friendly. cuisine tastes nicely, dishes are value money. Highly recommend the Singapore fried noodle and beef rice noodle.

Address: 62 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C2 Canada
Review: Great place for a tasty burger and a pint. The service was great and the draught variety was awesome. The patio had shade options. I hate the sun but my wife loves it so it's great to get an option that makes us both happy. We were there celebrating a birthday. No one came to sing so that made us happy.

Address: 62 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C2 Canada
Review:
Went in here for a late afternoon lunch. The place was packed and had a fun atmosphere. Although the seating is a bit tight the place was very clean and hygienic.

Ordered a Fried Chicken and a Mushroom Hoagie along with the Jupiter Cocktail and a Mocktail. The chicken sandwich was fine but we were left a bit disappointed with the Mushroom Hoagie. The fries were good too. The cocktail was excellent.

Hope they improve upon the vegetarian/vegan menu but otherwise alright.

Address: 62 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C2 Canada
Review:
Truly one of the best hangout spots/bars in Downtown Dartmouth. The staff are extremely friendly, the decor panders to a mix of geek cultures in a maximalist and playful way, something both my boyfriend and I really enjoyed, and the atmosphere felt extremely relaxed and comfortable for two easily overstimulated bar-goers, though we were there extremely early in the day.

Unfortunately we never had a chance to try the food, but the menu hits all the necessary classics and we hope to be back soon to try some!

Address: 62 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C2 Canada
Review: Great downtown Dartmouth location. We arrived on Saturday lunch hour and it was super busy. The service was great 👍 Food was good for the price. We found it was a bit cramped in the small space, and because of this, we found it difficult to converse with others at our table. Overall, I give it 4*

Address: 62 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C2 Canada
Review:
Battery Park was a pretty cool spot to have a few beers and grab a bite.

We sat down on the patio and, even though it was a chilly evening, we enjoyed the atmosphere.

We tried several different beers and, we definitely found a couple of favorites. The food was quite tasty, simple but, well executed.

Overall, service was also good, a little laid-back but, still responsive so, no complaints!

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review: I was hungry after work and there were lots of people around because of the NAIG happening. I ate inside but there was a table next to me that was very loud and noisy.  There was also a table of kids. I had to wear my earbuds and play music and eat but it still was noisy. The Korean pork tacos were excellent but a little messy. The cocktails I'd had before and were refreshing. Loved the chocolate tofu pie and was pretty full after.

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
The seitan donair was really good 5/5 stars! And the roasties were really good too! The vegetarian special was not good, it tasted like left over food from yesterday. The pasta over cooked, cold and the “roasted vegetables” were just vegetables cut and thrown on the plate! The fish cakes would be a 3/5 nothing crazy…. The garlic “pizza” was small but it is what it said it was.
Overall pretty decent restaurant but the portions didn’t really justify the price. The concept behind the restaurant is nice.

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
Disappointed, again. This is the second and last time I’ll eat here, The food does not ring true to their mission statement of being locally sourced. It was bland and uninteresting, the ingredients were clearly not in house made and tasted like it came from a can. I had the eggplant parmigiana which was basically a piece grocery store eggplant roasted with cheese on top..

I don’t feel good about this review, and the food also made me feel sick.

The staff was delightful and I found that made the experience better.

Thanks

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
Attended here for a work lunch gathering a few weeks back. This was my first and likely my last visit. Our server was very friendly and attentive, the bright spot to my experience.
I ordered the Monkey Club with roasties as the side. The sandwich was underwhelming for taste and the bun it was served on was dry and crumbled in your hands. The roasties, which are their oven baked potato wedges, were nothing to write home about.
This wasn't the worst dining experience I've had, but it was far from memorable in a positive way. The product did not match up with the price and therefore I could not recommend it. I imagine it does well based on it's convenient location and it's accommodation to different dietary needs.

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review: Very good service with good food.  The reason for 4 stars is that it's good food but not great food.  We were a large group so we got a chance to try quite a few items.  Everything was decent but just lacking that little bit extra to out it over the top.  For ex, the scallops in the pasta were a bit over cooked.  The pasta itself was a bit underseasoned.  There were a good things as well, the brushetta was awesome, the caeser salad was pretty good and the pork loin tacos were good.  I think it's safe to say we enjoyed the appies more than the entrées.

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
The food was fantastic, and the service was even better. I don't think I've ever had such good service in a restaurant. Importantly, the server was very proactively helpful to one of our party at navigating the menu for a dietary restriction.
I ordered the scallop pasta. It was delicious. As feedback though, I think I'd suggest mentioning in the menu how many scallops are in the dish. As a tourist from a non-coastal part of Canada, seafood pricing in restaurants is unfamiliar to me. So despite how much I loved the dish and would recommend it, I may have chosen something different had I known how many scallops would be involved. Not a complaint, just feedback from a tourist who is still learning to ask before ordering when it comes to mouthwateringly delicious, fresh seafood.
Oh, and get the creme brule. It's worth it.

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
The atmosphere was very good given the clean, well-organized promises and beautiful views of the Halifax skyline. I found the staff to be very friendly and the food quality was also good. I found the place to be a little bit on the pricey side though.

I recommend this place. My experience here was positive.

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
There's a lot to love about "The Wooden Monkey", as a fan of sustainable farming they are a glowing example of how we can have awesomely delicious food while working with local farms to achieve true farm to plate as a business model.

The menu is based off seasonal and local offerings so it may change based on the time of the year but you'll find veg and non veg offerings at pretty much anytime of the year.

If you're looking for a great date spot or just love good food, check out the wooden monkey!

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
Great atmosphere on the patio, beautiful setting. Indoors was spacious and inviting.
Server was very energetic, attentive and polite.
Food was very good, ordered a pizza. This place is excellent for allergies. Clear answers, allergy guide online and great responses.
Highly recommend trying it out.

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review: Funny (but also semi seriously) they should have called it the hokey pokey, bc you will get yourself all turned around trying to find the entrance. Go into the Market and follow signs for elevator. It's on the 2nd floor. I cannot think of a restaurant where I've eaten more/better to die for food. Everything was absolutely delish. Our waiter, Sam, was great. We sat outside on a chilly day, they provided blankets for guests that were cold. 10/10, find a way to make sure you eat here!

Address: 1740 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B6 Canada
Review:
Great first night Halifax, glad we decided on this place. The atmosphere was excellent, and just the right noise level for us.

They were booked up and we didn’t have reservations so we sat at the bar. The staff at the bar were excellent, very friendly and knew when to chat and when to be scarce get seats if you have the chance.

We had the 5 Fish Experience and it was great, everything cooked perfectly, though I will admit the portion was a tad small for my expectation.

Address: 1740 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B6 Canada
Review:
This place is fantastic! Was a recommendation from a friend. We were only in Halifax for two nights but after enjoying it so much the first night we returned. We made a reservation and were seated promptly. The whole place had a great vibe with friendly staff and excellent music. Our server Sydney was excellent! She made several recommendations and was spot on with each one. The drinks we enjoyed were The South End (gin) and Tequila Mockingbird (Tequila) and they were delicious!

Food: Five Fishermen Experience, Arctic Char (was trout because they were out but was excellent), Oysters Rockefeller, Mushrooms Apps, Seared Scallops, Mussels, and Crab cakes. We did think the serving size of 3 very small scallops was a little lacking, but it tasted very good.

I felt like my stomach got a hug after eating here! So good! Would definitely go back next time we are in town.

Address: 1740 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B6 Canada
Review: 5 stars are not enough for my experience here. Food was amazing (shrimp toast was delicious), staff were lovely and the restaurant is stunning. My spouse booked our reservation for our 6 year anniversary, they went above and beyond with a complimentary drink and even gave me a rose after our dinner. Unbeknownst to the staff he proposed that night on the waterfront and having the service and experience we did that night made everything more magical. Definitely a go for date night 🤍

Address: 1740 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B6 Canada
Review: An upscale experience for sure but I don't know that the food necessarily deserved the same? Pricing felt a little too expensive for what was served. Regardless the food was tasty and well made. Service was quick and friendly. Our waiter was so personable which made the restaurant experience feel less formal - because we certainly weren't.

Address: 1740 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B6 Canada
Review:
Great beautiful modern lounge style dining experience.

Food was amazing. We had a delicious lightly dressed ceasar salad with pumpernickel croutons.

Our mains were a big bowl of mussels cooked it what tasted like a lightly sweet and savory french onion soup that paired well with the sour dough toasted bread wedges for dipping.

The other mains were the five fishermen experience had a very savory mushroom based mushroom risotto, and the scallop grenoblise had very plump, juicy tender scallops.

Our server was amazing, Laura. She was very accommodating, suggesting slight variations to the dishes to suit our taste, was also very friendly, attentive and had great attention to detail.

Definitely one of the best seafood places in Halifax, definitely worth the extra money!

Address: 2057 Gottingen Halifax, NS B3K 3B2 Canada
Review: A sweet little spot to hangout for a few drinks ans food. Came here on a Friday night at around 9:30. They had live music and the place was pretty busy. We were just able to snag a spot for 2. Despite the small size, the place didn't feel overcrowded. Service was quick and they had a good selection of drinks and bar food. The music was really good and the overall atmosphere felt very welcoming. Parking was a bit of a challenge but we were definitely glad we came!

Address: 2057 Gottingen Halifax, NS B3K 3B2 Canada
Review:
A must dine in when you go to Halifax! Awesome, courteous, quick service! The Elliot Page vegan chocolate cake ( layered chocolate cake with creamy chocolate mousse) an absolute perfect end to the scrumptious meal…even if you share it (though you wouldn’t want to share it!)

Everything we ordered was so flavourful. It has many vegan options (the pics are some of the vegan options available). They also have gluten-free options!

They even have weekly events like Trivia, Open Mic, Live Music and Comedy evenings; though we didn’t make it for those.

Address: 2057 Gottingen Halifax, NS B3K 3B2 Canada
Review: Service was awesome, fun atmosphere, live music when we went was really good. Although very cold in the winter with the door opening and closing but overall really nice.

Address: 2057 Gottingen Halifax, NS B3K 3B2 Canada
Review: Had a reservation for roughly 10 people. Staff were friendly and food was good. The service however was very slow. The two women working the tables just sat behind the bar chit chatting. Several people sat there for 40min without being asked if they want their drink replenished. They also screwed up my food order. Customer service needs improvement.

Address: 2057 Gottingen Halifax, NS B3K 3B2 Canada
Review: This place is cozy and the music is not too loud. You can have a nice conversation. There's a good selection of beer. The service is friend and the haddock burger was just succulent! Best I've ever had.

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: Staff are very friendly and accomodating, they take pride in putting the customer first. The wrap I had was delicious (chicken fajita with bacon) chicken is roasted on site as well as the bacon. The vegetables are crisp and fresh and you build it the way you like it. Best of the best. Delicious and I am fan, highly recommend if you want a custom, tasty and fresh sandwich. The clubhouse is delicious too...just saying!

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: Amazing food, amazing price, amazing staff. My husband and I will definitely be back 🩷

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: This is a great little sandwich shop! I usually get the chicken salad sandwich but the staff/owner will probably attempt to persuade you to try the clubhouse with fries, (which my girl ordered), and it’s great too! The fries are really good, as are the prices so if you’re looking for a tasty sandwich, soup and/or salad at an incredibly reasonable price, I’d recommend giving The Dill Pickle a go.

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: My husband and I just went there for the first time. We were very impressed.  Food was great and great prices. The biggest thing was the man at the cash. You very rarely experience such amazing customer service. I previously Managed restaurants for many years and would have loved for someone so amazing to have worked for me. Great Job!!!

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review:
I was HIGHLY amazed when stepping in this place.
I was hungry and googled “food near me” when I seen this place pop up. So, without second guessing I was on my way to try this place.

Immediately I was greeted and they took my order right away.
The staff were so friendly and helpful.
And the food was SO GOOD. If you’re looking for a good home cooked meal, this is the place to go!

I will definitely be returning when I’m back in Dartmouth for work!

I did a review on my TikTok if you want to see my reaction when trying the meal!
@hope_thescorpio

Address: 4 Panavista Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3M8 Canada
Review:
I went to Vines Pasta Grill & had the Wednesday night pasta buffet. Oh my goodness, it was so good.
How much pasta can one eat !? There was about 8 different pastas, a soup, warm bread and mussels ! I tried small portions of most of the pasta, but it was allot of food !
Everything tasted great and the service was great too !

Address: 4 Panavista Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3M8 Canada
Review: The food is wonderful, great spot up on the hill! I think they had a sick call the last time I was there bc our server had way too many tables to give anyone good service (not their fault for sure). We made the best of the evening by making a joke about how we never got what we asked for or that all the tables around us sat dirty after people left (for 2hrs). I understand how hard it is to find service staff. If this had been my first time I could see not wanting to return. But this situation had never been the case before. Maybe have some grace for your server if you happen to have a similar experience. Maybe they'll be able to get their staffing issues sorted before the height of summer. Wishing them the best!

Address: 4 Panavista Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3M8 Canada
Review: Excellent food and service. While entrance is not appealing - don’t be fooled! Food and service is exceptional. Had the shrimp and scallop flambé - delicious. Followed by the After Eight cheesecake - service is top notch!

Address: 4 Panavista Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3M8 Canada
Review: Amazing meal and the server was fantastic as well. It was my first time going but it definitely won't be the last.  The bread made in house was delicious! 100% would recommend!

Address: 4 Panavista Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3M8 Canada
Review: We tried their pasta bar. Lots of variety, moderate price. Salads and muscles were excellent. Lots of garlic! The rolls were fresh and delicious,  we wanted to eat 10 of them... We didn't try the soups, but they sounded good. We tried all the pastas,  just a tiny spoon of each. Our favorites were the new lobster ravioli and the cheese and spinach manicotti... The lasagna was nice, each pasta produced with care. I would certainly go back again, bring a friend... Service was very attentive by all staff...

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review: I was hungry after work and there were lots of people around because of the NAIG happening. I ate inside but there was a table next to me that was very loud and noisy.  There was also a table of kids. I had to wear my earbuds and play music and eat but it still was noisy. The Korean pork tacos were excellent but a little messy. The cocktails I'd had before and were refreshing. Loved the chocolate tofu pie and was pretty full after.

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
The seitan donair was really good 5/5 stars! And the roasties were really good too! The vegetarian special was not good, it tasted like left over food from yesterday. The pasta over cooked, cold and the “roasted vegetables” were just vegetables cut and thrown on the plate! The fish cakes would be a 3/5 nothing crazy…. The garlic “pizza” was small but it is what it said it was.
Overall pretty decent restaurant but the portions didn’t really justify the price. The concept behind the restaurant is nice.

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
Disappointed, again. This is the second and last time I’ll eat here, The food does not ring true to their mission statement of being locally sourced. It was bland and uninteresting, the ingredients were clearly not in house made and tasted like it came from a can. I had the eggplant parmigiana which was basically a piece grocery store eggplant roasted with cheese on top..

I don’t feel good about this review, and the food also made me feel sick.

The staff was delightful and I found that made the experience better.

Thanks

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
Attended here for a work lunch gathering a few weeks back. This was my first and likely my last visit. Our server was very friendly and attentive, the bright spot to my experience.
I ordered the Monkey Club with roasties as the side. The sandwich was underwhelming for taste and the bun it was served on was dry and crumbled in your hands. The roasties, which are their oven baked potato wedges, were nothing to write home about.
This wasn't the worst dining experience I've had, but it was far from memorable in a positive way. The product did not match up with the price and therefore I could not recommend it. I imagine it does well based on it's convenient location and it's accommodation to different dietary needs.

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review: Very good service with good food.  The reason for 4 stars is that it's good food but not great food.  We were a large group so we got a chance to try quite a few items.  Everything was decent but just lacking that little bit extra to out it over the top.  For ex, the scallops in the pasta were a bit over cooked.  The pasta itself was a bit underseasoned.  There were a good things as well, the brushetta was awesome, the caeser salad was pretty good and the pork loin tacos were good.  I think it's safe to say we enjoyed the appies more than the entrées.

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
The food was fantastic, and the service was even better. I don't think I've ever had such good service in a restaurant. Importantly, the server was very proactively helpful to one of our party at navigating the menu for a dietary restriction.
I ordered the scallop pasta. It was delicious. As feedback though, I think I'd suggest mentioning in the menu how many scallops are in the dish. As a tourist from a non-coastal part of Canada, seafood pricing in restaurants is unfamiliar to me. So despite how much I loved the dish and would recommend it, I may have chosen something different had I known how many scallops would be involved. Not a complaint, just feedback from a tourist who is still learning to ask before ordering when it comes to mouthwateringly delicious, fresh seafood.
Oh, and get the creme brule. It's worth it.

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
The atmosphere was very good given the clean, well-organized promises and beautiful views of the Halifax skyline. I found the staff to be very friendly and the food quality was also good. I found the place to be a little bit on the pricey side though.

I recommend this place. My experience here was positive.

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
There's a lot to love about "The Wooden Monkey", as a fan of sustainable farming they are a glowing example of how we can have awesomely delicious food while working with local farms to achieve true farm to plate as a business model.

The menu is based off seasonal and local offerings so it may change based on the time of the year but you'll find veg and non veg offerings at pretty much anytime of the year.

If you're looking for a great date spot or just love good food, check out the wooden monkey!

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
Great atmosphere on the patio, beautiful setting. Indoors was spacious and inviting.
Server was very energetic, attentive and polite.
Food was very good, ordered a pizza. This place is excellent for allergies. Clear answers, allergy guide online and great responses.
Highly recommend trying it out.

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review: Funny (but also semi seriously) they should have called it the hokey pokey, bc you will get yourself all turned around trying to find the entrance. Go into the Market and follow signs for elevator. It's on the 2nd floor. I cannot think of a restaurant where I've eaten more/better to die for food. Everything was absolutely delish. Our waiter, Sam, was great. We sat outside on a chilly day, they provided blankets for guests that were cold. 10/10, find a way to make sure you eat here!

Address: Bedford Place Mall 1658 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 2X9 Canada
Review: Haven't been here in awhile. So pleased to find its still as great as always! I love the interior with the sock-hop cafe style. So cool that there's a jukebox and any song you request is a donation to the IWK. Service was fast and friendly. It's my favorite place for fish cakes 😋 2 pieces, slightly crispy outside and tasty inside. Love their chow, a bit tangy. First time having one of their shakes and it was awesome! A whole dessert in itself. Overall a great dining experience 👌

Address: Bedford Place Mall 1658 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 2X9 Canada
Review: Great Service, server was friendly and professional. My burger with onion rings was tasty and arrived hot. The turkey dinner was delicious but arrived luke warm. Key menu item chili was unavailable.

Address: Bedford Place Mall 1658 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 2X9 Canada
Review: STOP 🛑! Give this place a chance! You’ll be pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food! The milkshakes are fantastic and we only tried the classics chocolate and a strawberry milkshake! If you feel hungry two must tries are the seafood chowder 🦞 and the burgers, more specifically the Bangger Burger.

Address: Bedford Place Mall 1658 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 2X9 Canada
Review:
I'm still getting used to Candian prices,so it seemed a tad pricey, But I am not positive about that.  I didn't like the fish in the fish and chips, but that was on ME, not the cook.  I didn't notice it was halibut, I was expecting perch or cod, but that is not the restaurant's fault.  The breading on the fish was good. It was just the Halibut consistency I don't like.  My son got a burger and a side of sausages, which he enjoyed.  My wife got turkey BLT and onion rings.  We also got a shake, float and a waffle desert, all of which were quite good.  The shake comes in a glass but with the metal mixing cup like they used to do at some places I went as a kid.

Heather was out waitress, very nice and attentive.  Atmosphere was nice.  Could have used a Pinball table, but minor quibble.  If we get by again will definitely return.

Address: Bedford Place Mall 1658 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 2X9 Canada
Review: I've been meaning to visit for years. Finally my brother and I stopped in for a late lunch. I intended on getting a burger and they seem to have an interesting array of burgers on the menu but we opted for the hot turkey and the hot hamburger sandwiches. They were hot and fresh, made to order. Fries are hot crisp and fresh. We also ordered coleslaw on the side which was a tasty addition.  Our server was nice and friendly. Looking forward to returning and trying something else.

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J Canada
Review:
Stopped in last evening and I’m so glad we did.

Right off the jump, we were treated so well. The staff are outstanding; friendly, engaging and knowledgeable.

It wasn’t long before we turned the decision making over to them and boy, they made it wonderful.

We started with fresh oysters, shared their Burger Week offering and picked items from the Dine Around menu, having a veritable smorgasbord of deliciousness.

The dessert, oh my, what a treat. Hats off to the pastry chef.

Completely impressed with the cocktails they crafted for us. There is a lot of beverage experience & knowledge, coupled with passion in spades.

We will be back!

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J Canada
Review:
Loved the vibe. The place is beautifully set up. We went for the brunch and it was delicious. We ordered eggs Benedict with salmon and the avocado croissant. The mimosa’s have a special place in our hearts now.
Would Definitely recommend. :)

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J Canada
