Review: We went there for our friends birthday, we were five people in total. It had a lot of sitting space but I’ve heard that it’s mostly reserved. Better to book it in advance. I would definitely go there again if I’m in Halifax. Their fries were very fresh and dips were awesome.

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J Canada
Review: An absolutely incredible venue for a wedding! The manager and all of the supporting staff at Lot Six went above and beyond to execute everything so flawlessly. They worked with us to create personalized details that we had in mind, and were very flexible and helpful leading up to the big day as well as on the day of. The food, drinks, and whole atmosphere were amazing. The atrium was a beautiful backdrop for both a ceremony and reception. All of our guests had an incredible time. I would recommend Lot Six for anyone looking for a place to have their wedding!

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J Canada
Review: Lot Six is by far one of our favourite Restaurants. It has a beautiful ambiance especially in the atrium with its glass roof and Edison lights. It's lively and the service it always great even when they are busy. The cocktails are always delicious and the food keeps us coming back again and again. If the atrium is too much for you they also have a study which is another dining area off the front bar. It's quieter and delivers a great alternative for those who may not want to sit in the atrium with the main bar and music.

Address: 1345 Hammonds Plains Road Hammonds Plains, NS B4B 1P6 Canada
Review:
Cold rainy day, so I ordered hot chocolate, which arrived just over room temperature. We had the fish and chips (cod), which were ok, nothing to scream about. The small burger was overpowered by the locally smoked bacon, which was tough and rubbery. The food is as advertised. Edible.
The waitress was polite, friendly, and attentive.10/10.

Address: 1345 Hammonds Plains Road Hammonds Plains, NS B4B 1P6 Canada
Review:
Visiting and touring Halifax area from Ontario. Stopped here for a bite to eat. Really good food! Came out hot and tasted home made, not the typical chain restaurant. Lots of parking.
Also very accommodating. I currently use a cane to walk so they seated us at ground level so I didn't have to go upstairs to the main eating area.
P.S. the pressed juice is delicious!

Address: 1345 Hammonds Plains Road Hammonds Plains, NS B4B 1P6 Canada
Review: I hadn't been to Edible Matters for a while, since the renovation, and when I visited recently it was really great! The tomato soup and sandwich was delicious (and affordable, the whole menu seemed fairly priced). Also the bakery case was full of so many good looking treats, we tried one of the cheesecake slices and it was super yummy, big enough for two to share with plenty for each! We made reservations before coming but it was not too busy at all anyway around dinner time on a Thursday night. I hope to come again to visit the cafe!

Address: 1345 Hammonds Plains Road Hammonds Plains, NS B4B 1P6 Canada
Review:
Beer battered cod was delicious. Side ceasar salads not so much. A touch of romaine with what looked like spring mix, watery dressing and no garlic flavoring. One came without croutons.
Pulled pork tacos were quite dry.

Address: 1345 Hammonds Plains Road Hammonds Plains, NS B4B 1P6 Canada
Review: First time diner after hearing from others that the food and service at Edible Matters were not to be missed. I was very happy with both when I stopped with my wife as we were on our way to the Halifax airport. My entree, chicken curry with grilled chicken strips over basmati rice, was excellent. A satisfying, full meal for an affordable price. Highly recommended!! The adjoining market, although small, offers some excellent bread, pastries, sweets, and various artisanal foods. There is a coffee bar as well.

Address: 2795 Windsor Street Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: Absolutely stunning atmosphere and ambiance. Expertly curated wine list. Extremely well prepared dishes. Knowledgeable and approachable servers. Honestly best restaurant I’ve been to in Halifax which is a fiercely competitive market. 10/10 no notes.

Address: 2795 Windsor Street Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: Brittney, thank you for the best meal I've had in Halifax in the two weeks I've been here. Bar kismet and bicycle theif are good but perhaps over hyped. The steak tartar is the best I've had in ages - can't wait to make my way through more of the menu.

Address: 2795 Windsor Street Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review:
Top-notch food. Some of the best I've eaten in Halifax. I had a potato leek soup, which was very good, although I could have done without the pickled mustard seeds. One of my baguette slices was toasted beyond edibility but that was quickly corrected. My entree was a short rib, which was very, very rich. It was served with hasselback potatoes covered in a delicious sauce, and a broccoli cooked with olive oil, lemon, and salt. They were the best-tasting broccoli I've ever had, and one of the highlights of the meal.

My wife had halibut with "French gnocchi" which she loved, too. I had a few bites of the gnocchi and it was creamy and delicious.

Address: 2795 Windsor Street Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: Brooklyn Warehouse is an awesome neighborhood spot, with a great atmosphere. The service was fantastic. I like the menu, I ordered the fried chicken sandwich today w the kale salad - it was very satisfying. Highly recommend this spot.

Address: 2795 Windsor Street Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: Delicious food. Relaxed atmosphere. My partner had the mussels and sirloin and I had the scallops and halibut. All were really enjoyable. Wil definitely be back for more.

Address: 150 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E6 Canada
Review: Visiting Ela’s is the first thing we do after arriving at YHZ! This restaurant has an amazing staff and wonderful Mediterranean food. Our local family has been visiting this location for years. Cannot say enough good things! Started with the Mediterranean Trio and Risotto Balls. Had the Chicken Souvlaki with Greek Salad and Lemon Grilled potatoes. My goodness. This is reason enough to visit again and again!

Address: 150 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E6 Canada
Review:
Location and atmosphere are fantastic !!! If you want a small piece of Greece go here.

Spanokapita was the best I've ever had fresh and hot.
The mousake was delicious but a bit cold they did not warm it enough. Service was amazing kind and promt

Address: 150 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E6 Canada
Review:
Ela! Is probably in my top five favourite places to eat in Halifax/Dartmouth.
I recommend many appetizers including the spanakopita which was one of the best I have had ! or the Kopanisti dip, which also is one of the best I've had.
If sharing, the grilled platter is a great choice and includes Seftalia, pork souvlaki, two pieces of rack of lamb, two chicken breasts, a salad, lemon potato and a dip.
The lamb is always done perfectly.
The stuffed chicken breast is also a great choice, always so good.
The service at Ela! Is always great every time I go.
I recommend the ekmek or chocolate torte for dessert, actually some of my favourite desserts around !
Ela! Is a cozy, well decorated restaurant with nice traditional background music & a romantic feel of Greece. I love to eat at Ela!

Address: 150 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E6 Canada
Review: YUM, yum, yum!! Went here yesterday for the first time despite always recommending it to people because a friend said it was the best. I decided to finally go myself and wow. The food was SO fresh, the falafels were the best I have ever had, and the crispy cabbage and pickled onions paired with them were so good. The atmosphere in the restaurant was very chill, quiet, and relaxing. The waitress was lovely.

Address: 150 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E6 Canada
Review:
Very poor experience. My sister and I visited this afternoon (Dartmouth Crossing location). My sister had had a Valentine’s Day dinner here and enjoyed it a few months ago. Today’s experience was night and day. We were seated promptly - good. Another server came over after we’d spent time with the menus, asked if we wanted something other than water, we didn’t. The server immediately turned her back and walked away without asking if we were ready to order. We were a little taken aback, but figured she’d be right back. She returned several minutes later, after making eye contact with us and immediately turning away to check on another table’s desserts. Seemed rushed and dismissive, even though there were very few people seated in the restaurant. We waited over 30 minutes for our meals. We were counting down to walking out when she came out of the kitchen.
The food was very lacklustre for the price. Calamari was over cooked and rubbery. Lemon potatoes tasted like they had been cooked in vegetable stock and nothing else. Greek salad was fine, but it’s hard to screw up a Greek salad. Pork skewer was very bland and under seasoned. Aside from the Greek salad, this was the most tasteless and unappealing Greek food either my sister and I have ever experienced. I had to go up and ask for the bill, as no one checked in on us after we received our meals. Staff were just standing around.
Poor service, meh food quality for a pretty inflated price, and an extended length of time waiting ensures neither my sister or I will ever eat at Ela! again, and I will very much recommend against dining there.

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: Their food is always delicious.  If you are looking for a good, tasty, and fast Thai food at lunch, I would highly recommend!  Best to arrive at 11:30 to avoid a Friday wait...although the wait is usually not long

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: This is an authentic Thai food.. I'm so glad to found this place.. this  Thai noodles soup is the killer, this is exactly why I'm here for.. the staffs and cooks are really awesome!

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: Some of the best Pad Thai in HRM. Anytime I'm up in this side of the city I always make an effort to stop by Cha Baa Thai. The store is always clean and tidy. The staff are always friendly, quick and prompt. The food is always incredible! Can't say enough good things. Love this spot

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review:
The best Massaman Curry and Black Pepper Beef I've had! Always excellent and prompt with service, polite and professional . Takeaway is usually about 15 minutes, so if you're ordering for lunch in Burnside, call ahead and they have it ready at the counter still piping hot.
The food is excellent, no matter what you get. It's hard to try something new on the menu, because everything is SO good that you want one of everything!

Definitely recommend.

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: We dined in for lunch and enjoyed Delicious Thai food cooked up fresh!  Friendly fast service and reasonable prices. What’s not to love?  We’ll definitely be back…..

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review: Good Thai Food with pleasant ambience. The drinks were bit below average but no complaints from the food. Pad thai was the standout followed by the Red curry and Cashew Chicken. The quantity is quite good and can be shared by two people(with rice or sides)

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review: The restaurant was nice, the staff was friendly, the cashew chicken was delicious, but unfortunately the spring rolls were not fresh, they were sour. Fried noodles taste sweet and sour, but it will be a little greasy, not recommended to try. Thai coffee tastes a little more weepy and creamy.

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review:
Great spot for a delicious and authentic Thai meal.

The restaurant's Pad Thai is a delightful mix of stir-fried rice noodles, vegetables, peanuts, and beef. The Pad Thai is served in generous portions, perfect for both lunch or dinner.

Wonton soup was surprisingly relexing, strongly recommend as well.

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review:
Very nice experience. I ordered the red curry chicken. The curry was full of flavor and the portion was perfect.

They even gave me extra chicken because I didn't want the egg roll that comes with it since I'm gluten free.

Will definitely be going back !

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review: Wow, probably the best Thai food I’ve ever had!(haven’t had much but this was exceptional) the flavors of my green curry chicken lunch special and coconut soup were out of this world. The Thai iced coffee was strong and sweet and my friends Thai iced tea was such a sweet and unique flavor. If you are in downtown Halifax or around the other location in Dartmouth you gotta go here for some of the best Thai food in Halifax.

Address: 3187 Highway 2 Halifax, NS B2T 1J5 Canada
Review: It is a great place in Fall River to go for some food and drinks with lots of parking. The club house is very unique and well worth a try. There's a nice big back room with a view of the lake that a large group can use, or maybe you just want a nice cozy table just for two. Both are doable.

Address: 3187 Highway 2 Halifax, NS B2T 1J5 Canada
Review: We called in around 730pm on Sunday 5 March for dinner. The food was superb. I thoroughly recommend the Turtleback Burger. See pics. The fries must have been freshly cooked because they were red hot, always a good sign.

Address: 3187 Highway 2 Halifax, NS B2T 1J5 Canada
Review: The food here is incredible..we had the big pig burger...and pulled pork potato skins... freaking amazing 😍🤩. This is a highly recommended place to eat..I had a gin Ceasar..so yummy..the pitcher was a vodka Ceasar equally as yummy. Honestly can't say enough about the food here.. extremely excellent.  The chef Tiny is above and beyond an incredible artist for food. Heather our server was a definite laugh and great person all around..this was first time here..and I will recommend turtleback tap & grill to everyone and will definitely return..thank you so much for an awesome experience.

Address: 3187 Highway 2 Halifax, NS B2T 1J5 Canada
Review: Would highly recommend trying this place the food is consistently amazing, lots of parking and excellent service. It has a great atmosphere and large windows on the water.   Great place for amazing food and a relaxing evening with family.

Address: 3187 Highway 2 Halifax, NS B2T 1J5 Canada
Review: Fantastic, great family place. Delicious food

Address: 205 Pleasant Street Unit 101 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 3RS Canada
Review: Their service on top of personal and amazing is so quick my head spun. The order was given and back cooked  to perfection in a matter of minutes. Even crowded, you can enjoy a good old East Coast vibe with great deco and fun staff

Address: 205 Pleasant Street Unit 101 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 3RS Canada
Review: We shared the Haddock tips and scallops combo and it was more than enough for us to share. Everything was cooked perfectly and the tartar sauce was excellent. We can't wait to come back when clams are in season. The service was very good as well.

Address: 205 Pleasant Street Unit 101 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 3RS Canada
Review: Went there at 1 pm on a busy. Waited a few moniutes for a table, and then my order of scaĺlops and fries arrived quickly, and it was good! A generous portion at a reasonable price. Good service. Decent coffee. I will be back.

Address: 205 Pleasant Street Unit 101 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 3RS Canada
Review: We love this place! It’s the best diner in Dartmouth or even in HRM! We love the food, attitude and atmosphere. Fish and chips and seafood platter are our family’s favourite dishes. Highly-highly recommended!

Address: 205 Pleasant Street Unit 101 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 3RS Canada
Review: My husband and I took his brother and wife here last night for seafood.  They are visiting from Alberta and love seafood. The reviews seemed good so we decided to try it.  My sister in law wanted clams but they did not have any at that time. She ordered the seafood platter and they gave her an extra piece of fish and I think extra scallops.  I had a salad and the guys had fish and chips. The fish and chips were terrible.  Small pieces with way too much batter and the fries were frozen, not homemade.  The only thing that actually tasted good were the scallops.  So disappointed, I had high expectations.  I read the negative reviews after we ate there and they are similar to ours.  Owners please read the reviews, make some changes and this would be a wonderful place to eat.  We won't be back

Address: 1595 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B4A 1E8 Canada
Review:
Met some friends here we had not seen in a long time for dinner.  The staff were super friendly and very attentive.

The food was very fresh and tasty, we had the seafood stew, halibut, bruschetta and lobster ravioli.  Everyone was very satisfied and had no room for desert!

Loved the “phrases” on the beer glasses!

Address: 1595 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B4A 1E8 Canada
Review:
While in Halifax the hotel staff recommended this restaurant.

We didn't have a reservation so we sat at the bar.

The staff was very friendly and we had an amazing meal.

Address: 1595 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B4A 1E8 Canada
Review:
Food was delicious and just as I ordered.
Waitress Flora was devine.
Four stars on atmosphere only because I sat outside and the view is great (green hills and sunset) but it looks out over the parking lot.

Address: 1595 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B4A 1E8 Canada
Review: Great service, even better food. Reservation for 6pm, got seated right away. Service was quick, food piping hot and delicious. We were so full we skipped dessert but we’ll try some next time.

Address: 1595 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B4A 1E8 Canada
Review: Food is flavorful, outstanding presentation and just down right outstanding!  Brett Marie went above and beyond and recommended the best meal I have had in a while.

Address: 635 Portland Hills Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 0J7 Canada
Review: I Love Turkish / Mediterranean food so I was very pleased to learn about this place recently. It’s been here for 7 years or so, (I was told) and I feel like it’s kind of hidden from sight on the opposite side of Finbar’s. (Probably why I didn’t notice it.)Their food is delicious and they have a lunch menu so it’s my new go-to when I don’t bring a lunch to work. I highly recommend upgrading to the beet salad and if you see the lamb shank is on special, I’d suggest getting it.

Address: 635 Portland Hills Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 0J7 Canada
Review: First time visit and I would return and try more. We ordered the beet salad, delicious and some appetizers. Terrific server who was attentive, we saw people from the kitchen coming out to see if we enjoyed our food.

Address: 635 Portland Hills Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 0J7 Canada
Review: We had the menu for two.  It came with hot and cold mezza and  a salad to start.  Then rice with either chicken or beef.  Dessert was also server with tea.  Removes all the selections and the chef decides off his menu.  Very nice atmosphere and Stephanie was very helpful and attentive.

Address: 635 Portland Hills Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 0J7 Canada
Review: the restaurant is sooooo amazing that we're so glad we had our first date since we moved here! The waitress Stephanie is so beautiful and nice to us! Also the Chef is so talented and wonderful to cook these magic dishes! We tried the grill cheese for appetizer, two lamb dishes even one is special today!😋 Highly recommend the lamb dishes, best lamb we had in halifax! Definitely will come back!

Address: 635 Portland Hills Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 0J7 Canada
Review:
I'd like to start by saying all these years I have been planning to try USTA but always went elsewhere not realizing what I was actually missing. We had a table of 7 and noone left disappointed. The variety of appetizers and the main dish options gave us plenty to choose from and only two people ordered the same thing. I had the lamb kofte and it was so well seasoned and tender. My appie of hummus and ground lamb with the warm pita type bread was amazing. Our server really made the meal, he was very pleasant to deal with, knowledgable about the dishes and he just added to the whole situation.

I plan to go back soon with my 88 year young mother and will definitely be recommending to other family and friends. Don't delay like I did as I ended up regretting that I hadn't experienced it sooner. Well done USTA.

Address: 1477 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z4 Canada
Review:
Came in with 4 young kids and was happily greeted by staff who engaged us and our kids.  They provided some colouring and a kids menu and we all enjoyed a very delicious meal together.  Small warning that this is a semi fancy place, and while we were not dressed up (and had kids!) we also went a bit early to avoid the later celebration/romance/special occasion crowd.

Parents: this is a great place to bring your kids but be aware their meals come with only the entree, so drinks and dessert are separate (and definitely worth it!).

Address: 1477 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z4 Canada
Review: We went here for my birthday and it was a great experience. The indoor seating was pretty full and a little loud so we sat on the patio which was perfect. The food was good and Francesca was a great host and made sure we had whatever we wanted. We will definitely be visiting again.

Address: 1477 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z4 Canada
Review:
We came to Ristorante A Mano for lunch, early on a Friday. At first, it wasn’t busy but, it got crowded quickly. We were a large group and, even though the service slowed down at times, the staff was quite diligent.

Overall, the food was very good! For the most part, the portions were filling or, at least, reasonable. The drinks were also good.

Address: 1477 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z4 Canada
Review:
So, I found this restaurant on Google maps. I really wanted to avoid greasy food as I'm out of town and been having a little to much of that recently.

My partner had the pizza which wasn't anything to write home about... Just okay.

I had the tortellini Al Prosciutto, it costed 24$ on the menu. I was expecting a big dish but I was served 12-13 peices of tortellini. That's the equivalent of 1.84-2$ a piece. I was pretty disappointed with the dish being this was advertised as a main course meal when this could easily be eaten as an appetizer. The pasta is hand made which I understand although it's nowhere near a dish being a main meal.

Drinks are alright (sangria and MIA)

The manager came to my table with a piece of cake on the house to go which was nice of her. Would of appreciated if they remade the dish to go being how little was served but I guess take what you can get right ?

Address: 1477 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z4 Canada
Review: Appetizers were great, food was absolutely delightful! Service was fantastic. We sat outside the breeze was perfect on a hot day. A strong 10/10 for me. We’ll be back for sure.

Address: 1725 Market St Halifax, NS B3J 3N9 Canada
Review:
Wow, we’re sleeping on this place! Saturday night, the place was like 1/4 full. It’s been a around for a long time and was known to be fancy back when I was in high school, but over the years with all the new restaurants this place has kind of been forgotten.

The scallops, short ribs, octopus and cocktails were fantastic! The ceviche (was told it was new on the menu) needed more lime and salt but the fish was very fresh, after adjusting it it was great as well. The parsnip dessert was cute but just tasted like a spice cake, maybe go for the chocolate dessert next time…There will definitely be a next time! The Asian bartender/server also made dinner very enjoyable. Go with his recommendations!

Gosh those scallops…with a sweet creamy savoury sauce and perfectly cooked scallops… I’ll be dreaming of you 😂

Address: 1725 Market St Halifax, NS B3J 3N9 Canada
Review: What a great dinner! I was very impressed with everything the food, service and atmosphere. The food was amazing and everything I was hoping for!! Our server Oscar was a delight and very knowledgeable. He made us feel at ease and had great suggestions! The bone marrow and snowcrab salad was lifechanging! Thanks for a great evening!

Address: 1725 Market St Halifax, NS B3J 3N9 Canada
Review:
Gio is considered a 4 diamond restaurant, and I can absolutely see why. Right from the moment we set foot into the restaurant, the welcome and attentiveness was impeccable. The menu is seasonal, so what you may see online in terms of menu may not match what's currently being offered. This means that the ingredients used are fresh and local, hence why the change in menu depending on availability.

All that to say that they chana masala (included in picture) I ordered was absolutely divine. The basmati rice was cooked to perfection, and the chickpeas were beautifully flavourful. But the stand out here was the homemade mango chutney - it was quite possibly the best chutney I've ever had.

Our server, Oscar, was a pleasure to deal with from the very first moment. Being also the main bartender, he was able to recommend some fantastic cocktails for us to try depending on what we were in the mood for. And the cocktails: on my! They're inventive, modern, and a pleasure for the sense! I'd highly recommend trying one!

All in all, an excellent place to dine with what I consider absolutely 'bargain' prices for a 4 diamond restaurant! Highly recommended!

Address: 1725 Market St Halifax, NS B3J 3N9 Canada
Review: Gio's pretensions far outweigh its delivery. Management needs to get a real chef PRONTO! It was perhaps the worst restaurant meal I have ever had, at the highest cost. I am 70 years old and have travelled around the world. Both mine, and my husband's meals were appallingly bad. As soon as mine arrived, he asked 'Where is the rest of your dinner?". When his arrived he promptly lifted his Atlantic trout out of the curdled swill that surrounded it and ate it off his bread plate. My two tiny, unaccompanied agnolotti were the texture of cardboard. I managed to eat half of one and tried picking out the tiny smear of mushroom duxelle, but the other was headed for the garbage bin. Nothing else was on the plate for $31., and even the bread cost extra. The next night we ate at the Keg right across the road and got a much better meal for less money. Oh, and the ambiance? 1980's hotel breakfast bar. There is none.

Address: 1725 Market St Halifax, NS B3J 3N9 Canada
Review: 10/10. The oysters came with their blood orange granita and it added a lot of flavor. The agnolotti dish was exceptional.

Address: 5190 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: Decided to try ramen for the first time. I been putting it off for years as it just doesn’t wow me whenever I look at pictures of it or read about it. Since I live next door I decided to support local. The atmosphere was great, the service was splendid and the food was prepared in a flash.  I got a Sapporo beer to wash it all down.  The food was flavourful and extremely fresh. After trying ramen I can say I’m not a fan of the style of meal it is. It was nothing to do with this place as they seem extremely knowledgeable and serve up a great ramen but as I stated… not my thing. If you like ramen I suggest trying this place. For myself this was a one time experience.

Address: 5190 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review:
A hidden gem right downtown!

Pretty cozy space with not a lot of seating, so keep that in mind if you have a larger group attending.

Their vegetarian ramen is delicious, so flavorful and loaded with toppings. They also offer a tasty korokke (croquette) if you're looking for a veggie appetizer. The tables each have some additional toppings as well if you want to kick it up a notch.

I was pleasantly surprised by the variety of options for Japanese brews and liquors - their sake was smooth and tasty - nothing fancy, but just nice to have the option available on a cold day.

Would recommend checking it out if you have an itch for ramen in the downtown core.

Address: 5190 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: I really liked the staff were attentive and quick service was provided. Had great meal loved the ramen and sweet edamame beans. They have limited menu but still have gluten free options. Although I find it's bit pricy, I would still visit again.

Address: 5190 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: First time dining at Buta Ramen, and first time ever having Ramen. I ordered the Nagasaki Champion, and my partner had the Tantanmen. To start we had the Chicken Karaage. All of it was amazing, so good! The atmosphere was cute and cozy. All of the staff members who served us were friendly, fast, and knowledgeable. The food came out lightening quick and it was busy! Will definitely be back again!

Address: 5190 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: Nagasaki ramen, while filled with lots of stuff (some plain fried pork belly, some mussels, a couple shrimp, and lots of squid) didn’t have a very authentic ramen flavor. The tantan noodle was better flavoured but there was only a bite of meat. The fried squid legs were delicious.

Address: 942 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E6 Canada
Review: Really disappointed with the food after seeing lots of good reviews. The lemon potatoes must have been soaking for days.  The spinicapita was soaked in grease.  I actually sat it on napkin before taking it home to soak up some of the grease.  Thd waitress was excellent and the drinks were good .

Address: 942 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E6 Canada
Review:
Such a great experience! Received a warm welcome from the moment we walked in and had excellent service the entire time.
We ordered the Eggs Benedict, Fried Calamari and Fish & Chips (Three Pieces)
The Eggs and Calamari were great but the star was the Fish & Chips! They were huge! Remarkable fish to batter ratio and very nice texture.

Address: 942 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E6 Canada
Review:
Hard pass on the breakfast next time for me.

Walked into the restaurant to be immediately greeted with the door closer hanging off the frame. Was seated fairly promptly and ordered a bacon & feta omelet with a poutine hollandaise home fries with toast and wife ordered a Mediterranean Benny. Daughter ordered a waffle with bacon. While the restaurant was practically empty the food took forever and the server never really came back to see if we wanted our beverages topped off. The other server looked over in what appeared to be concern but didn’t really assist the matter.

We finally get our food and the wife’s Benny looked quite paltry compared to similar restaurants Benny meals. Perhaps it was the small eggs and the micro hash browns but our portions in general were on the verge of being below average.

My meal had to be sent back as the poutine did not appear on my plate. 7 minutes later my food reappeared as everyone else finished their food. I found it extremely odd that it took that long just to put cheese on the home fries. The hollandaise itself was tasty. The omelet was more of a mixed western with bacon and feta but it didn’t quite taste like the feta I’m used to. At his point I didn’t really care too much over the entire experience as I was starving. Sorry forgot to take a photo as I was ravenous by that point.

Daughter received a decent waffle with a side plate of bacon (again kind of odd not to be on the same plate but not the end of the world). We were packing up waiting for the bill when the waitress recalled she had to bring jello for the daughter but decided it was a to go thing instead of giving it to her with her meal. Then forgot the spoon. Kind of unfortunate.

So sadly the entire first time experience pulled my mood down and is reflected in my review. Perhaps I may try the seafood lunch/dinner but right not I’m disappointed enough that I may not just bother. We had tried to get into this place one other time and the waitress tried to shove us into a tight corner where neither my wife or I could even get between the table and the chair so we walked out.

Address: 942 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E6 Canada
Review: Best breakfast and coffee in town (served to 4pm which is perfect for some of us like myself who doesn't eat breakfast until early afternoon)..... They consistently serve up some of the best meals in town and the prices are very reasonable.  My wife and I often share the seafood platter when we go out for dinner or lunch (which is fantastic btw....) highly recommend...

Address: 942 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E6 Canada
Review: We came across this place by chance for breakfast while my mom and Grandma were visiting. All wait staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful! We all enjoyed our breakfast - we each had something different and all dishes were delicious! Really great feel, comfortable, spacious. Eggs Benedict was so good we would drive back to have it again, and we live nearly half hour away!

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review:
Discovered Byblos just over a year ago... and I keep coming back. Their food is the definition of comfort food. Warm, delicious and flavourful. The space is inviting and all staff are beyond friendly. I especially adore Sara, who is an exceptional server and gives great recommendations.

If you enjoy hot spicy like me, give the chicken kadai a shot. Something I appreciate about Byblos is how FRESH the spices are. It truly makes all the difference. My favourite dish so far is the butter chicken - the best I've tried anywhere in the halifax area. The veg samosas and butter chicken are great options if you're looking for something more mild.

Whether you're coming here for a full meal, or a quick snack, I find it quite affordable.

Attached are photos of the aloo tikki chaat, butter chicken with rice and garlic naan - which is a classic. (Of course we also had some gulab jamun for dessert but it was gone so quickly I forgot to take a picture!)

Thank you Byblos! You always make my night. I will never stop recommending this awesome local restaurant.

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review: super delicious food. Thank you biblos team. I tried manchurian and amritsari kulcha today. It was a complete taste of india. Price is also reasonable. Loved it. Must try.

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review: We had the samosas the dal makhani and the butter chicken with garlic naan and the food was incredible. We have been a couple times pre Covid when they only served Lebanese food and the food was always amazing, this was our first time trying their Indian cuisine and it was phenomenal. Hands down the best meal we’ve had in a long time, will definitely be back.

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review: This was our first visit and we will definitely be back!  We shared the dinner for two with butter chicken, a lentil dish, samosas , rice and garlic naan. Simply delicious. The service was great.  Honestly, a very pleasant surprise. Don’t hesitate to try this restaurant. A new favorite!

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review:
We had a great time at Byblos. The menu was Indian with lots of varieties(veg and non veg) and the drink menu had a great variety of wines, spirits and cocktails. There was a bubble tea bar too so that was a good touch. The staff is very accommodating, warm, friendly and welcoming. We ordered Veg Manchuria, Chicken 65, Naans and Jeera Rice - everything was made fresh and the taste of every dish was amazing. The food came out in 15 minutes and we were very happy overall.
I highly recommend this place to everyone.

Address: 556 Sackville Drive Lower Sackville, NS B4C 2S2 Canada
Review:
My favorite place to go with my son.
The salmon pizza is my most favorite. The salmon is so fresh and just like butter. Delicious

Address: 556 Sackville Drive Lower Sackville, NS B4C 2S2 Canada
Review: The food is really good, the servers are so kind, the only thing is if you want add more food at your order you might to wait for a while. But definitely I gonna back! Sushi lovers would love this place

Address: 556 Sackville Drive Lower Sackville, NS B4C 2S2 Canada
Review: We took the buffet set menu, but it is very limited selection, wudon soup is too salty to taste. No free drinks provide. Sushi roll collections are not bad. No any surprising touch point.

Address: 556 Sackville Drive Lower Sackville, NS B4C 2S2 Canada
Review: 4th time we’ve been here, the food is always delicious and fast. It was the second time we got the all you can eat Sushi. We had the food in about 6 minutes which was crazy. The place is never to busy which is nice so there isn’t usually a wait, but it is always busy enough for a good atmosphere. They seem to do a huge take out service which I am sure we will be trying some night after work. It is now our go to spot for sushi since we moved to a Lower Sackville, it is worth the visit for anyone outside of the area as well. #sushi

Address: 556 Sackville Drive Lower Sackville, NS B4C 2S2 Canada
Review:
Small restaurant. All you can eat Available. All you can eat ordering done via paper. The Service was slow and the restaurant was not very busy on the inside but it did look like there was alot of pickup/mobile orders being prepped.
The food itself was ok...too much rice with the sushi and some of our sashimi was still slightly frozen.
Bathrooms were a mess, water everywhere on the sink, dirty doors, wet floors.

Address: 6021 Cunard Street Halifax, NS B3K 1E5 Canada
Review: Just awesome. Have been coming here for years and always have the best time. Guy and Andre don’t do this for a living, they are passionate about what they do and that reflects on the dishes they put out here. Very generous portions and explosion of flavors. Jessica and Sara are always awesome. Can’t wait to go back.

Address: 6021 Cunard Street Halifax, NS B3K 1E5 Canada
Review:
It’s been a min since last dining Studio East and that’s my error.  This place has a vibe.  Wednesday night and the place was packed with a vibrant crowd.     Staff and service was excellent.

You can tell when the owners out their own personal touches in the food.   Everything was homemade and fresh.  The menu has some creative elements but always some standard loves such as the Pork Ramen.     The drinks were a surprise hit.   Cannot wait to find the next opportunity to go back.

Address: 6021 Cunard Street Halifax, NS B3K 1E5 Canada
Review: Really, really great food. My partner and I had the chicken karaage and I had the bulgogi short rib and he had the chicken sandwich with the parmesan fries. Our server was very friendly. Love that they have an iPad with a visual menu, makes choosing the food easier and more fun. Drinks were good. My friend's had the chicken crisps, the Bao that was on special, the burger and the small ramen bowl and raved about how food their food was. Was pleasantly surprised there were so many gluten free options. Will DEFINITELY be back.

Address: 6021 Cunard Street Halifax, NS B3K 1E5 Canada
Review: Super fun place. Staff so attentive. Food excellent. One grind was the drinks, were skimpy and small for the high price of 16.00, but tasty.

Address: 6021 Cunard Street Halifax, NS B3K 1E5 Canada
Review:
Good Asian fusion options.  Was very cool to see that they provide an iPad at your table to show you pictures of all the dishes - absolutely helps with decision making.  First time I’ve ever seen that.  I’d recommend the bao buns as an appetizer.  The tofu bao had good flavour and was not dry.  We also enjoyed the chicken crisp and the studio dumplings for apps.  My partner had the chicken rice bowl - this was a miss for us.  It was very saucy almost too the point of soupy and we found the different sauces they used did not really compliment each other.
I had the kung pao cauliflower bowl which was great - I opted for the noodles.  The only suggestion is I wish it had more vegetables because it’s quite carb heavy with the noodles and the cauliflower being fried.
Overall - I would visit again, they seem to change the menu quite often which is great.

Address: 5120 Salter Street Halifax, NS B3J 0A1 Canada
Review: Loved it here. Super friendly and considerate waitress. Ordered a Seafood Petite Tower that came with two different sets of oysters, half a lobster, tuna sashimi, halibut, and chopped scallops. Absolutely delicious. We also ordered a separate two sets of oysters which tasted quite different. Was nice trying them all. The seafood chowder was amazing as well. Highly recommend and would come here again.

Address: 5120 Salter Street Halifax, NS B3J 0A1 Canada
Review: Came here during happy hour (4-6pm) for the $1.50 oysters - very fresh and satisfying. Ordered a couple other dishes to try and we discovered that the fish & chips here are to die for! One big piece of fresh fish in thin panko crust - yummy. We didn’t have enough and ordered more. I’m not a big fan of thick greasy batter so I really enjoyed their version. The octopus salad, on the other hand, was a little fishy for me.

Address: 5120 Salter Street Halifax, NS B3J 0A1 Canada
Review: My boyfriend and I had a holiday.  We chose this restaurant for lunch.  The service was excellent.  The waiter is friendly and patient.  However, we do not speak English well, but the staff listened attentively to our wishes regarding the menu.  Good impressions, tasty, romantic atmosphere.  I ate pasta with seafood, the shrimp had an incredible taste, the scallop was tender)) 3 types of oysters - incredible)) I definitely recommend this restaurant!  At least - taste oysters)

Address: 5120 Salter Street Halifax, NS B3J 0A1 Canada
Review: My husband and I went to Shuck's last night. What an amazing experience right from when we stepped into the restaurant! The staff is very helpful, polite and friendly. It was Happy Hour so we had to indulge in the oysters. Every oyster was FRESH and nicely shucked. The BEST OYSTERS we have ever had (and I have had PLENTY!)! Next we had the the suggested meal for my husband baked cod, and fish and chips for me. Once again, we thoroughly enjoyed our food! We will be back again and again as long as they put out such amazing food. We were too full to even consider dessert. One recommendation would be to use some sort of noise dampening material in the restaurant as it is very LOUD making conversation difficult. Other than the latter, it was a totally awesome experience! Thank you, Shuck's!

Address: 5120 Salter Street Halifax, NS B3J 0A1 Canada
Review: Very nice place! Service was amazing and the food was good too. Pricing is reasonable, not cheap but on the lower end in comparison to nearby restaurants for the same foods. The facility also has a lot of eco-friendly features, one of my favourite being that the bathroom provides fresh towels for drying your hands with a basket under the sink for the used towels rather than wasteful paper towel.

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review:
The Nachos were absolutely AMAZING!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND the Nachos. The chicken wings were amazing, my husband raved about the flavour of the HOT WINGS, they did run out of Honey Garlic though so I was not able to try the wings myself. We ordered dessert along with a cocktail and beer. I had the Ocean Pearl, it was very delicious.

My husband and I will definitely be back to have the Nachos again!

Restaurant was nice inside with a good atmosphere, the option of Bar side or Restaurant. Service was also really great, friendly and Quick.

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: Yummy!! The food was amazing and my son and I ate and loved our experience!! It was truly delicious and our service was exceptional!  They got my son a high chair when he asked... he's 3... they said sure and brought it right over and cleared the table for us right away etc.   They were very nice and sweet girls working here and I'm very happy with their service and the amazing food!  My son ordered fish and chips and his order was huge!! I'm very happy with the food we had! Thanks!!

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: The service at Millstone Public House is absolutely top shelf! Unfortunately, I did not enjoy the buttermilk sliders as much as I thought I would. They were very dense, a but dry, and could have used some acidity to round out the flavour of the dish. Also, my cocktail really needed to come with a straw to mix it better. The gin royale was sitting on top of the lemonade.

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: Our visit here was lovely. Beautiful inside but a little cramped so we opted for the patio which was lovely and quiet. The chicken parm was amazing. The Alfredo was good and the chicken was moist! I recommend getting the garlic bread with it too. I did get the blueberry sour and it was WAY too sour, was basically just pure lemon juice, but everything else was amazing.

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: Ordered the maple curry chicken… had 3 pieces of red pepper for the veggies with alittle red onion…and absolutely no flavour… so disappointed!!…

Address: 67 King’s Wharf Place Suite 102 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 0C6 Canada
Review:
My beautiful wife picked this location, and we were all glad she did. The food was excellent! I can personally recommend the lobster fettuccine.

Our server was quite attentive and courteous.

The menu really is quite extensive. So, it's probably a good thing to plan on returning.

Absolutely recommend dining here.

Check out all of my honest Google reviews. My photos have over 12,000,000 views!

Address: 67 King’s Wharf Place Suite 102 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 0C6 Canada
Review: Great experience. Went here for a late Saturday lunch. Found a cozy spot inside next to the water in their indoor bar seating. Had few drinks(That ocean cocktail was excellent). The Fish and Chips were nice with very less oil. I tried their Candied Bacon Burger which was a pleasant surprise. We also had the Maple Curry Chicken Penne Pasta which was decent. All in all, a good experience. Will probably come here on a cooler day again to try eating at their patio as the view seemed even better.

Address: 67 King’s Wharf Place Suite 102 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 0C6 Canada
Review:
An excellent lunch had by all.

From the start, I knew I chose well. Excellent and attentive service from Morgan went a long way to making our afternoon stop enjoyable.

And then there’s the menu. So many things sound so good - took me a while to decide. But choosing the pulled pork wontons for an appetizer was the right move. Y-U-M. Everything we had was terrific. We’ll worth the ferry ride from Halifax. If I lived nearby, I could easily see myself eating my way through the entire menu!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED 🌟

Address: 67 King’s Wharf Place Suite 102 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 0C6 Canada
Review: The signature haddock dish was absolutely perfect, would highly recommend. The server was very attentive and gave great recommendations, hence the haddock. They accommodated and made a gluten free version of the haddock for my grandmother who is celiac. Lots of tasty cocktails and beer as well.

Address: 67 King’s Wharf Place Suite 102 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 0C6 Canada
Review: Chicken Curry Vindaloo was amazing! I’m never disappointed with the food when I come here. The atmosphere on the water is delightful. The service was a little slow this time but other than that, it was a great dining experience.

Address: 50 Gary Martin Drive Bedford, NS B4B 1H3 Canada
Review: Very cute spot! Good food, fast service and the staff seemed friendly, but the waitress was really busy and didn't check in often.  We were here for lunch so there was no wait.... I've been here on Thursday nights where there was a 45 minute wait (but it's worth it if you need to wait a bit).

Address: 50 Gary Martin Drive Bedford, NS B4B 1H3 Canada
Review:
Absolutely wonderful place to go. There is a welcoming atmosphere fromthe moment you walk in,music is not over bearing. Staff is friendly and knows the menu well. Great selection of local draught.
I had bought the potatoe skins, Eggs benedict, The signature Millstone burger and a poutine as a side.
i kid you not when i say by far the best meal ive had in a long time
The food was amazing and everything was fresh.

i also had an awesome server. Daniel was amazing and was very friendly, he executed his job amazingly and he made sure we had everything we needed all whithout being overbearing. Many Servers can learn from him. i could not be happier.
I will be coming back and i will recomend all my friends to go.

Address: 50 Gary Martin Drive Bedford, NS B4B 1H3 Canada
Review: Great spot in Bedford. Little busy around dinner time so call ahead and make a reso. Service was super quick and the food was fantastic!

Address: 50 Gary Martin Drive Bedford, NS B4B 1H3 Canada
Review: We ordered the signature haddock and salad with scallops. The signature haddock was out of this world delicious. We added a side of vegetables to it but the dish alone was wonderful. Could have eaten two just for the flavour alone. The scallops were perfectly cooked and great texture and flavour. Highly recommend.

Address: 50 Gary Martin Drive Bedford, NS B4B 1H3 Canada
Review: Nice restaurant around town that’s open till 11pm! Milestone burger and milestone signature haddock was amazing! Would recommend!

Address: 978 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E7 Canada
Review:
Location is good, lots of free parking. Layout is ok, decoration require reinstate the tables and seats need to be redone, some chairs are not comfortable. Colors are dark, if you offer breakfast then, you should make the atmosphere brighter. Also the there is a fridge in the middle of the dining area need to be relocated.
Service, is within expectations, the with waitress well known of the  menu and able to explain the ingredients.
Waiting time for the order, my experience is within expectations, as a matter of fact I received my order today very fast.
Cleanliness, I noticed the place cleanliness is within expectations.
Test, the food taste was delicious and Rich. I really felt full. I have only one issue with the breakfast menu, I don't eat bacon and most of the options has bacon.
Prices, really the price was extremely acceptable ($).
Conclusion: I liked my experience, and I see if you tried it, you should have a good experience.

Address: 978 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E7 Canada
Review: Great customer service from owners and employees. Made us feel welcomed and comfortable. Great  great burgers!!!! Highly recommend if your a carnivore 😀

Address: 978 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E7 Canada
Review: Have been here about five times over the last few years, mostly when invited along with a friend's family.  There's a comfort in the simple 'Mom & Pop' feel to this place, which is nothing fancy, but gives a content feeling.  Four booths by the window, four or five other tables, with total seating capacity for probably 35-40 total.  Friendly service from staff and owners.  Reasonable prices.  I enjoyed the breakfast wrap on my most recent visit (lettuce, tomato, bacon, egg and I think cheddar) with side of home fries, and hollandaise as a bonus.  Good size, well prepared, satisfying.  The dishes I'd tried before,  are too long ago to remember the details, but I do recall that they were safe, filling, no complaints.  There are Greek options available that I am looking forward to trying in the future.  Kid friendly.  Accessible with lots of free parking in the plaza.

Address: 978 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E7 Canada
Review:
The outlaw burger 🍔. One word - Awesome
Stopped here for a quick take out lunch . After a online recommendation I thought why not . Ordered the outlaw burger on a fresh brioche bun with dry fried onions and bacon with a bbq sauce on it . Came with fresh cut fries and coleslaw which was great. The coleslaw was terrible however had to throw it out . The coleslaw recipe needs a re evaluation. Would definitely try this place again.

Address: 978 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E7 Canada
Review: Ate here for the first time today and was so happy I came. The service was so good and the food was amazing. Might be my new favourite and regular breakfast place.

Address: 347 Herring Cove Road Halifax, NS B3R 1V5 Canada
Review: The best Chinese food around! Large portions, fantastic taste, budget friendly prices. We recommend it to all our friends and family. Have been ordering here for over ten years and the service has always been great and consistent. One of our favourite, local spots to eat at.

Address: 347 Herring Cove Road Halifax, NS B3R 1V5 Canada
Review: Waitress didn’t listen to our order and served us whatever she wanted. My daughter waited a hour for her poutine. When asked where her poutine was the server said oh I forgot we have no fries.

Address: 347 Herring Cove Road Halifax, NS B3R 1V5 Canada
Review: This is another local Chinese store that no longer opens at 11:30 a.m. and sells lunch specials. They now open at 3:00 p.m. and have drastically increased their prices and the amount of food you get is less than before, so I don't go there anymore and don't recommend it.

Address: 347 Herring Cove Road Halifax, NS B3R 1V5 Canada
Review:
Great food and even better service, always a pleasure with Julie.

My family and I got a few dishes authentic to Chinese cuisine including Chinese broccoli with beef, fish maw soup, steamed fish with ginger onion and soy sauce, and always black bean fried rice noodles.

Address: 347 Herring Cove Road Halifax, NS B3R 1V5 Canada
Review: Authentic Chinese food at a decent price. The Szechuan (spicy) eggplant is our favorite dish.  This place is like a second home to us.

Address: 5136 Prince Street Halifax, NS B3J 1L4 Canada
Review:
Great bar that reminds me of a local pub back in Montreal! It's a little loud but then again it's a pub with music and people are having fun.

The food is decent although my burger was a little dry and the Dublin pasties as well was dry. Drinks had been good so nothing to complain about that. The live singer was nice to hear !

The portions are just enough for me and my partner enjoyed her meal as well! Prices are dencent !

Address: 5136 Prince Street Halifax, NS B3J 1L4 Canada
Review:
Excellent place to visit in Halifax! We went on a Sunday afternoon and the atmosphere was very cool, live music, delicious food and very good customer service.
We ordered a fish appetizer, a seafood pasta and a fish and chips, everything was delicious.
The prices are pretty good for the area and they have different beers and local ciders to try.

Address: 5136 Prince Street Halifax, NS B3J 1L4 Canada
Review: Great food! The mussels were delicious. Huge kids meals, attentive friendly service. Great drinks, Caesars were on point.

Address: 5136 Prince Street Halifax, NS B3J 1L4 Canada
Review:
Great Ambience with live music performances(Plenty of seating space) and reliable, friendly service. The vegetarian burger was unfortunately not as good as my friend had hoped. Although I can definitely recommend their Footballs Club Sandwich. Dipping it in the hot sauce definitely made it not-so-crispy(to be expected) but the taste was fantastic. The cocktail was great, albeit very slightly on the expensive side.
Can recommend if you’re looking for a nice-relaxing time with good food.

Address: 5136 Prince Street Halifax, NS B3J 1L4 Canada
Review: Food tasted homemade and delicious. Beer was cold and the live music cant be beat. Also Thursday night bottle of Red wine -big friggin red for $25 !!  Cost you $20 at NSLC.  Excellent deal

Address: 6311 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A4 Canada
Review: Highly recommended! Best soup I've had in a while. Their Gomtang was so good that I forgot to take a picture of it: had a clean taste. Everthing we ordered were good. We'll definitely come there to eat again when we're back in Halifax.

Address: 6311 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A4 Canada
Review: I have heard such great things about Busan Korean BBQ on Quinpool.     We didn’t get BBQ this time but went with some lunch specials and a few add-ons to try.    Service was quick, pleasant and efficient.  The price was very reasonable.   The food was the show stopper.   The Spicy Pork Bone Ramen had great flavour with bouncy firm noodles.   Just the right amount of spice.  The Tteokbokki was sweet and spicy.   The sauce was a used for dipping Gyoza and Kimchi Pancake.   The pancake is a must try if you go.   Absolutely delicious.    Todays lunch made 3 new regular customers.

Address: 6311 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A4 Canada
Review: Korean BBQ is hard to measure as the range of foods stretches so far. Price wise, the combos were reasonable, maybe a little more than I would expect but the individual dishes were on the cheaper side. The service was quick and kind and the grills on the tables managed the smoke well so it felt very comfortable. The side dishes served with the combos felt on the smaller side, and I wish there had been more option for vegetables to grill. Overall would recommend, but expect a to leave stuffed!

Address: 6311 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A4 Canada
Review:
We've been here twice and had great food both times! Here we had the bulgogi beef lunch and fried chicken. The beef doesn't skimp on flavour and is loaded with vegetables, served on rice. The boneless fried chicken bites were tossed in a sweet chili sauce and served with tteokbokki. They come with a variety of side dishes like kimchi and potato which you can refill for free.

Staff were very professional and friendly. Very affordable too--we had lunch for two + a pear juice drink for under $25. Pay for cash for a discount!

Address: 6311 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A4 Canada
Review: If you think of Korean food then you have to start at Busan. Always smiling staff and quick service. Lot of options to choose from including a gluten free options. The food is packed with flavors and served with many side dishes. Reasonably priced food in great quantity.

Address: 1990 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1P2 Canada
Review: We went in after making a reservation on St. Patrick’s Day. Given it was a busier-than-usual day the service was a bit slow(understandable). The portion sizes were fine with the taste being above average. The fried chicken burger was fine although I wish it had one piece of fried chicken instead of few tiny ones as it would be easier to handle. The pasta and the black bean burger were a success and can be recommended for Vegetarian folks. Weirdly their fries were soft and not crunchy. The taste was fine though so not an issue. Highly recommend their Black Forest cake. The taste of Beep Brulee wasn’t something one of our friends expected but the staff was generous enough to replace her order for no extra charge. This was almost at their closing time(Appreciate this for sure). Their service is good and I’ll be sure to visit again someday to try rest of their menu.

Address: 1990 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1P2 Canada
Review: Really good food. Good and friendly service. Update banana split black forest cake nachos

Address: 1990 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1P2 Canada
Review: When we booked our vacation here, we were very excited to see that they had some dairy-free options, as my wife has a dairy allergy. Unfortunately, between the booking and our trip, it looks like the vast majority of them were removed from the menu. Usually we can get by asking them not to use cheese or butter, but apparently both their hamburger buns and their multigrain toast contain milk for some reason. We also informed the server of her allergy ahead of time and were still served butter on toast - had my wife not double checked before eating, she would have been seriously ill. Will eat elsewhere for the rest of our trip as they clearly do not take allergens seriously here.

Address: 1990 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1P2 Canada
Review: This isn't your ordinary hotel restaurant! It's actually fire, the fish and chips were perfection, reasonably priced and a huge portion. Staff were super friendly and sweet. Would definitely come here to enjoy some seafood while staying in Halifax without the "tourist tax" like at the waterfront.

Address: 1990 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1P2 Canada
Review: The restaurant itself is very nice. The service was top notch. And the food, while the menu wasn't as big as I remembered, they had great food! Fish and chips was amazing. Also, as always, good local beer!

Address: 9 Countryview Dr Dartmouth, NS B3B 0G4 Canada
Review: We chose Moxie's because of the location in Dartmouth Crossing close to where we were shopping, past experience, great parking. The restaurant has a classy, dark vibe with modern features. The booth was comfortable for plus size people and we had lots of privacy. The restaurant was loud though not full, just lots of dishes clanging and dishes dropped on one occasion. Our server was brand new. She did a great job; polite, friendly, knew the menu well, checked in with us frequently but not too much, and helped me look for missing keys. The water was good for Halifax; I'm not sure if it's filtered. Our meals were quite good but definitely higher in price for quantity. The food presentation was very nice, taste was delicious and the meals sat just right with us (no stuffed bellies). I ordered the cashew chicken lettuce wraps from the appetizer menu and they were a meal on there own. My daughter ordered the mango chicken from the main dinner menu and found it small for the price. The summer menu offers lots of flavors, and we were glad we ordered the cashew dip as an appetizer or we would have still felt hungry. Overall, a very positive experience and I will go again.

Address: 9 Countryview Dr Dartmouth, NS B3B 0G4 Canada
Review: Movies never disappoints. Our waitress, Himaly, could not have been better. When 2 items were not available she made several suggestions on other items or how substitutions could be made with the items that were sold out. Her drink recommendation was bang on. Our table was comfortable. Atmosphere was good. I will definitely dine at Moxies again.

Address: 9 Countryview Dr Dartmouth, NS B3B 0G4 Canada
Review: The food portions are generous and the taste is very good. They have very good customer service. I find the prices a bit high in some dishes

Address: 9 Countryview Dr Dartmouth, NS B3B 0G4 Canada
Review: Pleased.  First time visit.  Was craving nachos with chicken. It was tasty and do much that I couldn't eat half.  No disappointment whatsoever. I will be returning.

Address: 9 Countryview Dr Dartmouth, NS B3B 0G4 Canada
Review: Great venue. Service was amazing and  food was good. Would visit again

Address: 50 Tacoma Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3E6 Canada
Review: Kind and helpful staff. Food was wonderful! Great Arabic music and videos. Had tabbouleh, grape leaves, souvlaki, and Station 1 platter. Baclava too. Greatly enjoyed the meal and overall experience!

Address: 50 Tacoma Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3E6 Canada
Review:
I don't give bad reviews often but I'm not thrilled about my first time getting take out here.

When I arrived, the restaurant was pretty empty except for one customer.

I ordered a chicken souvlaki plate which on the website says that it's supposed to be $11.99+tax for 1 skewer. They charged me $14.49+tax. The chicken skewers were barely edible since they had been mostly charred (see photo) and were extremely dry. The fatoush salad was lackluster and the pickled turnips were also dry af. My friend remarked that the pita bread looked like it had been picked up from the streets of Aqraba. Hummus was also pretty bland in flavour - it needed more garlic for sure.

Staff member serving me seemed quite unhappy to be working that day as well. Not sure if that is a one-off.

Either way, despite the high ratings this place has on Google Maps, I'm disappointed to say I would not recommend this establishment.

Address: 50 Tacoma Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3E6 Canada
Review: This is my new favourite shawarma place! The Station 1 shawarma (Syrian shawarma) is absolutely delicious and the plates here are big. I never leave hungry, that’s for sure. Staff is super friendly and kind enough to teach me how to say Muhammara, (which is delicious, btw). My favourite plate is the falafel plate with lentil rice, Fattoush salad and muhammara. Their falafel is so good it’s really hard to go anywhere else that I still think have good falafel and I don’t mind driving a little further down the road to enjoy the excellent food at Station 1.

Address: 50 Tacoma Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3E6 Canada
Review: Watched the staff make fresh falafel, something you don't find everywhere. Really fresh and delicious!

Address: 50 Tacoma Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3E6 Canada
Review:
I don't know how anyone can give the food and service at Station #1 less then 5 stars. I really enjoy Lebanese cuisine and have made a point to try as many places in HRM as I could back when I was on the road everyday for work. That being said I have had recommendations from my middle Eastern colleagues on other places in HRM to try which I have and they were good as well, but can't hold a flame to Station #1. We live in Lower Sackville and when ever we get the urge for good shawarma we always end up at Station #1 and have never been disappointed. In fact we used to go there before they moved to Tacoma and started to get known. Their previous location did not get as much traffic because they were tucked at the end of a small strip mall on the corner of Forest Hills Parkway and Main Street. Now with their improved location people are starting to notice and try them, so they can get busy at times, but it is worth the wait if you arrive and there is a line up!

The portions are always more than fair for the price you pay (comparing to other competitors), the service has always been great. Their hummus is made from scratch, and not that pre-packaged grocery grade wanna be hummus. The owners care about their customers and you will often find them behind the counter working to ensure a good consistent quality of food is produced. They make their food with love and it shows in the flavour!

If you have not tried Station #1 yet, you need to take a trip to Tacoma Plaza in Dartmouth and so yourself a favour. You will thank me later! I have said this before to everyone I know who enjoys Lebanese food, and I will continue to say it, that this is the best you will find in Halifax. Hands down! Keep up the great work guys. As always, I will be back! 👍👍

(I confess as many times as I have eaten there I have not even thought about taking pictures. All I think about is eating and enjoying their food, but I will update the next time we go!)

//Update// So I have been back a few more times since and still forgot to get pictures but this time my daughter reminded me 🙂

Still 5 stars as expected! I would give them a higher rating if I could! We also have their grape leaves and cheese rolls a try in addition to our usual chicken shawarma and they were both amazing as expected! 👍👍

Restaurant_name: The Barrington Steakhouse and Oyster Bar
Address: 1662 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 2A2 Canada
Review:
It took me a while to get around to this, but the experience was so memorable that I couldn't let it pass. We visited Halifax about a month ago - May 2023. In spite of our terrible dining experience, I've heard others defend the place. Even one of our 3-person dinner party that evening, a local resident, was surprised and said it's usually quite good. I guess we got them on the wrong night then, the weeknight B-Crew. The service & food were equally abysmal. The hostess was unfriendly, the waiter was a wise guy who thought he was funny (I wish he had been), and possibly 1-2 of the dishes we had between the 3 of us rose to the level of average (not the steaks). That's just not acceptable at their price point. We were 3 and spent about $500-600, I don't quite recall exactly. Only the wine was good.

Now I could drone on about the details far more than you'd care to read, but a picture is worth 1000 words. I will take a moment, though, to advise you against ordering the wedge salad. Unless you think a wedge salad is bibb lettuce, a boiled egg, and some kind of dressing I couldn't identify. If you do, then definitely order the wedge salad. The wise guy waiter was certain it was correct. It was at that moment I realized things were not going to get better and I should enjoy the wine. How this steakhouse classic could go so off the rails at a posh place like Barrington's, I can only guess. In hindsight, I should have taken a picture. But wait, I did promise you a picture. Check out whatever it was that arrived when we ordered another steakhouse classic, Creme Brulee. The over blackened top was hiding a blue surprise. I have no idea what it was, but it was disgusting. I think what bothered me the most was that they didn't think there was anything wrong. They were completely unaware of their incompetence. The last time I had an experience even close to this bad was in the height of covid, when you were lucky to even find a place open.

Restaurant_name: The Barrington Steakhouse and Oyster Bar
Address: 1662 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 2A2 Canada
Review:
The restaurant is beautifully decorated and had a great upscale vibe that sets the tone for a great dining experience. The Oysters were fresh and served with a variety of sauces that perfectly complemented the Oysters. Also the dessert is a YES!

I found the service was lacking a bit, we were waiting for some time to get a server stopping by to set up the table with utensils and to take the order....

Overall, the quality of the food and the beautiful atmosphere makes this restaurant a must try 😋

Restaurant_name: The Barrington Steakhouse and Oyster Bar
Address: 1662 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 2A2 Canada
Review: Delicious steak! The atmosphere is great for a nice date or celebration. Very quiet and elegant. We got the ribeye and tenderloin steak with the double stuffed potatoes as a side.

Restaurant_name: The Barrington Steakhouse and Oyster Bar
Address: 1662 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 2A2 Canada
Review: A one of a kind experience. Service is spectacular and the food is divine.

Restaurant_name: The Barrington Steakhouse and Oyster Bar
Address: 1662 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 2A2 Canada
Review: Wonderful Canada Day celebrations with beloved family. Food and surrounging were excellent.   Menu was quite extensive, superb quality

Address: 5883 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3H 4S4 Canada
Review: It was my first time, very good food and really good service. Nice to eat alone or with friends.

Address: 5883 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3H 4S4 Canada
Review: Lovely experience from service to food. I was a bit skeptical as to being rushed due to the hours of operation but i needed not to worry. Every item ordered was superb! Compliments to the chef; i perhaps missed my server's name but she was great. My only reason for taking a star was due to the noise level because of how small the space is within the restaurant.

Address: 5883 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3H 4S4 Canada
Review: Everything was delicious! We really struggled with what to order because it all seemed great, so our waitress gave recommendations and we trusted her—and are so glad we did! Aside from the tasty food, everyone there was so kind and it’s super cute inside. Highly recommend!

Address: 5883 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3H 4S4 Canada
Review: Great food and ever better service. We also love the gelato.  It's on the pricier side but we felt it's worth it.

Address: 5883 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3H 4S4 Canada
Review: Had an amazing meal here. The staff was friendly and attentive. Started off with the mussels and had the featured fish of the day - seared halibut and scallop on a shrimp risotto. The fish was perfectly cooked, the skin was crispy but the meat was still nice and juicy. Finished off with the chocolate espresso torte. Everything was delicious but the fish definitely was my favourite. One of the best resturants I've tried in Halifax. Would definitely come again!

Address: 1358 Birmingham Street Halifax, NS B3J 2J2 Canada
Review:
We went to Halifax 3 weeks ago and were craving Korean food after having eaten seafood the first two days. We chose this place since it had good reviews but quite frankly it was not well deserved based off the experience we had.
Service was lacking. The lady at the cash didn't event greet us. Food was also served in a take out container even if you're dining in. Water is also self serve.
They didn't have the item I wanted so we only ended up ordering the bulgogi rice bowl. The dumplings were good, rice was a bit hard but since the dish was so oily, it soften it up. The onion to beef ratio was about 80:20. It also didn't really taste like a regular bulgogi dish and I've been to many Korean restaurants. Def was a bit disappointed.

Address: 1358 Birmingham Street Halifax, NS B3J 2J2 Canada
Review: One of the best Korean fried chicken around town! We (a family of 3) order the all-flavours chicken box and it lasts us for 2 meals. It doesn't come with rice but you can always make your own rice or order some of theirs. Great flavours! Our favourite flavours are the Korean Chilli and Honey Garlic ones. But the box comes with 2 other options as well - the Original and an Onion/Vinegary option.

Address: 1358 Birmingham Street Halifax, NS B3J 2J2 Canada
Review: The food is exceptional!  Fast service, friendly staff!  You have to try it we will be ordering again and again.

Address: 1358 Birmingham Street Halifax, NS B3J 2J2 Canada
Review: Pretty delicious and very fast! They seem to be a popular place and actually had to turn away customers while I was there because the kitchen was so busy! If you’re looking for a friendly place to get take-out food, this is a great, clean, and yummy spot.

Address: 1358 Birmingham Street Halifax, NS B3J 2J2 Canada
Review: Ordered the ultimate box! So much good chicken fresh and hot. Though i wish the salad and pickles were bigger as its kind of a meal for 4 and the sides are kind of small along side it all. Each flavor is so good its kind of hard to choose which is best. Fantastic chicken wish they were closer to home!

Address: 14 Highfield Park Dr Dartmouth, NS B3A 4S8 Canada
Review: We just had dinner as a family at Parkside and gosh, what a great time we had! The food was delicious - everything from the tater tots to the pulled pork and strawberry lemonade! The highlight for me was the smoked wings with Jack Daniels sauce we had as an appetizer… best wings I’ve eaten, hands down! My husband loved his ribs. And the portions were huge - we have enough left for lunch tomorrow! Thank you as well to our waitress - unfortunately I did not catch her name - for being so kind, funny and attentive! If we come back to Halifax we’ll eat there again for sure! ☺️

Address: 14 Highfield Park Dr Dartmouth, NS B3A 4S8 Canada
Review:
Today, March 24, 2023, we tried the Dutton Burger as part of Burger Bash. It was a very good burger topped with brisket and hickory sticks that rounded this off really well.  Another great meal.

How can I say this? The food was so good and attractive that we were halfway before I thought of taking a picture. We love Mic Mac bar and grill but this restaurant gives that one good run for its money. It was amazing that people, on a Friday night, were not lined up here. Not only was the food great, the service was also great, very friendly and helpful. I think this restaurant deserves much more attention. Certainly coming back.

Address: 14 Highfield Park Dr Dartmouth, NS B3A 4S8 Canada
Review: A co-worker wanted me to go.  I had never been there before and went with low expectations.  I am happy to admit that I was wrong.  I ordered the soup & sandwich, Rubin sandwich with some type of beef soup.  Both were absolutely delicious.  One of the best Rubin's I have ever had.  The soup was a hot & sour flavour and had big hunks of beef.  I really enjoyed both.  The service was fast and the price reasonable.  I highly recommend this place for lunch.

Address: 14 Highfield Park Dr Dartmouth, NS B3A 4S8 Canada
Review: Foods are tasty, nice place, great service and price is right. Been here many times. Would recommend to anyone.

Address: 14 Highfield Park Dr Dartmouth, NS B3A 4S8 Canada
Review: Very good atmosphere and served. Tasty food and beer🍻

Address: 200 Government Wharf Rd Building 6 Halifax, NS B3G 1M7 Canada
Review: Lovely place to grab a bite of great and hearty comfort food with some excellent scenery to go around. Staff were excellent, provided prompt and friendly service. Food was served hot and well portioned. If you're in Eastern Passage and need some solid fuel, it is an easy recommendation.

Address: 200 Government Wharf Rd Building 6 Halifax, NS B3G 1M7 Canada
Review:
We really enjoyed the fun and comfortable atmosphere after a walk along pristine snowy shoreline. Great plaxe to stop and fill your belly! The kiddos had a wonderful time playing a game while they waited to occupy young minds. There were rubber ducks placed everywhere on a bit of a "treasure hunt" for the kids. The seemed to really enjoy the sleuthing!
Server was amazing. Food was great! Will be back!

Address: 200 Government Wharf Rd Building 6 Halifax, NS B3G 1M7 Canada
Review:
I found this to be a laid back casual place to eat with a nice atmosphere and fun decor. We stopped in after hearing a friend talk about it. We stopped in for lunch a bit after they opened so there was no wait. There was a sign outside that warns you of a wait during busy times. Not sure why people complain about that, not too sure what they expect if a restaurant is busy.
The food was good, I had the Mediterranean salad with shrimp and found it to be a nice size and enjoyed it. Two others tried their different macaroni, they said it was okay but nothing special. My husband had the chowder and poutine which he was happy with. I tried a bite of the chowder and it was really good, almost wished I had a bowl myself. Waitress was nice and attentive. Overall it was a nice lunch.

Address: 200 Government Wharf Rd Building 6 Halifax, NS B3G 1M7 Canada
Review: Staying in the Eastern Passage and stopped in for a casual dinner. They had great decor and our server did his best but we were disappointed in the food. Before we sat down we were warned of a 45 minute wait for food (appreciated the heads up) We wanted mussels but they were out so we ordered bacon wrapped scallops - they were $18 and seriously overcooked and super disappointing. My husband ordered the lobster roll which was soo tiny and I got the lobster mac and cheese. Not sure what kind of meat they had in there but it was not lobster.. it was our first dinner in the city and I wish we had chosen elsewhere.

Address: 200 Government Wharf Rd Building 6 Halifax, NS B3G 1M7 Canada
Review: The food was delicious, we had a lovely evening on the patio, and our server was very friendly. The restaurant was pretty busy but the food still came out quickly. We’ll definitely be back!

Address: 746 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B3M 2L9 Canada
