Review: I went 902 on the second day after opening because they had a special 50% off shawarma and fried chicken. I went for the shawarma, but I arrived late and the only available item on their menu was fried chicken. They told us upon arrival that it'll take 45 minutes and we decided to wait. It took longer than that, but they apologized and it was only the second day so understandable. The chicken came with garlic sauce and fries. It was fresh and hot, but not juicy. I never like fried chicken so my review could be biased. I didn't enjoy the atmosphere so I'll probably be doing take-out in the future. I like the downtown 902's atmosphere better.

Address: 746 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B3M 2L9 Canada
Review:
I visited 902 restaurant earlier today and unfortunately had an extremely disappointing experience. My party and I ordered meals worth around $250 and we were left with a bad taste in our mouths, both figuratively and literally.

First of all, the ambiance was terrible. It was unpleasant to look at. We didn't feel comfortable or relaxed in the environment, which is a key part of any dining experience. There was no heating in peak winters and we were provided with a small portable heater which didn’t help.

The quality of the food was equally terrible. It was apparent that some of the dishes were frozen and then reheated, leading to a loss of flavor and texture. The meat, especially the beef, was extremely dry and shrunk. The outside was burnt, while the inside was hard and rubbery. The Mandi rice dish was also a major disappointment, not tasting or looking like real Mandi rice.

There were a few positives, however. The garlic and spicy sauce were decent, but not enough to save the meal. The broasted chicken looked healthy and crispy, but it was unfortunately the only dish that met any standards. The French fries, chicken and fish all seemed to have been cooked in the same oil, resulting in a strong fishy smell. This was not good for members of our group who don't like the smell of fish, as it interfered with the enjoyment of their meal.

Overall, I regret visiting this restaurant and would not go there again. I will be attaching photos of the dishes we received, and I will leave it up to the readers to judge the quality for themselves.

Address: 746 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B3M 2L9 Canada
Review: We had organized our ladies event at 902 Restaurant in Bedford location recently and I have to say I was impressed with all the arrangements and service provided. The food was deliciously amazing and everything was so smooth in organizing such a big event of around 50 ladies with no hiccups at all. It was only possible because of the Restaurant Manager Naela Al Kurdi and Jason. They are true professionals and know how to satisfy the customer needs. We would like to organize more events in the future because of these two amazing people. Everyone had a wonderful time. Thank you Naela and Jason, truly appreciate your superb management. 👏👏👏

Address: 746 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B3M 2L9 Canada
Review:
Food was delicious but I felt the rice needs to be cooked more. More than enough portions of food in my order which was Roasted Lamb Shank and nice presentation. Service was really good.
It is in the Bedford Highway, there are different Mediterranean restaurants around and this one is a worth try.

Address: 746 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B3M 2L9 Canada
Review:
Overall great food!

We ordered a tandoori wrap as well as lentil soup and another main. Everything was well cooked and portions were pretty generous. The tandoori wrap was really the star though the meat was absolutely perfectly cooked, well spiced with a bit of crispiness from the grilling. Our second main was delicious as well, the hummus was the perfect texture and the salad was flavorful.

Service was good.

The decor is nice and the seating is pretty unique with regular tables as well as lounge style areas.

Parking was kind of annoying as there isn't much.

The only main downside is there was a bit of a strong smell of smoke. At least in the lounge area where we were sitting.

Address: 535 Portland Street Unit 100 Dartmouth, NS L6H 6Z9 Canada
Review: I cant get over how quick the service was! We misread the menu thinking we could order regular lunch on the weekend and my daughter was nervous to try something new. She tasted my food and loved it, the waitress was super quick to add to our order and bring out some food her! Really over the top experience. The santa fe benedic was so delicious! The crepes looked amazing!!

Address: 535 Portland Street Unit 100 Dartmouth, NS L6H 6Z9 Canada
Review: My partner and I love Pur & Simple. The food is great, as is the service. We've been to both the Halifax and Dartmouth locations, and this location is definitely at the top. We're weekend regulars and that will likely remain. My favorite is the Gourmet pictured with this post.

Address: 535 Portland Street Unit 100 Dartmouth, NS L6H 6Z9 Canada
Review: Husband and I ate here on the Monday right after the new years weekend. Arrived around 9:15am and expected a wait with school being out and most people being off/on vacation but were seated right away. Definitely just beat the rush! I had the chocolate macchiato to drink and my husband a white cranberry juice. Both were good, I really enjoyed the macchiato 🍫. Husband had the Don Chorizo Eggs Benedict. Chorizo was really good and so were the potatoes (piping hot, flavored well and crispy to the bite), he also opted for the spicy hollandaise sauce. I had the French Toast Crisp, it was really good. Reading the menu I'm always worried about the mint, but it's really only a sprig that is easily removed. Topped with a healthy dollop of whipped cream and lots of fresh raspberries and blueberries. Hope to be back again soon with our toddler!

Address: 535 Portland Street Unit 100 Dartmouth, NS L6H 6Z9 Canada
Review: I use to visit here often but the quality of the food has gone downhill. My eggs benedict were over cooked and the portions are relatively small. The kids meals are expensive for what you get and the quality is meh, the pancakes were soggy, undercooked and just full of food colouring. I’d like to see fresh fruit or whipped cream added to this dish for kids and maybe a smaller portion.

Address: 535 Portland Street Unit 100 Dartmouth, NS L6H 6Z9 Canada
Review: I eat here regularly and will continue to be a regular, the food is great and so are the serving sizes. My partner and I always request Ashley as she is simply the best server! The conversation we have with her and the service she provides is what makes us come back! We live in the city and drive over to the Dartmouth location just to see her as without her our experience is simply not the same.

Restaurant_name: The Press Gang Restaurant & Oyster Bar
Address: 5218 Prince Street Halifax, NS B3J 0B1 Canada
Review:
My wife and I decided to pop in here for dinner a bit late (10:30) on a Friday. Our first server, was amazing. She had to leave for some type of appointment quite late, which was disappointing.

We started with calamari and 'beef, bacon and blue'. Both appetizers were cooked and seasoned to perfection.

For mains, we had the seafood risotto and the halibut. Both meals were cooked beautifully, but unfortunately lacked almost any seasoning. Our guess is that a more junior cook had taken over the cooking and was tentative about using salt and pepper. We asked and they brought us two grinders, which helped tremendously.

We would have liked to enjoy a dessert and some he finish of our meal, but our new server came with the bill....without an offer of even a coffee. When we asked about dessert she said 'I can see if I can find a cook to come back and do something for you'.

We passed on the offer. Disappointing way to end a wonderful time. So, the tale of two servers, one great and one that didn't really care.

We are still giving the place a 4-star review, but it's because of our first server and the quality of the food (even with the lack of any seasoning on the mains).

Restaurant_name: The Press Gang Restaurant & Oyster Bar
Address: 5218 Prince Street Halifax, NS B3J 0B1 Canada
Review:
The Press Gang has been one of our favourite restaurants for almost 2 decades.  It’s always a go to choice for a special occasion and/or to stop by for a cocktail & some oysters.
We were recently there for my birthday and they did not disappoint.  Service & food were amazing!

We always tend to choose the drill rather than ordering selections from the menu. This is where the chef designs a 4-course dining experience for two.  No two drill’s are ever the same.  It’s a great choice if you want to be surprised and try something new.  We recommend doing the wine parings as well.
Each course is delivered with an excellent explanation from the server or executive chef detailing what you will experience.

This dining experience was our best one yet!  Below are pictures of our dining experience from February 24.

Restaurant_name: The Press Gang Restaurant & Oyster Bar
Address: 5218 Prince Street Halifax, NS B3J 0B1 Canada
Review: Ordered The Drill. It was great. I love not knowing what I'm in for. I also love four course meals. Everything was amazing. If I am being hyper chef critical, each plate seemed like it was trying very hard to be amazing. It came off as a bit busy. Maybe more than a bit. When you have all the amazing ingredients you can use them all, but do you need to? There were no less than seven amazing flavors in the desert.  The beef tenderloin w/demi-glace was truly great. 4.87 ⭐️

Restaurant_name: The Press Gang Restaurant & Oyster Bar
Address: 5218 Prince Street Halifax, NS B3J 0B1 Canada
Review:
Visited here for the fresh Oysters which were really good! We stayed for some cocktails which were also excellent (although a little pricey!)
Our server was very knowledgeable, explaining where the oysters were from and then explaining every item on our charcuterie board.
The service was fantastic and I would definitely go back when in Halifax!

Restaurant_name: The Press Gang Restaurant & Oyster Bar
Address: 5218 Prince Street Halifax, NS B3J 0B1 Canada
Review:
Absolutely loved everything about this place. The location was in mid downtown core, so it was easy to find. They had live music, which was a great touch to my dinner. The fresh oysters was to die, for I would fly all the way back from Toronto just to try these oysters again.

Would definitely recommend and would definitely go back.

Address: 1589 Dresden Row Halifax, NS B3J 2K4 Canada
Review: This restaurant doesn’t gave importance for decorations but the food!!! Their food was amazing and delicious. We ordered Braised Pork Shoulder. It was so good and melted in my mouth. Braised Beef Brisket was also tender. Both dishes were not easily and need longer time to cook. Anyhow, it is worth for waiting. We definitely will be back soon for exploring more menu.

Address: 1589 Dresden Row Halifax, NS B3J 2K4 Canada
Review: The food was authentic and flavourful but a bit oily for my liking. Despite that, we visited twice during our trip to Halifax and enjoyed the dishes that we tried. There were far more meat focused dishes than mixed or vegetarian options but it wasn’t too difficult to customize or make requests. Service was very friendly as well.

Address: 1589 Dresden Row Halifax, NS B3J 2K4 Canada
Review: Highly recommend. Everything I ordered was tasty. Crunchy chicken, curried lamb, shredded pork with bean curd, noodles with bean paste and cucumber, cucumber salad. All very much on point. Great for a group. Vegetarian options available.

Address: 1589 Dresden Row Halifax, NS B3J 2K4 Canada
Review: Authentic North Eastern Chinese food. A big menu with various dish options and even daily lunch specials available. We have been here many times and they are very consistent with the taste of their dish. We got the zesty eggplant which is cooked in a lot of oil, but is so worth it with plain white rice. We also ordered the squid tentacle stir fry, which also comes in fried fish version, and the coating they have on the squid tentacles is very unique and is so addicting to eat along with the vegetables. Highly recommended if you want to try some North Eastern Chinese food that is made by Chinese chefs who are familiar with the cuisine.

Address: 1589 Dresden Row Halifax, NS B3J 2K4 Canada
Review: The Mapu Tofu was one of the best I ever had. The Yeung Chow fried rice and the sizzling beef steak were also delicious. Too bad I was not staying for long in Halifax, I could have ordered all their menu :(

Address: 15 Spectacle Lake Drive Dartmouth, NS B3B 1X7 Canada
Review: Had this place twice during our stay. Really good food. Had little bit of everything there. The wings we're so delicious. The Buffalo chicken sandwich was good as well the poutine was average but also good. Had there garlic fingers the garlic fingers were good. But the wings are to die for one of the best place for wings I when too. Great size great sauce 👌. They also put on a great breakfast in the morning for guests lots to choose from really enjoyed eating here. Everyone was nice.

Address: 15 Spectacle Lake Drive Dartmouth, NS B3B 1X7 Canada
Review:
I have eaten at Trendz three times now. Our middle visit was not the best but there was a sports event on and the restaurant was crazy. So, I am not adding that to my star review.
Tonight, we had a wonderfully friendly waitress who was bubbly and excellent. A friend and I had the pulled pork boa. It was amazing! Soft and juicy! Highly recommend trying them next time you are at Trendz!

Address: 15 Spectacle Lake Drive Dartmouth, NS B3B 1X7 Canada
Review: Service was very attentive and friendly. Started with the mussels which were lightly seasoned and sitting in a beer-based broth with nice pieces of focaccia. Fish tacos were quite nice. The buffalo chicken sandwich had a lot going on. There was bacon, lettuce, and cherry tomato on it as well. The vinegar was a little strong in places but was good overall.

Address: 15 Spectacle Lake Drive Dartmouth, NS B3B 1X7 Canada
Review: I’m reviewing this based on a takeaway order. We travel with a dog so don’t have the opportunity to dine in anyplace.  If you are looking at takeaway back to your hotel I’d suggest finding another restaurant. We had two orders of the mac n cheese and a Caesar salad. Each mac n cheese was maybe a cup and a half of elbow macaroni in a rather ordinary cheese sauce. The ‘caesar’ salad was a bunch of kale with a side of dressing and some kind of fried Parmesan chip on top. No croutons, no shredded Parmesan. How they can call it a Caesar salad is beyond me. This three dishes totalled almost $50, even with a 15% discount, and were completely not worth it. We were very disappointed with what we got for that kind of money. Very little value or enjoyment at all. Now, if you dine in that might be a completely different story, I cannot vouch for that, but for takeaway look elsewhere.

Address: 15 Spectacle Lake Drive Dartmouth, NS B3B 1X7 Canada
Review: Went to the Trendz cafe a few time during our stay at the Best Western. Super calm restaurant, friendly waitress, menu with a lot of different options.   Loved the little pulled pork bao buns!

Address: 1579 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C3 Canada
Review:
Stopped in with work friends while visiting halifax.
Great spot to relax, eat some good food and try some drinks.
Great atmosphere,  music is not too loud, easy to carry on a conversation.  Staff was very friendly and helpful when selecting meal options.
We have some dip, Mac and cheese, pizza and grill cheese.  All were great!

Address: 1579 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C3 Canada
Review: Forgot to take all my food pictures here. The burgers were great, there were many options when it came to Mac and cheeses. I got a Mac and cheese with pulled pork on top. And the selection of beers was good, learned that sours are very popular in Halifax and I am also a big fan.

Address: 1579 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C3 Canada
Review: Stopped by the Stubborn Goat after a long day of driving and doing vacation things.  Conveniently located next door to where we were staying.  While it was extremely busy they found us a nice ground level table by the door - good temps on a warm July evening and atmosphere.  As busy as they were the wait staff was great at taking time to explain items on their menu and helping with beer choices.  Food was great and prices reasonable.  Recommended.

Address: 1579 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C3 Canada
Review: I love the atmosphere in this spot. The food is very good, the staff are all very friendly. It gets very busy in there so you may wait a bit for your food and drinks but it's worth it. If you like a good Cesar, try their flight 👌 (delicious)

Address: 1579 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C3 Canada
Review: This place is awesome!!! We were out on a girls weekend and hit up many restaurants and pubs but when we got to the Stubborn Goat for brunch we were so happy!!! Great food and service. But the best part was their flight of Caesars!!! Yummy!! Very unique and very tasty.

Address: 250 St Margarets Bay Road Halifax, NS B3N 1J4 Canada
Review: Lakeside is attached to where we are staying. The complimentary breakfast rotates it menu daily so you always have fresh options in the morning. Plus it was a gorgeous lakeside view while you are eating. We had dinner there and the server Joe was super nice!! We sat outside on the patio in the evening when it was a little cooler. They had a fireplace going and he noticed I seemed cold and brought a blanket out for me. Really good food as well!

Address: 250 St Margarets Bay Road Halifax, NS B3N 1J4 Canada
Review: Stayed at the hotel .  Our server was Joe.  He was so friendly and nice.  Super excellent service!  He recommended the lemon dream dessert and it did not disappoint!  The food was fabulous the restaurant atmosphere was so relaxing and everyone was so polite!  I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

Address: 250 St Margarets Bay Road Halifax, NS B3N 1J4 Canada
Review: Hostess wouldn't seat us outside or near a window because "reservations" which never came. Then sat a couple without reservations in the spot she wouldn't seat us. Along with the undercooked chicken I got the first time I went here, screw this place. If you are staying at the hotel, by all means it's great. But as a local I don't have to travel very far to do better. (food was actually good, credit where it is due!)

Address: 250 St Margarets Bay Road Halifax, NS B3N 1J4 Canada
Review: Amazing drinks at the bar. Brandon was a great bartender with awesome drink recommendations and awesomely prompt service. Definitely worth trying Brandon's Whiskey Sour! Best version my boyfriend has ever had. Come here! 10/10

Address: 250 St Margarets Bay Road Halifax, NS B3N 1J4 Canada
Review: Had a great overall experience here! The staff were great, our waiter was very helpful & nice, our food came out to us really fast & it was delicious! I had the Maple Curry Chicken Penne & it was awesome! Definitely recommend giving that a try. Thanks for the great experience!

Address: 2157 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B3 Canada
Review: Very welcoming atmosphere, they asked us to sit well they prepared the sandwiches and gave us water while we waited even though we were getting the food to go. Definitely recommend

Address: 2157 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B3 Canada
Review: Went here in September and grabbed a late lunch the afternoon the Queen passed away. Didn't know what to expect since we were the only ones there - but the chef whipped up a spectacular dish of duck leg confit, green beans, potatoes, and some just-foraged yellowfoot chanterelle mushrooms. Got some helpful tips on mushroom hunting in Nova Scotia that I put to good use a few days later on a camping trip. Can't recommend highly enough.

Address: 2157 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B3 Canada
Review: This is THE place I get my meats and cheeses from. So fresh. So good! Staff if knowledgeable and they always have an amazing selection.

Address: 2157 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B3 Canada
Review: We love this place. My wife will frequently call in and they put together the most incredible assortment of charcuterie every time. There is always something different and exciting, it’s a fantastic food experience.

Address: 2157 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B3 Canada
Review: Beautiful selection of cheeses & cured meats, knowledgeable, friendly staff!! I love picking out special treats here to share with my family & friends- everything is delicious.

Address: 151 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Decided to order some late night pizza as we were staying in the hotel that is in the same parking and it was a 1-minute walking distance. The pizza was delicious, I would definitely order it again and do want to go dine in as the food looks amazing. The only thing that I did not like was that I got charged $3 more for a topping (onions), and there was none on my pizza, and I love onions on pizza. The girl working was super friendly, and we had a great laugh as there was a big group of girls staying at the hotel, and she thought that she gave away their pizza to another group 🤣 but when she looked there was another one ready. The pizza was slightly pricey than what I am used to pay, but this would not stop me from ordering again.

Address: 151 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: This spot is a little on the pricey side but once you taste the food it’s totally worth it. The service is always fantastic and quick.

Address: 151 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: I’ve eaten here 3 times and the first time it was great. Second time my pasta was really dry and I took it as leftovers basically just to be polite. This time my wife wanted to give it another try so we ordered take out and well… I’m typing this across from $80 + of some of the most inedible food I have ever suffered. Not sure what the take away of my review is exactly - don’t order take out from them? This place is ok sometimes? You decide!

Address: 151 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review:
Lovely place to go! Food was awesome! I got the Chicken Alfredo and it was homemade sauce and it was so good!
The food came within 30 minutes. I asked for a straw and the waiter forgot, that’s okay though we all forget things sometimes but I did find they looked a little sad there. Overall I had a good time and the food was worth it.

Address: 151 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review:
Location is good, easy to find, lots of free parking. In commercial and shopping industry. You can shop and take a nice bite there.
Decorations and layout, i found the place is cozy and romantic. Lots of photos and the ceiling really cool
Cleanliness is plausible.
Service, the service is excellent. They treated us with a smile and respect
Waiting time for the food, was within expectations
Food, we had different plate, all was as follows,
The plates were staffed well
Rich
And delicious 😋
Prices I can say nothing it might be $$ for a dollar. But if I want to.compare the prices with the value of food and the service. Then I can say it is within expectations.
Conclusion: myself and my family liked our experience and we will go back sometime soon 🤗

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review:
We had never heard of this all you can eat restaraunt before.
We happened to be in the area and googled Japanese cuisine. We were not disappointed. Moderate amount of parking spaces for a strip mall corner side store front; with plenty of seating inside. (
Can easily accomidate large groups, or appropriate for small intimate meals.)
The host sat us at a window booth around 230. Lunch price and menu ended 215. So, for over 30$ a person supper menu was offered. A bite pricy for all you can eat but justifiable price *IF* you dont tip, want quick service and considering covid recoup for business/tourist slump.... but because of price it wouldn't be a regular spot for us.
How to order: From our table a tablet was handed to us to select the images to send our own order digitally to the kitchen. Items were separated into categories, and when clicked upon the photo you can see a brief description of some of the items, click quantities then send the order to the kitchen. (As many times as you like). The establishment was medium well maintained no obveous structual wear a tear, with wood chop sticks and serving dishes in good shape. Bathrooms were suitable but could use some touch up. Old finger prints on the tablet. Standard canadian accomidated sushi and Thai food. Quick and friendly service with servers brining one or a few items to all tables throughout your meal.
Requests you click allergies first on the tablet. Nice!

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review:
Let me just say that this restaurant went above and beyond, there was always waitresses on the floor for any service question. The sushi and sauces were spectacular and the ordering interface was straightforward and extensive.

The have the rule "any wasted food may incur a extra charge" and I am ashamed to say I was defeated by this restaurant and could not finish one order of sushi, however they allowed us to take our left overs home as we didn't order massive amount of food.

Great restaurant and will be back

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review:
Based on my 2 visits in the last 2 months, service has been amazing and food has always been hot and taste great.

I love ordering food on a tablet so there is less order mistakes and less person to person interaction for introverts like me. The tablet also includes icons to show what is vegetarian or spicy as well.

Went both times with my vegetarian girlfriend and found the menu has many wonderful vegetarian options that everyone can enjoy. No problems at anytime and I find the price for all you can eat is very fair for what you can get. Dessert is included in the price, drinks are extra.

Highly recommend and will be going to eat here at least once a month.

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review:
An amazing all you can eat sushi place. You get three rounds of ordering sushi for you and others at your table. The California and Dragon rolls are amazing !

The service is great, they send the food out fairly quick and constant, depending on how much you order per round.

The dessert is limited but good and quite tasty. Ice cream, deep fried banana and a mango pudding and one or two more goodies.

Pricy, but the quality is awesome ! For two people, it's around $80.

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review: I love it!! Nice clean place and efficient service. I usually order can pop as I find the fountain is usually flat, but no complaints. Absolutely delightful

Address: 227 Bedford HIghway Halifax, NS B3M 2J9 Canada
Review: Honestly, the workers were super duper friendly, but that’s about it. The food was horrible to say the least. I had very high expectations considering the high prices and the multiple certificates and trophy pics the chef had displayed. It’s easily the worst Chinese food I’ve ever tasted. The Shanghai noodles were bland, I couldn’t believe it. Felt like I was chewing nothing. I’m not exaggerating. The fried rice was somehow even worse. For $26 you would think it would taste somewhat decent, but tbh at that point I’d rather munch on a plain bowl of plain white rice. My last straw was the shrimp. Honestly how does one mess up Shrimp? It Literally has to be the simplest thing to cook but barely had any flavour. I will not be trying this place again, tbh you’re better off grabbing cheap Chinese mall food. Good customer service though.

Address: 227 Bedford HIghway Halifax, NS B3M 2J9 Canada
Review:
Authentic food! Service was good and welcoming. The chief chatted with us for a while. I loved the food is not as sweet as other places in NS. Price is higher than other Chinese restaurants for sure but we can tell the difference.
Not a spacious restaurant. Would be nice if there are more space and tables.

Address: 227 Bedford HIghway Halifax, NS B3M 2J9 Canada
Review: FRESH FRESH FRESH!  I could not believe how fresh the food is at this restaurant!  It was my daughter's first time trying Chinese and when the waitress learned this, she brought out eggrolls on the house for her to try (the most amazing egg rolls I have EVER had!), so sweet and welcoming of her! I highly recommend this place if you are looking for authentic, fresh chinese food!

Address: 227 Bedford HIghway Halifax, NS B3M 2J9 Canada
Review: Best place to have Peking duck within NS! My boyfriend isn’t a soup person but he loves the duck soup. Bamboo boots in the duck stir fry make the flavour so fresh! Love love it! Customer service is also amazing. There was another family with two little kids, waitress was very patient to the kids :)

Address: 227 Bedford HIghway Halifax, NS B3M 2J9 Canada
Review:
Just tried for the first time. I’m not a foodie but I found that the Orients food was very fresh and felt good on my belly. Hard to explain but compared to other Chinese food it just felt premium. The owner Ivan came by to check in on us, very nice guy.

Highly recommend if you want to try more traditional Chinese food with what would seem like quality ingredients!

Address: 5232 Blowers Street Halifax, NS B3J 1J7 Canada
Review: Really impressed with the quality and quantity of food. All the dishes we ordered had authentic Indian taste. Quantity was also good. But there were only 2 ladies taking orders and serving. It was clearly overwhelming for them. Otherwise everything was excellent.

Address: 5232 Blowers Street Halifax, NS B3J 1J7 Canada
Review: I was worried as we were 1st to arrive and well the bathroom is gross, since all the urine stains must have been from earlier in the day or from the day before. I am a little concerned it that is going to reflect on the food. Restaurant itself looks clean and service was fast and very nice. The food…. Looked, smelled and tasted amazing. I just did butter chicken but it was so creamy and good. I will be back

Address: 5232 Blowers Street Halifax, NS B3J 1J7 Canada
Review:
We were in downtown Halifax and looking for a place to eat when we decided to check this place out as you could smell the aroma of tasty Indian food as you got near the restaurant .

It is a fairly small restaurant and seemed very popular as it was packed but after a wait we were able to get a table, The menu was fairly large so it was hard for me to choose what to have (a good problem), I eventually opted for the Lamb Shank Biryani with Chilly Garlic Naan. I thought the food tasted excellent and it was extremely filling. I could barely finish the meal despite finding it to be delicious. The price was very reasonable for what you got.

The staff were very helpful in helping us out as one of us had a food allergy so they took particular care in helping him find a dish that he could eat safely.

Being in downtown Halifax it has the usual issues of trying to get parking close to it, but that is not a reflection of the restaurant more of the whole area. They also have delivery options as I noticed a number being picked up while we were there.

Address: 5232 Blowers Street Halifax, NS B3J 1J7 Canada
Review: Super delicious food, we had lamb biriyani, Tandoori chicken, naan bread, and a dessert I forgot the name. Big portion, fair price. I have to mention the owner and stuff are super friendly, definitely will go back !Highly recommended!!!

Address: 5232 Blowers Street Halifax, NS B3J 1J7 Canada
Review: Excellent food and located at an excellent place at the heart of Halifax. You might not find much parking space around. However the food is delicious and the portions are massive, we had a takeaway order. The chicken Biryani is bone in loaded with 3 leg pieces. Two plates of chicken Biryani is enough for 3 people. The chicken lababdar was mind blowing. I would recommend this to everyone.

Address: 2076 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B4 Canada
Review: Pretty decent spot with interesting food options. Seating is rather limited - even with a reservation we were seated at the bar, which was kind of uncomfortable. Service was adequate. The charcuterie board was tasty, but also pretty large despite being included in the “sorta hungry” part of the menu, so bring a very empty stomach if you want it.

Address: 2076 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B4 Canada
Review:
We stopped in here a few weeks ago for a mid day drinks and some apps! Their cocktail menu was fun to look at and I ended up going with the Pandan one which was delicious! Foodwise, we ordered oysters and one of each of the baos. Though we’re not vegetarian, the mushroom baos are a MUST try. So incredibly flavourful and melt in your mouth, we could’ve ordered another ten of them.

Lots of seating options and they were pretty full when we arrived so would recommend making reservations!

Address: 2076 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B4 Canada
Review:
Always thought this place was lovely for cocktails and snacks, however, the “Let us decide for you” option was 5+ stars! We loved every bite and discovered new favs.

Our favorites (in order of most favorite):
1) seared scallops with cannellini beans
2) rhubarb upside down cake
3) tuna and turnips
4) fresh oysters with house made strawberry? Mignonette and hot sauces
5) the prettiest potato salad on earth

P.S. All the cocktails we had were perfection. I loved the nonino fresco (incredibly refreshing) and my partner enjoyed the campensino old fashioned.

Address: 2076 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B4 Canada
Review:
Absolutely wonderful experience end-to-end from Field Guide. This was our second time visiting Field Guide for dinner, and it was just as good as the first, if not better.

We chose bar seats right in front of the open tiny kitchen and enjoyed chatting with the cooks during service. Everyone - The bartender, the hosts, and the cooks were personable, fun, and attentive.

The drinks were inventive and well balanced, exactly what I'd expect from an eclectic bar on Queen West in Toronto, but much closer to home. Food came out at a reasonable pace, which considering the size of the kitchen (Three cooks in something smaller than apartment kitchens I've had before! A single 30" Induction range!) is impressive. I'd say we made a mistake doing 6 of the larger plates between two people, but we managed to down it all. Everything was well balanced and approachable, with a huge focus put on texture - Incredibly well thought out from that standpoint.

We left completely satisfied and look forward to our next opportunity to visit. If more places took after Field Guide when it comes to hospitality and care, the world would be a better place.

Props!

Address: 2076 Gottingen Street Halifax, NS B3K 3B4 Canada
Review:
All around AMAZING! Im quite particular about my food and drinks, and this place did a fantastic job of creating a summer fresh, delicious and creative menu (with great service). I had minor critiques, but overall was in love and would return and recommend to anyone.

Food: We started with the bread and mussels. Best mussels we’ve ever had, as they were cooked perfectly (and fresh) and the broth was heaven. The bread pairing was perfect to soak up all the buttery broth goodness. Next was the Shrimp Bao. The bread was fluffy and light, and shrimp was at chilled room temperature, perfect for a summer day. A good flavour of celery in case you dislike that, but I’d still suggest you try it! Finally we had the Zucchini and Beef Tartare. Zucchini didn’t wow, though still fresh and summer minty vibes. Beef Tartare…hands down best we’ve ever had. The Asian fusion incorporated was perfect. Closed it out with a Strawberry & Cream, which albeit simpler was well done.

Drinks: Go for them all. Very creative and they can walk you through tasting notes perfectly. Milk Punch (method; not actually milk; recommend), Strawberry Basil Negroni (strongly recommend; not traditional negroni alcohol forward), Eucalyptus Sour (subtle, calm and collected; recommend), Corn Star (be adventurous, as the chipotle is super subtle; worth the risk; recommend), Vesper (again, not alcohol forward; recommend).

Atmosphere: Cozy and charming, yet the accents are vibrant and energizing. Indoor volume is medium, and great for a family, cocktail, date or a “i want a nice drink/bite” any day of the week.

Address: 1673 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z9 Canada
Review: So good! We went for happy hour and it's an absolute steal. If this place was in Paris, NY, LA, etc. it would be absolutely packed from 4 to 5. Excellent platters and oysters, $10 cocktails, and a cool but unpretentious vibe. We'll definitely be back!

Address: 1673 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z9 Canada
Review: Had a fabulous experience here! Went for dinner and drinks with my brother and his wife and the staff were truly fantastic. I hope they all get the recognition they deserve because they made the whole experience worthwhile. Whether you're seated at a table or posted at the bar, the fun and elegant atmosphere helped set the scene for some delicious nibbles from the wide ranging menu. The Mushroom Risotto with Saffron & Manchego is heavenly and has to be tried. Booking is essential during busy times.

Address: 1673 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z9 Canada
Review: A colleague recommended this place. Wow am I glad I visited. It was a difficult choice and I’m so glad I went with the croquetas, they were crispy on the outside and soft and warm on the inside. The I had the pork belly and scallops. Great food and presentation, great staff with interactions with a few of them.

Address: 1673 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z9 Canada
Review:
Highway man was good but I think it’s a little overrated if you ask me.

The drinks are priced higher than most restaurants in the area but they are delicious. You can tell that a mixologist made the drinks instead of a regular bartender.

Don’t expect to leave here full. The sharing platter don’t come with much food.

As a group of six we spent almost 600 dollars on drinks and food and still had to go elsewhere for dinner.

Address: 1673 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z9 Canada
Review:
Was a decent experience as I was from out of town. I found it was a little difficult to get the waitress attention once we had our drinks as we are being ignored.

The drinks had been pretty good and the atmosphere itself was nice. It's pretty dark ! You don't need a reservation if you go during the week but I suspect you'd need one of you go Friday night or weekend evenings.

Address: 172 Wyse Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1M6 Canada
Review: The food and service is great as a family type restaurant.  But I was not informed about them charging extra 4% for paying with credit card.

Address: 172 Wyse Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1M6 Canada
Review: I will always be a #1 fan of Pho Hoang Minh Restaurant. While living in Dartmouth, it was a go to for us when I worked just nearby. And now that I don't live near the city at all, every time I'm driving by and know they're open, I will always stop for the famous #15 meal. I've shared my love for Pho Hoang Minh Restaurant with everyone and will always recommend it. The perfect flavors of the #15 are a staple. My husband and family members also really enjoy the Chinese combination meals. Everything is amazing!

Address: 172 Wyse Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1M6 Canada
Review:
They do both Vietnamese and Chinese food but I would only go there for the Vietnamese dishes. I've had the Pho and noodle bowl, both are as good as any I've had in Asia.

It's a no frills place so don't expect any ambiance but the price reflects that. It's good food at a reasonable price and there's not many of those kinds of places left these days.

Address: 172 Wyse Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1M6 Canada
Review: Fast service, large portions, and a big menu. We ordered the beef pho and the pork and vermicelli dish and both came out within 5 minutes. The bbq pork that came was the vermicelli was delicious and had a smokey flavour and the beef strips in the pho had a bit of red to it when it came out but cooked well in the broth. One thing I didn’t enjoy was having a view of the kitchen while eating and watching the chef cut up the raw meat while eating. Otherwise good Vietnamese restaurant in a convenient location with lots of parking.

Address: 172 Wyse Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1M6 Canada
Review:
Very good food. I really enjoy seeing the boss cut up the meat from the restaurant through to the kitchen. At least this way I know it did not come out of a bucket of saline SLIMEY solution, like some of the other restaurants. This is very fresh honest food.

a very good family business. Very nice

Address: 79 Alderney Drive Dartmouth, NS B2Y 2N7 Canada
Review:
I recently had the pleasure of trying pizza at the stone pizza shop, and I must say it was unique but average rating as per taste. The stone pizza, also known as a brick oven pizza, is prepared using a traditional method of baking pizza on a stone surface inside a wood- fired oven. Here’s my detailed review-

Crust- the crust of the stone pizza was not baked properly. We would love to eat well baked crust.

Toppings- There are multiple options of toppings and you can change your toppings with the other available toppings just in case of you don’t like any toppings. Like we replaced the top oh my veggies pizza from olives - jalapeño and mushrooms- pine apples.

Presentation- The stone pizza was visually appealing. The pizza came out of the oven with a beautiful golden crust and the toppings were artfully arranged. The aroma wafting from the pizza was irresistible making the presentation even more enticing.

Classics pep and cheese - I didn’t like the taste of it, although presentation wise it was tempting.

Address: 79 Alderney Drive Dartmouth, NS B2Y 2N7 Canada
Review:
Tried this place as the reviews seemed good, unfortunately will be the first and last time I will order from this place.

The pepperoni pizza was a 0/10 the cheese seemed curdled & not even melted.

Dough was not fully cooked through & raw under toppings.

I'm sorry to leave this review, but I am extremely dissapointed.

Address: 79 Alderney Drive Dartmouth, NS B2Y 2N7 Canada
Review: I'm a little torn, this was my first time having Stone Pizza. Ordered a personal size Hawaiian pizza, and one of the oreo dessert pizzas.  My Hawaiian pizza was delicious,  but my oreo dessert pizza looks and tastes as if the crust was barely cooked...which is really unfortunate

Address: 79 Alderney Drive Dartmouth, NS B2Y 2N7 Canada
Review: Ordered a donair pizza and was so disappointed, when I placed the order was told it would be ready in 10 minutes which was not typical of when I ordered from Stone in the past as they are my go to for pizza take out. It was evident that this pizza had been prepared much earlier and was reheated the outer edge crust was very crisp. And the donair meat was dry, called to let them know and received an apology that it was not up to my standards, however it was more important to note not up to their standards, the person I spoke with was very curt until I said I was not looking for a refund but making them aware I was disappointed, this makes me rethink my pizza choice moving forward.

Address: 79 Alderney Drive Dartmouth, NS B2Y 2N7 Canada
Review: Tried this place today for dinner and had delivered. Have to say the half and half was perfect the whole way through. Great taste and perfect portion of your looking for a lunch or dinner option. Will def order again! Super fast and great quality!! Keep up the great food!

Address: 480 Parkland Drive Halifax, NS B3S 1P9 Canada
Review:
I don't often give five stars across the board, but Tako Sushi is worthy. I've eaten a lot of sushi in Japan and Korea and the sushi here is on par!

Large menu, so it wasn't easy to make a decision. I finally chose the assorted maki [number 6 under Sushi Combo]. What a delight! The ingredients were fresh and the flavours were spot-on. The miso soup was lovely, too [rich flavours].

The staff was friendly, and although busy, the service was quick. The prep area reminded me of a restaurant you would find in Japan.

My only suggestion is better chopsticks, please. I've been eating with chopsticks for 20-plus years and the wooden ones wrapped in paper are truly awful!

Thank you for a great dining experience. I will be back!!

Address: 480 Parkland Drive Halifax, NS B3S 1P9 Canada
Review:
It was our first trip to Halifax and the first Japanese restaurant we visited.  Tako Sushi & Ramen is a friendly place!
We got a Green Dragon & Ninja roll and 2 types of Ramen: Seafood & Hokkaido. It was awesome!  Hokkaido ramen recommend for all who are fans of spicy food! Seafood ramen (scallops,  shrimps,  calamari ) just 🧡
The dish was so big; we were unable to finish it 😊
The sushi was delicious and super fresh!
I highly recommend trying this place out!

Address: 480 Parkland Drive Halifax, NS B3S 1P9 Canada
Review: What a wonderful little spot! The service was excellent and the sushi was even better. Everything we had was prepared with care, very tasty, and so fresh tasting. Presentation was top notch. Couldn't have asked for better.

Address: 480 Parkland Drive Halifax, NS B3S 1P9 Canada
Review: This was my favourite restaurant in Halifax. The food is always amazing. The chef and cooks are very talented. Unfortunately, in recent months the service has been absolutely abysmal. Seated with no menus, takes 30 minutes to get water, food arrives before drinks and cutlery. Really hoping this changes so we can continue enjoying this awesome restaurant!

Address: 480 Parkland Drive Halifax, NS B3S 1P9 Canada
Review: I’ve had a lot of sushi around Halifax. This is by far the best quality and most delicious sushi I’ve had so far. The sapori role and umi role was incredible. It’s not a fancy place but if you’re looking for some delicious sushi to take out and dine in, def a must go

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review: We chose a type of soup that half normal and half medium spicy 🌶️😅 (Not recommend as lots of chilly oil with garlic and still.. too much spicy). A kind of buffet hot pot as We can select the rest topping, by the kind of meat/seafood/ball/tofu/vegetables/noodles/sauces/ herbs... and  even the starter food. The bigger group we are, the better deal we get as we can enjoy different foods with reasonable price.

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review:
Updated Review:
Reduced star down to 1 since this restaurant has no parking spot and provide no info for facilitate customer like me to park. And i got $115 ticket from their building on top of my 15% tip to their foods and service. Extremely bad experience. Will never come to pay any cent to this business.

——-//////——

I would give 3 stars for hotpot since i still cannot find the right dipping sauce. We had tried peanut sauce but it was too bland. However, because of their pan fried dumpling was so good. There a plenty of ground pork inside and it is only $10. So i have to add 1 more star for them. It seem that their a la carte menu will be much better to try. It looks so good by observing from the other dining table.

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review: Delightful experience. Always wanted to try hot pot and this place did not disappoint me! Good service, delicious food. I will come back for sure.

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review: Great place to get hot pot in Halifax. Although the hot pot is not all you can eat, the price would be around the same for two people but might be lower overall for more people. Easy paper ordering system where you check boxes based on what you want. $30.99 for basic broth and two meats. Waitress was very attentive with the broth as well as refilling the waters.

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review: My first time having hot pot. Super yummy and staff were really helpful for how and what to order. Everything came out very quickly and was delicious!

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review: My first time having hot pot. Super yummy and staff were really helpful for how and what to order. Everything came out very quickly and was delicious!

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review: Really nice French Bistro inspired restaurant. The service is perfect. The food is nice. Many gluten free options! The prices are really fair! Totally worth it!

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review:
A Halifax classic, a gem in the Halifax restaurant scene for many years. The newer restaurants may be fashionable but Le Bistro has maintained their place as a go to spot in Halifax

The mussels were great really need a spoon for the delicious sauce. The Coquille and Seafood Crepes are very good  and the seafood was very fresh. I forgot how good the lemon parfait pie is , next time I will get the large portion.

Our server reflected the professionalism of the hands on owner Liz. We really enjoyed our evening dinner.

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review: Great brunch spot and good value. Fantastic service and you can tell the resto has its regulars because it has a very welcoming vibe.

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review: Enjoyed brunch with my husband and we loved the food specially the dessert 🥰

Address: 1333 S Park Street Halifax, NS B3J 2K9 Canada
Review: On a visit to Halifax for a conference, coincidentally ended up here three times - twice for lunch and once for dinner. The food was great! The service was awesome too. We had a great time! Would highly recommend if you are in the area. Don’t let the oddness of it being at the bottom of an apartment building put you off. It’s worth the trip to Liz’s.

Address: 179 Wyse Road Dartmouth, NS B3A Canada
Review:
Honestly have nothing good to say. The number of decent reviews is astonishing. I don’t like to hate on businesses especially on local ones, but I also want to help others make informed decisions on where they’re going to spend their money and what they’re going to eat.

I ordered takeout by phone. Someone answered the phone, hurriedly said they would put me on hold and then proceeded to just leave me on the line without actually putting me on hold so I could hear everyone talking in the kitchen but had no idea when I would actually be helped. Finally, I was served by someone and she was nice enough but then as soon as I was done going through the order she abruptly said “bye” without asking me my name for the pickup or giving me an estimation for when it would be ready. She didn’t actually hang up so I was once again just left sitting on the other end of the line, but no one was there to listen to my questions.

Finally got our food and while the portion sizes were enormous, the food itself was just horribly bland. It looked like it had sauce on it but somehow there was literally no flavour. Basically eating super greasy food without any good taste experience to make up for it. Also, I ordered the eggplant off of the vegetable section of the menu assuming it was vegetarian and it was full of beef. I get that this was partially my fault for not double checking, but putting a meat dish under the vegetable section and not indicating anywhere that there is meat in it is just horrible business protocol.

On the whole, this experience was bad enough for me to never return.

Address: 179 Wyse Road Dartmouth, NS B3A Canada
Review:
Super impressed with the size pf the serving. 👏🏻

Honey garlic ribs are great, egg rolls ate awesome, beef broccoli is also a must try, the wanton is also superb. I dont personally like the chicken balls though (i think that’s what it’s called). But overall, it was super great experience to eat here. We ended up taking out a huge portion of our meals. If you are not a big eater, a serving can be good for sharing. 😊

Address: 179 Wyse Road Dartmouth, NS B3A Canada
Review: So my boyfriend and I called trying to place an order for delivery at 8:30 pm, we're home with a new baby, exhausted , and don't want to cook because we are tired. the restaurant closes at 9pm. Now I've worked in food service, and the last time I checked you have to serve the customer UNTIL CLOSING. If I call a pizza place at 9:50 and they close at 10pm, they still deliver. Anywho the lady who answered the phone refused to serve us and said "we stop taking orders at 8:30" ma'am ? Do you want to make money ? We can order on doordash and get our food delivered with you guys but your delivery driver doesn't want to work passed 8:30? Or your cooks don't want to cook? Whatever the case may be fix it because you're going to lose money like that.

Address: 179 Wyse Road Dartmouth, NS B3A Canada
Review: Food is average.  One star rating is because upon request of pkg of Soy Sauce for my rice, I was told they have none and haven't had since Covid.  Tell me...what Chinese food restaurant has no Soy Sauce???  Unbelievable.  Had I known before having ordered and paid for my combo plate, I would have gone elsewhere.  If you are getting takeout and want Soy Sauce...avoid this place.  Ridiculous.

Address: 179 Wyse Road Dartmouth, NS B3A Canada
Review:
If your looking for tasty chinese food in hrm dont waste any time just come here.
Chicken su guy was amazing
Big portions
Cherry sauce on the chicken balls. chow main awesome beef/ veg was crazy tasty.
Egg rolls perfect

Address: 1580 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 1H5 Canada
Review: Went there seeing excellent reviews of food, doesn’t live upto hype. Wanted to try Mediterranean Nachos but they completely revised the menu as such. Tried normal nachos, chicken wings and another chicken dish ;wings were smelly and below average and can’t complain about nachos (serving is large for a single person). Overall, average, nothing to be hyped about!

Address: 1580 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 1H5 Canada
Review: Good place for half priced nachos and pub snacks from 4-6. The nachos ($9.50) were layered well with peppers, artichoke pieces and pickled onion, and had a good ratio of cheese to chip and amount of dip (sour cream, refried beans, fresh salsa). 3 Chicken sliders ($8) were tasty but not very filling. Sat outside on the patio and could hear music from The Pint across the street.

Address: 1580 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 1H5 Canada
Review: Loved the nachos here! And our server was VERY busy (we could tell by all the new tables coming in) but she was very attentive to us. Great overall experience, we'll be back for sure.

Address: 1580 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 1H5 Canada
Review:
With the name gastropub, we were expecting higher quality food.
The beer was fine but the fish n chips was more on the store bought / freezer side. Shocking since when we asked the server he said it was a popular dish.
Also the Fries felt like they were refried, stale almost. Nice looking place and ambiance for drinks, not sure we would go back for the food.

Address: 1580 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 1H5 Canada
Review: We wandered around downtown Halifax until we were hungry and came across this adorable bar right in time for happy hour. This seems to be a favourite among the locals because they said in a few hours they'd be full with reservations. The cocktails were fantastic and I would definitely come back with friends for dinner and drinks. A great place for a date too.

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: Their food is always delicious.  If you are looking for a good, tasty, and fast Thai food at lunch, I would highly recommend!  Best to arrive at 11:30 to avoid a Friday wait...although the wait is usually not long

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: This is an authentic Thai food.. I'm so glad to found this place.. this  Thai noodles soup is the killer, this is exactly why I'm here for.. the staffs and cooks are really awesome!

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: Some of the best Pad Thai in HRM. Anytime I'm up in this side of the city I always make an effort to stop by Cha Baa Thai. The store is always clean and tidy. The staff are always friendly, quick and prompt. The food is always incredible! Can't say enough good things. Love this spot

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review:
The best Massaman Curry and Black Pepper Beef I've had! Always excellent and prompt with service, polite and professional . Takeaway is usually about 15 minutes, so if you're ordering for lunch in Burnside, call ahead and they have it ready at the counter still piping hot.
The food is excellent, no matter what you get. It's hard to try something new on the menu, because everything is SO good that you want one of everything!

Definitely recommend.

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: We dined in for lunch and enjoyed Delicious Thai food cooked up fresh!  Friendly fast service and reasonable prices. What’s not to love?  We’ll definitely be back…..

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review: Good Thai Food with pleasant ambience. The drinks were bit below average but no complaints from the food. Pad thai was the standout followed by the Red curry and Cashew Chicken. The quantity is quite good and can be shared by two people(with rice or sides)

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review: The restaurant was nice, the staff was friendly, the cashew chicken was delicious, but unfortunately the spring rolls were not fresh, they were sour. Fried noodles taste sweet and sour, but it will be a little greasy, not recommended to try. Thai coffee tastes a little more weepy and creamy.

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review:
Great spot for a delicious and authentic Thai meal.

The restaurant's Pad Thai is a delightful mix of stir-fried rice noodles, vegetables, peanuts, and beef. The Pad Thai is served in generous portions, perfect for both lunch or dinner.

Wonton soup was surprisingly relexing, strongly recommend as well.

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review:
Very nice experience. I ordered the red curry chicken. The curry was full of flavor and the portion was perfect.

They even gave me extra chicken because I didn't want the egg roll that comes with it since I'm gluten free.

Will definitely be going back !

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review: Wow, probably the best Thai food I’ve ever had!(haven’t had much but this was exceptional) the flavors of my green curry chicken lunch special and coconut soup were out of this world. The Thai iced coffee was strong and sweet and my friends Thai iced tea was such a sweet and unique flavor. If you are in downtown Halifax or around the other location in Dartmouth you gotta go here for some of the best Thai food in Halifax.

Address: 8 Oland Crescent Halifax, NS B3S 1C6 Canada
Review:
I absolutely classify Dhaba Express as a hidden gem of Halifax. I have only ever gone for the weekend buffet and it has been stellar each and every time. On my most recent visit I fell in love with the samosa chat and the punjabi chicken.

I highly, highly recommend.

Address: 8 Oland Crescent Halifax, NS B3S 1C6 Canada
Review:
We were drawn here by the aromas as we passed on our way to CBSA nearby. We had a lovely lunch which was very tasty. We chose what was on special, recommended by the waitress.  The staff were friendly, welcoming and efficient.
Very good curry.

Address: 8 Oland Crescent Halifax, NS B3S 1C6 Canada
Review:
Amazing food always. Saturday Buffet is Worth trying. Everything is super tasty.

Update:
Came back for the buffet again. Pleasantly surprised with the menu. Always new items to try.

Address: 8 Oland Crescent Halifax, NS B3S 1C6 Canada
Review: Food is tasty, but butter chicken had a sweet and sour taste, did not like that. Thandoori chicken curry is also very delicious. Butter naan is super big, One is enough to fill your stomach. Authentic Indian taste.

Address: 8 Oland Crescent Halifax, NS B3S 1C6 Canada
Review: The worst Indian meal we have ever had and we have eaten at many excellent Indian restaurants.  This is definitely one of them.  Where do we start - the “nan” is unlike any we have ever eaten it is more like a flat bread.  The curry had loads of grease and hardly any chicken.  The rice is not like regular saffron rice, which is much finer.  The pics speak for themselves.  It was expensive for sub-standard food and we won’t be returning.

Address: 81 Peakview Way Unit 100 Bedford, NS B3M 0G2 Canada
Review:
Top-Notch!

We went to Blue Elephant for lunch, and it’s one of the best Thai food in town.

I have been to almost all the Thai places in town, and by far, the best experience in terms of food, ambience and hospitality - Blue Elephant.

If you struggle to choose as all options excite you, SALLY will jump in to help. She is the nicest to the core and one person who does everything - Taking orders, delivering the food, billing and cleaning. Uff - hats off to you!

Since we went on a weekday, their inventory for drinks where missing a few to try cocktails, but it’s understandable.

Overall - if you like Thai, you must try Blue Elephant at least once before you stick with your regular Thai place.

Good luck, Blue Elephant crew; we will return soon with a big crowd of friends and families.

Address: 81 Peakview Way Unit 100 Bedford, NS B3M 0G2 Canada
Review: We ordered shrimp pad thai and spring rolls for take out. The food, service, and atmosphere were average to us. It would have been nice to have some fresh green onion and bean sprouts in the pad thai.

Address: 81 Peakview Way Unit 100 Bedford, NS B3M 0G2 Canada
Review:
Loved the decor, the ambience and the vibe. DID NOT like the phone constantly ringing and no one answering the phone...very distracting and annoying.  We had the spring rolls (good) and wings (good, nothing special) for appetizers.  Our main was the Pad Thai, which was DELICIOUS!! One if the best we had!! Waitress was very apologetic for the long wait and mix up with the spring rolls. Was a good experience and will probably be back to give it another chance.

Back again and had the Cashew chicken and ginger beef...the chicken will be my go-to order!!! Soooooo good!!

Address: 81 Peakview Way Unit 100 Bedford, NS B3M 0G2 Canada
Review:
My wife and I had an amazing experience here. We shared the fresh spring rolls which were excellent, and the dipping sauce was delicious!
We also had the Pad Thai, and the Red Curry which was also amazing.
Everything was so fresh, the portion sizes were great, the staff was extremely friendly.
We will definitely be coming back here, despite it being out of our way.
My only regret was not taking photos of the food as we devoured everything because it was so good!

Address: 81 Peakview Way Unit 100 Bedford, NS B3M 0G2 Canada
Review:
Good portions and taste, will definitely come back.

4 months have gone by, sat and ate in once. Food was still really good, service was a little slow (server seemed to be busy trying to keep up).

Delivery was tonight and whilst there's a $10 charge for the service (you're going to be paying that on Uber or Skip with all their fees), the food got to me an hour from when I placed my order (exactly when the lady on the phone said it would). Everything was piping hot and just as good as every other experience. Wish I gave a little bit more of a tip to the driver but I didn't want to leave a big tip and find my food cold afterwards. Will definitely be ordering again.

Ginger beef is a 10/10

Address: 1014 Barrington St Halifax, NS B3H 2P9 Canada
Review: Staff are friendly, limited street parking. Pulled pork and pork ribs were great, but the brisket didn't really have a smokey flavour that I would expect. Sweet potato chips, cornbread and beans were good.

Address: 1014 Barrington St Halifax, NS B3H 2P9 Canada
Review: Omg this BBQ was soooo good!!!!! Would highly recommend to anyone who likes BBQ! I got the chicken sandwich meal. We ate there, which I thought was even better. They have different sauces at the table!

Address: 1014 Barrington St Halifax, NS B3H 2P9 Canada
Review:
Food wasn't very good. Pulled pork was only thing that had flavor, everything else was bland or just average.

The worst was the brisket! Absolutely bone dry and no flavor whatsoever. Possible the worst I've ever had.

Staff was very friendly however.

Address: 1014 Barrington St Halifax, NS B3H 2P9 Canada
Review:
We got the 3-meat combo: double order of ribs and sausage (they had run out of brisket and chicken). Ribs were great, sausage was good. Sauces were delicious (especially the gravy), tasty cornbread and coleslaw.
They forgot several components of our order, which we checked before we left. They were apologetic, but just FYI to check your takeout bag before you leave.

Address: 1014 Barrington St Halifax, NS B3H 2P9 Canada
Review: Small space, they have two tables I believe but not really a sit and eat kind of place. Had the pull pork sandwich with dirty rice. The dirty rice was bland, and the pull pork could have used more of the bbq sauce. There are better BBQ options out there. They also need a better system for pick up. Everyone was waiting in the same line if you were placing an order or just picking up.

Address: 1261 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y2 Canada
Review:
An absolutely incredible experience 🤩
We ordered the Everything Combo for 3 people, Pork Bone Hot Pot for 2 people and Eel rice bowl. We love everything so much!! The portions were enormous with very reasonable price, even though it's located conveniently right in downtown Halifax.
It could be a bit tricky finding parking spots, so you may expect some walking uphill to get there.

Address: 1261 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y2 Canada
Review: Great Korean food restaurant. Been there few times with family and friends. The price and quantity are balanced. Service is reasonable and not generally delayed. Would go back at some point.

Address: 1261 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y2 Canada
Review:
As a connoisseur of Korean cuisine, I must say that the Korean BBQ restaurant located in the center of downtown Halifax is a standout establishment that truly excels in every aspect.

First and foremost, the service was impeccable. The staff were not only attentive and efficient, but also welcoming and hospitable, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere for diners.

In terms of atmosphere, the restaurant is tastefully decorated with traditional Korean elements, giving it a sense of authenticity and cultural immersion. The energy of the restaurant was lively and dynamic, making for a truly enjoyable dining experience.

Now, onto the food. The selection of meats offered at the BBQ was diverse and of the highest quality, expertly prepared and cooked to perfection. The accompanying "banchan," or side dishes, were also a delight, offering a plethora of flavors and textures that enhanced the overall meal.

In conclusion, it is with the utmost conviction that I highly recommend this Korean BBQ restaurant to anyone seeking a truly exceptional dining experience. The combination of excellent service, authentic atmosphere, and delicious food make it a must-try for anyone in the Halifax area.

Address: 1261 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y2 Canada
Review: Korean BBQ was a hit, delicious meat and servers were fast to replenish. The one downside we found was that the hot pot we found lacking, overwhelmed with pork bones and barely any soup, and most places have deeper pans for the soup. Service was excellent just the hot pot was lacking.

Address: 1261 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y2 Canada
Review:
The service was kind and efficient, the meal was hot and savoury,  and the price was truly good value for the quality of food.

We tried the bulgogi, the spicy chicken, and the Kimchi soup and the word ‘delicious’ was tossed around the table many times.

I highly recommend this restaurant for authentic Korean dishes.

Address: 746 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B3M 2L9 Canada
Review: Attended this restaurant after a friend’s recommendation! Delicious pho, but it’s very important to know that when they write “spicy” on the menu, they really mean it. Ordered the spiciest pho on the menu and was only able to eat a quarter of the bowl before my mouth was too swollen. Most painful meal ever, but such a delicious flavour. The space is a bit crowded, though the service is excellent. Can’t wait to go again and order a less spicy dish to fully enjoy the experience!

Address: 746 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B3M 2L9 Canada
Review: I am a frequent I Love Pho customer, mainly for their Pho and Bun Bo Hue. I highly recommended both, they taste very good with decent portion. The restaurant itself is small but cozy, and the waiter is always helpful and friendly.

Address: 746 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B3M 2L9 Canada
Review: Great place to eat traditional Vietnamese food! You can tell that the Pho is made fresh using fresh ingredients! Very tasty soup! The sandwich brought me back memories! It’s like as if you were in any vendor in Hanoi! Delicious!!! Highly recommended!!

Address: 746 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B3M 2L9 Canada
Review: We came here twice in July and our first experience with the restaurant was pretty good. Pho was good and the service was also nice. We stopped by again on Wednesday, July 19th and it was quite rainy out but we asked if we could sit at the patio. The server said something but we didn’t get it clear, so it was our fault for not confirming his answer and headed out to the patio. Around 5 minutes later he peeked his head out, not coming out and telling us properly, peeked his head out and told us “I said no patio”, I’m quoting him now because it was so impressive how he talked to customers. Quite disappointing because we like the food there and our other server was really nice. We left after that and did not get food.

Address: 746 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B3M 2L9 Canada
Review: Delicious pho!! Spring rolls are very crispy. Always my pho go to place :D

Address: 1824 Hollis Street Halifax, NS B3J 1W4 Canada
Review: We enjoyed going to this restaurant on a recent holiday in Halifax. I had scallops which were good - not that big though - we also ordered the salmon and the calamari- the calamari was great - the salmon was a little overcooked but tasty. We each had a drink from the bar which we found to be very reasonably priced. The atmosphere was casual and the service was friendly. I would go back :)

Address: 1824 Hollis Street Halifax, NS B3J 1W4 Canada
Review:
Wow, i fell in love with this place.
I ordered the lobster dinner, and it was super delicious! It cam with clam chowder which was rich and creamy! It also came with a side and i choose mash potato which was amazing! The other side dish we ordered calamari was also delicious. The dessert was also very filling! Delicious as well.
I will definitely come back to Bluenose II when/if I ever travel back to Halifax!

Address: 1824 Hollis Street Halifax, NS B3J 1W4 Canada
Review: So happy we went here during my recent vacation to Halifax. We had the seafood chowder and the 2 piece fish and chips. The food was excellent and served hot and fast. Very friendly staff, great atmosphere! We will definitely return.

Address: 1824 Hollis Street Halifax, NS B3J 1W4 Canada
Review:
I recently visited Bluenose II in Halifax with my wife for a delightful lunchtime experience. This charming restaurant exceeded our expectations with its delectable seafood, cozy ambiance, and attentive service.

First and foremost, the food at Bluenose II is a true delight for seafood lovers. We indulged in an array of mouthwatering dishes, from succulent lobster rolls to perfectly seared scallops. Each bite was bursting with freshness and flavors of the sea, making for an exceptional dining experience.

The restaurant's interior exudes a comfortable and inviting atmosphere. The maritime-themed decor and beautiful seafaring artwork created a unique and enchanting ambiance. We particularly enjoyed sitting by the window, which offered a pleasant view of the bustling street outside. It was the perfect spot to unwind and soak in the relaxed vibes.

The service at Bluenose II was commendable. The staff members were friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. They were prompt in taking our orders and made sure we had everything we needed throughout our meal. Their warm and accommodating nature added to the overall positive experience.

In conclusion, our visit to Bluenose II was a delightful journey into maritime cuisine. The delectable seafood, comfortable surroundings, and attentive service made for a memorable dining experience. Whether you're a seafood enthusiast or simply seeking a relaxed and enjoyable meal, Bluenose II in Halifax is a fantastic choice.

Address: 1824 Hollis Street Halifax, NS B3J 1W4 Canada
Review:
The food was good. Very quick, tasty, and fairly priced.
Service was meeting the bare minimum. The service was quick but the server never topped up our waters or even chatted with us. It was definitely efficient, but it felt like a get in and get out kind of dining experience. Then to have the lowest pre-set option for tipping to be 18% was shocking considering all that.
The restaurant was almost full when I went, so it was loud and difficult to have a conversation. I felt rushed to eat and leave since it was so busy.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Best sushi on the East Coast! Amazing service, atmosphere & fresh sushi that is always perfect. Dine in or take out. Gonna miss this place so much after living here for 7 years. We will be back when we come & visit the maritimes.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Visited from Toronto and first time trying restaurant. They had a good variety of selections.  I chose the dinner special with soup and salad which were both very good.  The sushi plate had California roll, spicy tuna, assorted sushi and sashimi.  The platter was good but sashimi was cut a bit too thick.  I have eaten a lot of sushi and sushi Nami was just okay.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Had our lunch. They open 12nn every Sunday. We came early around 11 am. They charge extra 15% service fee if you exceed 5 person. We are 6 but it's considerable because they got nice and good service Nd food

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Canada day lunch! Awesome Sushi, delicious desserts and overall a wonderful experience.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Not  the greatest   but if you don't know good sushi then you may think its a good place   plus you shouldn't have to worry about  bones

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review: The food is always delicious and comes out fast. I love getting a bunch of appetizers and having small dishes and it's a great place for that.

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review:
This is a pretty decent sushi restaurant, middling food but not terrible. They have a wide variety of options if you want to explore some new flavors.

The interior design and atmosphere is probably the best part about this place - a wide sushi bar takes up the middle of the space, and the entire restaurant is slightly sunken into the building which makes it feel a little quieter despite being right downtown.

They have a pretty nice variety of beverages, including an interesting ramune flavored drink which I would recommend if it's still available.

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review: Went to get sushi downtown for a lunch date with a friend. I ordered the Maki Lunch, providing me with a delicious plate full of rolls. The atmosphere in the restaurant is very nice with kind servers to bring you your food. The miso soup was excellent and the spicy salmon rolls were very yummy. However, the house salad was not very good and some of the rolls had an uneven proportion of elements, making each bite slightly unbalanced. Overall, a good place to go for a reasonably priced sushi lunch deal.

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review: Great, fresh sushi. The quality of the food makes up for any other shortcomings. I was there on a holiday weekend (Canada Day) and it was clear they were not prepared to be that busy. The staff was struggling to keep up. But once I finally got my food, it was amazing. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review:
The sashimi is a must: big chunks of melt-in-your-mouth salmon, tuna & escolar. This Cantonese-owned place has been a Halifax classic and I was happy to know they’re still open. This newer location has great decor and is very spacious! Waitress was very polite.

Rolls were somewhat of a letdown on the day we went, but tasted good. They are a bit loose, sparse and some classics like the dragon roll, while not bad here, didn’t taste as good as some other restaurants.

Address: 547 Portland Street Unit 1 & 2 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4B1 Canada
Review: Everything was great, Trish was an excellent server. The only thing I would recommend is not to sit in the booths. They are attached  to each other, and every time you moved or the other table moved, it felt like a kid was sitting behind you kicking your seat.

Address: 547 Portland Street Unit 1 & 2 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4B1 Canada
Review: Ordered wings tonight for takeout when I got home and opened them up. This is what it looks like. Very disappointing well over cooked

Address: 547 Portland Street Unit 1 & 2 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4B1 Canada
Review: The portion was disgusting, 8 wings and a little bit of fries, ok too if that the wings didn’t even taste good. Worst spot for wings in novascotia so far.

Address: 547 Portland Street Unit 1 & 2 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4B1 Canada
Review: Asked the server about all you can eat, after 2 rounds of questions. Find out out the end all you can eat ended 2 days ago, they just didnt take down the signs. Didn't even bother ordering, took 25 minutes to ask what we'd like to order. This is not the first time I've had a bad experience here. Zero stars if i could.

Address: 547 Portland Street Unit 1 & 2 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4B1 Canada
Review:
I have come here for years. I've usually enjoyed it. It has definitely changed since the old manager left over a year ago. I sat on the patio and there was a gentleman vaping, clearly against the regulations governing eating/licensed establishments. Staff even sat with him while he was vaping.
Then to top it all off, the patio is littered with broken glass. Which shocked me, especially when the patio is suppose to be dog friendly.
To top it all off, the food was lukewarm

Address: 55 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1H1 Canada
Review: The staff are nice. But, the portion is disappointing.  Stuffing is very little and the plate is for some reason so small that it is hard to avoid the food falling out of it. One scoop of ice cream was not really a complete one scoop. It is different from the pic I see in the past post. If the quantity was more generous, they would be for sure more popular.a coffee was a it small for the price, too:(.for lunch, one crepe may not satisfy you.  May need a cup of soup to go with it.
