Also, it is completely self service, so why tips are asked…?

Address: 55 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1H1 Canada
Review: We ordered the mushroom crepe which was definitely worth 5 stars. Additionally I also got the baseline and although I would have appreciated more bacon/banana filling inside, I definitely enjoyed the cook on the bacon. The staff was friendly and overall a good spot.

Address: 55 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1H1 Canada
Review:
BEST CREPES IN NS! 🤩🤩☝️#️⃣1️⃣

What an amazing vibe and delicious crepes !
The food was exceptional the crepes were prefetch thin and the variety of choices.

MUST TRY THE PIEROGI CREPES ITS UNBELIEVABLE! 🔥 🤤 🍨

Address: 55 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1H1 Canada
Review:
What a nice spot to stop in for quick brunch. The staff were incredibly lovely and the shop was clean. I personally wish there were more sweet crepe options with fruit that didn’t involve chocolate or cheesecake, but can’t do everything. When reading the savoury menu some of the options seem unusually, but they’re on there for a reason.

This building is wheelchair accessible, but it may be a little harder to navigate with mobility issues once inside, specifically if you come at a busy time. The washroom might be especially hard to reach in a wheelchair.

I wish there was a little bit of art or something on the walls, but overall so lovely!

Address: 55 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1H1 Canada
Review:
Spectacular in every way!

We had a lovely interactions with fellow customers before we even got inside. The atmosphere was friendly and wholesome inside, they even changed the music as different demographics of people came in.

We had a La Marais and they honoured an online only coupon to give us a Lemon Sugar Crêpe for free! Both were delicious and prepared perfectly.

The staff was friendly & engaging, and made us feel comfortable and at home.

Prices here are excellent! I haven't felt like I paid a reasonable price for a meal out in years.

A wonderful place, I highly recommend!

Address: 2540 Agricola Street Halifax, NS B3K 4C5 Canada
Review:
Agricola Street Brasserie did everything right.  The  design and atmosphere is outstanding.   The service was exceptional.  I wish I could recall my servers name but he did a terrific job.

I went for Brunch.  Menu was the right size.  The options made it tough to choose.   I had a cappuccino which was great.  Brasserie Breakfast and Duck Confit Hash were chosen.  Cinnamon Roll and Danish Pastry were add-ones.    Food was a 10/10.

I am looking forward to heading back for dinner soon.

Address: 2540 Agricola Street Halifax, NS B3K 4C5 Canada
Review:
Great dining experience.
The kitchen is uniquely visible, the staff are amazing and the atmosphere was great; dim lighting & cool wine-bottle glasses. It's a little pricey, but the food is worth it. Yum!!!

Address: 2540 Agricola Street Halifax, NS B3K 4C5 Canada
Review: We ate here as a group and were seated above the kitchen in a cozy space that was large enough for our 15 or so people. We had a choice of appetizers main course and dessert. I enjoyed my calamari, it was cooked perfectly and was definitely sharable in size. I couldn’t eat more than half of it as I wanted to enjoy my main , the herbed chicken. The herbed chicken was a mixture and not the usual breast meat by itself. The accompanying veg and sauce tasted great. For dessert they hit it out of the park with cheesecake. I enjoyed my meal but would have loved it if I’d read the menu in better light. The green bean Caesar looked amazing and everyone who had it cleaned their plates. However the filet mignon were undercooked but still had great taste. The bread pudding was yummy as well.

Address: 2540 Agricola Street Halifax, NS B3K 4C5 Canada
Review: My partner took me to Agricola Street Brasserie for my birthday yesterday. We had the tasting menu with wine pairings and sat by the kitchen bar. It was the best culinary experience I’ve ever had in Halifax. The service was amazing, the dishes were beautiful and delicious and the wine pairings were phenomenal. I would definitely go back any time.

Address: 2540 Agricola Street Halifax, NS B3K 4C5 Canada
Review:
10/10 - one of the gems of Halifax, the Brussels Caesar Salad is next level & the atmosphere is so chill.

Will absolutely be coming back.

Address: 5650 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3J 1H1 Canada
Review: Delicious pasta with fresh seafood. Generous portions with reasonable prices and friendly service. Would highly recommend the lobster risotto and seafood linguine. Only complaint is that the tip option on the machine started at 18% for a group of 4 rather than 15%.

Address: 5650 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3J 1H1 Canada
Review:
One of the best restaurants we’ve ever been to - a must visit!
The lobster risotto and the scallop linguine is incredible.
Also, our server was AMAZING!! He recommended we get the white chocolate cheesecake as it’s his fav… and we were glad we did.

Address: 5650 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3J 1H1 Canada
Review: I have frequented LaFracsa dozens and dozens of times since it opened.    I go back because the menu has so many great choices, the restaurant atmosphere is fun and laid back, the food is delicious and the service never disappoints.

Address: 5650 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3J 1H1 Canada
Review:
Super romantic little resturant with awesome food. The pumpkin ravioli is by far the best ravioli I've ever had.
My partner and I went here for our first date and he still talks about the burger he got near 4 years later.

Address: 5650 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3J 1H1 Canada
Review: I really enjoyed the food here. I’m going to be dreaming of the linguine ai fruitti de mare for a really long time. The creme brûlée was delicious as well. The sauce for the linguine was so rich.

Address: 6169 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 4P6 Canada
Review:
Seven Spices, a Syrian restaurant that serves up some delicious food! I recently had the pleasure of trying their chicken shawarma and falafel wrap, and I have to say that both were absolutely fantastic.

The chicken shawarma was tender and juicy, with just the right amount of spices to give it a flavorful kick. And the falafel wrap was packed with crunchy, fresh veggies and a deliciously seasoned falafel patty that was cooked to perfection.

Overall, I highly recommend Seven Spices to anyone looking for a taste of authentic Syrian cuisine. The quality of their food is truly top-notch, and I can't wait to come back and try some of their other dishes!

Address: 6169 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 4P6 Canada
Review: The Best shawarma 🌯 wrap i ever had. It was good size, so fresh and delicious 😋. The guy working (Abdul) also offered me complimentary soup 🍲 that was good too. I would recommend  everyone to try.

Address: 6169 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 4P6 Canada
Review:
It was our first time ordering the food from them and we were so surprised! The food was so tasty and the portions were big!! The chicken skewers was so tender and juicy, the lamp kebab was so delicious! I also love the spice in the rice, very tasty!
There’s only one thing I am curious, we ordered chicken kebab plate, but it came with 2 lamb Kebab and 1 chicken skewer.
However, we do love their food so much. Will definitely gonna order it again soon!

Address: 6169 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 4P6 Canada
Review: The hostess was really good and friendly.. the food was not as par as I was expecting. We had the chicken kebab and lamb kebab.. both were alright , quantity will serve a good sized apetite.. ambiance isn't that great. Would prefer for take outs.. there are better Lebanese restaurants in town.. this wouldn't be my first pick..

Address: 6169 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 4P6 Canada
Review: I am vegetarian and ordered veg falafel platter. It was too yummy tasty and delicious.   I know they have only this veg option, but I can visit them just for this. One suggestion,  if they add more veg option from the middle east, I would love to try more veg dishes here. The portion is also great.

Address: 1335 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y9 Canada
Review: It is a treat to find a restaurant with the authentic Chinese northern home food flavours.  Great price for tasty and plentiful food.  A gem in the heart of down town Halifax, if you want a hearty noodle soup.

Address: 1335 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y9 Canada
Review:
In short, excellent. In long,

This restaurant is well located downtown Halifax, it's right across from Dalhousie (enginnering faculty). The parking is as such street parking.

The location itself is nice, cleanly decorated with good spacing between tables.

The menu is straightforward and easy. Simply 1 page back and forth.

We ordered the regular steamed beef and lamb dumpling with some egg rolls to start.

The eggs rolls were good crispy, but the filling was a bit unfamiliar to me but not bad.

The dumplings were simply excellent. They had a good amount of filling, the shape was also visually nice. There was a complete set of condiments, soy sauce, black vinegar, chilli oil, salt and pepper.

Service was excellent. Quick, courteous. Not sure if its a winter thing but hot water was served too, nice touch.

Prices were very fair, the steam dumpling order was many and with eggs rolls it made a great lunch.

I look forward to trying many more dumplings!

Cheers

Address: 1335 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y9 Canada
Review:
I really wanted to give this place 5 stars but the food was ok.

Visiting Halifax from Toronto, I guess I’m putting this place up against a lot of other more established dumpling places but for what seems to be one of only a few dumpling places in town, it’s decent.

Dumplings seemed small though, and could barely taste the shrimp (pork and shrimp version). Could have ordered the pork dumplings and not have told the difference.

The chicken leg/rice combo was good - never had this dish before and the pickled potatoes or whatever it was was a nice complement. Sauce could have been more flavorful.

Address: 1335 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y9 Canada
Review:
Had an excellent time! Server was polite and I can't rave enough about the food. I had the braised pork and egg noodles and the pork was perfectly tender. The broth it came in was very flavorful.
I don't know if it is useful quiet in the late afternoon but when we came there was only one other table of people, so it was a quiet, peaceful atmosphere.
Would definitely recommend checking this place out!

Address: 1335 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y9 Canada
Review: Food and service was great. A few fruit flies did keep us company which was a little annoying.

Address: 1549 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 1S2 Canada
Review: Food is decent. Calamari was lacking seasoning. Dip was above average. Apple compote ratio to fritter is to much. Ahi tuna Sandwich was amazing. The Lobster roll was great as well. Service was amazing. But Service is not great enough to overcome slightly above average food.

Address: 1549 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 1S2 Canada
Review:
Great atmosphere, food, and service.
Lobster roll had a generous serving of Lobster.
The dozen chef selection of oysters was fresh and reasonably priced.
Chicken sandwich for the non seafood lover in you was very good.

Address: 1549 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 1S2 Canada
Review: The food was so good! Tried the chef selection of oysters, scallops, and crab fritters. If I wasn’t so full I would have kept going because it was just so good! The patio is absolutely amazing too. Will definitely return.

Address: 1549 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 1S2 Canada
Review:
It has been 20 years since I last ate at The Waterfront Warehouse.   On. Rainy summer day, stopped for lunch and had a Lobster Roll.   The menu was built for tourists with great fare for all ages.   The Lobster Roll actually had some great quality chunks of claw and knuckle lobster meat.    The chips were also great.

Service was quick and polite.   Just what was needed for a quick lunch.

Address: 1549 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 1S2 Canada
Review: We had an incredible time at the Waterfront Warehouse! We came for a drink in the afternoon and then decided to come back for dinner after seeing how great the menu was. When we came back for dinner we got: popcorn scallops, kimchi arancini, 2 oysters then the fish/chips and the fried chicken. We loved everything! We loved that there was an oyster bar and a menu describing them all. We’ve never had them so we got one each to try. We will definitely be back!

Address: 1871 Hollis Street Halifax, NS B3J 3M8 Canada
Review: Lovely delicious Mexican specialties. I only wish I’d known it sooner. It’s a tidy, pleasant breakfast/lunch place. I also wish it were bigger, had a bar, and had dinner. My new favourite lunch. This will require self control not to go all the time.

Address: 1871 Hollis Street Halifax, NS B3J 3M8 Canada
Review: Stopped here on a lunchtime walk while visiting Halifax in May. I ordered two empanadas - one black bean and one pork - they were way bigger than I anticipated and I could not finish both. So tasty! Friendly staff. Would like to return to try more menu items.

Address: 1871 Hollis Street Halifax, NS B3J 3M8 Canada
Review:
I ordered Patacon.
It had roast beef ,special sauce and some other stuff. It was a Venezuelan dish.
I loved the way which they take orders. You would a qr code at the table and order by scanning it.
Customer service was awesome 👌

Address: 1871 Hollis Street Halifax, NS B3J 3M8 Canada
Review: Favourite place for lunch in Halifax. Everything here is amazing and the service is incredible. I had the pork arepa and was not disappointed. I usually stick with a favourite menu item at restaurants but I am determined to try the entire menu as everything is phenomenal!

Address: 1871 Hollis Street Halifax, NS B3J 3M8 Canada
Review: Verano is Halifax's top spot for homemade empanadas. Trust me. What sets them apart are two things: excellent portions and mouth watering fillings (16 Hour Braised Beef, Black Bean and Queso fresco, Chicken Tinga - just to name a few). This is a uniquely wonderful Mexican and Venezuelan restaurant experience that, from what I can tell, is family-run. Dine-in or order as the perfect grab-&-go snack, you won't be disappointed. The only downside is they're not open on weekends.

Address: 2305 Clifton Street Halifax, NS B3K 4T9 Canada
Review: We went early to take advantage of Happy Hour and are glad we did. It wasn’t busy so the server was very attentive. We enjoyed delicious Buck a shuck oysters from Pristine Bay and $6 margaritas to start. Then I had the tuna tartare and fries while my husband had the halibut. We were both very happy with our choices. Hope to go back soon!

Address: 2305 Clifton Street Halifax, NS B3K 4T9 Canada
Review: Best restaurant in town! Phenomenal food and atmosphere. Great prices for the top notch quality of their ingredients. Even the basics like the EV Caesar bring that wow factor. The house-made pasta never fails to impress! Do yourself a favour and try it out!

Address: 2305 Clifton Street Halifax, NS B3K 4T9 Canada
Review: Such a wonderful happy hour (and onwards) experience! We had wonderful service all night. We enjoyed the oysters so much that we ordered a third set! Happy hour oysters is a bit funny- you get 8 oysters for one dollar each for each appetizer/main that you order. So 8$ for 8 oysters with a food purchase. There is also a sparkling, red, and white wine option for 6$ during happy hour instead of 9$. We had 24 oysters, charcuterie plate, gnocchi and a burger and it was all really delicious. I will definitely be back!

Address: 2305 Clifton Street Halifax, NS B3K 4T9 Canada
Review: Fantastic experience here! Came for their happy hour and enjoyed $1 oysters with our order of a charcuterie board. Limited selection of wine and beer was available for $6 for happy hour. The food was delicious and the server was very attentive, we asked for extra crackers for the charcuterie board and she provided them promptly! Would definitely recommend to friends and family!

Address: 2305 Clifton Street Halifax, NS B3K 4T9 Canada
Review:
I love this place more and more every time I go back!
I often find myself loving a dish at a restaurant and then reordering the same one each time I visit... however everything at EV is so delicious that I love switching it up !
(Except the blueberry "cheesecake" - that's a staple)

Love everything about this place. Can't wait to try brunch.

Address: 7156 Chebucto Road Halifax, NS B3L 1N4 Canada
Review: Nice restaurant, good service. Food is tasty and reasonable prices. If you like diners or looking for a casual family/friends dinner spot, this is a great place to go. A little hard to get into narrow, small parking area (busy road - take Quinpool to rotary and turn right into lot that only has about 9 spots). Good but small wine selection and reasonable prices per bottle. Food was delicious and fresh, desserts were excellent. Recommend pies and bread pudding. Yum! My parents loved it too. Picnic tables were added outside for summer time eating, fyi.

Address: 7156 Chebucto Road Halifax, NS B3L 1N4 Canada
Review:
Had a good dinner at the Armview. I remember as a child going into a restaurant like this with my grandmother and it brought back pleasant memories.
I love establishments like the Armview, where everything seems original to the time period it was first opened. These establishments are becoming rare to find.
The Armview is a terrific restaurant and has amazing atmosphere. The staff are super friendly and attentive to their guests. The food was good, made fresh and served hot.

Address: 7156 Chebucto Road Halifax, NS B3L 1N4 Canada
Review: So good! Sat in the dog friendly park and got take out from them because the park part of the restaurant was not serving yet. But the bartender was great and made it easy to order take out. Got the lobster eggs Benedict and the regular eggs Benedict, as well as the creme brulee french toast. It was all amazing!! Highly recommend!

Address: 7156 Chebucto Road Halifax, NS B3L 1N4 Canada
Review: We went for breakfast on Sunday; it was my first time there. There was a line of people waiting for tables, and the place was very busy. We waited 10 - 15 minutes and got a table. The server was nice, and the atmosphere was good. I didn't like the menu, and what we decided to get was OK.

Address: 7156 Chebucto Road Halifax, NS B3L 1N4 Canada
Review: Menu was on the small side and didn't really have a wide range. I brought my grandmother and son in to try it out. The onion rings had a too crispy coating that left the roof of my mouth a bit raw. My grandmother could not eat them. She did like the burger. I could not finish my burger as there was a short and curly not belonging to myself or my company. Thankfully the server graciously refunded the meal. The interior has a nice old set feel but, suffers from its age and lack of upkeep. My son did enjoy his pizza.

Address: 59 King St Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1H2 Canada
Review: We stopped in last night for the first time for food and drinks and I was pleasantly surprised with how great it was. We shared the variety platter which was 10/10! We also tried the nachos, and fries which were loaded with fresh ingredients and super flavourful!! The sangria was delicious. Everything was fairly priced. The live music was awesome as well. I will definitely be back!

Address: 59 King St Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1H2 Canada
Review:
This was one of the best breakfast I had in a long time. Big portions, great taste, nice presentation and a nice variation on our plates.

We were questioning at first when we walked in and saw that no one else was there eating whether or nor we wanted to stay but we gave it a shot and were thankful we did. This is going to be a must stop anytime were going to be in Dartmouth area.

We went a second time and tried lunch instead of brunch and it didn't disappoint.

Address: 59 King St Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1H2 Canada
Review: Went with a friend this morning for brunch. This was my first time and I can say wholeheartedly everything was phenomenal. I was hyped about chicken waffles and it wasn't short of amazing. The chicken was tasty and bacon was crunchy! Waffles were served with maple syrup! The service was wonderful too, we were the first ones in and although few more tables came in, the server didn't neglect us. Coffee was too strong for me but it's caffeine so that's not really a bad thing lol. Free mimosa with brunch is also a score! I highly recommend this place for a good brunch meal. Just go!

Address: 59 King St Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1H2 Canada
Review: Visited here for first time last weekend. Will definitely be back. Amazing service by Meg.  She took time to introduce the item on the menu. Made several recommendations. Overall super service and great food!!  Drinks were nice and cold too.

Address: 59 King St Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1H2 Canada
Review:
Talk about a hidden gem. Who would guess that a bar & grill in downtown Dartmouth would have one of the best brunches in the city?

The menu isn’t huge, but the portions and quality make up for it. Plus, they have free Mimosas and Caesars! You’re welcome!!!

Address: 1075 Queen Street South End, NS B3H 1M5 Canada
Review: Authentic Chinese food right in downtown Halifax. The menu has skewers, hot pot, noodles and rice dishes. Lots of options for different tastes. We tried the beef noodles and the seafood hot pot special from the Off the Eaten Path: Halifax Asian Food Festival and they were both very tasty and affordable. Would definitely come back and try other dishes. The only downside was that only one main dish came first and it wasn’t until the dish was almost finished that the other dish came.

Address: 1075 Queen Street South End, NS B3H 1M5 Canada
Review: OMG i never would have found this place if someone hadn't taken me! Such a tiny hidden away spot! And soooo delicious and authentic. We shared a shrimp pan full of fresh veggies and crispy shrimp that you ate whole, skins and all. Full of fresh and dried peppers but just the right amount of heat. Interesting cumin seed flavour as well. Next time we r trying the pan full of trotters (pig feet). Wear a sweater in the summer as highly air conditioned. My only complaint is the seating is uncomfortable, no legroom at any of the tables it seems. But we keep going back because it's so delicious! Highly recommended cold chicken appetizer.

Address: 1075 Queen Street South End, NS B3H 1M5 Canada
Review: Fantastic food and the waitress was very polite. The owner helped me order something I was happy with and overall it was a great experience. I got the beef tendon appetizer which was a bit spicy, which was nice.

Address: 1075 Queen Street South End, NS B3H 1M5 Canada
Review: I loved this restaurant very much.I ordered spicy chilli fish fillet and lamb skewers.  They were fantastic.

Address: 1075 Queen Street South End, NS B3H 1M5 Canada
Review: We tried this while visiting Halifax for the IWK and we liked it!  Not exactly what we thought we were getting but it was still good!!

Address: 3619 Novalea Drive Halifax, NS B3K 3G1 Canada
Review: Stumbled into Caribbean Bliss this morning and was welcomed with the warmest greeting and most fantastic food! Really low key spot in the north end and totally worth the stop. Service was so friendly as we learned the story behind the business and the passion going into the food. THIS is what real cooking tastes like. The menu is small and yet curated in a way that caters to all tastes. The flavours of Caribbean cuisine come together with French food and a touch of Lebanese background. Everything is so well done, fresh and a delicious balance of sweet with a Caribbean kick. The sweet and sassy breakfast croissant  was delicious and the Benedict was perfect! The wedges that come on the side are also amazing. Just overall a great dining experience doing something a little different in Halifax. Worth the stop! Will be back to try some of the sweet breakfast options and desserts!

Address: 3619 Novalea Drive Halifax, NS B3K 3G1 Canada
Review: Truly remarkable. What amazing food ( I had the jerk chicken and waffles for breakfast) and a very attentive, informative, and charming owner. It’s a little outside of downtown but I really must encourage everybody to visit this restaurant. The ambience is amazing and service is out of this world. You won’t regret it.

Address: 3619 Novalea Drive Halifax, NS B3K 3G1 Canada
Review:
It is a small restaurant full of very good vibes, the owner is very nice and he pays attention to every detail.  The food is prepared with a lot of dedication and the end result is simply delicious.
The mango cheese cake is the Most💯 Superb✅️ Highly Recommended⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Address: 3619 Novalea Drive Halifax, NS B3K 3G1 Canada
Review: Fine breakfast dining with Carribean twists. Great price and huge portions too, that never happens. Made our trip to Halifax memorable. You must order the mango drink. The breakfast croissant a staple. Breakfast roti, huge, great house sauce. Frites all eaten. Place clean and peaceful decore is easy on the eyes as is the food. Very talented and experienced Chef who studied French cuisine.Thank you Chef Elias. Was full all day after.

Address: 3619 Novalea Drive Halifax, NS B3K 3G1 Canada
Review: The BEST place to start your day, the chef is very kind and funny. Very yummy breakfast. Very recommended..

Address: 100 Main St Dartmouth, NS B2X 1R5 Canada
Review:
It was a delight full experience 🥰
We went around eve and we got good seating options and had ordered just a little but the servings were so big 😅 keep that in mind one serving can be shared by 3 easily. And they have this halal menu wow 🥰

Address: 100 Main St Dartmouth, NS B2X 1R5 Canada
Review:
I remember it used to be a good restaurant with a good selection even on lunch time But over the last time so called “New Panda” got worse and worse
I saw again Almost empty trays No  longer seafood e.t.c   Waiters looking at clients how they struggling to find something to eat and no one cares to refill trays On your request to add food in trays no one doing this

Address: 100 Main St Dartmouth, NS B2X 1R5 Canada
Review:
Decent experience. All you can eat buffet which are very few in the city if Halifax. This place offers a wide range of East Asian food. The food is good. No complaints there. The service was also very good. The staff were smiling, very polite, and always checking on its customers.
I've been there approximately 4-5 times and my only criticism is that the restaurant has never been renovated. It would be nice to have the seating areas updated and cleaned as there were liquid stains on the tables and seats, peeling paint on walls and wooden seats, etc. Otherwise, you will enjoy the food and service.

Address: 100 Main St Dartmouth, NS B2X 1R5 Canada
Review: We are extremely satisfied by the service and attitude of the employees. The approach was very polite and respectful towards the customers. Even though we were late to dine in they were still happy and served us well! Thank you

Address: 100 Main St Dartmouth, NS B2X 1R5 Canada
Review: We recently held a birthday party here with around 20 people. The selection was excellent and the buffet counters were kept clean. Food was hot and fresh, and replenished if any selection was running low. Communication was also very good, the restaurant even called a few days in advance to reaffirm our reservation was still happening. Service was friendly and polite.

Address: 620 Nine Mile Drive Unit 1-9 Bedford, NS B4A 0H4 Canada
Review: I have nothing but absolutely kind words for these people in particular Bedford location. Beautiful atmosphere, non rushed services, kid friendly and able to accommodate similar but virgin drinks for you’re pre teens. Servers and service is just exceptional and just beautiful humans ❤️ I’m thankful for Robyn (sorry if I misspelled) and her amazing staff ❤️❤️ food is great I love the selection and drink selections .. I would say in the last week I have been there 3 times !! The lunch menu is just so simple and a great treat whether eating alone or with your 7yr old !! I love this place nothing but positive interactions every time I’ve been there

Address: 620 Nine Mile Drive Unit 1-9 Bedford, NS B4A 0H4 Canada
Review:
I have dined at Morris East @ Uteck many times over the years.   It’s one of my favourite spots to go for a great pizza at a reasonable price.   Good spot for Family Night or Date Night.  Great variety of pizzas with some good appetizers and dessert.  My personal favourite is the Lumberjack.
Recently went for Dine Around and the special was great.
Looking forward to going back soon.

Address: 620 Nine Mile Drive Unit 1-9 Bedford, NS B4A 0H4 Canada
Review:
Service was excellent as we had almost all the servers on staff either serving or checking on our welfare/satisfaction. We had a party of seven and we were all served at pretty much the same time. All persons in our group had commented on the great taste of their orders. I had the Spicy Hawaiian pizza and it was phenomenal and highly recommended (not overly spicy, but you have to cater to all levels of taste). The open kitchen allows the customer(s) to view the operation and cleanliness.

Definitely we will be returning!

Address: 620 Nine Mile Drive Unit 1-9 Bedford, NS B4A 0H4 Canada
Review: Went with my daughter, looking forward to it as we've been before. The menu changed, and it was ridiculously expensive. $50 plus tip for one appetizer & one pasta .. I had only water. No wine, no desert.. no coffee .. no table bread. We shared the pasta, so each had one tube of canneloni .. walked out hungry and $60 poorer. It's not fancy enough to charge this much for a romantic dinner, yet not reasonable enough to go for a nice bite after shopping. Sorry Morris East, you're off the list.

Address: 620 Nine Mile Drive Unit 1-9 Bedford, NS B4A 0H4 Canada
Review: We live nearby and frequent Morris East for dinner at least every couple of weeks or so. It is ALWAYS incredibly pleasant, delicious and quick. Cody is an outstanding server… If you’re looking to have a great evening, he’s your guy. My favorite part about the restaurant is that you can tell the owners do not skimp on the quality of ingredients. Everything is always delicious - please stick around!

Address: 984 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E7 Canada
Review: Stopped in for early dinner.  Promptly welcomed & seated.  Order fried spring rolls, Pad Thai & Green Curry.  Everything flavorful, spicy & served hot. Service was low key but efficient. Highly recommended spot!

Address: 984 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E7 Canada
Review: My boyfriend and I tried this place yesterday for the first time as he loves his Thai food and I must say the presentation, the food and the service was wonderful. I usually don't go out for Thai but I ordered the sweet and sour chicken and my boyfriend had the red curry chicken and a side of spring rolls. Food was served piping hot and in a large portion, not to mention great prices. The spring rolls were some of the best I've had. Highly recommend this place for good pricing and quality food and service, thanks again will definitely be returning in the future.

Address: 984 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E7 Canada
Review: I have only ever had delivery/pickup from this location so I can’t speak to the dining in experience. The food is awesome, always fresh and super high quality. They always have it ready quickly, and the pickup is always simple speedy.

Address: 984 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E7 Canada
Review:
Came to the restaurant for lunch. I ordered fried prawns with tamarind sauce and my friend ordered lunch menu - stir fried spicy chicken. The food was ok, an average, not too good. The service was good.
The only thing that I don’t like is the messy sauce on the edge of the plate. How long it takes to wipe it before you serve it to the customer(?!).

Address: 984 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E7 Canada
Review: Great little restaurant.  Michael our server couldn't have been more attentive.  The cashew chicken is superb as is the chicken satay with peanut sauce. I wish they would bring bring back the Thai Tea...I so miss it.

Address: 27 Dellridge Lane Unit 105 Bedford, NS B4A 0H1 Canada
Review: Great place to hang, live music was terrific. 1st time golf simulator was a great experience. Drinks were on point, the Blue Hawaiian is a fruity drinkers too choice.

Address: 27 Dellridge Lane Unit 105 Bedford, NS B4A 0H1 Canada
Review: I’m doing a 3 but it’s really more of a 3.5. We were first timers doing a private golf room.  The room itself was generous and well set up with lots of room to play and sit.  A pleasant couch and chair as well.  The food - we had some sharables and beer - was all perfectly standard for a modern pub.  The golf experience however needs help.  The simulator software being used is lacking.  We play virtual golf weekly using the E6 software and Patrons system (is poor in comparison - especially given that Patrons is more expensive.  The projection is week, the projection screen is torn up and saggy, the computer had a broken screen, the tee box does not allow you to effectively place your own tee in the ground (the white placement nub is not helpful). Service was very good. These small things could be taken care of pretty easily.  And I would strongly recommend they switch to E6 as the golf experience is much, much better.

Address: 27 Dellridge Lane Unit 105 Bedford, NS B4A 0H1 Canada
Review:
Great visit to Patrons for lunch. This is part indoor golf driving range and part restaurant.  Overall, the service was very good, friendly and attentive.  Food quality was also good, fresh and tasty. The atmosphere is good although you will hear the wack of a golf ball as folks practice their drive. Looking around, I did notice a dead poinsettia on the floor in the corner of the restaurant, assuming it was leftover from Christmas.

One thing we all were surprised to find out and you should consider, is they do not serve any coffee there! This is the first restaurant I've visited that serves almost everything, except coffee (Note to management, put coffee on menu!).

All in all, if you are a golfer or not, Patrons is worth a visit to gather with friends for a few drinks or a bite to eat.  The driving range also looks fun.

Address: 27 Dellridge Lane Unit 105 Bedford, NS B4A 0H1 Canada
Review: Update: watch the bill, after getting home and having a chance to review, we were double charged for an item.  Star removed.    Been a place I've passed my times over the years but never have gone.  Tried it out and ready liked it, just wished it was a 1/2 priced sharables.  Food was great, we ordered way too much, relaxed atmosphere and might have to try the golf sometime.

Address: 27 Dellridge Lane Unit 105 Bedford, NS B4A 0H1 Canada
Review:
We loved the experience! Indoor Golf/ singing and dancing with lovies••• ‘twas such a great visit to Patrons for dinner. We so loved the service so friendly, attentive and helpful.
&& Oh the food 😍~fresh and tasty! #unwind
Just all FUN on my 101122!
So lovely for intimate gatherings💐

Address: 247 Herring Cove Road Halifax, NS B3P 1L6 Canada
Review: Really enjoyed our lunch here after kayaking on the lake nearby.  Reasonably priced and good food.

Address: 247 Herring Cove Road Halifax, NS B3P 1L6 Canada
Review: I have never had wings as delicious as the Maple Chili wings here.  You could smell the Maple, good balance of sweet with little kick of spice, perfect. Wife had the pulled chicken club wrap with the beet salad, she almost wanted more. Great service, nice rustic atmosphere.

Address: 247 Herring Cove Road Halifax, NS B3P 1L6 Canada
Review:
Seemed to have went downhill. I went five years ago and remember really enjoying the food. I went yesterday and it was a different story. The truffle fries tasted like they were baked in an oven (no flavour, and soggy), my friend’s smoked meat sandwich had way too much mustard, my chicken pot pie was almost tasteless (ones you can get in the frozen food aisle taste way better).

On the positive, my drink was nice and the waiter was fantastic (even though she just started working there). And the Caesar salad was good

Address: 247 Herring Cove Road Halifax, NS B3P 1L6 Canada
Review:
I can not say enough great things about this place.  The environment was great, the service was wonderful and the food was fantastic.  I went with 4 of my girlfriends and we all got something different.  Every dish was delicious, hot and fresh. What

We loved it and will definitely be back!

Address: 247 Herring Cove Road Halifax, NS B3P 1L6 Canada
Review:
My husband, myself and two friends went here for dinner a couple of weeks ago. I do not recall the servers name but she came and took our order. I and my friend asked for the Captain on Duty mocktail to drink. Our drinks arrived and I had about 3 sips and started to feel off. (Now for context, I had Gastric Bypass surgery a few years back and so alcohol is a big no no and it doesn't sit well with me.. almost reacts similar to an allergy) So I felt as if I was going to pass out. I get up to go to the washroom and almost fall asleep in the bathroom. As I come back to the dining area I see my husband and friends all paying for theirs and my order. I see the receipt says that my drink was $12 so I was confused as mocktails are $5... so I go gran a drink menu and point it out to my husband that it's supposed to be $5... we bring this up to the server and she said she didn't know there was a difference. She ended up serving us Captain on Vacation which has rum in it. She also didn't ask for ID because when we ordered it was mocktails. I know she was mortified when she realized what she had done and she said the manager gave us $15 each back to compensate for what had happened... but the problem is this shouldn't have happened and what she did was dangerous. I hope she learned her lesson and won't be doing that again. I am now nervous to order mocktails again with out double checking with the server first.

Beyond that the food was awesome and we loved the vibe.

Address: 1284 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y5 Canada
Review: Loved it! I live nearby so I've walked by this place probably over 100 times now. I went for the first time tonight and it lived up to every expectation I had. It's so cute inside. Twinkly lights, a little diffuser, candles... it was so nice. It was clean and the service was friendly and fast. I loved my vermicelli bowl and the veggie spring rolls were fantastic. I'm so excited I live so close! Just disappointed it took me so long to get here.

Address: 1284 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y5 Canada
Review: Delicious food and excellent service! So happy I gave this place a try. The veggie spring rolls are SO GOOD!! definitely coming back :)

Address: 1284 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y5 Canada
Review: We came in for bahn mi on a hot day and it was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Perfectly cooked meat, top tier bread, the flavours are harmonious, and they'll add hot sauce if you ask. Nice quiet location with plenty of room to sit and a simple clean decor scheme. Very polite and attentive staff. I'll absolutely be back, I'd recommend it to anyone.

Address: 1284 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y5 Canada
Review:
6/10 Pho, 6/10 spring rolls came fried for some reason.
Very small soup. Broth is not tasty. Noodles are off.

Address: 1284 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Y5 Canada
Review: A great place with a friendly waiter. A place to taste a delicious national dish. I recommend tasting vermicelli with shrimp and chicken and drinking Vietnamese coffee.

Address: 5640 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3J 3M7 Canada
Review: We had hot pot (chicken) and beef bulgogi. The food was delicious and service was impeccable. Given the previous reviews my expectations for this place were high and it did not fall short. We will be back. Thank you!! ♡

Address: 5640 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3J 3M7 Canada
Review: Pretty good lunch specials! Hard to find if you don't know where you're going, but service was friendly and food was fresh. I ordered the tonkatsu ramen, and truly I found it a bit underwhelming in terms of flavour, but I enjoyed it nonetheless. Not a bad option if you're in the area!

Address: 5640 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3J 3M7 Canada
Review: A good friend of mine and I had lunch here and it was absolutely delightful! I hadn’t had sushi since before the pandemic, and this was a real treat and the dishes were absolutely delicious! And adorable waitress brought our dishes to us and they made sure that we had all of the sides too!  If you wish to try Japanese cuisine there’s no better place in Halifax that I would personally recommend to a great friend.

Address: 5640 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3J 3M7 Canada
Review: Fresh sashimi with a fresh ambiance. If you’re a sushi/raw fish fan, then is a great place to go. The Tonkotsu Ramen was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend.

Address: 5640 Spring Garden Road Halifax, NS B3J 3M7 Canada
Review:
Wasn't decided to try more sushi places in town but today a great colleague of mine recommended this place and I found it a nice place to satisfy my sushi hunger despite I'm not a gobbler but vulnerable to seafood and sake.
Overall, well priced menu, delicious dishes, nice servers and naughty cooks who make fun out of customers in their native language !
Will come again and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonably priced Japanese food in downtown Halifax.

Edit:
I'm back again and still the same good place. Thanks to Ryu

Update:
Many thanks to Chihiro and Yuki for their great service.
The eel portion was fantastic.

Address: 54 Locks Road Dartmouth, NS B2X 2W7 Canada
Review: Visited Halifax from Toronto, where there is an abundance of vegetarian and vegan restaurants, however this is by far the best vegetarian burger I've ever had. The raspberry lemonade float was also delicious!! They were also serving a vegan cake for their 10th birthday and I'm not really sure how they made the butter cream but it was amazing 😍.

Address: 54 Locks Road Dartmouth, NS B2X 2W7 Canada
Review: AMAZING!! It's always awesome to find hidden gems like Lemon Dogs. I ordered lunch for my workplace and we loved it! I was informed that everything on the menu was vegetarian and to be honest I couldn't believe it. I got a peach plum sparkling lemonade too and it was so good! Even the meat eaters loved it. We will definitely be back. I can't wait to see what the weekly specials are!

Address: 54 Locks Road Dartmouth, NS B2X 2W7 Canada
Review: Great Imposible burgers with smart flavour combos. We booked ahead and the order still took some time. Lovely outdoor spot by a river and walking trails. Outdoor music isn’t our choice but still worth the experience

Address: 54 Locks Road Dartmouth, NS B2X 2W7 Canada
Review: Disappointed with this place. They ran out of the kind of tacos I wanted to order and then when they did arrive they were disappointingly small. I know the hype about this place is great, but I wasn't overly impressed. Service took forever. We had to wait almost 15 minutes for the drinks to arrive alone, and then another 15 for the food. It's just tacos folks. How long does it take? I won't be back. It's the only food place in Shubie Park though, so that is a bonus. Beautiful park.

Address: 54 Locks Road Dartmouth, NS B2X 2W7 Canada
Review:
6 Stars for Krista, Jordan and their team.
You need to come here...nice music, great vibe, so friendly and GREAT FOOD AND DRINKS!

Address: 5184 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: When in Halifax direct your Uber ride to 5184 Morris for a culinary treat that is out of this region! It’s simply the best fine dining anywhere. The service is impeccable, the portions are civilized, the wait staff is professional, the ambiance is perfect and the prices more than reasonable. If it’s a memorable dinner you’re after, then this is the proper place.

Address: 5184 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review:
Place was perfectly balanced between a wonderful dining experience and amazing food. I can explain to you how much the scallops are to die for. This place is a must try.

The mains were amazing and lamb 3 ways is a must try. This is best fine dining experience in Halifax.

Address: 5184 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: Absolutely delicious place. Great food. Superb service. Very private space. Perfect for a group dinner of about 15-20 people, as if dining at home not bothered by other people in the restaurant

Address: 5184 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: The staff at Stories went all out to make our first anniversary an amazing night. The food and service was remarkable, the atmosphere was incredible. Thank you for everything.

Address: 5184 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: Amazing dining experience; we stayed at the Halliburton and therefore reserved for dinner.  Appetizers: the scallops (unreal, delicious, perfect, best I've ever had (53 yrs); charcuterie plate was good.  Main course: duck was a good-sized portion, potatoes/veggie sides were succulent; beef striploin was tender and full of flavor; scalloped potatoes were excellent.  Great service, friendly/polite staff - lived up to its reputation - thank you!!

Address: 1919 Upper Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3J5 Canada
Review: Lovely Restaurant is located inside the hotel with a beautiful atmosphere. Great staff, the manager, she was amazing & super friendly, made my drinks on point 👌🏽👌🏽along with the other bartender Carly. Not to mention the waitress/waiters: Hannah & Christian gave absolutely amazing service with the food/drinks. I will definitely be back next time in town. Highly recommended!

Address: 1919 Upper Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3J5 Canada
Review:
The service was the best part! Hannah and Christian were fantastic and fun to be served by!
The burger was tasty (although I think I let the bun get a little soggy cause I was busy chatting), fries are well seasoned and crispy, and the Dragon tail cocktail is worth trying! Great comfy seating with pillows, and they close later than other spots in the city. My friend got the fish and chips and said it was very tasty as well. Good place for quiet dinner and drinks with good company.

Address: 1919 Upper Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3J5 Canada
Review: We popped in to grab some appetizers to share after walking around the Halifax Waterfront on an overcast day. Staff were awesome, the food - nachos, wings & ribs, and charcuterie board - was delicious, and the overall atmosphere was perfect. We will be back for dinner soon!

Address: 1919 Upper Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3J5 Canada
Review: Atmosphere is the best. Love the booths, bold colors, light fixtures. Very instaworthy. My service tonight was also really good.

Address: 1919 Upper Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3J5 Canada
Review: My wife and I ate here while staying at the Marriott. We both had the eggs Benedict with home fries. Everything was very good and cooked perfectly. The coffee was good as well. The service was very good too. Update: We stopped by for a quick bite and drink at happy hour. We shared an Ocean sampler and it was delicious. Nice to have other choices besides fried seafood. We be definitely going back on our next visit but not going to share this time.

Address: 6041 North Street Halifax, NS B3K 1P1 Canada
Review: Great food, with some value. I had the special while my son had the Spicy and my wife grabbed the tacos. We shared a large fry. This was my first visit, we went because my son recommended it. They have a great menu with something for everyone, if you like chicken! I hope you like chicken.  The burger is a great size with a perfect dredge and flavor topped with the perfect garnish and flavors.  The special had cheese, which I always shy away from cheese on chicken but is was excellent.  Go, eat and rave. The meal was $20 per person which is where the value is.  A phenomenal chkn burger side and drink for$20. Too easy to recommend.

Address: 6041 North Street Halifax, NS B3K 1P1 Canada
Review:
I've wanted to try this place for months, but never have. Randomly decided to try it today. I got the weekly special, which was a jalapeño cheese chicken bacon sandwich, and I got fries alongside it. Came to $19 before tax, $23 after tip.

Thought for that price is better be good, it's better than good, amazing. The chicken sandwich was huge, and the fries, though looked burnt, were not. They were perfect, in texture and flavor.

Staff was friendly and the service was quick. It's expensive, but they lived up to the hype, will definitely return again someday.

Address: 6041 North Street Halifax, NS B3K 1P1 Canada
Review:
The location is ok. There are lots of free parking 😀. 😀
Decorations and layout,  although, in my opinion, that the restaurant should be classified as fast food. The decorations is modest and nice. The space is small and can fit small groups.
That makes this place unique 👌.
Waiting to be seated,  my experience, we have to wait for 20 minutes to get seated 💺.  I understood that the space is not meant for tables serving.
Time to get the order. It was really fast. Beyond expectations.
Cleanliness,  from my experience,  the space is cleanliness is within expectations. 👌
Food, the good, was rich, delicious 😋 😍 😜 👌 and tasty 😋 😀 yamy. It is well cooked and prepared, and the food presentation was good 👍 😋.
Prices are affordable and reasonable.
Staff are friendly and respectful 🙏 🙂
Conclusion I am coming back for sure.

Address: 6041 North Street Halifax, NS B3K 1P1 Canada
Review: This is such a lovely little place. First of all, the food was excellent. Freshly made, flavourful sandwich - no frozen chicken patties here! Generous portions - next time I'll order a side to split with someone rather than a sandwich and my own side. Fairly priced for the quality of food you get, and I was really impressed with how creative the special sandwich I ordered was. This is an "order at the counter" kind of establishment which I didn't realize, but it was very efficient and the staff were helpful and patient while we ordered. I imagine the place would be great with a patio in the summer. The only reason I removed a star was for reasons of accessibility. The restaurant is very cramped inside and that could be a challenge for those who use a mobility aid; as well the washrooms have a very narrow door and no handlebars on the walls/reachable sink which does not accomodate for someone in a wheelchair. Overall, we will definitely be back!

Address: 6041 North Street Halifax, NS B3K 1P1 Canada
Review: An excellent food stop for a variety of chicken options and sides. I've had the 1/2 chicken and chicken sandwiches and both were excellent. I'd skip the salads, but the other sides are very tasty. Can get a bit pricey if you want sides and drink as there's not 'meal deals'. They often have specials too.

Address: 30 Farnham Gate Road Halifax, NS B3M 3W8 Canada
Review: The Korean food was ok, the sushi wasn't good, we got there at 6:30, there was only one waitress, and many tables were not cleared until we left.

Address: 30 Farnham Gate Road Halifax, NS B3M 3W8 Canada
Review: This place is fantastic! The food is absolutely amazing and our waitress was probably the best waitress we’ve ever had. We arrived around 6:15 and had our first dish (Japchae) within 20 minutes of going through the menu and ordering. They also gave us complimentary miso soup and it was excellent! We ordered the Tiger Roll to share as another appetizer and it was pretty great too. My girl had the Bibimbap and I had the Bulgogi and we were both super happy about our meals. But the best part of the whole dinner was the Bingsu, which is absolutely delicious and we will be going back often, even if it’s just for dessert! Thanks Arirang!

Address: 30 Farnham Gate Road Halifax, NS B3M 3W8 Canada
Review: Your saying the je yuk bo keum 18.95 plus tax and you send a small half bowl when its just beef and a bit of veggies.........

Address: 30 Farnham Gate Road Halifax, NS B3M 3W8 Canada
Review: I ordered take out and was not disappointed in the quality of the food when it came! I'd be interested in dining in one day, seems to be pretty great value and delicious.

Address: 30 Farnham Gate Road Halifax, NS B3M 3W8 Canada
Review: Good Koreans and Japanese food with lots of options available on the menu. We ordered a sushi set and a tofu soup. Both came pretty quickly. Although the restaurant was empty, there was a bunch of people picking up food for deliveries or take out while we were there. Food was good but not amazing. They also had the shaved ice as a dessert option which was affordable and delicious. We ordered the mango shaved ice and it came with frozen mango chunks, syrup, a scoop of mango ice cream, and blueberry cheesecake pieces. We spent $50 for two and it was a very filling meal.

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B5 Canada
Review: An absolute treasure! We attended 2 shows there for the Jazz Fest, and we cannot believe the quality of this place. The reservation process was seamless, the service outstanding,  and the food delicious.  However the icing on the cake is the incredible music venue it is, from the sound quality to the layout of the room. We had the best time enjoying live music, and cannot wait to go back. Kudos to the whole team!

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B5 Canada
Review:
Went to see The Stanfields play on May 12 2023 and it was my very first time there.
I absolutely love the atmosphere!  The staff was so happy and accommodating, and our waiter was the sweetest.
I can’t say enough good things about this place!   The sound is amazing and it has an extremely intimate feel - even though it is quite large.   The food is sooooo great, I mean, what can I say, the menu is small and eclectic, but everything on it looks fabulous!   I had a hard time choosing, but finally decided on the crispy chicken sandwich.   It was YUM!!   I finished the night with the orange crème brûlée and a cappuccino. Had a couple of great drinks in between.  Lucky for you, I have included some photos for your viewing pleasure!  I will be back for sure. Thank you so much to the Carlton for such a great night and introduction to your wonderful establishment!

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B5 Canada
Review: Best place in town to see musicians play in an intimate setting.  Food is great (love their special skinny spiced fries), drinks too.  The staff are amazing😎

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B5 Canada
Review: Watchd The Stanfields play tonight, great band. Only had some appetizers for food from the Carleton which was good except the charcuterie board wasn't to our liking. Staff was pretty low key and had a decent vibe.

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B5 Canada
Review: The Carleton never disappoints. I have been here many times to see some amazing live music. Tickets are affordable, food is delicious and the staff are fantastic. I recently purchased 4 tickets to a show and 2 people couldn’t make it. It’s was a sold out show and I told the venue I had 2 tickets for anyone on their wait list. They credited me that same evening! Thanks for supporting local also. 😊

Address: 135 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C9 Canada
Review:
Super friendly people!! I ordered the Donair with cheese, I think it's my favourite in Halifax/Dartmouth now. It was super good! And not crazy messy like most donairs. My favorite before I tried this was Tony's Donair.
But hungry hut prepare theirs with much more care, and it shows. That is why this is now my favorite Donair. Thank you

Address: 135 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C9 Canada
Review: Hungry Hut has been a staple in the Dartmouth community for as long as I can remember. The food is amazing, especially the donair pockets (my fave), but the service is really what makes this place special. My partner and I both used to come here as kids and Hana always lets us know how sweet it is that she sees us together now. Everyone is always positive, smiling and happy to see you, whether it's been a day, a week or a year you can always count on the Family of Hungry Hut to accept you and welcome you home. We love Hungry Hut, from the mozzarella sticks, roast beef subs, donairs, all the way to the pizza, garlic fingers and deep fried pepperoni, there's nothing on their menu that they don't make perfectly. Support local and you won't be disappointed, become part of the Hungry Hut family 🩷

Address: 135 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C9 Canada
Review: This place has the best food and the best prices in town.  The people who work there are really nice too and friendly.  I had the best pizza pocket in town and my husband had a donair that he says was awesome.

Address: 135 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C9 Canada
Review: Best large donairs around, a little hidden gem and they have great deals too, I love their deep fried pepperoni too!  Awesome staff!!

Address: 135 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C9 Canada
Review: always awesome, I go their so often they know me and my family by name and what we order  love them, always friendly and have quality food. best donaor in town.

Address: 342 Windmill Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1J1 Canada
Review: So I’m not one to usually do this , but honestly one of the worst pizzas I’ve ever had. Happened a few weeks ago ,me and my coworkers called and ordered a pizza for pick up , which we didn’t realize they closed at 1:30 and reopened at 4 or 430. We asked if we could pick up at 2 and she informed us but told us it was ok and we could come to the side door and get our pizzas. They must have made it right there and then because it was not hot at all by the time we got it. I have never opened a pizza box and laughed before. But here we are. ( we did ask for pepperoni on top but they should have informed us it is not your traditional pepperoni. ) the cheese underneath tasted sour and some of it was not even melted. We also got a Hawaiian pizza as well which the meat and cheese also tasted rancid. We were sick for days after eating this. It’s really sad to see this place go so downhill as it used to be one of the best in the area back in the day. I really hope they try and do a bit better.

Address: 342 Windmill Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1J1 Canada
Review: Hidden gem. Best donairs I've ever had (not pictured) A small is large enough to feed two people EASILY. Donair meat was spiced perfectly. I had a Chicken Caesar as well that was equally as delicious. Highly recommend if you're looking for some good eats.

Address: 342 Windmill Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1J1 Canada
Review: Robert’s Pizza Donair & Subs makes delicious food. The first thing that I noticed when I picked up my medium donair pizza (I asked for no veggies) was how heavy it was. These pizzas have some serious weight to them. Beyond that, they are layered with meat (see the picture). The pizza comes with ample sauce on the side since the donair pizza doesn’t have tomato sauce. Dining in was comfortable, though there is no wifi. Excellent experience overall.

Address: 342 Windmill Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1J1 Canada
Review:
Gettting donairs at Roberts has been a tradition with friends for several decades (since their old location). Back home for vacation, a visit to Roberts was on the agenda. One of our friends is well acquainted with the owner, Malek, having made regular stops for donairs when living in New Brunswick, and Cambridge Bay.

We all enjoyed a tasty donair and a chat with Malek. The donairs were great, but I will need to make two visits there next time to try the pizza - they look delicious!

Address: 342 Windmill Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1J1 Canada
Review:
I was a bite discouraged about my first ordering on Uber but glade I got it 75% off with the Uber coupon.

I order a 16” Donair Pizza.

What I liked was the pizza was huge and weighed a lot, love the big pieces of donair chunks and they weren’t shy with the cheese and donair meat👍
I loved that the donair sauce came on the side , not being on the pizza it self, made the pizza easy to cut without it being sloppy, love the idea.
👌🏼🫶

What I didn’t like was there a inch and a half of the donair meat not covered by cheese making it very dry.
Looking at the pizza wen first opened cheese topping could of been a bite more cooked and spread out more to the sides of the pizza as there was about a inch and a half of donair meat not covered making it very dry and could of added a bite more tomato’s on top.
For the crust, pizza was over cooked on the bottom and had to cut with a streak knife it was very hard to go true crust but inside of pizza crust wasn’t cooked and looked like Raw dough.

Address: 2398 Robie St Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review:
Cute spot, cute ambiance, great fish tacos and margaritas (I have no experience with margaritas but I liked it)

First off, fish tacos were so good! Fish was perfectly fried in a crispy batter with great toppings.
Pork taco was loaded but lacked a wow factor (looked good and was filling and juicy though)
Chicken wings were dry/overcooked and the flavour wasn’t great (reminded me of a cold Chinese fried fish dish-also might be a me thing but I wouldn’t get it again)
Nachos were yummy but basic so I felt like the price was a bit high. Chips were very fresh and crunchy.
Pork belly bao was yummy but lacked a fresh flavour like cilantro or pickled veg (might be a personal preference) but the pork belly was yummy and the bao was fantastic.

We ordered the classic margarita and I thought it was great (I usually hate tequila but I’m trying to open up and try it again) and the agua de Jamaica wasn’t my jam but that might be a me thing.

Female Asian server was great! So nice and helpful BUT there was the grumpiest looking white female server that… might be in the wrong profession. I felt intimidated whenever she glanced at our table. She brought out our nachos and practically rolled her eyes while adding another table to ours (I told her to leave nachos on the bench (table was full) beside me no biggie). Just big frowns the whole time we were there.

Overall pretty good experience, kinda pricy ($135 for 2 people) but will be back for more delicious fish tacos and margaritas.

Address: 2398 Robie St Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: I loved the atmosphere and how delicious everything was. It's a small venue with limited seating allowing the staff and kitchen to focus on quality food and service. I also loved how the menu was short; you knew that whatever you ordered would be delicious. The food did not disappoint, the nachos and the tacos were so tasty and generous portions! I'll be back and next time to try their bao ice cream sandwich :)

Address: 2398 Robie St Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: I went to El Chino for my sisters Bachelorette party. We wanted a mixology themed event and K and her team really delivered. They organized a super fun, informative & delicious evening. They were incredibly friendly and helped us through all the steps of crafting our own cocktails. They went above and beyond by decorating the space and crafting personalized cocktails. We also tried some of their snacks which were very tasty and generous. Can’t recommend them enough! Perfect space for a small event or just an evening out with loved ones!

Address: 2398 Robie St Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: Great food, great service! The restaurant itself is quite small, they don't take reservations. It's worth the wait though! The Bao are amazing, the cucumber salad is refreshing, the nachos are a big serving great for sharing but pretty basic.

Address: 2398 Robie St Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: Really enjoyed my first experience here at El Chino. A friend recommended it because of the tacos and we were excited to try it. We had the pork dumplings, General Tao chicken wings, and the pork tacos. Everything was delicious. The standout item was definitely the tacos. They were jam packed and very authentic Mexican tasting. It’s definitely a little bit pricey for what you get, which is the only reason I didn’t give it a full 5 stars. However, they do call them self a snack bar so it’s not exactly a dinner destination so I may do it right next time and just pop in here when I crave a little snack rather than a full meal.

Address: 6214 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A3 Canada
Review: First time dining in at Truly Tasty and it was amazing. If we could rare it more than 5 stars, we would. We got the gnocchi appetizer, a soba, a ramen and a rice bowl and every single dish was generous, flavourful, and beautiful. Will be back to try the other items on the menu. Best ramen restaurant in Halifax by far.

Address: 6214 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A3 Canada
Review:
The best ramen you will have in Halifax,

Food is extremely tasty, portion is generous. Service is 5/5. They should get more recognitions!

Address: 6214 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A3 Canada
Review: The name of the restaurant is accurate! We really enjoyed our ramens, with homemade noodles and amazing flavors. The portion are generous. The vegetarian options are great. The staff is friendly. Nice place !

Address: 6214 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A3 Canada
Review: Had the Shoyo Chansu Ramen and the fried chicken. The portions are kinda big so come hungry. Great flavors and fast service even during the lunch rush.

Address: 6214 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A3 Canada
Review:
My husband and I just ate there for the first time. We ordered spicy tan tan Ramen, spicy kimchi Ramen, and the fried chicken to start.

Everything was delicious, portions were huge. I couldn't finish my Ramen and have enough left over for an entire other meal.

This was the best Ramen we've ever had, fresh, flavorful, ready quick, excellent broth, and the service was perfection. 10/10 would recommend!

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Best sushi on the East Coast! Amazing service, atmosphere & fresh sushi that is always perfect. Dine in or take out. Gonna miss this place so much after living here for 7 years. We will be back when we come & visit the maritimes.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Visited from Toronto and first time trying restaurant. They had a good variety of selections.  I chose the dinner special with soup and salad which were both very good.  The sushi plate had California roll, spicy tuna, assorted sushi and sashimi.  The platter was good but sashimi was cut a bit too thick.  I have eaten a lot of sushi and sushi Nami was just okay.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Had our lunch. They open 12nn every Sunday. We came early around 11 am. They charge extra 15% service fee if you exceed 5 person. We are 6 but it's considerable because they got nice and good service Nd food

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Canada day lunch! Awesome Sushi, delicious desserts and overall a wonderful experience.

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: Not  the greatest   but if you don't know good sushi then you may think its a good place   plus you shouldn't have to worry about  bones

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review: The food is always delicious and comes out fast. I love getting a bunch of appetizers and having small dishes and it's a great place for that.

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review:
This is a pretty decent sushi restaurant, middling food but not terrible. They have a wide variety of options if you want to explore some new flavors.

The interior design and atmosphere is probably the best part about this place - a wide sushi bar takes up the middle of the space, and the entire restaurant is slightly sunken into the building which makes it feel a little quieter despite being right downtown.

They have a pretty nice variety of beverages, including an interesting ramune flavored drink which I would recommend if it's still available.

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review: Went to get sushi downtown for a lunch date with a friend. I ordered the Maki Lunch, providing me with a delicious plate full of rolls. The atmosphere in the restaurant is very nice with kind servers to bring you your food. The miso soup was excellent and the spicy salmon rolls were very yummy. However, the house salad was not very good and some of the rolls had an uneven proportion of elements, making each bite slightly unbalanced. Overall, a good place to go for a reasonably priced sushi lunch deal.

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review: Great, fresh sushi. The quality of the food makes up for any other shortcomings. I was there on a holiday weekend (Canada Day) and it was clear they were not prepared to be that busy. The staff was struggling to keep up. But once I finally got my food, it was amazing. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review:
The sashimi is a must: big chunks of melt-in-your-mouth salmon, tuna & escolar. This Cantonese-owned place has been a Halifax classic and I was happy to know they’re still open. This newer location has great decor and is very spacious! Waitress was very polite.

Rolls were somewhat of a letdown on the day we went, but tasted good. They are a bit loose, sparse and some classics like the dragon roll, while not bad here, didn’t taste as good as some other restaurants.

Address: 5144 Morris Street Halifax, NS B3J 1T6 Canada
Review: This place is as authentic as it gets in Nova Scotia. I have never had a bad meal here, and I am a repeat customer! The pizza is the best in the province, and so is the tiramisu. I would definitely recommend this place for a formal dinner date or a casual lunch

Address: 5144 Morris Street Halifax, NS B3J 1T6 Canada
Review:
I love the wood fire oven pizza from this establishment.  The beet salad is equally amazing.  The burger week burger was also tasty  in 2022.  I eat here regularly and have never had a bad experience.  Great place to pull up a seat at the bar solo for a drink and apertivo or to go on a date night with your partner. Atmospheric and the staff are over the top friendly.  Cannot suggest this place enough.
Edit1: Burger week burger is insane, best I had all week. 2023. Edit 2: Now owned and operated by new management as of 2023_07_07. Still the same vibes for now but with more creative freedom over the food I would think. Down the road the place will be redone inside for a new and refreshing feel.  Can't wait.  --Sincerely longtime supporter.

Address: 5144 Morris Street Halifax, NS B3J 1T6 Canada
Review: The food was delicious. The service was excellent.  We went to celebrate my friends' anniversary, and they gave us a courtesy liquor shot to all of us.

Address: 5144 Morris Street Halifax, NS B3J 1T6 Canada
Review:
Not enough sauce or cheese, raw ingredients and middle, barely any prosciutto on the Siciliana.  Not impressed

Not enough selection, no quattro formaggi ??? Perche?

Address: 5144 Morris Street Halifax, NS B3J 1T6 Canada
Review: I never leave reviews but me and my mom came in a few minutes before closing and the service was great. we got takeout and they gave us free focaccia bread and a lemon dessert on the house. the meal came within 10 minutes of ordering, worth the price, the ambience was great and they had 3 display vespas 10/10 👍

Address: 1887 Upper Water St Halifax, NS B0J 1W5 Canada
Review: We had our wedding at lower deck and I really can’t say enough about the entire team. Laura and Larissa are beyond amazing. They are so well organized and basically took away all my stress. The staff were so lovely and every guest commented how great the food was. Thank you to the lower deck team for making our day absolutely perfect. Would highly recommend!!

Address: 1887 Upper Water St Halifax, NS B0J 1W5 Canada
Review: Awesome venue for a small-medium sized wedding. We've photographed here multiple times and it's always been an absolute treat! The decor is really rustic, super into the wooden slats and dope spot for dancing. It's also right in the historic properties on the waterfront which is perfect for portraits, and super beautiful! It is a dark venue but as long as you hire photographers who know how to shoot there, you are golden. 10/10 recommend!

Address: 1887 Upper Water St Halifax, NS B0J 1W5 Canada
Review:
I mean what can you say about this iconic location. We went for supper and a beer but ended up staying until last call. The band that playing that night was excellent and once the place got busy we just ended up staying. Despite the place being extremely full the staff was attentive.

I would not recommend this place to anyone who gets claustrophobic as once the band starts playing it is very hard to move. We were there on a Wednesday evening and it was a busy as a Friday night.

Otherwise we had a great Night and of course I highly recommend the lower deck for a true maritime experience

Address: 1887 Upper Water St Halifax, NS B0J 1W5 Canada
Review: I didn't stay long. Had a Corona on the patio. Waiter was a bit odd but better than rude. The service was really fast but I had to pay for each drink when I got it. Kinda odd but ok.

Address: 1887 Upper Water St Halifax, NS B0J 1W5 Canada
Review:
Had the fish n chips and it was pretty good.

Went a second time and was told it was a $9 a person charge for live music. We were just looking for a quick bite to eat, so ended up leaving. I do feel $9 cover charge is a bit much though.

Address: 32 Albro Lake Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 3X8 Canada
Review: I was wrong when I expected some glossy noodles with heavy taste. They are not! We ordered three types of noodles, and each has its distinct colour. I didn’t taste any MSG and each has its tasteful personality. Neither did I have hiccups after meal like other greasy Chinese takeout.

Address: 32 Albro Lake Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 3X8 Canada
Review: Never heard of this restaurant before  decided to give it a try I'm so glad I did! The food is incredible,  the rice and Eggrolls are delicious! 10/10 from food to customer service . I will be back!

Address: 32 Albro Lake Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 3X8 Canada
Review: Had almost everything on this menu, and I love it ! Every time I visit Halifax I do my best to stop in for a plate

Address: 32 Albro Lake Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 3X8 Canada
Review: Came here twice now, big portions and tasty.

Address: 32 Albro Lake Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 3X8 Canada
Review: This is the go to Chinese food restaurant I have found after a long search since living in Nova Scotia. When giving the rating I separate it's rating category in comparison to going to a fine dining experience. So far I have had the items from a Dinner for 2 plus meat spring rolls.  Nothing short of being blown away, every item was cooked as close to perfection you can get. Each item deserves a thorough review as they all genuinely surprised me but I shall not for both our sake: flavour, consistency, portions, and a truly harmonious balance of grease/oil/moisture in each item. I have not had a bad experience, I won't ever care even if I do. This establishment has both earned my respect and culinary appreciation. Please don't order from them on a food app. It's worth the effort.

Address: 80 Hogan Court Bedford, NS B4B 2H1 Canada
Review: Visited them for brunch. Had to wait for 15 minutes but they do text you when the table is available. The staff was friendly. The place had a happy vibe, perfect for a breakfast place. The pancakes were delicious and the portion size is good as well. Would visit again to try other menu items.

Address: 80 Hogan Court Bedford, NS B4B 2H1 Canada
Review:
Spotless restaurant, coffee great (thermos on the table too!)  The staff were helpful and kind. Multiple flavors of maple syrup.
55+ menu only $9.99. in most cases the same size as 55-, but cheeper!
Receipt attached. Regular menu prices quite reasonable. Very cool hash browns! Multi grain toast.
*Nice clean bathrooms.

Address: 80 Hogan Court Bedford, NS B4B 2H1 Canada
Review: Very friendly staff. Wasn't busy at all. Omelets are very good and a large portion. Had to take home half. Was a bit disappointed,  there was eggs Benedict advertised but it wasn't available until tomorrow. I would think something shouldn't be advertised if you can't get it. Overall a good place to have an enjoyable meal.

Address: 80 Hogan Court Bedford, NS B4B 2H1 Canada
Review: I am seriously disappointed at the ihop here in Bedford. I have eaten at ihops in the united states and absolutely loved it. The Nova Scotia Version is a disappointment. I just ordered the cinn-a-stacks and only have cinnamon on the top, not in between the stacks. The cream cheese drizzle was lacking as well.

Address: 80 Hogan Court Bedford, NS B4B 2H1 Canada
Review: Delicious food, but often a bit of a wait. However, I discovered that you can order take out, so for Mother’s Day we did just that! Called about 40 minutes ahead of time, and staff was very helpful to get our order right. Take out bags had everything we needed to enjoy a perfect breakfast at home :)

Address: 540 Southgate Drive Bedford, NS B4A 0E1 Canada
Review: Best pictou county pizza and garlic finger in town!! Super generous on cheese and ingredients !! Very fast and friendly delivery person!!! Definitely will come back !!!

Address: 540 Southgate Drive Bedford, NS B4A 0E1 Canada
Review:
I definitely recommend Nayya to every pizza lover. They probably have the biggest pizza collection in the entire NS. I have never seen this much variety anywhere else! Amazing and very exciting! Quality of the food was superb! Taste was fantastic and very balanced.
Staff are super super friendly and I really liked their behaviour. Specially Mr. Amin whose behaviour and customer care discipline should be a role model to many famous restaurants in Halifax. Such a down to earth and nice person!
I am so happy to have found this place! It’s a game changer for me :)

Address: 540 Southgate Drive Bedford, NS B4A 0E1 Canada
Review:
One of the best place to have variety of pizzas, subs and many more. Customer service is really good. Especially Mr. Amin (Sanjam) is a really good person who always has a smile on his face. All crew members were really nice they did their best.

3 Cheese Garlic fingers and Margherita pizza highly recommended.

5/5 Pizza base made from fresh Dough - one of the best I ever had.
5/5 Fresh toppings
5/5 Overall Food
5/5 Customer Service
5/5 Ambiance
4/5 Wait time - This is normal as compare to other restaurants.
5/5 Mr. Amin

Address: 540 Southgate Drive Bedford, NS B4A 0E1 Canada
Review: SO YUMMY!! We live just around the corner and often get pizza from other places in the area but thought we'd try this new place. We were not disappointed!!  It arrived quickly and was hot, fresh and really delicious. LOADS of FRESH toppings! The taste is so amazing and perfect. Everyone raved about how tasty the sauce is  and how generous the toppings were. This is now our go-to pizza place! Best pizza in the area! And best price in the area!

Address: 540 Southgate Drive Bedford, NS B4A 0E1 Canada
Review:
PUT THIS ON YOUR BUCKET LIST. Well worth the hour travel.
