Wow I was super impressed at this recommendation from my friend. I ordered the gourmet donair with garlic fingers combo and it did not disappoint. Carved tastefully spiced donair meat right off the stick and the ingredients where to die for. The garlic fingers were on point and soo good.

The wife ordered the shawarma platter not realizing how huge it was and absolutely loved it. I took a few bites of it as well and it was tasty.

The child ordered the fish and chips but she thoroughly enjoyed them.

Price point is on the higher side but you are getting a LOT of food. Pretty sure we could split the shawarma or the donair pizza between the three of us.

My only complaint was the dine in experience could have been made better minus the timers constantly chiming in the background. Otherwise zero complaints for us.

Address: 772 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 1A2 Canada
Review: Very professional staff, their mussels dish is very good, after that their lobster sandwich is good, but it is totally unacceptable that their calamari dish is calamari taken directly from a deep-frozen bag and the same goes for their French fries, even with their vegetables, which are all taken from frozen bags. For a restaurant in Halifax where you're not looking for fast food, they serve calamari that I can enjoy at home just by taking it out of a bag and frying it. Forget frozen food, increase price of your dishes and your gonna be the king of your area with happy customer and same profits.

Address: 772 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 1A2 Canada
Review: This is a cozy restaurant along the bedford coast. I go there very often since it's close to my work place. I am curious to know why mostly elders eat there! It's normally full at peak time. The food is not too bad and reasonably priced. I like the coffee which is refilled. My friend Cyntia absolutely love the coconut pie cake.

Address: 772 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 1A2 Canada
Review: Came just for the lobster roll and it did not disappoint. Overall a great diner spot for lunch, the chowder was good too!

Address: 772 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 1A2 Canada
Review: Very cozy, Family friendly place. Chowder was fantastic. Server was very friendly and helpful. Loved this place. Will go back More.

Address: 772 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 1A2 Canada
Review:
Excellent food and service. Coming from a landlocked city, I forgot that seafood was supposed to taste like this.  We had the seafood chowder and fish&chips.  The shellfish felt like butter in my mouth and the dish flaked easily but still moist.  The chowder was not thick but rather like a cream soup.  The fish and chips was light and not oily.

Service was very friendly and attentive. Had the feel of a seafood dinner with its relaxed local atmosphere.

Price point is decent for the quality of the food.  The presentation is what you expect for a diner but the flavour is far above.

Address: 6403 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A7 Canada
Review:
We were in the area and looking at dine in options. I found this restaurant and was sold by reviews immediately. I knew I had to try it. Not sure how you can spend there $10-20 per person. You eithereat like a bird or don't like rolls. We ordered bento box, udon, couple rolls and ice-cream with bananas. I wouldn't call it "a lot" of food per person, our bill was a little over $60 per 2 people.
The food was very fresh and delicious! Complementary rolls were also VERY good. I wouldn't think of ordering them myself, but the combinations of ingredients make them so yummy, I will order them next time.
I would definitely recommend the place!

Address: 6403 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A7 Canada
Review: What does excellent customer service mean?  This answer the Wasabi House sure knows.  The food was wonderful, the waitress was incredibly friendly and attentive and the cooks were happy to receive customers.  It sure makes all the difference.

Address: 6403 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A7 Canada
Review: They stopped dine-in since the pandemic started, heard they resumed dine-in recently and decided to go for lunch.  The sushi tastes the same as before, the food is fresh and the service is as good as ever.  The two of us ordered three rolls and tempura shrimp. The boss gave us a large plate of sushi for free. In the end, we paid less than $35 and took a large box home.  I will be back again.

Address: 6403 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A7 Canada
Review:
If you see other reviewers saying that they get free rolls... they're right! I ordered 2 rolls and they gave me 2 extra rolls on the house.

This makes Wasabi House a truly reasonably-priced restaurant—perhaps the best one in Halifax!

Address: 6403 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A7 Canada
Review: The service was fantastic and the sushi was delicious. We have food allergies and they were very good about making sure we could eat the sushi. the chef made us extra on the house. It was a great experience.

Address: 5501 Boulevard Gouin O Montreal, QC H4J 1C8 Canada
Review:
We came here specifically for poutine and was not disappointed!

We ordered a traditional poutine and popcorn chicken poutine. The gravy was good and not too salty, the popcorn chicken was still crispy and the squeaky cheese was perfect.

They have so many different options for poutine that I would need to come back.

The restaurant is a small local vibe and is 24/7. Just a heads up, they only accept cash!

Address: 5501 Boulevard Gouin O Montreal, QC H4J 1C8 Canada
Review: My favourite food place ever🔥 the best Poutine in Montreal, also restaurant working until late. Recommend everyone to visit! Especially try their pancakes with chocolate and strawberries for dessert 😍😍😍

Address: 5501 Boulevard Gouin O Montreal, QC H4J 1C8 Canada
Review: I personally don’t understand the hype of this place. I had the BBQ poutine and the Poulet Extreme Grilled Cheese. The grilled cheese was good but the poutine was horrible. The gravy was good, not too salty and there were a lot of cheese curds. However, the fries were not good. I feel as though they were fried in old bad oil. I don’t understand how people can say this is the best poutine in Montreal. I was extremely disappointed. The service was not great. The waitress messed up the order. Maybe it’s because she was new but it didn’t make my experience enjoyable.

Address: 5501 Boulevard Gouin O Montreal, QC H4J 1C8 Canada
Review:
Cash only place,they have a withdrawal machine but the machine doesn't always have cash in it.

Best comfort food I've had in MTL
The food is always on point whether you pick it up or on Uber eats

They put the perfect portion of cheese curds and gravy on the poutine.

Fell in love with the smoked meat grilled cheese

The burgers are all so good, always having trouble deciding which one to get.

The staff has always been super nice.

Definitely the place to go to satisfy your comfort food cravings

They have a small seating area which is always packed, this place is mostly packed during night time also.

They do breakfast, lunch, dinner, late snack.
I also love there thin crepes with strawberry and bananas.

I'm obsessed with this place.

Address: 5501 Boulevard Gouin O Montreal, QC H4J 1C8 Canada
Review: Great food in general, a table could hold up to 5-6 people maximum. Would recommend for small group of friends for a night out. Could be a little busy at night because it is one of few places opened at that time.

Address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Montreal, QC H3H 1M1 Canada
Review:
Despite my name - I am actually Japanese and for the first time since moving here I felt like I was eating real Japanese food. We ordered the bone marrow  yakitori, forty eight hour pork w/ curry and deep fried beans - all of which were excellent. With that said, as is usually the case with small plate restaurants, the dish you least expect ends up being the highlight of the meal. Today, the green beans were no exception to this rule. The combination of rich truffle mayo and salty and crunchy beans was perfect.

I was also surprised to find actual vegetable chunks in the curry. Personally, I prefer when restaurant opt to make a more homestyle sauce instead of blending it smooth.

Overall, a fantastic meal. Will definitely be bringing my Japanese mother here.

Address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Montreal, QC H3H 1M1 Canada
Review: We had a group of six and it took us more than 1.5 hours to get a seat on a Saturday night. That being said the food was good but the drinks are desserts were the highlight for me. Yuzu beer and ginger beer was amazing. The black tea soft serve ice cream was the best part!!! Get the homemade ice cream for sure. Food wise it was a little over hyped: I read the reviews on google and a lot of people recommended the tuna salmon bowl so I ordered it. It was good but wasn’t fully worth the hype, it felt like it had more salad in it that salmon, instead I would recommend ordering the 48 hr pork or lamb. The fried beans for appetizer was good and came in a large portion.

Address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Montreal, QC H3H 1M1 Canada
Review: A must go to restaurant!!! They are the nicest people ever! They are super understanding when it comes to allergies. And the food is so flavorful and feels like you’re in Japan. You feel like you’re at home. I came here from the United States, and I would honestly fly back to Canada just to come back and eat here again. We came in 30 minutes before they closed and they were still were kind and sweet! We’re sorry we came here late, but thank you so much for the amazing service and food.

Address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Montreal, QC H3H 1M1 Canada
Review: There is a reason that there’s always a lineup in front of this restaurant ! It’s simply the best one in town! So flavourful and mouthwatering! We enjoy every single dishes! I especially love the beef carpaccio, the sashimis and the shrimp burgers. The wait is about 45 minutes depending on what time you arrive. They make their own soft ice cream which is extremely delicious!

Address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Montreal, QC H3H 1M1 Canada
Review: Always a line-up. At this place, you will not find sushis but authentic Izakaya style Japanese foods. The place is always crowded. If you don't want to wait, start to line up at 16:45 when they open their doors at 17:00.

Address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1K4 Canada
Review: My second time here and it was just as amazing as my first time. We decided to order only appetizers tonight and all were amazing thanks to the awesome recommendations of our waiter. If it's your first time, I highly recommend trying the tasting menu....bring your appetite!! Fantastic ambience and amazing service. Enjoy!!

Address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1K4 Canada
Review: Damas is my newest favorite restaurant. Everything was to perfection. The food is incredible. From the texture of the hummus, to the grilled veggies. It’s the tastiest food! It was so good and very good portions. The waiter was able to guide us through the menu and we did not regret an of the choices. The drink were also very good and the decor and ambiance were fun.

Address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1K4 Canada
Review:
I have never eaten Syrian food before. This was an incredible culinary introduction to fantastic food. The food was delicious, the service was attentive and the atmosphere was nice.

My only issue is that this seems like a restaurant worth going to with a few people to split and share the food. It is an EXPENSIVE place, and my wife and I ordered too much food for 2 people. Go with friends.

Address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1K4 Canada
Review:
Not the first visit and will go back again and Again for sure .. it’s a beautiful dining experience … u feel like u went on small  vacation …
it’s pricy so it’s not to be repeated every other week :) … but the ambiance is very nice , the music in the background , the excellent service and exquisite menu …. The place is always packed but you never feel rushed to eat and you don’t feel waitresses are stress and running around … every thing is organized and chill …
One tiny note , I used to like the hotly served bread better in the past …. Again excellent experience

Address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1K4 Canada
Review: We took the tasting menu with wine pairing (exceptional wine). Honestly it was expensive and I was expecting that. The wine pairing were awesome. The food itself for the most part was amazing and really tasteful except for the desert.  I must admit though I was still hungry after a 400$ bill which is a bit disappointing no matter how good the food was.

Address: 2059 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1N3 Canada
Review:
We’ve been the Montreal branch, found it better than Laval. Service is only okay, I mean from
the welcoming to the availability of our table sharp at the time of reservation.. food is always very good in both branches, order from what they have on the special menu for the night, often you will be satisfied and its always good to twist the menu and add new things. No problem for the prices very reasonable for this very high quality of pizza.

Address: 2059 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1N3 Canada
Review: I have eaten Bottega pizza before but never at the Laval location. I got a chance to eat more than just the pizza (which is always delicious), but a good amount of many other dishes and it was all phenomenal. The atmosphere of the restaurant was only bettered by the incredible and kind staff. An incredibly authentic Italian experience I can't wait to go back again. HIGHLY recommend!

Address: 2059 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1N3 Canada
Review: I went to this restaurant yesterday with my boyfriend and we were both shocked of how delicious the pizza was! I never tasted a pizza like that before, it was incredible. All the flavours were there, everything seemed fresh. We also had desert, the ice cream was chef’s kiss. Also, the staff was great. Everything is 10/10, I’m very satisfied!

Address: 2059 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1N3 Canada
Review:
I want to bottega for the first time for a work party and it was hands thé thé best Italian restaurant I’ve been too!
The staff was very friendly in answering my questions, telling me about the lastest specials and really knew the menu well!
I recommended literally a lot of things on the menu especially the lamp piece which is 10/10 juicy🥵
The portions are decently sized to really enjoy a appetizer, main dish and desert for a good fair price for the quality you are recieving.
10/10

Address: 2059 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1N3 Canada
Review: Most tasty place for me. Cuisine at the highest level.

Address: 1223 Rue du Square-Phillips Montreal, QC H3B 3E9 Canada
Review: One of the best pizza I ´ve ever eaten! Enjoyed the atmosphere too. Located in one of the most touristic places of the city Montreal. Enjoyed the draft beer and salad czars before our pizza. Guys! You are perfect. My wife and I enjoyed our Friday evening there and was there the next day for Saturday lunch🙂🍻. Can't wait for the weekend to go there again...

Address: 1223 Rue du Square-Phillips Montreal, QC H3B 3E9 Canada
Review: I was amazed by how large the menu was and how many options were available just on pizza. Our waiter was well-seasoned and his recommendations were exactly what we needed. This restaurant was founded in the early 1980s and I found the taste of the pizzas nostalgic. Here is a must-try spot if you are a pizza lover like me!

Address: 1223 Rue du Square-Phillips Montreal, QC H3B 3E9 Canada
Review: Freshly made pizza and really fantastic. There is lot of choices you can select. Last but not the least, the tiramisu was so good that I highly recommended.

Address: 1223 Rue du Square-Phillips Montreal, QC H3B 3E9 Canada
Review: The pizza was so GOOD! I can not have lactose so when I saw that were TWO options for cheese, I was thrilled! I got the number 11 with lactose free cheese and my goodness, I finished the whole thing! My sister enjoyed her pizza as well. We definitely recommend this place if you have. some dietary restrictions.

Address: 1223 Rue du Square-Phillips Montreal, QC H3B 3E9 Canada
Review:
I was surprised to suddenly find this place in the city center, considering that I passed by many times, but did not pay attention. And this was my mistake. I'm crazy about pizza, so going to a restaurant with 77 types of pizzas = going to heaven!! The service is very fast, my order was ready in 7 minutes.
By the way, there is a beautiful view of the park and skyscrapers from here.

Address: 2491 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H3J 1N6 Canada
Review:
This was one for the record books. A flight over to Canada, a booking made in advanced, a ‘clear my schedule’ kind of evening.

From the moment you set foot in Joe Beef you know you’re in for a what can only be described as romantically gluttonous time.

We started with the seafood platter, scallops the size of my fist with an added lobster tails (for good measure). Moving onto the Octopus Bouillabaisse, Sweetbreads, Duck and Hanger Steak. All with their own amazing sauces that seemed to almost glue the dish together with richness.

The staff were welcoming and made us feel right at ease in our quest to tackle the menu. Throughout each dish we were almost confused where to start and end as each bite was just better than the last.

A full but non-intimidating wine list let us make the best of our food settling on a lovely Riesling.

Did we travel to Canada just for Joe Beef? No. But would it have been worth it if it was the only place we visited? Yes.

Address: 2491 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H3J 1N6 Canada
Review: We were a party of 3 and loved everything that Joe Beef offered. We had high expectations and it exceeded it. Flo made our experience even better with all his recommendations. They are known for their Lobster Pasta but honestly, just ask what’s good. They are the professionals after all. All the staff were lovely and so courteous! Thank you so much for the experience.

Address: 2491 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H3J 1N6 Canada
Review:
I will be honest, I can see why some people will say that it is the best restaurant in town.
However it is just not for me.

-I have seen better french cuisine restaurant with a larger menu and product that are just as fresh and local. Even if its about the same price, I would still prefer the one with larger menu.

-The waiting time is quite dreadful, I understand that it is a smaller sized restaurant, but waiting for an hour and 15 minutes isn't exactly ideal for the food quality received. Food was, okay. (Fries were extremely salty)

-Have to give credits to the waiters for refilling our cup every 10 minutes so the service is really up on another level.

-The booking has to be made too much in advance in order to guarantee a spot. This is due to the fact that the restaurant is very small and has a very large title under it's belt.

Maybe the place is really the most astonishing place to visit, or maybe my brokeneess has limited my vision towards fancy restaurant and made me unable to understand the reaction by most people. But I would say that it is definitely a restaurant that you would go for once or twice in a lifetime. Not more unfortunately.

Address: 2491 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H3J 1N6 Canada
Review: Joe Beef was one of the many reasons we first visited Montreal. The food here meets and some cases exceeds expectations. The drinks are also very well made. The perfect martini is a great way to start the meal, along with some oysters and one of the specials as an appetizer. The lobster pasta was insanely good, along with the special of short rib that we got this time around. The desserts are also so so good. Hits the mark all around, great place and will definitely go again!

Address: 2491 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H3J 1N6 Canada
Review: This was a fantastic experience! The restaurant feels very low key, but the food and drinks were phenomenal. Do whatever it takes to get online once the reservations are released and grab a table before they're all snatched up.

Address: 735 boul Décarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L3 Canada
Review:
Quality price the food isn't bad but it's not as good as before. That's why I'm disappointed. A few years back, it was one of my go spot.

The portions are generous, but the dumplings are my biggest disappointment. The skin of the dumplings were too thick and the meat had no flavor. I could not distinguish which one was beef, lamb or pork.

Address: 735 boul Décarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L3 Canada
Review: Decent Sunday evening dining experience. Homemade noodles were great, the smoked tofu & cucumber salad was ok, the steamed dumplings were a bit too thick yet ok, the skewed squid was meh... Decor and hygiene can be improved, and BYOB is a huge pro. Will be back one day to try more stuff.

Address: 735 boul Décarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L3 Canada
Review:
Pretty quiet environment! Service was fast and took the shrimp dumpling and the chicken general Tao. The Chicken general tao was actually pretty good ! Love the crisp of it and portion was alright.

As for the dumpling was little disappointed for the price. The texture was little harder to chew than the usual ones but overall it's alright my experience ! Will probably come again to try their others stuff on the menu

Address: 735 boul Décarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L3 Canada
Review:
I ordered from this restaurant since I was with friends and we wanted to eat dumplings. We ordered 4 types of dumplings.
They gave us a good recommendation of which one should be fried and which one should be steamed. It was pretty on point.
Also, for the price payed, it was pretty good quality and quantity. I definitely would recommend this restaurant for dumplings. It will be my go to place from now on.

Address: 735 boul Décarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L3 Canada
Review: Absolutely amazing dumplings. Great quantity and fair price! Peanut butter sauce is delicious as well!

Address: 1255 Rue Crescent Montreal, QC H3G 2B1 Canada
Review: I could talk about this place for hours!! FIRST of all, great music. I announced that I loved a song they were playing probably around 5 times. SECOND of all, everything was so so accessible for my allergies, which is rare for an asian restaurant. (gluten sensitivity) Their meats are marinated in gluten free sauces so I was able to enjoy my meal with my family without concerns of cross contamination. FINALLY, the service was amazing. The server was so incredibly kind and helpful with my allergies and knew the menu front to back. She provided helpful advice on how much food we should order, and reminded us on the allergens for every dish she brought out. Overall, I would definitely recommend and I will be visiting soon in my area.

Address: 1255 Rue Crescent Montreal, QC H3G 2B1 Canada
Review:
First time trying this place, beyond my expectation.

The ambiance is great, music, lots of happy customers enjoying their food.

Our two waitresses back to back, very friendly and efficient. always made sure we had everything. Explained to us every dish they would bring to our table.

Food wise, the meat and seafood were quite fresh and tasty, except for the kimchi (not the usual korean kimchi, it was overall too sweet and not spicy)

Price is definitely not cheap for those with budget but definitely worth going. Very nice experience definitely will go back!

Address: 1255 Rue Crescent Montreal, QC H3G 2B1 Canada
Review: I have been to Gyu-Kaku a few times and I would easily recommend this over Korean BBQs around. There’s a lot to choose from and it’s always too much meat for me, even when I went for lunch and had two meats lunch course. But the ambiance is amazing, not a big fan of cooking my own food (I’d rather get salmonella from the chef’s cooking than my own), but they change the grill frequently so that’s one good thing. The garlic fried rice is delicious and the basic meats are great. Overall I definitely recommend this place. 4 stars because I am not a big fan of the whole grilling your own meat concept.

Address: 1255 Rue Crescent Montreal, QC H3G 2B1 Canada
Review:
Be sure to call beforehand as they are always fully booked!

This is my best friend and I's go-to place.
They have a lot of food choices. Very good variety and very good quality meat and marinades. They also have good tasting desserts. Beware: It is NOT an all you can eat if that's what you are looking for.

We've been eating here a lot, and each time, I have forgotten to take photos before we completely demolish them. Here's a photo of the desserts, though.

Address: 1255 Rue Crescent Montreal, QC H3G 2B1 Canada
Review:
Love it! The quality food is impeccable. Alot of meat options for groups or individuals. Services a little slow but normal because they get full house easily so you better reserve your spot in advance and also it is NOT an "all you can eat" you have to pay by pieces so get your wallet ready if you are planning eating without minding cost because it's abit pricey but worth it!
PS: if you can't finish your cooked food you can ask for a transport box to bring it home :)

Address: 2575 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson Laval, QC H7T 1S8 Canada
Review: Hands down the best vegé ramens available. Everything from the broth to the noodles was great. Their rice noodles have great texture and doesn't get soft and pasty like other places. But that spicy miso broth was the star of the night. In the future I hope they add spicy tofu and fried potatoes on the menu; those would be delicious in ramen. Great food, great atmosphere.

Address: 2575 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson Laval, QC H7T 1S8 Canada
Review: Food is great as always but service was really slow. The beef donburi is pretty good. The Pork Tonkotsu Ramen is a classic!

Address: 2575 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson Laval, QC H7T 1S8 Canada
Review:
The food is good and especially delicious during winter. We liked the beef ramen but personally, we liked the pork better.

What was a bit annoying was the waiting time. We first had to wait 20 minutes for a table (which you had to install Yelp...) And then another 40 minutes for two bowls of ramen. And our order got mixed up.

So good food, but the service and waiting time was what brought the rating down.

Address: 2575 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson Laval, QC H7T 1S8 Canada
Review: I went to Kinton Ramen with my boyfriend for dinner and it was packed! The staff was friendly overall. I ordered the Pork Shoyu and my boyfriend ordered the Pork Miso. Unfortunately, the shoyu lacked flavor compared to the miso, but the miso itself wasn't exceptional either. While the portion sizes were good for the price, we were disappointed with the taste of both ramens.

Address: 2575 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson Laval, QC H7T 1S8 Canada
Review: good ramen at a good price! Servers were friendly! Would come here again. I got the original pork ramen. Good but a little bland for my liking and the pork was tougher than I would’ve liked

Address: 7153 Chemin de la Côte-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3R 2M2 Canada
Review:
Good little restaurant. I had the dry Phnom Penh soup, egg rolls, fried Chinese doughnuts and an avocado smoothie.
Even though the restaurant was full, the wait was not too long, about 10min. Service was quite quick. The soup was tasty. The egg rolls were amazing. The fried doughnuts were crispy. Great little meal. Just don’t forget to bring your cash because it is cash only.

Address: 7153 Chemin de la Côte-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3R 2M2 Canada
Review:
Food is great and staff is nice. I had a Phnom Penh with soup on the side. You can have the option of choosing rice noodle, wheat noodle or both together.

Not the best localisation though and not much place to seat. It's toddler friendly (baby seats).
Parking hard to find.

Overall, it was worth my 30 mins drive and 5 mins time of searching for a parking 😅.

Address: 7153 Chemin de la Côte-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3R 2M2 Canada
Review: Authentic food. I liked it very much. I’ve never tried Cambodian food before but I found it super good. Highly recommend.

Address: 7153 Chemin de la Côte-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3R 2M2 Canada
Review: This was my first time trying authentic Cambodian food. The soup was delicious. The sliced meat was tender and the broth was flavourful. Truly a hidden gem. Satisfied customer from Toronto.

Address: 7153 Chemin de la Côte-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3R 2M2 Canada
Review: “Hu tieu mi nam vang” soup Phnom Penh  is delicious 👍 good service.

Address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest Montreal, QC H3H 2S7 Canada
Review: I personally had a mediocre experience. We were sat at the worst table that was wobbly and next to a large group of loud people even though I had made a reservation prior. Other tables were available and I do realize I should have asked for a different table. The drinks are really good but do not order the set menu. It’s boring and repetitive. Not any of the dishes had a wow factor and for a table d‘hôte you would expect the dishes to be better curated. I still think some of the other dishes might be delicious though. On another hand, the decor is very charming and the bathrooms are top tier. Visit the bathroom just for the experience you won’t regret it. Note that the music is very loud and it’s hard to hear each other talk. One thing that really bothered me though is the poor service. The dishes were served not in order, it took them very long to pick up empty plates and overall they looked like they did not want to be there. Léa was the only one that should be a server since she at least had the ability to smile and check on us a couple of times.

Address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest Montreal, QC H3H 2S7 Canada
Review: The atmosphere here is clean, open, and casual. The service we were provided with was also top and one of the best. Everyone was so nice and the food was so good! I honestly recommend their cocktails too - I had the mojito lychee and it was the most refreshing cocktails ever. I wish I could try all their cocktails! For food, we ordered okonomiyaki to share, karaage curry, and sukiyaki curry udon. The price here is so reasonable and the portions are very large. If you haven't been DEFINITELY try!

Address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest Montreal, QC H3H 2S7 Canada
Review:
Ordered almost everything on the menu.
Must try: cold noodles udon, fried chicken(karagge), sushi, cheese curry rice!

Don't recommend the fried stuff beside chicken because they all tasted burnt and bitter.

Overall 10/12 dishes were good
One of the best Jp restaurants in the street

Address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest Montreal, QC H3H 2S7 Canada
Review:
We came here on a Wednesday night, we didn't have any reservations but we didn't mind sitting at the "bar area".

It's a cute little place that has an open chicken

When we walked in, you can instantly see the interaction between the employees which I loved, they were calling out of each other when a customer was coming in or leaving and also when it came to food.

The service was good, we ordered and the food came in pretty fast

We ordered Miso soup, seaweed and tofu salad, veggie dumplings, udon carbonara and the salmon tataki.

This is a tapas restaurant so the portions arent huge.

My favorite was the udon carbonara is was creamy but not to heavy and also the veggie dumplings.

The seaweed and tofu salad was not that good, there was barely any seaweed or even dressing in the salad, it was mostly mixed greens.
And the salmon tataki was a tease there was only 4 pieces that we shared.

We didn't get any drinks so I cannot comment on that.

Overall it was good and not expensive, if you like to share good this is a good place but not the best Izakaya in Montreal.

They also have locations in Toronto and New York.

Address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest Montreal, QC H3H 2S7 Canada
Review:
I only discovered this restaurant this year and came back 4 times so far because of its great food and ambiance! The host even recognized me!

I strongly recommend this place for birthdays because of its festive atmosphere and the warm hospitality of the staff. They give one small matcha cheesecake for the birthday person so if you want to have something for the whole group, you can also order the assorted dessert in extra.

My favourite among appetizers is the sashimi salad and among tapas, the Tokyo calamari! For the noodles, the stir-fried beef udon is very good, and is not too salty and for the sizzling stone rice bowl, the curry cheese smells extremely good and can be smelled meters away! I wish however they didn't get rid of the pork tonkatsu curry on the menu!

I can't wait to come back to try their lunch menu and their terrasse during summer!

(sorry, I didn't take pics of all the food I ate. Was too busy eating!)

Address: 1440 Rue de l'Eglise Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 2H3 Canada
Review:
I’ve never tried Taiwanese much so can’t compare but over all tasty. It cost around 50$ for the beef soup + pork with rice + 2x potatoes and fried chicken. So quite cheap ! We were the only one at that moment and there was no music in the background so we couldn’t talk much I was too shy to talk in the quiet place.  I felt watched and heard haha
So I still recommend :)

Address: 1440 Rue de l'Eglise Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 2H3 Canada
Review: Highly recommend! Food was bursting with flavor! The owner and cook was so friendly!

Address: 1440 Rue de l'Eglise Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 2H3 Canada
Review:
Maison Mignon is very easy to miss. This small family-owned humble business doesn't look like much from the outside (or the inside) but don't let appearances deceive you. The food is RIDICULOUSLY good. The owner is INCREDIBLY friendly, hospitable and honest. This is one of the rare places that I actually feel deserves 20%+ tipping.

The beef noodle soup is easily one of the best in the city. EASY. This is a complete "Sleeper OP" restaurant. It is LEGITIMATELY one of those hidden gems.

The prices are fairly low too.

Strong recommendation for the Beef Noodle Soup and Almond Shrimp plate.

Address: 1440 Rue de l'Eglise Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 2H3 Canada
Review: Maison Mignon Taiwanese restaurant is a hidden gem in the city. The menu is diverse, offering a mix of traditional Taiwanese dishes as well as some other Japanese and unique fusion items. The flavors are authentic, with a particular emphasis on fresh ingredients. The atmosphere is cozy and intimate, perfect for a small gathering with friends. Service is prompt and friendly, with the staff knowledgeable about the menu and eager to make recommendations. Overall, Maison Mignon is an excellent option for anyone looking to experience Taiwanese cuisine.

Address: 1440 Rue de l'Eglise Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 2H3 Canada
Review: Prices are very reasonable and food tastes home made. Staff is nice and friendly.

Address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B7 Canada
Review: Amazing customer service and the food was good and very aesthetically pleasing ! Micheal was so sweet and very knowledgeable about the food. His energy also made our experience that much better. Felix was also super helpful and kind ! Amazing dinner experience:)

Address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B7 Canada
Review: My boyfriend and I wanted to try some authentic French cuisine while we were visiting Montreal and looked up this restaurant on google. We had to wait a few minutes before we got a table outside. Ben was very courteous and explained the menu to us in English. I got their signature arugula salad with goat cheese while my boyfriend got duck Condit. The food was absolutely delicious. We finished our dinner with soe delicious chai tea crumble. We left the place satiated and full of gratitude.

Address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B7 Canada
Review: Quaint restaurant with welcoming and attentive service. The daily set menu was perfect. Escargots presented in a unique salad that was especially tasty. Ricotta pasta and chocolate profiteroles were perfectly prepared. Kids loved their French onion soup and even ate the onions this time! Beef tartare and fois gras delicious! Lamb shank tender.

Address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B7 Canada
Review: Food is amazing. Nice (normal) portion sizes (but maybe small for some people). Love that the wait staff dresses nicely.  Nicely-dressed servers seems to be a dying art. They are classy there.  Also love that they don’t play loud music.  Will go back for sure!

Address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B7 Canada
Review: Really really great food, presented really well. The waiter was attentive and fun too! I can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu. The only minor issue was that it was a little bit cold inside the restaurant, maybe it was because it had just opened for the evening, either way, it wouldn't stop me coming back again, I'll just wear a sweater next time!

Address: 617 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L2 Canada
Review: First time trying Russian food, and I have to say: I loved it. Very cozy restaurant - if you go Saturday night, you might be able to enjoy some Russian music live. Very friendly and attentive staff. I would definitely recommend the place and come back again if I have the opportunity.

Address: 617 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L2 Canada
Review:
One of the best Russian resturant in Montreal. We reserved a table for a Saterday (for our family post Covid - backing to normal life party🤣🤣) and the owner was kind enough to give us party menu although we were a small group.We reached there at 7pm and non of us thought that we would stay there for 5 hours. Our table was filled with very delicious Russian appitizers and salads (Egg plant roll was astonishing 🤪- Jouline was extra ordinary🥰🤩 ). Overall the tastes of all the meals were great and resturant serve them on time in a proper maner and size.Delsious food plus great music and dancing place made the expirence  unforgetable 🥰🥰🥰 . They also packed all left overs for us upon our request and it means we had a chance to eat tasty meal the next day too🤗🤗🤗.10 from 10 . I have a  plane to make a biger party there very soon 🥳🥳🎊🍻👯‍♀️🥂👯‍♂️stay tuned.
Update 30 July 2022:  I went there with my international family (USA-Iran-Russia) once more and the experience was amazing🤗🤗. I resereved for party menu for 8 people for Saterday night. My family were in love with great music, tasty foods and positivity. The singer could sang in many launguages and owner also sang that night. We all danced  like there would be no tomorrow💃💃. My whole family were obsessed😎. Make sure to reserve before going and do not lose your chance to have great russian party 😍😍🥰

Address: 617 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L2 Canada
Review: All about this place is 5 star. Perfect food quality (chicken broschet was super amazing). The vibe is perfect. DJ accomodates everyones ask for songs. Servers are kind & attentive. Owner is very kind & caring as well. He ensures best service is provided. We have been here multiple time and every sinhle one of them was amazing.

Address: 617 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L2 Canada
Review: Absolutely delicious. We ordered out to eat in the backyard and everyone in my family loved it. The eggplant filled with cheese is amazing. My dad didn’t want to share his beef stroganoff because he loved it too much. Everything was perfect, we will go there again. Very happy to support local family business.

Address: 617 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L2 Canada
Review: Absolutely delicious traditional Russian food. We had Cesar salad and Pelmini with a main dish of cabbage rolls and Kiev chicken, Napoleon cake and everything was fantastic. Terrace was quiet and service was quick. I look forward to come back soon!

Address: 4271 Rue Saint-Jacques Montreal, QC H4C 1J7 Canada
Review:
Really comfortable cafe with great food and service!

Their pastries are good, but their sandwiches (Turkey pesto, etc) are what really stand out. They are a bit pricey at $12-$13 but they are delicious!

It’s a really nice space with lots of light and live plants, as well as a chill terrace in the back.

Address: 4271 Rue Saint-Jacques Montreal, QC H4C 1J7 Canada
Review: We loved this place. A proper old-school corner cafe, in an authentic neighborhood. Great for breakfast.

Address: 4271 Rue Saint-Jacques Montreal, QC H4C 1J7 Canada
Review: Wow!!! truly a hidden gem in Montreal. I decided to stop by on my way to the airport back to Vancouver. I grabbed some lunch and I grabbed a few items to take back with me for the plane ride. I love croissants so I decided to grab three to share with my family at home, but when I got home and opened the bag, I saw an extra croissant!! it felt so nice that the staff tried to make my visit to the café a little extra special. 🙏 I will be recommending this place to everybody! The staff are truly kind, the food is absolutely delicious (pesto is unreal) and the vibe is phenomenal. Thank you for giving me a wonderful experience. I cannot wait to come back again someday!! 💕

Address: 4271 Rue Saint-Jacques Montreal, QC H4C 1J7 Canada
Review: Small café and cozy especially for a winter day. There’s an outdoor terrace that’s also nice during good weather. Service was quick, but we only ordered drinks. We got iced-chai for $7 each. It’s quite pricy for a glass of chai half-filled with glass. My friend the chai was dull. I thought it was good after I added an alternative sugar (I think it was called Twinner). You also have many vegan milk options in addition to the regular. But the windows and the vibe is so cute!

Address: 4271 Rue Saint-Jacques Montreal, QC H4C 1J7 Canada
Review:
Very cute place. Food was priced right and good. The live jazz on Sunday is a nice treat. (might be there other days too, not sure)
They have a cute outdoor seating area as well as indoor seating. The staff was friendlier than most places. I am happy to have this place in my neighborhood and will keep going. Go to brunch on the weekend, they offer the best deals then!

Address: 536 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A9 Canada
Review: Food was delicious.  Just stopped for a quick bite, had the best poutine of my life.. the service was 10/10, made us feel like family. Had the pleasure of enjoying this on the patio. I can't wait to try more from the menu next time I ordered.

Address: 536 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A9 Canada
Review: Our best meal in Montreal! I highly recommend everyone have dinner here. All our food was incredible and the drinks were amazing. The service was impeccable.

Address: 536 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A9 Canada
Review:
Disappointed with the food. We got the oysters (great appetizer), Foie Gras Poutine (pretty good but slightly overpriced), and finally the duck in the can.
Duck in the can is overly overhyped, unflavoured and overpriced. For $60 I was expecting something exceptional. We got a nice show and hard duck breast. The cabbage was not that good and the meat was hard and unsalted.
Maybe different strokes different folks but my 2nd time at Au Pied was a big disappointment.

Address: 536 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A9 Canada
Review: Completely worth the hype. Had the foie gras poutine and the duck in a can to share. We were very full from this! The dishes weren't too heavy and just great flavours and cooked perfectly. I have never experienced such incredible service. We never had to fill our own cups with water and had our table wiped down multiple times and felt well attended to.

Address: 536 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A9 Canada
Review: I highly recommend this restaurant.  The food and the service were excellent.  We had the Duck Temaki, Salt & Maple Sugar Fries, and the Duck in a Can.  Everything was high quality and the presentation was beautiful.  The Duck in a Can is a large enough portion for you to share with someone for your meal.  This place is popular, so I recommend making a reservation before going on your vacation like we did.

Address: 5968 Rue de Salaberry Montreal, QC H4J 1J8 Canada
Review: The best restaurant in Montreal.  A variety of food to choose from. Great atmosphere, good drinks, and  the services are impeccable .

Address: 5968 Rue de Salaberry Montreal, QC H4J 1J8 Canada
Review: Food was really delicious, we took the cabri en sauce. The service was excellent. Staff super friendly and kind. It’s a bit more on the pricy side but still worth it, would recommend!

Address: 5968 Rue de Salaberry Montreal, QC H4J 1J8 Canada
Review: Excellently prepared and fresh, authentic Haitian food! Highly recommend for those who like to try new things!! My Mediterranean palate was completely satisfied here. The Lalo (Jews Mallow) with rice and the fried red snapper were my favorite dishes!

Address: 5968 Rue de Salaberry Montreal, QC H4J 1J8 Canada
Review: 10/10. I’ve been going to Fourchette Antillaise everytime I come down to Montreal since 2018. The food is great. The service is great. The restaurant is always clean and well maintained. Nice spot for a date, celebrate an event or more. I’ve bought friends here who also enjoyed it and said they would come back because that’s exactly the feeling this restaurant leaves you with, the desire to return.

Address: 5968 Rue de Salaberry Montreal, QC H4J 1J8 Canada
Review: My boyfriend and I  went to that restaurant last weekend and we surely enjoyed the food. We couldn't even finished our plates. They give you a very fair portion for the price and the service was very fast. If you are looking for an Haitian/Creole restaurant, well that's the  place to go! Great job to the team working at Fourchette Antillaise we will definitely be back.

Address: 3825 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1B2 Canada
Review: My boyfriend and I come very often and it’s always a blast. The staff and food are great! My boyfriend said that no one can beat his nonna’s cooking and yet, this restaurant came close. We are so grateful to the portions and quality of the food as well as the experience we get. This was the third time I get the gnocchi and it’s so hard to not come back everyday and get it again. You guys need to try the cheesecake they have, it’s the best!!! Thank you so much for always satisfying.

Address: 3825 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1B2 Canada
Review:
Very reasonable prices for freshly made pasta. Chef Panza definitely knows what he's doing, is super friendly and brings the true authentic flavors of Italy to your plate in this cozy setting. No bells or whistles, just good food.

Has never disappointed. Looking forward to going back.

Address: 3825 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1B2 Canada
Review:
Hands down the best pasta I have had in Montreal and Laval ever since I came back from Italy 7 years ago. From the first bite I had it brought back memories of what I was eating when I was in Napoli and Arezzo.

Dont be fooled by the outside signage the owner told me he knows and are planning on re-branding. I am so lucky I found this place and will be coming more and more. I swear this is the best Italian food I have had in a long time.

You will not regret coming here. Friendly delicious and home-made fresh food. It's a treasure.

Address: 3825 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1B2 Canada
Review: The best pasta place I have ever been to in Canada.. the pasta is really fresh and ingredients used are top quality.. will recommend all my friends and will surely come back again.. also very customer friendly and you are welcomed well..

Address: 3825 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1B2 Canada
Review: An absolute gem. Easily the best pasta I have ever had. Had the tagliatelle carbonara and it was out of this world good. The quality of all the ingredients and the fresh pasta itself is unparalleled. Love that you can pick your sauce and pasta and have it be very customizable. The chef is also very friendly and personable. Will definitely be coming here again to try their pizzas and more!

Address: 5195 Rue Paré Montreal, QC H4P 1P4 Canada
Review: In one word its mom made food . Not many masalas and total home style . Prices were nice but takes only cash . Was not enough food as were told by them but survived . Kofta and shahi paneer curry was same , dal tadka was good and also cheese chilly .

Address: 5195 Rue Paré Montreal, QC H4P 1P4 Canada
Review:
I love the food here. I have tried most the  dishes on the menu and everything tastes nice. Been coming here for years now and will continue to.
Post covid, the taste changed(still tastes good) for few items, may be the chef changed. Earlier, it was more home like now its little spicy and more oily.

Requires some efforts on regular cleanliness of the washrooms.

Address: 5195 Rue Paré Montreal, QC H4P 1P4 Canada
Review:
I ordered on Uber.  Gravy of Paneer korma is as thin as Dal.  Chapaties are thick and cold.   Totally unhappy with the quality.  Not only that food is delivered without cutlery and tissue paper.  How can you eat .. ?
.
My advice to owner.. TRY RESTAURANT  TGG.. nearby you.  You will see the difference of food quality.   Concentrate on Quality rather than Quantity.

Address: 5195 Rue Paré Montreal, QC H4P 1P4 Canada
Review: Great affordable local spot! Lots of people coming and going which shows it’s a staple in the neighbourhood. Worth the detour, especially if you like indian food and/or vegetarian options.

Address: 5195 Rue Paré Montreal, QC H4P 1P4 Canada
Review: Best place for vegetarians. Tastes like home made food, reasonable prices, good staff, fast servings. Best in everything. Will recommend everyone to visit this restaurant. Prices are really really good.

Address: 640 Rue Jarry E Montreal, QC H2P 1V7 Canada
Review:
Food is affordable, tasty and the portions are generously served the few times I've ordered (3-4x).
It's better calling before going to be sure there's enough fresh food. Man answering the phone is not friendly at all and has 0 customer service.
He refused to take my order even though the usual lady is ok in preparing the plates a bit in advance (since there's only street parking). Not really a place to dine in cuz the tables are quite small. Place could definitely use some improvements and be more clean.

Address: 640 Rue Jarry E Montreal, QC H2P 1V7 Canada
Review:
I visited this Haitian restaurant in Montreal several years ago, thanks to a recommendation from a dear friend. Back then, my experience was fantastic. The service was satisfactory, the portions were generous, and the food itself was incredibly tasty. I often made it a point to stop by this place before heading back to my town.

However, over the past 5 to 6 years, I've observed some noticeable changes in the level of customer service and the overall layout of the restaurant. It seems that the owners have missed an opportunity to enhance their profits by not considering the logistical aspects of the establishment. There's room for improvement in this regard.

One of the major changes I noticed is the declining level of customer service. The staff appears to lack the same level of care and dedication they once had. During a recent visit, I brought some friends to experience the authentic Haitian cuisine. Unfortunately, I encountered an unpleasant situation when I had to return to the front cashier to make a change to my order, despite clearly specifying my desired rice type. The staff in the kitchen were rude and insisted that it wasn't on the receipt, instructing me to go back to the front to pay for it. This encounter left a sour taste in my mouth.

Furthermore, upon reaching home and indulging in my meal, I noticed a decline in the quality of the food, particularly the beef. As a lover of the “Legume”, I've been consistently disappointed by the dish at this restaurant in recent times.

I truly hope the owners take note of these customer concerns and consider making changes to enhance the overall experience. It would be wonderful if they paid attention to reviews like these. I believe there are customers like myself who long for a return to the delicious food and enjoyable dining experience that this restaurant once offered.

Address: 640 Rue Jarry E Montreal, QC H2P 1V7 Canada
Review: I went in today after a recommandation. As some other previous comments the customer service is seriously lacking. I don’t know Haitian cuisine so I was asking the cashier what the dishes are and the whole time I felt like I was bothering her. She told me “beef Tasso” was “Griot” but with beef, and didn’t even bother explaining the different sizes. I don’t even know if it’s true but what I ate today was nothing like the griot I had before. A few slices of an extremely dry meat, I couldn’t even finish the dish, and to top it all I paid 27.50$ for that plate + an accra (Aran kind of who she said was 5$! For a single accra!). Very disappointed.

Address: 640 Rue Jarry E Montreal, QC H2P 1V7 Canada
Review: Terrible customer service! The ladies who prepare the food should take a course on how to treat their customers. They are very disrespectful and have no manners. You can't even ask them a simple question. I will not be coming here again and I do not recommend this place. There are so many better Haitian restaurants than this place.

Address: 640 Rue Jarry E Montreal, QC H2P 1V7 Canada
Review:
I ate a lot of griot when working in Haiti. This one is excellent! Portions are very generous and include all the trimmings: rice (djondjon, collé, blanc), banan pese, sauce, pikliz, ... add an order of akra to this.
They also have t'assoit, lambi, ... everything to make you feel in Haiti.

Address: 994 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2J3 Canada
Review: Hands down, the best poutinerie! I feel like they are crafting art. When I can't tell where the fries end and the meat begins, they have really crafted something special. This place is always busy, but the staff are always calm and relaxed. They definitely have good systems in place here. I've been here 3 times now, and it's a must visit whenever I am in Montreal.

Address: 994 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2J3 Canada
Review: Everybody told me that this is the best poutinerie, but now I doubt it. We had to wait 40 minutes for the food, and when the food arrived, the fries were cold (like old ones), the beef, onions and sausage were burned. Maybe it was because of the amount of people, but the quality of the food should not go down in such a renowned restaurant.

Address: 994 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2J3 Canada
Review:
The hype is real!
When we arrived here the line up was pretty long (we also came on a Saturday)

The line didn’t take to long and we eventually got a table on the terrase (outside) one thing to note is that they don’t serve alcohol outside. They had really good music out on the patio as well.

We ordered the regular size poutine, 1 classic and the other with smoked meat on top. They were both divine!

Beware if you order the grande it’s MASSIVE!
poutine so good we wanted to come back the next day to eat more.

Address: 994 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2J3 Canada
Review: Good and delicious food. Poutines are really good and so are the burgers. We ordered a vegetarian option and it was too yummy. My wife liked the veg burger. The ambience is good. They have an ATM machine inside. Sometimes they have a long queue too, so plan accordingly.

Address: 994 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2J3 Canada
Review:
There was a long line but tables for 2 get in faster. I tried the poutine with pickles and ground beef and loveddd it! I didn’t know what to expect the pickle to taste like but it all was great together.

I’d say it’s a must try when in Montreal!

Address: 73 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B4 Canada
Review:
This restaurant is colorful and fun! All the food we ordered was tasty and feels authentically Venezuelan. The portions are generous and even though the menu makes you want to order one of everything keep in mind that the food is very hearty and filling.
*Everything on the menu is also gluten free!

Address: 73 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B4 Canada
Review: Great Venezuelan fare with a great sense of allergies and helpful staff helping you identify the tastiest foods that respect dairy, gluten, and egg allergies. Their arepas are crunchy, fluffy, juicy amazing deliciousness! Wholeheartedly recommended for a delectable treat. Definitely a place worth repeated visits to explore their menu.

Address: 73 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B4 Canada
Review: The entire restaurant is gluten free so there's no worries about cross contamination. Food comes out quickly and hot. Servers are friendly and welcoming.

Address: 73 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B4 Canada
Review: What a beautiful restaurant and amazing food. Arepera’s quality of food was amazing for its price. I loved that we were able to order our food from our phones and the server just comes and brings it to you. Their empanadas were different from what I’m used to, crunchy in the outside and soft in the inside. The areperas itself were tasty. Service was great and atmosphere was amazing. Loved my experience there!

Address: 73 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B4 Canada
Review:
Delicious food and fantastic service! This was my first time eating arepas and Arepera exceeded my expectations. To eat, we had the cheese empanadas, la llanera de pollo arepa, and dominó con plátano arepa and each item was exceptional - light, crispy and flavourful. Not to mention the house made sauces! Yum!

What made our visit truly perfect was the staff. Our server, Pascual, was phenomenal! He was friendly, checked in often, and made us laugh. He also went above and beyond to ensure we were well taken care of, such as clean up our baskets regularly, provide fresh napkins, and refill our waters consistently. Mali and Norah were also lovely, each stopping by to ensure we received our food quickly, we were satisfied, and also humoured us while we waited.

Well done, Arepera. You have fantastic food and fantastic service! An unbeatable combination when choosing where to eat. We will certainly be coming back again soon.

Address: 699 Boulevard Curé-Labelle Laval, QC H7L 5R7 Canada
Review:
Food was delicious and service was great. The summertime special cocktails were a bit strong in taste in my opinion, but still good. I loved the sangria.
The ambiance was great, the music playing was enjoyable and fit the american BBQ theme.

Address: 699 Boulevard Curé-Labelle Laval, QC H7L 5R7 Canada
Review: We came here because of the blooming onion and it was really worth it! It was so good that I'd want to come back just to eat that. Our waiter Mathieu was super friendly too and he took the time to recommend us which drinks to choose. He made our resto experience super enjoyable - he definitely deserves a raise!! We ordered the Rio Grande dish to split between 4 people and even at the end, there was still plenty of food to bring back home for each of us.

Address: 699 Boulevard Curé-Labelle Laval, QC H7L 5R7 Canada
Review: The fried chicken was good. Service not bad either. Could’ve used a bit more coleslaw with my dish. Fries tasted like they were from McDonalds though hence the minus 1 star

Address: 699 Boulevard Curé-Labelle Laval, QC H7L 5R7 Canada
Review: As always, excellent food and service. Loved every seconds of it.

Address: 699 Boulevard Curé-Labelle Laval, QC H7L 5R7 Canada
Review:
Boeuf cochon burger is tasty!! Would order again.
Mother clucker sandwich- hmm it’s good in general but the chicken is a bit dry.
Service is fantastic; the waiter is bilingual and he was friendly with my child asking directly what she wanted to have.

Address: 3721 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H4C 1P8 Canada
Review:
First time trying Singaporean restaurant and was definitely impressed by its unique flavours. The ambiance and service were fantastic, and the staff, were all dudes dressed in shorts and t-shirts, giving a relaxed and welcoming vibe.

The chicken satay was absolutely amazing, the other dishes and cocktails were good as well. I highly recommend this place.

Address: 3721 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H4C 1P8 Canada
Review:
Amazing place. Great staff and ambiance. Music is a bit too loud but very good. Everything was delicious. Papaya salad and pork buns are a must.

Highly recommend to share the plates. We shared 5 plates and the desert plate for 3 people and it cost us under 40$ before tax and tip.

Place gets packed everyday, reco to get there before 7:30-8pm.

Address: 3721 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H4C 1P8 Canada
Review:
The music was extremely loud when we visited. Impossible to make any conversation even with the person sitting next to you. Food was alright, would have enjoyed it better if we could've talked to each other.
We made a reservation for 11 people and one person didn't show up. They split the 11th person's charge evenly over our bills; even though they only brought food for the 10 of us.

Unfortunately, I would not go again.

Address: 3721 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H4C 1P8 Canada
Review: A must for those who love Asian food but crave something different from the traditional flavors found in Chinatown. I suggest coming as a group and ordering many dishes to share. The umami is through the roof and can feel heavy if not paired with white rice. My personal favorites are the pork belly steamed buns and the laksa.

Address: 3721 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H4C 1P8 Canada
Review:
No resos for groups under 6, and I recommend getting there early. We arrived at 6:30pm on a Thursday and it was packed, we waited roughly 15-20 minutes for a spot for 2. They let you order drinks while waiting though, which is a great start.

Must try’s on the menu are the satay skewers with peanut sauce, the fried pork and shrimp rice rolls (not pictured, but we both agreed it was the best thing we tasted!), papaya salad, and the regular pork steam buns.

The shrimp buns were part of their specials, but it’s not as balanced and tasty as the pork buns. If you’re stuck between the two, go pork.

For the noodles, I would go for the mussel and chorizo noodles instead of the shrimp and cuttlefish.

But really, everything on the menu is excellent. We also have our amazing experience to thank to our server Carl, who went above and beyond in the service.

100% recommend!

Address: 510 Promenade de Centropolis Laval, QC H7T 3C2 Canada
Review: Nice place with a good cocktail selection! I think the music inside is too loud because my friends and I couldn’t hear each other. The food was tasty, so I think I would come again.

Address: 510 Promenade de Centropolis Laval, QC H7T 3C2 Canada
Review: The burgers were only warm when we got them, the meat was dry and lacked flavor…the fried pickles were the best but the portion was tiny (only 4 pieces). The music is so loud we couldn’t hear each other talking.. the only good thing is the rapid service and nice interior decor.

Address: 510 Promenade de Centropolis Laval, QC H7T 3C2 Canada
Review: Overall satisfying experience. Can be crowded and noisy. Amazing burgers. Highly recommended. Great selection of drinks!

Address: 510 Promenade de Centropolis Laval, QC H7T 3C2 Canada
Review: Let's be serious, the burgers here are pretty mid. But it's a fun place to grab drinks with friends while getting serenaded by the friendly staff.

Address: 510 Promenade de Centropolis Laval, QC H7T 3C2 Canada
Review: The decoration, service and the vibes are excellent - the food is good, however it can be enhanced . The flavors are missing

Address: 4105 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2W 1Y7 Canada
Review: Ok, this wasn’t our first choice but I am glad we made it. Excellent food. Limited beer choices but quality. Menu out of sight. We had the Caesar salad, Pork Cheeks, Octopus and Beef. All amazing and each with their own unique flavor. Look if you’re American looking for mega servings this is not the place. This is relaxed fine dining, small plates, big flavors. Cocktails excellent and wine selections almost overwhelming! Staff is down to earth and informative. Don’t miss this place.

Address: 4105 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2W 1Y7 Canada
Review:
Very recommended their oyster. It comes in 3 different types. All of them are fresh and tasty (come with natural sweetness). Other food is very well-seasoned.
The mousse de foie surprises me because of its creamy, fatty flavour with a bit of bitterness from the liver and sweetness from the pear and brûlée on top.
Their hot dog is pretty big (obviously it’s 12 inches). The mixed salad balances the flavour well.
The whelks is a hit-or-miss tho.
I will come back to taste more of their dishes and drinks. If you don’t come for their food, you can try their drinks because they have a very long list for them.

Address: 4105 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2W 1Y7 Canada
Review: I cant recommend this place enough, professionals doing a great job providing delicious food, amazing cocktails and attentive, friendly service at a reasonable price.  They love what they do and it shows! I will eat here again in the near future.

Address: 4105 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2W 1Y7 Canada
Review:
One of our go to favourite places for a drink, dinner, and oysters. If you get Michelle as you server, you'll be in great hands - very attentive, attention to detail, and great recommendations. The hostess was also a pleasure to talk to over the phone. Duck tartar was very delicious, we'll come back for the pork belly, and next time we'll do 24 oysters instead of 12. Fries are absolutely worth getting. The vibe is great as it gets busy but not overwhelming, and the decor is spot on. We make an effort to visit all our favorite places everytime we come back to Montreal (as we are from Toronto) and this place is on our list. Thank you Michelle for giving us such a great night!

Saka & Jamie
Visited: Fri, Aug 27, 2021 8pm

Address: 4105 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2W 1Y7 Canada
Review: The food here was beautiful!! Shrimp sandwiches, mackerel salad dip, etc..great small plates! Phenomenal and not pretentious at all.

Address: 983 Boulevard Décarie Montreal, QC H4L 3M6 Canada
Review:
Lovely owners and food! Had the dolsot bibimbap, ingredients tasted fresh and the dish was delicious. The veggie dumplings were also great!

Every now and then I also get a box of rice cake skewers to-go, and they always hit the spot!

Place can get crowded at times, but the atmosphere is still nice to be in. I'll definitely come back to sit in with more friends, thank you for the service!

Address: 983 Boulevard Décarie Montreal, QC H4L 3M6 Canada
Review:
Five stars well deserved.
Ordered the hot stone beef binimbap , the flavours have a nice warm feeling to it, tasteful and full filling, also had the ramen with beef and it was outstanding. The place looks and feels cozy too.
Definitely recommend for korean food 10/10.

Address: 983 Boulevard Décarie Montreal, QC H4L 3M6 Canada
Review: I love this spot! The one spot in Montreal with some of the BEST kimbap. I always go here for the spicy tuna kimbap (it’s to die for !!!!!). I believe it’s a family owned business and they have great food for great prices. Also very close to the metro for those of you who don’t drive (metro cote vertu). I also always get their dak galbi stew (spicy chicken. Stew with rice) so good!! Must try!!!

Address: 983 Boulevard Décarie Montreal, QC H4L 3M6 Canada
Review:
Update april 24 2023

They finally hired a new good staff.  It was a full house at 6 pm  Saterday.  Prices went up again but so did service snd quality.

Wings    10/10
Bi bim bap   10/10   i like to to have a little more crust at the bottom of the bowl but it is a personal choice
Ramen noodles  9/10    good broth and flavor

----
Very good fried chicken. Not many places offer wings, most offer half or whole chicken.   Bi bim bap was very good.    The noodles and kim chi were ok. The is the only place in Montréal/ Toronto that has pork bone  soup, bi bim bap and fried chicken.  Very good prices.   The food is timed and comes out at the same time (most of the time)

Address: 983 Boulevard Décarie Montreal, QC H4L 3M6 Canada
Review:
SERVICE: Came here when they first opened, food is always good. Went back a couple of times recently, the person that works in the front is a bit slow, we had to ask for cultery, dishes, napkins. When we were ready to leave, which we waiting 20minutes to have the bill, we asked and the person went back to clean some spoons, or going into the back doing God knows what. Asked a second time and still proceeds on doing something else so we finally walked to the front and asked the owner to have the bill. As for the service, I’d give 3/5. The waiter would leave tables dirty and not clean up the table until there is a line up. Not very efficient.

FOOD: love their spicy tuna kimbap, chiken cutlet is very good but the chiken is always over-fried, as it was super hard to chew and burnt.

We love coming to this place but for sure has some adjustments to make.

Address: 1440 Rue Drummond Montreal, QC H3G 1V9 Canada
Review: wow! what a mesmerizing place. came to celebrate my friends birthday and everything was even better than expected. food was so fresh and flavourful. wine and service was astonishing, all the staff were so friendly and welcoming. we got quite a few of the « snack » dishes and every single one was beautifully presented and tasted amazing. atmosphere was everything! music was nice, decor, vibe etc. was worth every second! will be back many more times. thank you! xx

Address: 1440 Rue Drummond Montreal, QC H3G 1V9 Canada
Review: Another great experience of food and culture.  Such an amazing building with superb design and art. Loved the stained glass. But be prepared to pay for this. It cost me a small fortune. I love Hibiki but not willing to pay 54 bucks plus tax and tip. This is crazy. I did not like the octopus and frozen fries but everything else was A-1. I ordered the beef wellington and loved it.

Address: 1440 Rue Drummond Montreal, QC H3G 1V9 Canada
Review: What a lovely old home. The architecture and decor are outstanding! Had drinks at the bar but would love to go for dinner. Hostess was super friendly & accommodating. So much to look at and appreciate!

Address: 1440 Rue Drummond Montreal, QC H3G 1V9 Canada
Review:
I recently visited Bar George in Montreal for a late-night outing. Initially, I intended to have dinner, but unfortunately, the kitchen was closed by the time I arrived. However, this turned out to be a blessing in disguise as I got the opportunity to sample their drinks instead.

Despite the fact that there were empty seats, I had to wait in line for about 20 minutes to get a seat at 1am, which was a bit of a letdown. However, once I was seated, I was quite impressed by the atmosphere. The interior is beautifully designed, giving off a high-class vibe that I thoroughly enjoyed.

Overall, even though my visit didn't go as initially planned, I had a good time at Bar George. The ambiance and the quality of the drinks made up for the initial hiccup. I would recommend this place for anyone looking for a classy spot to unwind in Montreal.

Address: 1440 Rue Drummond Montreal, QC H3G 1V9 Canada
Review:
The place itself is a historical building with lovely carved wood, the dim setting and combinations of wood makes it a perfect dining space. I appreciate the staff allowing us to explore the second floor of the building!

We came during lunchtime. We ordered the hamburgers, they are so good! The buttery brioche bun topped with an amazing smokey caramelized onion and well seasoned beef patty perfectly encapsulated the combination of sweet and salty. The density of the burger felt perfectly balanced all throughout, although I believe the mayonnaise sauce served with the fries was too dense and did not compliment the lightness of the burger.

Unfortunately I could not take a picture of the burger as the lighting present with my phone was too bad.

The staff were very kind and helpful.

Address: 3455 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1A2 Canada
Review:
Where should I begin?

The food is absolutely delicious and it tastes so fresh! We had various starters to start and everything was great. From the salad to the hummus, it was delicious.

For the main plate, we’ve ordered the kafta brochette, the chicken brochette and the lamp chops… delicious!

The staff is friendly and helpful.

I recommend it!

Address: 3455 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1A2 Canada
Review: Highly recommended! Delicious food, fresh ingredients, and fast service. Their hot pita bread, Hummus, and garlic yogurt were an amazing combination as a starter. A grilled plate could be a good option for the main course and out of this world!

Address: 3455 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1A2 Canada
Review: My family and I went to Beroya a handful of times and it was always excellent. The food was always outstanding. The quality is unparalleled to any other Syrian restaurant in Montreal, plus, the prices are extremely reasonable. There are many options of authentic Syrian meals to choose from, including meat, vegetarian and vegan options. Kevin, our waiter, was incredibly kind and made us feel very welcomed.

Address: 3455 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1A2 Canada
Review:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at Beroya, a Syrian cuisine restaurant located in Laval, and I must say that it was an amazing experience. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a lovely Middle Eastern and Syrian look and feel that immediately transported me to a different world.

But the real star of the show was the food. I was lost what to order, but the staff were incredibly helpful and provided excellent recommendations. I ended up trying several dishes, and each one was more delicious than the last. The taste was mouthwatering, and the spices were just right, giving every bite the perfect kick.

One thing that really impressed me was how quickly the food was served. I didn't have to wait long at all, which is always a plus in my book. And once I was done with my main course, I made sure to taste the delicious dessert options. The ice cream and cotton candy were particularly noteworthy, and I found myself craving more even after I had finished.

Overall, I highly recommend Beroya for anyone who loves Middle Eastern and Syrian cuisine. The food is simply amazing, the staff are helpful and friendly, and the atmosphere is perfect for a night out with friends or family. Don't miss out on this hidden gem in Laval!

Address: 3455 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1A2 Canada
Review:
It was perfect since I love exquisite food that is less than 500 calories, when seriously watching my weight . There individual dishes 30-40$ are dishes to die for, plate is cute, even smaller than regular plate, where they fit little bit of protein with grill veges - half med onion half med
tomato a half pepper and garnished with 5g of parsley and onion, pita sliced into few pieces; leaves your stomach much room for dessert 😋 So yummy and so little we finished our individual dish in less than 5 mins, this was first time in the history defeating McDonald's trio under 5 mins. Yes, you can order rice, potato and salad for extra extra charges. Of course, you can order chef choice platter for 55$/person, which supposedly fills the whole table. In short, there are better restaurants, gentleman serving us was nice.

Address: 6653 Rue St-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2M5 Canada
Review: Disappointed. The service was bad, even though the place was empty. We ordered the beet salad and found a hair in it. We complained about it and they offered us another plate of salad. We also ordered the lobster roll and it was okay. We asked for a smoothie with our order but it never came although we have paid for it. So, before leaving the restaurant, we claimed the smoothie and that’s when the server started making it. I think the smoothie was the only tasty thing we had at Beaufort.. unfortunately, it was a bad experience and we don’t think we will ever come back here again.

Address: 6653 Rue St-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2M5 Canada
Review: It’s my first time to come to Montreal. I booked a Airbnb nearby. The house owner recommended me this restaurant! It’s really a good recommendation! I like this Pieuvre! And the french fries is also good! Btw, the service is pretty good! I will come again! To try the Steak!

Address: 6653 Rue St-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2M5 Canada
Review:
I’m super glad I finally made it to this restaurant !

The atmosphere is very relax, the decor full of cute little details; a place where you feel comfortable and welcomed.

I got the salmon tartare and my friend the guédille with lobster and nordic shrimps. We were both really satisfied :)

Best aspect of this place is the service is attentive, everyone is kind and laid back. The kind of restaurant you can feel the staff is well treated and they work as a team. Fully recommend!

Address: 6653 Rue St-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2M5 Canada
Review: Friendly, attentive staff and tasty food. Nice location, right on Plaza St-Hubert. We were a group of three and all shared the plates so we got to taste several this. Everything was good but the octopus stole the show.

Address: 6653 Rue St-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2M5 Canada
Review: Very varied menu, open kitchen, the chef came to the kitchen counter and described some of the food and its preparation.

Address: 1794 Boulevard le Corbusier Laval, QC H7S 2K1 Canada
Review:
I planned an event with about 40 people in the restaurant's private room. It was perfect!

We had all the space we needed. The private room even has its own bathroom. There are no stairs so accessibility was great for elderly guests.

If you want a hall but don't want hall prices, look no further!

The staff was excellent! Very accomodating and helpful.

I highly recommend this restaurant for events but also for dinner on the restaurant side.

Address: 1794 Boulevard le Corbusier Laval, QC H7S 2K1 Canada
Review: Food was excellent. Service was good. All in all, i am very pleased with this restaurant.

Address: 1794 Boulevard le Corbusier Laval, QC H7S 2K1 Canada
Review: Great food…homemade traditional italian fare.  Best calamari in town!  Warm and friendly service by all!  Would highly recommend!!!

Address: 1794 Boulevard le Corbusier Laval, QC H7S 2K1 Canada
Review: Food was phenomenal. Waiters were great! Very accommodating. Ambien was nice. Service was slow though. I would definitely come back if I had time.

Address: 1794 Boulevard le Corbusier Laval, QC H7S 2K1 Canada
Review: Excellent restaurant with a good menu and varied wine list.  The staff has been there forever. The food is tasty and flavorful, well seasoned, but not salty like some other places.

Address: 169A Boulevard Sainte-Rose Laval, QC H7L 1L2 Canada
Review: The chicken is delicious, the specify one in particular. The staff are very friendly. Get the combo, you get great value and amazing taste.

Address: 169A Boulevard Sainte-Rose Laval, QC H7L 1L2 Canada
Review:
Very small restaurant. They give complimentary bread and olives which is nice.
We were 3, ordered one plate of chicken and a platter to share. The chicken was good but very salty. Didn't care for the rest of the meat, the pork seemed a bit over cooked and the sausage was chewy so we really only ate the chicken. Salad and fries were good. Portuguese beer was also pleasent, but a bit pricey.
