Waitress was nice, but the guy who served our drinks kept poring a 7up while looking at it and didn't stop until it overflowed on to the floor and served the glass sticky with no apology or offer to bring a new drink since the glass wasn't full. Very bizarre.

Address: 169A Boulevard Sainte-Rose Laval, QC H7L 1L2 Canada
Review:
What a terrific find in Laval! We had spicy grilled chicken and assorted meat plate with a very nice red house wine. The roasted meat with paprika was so delicious. Mum said she hadn't enjoyed a roasted chicken this much in decades. And for dessert a homemade Portuguese tartlet which was.perfect.
Service was fab. Simple setting which was just fine. Thank you to all the staff.

Address: 169A Boulevard Sainte-Rose Laval, QC H7L 1L2 Canada
Review:
The service was not impressive because it took a while which we did not mind thinking we will get the great food and fresh. we ordered a lot but the chicken was very dry and half of the plate was rather burned. my family went there before and said the chicken was not bad (when an older gentleman cooked it). next time we would rather go to Romados in Montreal.
pricey for the burned dry chicken if you ask me

Address: 169A Boulevard Sainte-Rose Laval, QC H7L 1L2 Canada
Review: Some of the best chicken you'll have in this areas. Char-grilled with a mild or spicy sauce topping. It almost tastes South American, and super delicious. Lunch special choices were chicken (light or dark), chorizo sausage, or grilled sardines, paired with pomme frites and a tasty salad. Had the breast and wing and the chicken literally falls off the bone. Parking is a little spotty but a public parking lot is about 200m away with a few more potential spots.

Address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1M5 Canada
Review: Food is delicious loved the calamari perfectly fried so far the best in Laval.

Address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1M5 Canada
Review:
Favourite restaurant, easy, in Laval.

This restaurant is one of my all time favourites in laval. I've come here over 30 times in my lifetime and it has never disappointed me. It's my family's go-to spot.

My favourite dish is the Scaloppine Alla Grigio. Veal, with a side of vegetables, and pasta. I usually ask for regattoni conspec as my pasta side. Absolutely delicious, the mushrooms and the veal in the Porto sauce are really good. (The picture was taken after I had already dug into it, I couldn't resist!) My sister gets the regattoni con spec as a dish and she loves it every time.

The appetizers here are also very good and popular with us. We have the calamari every time we come here, an easy 10/10, crispy and delicious. The newest one we had was the sausage, which was just pure bliss, sublime.

The desserts here too are great. I had the crème caramel and my sister had the crème brûlée, both super sweet and tasty.

Thank you so much for the impeccable service and food.

Address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1M5 Canada
Review: Extremely good.  Food arrived hot.  Our server believe her name was Eli was just fantastic.  We give her a 10 for professionalism.  Congrats to the whole team.  Will definitely be back.  We are about 40 minutes away from there but we'll worth the trip.  Thanks again de

Address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1M5 Canada
Review:
Baby friendly restaurant.

Pretty nice decor, a bring your own wine restaurant you can’t miss, Food is good and well priced :) will definitely come back again.

The service was very good too!

The only problem were the fruit flies ~ fix that problem and it will be a definitely 5 stars :)

Address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1M5 Canada
Review:
Food was excellent but service was awful.  It was a Saturday night, granted, but I've been to many other restaurants where it wasn't as slow. We were 10 people.   We were not all served our meal at the same time. Our waitress was more attentive to the men, especially mine!  She totally ignored me until she saw it was ME who paid the bill. Sweetheart,  your boss should remind you to treat ALL your customers the same.  I gave her a generous tip in spite of her embarrassing and inappropriate behaviour.

My friend said the same thing.  HER husband was served his meal before any of us!  He did not want to start eating while the rest of us waited for our entrées/meals..  but we all insisted he do so.

Address: 5024, ch de la Côte-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3V 1G6 Canada
Review:
✨Short review ✨
Decor, layout and music was great! Food was delicious! Service was impeccable!

✨More elaborate review✨
Firstly, when we walked in we were so happy with the ambience/atmosphere of this restaurant; the decor, music and layout were lovely!

Second, this was our first time trying Russian cuisine and I personally wasn’t sure about what I was reading about on the menu. After ordering, I realized they have pictures of all their meals on their website in the gallery section! I highly recommend to go take a look if you also are unfamiliar with Russian cuisine!

Furthermore, I am so pleased to say that the food was DELICIOUS. Generous portions, flavourful and truly satisfying. Plus, the bread, butter and sour cream were all homemade. (I’m sure more was homemade but this is what we specifically found out was homemade!) I’ll post photos of what my husband and I got for reference!

Third, the lady who served us, I wish I had asked her her name, was so warm, kind, generous, helpful and pleasant! She is a gem and 100% added to the amazing experience we had. Such attention to detail and care!

All in all, please go check this restaurant out! It is worth it!

PS: Most photos are from the website; I forgot to take pictures of the food myself -website photos are true to what we were served.

Address: 5024, ch de la Côte-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3V 1G6 Canada
Review: Was a complete 10 out of 10 experience. The food was delicious, and the service impeccable. Would definitely recommend. The ice-cream at the end was a real treat, home-made and decadent. Will be coming back for sure.

Address: 5024, ch de la Côte-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3V 1G6 Canada
Review:
Enter into a quaint, ten table, Eastern European Restaurant with an amazing staff and chef! The setting / ambiance is amazing!

The appetizers are fantastic! Main course? Kiev and Stroganoff, of many options - FANTASTIC!

Finished our evening experience with a mouth melting honey cake with a dripping of strawberry glaze... and a coffee.

My word selection may not identify the specific menu listed entrees we enjoyed though, I'm sure you have a quality understanding of our experience.

Amazing!

Address: 5024, ch de la Côte-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3V 1G6 Canada
Review: The waitress did a phenomenal job with our family of 7, including 5 children 10 and under.  The food was delicious and tasted like the cuisine I had eaten in Russia.  This restaurant  is obviously popular and has a number of regulars who frequent.  Make sure to call ahead since they regularly have parties that block out the whole place.

Address: 5024, ch de la Côte-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3V 1G6 Canada
Review:
Every meal is fresh and delicious, made with love and beautifully presented. The waiters are courteous and friendly. The owner will ensure everything is to your liking and more and will go out of her way to please you.
We recently had an over 20 people celebration there, everything was seamless, from the delicious food on the table, amazing and thoughtful service, attention to detail and personal touches, they have surpassed our expectations. All guests were complementing how good the food was.
The experience was just as positive when i went there for supper with a friend
This restaurant has been in business for many years and they value their reputation and maintain their standards of quality, you will not be disappointed.
Will be back soon for sure

Address: 5690 Avenue Victoria Montreal, QC H3W 2P8 Canada
Review: We travelled to Montreal and visited this restaurant three times within a week. We really like the Bun Bo Hue there, the soup is so tasty.

Address: 5690 Avenue Victoria Montreal, QC H3W 2P8 Canada
Review: It's a small restaurant but offers an authentic Vietnamese delicious food. I love bún bò hue (spicy noodles soup) that has a very good taste of lemongrass. Bbq pork is delicious too! Service is quick and professional! It's a must-try restaurant in busy Montreal!

Address: 5690 Avenue Victoria Montreal, QC H3W 2P8 Canada
Review:
Sen Vang is one of the best Pho in Montreal.  In these times of pandemic it’s hard to transport soup.  The menu is reduced but the best spicy soup is still there.  I love their Pho and I am a regular. Sony (owner) is one who can pack the take away really well. The spring rolls are fantastic.  It’s a perfect lunch on a cold afternoon hop off and pick up the soup and you can heat up the broth at home in case it’s not as hot as you would like it.

Update: By this time the ownership has changed and the Pho is still very good.  Now there are a more items on the menu and we hand a wonderful time.  The place accepts credit and debit cards now.  I would recommend this place.

Address: 5690 Avenue Victoria Montreal, QC H3W 2P8 Canada
Review: Yummy, my special beef noodle soup is great! The ingredients are fresh, the beef is thick and plentiful! The environment is very clean, the boss is very kind!When the boss knew I was pregnant, he took out the spices that I couldn't eat. How nice!

Address: 5690 Avenue Victoria Montreal, QC H3W 2P8 Canada
Review: The bun bo hue flavour is loaded with lemongrass flavour. Small size was reasonable. Service was nice and homey.

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: Went for my birthday, the host heard that it was my birthday and came with a desert and made sure that our glass was always filled.  Super good wine. I'm a bit disappointed about the portion size of the ribs. It is a good portion. However, if you've been in the past, it changed. You have fewer sides than before. Overall, it's a super good place for chicken and beef. Amazing host.

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: It's a hit or miss place depending on your waiter/waitress. The food is good 90% of the time (if it's not after your first few bites, they are happy to take it back in the kitchen to cook it again). I wouldn't mind coming here if I needed an idea on what to eat for dinner. Obviously, you come here for the ribs.

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review:
So happy to sit down on a nice comfy seat and have a delicious lunch on our shopping day.
I shared a delicious grilled chicken Caesar and it was plenty for 2. Our waitress was lovely and so chipper and made it all a very pleasant experience for us.

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: I had a dinner with my friends here. The food was good, but I think the prices are too high. But the service and atmosphere were good.

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review:
For fine dining this place is 'da BOMB'!!
Service is Top Shelf!!
Portions are very generous!
Baton Rouge has a rather unique system whereby the wait staff are constantly attempting to be aware of each others tables.  What this means for the customer is Fast Efficient Service.  If your meal is 'up' in the kitchen, and your server is not there, but another is -- that server will bring it out to you.  Simple things like water refills and clearing dishes is rarely missed.
For starters we had the Calamari.  it was cooked to perfection, tender and crispy on the outside, served with Smoke Show Aioli. The Seared Ahi Tuna Salad (the tuna was 'melt-in-your-mouth' delectable)
The New York Strip Loin** ordered Rare was incredible!.
We also went 'overboard' by adding a side of Sizzling Shrimp and Scallops.
**The waitress (Maria) was quick to ask if I wanted the steak off the regular menu - or the special (upgrade that came with starter salad, and the steak was topped with a generous slice of Brie and Pan Seared Mushrooms and accompanied with Green Beans and choice of second side).**
Our meal was capped off with the White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake to share.
The prices are quite fair, considering the exceptional service, and generous portions!  It seems rare that you can find a restaurant where the entire waitstaff seem happy to serve, are very friendly and efficient in their work!

Address: 908 Rue Sherbrooke O Montreal, QC H3A 1G3 Canada
Review:
I came here for lunch on a Thursday with my friend. I ordered the Vegetable Noodle combo and my friend ordered the Small Special Lanzhou Beef Noodle combo, both with spicy cucumber. Everything was very delicious. My Vegetable Noodle was a nice generous portion; both the the noodles and the vegetables were cooked perfectly, and the broth was very tasty. The spicy cucumber was crunchy and sweet, which I really really liked.

It's a small restaurant, with maybe 20 seats. I'd say it's more of a place where people just come, eat and then leave; less of a place where people sit and chat, especially during weekday lunch rush because it gets really busy.

Service was very efficient. Even though we were sitting tightly in a corner, the waitress checked in on us and filled our glass of water.

Address: 908 Rue Sherbrooke O Montreal, QC H3A 1G3 Canada
Review:
As a fan of authentic Chinese noodle dishes, I absolutely loved this place. I had the large Beef Noodle Soup with the 三細 (San xi) noodles, with the shredded tofu skin as an appetizer. The texture of the tofu was perfect, almost exactly like a firm curd cheese. The broth of the soup is extremely fragrant and tasty! But beware of the large portion, it's massive.

Only downsides to this place are that the interior is very cramped and there isn't a lot of seating. Also keep in mind that they only take cash and debit, no credit.

Very highly recommended!

Address: 908 Rue Sherbrooke O Montreal, QC H3A 1G3 Canada
Review: The broth is very flavourful and the toppings are decent, the beef can be chewy at times. The noodles however are far too chewy for me and I wish they were softer. Still a decent experience. Place is very small and packed, and I visited in summer so can’t really recommend the place for its ambiance.

Address: 908 Rue Sherbrooke O Montreal, QC H3A 1G3 Canada
Review: Western chinese noodle soup classic with all the fragrance and flavors. It's all well balanced, the noodle are freshly made in store and you can watch it from the front window on the street, really cool. Professional and efficient staff. Quick service, you have to pay before you eat. The prices are fairly good with 15$ for the large bowl. The cucumber side is very good a must try! Plan to go back to try their other soups and noodles size. I recommend this place.

Address: 908 Rue Sherbrooke O Montreal, QC H3A 1G3 Canada
Review: I thing this place is one of the best Chinese noodles in Montreal. The service is nice and server was easygoing with us. The noodles were delicious. Highly recommend.

Address: 885 Boulevard Décarie Montreal, QC H4L 3M2 Canada
Review:
To put it simple, not the best but not the worst Korean restaurant out there. Food was okay but nothing too special about it.

Only one waiter doing everything from cash to serving food so keep that in mind if you go.He was very nice though.

Address: 885 Boulevard Décarie Montreal, QC H4L 3M2 Canada
Review:
The kimbap was great, it was freshly made; soft rice, perfect vegetable crunch and just very delicious.

The seafood noodles was amazing, lots of seafood and noodles and the taste was great, not too spicy. Love this ❤

Address: 885 Boulevard Décarie Montreal, QC H4L 3M2 Canada
Review: Ribs were cold and tough when served, they waited until the wings were ready to bring out the ribs. Seafood pancake was best part and the salad on the side was actually spicy unlike the wings. Service was good.

Address: 885 Boulevard Décarie Montreal, QC H4L 3M2 Canada
Review:
Although the restaurant could use a fresh coat of paint, you will be impressed by the huge variety of korean dishes present on the menu.
They offer excellent service during lunch and the bulgogi porc and rice cakes are just as good.

Address: 885 Boulevard Décarie Montreal, QC H4L 3M2 Canada
Review: Despite ordering from them after they had come back from break, the food ordered (gimbap) was slightly dry. However what was more displeasing was the tteobeokki that was in a large container and barely filled 1/4 of the container.. barely had any spicy sauce inside the container along with the rice cake, to top it off, there was a piece of paper inside the container stuck on the food... wasted quite a large amount (for the total amount) for such little quantity which was also disappointing based on its quality. Wouldn't recommend ordering gimbap and tteobeokki, however I don't know how their other dishes taste like, so I will not comment on them.

Address: 6704 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2S 3G2 Canada
Review: Okay, this place is AMAZING! the staff are so kind and the food is incredibly delicious. The gravy, mac and cheese, and biscuits were really really good and the desserts as well! I got the key lime pie and also tried a bit of the blueberry cheesecake. I seriously can’t wait to go back and try their chicken and waffles and other rotational desserts!!

Address: 6704 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2S 3G2 Canada
Review: I liked the setup of the restaurant a lot, and the key lime pie is very good - not too sweet or too 'creamy' given the balance of the white chocolate mousse and the sour lime cream. However though I find the mac and cheese a little too salty so I had to keep on drinking water... but still it's the best mac and cheese I've had so far!

Address: 6704 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2S 3G2 Canada
Review:
The fried chicken was decent. It was freshly fried so that made it taste good enough, but the batter felt a little off, maybe seasoning, maybe oil too hot, and the breast was a little dry. But overall, the biscuit was amazing, mashed potatoes and gravy were good and the waffles were tasty.

We also got a derby pie, if I remember the name correctly, and it tasted very sweet but not in a bad way, but the crust was very hard, dry and felt old.

I will give this place another chance at a later time. Hoping for a better experience!

Address: 6704 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2S 3G2 Canada
Review: Ordered sweet tea, waffles and fried chicken. Total is about 30$. Waffles and tea were good but the fried chicken was old, dry and under seasoned. You could get better chicken at your local grocery store where they let the pieces sit under a lamp for 16 hours at a time, and it would only cost you 8$. When chicken is the only protein you have, better make it good if you dare to charge that much..

Address: 6704 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2S 3G2 Canada
Review: I usually get the fried chicken and had tried some of the sides such as the coleslaw, mashed potatoes, hush puppies, pinto beans and buttermilk biscuit. Today, I decided to try the big nasty. It was so good and it did not disappoint. The service staff are friendly as usual and it was a pleasant dinning experience.

Address: 1510 Chomedey Boulevard Laval, QC H7V 3N8 Canada
Review: Was enjoyable.  I like when they play with fire. :) The chef was somewhat animated and made some nice jokes.

Address: 1510 Chomedey Boulevard Laval, QC H7V 3N8 Canada
Review: We were very pleased, fun atmosphere, good food and a very entertaining show. It took us some time to do it all but that's what the experience is about.

Address: 1510 Chomedey Boulevard Laval, QC H7V 3N8 Canada
Review: Wowwww I went to Toyo for the first time last night. Omg the food is delicious, our waitress was very nice great customer service. But the cherry on top was Ron our Cook he was hilarious it was like I was in a comedy show An awesome first experience looking forward to go again 5*

Address: 1510 Chomedey Boulevard Laval, QC H7V 3N8 Canada
Review: Overall we are very pleased with our experience at this restaurant. The food was great, the service was fast and efficient and more particularly the chef named Ron was amazing! He was humorous, engaged well with the table, was very entertaining and excellent at preparing the food. We have no complaints and will definitely recommend it and go back again.

Address: 1510 Chomedey Boulevard Laval, QC H7V 3N8 Canada
Review: The food was good, the experience was fun and our cook was quite the comedian.  The food portions were very large, at least mine was. I chose the vegetarian meal.

Address: 232 Rue Jean-Talon E Montreal, QC H2R 1S7 Canada
Review:
The moment I stepped into this restaurant I was welcome with a big smile and friendly attitude by the staff. They have tables inside and on the terrace too. The vibe of the place is a relaxed one, almost teleporting you to beautiful Mexico.
I found it a great place to savor the traditional Mexican dishes. Food was fresh, well seasoned and brought to the table pretty fast.

Address: 232 Rue Jean-Talon E Montreal, QC H2R 1S7 Canada
Review:
If you're in the mood for some delicious Mexican food, El Rey Del Taco next to the farmers market is a must-visit spot. We tried their pork tacos and enchiladas de mole, and they were equally as delicious! The pork was juicy and flavorful, and the mole sauce on the enchiladas was rich and delicious.

One thing to keep in mind is that El Rey Del Taco doesn't serve alcohol(at least they are not on menu)

Overall, I highly recommend El Rey Del Taco!

Address: 232 Rue Jean-Talon E Montreal, QC H2R 1S7 Canada
Review: Good service and beautiful interiors. My tacos were good except they were a little salty (it’s easy for carnitas to be salty tho). The churro was to die for, will definitely come back

Address: 232 Rue Jean-Talon E Montreal, QC H2R 1S7 Canada
Review: El Rey Del Taco is The place in Montreal for authentic tacos. Make sure you order by weight. Their al pastor is incredible. I'd recommend about 250g of meat per person.

Address: 232 Rue Jean-Talon E Montreal, QC H2R 1S7 Canada
Review: Sooo good! I just wish they put mushrooms on the burrito and the hibiscus water is super good, just a bit less sugar please! Your food is always perfect, Muchas gracias! Tudo sempre está muy saboroso!

Address: 1541 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1L4 Canada
Review:
I tried Roch le Coq on a Friday night with a friend. The place was PACKED and they had about 15 Door dash orders waiting on top of the customers who ordered as take-out. I heard good things about the place and really wanted to try it.

I ordered the Rochy sandwich which was very small, but inexpensive (5.50$) which could explain the price. The presentation was good, the pickles as well. It had kimchi mayo inside which was really good. The fries don't come with the burger, you have to order them on the side, they were good as well. The sauce that came with them had a weird taste, I didn't really like it. They also don't have ketchup, which I found weird. My friend ordered the 2 piece combo which was 14,75$ for the chicken, fries and a coleslaw salad (a bit expensive for what it was).

Overall, the chicken was great but nothing out of the ordinary, it was tasty and juicy. We waited around 20 minutes for our orders which seems reasonable considering that it was a Friday night and there were a lot of people!!

Address: 1541 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1L4 Canada
Review:
Philo Poutine/ Popcorn Fried Chicken, Wild Flower Honey Hot Sauce, Green Onions
.
I really really really loved this spot over the weekend. We got a couple of things but this poutine from @rochlecoq doesn't have a single flaw tbh. It's perfecty fried and crispy chicken, heavenly gravy and unique hot sauce all blend together in this harmonious poutine.
.
Ive been wanting to go here and try them out for months and months and finally I was in the area, happened to pass buy it and had to get it. Amazing food go and check them out!

Address: 1541 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1L4 Canada
Review: The dining experience  was 5 star really amazing, everything was on point ! But sadly two days after I had Delivry and we didn’t really like it and I don’t know why. But 4 star overall loved the employee the day I was there and the fried chicken is one of the best I had in Mtl.

Address: 1541 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1L4 Canada
Review: All around great place. Old school music, great friendly service and the chicken is on point. Great single combos and family friendly combos. Nice selection of sauces to dip your chicken into as well. Will definitely be coming back for some more of it all. A must try in my books

Address: 1541 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1L4 Canada
Review: Loved this place! One of the best chicken sandwiches I’ve eaten in Montréal, great fries too!! Also the guy the guys were so nice!

Address: 4007 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2W 2M4 Canada
Review:
A small group of four, we shared the shrimp cocktail, had lobster risotto and the sea bass for two dinner.  The shrimp was tasty, sweet and completed by fresh horseradish and cocktail sauce.  The sea bass was wonderful, perfectly crisp, light and flaky in a tray bean gravy with thin roasted fennel bulb and crispy shoe string potatoes. We were a hungry group so everyone enjoyed their dishes that night, yet all felt the same the next day.  😊

In addition our server was wonderful and had great stories to share on the history of Montreal and the changes happening in the Latin quarter today.

Address: 4007 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2W 2M4 Canada
Review: Enjoyed the food but wish we would have tried some different dishes. We had the catch of the day and the mussels, which were both tasty but nothing to rave about when it came to the flavour. The service was great and the restaurant has a fun vibe. Would definitely come back to try something else!

Address: 4007 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2W 2M4 Canada
Review:
Restaurant we booked shut down due to an electricity issues so we stumble upon Josephine impromptu. I have to say our experience was not the best despite the high pricetag of the restaurant. To start off as I was tasting the wine I had to select from a mini wine list, I mentioned that the temperature of the wine was not adequate and the waiter proceeded to convince me that my mouth was probably detecting the wrong temperature cos he "touched" the bottle and it was ok.
The service was very slow, slow to take orders, slow for food to come, slow to check back, slow to get the check and slow to pay.

Had the oysters and mignonette as a starter and they were good.  The main was the octopus and really the dish was problematic. The octopus itself was chewy, tasteless, if not for a strong artificial smoke taste.  It came with a caponata that had never heard of Sicily and a tasteless artichaud puree.

Other guests had:

- The Cesar salad that was good and the salmon tartar that was average.

- The mussels were  hard as stone (not sure how that is possible, may be they were recooked) and not enjoyable to eat.

Address: 4007 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2W 2M4 Canada
Review:
Highly recommend this restaurant. The food is wonderful and the space is bright and decorated beautifully.

We loved the grilled oyster mushrooms--so good! Both the lobster risotto and the moules frites were amazing. Nothing but praises for this menu.

Address: 4007 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2W 2M4 Canada
Review: Was really looking forward to a fine dining seafood restaurant experience. Instead was extremely disappointed in the food. , service and atmosphere. The server did not explain the dishes as they were served on your plate. The arctic char was a very small thin piece of dried out fish served with eggplant. She told us it was a large portion served with bok choy and potatoes. The wine by the glass was only 3 choices of very cheap quality white wine that did not go with the food at all. The music in the background was annoying and the entire atmosphere of the restaurant is unattractive and loud. It was also very pricey for that quality of food. I don’t usually give reviews but this one was necessary so as to let people know what to expect for their time and money.

Address: 4367 Rue Notre Dame Laval, QC H7W 1T3 Canada
Review:
Quite frankly possibly the most underrated Greek restaurant in Laval.

We got some takeout - it was ready very quick for a Saturday night. The pork gyro pita are fantastic, well balanced and stuffed to the brim. Pork is not too fatty. The moussaka was very good - probably the best we’ve had. Very fair prices.

I’m very interested in coming back and trying some of their other daily or weekly specials. The Greek meatballs, roasted pork or the lamb look amazing.

Glad we discovered this little gem. Don’t think we’ll need to go anywhere else in Laval to satisfy our Greek cravings. I think it deserves more recognition.

Address: 4367 Rue Notre Dame Laval, QC H7W 1T3 Canada
Review:
Welcome home. The food served here is a delightful showcase of traditional Greek cuisine, prepared with utmost care and attention to detail. What impressed me the most was the affordability of the dishes without compromising on taste or quality. It's truly a haven for those seeking authentic flavors at reasonable prices. I was in awe when I first glanced at the Skepasti platter that I ordered. And later, I was in absolute bliss after tasting it. The horiataki salad was also fantastic , the tomatoes were just perfect. As was the dill salad (psilokomeni) . The Greek potatoes will make you question every other potato you've eaten before. What was also a huge highlight was how tasty their olive oil was. They serve bread with your meal, and the olive oil tasted unlike any olive oil I've ever had. I could have drank an entire cup of it it was so good. The portions also are very generous. You are getting your money's worth.

The wines offered here are all imported from Greece, featuring a selection of high-quality wines. We were a party of 6 and we all thoroughly enjoyed each bottle we shared.

The ambiance of the restaurant is cozy and welcoming, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere to enjoy your meal. The friendly and attentive staff further enhanced the overall dining experience. Dom, our waiter took good care of us the entire evening. He helped us decide what to start with and made us feel confident in our selections based on what we liked and the portions .

If you're in Laval and craving traditional Greek cuisine at an affordable price, this restaurant in the Chomedey area is an absolute must-visit.

Address: 4367 Rue Notre Dame Laval, QC H7W 1T3 Canada
Review: Great food, vibe and service. The food is so good and yummy. The Greek Vibes are amazing. We were ported to Greece in this short period of time. Highly recommended.

Address: 4367 Rue Notre Dame Laval, QC H7W 1T3 Canada
Review:
I really like this place, if you are craving some good Greek food made by Nonna this is the place to go

The staff is always so nice and the food is so good, the portions are big, also if you get a plate it already comes with tsatiki so you don't have to buy extra which I love because alot of places you need to buy extra.

They have a small little dinning area which is nice

Definitely a must to try honestly

Address: 4367 Rue Notre Dame Laval, QC H7W 1T3 Canada
Review: We received an incredibly warm welcome and were presented with the daily specials. The cuisine was both fresh and outstanding, and the service was flawless. I couldn't help but observe the restaurant's remarkable cleanliness and the evident dedication and affection put into maintaining it.

Address: 11655 Boulevard Gouin Ouest Montreal, QC H8Y 1Y4 Canada
Review:
What a gem!  Stumbled upon this restaurant searching for a place to eat on Google maps!
The staff is SO friendly, the restaurant is really clean, and the food is outstanding!  The portions are extremely generous, soup, salad, shrimp, rice, veggies and whatever protein you chose.   The products used are great !   My 2 kids loved it and we cannot wait to go back !

Address: 11655 Boulevard Gouin Ouest Montreal, QC H8Y 1Y4 Canada
Review: We went as a group and ordered separate food, but then the chef divided the meals and only gave us small servings each. Food is also a bit bitter. I think it's too expensive for such small servings. Soup tastes good, though, and the chef entertained us well with the fiery stuff.

Address: 11655 Boulevard Gouin Ouest Montreal, QC H8Y 1Y4 Canada
Review: I only took one picture of the food because everything was so delicious I forgot about documenting my meal. The chef was great. The food came fast. The service was on point. I went with my wife for date night and we were really happy. It's good value. We'd definitely go back.  I would recommend going in a group to avoid sitting with random people.

Address: 11655 Boulevard Gouin Ouest Montreal, QC H8Y 1Y4 Canada
Review: This would be my first time at a Teppanyaki grill restaurant and I wasn't disappointed. They chef was super nice and personable I love the whole act. Food was cooked perfectly I went with the steak cuts and chicken. It was very delicious also the onion soup was great. I was with a big party and everyone agreed they had a good time. FYI you get what you pay for.

Address: 11655 Boulevard Gouin Ouest Montreal, QC H8Y 1Y4 Canada
Review: My first time at this style of restaurant and I loved it. Food was great (I never thought onion broth could taste so good). The staff are all attentive and very pleasant. And the chef was friendly, entertaining, and funny; overall a great host.

Address: 1575 Rue Fleury Est Montreal, QC H2C 1S7 Canada
Review:
Everything was perfect!
The most friendly helpful service! We shared a fun shot with our waitress.
The calamari was good, tuna tataki salad excellent, very good poutine, the burger so surprisingly amazing, the thai pasta was also perfectly done. We had the lava cake for dessert and it was so warm and good.
Will be coming back.

Address: 1575 Rue Fleury Est Montreal, QC H2C 1S7 Canada
Review:
Brought my mom here for supper and had the plance with various meats. Was more than we could finish and was delicious.

The waitress was wonderful and really kind, my mom doesn’t speak much french and I truly appreciated her efforts to ask my mom questions. I cannot share enough how nice the folks at this restaurant are.

As a local who lives in the area, I’m glad to have found this place and plan to return!

Address: 1575 Rue Fleury Est Montreal, QC H2C 1S7 Canada
Review: Very nice find. We were looking for a RSVP last minute in the area and found this gem of a place Food was very good my safe had the bavette which were grilled to perfection and I had the St. Louis rib which was falling form the bone Ambiance was nice and they have a well stock bar.Desert menu was unique ask for it and you will see...Tried one of their drinks gin with basil which was phenomenal will recommend and be back

Address: 1575 Rue Fleury Est Montreal, QC H2C 1S7 Canada
Review: Great Service from Samuel our waiter funny,friendly and knowledgeable of the Menu,we had many laughs !!!! Food was amazing, nice portions,so happy I went on recommendation of a friend !!! Will definitely go Back!!!! So nice to know we have a few good Restaurant on Fleury, Ahunstic

Address: 1575 Rue Fleury Est Montreal, QC H2C 1S7 Canada
Review:
Well hidden restaurant below the street Fleury,
Place is know for its Bib of beef 🥩

Nice atmosphere inside,Cosy decor and nice wine selection.Friendly service and Prices are decent. My favorite Restaurant on Fleury street 👌for these reasons.

Merci

Address: 5312 Patricia Avenue Montreal, QC H4V 1Z2 Canada
Review: It serves mostly take out, there is a sitting area with two tables, best for sitting while waiting for your order. The temperature in the restaurant is warm inside, so if you don't mind the heat, then dine in. The service was very good and professional.

Address: 5312 Patricia Avenue Montreal, QC H4V 1Z2 Canada
Review: 1st time and I found the patty to be very BIG in size and value.  I found the secret is to heat the patty either in oven, air fryer or toaster oven.  The pastry will be nice and crispy & fluffy.  If you microwave, the pastry will come out tuff and a bit hard to chew.  I found the to patty pastry was very thick and heavy overtaking the filling which seemed mildly spicy. Maybe it was the batch, but I wished there was more beef filling.  Anyhow, these are BIG patties.  Please, more filling, it would make them so much more enjoyable.  Thanks

Address: 5312 Patricia Avenue Montreal, QC H4V 1Z2 Canada
Review:
Best home made Jamaican patty's in westmount.Teal authentic.
Make sure u order in advance.

Address: 5312 Patricia Avenue Montreal, QC H4V 1Z2 Canada
Review: Quality has gone down over the years, one a great local business now, need work on customer service and business. They just got a few changes and take the business seriously. Good luck

Address: 5312 Patricia Avenue Montreal, QC H4V 1Z2 Canada
Review: Am honestly disappointed. In the past, their beef patties actually tasted like beef patties. Bought a patty and I felt like I was eating a bread crumb patty with little pieces of meat here and there. I don't know if they are attempting to save money by cutting down on the beef and increasing the portion of bread crumb but it shows in taste, texture and appearance. It looks very pale compared to how was before. Hope they go back to their old recipe.

Address: 4567 Rue Wellington Montreal, QC H4G 1W8 Canada
Review:
Loved the buzz and vibe of the place.

We ordered a bottle of wine but it took quite a while to get it.  Another couple arrived after us and they got drinks well before us, so maybe we just didn’t get the right person.

The Enchiladas were great, although I would have loved to have a little hot sauce.

My wife had the Picante Grilled Shrimp and Calamari.  They were not picante…because we didn’t get the accompanying sauce.  Asked once…nothing.  Asked a second time and finally got it.  This would have been solved had our wait person return a few minutes after serving to see if all was good.

We did give an extra tip to one guy that was running around giving 100%.  Although he didn’t serve us, we noticed his hard work.  Wow.

Maybe we will get him next time!

I will return, and hope we have a better experience.

Address: 4567 Rue Wellington Montreal, QC H4G 1W8 Canada
Review: Passing by and seeing this Peruvian restaurant, my friend is Peruvian and was happy to see that. This is my second Peruvian meal, compared to the first Peruvian restaurant I have been, this one was not very professional, there were two dishes with missing ingredients, my friend reminded the waitress to make up for it later. Other than that, the ambience, service and dishes were great and I loved the decoration of this restaurant

Address: 4567 Rue Wellington Montreal, QC H4G 1W8 Canada
Review: Delicious 😋 Peruvian food, very tasty 🤤 and fresh,the portions are abundant and satisfying.The service is great 😃 so is is the atmosphere with irs Peruvian music.The patella dish was amazing 🤩 especially the rice,amazing texture and seasoning.Loads of delicious dishes.

Address: 4567 Rue Wellington Montreal, QC H4G 1W8 Canada
Review: I highly recommend this cozy Peruvian restaurant. The quality of the food is consistent and the staffs are very welcoming. Once you try their tasty food, you will crave for it later. That’s how it makes you go back to the resto again and again! Overall, an superb restaurant for a foodie.

Address: 4567 Rue Wellington Montreal, QC H4G 1W8 Canada
Review: Best Peruvian food I've had in Canada BY FAR! The food tasted as it should - with authentic Peruvian seasoning - and it was DELICIOUS! And the service was EXCELLENT (even though it was a busy Friday night!) We were a group of 8 - and had reservations, so we were seated right away. My family and I will definitely be back - can't wait to try their other dishes on the menu!

Address: 597 Boulevard Côte Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L Canada
Review:
Very delicious food. The staff is super hospitable and welcoming.
The taste of the Kaak itself is amazing, as if I am taking a bite from home. (Very close taste to Kaak Abu Arab in Lebanon!)

By far, the Farfelu Kaakeh (3 cheese - Mozzarella, Akawi, Halloumi) is their signature Kaakeh. It is a MUST try.

I also ordered the Basterma & Cheese, as well as the Turkey and Cheese, very good taste, and the portions are big enough. If you are not a heavy Kaakeh eater, 1 Kaakeh is more than enough.

Prices are crazy good, compared to the size of the portion and ingredients the price is very acceptable.

Chez Wafi, chapeau bas, my expectations have been exceeded. Will I visit again, you bet I will.

10/10 Service.
10/10 Food.
10/10 Pricing.

Address: 597 Boulevard Côte Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L Canada
Review:
I would share my own experience, which might be different from others.
Food taste is average, not impressed.
They were not honest as they overcharged me way more than the published price.
Unfortunately, I figured out after I left the place, first and last visit.
My advice is to be careful when you pay if you want to go

Address: 597 Boulevard Côte Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L Canada
Review: Such delicious food! Always have to stop by when I’m Montreal! They are always so friendly and the food is incredibly fresh. Highly recommend!

Address: 597 Boulevard Côte Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L Canada
Review: Very good and delicious food. Very kind people !

Address: 597 Boulevard Côte Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L Canada
Review: An amazing kind lady and food was better than great and fresh

Address: 7112 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2S 3E2 Canada
Review: We unexpected had free soup and salad after we've ordered food. Cozy restaurant. Great amount of pork Katsu, it was really crispy and tasted really good. Karaage was average for me.

Address: 7112 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2S 3E2 Canada
Review: Food is really just average. I’ve had better Korean food is Montreal. I ordered their pork sauteed and although presentation and color is really nice, taste was lacking. The chicken katsu is actually better. Food is served is a long wooden platter, but portion is actually small.

Address: 7112 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2S 3E2 Canada
Review: Very tasty Japanese/Korean food, fairly affordable. They bring you a free miso soup and little salad to start. Really loved the vegetable tempura and the chicken katsu, especially. We also ordered the bibimbap, which was quite good as well, and edamame, which are always nice to have.

Address: 7112 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2S 3E2 Canada
Review: Absolutely delicious food, cooked with care and so much skill. I had the tofu teriyaki and my girlfriend had the beef, we were both blown away. The agedashi tofu was delicious as well. And the Tteok-kochi was perfection! Crispy outside, chewy inside, perfectly spicy. Miso soup and a fresh and delicious salad come with every meal. This place is such a find! Super yummy, affordable food, and caring service. We can’t wait to go back.

Address: 7112 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2S 3E2 Canada
Review: Delicious food! They have the best chicken katsu or okonomiyaki! I definitely recommend this place. The staff is very friendly! However, I wish they offer delivery. Whenever I open Uber eats or SkipTheDishes app, it is always close for delivery.

Address: 5136 Avenue du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4G5 Canada
Review:
I REALLY LOVED THE SOUP SOOOOOOOO MUCH!!
My sister also loved her dish so much.
I really really want to say a huge thank you to the owners!! I have left my instax camera at the restaurant, but the owner even ran out to find me and to give it to me back...감사합니다!!!
GREAT FOOD, GOOD SERVICE, NICE AND KIND HEARTED OWNERS
-->IT'S A RESTAURANT YOU CAN'T MISS!!

Address: 5136 Avenue du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4G5 Canada
Review:
One of the best korean restaurants I've tried. It just tastes like KOREA. The soup base is amazing. Good spicy level. It was huge but I couldn't help finishing it. Even the Banchan was excellent!  (Especially Kimchi!)
The owner is very kind. Def Must visit K-restau.
If Iived in Montreal, I'd come everyday.

Address: 5136 Avenue du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4G5 Canada
Review:
The freshly baked cowboy bones sizzled on the hot iron plate, and the aroma hit my face. The big plate full of cowboy bones made my mouth water. The marinated cowboy bones are very tasty, and the meat is very tender and easy to bite. It may be a little salty when eaten alone, but it is just right when paired with the black rice served by the store. Seasonal vegetables are also grilled, which is very appetizing and relieves greasy when paired with cowboy bones. We ordered the vegetarian tofu bibimbap. The bibimbap with sun eggs is very tempting. Bibimbap itself has only the aroma of rice and seasonal vegetables. The store will serve it with a Korean spicy sauce, which can be adjusted according to personal taste.
The hot sauce is also tempered, fragrant and not too spicy.

Address: 5136 Avenue du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4G5 Canada
Review: Beautiful warm restaurant....perfect for a family dinner or date night 😁 Fast and friendly service!!! The seafood pancake was so light and crispy.....every bite had delicious veggies and seafood! Bimbimbap was on point but the star of the show was definitely the Pork Bone Soup (Gamja Tang). The meat was the most tender thing ever and the soup was just out of this world. If you go here, you MUST try it!!! Enjoy.

Address: 5136 Avenue du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4G5 Canada
Review: This restaurant is a must-visit for anyone looking for delicious, authentic Korean food in a cozy, welcoming atmosphere. The family who runs it are incredibly hospitable and make you feel like you're dining in their home. I highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a delicious, authentic Korean meal.

Address: 6015 Saint-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2L8 Canada
Review:
I would try this place again.

I've only tried this location, so I will comment this location alone. They have 2 other locations.
Very nice staff.
The drinks were good.
They have a big selection of wines and a pretty big menu for cocktails aswell

This is a tapas restaurant so for those that like sharing it's perfect because the portions are not huge. It's perfect to get a few different things and share in between.

We got the oysters, the tuna tataki,the crab bites and also the salmon tartare. All of those were good. The only disappointment that I had was more of the tartare, I feel like the amount of salmon in the tartare was not enough and there were more of the other ingredients then the salmon in the tartare.(like tomato that looks like tartare but it's actually tomato).

Prices are not that expensive compared to other tapas restaurant in MTL

I definitely recommend this place, it's nice for a date night or to catch up with a friend. This location wasn't big.

Address: 6015 Saint-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2L8 Canada
Review: The oysters and the sangria are delicious! One of the best sangrias I’ve ever had. But there’s no air conditioner and it gets very hot.  The fried calamari 👎

Address: 6015 Saint-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2L8 Canada
Review: Great place to go eat and drink! The asian fusion food is excellent. I was surprised that the poutine bibimbap tasted that good. The flavours blended well. The tuna tataki was amazing and calamari was good. The service is great as well but my only thing that I would neatpick would be the decor that needs a bit more love but besides that, very good place to come and eat with some friends!

Address: 6015 Saint-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2L8 Canada
Review:
Nice restaurant with a budget friendly menu.
Music and ambiance was nice and welcoming.
The oysters were really good.
My friend ordered crab bites, those were very good as well.
There was a dish I chose that wasn't really to my liking and the waitress immediately spoke with management and offered to replace it with something else from the menu. She suggested two that were her faves and I ended up with the Tuna Tataki. It did not disappoint. Excellent dish, right down to the details on the plate.
We also ordered a mocktail of one of their drinks and it was so refreshing.
Would definetly recommend this spot.

Address: 6015 Saint-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2L8 Canada
Review:
Been wanting to go to la Bêtise for a long time and finallyhad the occasion to try.
They offered a special menu since it was their anniversary and we got to try their shrimp pasta with lobster bisque sauce.. If only it was on their menu all year long because it was EXCELLENT!
The truffle oil fries are a must! Lightly salted with a not too overpowering taste of truffle oil served with some kind of spicy mayo sauce.. Addicting!
Don't forget their 2$ oysters.. Had to order 2 platters, one as an appetizer and another for dessert.

Address: 575 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7M 1Y9 Canada
Review:
Exactly as it was when it first opened on Cote Des Neiges 40+ years ago!  Food, Staff, owner...all the same and all is as good and cheap as it ever was back in the day, iconic!

It's not high end fancy, sexy presentation, it's just tasty, great, cheap American Chinese food that comes to your table fast, fresh and hot!  Service as always... very rapid and courteous!

Address: 575 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7M 1Y9 Canada
Review: I went once in the past with my family, we really enjoyed the food but the service was pretty lacking. We decided to come back today, we had to wait 15 minutes to even get a table (when there were like 3 tables taken) and even then, we had to ask to get seated. We waited at least 30 minutes for someone to take our order until we asked someone, they said “a moment” and did not come back for another 10 minutes so we just left. If you have the patience of a saint and don’t mind waiting an eternity to eat, then the food is great, but they have to fix their customer service for sure, it would lowkey be less time consuming to go to the super market and cook the food yourself.

Address: 575 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7M 1Y9 Canada
Review: Pretty tasty food, tried the chicken with cashew nuts, fried rice and the salt and pepper shrimps, they were very good. The hot and sour soup could have used a little seasoning but everything else was very tasty, would definitely recommend if you're in the laval area

Address: 575 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7M 1Y9 Canada
Review: Really great! I had their yang chow fried rice, general tao, salt and pepper squid. All were really good, portions are gigantic. Service was quick and courteous. This is my go to Chinese restaurant!

Address: 575 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7M 1Y9 Canada
Review: Hard to review. Good place for a family to eat at low price and soft taste. For my part i preferred to have my plate with more taste. But in the same time i may not chose thr speciality. To retry one day.

Address: 3424 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7V 1K2 Canada
Review: After seeing and reading couple of unpleasant comments on their website, I decided to try it out myself.. Actually I believe all those comments were not fair to them specially with about rudeness of the wait staff. All I have seen and have to say; wait staff was kind, pleasant - respectful and top of the action….. In regards to food; I had a butter chicken, which was delicious fresh and had a good taste of the flavor. Rice and their non was fresh hot. Vegetable dish that I had was quite tasty as well. Our server was ( Harsh) special thanks to him in regards to explaining the menu and recommendations that he made. He was quite knowledgeable and having complete understanding of the menu. I can’t really remember the waiters name she was kind and walking around with water jar going table to table for refilling glasses. Overall we had an exceptional service and authentic Indian cuisine!!! I am not really very close to them otherwise I would have become their regular customer. But definitely I will go back and try some other delicious foods. P.S. ( to the owner or manager; please disregards all the previous negative comments about your wait staff. They all work very hard and they represent your business… Stop investigating all the fake comments about them. I seen it and witnessed that they are very welcoming and kind…. )

Address: 3424 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7V 1K2 Canada
Review: This is our go-to for Indian. With the monopoly in Laval, there’s no need to head to Jean Talon anymore. Their butter chicken is absolutely spot on. Naan is fantastic. Preferred the korma dish elsewhere, but still a really solid spot for comfort food. Bring your own wine & friendly service - even when they’re super busy.

Address: 3424 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7V 1K2 Canada
Review: Wow. That's a place I would definitly go back to. Food is so good and the service is nice! You have a lot of choices & Naan bread is huge !! I went for a takeout, and I forgot a small bag of food. The guy actually called me back. You don't see that in many places. The place is also beautiful.

Address: 3424 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7V 1K2 Canada
Review: Excellent Indian cuisine. Family run business. Home made dishes and affordable prices. A hidden gem. Try the butter chicken.

Address: 3424 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7V 1K2 Canada
Review: Delicious food…very good portion sizes. The samosas were the best I’ve ever had. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We were a group of 8 on a very busy day but everything was delicious!

Address: 1661 Boulevard de l'Avenir Laval, QC H7S 2N5 Canada
Review:
Cool place, the interior is not bad it’s a full menu place where you can fined an amazing international menue with alcohol 🥃
The best part was the food !!!! Delicious !!!! We really loved our plates
The service was not bas could be uplifted with a bit more of smiles
Prices were logical compared to a similar place
I will definitely visit it again to try more delicious food
Cheers

Address: 1661 Boulevard de l'Avenir Laval, QC H7S 2N5 Canada
Review:
Great spot for breakfast in Laval!

Food is fresh & delicious, my favorite are the potatoes! Good size portions and reasonably priced.

Service is great and quick. Definitely one of my favorite places to have brunch at.

Address: 1661 Boulevard de l'Avenir Laval, QC H7S 2N5 Canada
Review: I had a great breakfast. The food was served fast. The portions were a good size and the staff was nice.  I would definitely come again.

Address: 1661 Boulevard de l'Avenir Laval, QC H7S 2N5 Canada
Review: This restaurant is amazing and the service is impeccable! My friend and I went to brunch to celebrate our birthdays and our waiter was so warm and accommodating! The food is delicious, whether you're eating breakfast or lunch! And those potatoes 🤤 Definitely recommend, I will be going back!

Address: 1661 Boulevard de l'Avenir Laval, QC H7S 2N5 Canada
Review: I just had lunch at Kitchen 73 Laval and I was disappointed with the food and the manager’s service. I took the table d’hôte which included dessert and coffee. The appetizer and main course took a long time to arrive so I asked for the dessert and coffee to go. Instead, the manager comes to hand me the bag with the dessert and added that we shouldn’t take it to go nor can we take the coffee to go since they’re need to be consumed in the restaurant. I tell her that the main course was late and I’m out of time so that’s why asked for them to go. She adds : do you want to have your coffee now in the restaurant?! Obviously she’s didn’t get it! She could have just explained that they’re to be taken in the dining room and that she’ll make an exception if that’s such a big deal for them. At least, you gain a customer. But this time you lost a returning one.

Address: 1031 Boulevard des Laurentides Laval, QC H7G 2V8 Canada
Review:
This restaurant was recently recommended to us. Here we were for the first time. Service was excellent after waiting only about five minutes to get in. They even have a shelter to wait in outside, if it's bad weather.
Once in we were served quickly. Menus is simple and straight forward, place under a glass table top.
Started with a glass of Sangria for both of us and an appetizer of Caesar Salad, which was enough for both of us, tasty and fresh.
We ordered their specialty, which was the Fish and Chips (Single Piece), which came with a quarter of lemon, Tartar Sauce, and a side of Cole Slaw, needless to say plenty of home made fries. No frozen food here.
Definitely good value for your money here.

Address: 1031 Boulevard des Laurentides Laval, QC H7G 2V8 Canada
Review:
We’re on a mission to find the best fish and chip place around town. For context we are bench marking against the Fish Shack in Lunenburg NS which I consider a 10/10.  So far this does not disappoint with a strong 8.5 to 9 out of 10. The portions are large, but not greasy. Take the double, you won’t regret it. Since it was our first time, my partner took two and I took one… yes I stole 1/2 of his second ;) and absolutely will be taking the double next time.
The fries are standard size, home made and crispy. The cole slaw, on point!  Tartar sauce was sweeter than expected (still very good- not knocking it) and really enjoyed the dill sauce (not as sweet and very “dilly”).
We did not try the deserts, maybe next time.
Note the place doesn’t look like much, but don’t be put off by the location or aesthetics. The food is an epicurean’s dream.
Service was really good also, we were greeted and sat right away, namely because we went for lunch on a Saturday. They don’t take reservations, so if you’re going during peak hours there will most likely be a long wait… totally worth it.

FYI not much choice on the menu which IMHO is a good thing, didn’t see any veg options aside from soup and salad (but that’s not why we’re going there).

Address: 1031 Boulevard des Laurentides Laval, QC H7G 2V8 Canada
Review: Great place, I really loved the fish and chips! The portions are very generous, service was quick and polite, really great place! Highly recommended!

Address: 1031 Boulevard des Laurentides Laval, QC H7G 2V8 Canada
Review: A friend recommended this restaurant to me, saying that they made the best fish 🐟 chips in laval. My friend was right!!! Had the cream of cawliflower soup, fish n chip platter (fresh cut homemade French fries 😋) and ended my meal with an upsidown strawberry 🍓 cake. Hats 👒 off to the entire staff , the restaurant is extremely clean and inviting. Thank you, I will definitely be back soon.

Address: 1031 Boulevard des Laurentides Laval, QC H7G 2V8 Canada
Review: Food was delicious, portions were generous, service was amazing. We went there for my mother-in-law's birthday and out of 8 adults, everybody loved their food.

Address: 3131 Boulevard de la Côte-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1Y6 Canada
Review:
Went for a late night snack. Love the ambiance. I had the sliders and the spinach dip. The sliders were good, but I would have preferred it with some tomatoes and maybe a bit more cheese.
The spinach dip was delicious but the chips were just ordinary.
The waitress was extremely nice. Personally, I thought the service was great. I would definitely come back.

Address: 3131 Boulevard de la Côte-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1Y6 Canada
Review:
I always get the chicken BBQ pizza and seafood linguine. Never fails to hit the spot.
Quality of both depends on the day though but it’s all good, it’s been fine so far. Some days are just better than others.
Go on their website to make a reservation to make sure you have a spot. Really easy and simple.

Address: 3131 Boulevard de la Côte-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1Y6 Canada
Review: Not bad at all. It's decent. It's not perfect but it's good. The food is delicious, meatball spaghetti could be better. They make the pizza in front of you.

Address: 3131 Boulevard de la Côte-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1Y6 Canada
Review:
Much much above any expectations. This wonderful and rich choice of beers. Really tasty Degustation sets, ive tried 2 of them.
Great and friendly, fast, polite and joyful service.
Atmosphere is exactly what you need after a long day at office
Next visit i’ll come again

Address: 3131 Boulevard de la Côte-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1Y6 Canada
Review: The food at the restaurant was excellent, but the service was disappointing. The server did not know the menu, which led to some confusion and delays in getting our order taken. Despite this, the quality of the food made up for the lackluster service.

Address: 9443 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2M 1S5 Canada
Review: Absolutely love coming here. When ever friends come from out of town they want to come here first. Great service, amazing food, and they are so nice and welcoming. Always get good laught. Such a great addition to the neighborhood.

Address: 9443 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2M 1S5 Canada
Review: Best French coffee barister in Ahuntsic Cartierville. Enjoy a delicious meal or take out

Address: 9443 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2M 1S5 Canada
Review: Excellent kitchen, cosy place, nice owner. Very good coffee, excellent meat.

Address: 9443 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2M 1S5 Canada
Review: Excellent food and 10/10 customer service

Address: 9443 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2M 1S5 Canada
Review: Dominique has brought to life a long-cherished dream, he is a wonderful host and this is most definitely a great addition to the neighbourhood.  A must visit!

Address: 20 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2W 1G6 Canada
Review: The atmosphere and the vibe of this place is awesome! The staff were friendly, attentive and their recommendations were top notch. The waitress said they are known for their dumplings and she was not wrong. Really good place for drinks and aperitifs!

Address: 20 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2W 1G6 Canada
Review:
Cocktails were great and special, however I don’t think the dumplings were good.

Food is soso.

I still give a five stars as the servers were super nice !

Address: 20 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2W 1G6 Canada
Review: Bar Suzanne is such a find:  fabulous gastropub food available most of the day, and happy patrons gathering, laughing, talking, communing. We loved the open balcony and tables in the bar where we could perch and watch the enlivening street life below, while the best music wooed us into a state of joy.  Bar Suzanne should be kept a secret so it can retain its fresh innocence but it’s a secret worth shouting from the rooftops. Go there, eat dumplings, libate and you’ll be writing the next rave review!

Address: 20 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2W 1G6 Canada
Review: Love this place. The cocktails and food are very delicious. And there prices are very reasonable. If you like something casual for a date or with friends. This is the perfect place. Staffs are very friendly and of course, there cocktails are on point too. Will definitely come back.

Address: 20 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2W 1G6 Canada
Review: Cozy atmosphere, ambient light, great choice of soundtracks. The place offers a large selection of wines which was a nice surprise. Not overcrowded. The asian fusion fries with french vinaigrette and seaweed are a truly delicious snack on a winter night. The only downside are probably the prices which are a bit high in my opinion.

Address: 8870 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2M 1R6 Canada
Review:
Venue is kid friendly.  Lots of entertainment from staff!  Generous on the food!  Can be loud at times.

Warning… forks were not invented. So good luck if you’re asking for one to eat your salad.  😜

Only downside, because of the location, parking can be a challenge.

Venue DOES NOT ACCEPT CREDIT CARD!

Address: 8870 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2M 1R6 Canada
Review:
Went for a night out with my girlfriend to check out what it was all about. This place was even better than what we imagined. The food, the people, the atmosphere is all amazing. A little more on the pricier side, though you're going for the experience of dining at a tavern filled with rustic decorations, captivating servers and charismatic bards.

I don't want to say too much so you can experience it on your own. Though it was our first time going, we're definitely coming back!

(Merci Chopin)

Address: 8870 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2M 1R6 Canada
Review: Absolutely an amazing place with the best atmosphere and really great food too. Hats off to Gaspard who was our host that evening. Also the troubadours were really nice too.

Address: 8870 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2M 1R6 Canada
Review: Amazing staff. Ambiance was impeccable. A knight was walking by regularly to talk to us (roleplaying). The barb was incredible. Took request song. It is an ambiance dinner. We were last service, so they asked for the attention of the room and told a story about a dragon. We then all share the blood of the dragon, and it waste "worth it." I think I'm becoming a dragon. Would recommend in a heartbeat for anyone who wants to have a medieval ambiance feast!

Address: 8870 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2M 1R6 Canada
Review: We had a great evening of boisterous entertainment and hearty fare at the Red Dragon Inn. The decor and staff really helped the medieval theme, transporting you back to a simpler time. Tasty and filling food all washed down with good ale (Boréale). Not the place for a quiet romantic evening but one to be thoroughly enjoyed with good company as you bang the tables and raise your tankard to the troubadour who regales you with tales and song.

Address: 124 Rue Fleury Ouest Montreal, QC H3L 1T4 Canada
Review: The food is decent quality but there's no variety nor something special. The place lacks of atmosphere.

Address: 124 Rue Fleury Ouest Montreal, QC H3L 1T4 Canada
Review: As you step your foot into the restaurant, you are welcomed by the magnificent  setting it may be a small restaurant but it is cozy and we got a lot of help.from the caring staff, with recomendations and good descriptions of the plates, the cheff was also on point. Great di ing experience.

Address: 124 Rue Fleury Ouest Montreal, QC H3L 1T4 Canada
Review: Excellent Peruvian restaurant with with 2 other couples and we all like it Will be back

Address: 124 Rue Fleury Ouest Montreal, QC H3L 1T4 Canada
Review: One of the best restaurant in Mtl hands down. Ceviche de Thone is out of this world. The service was steady and excellent. Cant wait for the new menu on next month!

Address: 124 Rue Fleury Ouest Montreal, QC H3L 1T4 Canada
Review: Fantastic place! Great food, great wine. That place should be packed on a saturday night, yet it was as if we were uncovering some precious secret!

Address: 9735 Boulevard de l'Acadie Montreal, QC H4N 2W2 Canada
Review: The best place for a real 100% Lebanese brunch. The food is really good. If you want to taste everything, I advise you to go in a group. The portions are huge and made to be shared. The only negative point is that the wait is long and it is not possible to make a reservation... There is not much space and the restaurant is too popular for its size. But it's worth it. I highly recommend it, the service is fast, the portions are generous and the price is reasonable.

Address: 9735 Boulevard de l'Acadie Montreal, QC H4N 2W2 Canada
Review:
The traditional lebanese breakfast place in Montreal. The food was great it really feels and tastes like you’re in Lebanon. Unfortunately the service is not that great. They missing the smile 😊 and if they do smile, it doesn’t feel genuine.
This is a highly recommended place if you are in Montreal and starving for a Lebanese Breakfast
Bonne appétit

Address: 9735 Boulevard de l'Acadie Montreal, QC H4N 2W2 Canada
Review:
We came here for Sunday brunch.

There's no reservations and the place is very small, they give you a number and you wait until they call you. We waited for about 30 mins and we were seated.

The place is very small that the tables are all so close to each other, you can clearly hear other ppls conservation, it's very loud and there's also alot of families with kids

If you are looking to go somewhere quit to eat brunch this is not the place to go.

When you seat down they give you tea, the tea wasn't to my liking at all.
They don't offer glasses of water so we got bottle of water?

They also give you complimentary plate of olives, turnip, cucumber and tomatoes.

We ordered the spicy cheese and zahtaar sage, that was very good, I think it was my favorite. It was very big and came on a board.

We also got the professor lebneh, the tahini foul and the meat egg, they were okay nothing especially, the tahini foul was lemony, I felt like there was just too much lemon in there.

Will I go back I don't know, this is not a place you would go every week, it's a once a few months vibes

Address: 9735 Boulevard de l'Acadie Montreal, QC H4N 2W2 Canada
Review:
The best lebanese/syrian  authentic breakfast or brunch you can ever have in montreal. The taste takes me back to lebanon. Service is amazing, friendly stuff and so kind  🥰
I love the idea of the  small corner organised for kids with some toys and books. Lovely place😍 will come back again

Address: 9735 Boulevard de l'Acadie Montreal, QC H4N 2W2 Canada
Review: The food there is really tasty! The best Syrian/Lebanese breakfast in town. we were group of 5. The place was crowded so we had to wait about half an hour to get in. The service was okay the food came really fast. Very nice atmosphere, definitely going back again. I recommend you to try Syrian Fatteh . Plus you will be served a cup of tea once you sit down and it’s re-fill.

Address: 1238 rue Mackay Montreal, QC H3G 2H4 Canada
Review:
Amazing food, great portions, excellent service, and very friendly staff.
I ordered the Tabouleh salad, whoch came in a good portion suitable fir 2 people, it was very fresh and tasty. As for the hot starter, I tried the pastrey plate and it was delicious For the main, I got the shish Tawook chicken, I’d say it was one of the best shish Tawooks I’ve ever had in my life. The chicken was very juicy and tender and it was well marinated. For the dessert, the knafe is a must have, I tried it with their black mint tea and it was delicious! Overall, this place is a must try!! Highly recommended!

Address: 1238 rue Mackay Montreal, QC H3G 2H4 Canada
Review: I loved this place! First of all I’m lebanese so you can imagine how much I love Lebanese cuisine! It’s just the best, right? That said, I can honestly say how authentic the taste of their menu items is. We ordered the dips, the  garlic potatoes, some cheese rolls, Fattouch, and Knefe is a must at the end yumm! Service is great. Make sure you reserve because it’s almost always full!

Address: 1238 rue Mackay Montreal, QC H3G 2H4 Canada
Review:
I love lebanese cuisine and this place was really good!
The staff were really nice, polite and friendly!
The food was good too!
We got Moussaka and I loved it! That was really delicious!
We also got Shish Taouk and Shish Taouk chili and it was good too!
Overal, liked the place and the food!

Address: 1238 rue Mackay Montreal, QC H3G 2H4 Canada
Review: Excellent authentic Lebanese food. A little on the pricier side but justified by being one of the top I've had in Montreal to date. The place is small but it's part of it's charm. The service was A1 with great attention to detail. I'd can't even recommend a dish as everything I tried was cooked to perfection. You should definitely reserve in advance if you want to dine in.

Address: 1238 rue Mackay Montreal, QC H3G 2H4 Canada
Review: Cute place with good food. We got the degustation trempette and the Shish Taouk. The hummus and baba ghannouj were our favourite while the muhammara wasn’t the best. The chicken in the Shish Taouk was nice and flavourful.

Address: 861 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L7 Canada
Review: I highly recommend this place for special occasions. They are consistent in their preparation and the rolls always taste amazing. The way the rice is prepared is a key part of what makes sushi so delicious and Kyoto does it perfectly with just the right amount of vinegar/sugar. Combine that with their great fish and high quality ripe avocados = a real special treat :)

Address: 861 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L7 Canada
Review: Great place! Love the delicious & delicate dragon eyes, as well as the Crab leg tempura! The wasabi, I love it, so fresh and just right!

Address: 861 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L7 Canada
Review: The best place in Montreal. The sushi was delicious and fresh. A great service given by the young gentleman. I highly recommend this restaurant !

Address: 861 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L7 Canada
Review: Kyoto is a cozy and inviting family run Japanese restaurant that offers outstanding quality sushi with fresh and high-quality ingredients. The menu is extensive and very authentic food, I recommend trying the crab tempura (Kyoto) and to order the kyoto special for a taste of Japan. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, and the staff provide attentive and friendly service. It's a must-visit for sushi lovers

Address: 861 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L7 Canada
Review: Had a lovely meal, it’s a bit far from my neighbourhood but would go again, though there’s no photo we also had a korroke too and it was great!

Address: 3035 Boul Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: I celebrated my birthday there and it was a wonderful experience!  If you like steak, this place is very suitable for you.  I had a piece of prime rib and it was cooked to perfection.  The atmosphere is nice and the service is very good.

Address: 3035 Boul Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: The food has always been good every time I came and the servers are very friendly and professional. It’s well located with easy access to the highway and Carrefour Laval mall.

Address: 3035 Boul Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review:
Absolutely amazing! The Keg Steakhouse in Laval never disappoints.

It’s the perfect spot for a night out with friends or a special occasion with loved ones. The team at Crown Movers has been celebrating there for years and it's always a hit! The atmosphere is warm and inviting, and the steaks are always done to perfection.

The service is top-notch, with friendly and knowledgeable staff that make you feel right at home. Most importantly for us protein lovers the Medium rare is always done right!

Address: 3035 Boul Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: We went last week for my husband's birthday, terrific experience, food was delicious and they provided a slide of an amazing cake the six of us enjoyed. Highly recommend!

Address: 3035 Boul Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: Monday night at The Keg. Six of us decided to pop in for a bite. Plenty of people to make it feel right. We had the nachos, calamari, burgers, shrimp, ribs, steak and a slice of cake. Everything was on point, cooked well and very tasty...but the calamari was small, tough and tasteless. The service was polite and attentive.

Address: 1206 Avenue Union Montreal, QC H3B 3A7 Canada
Review: Extremely popular joint. It was hard to get a reservation on a Thursday night—loud, vibrant, and zestful crowd. Great wait staff. Portions are small tapas style. We ordered tacos, and they were one of the best tacos we have ever had, including in Mexico. I recommend it 100%.

Address: 1206 Avenue Union Montreal, QC H3B 3A7 Canada
Review: 4.5/5. Al pastor tacos: decent. Fried chicken tacos: not bad. Ribs: tasty, a tad pricy, small amount. Churros: good. Mezcal: enjoyed neat, served with orange slices dipped in sweet salty spices. Overall, good food though on the expensive side for what you are getting. Taco presentation on the messy side.

Address: 1206 Avenue Union Montreal, QC H3B 3A7 Canada
Review: Delicious tacos and ceviche! Great quality-price and very fast and friendly service 👌. A bit loud though during lunch rush hour so not the best place to chat. Still highly recommend.

Address: 1206 Avenue Union Montreal, QC H3B 3A7 Canada
Review: Fast and good service , delicious food and compostable takeout containers. What more could you ask for? The pozole verde soup and the cauliflower general Tao with tamarind, agave, coriander and garlic sour cream were delicious , as were the truffle mushroom cheese quesadillas I took to go. I’d come back to try the cauliflower taco :)

Address: 1206 Avenue Union Montreal, QC H3B 3A7 Canada
Review: Somehow I took no pictures of the tacos which were the best part! Okay the drinks were also great and the bartender was incredibly friendly and helpful. It was a kind of eclectic mixing of foods, but everything tasted good (except maybe the ceviche—it wasn’t bad but it wasn’t what I expected as ceviche: it was kind of like guacamole with some fish in it).

Address: 2373 Boulevard Marcel-Laurin Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1K4 Canada
Review: Fabulous Lebanese restaurant with an aged but still elegant setting. Meant more for groups willing to share plates vs individual orders. More variety in the appetizers than the éntrees. Definitely a pricier restaurant for the portions, but the quality is high. Particularly with their Meats. Service was a little slow even though it was not busy.

Address: 2373 Boulevard Marcel-Laurin Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1K4 Canada
Review: I went here with my lebanese girlfriend and she absolutely loved it. so did i, everything, everything!! was good, i don’t remember all the names of the plates but definitely try chef choice of grillades, and that raw kibeh entree, is typical lebanese dish. very good, abit expensice, but 100% worth it. family owned and been open for decades

Address: 2373 Boulevard Marcel-Laurin Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1K4 Canada
Review: One of the oldest middle eastern restaurants in Montreal, the place is traditionally old, but the food and service are amazing and the place as a whole is family-oriented. The grilled fillet mignon is fabulous 👌.

Address: 2373 Boulevard Marcel-Laurin Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1K4 Canada
Review:
Great Libanon ambiance
Cozy
7./10 for the food
Rice not famous
Meat needs more passion and seasoning.

Great with family

Address: 2373 Boulevard Marcel-Laurin Saint-Laurent, QC H4R 1K4 Canada
Review:
A well known Lebanese restaurant that I had the pleasure to try for the first time.
We had a meeting first  they organized that we can meet in a private room with water and coffee service. After the meeting, we went out of the room. We had our table already prepared. Food and service are excellent.  The best was the falafel plate. A place to recommend

Address: 1695 Boulevard de l'Avenir Laval, QC H7S 2N5 Canada
Review: Love this restaurant. The staff is amazing and so is the food. Nice portions and a beautiful atmosphere. They have a private upstairs area that seat 30-55 ppl. I always feel like I’m with family when I eat here. The BEST IN MONTREAL & LAVAL surrounding area.. A MUST

Address: 1695 Boulevard de l'Avenir Laval, QC H7S 2N5 Canada
Review:
This was my first time here and I came with a big group for a birthday so that could affect my experience but if i had to describe it, it wasn't good but wasn't bad either.

The food was okay, we had nachos and calamari that we shared for appetizers and for my main meal i had the filet mignon with peppercorn sauce accompanied with salmon tartare, mashed potatoes and vegetables.
-The nachos were good.
-The calamari was good but everyone that had some felt sick by the end of the night.
-The filet mignon was ok not a lot of flavor and even with the peppercorn sauce it was still ok.
