-The salmon tartare was good and fresh, maybe a little more seasoning but overall I'd have it again.
-The mashed potatoes were a little bland to my taste but was good with the peppercorn sauce.

For the service, they had multiple big groups that night so it could effect this but for our group we were over 20 and had only one server. They never came to check for water or that everyone had, only at the end did we get more after asking, we had drinks (the drinks were good) in the beginning as well but they never came back to ask if we wanted more. I never had a set of utensils and had to grab from another table (this could be a mix up with a big group). The server was nice and handled multiple groups hence why I can't blame her but they could have added more servers, she had two big groups in all that so of course some things will be missing.

Overall the experience was ok, i don't know if I'd go back.
I've attached some photos of my meal and drinks we had.

Address: 1695 Boulevard de l'Avenir Laval, QC H7S 2N5 Canada
Review: Really good place to eat. Food is amazing and service is great! Perfect place for a big group or big family dinner.

Address: 1695 Boulevard de l'Avenir Laval, QC H7S 2N5 Canada
Review: Great Food and great atmosphere but the service is amazing, one of the best I've seen in 40 + years. When Madison says that service is a priority, they really seem to mean it and it is reflected in the attitude of every employee in the restaurant. Special praises for our server Giovanni, his service blew me away. From his initial greeting to the moment we left, his service was well above 5 stars. Simply put, if I ran a restaurant, I would have offered him a management position right on the spot. Thank you for a great experience!

Address: 1695 Boulevard de l'Avenir Laval, QC H7S 2N5 Canada
Review:
I was going for my usual "Sure-shot" meal when a family looked at me and said; "Why chicken Vlad?! You should try something else today. Like the Filet Mignon for example."

I was like, okay. Why not, as long as I see no blood on my plate 🤦🏽‍♂️🤣. So the waiter came through and it was time to order.

Despite all the sarcasm on the table, she managed to understand my picky request. She even went as far as saying that her grandmother loves it just like that too lol.

Long story short, I really enjoyed my meal. Big shoutout to the waiters who made our stay a fabulous one tonight 😉.

Address: 30 Boulevard Curé-labelle Laval, QC H7L 3B5 Canada
Review:
Nice setup with a good outdoor layout. It was a bit chilly so we went inside. Inside has more a bar/supper club vibe. Music was nice but at certain times super loud. Will definitely try to sit outside next time.
Food:
We ordered two appetizers the cheese platter and gnocchi. Both were good, good size and nice presentation
For the main, we ordered the ravioli with lobster and mushrooms. Really good. A bit on the salty side but loved it.
The grilled octopus was also delicious
Dessert:
We just had the churros as the creme brûlée had whiskey in it and thought it could be sour.
Overall nice experience and will definitely come back

Address: 30 Boulevard Curé-labelle Laval, QC H7L 3B5 Canada
Review: This place was absolutely awesome. The oysters were so fresh and massive, we ordered multiple different plates and everything was good. The waitress was very friendly and our drinks were always kept full. I am removing a star because there were a lot of young staff standing by the kitchen hugging and touching each other and it was so unprofessional to have that right by our table all night.

Address: 30 Boulevard Curé-labelle Laval, QC H7L 3B5 Canada
Review:
Sunday it seems like oyster 1$

They were mainly good, drinks r good but a little expensive.  Food was perfect, price is with the market but service was not there..
no one came back to ask if it was ok. The two staffs were probably new, and they were always talking in the corner.

The good food kept the restaurant at 4/5 stars.

Address: 30 Boulevard Curé-labelle Laval, QC H7L 3B5 Canada
Review: The service we got was borderline unnaceptable. Having been there more than a dozen times over the last few years, July 2023 we jad the gnocchis which were utterly dissapointing, cocktails were watery... first time dissapointed at le Boating.  Will be back and hope that it was a nad night amd new staff in the kitchen and at the bar?

Address: 30 Boulevard Curé-labelle Laval, QC H7L 3B5 Canada
Review:
Overal 3/5, definitely not what it used to be. They need to have more bars in this place. You're gonna wait over 5 mins (sounds like nothing until you're actually waiting) just to get a drink.

And the drinks aren't consistent. They're stronger towards the end of the night. Probably their way of getting people out faster.

Address: 424 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A3 Canada
Review:
This is one restaurant we always visit every time we are in Montreal. The staff are always very friendly and helpful. One employee even recognized us although it’s been four years since we were there last time.

Their sushi is not the traditional type, which is why they call it fusion sushi. But their food, from sushi, maki to sashimi, it is always fresh. We have never had any bad experiences. Their prices are a bit higher now. For the service we received and the great quality food they prepared, it was still worth it in my opinion.

Address: 424 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A3 Canada
Review:
Its easy to say that the chef knows what is doing.

Great quality, great technic, friendly and qualified staff.

Order the degustation and enjoy your food.

Address: 424 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A3 Canada
Review: Lots of people recommended the “Christmas tree” appetizer so we started with that and loved it! The table also ordered the small sashimi plate, the nigiri plate, and a Madonna roll. All of the fish was fresh and everything tasted good. But I didn’t love that our server was not confident in which fish came on the sashimi and nigiri plates when we asked what they were. Service overall was not great, but I did love the atmosphere and playlist.

Address: 424 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A3 Canada
Review: My favourite sushi spot in the city. The space is cozy but not cramped, with fun decor and music. The staff is always super friendly, and of course the food is awesome. I’ve tried most things on the menu and have never been disappointed, but make sure to get the Christmas trees as an appetizer!

Address: 424 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A3 Canada
Review: Must-have whenever we're in Montreal. The food is so fresh, the sushi rolls are super unique and delicious, and Chico remembered my order from a year ago! Amazing everything: food, service, and super cute hoodies! 10/10 Can't wait to be back!!

Address: 851 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2H9 Canada
Review: The vibe the place gave us: true haute cuisine. Very exotic dishes, super tasty, excellent customer service, very calm atmosphere. We could talk and it was just awesome for a date or a friends catch up. Love it!!! We will go again

Address: 851 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2H9 Canada
Review:
Upscale African restaurant, with different traditional cuisine throughout the continent. Absolutely delicious dinner, everything was breathtaking. Portion sizes were very small  yet expensive, I just wished there was more to savor.
Beautiful atmosphere, friendly staff and very quaint. Highly recommended.

Address: 851 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2H9 Canada
Review:
Quaint restaurant serving amazing sub Saharan African food.
Service was great
Drinks: Asmara and Dawa were amazing
Food:
4 course tasting menu and artic char(fish dish)
Dessert: puff puff with amarula/mango ice cream

Address: 851 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2H9 Canada
Review: Great food and great service! We loved the zucchini starter and the pintade dish! We recommend!

Address: 851 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2H9 Canada
Review: Exquisite service. The waitresses were both lovely. We ended up on a special anniversary night and the menu was spectacular.  Wasn’t the quickest but, that is fine since the food was amazing. The Salmon appetizer and the Salmon entree were cooked to perfection. The goat was equally good and i had no idea you could add maple syrup as a sauce to goat. This restaurant was one of the highlights to my trip to Montreal.  The only downside was the salad and the cocktail (Mombassa) wasn’t of the same standard as the other food. However Id still drink that again too. Can’t wait for my next Montreal trip to revisit this place.

Address: 4185 Rue Drolet Montreal, QC H2W 2L5 Canada
Review: Cute spot for ramen. The food was a little overpriced but all in all a good experience. I loved being able to choose the saltiness level of the dish. Also the service was great. They do not take reservations and there’s only a small seating area so I would make sure to go on a weekday or early on a weekend. The chicken soup base was delicious and I wish I tried the thicker noodles. All in all, a great dining experience.

Address: 4185 Rue Drolet Montreal, QC H2W 2L5 Canada
Review: (5/5) For everything. The service was really good, the server was really pretty. And they gave us a complimentary drink due their renovation. The broth was well seasoned and creamy, the tokontsu was delicious which is the most special dish. The sides like the takoyaki were normal and tasted like any other.

Address: 4185 Rue Drolet Montreal, QC H2W 2L5 Canada
Review: Insane ramen which fully exceeded all expectations I had based on the hype of this place. Well worth the wait, but suggest going for lunch to beat the crowds. I haven’t had ramen this good since a salaryman-filled hole in the wall in Kyoto. The broth is so incredibly flavoured, the noodles are absolute perfection and even the pork in the ramen was marinated with some sort of sweetness. The croquettes are to die for (we ate them so quickly I totally forgot to take a photo) and the karaage was phenomenal with some of the best sauce I’ve ever seen paired with it (photo is one piece less than what arrived as we couldn’t help ourselves from tasting). The food is absolutely a 100/10 and can’t wait to go back to try to other menu items. Note that the ramen side is currently closed for renovations, so we ate on the other side. The service was a bit all over the place (eg. got our beers after our first appetiser was out) but still recommend this place nonetheless. If you’re going to eat ramen anywhere in Montreal and want a true Japanese dish, make sure to stop in here.

Address: 4185 Rue Drolet Montreal, QC H2W 2L5 Canada
Review: I went a Monday evening and it was quite busy as we had to add ourselves to their virtual waiting list. The place was very packed as we were going to have to wait over an hour to sit. We ended up sitting at the bar area instead. The place is a little small and there was not that much room overall . The guy at the bar was very friendly and gave us a good service. The ramen was good quality and you can customize it with the order sheet. They are generous with the meat portion and their chicken teriyaki was very good. They also have many interesting options excluding the ramens . They also give extra dressings on the side for the ramens which was a nice feature as well . Their cocktails were good and they have many unique options.

Address: 4185 Rue Drolet Montreal, QC H2W 2L5 Canada
Review: The ramen is always good. Our service was quite slow and the server got our order mixed up. But they apologized and gaved us free dessert. Overall, it is a nice restaurant with caring servers.

Address: 196 Rue Fleury O Montreal, QC H3L 1T5 Canada
Review: Retro looking bistro inclining towards a classic fine restaurant. A bit pricey though. It is worth visiting once or twice, but that's it unfortunately. Their food is ok-ish. I give, a rare for me, four stars to Les Cavistes simply the kitchen's saucier made a much better job then the chef who grilled my cheap-cut steak. In fact, the sauce was notice-worthy I should admit. I cannot say the same for their pasta, which lacked the essence of oily-spicy-aromatic textural balance. If not the sauce, what's in pasta??? The apperatifs tray was aesthetically pleasing yet harbored ridiculously small quantities. I simply was not impressed by it. During covid-19, they let you scan a q_code and the menu miracalously appears on your phone, if you will be moved by the action. Overall, I recommend this restaurant for the uninitiated to give it a try.

Address: 196 Rue Fleury O Montreal, QC H3L 1T5 Canada
Review: This place is a bit out of the way of you are in Montreal for a weekend. However it is a great place to hang and worth the detour. Great place, service  food and drinks. The menu was diverse and the food tasted amazing. It is a fun area to be I  too. Backeries and coffee shops before dinner and an amazing cocktail bar after.

Address: 196 Rue Fleury O Montreal, QC H3L 1T5 Canada
Review: Cute corner restaurant with extensive wine list. Very accommodating with my friend’s allergies ☺️

Address: 196 Rue Fleury O Montreal, QC H3L 1T5 Canada
Review: Great ambiance, good selection of wines, delicious food. I had the magret de canard ans the cannolis as dessert. Strongly recommend!

Address: 196 Rue Fleury O Montreal, QC H3L 1T5 Canada
Review: I don't get how this place is rated so highly. Literally everything we ordered (entrecôte, pieuvre, tapas plate) was terrible.

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: This place is way to expensive. 31$  for very disgusting food.  I will never go back. The egg roll was cold mushy and old. The rice was pretty dry and bland. The meat was quite hard to chew felt like rubber. Just avoid going there! I had to throw aways the food it was painful to digest. Just yuk! It's beyond me how they don't go out of business...

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: Food was decent priced , very good cheat meal 😁 enjoyed the hospitality of the staff and the service they gave !

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: I ate there on Saturday and since then I had diarrhea and I vomited twice. 2 days later, I still can't eat anything. I had the bang bang chicken and the egg noodles and I regret it. I will never go there to eat ever again and I suggest you don't either except if you want to be dead inside.

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: $24 for a meal that taste like it was cooked 2 days ago and warmed up in microwave.

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: Delicious melt in your mouth chicken (had the general Tao and grilled chicken) and very generous portion! Definitely worth 20$ for the plate

Address: 69 Rue Saint-Zotique Est Montreal, QC H2S 1K7 Canada
Review: This might be my favorite cafe I have ever been to!! Everything about the food, the staff, and the outdoor seating was fabulous! My partner and I both got gelato, chocolate and vanilla. This was the best gelato I have ever had! We both got slices of pizza, both were absolutely fabulous. The dough and the flavor were great. Furthermore, I got a cappuccino and the flavor was rich. I highly recommend this cafe, the good prices were the cherry on top!

Address: 69 Rue Saint-Zotique Est Montreal, QC H2S 1K7 Canada
Review: Came here for breakfast and everything was  warm and delicious. They have a nice outdoors patio to eat. Breakfast pizza was my favourite, loved the egg embedded into the cheese. The bombolones were fluffy and coated with sugar. A little too much sugar coating in my opinion as the sugar got everywhere on me. Freddy coffee drink was great 👍 would love to come back and try new things

Address: 69 Rue Saint-Zotique Est Montreal, QC H2S 1K7 Canada
Review:
Marinara, Margherita, Pepperoni, Sausage and Caciocavallo Pizzas
.
I have to admit I see what all the hype is behind @sangennaromtl. It's been around for years and I finally made it there! A great little spot located in the heart of little Italy serving up some great pizza and coffee for the neighbourhood.
.
Being my first time there and not knowing when I would have the time to go back, I naturally got the lot! I got every slice and style they had that day and each was delicious. I feel I'd have to say my favorite was the Margherita. Something about a classic style pizza just does it for me. The dough is fantastic, the crust is crunchy and each bite has a little something on it!
.
When your cooking with love and passion it's no surprise your going to turn out a great product!

Address: 69 Rue Saint-Zotique Est Montreal, QC H2S 1K7 Canada
Review:
Great Roman style pizza for sure. Crust is good and the potato and tropea pizzas are delicious. I’ve had slightly better crust for this kind of pizza elsewhere, but it’s still good.

Drinks are also very strong, so they’re not cheap on the booze. Limited seating with outdoor stand up style tables.

Address: 69 Rue Saint-Zotique Est Montreal, QC H2S 1K7 Canada
Review: The marinara slice is sooo simple and delish. $3.50, pretty big and really great. Crispy crust, soft top, juicy tomato sauce.

Address: 1265 Rue Bernard O Outremont, QC H2V 1V8 Canada
Review:
A great place for pasta. They do have good variety of pasta on the menu. They even offered non gluten pasta.
The decoration of the restaurant is very cute and cozy. It's a great place for family, friends or a date (about 50 places seated).
Overall the food and cocktails that we ordered were good. The cocktails could be a little bit more elaborated.
If you are a fanatic of pasta, I highly recommend this place.

Address: 1265 Rue Bernard O Outremont, QC H2V 1V8 Canada
Review:
Food quality is very average.
Price versus portions is terrible. Portions are so small. Menu is way overpriced. Service is very ordinary.
You feel cheated when you have this restaurant because they charge way too much versus what you receive in your plate. I would be embarrassed to serve those portions.

Address: 1265 Rue Bernard O Outremont, QC H2V 1V8 Canada
Review: Looking for a go-to spot that never disappoints? Look no further than Le Petit Italien! This restaurant consistently delivers amazing dishes and top-notch service, with an attention to detail that truly sets it apart. Whether you're dining solo or with loved ones, you're guaranteed to have a memorable experience. Our recent visit with family was a total success - everyone left feeling satisfied and happy. Don't hesitate to make Le Petit Italien your next dining destination!

Address: 1265 Rue Bernard O Outremont, QC H2V 1V8 Canada
Review: Cute restaurant and really nice atmosphere,  I wish I would have taken pasta but if the pasta is anything like the rest of the food we got then I would have been extremely disappointed. It’s really hard to not get a Cesar salad right but this Cesar salad was extremely bland, little to no dressing. The focaccia…. Well they call it focaccia but it was a poorly baked piece of bread that had the texture of uncooked bread but the taste of burnt bread, i’m not sure how they did that… and the meatballs, they were okay, the sauce tasted like some sort of canned pre-made sauce. If you don’t know authentic Italian food then you should be fine.

Address: 1265 Rue Bernard O Outremont, QC H2V 1V8 Canada
Review: I got lucky tonight…. I had the worst experience of my life here tonight and its all thanks to Le Petite Italien ! By far the worst in the city. Wine and service was excellent i must say, aside from that, we are strongly recommending not eating the food here.

Address: 1029 Marché Central Montreal, QC H4N 1J8 Canada
Review: The regular size burrito was more than enough for me. The taste and the customer service were good. I can pass by one more time to try something different.

Address: 1029 Marché Central Montreal, QC H4N 1J8 Canada
Review: I am a huge fan of Mexican cuisine and I have to say, the burritos at this restaurant are simply out of this world. The flavors are so fresh and authentic, I can't get enough of them! Mucho Burrito always satisfied my cravings and the burritos are massive! The workers are always friendly and welcoming. Every time I visit, the staff goes above and beyond to make sure I have a great experience. They are always happy to answer any questions I have and make sure I am completely satisfied with my meal. Very sweet people!

Address: 1029 Marché Central Montreal, QC H4N 1J8 Canada
Review: Amazing restaurant, very clean. Food is always fresh and tasty. Staff are friendly, professional and very generous. Highly recommended if you're in the area 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

Address: 1029 Marché Central Montreal, QC H4N 1J8 Canada
Review: Did not receive my order when I called about it the lady was extremely rude. I told her not to worry and I will not come back to their establishment.

Address: 1029 Marché Central Montreal, QC H4N 1J8 Canada
Review:
Love this place,
1- very clean
2- they make the food in front of your eyes
3- they take the time with customers to fulfil their needs.
4- I’m not fun of fats food but this place is very special.
5- pay a bit  more for tacos but worth  it .
6- they are nice team 👍
7- easy to park
Highly Recommended.

New comment :::the place techniquelly should close at 10:00 pm we come 9:32Pm to order the lady she said we are close and we are waiting for the cleaners to clean the fan !!!
And it was ppl there with their orders . Honestly it’s not nice at all I hope the owner sees this comment .☝️

Address: 2125 Boulevard le Carrefour Boul Laval, QC H7S 2J7 Canada
Review: We went there without  reservation and they accepted 4 people. They told us we had 1.5 hours to eat and then leave, which I find was strange. We accepted as we were sure they would not kick us out if we stayed 1/2 hour more (dont want to choke on steak). We waited 20 minutes for our meal. My friend ordered the New york steak and it was fatty and rubbery. I wanted a rib steak but they did not have. They provide you with little fries and then they come back to see if you want more. They charge 50cents for tiny bread which is ridiculous. Service was poor as waiter hardly came by to verify if all was ok. Ambiance was not great. We would not return back.

Address: 2125 Boulevard le Carrefour Boul Laval, QC H7S 2J7 Canada
Review: My 8 months pregnant wife and two of our friend with two kids total guest of 8. However the server was very pushy, the lamb was dry and when my wife asked her why is it so dry she said that’s how it’s supposed to be, at the same time my friend lamb was juicy. Our bill was 400$. I would not go back due to service. They 0.5$ per bread. I would not go back.

Address: 2125 Boulevard le Carrefour Boul Laval, QC H7S 2J7 Canada
Review: Good service, but food is not that good compare with another steak house…

Address: 2125 Boulevard le Carrefour Boul Laval, QC H7S 2J7 Canada
Review: We had a reservation for 13 people. We had an amazing service. The atmosphere was nice. I ordered la table d'hôte, in which I had snails with garlic and cheese, New York Steak with a lobster tail and cupcake trio. The snails and the lobster tail were delicious. The steak was good too, but I ordered it medium and it came medium-well. The fries lacked seasoning and were bland. The trio cupcake was good. Overall, the food is delicious and I had a great experience.

Address: 2125 Boulevard le Carrefour Boul Laval, QC H7S 2J7 Canada
Review:
French fries are all you can eat here with mayo and ketchup, always freshly made. The lamb sharnk is tender, but served without a sauce. The St Paul steak is tender but the chef failed to produce the medium rare as ordered. The Terre et Mer is very good, both the lobster tail and well done filet mignon. All vegetables came with the main are excellent roasted. The calamari is good but the size of squid is too small for making the dish.
It was an enjoyable evening, will come back next time and bring a bottle of wine.

Address: 2940 Ave Pierre-Péladeau Laval, QC H7T 3B3 Canada
Review:
This place is okay, but it's not authentic.

The octopus was really good, but very small portion.
The calamari was okay, nothing special, there was no tentacles.

The truffle pasta was okay also and the risotto dish came with a big piece of Osso bucco, was not expecting to have a big piece of Osso bucco, I thought it would be bone off.

But I can say that the creme brulee was really good

The service was actually amazing, the waiter was really friendly.

I had ordered an espresso martini with my dessert but they had forgotten to put khalua in it and it taste horrible, when I told the waiter about it he was doubting me on why I wanted to return the drink back but then he realized that it was the khalua that was missing in the drink, he brought me khalua in a glass so I can mix it in my drink.

This place seemed to be more of a place for groups, they had private rooms. If you are celebrating a birthday party or a big get together in Laval with Italian type of food, I think it's a good choice.

Address: 2940 Ave Pierre-Péladeau Laval, QC H7T 3B3 Canada
Review: Went on a weekday evening, hardly anyone there but yet the service was lacking.   Caesar salad was made with green lettuce instead of romaine.  Became very soggy. Plates did not look nice.   Steak was very hard to chew.  Where was the veggies in the shrimp and veggies dish? Cold and tough shrimp.  And the ravioli was just ok.    I expected so much more from this restaurant. I was not impressed at all. Did not finish plates.  Sprinkling tomatoes does not make a plate look nice..

Address: 2940 Ave Pierre-Péladeau Laval, QC H7T 3B3 Canada
Review: The service was pretty bad. We found a bug in one of our glasses and after removing the insect, our server tried to give us the same glass of wine since the ''wine was still drinkable''. The food was good but the service was very off putting.

Address: 2940 Ave Pierre-Péladeau Laval, QC H7T 3B3 Canada
Review: Great service (!!) but the food and ambiance here are absolutely nothing to write home about. The food was mediocre and as such acceptable, but the overall experience feels tired and dated. I understand that not every place wants to be trendy, but Calvi lacks a sense of pride.

Address: 2940 Ave Pierre-Péladeau Laval, QC H7T 3B3 Canada
Review: Just Avoid this place. The restaurant was empty, The manager name Adil welcomed us. However, he didn’t seems to happy, since we were with 2 kids. Therefore, he gave us a table in an isolated room, where it was very hot. As soon as we wanted to sit, he even closed the door.  It was 42 degrees Celsius outside. I asked him “is the air conditioning working in that room, he told me yes”. Which was not true. Therefore we decided to leave and we came to Sterling Steakhouse right next door. They were very nice and accommodating and helpful with the kids. Mr. Adil I hope you have kids and if you do, I hope no one’s treats you like how you treated us.

Address: 1145 Rue Fleury E Montreal, QC H2C 1P9 Canada
Review: Our first time at this  great local Bistro restaurant. Very nice!

Address: 1145 Rue Fleury E Montreal, QC H2C 1P9 Canada
Review: Lovely cafe with a French menu. The cafe is cute, the service is friendly and inviting. This was my first and only experience eating out since the start of the coronavirus and they were so professional. There aren’t a lot of options for those who don’t eat meat - but it’s French cuisine so that’s on me! The quartier of the cafe is also lovely, I would highly recommend this beautiful spot.

Address: 1145 Rue Fleury E Montreal, QC H2C 1P9 Canada
Review: went there a couple days ago, food was ok coffee and desert were nice. Good service.

Address: 1145 Rue Fleury E Montreal, QC H2C 1P9 Canada
Review: Salad was very good but chicken was dry. Great presentation. Nice atmosphere with outdoor space.

Address: 1145 Rue Fleury E Montreal, QC H2C 1P9 Canada
Review: Very nice place, cozy & friendly staff 😊 the food is average. Going next time for a coffee 😊

Address: 3591 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2X 2R9 Canada
Review:
Juicy, packed-full dumplings that are flavourful and comforting. Good prices too :)
The egg and tofu dumplings were among my favourite (even compared to meat ones). The beef and coriander were also very good.
Pork and cabbage were my least favourite.
Cute atmosphere - it’s literally in a house.
Great for vegetarians!

Address: 3591 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2X 2R9 Canada
Review: Dumpling Hut is the Barbie dream house of dumpling places in the Milton Parc area. My friends and I wanted to make sure we were emotionally and spiritually ready for our movie adventure so we fuelled our bodies with dumplings. As is tradition we all split our different types of dumplings so we got to sample the lamb/coriander, chicken/mushroom, and beef/coriander varieties. Wow is this place good. The sweetness of the ginger ale was made sweater when the waiter complimented our Barbie outfits. I am a Barbie girl, sampler of dumpling worlds. Great place, highly recommend.

Address: 3591 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2X 2R9 Canada
Review:
Really good dumplings, all made from scratch.
We had the cabbage and mushroom, and pork and cabbage. Both were delicious.
Hopefully will get to try the fried version next time. (It was too hot and no ventilation the day we went so they werent offering fried.)

Address: 3591 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2X 2R9 Canada
Review: Super spicy chilli oil! Reasonably priced hand made infront of you dumplings. Would return for another 16 Pork and Cabbage.

Address: 3591 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2X 2R9 Canada
Review: Wonderful restaurant! The food is 10/10 I went three times and will definitely go back whenever in Montreal again! The servers are all so nice and cute and service never takes long! It is a clean and chill space perfect for people of all ages. I also loved the little candy bowl by the register and the little space with the notes in the entrance, so cute!

Address: 7032 Rue Waverly Montreal, QC H2S 3J2 Canada
Review:
Great little corner in montreal. Must try if you are in the area. Food is slightly overpriced but you should also consider the experience and the vibe.
I got the pulled pork sandwish and it was a solid sandwish. I would like to try their burgers next time as it was highly recommended to me as well.

Address: 7032 Rue Waverly Montreal, QC H2S 3J2 Canada
Review: This is our kind of place. Straight forward, food focused, decorated like a cozy basement with a vintage look adorned with silly props (like a giant comb), quirky signs and jars in the shape of shorts. This is a great place for to have a satisfying sandwich or burger for lunch. Huge, juicy, fresh, exquisitely seasoned and topped, served with a refreshing smile. Theres nothing about @deplepickup that we don't love!

Address: 7032 Rue Waverly Montreal, QC H2S 3J2 Canada
Review: It's a great little place to have an amazing sandwich. The pull pork sandwich is the one you want to get. Although the rest is good too. Simple place, simple people, I wish there was parking spots. It's a residential area and you need a sticker. (I got a parking ticket) so be careful.

Address: 7032 Rue Waverly Montreal, QC H2S 3J2 Canada
Review:
I went to this place many years ago and I've visited it again last week and I was not disappointed. Still the same great homy, easy, simple vibe. WISH this place was in my neighborhood.

Tried the vegetarian options, with the fake pulled pork (AMAZING, even better than the real stuff no cap, made from tofu skin with a rich cozy delicious barbecue sauce) and halloumi. Both were successes. They also have a great selection of local beer and wine.

Address: 7032 Rue Waverly Montreal, QC H2S 3J2 Canada
Review:
Diamond in the ruff.
Unassuming, small and convivial “depanneur” that serves the best sandwiches in town. Grilled halloumi, cubano, pulled pork and trout gravlax are all amazing.
Super friendly and casual atmosphere. They also sell microbrewery beers, hot sauces (try their home brand mango pick up hot sauce, amazing) and other specialty items.

Address: 1626 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O Montreal, QC H3H 2N4 Canada
Review: Blown away by the ground beef and lamb wrap. It was phenomenal. The bread was made fresh on site and was so delicious. Highly recommend. We also tried the chicken wrap, which is also good. Chicken was tender. We liked the ground beef and lamb more. The owner is so nice. It started pouring outside so he lent us his umbrella so we can get to the car safely. Thank you!

Address: 1626 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O Montreal, QC H3H 2N4 Canada
Review: Excellent kebab and more. I had the chicken kebab sandwich for about $12 and it was pretty filling with a bottle of ayran - about the size of my hand. YOU GOTTA HAVE CASH! They have an ATM in there but it’s one of the sketchy grey ones you find at clubs 🤷

Address: 1626 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O Montreal, QC H3H 2N4 Canada
Review:
Nestled in the heart of the city, Antep Kebab is a true gem for lovers of Turkish cuisine. From the moment you step through the door, you're greeted with warm hospitality and the enticing aromas of perfectly seasoned meats grilling on open flames. However, what sets Antep Kebab apart from other Turkish restaurants is its exceptional homemade bread and mouthwatering dressings that elevate the dining experience to new heights.

The star of the show at Antep Kebab is undoubtedly their freshly baked bread. With each bite, you can taste the care and craftsmanship that goes into its preparation. The bread is soft, yet slightly crispy on the outside, creating the perfect vessel for savoring the tantalizing flavors of their kebabs. The bread is served warm, allowing it to melt in your mouth and complement the grilled meats impeccably. It's evident that Antep Kebab takes great pride in their bread-making tradition, and it shines through in every delightful bite.

The assortment of dressings at Antep Kebab is a true delight for the taste buds. Each dressing is thoughtfully crafted and perfectly balanced, enhancing the flavors of the kebabs without overpowering them. Whether you prefer the tanginess of the yogurt-based tzatziki or the rich smokiness of the roasted red pepper sauce, there is a dressing to suit every palate. The attention to detail and quality of the dressings truly add depth and complexity to the entire dining experience.

Beyond the bread and dressings, Antep Kebab offers a wide selection of kebabs, each prepared with the utmost care and using authentic Turkish spices. The meats are tender and succulent, showcasing the expertise of the chefs and their commitment to serving top-quality dishes. The menu also includes an array of vegetarian options, ensuring that everyone can find something to savor and enjoy.

Address: 1626 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O Montreal, QC H3H 2N4 Canada
Review: SO DELICIOUS! This place is a must try. The Antep Kabab sandwich is my go-to which is a blend of ground beef and lamb. The pita bread is made fresh in-house and is soooo goood. Just bring cash with you as it is CASH ONLY!

Address: 1626 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O Montreal, QC H3H 2N4 Canada
Review: This place was on my radar for awhile now and I had the opportunity to check it out today. I ordered the lamb sandwich with spicy sauce and my oh my was I blown away. From the soft warm bread to the ever so juicy lamb, I will most definitely be back here to try the chicken and filet sandwiches. My mouth is already watering thinking of them. 10/10

Address: 2379 Boulevard Rosemont Montreal, QC H2G 1T9 Canada
Review:
This restaurant is amazing never had one meal that i did not enjoy .

Friendly staff along with the owners. Food is so tasty and prices are reasonable for the quality of food .

Address: 2379 Boulevard Rosemont Montreal, QC H2G 1T9 Canada
Review: Délicieuse food in a very cozy and friendly environment. Staff is amazing. I definitely recommend

Address: 2379 Boulevard Rosemont Montreal, QC H2G 1T9 Canada
Review: This place is just amazing! The food was fresh and really delicious. Service was very welcoming. The atmosphere was nice and actually you are able to have a good chat with your friend/family when enjoying your meals.

Address: 2379 Boulevard Rosemont Montreal, QC H2G 1T9 Canada
Review: My partner and I had a wonderful time at La Menthe Poivree. The servers were friendly and seated us quickly, the menu had a ton of options that made it easy to satisfy more than one of our cravings/curiosities. A hidden gem in Rosemont!

Address: 2379 Boulevard Rosemont Montreal, QC H2G 1T9 Canada
Review: A quiet place with very well priced food. The scallops were amazing! Don't let the pictures on the online menu fool you, the flavours are very good in their dishes. I went for the terrace but it is not open yet.

Address: 3669 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9G 1X2 Canada
Review:
This restaurant produced some of the best southern food I’ve ever had! The drinks were amazing, appetizers (esp. the fried chicken) were immaculate, entrees were tasty with large portions.

The customer service was amazing! The waiters were extremely knowledgable, and answered every question we had. The head chef interacted with customers and was extremely welcoming.

Ambiance, COZY!

Wow wow wow. I will definitely be back soon.

Address: 3669 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9G 1X2 Canada
Review:
Finally tried this West Island establishment after passing by it for over a year. Booking a table was easy via the open table app. Service was friendly and attentive. The food, of course, was the shining star. We had the jambalaya which was super tasty. The pork bao was delicious and so were the fish cakes. For the mains, the brisket and blackened catfish potions were very generous and also very tasty.
Will be back to try the tasting menu.

Address: 3669 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9G 1X2 Canada
Review: What an incredible place. My friends had raved about it for so long and I finally got a chance to join them - already can’t wait to go back! The food was incredible, every bite of every item was memorable. The drinks were on point, and so was the service. Major compliments to the chef. Can’t wait to go back soon and try the tasting menu!

Address: 3669 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9G 1X2 Canada
Review: My favourite restaurant in Montreal. My boyfriend and I go every time we visit and we are never disappointed. The menu is small but top quality with a wide selection from comforting Mac and cheese to the complex flavor palate of scallop ceviche. A focus on sea food with New Orleans spices. Small quaint atmosphere. Caring servers.

Address: 3669 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9G 1X2 Canada
Review:
Decmber 17th 2022.

Where do I even begin? First off, we were here thanks to a giveaway that I had initial won through a certain platform. Entrée, main meal and dessert was on the house for two.

From the moment we entered the restaurant, we were greated right away. They already knew why we were there. Which was great! I didn't have to explain myself and show proof and have to go through a long series of waiting for an authorisation from the owner. The staffs were all well informed about everything!

We were seated right away. They took the time to explain the menu and informed us about the specials of the evening. Our waitress/hostess was a little cold by mid meal. Meaning, she did not took a moment to ask if everything was to our liking. While on the other hand, a table next to us, were regular costumers and I will say, they were treated first-class! Mind you, we ordered extra items (two cocktails) and tip was given according to our entire meal including the extra items.

Despite that little hiccup, our dinner experince at Bistro Nolah was by far the best we have ever had in a very long time.

I have always wanted to try Southern dishes without having to travel too far and let me tell you, the food was mouth-watering. It was an explosion of flavors! The details on each plating was immaculate.

The whole experince was so memorable that we came back a second time, not long after!

Mr. Chef Taitt, you have an amazing team with such talent and your restaurant reflects that. Thank you for 2 unforgetable dinners!

Address: 3035 Boulevard Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: I celebrated my birthday there (20 ppl+) it was an amazing time and food was very good! Portions are amazing and the staff where above and beyond great

Address: 3035 Boulevard Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: My first time ever to this restaurant. I heard that it was good so I wanted to try it. I had a great experience here. Clara was my waitress and she was very nice. Thank you Clara for the service. Next time I come I will ask to be seated at your table.

Address: 3035 Boulevard Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review:
Loved the ambiance and enjoyed the Tuna, which was cooked perfectly, despite the Kale salad, which is last place in my salad choices.

Wine by the glass had a generous pour, and tasted good.

Address: 3035 Boulevard Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: Nice atmosphere, super friendly staff, delicious food. We will definitely come back!

Address: 3035 Boulevard Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: Great experience, food was properly prepared and well worth the price. Overall experience was amazing. I’ve been left disappointed at other restaurants but I can gladly say I will be returning to Table 51!

Address: 5163 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2T 1R9 Canada
Review: Feels like authentic Mexican food. Tapas are great, a few to choose from, some tastier than others. Overall a good and tasty experience. Service is on point, charming waiter and waitresses add to the experience. I will come back again to try out more of the menu.

Address: 5163 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2T 1R9 Canada
Review: Great mexican place to eat. Gringas Al Pastor plate was a good size, served with a plate of chips. Had a chat with the owner and it was a nice moment.

Address: 5163 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2T 1R9 Canada
Review: I came across this lovely authentic mexican restaurant in Montreal while on a stop over before heading to Quebec City with my husband and daughter. The food was great and taste really good. Cozy ambiance and great service.  Definitely a must try.

Address: 5163 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2T 1R9 Canada
Review: This was our second visit to this colorfully decorated Mexican restaurant. It was a warm evening so we took advantage of the warm weather to eat on their curb side terrace. The service was prompt & the waiter explained the concept of the tapas style menu with cazuelitas. You make your own tacos. The Margaritas were good & accompanied with tasty nachos & guacamole. Our appetizer of cheese quesadilla however lacked a little flavor. The tacos came in a pretty little bowl with towel that kept them warm. You order your own fillings for the cazuelitas. There are 2 extra sauces that you can add a mild one & an extremely hot one that my wife who  likes spicey foods even found too hot. We ordered 3 cazuelitas which I found underwhelming. I would have liked the opportunity to order some rice or refried beans as a side but they are not on the menu. The presentation & service were very good however overall the food lacked the wow factor for us.

Address: 5163 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2T 1R9 Canada
Review: Could not be more impressed honestly! The service was amazing, the food & drink was perfect. Wasn't even troubled by the delay on the food but they still went above and beyond with extra chips and churros on the house. I'd give this place 6 stars if I could just for that!

Address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2J 2L1 Canada
Review:
Pros:
-Nice place to play board games with friends. They have a good variety of games (even though not as much as other board games places in Montreal).
-For 5$, you have access to all of the games available, and ask questions to one of the employees that will help you pick a game depending on your mood
-The tempeh salad tasted great, I loved it and wasn't expensive.
-The mocktails are original, and delicious

Address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2J 2L1 Canada
Review:
Always a great place to have fun with friends while playing boardgames. Great ambiance, the food and service are both great.
Personally I like it better than Randolph.
The only thing is you cannot reserve a table but it does give a fair chance for everyone to get a table.

Address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2J 2L1 Canada
Review:
Very nice and happening place . Everyone was so fun and the food was good too. They had a trivia night but we were late for it. They do have plenty of board games. This is the right place to chill out with your friends.

The waitress speak English and being non French speaking, we didn't have problem communicating.

They did have vegetarian pizza option , which was good.

Address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2J 2L1 Canada
Review:
Cocktails are delicious: me and my 2 other friends ordered three to four of them each!! Can't say anything about the food as we had already eaten before coming.

We came on a Friday around 9PM and had to wait in line for about 15 minutes: we were seated at the bar at first and then moved to a table when one freed up!

We had a great time and would totally come back again. Also, their bathrooms are very clean!

Address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2J 2L1 Canada
Review:
Excellent concept.  Great way to spend an evening and satisfy your inner gamer.
Huge selection of games for all.  From quick two player party games to the longer drawn out strategy games.
The game concierge are extremely knowledgeable, approachable and friendly.  The food and drink selection was surprisingly good.  The staff was warm and often checked in.
Highly recommended for a evening with friends or even just a 2 person outing.

Address: 7093 Jarry E Montreal, QC H1J 1G3 Canada
Review:
The salad was so fresh and tasty. The burger tasted wonderful and the sauce was incredible.

Order: Suisse pleurote burger with extra fresh onions & a normal burger with cheddar, bacon and onion, coleslaw, a small salad and a Stewart's orange'n cream.

Address: 7093 Jarry E Montreal, QC H1J 1G3 Canada
Review: One of the best burger I have tested. And the spicy fries is a must taste

Address: 7093 Jarry E Montreal, QC H1J 1G3 Canada
Review:
***update - it's still a 5 star almost 2 years later and several times of dining in, taking out, or delivered!

Amazing food, Amazing service.  Absolutely unbelievably kind and generous owner.  This is THE place to go for a burger. Worth driving here.

Yes, it could be a little slow to get order, but it's only because the patty is thick and they make it all fresh!  Well worth the wait.  If you're in a rush, then call ahead of time !  I've done that before.

Address: 7093 Jarry E Montreal, QC H1J 1G3 Canada
Review: Amazing burgers and steak! Honestly is there a better burger joint in the city than this place? Inexpensive, especially for the quality you are getting. Most burgers will top out around $7-8, and the portions are big. For most common burgers they're cheaper than the fast food restaurant chains, but much better quality. Quality is also way above some of the "trendy" hamburger restaurants that have opened recently; they are substantially cheaper than them. Had a 12oz steak (New York strip) with a side for $18.95 (pic below) ; very inexpensive for the quality of the steak they make, and it's fresh (due to this the price is variable).

Address: 7093 Jarry E Montreal, QC H1J 1G3 Canada
Review: Great burger and good service. Recommended.

Address: 5007, Avenue Du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4E9 Canada
Review: The best lasagna restaurant in Montreal! It was really tasty when we tried the meat one. The pasta was delicious (the texture was great). There is a vegetarian option as well. The restaurant offers take-out lasagna, as well as a few tables for eating in. The staff (owner?) were friendly and helpful! This is a place I highly recommend.

Address: 5007, Avenue Du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4E9 Canada
Review: This is the best place in Montreal to have lasagna! You can certainly dine in but I think most of the business is a takeout business. I stop in once or twice a week to get my lasagna fix. I'd go more often but this restaurant is only open Wednesday Saturday. The owner has his own recipes and handles everything himself. I'm wildly pleased with each type of lasagna he makes. Definitely recommend him to anyone who loves lasagna the way that I do.

Address: 5007, Avenue Du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4E9 Canada
Review: Really good lasagna. The pasta was especially nice, great consistency. Feels very homemade, only organic ingredients, no added industrial sauces. To top it all off, the owner is really great and kept up a great chat.

Address: 5007, Avenue Du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4E9 Canada
Review:
LDP lasagna is on point! If you like good marinara sauce and homemade pasta, LDP never disappoints. Excellent for parties, chalet events or when you are hosting an event and you do not want to do hours and hours of work but want your guests to be satisfied and impressed with the food. Vegetarian options available, our favourite is the vegetarian lasagna and eggplant parm (seasonal)! Whether you order a tray or a single portion, you can expect the same quality. LDP does not skip out. We have ordered from LDP for lunches of +20 people for work (pre-covid), chalet outings (10+ guests) or just grabbed lunch, every time LDP has delivered and have our friends going back on their own for more. A great plus, the owner is a great human and cares about his customers!
Pro tip - Call them order ahead because they sell out often.

Address: 5007, Avenue Du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4E9 Canada
Review:
Let break it down for everybody,
straight up, Super cool place, Super cool guy,  Bruno, Reminds me as if we we’re in a Bronx tale ;). He made us 2 lasagna’s/Beef sauce and one Ravioli.
It was amazing! Texture of lasagna was immaculate, tomato sauce wasn’t acidic, but perfect, like what you make at home, cheese, enough to melt in your mouth and finally, temperature, to perfection, enough for you to enjoy your meal. We we’re 3 people and every bite we were giving each other eye contact and agreeing to ultimate satisfaction. If you don’t like your meal, message me and I’ll pay it, that’s how much I trust this place.
So lady’s and gentlemen, enjoy!
Soho Carpets

Address: 138 Avenue Atwater Montreal, QC H4C 2H6 Canada
Review:
First time trying Singaporean restaurant and was definitely impressed by its unique flavours. The ambiance and service were fantastic, and the staff, were all dudes dressed in shorts and t-shirts, giving a relaxed and welcoming vibe.

The chicken satay was absolutely amazing, the other dishes and cocktails were good as well. I highly recommend this place.

Address: 138 Avenue Atwater Montreal, QC H4C 2H6 Canada
Review:
Amazing place. Great staff and ambiance. Music is a bit too loud but very good. Everything was delicious. Papaya salad and pork buns are a must.

Highly recommend to share the plates. We shared 5 plates and the desert plate for 3 people and it cost us under 40$ before tax and tip.

Place gets packed everyday, reco to get there before 7:30-8pm.

Address: 138 Avenue Atwater Montreal, QC H4C 2H6 Canada
Review:
The music was extremely loud when we visited. Impossible to make any conversation even with the person sitting next to you. Food was alright, would have enjoyed it better if we could've talked to each other.
We made a reservation for 11 people and one person didn't show up. They split the 11th person's charge evenly over our bills; even though they only brought food for the 10 of us.

Unfortunately, I would not go again.

Address: 138 Avenue Atwater Montreal, QC H4C 2H6 Canada
Review: A must for those who love Asian food but crave something different from the traditional flavors found in Chinatown. I suggest coming as a group and ordering many dishes to share. The umami is through the roof and can feel heavy if not paired with white rice. My personal favorites are the pork belly steamed buns and the laksa.

Address: 138 Avenue Atwater Montreal, QC H4C 2H6 Canada
Review:
No resos for groups under 6, and I recommend getting there early. We arrived at 6:30pm on a Thursday and it was packed, we waited roughly 15-20 minutes for a spot for 2. They let you order drinks while waiting though, which is a great start.

Must try’s on the menu are the satay skewers with peanut sauce, the fried pork and shrimp rice rolls (not pictured, but we both agreed it was the best thing we tasted!), papaya salad, and the regular pork steam buns.

The shrimp buns were part of their specials, but it’s not as balanced and tasty as the pork buns. If you’re stuck between the two, go pork.

For the noodles, I would go for the mussel and chorizo noodles instead of the shrimp and cuttlefish.

But really, everything on the menu is excellent. We also have our amazing experience to thank to our server Carl, who went above and beyond in the service.

100% recommend!

Address: 46 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7N 2H4 Canada
Review: I get it that it's a fast food place but don't offer a salad if you're not going to wash it first. I paid over 11$ for a Caesar salad (no extras). The lettuce was dirty and to top it off- a blue collar worker with very dirty hands helped himself to the croutons behind the counter.  I guess he's a regular customer so they don't bother him. He reached into the jar of croutons, took out a handful - put his grubby hands to his mouth and then reached in a couple more times.  These are the very same croutons that were on my salad!  Ewwwww!

Address: 46 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7N 2H4 Canada
Review:
This Chez Gerard is phenomenal. The customer service is excellent and the food is really good. The prices are somewhat better than the one on Concorde.
Picked up food many times, and it has always been good.

Address: 46 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7N 2H4 Canada
Review: My brother and I went to this place. WE DID NOT REGRET IT!!! Best poutine in town. Tall man served us with the best service. (He is the owner or manager) Will be back soon for sure!

Address: 46 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7N 2H4 Canada
Review: Been going there since I was 6 years old, spot never changed, same owner same awesome fast food. They don't mess around with the Quebec classics. Won't regret.

Address: 46 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7N 2H4 Canada
Review: Great fries and poutine, customer service is friendly and kind.

Address: 733 Boulevard de La Cote-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 1Y3 Canada
Review:
Hello

I'm traveller and this is first time I tried meat and chicken cooked one day before..
Not healthy atmosphere..use to be good before.

The owner very rude and he treated customers base on their background

Won't recommend it

Address: 733 Boulevard de La Cote-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 1Y3 Canada
Review:
So disappointed by Abu Elias. Clear sign that Anthony cant be trusted anymore as a reliable source. Got the marinated chicken legs, raw meat and ribs.

The bad: chicken thighs sadly had to be thrown out the next day. It was old and smelly. For the price tbh i was expecting fresh chicken. For it to spoil within a day isnt a sign of fresh chicken. It was stored along with the ribs which were amazing, so definitely not a fridge issue on my end.
The raw meat was not handled according to Canadian guidance for handling raw meat which was a major disappointment given that they make “kebbe nayeh”.
The ribs were delicious so no issue there.
Prices are really inflated and doesn’t justify the quality.

Address: 733 Boulevard de La Cote-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 1Y3 Canada
Review:
Review of Abou Elias Restaurant:

I recently had the opportunity to visit Abou Elias Restaurant, and unfortunately, I left with a rather disappointing experience. While I had heard positive things about their sandwiches and service, my personal encounter was far from satisfying.

One of the first things I noticed was the size of the sandwiches. They were incredibly tiny, which left me feeling a bit short-changed. It seemed like there was barely any filling, making the overall taste and satisfaction quite underwhelming.

To make matters worse, the meat in the sandwiches was extremely chewy. It felt like it had been overcooked or lacked tenderness. This greatly affected the overall enjoyment of the meal, as I had expected a better quality of meat.

Moreover, the service I received when requesting a bit of garlic sauce on the side was quite disappointing. The employee seemed irritated by the request and proceeded to lecture us about their policy of not providing additional condiments. Their attitude was unprofessional and left a negative impression. It is disheartening when a customer's reasonable request is met with such hostility.

The most disappointing aspect was the stark contrast between the restaurant's online presence and the actual experience. While they may portray themselves as generous and offering amazing service on various YouTube channels, the reality was far from it. It felt as if they were merely pretending to provide exceptional service for the sake of online appearances.

Overall, my visit to Abou Elias Restaurant was far from satisfactory. The sandwiches were tiny, the meat was chewy, and the service was below par. I would advise potential customers to approach this establishment with caution, as the actual experience may not align with the advertised image.

Address: 733 Boulevard de La Cote-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 1Y3 Canada
Review:
Delicious food, tastes just like in Lebanon. I can't believe I've waited all this time to discover this place.

Treat yourself and go the mixed meat platter. I see some comments here saying it's overpriced, it's just not. This is MUCH better than what you can get from the big Lebanese food chains, it's incomparable. The meat is flavorful, fresh, juicy. It comes with all the right fixings. Their potatoes are d delicious too.

Also, please give a try to their hummus. This is what real hummus should taste like. This is the only place I've tried  that serve a proper hummus in Montreal (and trust me, I've tried many Lebanese restaurants on the island and in Laval for the past 10+ years). This would be considered a good hummus even in Lebanon. It is creamy, and you can really taste the tahini.

Ordered through doordash and it arrived quickly and well packaged.

Address: 733 Boulevard de La Cote-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 1Y3 Canada
Review: The food was excellent. We ordered the mixed tray to dine in. However, there were no forks or knives. Just if you ask, they will give you. They also don't accept credit cards.

Address: 1459 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7S 1N1 Canada
Review: I really enjoyed their large variety of options in their menu which caters to a lot of people with different types of food restrictions. It allowed a large group like ours to all find something that we like easily. The food here was decent, the prices are a bit higher than a lot of other Italian restaurants but the quality is a bit better I would say. The portions are also reasonable for the prices. The service was split in two, one waitress was nice and friendly, being very careful about allergies and food restrictions while another waitress was a bit more less friendly. In my opinion, everything was decent and a bit above average, overall a decent place to enjoy a meal with a larger group.

Address: 1459 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7S 1N1 Canada
Review: I remember going there 15 yrs ago with my best friend and after all this time, i would still recommend it if you are looking for a nice restaurant. The staff was friendly we had good service

Address: 1459 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7S 1N1 Canada
Review: Great variety of pizzas and pastas that caters to everyone. Also nice that you can bring your own alcoholic beverages. The atmosphere can get pretty loud and busy at times especially on the weekends so best to make a reservation.

Address: 1459 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7S 1N1 Canada
Review: Good place to hang out with friends. The food was good and the service let's say: a bit too fast. One of the good things is that u can bring your own wine.

Address: 1459 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7S 1N1 Canada
Review: Food was tasty too salty! We ordered 3 different plates and we all had the same comment. Service too slow. If u are in hurry, better  go elsewhere for quicker lunch.

Address: 4337 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9H 2A4 Canada
Review:
For All-you-can-Eat, the food was great! Service was nice and friendly. Small space needs better ventilation, there was a lot of smoke, and it was very hot.

Ice cream is also all-you-can-eat!! :)

Address: 4337 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9H 2A4 Canada
Review:
The restaurant is small and has no ventilation so it was very smokey.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  They changed the grills often to reduce the amount of smoke but it didn't make much difference.

The food was decent but nothing special.  Some of the meat was tender and some was chewy.  The shrimp were tasty but not very big.  The best thing that we ate was the spicy fried chicken.  It was crisp, flavourful and juicy.  It would have been nice to have more dipping sauces for the largely unflavoured meats.  The kimchi was also very nice and not overly spicy.

The restaurant is fun since you grill your own food to the doneness that you prefer but once the novelty wears off, you realize that you are paying to cook your own meal in a restaurant.

My main concerns was more of a food safety issue.  You are given tongs to grill the raw meat but you use the same tongs to serve the cooked meat and the side dishes thereby contaminating everything.  I'm not usually a stickler about these things but in this case you are cooking many different pieces of meat at many different stages of doneness and everything is contaminated.

Address: 4337 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9H 2A4 Canada
Review:
it's sad for me to say but this was the worst dining experience i had in years. food was okay but nothing special.

i recommand the marinated chicken and the spicy chicken legs. also their seafood on the grill was decent.

unfortunately, this place is understaffed,no ventilation and they give you 2h max even though the place was slow. me and my colleagues were inhaling gas and charred meat smoke the entire time. i felt sick to my stomach and had a headache until the next morning... sorry guys but am not coming back.
34.99/person for a terrible supper experience.

on the brighter side of things. decorum was very pleasant.

Address: 4337 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9H 2A4 Canada
Review: Maria, May and Bob are the nicest, the more kind and genuine staffs I’ve had in a bbq resto. Changed our grills often, passes to check up the clients a lot, very present on the floor. Not once we had to chase down our server, she was always present. Although the ventilation could be better, I enjoyed very much my time here eith my friends and they’ll most definitely see us coming back more often as a group.

Address: 4337 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9H 2A4 Canada
Review:
Absolutely LOVED the food here.
Lots of choices for meat, and other Korean foods.

Amazing staff as well, and our ice cream came with a cute deco:)❤️

Address: 431 Jean-Talon Rue O Montreal, QC H3N 1P9 Canada
Review:
I got the XL rare, well done, and beef brisket Pho, it was very good! I really enjoy that they have multiple sizes to choose from. The atmosphere was really lovely, quiet. I'm surprised that they don't have more people just hanging out and enjoying a bowl of soup.
The service was marvelous too. Very fast.

Address: 431 Jean-Talon Rue O Montreal, QC H3N 1P9 Canada
Review: The best Vietnamese restaurant in Montreal! The Bún bò Huế is delicious!

Address: 431 Jean-Talon Rue O Montreal, QC H3N 1P9 Canada
Review: Not only do they have a great menu filled with delicious choices the staff are so friendly and helpful that it’s a delight to eat here. We always go for the soups which are always served with fresh Thai basil, sprouts and if you want to live dangerously or love spice fresh chilli’s. We never leave disappointed. We also have tried a few sides and desserts which are delicious. Place is always kept clean even when it is super busy. Prices are reasonable

Address: 431 Jean-Talon Rue O Montreal, QC H3N 1P9 Canada
Review: Big plates, delicious food, reasonable prices. Super attentive and friendly staff. Clean and utilitarian inside. Looks mediocre from the street, but it’s really a hidden gem.

Address: 431 Jean-Talon Rue O Montreal, QC H3N 1P9 Canada
Review: We ordered the Extra Large Spicy beef and pork Pho. It was delicious, flavoursome and HUGE. I mean HUGE. I was starving before ordering XL but turns out that still was too much. Definitely coming back. Recommended.

Address: 8084 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2R 2J6 Canada
Review: Had the beef bahn mi and the chefs special banh mi, they were really good and good price. Also had the bloody beef soup and since i ordered take out they gave it in 3 separate containers 1 with broth, 1 with meat and 1 with sprouts,sauce and limes. Made it good so when i got home it tasted fresh.

Address: 8084 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2R 2J6 Canada
Review: Woow! This place is a gem! The food is sooo good.  I had the bbq pork banh mi and it's stellar! The best one I've had in Montréal! Can't wait to try the pho soup!

Address: 8084 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2R 2J6 Canada
Review: It's a cozy place from Vietnam. The owner and the cook are really friendly. You'll discover that they're not working for profit. Today I took a delicious chicken soup for just 10 dollars. I liked it because is beside Jarry station. I'll be back soon.

Address: 8084 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2R 2J6 Canada
Review: Very good food at low cost. The owners treat you great.

Address: 8084 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2R 2J6 Canada
Review: Always a pleasure to get a Banh Mi from this place ❤️ so friendly too!

Address: 2119 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7S 1Z4 Canada
Review: Great menu, awesome service, very cordial servers, and all were helping each other out. The food was fantastic, especially the beef tacos and the guacamole dip.

Address: 2119 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7S 1Z4 Canada
Review:
Ask your waiter about "L'expérience Escondite" and you won't be disappointed. You get to taste a few items on the menu for 40$/person.

We got the nacho dumplings (highly recommend it) & mango salad as an entree. Then they served us the ribs which were to die for. Then we had the tacos - my favorite was the fish (Baja 2.0). And finally churros for dessert! Overall the meals were very well balanced and we were super full by the end.

We had the Margarita Media Noche & a classical one.

Would definitely go there again

Address: 2119 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7S 1Z4 Canada
Review: Second time here - small, very cute and trendy place. Atmosphere is fun (cute signs hanging on the walls - see pictures) albeit a little loud for conversation. The food was excellent (melt-in-your-month good) and very flavourful. I had the mango salad (wow) and my husband had the chips ‘n guac and we had 2 tacos each - it was plenty. The tacos are quite small but with an appetizer, sufficient. I would definitely recommend for a fun night with friends!

Address: 2119 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7S 1Z4 Canada
Review: Friendly staff, fast service. A bit pricey but don’t expect to be full. It’s mini size snack. We enjoy our night but was still hungry after. This mexicain restaurant is more of a chill and hang out for drink kinda place. Beautiful decorations and the male & female bathroom are kool.

Address: 2119 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7S 1Z4 Canada
Review: When I took my first bite of their nachos, I saw the holy light. I was surrounded by angels. I could hear the trumpets. My life flashed before my eyes. I witnessed every moment that led me up to that very moment. When I snapped back to reality, those nachos had already made sweet SWEET love to me twice. AND tHAT WAS JUST THE BEGINNING. Their tacos. I did not think these flavors were even possible. I was killed beautifully and reborn and baptized gracefully by their tacos. It was a moment like never before. This is what love feels like. And that love was found here, at Escondite, behind a bar, being served by an angel of a bartender. I wanted to spend the rest of my life and grow old with this meal. I wanted to be buried beside this meal. The only thing I could ever complain about this place is that I cannot stay there all day.

Address: 2010 12th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review:
We had a wonderful evening here tonight! We reserved on the penthouse patio, gorgeous view of the city and a nice al fresco dining area. Seated initially in one of the banquette style seating tables - pro tip, if you have people in your party who are shorter, request (at time of reservation) to be seated at the traditional table and chairs seating. We asked if we could be moved, and our server checked with the hostess to make sure that there was a table available (that hadn't been reserved in advance) to seat us at. There was, but the restaurant was not as busy as one would expect on a beautiful Saturday summer evening, so we lucked out.
We ordered drinks, Aperol spritz was well made, cold and refreshing. The Cucumber Basil Gimlet was stellar. Cucumber/basil were a perfect match for the gin, and citrus ingredients gave lively sweet/sour notes. Served on rocks, it was a welcome aperitif for a warm humid evening.
Appetizers were shared; the Korean Kimchee Dumplings were delicious! Beautifully thin wrappers with pork and kimchee filling, steamed and served with a soy/sesame dipping sauce. The Giant Calamari Crown was a whole calamari tube, sliced into rings, delicately breaded and fried.  Tender, tasty, served with one of the best aioli's I've ever had - smoky, savoury, slightly spicy with an herbaceous note I couldn't identify but really enjoyed. Crab cakes were homemade with a nice crust, pan fried and served with chipotle remoulade, good texture and taste. Bruschetta was good, the tomato topping was fresh and tangy. My only issue is that I prefer the baguette slices toasted or grilled and these were served 'au naturel', not my personal taste...
Mains were the Double Cut Pork Chop stuffed with brie, pecans and dried cranberries (big appetite at the table), the Chicken Supreme with maple mustard glaze (for the smallest appetite). The pork chop was nicely seared, tender, juicy, served with a port reduction. The chicken was cooked perfectly on the bone; the glaze skewed more to being a sauce but it was quite delicious, more savoury than sweet, well balanced. Both were served with roasted baby potatoes that were creamy inside, and seasonal fresh vegetables cooked tender crisp, also tasty. Myself and the other member of our party ordered the fish special; pan fried Salmon filet with pineapple and apple salsa, seved with pecan fried rice and the fresh summer veg. The salmon filet was cooked perfectly, seared outside, moist and tender inside. The salsa was a fresh, tangy note that complimented the rich salmon. Pecan fried rice was astounding! A seemingly odd combination that was extremely yummy. We ate every bit of it😋
For dessert the large appetite had a Creme Brulee. The rest of us ordered one each of the three available desserts to share. Creme Brulee was nice, the custard was smooth, silky with perfect texture, the sugar crust torched to a golden brown that cracked satisfyingly when struck with the spoon. It was a hit with the creme brulee lovers at the table. The lemon tart had a light fresh filling topped with 3 individual meringues, lending a nice textural element. The crust was on the thick side and very difficult to cut into with the spoon, but the flavours were there. The absolute stand out was the Chocolate Torte! Dark, rich, decadent, sweet and bitter notes of the chocolate PERFECTLY balanced,SO GOOD
Our server Tegan was excellent😊 Friendly and personable.
We had 2 cocktails, a beer, 9 glasses of wine (couldn't agree on bottles!), 4 appies, 4 mains and 4 desserts. The bill, after tax and before tip, was 434$ We left stuffed and extremely happy. 5 stars, highly recommend...will eat here again next time I'm in town.
20Ten, you need to relocate to Vancouver where you would be truly valued and packed out every night...recent reviewers seem to lack a true appreciation for and/or familiarity with this style of food and dining!

Address: 2010 12th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review:
Special rooftop birthday surprise with fiancé, it was super expensive & we really liked the dessert. The food, apps didn’t have much flavour & the meats were pretty dry. Disappointing food (especially for how expensive), dessert was delicious.

Also the view was amazing at Sunset

Address: 2010 12th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: Absolutely top marks for 20Ten City Eatery.  The ambience and atmosphere was outstanding, the service was fantastic, and the food was first class.  The quality, presentation, creativity, and flavour of each of the dishes were exceptional.  There was a lot of thoughts put into each of the plates.  20Ten City offers second to none, the finest dining experience.  Highly recommended.

Address: 2010 12th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: I've never eaten at 20 Ten City Eatery until tonight. Oh. My. God. The food is so good. I kept meaning to take pics before I dove in like a pig but I failed horribly. Trevor is the chefs name and his food is AMAZING.

Address: 2010 12th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review:
I'm surprised with all the good ratings of this place. Visited from Toronto and decided to try the restaurant on a Friday evening, yet our experience at the 2010 restaurant was a great disappointment.  We tried to make a reservation by chat, email and phone and no one got back to us either way, so we decided to walk-in. When I told the manager this, he simply laughed it off and said that if we didn't get a response we didn't get a reservation. This caught me off guard and reflected on his unprofessional and rude demeanor.
They placed us at a wiggly table and we felt completely ignored. The evening wasn't that busy and there were a couple of empty tables. When we asked if we could change our table after a couple finished to get a better view the waitress came back and told us that the manager said it was booked. Yet we stayed past 9pm and no one came to claim the table. However,  one couple did come and surprisingly they changed their table three times. So basically from what I gather is, if you are a regular and an important personal you'll get the high-end golden treatment, if not you are treated with rudeness.
As for the food,  it is overpriced and nothing to crave about. Any good food critic would give them nothing higher than one star. If you are looking for something with flavor I'd recommend an ordinary pub such as Taverna or the pizza restaurant Famoso.
I do not recommend this restaurant.   Simply visit the restaurant for the view, (and order nothing more but one drink) but getting a helicopter ride to see the veiw of Regina would be a better experience. Bad service,  rude management,  overpriced food. Highly not recommended.

Address: 1625 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X3 Canada
Review: On our first time in Regina, we found this nice Indian restaurant with fantastic food and friendly staff. The Mix Veg pakora (gluten-free), as a free start, which mesmerized me, was so yummy and tangy 😍 Samosa (not gluten-free), Chana masala, and Fish curry were also delicious, as well as the Saffron rice. As a gluten-free person, I immensely enjoyed my dinner. If you did not try this place yet, add it to your must-go list 👍🏻 Bon Appetite!

Address: 1625 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X3 Canada
Review: I LOVED this restaurant! I ordered the chicken korma with saffron rice and garlic naan. The best chicken korma I’ve ever had! Next time I go I will request extra chicken. It’s that good.

Address: 1625 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X3 Canada
Review:
Great food and incredible service! 👌
Absolutely recommended!
Tried the chicken samosa and lamb beryani!
The portions are not much but they meet the price you pay! 5 out 5 experience!

Address: 1625 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X3 Canada
Review: We have been coming here since it first opened!! I have tried almost every dish on the menu too!  Their lunch specials are very delicious and filling!  Their service is so welcoming and humbling.  With myself being East Indian and completely approving the variety of flavours and taste to be on par says a lot on how authentic it really is!

Address: 1625 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X3 Canada
Review: This place blew me away!  Hands down some of the best SE asian food I've ever had.  The chef knows how to balance spice and flavour to let the ingredients shine through. This is my go-to place in Regina now.

Address: 1852 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G3 Canada
Review: Got served by Brady tonight, very friendly  guy and created such a good environment. Thanks man!!! Best bartender around, give this man a raise !

Address: 1852 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G3 Canada
Review: This used to be one of my favourite spot when I was working downtown with great service but have gone back three times in the last 6 months and the service has been terrible. It was between 2-3 pm when there hardly any customers there and the staff does not seem to care. You literally have to keep watching around for some to serve you a drink while everyone is chatting even when you are sitting at the bar. I literally wanted to get up and leave all three times but it was cold so just stayed.

Address: 1852 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G3 Canada
Review: This bar was subpar, I don’t recommend it and would not return. They have a simple selection of drinks and food. I tried their wings, which may have been the worst wings I’ve ever had. Also tried the shrimp po’boy, which was very salty. They had a chicken pot pie soup, it was odd tasting. Their fires were also very salty. My friend said the blt was good, and would order it again. Server was kind but didn’t know much about drinks. But she was diligent on getting the answers to our questions.

Address: 1852 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G3 Canada
Review: Cold food, terrible service. Sat at our table for over two hours and saw the waitress maybe 3 times. It was not busy enough to justify this. Waitress seemed more concerned with hanging out with her friends than serving customers. Would’ve liked to have more than two drinks over the 2+ hours at a bar. Definitely was not wanting to stay as long as we did but it took 45 minutes just to get a bill. Will not be returning.

Address: 1852 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G3 Canada
Review: Homemade burgers, healthy salads— all at a reasonable price. Regina’s best known and most loved restaurant is popular with locals and tourists alike. I’ve always enjoyed lunch at the Badger. Healthy, hearty meals served with a smile.

Address: 2032 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y3 Canada
Review:
Best Steakhouse ever! I was randomly walking around. And I happened to walk by this building. And I was wondering what it looked like in the inside. Turns out it was open! So I walked in, and it turns out to be a fancy place! Which is awesome.
