So someone escorted me to a seat. And when they asked me what I wanted to drink, I’ve asked for a double Cherry vodka. Which is awesome, because usually Cherry Vodka is not available at bars and stuff. So that was nice.
I normally don’t order seafood, but I’ve asked to get a fresh grilled Salmon. And the waitress recommended the better version, which was something I wasn’t expecting. So I got it, and wow did it ever tastes great. In fact, I wanted more lol. So I’ll make sure to get that again, if I have the luxury to go there again :)
As for the staff, all of them were really nice to me, Especially Alyssa. So keep up the good work guys!

Address: 2032 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y3 Canada
Review:
Best fine dining experience in the city of Regina hand down.

For staff service, I’d give an easy 5 stars. The waiter was courteous and checked in to ensure our meal was going great and we had all we needed throughout our stay.

For the food; it was tasty, well seasoned, satisfying and there was so much variety to choose from. It took a reasonable amount of time to prepare compared to some other fine dining outfits in the city that take more time.

The plating technique here is very impressive too.

Only downside is parking. The parking lot for this restaurant is quite small and not easily accessible.

Address: 2032 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y3 Canada
Review: Although our last two experiences at the Diplomat had not been positive, we decided to give them another chance when friends from out of town arrived.  The waitress was wonderful (unfortunately I didn’t get her name), and the drinks were made to perfection.  Our friends had the Chateaubriand for Two, and said it was delicious.  I enjoyed the Diplomat Chicken, although the stuffed potato was burnt.  We were extremely disappointed in the 10 ounce steak my husband ordered - it was cooked to his preference, but the steak had so much gristle in it, he found it was inedible.  Our waitress offered to take it back, but this would delay his meal and we would be done by the time he got his meal back.  For this reason, he declined a replacement.  I suggested there should be a reduction on the bill, as the steak was priced at $46.95. I was vastly disappointed to see the restaurant took a mere $10 off.  Ultimately, we paid $36.95 for a piece of inedible meat.  This is the third strike - we will not be back.

Address: 2032 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y3 Canada
Review:
This place is is what the Keg wants to be when it grows up. Literally has changed my perspective on what steak should taste like, and every time I go, I leave in awe. Staff is old school cool and classy, but with modern and accepting of everyone. Wine collection and bar is best I have seen in Canada and will always tell people to go for the experience.

It's a spectacular spectacle that is worth it.

Address: 2032 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y3 Canada
Review:
Lovely restaurant and the staff are extremely friendly. You just always want to go back to a place like that.
The ambience is perfect as well. I brought my friend here to celebrate her birthday. Although they don't offer a birthday special or chef's special treat for birthdays, they were kind enough to let us bring our cake and they helped cut it and serve it to everyone at the table.
The food tastes so good. I ordered the New York Streak Strip and some potatoes.
For a special night out, you want to visit this place.

Address: 2903 Powerhouse Drive Regina, SK S4N 0A1 Canada
Review: Was DJing for a wedding on the patio... Beautiful weather. Staff were attentive and friendly. Food was delicious and presentation amazing. Some very creative flavor pairings made for a wonderful experience. Could use more plug ins but that doesn't concern me as a consumer... just as a vendor...lol.

Address: 2903 Powerhouse Drive Regina, SK S4N 0A1 Canada
Review: Super cute from the inside it has a completely different interior in comparison to other restaurants in regina. The food was exceptionally well and the chef also had halal chicken available upon request.

Address: 2903 Powerhouse Drive Regina, SK S4N 0A1 Canada
Review: When you enjoy the best thanksgiving meal you've had in a long time and make a special request almost an year later to fullfil your craving of some good chocolate cake and you fulfilled! can't thank you guys enough! 2 amazing cakes delivered over 1500KMs all the way to Minnesota (delivered by family members)! Can't wait to stop here the next time we travel to Regina!

Address: 2903 Powerhouse Drive Regina, SK S4N 0A1 Canada
Review: Waffle and chicken. The chicken doesn't really jump out in flavor, however, it is balanced out with the waffle. The sauce/gravy has a flavour that I was not able to distinguish. It did, however, bring the waffle and chicken together.

Address: 2903 Powerhouse Drive Regina, SK S4N 0A1 Canada
Review: 10/10. Must try if you’re in the mood for something comforting and next level. Brunch was simply amazing and the atmosphere is beautiful from the food presentation to the flowers/decor, right down to the hand crafted cups.

Address: 4626 Albert Street Regina, SK S4S 6B4 Canada
Review:
My husband and mother in law went here after we walked out of another Chinese food place. It was a buffet and it was disappointing nothing but scraps in the buffet. This place was nice and many great options. Everything from Canadian Chinese to Vietnamese fresh noodle bowls. The ginger beef was a nice crispy with the right amount of spice. The pork noodle bowl was tender with the right amount of fat on the pork.
The serving of chilli oils on the table could have been fuller I was digging out the last bit.
The service could have been a bit better. The servers kept forgetting to fill our drinks.
Other wise the atmosphere was clean and a nice touch of colour.

Address: 4626 Albert Street Regina, SK S4S 6B4 Canada
Review:
Good food, fast service. We ordered a mix of sweet pork in peking sauce then a spicy dish chicken xo sauce and they both work so well
Together. Enjoyed it overall with some
Taro boba and some soup and fried rice.

Address: 4626 Albert Street Regina, SK S4S 6B4 Canada
Review: The food is very good, but most of the service staff here have a very bad attitude, and the way they serve, they do not smile, do not welcome guests. Everytime I come, it’s always like this and to be honest I think the management staff should review and replace all employees if they continue like this.

Address: 4626 Albert Street Regina, SK S4S 6B4 Canada
Review: Great food and good service. The wait was a bit  long but it worth it. Definitely try it with a group of people so you can order multiple dishes and share.

Address: 4626 Albert Street Regina, SK S4S 6B4 Canada
Review: This is good Asian food close to home. Generally the food comes fairly quickly and the service is good. This time we were told after we were sat that the kitchen was backed up and our food would take at least 30 minutes. We were given the choice to stay or not. I didn’t like the wait but I liked I was given the truth and the option.  The only downside thing I can say is that the prices are a couple of bucks a plate more expensive that other similar restaurants.

Address: 4908 Dewdney Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1B8 Canada
Review:
I’ll be honest, I don’t even really like poutines. I wasn’t overly looking forward to coming here but I had to give it a shot because of all the hype. I LOVED it!! So many choices (almost too many, makes it very hard to pick) and such a great value; there is SO much food, no one at our table could even finish their meals, seriously (Mmm, leftovers). Everything was delicious, even the burgers. I can’t wait to go back.

P.S. Coney Island rekindled my love for milkshakes.

Address: 4908 Dewdney Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1B8 Canada
Review: Fun little dinner, great selection of milkshakes, I'm addicted to the German chocolate cake milkshake and I'm not a chocolate person. I love their pick-a-dilly poutine and have ordered it more than id like to admit. If you're a pickle lover this is your poutine. Don't be fooled by their smaller size option, their poutines are very filling and a small always fills me up for hours.

Address: 4908 Dewdney Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1B8 Canada
Review: Delicious food and a crazy good selection of poutines. This place won’t disappoint to fill you up and keep you eating even though you don’t want to. Gravy is very tasty and good consistency. Fries cooked well and taste good too. Chilli was delicious and didn’t taste bland. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a nice greasy snack

Address: 4908 Dewdney Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1B8 Canada
Review: Friendly staff with fast service and tasty food, I recommend the pulled pork poutine and chocolate milkshake

Address: 4908 Dewdney Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1B8 Canada
Review: The service, burger and poutine were so good.  The staff very friendly and offered excellent suggestions and lots of options to choose from. A wonderful place  for something different. I didn't have a milkshake but those who did said milkshakes were very good..

Address: 227 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0P4 Canada
Review: We love this place! We always order lemongrass pork vermicelli bowls- SO good! Tonight they threw in two things of fresh rolls on the house! Wow they are incredible!

Address: 227 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0P4 Canada
Review: Amazing  price for the amount of food you get!! Such a cute little restaurant and the service is great. Will come again, new favourite Vietnamese restaurant in Regina by far!

Address: 227 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0P4 Canada
Review: First time there, ordered fried rice and wings, she asked me wut level spice I wanted. Ended up getting the regular level, if u don't like spicy, not a place for u..I can't imagine wut the higher level spicy is..but the meal was so good..I would go back..friendly people too. Just one thing, little pricey for how much food u get, could get abit more, it's fried rice.

Address: 227 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0P4 Canada
Review:
We were passing through Regina,
I read some reviews on this place and it did not disappoint. We had Bun bue hue with rice noodle (my usual.. go to)deluxe noodle bowl and Bahn mi sandwiches. The food was delicious. The staff was very friendly,  and the atmosphere was busy.
Great Job!! Definitely recommend.

Address: 227 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0P4 Canada
Review: Recently I went to dine in for supper with my family. They didn't have any air conditioning which made it super hot inside. They also had a bunch of flys flying around which made us not able to enjoy our food at all.

Address: 1881 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 4K9 Canada
Review: We made a reservation for 15 the day of which they happily accommodated however the service was painfully slow even though we were the only ones in the restaurant. 2 hour wait for food made our guests wondering what was going on. Only got offered one round of drinks and no refills after that. The pizza was pretty good but salad and pasta was only okay. Gelato was a treat. Overall not the best experience but would likely be better with a smaller group of people.

Address: 1881 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 4K9 Canada
Review: Food is always great. Service was okay... but not the servers' fault as she was the only one serving inside, outside, and the bar. Because of the large homeless population in downtown core right now, I would suggest sitting inside for a better experience.

Address: 1881 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 4K9 Canada
Review: Decent hang out place in the downtown with delicious food

Address: 1881 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 4K9 Canada
Review:
Very disappointing. We have enjoyed our experience at Famoso in the past. This time the carbonara sauce was bland curdled and separated and they also forgot the pancetta, the lettuce was rusty (the worst parts were in the garbage by the time the picture was taken). The wings themselves were good, but you can see a lack of care even in simply tossing them so the sauce would be evenly coated. The lasagna was fine, though not very warm which I will give a bit of a pass on since it was takeout. The pizza was good.

Edit: this review was intended for the east location, but I understand the ownership is the same regardless.

Address: 1881 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 4K9 Canada
Review: The food was really good. The waitress never checked in with us and it took well over 20mins to flag her down after our table was cleaned just to get the bill. The restaurant wasn't even busy.

Address: 1953 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2H1 Canada
Review: Cute little venue with tasteful decorations. The service was very kind. We overstayed an hour and a half without knowing and they were serving us drinks even after closing. The food was good and the smoked whiskey was one of our favourite drinks.

Address: 1953 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2H1 Canada
Review: Heard about the dolmades and had to try them. They were delicious. I would recommend. Had the chicken souvlaki. Again it was delicious. The service was great and friendly. Loved the original menu blow up on the wall. Whish I could still get pumpkin pie for ten cents.

Address: 1953 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2H1 Canada
Review: Came in right at closing and wait staff was extremely kind and fast with our food! Seafood saganaki was flavorful and the soup was one of the best I've had. Highly recommend!

Address: 1953 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2H1 Canada
Review: I’ve gone here twice and both times it was a 10/10 experience. The food is just amazing and the service is really good too. I would definitely go here a third time.

Address: 1953 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2H1 Canada
Review: Historical restaurant in the heart of downtown Regina. Top tier food. Highly recommend anything Greek or the pizza.

Address: 1851 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G9 Canada
Review: Reasonable prices.. sauce was great.  Unfortunately the pasta seemed store bought and was undercooked.  Will try again.

Address: 1851 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G9 Canada
Review: I had the Limoncello on ice and Fettucine Alla Boscaiola with chicken and mushroom. The bread was perfect, soft and straight out of the heaven. La signora was so nice and helpful. Will visit again.

Address: 1851 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G9 Canada
Review: Restaurant was clean, service was good. Food was okay, had the spaghetti aglio e olio. Taste was good but the pasta was quite watery

Address: 1851 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G9 Canada
Review: I went to this restaurant many times  to eat. I had pizza and ravioli special . Everything was really delicious and staff  is friendly and kind !! Everything is Homemade!

Address: 1851 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G9 Canada
Review: hands down best food in Regina :)

Address: 1800 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 7K3 Canada
Review: Food was quite delicious, and the service was also great. The music they play is also great to vibe to, and it was altogether a good experience having my dinner there. I don’t remember the names of the dishes as it has been a while since I went there.

Address: 1800 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 7K3 Canada
Review:
Moxies is one of Regina's finest Restaurants. It has a clean sofisticated design which I enjoyed a lot. The staff are friendly and professional. The lighting for evening dining is perfect.

The appetizers, main course and desert were all very good. I was satisfied with the prices as well. I recommend you try out this fine dining restaurant. The booth area has a an intimate feel to it especially when it is dark with that low light.

Address: 1800 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 7K3 Canada
Review: They have some of the best shrimp tacos! Staff was super friendly and they have a good menu. Would definitely come again

Address: 1800 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 7K3 Canada
Review: Great service,  great food.  We shared the pot stickers and nachos and couldn't finish lol

Address: 1800 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 7K3 Canada
Review: Wow, the cashew chicken lettuce wraps were amazing. Great service, food, and atmosphere for our little date night.

Address: 1975 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y1 Canada
Review: While staying at Doubletree by Hilton decided to try the happy hour at Wild Sage Kitchen and Bar.  Had the Classic Canadian Pizza which was very good and a couple of drinks.  Allison, our bartender was great;  friendly and efficient.   Happy we chose this happy hour!

Address: 1975 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y1 Canada
Review: Very dis-appointed as we waited 1/2 hour for a server, no beverage provided and then didn't take our order. We booked for a 4 night stay and if this is how the restaurant is run we will not return. A skeleton staff is no way to run a business. Patrons next to us waited for their bill for over 40 minutes and contemplated on just walking out. Servers have to acknowledge and inform customers ahead of time if there is a wait. Hotel staff is great but, the restaurant needs better management.

Address: 1975 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y1 Canada
Review: Great restaurant located in the Double Tree hotel. 15 dollar pizza and pint special is more than enough food and terrific value.

Address: 1975 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y1 Canada
Review: Food was nicely prepared. Nothing breathtaking but they got all the fundamentals down. Quality food, good service, friendly staff and reasonable prices. Portions were a little small but in line with what you'd expect at similar place. Would eat there again.

Address: 1975 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y1 Canada
Review: Wonderful experience. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Amazing food. We had the beet hummus and rock shrimp fritters to start - both things I wouldn’t normally choose but I was practically licking my plate after! I had the avocado club and Parmesan fries for my entree and it was delicious - a bit of spice but not too much, awesome dip for the fries. And of course dessert! The ice cream! Purple yam and salted egg ice creams - Can’t even describe, but definitely worth checking this place out!

Address: 1946 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2C4 Canada
Review:
Delicious food! Never been to Thailand but just feels very authentic!

Generous portions, will not leave hungry (if even can finish the portion)!

Very fast service, didn’t wait more than 10 minutes to get it.

Address: 1946 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2C4 Canada
Review: The shrimp cakes are a must try! The curry and Tom yum are awesome. It actually suits the name very well. Authentic Thai!! Highly recommend! The service and atmosphere is also great. The decoration reminds me of Asia. A gem in Regina!

Address: 1946 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2C4 Canada
Review: Great service and great tasting food. This is authentic in the way the food comes spicy. I don't think there is an ability to make anything mild (trust me I've asked on a variety of food items and always end up getting medium spiced food). I don't think they do true Thai spice levels but for those who can handle the heat, the hot is hot.

Address: 1946 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2C4 Canada
Review: Went for dinner and loved the food. Shrimp cakes were delicious. Ambience is okay and service wasn't very prompt but the authentic taste makes up for it. Pad thai portion was decent but there wasn't much on the plate of shrimp with cashew (H04). Would come again and try other items on the menu.

Address: 1946 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2C4 Canada
Review: World class!!! In Regina of all places… the most amazing match of flavours, every piece of the meal was cooked to absolute perfection.  The Red Curry Pork was outstanding.  The drunken noodle was equally amazing. Can’t say enough about this place.  If you’re into Thai, you have to try this place!!!

Address: 1845 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0R2 Canada
Review:
Definitely top 3 of my favourite restaurants in Regina.

- The staff here are super helpful and courteous.

- The restaurant environment is really neat, offers great lighting and is great for picture taking as well.

- The food was very tasty, well seasoned and cooked to my preference.

- Their food prices are moderate and there’s a wide variety of food options to choose from.

- Having a dedicated bar tender would be nice tho as there wasn’t one when we visited and the drinks had to be remade a few times.

If you’re also looking for a private dinning or small event room (up to 16 people), you can check out there Lucky 12 private room.

Address: 1845 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0R2 Canada
Review: Great for gathering with family or friends. Has a pretty good selection of menu items, and good service from the staff.

Address: 1845 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0R2 Canada
Review: We were very eager to visit as my husband  has had the Prime Rib multiple times and raved about it.  We wanted a table on the actual rooftop as it was a beautiful evening. Chairs are extremely uncomfortable and not met for someone with any extra body weight. It was a Saturday evening (6pm), one of the tables was enjoying their alcoholic beverages rather loudly and very colorful with their language.  I understand it's a Bar and Grill but it was a bit excessive.  Appy's were delicious, deep fried chicken dumplings and calamari. Cesar salad lacked dressing and croutons. Chicken Souvlaki was dry, fries had no crisp and raved about Prime Rib was far over done. Overall not impressed.  Might go back for drinks but not for a meal.

Address: 1845 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0R2 Canada
Review: The night started out fine, server was friendly, courteous. Took a long time for our drinks though we felt they might be understaffed or we got forgotten about. I got a lime margarita, flavour was good though it didn’t come in a proper margarita glass nor was the rim salted. I ordered the steak and shrimp with pepper sauce and sweet fries. Steak was cooked well though it could have been trimmed better. The fries were good. The pepper sauce was disappointing, it tasted like mushroom soup( which I detest) there were no peppercorns that I could discover despite repeated searching. My partner had the baked penne with broccoli, she enjoyed her dinner. Not sure we would return.

Address: 1845 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0R2 Canada
Review: Late supper date, food was below subpar. Calamari was rubbery and inconsistent. Caesar salad was flavorless and the lettuce was old, mushy and wilted. Lobster pasta was made with a can sauce and dried noodles, burger was frozen, had a very odd flavor like it was old. Fries were hot but floppy and soft, no crisp to them. Overall really bad experience, over priced for the kind of food you'd expect from a lunchroom cafeteria.

Address: 1717 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0P9 Canada
Review: Absolutely excellent dining experience for our first time at this restaurant. We had the spanakopitas as an appetizer, and the entrees were moussaka and Greek pork chop. The food was delicious and large portions, and the service was outstanding. We will certainly be back.

Address: 1717 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0P9 Canada
Review: We had a lovely night with friends for dinner. Food was excellent and service was attentive and fun! Thanks for the great night!

Address: 1717 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0P9 Canada
Review: Me and my wife experience with Memories great and create beautiful memories for our anniversary especially with our host Xania, she was supper nice and friendly addition to that the food was delicious and like home made meal, end of the meal they surprise us with small bottle of champagne with our names on it.

Address: 1717 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0P9 Canada
Review: Their food was beyond my expectation and their service was exceptional. The seafood crepe was so good!

Address: 1717 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0P9 Canada
Review:
Our recent anniversary celebration at Memories Dining & Bar was absolutely outstanding! The staff consistently made us feel remembered from our first visit, giving us a warm and welcoming experience. The ambiance was enchanting, setting the perfect mood for our date night. The food was divine, with each dish expertly crafted and bursting with flavor. The service was top-notch, with attentive and knowledgeable staff who made our evening truly perfect. We left Memories with hearts full of joy and cherished memories. It's the ideal place for special occasions.Thank you, Memories, for an unforgettable experience!

#UnforgettableAnniversary #OutstandingService

Address: 1821 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X7 Canada
Review:
I ordered the Appetizer Combo Platter. The BBQ chicken was fantastic, the Beef was perfect, the mixed veggies were fresh and tasty. The pork wasn't quite as good as normal, but still tasty.
I just wish that they delivered to my area! Open up something in the Northwest, please.

Address: 1821 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X7 Canada
Review:
Well I have to give 5 stars to this place
I came here lots of times and I don’t need to read menu just order Xl beef ball soup, BBQ duck, Bubble Tea，Garlic ribs and my favorite spicy sauce(a little bit sweet). By the way, I've been to Calgary and can't enjoy these delicious food every day, so I came here thousands of miles to have a bite of hot noodles a few days ago. If I have chance or free time in the future and I will be back.

Address: 1821 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X7 Canada
Review: I been going to Mai Phuong for the longest time, it is a hidden gem. The food is always great, along with the service. I almost always stick with the double beef on rice (which is absolutley amazing paired with the hot sauce that comes with it) but I have had other things like the pho which is also great. Family run business, I haven't been here during the lunch buffet or nor have I tried it but I'm sure it's just as great. Definitely a place I reccomend A+.

Address: 1821 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X7 Canada
Review: We get takeout here about once a week; it's our family go-to. They are friendly and the food is tasty.

Address: 1821 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X7 Canada
Review: Each and every time I come to this restaurant, I am so satisfied! It’s a family run business of hard-working people who make great food! We had some family in town last night and we ordered a meal for 7! It was hot, ready for us, and our family loved it! Thanks so much, Mai Phuong!!!!!!

Address: 3823 Sherwood Drive Regina, SK S4R 6N1 Canada
Review: This is our second visit this year and it’s such a treat every time. The service is excellent and fast even when they are packed full. My family of five ordered two 8” pepperoni pizza, chicken souvlaki with fries, pork souvlaki with mash potatoes, beef dip with fries. The souvlaki’s were so delicious. So tender and full of flavor. I highly recommend this place. Can’t wait to be back. Their pizzas are one of the best in the city too!

Address: 3823 Sherwood Drive Regina, SK S4R 6N1 Canada
Review: We just discovered this hidden little gem!  It doesn't look like much from the outside and is tucked into the corner of the plaza, but the inside had great atmosphere, fantastic service and even better food! Serving sizes were huge and their Greek fries are to die for! Everyone in our party left awed!

Address: 3823 Sherwood Drive Regina, SK S4R 6N1 Canada
Review:
Can't rave enough of this place ❤️.. Honestly speaking I didn't have high hopes at first entering the place and settled my expectations at "possible decent to average dining experience". Not so attractive interior with a touch of retro looks. Very basic and simple.
But they reminded me again of an old saying - " don't judge a book by its cover".
By far THE BEST MEAT PLATTER we have had in Canada till date. They say it's a platter for two but can easily satisfy four hungry people.
Highly recommended.

Service is very fast.. it took them hardly 15-20 mins from order to table.
Definitely going back again but with bigger gang..
⭐ Recommended.

Address: 3823 Sherwood Drive Regina, SK S4R 6N1 Canada
Review: Got the pork souvlaki with rice, greek salad, T-bone steak with a poutine, and a ceaser salad. Very delicious! Really recommend the steak, poutine, and greek salad!

Address: 3823 Sherwood Drive Regina, SK S4R 6N1 Canada
Review: The food was really good. Nice ambience and the waiter was very helpful and made our experience worthwhile. I think they should increase the music a bit, this sometimes people just want to have fun while eating.

Address: 4820 Gordon Road Regina, SK S4W 0B7 Canada
Review:
We had Sarah as our server tonight at Canadian Brewhouse south and her service was very good; happy and very fast. Hats off to the bar tender and the kitchen staff as well. Drinks were very fast, as was the food. Brewhouse reliably has great wings so I would suggest checking them out on Wednesdays for wing night.

Greg

Address: 4820 Gordon Road Regina, SK S4W 0B7 Canada
Review:
We enjoy eating at Canadian Brewhouse restaurants, I know they aren’t the classiest of joints but years ago the food was pretty good. We won’t go back to this location. We have ate here 3 times in the last year and the service was lousy every time. This last visit I ordered a Brisket Grilled Cheese with fries for $19.99. Our meals were served with no cutlery or napkins, it took a long time to get a server to bring us some. Probably because the server never served the food just some guy complaining he got called in on his day off. Welcome to the real world buddy!! Lol
The Grilled cheese was two pieces of toasted Texas toast with a slice of cheddar so thin it was translucent. The meat was warmed but overall had too many cold spots to enjoy it, it was wasn’t warm enough to melt the cheese. How can this be called grilled cheese if it isn’t even grilled nor enough cheese to constitute a cheese sandwich? The waitress offered to have it remade but honestly how can you screw up a grilled cheese sandwich? I declined.  She took $4 off the bill instead. See the picture.

Address: 4820 Gordon Road Regina, SK S4W 0B7 Canada
Review:
We were happy to find the kitchen still serving after 10pm on a Sunday, when dining choices are a lot more limited. The Impossible Burger version of the Spicy Hickory BBQ sandwich was tasty, as were the mini pierogis. Lots of the menu was higher priced than I expected, but that's the same everywhere these days. The best thing about our visit was our friendly and attentive server Sara. She made us feel welcome right away, even though we're not usually fans of the sports bar atmosphere.

We'd visit again next time we're out late and in the area.

Address: 4820 Gordon Road Regina, SK S4W 0B7 Canada
Review: Sarah was very sweet and helpful when we needed drinks or food. She checked on us multiple times to make sure we were all doing okay and had everything we needed. Following that she was very smiley and happy throughout the entire time that she was serving us. I believe that she is an amazing waitress and woman all together. As for customer service she is very good at that and accommodating. ❤️

Address: 4820 Gordon Road Regina, SK S4W 0B7 Canada
Review:
Very good experience here, sorry will be a long review, went on October 28 with friends as it was my birthday month and I had free nachos on the App to redeem.
My friends got some appetizers as well and all of them were very good.
I was very shocked by the size of the nachos and could barely make a dent in them in the restaurant, I ended up taking them home and sharing them with my kids after.
Our waitress I have since forgotten her name was awesome and she was very attentive and in a great mood and she was just starting her shift it was nice to go to a restaurant and have Good vibes all around and have the wait staff be genuinely friendly and happy and they were all dressed up as well in the Halloween spirit.
We threw the hostess off a bit as my friend was wearing a large brimmed hat for her gothic Halloween costume and I was wearing a pumpkin shirt and leggings with pumpkins on them. She complimented us on our costumes and my friend looked at her with a straight face and said what costumes? this is our everyday wear! The hostess had a look of horror on her face until we started laughing and said just kidding and then she laughed as well.
5* keep it up! Can't wait to come back again to enjoy the atmosphere

Address: 1850 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 3Y9 Canada
Review: My dining experience at Peking House was exceptional! The ambiance was cozy and inviting, and the service was friendly and attentive. I ordered the Yang Chow fried rice and seafood hot plate, and they were both outstanding and my favorite. The rice was perfectly cooked and the seafood hot plate was flavorful and cooked to perfection. The presentation of the dishes was beautiful and the portion sizes were generous. Overall, I had a wonderful time and would highly recommend Peking House to anyone looking for authentic Chinese cuisine and a great dining experience here in Regina downtown.

Address: 1850 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 3Y9 Canada
Review: This is a restaurant specialising in Beijing cuisine that I thoroughly enjoyed. When our family came to eat, the staff was attentive, dedicated, and carefully guided about the food. They didn't leave us alone especially considering the fact that there were only two of us and one guest table on that Monday. When it comes to food, the food here is outstanding for my family because the dishes we ordered were neither too salty nor too sweet. Also, the fish maw and crab soup, yang chou fried rice, and bbq duck are all excellent.

Address: 1850 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 3Y9 Canada
Review:
We ordered in advance for pickup, and were given a time of 45 minutes before the order would be ready.  We prefer waiting for good food.  However when we arrived, they were extremely busy, and unfortunately we waited another 45 minutes to an hour after paying for the order for our food to be ready.  Again, we prefer to wait for good food as opposed to having it rushed, however if the establishment was that busy, letting us know the wait would be longer than normally anticipated would have been better than waiting around the crowded entry and parking lot.
The food was definitely great, priced a tad high, and the extra wait without as much as a word or an apology left us a bit unimpressed.

Address: 1850 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 3Y9 Canada
Review: Spent 150.00 for 7 people. Only got 2 fortune cookies, and enough lemon and sweet and sour sauce for 1 person. Really !!! Why is your take out food not as good as your in person food? I realize that take out is never as good as being there in person, but I ordered dinners for 10+ people before and it was still good. This time I ordered out favourite items off menu for my special guests. After raving about your food, I was embarrassed and disappointed especially with the shrimp, which was in most dishes. It’s hard to let go of what I considered best Chinese in Regina.

Address: 1850 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 3Y9 Canada
Review: Food was great. The prices are definitely not overprice considering how authentic and scrumptious the food was! The staff was so kind and thoughtful. The atmosphere was great and the restaurant was just spotless!!!

Address: 2305 Smith Street Regina, SK S4P 2P7 Canada
Review: I absolutely loved the mango shrimp salad. My partner's waffle was excessively sauced but that's better than under-sauced. Cozy atmosphere, was a gorgeous day to be seated outside. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Address: 2305 Smith Street Regina, SK S4P 2P7 Canada
Review: We ate here on the patio in the summer with kids.  Service was exceptional and the food was really good.  The five of us each ordered something different, and every dish was excellent. They even whipped up some off-menu mocktails for us!

Address: 2305 Smith Street Regina, SK S4P 2P7 Canada
Review:
The brunch at Fireside Bistro is fantastic!  They have a great little patio outside or  inside seating in the lounge area or in their regular dining room.

They have a variety of breakfast and lunch items to choose from.  From waffles loaded with warm strawberries to make your own omelet or choose from 6 different eggs Benedict, there is something for everyone.

I had the Oaxacan Benedict, which was served spicy Chorizo.  It will leave your tastebuds tingling!

Address: 2305 Smith Street Regina, SK S4P 2P7 Canada
Review: Food was fantastic!! The patio is lovely. Service was good, but really slow. Took a long time to get order taken and over an hour to receive food. Thank goodness it was worth the wait. Tandoori chicken salad was amazing.

Address: 2305 Smith Street Regina, SK S4P 2P7 Canada
Review:
This place is amazing! A hidden gem in the city that deserves to be discovered over and over again!

The food presentation alone is worth the trip.

Please come support this local masterpiece.

They honestly have the best Pecan Pie in all of Canada. Better than any other place I've been since getting to this country a decade ago.

Address: 832 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P5 Canada
Review: First time trying Afghan cuisine and it's way better than I thought! The lamb kabob I ordered is tender and juicy and full of spice aroma.  My wife ordered the lamb stew and it's also very excellent.  What a great experience!

Address: 832 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P5 Canada
Review: The lamb was fall of the bone delicious! It just melted in my mouth. Absolutely wonderful. The chai was very nice and aromatic!

Address: 832 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P5 Canada
Review: The staff were so friendly and caring about customers, the food quality was good , well marinated kebabs, tasty felafel, well cooked rice.but food portion is not as much as expected according to the price. I got platter deal for 2 and it was really small portion.if you order these kebabs and meals separately, it would be more reasonable.

Address: 832 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P5 Canada
Review:
Enjoyed the lunch buffet!
Nice restaurant, I'm the only customer today lol
Not much variety but it's enough
Simple but delicious 👍🏻
$23.3 is acceptable
Love the Kebab and falafel

Address: 832 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P5 Canada
Review:
Very good and delicious food.
Excellent customer service.

Address: 2234 14th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0X8 Canada
Review: I ordered the bowl and it was so fresh and delicious. It had chick peas, veggies and I added greens. The dressings came on the side which I love. Then I can control how much dressing I want. There's nothing worse than too much dressing or sauce on food destroying the dish.

Address: 2234 14th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0X8 Canada
Review:
Cozy and hipster spot with delicious food! It’s fresh, tasty and unique. I had the dill egg salad sandwhiche and it felt like a gourmet meal. They also have funky coffee and tea drinks, so it’s nice to even stop in for a quick to go item.

I was impressed by how many nooks and crannies the space had, there’s a back room you might even be able to reserve for a shower or party! Great neighborhood cafe/restaurant!

Address: 2234 14th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0X8 Canada
Review:
I moved to Regina roughly 3 mo. ago and have been craving a good cinnamon bun since. Been to a few different places and hadn't  been able to find that one special cinnamon bun that satisfied my craving, until I tried this one (see picture for reference).
The smooth, creamy texture and flavor captivated my heart from the very first bite all the way to the last one!

Address: 2234 14th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0X8 Canada
Review: Generally love this place it is on my way to work and one of the only places open earlier in the morning. However the last couple of times I have went there I have had to wait longer than usual and the lattes have been awful! Poorly made, too strong, coffee grounds in my drink. The one I got this morning was undrinkable. I expect more when I am paying $7.

Address: 2234 14th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0X8 Canada
Review: Love this place. Best donuts, best service. It can get quite busy around the lunch rush, but otherwise it's a nice, super chill place to have some good + great coffee if you're a work from home type like myself!

Address: 3215 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
The only bad thing is that they are not open the whole week! 😂😂 They open on Wednesdays - until Sundays.
So nice atmosphere. Service they offer is exclusive! Food was done in nothing! I think they were waiting for us with our dishes prepared and all! 😂😂
I had the ""LOBSTER BENEDICT "" and my husband had ""BISTRO SKILLET"" .
and we also had a cappuccino.  It came down to 68dls. AMAZING!

Address: 3215 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
I can’t get over how their Benedict lobster is soooo good! It’s got a nice kick to it and I normally can’t handle spicy food but dang, this was soooo good! My partner got the shakshuka and she couldn’t even finish it all with such large portion. (Even better to have leftovers)

Our server had started there for only a week and he was super friendly and very quick!

The sister restaurant, Luna is a must. Have to try the Athenian!

Address: 3215 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
I consider myself a brunch fanatic, so I feel like I’ve definitely set some high standards. Breakfast Bistro did not disappoint. From the moment you walk through the door, the ambience of the restaurant is so inviting you never want to leave. Of course the food is spectacular, always consistently bringing out the best dishes (and the best mimosas and daiquiris).

But the service here is unlike any other. I elected for a dairy heavy meal - even though I’m lactose intolerant - and 3 servers made sure to check in on me and even brought me some lactose pills. All of them were so kind and talkative, even though I had brunch by myself!

If you’re ever in Regina, you’d be remiss not to try Breakfast Bistro. You won’t be disappointed!

Address: 3215 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review: Had a lovely lunch. I have all the allergies (Dairy, soy, gluten, egg) so eating out can be a challenge. My server was very helpful with recommendations. I had a delicious Ruben on the gluten free bun with the side of yam fries.

Address: 3215 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
An absolute gem of a spot for breakfast in Regina. A bit on the pricier side (expect to pay 20 plus per person), but the food was delicious with decent portions!

I enjoyed the atmosphere of the Breakfast Bistro, we sat inside and enjoyed the modern decor, but there was an outdoor patio that might have been nice to try as well.

Have a special occasion coming up? Give this place a try!

Address: 1-425 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N8 Canada
Review: The food was delicious. I loved the banana bread French toast, it was so unique. Service was quick, and our waitress was so nice. Definitely worth trying😊

Address: 1-425 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N8 Canada
Review: Came here twice and I must say the service is amazing. The waiters/waitresses are super kind. The food is pretty good too and they got a decent sized menu with lots of options. Definitely one of the best local cafes to come visit

Address: 1-425 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N8 Canada
Review: We left feeling like they could not decide whether it was a boutique breakfast place or cafe as there were a mixture of both characteristics.  Good food, but overpriced.  We spent $40 to share a single breakfast (avocado/ eggs benedict on waffle) and two (non refillable) mugs of coffee.  The presentation was excellent, like a boutique style restaurant, service was more of a coffee shop feel.  The tables arent set, we had to collect utensils at the front counter (which is more of a coffee shop feel). We also had go to the counter to pay.

Address: 1-425 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N8 Canada
Review: The best cake I have ever had! Mooist, not to sweet and flavorful! Beautiful inside and out!

Address: 1-425 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N8 Canada
Review:
I’ve been in Regina for only 2 months and was looking for a good place to go for breakfast but was never satisfied..until I came here! The service is amazing, and the food is 10/10!
If you are looking for good quality and fresh food you absolutely have to go! It is definitely a must in Regina!

Address: 2545 S Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 0M9 Canada
Review: There was too much sauce in the poutine (too much mayo! and by the way, why mayo??!), they could have served it seperately. taco salad was ok. The drinks were good and fancy. the waitress did a good job.

Address: 2545 S Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 0M9 Canada
Review:
Updated review: Tried The Lobby again for lunch with some friends after 5 months. It’s not better. If you can’t cook something, take it off the menu. Or if you know it’s burnt, don’t send it out. This was the case with my salad. I ordered the Apple Walnut salad with salmon and the salmon underneath was completely burnt and hard, looked like chicken. The service was better but I’m still not impressed. I still stand by my previous review and I’ll like never refer someone to The Lobby.

Very disappointed in the service. We had a group of 8 and had to wait 10-20 minutes for the waitress to ask us if we needed more drinks, not to mention my brother is still waiting for his refill…As we were wrapping up to leave, the restaurant was completely empty save us and a single other patron. There were absolutely NO staff in sight for about 20 minutes. We were finally able to wave over one staff member who tried to charge my grandfather for the entire table when we had 4 separate bills. Most of us were pleased with our drinks and food, despite some of it being on the pricey side. However, this did nothing to outweigh the terrible service.

Address: 2545 S Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 0M9 Canada
Review: The food was nice. Drinks were good. So was the service and the atmosphere. I had fish tacos, poutine and berry fizz.

Address: 2545 S Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 0M9 Canada
Review: Very limited options for vegetarians/people who eat halal. Any fish option has beer batter which we couldn’t eat. Had to order the other options we had remaining and it was just okay wasn’t that great. Customer service was really good though.

Address: 2545 S Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 0M9 Canada
Review:
A very cool, easygoing place to hang out.  It's far enough away from downtown that you don't get some of the more unpleasant clientele that hangs out in that area.  The owners and the staff are very personable and the food (especially the Wings, Pizza, and Tacos) is really good.

It also probably has the best Patio in the city and we always have a great time here.

Address: 5064 4th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 0J6 Canada
Review:
We took a little convincing to stay, I won't lie about that. But im honestly glad we did! We sat in the lounge and the place looks well traveled in people wise, and the menus may look a little dated, but I feel this brings a very Italian character feel to it in some way.
The pizza we ordered was the Juliana's Special from the back page of the menu, and we were not disappointed when our server said it was a pretty thick layered pizza! The flavour was on point for how it's described in the menu - fresh ingredients, quality crust, and you can taste the love in every bite! My kind of place!!
I am incredibly sad we do not have a Juliana's back home, but it will be a pizza I remember!!

Address: 5064 4th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 0J6 Canada
Review: Great pizza!  Had been hearing great things about this restaurant for years. Finally got there!  Very good pizza! We loved the crust, especially!  Definitely will return!

Address: 5064 4th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 0J6 Canada
Review: I used to be this places biggest advocate and was a long time customer. Not anymore. Standards have gone way down. They essentially sold me saucy bread this last visit. When I got home and opened the box, I called to tell them the issue and the manager couldn’t be bothered. Emails have gone unanswered. Proof is attached.

Address: 5064 4th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 0J6 Canada
Review: Their hours of operation are a lie. Their Google hours of operation state they are open until 11pm (and say updated 1 week ago, as of June 1st 2023) everyday but when you call their business their automated phone service states they’re only open until 10. Thanks for lying for no apparent reason about your hours, that’s super helpful to those who plan in advance. Will go to a business that doesn't lie about their hours in the future.  Also for those looking the atmosphere of this place was heavily influenced by a 1980’s truck stop. Thanks for nothing Juliana’s.

Address: 5064 4th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 0J6 Canada
Review: Ordered from Juliana last night and it was fantastic! Got a combo of pizza, dry ribs, pop and a side salad and it was all delicious. Order was ready in under 25 mins for pickup. I normally dislike extra thick layer of toppings on pizza but this has now made me a convert to a thick pizza. It was cooked perfectly and not soggy on the bottom at all. Will definitely be ordering from them regularly from now on!

Address: 3610 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: The experience visiting this restaurant is always wonderful. Our server was very friendly and patient. Food was excellent. I would definitely recommend their florida special sandwich with the garlic parmesan fries. I liked the atmosphere all around with those little candles and the music. Also, the brownie dessert was my favourite part of the meal that night. I may have named the items a different than what exactly they are in the menu but that’s the closest I could remember them.

Address: 3610 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: Food was delish, place was hip and rocking for a nice dinner setting. Prices on the high end (for the area) but you definitely won't be disappointed. Went to this place several times this week while in town. Will definitely be back!!! The two pics are the lettuce wrap app, and the blackened chicken Alfredo. The chicken was done perfectly! Moist and very flavorful. Side tip is to add Cajun thru out the pasta as well. Thank me later🍻

Address: 3610 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review:
Was a last second change of venue.  Our experience was nice.  It was quiet since it was after the lunch rush.  The meals were tasty, bursting with flavour. Portions were a little small for the price.  But then everywhere seems to be higher in price these days.   Szechuan beef noodle bowl x3 spicy was just a nice amount of spice for accentuated flavour.  If you are one that wants a burning sensation, you can always get hotter than what they offer.
Others had Tiki Tuna Poke bowl, burger and fries, and chicken quesadilla.  The fries and gravy were quite welcoming surprisingly.
The service was attentive, polite and welcoming.

Address: 3610 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: Atmosphere is great! Food is delicious. Service and staff is attentive. Would definitely be back to try brunch and happy hour. The price is reasonable and good size portion. Definitely is good date night or girls out night.

Address: 3610 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: Decent place to eat dinner. Food quality was good and service was friendly. We hit the end of the dinner rush so food was a bit slow, but that’s to be expected

Address: A-2136 Robinson Street Regina, SK S4T 2P7 Canada
Review:
I had dinner at Orange Izakaya Cafe, and it was great! The food was tasty, especially their rolls. It's clear their chefs know what they're doing!
The server working there was friendly and helpful, which made the whole experience even better. The place itself has a cool vibe - very welcoming and clean.
Prices were decent for the quality and amount of food. Can't beat it!
Highly recommend here to anyone looking for a great Asian food in Regina.

Address: A-2136 Robinson Street Regina, SK S4T 2P7 Canada
Review: Had a lovely lunch here.  The food was very high quality and delicious.  We had several sushi items and veg tempura which impressed on all fronts.  The tempura batter was perfect.  Also the chicken teriyaki and miso.  Shared all and were very pleased.  Staff are very attentive and friendly.

Address: A-2136 Robinson Street Regina, SK S4T 2P7 Canada
Review: I liked the food but the portions are very small myself and a friend were still hungry I'd happily pay more to be full. Service was slow which I was surprised by as it wasn't that busy maybe 5 other tables. The atmosphere was nice we sat outside the downside was the tree above us it needs pruning. I would eat there again but maybe go not as hungry next time.

Address: A-2136 Robinson Street Regina, SK S4T 2P7 Canada
Review: My daughter went to the Orange Izakaya Fusion Cafe . We loved the food,  the service was outstanding.  The Atmosphere was very Authentic and also warm on a cold winter's evening.

Address: A-2136 Robinson Street Regina, SK S4T 2P7 Canada
Review: Such a cool little place! We stopped in at the end of a long road trip of junky fast food for something fresh and delicious, and this place DELIVERED. It started to get really busy after we came in but the service was top notch and the rolls were so tasty. Nothing bad to say, would return anytime.

Address: 1950 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X9 Canada
Review: Best Japanese food in town with nice and cozy atmosphere, the dish that particularly stood out to me was the sushi. The rice was perfectly seasoned, and the topping like fish or their fruity craft was incredibly fresh its just melt-in-your-mouth tender. Highly recommend this Japanese restaurant to anyone who appreciates exceptional food and a memorable dining experience.

Address: 1950 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X9 Canada
Review: Food was very good but it’s definitely on the more pricey side so if you’re going out to celebrate definitely come here. I found the portion for the ramen to be quite big, however the sushi and appetizers were not that much in quantity in relation to what you pay for. Highly recommend coming for the ramen!

Address: 1950 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X9 Canada
Review: Spacious restaurant, good food. Fast service. The only downside is paid parking at the back, but I don’t mind because the food is worth it.

Address: 1950 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X9 Canada
Review: Our waiter was very charismatic and the food was great. Exactly what I expected for the ramen that was ordered.

Address: 1950 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X9 Canada
Review: Overall very good taste with fast service. Ramen tastes good. Wonder if they have dessert menu 🧐

Address: 2062 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2T7 Canada
Review: It was so beautiful on the patio! The food was super delicious. My boyfriend recommended here as I have never been before, I am so glad that he did!

Address: 2062 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2T7 Canada
Review:
House Rub $17.50
Salt & Pepper $17.50

Chicken wings never again, dry, tough & chewy.
------------------------------------
Triple B Salad $18

Salad was good, could have used a bit more dressing.
------------------------------------
Hall Nachos $23

Good & would order this again.
------------------------------------
Staff was nice!

Address: 2062 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2T7 Canada
Review: Great place to meet with friends. The food is really good and you get a good portion. There are so many options it's almost overwhelming. The service is really where this place shines. Our server was so attentive and we were very impressed with her. Friendly atmosphere and a great place to catch up with people.

Address: 2062 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2T7 Canada
Review:
Extremely disappointing service for take out. Been asked to sit one red chair and no one bothered to follow up for good 15-20 mins.
And when finally approached, bar guy grabs food immediately without a sec delay and says “sorry about that”.

If this is suppose to be a top notch joint…… i would say u will get a lot better service elsewhere.

Address: 2062 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2T7 Canada
Review: I came in for a quick drink with a friend and was greeted with a somber attitude bartender who asked me if I was hungry. Had no knowledge of anything. Drinks were sub par and had no emotions was super disappointed because this was my only night off and was looking forward to my local neighbour hood to fulfill my evening with fun. I’ve worked in the industry for 18 years and currently agave worked my way up to being a GM and I’m proud, that being said I was throughly disappointed with Travis tonight and his bartender guest experience. Thanks but no thanks ever again

Address: 736 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R3 Canada
Review: Not a regular dinner spot as the prices are high. Great for special occasions but make sure you call ahead for a reservation as they have limited spots. Parking is limited so if you go with a group it is best to carpool together. The food, service and experience is great. My family of 4 ordered a combination entree each, alcoholic drinks for 2 and 2 desserts which equaled to $300+ without tips. The chef gave us a complimentary sake which was nice. I wouldn't recommend the deep fried ice cream and deep fried banana. Everything else tasted good.

Address: 736 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R3 Canada
Review: Definitely on the more pricey side. The parking is limited however, the food is decent and worth the experience if you’re celebrating a special occasion.

Address: 736 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R3 Canada
Review: We enjoyed this place. Food was good, cook was funny, flipping his knife and cooking tools up in the air and catching them, little fire show as well. Also brought out the rubber band setup for both my girls so they could use chopsticks. Wife felt they rushed us out a bit and it's going to cost you here so be prepared but we'd go back.

Address: 736 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R3 Canada
Review:
It's entertaining and the food tastes pretty good. The only issue is you'll pay quite a bit and you'll leave hungry. By quite a bit, I mean you could eat steak and lobster at the Keg, have great service, and you'd be out about the same $$$, though the Keg won't juggle fire at your table... This place is good for an experience but I can't imagine wanting to repeat it very often.

Disclaimer - I'm a large person and eat accordingly. If you're small, you might not notice the portions are small. I review things in case I forget about them later.

Address: 736 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R3 Canada
Review: Expensive but low quality food, you pay $80 dollars for 3 piece of small scallops and shrimps, half not fresh lobster, 100g steak, one chicken leg meat and another $10 for a small bowl of rice to be fired with a egg, ye, they add a egg to rice then it costs $10, I mean if you are the type of guy who wants to waste money, you go ahead .Oh wait, they play acrobatics for you before it start, chief throw knife and forks around, but i won’t give him any quarter if that’s a street show, even you can do that with 2 hours practice lmao, this restaurant had been overrated so hard, don’t waste your money here!

Address: 1101D Kramer Boulevard Regina, SK S4S 5W4 Canada
Review: I’d say the experience here was good but could be better. The wait time for my meal was quite long, although they did mention to me that my food would take about 15 minutes to get ready, it took longer than that. I also requested for rice to be added to my meal as it was only chicken. The serving was quite small and appeared a bit soggy. The chicken was really good, tasted really nice and my colleagues also enjoyed their meal.

Address: 1101D Kramer Boulevard Regina, SK S4S 5W4 Canada
Review: If I can give the service 0 star，I will. I want order to dine in, and I ordered 4 dishes. They refuse to provide any water unless I buy a bottle from them. They said they do not have any cup. If you don’t even have a cup in a restaurant, then just shut it down.

Address: 1101D Kramer Boulevard Regina, SK S4S 5W4 Canada
Review: I really enjoy Pronto. It’s my new go-to place. The crispy Dynamite roll is my favorite and I am excited to try more! When I asked for more soy sauce, they gave me an extra 4-5 packets!

Address: 1101D Kramer Boulevard Regina, SK S4S 5W4 Canada
Review:
The food was disgusting, bland, way overcooked, and looked old.

The ramen broth was gross, noodles were cheap, veggies were old, the egg was way overdone, the pork was overcooked and cut into sad little strips, it was like eating tiny strips of leather, and the rice was old and dry.

Ramen is served in a plastic bowl with plastic cutlery and the rice is served in a small paper bowl.

This is one of those places you wish you couldn't see the food being prepared in.  The kitchen is filthy, the decor and lighting in the dining area has years of dust caked on them.

With the close proximity to the Uni, I genuinely feel like they're preying on students that just don't know any better.
There is nothing tasteful, genuine, or clean about this place.

Address: 1101D Kramer Boulevard Regina, SK S4S 5W4 Canada
Review: Love this place, combo A to go is my regular order! Sushi is fresh and tasteful. I come here at least once a week for the past year or so. Love and recommend this place.

Address: 2005 Prince of Wales Drive Regina, SK S4V 3A3 Canada
Review: The food is great. The place is huge. So huge that it's hard too get good service. We went back to check if it was better than before. It wasn't. Both times they were covering this huge place with 2 worker's. Too recap, good food, poor service.

Address: 2005 Prince of Wales Drive Regina, SK S4V 3A3 Canada
Review: We were there on Sat afternoon,July8/23 with our family and as we were leaving, my nephew had a heart attack outside door! Ken (GM), was sooo amazing and helpful and was there ready to do anything we needed! It was very appreciated! Thank you Ken! Next time I’m in town I will b happy to give you our business again! My nephew is recovering and will b fine! Great Place, I recommend it to everyone! GREAT food and EXCELLENT service!     Mary 💜

Address: 2005 Prince of Wales Drive Regina, SK S4V 3A3 Canada
Review:
Have enjoyed Canadian Brewhouse in the past.   However, we had issues with the cleanliness and food availability when we were there on Friday June 30 at 6pm.

Several items on the menu which were recommended to us by the server, were not available.  Our party, and the server, only become aware after the order was placed.   This implies poor communication with management when items listed as specials (several drink specials) as well as common items like onion rings were not longer available.

Also, we sat in the patio area at the top of the restaurant and, even though we don't expect cleanliness to be a top priority for outdoor seating, the quality in this case was terrible.   Many of the tables and chairs were covered in bird droppings with no attempt made to clean them.  We managed to move things around sufficiently to find a clean area for our group, but we were surprised there was no attempt made by Canadian Brewhouse staff to assist.

Definitely not the standards I expect from this restaurant.

Address: 2005 Prince of Wales Drive Regina, SK S4V 3A3 Canada
Review: Went for the 40 oz steak nite. Had an issue with my tickets and the woman helping me was so friendly. Waitress was a lil cold after we had issues. Finally got it all sorted and our steaks came 😀 . They were very flavorful but extremely fatty as is shown in the 2nd pic. All in all was well worth the price. Will definitely go again if they have this night again!

Address: 2005 Prince of Wales Drive Regina, SK S4V 3A3 Canada
Review:
Went in and had a bad experience with the manager on shift. The General Manger Ken Poag was quick to reach out and address the matter. He sorted things out in a polite manager.

Good food, Good servers, Overall a good place. If you are in the area and need good place to sit down. Give Brewhouse a try.

Address: 2080 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2T7 Canada
Review: Our family visited after not being at this restaurant in many years. I was unsure what the kids would think but everyone more than loved the food!! The rolls, bowls, and pad thai was all so very very good! On top of the great food we dealt with two staff members and they were both fantastic! Everyone said we have to come back when we are back in Regina.

Address: 2080 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2T7 Canada
Review:
Very quick service. Came in around 1pm on a Thursday for lunch. Sister got the lunch special 4, and i got the beef rice noodle(pho) combination and sweet and sour spare ribs

Large portions, broth is really good. Good very flavourful. nice

They have some spaces cordoned off and it's bit of a maze. There are no parking spaces around it, so we parked on Angus St

Address: 2080 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2T7 Canada
Review: Was an order of take out. I will say I was quite happy with the service given here. This is some of the best take out food of (this kind) I've ever had. Price was far less than everywhere else in the city. Restaurant appeared to be clean when I walked inside to pay. Staff seemed knowledgeable of the type of food being sold. Food packaging was perfect for portion size! Except for the fortune cookies only given 2 fortune cookies for a dinner of 4 I bought :( all of that aside, I'd recommend Viet-Thai over any other Thai food chain restaurants I've been to. This place was awarded the best Chinese food year over year in the city for a reason. Keep up the great work highly recommended. The downside was that the inside could use a bit of renovations and / or better styling. It was clean for sure. However, looked slightly dated for the year we're in now. As well parking is utterly horrible, in my opinion, some to the rear or the building for free, as well as out front for payment.

Address: 2080 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2T7 Canada
Review: I highly recommend trying the food combo at Viet Thai Restaurant, featuring the mouthwatering Pork on Skewer, Grilled Chicken, and Stir-Fried Lemongrass Shrimp. The flavors are incredible, and each dish is cooked to perfection. You also have the option to choose between 2 Spring Rolls or 2 Fresh Rolls, which are equally delicious. Don't miss out on this amazing combination!

Address: 2080 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2T7 Canada
Review:
Honestly if I could give a place 6 stars I would. I am a HUGE Vietnamese food fanatic and this was hands down one of the best places I've eaten. Number 39 or 40 is the go to! 17 bucks and you get the biggest bowl of all time.

And on top if you order the fresh salad rolls, they give you 2 MASSIVE rolls. Def recommended.

Also Tin the server, man is an absolute beauty. So friendly and nice. Go just for him 👏👏

Address: 3618 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: I have been coming almost weekly to ZamZams since it first opened.  At the start the place was an absolute gem.  The food was flavourful, the prices modest, the service quick and the staff extremely personable.   I brought all my friends and family here and they too became regular customers, telling their friends and family.  Year after year it has got worse in every area to the point where I've stopped going and so does everyone I know.  The food is bland, expensive for what you get (the platter is just a 25 dollar bowl of rice with hardly any meat) service is slow and the new staff clearly don't care about their work or the customer.  I've been the only person in and there are five employees working and still it takes forever to make my meal.  I wrote this entire review while waiting in line and I've now waited 20 minutes to get a platter made-- last time I'm ever coming here.  Too bad.

Address: 3618 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: It looks run down on the outside, but inside is bright & clean. Fantastic, fresh middle eastern food with lots of well-marked gluten free items. Helpful staff and delicious meal!

Address: 3618 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review:
Don’t miss out on this this one!
Had the lentil soup, grannies special and a wrap, all were delicious!!!
Was my first time here, staff were very helpful in explaining the different options and combos.
Then made recommendations for the wrap by asking a few simple questions about my likes, such as sweet or spicy and was went with their recommendations, glad I did!
I enjoy my wraps and this place is top notch!

Address: 3618 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review:
We were driving  through Regina and after a long day of travelling we wanted something tasty, healthy and comforting
This was exactly that & more!!
I totally recommend getting the platter with tandoori chicken and lamb

Great service!

Address: 3618 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: I really enjoy their lentil soup! The flavours are balanced and delicious! Whenever I come in, the staff are always so polite too. I recommend ZamZam!

Address: 890 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P5 Canada
Review: Experience...Not good. Had to wait for an hour before food was served. Ordered medium rare steak, got a well-done one instead (see picture), lacked flavor too! The lady who attended to us apologized for the delay in serving our food which was good, but then said initially that the bill will be on the house because of the delay as per the manager, only to return and say that it wasn't and a discount will be given instead. Proper communication needs to be better. Lobster tasted great though esp the sauce, I have to give credit to that. I like the ambiance of the place. But overall, not a very good dine-in experience.

Address: 890 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P5 Canada
Review: Okay, I know ordering a steak at a seafood restaurant is a gamble but this just isn’t medium well. Food and drinks were good otherwise. The service was just okay. We were ready to order before we even had our drink orders taken and then had to ask for additional biscuits when we could finally flag down our waitress.

Address: 890 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P5 Canada
Review: Saturday night 6pm and we were shown to a booth right away. This was all you eat shrimp extravaganza so no waiting was appreciated. The booths are a tight fit but clean. The wait to order was short and the food came out fast and hot. Our server Serg, was friendly and helpful, extra helpings were offered and at the table before we had finished our previous setting. Would go again

Address: 890 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P5 Canada
Review: It's a great place to have fun. The food is perfect. If they can add more staff, everything will be even better

Address: 890 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P5 Canada
Review:
Was our first family visit to this place, food was amazing!!.
Very good service and very friendly people.

Address: 2143 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2V1 Canada
Review:
Must try this eatery.

100% authentic South Indian food.

What I liked the best about this eatery is, that they are entirely focused on food quality rather then spending thousands of dollars on decor as I have noticed in many restaurants in Regina and other cities where eateries have decor worth million but food quality not good at all.

This eatery have simple but functional dinning area. (See pictures)

We ordered Tandoori Pomfret, Madras Fish Curry and Onion Dosa. Food presentation, Taste and quantity was simply outstanding. The best South Indian Food we have eaten in long time.

None of the food was spicy for us. Each items tasted different and unique. Onion Dosa crunchy from outside and very soft inside. All the sauces served with all the dishes were very delicious as well.

Place was busy with dine in and take outs.

Met the owner, Raj. He was cooking serving and attending customers. Always a good sign for family run business.

Highly recommended.

Address: 2143 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2V1 Canada
Review: I would rate it 3.5/5. It's a low-key, homey restaurant which I liked. The portions are generous and reasonably priced. The food itself was okay to me - Definitely not bad but wouldn't call it one of my top experiences for Indian food. The hot and sour soup was the spiciest soup I've ever had in my life anywhere - Did not expect to find that at a restaurant in Regina!

Address: 2143 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2V1 Canada
Review:
It’s first time I am going to review a food of a restaurant.
I have never ever done it no matter how bad the food is.. however, this time it went beyond bad and I have had a pathetic experience and it triggered me to write a review.
My brother ordered lunch for me and he chose Noodles and Manchurian..
😥 Disgusting food.. burnt Manchurian and the level of spice was to an extent that we could hardly taste the food.. it was just the spice.
Really disappointed. They should at least not serve burnt food.

Address: 2143 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2V1 Canada
Review: Best non-veg thalli  i ever had in Regina. Each dish on a plate has its own aroma and taste. Staff is good knows how to treat customer and make them Happy with delicious food .

Address: 2143 Albert Street Regina, SK S4P 2V1 Canada
Review:
This is my go to Indian restaurant every time I visit my friend in Regina! Great service, clean environment, clean washroom.

The food variety is good for me as I love Indian food, especially dosa. Good quantity and delicious!

Thank you!

Address: 4303 Rochdale Boulevard Regina, SK S4X 4R3 Canada
Review:
We got dessert. Had to wait a the waitress advised she had a big party to tend to and would get back to us. Ordered tea and my pot of ware was warm so had to ask for another one. This time it came hot. Was not offered any refills though.

ATM machine was left unlocked and unattended to at 11pm.  That was weird.

Address: 4303 Rochdale Boulevard Regina, SK S4X 4R3 Canada
Review: Boston Pizza is a consistent, reliable chain restaurant. The food preparation is standardized and you can generally depend on getting a decent quality product. Having arrived at our hotel later in the day, we were looking for something close and quick. We split a small pizza and had a salad each. The garden salad at BPs is better than those at most other chains. Along with a mix of greens, there was several veggies added, including grated beets. The salad has character and doesn’t seem like the restaurant is trying to save money by limiting ingredients. This location in Regina was friendly and quick. Would go back again.

Address: 4303 Rochdale Boulevard Regina, SK S4X 4R3 Canada
Review: Pizza is really tasty and there is a good family atmosphere. Good service overall.

Address: 4303 Rochdale Boulevard Regina, SK S4X 4R3 Canada
Review: This place was so much fun! Server named BellA there was great!! Amazing service, cold beer and good food!

Address: 4303 Rochdale Boulevard Regina, SK S4X 4R3 Canada
Review:
I wish I could give half a star lol but the service at this location was really awful.
My family and I had dinner here for my birthday and the server was really rude to us. Either she was racist or she just found black people annoying but she rolled her eyes every time she had to serve us. The worst was when she came to collect the bills and she made it so clear that she did not want to serve us. As if that wasn’t enough she continued to roll her eyes at us while serving another table next to us.

Address: 3136 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1P2 Canada
Review: I tried the salmon salad sandwich on gluten free bread and it was amazing! My sister had a vegetarian burger that was flavourful and delicious. Two thumbs up!

Address: 3136 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1P2 Canada
Review:
Stopped in for a bite on our way through Sask. Ordered the Deli sandwich which was good, but extremely small. Also ordered the side Cesar salad which is where things went downhill. Clearly the lettuce is not washed as every single piece still has lots of visible dirt on it. I think washing your produce is the bare minimum of expectations when paying +$40 for a lunch for 2 that still leaves you hungry.

Look elsewhere if hungry in the area.

Address: 3136 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1P2 Canada
Review: Great tasting coffee and has a variety of savoury dishes. The bagel sandwiches and breakfast bowls are my favourite. The sandwiches are decent and I know others really like hot lunch offerings. They do have a liquor license for that after work drink. Really eclectic vibe and you can purchase plants, local artwork and seasonal produce occasionally. Sweet treats are a limited selection and they don't have pastries, pies or cakes.

Address: 3136 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1P2 Canada
Review:
Really excellent coffee and if you can get a hold of one of their Morning Glory muffins, they are MOIST and delicious. A perfect breakfast. They switch up their specialty drinks and food all t he time so it's worth following them on Insta - I'm still thinking about the butterfly pea coconut tea I had last year. Super refreshing on a hot day and just what I needed.

While I was in a shop recently, a gentleman came in insisting that he lost his wallet - he clearly didn't and just wanted some food but the owners were super kind and gave him some even though I offered to pay. This is a cafe that supports their community and I love that.

Address: 3136 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1P2 Canada
Review: Being Indian from country India, I am pure vegetarian (no meat) and this coffee house I found best for myself to have 95 % vegetarian eatery options, I ordered Iced Mocha and Mediterranean bowl, tasty was amazing and the atmosphere and interior of cafe is very calm, relaxing, refreshing and homely. Out and out love it 100 %. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Address: 6843 Rochdale Boulevard Regina, SK S4X 2Z2 Canada
Review: I have been ordering from S R Kitchen for many many years. My company from Ontario tried its food for the first time, he said "Hard to find a Chinese food restaurant comparable to your level across the country! The BBQ pork is the best I have ever tried" That says a lot!

Address: 6843 Rochdale Boulevard Regina, SK S4X 2Z2 Canada
Review: Even with the strains of getting all the New Year orders out food was ready at the time promised. It was hot and tasty. Been going here since 1985.

Address: 6843 Rochdale Boulevard Regina, SK S4X 2Z2 Canada
Review: Party for 20+, excellent, everyone enjoys it. BTW, really liked the renovation! I didn't know you have the new Keto option, nice!

Address: 6843 Rochdale Boulevard Regina, SK S4X 2Z2 Canada
Review:
Sadly they have really gone down hill.
Higher prices and lesser quality food.
Ordered pork low mien.
Got dry noodles, 2 pieces of broccoli, one mushroom, a couple pieces of celery and 2 small slices of pork.
Would not recommend.

Address: 6843 Rochdale Boulevard Regina, SK S4X 2Z2 Canada
Review: Poor customer service…. Ordered about $90 worth of food. When we ordered, we put half the order in with one lady and then the phone was passed to another person to finish the order. When I picked it up and took it home, we were missing a dish. We figure because 2 different people were taking our order. We called to let them know so I had to drive back to pick it up. I want to specify that they forgot to charge and include it in my original order. When I went back they charged me for the single dish that they forgot.  I feel that since it was their mistake, they shouldn’t be charging me since my family was sitting at home waiting for me to get back to start eating. It took me about 25 minutes there and back so the food waiting for me at home was not as hot anymore. We all had to microwave our food.
