There are so many places to choose from and yes, this was my go to… but customer service is at the top of my priority list so I will not be going back.

Address: 2936 13th Ave Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: It was very busy at the restaurant today and the two servers definitely did their best to keep things running smoothly. All of our meals were good. The beef in the beef dip was a little on the dry side. I would come back though.

Address: 2936 13th Ave Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: I wanted to like it so bad. It’s an iconic location in Regina and I was excited. However I am so disappointed. It was extremely expensive for less than mediocre food. The burger was a decent size but it wasn’t special, there were basically no fries and the milkshake was just milk… nothing about it was a milkshake. I’d rather just go spend $30 at McDonald’s.

Address: 2936 13th Ave Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: Went here for the 1st time tonight for supper. Looking for a local mom and Pop café .this did not disappoint It’s a nostalgic 50s 60s diner awesome little spot reminds me of happy days diner on TV . Friday ‘s special was fish and chips and for dessert, which was free by the way, made from scratch apple pie. so good ! the prices are quite reasonable and the beer is ice cold . Come support this place. It is great! It’s  in the Cathedral Area in Regina. Definitely recommend.

Address: 2936 13th Ave Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: My 1st time here. Such a great ambiance.   They were also busy. Friendly staff. Food was great. I had the bacon cheese burger.

Address: 2936 13th Ave Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: Recommended by my sister on a visit to Regina, and it did not disappoint! Food was fresh, scratch made soup and delicious, service by server Galya was stellar, courteous fast and efficient. As for dessert it was a well executed classic, Carrot Cake! Definitely will return.

Address: 2161 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 2A5 Canada
Review: Love this place - with a very nice patio. Lots of choices of Vege food. Also love their special lattes. Super good service. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Address: 2161 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 2A5 Canada
Review: Stumbled on this delightful cafe when I was in town for a few hours. Food was great, very nice staff, I will be back again! Our group had the Chicken Shawarma and the Falafel wrap.

Address: 2161 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 2A5 Canada
Review:
Lovely place!
Baba ganoush was really special, smoky flavor eggplant puree!
Lentil soup is nice too

Address: 2161 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 2A5 Canada
Review:
Coffee is delicious! The chicken Arabia in focaccia bread is also delicious!
The owners are super friendly.
Will definitely visit again!
Cozy atmosphere, stress relieving music.

Address: 2161 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 2A5 Canada
Review:
Food was amazing, but there was lack of communication with the kitchen. I got there and ordered at 1150 and our food didn't come out until after 1230. Especially when you're on your work lunch, you don't have time to wait 30 min for a meal.
We will definitely come back, but I can understand that sometimes things happen beyond the restaurants control.

Address: 2606-28th Avenue Regina, SK S4S 6P3 Canada
Review: Had a good time at Earls south location. The seats were spacious. The staff are friendly and professional. Everything was fine but oh lord the biryani was questionable. This is where I would say leave this dish to the pros lol because it was not as good, the side bread 4/10, the garlic dip 4/10 is was too oily I burped all the oil came back rushing my throat. The biryani was cold. This dish looks good but needs a little rework, but otherwise, everything else was good.

Address: 2606-28th Avenue Regina, SK S4S 6P3 Canada
Review: If you combined precious, cozy, and delicious you would end up with Earl's Kitchen + Bar! This place has such a beautiful atmosphere and scrumptious meals. This was the last place me and my girlfriend ate before getting engaged so it's definitely a fav in my books!!

Address: 2606-28th Avenue Regina, SK S4S 6P3 Canada
Review: It is perfect at all. Nothing negative need to mention. The staff was very nice. The wash room is clean and dry. I have nothing to claim here and feeling very comfortable when tip for the staff. Hope that they have more special day for discount some food.

Address: 2606-28th Avenue Regina, SK S4S 6P3 Canada
Review:
The most happening place to be in Regina.
Loved the ambience and the service.
Also the staff including the manager were very helpful.
The food was delicious.
Highly recommend trying Cajun chicken and tacos.

Address: 2606-28th Avenue Regina, SK S4S 6P3 Canada
Review: Food was great. The steak was one of the better steak i had in Regina. The chicken salad looked good. The place was busy in a good way. The restrooms were clean. The music was a bit t o loud. The servers were friendly and check in with me about the food quality but disappeared when it was time to pay the bill.

Address: 436 Dewdney Ave Regina, SK S4N 0E9 Canada
Review: It has a lot of variety and the food was good.  Their full menu as of Jan 4 2023

Address: 436 Dewdney Ave Regina, SK S4N 0E9 Canada
Review: We got take out,  Beef and broccoli was overcooked  Broccoli  Was saturated with soy sauce the beef was chewy and hardly edible. Also had barbecue pork ,dry and flavorless, Chicken Chow Maine could still taste the cornstarch or whatever they use On the chicken left it slimy.  I do not recommend this restaurant.  Is epic fail.....

Address: 436 Dewdney Ave Regina, SK S4N 0E9 Canada
Review: Ask for their secret menu, it’s absolutely delicious. Much more exciting than the stuff at the buffet!

Address: 436 Dewdney Ave Regina, SK S4N 0E9 Canada
Review: I think it is the one of my  best  favorite restaurants! The service is really very nice ! The hall is spacious and bright and feels cool! The kitchen feels excellent. Especially the Spicy deep fried fish , the taste is very delicious. It was a best experience and should be  try again or recommend.

Address: 436 Dewdney Ave Regina, SK S4N 0E9 Canada
Review:
Had a buffet dinner with this restaurant. Good food, a lot of selections and it seems they do not add MSG to their dishes. I personally prefer foods without
MSG added.

Address: 474 Mcarthy Boulevard Regina, SK S4R 7M2 Canada
Review: Just had a great experience here. The bartender Hailey was amazing. She recommended great food and drinks and took the time to make me feel comfortable and excited to come back. Her positive energy and strong work ethic were very much appreciated. More places need employees like her, it’s refreshing to have customer service this strong. The food and drinks were excellent. I highly recommend! Can’t wait to go back!

Address: 474 Mcarthy Boulevard Regina, SK S4R 7M2 Canada
Review: I do not recommend going to this establishment. My family and I went to rock creek for a birthday and we were one of the only tables in the building… Our food took about an hour and 15 minutes to get to the table and once our food got to the table one of the meals was completely wrong, so we sent it back and it came back wrong three more times. After we were finished our meals the server brought our bills and no discount or apology for the slow service , the meal being wrong THREE TIMES. So I asked for a discount on the bills and she gave us a dollar off each of our bills , seriously a joke!!

Address: 474 Mcarthy Boulevard Regina, SK S4R 7M2 Canada
Review: My husband and I just left this establishment. When we arrived we were the only people in the dining room. A very pleasant girl took us to our table, gave us water and said our waiter would be there soon. We saw more people arrive, three other tables while we waited for our server to arrive.  Later we looked over and saw the other tables being served their drinks, have their orders taken while we were still waiting for service.  After waiting even longer we decided to leave and went to another establishment filled with about 30 customers all being served. So I can only judge the service as low since we never did get drinks or food. Do better Rock Creek. This used to be a favorite spot but no more. We will not be back.

Address: 474 Mcarthy Boulevard Regina, SK S4R 7M2 Canada
Review: My friends and I had the absolute pleasure of being served by Julia at your restaurant on Sunday June 24. Through a few kitchen blips, Julia was charming and humble, an absolute treasure. She made us laugh, she made all the little difficulties just melt away and made our little high school get together (class of 1990) one of the best we’ve ever had! Kudos to a job so very well done! We’ll be back to sit in Julia’s section very soon!

Address: 474 Mcarthy Boulevard Regina, SK S4R 7M2 Canada
Review:
It’s been awhile since I’ve eaten here. It’s nothing like it used to be… I ordered steak with mashed potatoes and gravy. First off the steak wasn’t medium rare, and on top of that the gravy for the mash potatoes was COLD.

I had a few bites and couldn’t do it so I paid and left.

Also a customer was at the bar ordering beer and everything he asked for was not in stock. He got fed up and asked the bar tender “ well… what do you have “

They seemed understaffed as well.

Address: 363 Broad Street Regina, SK S4R 1X2 Canada
Review: The Crispy Pata Whole and the Pork Ribs Sinigang were very delicious. They also have good serving. If there is a 10 star, I would give it to them. Highly recommended.

Address: 363 Broad Street Regina, SK S4R 1X2 Canada
Review:
Super nice people. Patient, kind and helpful. This was our 1st time ordering Philippine food and they took time to explain, to let us make our mind and food was ready just on time when they said it's gonna be.
And food, delicious and just how we expected. Great place to order.

Address: 363 Broad Street Regina, SK S4R 1X2 Canada
Review: I’m from Cebu so if you’re tastebuds is very picky and the only thing you want is eating savory delicious food from Cebu, I guarantee you this is the spot and pandesal just got out of the oven. So don’t forget to ask for the pandesal.

Address: 363 Broad Street Regina, SK S4R 1X2 Canada
Review: This was like coming home.  Friendly staff, comfort food, interior design of a party room in Winnipeg.  I'd go back every time I'm in Regina.

Address: 363 Broad Street Regina, SK S4R 1X2 Canada
Review: I ordered the spring rolls and buns for a birthday party. They were a great hit. Thank you 😊

Address: Valley Girls Catering 2500 Victoria Ave Regina, SK S4P 2T5 Canada
Review:
Brunch Spot Alert!

First time I tried Fresh & Sweet was this weekend and it did live to the hype.

The staff were kind and courteous and even walked us through the menu when asked.

If you want a sweet and fresh meal experience, be sure to check it out.

Address: Valley Girls Catering 2500 Victoria Ave Regina, SK S4P 2T5 Canada
Review: Ordered the 16 ounce cappuccino and was blown away. Not that bitter. Very smooth. And frothy as it should be. The Best sandwich is a croissant sandwich and has all the trims on it. Do try their hashbrowns/home fries. Really flavourful.

Address: Valley Girls Catering 2500 Victoria Ave Regina, SK S4P 2T5 Canada
Review: Great sweet or savoury options for pairing.  The chicken and waffle was a great surprise on how they executed.  The bacon peach pancakes were excellent and now I cant make pancakes at home without bacon cooked into them.  Service is chipper and friendly making the atmosphere great.  Parking is the only thing to plan for, its downtown Regina so have change, its a pain.  Love this place.

Address: Valley Girls Catering 2500 Victoria Ave Regina, SK S4P 2T5 Canada
Review: Talk about fresh & sweet when in reality you get unloved & unflavored. I came here bc we usually go for breakfast somewhere else which now thinking about It I regret coming to this place. It seems fun and cozy with lots of people but with all the whispers you soon learn that the chef should have stayed a dishwasher bc it's a sad lie who told them they have the right to cook breakfast as sad as the eggs to the ham to the potatoes I am devastated this place has such good reviews I mean then again the sweet are good but if you want decent eggs ham or bacon or hash browns with toast do not come here. Also definitely not worth the money.

Address: Valley Girls Catering 2500 Victoria Ave Regina, SK S4P 2T5 Canada
Review: Ordered the chicken waffle and it was pretty disappointing, probably one of the worst variations on chicken and waffles I’ve had before. The Dijon honey sauce is so overwhelming and the chopped chicken is just sad, the potatoes taste like they’ve been sitting in a warmer for hours. On top of that I was given minestrone soup when I ordered potato bacon. I like this place though never had a bad item on the menu before until now. The soup was good even though it wasn’t the one I ordered.

Address: 1908 Prince of Wales Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A4 Canada
Review: Absolutely top notch Indian food. This place is open late and is a great treat. We went with butter chicken, pekora, Naan, and a chick pea dish that was very good. They have some combo dinners on the menu which are apparently only for take out and not for dine in. We ordered the same items as one of these combos and it rang in about $25 more. That being said, I understand there are extra costs associated with dine in customers vs take out. I will certainly eat here again.

Address: 1908 Prince of Wales Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A4 Canada
Review: I recently was traveling through Regina and stayed overnight at the comfort inn. I decided to stroll for dinner at thr nearby Indian restaurant, Dawat. The host, Parul,  was cheerful and friendly. I ordered a thali, and they happily customized it for me. The chefs Pritam and anmol dished out some amazing quality of food that felt homely and had nice flavors of the spices and herbs in exact proportion that I expected. It has been indian fine dine experience in Saskatchewan.  Keep up the good work.

Address: 1908 Prince of Wales Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A4 Canada
Review: They do not even know the difference between red,  orange and white gravy vegetables. After repeated confirmation for white gravy vegetables they still served us with orange gravy dish. Also the food was not cooked properly and tasted as if it was old and reheated before serving.

Address: 1908 Prince of Wales Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A4 Canada
Review: I did order from Uber eats delivery last night. As soon as I pressed the order button I realized wrong item got selected. I called them right away to cancel it and they guided me to do it from the Uber app. I did canceled order within 5 minutes of placing and restaurant still charged me saying they started preparing the order. There is no way they can prepare order within 5 minutes. Really poor experience, more than serving good food restaurant’s interest is earning extra money via wrong ways! Never going to order anything from you again. Thanks for the great experience!

Address: 1908 Prince of Wales Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A4 Canada
Review: Unprofessional staff, improperly cooked food, and when I and my friends complained, the manager there began yelling. Part of our food was also improperly prepared. Instead of offering to exchange those plates for us, as should have been their duty, the manager started arguing with us.

Address: 1840 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X6 Canada
Review: Visited this Vietnamese restaurant for the 1st time and I was not disappointed at all!  We had the dishes # 201 & 205 and it was a huge portion and very tasty and well cooked and very well prepared! I would recommend anyone to this restaurant for sure and I will be back no doubt about it when I'm in Regina again.  The Vietnamese restaurant is well kept and clean and the washrooms were clean too and the price was fair considering the large portions and we had appetizers which I shouldn't have had cuz the main dishes are HUGE.  Excellent hospitality by our waitress and she was very attentive to our dining experience and friendly.  I will be back for sure.

Address: 1840 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X6 Canada
Review: I've been going here for 25 years.  Yes, 25!  I think it may have changed hands in that time but the food has always been fantastic.  It's simply some of the best Vietnamese food in Regina hands down.

Address: 1840 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X6 Canada
Review:
MUST READ

I never ever have complained on a restaurant online, but this is a WARNING

WORST food ive ever tried to consume - anyone liking this joint has never had a half decent meal in their life.
Ordered - 'famous' verm and char pork w spring roll.  Verm had no sweet sauce on it, 'pork' was absolutely disgusting anf Id challenge that they are even actually serving real pork.  The springs roll - dont even know how to say it bc im not sure what they actually were.  Some weird stuffing inside a THICK wonton wrapper, completely undercooked and not crisp at all. Disgusting.
Dry ribs - box packed full, but absolutely no meat, honestly not even 2oz total meat on this 2lb box. This is not even a 'number 2' riblet, no half decent place would ever serve this atrocious product.
Next, 'curry' seafood. Laughable. No sear on the scallops, prawns were precooked and warmed thru, there 4 of each and 2 whole peppers and a whole onion chopped up packing the container. the sauce was not 'curry' at all, some fatty consume with a hint of basil.
The white rice was acceptable.
I ordered and they said 15m, I walked over in 8mins and it was rrady - I should have left then.

Unquestionably the worst meal ive ever ordered from anywhere, ever.

Address: 1840 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X6 Canada
Review: Food comes out fast. Place is dirty, needs a really good cleaning. Our table was sticky so was the floor. And does the owner we assume do anything but stand at the till and stare at customers…little unnerving we thought.

Address: 1840 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X6 Canada
Review: It was the first time that my family tried this restaurant. We order beef, vegetables, wonton soup and chicken. The serving of food was excellent and it was tasty. The Vietnamese guy who served us was friendly and accommodating. Also, their Vietnamese iced coffee is so yummy. We will come back again for sure. 😊😋

Address: 4651 Gordon Road Regina, SK S4W 0B7 Canada
Review: Best waiter ever!  Dillon was nothing short of amazing.  What great service,  a beautiful person.  We will be back, and ask for him !

Address: 4651 Gordon Road Regina, SK S4W 0B7 Canada
Review: A fun and casual place to enjoy a good meal and one of my favourite desserts. Their sticky toffee pudding is the best in Saskatchewan, hands down. After enjoying the summer platter that consists of sirloin steak, garlic prawns with avocado and spiced tenders, my buddy and I were ready for the dessert. Unfortunately, this time, it was unavailable. Our waitress Whitney was exceptional in every way and she suggested the cheesecake, which was delicious. She also gave us both a card to give us a free sticky toffee pudding the next time we came back. So great service, excellent food, wonderful waitress and an establishment that realizes that customers are important.

Address: 4651 Gordon Road Regina, SK S4W 0B7 Canada
Review: Mediocre experience overall. Was excited for the antler ale, but the keg wasn't tapped properly do they couldn't serve it so I decided on their other tap beer. Also had a keg problem. Burger was fine, but my poutine was only on the warm side, not hot.

Address: 4651 Gordon Road Regina, SK S4W 0B7 Canada
Review: My husband and I were looking for a place to become regulars at as we often work long hours. We drive by the Mr. Mike's grassland location almost everyday so we decided to give it a try. We ordered 2 steak and shrimp dinners for take out. The atmosphere and service was ok. I ended up by finding someone when I arrived as I waited for several minutes and didn't see one server. I have never been more disappointed in a meal especially for a restaurant that has the word steakhouse in its name. Everything was absolutely doused in a coursely of ground black pepper much like Montreal steak spice. Both steaks were dry, tasteless and very very tough. We ordered med rare and medium steaks. The vegetables were absolutely rock hard with burnt sear marks on them. I opted for the Caesar salad as a side and was flabbergasted when I opened the container because it was a spring mix lettuce mix, no romaine, no croutons, no parmesan cheese, but it did have a side of Caesar dressing. My husband had fries and gravy for his side. The gravy tasted so synthetic. It was as if someone opened a box of Campbell's vegetable soup broth and heated it up and added a cornstarch slurry to it to try and make it pass as gravy. The only thing good in both of our meals was the shrimp. The rest was horrible . We spent 100 dollars on this meal as it was a special occasion for us. I contacted the manager via email and never even got so much as a response from him. Very disappointed not only are we out 100 dollars but it's clear that the manager doesn't care either. This place will not become our regular place.

Address: 4651 Gordon Road Regina, SK S4W 0B7 Canada
Review: I had the 14oz Ribeye steak. The price may be high, but an incredible meal. I prefer this restaurant even over The Keg!

Address: 1350 23rd Avenue Regina, SK S4S 3S5 Canada
Review: Went for celebrating our wedding and they were very kind at all times. Great food, and atmosphere. I am a vegetarian, so the only option available I was able to find was a pasta and vegetables. The desserts were delicious!

Address: 1350 23rd Avenue Regina, SK S4S 3S5 Canada
Review: Attended a large anniversary function. Held in a back room that I didn’t even know existed. Was too hot and crowded in that room. But the servers were very attentive and quick and the food was delicious.

Address: 1350 23rd Avenue Regina, SK S4S 3S5 Canada
Review:
Everything was excellent!
My very well done steak was only a little well done lol but I like my steak burnt and no one ever gets it right for me 😉😂
Escargot were soooo yummmyyy. Will definitely go back!!!

Address: 1350 23rd Avenue Regina, SK S4S 3S5 Canada
Review: Used this restaurant's drive-thru window to pick up a supper order. The food was packaged with care and tasted delicious. I ordered the Greek chicken with garden salad and roasted lemon potatoes, and for dessert the chocolate almond torte. I didn't have cutlery in the bag, I forgot to ask for it. Fortunately, my hotel provided a plate and cutlery upon my arrival to my hotel.

Address: 1350 23rd Avenue Regina, SK S4S 3S5 Canada
Review:
Unfriendly male server at lunch. No happiness, no cheerful smiles or thanks for coming in. When we said thank you quite a few times during our meal he wouldn't say nothing back, maybe a yup but no you're welcome. Sometimes nothing. . No smiles, yet pointed out that tips can not be used for gift cards but I can leave cash! Who said I wanted to leave a tip?!
Food good as always, decor classy cool vintage!

Address: 2445 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y9 Canada
Review:
Brunch Spot Alert!

First time I tried Fresh & Sweet was this weekend and it did live to the hype.

The staff were kind and courteous and even walked us through the menu when asked.

If you want a sweet and fresh meal experience, be sure to check it out.

Address: 2445 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y9 Canada
Review: Ordered the 16 ounce cappuccino and was blown away. Not that bitter. Very smooth. And frothy as it should be. The Best sandwich is a croissant sandwich and has all the trims on it. Do try their hashbrowns/home fries. Really flavourful.

Address: 2445 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y9 Canada
Review: Great sweet or savoury options for pairing.  The chicken and waffle was a great surprise on how they executed.  The bacon peach pancakes were excellent and now I cant make pancakes at home without bacon cooked into them.  Service is chipper and friendly making the atmosphere great.  Parking is the only thing to plan for, its downtown Regina so have change, its a pain.  Love this place.

Address: 2445 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y9 Canada
Review: Talk about fresh & sweet when in reality you get unloved & unflavored. I came here bc we usually go for breakfast somewhere else which now thinking about It I regret coming to this place. It seems fun and cozy with lots of people but with all the whispers you soon learn that the chef should have stayed a dishwasher bc it's a sad lie who told them they have the right to cook breakfast as sad as the eggs to the ham to the potatoes I am devastated this place has such good reviews I mean then again the sweet are good but if you want decent eggs ham or bacon or hash browns with toast do not come here. Also definitely not worth the money.

Address: 2445 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y9 Canada
Review: Ordered the chicken waffle and it was pretty disappointing, probably one of the worst variations on chicken and waffles I’ve had before. The Dijon honey sauce is so overwhelming and the chopped chicken is just sad, the potatoes taste like they’ve been sitting in a warmer for hours. On top of that I was given minestrone soup when I ordered potato bacon. I like this place though never had a bad item on the menu before until now. The soup was good even though it wasn’t the one I ordered.

Address: 2705 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review: So. Stinking. Delicious. Not even kidding. Their savory breakfast crepes were tasty. Their coffee was good. The quiche was exceptional. But those pastries. The croissants. The creme puffs. The fruit tarts. It was paradise. We got a sampler box and ate on it over time, but, if we lived here, we would have to come and try everything on their menu. So good. The atmosphere was wonderful as well. And they make cakes to order.

Address: 2705 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
A must stop if you're coming to or passing through Regina! The deserts and crepes are fantastic. The portions are large for the price; I saved half my crepe for later so Id have room for desert.

If youre from Winnipeg and remember S Squared Patisserie this place is just as good for petite gateux and tarts. I also found the macarons were better.

Address: 2705 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
Good location in a shopping Plaza. Nice simple building from outside. Magical experience with decor and design when inside. Good smells, good music and nice staff.
My favorite food here is the crêpes plate. Sweet and decadent.
They really focus on quality and customer experience and it shows.
Went there with family member when she was visiting from Germany 🇩🇪

Address: 2705 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
Delicious, decadent, and divine!  A delightful experience, everything tastes superb!

The macaroons, croissants, and pastries are all great! Everything we tried was devoured!  Enjoy!!!

Address: 2705 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
This is the first French bakery I visited; in general, the space was not outstanding, but because the bakery appears to be cozy and the bakery has both a cafe and sells breakfast, many people prefer to visit because of the convenience shop type. Concerning the staff, I dislike the staff here because they are impatient in waiting for their customers. For example, last week when I went to buy a cake, they were impatient and had a bad attitude toward me. Instead of waiting for me to ask, "Anything Else?" I believe they should guide and recommend delicious and unique cakes to new customers.
The second is about the cake I purchased, which consists of a dozen Macarons, a Pitasschio, and a Fruit tart, as shown below. They all have the same flaw in my opinion and taste: the cream in the cake is too sweet and very sweet. It was too sweet for me to eat any longer. By definition, macarons are sweet, but in terms of taste, the flavours I purchased are nothing special except for chocolate, because chocolate flavour is the flavour that shows its taste most clearly and accurately.
If I have the opportunity again, I will try other bakery dishes, but I will not recommend them to those who are not as fond of sweets as I am. However, if you enjoy French cakes, you can try them and make suggestions.

Address: 305 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N6 Canada
Review:
We have few options because we are vegetarians. One of the best ways to go on a date and spend time with someone you love is to do this.

Additionally, they provide combos so you can have tasty cuisine at the lowest possible cost.

Also they have best buttermilk.

Address: 305 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N6 Canada
Review: I recently had the pleasure of dining at Flavour of India, a restaurant that specializes in Punjabi cuisine. I was blown away by the quality and authenticity of the food, and I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Indian dining experience. We ordered Manchow soup, and veggie pakora at first and then for the main dish we ordered Paneer Jalfrezi, Butter Naan, Rosted papad, Rice, Daal-Makhni and Sweet Lassi.

Address: 305 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N6 Canada
Review: We recently dined at Flavours of India, and it was blown away by their exceptional customer service. The host went above and beyond, being incredibly helpful and kind throughout our visit. What really impressed me was their new indo-Chinese feature. It's a fantastic addition that brings together the best of Indian and Chinese flavors, creating a unique and exciting dining experience.The Chicken 65 dish left me in awe. The flavors were sensational, with the perfect balance of spices. Flavours of India is a must visit !!

Address: 305 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N6 Canada
Review: We tried first time here . The taste is really good . Quality and Quantity is excellent. This is real taste of India . Really appreciate for service.

Address: 305 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N6 Canada
Review: Flavours of India is a relatively small restauraWe had had take out, which piqued our interest in visiting the restaurant itself. We were warmly greeted and seated. The server was very attentive to our dietary needs, and noticed we had ordered a dish we thought was purely vegan, but was not, and suggested an alternative after checking with the kitchen. We had onion baji for an appetizer, which was wonderfully fine, light and crisp. Our two, shared main dishes were fresh, rich, and complex in flavours. One cannot recommend this restaurant, either in person or take out, highly enough--and we've eaten Indian food in far flung locales, including Amsterdam and Heidelberg. Flavours of India vies with any Indian food we have had!

Address: 3422 Hill Avenue Regina, SK S4S 0W9 Canada
Review:
Love this location and their food. Chefs/cooks are top notch, and the waitresseses are outstanding with their service.  Kharen specifically brings such a joyful, positive, and genuine vibe.

Will definitely be back :)

Address: 3422 Hill Avenue Regina, SK S4S 0W9 Canada
Review:
Amazing pizza, very generous on toppings. Crust is perfect and a little chewy which is great. The sauce is tangy and delicious. Pizza is cooked perfectly.
Just a bit pricey.

Address: 3422 Hill Avenue Regina, SK S4S 0W9 Canada
Review:
Heard from co-workers that Houston Pizza was some of the best pizza Regina has to offer. Going into it I was super excited, although a little hesitant since the prices of pizza aren’t listed on the website. The pizza is quite expensive.
At first I was very disappointed with my first pizza as it was undercooked, but I was offered a re-do (which was very nice of them). The re-do was much better and I understand now why people recommend Houston Pizza.
At first I thought the ingredients were low quality, but that was because it was undercooked. On the second time I can confirm the toppings are top-tier and would recommend.

Address: 3422 Hill Avenue Regina, SK S4S 0W9 Canada
Review: Ordered a XL Pizza from this place, and it was awful. The Pizza is about half of what it normally is, and the quality wasn't there. I ordered from this place before and it was good but this time it was very lackluster. I left a complaint with the employee for the manager and didn't hear back, but I expected something better then this for what i've ordered. I atleast would've liked to hear from the manager of why there wasn't much meat and fewer toppings all of a sudden, but I guess they don't care for loyal customers.

Address: 3422 Hill Avenue Regina, SK S4S 0W9 Canada
Review: We ordered the combo for 4. Fries and gravy were ice cold and the souvlaki smelled very off,we didn't eat it because it smelled so bad. The pizza was okay but also cold and not as good as usual. We have ordered from here for years,this is very disappointing.

Address: 919 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P6 Canada
Review: Ordered from here through UberEats , spent over $100.00 and food was awful.  Wings dumped all over pizza box,  the garlic bread was rock hard.  Ribs were good and wings, lasagna was ok.  The driver took forever.  Sat on my street and then took off and  came back again.  I had to stand outside for driver to see me.  Not impressed.

Address: 919 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P6 Canada
Review: Love the Greek salad -- veggies are always cold and fresh, lots of feta, superb dressing and pick up is a breeze! They have kind, knowledgeable, well trained staff who really make the transaction effortless. Oh!! AND... the garlic toast...fresh homemade bread! Amazing!!

Address: 919 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P6 Canada
Review: Ordered pizza for the office and while this location isn’t my normal go to, I was redirected to this location since it’s near my place of work. Ordered large pizza combo with salad and drink. When asked what 3 toppings we wanted, we said triple pepperoni. My usual location usually loads up on the Pepperoni since it would be considered 3 separate toppings. However, when the pizza came, it had one layer of pepperoni. I was hyping it up how good Houston’s is, don’t get me wrong the flavor was there… just very disappointed we were allowed 3 toppings and got 1 layer. I’ll be driving to the Houston pizza in my area  next time.

Address: 919 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P6 Canada
Review: Ordered lasagna from your Albert location. Wasn’t very impressed with it seems the meat sauce was forgotten or your amount you put on is extremely very little. Very disappointing!!! Made phone call was told they do put sauce on. I showed two people what it looked like and they said what the hell is that. $16.00 for just a tad of sauce noodles and cheese.  I have had far better.  First time ordering from your place and the last!!!

Address: 919 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P6 Canada
Review: They were short staffed but very kind and the food was delicious. I got the all dressed pizza and was very happy with it! The crust was nice and crispy despite having a lot of toppings.

Address: 2102 - 11th Avenue Unit  TT10B Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: Good food to stop caving for Middle Eastern food. Customer service is amazing

Address: 2102 - 11th Avenue Unit  TT10B Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: Never been and when I came there the person working was very nice. Gave me a sample and then when I ordered added a salad to my order on the house. Tried the food and it was awesome 10/10 recommend

Address: 2102 - 11th Avenue Unit  TT10B Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: The best baklava I ever had here in Regina! Friendly staff, gave us a lot of free samples.

Address: 2102 - 11th Avenue Unit  TT10B Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: Very good doner wraps. Must try if you get a chance.

Address: 2102 - 11th Avenue Unit  TT10B Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: I've eaten here many times. I am never disappointed. The food is great. There is a location in the east end that is equally as good. You gotta eat here, give it a try!

Address: 1247 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2R4 Canada
Review:
My mom and I were looking for breakfast on Sunday, and we noticed this place on Skip. Never heard of it, so we thought we’d give it a go.

We both ordered “The Usual”; you get a choice of egg, meat, and toast, and a side of hashbrowns for only about $10. It came hot, fresh, and soooo delicious. It was probably one of the best breakfasts we’ve had in a while. Great value for your money.

I’d eat here again!

Address: 1247 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2R4 Canada
Review: Never Herd of this place . So I order breakfast . Very delicious and good portions. Will definitely order again or drop in to eat a meal. Recommend this place!

Address: 1247 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2R4 Canada
Review: Very good food, just wondering about allergy info

Address: 1247 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2R4 Canada
Review: Food was good. This is a breakfast brand related to Western pizza but everyone liked it. Would order again.

Address: 1247 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2R4 Canada
Review: Was unable to find this physical store. Skip suggests it is available for delivery, no pickup option. Makes me very skeptical. Went out of my way to come to a new local restaurant... perhaps they should be clear about status on google. google maps

Address: 1883 Victoria Ave E Regina, SK S4N 6E6 Canada
Review:
Clean Restaurant with professional staff, I like the available seating options, they are very comfortable.
I have had breakfast and supper at Cravings and at this time I am not opposed to coming back for more of the menu items. So far, everything has been good.
The food has flavor, I was Impressed when I ordered my food with rice being a side, to my surprise the rice was actually flavorful unlike some places where they give you only white rice as a side.

Address: 1883 Victoria Ave E Regina, SK S4N 6E6 Canada
Review: Overall I was very happy with my meal here. Had the calamari as an appetizer. This came with homemade tatziki which was very good. I had the fettuccine Alfredo for an entree. I did go with the added chicken. The chicken wasn't bad but just didn't have much flavour. The Alfredo sauce on the other hand was quite good. I would recommend skipping the chicken on this dish. My friend had the steak sandwich. He enjoyed that as well. Only odd part about that dish was the side it came with (soup) came out with the appetizers leaving just the steak sandwich by itself on a much too large plate. I think adding something to that dish would make the plating much nicer. Even if it was just a small portion of vegetables.

Address: 1883 Victoria Ave E Regina, SK S4N 6E6 Canada
Review: I was at Cravings to meet an old friend for lunch. The food was tasty, however, not very warm. The food came in a reasonable amount of time, was priced competitively & the waitress was very friendly & funny. The experience was good & I would go back again. Next time I may try the wing night. I had the Beef Dip & my guest had soup & salad.

Address: 1883 Victoria Ave E Regina, SK S4N 6E6 Canada
Review: i rarely leave reviews unless it should be a warning for others, i ordered a greek skillet for i believe is 18.49. Anyway, this might as well be a dive diner based on the food, shredded hash browns , basically uncooked,( i mean they were white)@ its not what the delicious description is, it 2-3 potatoes shredded that fills almost the entire bowl, then 2-3 eggs thats just scrambled and then folded to fit in said bowl, maybe 6-10 leaves of spinach , 1 whole olive sliced, and then 2 tsps maybe of crumbled feta cheese , on top and baked to make it look great. But its just layer of hash, folded eggs then sprinkled said ingredients on top, for 3$ worth of food and 20$ price tag its, in MY opinion definitely not worth it. Marbled toast was fantastic but that was it. Oh i missed the chopped onion which couldnt have been more than 1/2 slice if that. will not return.

Address: 1883 Victoria Ave E Regina, SK S4N 6E6 Canada
Review: Ordered the Beef Dip with a garden salad and really enjoyed both.  I would have preferred a whole wheat sub bun instead of white bun, but forgot to ask if they have before ordering.  Later, at the till I did ask and learned they don't have whole wheat buns, but they do have flax buns, which would probably have less carbs and higher fibre than the white buns.  Because I have Type 1 diabetes, I need to know how many carbs I am getting so that I can calculate how much insulin I need to take.

Address: 3622 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: The buffet was cold. Food looked like it’s been a while since it was refilled. Kinda disappointed. The sushi was very good. Tempura shrimp was very good. Salmon 🍣 was tasty. The restaurant needs to clean up the doors and windows were very dirty. If u go make sure u order sushi. That filled me up. Service was not the best. Ran out of water and ginger and wasabi. Not once but twice.

Address: 3622 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: Very good place to find Chinese food. Sushi was great. Takes a while for you to get the food but other than that, it was a very nice place.

Address: 3622 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: I haven’t been to I love sushi since 2014 and decided to go out with my wife on a Saturday. All I really like is sashimi since I don’t eat rice and stick with a very low carb diet. I put in one order at 5:58 for 12 pieces of sashimi and it didn’t arrive until 6:40! I had to go ask the front of staff where the order was twice. The lady didn’t seem to really care too much and talked to the kitchen staff. She came back and told me “later later” I did put in two more orders since I thought they might’ve missed the original order. I had to speak to her a second time,  and she grabbed the iPad from us and seemed annoyed that we kept bothering her. After speaking with the waitress directly, who was serving our table our orders finally came. I was so disappointed with the quality of the food here. The sashimi was mush and not high quality, very small bite sized pieces and I completely lost my appetite after reading some people got food poisoning here. I’m not really sure what happened to this place because back in 2014 I was a satisfied customer. The washrooms were very dirty as well. Definitely not coming back to this place ever again. Makes me really sad to write this review.  Feels like I wasted $66 on poor service and poor food.

Address: 3622 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review:
I Love Sushi really gives meaning to their name.
I visited them again during a very busy time, and while service was slow due to so many people ordering with limited staff working, the 30-45 minute wait time between Sushi orders is very worthwhile to me because it is so good and fresh.  But there is also a Chinese buffet that you can have between ordering or as an appetizer.
On a regular day with a few other customers,  the wait time after ordering is amazingly fast.  We ordered several different dishes and had them all served within 10 minutes.
The staff also deserve high praise, doing their best to multitask as servers, taking care of customers' needs, clearing tables and setting up for the next customer, and running the till.  All with a smile and a friendly attitude.
The quality of the food is where they really shine. Fresh ingredients, time and care in preparation, and presentation are very important, and it all shows with their sushi.  I can't wait until my next visit to this restaurant.

Address: 3622 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: As many have already commented, I will pass the comments and make a recommendation to the business owner. You can limit the total pieces of sashimi one adult can order like what Miso Ya is doing. You don’t have to use a long-waiting (45min waiting, plus thin-cut, lowing number of pieces  customer ordered) strategy to lower the service and food quality. There’s always a better way to cut the cost for your business.

Address: 545 Albert Street N Regina, SK S4R 8E2 Canada
Review: Every Boston Pizza in the city of Regina has a unique self representation. At this location, the seats give off an old-school vibe. The artwork displayed on the walls gives it a relaxed look with a hint or artistic sofistication...."caughs while holding on to mustache".... the staff members are friendly, professional, and knowledgeable about their products. The food was good, I was going for something light and I sure was not disappointed.

Address: 545 Albert Street N Regina, SK S4R 8E2 Canada
Review: Food was great as always, friendly staff, fast delivery of food to tables! I believe our servers name was Dexter, he was great. Very professional, friendly, polite, and was great with my baby! You’re doing awesome!

Address: 545 Albert Street N Regina, SK S4R 8E2 Canada
Review:
Ordered a ham and pineapple, it appears they made a cheese pizza, and then put ham and pineapple on top after coming out of oven, then a quick reheat. The toppings fell off while eating it.
Should have got a frozen pizza instead.
Boston Pizza Food quality over the years has become a joke. Only senior citizens with a couple taste buds remaining like this factory food.

Address: 545 Albert Street N Regina, SK S4R 8E2 Canada
Review: Rude customer service and not great food. Upon entry, the lady manager/host was condescending and trying to be funny when I couldn’t find my guest. The burger on special tasted pre-made and old, bun was stale and I’ve never had so many onions in my life. Atleast the kettle chips were good.

Address: 545 Albert Street N Regina, SK S4R 8E2 Canada
Review: It was a very peaceful and relaxing  stop for dinner. Service and food was exceptional as expected. Will be back again.

Address: 2926 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review:
Delicious, authentic Filipino cuisine!
I visited today and had the Chicken Adobo, it was rich and so tender and delicious. My friend had the Pork Menudo and it was unreal, the spices were perfect!

Address: 2926 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: The food was fantastic & delicious.The pancit was to die for.The pork menudo was masarap.we really enjoyed our dining experienced.Steve&Joi

Address: 2926 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: Love the food here!!! Great staff as well. Worth every single pennies you spent😊

Address: 2926 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review:
Super great place to sit in silence, while not eating anything.

Popped in for what we hoped would be pancit and other nice treats. Sat at one of the three tables. Woman behind counter did not acknowledge us at all. We sat there for 6 or 7 minutes while she did something at the counter, then we just packed up and left. Lame.

Address: 2926 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: Took an employee and his son here.  We loved the food and had fantastic friendly service.  I highly recommend this place.  We will be back.

Address: 1779 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 1Z4 Canada
Review: The dishes could have been more flavourful. It's not as good as dim sum in bigger cities but for our city, I'd say it's the best dim sum place we've got. The service was great.

Address: 1779 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 1Z4 Canada
Review: I went for lunch here and had a good meal with reasonable prices. We did the dim sum option and had nothing but good food. The service was also very good and prompt. Would be interesting to see their dinner menu.

Address: 1779 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 1Z4 Canada
Review: Excellent dim sum. I took my friend from Edmonton and we both agreed: much better than Edmonton!! Fresh, tasty and good portions. I enjoyed all the dishes ( 7 between the 2 of us)!!

Address: 1779 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 1Z4 Canada
Review: If you’re looking for authentic and really good tasting Dim Sum, this resto is for you! The Dim Sum, especially on the weekend specials, are very fresh, tasty, and well made. The exterior facade and OG part of the resto can be considered old and intimidating by new patrons as it’s a bit dated and has the “hole in a wall” vibe but for Anyone who grew up in Asia, this is the look of a “mom&pop” store where you will be served food cooked for family and not commercialized food like so many restos in Regina do nowadays. The service is topnotch and the food comes out real quick. Will definitely recommend!!!

Address: 1779 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 1Z4 Canada
Review: Food is delicious. So many dishes that you don't see anywhere else. Not your standard Americanized Chinese food. If your go to is chicken balls and fried rice, this may not be the place for you. They do it differently and it is awesome.

Address: 1812 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review:
I adore this Cafe! Great atmosphere and the cheesecakes are delicious! Though I personally didn't like the cinnamon buns, they tasted more like donuts.
Highly recommended to meet up with friends and enjoy a lovely treat.

Address: 1812 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: The coffee is good and it has a great view! I was able to find a place to sit on a weekday, so it might not get as crowded as expected.

Address: 1812 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: Stopped for a coffee. It was a great environment and the service was perfect. I sometimes do not like the upsell but the addition of cinnamon buns put the coffee date over the top!!!

Address: 1812 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: Their cinnamon bun is well known. The morning seems much busier than lunch time. I also tried their cheese cakes, good with black coffee.

Address: 1812 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: This was a welcoming and sociable environment to have my morning coffee along with a delicious, warm cinnamon bun. The employees are friendly and helpful and put care into their food. Would definitely recommend this place on Saturday morning for the buns!

Address: 806 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R6 Canada
Review: My husband brought me here as it’s his favourite place in Regina. Nice atmosphere, great service & incredible food!! Cannot get over the beautiful flavours! Definitely worth visiting!

Address: 806 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R6 Canada
Review:
It is our third time here, and we loved it every time! Manmeet served us here in the last two times, and we really enjoyed the service as well.
The food is plenty, delicious, and served beautifully!

Address: 806 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R6 Canada
Review: A good Indian restaurant with authentic Indian taste! Great service with a smile! Kapil and the team is doing a good job!

Address: 806 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R6 Canada
Review: We had the butter chicken combo and lamb dhaba curry with garlic naan. I was looking for a curry that was very spicy to fulfill my needs and the DHABA CURRY absolutely met my spice level 🔥. Butter chicken was bomb. They were both a little salty, but perfect with rice and naan. The prices were very reasonable. Convenient parking space right behind the building. 100% recommended!

Address: 806 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R6 Canada
Review: You will not regret if you came here. Because everything is delicious and it is best restaurant in regina city

Address: 2102 11th Ave Unit 11a Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: Avoid this location. There’s many others in the area that you can go to. It’s ghetto, dirty and dangerous. Ordered a bagel today and it tasted like cigarettes. The person who made it must’ve not been wearing gloves and just came back from a smoke. Disgusting

Address: 2102 11th Ave Unit 11a Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: Always very Nice and Sweet peoples there to treat you very well and Coffee my favourite one is 1Milk + 1Sugar Small one .

Address: 2102 11th Ave Unit 11a Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: The pizza at this place was amazing! The crust was crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside, and the toppings were plentiful and flavorful. I highly recommend trying the margherita pizza.

Address: 2102 11th Ave Unit 11a Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review:
The guy who is supposed to clean the place,was cleaning the floor with a broom,than he used the same broom to clean the tables.
Staff didn't want to open the bathroom for customers when they asked. Very weird attitude to their visitors

Address: 2102 11th Ave Unit 11a Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: Every time I go there I get great services,love their coffee 😊 ,good parking,

Address: 8 Barrows Road St. John's, NL A1A 1G8 Canada
Review:
The food was excellent. Taste was great and everything was cooked perfectly. We particularly enjoyed the cod thongues, the scallops crudo and the pork belly.
We where in a little and quiet side room, which we really loved. It felt cosy.
However, the service staff didn't come very often in our room, so we sometimes had to wait a few minutes for service. They sometimes forgot to take our plates away when we finished eating. We were also advised that the portions were very small and that we needed to order more, but ended up with too much food that we couldn't finish (we both took 1 appetizer, 1 side and 1 main dish and shared 1 extra appetizer). Staff was kind, but overall, service could be improved.

We recommend booking a few days in advance.

Definitely recommend this place if you want to eat a great meal and are prepared to pay a good amount.

Address: 8 Barrows Road St. John's, NL A1A 1G8 Canada
Review:
Class act all the way here. Doesn’t hurt that it’s a stones throw away from Quidi Vidi Brewery for some pre-dinner drinks, either.

Seriously, though, the service here was kind and thoughtful, and the food matched the rustic decor, the reputation for which precedes this place.

Suppose the only thing the people to watch out for is, you’re gonna have a hard time coming in here if you’re over 6 1/2 feet tall, but then again, you can squeeze your way through the hallways and into the main dining room, where everything opens up and you get a nice view onto an open kitchen.

Address: 8 Barrows Road St. John's, NL A1A 1G8 Canada
Review:
Cute historic restaurant. 2 locals I met suggested I come here for some of the best food in St John's.

While I really enjoyed the good service and atmosphere, the food wasn't as impressive as I expected. The lobster thermidor was difficult to eat without the right cutlery and because it was just a half portion, I was left wanting. The scallop crudo was great, but I've also had better elsewhere.

Overall, great experience but just lacking a little something extraordinary.

Address: 8 Barrows Road St. John's, NL A1A 1G8 Canada
Review: I have visited Mallard Cottage a number of times and I have yet to be disappointed! We visited a couple weeks ago on my fathers birthday and the brunch was exceptional! We had the French toast, Fish cakes & taters, Steak & Eggs, & Eggs Benedict. They were cooked excellent and all delicious. You can definitely tell they use good quality products at Mallard Cottage.

Address: 8 Barrows Road St. John's, NL A1A 1G8 Canada
Review: Food here was delicious, and the setting and building in Quidi Vidi are gorgeous. Cocktails and wine were excellent, and we shared scallops crudo, beets, hanger steak and some particularly delicious potatoes roasted in honey. A delectable lemon meringue pie with raspberry rounded off our meal. Service was slow, with gaps between courses, and we struggled to get a table quickly - despite calling on the day and being told their online platform isn’t very good, but assured that if we called 15 minutes ahead of arrival we’d be served. In reality this was not true and we ended up waiting a long time, almost missing the opportunity to eat. Food was spectacular, service was lacking.

Address: 223 Duckwoth Street Saint John's, NL A1C 6N1 Canada
Review: Excellent food quality, flavor, and portion sizes! We were so impressed - everything was incredibly fresh and delicious. The service was also excellent from Hailey! We got 2 burgers (and they accommodated my lettuce bun for no charge), the cod bites, and the UNREAL chowder!

Address: 223 Duckwoth Street Saint John's, NL A1C 6N1 Canada
Review:
The reservation we made wasn't recorded but they got us a table. Table was by a beam so we moved to another one which was much better.

We ordered 3 appetizers and a main each. The apps were wonton nachos, bacon wrapped Buffalo chicken stuffed jalapeño poppers, and spicy shrimp. The food looked amazing and tasted amazing but the portions were a little underwhelming, especially the shrimp. 6 shrimp with sauce for $18 seems a little steep but, as I said, the flavor was fantastic. The apps took long to come out as the had originally burned our nachos and the ones we received seem to be overcooked still. It also had a lot of pulled pork and toppings under the wontons so it was basically half and half toppings to wontons.

We both ordered burgers, i got the Pierogi burger and she got the Geraldine Hot Honey Southern Fried Chicken burger. They both cane with fries and spicy ketchup which was awesome, really enjoyed the spicy ketchup. My Pierogi burger was pretty good, burger patty was a little overcooked but still juicy and well seasoned. Her burger was a little less impressive. It came with coleslaw which was large chunks of cabbage which had a bitter taste. The batter on the chicken wasn't that good either but the sauce was the best part, she didn't even finish half of it due to the coleslaw tasting so bad. Hers meal was 24 and mine was 23.

Overall, the food was fairly good but the apps pricing was a turn off. Don't think we'll be returning but it is worth a try.

Address: 223 Duckwoth Street Saint John's, NL A1C 6N1 Canada
Review: the server was super nice but we wished the fries were better fried and bigger. we loved the curry sandwich though!

Address: 223 Duckwoth Street Saint John's, NL A1C 6N1 Canada
Review: Absolutely great. Entrées we’re delicious, chowder was killer. The dessert was meh, kinda dry. Will be back for sure.

Address: 223 Duckwoth Street Saint John's, NL A1C 6N1 Canada
Review: Huge portions, incredible food. If you are dining with two people split a burger - they are too much for a single meal.

Address: 5 Bates Hill St. John's, NL A1C 4B5 Canada
Review: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Amazing music and atmosphere. I started with the strawberry fields (cocktail special) created by Danny (best bartender ever!). I had pig ears with buffalo sauce. Sooo crispy + good. I tried the duck. Delicious! Had the punch cocktail SO YUM. Overall just so so impressed by the taste and presentation of everything (the cocktails had dried flowers, so cute) and the PEOPLE! Such lovely staff and the owner Michelle is such a down to earth sweetheart! You must come here!!!!

Address: 5 Bates Hill St. John's, NL A1C 4B5 Canada
Review: Food has always been good, and I gave it a 5-star rating 4 years ago. However, I am back to change it to a 4-star rating now because I feel really hurt. I have celebrated my birthday three times here in the past, but this year, I am extremely disappointed. We made a reservation a week before my birthday, but when we arrived on time, the waitress informed us that they were 'busy' and seated me at a table facing the washroom. I politely requested a different seat for my birthday, but she refused to accommodate my request, not even pretending to do so. Throughout the meal, the washroom door remained open, which was highly unpleasant. Furthermore, the waitress used an uncomfortable tone while reiterating how busy they were and insisted that we finish the meal within 1.5 hours, even though we had just sat down. After placing our food order, she did not bother to check on us or inquire about the quality of the food. When she changed the water bottle, it was done hastily and with a hint of rudeness. Her fingers even touched the inside of the bottle, yet she said nothing and left it on our table. When we finished our main dishes, only one dessert arrived instead of the two we had ordered. Not wanting my partner to witness me eating the cake alone, we had to wait for someone else to check the table and inform them of our missing order. Despite the disappointing experience, we still tipped 18% for the meal. However, this birthday experience has left me deeply hurt in numerous ways. I used to love Chinched, which is why I celebrated my own and my parents' birthdays here in the past. Unfortunately, I will never go to Chinched again.

Address: 5 Bates Hill St. John's, NL A1C 4B5 Canada
Review:
Our experience at Chinched was absolutely delicious. We shared a small charcuterie and cheese board (had a pancetta, summer sausage, aged cheddar and brie) - the meats were so flavourful, the apricot compote was a great addition, and the spiced nuts were good on their own or with the meat and cheese.

We also had the cod dish and the roasted cabbage caesar based on the recommendation from our server Ivan. Not a crumb left.

Highly recommend - great service and great food!

Address: 5 Bates Hill St. John's, NL A1C 4B5 Canada
Review: Absolutely an amazing restaurant that we stumbled upon during our trip to St. Johns. The food was the best we had during our trip - the Bao and Potato Wrapped Cod earned them 5 stars in its self. Our server was one of the best I've ever had, he was so personable and attentive - he even provided us with a list of other restaurants to checkout while we were in the area. We will be returning to St.Johns specifically to enjoy another meal at Chinched.

Address: 5 Bates Hill St. John's, NL A1C 4B5 Canada
Review: The dill pork ears are seriously good! Also, I cannot attest others experience but the waiter is super super nice. One of my friends forget the stuff and one of the waiter chased us to ask if we lost our staff. Going well and beyond the service and didn’t accept any appreciation tip at the end. Will come back if I had the chance.

Address: 334 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: Excellent experience! All the staff was super friendly and the food was incredible. Excellent oysters, tuna sashimi was to die for, Brussel sprouts were so flavourful, tuna taco was delicious! The fish meal I've been craving!

Address: 334 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review:
recently had the pleasure of dining at Adelaide in St. John's, and I must say, the experience was nothing short of amazing! From the moment I stepped in, the warm and inviting atmosphere set the perfect tone for a memorable evening.

What truly stood out was the impeccable service provided by our server, Sarah. Her attentiveness, knowledge, and genuine passion for ensuring our dining experience was exceptional truly shone through. She went above and beyond to make us feel welcome, offering insightful recommendations and accommodating our dietary preferences with a smile.

The menu at Adelaide is a true culinary delight. The dishes we ordered were prepared with precision and skill, showcasing the chef's creativity and attention to detail. Each bite was a tantalizing explosion of flavors, leaving us wanting more.

Whether you're a local or a visitor to St. John's, I highly recommend Adelaide for an unforgettable dining experience. The exceptional service from Sarah and the rest of the staff, combined with the fantastic culinary offerings, make it a standout destination in the city.

Thank you, Adelaide, for a truly memorable evening. I can't wait to visit again and explore more

Address: 334 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: Great cocktails and great food. A small menu and I think a couple more options would help round it out. The crispy fish tacos were a favourite amongst our group. Cauliflower share plate was also very good. If you have oysters, there was a spicy pear purée offered that was delicious if you like some heat. The only dessert option was a sticky toffee pudding, which was a bit on the dry side. The atmosphere is very cool and old comes out as it’s ready, not all at once, which adds to the relaxed, shared meal feel of this place.

Address: 334 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: Amazing spot and nice menu with a variety if options. Brussels Sprouts were dementedly good. Really fun vibe and staff in here, sit at the bar if you can it's a great experience. Thank you

Address: 334 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: Fantastic!!!! The food is delicious and fresh. You have to try their poke and the oysters.The ambiance is very romantic. Can't wait to be back!

Address: 291 Water Street St. John's, NL A1B 4B8 Canada
Review: Solid restaurant with a good tasting menu. Could improve with some slightly more experienced staff, but they were able to maintain the atmosphere. The sommelier made some good pairings, and the food was generally well prepared and tasty. Would have liked some non-menu surprises. The carrot cake was great.

Address: 291 Water Street St. John's, NL A1B 4B8 Canada
Review: The food was amazing and there was such a wide variety, from steak to pasta to crab. The overall restaurant had a lovely ambience. I ordered the spaghetti carbonara and it was extremely delicious, with lots of cheese, creaminess and flavor. The Artic Char was incredibly delicious and tasted almost like salmon. Overall, a great option for a night out!

Address: 291 Water Street St. John's, NL A1B 4B8 Canada
Review: Overall not bad but disappointing especially given the price. I don't mind paying for good food but this was simply Mediocre at best. most of the restaurants I've tried downtown have been great, but unfortunately not this one. In my opinion this tarnishes the Raymond's name. Service was speedy but I felt rushed to order.  Drink's were also heavily pushed which was unnecessary in my opinion. Atmosphere was nice but restaurant was quite loud. Appetizer was amazing which was the only good part of the evening, we had calamari. The mains lacked flavor and felt small. The chicken was kinda dry and the " lemon Beurre blanc" didn't really help. Thought that desert might have been able to make up for the mains but they were even more disappointing. Pastry of the Lemon tart tasted stale. I have my doubts that any of it was made in house because the meringue was no better then store bought package. THE WORST PART... I paid 12 dollars for the tiny tart which is shown in the photos. Definitely will not be back to the restaurant. Was hoping for so much better :(

Address: 291 Water Street St. John's, NL A1B 4B8 Canada
Review: This was our first time visiting Merchant Tavern but it definitely won’t be our last! The service was great and I loved the atmosphere, we especially enjoyed the open kitchen! The food was amazing, 10/10! We had the mussels as an appetizer, and had scallop risotto and steak frites as our mains.. they were all delicious!

Address: 291 Water Street St. John's, NL A1B 4B8 Canada
Review: Mediocre food for the price ($125/pp); not good, but not bad. First course of local scallops, fermented gooseberries and chive oil was unbelievably sour it was a hard time attempting to finish the dish. The rest of the courses were okay, but not worth the price tag. As well, being sat at a bar was also quite uncomfortable as the bar table was much higher than the seats, making it hard to eat. I had reserved ~ 1 week prior to the visit in order to have good seating, but still got sat at the bar nonetheless. Wish it was a better experience but the first course was such a disaster it ruined the rest of the evening.

Address: 318 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: Busy Friday night. Got a table easily. Service was good but they didn't clear our empty dishes from the table for quite a while. They brought food the food out within a decent time. Food was good. We had a delicious juicy moose burger with pickled beets. It was delicious. The jiggs muscles were good. We got an order of 2 lbs. Our black forest cheesecake was scrumptious.

Address: 318 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review:
Moose burger is available here. Although it doesn't taste different from a regular beef burger.
The mussel is pretty tasty.
Salad is overpriced for the portion .

Address: 318 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: This was the final night of our stai in Newfoundland. Our group enjoyed this restaurant. I had mussels done in a German style sauce.  It was good.

Address: 318 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: Luckily got a table on a busy Friday night with no wait.  Service was friendly, quick, and competent.  Food was good.

Address: 318 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: The nachos and stein was a good deal at $26 and the Yellowbelly Red was smooth. Nachos with pulled pork, sauerkraut and dill pickles - who knew it would be a winning combination? The red curry mussels were ok. Quite a wait considering the restaurant wasn't super busy but we enjoyed ourselves.

Address: 377 Duckworth Street St John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review:
Came here for the first time the other night. We were seated quickly, our server was friendly, it was clean inside.

I wasn’t a huge fan of the orange creamsicle drink. The tomato sauce on the pacchi di proscuitto was really tart. The Stephanie pizza was good and my smash burger was decent. I don’t think it was worth $80 though.

Address: 377 Duckworth Street St John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: The pizza was delicious, the staff is kind, and the atmosphere is very nice with the open kitchen area and the dim lighting & candles. Would recommend booking though as it can get very busy especially on the weekends. The bathroom is very clean too.

Address: 377 Duckworth Street St John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review:
Their pizzas are truly DELICIOUS!
The best one I've ever had.
We've had the one with honey/prosciutto and one with blue cheese & mushrooms. Both were very tasty.
You can really feel the authenticity from Italia. The pizzas are cooked in a wood oven which is great. The incredients on the pizzas are sparse which makes every bite taste different. The cooks seemed to be having fun and if you're seating at the bar, you can watch the preparation.
We didn't try their pasta but they looked freshly made.
You should definitely go

Edit. I went again to try their pastas and wow. It was DELICIOUS. I had the rigatoni with the lemon ricotta (chef's kiss). LOVE this place.

Address: 377 Duckworth Street St John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review:
I absolutely loved the pizza! It is my favourite that I’ve ever had. Highly recommended for sure! My boyfriend had pasta there and he loved it as well. I got the Margarita with added Pepperoni and I absolutely fell in love with it. It’s so delicious, juicy and full of flavour.

The best pizza I’ve ever had in my life and nice atmosphere too.

Highly recommended!

Address: 377 Duckworth Street St John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: Best pizza ever! Waiter was very efficient. We ate outside and traffic was busy so the exhaust from cars was not great, but the food made up for it.

Address: 320 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: Ordinary food at extraordinary price. The post disappointing if all is the lobster which is small and meatless for a high price. While the cod fish was good I do not know what the hype of this restaurant is about. Noted this is the most disappointment meal of our 5 day trip in NL. The biggest factor that drove this mediocre rating is that they cannot even do the fries right. It is greasy and soggy soaked in oil. Very disappointing

Address: 320 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: I was hesitant after reading some of the reviews but went for it. And I cannot be more thrilled that I did! Our server, Russell, was the ABSOLUTE best. Fun and attentive and just top notch all around. We had the chowder and burger and oysters and lobster roll. After living in Boston and Florida for fifteen years, I can say that this was HANDS DOWN the best lobster roll I have ever had, and I am what some would call a food snob. I would recommend to ANYONE.

Address: 320 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: Okayyyy, this restaurant is 👌. Great atmosphere. Our server recommended the bruschetta and it was absolutely to die for. I've never had such delicious bruschetta before! I had the seafood chowder, and while it was quite tasty my only criticism is that it didn't have a variety of seafood in it (no mussels or shrimp, just white fish which I'm assuming was cod), so it should be called cod chowder instead. The food is on the more expensive end, but I would definitely recommend.

Address: 320 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: We had a great experience! Food was great, and we thought very reasonably priced. Atmosphere and service also top notch! Will def be back. Nice cocktail menu, too - original and well priced.

Address: 320 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review:
I have to say I think Saltwater needs to be rebranded. If you are a local in St.John’s you'll remember the Saltwater on Duckworth. After the move to Water street I'm sure the chef and owners have changed and if not that the brand or audience they are attracting is not the same as when they were on Duckworth.

My family and I were celebrating a birthday / early mother's day. We ordered a fair amount of food. Or server was very sweet and helpful when we ran in to food issues. So 4 stars for that only issue it was not 5 is because service includes the Kitchen in my eyes.

Drinks:
Elderflower fields martini - sweet elderflower does come through. 5/5
Cesar - Classic Cesar, it's good! 4/5
I forget the name but it's the spicy margarita on the menu - really nice, refreshing, wish there was more of a salt rim. 4/5

Apps:
Mussles - plump, but over cooked, not much broth, and underseasoned.
Wings - I actually really liked the breaded wings I thought they were 5/5!
Pork belly - Kinda funny but maybe a bit too honest. Our server apologized for the wait on this dish, due to the fact that the chef slipped and dropped our original pork belly on the floor. She quickly offered a discount on our meal and it came out maybe 7 mins later.

Mains:
Seafood risotto -
Came with mussles scallops and shrimp I believe. My dad had it and the read was average. Not over done but nothing to make you want to order it again.

Cod with Beet salad -
My mom raved about this dish she was it was excellent!

Steak-
unfortunately my brother's steak was over cooked. Again our server noticed without us having to say anything. This was due to her own experience cooking at home, she visually saw the cook was over. Following this she offered to have another one made or give us a discount. My brother opted to keep the one made already due to food waste and time. The garnish and flavours on this dish were very delicious!

Salmon with Beet salad-
When I got the plate I realized I am particular about salmon and probably should of asked more questions. The salmon was over cooked and the skin was kinda soft which I personally really like salmon skin crispy or with a hard sear. Maybe it was just personal preferance but I really didn't like the cook on it. The fish was just not handled well. Again simular to the steak the cook not on par but the flavours of the sauce and seasoning were great!The Beet Salad on the side was a vanilla dressing with goat cheese.

Dessert:
Baklava 5/5 so good made with walnuts and you can tell it's a home recipe!

Overall:

I think the place can do really well as a relaxed seafood restaurant. I think the pub food options are awesome for students to get some food before going out! Theres a wonderful atmosphere with the arches and long tables thay give a cozy casual feel. I also would tell anyone that the wings are good. The only downfall is the price for what you get. I wouldn't want to pay for food overcooked or not paid attention too. I think sorting out a clear focus on what kind of restaurant this is now will help. An updated about us online will bring in more people in the upcoming summer Season for tourists. Now a days online presence is so important. I'm excited to go back with a few friends and try more of the pub food when I get around to it!

Address: 298-300 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B6 Canada
Review:
I've given the Celtic Hearth many chances but unfortunately it just hasn't gotten better, so I've gone for the last time. I went recently with my girlfriend. It wasn't very busy at all. The food took about 30-40 minutes to come out. Our server was very friendly, kind, and attentive, so I didn't really mind that wait.

I got fish and chips and my girlfriend got the steak and cheese sandwich. Her sandwich was tasty, just very oily, which is a little off putting. My fish and chips were below average as well, with only getting a few fries that were luke warm, and the fish just tasted bad, the batter wasn't crunchy and  just came right off the fish. Shame

The prices here have gotten ridiculous as well. You're better off going to yellowbelly or somewhere else nearby, you'll get more food, that's much better and fresher, and cheaper!

I hope this restaurant can turn things around but in my opinion it's just not worth going, especially at the inflated prices.

Address: 298-300 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B6 Canada
Review:
We stopped here for dinner, as recommended by our waitress in Brigus. Service was quick and friendly.

I had the Cod Au Gratin (flaky cod baked in a creamy sauce topped with cheddar). I had a side salad with mine, and it was all very tasty.  I would definitely go back again.

Address: 298-300 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B6 Canada
Review: Quaint spot and read it had good breakfast options. It had the Irish pub vibe, friendly service. They had gf toast options but don’t order the ham with the breakfast - there was more fat and grizzle than ham - bacon or sausage options looked better. When we asked if the hash browns were gf, we were told “no problem” but got our Celtic breakfast and the home made hash browns, which were good, came 20 minutes later 🙃 it wasn’t busy and our server was very nice. Good coffee here as well. Pricey for a breakfast at &17.95 pp, plus lovey 15% tax and tip makes for an expensive but typical breakfast.

Address: 298-300 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B6 Canada
Review: The Celtic Hearth once held the title of the best burger I've had, but things have gotten a bit rocky since. The service and atmosphere here are always great, but my main issue is the massive increase in pricing. Prices in the past two years have gone up nearly half, and it's honestly ridiculous - not to mention portion sizes. I went here today, and the food was decent (I've only had one bad experience here with taste), but it was almost insulting how little you get for the price. They used to give you a full basket of fries that would fill you up by themself, but now it pretty much amounts to what would be in a small McDonald's fries.

Address: 298-300 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B6 Canada
Review: Always awesome and count on able. I was looking for a place to eat last Wednesday night around 9pm and they were the only place I could find still serving. Today I came straight here.

Address: 319 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B9 Canada
Review:
We just finished a lovely stay at this hotel and highly recommend it.  The staff is amazing.  I haven't experienced this level of attentiveness in many years.  Thank you, Victoria (and others) for making us feel so special.  The bathroom in our room was to die for.  We loved the heated floor and the beds were so comfortable.
If there is any room for improvement, it is the coffee supplied in the room.   All three of us joked and called it coffee water - even though it was a specialty company who supplied it.
