I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel  - if only to remind people of what true customer service is all about.

Address: 319 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B9 Canada
Review: A local friend recommended Blue and it was a pricey but wonderful location for exploring St Johns. We were in room 201 so facing the street. The room was large, comfortable and had a fridge, tv - although odd channels- coffee station and an amazing bathroom! Despite many ceiling lights, the lighting in the bathroom is terrible. I found opening the drapes and standing in front of the long mirror was the only place I could see to put on makeup. The sounds from George Street do find their way to you until 2:00am. Parking was on a roof a block away and cost an additional $20 a night.  There are many restaurants, pubs, coffee and various shops within walking distance. We had one evening meal in Blues restaurant: chicken tacos, scallops and a chowder. It was fine but we didn’t go back for more. They were very good to accommodate a gluten free request and every server was friendly, helpful and pleasant whether helping with luggage, serving a meal or checking us out of the hotel.

Address: 319 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B9 Canada
Review:
I have absolutely nothing negative to say. The experience was stupendous from beginning to end. I LOVED my room (I don’t remember the name but it was 301). And the staff. Everyone was so kind and generous in spirit and help.

I also recommend the Goddess Salad in the restaurant.

(The accompanying photos are from my stay in St.John’s and not from the hotel.)

Address: 319 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B9 Canada
Review: We had Grilled Lobster with risotto very good and this lobster arancini that weren't on the menu. Other ones in the pictures are seafood clam chowder and seafood linguine and scallops :) Best food we had by far in St John's. Would recommend. Servers were very nice too :)

Address: 319 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B9 Canada
Review:
Great food.  Probably one of the best restaurants in St.Johns.  Access to the hotel during the summer is tricky but not impossible.  Take a smaller suitcase!
The rooms are all beautiful- one is very dark.

Address: 1 Dunns Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 3L1 Canada
Review:
Nice local diner with fast & friendly service and considerable variety of tasty lunch and dinner items on the menu.

Very popular local restaurant ... if the dining space were larger I am sure they would continue to fill the place. 👍🏻

Address: 1 Dunns Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 3L1 Canada
Review: This really is a hidden gem.  Always friendly service and great meals. I’m partial to their Chinese food but the fish and chips or the hot turkey sandwich are great as well. Drop by and give it a try. You won’t be disappointed.

Address: 1 Dunns Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 3L1 Canada
Review: By far the best Chinese food. Decent orices,great service. This restaurant doesn't get enough recognition. Uts always fresh and hot. If you want a delicious feed of Chinese food I highly recommend this gem.

Address: 1 Dunns Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 3L1 Canada
Review: Great Service. Very well cared for.  Thank you.

Address: 1 Dunns Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 3L1 Canada
Review: Had my husband's birthday supper there last night have not been there in years it was so good definitely be going back again

Address: 178 Water St St. John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: Nice chill atmosphere, tasty drinks, and I enjoyed the veggie tempura and egg add-on. I want to like it, but the ramen broth is just okay for the price. On the cold day I visited, the room was wear-your-coat-indoors chilly.

Address: 178 Water St St. John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: Exceeded my expectations. We ordered the Pork Tantanmen and Pork Belly Shoyu. Both had plenty of pork and a good amount of noodles and vegetables. Also added the homemade hot sauce which was sweet and spicy. It's not quite traditional but was quite good. Service was good and efficient for having only one person on staff for the whole restaurant. Decor was familiar for a ramen restaurant with the menu on a wall chalkboard and benches along the wall and chairs on the other side. Would definitely recommend.

Address: 178 Water St St. John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: This was my first time at Bad Bones Ramen, located in downtown St. John’s and it did not disappoint!! We had the Chicken Gyoza dumplings as an appetizer and the pork belly ramen and miso chicken ramen.. both so flavourful and delicious! I can’t wait to visit again! I only managed to take one picture after I had already taken a few bites.. it was too good to wait! lol

Address: 178 Water St St. John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: Awesome food. Looked delicious and tasted amazing too! I had the fried chicken curry and the flavours were sooo good. and the ramen eggs were awesome aswell as the chicken (super crunchy) We also had the chicken dumplings for a side and even they were really good. deffinitely reccomend, and doesnt even compare to instant ramen lol.

Address: 178 Water St St. John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: Every time I go to Bad Bones it's a pleasant experience. The service is quick and kind, the atmosphere is very welcoming and the unique and absolutely delicious menu is one everyone should try. Would highly recommend!

Address: 1304 Topsail Road Paradise, NL A1L 1N9 Canada
Review:
Had a great experience at Ocean Sushi! So far, this is our favorite sushi spot since arriving to Newfoundland.

Very pleased with the various options on the menu for different kinds of seafood. We went with the Salmon 5 Ways platter, Crispy Spicy Crab rolls, calamari appetizer, octopus sashimi, and butterfish sashimi.

All of the cuts of fish were extremely generous. The rolls had the perfect ratio of rice to meat. The batter on the calamari was light and crispy, and the calamari weren't rubbery on the inside.

We were also happy that there was a low sodium soya sauce option for dipping. The flavors and spices used throughout were delicious.

Our server was very attentive, and checked back often. We didn't finish a glass of water or a drink before he came over to ask if we needed more.

Will definitely be regulars here. Thank you!

Address: 1304 Topsail Road Paradise, NL A1L 1N9 Canada
Review:
We stopped here for one last taste of fresh fish before flying out of Newfoundland, and it did not disappoint! The servers were exceptionally pleasant and attentive, every piece of sushi was delicious - some were just more delicious than others. Ive never encountered asparagus sushi before trying Ocean and it was a really fun and tasty new one for me.

Great location too, great bathrooms and great atmosphere. Whenever i am back in Newfoundland i will be stopping back in here.

Address: 1304 Topsail Road Paradise, NL A1L 1N9 Canada
Review:
Their lunch menu is fantastic with some great deals. Food is fresh and with some newer combinations of flavours, it is delicious. I'm from West Coast where there are loads of sushi snobs, this place is better than a majority of any other places I've ever been to.
Pictured is Dynamite Roll, Salmon Avacado Roll, Salmon Tempura Roll, Salmon Mango Roll, Spicy Scallop Roll, Tuna Avacado

Address: 1304 Topsail Road Paradise, NL A1L 1N9 Canada
Review: I've been to every province in Canada and this is hands down the best sushi I've had. It is insanely good! Very nice quantities for an insane price. The lunch special is also crazy, with 3 standard rolls costing less than $20!!! That includes Miso soup too! Great location and on skip as well. Ample parking and never had a problem getting a table. If you're in St John's and want sushi, this is hands down the best spot of them all. The dynamite roll is sublime!

Address: 1304 Topsail Road Paradise, NL A1L 1N9 Canada
Review:
There is something special about the sushi here.  Not only is the sushi and sashimi fresh and made to order but they also offer a torched "Aburi" variety that sears the fish and adds a bit of charred smokiness giving it an extra boost of complexity.  There is an add-on cost to this technique but if you're looking for something different, give it a try.

The first time I was there, we had the sushi and sashimi combo for 2 and a fried calamari appetizer.  Although the fried calamari was good, it was similar to what you can get at any Steakhouse restaurant.  2nd time I was there, I had the grilled calamari and it is 100x better.  Cooked tender, not chewy, very umami.

It is my new favorite casual sushi spot in the St. John's area.

Address: 294 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: Cute little shop with old architecture. Tables available inside only. Locally owned. Food is fresh and delicious. $12 for a small wrap. Small town feel and decor. Right on the water street strip. Was busy with customers ordering for take-out. Inside seating less busy. Could be a bit cleaner inside...floors, windows and tea ceremony table. Otherwise a nice place to get freshly made good food.

Address: 294 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: We had their breakfast sandwich on a croissant and a cheese/green onion biscuit. They nailed it on flavour and amount of food. Very filling without being stuffed. Coffee and London fog were great! Good community vibes too.

Address: 294 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: Popped in to grab a coffee and sweet with my partner today. The coffee was amazing, and so was the brownie that I got! I was extremely impressed with the price point of everything offered by Rocket Bakery. My partner got a London Fog and almond croissant which were both fantastic. The store front was clean and the staff were friendly. Definitely recommend!

Address: 294 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review:
So if you’re in Newfoundland and happen to be anywhere near water St., St. John’s, and would love a cappuccino that will rock your world, then the Rocket is a must!! The young lady behind the counter makes the best cup I’ve had so far,  I spend a lot of time in Latin America so I’m a little picky. The atmosphere's amazing, food is incredible. Ten stars 🌟
😎

Address: 294 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: The rocket sandwich was very tasty and the quinoa salad fresh. Great spot if you don't want to visit the many taverns on the street. You can see signal hill from here and it's tiny.

Address: 210 Water Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review:
My husband and I did the All You Can Eat at Sushi Island and it was decent overall! The All You Can Eat menu is great if you want to try different dishes. They do charge for sushi and dishes not finished (2$/roll, 7$/plate for a dish) but will let you take it home.

The fried wontons were a little overcooked and lacking filling. The sushi rolls were not cut evenly, but the food was fresh and rice was sticky.

We wanted to order sashimi, but didn't see it on the menu during lunch (12:00pm). It did appear to be sold later in the day.

Service was good. They do have "server" robots that bring your food to you. The server we had did some around to check on us a few times as well.

Address: 210 Water Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review:
The food is absolutely delicious and, in all seriousness, I have to say that it’s the best service I’ve ever received at any restaurant. The staff members are so nice and they all seem very genuine. My mother and I go fairly frequently, admittedly to the point that we get recognized by most. The quality of the food is consistant and the prices are amazing. We always get the $40 combo thing they offer and honestly, it’s such a steal that it feels criminal. You get two drinks (pop), two extra sauces, four appetizer-like things (soup and salad), four rolls of sushi, and three side dishes. They offer complimentary ice cream at the end of your meal if it’s available and ginger and wasabi are both free as well. The combo feeds 2-3 people. Also, they have robotic cats that bring you food and, I promise, seeing them and getting to pet the robocat is enough to make grown adults squeal like children. It’s seriously so fun. The atmosphere is wonderful and the walls are covered in beautiful murals. I know this review sounds like I’m being paid to write this but I’m genuinely not, I just love it that much. I have literally nothing to say about the place except for glowing praise. If you’re in the St. John’s area and you like sushi or would like to try it, I’d highly recommend you go.

Food recommendations:
- seaweed salad
- black dragon roll
- spicy tuna roll
- salmon avocado cream cheese roll
- golden crab roll
- pork cutlet
- sweet and sour chicken
- fried scallops

Address: 210 Water Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: The sushi  is pretty bland.  The fried rice is very good. The price is affordable.

Address: 210 Water Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review:
I go here everytime I'm in st John's.

Food and service are awesome. Very friendly staff and they have the cool robot.

Address: 210 Water Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review:
We had a great experience at Sushi Island. The staff were amazing (to the point they ran after us because we forgot our leftovers!)

The food as always was super tasty and the little robo kitties make it such a fun experience!

Address: 123 Quidi Vidi Road St. John's, NL A1A 1C3 Canada
Review: A tucked away gem of downtown St. John's. If you're looking for pasta based dishes, or you are hungry then you should come here.

Address: 123 Quidi Vidi Road St. John's, NL A1A 1C3 Canada
Review: Delicious food, cozy atmosphere and excellent service. We ordered the deluxe bruschetta as an appetizer + the carbonara pasta and chicken parmesan sandwich as mains. Took a lovely tiramisu latte to go as well. Will definitely be back on our next trip to town!!

Address: 123 Quidi Vidi Road St. John's, NL A1A 1C3 Canada
Review: The experience I had at Bellissimo tonight was TOP NOTCH. I had the seafood linguine and it was simply a delightful explosion of flavours. The music and atmosphere was pleasant and the server was very professional. After a long and stressful day at work, Bellissimo truly made my day. Will definitely go back!

Address: 123 Quidi Vidi Road St. John's, NL A1A 1C3 Canada
Review: We liked the food but felt portions needed more. A sandwich with a salad or fries instead of alone. Pasta with a salad instead of alone. Unfortunately, it didn't quite fill us up. The service was friendly. Decor has potential, but it is cold and missing a cozy feeling. We thought the exterior was nice.

Address: 123 Quidi Vidi Road St. John's, NL A1A 1C3 Canada
Review: Best To Call Ahead To Make Sure They Are Open. We Drove An Hour To Eat Here, Arrived At 7:50 And Was Told The Kitchen Closed Early. The Food Is Great However ! Worth The Hour Drive

Address: 375 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: Tried this place for the first time today and really enjoyed! We got two of the daily specials, vegetarian and non. Every bite was packed full of flavour and so delicious. The naan bread was a treat and the samosas were good as well. An added bonus was that our order wasn’t ready when we came for it so the owner brought it out to our car so we wouldn’t get a ticket. Will definitely be back!

Address: 375 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: Ate here a couple of times while visiting St. John's and had their lamb kebab and non vegetarian mixed platter. Both times the food was ready soon, affordably priced, tasty and had generous serving sizes. Would definitely eat here again.

Address: 375 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: Quaint spot, small menu, but you certainly get your money's worth! I imagine their takeout is most popular

Address: 375 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: Cozy, cute, welcoming and very tasty! The lovely couple, who I believe own this place, serving me were polite and prompt. They welcomed me in and served such delicious authentic Afghan food! I absolutely love how much the way they have set this small space up! Their veggie samosas were so crisp, came with a delicious dip sauce and hit the spot! The veggie dish I ordered was packed with flavour and spices! I've had Afghan food before but this place is legit! What a lovely tucked away gem for St. John's! If you have never had Afghan food, make this the first place you go! Thank you for your kind hospitality and amazing food!

Address: 375 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: One of the best meals I’ve had in St. John’s with great service at a great price

Address: Glenhill Plaza 74 Old Placentia Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 5H6 Canada
Review: Best pizza place in town. These guys are serving the perfection 👍🏻

Address: Glenhill Plaza 74 Old Placentia Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 5H6 Canada
Review: Almost everything I and my girlfriend have had from here is amazing. The pizza, donairs, gyros. All great! The only things I've had that I didn't like were the fries and wings. Those were mediocre at best.

Address: Glenhill Plaza 74 Old Placentia Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 5H6 Canada
Review: Mistake made on our nacho Grande order,  much less cheese than it used to be, much less toppings, price much higher. They asked for a tip at the pay terminal to pick up take out which is rude and inappropriate for no service. Pay your employees and don't beg to top up their salary. Used to be the best nachos on the Avalon, but now just another rip-off.

Address: Glenhill Plaza 74 Old Placentia Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 5H6 Canada
Review: I ordered a while ago on Door Dash. The dasher must have dropped my order off at another house. The dasher said it was delivered. But it wasn’t, and I never got a refund.

Address: Glenhill Plaza 74 Old Placentia Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 5H6 Canada
Review: This place is great! The staff are friendly and the food is delicious. They also give you a cookie with pizza slices! Nice touch.

Address: 283 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G9 Canada
Review:
I have heard of Basho quite a few times and always wanted to try it. I got the chance today and I was not disappointed at all! Loved the sushi and the tempura I had! It was nothing less than authentic and was absolutely delicious! Although it was a bit pricy, but I think it's well within reasons.The servers were very professional and friendly too. They provided pretty good service.
I would like one thing changed though. I would like a bit more lighting in the dining area, as it was a bit too dark.

Address: 283 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G9 Canada
Review: Salmon tartar amazing. But eel and avocado roll…. there were bones, a lot. Mojito was really fresh and tasty.

Address: 283 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G9 Canada
Review: Great meal that didn't disappoint! The Nobu new style Sashimi was exceptional and worth a try. The goat's cheese cheesecake was also an unexpected treat if you're looking for something different. Well done!

Address: 283 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G9 Canada
Review:
Had seafood & vegetable tempura, seasonal nigiri & sushi assortment, Spanish wine and blueberry mojito at Basho. Everything was quite nice, particularly nigiri and the blueberry mojito. Their sushi rolls were good but I have had better at another restaurant in the Avalon area. A friend who had surf n’ turf & pan seared seasonal white fish confirmed that they were both great. (They looked great too).
A good thing about Basho is that you can get gluten free appetisers, mains and desserts.
Ambiance of the restaurant is amiable and the staff is not bad either.

Address: 283 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G9 Canada
Review:
10/10 service & atmosphere.

If you want the best meal & service in the city I couldn’t recommend this place more. From the service, the atmosphere, the staff it truly is a one of a kind dining experience in the heart of St. John’s.

We love Basho 🫶🏻

Address: 36 George Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1M3 Canada
Review:
Pretry good place for some well done Japanese food. The atmosphere is pretty fancy, and the staff are quite hospitable.

We had their yuja cha and that was delightful. Their ramen was divine and their sushi was fresh and smooth. Would definitely come here again.

Address: 36 George Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1M3 Canada
Review: I had the teriyaki chicken meal with an honey avocado salad. The salad was not wring properly so the mixing it the bowl made the honey avocado taste watered down. The chicken was white meat and overcooked. It was just warm so I got a feeling it's not freshly made and was just kept warm. The teriyaki sauce was good though. The place was pretty empty, but it was a Monday night. I was seated close to the sushi bar and heard all the staff's conversations as they were speaking pretty loudly. My soup and salad came first and 3 minutes later my entrée came. I didn't have time to finish my appetizers. Plus my table had traces of dried sauce, nobody ever came back to ask how was my food nor did they come back to fill my water or tea. I had to raise my hand to get someone to come over and I had get up afterwards to pay at the cash since I don't want to have to raise my hand again to get the check. Very disappointed on everything. Not going back until they train their staff better. This is the worst restaurant I've been to in a long time.

Address: 36 George Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1M3 Canada
Review: I'll give a 4 stars for service, but the food is about 3 stars as I loved their fusion of Japanese to sit Western tastes, but the really should arrive for keeping it Japanese as so many people, I included, have been there and people who has had real Japanese food live it more than the stuff you find at home. So if you've never been to Japan, this place is the best, but if you're like me I think the best options are the basic 🍣 and their Ramen. Alcohol is a bit expensive so keep that in mind too.

Address: 36 George Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1M3 Canada
Review: Great and fast service. Mind me it was a Monday night and there was less than 10 people when I came in. I had the Pork Belly Ramen and it was delicious!! Sweet and salty with chilli on the side as requested. The server surprised me with a free appetizer (fried sushi) it was good but a bit on the cold side. Did I say free?? :) Also, the washroom was the best I have seen in a sushi restaurant. 👍👍 I might come back and try the fish.

Address: 36 George Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1M3 Canada
Review: Decent prices and good service. Well made rolls. Ordered octopus salad and I'm sure it was good for those who like it but it wasn't for me! Made a good Long Island ice tea too. Good for groups, dates or solo dining. On George street.

Address: 142 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2E7 Canada
Review:
We came here for lunch after landing in St Johns. After sitting on a plane, this simple to the point meal was perfect. I didn't leave feeling heavy or hungry. I loved it even more after finding out that they do this as a social enterprise to help vulnerable adults and help get them into the food service industry.

The service was really good and the food and atmosphere is perfect. There is a small outside area to eat but we just sat inside by the window. It's a lovely cafe to have lunch. We didn't need reservations or have to wait in line and came in 30 minutes before they were expected to close. We never felt rushed or like we were being waited for. I would say the cost is acceptable and for the cause, I would say that it is well worth paying for.

Would definitely return to have lunch.

Address: 142 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2E7 Canada
Review:
I'm gonna give an objective review since I'm not from NL and because I've only been there once.

The cafe in itself is cute with a warm ambiance.

First I was disappointed because I expected them to offer a variety of coffee like espresso but they only have regular filter coffee which isn't bad.

Then, the service wasn't bad, but it was kinda strange.. From what I could grasp, I think employees there are being rehabilitated to society by being offered a job at this cafe by the church. Please, tell me if I'm wrong.
I think it's great! More places should do this. But like I said it was kinda strange.. I think one of the server didn't like my boyfriend and he was giving him weird intense looks. I had to point it out.

Then, the food was good. I had the applebutter grilled cheese. But the portion is too small for the price.

I can't give a better rating because of these reasons. I'm still glad I tried it.

Address: 142 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2E7 Canada
Review:
This teeny café is delightful. It’s not cramped, there is no uncomfortable banquette seating (thank the gods!) and it’s open and sunny in the morning.
The server was extremely friendly and attentive. The food was delicious (we both had the hearty breakfast with sausage) and we were tempted by dessert afterwards but couldn’t have fit it in! We will definitely return though.

Address: 142 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2E7 Canada
Review: The ambiance of the place is good with giant windows. It's very bright and clean. The fresh little flower vase was a nice touch. The food is alright. Although it's unique, it's a little bit pricey. I liked the Mimosas here. Tried the soft shell moose tacos and breakfast on the bun with potatoes and salad. The dessert was delicious. The covid protocols are being practiced and the tables spread apart.

Address: 142 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2E7 Canada
Review: I was pretty disappointed with our experience, especially when the place had so many good reviews. The food tasted old, felt like rubber and was in very small portion for the price paid. A breakfast with one egg (so cooked it was like rubber), some veggies (boiled tomatoes and spinach)  and old potatoes cost $16 plus tax and tips. The waiter made us feel very uncomfortable and reached at us a couple of times. I am unsure what that was about but I will give them the benefit of the doubt. All in all a bad experience. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Address: 302 Kenmount Rd St. John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: Not only did we have a missing entre our whole order was a disaster and this is not the first time. Out salad had rotten lettuce throughout it. Chicken was burnt and soggy and our order of brushetta was coated in seasoning salt it was not edible. The inconsistencies at this restaurant are unreal.  120 dollars wasted...

Address: 302 Kenmount Rd St. John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: Karle was an awesome server. She helped make our order more enjoyable & always came back to our table to make sure things were going smooth and if we needed anything else. 😉

Address: 302 Kenmount Rd St. John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review:
Just had the BEST experience at Kelsey's on Kenmount Rd. We were seated by a lovely hostess. Our server Miranda came straight away to offer drinks and advise us of the specials. She gave the appropriate amount of attention, genuine, and not pushy. She told me it was her first time making my sangria. It was perfect! My husband and I had the steak. My Dad had the ribs and wings. My compliments to the back of house team. My steak was perfect! A beautiful rare steak isn't easy, but mine was melt in your mouth delicious. The chili sauce over the shrimp was so tasty.  For the desert they indulged in the cheesecake and I enjoyed the churro fries. They were good, but would be better with the chocolate.
All in all the food was great but everything was enhanced by Miranda's five star service. She was fantastic and I hope she sees this.

Address: 302 Kenmount Rd St. John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: Was at Kelsey’s and ordered a full rack of ribs. I did the rib and wing combo. The ribs were succulent and the wings cooked to perfection. We had the best service we could ask for. The waitress was kind and very accommodating. The service at Kelsey’s is definitely worth the stop. Ask for Erin O and the service will be unmatched!

Address: 302 Kenmount Rd St. John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: We had a wonderful experience. Our server Brittany was amazing! We were a large group of 14 and she didn’t miss a beat.  She was warm, friendly and efficient. She kept track of all our orders and I was very impressed with how fast we were all able to pay  separately. If you go, ask for Brittany.

Address: 364 Duckworth St St. John's, NL A1C 1H5 Canada
Review: I am glad that I went there as the food is exceptionally delicious!! I was happy to see that there are places which offer pure vegetarian &  egan food. Order Teriyaki Bowl and it was portioned well with brown rice. I wish that dining area was bit more option but not at big issue.

Address: 364 Duckworth St St. John's, NL A1C 1H5 Canada
Review: Great food, especially the enchiladas! Would highly recommend for someone looking for a great vegetarian/vegan option

Address: 364 Duckworth St St. John's, NL A1C 1H5 Canada
Review:
Delicious vegetarian and vegan sandwich, soups and dishes. Everything was fresh and the tastes were well balanced.
Didn't have any of their mains but if the their soups and sandwiches are any indication then they'll be top knot too.

Address: 364 Duckworth St St. John's, NL A1C 1H5 Canada
Review: We were visiting from out of town and really enjoyed our dinner here. We dined in the restaurant which has several cozy tables indoors as well as outdoor seating. We had the burrito and "chicken" tacos both made vegan. They are not kidding about the spice on the habanero sauce, but that is to be expected and it was great. The burrito was delicious and filling. We often struggle to find vegan options when we travel but this place was great. We were stuffed so we didn't have dessert but they had several vegan and gluten free sweets on offer as well.

Address: 364 Duckworth St St. John's, NL A1C 1H5 Canada
Review:
We had the Bravacado sandwich and the chickpea curry. Everything was delicious. Service was pleasant and accommodating.

Highly recommend this place for well made food at a good price.

Address: 355 Main Road St. John's, NL A1S 1J9 Canada
Review: Nice place to meet people and have a chat. Friendly helpful wait staff. Music left a bit to be desired.

Address: 355 Main Road St. John's, NL A1S 1J9 Canada
Review: So, want to say thanks to the server at Jungle Jims on topsail road for suggesting we try here when they were really busy.  Had a great meal with the kids and hubby.  Our server was friendly and efficient.  The food was hot and tasty.

Address: 355 Main Road St. John's, NL A1S 1J9 Canada
Review:
In fact, my friend and I did not visit the Shamrock City pub in the goulds...
We went to the sister business, aka Jungle Jim's for Wednesday wings.
There's a lot more on offer than just wings. Great value and selection. There was no crowd when we visited. Service was first rate. Very enjoyable visit! Thanks

Address: 355 Main Road St. John's, NL A1S 1J9 Canada
Review: So happy we found Shamrock City in Goulds. Closer than Mt. Pearl, and absolutely much a much more preferred spot, distance aside. Menu is comprehensive but not overwhelming. Steak night is by far the best value anywhere, and the quality does not suffer. Excellent, fast and friendly servers. Each visit is a treat.

Address: 355 Main Road St. John's, NL A1S 1J9 Canada
Review:
Great food and service.
Nice atmosphere,and really good music!

Address: 246 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G6 Canada
Review: There's a reason this place is voted best breakfast in St. John's: because it is! The menu selection is massive, and everything I've tried so far was delicious. On our last visit the lineup wasn't bad, but began to lineup after we'd been seated, you definitely want to get there early on weekends, this is one of the most popular places downtown for breakfast and the wait times can reflect that.

Address: 246 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G6 Canada
Review: Visit  from Toronto for work on the same street as bagel cafe walked pass by it a few time then decide to make a plan to go with friends and it was the best decision . Everything we ordered was on point service was awesome our water and coffee mugs were always full . Atmosphere inside is extremely clam everything is friendly . I order me a simple bagel egg sandwich it was delicious fresh it comes with a side of home fries  / hash brown . Bagel was fresh nicely toasted it was tasty my friends order omelette/ fruit bowl and other items everyone was funny satisfied with the amount of food that comes with each order so is I like to eat big meals u got urself a lot of food u can eat . They don’t cheap away from the portions . If u visiting make sure to visit this for breakfast and hope u have the same experience as me :) thank you 🙏🏽

Address: 246 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G6 Canada
Review: Ordered the mushroom, spinach, cheese open omelette and it was huge. No paper thin omelette here, more like an inch thick for just the egg. There had to be like half a dozen eggs in it. Very tasty. Also ordered the touton breakfast sandwich with bacon, egg, and cheese with a side of molasses and hash browns. Another large meal and also very good. A lot of dough though. Only issue is that there are no drinks on the menu. Ordered a coffee which came in a large cup but was also $4.85. I would also go directly to the website to look at the menu for pricing, Google Maps menu link, deep links to an old version of the menu and older prices. Service was quick and efficient by both the host and wait staff. The atmosphere is definitely "cozy" and quaint. Small pathways and low ceilings and some unique small booths for two. We got a small booth right beside the front window which was nice. Overall good food, good service, and good value for money.

Address: 246 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G6 Canada
Review: We had breakfast and dinner here. For breakfast, we ordered Harborside Big hardy breakfast, the dish is huge, it's too much for one person. So we shared it and added two bowls of yogurt with fruit. It's the best breakfast we had in St John's. For dinner, we had two lobsters. The lobsters were steamed, cooked at right level very fresh and taste delicious.

Address: 246 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G6 Canada
Review: Great deal for 2 for 1 dine Lobster dinner for $79.99 with a bottle of wine. Hubby added a steak for additional $12.99. Wine was actually decent, not sweet.

Address: 315 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B4 Canada
Review:
The food was very good. The Brie was exquisite, the duck special was outstanding, gypsy salad delicious and refreshing. Not to forget the calamari just yum. The cocktails were also good

The service stuttered when the crowd appeared but it caught back up

Address: 315 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B4 Canada
Review: I recently made reservations here for my parents to try. They had a very pleasant experience here. The staff were friendly the food was on time, fresh and flavourful. Ordered the calamari and curry chowder for appetizers and for the main they both had Cajun chicken linguini. Overall great spot for a date night or special occasion.

Address: 315 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B4 Canada
Review:
My cousin &  I came in for lunch. The staff was very attentive & went out of their way to make us feel special. My cousin ordered the turkey brie something with pepper soup which she loved. I ordered the blackened salmon which I didn't care for much but I would still come here again.

PS. Do not miss their addictive chocolate mints which they so generously plied me with!

Address: 315 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B4 Canada
Review:
The food was unbelievably delicious!!
Basically anything that we ordered was great!
Staff were super friendly and professional!
Loved it!

Address: 315 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B4 Canada
Review: It was a bit busy at around 2pm. Their outdoor eating area wad blocked and busy during the Pedestrian Mall. I went inside and sat at the bar. It was about 10 minutes to be served and 20 minutes to receive food. I ordered the  loaded street fries and a Corona. They could have been great except the fries were cut very small, something in the dish was extremely salty and the jalapeños were candied (not hot and very sweet). I didn't eat it all as  the meal was too salty. The Corona (on tap)was enjoyable and the bartender was nice though.

Address: 329 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review:
We were blown away. Food was perfectly done. Dasha was our server and she was excellent, giving just the right amount of attention, but friendly and welcoming. I fear we closed the restaurant after two bottles of wine and she never made us feel rushed.

But the food! Everything we had was perfect, from the calamari to the crème brûlée. We had a delicious lobster and even the julienned vegetables were perfect! Imagine taking the care to make veggies delicious under a lobster!

I’m kind of glad we found this place at the end of our trip because any other restaurant would have paled in comparison.

Address: 329 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: Well, we have been dining at Magnum & Steins, off and on, for 20 or more years. Experiences have always been super but tonight’s was a bit of a downer. We went for the advertised Happy Hour and from the outset it was more ‘hijack hour’.  Maybe I don’t get out enough but happy hours to me imply 2 for 1 specials or similar. The red wine special tonight was Tripache Malbec 5 oz glass regular price of $9.50 for the low, low price $8.75 [And there was no pan fried Cod option to boot]. I understand that the restaurant business is tough but in my opinion you need to build in a little more Joy into the pricing of your advertised Happy Hour specials.

Address: 329 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: My partner and I enjoyed dinner at Magnum and Steins last night and it was fantastic. We had the duck nachos to start which were highly recommended by friends and they did not disappoint, definitely the highlight of the night! For mains I had the fish of the night, which was a cod dish. The dish was prepared very well. My partner had the pasta of the night, which was a chicken based pasta dish which was quite good! For desert we had the chocolate flourless torte which was superb. Our server Laura was friendly, helpful but a bit slow at points, however she had many tables. She gave us great recommendations, and even surprised us with our mains and wine pairings. The restaurant was clean, and the atmosphere was intimate. Would recommend

Address: 329 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review:
Not fussy.

We had reservations at 7 but we're able to get in at 645 and take advantage of the happy hour specials. She ordered a Starburst martini while I sipped on a long Island ice tea.

We ordered appetizers, duck confit nachos and the potato skins. They tasted great but the nachos were quite small and the potato skins are literally 3 halves of potatoes.

Pretty sure we were the youngest people there besides the servers, the next youngest person after myself looked to be 15 years older. We felt very out of place. The menu was also minimal but didn't have so many options different outside of most restaurants locally.

The meal of two drinks and two appetizers came out to about $50, the drinks were as expensive as the aps. Their wine menu was quite extensive except we aren't wine drinkers so this probably isn't the place for us.

I don't think we'll be returning any time soon, there is literally nothing else on their menu I would like to try that I can't have anywhere else.

Address: 329 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: Food was amazing.  Oven baked Halibut,  fish and chips and duck confit nachos were phenomenal.   Highly recommend!

Address: 10 King's Road St John's, NL A1C 3P1 Canada
Review: Please visit! We LOVED our pizzas. Visiting from our of town and went more than once. Gluten free & Vegan options too were amazing. Sooo delish, don't skip eating here! Lovely staff, amazing food, great location. You won't be disappointed!!

Address: 10 King's Road St John's, NL A1C 3P1 Canada
Review:
We ordered the Fibonacci and Sir Isaac Salmon pizzas. It was our first time having Fibonacci and we really liked it! However, the Sir Isaac Salmon pizza wasn’t as good as the previous time we had it. The crust was delicious but the fish was salty and not smoky enough.

We got take out because the inside of the restaurant had a bit of cigarette smell and the atmosphere is not that cozy.

Address: 10 King's Road St John's, NL A1C 3P1 Canada
Review:
Pi Pizza until tonight was my favourite. Always order Prime Colours. Not sure what has happened, the crust has changed, it’s very doughy now, and let’s face it the crust makes it breaks your pizza. While the toppings were mostly liberal, I had to hunt for the bacon. Overall it was rather tasteless. I asked for their hot oil sauce and got some kind of hot tomato base sauce. The pizza was also not hot or even warm despite the fact that we picked it up on time. Their online menu said the cost was $30 plus $2 extra for the sauce yet we got charged $42.

Anyway perhaps their recipe has changed or their pizza maker whatever the reason sadly I won’t be going back.

Address: 10 King's Road St John's, NL A1C 3P1 Canada
Review:
Would've left 6 ⭐if I could!
Best pizza pie in St. John's

Address: 10 King's Road St John's, NL A1C 3P1 Canada
Review: Editing review: chocolate fudge is disgusting. I wish i can go back and prove myself its a mistake cuz their food overall is amazing…$$$ Good pizza, alot of varieties. Amazing and very lovely staff and customer service. Ill definitely come back but mainly for the friendly quick easy service

Address: 127 Harbour Drive Bishops Cove Landing St. John's, NL A1C 6N6 Canada
Review:
Best patio in St. John's!  We stopped in here after a long walk to have an afternoon drink.  The outdoor patio on the 2nd floor over looks the harbour.
It is very picturesque  and relaxing.  The service was great.

Address: 127 Harbour Drive Bishops Cove Landing St. John's, NL A1C 6N6 Canada
Review:
The warm hospitality and inviting atmosphere set the stage for an unforgettable meal.

Let's start with the star of the show - the steaks. Keg's Steakhouse truly lives up to its reputation as a steak lover's paradise. The menu boasted an impressive selection of prime cuts, each cooked perfectly. I opted for a juicy steak, cooked medium-rare, and it arrived at my table with a mouthwatering sear and a tender, melt-in-your-mouth texture. The quality of the Steak was evident in every bite, and the expert seasoning beautifully enhanced the flavours. This was one of the best steaks I have ever had the pleasure of eating.

The service at Keg's Steakhouse was top-notch. The staff was knowledgeable, attentive, and genuinely passionate about ensuring a memorable dining experience. From offering recommendations to promptly refilling glasses, they were always one step ahead, ensuring I wanted nothing throughout the meal. In addition, the waitstaff's friendly demeanour added a personal touch to the evening, making me feel like a valued guest rather than just another customer.

The restaurant's ambiance was elegant and sophisticated, with dim lighting, cozy booths, and tasteful decor. It was the perfect setting for an intimate dinner or a celebratory gathering. The noise level was well-controlled, allowing for comfortable conversation without feeling overwhelmed by the surrounding buzz.

Address: 127 Harbour Drive Bishops Cove Landing St. John's, NL A1C 6N6 Canada
Review: You can feel the difference here. Everything tastes fantastic, we were a group of 7 and we ordered different types of food but all were delicious. Great staff, harbor view.

Address: 127 Harbour Drive Bishops Cove Landing St. John's, NL A1C 6N6 Canada
Review:
My family and I had a wonderful meal from start to finish this evening.  Being quite warm inside, we asked if we could be accommodated outside, which was done quickly and seamlessly.

The food was hot, delicious, generous in portion size and our server was very attentive.  We will definitely be returning!

Address: 127 Harbour Drive Bishops Cove Landing St. John's, NL A1C 6N6 Canada
Review:
Not as good as we expected. We arrived at 4:45 PM for an early dinner and we were told there was no server before 5:30 PM. So, we ended up having a drink at the bar. They have a good selection of beers and wine. The bloody ceasar is filled with ice in a small glass. So, not a big drink, you got a couple of sip.

I don't recommend the burger there. It was very dry. Fries were good. Friends with steak said they were very good, but one of them was overcooked.

Long story short, I think you can get a better taste somewhere else for the same amount.

Address: 402 - 408 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C9 Canada
Review: We used to eat at this restaurant all the time and get excellent service. Since Covid the service kept going downhill every time we placed an order. Today we placed an order, and when we showed up, my husband was given one order instead of two. The staff argued with him and myself, saying that we only placed one order and their staff was right not me. I asked him what would I gain by showing up to pick up two orders when there was only one ready? We ordered there that much they would have known our orders previously and known that we have never placed one order. We always place the exact same order all the time.. so instead of saying that the person on the phone was mistaken, they just argued with me and said no, it was me that was wrong. Then she wondered why I wouldn’t take that food that was ready and wait for more to be made so I could have one order of food half cold. I asked to have two orders made, and they refused. Needless to say, it will be my last order placed ever there. The staff is rude, not friendly at all. Even the food itself has gone downhill since Covid started. There was absolutely no one in the store, picking up an order or eating in at this time, so I think this should tell them to treat people better. It’s not worth my time ordering from a place that calls me a liar about my own order. I think I remember what I ordered.

Address: 402 - 408 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C9 Canada
Review: Very clean and well taken care of. Very welcoming, non judgemental atmosphere. The waiter was very kind and the food is always amazing. The food is so delicious and flavourful.

Address: 402 - 408 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C9 Canada
Review:
The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was tasty.

The deep fried BBQ pork bun had a lot of flavour but I thought it would be bigger.

The sweet & sour pork was spot on but it was strange that it tomatoes instead of red pepper in it. But it was still tasty overall.

The egg roll was flavoursome. I liked it.

The crispy wonton was wonton sheets deep fried. It wasn't deep fried wonton balls with shrimp & pork in it. But it was still good with the sauce.

The coconut pudding was a coconut filling in batter, deep fried and dusted with icing sugar. It was sweet to end the meal.

The restaurant had a great atmosphere and the service was good too. I would come back here and try other dishes on the menu.

Address: 402 - 408 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C9 Canada
Review: It was a nice place. The food and environment was good. I especially like the cocktail I ordered.

Address: 402 - 408 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C9 Canada
Review: Very good Chinese restaurant. The authentic dishes are very authentic. The chef knows how to work the wok. The service is very attentive and friendly. This is one of the cleanest restaurants I've been to and it's very well maintained. I've been there multiple times and I haven't been disappointed.

Address: 367 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: Great spot with a great atmosphere! A little away from the hustle and bustle of water street, but close enough that you're still "in" it. Love the staff, something to eat for everyone. Definitely recommend giving it a try!

Address: 367 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: Holy cow their drinks on point! Food incredibly delicious. Servers the very best! They treated us so amazingly. Love this place

Address: 367 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: Ordered delivery last night. Price was outrageous- 2 pizzas, garlic bread and 6 pops for over $100... plus they forgot to send our drinks, said they could do anything about it when we called about it. I asked to talk to the manager who apparently wasn't there that day and was told they would call me back the next day to refund the drinks... never did hear back. Extremely disappointed.  I get people make mistakes, but then they should do what they can to fix it.

Address: 367 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: Absolutely terrible experience! >:( I ordered the “Chicken Parmesan” the picture from the menu looked delicious with the pasta and all. My order took one and a half hours to get here, my food was freezing cold, half of what I ordered wasn’t even in my plate, and I couldn’t use my gift card because the delivery guy’s machine was messed up. All this for 30$?! and not to mention my chicken was hard as rock. I wish i could get a refund for this but i don’t know how to.

Address: 367 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review:
Tables were sticky and dirty dishes were left on the tables around even tho servers were not busy and we're passing by dirty tables several times.
We ordered pizza which it was ok.
I am not going to come back here for sure

Address: 286 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: Food delicious, background music soothing. Service comes with a warm towel at the end of the meal. Excellent.

Address: 286 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review:
I don't know what to say. When you will open the menu for dine in, this is the first thing you will be looking at.
That's really awkward, you are Forced to give 15% tip along with the minimum $25 order for per person order while all the meal are overpriced compare to any other locations who served Indian food in the city.

Address: 286 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: We've visted this location twice and loved it. Will  be repeat customers. Delicious food.

Address: 286 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: This has been always one of my favorite places to go in St Johns  but not anymore Service was good but the food wasn't much chop. They have lost their flavors the lamb I ordered was cooked separately from the sauce it should have been stewed in the soup was the same thing  chicken added after the soup was poured. Honestly in my opinion it was not much better then something from a food court. The restaurant is very nice but I wanted a better meal. When we got our bill they informed us the tip of 15% was included in our total I discovered later that we tipped the hst amount as well. Not happy and won't be going back.

Address: 286 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: Food was nice service was good. The food was overpriced and then at the end to find out there was a mandatory tip was very disappointing. If we were 2 tables of 2 we wouldn't have had an extra 60 dollars added to the bill. If they can't handle serving 4 people at once maybe a new career is needed. Won't be going back.

Address: 102 Kenmount Rd St John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: I loved this restaurant but it's been closed since the Covid outbreak, hopefully it will open soon. The food was awesome and it had a very nice atmosphere, you can relax and feel like your in your own private space. The staff were always very friendly, if or when it opens again, I would greatly recommend trying it out.

Address: 102 Kenmount Rd St John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: Went on a date here and I did not have too high of expectations and yet they were abundantly exceeded. The decor of the restaurant looks quite beautiful and relaxing (although very old fashioned which may not be everyones taste). Our server was very sweet to us and the food was honestly delicious! I had a chickpea tomota curry kind of dish (forget the actual name) and my date enjoyed a stir fry. Both were large in portion sizing and were very good! I would highly recommend to give this spot a try, great for a family dinner, less so on the romantic side.

Address: 102 Kenmount Rd St John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: I have given this place multiple tries and unfortunately I (nor my company) have ever had warm meals. they always come out cool/cold . is there not a warming area? If so -it is broken. Also seems they are always understaffed giving one person all responsibilities (host, bar, server, cashier) - who is not to blame. The staff member has always been patient and friendly. The serving sizes are ok - prices high (being in a hotel I suspect). Ordering the prime rib medium rare gets you well done. Salmon is always well over cooked too. I can say the Seafood Chowder is awesome - however - again a bit overpriced. Done giving them chances.

Address: 102 Kenmount Rd St John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: If I could give half stars I would have rated PJ Billingtons 3.5. We were seated promptly, and our server was very attentive. Drinks came quickly. Food arrived promptly. The mussels were delicious and the wings were tasty. Our entrees lacked flavor, were pretty bland and forgettable. Overall service was great and the food was ok.

Address: 102 Kenmount Rd St John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: Great spot for supper (haven't gone here for lunch or breakfast). They have a new menu that, as far as I am aware of, is fantastic. Everyone in my party of 4 enjoyed their meal. The only complaint was an overly greasy onion ring out of 2 apps, 4 entrés and 1 dessert; which brings me to the apple pie and ice cream which was amazing. Hot pie and cold ice cream, "after" photo attached.

Address: 12-14 George Street St. John's, NL A1C 1L9 Canada
Review: I only had one night in st.Johns and I wandered my way into this pub. Drawn in by the live music, I was treated with nothing but kindness. Glad I walked in, happily stayed for 3 hours and delighted went back to my hotel.

Address: 12-14 George Street St. John's, NL A1C 1L9 Canada
Review: Great atmosphere with great live band that get the crowd out of their seats.

Address: 12-14 George Street St. John's, NL A1C 1L9 Canada
Review: Lobster roll made especially for us.  Can you get any better?  It was delicious!  Service excellence.  Our server Kenzie was excellent!  Thanks for the experience!

Address: 12-14 George Street St. John's, NL A1C 1L9 Canada
Review: Little pub/bar on George Street. 5 for $25 beer or seltzer are great deal. Only problem is when sitting on the patio is you are getting the music from Green Sleeves as well as martini bar across the street and the  street stage just down the street. It was very annoying hearing 3 competing different songs at once. We had to leave cause it was too hard on the head. Probably be fine if you are sitting inside.

Address: 12-14 George Street St. John's, NL A1C 1L9 Canada
Review: Great live music, they actually play music that isnt Celtic which is rare here. Don't get me wrong, I don't mind Celtic music but every bar except this one and Jungle Jims plays it.

Address: 250 Duckworth Street Saint John's, NL A1C Canada
Review: We had a great experience stopping by this family owned vegan restaurant during our visit in St. John’s. (We are not vegans) We found this place from online reviews about local favourites in town and this place did not disappoint.  The owner Loi is so kind and generous and immediately served us with tea and soup upon sitting. We ordered the squash roll and shanghai noodles and a rice dish. Each dish was full of flavour and complimentary home made sauce was provided to add to your liking. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone, vegan or not, local or traveller. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did!

Address: 250 Duckworth Street Saint John's, NL A1C Canada
Review: This was such a wonderful experience in hospitality and delicious food! I brought three non-vegans and everyone enjoyed their food! I'm also allergic to gluten and the owner took excellent care and made sure I didn't taste any of my friends' dishes which contained gluten ❤️ I can't wait to eat there again!!

Address: 250 Duckworth Street Saint John's, NL A1C Canada
Review: Coming from Toronto, I didn’t expect good Chinese food in Newfoundland. However, I have to give this place 5*!! The owner of this restaurant is super friendly. I can tell he loves what he does. He greeted us with a big smile, served us like we are his family. And omg…the food was super delicious!! No msg, high quality ingredients..what can I ask for more?!

Address: 250 Duckworth Street Saint John's, NL A1C Canada
Review: This place was amazing! My husband and I went here for our anniversary. The service was exceptional!! The food was equally amazing! I'm so grateful to have this fully vegan restaurant in st. John's. Will be coming back!!

Address: 250 Duckworth Street Saint John's, NL A1C Canada
Review: This may be the best Chinese food you will find in Atlantic Canada, let alone in St. John's. They make traditional Chinese dishes, while substituting meat with their own house-made meat substitutes made with soy, gluten, etc. The flavours are detailed and so beautifully rich, staying true to the flavours of the original dish - e.g. soy fish made with seaweed to give it an ocean flavour, or gluten marinated and grilled like char siu BBQ pork. You'll also get free house-made sauces which vary by the day, free soup, and free green tea. The portions are great, and the prices are great - less than $20 for nearly all dishes. All of this comes from the pure passion the old couple from Macau have for their art. The man (server) is a retired engineer in his 70s who opened the restaurant just to express his craft and not for any profit motives. The space is decorated with beautiful art and wise calligraphy, showing all that the couple has learned through their life. I have nothing but the utmost respect for them, and I highly recommend that everyone finding themselves in St. John's tries this food whether they are vegan or not!

Address: 70 Clinch Crescent Saint John's, NL A1B 4G8 Canada
Review: Friendly service and amazing food, got the grilled cheese and roasted red pepper soup and it was so delicious!

Address: 70 Clinch Crescent Saint John's, NL A1B 4G8 Canada
Review: Soo good! Visiting from Ontario and tried out this cafe. I loved my brown sugar latte and I liked the veggie breakfast sandwich (I got it on a croissant). The prices are were great, it was a smaller café, nice and clean, and our server was so kind! Hope to come back one day.

Address: 70 Clinch Crescent Saint John's, NL A1B 4G8 Canada
Review: Our meal was excellent, and for a great price! Highly recommend the vegan chili especially. You may want to make reservations as it seemed really busy with only a few tables (we got takeout and it travels well!).

Address: 70 Clinch Crescent Saint John's, NL A1B 4G8 Canada
Review: Friendly server, excellent service, delicious foods! Everything is good in here.

Address: 70 Clinch Crescent Saint John's, NL A1B 4G8 Canada
Review: Waited 30 mins to get an overpriced falafel wrap the size of a taco. Zero care to service.

Address: 55 A-1 Kelsey Dr St John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: My Family and I love the Dan Dan and the Firecracker stir fry dishes, Both very spicy, filled with flavour and a go to choice! Definitely recommend both of these if you enjoy spice! Fireballs and spring rolls are also an amazing side to add to your order! Would like to add staff were also very knowledgeable and went above and beyond to ensure a great quality meal. Definitely a go to spot in our books now, we will be back!

Address: 55 A-1 Kelsey Dr St John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: The food is amazing! The sweet mongolian and spring rolls are my favorite menu items. The service was professional and we were served very quick as well! Friendly environment and will definitely be back again!

Address: 55 A-1 Kelsey Dr St John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: Super delicious.  I will 10000000% go back again. Super affordable and cooked right on front of you.

Address: 55 A-1 Kelsey Dr St John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: The smell coming from this place was phenomenal. I ordered chicken Pad Thai with chow mein, Mongolian beef and broccoli on rice, and butter chicken on rice. The Mongolian beef was our favorite by far despite the broccoli being almost raw. The beef is tender and I really like the sweet sauce. The Pad Thai tastes too strongly of tamarind for us, unfortunately. The butter chicken was ok but I wouldn't get again. We were not fans of the texture of the chicken in either dish. The service was great and I really like watching the food being prepared. I will order from here again, probably a beef dish.

Address: 55 A-1 Kelsey Dr St John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: My son loves the butter chicken here, he’s always asking me to take him to Wok Box every weekend! Staff are always friendly and helpful, would definitely recommend this place to anyone. Oh and the kimchi fireballs are to die for!

Address: 460 Topsail Rd St John's, NL A1E 2C2 Canada
Review:
Food was hit or miss. Some items like the noodles weren't great and the baked potato was not good either. Other things like the wings, rice, broccoli and general tso chicken was pretty good. Nothing extraordinary. Ice cream was good, central dairies stuff.

Staff was tentative but it was completely dead so that was kind of expected.

Now the price, pretty ridiculous if you ask me. $30 per person is a bit out there for what it is but I guess that's what covid done to this place.

If you want to try it, go for it. I was stoned so I was loving it. Some of the food was not up to par but what do you expect, this place is dead.

Address: 460 Topsail Rd St John's, NL A1E 2C2 Canada
Review:
Ideal for having your dinner with friends, Family members or as a small group. Its a buffet with many choices. Worthy for the price. Usually around 20-30$ pp beverage extra.
Staff is very friendly, fast and caring. Nothing to complain about.

Address: 460 Topsail Rd St John's, NL A1E 2C2 Canada
Review: The food tastes quite good, and the staff were very friendly. The highlights for me were the wonton soup and hot and sour soup, allowing me to have "hot and sour wonton soup ". So good. The second bonus was the delicious pork dumplings, with small bowls nearby so you can bring some of the sauce (goya-ish) back to your table for dipping. Other unique fare included sticky buns, dim sum and white rice. The chicken and broccoli was a nice variation. Recommended.

Address: 460 Topsail Rd St John's, NL A1E 2C2 Canada
Review:
So disappointed
First time going to buffett since the pandemic 😫
I use to love their food...but after last week...I won't be going back.
And it has doubled in price...but the quality of the food has gone down drastically.
The Chinese food was like it was all cooked in the same sauce...and the Canadian food was too hard and dry to eat🤮

Address: 460 Topsail Rd St John's, NL A1E 2C2 Canada
Review: Food was pretty good, but $30/person is insane. They have a sign on each table warning that any scraps you leave on your plate will be weighed and you will be charged $9.99 per pound for any food you can't eat.  Not a pleasant dining experience.

Address: 25 George Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: We used to eat at this restaurant all the time and get excellent service. Since Covid the service kept going downhill every time we placed an order. Today we placed an order, and when we showed up, my husband was given one order instead of two. The staff argued with him and myself, saying that we only placed one order and their staff was right not me. I asked him what would I gain by showing up to pick up two orders when there was only one ready? We ordered there that much they would have known our orders previously and known that we have never placed one order. We always place the exact same order all the time.. so instead of saying that the person on the phone was mistaken, they just argued with me and said no, it was me that was wrong. Then she wondered why I wouldn’t take that food that was ready and wait for more to be made so I could have one order of food half cold. I asked to have two orders made, and they refused. Needless to say, it will be my last order placed ever there. The staff is rude, not friendly at all. Even the food itself has gone downhill since Covid started. There was absolutely no one in the store, picking up an order or eating in at this time, so I think this should tell them to treat people better. It’s not worth my time ordering from a place that calls me a liar about my own order. I think I remember what I ordered.

Address: 25 George Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: Very clean and well taken care of. Very welcoming, non judgemental atmosphere. The waiter was very kind and the food is always amazing. The food is so delicious and flavourful.

Address: 25 George Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review:
The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was tasty.

The deep fried BBQ pork bun had a lot of flavour but I thought it would be bigger.

The sweet & sour pork was spot on but it was strange that it tomatoes instead of red pepper in it. But it was still tasty overall.

The egg roll was flavoursome. I liked it.

The crispy wonton was wonton sheets deep fried. It wasn't deep fried wonton balls with shrimp & pork in it. But it was still good with the sauce.

The coconut pudding was a coconut filling in batter, deep fried and dusted with icing sugar. It was sweet to end the meal.

The restaurant had a great atmosphere and the service was good too. I would come back here and try other dishes on the menu.

Address: 25 George Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: It was a nice place. The food and environment was good. I especially like the cocktail I ordered.

Address: 25 George Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: Very good Chinese restaurant. The authentic dishes are very authentic. The chef knows how to work the wok. The service is very attentive and friendly. This is one of the cleanest restaurants I've been to and it's very well maintained. I've been there multiple times and I haven't been disappointed.

Address: 57 Rowan Street St. John's, NL A1B 2X2 Canada
Review:
I’m changing my review because the next time we went with my friend, the food and drinks were much better! I order tacos, and we had a pitcher of Margaritas! So yummy!
(Past review: 3 stars. I’d recommend the margaritas and sangria but not the food in general! The burritos did not have any greens, and the salsa was not fresh. The taco was ok!)

Address: 57 Rowan Street St. John's, NL A1B 2X2 Canada
Review: My partner and I have been coming here since I moved to St. John's twenty years ago. We are going again tonight. I expect it to be thoroughly delicious. Clean, friendly staff and terrific food. I don't drink, but my missus always has at least one Margarita.

Address: 57 Rowan Street St. John's, NL A1B 2X2 Canada
Review: 2nd time being here and amazing again. Best nachos in st John's 🍻 Thomas served us today and the last time. Very friendly knowledgeable hope to have him serve us again. I've worked in restaurants for over 20yrs and if I had my own place I would try to steal Thomas to work for me😊

Address: 57 Rowan Street St. John's, NL A1B 2X2 Canada
Review: Excellent service.  Among the best I ever had.  The food was very very tasty. Gotta love the complimentary nachos and salsa that they make in house.  The food was hot, the dessert was very tasty.  You couldn't ask for a nicer experience. We will be back and I recommend the speciality coffees..

Address: 57 Rowan Street St. John's, NL A1B 2X2 Canada
Review: My partner and I ALWAYS have an amazing experience when we go here. The food is SO good and our service is always amazing. We’ve had Jess the past few times and after not being there for a few months, she remembered us and asked how we’ve been! She is SO lovely and I hope she is appreciated for how awesome she is at her job! Nowhere compares to her level of customer service or just the quality of the experience we have there. :)

Address: 662 Topsail Road St. John's, NL A1E 2E2 Canada
Review: Lads couldn’t cook a pizza. Truly repulsive. Grease caked in the middle of the pizza, puddled. The toppings would fall off every time you took a slice. I think I could cook a better pizza using mud as dough in the sun. Health inspection report confirms this. Read that before ordering.

Address: 662 Topsail Road St. John's, NL A1E 2E2 Canada
Review: Seriously delicious pizza, delivered fast. Gluten free options are cheap and worth it!! Their GF garlic fingers are the best in the city.

Address: 662 Topsail Road St. John's, NL A1E 2E2 Canada
Review: Never again will me or my peers eat this pizza. Very distasteful. Normally I only leave positive reviews. Unfortunately, this place doesn't get one. Awful service, and the pizza had so much grease it was pooled in the middle like someone poured water on it. Go somewhere else, this place is disappointing.

Address: 662 Topsail Road St. John's, NL A1E 2E2 Canada
Review: Pizza is good tho garlic fingers are there better item. Price is fair and staff are really nice.

Address: 662 Topsail Road St. John's, NL A1E 2E2 Canada
Review: We were overcharged and I don’t feel like the gluten free pizza was really gluten free.

Address: 29 Commonwealth Avenue Mt Pearl, NL A1N 1W7 Canada
Review: Great food! Atmosphere was a little all over the place. 2 Tvs playing different shows with both volumes on and music playing. The server was nice enough to put both tvs on mute so we could enjoy our experience better( but I had to ask).

Address: 29 Commonwealth Avenue Mt Pearl, NL A1N 1W7 Canada
Review: Had this for supper today and the family all agreed it was great! Talked about doing a little job with the owners but they didn’t need it after all so There was no payment needed but they gave me a free comp jumbo pizza for my time! Great people! Thanks guys! For anyone saying theirs may have been undercooked I always ask for well done anyways to always avoid that problem as pizza shops will always go with 10 mins recommended times anyways!

Address: 29 Commonwealth Avenue Mt Pearl, NL A1N 1W7 Canada
Review: Came here recently with my aunt because this is one of her favourite places. For pizza and donairs. The owner came and chatted with us and he was so sweet and kind. Made sure everything was good and it shows he does care what he does. Staffing was an issue and hopefully they find the people they need. If I’m ever in the area again I’ll definitely stop by!

Address: 29 Commonwealth Avenue Mt Pearl, NL A1N 1W7 Canada
Review: Amazing service right before closing. Cody was very accommodating, professional and friendly. Even though it was closing time he still made sure we didn’t feel rushed and provided amazing service.

Address: 29 Commonwealth Avenue Mt Pearl, NL A1N 1W7 Canada
Review: This pizza place has a surprisingly good sports bar section for sit down and dine-in eating. The walk in service is good but cursory as they are quite busy with take out pizza, which is their main feature. The pizza is a classic pizza joint pizza that will satisfy the need for a cheesy bite. Available for delivery on skip the dishes and door dash.

Address: F3-35 Kelsey Dr St. John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: My sister and I ate here for dinner this evening. I was surprised that there weren't any specials, especially on a Monday. Most restaurants have daily specials. We both ordered the chicken club and shared a small garlic fingers. Both were very good. Soft drinks are $4 so a little overpriced in my opinion. Restaurant was very busy. Server was polite and efficient. Food came fairly quickly.

Address: F3-35 Kelsey Dr St. John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: Ordered delivery through Skip the Dishes. Their app says the accuracy of the order is on the restaurant. This location put the blame on Skip the Dishes for items missing. An hour and a half wait, with over-priced food, to not even get it right?! And then throw around the blame?!  Unreal!!! At least Skip the Dishes helped.

Address: F3-35 Kelsey Dr St. John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: One of the few restaurants that would take reservations for our rather large family group. The service was excellent! The young man who was our server never missed a single item on our orders....a daunting task no doubt! The food arrived hot and within a reasonable time frame. The one issue we had was with the dill chicken sandwich....the texture was "rubbery" though the taste was good. Definitely worth another visit.

Address: F3-35 Kelsey Dr St. John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: Can't share details about my experience because I didn't get to. Made reservations 2 days in advance for a large party of 10, everything was ok. Even called to increase it to 15 and they said no problem. On the DAY OF the reservation,  they call and say they're closed for renovations. Poor customer service there. Making renovations requires planning so they had to know they were closing. Not satisfied at all.

Address: F3-35 Kelsey Dr St. John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: The food was good and the atmosphere is definitely up to brand standard. The only downside is that we didn't get any top ups on our drinks which we received prior to receiving our main dishes. So got a little parched. Our sever Angela was very nice.

Address: 75 Kenmount Road St. John's, NL A1B 3P8 Canada
Review: Complete disappoint! We ordered for pick up a 90 dollar order and honestly I have never felt so ripped off!! 2 thumbs down. Took a hour to bring out to us. Not a soul in the park lot. The dinner for 4 was honestly enough fir 1. Very poor quality. We definitely will not be back! I thought as a business owner myself. How can you feel good about sending this out to a family. Brutal!  Save your money.

Address: 75 Kenmount Road St. John's, NL A1B 3P8 Canada
Review:
I love the old layout and the building has a cool design.
I dont know why people are complaining so much. Why would you go to a restaurant just for the wallpaper?
You should go there for the food.

I had the Yang Chow Fried Rice and I enjoyed it.
Its just too bad im broke because theres so many other dishes there that sound yummy and I dont have the money to afford to go there often but the food is well worth the price.

We dont see a lot of fancy old school Chinese restaurants like this anymore.
I think its cool.

If its not busy there like how it used to be then thats because there's a Buffet across the street. DUHHH!
So its not because the restaurant is bad , its a very good restaurant but people who are cheapskates rather pay $20 at a buffet to eat cheap quality buffet food with very little taste in the meats that isnt always fresh instead of spending a little extra money to go to a traditional Chinese diner and order freshly yummy well cooked served Chinese dishes made with better quality.

Address: 75 Kenmount Road St. John's, NL A1B 3P8 Canada
Review: The decor is dated and there are never many customers there when I visit but the food is the best Chinese food available anywhere ... and I mean anywhere in North America. I’m referring to Americanized Chinese food that we are accustomed to. Try the chicken balls, yang chow fried rice, chicken chow mein,wings of heaven, and egg rolls and enjoy. Better hurry though because I suspect the owner will be retired  soon and the restaurant will be closed.

Address: 75 Kenmount Road St. John's, NL A1B 3P8 Canada
Review:
I have read the comments. Yes it's older but beautifully maintained. Very clean. Will lit in a romantic/subdued way. Very friendly staff.
I would recommend for a family dinner, party or just by your self.
Food was good.

Address: 75 Kenmount Road St. John's, NL A1B 3P8 Canada
Review: the worst chinese food ever! the price is a total rip off...canned mushrooms...2 slices of beef in the brocoli and beef plate for 4 persons....3 tiny chicken pieces in the 4 serving padthai....frozen wong tong.....dry and tasteless eggrolls.....4 servings take out cost about 100$ could have get better food at the dollar store...dont waste your money in this scam restaurant!!!

Address: 107 Long's Hill St John's, NL A1C 1V4 Canada
Review:
Absolutely love this place, the folks who run it are friendly and knowledgeable, and bottom line: they make awesome food. The store side of the business has a lot of difficult to find African cooking ingredients, and treats from all over. The prices are very reasonable, and there are some absolute killer deals on things like olives.
My favourite place for takeout in St. John's, by far.

Address: 107 Long's Hill St John's, NL A1C 1V4 Canada
Review:
New take-out restaurant and grocery store.

They have a variety of interesting and healthy ingredients from Africa, and they also have juices to-go. The juices are healthy, delicious, and good value! The staff are helpful and friendly, and will show you some ingredients to try.
Also a good place for gluten-free flour.

Give this place a visit and support a new local business.

Address: 107 Long's Hill St John's, NL A1C 1V4 Canada
Review: We ordered the Patties, one beef dish and chicken that we shared with our two year old. It was all exactly what we needed, just a satisfying mix of flavours & our two year old ate all of her portion with many “Yums” being uttered. Mama Africa has been added to one of our favorite take outs!

Address: 107 Long's Hill St John's, NL A1C 1V4 Canada
Review:
Love the food here and it's so underpriced. The beef mafe is world class, nothing like it in St John's. The marinated chicken in their dishes is crazy. They serve fresh Baobab Juice and I'm telling you, for a hangover, nothing beats it. It's a miracle cure. They also have the best price in town for Jarritos soda. The owner is very excited to explain any questions you have about his products. They've got a huge selection of spices, skin and haircare, cold drinks, and grocery items on top of their amazing food. I bought a pack of orange blossom soap and now I smell like a king.

Also, the food they serve is halal. When you go, you have to try the hot pepper sauce that the owner prepares himself. It's almost like a salsa and you will be addicted right away!!

Address: 107 Long's Hill St John's, NL A1C 1V4 Canada
Review: I had the mafé and it was very filling and delicious! I would have liked a bit more beef in the portion but it was still very good! I also got the pineapple-ginger juice which was amazing! It had a strong ginger flavour which I loved. I had the bissap as well which was phenomenal!

Address: 364 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C1H5 Canada
Review: I am glad that I went there as the food is exceptionally delicious!! I was happy to see that there are places which offer pure vegetarian &  egan food. Order Teriyaki Bowl and it was portioned well with brown rice. I wish that dining area was bit more option but not at big issue.

Address: 364 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C1H5 Canada
Review: Great food, especially the enchiladas! Would highly recommend for someone looking for a great vegetarian/vegan option

Address: 364 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C1H5 Canada
Review:
Delicious vegetarian and vegan sandwich, soups and dishes. Everything was fresh and the tastes were well balanced.
Didn't have any of their mains but if the their soups and sandwiches are any indication then they'll be top knot too.
