Address: 364 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C1H5 Canada
Review: We were visiting from out of town and really enjoyed our dinner here. We dined in the restaurant which has several cozy tables indoors as well as outdoor seating. We had the burrito and "chicken" tacos both made vegan. They are not kidding about the spice on the habanero sauce, but that is to be expected and it was great. The burrito was delicious and filling. We often struggle to find vegan options when we travel but this place was great. We were stuffed so we didn't have dessert but they had several vegan and gluten free sweets on offer as well.

Address: 364 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C1H5 Canada
Review:
We had the Bravacado sandwich and the chickpea curry. Everything was delicious. Service was pleasant and accommodating.

Highly recommend this place for well made food at a good price.

Address: 201 Blackmarsh Rd. St John's, NL A1E Canada
Review:
Absolutely horrible "Jiggs dinner".  Salt meat was like brine,  turnip was strong and sinewy.  Gravy was like water,  I have been sick all night due to the level of salt in the beef.   Worst ever!

I was all hyped up for this. My friend told me it was the best in town.  I think not.

Address: 201 Blackmarsh Rd. St John's, NL A1E Canada
Review: Had breakfast this time. The omelet was pretty good. Service was great. Waitress was new and attentive.

Address: 201 Blackmarsh Rd. St John's, NL A1E Canada
Review: Ordered 2 piece fish and chips with dressing and gravy for pickup. Fish was not fresh and was mushy from being soaked in gravy. The fish needs to be kept separate from the gravy folks. Every thing was all packed tight in a square container.  The price almost knocked me off my feet too. Last time I go there.

Address: 201 Blackmarsh Rd. St John's, NL A1E Canada
Review: Been there for pickup. Asked the lady infront how much time will it take and she said Mayb it’s 10 min or 20 min. Then I was asking a guy and she interrupted us by saying she already talked to me. After I said this is rude she start passing racist comments. I really prefer not to go here if you are not Canadian. Facing this kind of behavior first time in Canada. *racist*

Address: 201 Blackmarsh Rd. St John's, NL A1E Canada
Review: Terrible place if you knew what happens in that kitchen you'd never eat there again. Worked as delivery driver at blackmarsh rd location for 4 years. I have seen first hand the nepotism and lack of respect they have for their workers. After I had been there for 3 years the other driver quit so the owner hired his friend to do deliveries. Well suddenly I started getting scheduled for less days and rescheduled from the busy days like friday and saturday. The owner was pushing me out to favor his friend even though I had been there for years at this point. When good friday came around the best day for the year to be doing deliveries for the big r I wasn't even scheduled despite being the driver that was there the longest. So in summation terrible food terrible owner St.john's would be better off without the big r

Address: 81 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2C8 Canada
Review: Awesome pizza spot. They even catered to our specific request that wasn't on the menu. Not saying they'll do it all the time for anyone, but the fact that they catered to a specific allergy request was amazing. Thank you!!! They have all types of pizza, and even some fried food options too! I haven't tried everything there yet, just the pizza, but I wouldn't be surprised if I go for the mozza sticks sometime! Would definitely recommend giving this place a try!

Address: 81 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2C8 Canada
Review: Venice is not necessarily a place to dine in, but their takeout pizza is consistently good. The sauce is fantastic.

Address: 81 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2C8 Canada
Review: Good pizza, ordering over the phone can be frustrating. I find the employees could work on their manners. Other then that no complaints. A little expensive

Address: 81 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2C8 Canada
Review:
Pizza: 8.5
Good price, 6.50 for "one slice" which is actually 2. Very filling, served warm, good variety of toppings, definitely a step up from any Fast Food pizza you can get in st John's.

Other menu items: was surprised to find out that their fries are actually amazing, did not expect that from a pizza place. Putine is also good. Overall, you can expect everything on their menu to be served warm and in large portions.

Overall experience: As someone who goes there a lot I have never had a bad experience with customer service, food is served quickly and the people working there are pretty chill.
Only Con is that the store is not very big so there is not always places to sit, that's really only a problem in winter though since it is right next to Bannerman Park.

Address: 81 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2C8 Canada
Review: A staple in St. John's. It's my wife's favorite spot for garlic fingers. They have really good slices too when they're fresh.

Address: 166 Merrymeeting Road St. John's, NL A1C 2W4 Canada
Review: Found a Red pushpin that was baked into a turkey roll. Never ever had an issue with Fabulous Foods before now. Will be more cautious in the future.

Address: 166 Merrymeeting Road St. John's, NL A1C 2W4 Canada
Review: Amazingly tasty turkey and dressing flips and gravy! Flakies are really good! Stay away if you are concerned about your weight!

Address: 166 Merrymeeting Road St. John's, NL A1C 2W4 Canada
Review:
Simply the best turkey around. They've got turkey lot pies, hot turkey sandwiches that come with a pile of fries, dressing, gravy, and peas!

Super reasonably priced (about $10 a for the plate pictured) - and their homemade flakies are a must-have.

Address: 166 Merrymeeting Road St. John's, NL A1C 2W4 Canada
Review: A St. John's classic for old school take out grub!! Those turkey flips with a side of gravy for dipping are the bomb, and the cream puffs are a tower of deliciousness.  You won't go hungry here, buddy.

Address: 166 Merrymeeting Road St. John's, NL A1C 2W4 Canada
Review: The name says it all! Fabulous Foods! Not posh just perfect home-style meals served with warm Newfoundland Hospitality! Fish & Chips, Turkey Pot Pies! Turkey Roll (flip /turnover)! And oven-fresh baked goods daily! It's all simply FABULOUS!

Address: 9 Kiwanis Street Unit 1C St. John's, NL A1B 0A2 Canada
Review: This location is nice. I miss the Steak option, and they ran out of rhe spicy chicken on the night I attended but was able to find an alternative. The price remains decent for the city. The atmosphere in this location is lacking, front door is broken and the general feeling of the eat in area feels run down and out of date. It's right on rhe edge of that to creepy to order food state, more so if you've never been to this location.

Address: 9 Kiwanis Street Unit 1C St. John's, NL A1B 0A2 Canada
Review: Most disappointing burrito I have had since I started visiting this place for the past 5 years. Server didn't seem like he had any skill wrapping up a burrito. Had to use a fork ,knife and spoon to eat a burrito.  Should have just gotten a bowl if I need a  cutlery. Had one staff working out front while the rest of the staff were lost inside.

Address: 9 Kiwanis Street Unit 1C St. John's, NL A1B 0A2 Canada
Review:
Tasty food with fresh ingredients.
Menu is appealing.
Service is usually fantastic.
Restaurant appears clean and organized.
Packaging is durable.
Slightly Vegan and Vegetarian friendly.
Not wheelchair accessible.
Rewards program available.

Address: 9 Kiwanis Street Unit 1C St. John's, NL A1B 0A2 Canada
Review: Not worth the money paid $32 for 2 small burritos that were garbage . If you want a decent good burrito go to burritos Mexican out on topsail road.

Address: 9 Kiwanis Street Unit 1C St. John's, NL A1B 0A2 Canada
Review: I like getting Quesada when really hungry. It is very filling and I love how you have lots of toppings to choose from.

Address: 272 duckworth street St. John's,, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: One thing you need to keep in mind that they are not well known for their interior or anything. It's a very simple place; the interior is not impressive at all. But if we are talking about their food? That's first class. Starting from the appetizers to deserts, almost everything will satisfy your craving for deshi food.

Address: 272 duckworth street St. John's,, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: The best in St. John's to have chicken biryani. I have visited over 10 times to have chicken biryani at this place. Keep up the taste! 👍

Address: 272 duckworth street St. John's,, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: Mom and pop but really really good authentic Indian food. Great price!

Address: 272 duckworth street St. John's,, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: Simple, tasty, and definitely aromatic.The atmosphere is filled with peace and serenity. Something that many restaurants lack by poisoning their places with loud music that has zero resonance with the body's need for piece during a meal. Homestyle east indian cooking, and the lady running the place gives you the impression of "enjoy your meal, and make sure you empty your plates". No masks, no makeup, or false smiles. Almost like home. I have to come back.

Address: 272 duckworth street St. John's,, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: Poor service to say the least. Had to wait a long while to see no one in the store. We had to leave when we understood that there wasn't anything coming our way any time soon. We had to have our lunch from somewhere!

Address: 210 Pennywell Rd St. John's, NL A1C 2L6 Canada
Review: Hot and fresh!  Very generous portions.  Ordered the Singapore noodles and combo (wonton soup, egg roll, rice, sweet + sour chicken balls and veggies)  owners were polite and accommodating.

Address: 210 Pennywell Rd St. John's, NL A1C 2L6 Canada
Review:
A little bit too cool .
The food made up for it all .I could not describe how delicious it was.and the portions were monumental. We had take out for the next day. Very nice lady who cooked and served.

Address: 210 Pennywell Rd St. John's, NL A1C 2L6 Canada
Review: Great food, huge portions and friendly staff

Address: 210 Pennywell Rd St. John's, NL A1C 2L6 Canada
Review: Good food , friendly service , small prices big portions amazing taste .

Address: 210 Pennywell Rd St. John's, NL A1C 2L6 Canada
Review:
Visiting from Toronto and good lord is it ever awful.
The food tastes like dirty tap water and is bland, overcooked and blasted in a microwave.
Not sure if it’s because we ordered later in the day but please do not eat from here.
We ate three bites and threw it out as we are flying back out tomorrow and are scared of having food poisoning.
PLEASE DO NOT ORDER HERE.

Address: 18 Commonwealth Avenue Mount Pearl, NL A1N 1W5 Canada
Review:
I ordered a sub with double cheddar online, so 8 pieces of cheese.. I think.. Either way, there wasn’t any cheese on my sub at all.  I was already home it was late by the time I noticed, so I wrote the manager.
The manager offered me extra cheese for free the next time I buy a sub, after sending him proof of course..
So the math is: they rip you off for 8 pieces of cheese and correct that by giving you 4 pieces of cheese if you buy another sub.
There are subway stores in either direction, I won’t be returning to this one.

Address: 18 Commonwealth Avenue Mount Pearl, NL A1N 1W5 Canada
Review: Worst Subway sandwich I ever ate was at this location. Terrible shop, terrible operator. Avoid.

Address: 18 Commonwealth Avenue Mount Pearl, NL A1N 1W5 Canada
Review: Staff is really nice but would recommend ordering for pickup by app or website as it’s like, unreasonably slow with just a couple customers.

Address: 18 Commonwealth Avenue Mount Pearl, NL A1N 1W5 Canada
Review: Excellent customer service and well prepared sub.   My son and I really enjoyed our experience there.

Address: 18 Commonwealth Avenue Mount Pearl, NL A1N 1W5 Canada
Review: The Subway at the crossroads, on Kenmount Road, has a drive through which has been great during this last lock down. We were there twice this week; however, our second trip was much better. The first time the bread was not fresh and over done plus they did not put everything we wanted on our subs.

Address: 179 Elizabeth Ave St. John's, NL A1B 1S8 Canada
Review: Worker literally yelled at me for calling rotisserie chicken “shredded chicken” and then got really mad because I asked for avocado last and told me that I should have known better. Sorry I don’t work at subway lol

Address: 179 Elizabeth Ave St. John's, NL A1B 1S8 Canada
Review: Food is fine. Service is awful. The people working there(most of them) do not care at all and do the bare minimum. No smiles, no hellos, just "what do you want?". Very rude. Often have to stand at the cash for minutes at a time waiting for someone to check me out while my sub is sitting there getting cold. Everyone there seems to hate their life but don't take it out on customers.

Address: 179 Elizabeth Ave St. John's, NL A1B 1S8 Canada
Review:
By far the slowest subway I've been too. Even when the line is short, it's incredibly slow. The amount of cheese they use doesn't cover the entirety of the sub.
They also do not take Subway points or gift cards, and they leave you waiting at the cash while they serve the people before you.

Address: 179 Elizabeth Ave St. John's, NL A1B 1S8 Canada
Review:
Whoever is in charged of this station, stop exploiting your workers! Workers are doing much more than they are supposed to do.
HIRE MORE PEOPLE PLZ!

Address: 179 Elizabeth Ave St. John's, NL A1B 1S8 Canada
Review:
Worst service ever. The ladies working there are high on attitude and pretend as they’re paying for my sandwich
Awful service
Ask them for a more than 3 veggies on your sub and u will see them getting irritated.

Address: 361 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: Got a noodle dish with bbq pork and shrimp.  Where's the pork or shrimp? Very shy on ingredients other than Noodles. And everything was finely diced so even when you got meat, you couldn't taste it

Address: 361 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: One of the best places in town to get authentic Cantonese Chinese food.

Address: 361 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: I ordered take out. The food looks Ok but unfortunately the taste just wasn't there. For example the chop suey tasted like it was stir fried in water instead of the usual sauce that I am accustomed too. The egg rolls were puffy, full of air with very little filling inside. The egg roll cover was good and crispy and the filling was ok .just very little of it. The food overall wasn't bad..just wasn't up to my overall standard.

Address: 361 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: Fresh ingredients! Vegan options! I love the broth of their won ton soup and usually get the rice noodle dishes. If you like heat they have a great chili sauce to add to anything. Just ask! If you are calling for take out, try a second time if no answer during business hours.

Address: 361 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: If I could give zero stars I would. I don’t think I’ve had food so bland. Restaurants can’t be getting away with charging money for food that tastes like nothing. Worst Chinese I’ve had in town.

Address: 1 Richmond Street W Toronto, ON M5H 3W4 Canada
Review: So glad we tried the tasting menu tonight. Fresh and quality ingredients. We love the duck liver pate with strawberry puree, seared yellowfin tuna, braised chicken terrine, dry aged rib eye with oyster mushroom and the black forest cake the most. Friendly service and non pretentious. Highly recommend this restaurant in the heart of downtown Toronto.

Address: 1 Richmond Street W Toronto, ON M5H 3W4 Canada
Review:
Yo Richmond Station! Had a good time eating here and felt appreciated by your staff.

Drinks:
Ordered the Black Walnut Old Fashioned. I always gravitate towards old fashioned whenever I see it. Not the absolutely best but it does the job.

Food:
We started with the duck liver pate. We just simply love pate. Richmond Station provided a new experience for us. We haven’t had it with strawberry jam(?) but it went well over the brioche toast. We ordered the Stn Burger and this weekly special item that has bacon wrapped rabbit. We asked for plain but to keep the rest on the side. Hard to review this as my girlfriend prefers plain burgers. She did enjoy it though. Dessert was interesting. I recommend the rhubarb sundae. The earl grey whip cream was simply amazing. It had this rhubarb syrup and sorbet and stacked with these waffle crunch. What the heck is a waffle crunch anyway? Oh well, let’s not think too much and just enjoy good food.

Definitely can recommend this place. The pricing isn’t on the cheap side BUT gratuities are not expected. They’re able to pay their employees well, foster a good environment for everyone, and more. I like this so 5/5.

Address: 1 Richmond Street W Toronto, ON M5H 3W4 Canada
Review: This place is absolutely amazing - the food is first class, the service is great, the atmosphere is soulful. The duck liver pate 🦆 is mind blowing - the combination with dried strawberry and strawberry sauce is something you must try! The brioche, that accompany the  pate, Is delicious itself 😋 the menu changes every 3-4 weeks, so, don't hurry up with the burger - it's been in the menu for 10 years and will not disappear 😉

Address: 1 Richmond Street W Toronto, ON M5H 3W4 Canada
Review: the service was amazing! the lady was so patient with our large group (Robyn). Some of the food items were delicious and I wish there were more cocktail options. The station burger was a great choice as well as the chickpea panisse! what was most refreshing was at the end they didn’t expect a tip because it was included in the bill! I really appreciated this!

Address: 1 Richmond Street W Toronto, ON M5H 3W4 Canada
Review: The overall service was great and it was a nice setting for our tasting.  The food itself was just average compared to our palette. Underwhelming flavors on most of the course. The empanada on the first amuse was dry. The watercress soup was a mid level dish with 2 out our 4 diners still containing shrimp shells. Definitely not what we expected from a Top Chef winner, but it could have been an off night for the team.

Address: 3265 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2L5 Canada
Review: Food was great - loved the brisket. The Parmesan truffle fries are a must try as is the mac and cheese. I will say I was a little disappointed with the ribs, and with them being nearly $50 for a rack I expected more, they weren’t horrible but a little over cooked. Pulled pork was okay as well. Service was great!

Address: 3265 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2L5 Canada
Review:
We went in this place to celebrate a farewell party with friends Saturday night, 8 people. It was not busy, beyond our table, just two more. I counted on total 4 waitress, so we were expecting good service. But they are so busy talking with each other that forget about the costumer  service.

Despite this, the food was really good.

Address: 3265 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2L5 Canada
Review: One of my favourite restaurants in the city! The food is TOO good. My boyfriend and I always get the Mac & cheese as an app, the brisket burger as a main, and truffle parm fries as a side - the combo dreams were made of! Highly recommend!!!

Address: 3265 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2L5 Canada
Review: We dined in the restaurant and were very unpleasantly surprised. You can clearly tell that the brisket and ribs were boiled, not smoked. The ribs are tough and don’t fall off the bone. The pulled pork burger consists of an extremely dry and tasteless patty and about a teaspoon of pulled pork which was barely pulled. The chicken is raw and also tasteless. It’s great to come here after having a bad day and being cheered up by the amazing waitresses as long as you don’t eat anything.

Address: 3265 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2L5 Canada
Review:
Service was great. We enjoyed the platter for two. Everything was great. The brisket was the clear winner of the meats. The sides were tasty too. Beans, slaw & cornbread had to be taken home and were fantastic for breakfast the next day.
Good cocktails as well. Will definitely go again.

Address: 254 Queen Street  W Toronto, ON M5V 1Z8 Canada
Review:
3.9/5

Their lunch special is good value for money. We sat down for a quick lunch on a weekend. The space is clean and well kept.

We started with the Takoyaki, which was mostly batter and one small piece of octopus in each ball. I wouldn’t order these again.

Their lunch specials range from $16-20 and come with a main, rice, miso soup and side dishes. We chose the steak lunch, which was a nice variety of flavours. The steak could have been better as it was a bit chewy but for the price, not a bad deal. If we visit again, I’d like to try one of the cuts from their regular menu.

The slight disappointment here was the service. The host and server were pleasant but the service was quite slow and no one checked on us. I had to get up once to go ask for chopsticks and again to ask for the bill.

Overall, it’s fairly good value if you’re hungry!

Address: 254 Queen Street  W Toronto, ON M5V 1Z8 Canada
Review: This was a well-balanced, delicious meal! Started with scrumptious gyoza for an app. The steak was cooked just as ordered and the sides were a great compliment for the meat. This was a filling meal, but didn’t leave me feeling stuffed or uncomfortable, which is exactly what I wanted. The Sapporo went surprisingly well with the dish. The online ordering was easy to use, but the servers were still attentive and helpful. It was busy on a weekend night, so i recommend making a reservation.

Address: 254 Queen Street  W Toronto, ON M5V 1Z8 Canada
Review: Excellent steak. I had the wagyu beef. Sure it is the American version, but it was still great, cooked just right, and very reasonably priced (82 CAD for 10oz). The sides were very good too. Highly recommended.

Address: 254 Queen Street  W Toronto, ON M5V 1Z8 Canada
Review:
First + foremost service was excellent! The food was delicious, hot and fresh. The sizzling plates are a perfect touch to the experience. Casual vibe, good music and overall very welcoming.

If you’re downtown looking for a casual spot for a great steak dinner — do your taste buds a favour and stop in.

Address: 254 Queen Street  W Toronto, ON M5V 1Z8 Canada
Review:
With the atmosphere like any good established steakhouse... Expectations were reasonably high although the results seemed to be pretty average and rather disappointing across the table.

The Wagyu Don I had asked for was good without being great with the cook being just about there and a dish that could've always done with a little more meat. Sadly across the table, the Sirloin was tough and barely rare and needed 2 hotplates to get it to a consistent rare to consume comfortably.

Supposing this is a one-off, I would be willing to give them another try down the line with the recommendation to introduce thicker hot plates that would allow the dish to remain warm for longer and even cover for any cooking inconsistencies.

Address: 196 Robert Street Toronto, ON M5S 2K8 Canada
Review: We keep coming back to this place. The food is always consistently incredible with excellent flavours. Portion sizes are decent. The menu is shareable and is split into vegetables, sea and land so there are options for everyone. Menu favourites are the chopped salad, ceviche and sticky bun for dessert (you can get the bacon on the side). The new addition of chickpea fritters to the menu was a great choice too (hopefully it stays!). Honourable mention to the burger (not pictured), though it used to come with fries and now it doesn’t.

Address: 196 Robert Street Toronto, ON M5S 2K8 Canada
Review: An amazingly creative, playful and delicious restaurant in the heart of the Annex. The classic tasting menu offered a diverse selection of their menu items and we were allowed to swap out the burger for tacos. The tasting menu was also a bargain at just 60 a person and server Alex was very knowledgeable and provided excellent service as well. Just be warned that the food is a bit on the heavy side so do come extra hungry. We will definitely be returning to try all the other items on the menu.

Address: 196 Robert Street Toronto, ON M5S 2K8 Canada
Review:
I loved every bite and every sip! We had the chickpea fritters, chopped salad, beef short ribs, and lemon cake for dessert. My husband’s favorites were the chopped salad and the fritters and he really enjoyed the negroni as well as the “where there’s smoke…” that he was recommended to try. It’s hard to do the dishes justice without trying them for yourself but I highly recommend this place for friendly, attentive and fast service as well as a delicious night out. The food is sharing plates and we ordered three which was almost too much for just the two of us. Dessert wasn’t necessary but then… it always is.
Also, we got lost trying to find the restaurant! Not sure if this was because our Uber dropped us off down the street but the address didn’t seem to match the physical location. In case this happens to anyone else, it IS there on the main road, just keep looking.  It’s worth looking for

Address: 196 Robert Street Toronto, ON M5S 2K8 Canada
Review:
We were 2 couples and we started off with their Refreshing Peach drink, and a Spicy concoction. They were both amazing and went with every dish.

For Vegetarian options, we had the Chickpea Fritters, Salad, and Squash Ravioli. Non-Veg dishes our friends had were the Octopus and Crab dishes. Service was amazing and the food was really tasty.

The only issue was the portion size. They say it is Tapas style, but for $25 of Squash Ravioli, there could definitely be more on the plate, or like have more than 1 tentacle for $42 of Octopus.

We finished our meal with their Sweet Dish. It was really tasty but quite heavy on the sugar.

Address: 196 Robert Street Toronto, ON M5S 2K8 Canada
Review: We really loved the family style dining and had 4 dishes between 2 people. The service was really friendly. The server recommended the chop salad, burger, and tuna tartare which were all great. We also really loved the pea pappardelle which was super lemony and light. The cocktails were really yummy as well, the mango-rita was our favourite. patio was very cute.

Address: 46 Saint Clair Avenue E Toronto, ON M4T 1M9 Canada
Review:
Addicted to Mazesoba but they’re hard to find outside of Japan. In Vancouver there’s one and even in big megapolitan like LA there’s only one, NYC only one … you get the picture. Toronto, dubbed as the most diverse city in the world, didn’t have one … until Megumi.

Food was tasty and delicious. Service was great. Make it a point to be a regular here and tell all your friends of this amazing food.

Address: 46 Saint Clair Avenue E Toronto, ON M4T 1M9 Canada
Review: Great food with a relaxed atmosphere and great service. The noodles are very tasty and they do not cheap out on the toppings on each dish. The chili oil and kombu vinegar pack a lot of flavors that add to the dishes.

Address: 46 Saint Clair Avenue E Toronto, ON M4T 1M9 Canada
Review: I have lots of experience eating Japanese cuisine, especially ramen. Though this isn't technically ramen, the style is similar in the sense that it is a bowl of noodles with various sauces and toppings. The flavours of the dishes are very balanced, one spice does not overpower the other. They allow the dish to speak for itself. Appearance wise, it's very neat, not too complex, but not too simple. It's indicative of a chef that is confident in their food, and it really shows when you eat it. Atmosphere wise, it is very relaxing. You do not feel too rushed to finish your meal, and the layout of the building coupled with the relaxing music really compliments the taste of the food quite well. The owner is also quite friendly and is happy to help anyone who may be confused in regards to how to eat Mazesoba, being how it is such a new dish for most in Canada. Overall, great experience, and I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to try something new or step outside their comfort zone.

Address: 46 Saint Clair Avenue E Toronto, ON M4T 1M9 Canada
Review:
Megumi Mazesoba opened up in my neighbourhood two months ago, and I had been meaning to check it out sooner…boy, I wish I did!

I went with a friend of mine who had been raving about it, and the owner Paula - and the moment we walked in, I could understand why. The warmth and familiarity with which we were greeted INSTANTLY made us feel at home!

It was lunchtime on a Friday and I would say it was more than 50% occupied. We picked a table perpendicular from the long row of tables along the far wall. I would say that while we were there, it only got busier - both with dine-in patrons and people coming in to pick their takeaway orders up! All the more impressive that there were only TWO visible employees working - Paula (who worked the floor with her hospitality and also somehow managed to assist with the dish preparations) and another gentleman.

My friend and I both ordered the Megumi Mazesoba - hers with no spice, while I got the “Signature Spicy” which is a mid-tier spice level. Man - I can handle my spices and this was definitely a fragrant, pungent, sharp and delicious spiciness! They don’t mess around.

We both got our bowls with Udon noodles. They were PERFECTLY cooked - warm, supple, bouncy, and mixed together with the pork lard, ajitama egg, and all the other ingredients, it was a FLAVOUR BOMB in my mouth! Soooooo good.

DO NOT finish all the sauce at the bottom of the bowl - I made this mistake because it was just too yummy to resist, but you are supposed to save a bit of it to eat with rice at the end. Thankfully, my friend hadn’t hoovered her food down like I did so she spared some of her sauce for me and I got to enjoy those last few bites that are meant to be mixed with the rice.

I am still dreaming about this mazesoba…🤤🤤🤤

For dessert, Paula brought out little sample portions of the banana cigar dish, served with ice cream. It is like a banana spring roll. Very simple and delightful, and a nice, sweet finish to a meal filled with so much savouriness.

It is so great to finally have a GOOD Asian noodle restaurant option in this neighbourhood.

👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼

Address: 46 Saint Clair Avenue E Toronto, ON M4T 1M9 Canada
Review:
Today was my first time coming to Megumi Mazesoba, and make no mistake, it won’t be my last! From the moment I walked in, I was amazed by the ambiance of the establishment and how it was designed, then I was greeted humbly by Paula as I entered, and Steven from the kitchen then after. I ordered the house special and between the thin noodles with meat and egg and other ingredients, along with the white rice that came with it after to scoop up the rest of the sauce, I have to say that I was incredibly satisfied with my meal. Broth-less Ramen in my modest opinion is really underrated, and this Ramen Establishment along St. Clair East is one I would recommend hold heartedly. Thank you for the wonderful experience, it was worth every dollar.
UPDATE:
Megumi Mazesoba was so good the last time I was there [the day before] that I had to come back again to order the same signature dish, (only this time with udon noodles). This style of noodle reminds me of the homemade style of pasta, my paternal grandmother used to make, which made the experience all the more worthwhile! Thanks again Paula and Audrey (from the kitchen) for great food, great service, and for once again, welcoming me back into the humbling and modest ambiance of your establishment!!!

Address: 21B St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review: Big place with lots of tables inside and some outside. It works as a self serve basis. You place your order at the counter, take an order number and they bring you what they prepare. They have a variety of healthy types of food, smoothies and cookies. Me and my friend had smoothies that we enjoyed a lot as well as a chocolate sesame cookie which was delicious. Will definitely come back.

Address: 21B St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review: I love this place! Yummy meals and baked goods. Consistently excellent service. Tons of room. Nice ambiance. The whole package! I moved away from Toronto but make a point to visit here whenever I am in town

Address: 21B St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review: This was my first time getting food here as I usually only stop in for a drink. I loved the variety they had. My friend got 1 protein + 2 sides and I just got 2 sides. We both got the Mac and cheese which was so delicious. My friend got their mocha smoothie which I’ll definitely be getting next time as it was so tasty. I got the ginger maple lemonade which was very refreshing too. I’ll definitely will be coming back here

Address: 21B St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review: Really adorable spot with delicious healthy food! Can’t wait to come back and try all of the other things on the menu! I had the chicken breast with salsa verde, the mediterranean chopped salad, and the roasted cauliflower.

Address: 21B St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review:
5. Had a wonderful first experience at Mary Be Kitchen. Went with a group for lunch so had the opportunity to try many things. The sides are flavorful and delicious- very much enjoyed the brussel sprouts and found all the sides quite flavorful. The smoothies are a great consistency and the desserts (sweet potato brownie and vegan cookie) were both so good!!!!!! Need to return to try the lentil dal and the curry!

Returned for the lentil Dahl- and it’s amazing- comes on long grain rice with currents.

The regular salted chocolate chip cookie is really amazing too.

Address: 633 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review:
The menu offered a wide variety of authentic Italian dishes, each one made with the freshest ingredients and expertly prepared.  We started off with mussels and clams in a white wine sauce and grilled calamari. Both cooked perfectly and bursting with flavor.
Main courses included Pizza, Pasta alla Gricia, Lemon Bisque Shrimp spaghetti and Branzino. I’d love to say something negative here, but it’s impossible. These dishes were just outstanding. The branzino on another level of freshness and perfect preparation.
To finish off the meal, we had the tiramisu. It was light and fluffy, with just the right amount of sweetness and a hint of coffee.
I would highly recommend Positano Restaurant to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Italian dining experience in Toronto. The food, atmosphere, and service were all exceptional and I can't wait to go back!

Address: 633 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: Came here for the first time for my birthday! Location, atmosphere, service & THE FOOD... ALL so excellent! The gnocchi was delicious, tasted like when I was in Italy! 10/10 for me

Address: 633 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: Great restaurant. Very friendly with a great vibe.  The food is delicious and diverse. I bet it was the best pizza I've had in Toronto. The tiramisu was pure Italian. The staff is super friendly and professional. I will definitely come back and recommend

Address: 633 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: We had brunch at the Positano Restaurant last weekend. The atmosphere was very inviting. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. My favorite was the granola yogurt parfait. Housemade granola and mixed berry compote with balkan yogurt and fresh fruits. Yummy! Make sure to try:)

Address: 633 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review:
Amazing food and atmosphere with excellent staff - Branzino, Pizza and short ribs are my favourites. Cheesecake and tiramisu are wonderful.
They started serving breakfast / brunch on weekends with a wide selection. We had the best menemen and pide, best quality, definetely will be a regular for weekends - highly reccomend

Address: 398 Church Street Toronto, ON M5B 2A2 Canada
Review: It was my first time at this restaurant, it has an amazing welcoming atmosphere and presence. The staff are great at recommending food items on the menu, the service is also great! There’s indoor and outdoor dining; all dishes were delicious! It’s recommended to try multiple dishes to get a full experience on the various items on the menu. I highly recommend the mushroom cheese and rice dish!

Address: 398 Church Street Toronto, ON M5B 2A2 Canada
Review: This spot is a must try! The service is on point, the ambiance is great and they’re not going to disappoint. In terms of food you need to try their Salmon/Shrimp Ozusushi, the chicken karaage, and the rice bowls! Highly recommend trying a sake bomb if you’re with a group of people too! Overall this is great spot and I was really happy with my experience.

Address: 398 Church Street Toronto, ON M5B 2A2 Canada
Review:
Great for light dinner...we could've easily eaten more if we were hungrier. But we were perfectly served.

Loved the imported sashimi and the lobster sashimi too. Chicken Namban hit the spot. Fun atmosphere with a young attentive staff. $3 Soju shots? There's a catch - gotta cheer with the staff and the rest of the crowd. But hey, why not...I won't forget eating there now!

Address: 398 Church Street Toronto, ON M5B 2A2 Canada
Review: Came before the dinner rush - but service was a little slow to begin with. I ordered the grilled mackerel bento, the mackerel was good, however the fish cake tempura was not the 'crispy' tempura I was expecting, was kind of soggy and cold. Dining outside was a cool experience, but the food wasn't what I expected, and service overall could've been better.

Address: 398 Church Street Toronto, ON M5B 2A2 Canada
Review: Super fun high energy atmosphere! The heated patio is much quieter if you want a chiller vibe. Everything from our drinks (neko punch and the gin fizz) to our shared plates was amazing, and our server Nick was so friendly and attentive even though it was a busy night! The miso cod special was one of the best plates of fish I've ever had. The tapas are pretty small so you may also want to get a main if you're hungry, but everything is very reasonably priced for how beautiful and delicious it is! Oh, and the hojicha brulee was to die for.

Address: 18 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5H 3G8 Canada
Review:
Came back after a while and food was still very nice. We came as a group of 6 and all of the food we order were great. I love Tom Yum so much. Green curry and chef’s choice are the must-try dishes.
It was a little bit packed when we arrived, there were enough room for us to sit comfortable.
Drinks were not really nice.

Address: 18 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5H 3G8 Canada
Review:
One of the top spots in Toronto for Thai dishes. Very long lines even during weekdays.
The best dish was hands downt the pad Thai. It was everything I expected it to be. The green curry was not exceptional but everything we tried was delicious. Portion sizes are average and service was a little bit slow. Overall great with enjoyable food

Address: 18 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5H 3G8 Canada
Review:
The food and service here were overall really great. They have an entire separate section for vegan and vegetarian, so it's definitely diet restriction friendly.

The Khao Soi curry noodles with the crunchy noodles and egg noodles had a nice texture contrast as well as strong curry flavor. Beef was a tad tough so I'd go with the chicken next time. As for appetizers, the Grabong (squash fritter) was amazing. The dip that comes with it was so flavorful and not too sweet while the fritter itself wasn't too oily.

I recommend either coming 10-15 mins early before opening to grab a table for 1st seating, or getting a reservation outright. The lines start to get long before it even opens even on weekdays.

Address: 18 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5H 3G8 Canada
Review: Amazing spot for authentic Thai food. The Tom Yum soup was spicy and tangy and packs a punch. The main course was so delicious I forgot to take pictures. Can’t wait to go again and try new items.

Address: 18 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5H 3G8 Canada
Review: Loved this place. The food tastes so homemade and authentic. We went at 2pm and had to wait for 30 min, at 3 it dies down a bit. I had the Pad Thai and it was amazing but the see ew was the star of the evening, so tasty and flavorful. Definitely recommend coming here.

Address: 2335 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E6 Canada
Review: Been to their downtown location before but love love love the vibe of this location! A little hard to spot from the street but the interior is beautiful. The food came fairly quickly and definitely reminded me of Thailand. Fair portions and lots of options on the menu. It's a little pricey but understandable with how popular this place is. The dishes were well executed and had a lot of flavour. Would definitely return again!

Address: 2335 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E6 Canada
Review:
Loved this northern Thai restaurant. Foods are very authentic and tasty, service is good and fast. I liked this location because it is less busy than the downtown location.
Interior decoration are modern with a high ceiling. It is a nice place to hangout with friends.
Will definitely come back try more dishes!

Address: 2335 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E6 Canada
Review: It's a lot more spacious and open than downtown branch. It was busy but it was not overly packed. Recommended to make a reservation however!! We loved everything we ordered and we would definitely go back again!! We had chicken wings, green curry, pad Thai and their coconut sorbet for dessert - all of them were unique in terms of flavor and texture

Address: 2335 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E6 Canada
Review: First time visiting and will def be back. Service was great and attentive, food was amazing, and overall a great experience. My only complaint is that it took a while for our server to take our order however food came out quick and hot. I liked how they served our meals at the same time. You have to try the coconut sorbet served in a coconut shell-  best sorbet I’ve ever had. The restaurant closed at 10pm but they let us finished our meal, left around 10:30pm. Would def recommend!

Address: 2335 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E6 Canada
Review: First time at PAI uptown and it won’t be my last. From the moment I got there, I loved the atmosphere. We had some time before our table so we enjoyed some cocktails at the bar. The bartenders were so helpful and friendly from helping us decide what drinks we might like to try to what dishes off main courses might be a good choice. We all loved our meals and drinks and to finish on a high note..do get the coconut sorbet! Best shared though as it’s a big portion - but just scrumptious (although I wish there was more mango) ! Thumbs up for great friendly staff all around, great music too. Might be a little loud for intimate conversations but we managed. A must try if you haven’t been here yet. Vegan options bonus. Busy area so plan ahead for parking on the street or find a green P.  Subway right near by too.

Address: 1580 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: Delicious Armenian food, they mix traditional cuisine with a modern twist. Friendly staff. Atmosphere is elegant and great for dates or just a casual dinner with friends. Very clean, restrooms were neatly kept. Would recommend, would go back.

Address: 1580 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: We came here to try the summerlicious menu but so many things on their regular menu looked good too so we decided to pick our own dishes. The service was really good and super attentive. We got their dips, tabule, manti dumplings, akawi cheese, batata harra, adana kabab and lamb chops. And kunafa for dessert. The manti dumplings, and akawi were a stand out. The only thing we didn’t enjoy is the kunafa only because we make the best at home. Their patio and vibe is really nice and we’d def come again.

Address: 1580 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: This restaurant is amazing. Had a late lunch there. We first called in @Mirage Restaurant on the same street and were treated rather strangely. The food at the Mayrik is top shelf, the service out of 10 is at 11. We had such a lovely lunch and will visit them again. Wish I could give them 10 stars.

Address: 1580 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: The fatoush and the falafel were very flavourful, very satisfying. Just on the brink of too much seasoning which is really unnecessary. Also, I was really looking to get radish and pomegranate seeds, as became customary in fatoush at other restaurants - or else the dish feels simplistic and overpriced. The Armenian beer is very good, malty - would drink another if not costing $10.

Address: 1580 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: Definitely a must try spot in Toronto. The service was great, the concept of being an Armenian fusion was on point. While the food did not blow my mind away, the experience and taste was for sure above par. You won’t regret trying this place out - ambience, service, food, everything is of high quality.

Address: 2373 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2C8 Canada
Review: Excellent food. Came here on a busy weekend with couple of my friends and was able to get a table within 5 minutes. The food didn’t take much time to arrive on our table. Scrumptious fine food with good quantity. The hospitality was also exceptional. Will be my regular dine-in places from now on.

Address: 2373 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2C8 Canada
Review: Love the Baked Goat Cheese Salad! The servers were nice! I and my friend asked to recommend dish because it was first time to visit for us. We ordered what he recommended and these dishes were perfect! :> The interior design was cool as well.

Address: 2373 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2C8 Canada
Review:
This place is a gem!
Though the waiter forgot to give us olive oil for the bread at first, he later prepared and introduced us the hidden special spicy oil for it, which we loved it!
Ordered the most popular pasta and the pizza Giovanni. Food is awesome. Service is excellent as he knew we are sharing our food, pasta came in two separate plates, one for each of us.
The recommended creme brule cheesecake is very good and so natural that the combination seems meant to be together.
I will definitely go again and again!

Address: 2373 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2C8 Canada
Review: We visited here for lunch and it was a nice experience. The server was lovely and extremely nice, the interior is very friendly and cozy, their wine selection is great as well and they have a beer and cocktail menu as well. They will bring a bread basket for you as well. The pastas were really creamy and tasty, everything tasted amazing. It was a nice experience overall, definitely will come back to taste the rest of the menu.

Address: 2373 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2C8 Canada
Review: Everything about this place was great. Impeccable and fast service. Truth be told i was a bit disappointed when i first saw the size of the shrimp in my meal, but don't be fooled by that. The main ingredient in my spinach fettuccine was the creamy sauce. Never tested anything so divine. Savour it slowly and you will know what i mean.

Address: 214 Laird Drive Suite 101 Toronto, ON M4G 3W4 Canada
Review:
Came here on a Saturday evening after attending an event at the Japanese Canadian  Cultural Center. It’s like 10 min drive.

Easy street side parking just in front of the restaurant.

Upon arrival, we find the restaurant quite spacious and the staff was friendly.

They seem to be quite kid-friendly as well
- there are high chairs
- paper and crayons for coloring
- Unicorn chopsticks that our girl love
- Kid friendly utensils as well

We ordered a bowl of udon, the spicy trio sushi and an appetizer.

Prior to the food we ordered, we gave us the appetizer (small portion of delicious noodles in broth with some crunchy tempura bits). Our sushi combo also came with salads.

Overall it was a nice experience.

Address: 214 Laird Drive Suite 101 Toronto, ON M4G 3W4 Canada
Review: A hidden gem that any sushi lover should experience. The waitress is very kind and attentive. The food is delicious! I've had numerous types of sushi and maki from here and it's always fresh. The bulgogi was very tasty too. Got a pineapple vodka drink to top it off. Extremely satisfying meal, I will be back 😌

Address: 214 Laird Drive Suite 101 Toronto, ON M4G 3W4 Canada
Review: Pretty good quality fish here, especially considering the price. Definitely a step up from a lot of other sushi places in the neighbourhood. The service is great too.

Address: 214 Laird Drive Suite 101 Toronto, ON M4G 3W4 Canada
Review:
Wish I had found this place sooner. Quality is on the higher end of non-izakaya places. And the value for the lunch combo is unbeatable. Not to mention the presentation too! Did not expect the lunch combo to be served on a wooden platter

Their menu has a variety of appetizers and sushi, including dishes that not many places know about, as well as some of their unique traditional rolls.
Will come back for more

Address: 214 Laird Drive Suite 101 Toronto, ON M4G 3W4 Canada
Review:
We ordered sake - he gave us a free cup each right off the bat! -Such a welcoming  atmosphere…. Then we each ordered dragon rolls.. So delicious… and we are sushi snobs! We have tested sushi from Toronto to Thunder Bay.., This was the best in Toronto, and on par with the Thunder Bay we had .. We would definitely make the 2 hour drive into Toronto again just to have sushi here.
Highly recommend it!

Address: 420A Wellington Street W Toronto, ON M5V 1E3 Canada
Review:
They had a total change!

I came here when they first opened and a couple times after that. It’s been a few years since I visited last time but wow they changed their entire menu.

Honestly I think the previous chef was better. Trio ceviche was disappointing, not sure why they had to add a vegetarian version.

Happy hour was cute but the quality of food wasn’t there. Maybe because it’s happy hour food?

The beef tongue and short ribs were nice. Beef tongue was the best dish. Their fried rice was also interesting but great. I’d recommend the beef tongue, short rib and the rice. The rest were mediocre.

Address: 420A Wellington Street W Toronto, ON M5V 1E3 Canada
Review:
Perfecto!!! Food, service, and atmospheres are perfect. There's nothing to complain about!

I was always in the pain when the restaurant asked a bunch of tips and actually did nothing.

BUT! waitresses here, is next level.

They catch your needs right away!!!!!! Especially the waitress who served us today (braided hair) has a beautiful attitude. (The owner of the restaurant,  please compensate her.) I was extremely surprised that I didn't have to call them for help.

Amigos, please go to this place and enjoy your dinner!!!!!

Address: 420A Wellington Street W Toronto, ON M5V 1E3 Canada
Review: Mira was a surprising discovery! We were craving some Peruvian food and Google suggested Mira! Tucked away in a quaint little street on Wellington Street, Mira has a beautiful ambience and really good food! The waiter was super nice and courteous as well. The portions look small, but trust me, they're super filling. The chicken empanadas stole the show totally! So flavourful and filling. Definitely going back!

Address: 420A Wellington Street W Toronto, ON M5V 1E3 Canada
Review: Really cute place. Service and food was a little slow but the food was really good.  We ordered the ceviche trio and it all tasted different, in a good way.  Not the typical lemony ceviche that you get.  The wagyu carpaccio was ok, the beef was cut too thin so didn't capture a lot of flavors. The short rib was pretty tasty.  The meat was tender and sauce was good.  I'd go back to try the other dishes.  Oh if you like your cocktails stiff, this is the place.  Dang was hard to down it but 1 drink got us buzz. 😜

Address: 420A Wellington Street W Toronto, ON M5V 1E3 Canada
Review: We went there for my birthday and I really enjoyed it. The only thing is that service is really slow. The Ribeye is a must. A bit pricey but worth it. The grilled chicken was also Amazing. The 3 leches was just superbe. Highly recommend.

Address: 1084 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L4 Canada
Review: The first time I experienced Grandma loves you was back on December 19, 2020. I was having this weird obsession with hot dogs and I saw that Grandma love you made a variety of them. The Swedish dog was definitely my favourite. It was pretty cold that day and I remember just eating it in my truck and it was fabulous. The spicy ham is my favourite sandwich for sure, the chefs choice was also very good. I know my brother loves the German rye sandwiches, since he always asks me to pick him up one if I’m in the area. Really nice to see them expanding, I just hope the quality doesn’t get compromised due to that.

Address: 1084 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L4 Canada
Review: Was recommended the Spicy Ham and Cheese Sandwich and it was phenomenal! Sandwich was juicy and fresh, truly felt nutritious. Would say it would’ve gone perfectly with chips and a drink, which they have. Ate half of the 12” and feel full but not heavy, no bloating. Would recommend to try out!

Address: 1084 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L4 Canada
Review: I love deli sandwiches, and someone told me that this place offers the best sandwiches in Toronto! A bold statement but I would rank it  near the top for sure! The amount of people coming in and out of this place tells you it's a sandwich place worth trying! Got the mixed cold cut and honestly was full after eating only 6 inches of my 12 inc sub sandwich! Good typical cold cut ingredients, i was able to add green pepper and olives! If i would go back i would probably ask for banana hot peppers! The grandma Sauce they use is good! If you're into deli sandwiches, you should definitely check this place out!

Address: 1084 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L4 Canada
Review: Been wanting to try this place for a long time! Oh boy it didn't disappoint. Got 3 different 12 inch subs and each one was so good.  I can't wait to go back and try another set of 3.  The staff were super friendly and helped me choose as it was our first time. It's a small place but with a little corner window seat, prefect for a quick bite, with leftovers to spare... unless you are like me and devoured the entire thing. People who knew what they were ordering were in and out quickly. This place takes sandwiches to a whole other level! Def worth trying!

Address: 1084 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L4 Canada
Review: Very friendly adn quick service. Prices are on the higher end for a sandwich but still within reasonable range. Everything tasted fresh and quality. The spicy ham could have been a little more exciting but no complaints. I would try this place again when I'm in the area.

Address: 163 Spadina Avenue 1st Floor Toronto, ON M5V 2L6 Canada
Review:
Attentive and easy to talk to staff. We’ve been here twice now and love it every time. It’s a must when we visit Toronto. Eve fry thing in the menu is great. We’ve tried new things every time but the wedge salad is to die for. It has such a refreshing touch!

Desert was great. The lemon pie was too tart for me so I prefer the strawberry parfait.

Overall- this place is great. Just make sure you set up a reso before coming!

Address: 163 Spadina Avenue 1st Floor Toronto, ON M5V 2L6 Canada
Review:
An amazing experience from beginning to end. I’ve never been to a restaurant with such diligent front of house. It’s like magic when you turn around and realize your glass has been refilled or that your napkin has been folded neatly for you. Given their reputation it’s still a surprise.

The food is also really good and a good balance of comfort and original. The pigeon was essentially Korean fried chicken and the lemon meringue pie is classic. Speaking of which the food here is a bit acidic, but I prefer that! The torched scallops were platted like ceviche and was a great start. The complimentary cheese bread with smoked butter and the wedge salad were highlights. The wild rice with the wedge salad made it the standout dish by far, followed closely by the ravioli. 4-6 dishes should do it for 2 people.

Excited to try the other menu items!

Address: 163 Spadina Avenue 1st Floor Toronto, ON M5V 2L6 Canada
Review:
This was a great experience overall. The food selection was great for a smaller menu.

Each dish we tried had levels of flavour, and most importantly you definitively taste all flavours out into the dish… nothing got lost,

The presentation of each dish was photo worthy as you can see the care of how each dish is created.

The service was prompt and gave great recommendations for our group.

No complaints here.

Address: 163 Spadina Avenue 1st Floor Toronto, ON M5V 2L6 Canada
Review:
Great service and experience, if you are going during peak lunch hours, it is better to reserve ahead of time via phone.

Great lunch menu, prices were a bit expensive relative to the portion size, but the flavours were great. Oysters seemed a bit small but were still flavourful. The prawn ceviche and the Aloette burger are definitely a must have when visiting.

The crispy squash was surprisingly sweet and served as a great end part to the meal even though it was not dessert specific dish.

Address: 163 Spadina Avenue 1st Floor Toronto, ON M5V 2L6 Canada
Review:
One of the best spots I have tried in Toronto. Their burger was super flavorful. The complimentary toast was delicious. The stuff wings were very delicious but I wish it was a little more crispy. Their fries were also amazing. But the chocolate tart was the winner tonight definitely one of the best desserts ever. Super decadent and melt in your mouth rich.
Service was great. Fastest water refill ever not once my glass went more than half empty. Definitely recommend this place very nice atmosphere and amazing creative dishes. It's a little on the pricey side but worth the quality and creativity in my opinion.

Address: 1618 Bayview Ave Toronto, ON M4S 1T3 Canada
Review:
Been coming here for a few years. Always start with their lime margarita. 10/10 for flavor and portion. Get the pitcher size! Trust me !!!   We also started with their nachos and later had the Chorinacho for dinner . Yes we love nachos LOL but they make their fresh nachos here and was super good!  Always a favorite place to
Visit!

Address: 1618 Bayview Ave Toronto, ON M4S 1T3 Canada
Review: This is the first time we visit.  It is a family style Mexico restaurant with only three people operating.  The dishes are like family cooking.  Lime Margarita is a good choice pairing with nice and tasty Enchilada, Chimichanga, Quesadilla and Tacos.  The price is reasonable!  Next time we will try Burritos and Fajitas!  We also order dessert, Churros with peanut and caramel mixed paste.

Address: 1618 Bayview Ave Toronto, ON M4S 1T3 Canada
Review: One of the best Mexican restaurants in town! From the beautifully decorated interior, to the cute patio right on Bayview there’s a lot to love about Mexico Lindo. I highly recommend the enchiladas!

Address: 1618 Bayview Ave Toronto, ON M4S 1T3 Canada
Review:
I lovee this location!

I ordered this time through Ubereat. Food was still hot and tasty as usual.

Steak and shrimp were perfect. Delicous flavours. Good quality

Tacos were filled with lots of toppings. Lots of meat. I wish they gave extra hot sauce next time. Forgot to ask for it.

Anyway 10/10 for UberEat food

Address: 1618 Bayview Ave Toronto, ON M4S 1T3 Canada
Review: I absolutely love this restaurant. The food was delicious, and the environment was so festive.

Address: 96 Laird Drive East York, ON M4G 3V3 Canada
Review:
We accidentally found The Olde Yorke Fish and Chips in an old neighborhood setting. The pub reminds me of the UK pubs. Very authentic. The place feels old-fashioned cozy setting, with an old fashioned bar in the centre. There is an open patio. The fish is thick. The batter is thin and crunchy. The chips are thick cut, just like in the UK. As we left, we saw a truck deliver fresh fish inside. Not frozen, very good.

Waitresses are very friendly and helpful to us in choosing the many types of fish on the menu.

Address: 96 Laird Drive East York, ON M4G 3V3 Canada
Review: This is is the best fish and chips I’ve ever had in Toronto now I haven’t eaten at every place but this is definitely now my favourite. the chips were so crispy and fresh the fish was  nicely battered not overly done and it was incredibly tasty. I had the cod with fries and coleslaw and everything was really well done, I end up spending $26 for my meal plus tea tip included and I think for what I ate and how good it was. It was a pretty good deal. The staff was nice and my waiter was so beautiful and friendly I will be coming back here. It’s a small place and gets very busy so perhaps book ahead of you have a larger group

Address: 96 Laird Drive East York, ON M4G 3V3 Canada
Review: I got the Haddock and Chips. The piece of fish is quite large. Everything tastes great and it wasn't greasy. They don't include tarter sauce in the package so when they ask you if you want any condiments please ensure you ask for it. Oh their gravy is also really good. I will definitely go back. They have a nice space to eat outdoors too.

Address: 96 Laird Drive East York, ON M4G 3V3 Canada
Review: Upon walking in, you have to bypass a huge curtain i guess to keep the cold out. This place also has a distinctly strong malt vinegar smell. The food was pretty good with their crispy fish and good fries. Their cod is delicious. Portions were not overtly large. My husband and I dined there. Server did not make eye contact with me once 🤷🏻‍♀️ and yes they were busy but did not ask if we wanted another drink and their glasses are smaller than average. I was thirsty. The two things annoyed me. Friendliest person in the joint was the friendly guy who greeted us and showed us to our table.

Address: 96 Laird Drive East York, ON M4G 3V3 Canada
Review:
The fish and chips were good. The mushy peas were watery and had a slight flavor - 🙁The vinegar was weak. The service was good.

Avoid the solarium- it has an external door which was opened multiple times on a very cold day without any extra door. Did not mind the cold but it did make my food colder faster

Address: 612B-3401 Dufferin Street Upper Level Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
Truly enjoyed this restaurant. They offer a variety of Japanese inspired dishes. The ingredients used are fresh and the menu is well thought of.

The overall ambience is pretty, and the conveyor belt system surely entertains our little ones. It’s family friendly and very clean. We came in on a weekday, as soon as they opened so we had the place to ourselves, a few minutes later we noticed that the place is full. So be sure to plan ahead, especially on peak hours.

Their aburi sushi selections are the best. Their red tuna just melts in your mouth! They have a few food options for non sushi lovers that are quite sumptuous.

Will definitely go back and will definitely recommend.

Address: 612B-3401 Dufferin Street Upper Level Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
We had a great delicious meal here. The sushi was very fresh.the server was so kind and enthusiastic.
Loved every dishes that we ordered... 😋
happy soul for this foodie! Definitely going back for more. 🤩🤩

Address: 612B-3401 Dufferin Street Upper Level Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review: We visited during lunch time and it a great experience. Note they don’t take reservations so groups of 4+ may have to wait. The menu was vast and we got to try a variety of different types. The service was speedy and the staff were friendly. The conveyer belt was a nice touch that brought your food out very quickly. Although pricier, everything was of a high quality and standard. Some dishes I have never seen but would love to try. I can’t wait to go back and try their dinner menu. Overall it was a very unique sushi experience that everyone should try.

Address: 612B-3401 Dufferin Street Upper Level Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review: I have been here three times and every time the service and food is excellent! The sushi is always fresh and good quality. The servers are friendly and makes the experience better. For the good quality sushi the prices are reasonable. I always recommend this place if people are looking for a cool dining experience with excellent food.

Address: 612B-3401 Dufferin Street Upper Level Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
Tora. For all the sushi aficionados, lovers of great quality fish and delightful artistry. Look no further. Tora has done a great job with their aburi(torched) and I do especially enjoy the sauce for their shrimp.

The tuna was fatty and buttery with every bite.

Only negative, the karaage was minuscule. The small tiny quantity was disappointing especially paying premium prices.

Otherwise always a great dine 😀

Address: 121 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1C4 Canada
Review:
We found this place while wandering around the streets of Yorkville.
Next time we will be looking for it!
We both had the Winterlicious menu offerings. Everything was delicious. The food was perfectly seasoned.
They had a wonderful Scotch whisky selection, worth going just for that.
This place brought us right back to our vacation in Scotland and Ireland
Our server was wonderful, but clearly the team there works together very well. We felt well looked after.
This was an amazing place and we will be back!

Address: 121 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1C4 Canada
Review: We stopped in for a drink while walking around Yorkville enjoying a winter’s evening. A warm and inviting space that just looked like the perfect choice when walking by, and we weren’t disappointed. We chose the upstairs bar and dining room, and got great seats. The bar tender was extremely friendly, and discussed our drink preferences as he educated us on spirits we had not tried yet. After a lengthy discussion about gin, he pointed out the two he felt I would enjoy the most, and I ended really enjoying his first pick. My spouse enjoyed a hard cider. We weren’t hungry enough to eat, but all of the food coming out for the tables looked very appetizing, we will make sure to save room for our next visit and stop back.

Address: 121 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1C4 Canada
Review: Great cocktail!!! It's like Provence summer in a glass! Thanks to the suggestion from our wonderful waitress!!

Address: 121 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1C4 Canada
Review:
Food and ambience was great. Love the old London pub look, really brings the UK vibe.

Food for the most part was delicious, lots of traditional English dishes. The oxtail was perfectly cooked and the pudding soft and flavourful. My partner ordered the tenderloin medium rare and it came out raw. We sent it back to the kitchen and it returned a minute later looking exactly the same (see pic below). We sent it back again with the manager this time to have it cooked properly.

The main reason this restaurant receives a 1/5 is because of poor customer service. Our server was quite rude to our party of 8. When we asked about specials he curtly replied that he would prefer to wait to go over specials until the remaining two people show up so he doesn’t have to repeat the specials twice. Sure, makes sense but also is it that difficult to present the specials twice? One person in our party asked for some salt and he replied that he was still going around with the pepper and would get to it after. He could just say “sure no problem”. It was just the tone and choice of words, there was always some explanation that we found extremely patronizing. Not to mention he lectured my partner about how an old fashion drink is actually made when we just asked for a large ice cube and not small crushed ones. I’m not sure if our server was just in a grumpy mood but it sure did rub off on our table, and frankly that kind of patronizing attitude is just not acceptable at a restaurant in Yorkville charging ~$100 a head.

Slightly disappointed because I was excited about trying this London style restaurant.

Address: 121 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1C4 Canada
Review:
We came here for brunch and got the English breakfast and eggs Benedict. The food was okay and a bit pricey considering the eggs Benny didn’t come with any sides.

The atmosphere and service were great though. We were seated outside in the back, which had a nice, cozy feel and the service was excellent.

Address: 4 Manor Road E Toronto, ON M4S 1P8 Canada
Review: We had such an incredible meal here!! Delicious Syrian food, this is a must visit! The owners/staff were also super nice and welcoming, and can make some suggestions for you, from the menu. Pro tip: Get the knafeh volcano for dessert… Blew our minds. Best dessert I’ve had in a long, long time.

Address: 4 Manor Road E Toronto, ON M4S 1P8 Canada
Review:
I saw the ratings on Google and decided to visit Zezafoun. It didn’t disappoint at all. From the moment we sat till we left, we enjoyed every minute.
The hosts are so kind and polite. The food will leave you craving for more. They have authentic and tasty dishes. There was good music playing inside.
They even good us a dessert as we were celebrating a birthday.
Thank you everyone at Zezafoun. We would visit again soon :)

Address: 4 Manor Road E Toronto, ON M4S 1P8 Canada
Review: One of my favourite restaurants in the area with lots of vegetarian options. The waitstaff is very friendly and accommodating. I haven't had a chance to make a second visit but I hope to do that soon.

Address: 4 Manor Road E Toronto, ON M4S 1P8 Canada
Review:
This famiily owned eatery that has positive vibes.  Friendly service and courteous hosts. Middle eastern cuisine that has a Syrian touch. Food is fresh and flavors are unique, albeit, the taste is little bland as compared to other reataurants that offer similar food.

Tamarind based cocktails are unique. Mezze platter was fresh and tasty althoug a little expensive. Muhammara is a super hit. Molokia
tasted different but too sour( the leaf’s speciality) for our liking. Musaka
was average and so was the Shawarma platter. We liked the Hariseh better than the hyped  Volcano Kunafeh.

Overall a good  casual  family dining option around the midtown TO which may pinch your pocket a bit.

Address: 4 Manor Road E Toronto, ON M4S 1P8 Canada
Review:
We tried Kebbeh Labanyeh (beef kibbeh in a cooked garlic yogurt sauce served with side rice) & Kabab Karaz (Beef Kabab marinated in black cherries sauce, topped with almonds and parsley. Served with bread, side salad).
The taste for both dishes was phenomenon.  Very different and flavorful. Portion of Kebbeh Labanyeh was small in my opinion (with 4 pcs of meat balls).
We also tried Kunafeh Volcano and it's a must try. Its a Kunafeh tart stuffed with homemade cream cheese (Qashta) topped with ice cream and covered with Ghazli (syrian cotton candy) and pistachio. Turkish coffee was also great.
Meal, cold drink, desert and warm drink would come down to nearly $40-50/per person.
I recommend this restaurant for unique taste of meal and ambiance.

Address: 647 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1L1 Canada
Review: Waited for almost an hour. Worth the wait! Food is really yummy even the side dishes. Love the hot plate and cold noodles! Rice cake is just average. Will come back again to try more dishes!

Address: 647 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1L1 Canada
Review:
Recommendation:
kimchi fried rice,
부대찌개,
seafood pancake,
pork belly bossam(smelled so good and tasted not oily),
stir fried spicy squid(remember you can order the portion for one person if you’d like),
stir fried sweet potato noodles (smelled       great, like sesame oil in it),
soft tofu stew with seafood (rich and tasty, the most delicious one I’ve ever had in Toronto)

Everything was delicious. And the price was also reasonable!

Address: 647 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1L1 Canada
Review: Good food! Ordered the cold noodles and the noodles were chewy and the soup was flavourful! Refreshing for a hot summer day. Side dishes were refilled by request. Seafood pancake was dense and crispy, highly recommend! The seollatang was also soothing and warm. Service was ok, took a while and 3-4 of us to get their attention the majority of the time. We came around 5:30 and there was no wait, but by 6 a line started to form, so come early!

Address: 647 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1L1 Canada
Review: Had dinner with some friends here and the food was amazing! The seolleongtang was especially good and the seafood pancake was nice and crispy. It gets pretty busy around dinnertime, so try to come a bit before. Highly recommend if you’re in the area :)

Address: 647 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1L1 Canada
Review: easily the best korean spot in the area! smaller menu than others but all heavy hitters. their cold noodles are amazing! their bossam is amazing! their fried chicken is amazing! their black bean noodles is amazing! the service is amazing! they definitely get busy in the afternoon and evenings on the weekends, usually there is no wait if you come between 2pm-4pm. their lone waitress is always super sweet and patient.

Address: 66 Gerrard Street E Unit 100 Toronto, ON M5B 2M2 Canada
Review:
Delicious food- would go back. I think the price is very good for what you get. Great meal.

The server in my experience have a harder time describing the meal to me for example explaining between cheese katsu and potato cheese katsu. But overall, the other server or food runner was super nice and super hospitable.

Address: 66 Gerrard Street E Unit 100 Toronto, ON M5B 2M2 Canada
Review: I really love this location. The food is incredible for the price and its an awesome date spot if you’re craving Japanese food. The crab croquettes are slept on, they were so delicious and honestly the best. I haven’t found many places that serve it the way Katsuya does. The karage chicken was great as well, I really enjoy the light batter they use, and the side sauces that come with it are all super unique and innovative.

Address: 66 Gerrard Street E Unit 100 Toronto, ON M5B 2M2 Canada
Review: Its been a while since I've went to katsuya, it was delicious, crisp, light, sauce was on point. we were the first ones there for lunch, everything was awesome. def need to come back and have the other ones. 100% better than other places, the chicken was super light and tender and WOOOW juicy!!

Address: 66 Gerrard Street E Unit 100 Toronto, ON M5B 2M2 Canada
Review: Delicious and filling! Got some appetizers: Cheese Crabmeat Croquette and the Karaage Chicken Thighs. Good for sharing. Main dishes were the Honeycomb Katsu, Curry Katsu and the Japanese Katsu. For the choice of meat, I chose the Sweet Potato Cheese Katsu which had Pork Loin with Mozzarella and Mashed Sweet Potato. It was really good and VERY filling. The Katsu was very crispy. I really enjoyed my meal here!!

Address: 66 Gerrard Street E Unit 100 Toronto, ON M5B 2M2 Canada
Review: A cozy place to enjoy warm food, sounds perfectly ideal despite the weather outside. We tried Garlic Chilli Chicken Katsu which was finger licking good and dont get me started on Miso Soup it was one of the best that I have ever had. Definitely a must visit if you are looking for exquisite Japanese food and hospitality.

Address: 2009 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review: We had a really good experience here.  The food was amazing and everyone working there were attentive.  We really enjoyed the baba ganoush and found ourselves coming back to it between bites of the other things we ordered.  The grilled entrees had that smokey flavor for the grill that added to the flavors perfectly.  There’s a lot of shareable plates so if you have a group of friends that want to try out many different things consider coming to Tabule.

Address: 2009 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
We have dined  here many times and nice to see the same quality and service maintained over the years. Restaurant has even better vibes post the renovation few years ago.

Authentic middle eastern food and taste and quality have been same fo years. Warak Enab, Arnabeets, sample platter and the Tabule salad all taste good( although the pita  and arnabeets have changed a bit)

Simplistic menu and reasonable prices ( a couple items are slightly overpriced)  . Staff is courteous and attentive.  Good dining option in mid town TO wherabouts.

Address: 2009 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
Went here for lunch with a friend because we were in the mood to try a new cuisine. They are a Lebanese based restaurant, so we were pretty excited. When you walk in, the interior is very clean, modern, and bright.
To our surprise they were offering Winterlicious! (Although their restaurant wasn’t on the Winterlicious list of restaurants🤔). Regardless, this nice surprise elevated our experience. I ordered Lebanese coffee, as the server explained it is very similar to Turkish coffee (which I’m a fan of). It’s definitely lighter than Turkish coffee with strong cardamom hints.
We ordered the Mezza Sampler (Hummus, baba ghanouj, tabulé and falafel) and Halloumi Salad for starters. The portions were generous. I mean we were full from just the appetizers.
For mains we ordered a Kefta Burger and Salmon Kebab. The kefta burger was bursting with flavour and the grilled salmon wasn’t over cooked (yay!). Lastly, for dessert we ordered rice pudding and Knaffa Ashta. I personally loved the Knaffa Ashta, the custard was so creamy and flavourful but not too heavy.
All in all we had a great experience, and would love to return.

Address: 2009 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
Amazing place to be in for Middle Eastern cuisine. Babaganoush is a must have here.
Food is well cooked, falafel was not dry and had a unique taste to it.

Address: 2009 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review: Been to Tabule numerous times and as usual enjoyed my visit. Had their hummus with meat, chicken liver and Kefta Bandura, which are my fav go-to dishes. I must say the hummus and chicken liver were on the drier side compared to before but I still love their food. The interiors are really gorgeous now with decent amount of seating. Great service as per usual with good priced portions/dishes. I also love their mint limeade. Thanks!

Address: 72 Kensington Avenue Toronto, ON M5T 2K1 Canada
Review:
The Tacos 🌮 were mouth-wateringly delicious ❤️ However, beware of the hot salsa… it is burning spicy.

The staff were friendly and helpful as well.

Definitely would like to recommend.

Address: 72 Kensington Avenue Toronto, ON M5T 2K1 Canada
Review:
Possibly the best taco I've ever had.

I ordered only one blackened cod taco, because I was not that hungry. It was pretty big, I would only need two for a meal. The corn tortilla tasted very strongly of corn, and each of the toppings added freshness to the fish. The fish itself was freshly fried to perfection.

There are a few standing tables for guests to dine at, and a self serve salsa station.

Highly recommend this spot, it definitely lives up to the hype!

Address: 72 Kensington Avenue Toronto, ON M5T 2K1 Canada
Review:
