You want a good taco, come here!  They don't have chairs, but you don't need one since the food is so good that by the time you set, you've already devoured it :)
The fish taco is my favourite, but they also offer amazing ceviche and smoked meats, and I loved their cactus juice.  From crispy shrimp to swordfish or blackened fish, you won't be disappointed at Seven Lives!

Address: 72 Kensington Avenue Toronto, ON M5T 2K1 Canada
Review:
Great tacos. We tried the carnitas, Baja fish and the shrimp and queso. It was all delicious but I wish the shrimp was grilled or fried for some crunch.

Side note: not sure why their salsa is placed right above their garbage can.

Address: 72 Kensington Avenue Toronto, ON M5T 2K1 Canada
Review:
Always revisiting this tacos joint! It’s a must visit for me whenever I come back to Toronto! Freshly made & absolutely delicious, each bite sends exciting bursts of flavors in your mouth.

Wish there were seatings so I can eat more comfortably while ordering more! Try to come before the lunch crowd surges.

Address: 794 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B6 Canada
Review:
The food and service at Nodo is always top notch. Every time I visit, we are always treated so well by the staff, the hostess as well as the managers that come by to check on us.
The food is always tasty, and the menu has so much variety to choose from. We usually get a bunch of plates to share which allows us to taste a  bit of everything. My favorite dish is the old school gnocchi which I’ve had at least 15 times and it always tastes like the first time I discovered it. Chefs kiss!

Address: 794 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B6 Canada
Review: I live in this neighbourhood for about 4 years and finally got the chance to try Nodo which was on my list for a quite while. I found antipasto options so satisfying. Especially enjoyed octopus dish which was accompanied by baby potatoes, kalamata olives, and capers. The crispy texture of the potato skins was a highlight. The dressing of oyster mushroom & arugula salad was so delicious. I ordered the classic spaghetti with meatballs. While I prefer my pasta al dente, I felt that it could have used an additional 30 seconds of cooking time. I liked the gnocci more despite creamy sauces typically being a tad heavy for my taste. The stuff was friendly, the interior had interesting details (like the plates, the mirrored wall and the ceiling light ) and our night was pleasant.

Address: 794 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B6 Canada
Review: Honestly was pretty disappointed. Service was mediocre and the food was not amazing. I got the gnocchi as it was a recommendation from our server, this dish was way too salty and lacked any good flavour. We also ordered a pizza - the Oltraggioso, it lacked overall taste.

Address: 794 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B6 Canada
Review:
Excellent restaurant nestled in the heart of the community. Their food is incredibly delicious.We ordered the Pulpetti, the Sausage and Rapini pasta and the Ossobucco.  Each plate was well made, bringing that old country Italian flavour to the heart of St.Clair West. Portions are well sized.

The location would also be great for small parties and events

Only reco for this place, they need more beer options on their menu, however I appreciated that each beer glass was chilled.

Address: 794 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B6 Canada
Review: Love this place! Honestly,  we went here for a private party and the food was amazing.  Service was wonderful, and the atmosphere is very nice. I highly recommend to check this restaurant for a delicious meal.

Address: 101 Portland Street Toronto, ON M5V 2N3 Canada
Review:
Always been a fan of their mushroom pasta, but haven’t been here in awhile. The portion definitely got smaller, and the sauce is not as rich as it’s used to. Our pasta came a bit cold so it was not as enjoyable. Also, barely any cheese!

Tried their calamari for the first time, it was good but nothing special. All in all, a bit disappointed with this visit. Hopefully they can be more consistent next time.

Address: 101 Portland Street Toronto, ON M5V 2N3 Canada
Review: An airy industrial space that offers quality Italian dishes for all types of pallets. The service is very professional and upbeat. We went for brunch and had two dishes and drinks. Both were large portions and fresh. The eggs were free-range and you can taste the richness of it. The pizza dough was not chewy but had a nice texture.  The seats at the smaller tables were not comfortable though, the bench on the side looked more comfy. The kitchen is open. It is noisy but you can see which dishes you want to order. And it was tough... They all look good!

Address: 101 Portland Street Toronto, ON M5V 2N3 Canada
Review: Got the recommended mushroom pasta and it was as good as everyone said it was! Pasta was cooked perfectly and the mushroom flavour was tasty and not too overpowering. Would come here again!

Address: 101 Portland Street Toronto, ON M5V 2N3 Canada
Review:
The high ratings are well deserved. We ordered the popular items; mushroom truffle pasta, mushroom pizza and tiramisu. Pasta was creamy delicious, n best of the bunch.

Nice Italian joint with cool decor and lively vibe. Highly recommend.

Address: 101 Portland Street Toronto, ON M5V 2N3 Canada
Review:
Sydney made the whole experience and birthday celebrations, feel our of this world.

She gave the best reviews of food, insider tips and tricks!

Everyone here enjoyed our meal and we will be back tomorrow. Thank you Sydney!!!

Address: 11 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5V 3M2 Canada
Review:
Thank you for making my Birthday Celebration such a memorable experience! ☺️☺️🙏🏼🙏🏼
It was such an amazing birthday celebration at Byblos Downtown!
I can rate this restaurant as one of the top 5 restaurants in Toronto and GTA.
Everything they have was simply amazing; the staff, the food and the overall atmosphere.
The staff are very welcoming and so nice. We almost felt we have our own waiter as she taking good care of us ☺️
For the food, we truly enjoyed every bite of all the dishes we had, both starters and mains. I can confidently say that their lamb shoulder dish is one of the best and delicious dishes I had in my life.
We loved the atmosphere of the place with the details of the interior design and furniture. 👍🏼👍🏼

Address: 11 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5V 3M2 Canada
Review: The food was fantastic! We tried many dishes to share, and especially enjoyed the Turkish manti dumplings, lentil pide, labneh, and sweet jeweled rice. All so carefully prepared with sophisticated flavor combinations and sauces. Nice decor upstairs, although the booth seating is getting quite worn in spots. Definitely a treat for the pallet.

Address: 11 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5V 3M2 Canada
Review: Excellent service, delicious food, and great vibes. Special shout-out to Alexandra - she was fantastic and detail oriented (when it comes to explaining the dishes). They also have amazing hand-crafted cocktails and a decent wine collection. I highly recommend this place, no walk-ins.. We were so full that we didn't have apetitie for desserts, but I was told their baklava's are really good!!

Address: 11 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5V 3M2 Canada
Review: We had such an amazing experience. We were lucky to be served and helped by Tyler, the bar manager/our server. He was so helpful and kind and attentive, it really impressed us. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience not only because the food looked/tasted great, but Tyler also contributed to a majority of our experience. He managed the bar, our table as well as 2 other tables, and he managed to remember our order, dietary restrictions and was even considerate enough to tell us that the short rib was cooked in red wine but he’ll make sure ours isn’t due to us having dietary restrictions (alcohol free halal meat) overall great experience, can’t wait to come back here to celebrate more occasions ☺️

Address: 11 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5V 3M2 Canada
Review: Such a lovely evening! We sat at the bar and got to meet Tyler, the bar manager and our server. He was so kind and just amazing. We LOVED the food- the lamb shoulder was succulent and just fell apart. The baklava was definitely shareable and as delicious as it was beautiful. It was on the pricey side, but well worth it as a special evening out!

Address: 2183 Danforth Ave Toronto, ON M4C 1K4 Canada
Review:
We went there for lunch. The food was delicious, we got a huge portion for two with a bit of everything. We like it. The service is not bad, they really worry if you are enjoying.
We arrived a bit early so left we could see that they were preparing for a live music. Just the atmosphere that need a bit effort to be more inviting.

Address: 2183 Danforth Ave Toronto, ON M4C 1K4 Canada
Review:
We came to Danforth to run some errands and came across this Budapest restaurant with great Google reviews so we decided to give it a try.

It’s Tuesday lunch time around noon. The place was filled with 4-5 tables of customers.

We grabbed a seat at one of the tables and ordered 2 Schnitzels and a beer.

The schnitzels were really good!! Fried just right - crisp and tasty. Not dry at all! It tasted so authentic (according to my friend from Europe).

I think that’s what makes Toronto amazing - the fact that we can always find good, authentic food in different parts of Toronto.

Gave it 4-stars due to the rather “cold” service. We felt that the servers didn’t bother to make us feel welcomed. It was very transactional without much engagement - sit down, order taken, here’s your food, pay. Or maybe I shouldn’t expect too much 🤔

Address: 2183 Danforth Ave Toronto, ON M4C 1K4 Canada
Review: As an Hungarian-American who now lives in Toronto, I can honestly say it's a blessing that if I'm craving Hungarian foods, I can actually go somewhere to get it rather than cook it myself (sometimes you know, we just don't want to cook after a long day!).  The food here is authentic, delicious, and comes in huge portions (if that's your thing).  The service is always friendly and I'm assuming that if one goes and doesn't really know Hungarian food, they'd be knowledgeable as well to walk you through the menu.  Go there and make sure to get the langos!

Address: 2183 Danforth Ave Toronto, ON M4C 1K4 Canada
Review:
There are many things to like about the place: the food, the theming, and the service.

We wanted to sample many dishes that are close to authentic as possible, so we ended up ordering the Budapest-platter ($44.95) for two. In the platter, you get 2 sides, a porkchop, 2 slices of Debreceni sausages, 2 types of Schnitzel, and a cabbage roll. There was a good variety of food present in the platter as well as very generous portions. It was listed as good for 2 people, but I believe it can be spread out to even accommodate 3 people.

There was a good amount of thought put into the interior's theming. Laminated pictures of sights and attractions of Budapest, Hungary were present at the table to give a good perspective and insight into Hungarian culture.

Lastly, I have no complaints, and have only praises to the service we received while dining here. We were attended to dutifully, and we had the best of time dining.

Address: 2183 Danforth Ave Toronto, ON M4C 1K4 Canada
Review: Me and my wife dine in here last month and all we can say is excellent service and delicious European food. My wife is polish and it’s not easy to get a real Eastern European food. There are many food chain in Toronto but not everyone is so good. We will definitely visit this place again.

Address: 337 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1N7 Canada
Review: Came here for Summerlicious with my family, young kids. It’s quaint, quiet, and cozy. The staff there are super friendly, and the food is delicious. There’s some outdoor seating and it’s kid friendly.

Address: 337 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1N7 Canada
Review: I have often passed by Papyrus and made a note to try it. The idea of Egyptian food on the Danforth was so intriguing I didn't know what to expect. With a mostly vegan and vegetarian menu I had to really coax my partner to give it a go. Of course we had to order the two meat dishes on the menu, namely the beef hawawshi and the chicken hawawshi. Both were very good and nicely spiced. Wanting to try more we alo ordered the full and tameya platter that came with lentil hummus and salads baladi and bread. The Tameya were so good we ended up ordering a side dish of 3 more. And the owner who helped to serve us and who was so kind and took time to explain everything and reccomend what order to try things etc. Also brought us a small bowl of Koshari to try (Egypt's National dish). Wow what amazing flavour! The layers of rice, lentils, pasta, tomato sauce with chickpeas and caramelized onions spiced to perfection made this a stand out dish for certain. We already agreed at the outset to try dessert so we needed to pace ourselves and brought some of the hawawshi home. So we split a Bird Nest Konafa and it was simply remarkable! Light vermicelli pastry filled with pistachios ( and exceptionally good quality ones at that) with a hint of coconut! We had to admit next time we are each getting our own! It was that good. Not too sweet just ever so flavorful. Like everything we had the textures and layers of flavour made this a truly wonderful meal experience. And my carnivore companion had to admit how much he loved the vegan and vegetarian cuisine. We also had 3 glasses of wine. There is no doubt at all that we will be back. And if you are vegan or vegetarian this is a must try restaurant in Toronto for you. Be warned however that it is small seats about 20 or so. So make a reservation!

Address: 337 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1N7 Canada
Review:
Wow - Papyrus is such a hidden gem. The service was PHENOMENAL - he kindly explained the different menu options to us and recommended the perfect options for us to try the most while also being the right amount of food.

The food was absolutely delicious and we devoured it all. I personally haven’t had Egyptian before but will be back here in a heartbeat. For a lunch for 4 of us, it was only about $60. Such great value.

Address: 337 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1N7 Canada
Review: Everything tastes delicious.. the owner is amazing, friendly yet professional.. koshari tastes better than back home... I  ❤️ PAPYRUS..

Address: 337 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1N7 Canada
Review: Small place with a nice ambiance. The Koshari poutine and Ful platter were both really good. Drinks were okay and service was a little slow but still a good experience.

Address: 267 Scarlett Road Toronto, ON M6N 4L1 Canada
Review: First time here as we were looking for a good seafood place. We called to make a reservation & good we did as seating is limited and it was very busy. Immediately, the service was friendly and welcoming. The server did an amazing job explaining the specials of the day. For appetizers, we got the Cajun muscles and lobster/shrimp bisque - both were absolutely delicious and savoury. For mains we got the fresh fish of the day and the shrimp creole, the sea bass was so well made and honestly the best tasting fish we ever tried. The portions aren’t huge but with an appetizer you’re very likely to get full. The owner or manager was present and he was so kind and attentive. We would definitely come back for some amazing seafood and I’ll be recommending this to my friends and family.

Address: 267 Scarlett Road Toronto, ON M6N 4L1 Canada
Review: Exceptionally good food and amazing service! The food tastes so awesome that you can overlook the small size of the place. The superb service that is managed by Mike is by far the best you can get anywhere in Toronto and he does it in a really phenomenal manner that you feel at ease and enjoy the experience of authenticity of the flavours that this nice restaurant has to offer. Would strongly recommend for a fine dining experience and great place to explore seafood at its best.

Address: 267 Scarlett Road Toronto, ON M6N 4L1 Canada
Review: I chose this restaurant to celebrate my birthday and I can’t wait to go back there. I love the old charm decor of the restaurant. It’s very warm and inviting. I LOVE the smell that fills the restaurant. It’s a smell of delicious, high quality seafood that just makes my mouth water. The food is delicious. The service is impeccable. Everyone was so friendly and personable and they took very good care of me. I received a special treat for my birthday from them and I felt so special. Perfect medium rare steak, lots of interesting spices used. The roasted asparagus were a favourite of mine. Cajun shrimp was juicy and full of flavour. I can’t wait to go back here. I’m getting hungry just writing this.

Address: 267 Scarlett Road Toronto, ON M6N 4L1 Canada
Review: You will absolutely love this place. There's a reason why they're so busy. Food is delicious and service is top notch. The owner comes around the tables often ensuring that you're happy with everything. So attentive. Did I mention how FABULOUS the food is? Highly recommend this great restaurant.

Address: 267 Scarlett Road Toronto, ON M6N 4L1 Canada
Review:
A fine dining experience that delivers amazing cajun flavours in an unexpected location!

I’ve lived in the area most of my life and have always felt the area was lacking when it came to restaurant options, even in regards to take out. I probably have driven past New Orleans Seafood & Steakhouse hundreds of times coming home and never noticed it until I saw it pop up on google maps when looking for cajun restaurants in Toronto. Boy am I happy it did, because this has become easily the best restaurant in the area when factoring everything.

First the location and service. The location is a lacking point, as the restaurant itself is very small and probably fits less than 30 people max. Although its size, it doesn’t get too loud in the restaurant and the interior design is very formal and  has a hint of New Orleans culture. As for service, the family running this restaurant are incredibly kind and welcoming, the person I presume to be the owner was around making jokes with patrons and checking in on all of us, ensuring our glasses are full, and all requests are answered.

Now onto the food, man does this place hit the spot. I’ve wanted to try cajun food for years but never thought a place like this would be so close to home. We started our meal with the crab cakes that do come in a serving of two.

Without asking, we were presented our crab cakes on separate plates perfectly plated for myself and my date. Fried to perfection, tender inside but not mushy. Accompanied by a bouquet of fresh veggies, this was a great start to the meal alongside the complimentary bread.

Onto our main dish, there were a couple options on the menu I wanted to try, but I felt Jambalaya had to be my first deep dive into cajun food. This dish, although being priced highly, is a hefty portion and easily feeds 2-3 people. The rice, the sausages, the various seafood, all of it was just amazing and fulfilled all my expectations and maybe even exceeded them.

This restaurant has become the best fine dining restaurant in the area to me and will now become my go to spot for going out to celebrate special occasions.

Address: 563 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6 Canada
Review:
I've tried this location for dinner and for brunch. Both experiences were very good. Their cocktails are also nice. The burgers were very good. The brunch is priced higher than t
Average but the portions are gigantic. The steak and eggs is a fantastic deal and the steak is delicious. I wasn't a huge fan of their sweet options but overall everyone was happy with their order.

Address: 563 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6 Canada
Review:
We went here for Sunday breakfast, and it was a pleasure. Food was really good. My eggs Benedict were perfectly cooked soft inside.

The lemon French toast, I think, was a bit too lemony. Would love for the chef to try an orange French toast.

The chocolate cake was too for for. It was very rich and just melted in the mouth.

Address: 563 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6 Canada
Review: Heaven on the earth has been my absolutely favorite! French toast tasted so flavorful with cream cheese and berries. Steak and eggs was also amazing since the steak was juicy and fatty. Fantastic option for meat lovers! Great portion of brunch as always. However it would have been better if there are some seasonal specials for brunch as well. Looking forward to seeing new dishes on the menu.

Address: 563 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6 Canada
Review:
I recently visited the Insomnia Lounge in Toronto and had a mixed experience. While the staff was generally friendly and attentive, I did have an unpleasant interaction with a server who assumed we would prefer a cheaper vodka option. However, they were quick to correct their mistake and provided us with the premium vodka we desired.

The food at Insomnia Lounge was enjoyable, but the wait time for our dishes left something to be desired. It would have been nice to see the kitchen keep up with the bustling atmosphere of the lounge.

One of the standout features of the establishment was the lighting, which was truly exceptional and added a unique touch to the ambiance. However, the decor in the back of the restaurant could use some updating, particularly the odd red sofa chairs that seemed out of place with the overall aesthetic.

Despite some positives, the negatives of my experience at Insomnia Lounge have led me to the decision not to return. While the staff was mostly pleasant and the lighting was a highlight, the presumptuous server and lengthy wait times for food detracted from the overall experience. Additionally, the decor in certain areas could benefit from an upgrade to better align with the vibe of the rest of the lounge.

In conclusion, Insomnia Lounge in Toronto has potential but fell short in some key areas during my visit. If you're considering a night out at this establishment, be prepared for both hits and misses.

Address: 563 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6 Canada
Review:
10/10 in every aspect

Beautiful decor
Great food
Great service
Everyone at the table loved their food, lots of vegan and kosher options as well, fun and creative drinks as well.
Highly recommend for a work brunch, taking your parents out for breakfast, or a cute date.
Best waffle I have had in my entire life!
(Slightly pricey)

Address: 535 Mt. Pleasant Road. Toronto, ON M4S 2M5 Canada
Review:
Great food options and they have their specials. I got the burger but my friends got the pasta which they all found amazing.

We also ordered the sweet potato fries as an appetizer and it was perfect. Great cuts and sauce.

Address: 535 Mt. Pleasant Road. Toronto, ON M4S 2M5 Canada
Review:
It was our first time dining here, and we all liked this cozy place so much!  Their decoration in the restaurant was cute, especially since they light up a lot of small bulbs, which makes the whole space look cozy.

We ordered a chicken and coleslaw sandwich and a steak salad. I enjoyed the steak salad very much, and it was very delicious and unique.  My partner also really liked his sandwich, and the fries were delicious too.

Our server was also excellent. She answered our questions about the meal and was very knowledgeable about everything.  They served fast and were super friendly; I appreciated them.
We will be back very soon, for sure!

Address: 535 Mt. Pleasant Road. Toronto, ON M4S 2M5 Canada
Review:
Cozy, comfort restaurant. fun with family and friends

Veggie curry was good, had a nice kick in spice and packed with a wide mix of veggies!

Address: 535 Mt. Pleasant Road. Toronto, ON M4S 2M5 Canada
Review: This is my favourite neighborhood restaurant. I often go there for breakfast, lunch and dinner. (Not all in same day 😉) Love the Cobb salad, steak salad, fries, eggs Benedict, and fish ‘n chips. The Fish specials on the chalk board are often very good as well.

Address: 535 Mt. Pleasant Road. Toronto, ON M4S 2M5 Canada
Review:
Nice ambience, friendly service. The food was good too.

I ordered the chicken pot pie which was yummy though a little small. It comes either with the Garden or Caesar salad and I had the latter which was good. My hubby had the burger (also kinda small) but it was tasty as well. The portion of fries was quite large. The sticky toffee pudding was amazing!!

Address: 858 Eglinton Avenue E Toronto, ON M4G 2B6 Canada
Review: These guys are good. Not cheap on pepperoni either. When you order on Uber, they deliver with their own in-house professionals that keep the pie nice and hot. Unlike Uber drivers that dgaf and don’t have big enough sacks for pizza anyhow.

Address: 858 Eglinton Avenue E Toronto, ON M4G 2B6 Canada
Review: I've ordered and picked up pizza from here. Picking it up is a better option because it somehow tastes better. They make a great pizza. The crust towards the edges is perfectly crispy. It's a thin crust, which is what I prefer and I didn't need to ask for it to be well done. They load the toppings on, you never feel like you didn't get enough. You can taste the quality in the meats and the freshness in the veggies. It's decently a place you need to try. Keep in mind that if you go to pick it up it's inside a unit with 3 other businesses.

Address: 858 Eglinton Avenue E Toronto, ON M4G 2B6 Canada
Review: Really enjoyed this pizza, we had two different ones, the white sauce Cowspiracy pizza was our favourite of the two, but the Canadian was also very good.  Having the different sauces and cheeses from a typical pizza really added something to the flavours.  We split the two 10" pizzas between us, with some left over. The toppings are so hearty they are very filling!

Address: 858 Eglinton Avenue E Toronto, ON M4G 2B6 Canada
Review:
While waiting for our ice cream in the same location, we couldn't help but order a pizza to go. Everything smelled amazing and it seemed rather busy (always a good sign)

Menu is fun as far as names go, and I appreciate a brand who puts some creative twists into things!

We were not disappointed. 2 small pizzas to go, one was gluten free and I'm told was amazing. Crust was fresh, fluffy, ingredients taste fresh + pricing is great for made to order "different" types of pizzas.

Definitely worth going to try it out!

Address: 858 Eglinton Avenue E Toronto, ON M4G 2B6 Canada
Review: I love their new menu because they added more non-pork options. The personal size is exactly what we needed and pizza was delicious.

Address: 2388 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J5 Canada
Review: From start to finish our visit was top-notch. Our table wasn’t ready in time but the hosts were appreciative of our patience and we were fine to wait. The culinary experience was delightful to the taste buds as well as appealing to our eyes. What really made the night exceptional was our awesome server Melina who was genuine, outgoing, and made several great recommendations geared to our preferences - she rocks! Will definitely return and bring friends.

Address: 2388 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J5 Canada
Review:
We were at Stock Bar this past Sunday and truly we have nothing but good things to say. We arrived at our reservation time and were seated immediately. No waiting around - which is nice as sometimes even when you have a reservation you still have to wait for your table. So we had very little interaction with the hostess but she was pleasant enough. We were a bit nervous as we had read some of the reviews that the service was lacking so we had braced ourselves for a subpar experience and we were just hoping the food would outshine any negative experiences. However this was NOT our experience at all. We had EXCEPTIONAL service from our server Jessica. If the management team at Stock read these reviews, Jessica was amazing. She was attentive, quick and very friendly. It was just my husband and I and we were seated between 2 parties of 6+ people that she was also waiting on and she was extremely on the ball. Reviews and ratings are obviously subjective to your own experiences and I think restaurants should aim to have some level of consistency amongst their staff so I do hope there are more servers like Jessica at Stock because she really did make the experience enjoyable.

As for the food we order the:
- Shrimp and Lobster Roll (4/5 the bread was perfectly soft and toasted, the lobster tasted fresh)
- Pancakes (5/5 the pancakes were THE highlight for me, they were so soft and fluffy and served warmed - they were great)
- Stock Burger (4.5/5 the meat was unreal - one of the best burgers at a restaurant we ever had, knock .5 because it doesn’t come with a side)
- Truffle Fries (4/5 they were standard fries, really tasty with the truffle and Parmesan on top and the highlight was the truffle Mayo, I did find them a bit expense at $22)
- Brownie (5/5, soft and warm inside, not to sweet which was perfect with the sweet ice cream)

Address: 2388 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J5 Canada
Review:
I heard good things about this place online and we decided to try it out. We ordered the albacore tuna tartare, romaine salad, cavatelli pasta, truffle fries, and ribeye to share amongst the three of us.

Nothing to be impressed by all the dishes were fine but definitely did not justify their prices.

Address: 2388 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J5 Canada
Review:
Our friends invited us here for a brunch and after checking the reviews I was skeptical about this place. But honestly I don’t know why people wrote such bad comments.

We booked a table on a rooftop patio but unfortunately it was raining so they relocated us inside which wasn’t as cute but it’s okay

The food was good , everyone was satisfied with their choice, thanks to your server who helped us to decide what we wanted as well.

We had 5 dishes , 2 beers and 2 cocktails which costed us around 200$ plus tips. Which is not bad , yes it isn’t cheap but we knew what to expect

Address: 2388 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J5 Canada
Review:
Restaurant and atmosphere is beautiful. But the dishes are nothing spectacular.

The pizza was very underwhelming. The cheese was not melted and very rubbery, almost like cheese curds. Although  It was thin and had no structure, I couldn’t cut through with knife due to dryness.

The seared steak tartare was decent. But the bread was very hard.

The seafood pasta taste was good. A tad on the salty side and some of the pasta was dried. The amount of seafood was too little for the price.

Cocktail was quite strong, but taste was not to our liking. Also it is very expensive for a cocktail at $18.

We waited a very long time for order to be taken as well as getting bill. The food also took very long to arrive, the mains arrived almost an hour after we sat down. The service was very basic and not too friendly overall.

Address: 709 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2N4 Canada
Review:
Don't come if you're looking to take your time eating🤣 they seemed in a rush to get us out. We were just coming in for quick bite. My first time here, great food, younger lady was super sweet and very attentive. Older lady was also nice but typical Asian mom attitude, eat, enjoy, get out 🤣🤣🤣🤣

Overall, excellent food.

Cutely decorated space
The food was delicious

Address: 709 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2N4 Canada
Review: I was looking for something different and I never really had Thai food before except for some fast food place and this was exactly what I was looking for. Small quaint little place where the staff are friendly and personable. The combination of curry and if I remember correctly coconut milk was a great sensation for the taste buds. It was so good that I had to go back and it was just as good the second time. I am going to keep going back until I've tried everything on the menu at least once.

Address: 709 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2N4 Canada
Review: Their food is so good also the presentation makes it look more fancy. Nice portion with acceptable price. Friendly service👍🏻

Address: 709 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2N4 Canada
Review: The best Thai in Toronto! We’ve been going there for years, and it’s consistently amazing. The ambiance and decor are nice and cozy. The service is super friendly and prompt, and the food is so good. Fresh ingredients, super flavourful. We had the spring rolls, the pad Thai and the pad sew ew, all of which were so good! We also order takeout and the portions are generous.

Address: 709 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2N4 Canada
Review:
Tasted very authentic. The flavours may be too strong for some, but that's what non-watered down Thai food is.

Service was good and price was reasonable. I'd go back

Address: 21 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review:
My partner and I had the pleasure of dining at this restaurant for the first time, and overall, it was a pleasant experience with a few highlights and some room for improvement. The restaurant boasted a delightful atmosphere, creating a cozy and inviting ambiance for a relaxed evening.

The service was commendable - the servers were exceptionally friendly and attentive throughout our meal, adding a positive touch to the overall dining experience.

We decided to try their popular chicken tenders and fish and chips. While the chicken tenders seemed to be a crowd-favorite, we were slightly disappointed by the dryness of the chicken. Though they provided some sauce on the side, the tenders' inherent dryness made it a bit difficult to enjoy fully. However, on the flip side, the fish and chips truly stood out. The portion size was more than generous, offering two servings of deliciously crispy fried fish. The fish itself was cooked to perfection - crunchy on the outside, while the flesh remained tender and flavorful on the inside. The accompanying portion of chips was excellent, adding a delightful touch to the overall dish.

One noteworthy aspect of this restaurant is their enticing happy hour deal, available from 3 pm to 5 pm and 8 pm until closing time. Regrettably, we visited during dinner hours, and consequently, we missed out on these attractive deals. Nevertheless, the ample portion sizes of the meals made up for it, leaving us feeling satisfied and content with the value we received.

All in all, the dining experience was positive, with the standout being the delectable fish and chips. Although the chicken tenders were a bit disappointing, the restaurant's overall performance and inviting ambiance left a good impression.

Address: 21 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review:
My boyfriend and I went for the summerlicious menu and overall it was pretty yummy. We made a lunch reservation for 12 pm on the dot. We both started with the parmesan truffle fries which were very good and a decently big portion, the only complaint is that they didn’t use real parmesan.

For our mains I got the ace high club and he got the tofu tacos with salad. The sandwich comes with a side of fries but i chose to do a caesar salad instead. The sandwich and salad were pretty good. The market salad that came with the tacos was a little too sweet and the tacos weren’t as flavourful as he would’ve liked (he is a sauce monster).

We chose the seasonal creme brulee (which we were told was just vanilla flavoured and not really seasonal unless vanilla is a summer seasonal flavour?) which he really enjoyed, and the apple pie jar. Pretty standard desserts, not gonna lie I was kinda full at this point and didn’t eat much of it.

Our waiter was a very nice and chill dude who provided great service and we got to choose our own seats as it wasn’t really busy at the time. Paid around $60-70 all together after tax and tip, so around $30-40 per person.

Address: 21 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review: We went for the Summerlicous menu and very much disappointed. I ordered the House Braised Sirloin Firecrackers (to die for) & tofu taco with salad. My girlfriend ordered the Parmesan Truffle Fries and chicken taco with salad. We ordered our dessert ahead of time and there seemed to be no problem. Once we were ready for our dessert, we were told they ran out and they only had 2 left for the day! The GM came and she was very defensive as we addressed our concern. She promised a discount but when we got our bill, no discount was given. We even asked the waitress to pack our left overs but she forgot to bring us doggy bags. We paid our bill with bad taste in our mouth. This location is definitely thumbs down!

Address: 21 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review:
Union Social Eatery is a great spot for a work lunch, with its nice location and laid-back atmosphere. However, if you're planning on dining here, it's best to arrive at noon or before, as it can get quite busy quickly. Despite the crowds, the service at Union Social Eatery is great, and you don't need a reservation to be seated promptly.

During my visit, my server got my wing order wrong, and unfortunately, I didn't have enough time to return or cancel before lunch ended. This was disappointing, but it didn't ruin the overall experience.

If you're looking for a spot to catch up with colleagues or friends over drinks, Union Social Eatery is definitely worth considering. While the food didn't exceed expectations, the drinks are well-crafted, and the overall atmosphere is quite inviting.

In summary, Union Social Eatery is a decent option for a work lunch or drinks with friends. While the service is great, it's important to arrive early to avoid the crowds. And while the food may not be the main draw, the drinks are worth checking out. I would consider returning, but perhaps for a more casual and relaxed outing.

Address: 21 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review:
Tried out with a friend for Summerlicious. The app was delicious: crispy brussel sprouts with bacon and a generous serving! It almost filled me and ok to share. For Main we tried was butternut squash ravioli which was cheesy, but a bit on the oily side. They were out of creme brûlée so we had key lime which was fine; standard stuff, not too much coconut.
Service was hospitable.
I did not care for the atmosphere, since it was incredibly loud/echoing and the table was wide, so we felt far from each other. Giant tv with sports over big bar. It’s a kinda industrial feel, and there is a garage door which was open to the sidewalk patio. Very humid when we were there so that didn’t help. You’re beside parked cars there.
You go through 2 doors to enter and accessible (but bathrooms downstairs)
Lots if regular pub type stuff and gluten free offerings and vegetarian friendly.

Address: 2365 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J6 Canada
Review: I love this place! The food is always delicious and the service is good. It is not always very fast when they are busy so be prepared to wait a bit (10 mins). This place is affordable, I got 4 baos for only $22.00!! This is incredibly cheap. The bao is big enough and one can fill me up for a meal.

Address: 2365 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J6 Canada
Review: Their food is amazing. The squid taco is perfect 👌It's just $5 per one and it's so worth it! The staff is always friendly and welcoming.

Address: 2365 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J6 Canada
Review: We tried the five spice pork banh mi and fried chicken, braised beef, five spice pork belly baos. We love the banh mi and the fried chicken bao. And the pork belly bao was really good too.

Address: 2365 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J6 Canada
Review: Chicken sandwich in this locations was very tasty. I also loved sweet potato fries. Order didn’t take too long to be ready and the staff was nice.

Address: 2365 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J6 Canada
Review: Went for a quick lunch with a friend. Ordered the Chicken Taco, Pork Belly Banh Mi and Sweet Potato Fries. Delicious! Best to eat in store to avoid eating soggy tacos/banh mi. Very good value for money. Service was fast and friendly.

Address: 55 Bloor Street W Manulife Centre Toronto, ON M4W 1A6 Canada
Review: Nice place! Amazing atmosphere, exquisite delectable food. If you're planning on going here, make sure you bring a lot of money with you. The only drawback is everything is really expensive. Aside from that, this place is certainly an experience with numerous markets and restaurants. If there is a special occasion I would definitely consider coming here, although I would avoid busy hours because this place gets crowded at times.

Address: 55 Bloor Street W Manulife Centre Toronto, ON M4W 1A6 Canada
Review: Bustling place for anything Italian, from breads to pastries, to gelato to pizzas, pasta, and restaurants. Overpriced grocery items, but surprisingly, the hand or machine made pastas are worth it since they are made right there and then so can't go wrong. Amazing atmosphere if you want to go with a much smaller group as there is so much to discover and explore.

Address: 55 Bloor Street W Manulife Centre Toronto, ON M4W 1A6 Canada
Review:
This tiramisus is AMAZING!!!!  Creamy! And there isn’t too much sugar added! Tasted like a mixture of cheese and egg white.
Don’t by that small lasagna. The noodle is a bit dry and hard to chew. (But the meat sauce is tasty)

Address: 55 Bloor Street W Manulife Centre Toronto, ON M4W 1A6 Canada
Review:
We had a great time over the weekend strolling through the mall. This is a fun filled day where everything is fresh, and great tasting for all. There are so many different areas as you walk though and experience unique foods like you were in Italy vibe. Great customer service and everyone seemed happy to be there.

We seated ourselves for a bite to eat and ordered some delicious Italian cuisine. The service was on point and we enjoyed the experience overall. Can’t wait to check it out again!

Address: 55 Bloor Street W Manulife Centre Toronto, ON M4W 1A6 Canada
Review: The marketplace and specialty store are very cool. You can find a great variety of special Italian food items. The restaurant was average and a little underwhelming for the price. The lasagna was good. The burrata pizza sauce was a little water and soggy but tasted good. The best part was the Rossa foccacia.  It's a good spot for small bites and getting some specialty groceries but probably not worth the price for the restaurant.

Address: 2031 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z9 Canada
Review:
Fun creative dishes designed to be shared with friends over drinks. Between the 2 of us, we ordered 5 dishes and it was the perfect amount. I enjoyed everything, but didn't have any standout favourites.

Service was excellent - our server recommended cocktails and the food came out staggered at a comfortable pace. We actually stayed there chatting well after our meal was finished and nobody made us feel rushed (it was a quiet night, but still appreciated).

I would definitely come back to try more from their menu.

Address: 2031 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z9 Canada
Review: Phenomenal tasting food and service. Other reviews say portions are a bit small for the price, but we split the shrimp curry, nasi goreng, and 6 skewers between two people and it was the perfect amount of food for ~$35 each. The seasoning and spices in the dishes are very well done and make the food taste amazing. It’s well worth the price

Address: 2031 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z9 Canada
Review: I’ve been wanting to try Little Sister and finally got the opportunity to go with my sister! Great atmosphere with exceptional service. Bartender was constantly crafting amazing drinks and the main server was delivering terrific service and super friendly. The food is a bit on the pricier side but definitely worth it. Lots of great sharing plates and options! I personally had the sangria and little brother cocktail both 10/10. I can’t wait to return to try some more :)

Address: 2031 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z9 Canada
Review: Food is very plain. Everything tasted like it was very minimally seasoned. Nothing was outright bad, but lacked flavour. The lamb satay was probably the least flavoured dish we ordered. Portions are also extremely tiny. All the skewers we got were 1 bite, maybe 2 max, and I’d say that’d be smaller bites. The drinks were 17-19$ for like a vodka martini which is insanely priced. Service was decent. It’s a pretty small place and kind of cramped. Very dark inside so hard to see. Overall, it was a very ok experience, but not somewhere I’d ever go back to.

Address: 2031 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z9 Canada
Review: The entire experience was excellent - the service, food and ambience! The war fries were crispy and flavourful, the chicken satay with peanut sauce was perfect, and the shrimp curry was rich and tasty. Would definitely go there again!

Address: 643A Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: Best Japanese food I've ever hard! All 9 dishes were out of this world. It was such an amazing experience watching the chef make all the dishes, and his attention to detail. The service was 10/10. I can't wait to come back!!

Address: 643A Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: I wholly enjoyed the experience - every dish and every flavour. You gotta appreciate the ingredients and skill that the chef and his team put into a service. It's not everyday that you get to taste the sea on a plate. Everything was so fresh, beautiful and well blended together. Would totally recommend if you want to experience and taste something different.

Address: 643A Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review:
My wife and I had an amazing time at Yukashi, which recently hit my food radar after getting its Michelin star last year. We've been to a bunch of "top restaurants" in Toronto, and Yukashi really stands out. Each dish in the tasting menu was beautiful, creative, fresh and (most importantly) delicious. The pictures really don't do the food justice. My wife is pescatarian was they were able to accommodate by creating a great substitute for the wagyu and a couple other meat items.

We didn't have much experience with sake, and decided to add the sake pairing for the full experience. It was a great addition, and we loved how each sake complimented the paired food. Watching each dish prepared in front of us was an amazing experience, with great attention to detail from Chef Izutsu and his team. I really can't say enough about our memorable experience and the delicious food at Yukashi.

Address: 643A Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review:
Hello from San Francisco! We had a pleasant experience with Chef Daisuke on July 5th. Congrats on the Michelin star by the way! Daisuke has his process down to a tee. Everyone worked well together and are involved in the whole dining process. There wasn’t much waste, if any. The price tag was a little higher than expected, but it seems to be a result of rising cost of living and importing ingredients straight from his hometown in Japan. You do get to enjoy wagyu, uni, and foie gras as part of your 9 courses. The wasabi are grind fresh by Daisuke - you usually don’t see real fresh wasabi. Other items worth highlighting are their toro and smoked hamachi. The toro was just so fatty and delicious. I feel like all hamachi should be smoked after trying it here. Can’t forget the dessert at the end! It’s really expensive to buy it on your own. He used this large knife to cut it (definitely got everybody’s attention). The melon was juicy and literally melted in my mouth before I even start chewing. Amazing experience.

Keep in mind the head chef is busy in the beginning. Don’t think and just enjoy your food. He will have time to converse with everyone later. It’s not just your experience but everyone else’s. It’s easy for other guests to ruin the overall experience but we made it through ours. Thanks again Daisuke and for taking a pic with us!

Address: 643A Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: Hands down best sushi place I have ever been to, to date. I don't have anything negative to say about Yukashi, everything was perfect! Presentation is incredible, ambiance is warm and inviting, and the food itself is top top quality. This is a genuinely artistic omakase experience. The chef was a true pleasure to watch and speak to. Sake pairings were unbelievable. I could have paid much much more without it feeling overpriced.

Address: 1568 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: My sisters and I received excellent service here! First, half of the items on their menu wasn’t available today but they were apologetic and let us know what wasn’t available. Second, they accidentally gave us the kids classic breakfast with sausage and was apologetic and immediately made us new ones which showed us that they understood different diets like vegetarianism. Aside from those two hiccups, the food was amazing and the service rocked!

Address: 1568 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: Great restaurant for halal brunch! I absolutely loved the Nashville eggs benedict! We also got the scotch egg and I wasn't particularly a fan. I had a latte with oat milk and I enjoyed it a lot. The restaurant itself was pretty busy even on a weekday, but we were seated immediately. Our server was super friendly and helpful.

Address: 1568 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: One of the best brunches so far, it's halal.  We got lucky, the lotus pancakes was on the house - Excellent service. Kobs helped us out, super nice person. Also the soundtrack was nice - a true 1D fan playing all the new Niall and Harry's song 🤧🤍

Address: 1568 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review:
I went to Eggstatic for the third time with my family. This place is very lively and busy on a Sunday. As a result, parking can be a little hard to come by but every once in a while, a spot out front opens up and there is a Green P lot about a block away.

The owner, Faris and his partner are extremely friendly and kind. They went out of their way to ensure my family and I had a great dining experience. I would highly recommend trying this spot if you are looking for a halal brunch spot with a variety of options. Also, the Mango-Strawberry Lemonade is really delicious and not too sweet.

Address: 1568 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review:
This place is so cute! The food was really really good. I had a chicken sandwich— my coworkers had the Nashville chicken eggs Benedict and it looked phenomenal, the portion was huge in comparison to other breakfast spots.

Kiara was our server, she was so friendly and accommodating! She recommended a drink and I ended up trying / LOVING it. Would definitely recommend her choice of the mango strawberry lemonade. She was great.

Really enjoyed our meal & will definitely be back

Address: 2405A Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E7 Canada
Review:
Cozy ambience, they haven’t changed anything in the past 6-7 years except for the flooring. Friendly staff.

We mostly had seafood. They were good but a little overcooked. My seafood saffron risotto’s scallops were very over cooked but the shrimps were perfect. The seafood salad’s seafood was also overcooked but they were refreshing. Mussels were perfect. Veal with lemon sauce was good but maybe the piece was too thin. Overall pleasant experience.

Address: 2405A Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E7 Canada
Review:
I randomly found this place. I went there just for brunch but turns out it’s an authentic Italian place with all sorts of class and beauty. I ordered a brunch course followed by fruits and cheese and paired it with a glass of Rose. Absolutely loved the bar tender / server Jawahar and his service.
It was only me and I must say they treated me the best. I am going back with my entire crew. Loved every bit of it. Toronto is showing its good old kind Canadian face again. ❤️❤️❤️

Address: 2405A Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E7 Canada
Review:
We were a table of seven at La Vecchia and we all left very pleased.

The food was really good and the portions were satisfying.

The staff was very friendly and attentive, taking good care of us.

Address: 2405A Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E7 Canada
Review: I came to the Yonge and Eglinton location for my birthday and had the most incredible experience!! The brunch menu had tasty options and the service was very impeccable!! Alex greeted me! And checked on our table very frequently! We had the best seat in the restaurant and our waiter Manny was very attentive!! I will be back for all my special occasions!!

Address: 2405A Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E7 Canada
Review:
What can i say? One of the best Italian restaurants ive ever been to.
I have a different food pallet, so generally im not that big of a fan of Italian food .. but man...what a great place. The place is packed and it looks like everyone who works there actually loves their job.
The owner is amazing, super welcoming and cool, the server was amazing, fantastic stuff.
Only 2 issues,  pasta portions are small and i wish they served free bread with the olive oil.

Address: 6 Garamond Court Toronto, ON M3C 1Z5 Canada
Review: What do you get a guy who has everything?  An elite birthday dinner at Kaiseki Yu-zen!  The experience was exquisite from start to finish. The entire restaurant holds just three tables.  Each table is set in a separate and cozy room emulating the traditional "tatami" feel with western seating.  Our server was impeccably professional, friendly, thorough and knowledgeable with every detail of our meal.  Each dish was immaculately plated.  I'd tell you to avoid a "spoiler alert" by skipping the photos, but your visual and taste experience will change with the meat, seafood and vegetables in season at the time. If you want a fine dining experience like no other, this is the place.

Address: 6 Garamond Court Toronto, ON M3C 1Z5 Canada
Review: Truly an experience where you’re transported outside of Toronto and into a traditional Kaiseki in Japan. From the moment you walk to the front of the restaurant the cherry blossoms outside the building bloom (as i went in late April. Just as they were blooming). There’s a magnificent entrance and walk to your dining room. As for the meal. The flavors slowly build up as the night goes on, each dish adding a bit more complexity than the last. From the food to the impeccable service, it’s an experience you will never forget. Amazing memories.

Address: 6 Garamond Court Toronto, ON M3C 1Z5 Canada
Review:
An absolutely perfect kaiseki experience, I’m confident to say this was the best I’ve had outside of Japan. From the very beginning, the attention to detail is present. The staff immediately greet you and walk you to your seating area. As you make your way into the restaurant, the decor and ambiance of really pops out. Each decorative piece works as a whole to make you feel like you’ve been transported to Kyoto and prepares you for the work of art that is their kaiseki tasting menu. Even the movement of the servers showcased careful poise with no wasted movement, as each dish was placed with such care and love and a respectful bow as they enter and leave the room.

They really have mastered the art quite well, as each dish stimulates all five of your senses individually. Each course itself is a work of art in its own right, the textures of each dish work well individually and together, feel like a harmonious symphony that doesn’t overpower you. I must give kudos to their house made sesame tofu, the texture of that dish was a personal favourite of mine. Their steamed dish also whetted your appetite as when you uncover it, the balance of the vegetables and red snapper emit a delicate scent that is is a stark contrast with the umami of the mingled broth formed at the bottom. Needless to say, each dish was absolutely delicious and inventive. The chef has not only mastered his art but showcases how well thought out his combinations of seasonal ingredients are. The pairings of each dish and how they prepare them prove it’s Michelin status.

The only possible way they could have made the experience even more perfect would be to offer a seiza-style seating room with traditional tatami mats. I truly feel like that would make diners feel like they really have been transported to Japan. This has been my absolute favourite Michelin experience in Canada thus far. Kudos to all the staff!

Address: 6 Garamond Court Toronto, ON M3C 1Z5 Canada
Review:
Went for my boyfriend's 20th and it was phenomenal. The service and pace of the meal couldn't have been better and you leave feeling  full but not uncomfortable.

Food was delicious and a completely new sensory experience, each one was plated exquisitely. Truly a feast for all your senses! It's hard to pick a highlight out of all the course as each and every one had its unique quirks. I look forward to experiencing this in Japan when I get the chance.

Thank you to our gracious host, Haruna. She was kind, patient, and extremely informative. And of course thank you to Chef K who went out of his way to greet us at the end of the meal and talk us through the Kaiseki experience.

I look forward to coming back and trying their ever changing menu again. Gochisousama deshita!

Address: 6 Garamond Court Toronto, ON M3C 1Z5 Canada
Review: Lovely private setting with amazing dishes. The service is perfect and the hostess tended to our requests. I wouldn’t recommend bringing young children as it might ruin the atmosphere of other guests there.

Address: 21 Davisville Avenue Toronto, ON M4S 1G3 Canada
Review: What a hidden gem. Located in the back of this Hasty Market lies a wonderful shawarma shop. They make their own flatbread and it's so unique and delicious. Not your standard pita. I really enjoyed the different texture. I ordered the chicken shawarma wrap all dressed and they loaded it up! It's a hefty wrap. I got a couple of falafels broken up and added to the wrap and they soaked up some of the sauce to add a really nice flavour and consistency to the filling. Highly recommend.

Address: 21 Davisville Avenue Toronto, ON M4S 1G3 Canada
Review: Hasty Market / Flaming Stove is à truly hidden gem in DAVISVILLE, that definitely worth try, at the back of the store with lots of findings, you can see the FLAMING STOVE, the best local halal dish. There’s dine in only in summer they are mostly take out, I Totally suggest the baba ghanoush and the wraps ❤️

Address: 21 Davisville Avenue Toronto, ON M4S 1G3 Canada
Review: the quality of the chicken is great, however portions were rather small. the quality of the rice could also be better but overall a decent shawarma plate (I like mine without veggies). We also tried the Falafel, which was not bad. If you’re in the area, you should check it out.

Address: 21 Davisville Avenue Toronto, ON M4S 1G3 Canada
Review: It's a fine spot for takeout wraps. The food tasted good but I feel like it's missing a bit of seasoning. Great portion size though!

Address: 21 Davisville Avenue Toronto, ON M4S 1G3 Canada
Review: A place hidden in a convenient store. The entire place is quite clean comparing to most of the corner stores. The food is decent but not overwhelming. The shawarma chicken is good. The salad is mediocre. This box is $20. I also bought hummus and baba ghanoush. Liked the hummus but don’t recommend the ghanoush, too much salt.

Restaurant_name: El Sazón de la Tia Flor
Address: 1549 O'Connor Drive Toronto, ON M4B 2V7 Canada
Review: Can't go wrong for $1 Taco Tuesday!! It was our first time there, so we had to navigate all the amazing Taco choices. Needless to say, it was busy in there that day, but staff were friendly and helpful with all our taco questions. And the tacos did not disappoint! Will definitely be back!

Restaurant_name: El Sazón de la Tia Flor
Address: 1549 O'Connor Drive Toronto, ON M4B 2V7 Canada
Review:
We happened to catch ordering some quick take out right before they were closing at 7PM. The lady was kind enough to take our orders around 10 minutes before the end of the day.

There were not a lot of menu options available to get at this time, and we were limited to ordering the Pastor Taco & I think the Chicken Taco. Both orders were good and looked good. The tacos came with 2 sauces.

Probably, the only minor thing I can comment on that did not go right was that the lady did not include any napkins/tissues in the take out bag. We would have appreciated having some included for our takeout because we had the tacos to go and ate it at a park somewhere else.

I will surely try to experience dining in some time in the future. The interiors were themed right, and the place was very homey. I also can only expect some good and personable service received from the restaurant.

Restaurant_name: El Sazón de la Tia Flor
Address: 1549 O'Connor Drive Toronto, ON M4B 2V7 Canada
Review:
Finally found a place with proper sized tacos!! I'm tired of all these open faced burritos with massive tortillas masquerading as tacos!! Only thing they are missing is a double tortilla. The flavor is amazing!

Edit: Came for for the 1$ tacos, stayed for the the amazing food. Tried a few other items on the menu since the first visit. So far everything is incredable! Chilaquiles are super good

Restaurant_name: El Sazón de la Tia Flor
Address: 1549 O'Connor Drive Toronto, ON M4B 2V7 Canada
Review: We found this place 2 years ago. They have the $1 tacos every Tuesday & Wednesday. We’ve tried the pastor, chorizo, carnitas, and carne ranchera. They used to give lime with the order but now you have to buy it. We also tried the birria soup it was $2 for a mini portion of it but my sister think it’s delicious. I remember they used to have delicious desserts too but they didn’t have anything last time we came to visit. I used to get the hot salsa too and it used to burn my mouth but I guess they watered it down now. Overall, it is $1 taco every Tuesday & Wednesday so what else can you ask for. 👍🏼

Restaurant_name: El Sazón de la Tia Flor
Address: 1549 O'Connor Drive Toronto, ON M4B 2V7 Canada
Review: Went there for the first time to try out the $1 taco Tuesday and Wednesday. The tacos were delicious.  There's a good variety to choose from! Will definitely go back to try their other dishes. 4 stars only because I only tried the tacos 😊

Address: 2057 Yonge St Toronto, ON M4S 2A2 Canada
Review:
I’ve walked by this place many many times and have always wanted to try it. I finally gave in and made my take out order! I ordered the spicy veggie ramen ($19.05, around $2+ more than a meat option = $21.20 with tofu compared to a $16.95 for meat) and asked for tofu to be added since there wasn’t any protein in there (extra $2.15). Since I ordered it to go I was charged a $1 to go fee. (What????) Honestly after spending $25 (totally NOT worth it for a veggie bowl) I’m not sure I’d go back again. The noodles were really nice but honestly I thought the rest of the bowl was just okay in comparison to some other restaurants where I’ve tried ramen before. There was hardly any soup and the description on the menu lists that there’s broccoli included but I received none.
The service was also very slow. Maybe they were short staffed but I swear when I put my order through the gentleman said it would take minutes which turned into about 20+.  There was even a lady sat in there with her family that was complaining because their order was taking so long to come out. Also a little shocked to find out it’s a chain restaurant.

Address: 2057 Yonge St Toronto, ON M4S 2A2 Canada
Review: I went to this ramen shop with my wife and two daughters.  The ramen was excellent.  The wait staff are also nice and friendly.  You can order different sizes of ramen bowls depending on how hungry you are, which is great because my daughters weigh less than a 100lbs so they can’t eat a large bowl of ramen.  The small bowl was plenty for them.  We will be back again the next time we are visiting Toronto.

Address: 2057 Yonge St Toronto, ON M4S 2A2 Canada
Review:
It's a nice little ramen spot with a good atmosphere and pleasant service.

I thought the ramen flavours were good but not excellent. It seems to be a bit on the tame side of flavor. A bit on the pricer side for what you get. Overall, not a bad place.

Address: 2057 Yonge St Toronto, ON M4S 2A2 Canada
Review: Great Place for Ramen. The food is great but might want to book before arriving. The Fried chicken was the most tender chicken I have ever had. Do Try the chicken and pork ramen

Address: 2057 Yonge St Toronto, ON M4S 2A2 Canada
Review: Great service, you can order regular or large size ramen. The option to get a smaller size is great. I got spicy veggie ramen with kale noodles and tofu on the side. Would definitely recommend, it was delicious.

Address: 4 Crescent Road Toronto, ON M4W 1S9 Canada
Review:
I absolutely love their sandwiches, and my absolute favorite has to be their mouthwatering roast beef sandwich with its delectable BBQ sauce. The combination of tender, succulent roast beef layered with the perfect balance of tangy and savory BBQ sauce creates a taste sensation that is simply irresistible. Each bite is a symphony of flavors that leaves me craving more.

Not only are their sandwiches incredibly tasty, but the quality of ingredients and attention to detail truly sets them apart. The roast beef is expertly cooked to perfection, tender and juicy with a hint of smoky flavor that pairs perfectly with the bold, rich BBQ sauce. The bread they use is always fresh and just the right amount of softness, providing the perfect vessel to hold all the delicious ingredients together.

If you're looking for something special and unique to tantalize your taste buds, I highly recommend trying their sandwiches.

Address: 4 Crescent Road Toronto, ON M4W 1S9 Canada
Review:
Awesome food. They do no advertising and it's all word of mouth.  There is a Tiny patio for eating outside. This place has been around for at least 10 years. It is constantly busy, but the wait wasn't bad, and the staff is Friendly.
Inside it's a utilitarian vibe. Now, back to the food. I think any foodies would love the sandwiches. In all my reviews, this is a top spot.

Address: 4 Crescent Road Toronto, ON M4W 1S9 Canada
Review: great sandwich, it’s was extremely delicious and lives up to the hype! The bread was great, decent portions, savoury meat! definitely recommend to visit, it’s got some nice patio area outside now that the weather is great. Very close to the subway station!

Address: 4 Crescent Road Toronto, ON M4W 1S9 Canada
Review:
A cute little place by Rosedale station. It has 4 seats and 2 tables, so be prepared to get a takeout. No washroom in sight. A good menue that is accommodating to almost everyone. I got decent service when I visited but since I only went once, I can’t exactly vouch for the service. I took their recommendation and got veggie roasted sandwich with pesto mayo and it was about $11. A little over priced but that’s midtown/downtown for you.

The veggies tasted fresh and the bun was nice and chewy, although not toasted. They could have added a little more sauce to it.

Overall, a good place to grab a filling on the go lunch.

Address: 4 Crescent Road Toronto, ON M4W 1S9 Canada
Review:
Really excellent sandwiches. Cannot wait to try the beef brisket sandwich again but with toppings next time. The meat is tender and moist, and bun soaks up the delicious barbecue sauce. The camel BLT is a wonderful combination of classic flavours. It’s loaded with toppings but at its core, it’s still a great pesto chicken sandwich. The shop is tiny, only two 2-seater tables and a standing room counter. But the diners seem to eat as quickly as the sandwiches are prepared.

Update: 2nd visit was just as good. Pulled pork with caramelized onions and roast sweet peppers was delicious!

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: Absolutely amazing experience!! From the service, vibe and especially the food. We were a party of 3 got sat right away on the roof top (it was a Monday so not too too busy) ordered quit a few different items off the menu and we shared everything. Our server was very attentive and gave us lots of great recommendations. The grilled octopus was honestly one of my favourite things I’ve gotten at a restaurant to date. We had pasta, fish and pizza as well as some apps and desserts. Nothing disappointed!

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review:
The truffle pasta is a must try. I come here every few months just for the truffle pasta. The other pastas are good too but if you like mushroom, just get the truffle one. The pizza, bread, and bruschetta are also delicious.

The atmosphere and service is great. I highly recommend coming before 6pm to avoid waiting. If you do have to wait, you’re usually seated in 15-30 minutes.

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: Went with my family (4 people) for lunch. Hostess was very friendly and opened the door for us and promptly sat us. It was pretty busy, our server was quick, very friendly. The octopus as an appetizer was absolutely delicious and the plating was beautiful. Happy with our experience, lots to choose from on the menu.  Will be back again.

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: It was a nice restaurant with nice atmosphere. Not a big place but I like the interior settings inside. My friend love their risotto, and the Nduja Pizza is also very tasty with sweet and sour taste. Also, Marc is very nice :). I've been told the service is usually just so so, but he is friendly and been nice all the time~

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review:
Delicious delicious delicious!
Must try their truffle pasta!
The female server was very kind and sweet.

One thing to note is that the tables are stacked pretty close to one another, and it could get very lively and loud.

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: Absolutely amazing experience!! From the service, vibe and especially the food. We were a party of 3 got sat right away on the roof top (it was a Monday so not too too busy) ordered quit a few different items off the menu and we shared everything. Our server was very attentive and gave us lots of great recommendations. The grilled octopus was honestly one of my favourite things I’ve gotten at a restaurant to date. We had pasta, fish and pizza as well as some apps and desserts. Nothing disappointed!

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review:
The truffle pasta is a must try. I come here every few months just for the truffle pasta. The other pastas are good too but if you like mushroom, just get the truffle one. The pizza, bread, and bruschetta are also delicious.

The atmosphere and service is great. I highly recommend coming before 6pm to avoid waiting. If you do have to wait, you’re usually seated in 15-30 minutes.

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: Went with my family (4 people) for lunch. Hostess was very friendly and opened the door for us and promptly sat us. It was pretty busy, our server was quick, very friendly. The octopus as an appetizer was absolutely delicious and the plating was beautiful. Happy with our experience, lots to choose from on the menu.  Will be back again.

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: It was a nice restaurant with nice atmosphere. Not a big place but I like the interior settings inside. My friend love their risotto, and the Nduja Pizza is also very tasty with sweet and sour taste. Also, Marc is very nice :). I've been told the service is usually just so so, but he is friendly and been nice all the time~

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review:
Delicious delicious delicious!
Must try their truffle pasta!
The female server was very kind and sweet.

One thing to note is that the tables are stacked pretty close to one another, and it could get very lively and loud.

Address: 1677 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3C1 Canada
Review:
Was craving Thai and my friend recommended me Pii Nong! I’m so glad she did because everything was delicious and lots of fresh flavours. I’m a sweets gal so the teddy bear iced tea was absolutely adorable and refreshing. The mango sticky rice and the durian pancake were so good. I would’ve smashed them if I wasn’t too full off all the delicious entrees. I could go on forever about how tasty everything is. The service was also top notch as well.

Highly recommend!

Address: 1677 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3C1 Canada
Review:
Lovely dinner at Pii Nong Thai! We loved every dish and highly recommend the pandan chicken, soft shell crab and the shrimp platter! Every sauce/curry dipping sauce is amazing!

Don’t skip the sweets and grab the Thai milk tea bear and the coconut soup dessert to finish! Amazing service, will return

Address: 1677 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3C1 Canada
Review:
The thai tea bears are adorable!

This is a decent thai spot in the area. The presentation of the food and drinks were great and the restaurant has a nice atmosphere as well!

I thoroughly enjoyed the soft shell crab curry and highly recommend getting this item! the curry was delicious and i really liked how it paired with the crab!

the other dishes were okay. i felt like some could use a bit more flavour and some was a little too umami and salty for me. But that’s just my personal preference!

I did have a good time and enjoyed my dinner overall!

Address: 1677 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3C1 Canada
Review: My favorite Thai restaurant in Toronto so far! This restaurant is quite so spacious and has nice intimate vibes where lots of foodies like me would love to visit often! Unique and creative menu with fantastic flavor. 3 of us went there on Thursday noon and we were so easy to find parking spot even though I was bit concern about its location at the beginning. We ordered many dishes and our server was so friendly to offer signature dishes based on our preference. Food came out so quick and services were excellent. Firstly we were so surprised by the way how they make the Thai mike tea with the shape of cute bear.Such a genius idea! Best beverage to start a meal here. So refreshing and  not too sweet at all.And I love the seasonal specialty (Durian Roti) so much which came with great portion of Durian and they taste so creamy which perfect for people who are big fans of Durian aand you couldn't find this any Thai restaurant. Soft crab curry also tasted surprisingly good and I fell in love with soft crabs since then😅. Pandan leaf chicken is also a dish which you couldn't easily find anywhere and I was so impressed with the idea how they marianate and grill the chicken while they were wrap with leaf. They are so juicy and tender with light scents of leaf. The owner is also talkative and passionate about different ideas for the food his restaurant offers. I believe that's why this Thai restaurant is so outstanding and should deserve a michelin star one day! Will definitely come back again!

Address: 1677 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3C1 Canada
Review:
I had a very pleasant dinner at pii Nong. The servers really managed to find a table for us even if the restaurant was very busy and we didnt have a reservation, so thank you very much for that.

I am usually not a big meat lover, but probably the ribs were the best dish of our meal, so tender and juicy!
Overall also the other items were very good. We had Nana Garden salad, chicken khao soi, pad thai and soft shell crab ( the last one was a bit pricy and portion small, but def good taste).
We finished our meal with thr durian roti that was excellent! Durian flavoured desserts are often very artificial flavoured, but this one tasted very fresh.

Overall very recommended 👌

Address: 111 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V4 Canada
Review: My favourite spot in Ontario for tacos. Best fish and beef tacos. It’s a tiny spot so I’d recommend coming early or making reservations.

Address: 111 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V4 Canada
Review:
This place by far has one of the top 3 fish taco I have ever tried.
• Fish taco: I ordered Ubereats but when it arrives the fish was still crispy. I really like how they season it and love the sauce. The portion is pretty good with great amount of veggies. I was quite full with only 3 pieces of tacos and didn't have to eat or drink anything else.
I saw the lobster taco on the menu and definitely will come back to try.

Address: 111 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V4 Canada
Review:
4.5/5

Wow! These tacos were an explosion of mouthwatering flavours and textures… Hands down the best I’ve had in town thus far.

We tried the Ceviche Del Dia, which was okay. Nothing particularly special about this dish, but the chips were fresh and very good.

For tacos, we tried the Carnitas on soft tortillas and the Pollo Tinga on hard shells . Both were great with a wonderful combination of garnishes and sauces. My personal favourite was the Pollo Tinga as it had a good bite to it and the guacamole on the side was nice.

It’s a small and very busy restaurant with dimmed lighting and a cozy feel. The older gentleman (bartender) who served us was attentive and friendly. I’d definitely return!

Address: 111 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V4 Canada
Review:
The food here is incredible. I was so impressed and will definitely be back.

Their house hot sauces are so good! I put the milder one on everything (they’re deliciously spicy)!

We ordered the grilled corn and salsa and chips to start. The grilled corn was tasty, but missing the char I expected from grilled corn. The salsa was fresh and delicious, with a generous portion size of tortilla chips.

Tacos come as a set of 3/4, so we ordered a set of the shrimp and al pastor. Both were so good!!! The al pastor tacos pack a punch of flavour - the seasoning of the pork is spot on, plus the juicy sweetness of the grilled pineapple and slice of orange on top, mmm!The shrimp tacos were milder in flavour, but so juicy and so tasty! The fried taco shell was a nice touch.

We also tried the tres leches cake, which was massive (shared between two people) and not too sweet.

Incredible experience overall and definitely coming back to try the other tacos!

Address: 111 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V4 Canada
Review: Delicious, a must try taco joint in the city. The Guacamole and corn was absolutely delicious, very fresh. The fried fish tacos were so big (which you think would be a good thing) it was honestly difficult to eat and wish we ordered the grilled option instead

Address: 950 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 2C2 Canada
Review:
Overall had a good experience.
The bi bin bap was good but I had the tofu version which was very different.
This tofu was lighter and softer. The dish also seemed low in salt.
They had mexican coke which was yummy.
The beef (not pork) tacos were delicious as were the dumplings.

The space is small but owner is accommodating to groups. Service is friendly and helpful.

Great price! Haven't paid under $25 for my own dish for a while!

Washrooms available downstairs.

Wouldn't recommend for wheelchair accessible, unless it's on the patio.

Address: 950 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 2C2 Canada
Review:
been bummed out recently that most korean restaurants i visit have not met my expectations. However, this place helped me be proud of my culture and regained excitement for eating my food.

We ordered the beef bibimbap and the beef itself was so tender and soft. The apps were simple but yet delicious and affordable.

definitely will be coming back.
