Address: 950 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 2C2 Canada
Review: Delicious! Love the food from here. Good portions and good prices. Must try!

Address: 950 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 2C2 Canada
Review: My first time to dine in here, the  food are amazing and delicious, the presentation of the food is beautiful. The service of the food was efficient, we don't have to wait longer. The staff was friendly. Definitely coming back in here..

Address: 950 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 2C2 Canada
Review: This place is awesome. Never misses. Just tried the water dumplings today and they are outstanding! We always get the kimchi fries and love the chicken or beef bi bim bap.

Address: 872 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1M5 Canada
Review: Decent tasting food, fairly priced and excellent service. I order the “Fish of the day” which was Sea bass with white rice, avocado salad and green plantains. Sea bass was cooked perfectly, crispy on the outside moist in the inside, but it lacked in seasoning. I wasn’t too fond of the green plantain. However, the soup of the day “sea food soup” was amazing! It was the best dish overall. Lots of different kinds of sea food and bursting with flavour. Lastly, the Mojinica tasted like lemonade, no rum.

Address: 872 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1M5 Canada
Review: Friendly service. Huge portions. I left so stuffed. The daily special seafood soup was good. The Yuccanadas tasted just like nachos with cheese and salsa. My favourite meal was the Pez Dorado (grilled mahi-mahi); very flavourful. The fish of the day (sea bass) was cooked beautifully, crispy on the outside, moist inside, however, it lacked seasoning. I found the Mojinica drink to be very tart and strong in mint, but light in rum. There are other dishes that I would love to try so I will be back.

Address: 872 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1M5 Canada
Review: I love this place. A local brought me here 3 years ago when I moved to Toronto. It’s a small, cozy restaurant with lots of great food options and amazing cocktails. I eat here once in a while and enjoy the experience everytime.

Address: 872 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1M5 Canada
Review: Made a reservation and was glad I did, since the place was packed on a Friday night! I got the carne asada as my main and added the fried cheese. For the appetizer we got the fish ceviche and mussels. I've never had such tender mussels!! It was cooked so deliciously, we didn't waste a drop of the sauce and soaked it up with bread. The carne asada was not tough and had a good chew, but could've used more flavour. The ceviche was too sour for my liking. Everything was fresh and came piping hot. Only thing I wished was for a little more considerate service, after we paid we stayed a little longer to chat but they stopped serving us water. Although the staff are very friendly and didn't rush us to leave I still had a great time.

Address: 872 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1M5 Canada
Review: This was our first time trying Nicaraguan food and we were impressed. The service was friendly and the servers greet you in Spanish. We enjoyed our food here, and we couldn’t finish everything as the main dishes were fairly big. Next time, we will do different appetizers so we can try more items on the menu. The polo jalapeño plate is cooked with coconut milk, which was delicious, but we expected it to be a bit more spicy. This dish wasn’t spicy at all considering that it’s supposed to come with jalapeños. We loved the mixed seafood ceviches. Beef Churrasco could have been a bit better as I’ve tried this type of dish before. Also, vegetables on this plate were very plain. Overall a great experience. Thank you ☺️

Address: 180 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V7 Canada
Review: First time here, giving this a definite 5 across the board. I am amazed how many people work here. Besides that the food was really good the waitress (awsome hair by the way) working there new the menu and was knowledgeable with the products. I highly recommend having a few drinks and a bit to eat here. Thanks again.

Address: 180 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V7 Canada
Review: Had an amazing experience at this place, patio was lovely. Many thanks to our server- We asked if they use vegetable oil as I couldn't eat that due to my allergies and unfortunately they do use it. But really loved the fact that she didn't give up and suggested all the items that I could safely have  from the menu and suggested they can cook it in butter instead. We ordered Roti with Curry and Enchiladas - Both of it was delicious 😋

Address: 180 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V7 Canada
Review: Great place. Always has good food, nice drink selection. I recommend trying the house lager. Diligent about checking vaccinations, no complaints.

Address: 180 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V7 Canada
Review:
** reviewing latest visit -May 2023 **
Vibrant eatery hidden in the interiors of midtown. They have huge place no shortage of seating but we always fancy the patio - rooftop.. Getting to the washroom is a bit of inconvinience as its located deep down in the basement. Cheerful atmosphere and the place is always packed.

Cocktails are one of the best and they also have a good collection of beers and serve seasonal local brews too. Food is average and can get better rotating menu and
also more vegan/vegetarian options.
Service has been up and down but just about there in general.

Parking is very limited and is challenge finding every visit.

We visited the Local at Vancouver location recently but prefer home base better 😊

Address: 180 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V7 Canada
Review: 1st: patio is pet friendly! They brought a water bowl for my dog, all staff was really friendly. I order the breakfast sandwich, amazing! It has everything you need to start your day with the right foot. I paired with a beermosa with grapefruit juice.

Address: 407 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: Ordered via Uber Eats and we couldn’t have been happier with all the dishes! So fresh and delicious. Hugely appreciated their care to accommodate allergies. Can’t wait to go experience it in person now. We will be regulars.

Address: 407 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review:
Greek craving satisfied!! What a homey, authentic and delicious experience! We went on a Friday at around 8pm, and had a feast. The grilled and fried calamari were to die for- best calamari in the city! Don’t waste your time anywhere else. The dips were amazing too. The menu was so pleasantly overwhelming, we wanted to order everything.
Some people on the table had the lamb rack and really enjoyed it too.
Be mindful that the portions are huge, and you’ll want to order everything!
Super fresh, super delicious and I cannot wait to go back!

Address: 407 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review:
Without doubt this has been one of the most amazing experiences I have had in a Toronto restaurant in my 4 years here.
Food -Made with passion and care. Served hot or cold as the dish needs. And tasted delicious. And this is when we are vegetarians.
Service - Felt treated like a guest as cared for in small ways, like hot water, sugar.
When I mentioned that I was at the restaurant with my family visiting as a tourist they made the dinner special with honey cake on the house.
Had a very pleasant and memorable time and my family is going to remember this as one of the most special times they had while in Canada.
Thank you everyone at Pantheon for having such a high bar for customer service. I will definitely visit again and tell others to not miss this incredible experience.
This is the reason dining out is not just about food but an extraordinary experience!!

Address: 407 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: My family and I have been going to Pantheon for years, as our choice to dine on the Danforth. There are many quality Greek restaurants in the area and I would encourage everyone to try as many as possible to support local businesses. However, Pantheon goes a step above and they serve a high quality menu, especially the beautiful seafood (my favourite is of course the grilled calamari), but also very good lamb chops/leg. Their service is prompt and efficient; they make sure you are taken care of and always give you a complimentary Greek cake for the table on the house - have some coffees after your meal and unwind. Make a reservation as it might get busy especially in summertime if you want a seat inside for a larger party.

Address: 407 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: I went for dinner around 630pm and it wasn't immediately busy but it didn't take long to become a full restaurant. We ordered the grilled calamari dinner, a large skewer and Saganaki. All of which was great. The portions were generous and we were pleasantly surprised. They gave us honey cake on the house as well which was a nice end to the meal. The sweetness level was exactly as you would hope it to be

Address: 100 Front Street W Fairmont Royal York Toronto, ON M5J 1E3 Canada
Review: Such a classy place. Beautiful ambience. Amazing service. Have tried number of cocktails and there is always more to these cocktails, you can't judge it with one sip. A place to bring your date if you want to impress her. It's inside Fairmont hotel. We always have desserts here and the best is Bourbon Creme Brulle, it's huge and can be shared by 2.

Address: 100 Front Street W Fairmont Royal York Toronto, ON M5J 1E3 Canada
Review:
Went for drinks. The bar is really nice with a great ambience. Our server Joe was very nice and suggested great options.
We didn’t have any food.
The drinks were well made, delicious and creative.

Address: 100 Front Street W Fairmont Royal York Toronto, ON M5J 1E3 Canada
Review: I had the amore cocktail with tequila and that was the best drink I tried from what we ordered. The espresso martini was okay, I’ve tried a better one from Voodoo cocktail bar. Our server, Brie(?), was excellent! She was attentive and made our stay worthwhile. This is a nice bar to catchup with friends or with your date.

Address: 100 Front Street W Fairmont Royal York Toronto, ON M5J 1E3 Canada
Review: This is a very classy place. I visited this place along with some of my colleagues. The person attending our table was really nice and attentive. He made several recommendations and suggestions which turned out to be great.

Address: 100 Front Street W Fairmont Royal York Toronto, ON M5J 1E3 Canada
Review: I loved this bar. The bartenders, especially Aoife, are skilled and really nice and fun. Great vibes and good cocktails. I also ate dinner here three times and enjoyed all three meals very much - the Caesar with shrimp, the burger, and the pasta were all really good. Pricey but worth it. No complaints from me, I’ll be back!

Address: 2867 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9 Canada
Review: We had a really great experience there. No reservations for small parties and walk ins only. We didn’t wait too long before seated at the bar. Overall, we were happy with meal, drinks and ambiance, but they were far from 5 star rating. Here is my break down on the food we tried: calamari was a bit saggy but flavorful. Toad in the hole was probably the best, fresh sausage and pudding batter. Sheppard’s pie was so-so, if you like strong lamb flavor you’d probably like the pie, to me it lacked proper seasoning and spices. Panna cotta was standard, Negroni was very aromatic with complex profile( loved it). The menus were awful, degraded and mostly torn pieces ( I get the hip vibe but still menus should be reprinted) . Serve staff were not auper friendly, rushed , and a bit aggressive in taking orders. Some diversity training for them would be beneficial.

Address: 2867 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9 Canada
Review:
Absolutely gorgeous and fantastic vibes in this place!

I didn't know what to expect but it still trumped my expectations.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for arguably the best pub atmosphere, food and drinks.

Below you can see two cocktails and their regular pepperoni pizza.

(Long Island wasn't technically on the list but they served it!)

Address: 2867 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9 Canada
Review:
This was my second time visiting this location after having just a few cocktails the first time, my boyfriend and I went back a second time for dinner and more drinks. I'm very happy we did!

Here are the Five S's for anyone wanting to visit this excellent restaurant in future (for dinner or just for drinks):

Space: A very unique space with a "seat yourself" policy, meaning you can find the perfect little snug hideaway at the back, or choose to sit at the bar or the high-top tables with a great view of the unique and appealing interior. A very eclectic mix of random memorabilia, antiques, whisky bottles and a very charming bar with an excellent selection of spirits

Seasoning/spice: We started with two martinis which were very well made, then went on to have the "Chinatown" calamari which was delicious and well-seasoned. The main courses were a Toad In The Hole which consisted of a huge, home-made Yorkshire pudding, a delicious Cumberland Sausage which was actually a traditionally made British sausage which was surprising and delicious. I had a Lamb Shepherd's Pie which was delicious, with a light and fluffy mashed potato, seasoned well with a very tasty, meat filled Lamb part. Fantastic. We finished with more cocktails and aged Whisky (they have an amazing selection of Whisky).

Size: Delicious food and the right size. Not too big and not too small.

Spend: The prices are worth it for the quality of the food. You won't be disappointed. Typically main courses are around $20-25 but again the quality of ingredients means it's totally worth it.

Service: Very good service, attentive staff who are knowledgeable about the drinks and the dishes.

Address: 2867 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9 Canada
Review:
This is my favourite bar in the Junction area.  The place is small and seemingly crowded but very cosy and lively. I feel that sitting so close with other people adds to the intimate atmosphere.
The food is fantastic, the craft beer selection is great and the Dollar-ish Oyster Tuesdays are a hit as always.

Address: 2867 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9 Canada
Review:
This is such a new discovery for me in the Junction/ Dundas area. The place is easy to be missed, but you have to check them out and try their amazing pizzas, their Fish & Chips plus their beers and cider (the grape open is amazing) on tap.
Nice environment and beautiful people behind this business 🥰

Address: 3353 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2M6 Canada
Review: 4.45 | Delicious food, awesome service, nice atmosphere. All the dishes we had were very good, including even the bread. Wait staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating of any needs (also great singers for happy birthday). Definitely recommend stopping here!

Address: 3353 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2M6 Canada
Review:
My entire dinner experience was top notch!

Food very tasty and made with care. I loved the cozy vibe. Most of all the waiter went above and beyond. He is what customer service should be! Approachable, helpful, hilarious, and so much more. I felt like I knew him for years.

This is also a family owned restaurant which makes it even more special. I will be back!

Address: 3353 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2M6 Canada
Review:
Recently we had the pleasure of Summerlicious dining. Every dish we ordered was prepared with utmost care and precision, bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. From the appetizers to the main course and dessert, each bite was a delightful journey for the taste buds. It was a true culinary masterpiece...

Equally impressive was the exceptional service we received from the staff. From the moment we stepped through the door, we were greeted with warm smiles and genuine hospitality. We were feeling like valued guests throughout our visit.

Thank you, The Monkey Bar!

Address: 3353 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2M6 Canada
Review: We were excited to try this place when we browsed their menu and they came through. The braised lamb shank and grilled Atlantic char were succulent and cooked to perfection. The wait staff were friendly and very attentive.

Address: 3353 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2M6 Canada
Review: The food is SO good! Went for my birthday and they were amazing. The host (chef's son) is lovely and made our experience so fun (personalized drinks, bday song, and card). The food took about 30min to come out, but honestly, it was worth the wait. Everyone at the table raved about their dish (even the vegan meal). They were able to host two large groups and both servers were attentive. We wish the ac was a bit better, but truly, there is little to fault about this place. We would definitely go back!

Address: 1794 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 1H8 Canada
Review: Delicious local pub serving above average food. If you come here just for the Brussels sprouts, you won’t regret it. Pizza and salad was delicious. Our friend ordered the smoked chicken and loved it! Will come back again!

Address: 1794 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 1H8 Canada
Review: Great east end restaurant with a spacish bar and welcoming interior with a diverse menu sourcing many ingredients locally. The mussels were particularly impressive with a very flavourful sauce and fresh bread. Overall everything was great and the menu is certain to offer something for all palates and diets.

Address: 1794 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 1H8 Canada
Review: Just had dinner here. Everything was great aside from the service whic was slow. Cold drinks, great atmosphere and food.

Address: 1794 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 1H8 Canada
Review: Went there for dinner for my friend’s bday. We did order the burger. It was very good. The waitress and the waiter were very friendly. They have a nice collection of beers. The feel of the place is very nice - cozy and warm. It has a long bar nice wooden feel. I have moved to the neighbourhood about a year ago and it was the first time I go there. Definitely will return soon.

Address: 1794 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 1H8 Canada
Review: Nice decor, craft beer bar and excellent food. Well done!

Address: 2140 Yonge Street North York, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: Had a wonderful brunch here. The back patio has a great vibe. Their espresso martinis is 10/10. Got the fried chicken and waffles and loved the gravy they have drizzled. 10/10

Address: 2140 Yonge Street North York, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review:
Ordered French toasts, they looked great on the pictures, but I would not order them again.
System of booking is weird. While most of the places use OpenTable , they ask you to message in instagram, what about the people who does not have it , you also can call, but no one pick up the phone. You cannot make a reservation the same day. So if you woke up on Sunday and decided to book a table, do not even try, you should know in advance that you want to have a branch at this place. We have been waiting 20 min, while 3 tables were hold and no one eat there.

Address: 2140 Yonge Street North York, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: We got there around 10am.  There was a few groups waiting for the tables, but we opted to sit at the bar which didn’t require any wait.  The service was average for what you would expect.  One thing to note is that it gets a little noisy at the bar due to the staff crushing ice.  If you care to talk to your friends you may want to avoid the bar.  As for the food, everything came out as expected.  We really enjoyed the Smoked Salmon Benedict and the Brunch Poutine was pretty tasty.  It was a good experience and we were already talking about going back to try other things on the menu.

Address: 2140 Yonge Street North York, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review:
The food is overpriced, I would say. But, we liked its freshness and taste. The portion can be much larger than this. At least, It was not sufficient for me. I suggest reservations as it may become super crowded.
I would recommend the place if you are not that hungry or they balance the portion/price. For instance, for two Sunnyside up eggs, a few fried potatoes, a slice of toast bread and, a few selected fruits, and a few bacon strips (good morning plate) was $18. It had a good variety of freshly made stuff but just a sample of each.

Address: 2140 Yonge Street North York, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: Recommend their pancakes. Eggbenedict was good as well but not extraordinary. Servers are very friendly and cozy atmosphere to have a relaxing brunch under sunshine. Must seat their patio!

Address: 5 Coady Avenue Toronto, ON M4M 2Y9 Canada
Review: A sweet spot for good price food. We got the tacos 🌮 and the pulled pork box. And a pop. It was like 30 dollars. Also the outside seating is excellent!! The service was dope and they played some amazing tracks in there!!

Address: 5 Coady Avenue Toronto, ON M4M 2Y9 Canada
Review:
Really great food experience, the flavour is outstanding and exciting! I tried the steak box and it is beyond amazing. The eggs, the steak, the fries. Everything tasted wonderful together.

Definitely a must try, put it on your list.

Address: 5 Coady Avenue Toronto, ON M4M 2Y9 Canada
Review:
2023 June 4★
TACOS 11.50
3 house-made hardshell tacos with your choice of steak, pork, chorizo, veg or vegan. Finished with their house hot sauce, jalapeno-lime crema, mashed avocado, refried beans, fresh salsa,
and shredded cheddar. The Tacos are great. The hard shell is crunchy and flavorful.
A definite recommend.

CORN CHIPS with cheese. 7.95 + 2.00
House made tortilla chips served with mashed avocado, tomato-cilantro salsa, house hot sauce and crema.
The corn chips were amazing in the Tacos that I had to get them separately. Though the shredded cheese was a tad expensive given the amount that was on it. The avocado was ok. The salsa was ok. The hot sauce was good.
Would recommend but skip the cheese.

COMPLETO POUTINE 10.95 + $4 for the chorizo.
Hand cut fries, refried beans, and aged cheddar, topped with house made salsa. Served with mashed avocado and their hot sauce and crema.
This was ok. Their chorizo was more like a meat patty.  Not that it wasn't good, but the overall was so so.
Would pass next time.

Very Limited indoor seating about 3. Outdoor seating for about 14.

Address: 5 Coady Avenue Toronto, ON M4M 2Y9 Canada
Review: My coworker recommended this place. Especially tacos!!! So, we went there. It’s a small take away place. We ordered steak and pork tacos. Portion sizes were pretty good for the price!! The fries were also so really really good. Now, it’s one of our fav places to get food!  We will definitely go back!

Address: 5 Coady Avenue Toronto, ON M4M 2Y9 Canada
Review:
If you have the choice, pick their Broadview location over this one unless you just want takeout. This is a little hole in the wall take-away spot. Not an actual restaurant, as we learned. I really thought it would be as amazing as their other location.

The food was just as good, although the menu is much smaller, but it loses a lot of points for ambience and seating. You don't really have a choice but to sit outside on their tiny little patio sets. There is technically minimal indoor seating but the music is so loud, and the cooking too, that I can't imagine it would be great if you're looking to eat and chat with a friend. Eating outside on the sidewalk in chilly fall weather really killed the vibe for us. So, just be aware you'll have to bundle up now. It's either wasps or cold.

They have almost no selection of drinks, and no hot drinks. Not awesome when you're eating outside and it's autumn...

The staff was super friendly and helpful however.

As a takeout spot? 4.5 stars. As a dine-in (outside), it's only 3 as it's just okay. Nothing bad, but also not great. Still delicious food.

Also, if you're a woman (or man) looking for a husband, hang out here for a while ;) In the whole time we sat here, it was ALL men coming in. Only one other woman with her boyfriend. Good luck, single ladies!

Address: 337 Broadview Ave Toronto, ON M4M 2H1 Canada
Review:
If you want the best-tasting sandwich in Toronto, come to Completo. The beer on tap is barely cold and does not taste good but let me tell you, their sandwiches are the best! The Classic Churrasco sandwich will blow your socks off. Add a friend egg over easy and enjoy! Seriously, no other sandwich place in Toronto beats their Classic Churrasco sandwich IMHO.

The service was great. The Brazilian lady working there is friendly and courteous.

The outdoor patio furniture is very basic though. They should invest in nicer outdoor patio furniture. And please, get better-tasting beer on tap. Oh yeah, and make it colder. You serve barely cold beer. On a hot summer day, I want to enjoy a pint of ice cold beer, not barely cold beer. Ask the Brazilian lady working there how cold the beer they serve in Brazil is. It's ice cold, the way it should be, not barely cold like most places in Toronto serve it. Anyway, my rant is over. Go to Completo and enjoy the best sandwich ever!

Address: 337 Broadview Ave Toronto, ON M4M 2H1 Canada
Review:
Trying this location for the first time on a Tuesday evening at around 8:45PM. I've been to the other location in Leslieville and this place also did not disappoint. I ordered the box and the tacos which came to be about $30 tax included. Food was made fresh to order and came in good portions. Although it's quite greasy in general, it's still bomb.

Would recommend and come back.

Address: 337 Broadview Ave Toronto, ON M4M 2H1 Canada
Review: The food here tastes great! Their steak classic churrasco tasted amazing and the fries were well seasoned. Their oak latte was also just sweet enough but not too sweet to actually drown out the drink. I had already made up my mind on what I was planning to order because I looked up the menu online but there are also some daily specials that I might try and grab another time.

Address: 337 Broadview Ave Toronto, ON M4M 2H1 Canada
Review: One of the best Latin restaurants in the city! Usually not a big fan of hard shell tacos but they just do it right. Stuffed with huge chunks of meat, other fillings and hot sauce. Good selection of desserts - Bolas were so fluffy and sweet. My friends also swore by their flan and sandwiches! It is located only minutes away from Riverdale by foot so it makes a great picnic food too 😊

Address: 337 Broadview Ave Toronto, ON M4M 2H1 Canada
Review:
😇🤤🤤🤤🥰

These are
: the Classic Churrasco sandwich (looks messy from the inside, but it's filled to the brim)
: & goat fries

TIP for spice 🔥 level
: There are 2 spice levels to choose from for the sandwich, medium & spicy. I chose the latter. If you think you can tolerate the heat, go for it. It complements everything 🤤

Address: 672A St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B1 Canada
Review: The food here might be up to taste (my bf loved his lamb dish, I can only finish half of my zucchini). But this place no doubt has one of the best atmosphere among restaurants I've been too. The furniture, decoration, art pieces, utensils and music all came together so nicely for not just a delightful meal, but a delightful experience.

Address: 672A St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B1 Canada
Review:
Been to this place many times, for various occasions.

The food is great - whether it’s for dinner, lunch or as of recently brunch. Great presentation, very similar to more high end Iranian restaurants in Iran. Variety of options on the menu from kebabs to stews to small platters for share.

Very happy with their recent brunch addition to the menu. Delicious and reasonably price. Checkout the videos and photos from last year and this year.

Address: 672A St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B1 Canada
Review:
Initially, we were seated quite close to another table. However, one of them offered to rearrange some furniture and move our table further apart from the table next to us, which I really appreciated. The service was quite relaxed (or because they were busy, we had to flag someone down a couple of times), and so, we didn't feel rushed until they had another reservation a couple hours later.

Generous portion sizes for the price and great balance of flavours - I could easily share or have enough left over for another meal. The lamb skewer was tender and moist, while the lamb stew had a good amount of bite-sized lamb and aromatic and flavourful rice. While I would order a skewer or stew dish again, the dessert pastry roll seemed smaller than expected, compared to the mains, and could've had more pistachio taste.

Address: 672A St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B1 Canada
Review: What a gem! I went late on a rainy Sunday night and it was full and vibrant. The waitress was very kind and helpful with the menu. I had a delicious dish of stewed chicken with rice and a bright salad of greens, pomegranate, ground walnuts and white cheese. The flavours were tangy and complex and really don’t need as much salt as chef is using. Definitely will return with friends to sample more items. A welcoming oasis on an otherwise dull stretch of St Clair.

Address: 672A St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B1 Canada
Review: Went there for Summerlicious. Food was very good (especially liked Mirza Ghasemi, Ghormeh Sabzi and ice in Paradis). For $44 i found the quantity in each dish to be very generous, service was perfect/friendly.  Had better baklava but all the rest was spot on.

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review: I’ve been coming to Jerusalem for as long as I remember. Whether it was to celebrate birthdays, celebrate Easter or just to have a dinner with the family. The food has always been delicious. Sometimes the tabouli is missing some lemon, but overall it’s good. The falafel here is probably my favourite and the fried eggplant. The dinner for two is such a good deal and there’s a lot of food. You definitely get your moneys worth. Sometimes service is a bit a slow, but overall the servers are very nice.

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review:
Food was good.  We tried the Taste of Jerusalem dinner for two.   Had yummy eggplant,  hummus, baba ganoush.  The chicken and lamb skewers were good as well.  The dinner for two could really be a dinner for 2 and a child.
Good service.  Good atmosphere.

The menu you see now has actually increased in price.   The dinner for two was $50 now its $54.  A glass of wine was $14
Total all in with tax and 15% tips was about $80.   A bit pricey.   But gotta try it at least once.

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review:
This restaurant is now on my list of favorites in Toronto.
Clean and calm, with classical music in the background.  The decor is pretty and simple, which is a charm. As
We ordered the plate for two and we had enough, the plates were big and everything was delicious.  We also tried a different beer, I recommend it.
My experience was 100% positive.  I will definitely come back, and for sure very hungry.

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review:
I ordered the kafta plate with an extra skewer. The meat was very good, although underseasoned. I believe the intention was that the diner is supposed to add salt and pepper to their taste, so I don't really mind it. The fries and rice were not bad, the tahini was very good, the bread was also very good.
The service was good enough. I wasn't pampered, I also wasn't ignored.
The decor is pretty nice, floors were clean, table wasn't sticky, and oddly enough the dining area had no smell at all which for the most part is a good thing, although I wondered why the restaurant didnt even smell of the food they make.
I would come back again to try the other dishes.

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review: Love their food! Great shish tawoo and lamb kebabs!

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review: I’ve been coming to Jerusalem for as long as I remember. Whether it was to celebrate birthdays, celebrate Easter or just to have a dinner with the family. The food has always been delicious. Sometimes the tabouli is missing some lemon, but overall it’s good. The falafel here is probably my favourite and the fried eggplant. The dinner for two is such a good deal and there’s a lot of food. You definitely get your moneys worth. Sometimes service is a bit a slow, but overall the servers are very nice.

Review:

The menu you see now has actually increased in price.   The dinner for two was $50 now its $54.  A glass of wine was $14

I would come back again to try the other dishes.

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review: Love their food! Great shish tawoo and lamb kebabs!

Address: 1991 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
This is my favourite Indian restaurant in Toronto. The staff are friendly, food is delicious, and the menu is robust so you’ll never be bored as there are always news things to try!

I’ve done both dine in and take out- both are great.

What I’ve tried that I’ve loved:
- Bhindi Rajsthani - deep fried okra side dish- I’ve never had anything like it. This dish was recommended by the owner and was so crispy and delicious.

- Stuffed spinach paneer - so unique and flavourful

- Briyani - very unique in its presentation with a piece of pita on top of it

- Lasooni Dhaniya

Address: 1991 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review: Great Indian restaurant. Food is quite good and can be adjusted to your spice tolerance. The servers are very nice and informative. Walked us through the entire menu and had good recommendations. We ordered the Stuffed Mushrooms, Lamb Chops Burra, Lamb Rogan Josh, Dal Makhni, Chicken Dum Biryani, and Pudina Paranthas. Lamb chops Burra, Dal Makhni, and Chicken Biryani were really good. Lamb Rogan Josh was their own version and was decent. Worth a visit if you like Indian food.

Address: 1991 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
The vibes are so cool there…the music, slogans, paintings and of-course food everything is just great.
Bhindi Rajasthani deserves a special shout-out.

Address: 1991 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review: The food here is mindblowingly good. The lamb was succulent and mouthwatering. The butter chicken outshines all other Indian restaurants in Toronto. 100/10! If you haven’t tried this spot, you are missing out and that needs to change.

Address: 1991 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
Khau Gully is one of the finest restaurants with Indian Cuisine. Loved the food and tase is really very mesmerizing. It reminded me of the food taste from back home.Loved the food and the servers were also very nice. We tried the vegetarian appetizer platter & fried okras which were really tasty.

We also loved the Kofta Sham Savere and Lasuni Dhaniya Paneer in the main course. Both of these sabjis were up to the mark.A gem of a eatery hidden in Eglinton and Yonge!! Food is delicious, just perfect. They accommodate customers wish as per their choice. We went for our friends Birthday and they gave us the best service as well as served awesome food!! Thank you Khau Gully as we had a memorable and tasty experience.

Highly Recommended!!!

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review: The restaurant was able to place a reservation for a group of friends and family a week earlier. The staff was very accommodating, and always checked in to see if we needed anything else. Their food was very generous in portions and it was incredibly tasty. Overall great service and good! One of the best Thai spots in Toronto! 👍

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review:
We LOVE Thairoomgrand!! We actually come here many times and they are ALWAYS giving us best service, best food, and reasonable prices.

The staffs are super friendly! They are checking how we are doing. The food is DELICIOUS! Good portions and the prices is really reasonable too considering the portion that is so big.

Two of us came and we spent around $60 for 2 main courses and 1 appetizer and even that, we never finish our food so we can take out and eat that for tomorrow lunch. That’s how big the portion is.

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review: Came here in July and it was the best Thai restaurant I've been to in Toronto! The menu has a great selection (more options than many other restaurants) and the dishes are thoughtfully presented despite the affordable prices. The food had generous portions and was very flavourful - especially the tom yum soup. Also would highly recommend the mango dessert - so beautiful and delicious! Not to mention a tastefully decorated ambiance and friendly service. Would love to come back!

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review: This cozy place on Eglinton has a decent not too spicy Kao Soi with a different presentation than I've had before and included a hard-boiled egg, which was tasty albeit odd. We also had the equally yummy Malay Curry. The flavors of the two dishes were so similar that after a while we couldn't tell them apart. The Holy Basil Beef was nice only absent a distinct a Basil scent or flavor. Would not recommend. The amount of rice with that dish was shocking, although beautifully presented. The place was empty except for some takeaway pickups; it was midweek so not too surprising. Our server was delightful and even recommended another Thai restaurant in the area we should try.

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review:
We had a great time dining here. We ordered 2 main dishes and an appetizer. Food portioning was generous even for its price thats leaning towards expensive.

We ordered cashew nut chicken and beef massaman curry for the main dish and both were great. The chicken and beef were not chewy at all.

For the appetizer we had cripsy fried tofu. Portion was huge, its firm tofu nice and crispy but flavour wise, quite bland. The peanut sauce is bland and too chunky. But still a good shareable.

We also had coconut rice for the sides. My girlfriend was shook (lol) when she first saw the coconut rice were served with rainbow sprinkles on top. The texture was rice pudding like, too mushy, and tasted a little too sweet not umami.

Overall with a great service provided and for the price we paid, it was a pleasant evening spent.

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review: The restaurant was able to place a reservation for a group of friends and family a week earlier. The staff was very accommodating, and always checked in to see if we needed anything else. Their food was very generous in portions and it was incredibly tasty. Overall great service and good! One of the best Thai spots in Toronto! 👍

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review:
We LOVE Thairoomgrand!! We actually come here many times and they are ALWAYS giving us best service, best food, and reasonable prices.

The staffs are super friendly! They are checking how we are doing. The food is DELICIOUS! Good portions and the prices is really reasonable too considering the portion that is so big.

Overall with a great service provided and for the price we paid, it was a pleasant evening spent.

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: Service was quick and staff are friendly. We ordered chicken and lamb skewers, braised beef noodle soup and chicken cutlet(or filet?) noodle soup. I’d say that the lamb skewers were my favourite, it was so tender and flavourful, perfectly seasoned. I knocked off a star because the soup/broth had no flavour to it. I ordered extra spicy because I love spicy foods and although it looks spicy, it wasn’t at all. Didn’t even get a little kick of spiciness which was a bit disappointing because I expected it to be spicy. Other than that, it was very filling and we really enjoyed our time dining here!

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: Very tasty food and cozy environment.  Read the reviews and decided to go and try the food.  The portion is not small, enough to fill up . Thanks to the staff who served us.  They are very kind and welcoming.  The guy gave us a fork so that we would not suffer with chopsticks :)

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
The portion is ridiculous- great for sharing for sure. The lame on a stick is delicious. The best thing there. I might go back for something else and try their other noodles. The non caffeinated drinks are also yummy. Great service.

Their noodle though is good but flavour wise is not very flavourful but maybe I should have ask them for something else on the side.

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: I came here because of a tiktok, the food was really good. The taste of the Dan Dan noodles were really good, not as spicy as I thought they would be. The beef noodle soup tasted like home, the beef was so tender, however I got the flat noodles which were too thick for my liking, but that was my fault. Overall, great service and the food was really nice!

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
Delicious food! Had the stir fried noodles with chicken (thick round noodle size) and it was delicious. Nice, large portion and the service was quick - I got take out and had the food within 10 mins.
Will definitely visit again.

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: Service was quick and staff are friendly. We ordered chicken and lamb skewers, braised beef noodle soup and chicken cutlet(or filet?) noodle soup. I’d say that the lamb skewers were my favourite, it was so tender and flavourful, perfectly seasoned. I knocked off a star because the soup/broth had no flavour to it. I ordered extra spicy because I love spicy foods and although it looks spicy, it wasn’t at all. Didn’t even get a little kick of spiciness which was a bit disappointing because I expected it to be spicy. Other than that, it was very filling and we really enjoyed our time dining here!

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: Very tasty food and cozy environment.  Read the reviews and decided to go and try the food.  The portion is not small, enough to fill up . Thanks to the staff who served us.  They are very kind and welcoming.  The guy gave us a fork so that we would not suffer with chopsticks :)

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
The portion is ridiculous- great for sharing for sure. The lame on a stick is delicious. The best thing there. I might go back for something else and try their other noodles. The non caffeinated drinks are also yummy. Great service.

Their noodle though is good but flavour wise is not very flavourful but maybe I should have ask them for something else on the side.

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: I came here because of a tiktok, the food was really good. The taste of the Dan Dan noodles were really good, not as spicy as I thought they would be. The beef noodle soup tasted like home, the beef was so tender, however I got the flat noodles which were too thick for my liking, but that was my fault. Overall, great service and the food was really nice!

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
Delicious food! Had the stir fried noodles with chicken (thick round noodle size) and it was delicious. Nice, large portion and the service was quick - I got take out and had the food within 10 mins.
Will definitely visit again.

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
I really wanted to like this place. Maybe i ordered the wrong thing. It was average. There were a few things I did not enjoy. But first, the restaurant itself was clean and bright. The tables small and enough for 2 people and two bowls of noodles. The service was good and i liked their bubble tea.
I ordered the pickled vegetable beef noodle soup. The beef was so overcooked it was all crumbling in my soup and there wasnt a lot. The noodle portion sizes were crazy big. CRAZY BIG. There were so many noodles in there it felt like the more I ate, the more noodles there were. The flavour was alright.
It was definitely something that can be shared among two people or they could even have a size small.

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
9.6/10
One of the best noodle dishes in the city for sure!!! Please visit the restaurant as well as it will enhance your experience.

Ordered through Doordash before once and enjoyed the beef noodles. This time tried the Braised Beef Noodles and it was delicious!! Reheated the broth but that was due to my dasher not putting in a heating bag. 9.2/10

Reply to owner: Hello! I just visited the restaurant and the noodles were absolutely delectable!! It's a different experience eating them fresh!! The waitress with glasses was very polite and accommodating. My impression has become even better now! 9.6/10
Theirs no such thing as a perfect dish, but this is close. 🙏🏽🙏🏽🤤🤤

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
This place is beyond amazing. I can’t put into words the noodles I had. I know it seems very menial however these noodles are some of the best noodles I’ve ever had! The combination of the love put into the hand pulling done by the chef and the seemingly handful yet carefully chosen spices blend perfectly into a medley of amazing taste!

I can’t wait to go back and try more of their food! 😭😍

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review: I have been here twice so far and have thoroughly enjoyed the food both the times! I would 100% recommend their braised beef noodle, stir fried chicken noodle and lamb skewers! The server Jay was so helpful and patient with our questions. Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant.

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
For the price you are paying you get a huge quantity! I ordered the braised beef noodle soup and you can choose your spice level. The beef was very tender and the broth very flavorful!

I also ordered the bean noodle which I thought was jellyfish at first. Really delicious appetizer! I think it was topped with chili oil.

Restaurant is relatively small but humble and I really enjoyed my meal! Fair price point for flavor and quantity. Definitely appreciated that!

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review:
The service was not good. The attendant didn't offer or explained anything about the order. They cleaned out table with a smelly piece of cloth, splashing us in the meantime. They didn't dry the table properly. We have to ask for tea cup to be changed twice, as it was dirty with pink lipstick. The pottery was old. It wasn't worth the money spent.
The place has a very nice view.

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review: I love the atmosphere, perfect location however our food was burnt (it didn’t taste bad) and they don’t do pitchers :( but the service was good!

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review:
Sunnyside Cafe a summer must visit. Good, service and view the best.  Try the Mexican bulldog drink.
Yummy.

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review: Nice outdoor place to eat near the humber bay park. Interesting drinks and very tasty pizza. I suggest to try the upside down beer drink in the photo.

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting Sunnyside Pavilion, a charming spot for frozen drinks by the lake, and I must say that my experience was absolutely delightful, thanks to the exceptional service provided by Maddy, our server. From the moment we arrived, Maddy's warm smile and friendly demeanor set the tone for a memorable outing.

Maddy's attentiveness and professionalism were truly remarkable. She went above and beyond to ensure that our visit was enjoyable and that we had everything we needed. Her knowledge of the menu and drink offerings was extensive, and she took the time to explain each option in detail, making thoughtful recommendations based on our preferences. Her genuine passion for her work was evident, and it added an extra layer of enjoyment to our time at Sunnyside Pavilion.

Not only was Maddy prompt in taking our orders, but she also ensured that our drinks and food were delivered promptly and in perfect condition. Despite the bustling atmosphere, she managed to handle multiple tables with ease, always making sure to check in on us to ensure we were satisfied with our experience.

Sunnyside Pavilion's location by the lake is simply enchanting. The serene view, coupled with the delightful summer vibes, creates a picturesque backdrop for enjoying frozen drinks. Maddy's cheerful presence added to the overall ambiance, making us feel even more immersed in the carefree atmosphere.

Now, let's talk about the drinks! Sunnyside Pavilion's frozen drink selection is nothing short of fantastic. From fruity blends to refreshing classics, there was something to satisfy every palate. Thanks to Maddy's expertise, we were able to sample a variety of frozen concoctions, each one more delicious than the last. The presentation was impeccable, and the flavors were perfectly balanced. It was truly a treat for the taste buds.

In addition to the exceptional service and delectable drinks, Sunnyside Pavilion offers a delightful space to relax and unwind. The outdoor seating area is comfortable and offers a great view of the lake, allowing guests to soak up the sunshine while enjoying their drinks. The overall atmosphere is inviting, making it an ideal spot to gather with friends or spend a leisurely afternoon by the water.

In conclusion, my experience at Sunnyside Pavilion, thanks to the attentive service provided by Maddy, was absolutely outstanding. Her genuine hospitality, knowledge, and professionalism truly elevated our visit and made it an unforgettable one. I highly recommend visiting Sunnyside Pavilion and having the pleasure of Maddy's excellent service. You're in for a delightful experience by the lake!

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review:
The service was not good. The attendant didn't offer or explained anything about the order. They cleaned out table with a smelly piece of cloth, splashing us in the meantime. They didn't dry the table properly. We have to ask for tea cup to be changed twice, as it was dirty with pink lipstick. The pottery was old. It wasn't worth the money spent.
The place has a very nice view.

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review:
We had a fantastic meal here! The standouts were the scallops, the deer cavatelli, and the boar chop. The boar chop was actually one of my favourite dishes I’ve had at any restaurant in the city! So juicy and flavourful.
The service from Jade was awesome as well. She was so sweet and attentive. We will be back!

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review: Really great dining experience here. Drink selection was eclectic and great! The servers were very friendly and helpful. My friend ordered the venison while I had the duck. The plating was beautifully presented. I will say my duck was a bit overcooked to my liking. But overall, the experience was great, would definitely come back.

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review:
Antler is the restaurant that I owe my entire culinary journey to. I first came here during the tail end of my university days. I lived off free campus food, cheap pizza, and late night shawarmas up until this point. Antler was the very first high end restaurant that I visited. A lot of memories were made here, my first date, my first time having game meat, an Amazon based collaboration dinner with DOM. I’ve been making visits ever since.

You really can’t go wrong with any of Chef Hunter’s dishes, they are all phenomenal and (in my humble opinion) are well deserving of a Michelin star. Antler has the identity, the culinary inventiveness, the atmosphere, and the service that is expected of a Michelin restaurant. This restaurant will be a forever staple in Toronto and I highly recommend that you dine here when the chance arrives!

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review:
We sat at the kitchen table. For those who like cooking it’s a perfect spot to see everything that the chef is doing!
The food was good, yes, but we had higher expectations. The food was missing a little bit of “peps”. We did not got any dessert as we were slightly disappointed.
It is still a nice place, a fancy stakehouse.

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review: Staff were very polite and friendly,the owners and staff care about your experience and it shows, I didn't drive 5 hrs to Toronto just to east here, but if I had I would not have been disappointed. The pan seared duck was phenomenal to say the least. If you don't try this place you are missing out big time.

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review:
We had a fantastic meal here! The standouts were the scallops, the deer cavatelli, and the boar chop. The boar chop was actually one of my favourite dishes I’ve had at any restaurant in the city! So juicy and flavourful.
The service from Jade was awesome as well. She was so sweet and attentive. We will be back!

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review: Staff were very polite and friendly,the owners and staff care about your experience and it shows, I didn't drive 5 hrs to Toronto just to east here, but if I had I would not have been disappointed. The pan seared duck was phenomenal to say the least. If you don't try this place you are missing out big time.

Address: 1545 Eglinton Avenue  W Toronto, ON M6E 2G8 Canada
Review:
Doesn't get better than this for Jamaican food. Stopped by for a midnight snack and got a small jerk chicken and a small jerk pork to share. With oxtail gravy, of course and goes without saying, rice and peas. Also got a salt fish fritter. Everything was. Just. so. Amazingly. Good. You just have to walk by the place and smell the smoke coming off the grill to know what the food tastes like.
Ate in the car cause we couldn't wait. Inhaled it. Then I started getting mad thinking about the times I wasted money getting Jamaican food from places that are subpar.
I'm already thinking about when we can go back..

Address: 1545 Eglinton Avenue  W Toronto, ON M6E 2G8 Canada
Review: Best Jamaican bbq that you can get!!! They have jerk chicken, jerk pork, rice and peas, coleslaw, fried fish (snapper or saltfish) topped with onions and carrots, soup, dumplings, festivals, and more. But most importantly they have sauce and not afraid to give it! Overall the food is very flavorful. Their customer service is great and that's what you want from a business, so you can keep coming back!!The line was long before opening but after that it was moving. Hope this small business will always stay, despite all the construction.

Address: 1545 Eglinton Avenue  W Toronto, ON M6E 2G8 Canada
Review:
The smoke from the BBQ and the line up could be seen from a distance. One table was there to cut up the meat and the grill with pork was on the other side. CASH only at this restaurant.  If you don't have there's an ATM inside, the fee is $2.50.
They have a variety of items on the menu, there's no menu by the way. Just ask...there was fried chicken on the left and dumplings, festival, fried plantain  escovitch fish on the other side.  They have oxtail the night we visited.  You can order the small for $9, with or without rice; #2 meat only or #3 large meat and rice and peas.  Ask for gravy on the rice and get BBQ sauce on your meat.  You got to go outside once you ordered for the BBQ items.  It is worth the drive to Oakwood and Eglinton and worth the wait.

Address: 1545 Eglinton Avenue  W Toronto, ON M6E 2G8 Canada
Review: They are providing best quality food instant really appreciate to their hard work

Address: 1545 Eglinton Avenue  W Toronto, ON M6E 2G8 Canada
Review: Jerk Chicken was juicy smokey full of flavour finger licking good. Jerk pork also juicy and delicious. Rice and peas and festivals were on point too.  Will be ordering regularly

Address: 3070 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Z7 Canada
Review: I have been here a few times and the quality of food and service is consistent. Everything on the menu is really good and won’t disappoint. Their chicken & waffle sandwich is a must try and don’t miss out on their home fries. I also enjoy their eggs Benedict. Only downside is that they can get pretty long line ups but it is worth the wait.

Address: 3070 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Z7 Canada
Review:
Very popular for brunch so if you haven't reserved be prepared for as much as an hour long wait, but usually you'll be able to be seated in less than 30 minutes.

I had the Strawberry Johnny Pancakes (very good, very filling) but got a look at their Benny and it looked hearty as well.

Our server was very pleasant - attentive without being overbearing - and all the clientele seemed to be families or dating couples... so if you're looking for a good brunch date place consider this one. Meat and vegetarian options available.

Address: 3070 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Z7 Canada
Review:
Delish!! I’ve been wanting to come here for a while now so some of my girls and I finally came in for brunch the other day and wow! The explosion of flavour was so savoury and so unexpected, I will definitely be back again.
I highly recommend their chicken and waffles, the candies jalapeños were such a nice touch as well as the jalapeño infused syrup. My mouth is watering as I write this review right now 🥲🙃 10/10

Address: 3070 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Z7 Canada
Review: Very popular and tiny place makes for a loud and chaotic environment. Server's vibe was overwhelmed, at times. Having said that, the food service was quick and the food itself was really, really good! We had the Chicken and Waffles and the Special, which was a Pork Belly Benny. 👌

Address: 3070 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Z7 Canada
Review: Had a bit of a wait here but it's worth! I love the Southern brunch flare and the food was honestly too good. So flavourful and decadent! I had the brisket benny which was perfectly cooked. The brisket was fatty and tender and the home fries were so buttery, crisp and so indulgent. The staff was also very nice and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there.

Address: 280 Spadina Ave Unit M-N Toronto, ON M5T 0A1 Canada
Review: 5 stars for this restaurant.  Delicious dumplings and an unbelievable cost.  They were nice and juicy.  Be ready for long line ups due to how good they taste and the low price.  The wait isn't too long just have some patience as it's worth it.

Address: 280 Spadina Ave Unit M-N Toronto, ON M5T 0A1 Canada
Review: Looking for a reasonably-priced dumpling spot in Toronto’s Chinatown? Juicy Dumpling’s your place! I’ve heard that this place does get super busy but we were lucky enough to find seats. We ordered the pan-fried mini soup dumpling with crab and pork, pan-fried chicken dumpling and beef balls and everything was delicious. The crab and pork dumplings were a hit and definitely something we’ll try to replicate at home. They should get better microphone and speakers though because I found the cashier hard to understand. It’s a shame that their customer-facing staff seemed cold and distant at the time of our visit. Having said that, overall, we enjoyed our time here. The food here at Juicy Dumpling is excellent and I would definitely recommend them!

Address: 280 Spadina Ave Unit M-N Toronto, ON M5T 0A1 Canada
Review:
Juicy Dumplings Review

I recently visited Juicy Dumpling and had a good experience. The vegetable buns, including the one with Chinese spinach and the "mushroom" bun that turned out to be filled with green veggies, were delicious. Despite being busy, the service was friendly. Highly recommended for dumplings lovers!

Address: 280 Spadina Ave Unit M-N Toronto, ON M5T 0A1 Canada
Review: We were visiting Toronto and just had to stop by here for lunch. This place has the best soup dumplings. Once you bite into them they burst with flavors and the hot sauce they give just adds that extra kick of flavor. Super inexpensive for what you get. They have a sit down area as well. Definitely recommend to give this place a try if you are on the fence about it. When I visit again I will be back!

Address: 280 Spadina Ave Unit M-N Toronto, ON M5T 0A1 Canada
Review: While the service was average due to the self-serve setup, the dumplings at this dumpling joint were simply amazing! They were juicy, delicious, and exceeded all of my expectations. Overall, I highly recommend giving this place a try for their exceptional dumplings

Address: 2150 Yonge street Toronto, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: When expecting better you are served with best- that really happened at juicy dumplings. A very small shop a very simple atmosphere and a short menu. But worth trying all the menu items. Ordered Crispy chicken, veg dumplings, chicken pan fried dumplings, mushroom bun. All were so good. Can’t control our taste bud so got another chicken dumplings and crispy chicken. Will definitely go there again.

Address: 2150 Yonge street Toronto, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: A great place to get a quick little snack! My favourite is the pan-fried soup dumplings. They’re definitely best fresh, so I would recommend eating them as soon as you get them. The restaurant has an eating area inside, kind of like a cafeteria. There’s some street parking out front as well as some side streets to the right of the restaurant.

Address: 2150 Yonge street Toronto, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review:
Super quick, easy to order ...very reasonable prices and delicious...my 3rd time here this week...

Soup dumpling pork amd tried the pan fried crab and pork...

More soup in the steamed  ones...yummmmm

Becoming my regular meant to order the steamed pork as well...next time

Address: 2150 Yonge street Toronto, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: Insane value. Everything we ordered tasted very good and was extremely reasonably priced. I believe we ordered 5 items today and paid just shy of 25$. Food came quickly and was fresh. No complaints whatsoever.

Address: 2150 Yonge street Toronto, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: These are some of the most amazing dumplings. The value of the S1 is mind-blowing! Would totally recommend.

Address: 128 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
This is the third location of Hana Don and the first location downtown. It specializes more on premium seafood donburi so expect more on the menu if sashimi is more what you like.

It also has donburis that are found at the other locations though like chicken katsu or sous vide beef.

All the donburis are very colorful and plated nicely. A donburi can definitely fill you up but if you can eat a lot, might be better to order an appetizer too. The price ranges from $19 to $30 for a donburi depending on what you order. The most expensive one is the lobster donburi which can be upwards to $70 a donburi.

Food comes out relatively quickly but always check their Instagram for any specials that might be going on.

Address: 128 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: First time in Toronto. Chose this Japanese restaurant and the food is great! We chose 8-pc Sushi set, Beef Don and Nagoya Don. At the end we also ordered the Mucha Cheesecake and all dishes taste absolutely great! Highly recommended and will definitely come back.

Address: 128 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
Went to try Hana Don, and we ordered:
* Salmon Carpaccii
*Yuzu Ankimo - Monkfish Liver with ponzu sauce
* Toyoso Don - Sweet shrimps, Salmon, White Fish, Scallop & Ikura on premium sushi rice
*Large Premium Hana Don - Hana's top selection of seasonal seafood, which whole abalone on premium sushi rice.

The fish is very fresh and delicious and there is so many options, definitely coming back again.

Address: 128 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: Very fresh and delicious and the price is affordable.  The best high-quality seafood rice bowl in Toronto. More importantly, the service was absolutely brilliant, and friendly. A casual atmosphere and great value for what you're getting. Even got a 10% off coupon after. Will visit again!

Address: 128 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: The sushi rice was superb! All the seafood was cold and fresh. I love their chef’s choice of sushi. We enjoyed eating here. Highly recommended 🤩

Address: 1800 Sheppard Ave E Unit 2020 Toronto, ON M2J 5A7 Canada
Review: This place is actually pretty good. Portion and price about right. Selection is a bit crowded. They have dons and fried items and sushi rolls. Should focus on doing couple of things well. But no real complain about quality. Servers are polite and courteous.

Address: 1800 Sheppard Ave E Unit 2020 Toronto, ON M2J 5A7 Canada
Review:
Definitely a treat as their bowls weren't cheap, but solid. I ordered the Aburi Don to go and it was delicious. Fair portions and well seasoned rice. Came for 7pm on a Friday and there was seating available.

Would recommend and comeback

Address: 1800 Sheppard Ave E Unit 2020 Toronto, ON M2J 5A7 Canada
Review:
It was just an amazing experience having dinner at Hana Don.
Although it wasn’t planned, but I am happy I decided to go to this place for dinner.
I enjoyed all the dishes I ordered, soup, appetizers and the Sushi was really amazing.
I will definitely be coming back again whenever I will be around in the area and will also bring my family and friends over.
The staff were really amazing, very welcoming and highly friendly.

Address: 1800 Sheppard Ave E Unit 2020 Toronto, ON M2J 5A7 Canada
Review:
Great and cozy atmosphere, delicious food, friendly customer service.

The menu has good selection of food, and I have been working on trying each one.

I have been  to this place several times never disappointed.

Address: 1800 Sheppard Ave E Unit 2020 Toronto, ON M2J 5A7 Canada
Review: Pretty nice restaurant at farewell mall. Good choice for a quick meal while shopping. Flavor is decent but nothing special. Seafood is not the best. Uni is not fresh enough.

Address: 337 Oakwood Avenue Toronto, ON M6E 2V8 Canada
Review: The chuck burger was pretty great. Loved the flavors of brisket and other cuts of meat being tossed into a burger patty.

Address: 337 Oakwood Avenue Toronto, ON M6E 2V8 Canada
Review: This is such a hidden gem. The Oakwood Hardware is easily one of the best restaurants in all of Toronto, and I would even say in all of Canada. The ambiance, service, food, and total experience are simply amazing.

Address: 337 Oakwood Avenue Toronto, ON M6E 2V8 Canada
Review: I organized to host a baby shower at The Oakwood Hardware and Anne and her staff were all very accommodating, helpful and so kind. The food even went with our theme and she was so flexible with our budget. The staff and manager were so great on the day and all our guests had an amazing time!

Address: 337 Oakwood Avenue Toronto, ON M6E 2V8 Canada
Review: We came here for brunch with a couple of friends. Our reservation was at 10 AM and were the very first customer of the day. We ordered the omelette special of the day and the sausage biscuit. The former was delicious while the latter was decent. The frites were well done. We were a tad disappointed with the coffee refills. We were not informed that the refills were an additional.charge.

Address: 337 Oakwood Avenue Toronto, ON M6E 2V8 Canada
Review:
Just had one of the best burgers I've ever had in this city. Grab that OH burger and soak up this cozy, incredible place. Seriously, it's the highlight of the whole neighbourhood for me!

Friendly staff, great burger, absolutely coming back!

Restaurant_name: The Queen And Beaver Public House
Address: 35 Elm Street Toronto, ON M5G 1H1 Canada
Review: Nice spot close to the Eaton Centre to grab a drink or two. Cozy interior that reminds me of European pubs and they pour a lovely pint of Guinness here too. Didn’t try the food but the menu looks interesting. There are 2 floors as well as an upper patio. Friendly service by the bartender and front of house staff. Would recommend!

Restaurant_name: The Queen And Beaver Public House
Address: 35 Elm Street Toronto, ON M5G 1H1 Canada
Review:
I came here for the first time as a friend who had a good experience.

The bar's atmosphere was great, the decoration was also very English, and the overall style was well-established. But it is a pity that their food taste was relatively average, the portion was small, and the price was a bit too high.

There were six people in our group, and we ordered fish and chips, seafood pie and curry rice.
For the fish and chips, friends like it, and some don't because their fish is crispy on the top but soggy on the bottom. If you like crispy skin, their fish and chips might be for someone else.
I ordered the seafood pie, but it didn't surprise me. That pie was almost all mashed potatoes and little seafood in it. And it was about $30, so I didn't feel delighted.

The service was okay because it was jam-packed on weekends, and the server rarely checked on us. He talked fast and felt rushed all the time.

Overall, the food could have been more satisfying, the price was too high, and the service was average.

Restaurant_name: The Queen And Beaver Public House
Address: 35 Elm Street Toronto, ON M5G 1H1 Canada
Review:
Cute British pub with hearty delicious food. We sat on the 2nd floor which has a more casual vibe with couches, TVs and bar. Service was excellent. Drink selection had some classic UK pints. Food was British pub style with great flavours. We had the squash-chickpea-curry  pie which had a lot of great spices and flavours with a nice tangy garnish. My friend had the cod fish and chips which were perfectly cooked inside and out.

Update - came back in spring and it's still excellent! Try the pies, not too heavy and just right 👌

Restaurant_name: The Queen And Beaver Public House
Address: 35 Elm Street Toronto, ON M5G 1H1 Canada
Review: Great Pub! Love the atmosphere, wonderful space.  I had the Steak and onion pie and my wife had the Rib eye steak.   Both dishes were extraordinary!   Love the staff, very friendly.   Thanks!

Restaurant_name: The Queen And Beaver Public House
Address: 35 Elm Street Toronto, ON M5G 1H1 Canada
Review: INCREDIBLE burger, I've never tasted anything like that! Holy f---!!! Hand chopped meat, cooked medium rare, topped with aged cheddar, bacon, horseradish, curry mustard and a side of fries with malt vinegar mayo -made for some very unique and delicious flavours. Also the place itself is cozy and the staff was super friendly! Will definitely be back!

Address: 100 Adelaide Street E Toronto, ON M5C 1K9 Canada
Review:
Amazing seafood restaurant with great daily deals. My friends and I came for the $100 for 100 oysters deal, which is definitely a DEAL! Nowadays in Toronto, a lot of buck a shuck places have become $2 a shuck places, so it's rare to find such a high quality oyster deal. The oysters are fresh, a good size, and beautifully plated. The 100 came out staggered in 3 plates, which were delivered over the span of an hour or so. It did seem like they could bring them out at the pace that you requested, we asked for a staggered delivery because one of our friends was running late. We had three people sharing the oysters and it was a bit much - four people would have been ideal.

We also tried the PD Fries and Icelandic Cod, both of which were good. Next time we'll probably bring more people to split the 100 oysters and try a few more of the apps. Definitely make a reservation if you're coming on a Thursday, since that's the day of the deal.

Address: 100 Adelaide Street E Toronto, ON M5C 1K9 Canada
Review: If you’re a lover of seafood, Pearl Diver is absolute must. I’m glad I made reservations for this place, because even early on a weekday night, it was completely packed —  and for good reason! Great atmosphere, cheerful service, and above all else, some really incredible dishes. We ordered the sesame fried calamari, PD fish & chips and the atlantic lobster. The calamari might be my new favourite out of anywhere else I’ve tried! The fish and chips were perfectly fried with a delicious, flaky texture on the haddock. The lobster was also quite large, packed with meat and very flavourful! So glad we tried this place on recommendation of a local friend. I know we’ll definitely be back again on our next visit to Toronto.

Address: 100 Adelaide Street E Toronto, ON M5C 1K9 Canada
Review: Such a great local eatery. The oysters are always great here. The burger is one of the best in the city. We went with other options this time and it’s all very delicious. Can get busy even during the week, so make a reservation ahead of time.

Address: 100 Adelaide Street E Toronto, ON M5C 1K9 Canada
Review: Another delicious and classic seafood meal. We went for dinner on a Saturday evening and it really hits the spot. The chowder was hearty and thick. The lobster sliders are made with chunky lobster chunks and flavourful. The fish and chips were crispy and better than your average pub type. The oysters were a hit. A great place for a casual seafood dinner.

Address: 100 Adelaide Street E Toronto, ON M5C 1K9 Canada
Review:
Cozy!  That is how I would describe this quaint and an charming nook right off the busy streets of Adelaide.  A quirky bar celebrating all that is seafood.  the decor and the ambience of this venue is memorable...featuring anchors, ropes, iridescent shells and fishnets and with the walls and posts coated with blackboard paint features of the daily specials. And the pace is allows you take a pause and breathe, but that does not the service gets shortchanged. All of the servers are prompt and with adequate knowledge of the menu and faster on their feet in bringing the food over.

For seafood lovers, look no further as Pearl diver features a wide array of freshly shucked oysters all across the nation and a wider array of malted beverages to wash them down. I had the oysters from PEI with the mignoette sauces alongside hot mustard and they were divine! I had a thre grilled Sea bream and my friend dined on the  Fish and chips....I wasn't particularly attached to my Sea bream but that is no bearing on the chef! Sea bream is encased with bones but which fish isn't! My friend's entree had me salivating for more!

Overall, would definitely make another trip!

Address: 969 Coxwell Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 3G4 Canada
Review: WOW WOW WOW!!! Hidden gem in the city!!! The menu alone brought us there!! The photos on Instagram looked great!!! We get there and the smell drew is right in!!! We got the classic chicken and flank steak sandwiches and the tater tots supreme. Generous portions and taste extraordinaire!!! Beautifully crafted, flavour overload in a great way!! Nothing overpowered anything else, it was so well balanced and just taste with every bite!!!! Rustic ideas but modern spins on it and it really brought out the right impacts. Messy goodness and you love every bite of it! Definitely going back!!!

Address: 969 Coxwell Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 3G4 Canada
Review: For someone that isn't Muslim this is a good non halal option. I ordered the classic chicken sandwich and I didn't pay much attention to the actual description which I should have. When I think classic chicken sandwich I think fried chicken with mayonnaise. The chicken was cooked well however it was way too sweet for my liking and had no mayonnaise on the sandwich whatsoever. Personally I don't see the connection between classic chicken sandwich and this sandwich. I'd like to know what other people think. I wouldn't recommend this sandwich as a classic sandwich. I could only eat half, way to sweet for me. Also the bun was supper soggy and I only live five min away. As a suggestion I'd recommend putting a traditional chicken sandwich on the menu that is savory and not sweet. For $16.89 I also think the product doesn't reflect the price. Definitely over priced as well. I tried eating the other half but had to throw it out. It's like eating a spoon of honey. What a shame. I'd be interested to know if anyone else has other recommendations on where I can get some good fried chicken (non halal) thanks.

Address: 969 Coxwell Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 3G4 Canada
Review: It's OK. Heard alot of buzz about this place and their big sandwiches. Went in for a takeway snadwich and ordered the fried chicken sandwich. It took alot of time to make which I was fine. When I went to pay and tip it came to about 20 bucks which when I opened the food doesn't seem worth it. The sandwich was ok but I wouldn't be going back anytime soon.

Address: 969 Coxwell Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 3G4 Canada
Review:
I'm what you would call "serious" about my eating choices and I love the food there. It is wholesome! If you want to get something that's "not-so-great" you can choose that option.
If you want to have something that is "clean", there's that option too.
You won't get the "Ugh, why did I eat that" feel. It's worth the money and it's fresh. My first time there was great and I would definitely go again.

If you're in the area, give them a try, it's worth it.

Address: 969 Coxwell Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 3G4 Canada
Review:
Way too expensive for what you get. $30 with tax for a chicken sandwich and brussel sprout salad, no drink included.

The food is alright. Honestly as far as fried chicken sandwiches go, there is a lot of competition in this area putting out a better product for less. The Cuban was good, but again why is it $15+tax? For just a sandwich? I will echo another review here and say this is "beyond inflation." I went during peak times and the place was empty.. it has potential, I want to like this place.

I went here twice, really wanted to find a reliable sandwich shop in the Village. The atmosphere is actually nice, beers in the fridge, could be way more popular if prices were lower.

Sadly I won't be returning a third time. Too expensive for a quick lunch, not as substantial as a dinner elsewhere at the same price.

To the owners if you read this: I suggest either increasing the quality of your chicken, including a soft drink if you're going to charge $11 for a side, or overall just lowering your prices even a dollar or two. I would go once a week if I could get a Cuban sandwich, small fry and can of coke for $18, or $25 with a beer.

Address: 401 Danforth Avenue Danforth Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review:
We had such an amazing meal and experience here. The servers were super nice and attentive. We had the assorted meat platter momos which were delicious with the sauces they teach you to mix. The chili chicken was also super flavourful and the meal came with soup and a ginger cardamom tea.

Prices were very good and they had lots of seating inside and out (we enjoyed a nice sunny evening on the patio). Highly recommend!

Address: 401 Danforth Avenue Danforth Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: My girlfriend and I Found this spot accidentally while visiting Toronto from Buffalo years ago. Since coming here the first time this place has become a destination for us, and we try to make a point of getting here at least once a year.
