Because of the pandemic and resulting border closure, we hadn't been in over two years. We were finally able to make it up yesterday and it's still as good as ever. Food, service, vibe all on point. Coming here absolutely made our day in Toronto a 10/10. Thank you guys. BTW, I recommend the Ting-Ma buns, dipped in the momo sauces they give with a bit of soy sauce.

Address: 401 Danforth Avenue Danforth Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: Must go place for momo. Don't miss out on their amazing mixed platter which allows you to experience all the fantastic flavors they offer. The staff were incredibly helpful and made our  dining experience even better. The overall atmosphere is pleasant, making it a great spot to visit with family.

Address: 401 Danforth Avenue Danforth Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review:
Came by for a quick bite and definitely glad we did! Inside there are colourful flags with writing. The establishment itself is large, there is a small patio outside.

The service was great! Very attentive, also they serve water with chilled glasses.

Tried several different momo from shrimp, vegetarian and chicken (butter chicken)

The sauces they provide definitely added to the flavour of momos. The butter chicken momo was our favourite. Our least favourite was probably the shrimp.

They provide complimentary tea and that was delicious!

Address: 401 Danforth Avenue Danforth Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: First time trying Tibetan food, and the server was so patient when explaining the menu. It was a relaxing dining experience. I had 10 pieces of dumplings, a salad, and a bowl of soup for around $20. However, if you were hungry, you might need a bit more food.

Address: 788 Broadview ave Toronto, ON M4K 2P7 Canada
Review:
I tried a chicken, steak, and pork taco. They were tasty. I'd say the pineapple in the pork taco really made that one stand out as extra delicious. You get a generous amount of protein in each taco.

The service was efficient. There is a QR code for the menu, which is not my favourite but cost effective - this can help keep the food prices reasonable.

The atmosphere was fun and casual.

Address: 788 Broadview ave Toronto, ON M4K 2P7 Canada
Review:
A gem discovery, and will definitely be back to try other bites!

Here, we ordered the Tacos de Birria con Queso (comes with four tacos, grilled together with cheese, topped with slow cooked beef marinated in Mexican chiles salsa, with a side of birria consommé, cilantro, onions, limes, and salsa). Super delicious!

We also got some Tacos Baja Style, specifically the Pescado (deep fried battered fish, served in a blue corn tortilla). This was definitely good, but maybe not what I would try again here. I would opt for the birria or new dishes.

Address: 788 Broadview ave Toronto, ON M4K 2P7 Canada
Review:
The birria here is excellent.  I didn't have a single complaint about textures or flavors or anything else to do with this place.

There is a reason the rating is still so high even with the 1 star reviews.  100% Go try it yourself.

Address: 788 Broadview ave Toronto, ON M4K 2P7 Canada
Review: The cuisine was incredibly delicious and brought a sense of comfort. The staff who attended to our orders was both fast and amiable.

Address: 788 Broadview ave Toronto, ON M4K 2P7 Canada
Review:
The food was amazing !!!!!!!! Super flavourful, not salty at all, just packed with flavour. The presentation was great and authentic, the place is cute and quaint and feels comfortable with delicious food. The server was super kind and charismatic. The food came out quick.
I had the tacos of nopal and hongos (sautéed cactus and mushroom) and they was the best! The torta de chorizo / queso (sausage/cheese sandwich) was delicious, the tres leche and churros were amazing and the Birria tacos were the best I’ve had so far in the city. They have horchata too!!

Address: 1333 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1N1 Canada
Review:
Cozy space with great vibes. Finally came to try the food after being curious about the space for awhile. We had a great time! The tables are close together but we got to have a nice chat with our table neighbour and share recommendations on the menu.

We ended up ordering 2 appetisers and 3 mains - the Indonesian fried rice dish was our favourite! Super fragrant and was the perfect combo of salty, sweet and spicy. Definitely get this with the satay chicken skewers (that house made satay sauce - yum!). We can’t wait to come again to try the rest of the menu! Service was great and food came promptly! We spent less than $100 on the food for 2, and were stuffed!

Highly recommend this local gem! Thank you to the team that served us and fed us!!

Address: 1333 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1N1 Canada
Review:
Cozy, warm atmosphere, friendly staff, and good service. It was my first time trying Dutch cuisine, and I liked it. We had bitterballen, snert, frikandellen, boerenenkool, and poffertjes. The food was tasty, full of flavor, and well-presented.

Four stars due to reasonable criticism: first, portions are tiny, and I didn't feel satisfied with the dish; and second, the problem is that the menu is limited; there should be a broader spectrum of Dutch dishes, for example, notorious Pannenkoek was not on the menu; for desserts, there is only one option.

Overall it was a great experience, and I would come back again and recommend it as an introduction to Dutch cuisine.

Address: 1333 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1N1 Canada
Review:
I came here once for genever, once for rijsttafel, and finally here just for dinner.

I really wish it was better. The flavours just don't cut it for Indonesian food. We had a lot of indo food in Amsterdam, including rijsttafel a bunch of times at various places. This was as good as the worst place we tried there. I do recall (pre-COVID) the rijsttafel here being disappointing but this city is incredibly limited for this food so I was just grateful to have it at all.

This time... as nice as the staff are, they can't make up for the poorly flavoured food. The satays were edible, but not good. Tasteless. Just some overcooked chicken skewers. The nasi goreng was bitter and bland, and the plate was just ugly and brown. Not even a cucumber for colour. And where was the egg?!

The bitterballen were actually perfect. I don't know why I ordered them though because I didn't really get the hype about them in Netherlands, so I don't know why I thought that would change. I'll say Borrel's are almost identical to the ones we had in The Hague. So, they do succeed there. Very authentic.

The fries were just terrible. They tasted and felt like they had been fried, cooled, and refried about 10 times and then sat out all night under the headlamp. Rock hard and full of grease. And didn't even taste good. We had loads of Dutch fries in our visits and to say these are anything like the ones there is not even reasonable. I don't really know what to make of it if they can't make good fries...

It's hard to find good Indo/Malay food in Toronto, so I appreciate Borrel trying by doing not only the white Dutch food but also the Netherlands great Indonesian cuisine culture. I just think there are other restaurants in Toronto that do Indo flavours so much better.

Also, if you haven't had genever... do it when you're here. It is almost impossible to find in Ontario, and it's not available in any LCBO or any other Toronto bar as far as I know. I have to give kudos to Borrel for going through all the trouble of bringing this spirit to us.

I think it seems like the Dutch food is generally well-done, so if I ever do return, I'll just stick to that (and genever!) and go elsewhere for Indonesian food.

Address: 1333 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1N1 Canada
Review: This was my first time trying Dutch food and it was quite good. Came here on a Saturday morning for brunch with a friend. Menu is simple and not too much items. It was good that we were also able to order from their snack menu too. Bitterballen was a surprise for me and it was delicious. Frittata was good and even better with the sausage. My friend also enjoyed her frikmuffin but was surprised with how tiny her portion sandwich was. Service was great and staff was attentive. Overall, it's a great place to introduce yourself to Dutch food. Delicious and my friend says is authentic. I just wished they opened for lunch during weekdays too.

Address: 1333 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1N1 Canada
Review: What a great place! Dutch food... At first I thought it'd be bread and meat and bland... I was so wrong. The menu is a fun, easy introduction to many dishes I've never heard of before. We tried the Genever ( traditional Dutch spirit similar to Gin). We ordered two dishes from the Indonesian part of the menu as well. Mmmmmmmm. Peanut sauce.

Address: 1 Benvenuto Place Toronto, ON M4V 2L1 Canada
Review: We chose this restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. And it was a great experience. So much attention from our waiter, he was professional and knowledgeable. The food exceeded our expectations, and let me tell you. The filet mignon is one of the best in Toronto. Only Don Alfonso can compete. The cut was extremely tender, cooked to perfection (as ordered, rare), chicken was very tender too. The coconut cream pie is delicious! And the chocolate cake was so good as well, had many textures and elements in it. The atmosphere is so cozy and high end, it felt like a restaurant in Paris. They have a wonderful view from the balcony, if you are lucky enough, they let you go and enjoy it for some time. The only downside was that it was our anniversary and  my partner mentioned it in the reservation notes, but no one acknowledged it. A simple “happy anniversary!” would do :). But that’s my only complain. Beautiful, wonderful dining experience. Definitely recommend ♥️

Address: 1 Benvenuto Place Toronto, ON M4V 2L1 Canada
Review:
Being trying to have everything go right on my anniversary for more than three years now and I'm so glad it finally did thanks to Scaramouche.

I do the reservations for my husband and I read tons of reviews on the place and it was an absolute dream come true. My husband is an arvid stake eater and if he likes a stake... it's definitely good. In his own words, "he'd never had stake quite as good as this before."

With Scaramouche, it's not just the food that's great, the ambience too is absolutely wonderful. The waiters are kind, we get our corner to ourselves, and we enjoyed our meal in peace.

I love, love, love this place! and I'd be back in a few months again 100%

Address: 1 Benvenuto Place Toronto, ON M4V 2L1 Canada
Review:
Absolutely one of my favourite restaurants in the city. It’s been around for so long for a reason!

Wonderful city views, incredible service and in my opinion worth every penny for the experience.

Please never take the peppercorn fettuccine off the menu!! I have a tree nut allergy and they are able to accommodate this famous dish for me by not adding the pine nut crust. It is one of my favourite things I’ve ever eaten here and a must try if you come.

Address: 1 Benvenuto Place Toronto, ON M4V 2L1 Canada
Review: One of the best restaurant experiences ever thanks not only to the Fantastic food but the wonderful service from start to finish by all the staff. No wonder they have been around for decades. Perfect place for those special.

Address: 1 Benvenuto Place Toronto, ON M4V 2L1 Canada
Review:
Pro Tip: Valet parking is included and the entrance is unmarked. When you arrive at the condominium, enter the roundabout and look/wait for the valet at the condo roundabout.

Must try if you’re in town. This place is a Michelin Gourmand Bib but on its way to a star for sure. Every little bite was perfect and kudos to the pastry sous chef Shienita for her amazing talents and she even came out to take a picture with me!

Address: 414 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V9 Canada
Review: Never a bad meal here & feeling so lucky we could slip in without a reservation (so, yeah reservations are a good idea here). Very good food. Our biggest dilemma was decided whether to go hard on the dips or save room for the entrees. The cauliflower called our name. Highly recommend this spot and bring your friends!

Address: 414 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V9 Canada
Review: It was my first time at fat pasha and it exceeded all expectations! We got the fat salatim platter and everything was delicious, the cocktails were great too. I was most impressed with the service here. The host and servers were amazing and super helpful. We also loved the vibe of the outdoor patio. 5/5 Great place!!

Address: 414 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V9 Canada
Review: Amazing food! You will not be disappointed! There is a wide variety of flavors that are all executed excellently. Be aware, they do accept reservations so may fill up fast! I would not skip on Fat Pasha if you are in Toronto.

Address: 414 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V9 Canada
Review: Came to try the famous cauliflower- was not disappointed. I don't know how they did it but it is the best cauliflower I've ever had. The back heated patio was also really lovely. Shared the cauliflower and small dips tray between 2 people and was more than enough food.

Address: 414 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V9 Canada
Review: Stopped here for lunch. Food was amazing and very high quality! We got one of the platters that was recommended by our waitress. The hummuses were all VERY good and the falafels were perfect! It was definitely big enough for 2 people! There are so many other things that look/sound great on the menu, so we may need to try it again! Staff was also very friendly!

Address: 81 Harbord Street Toronto, ON M5S 1G4 Canada
Review: I had an expectation and they met it!  We reserved counter seats and the experience was great.  Our chef was making for us and a dining table which meant we basically had a private chef.  The sushi were great, there were some fish I've never had as sushi so it was surprising.  Overall excellent experience but definitely on the expensive side.

Address: 81 Harbord Street Toronto, ON M5S 1G4 Canada
Review:
Amazing Omakaze Spot! The quality of sushi is outstanding and the variety of fish is very unique compared to other Omakaze locations. The restaurant has maybe 15-20 seats so it’s very intimate. Great for anniversary or special occasions only due to the high price point.

Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating due to a few allergies I had.

Great experience overall! Definitely recommend:)

Address: 81 Harbord Street Toronto, ON M5S 1G4 Canada
Review: Absolutely stunning omakase. Was able to secure a reservation port last minute. Their ingredients are fresh and expertly prepared. If you’re looking to treat your palette to a delicious adventure, I highly recommend!

Address: 81 Harbord Street Toronto, ON M5S 1G4 Canada
Review: This place is all about the food. Service was prompt. The chefs are very talented and they ask you how the rice portion is and if you would like to up the wasabi level. Was well worth it! A very memorable dining experience.

Address: 81 Harbord Street Toronto, ON M5S 1G4 Canada
Review:
Best dining experience in Toronto. Everything is so beautifully and meticulously prepared. It’s the perfect amount of food to not make you too full.
The overall experience and food we enjoyed more than Alo.
Only wish they had some cocktails on the menu.

Address: 333 Lonsdale Rd Toronto, ON M5P 1R3 Canada
Review: First time to try Pizza Banfi last night with a party of 7 people. It was highly recommended by friends who have been visited there for over a decade. The inside was not so big but definitely a great ambience and cozy atmosphere. High quality dishes & each of them was carefully crafted. Lovely presentation and they all tasted delicious. We loved the Pizza Prosciutto E Funghi and their thin crust was fantastic. We also ordered the fish of the day ~ red snapper and mussels, their seafood were fresh and seasoned well. Their ravioli and spaghetti were a MUST try on menu. They did show warm hospitality. The Owner was super friendly. Staff were all polite and attentive. They came several times to check on us to make sure everything was good. That made it an authentic Italian restaurant. We enjoyed our meals and what a wonderful dining experience at Pizza Banfi. Please make a reservation in advance to avoid missing the opportunity having good decent Italian food. Will definitely recommend to friends and family who love Italian cuisine.

Address: 333 Lonsdale Rd Toronto, ON M5P 1R3 Canada
Review: Visited Pizza Banfi recently. Atmosphere was very cozy, and warm. Staff was really friendly and knowledgeable. Had the Vegetarian pizza - honestly probably one of the best pizzas I’ve had in Toronto, absolutely delicious. The dessert was also really good. Price is reasonable ($$-$$$)

Address: 333 Lonsdale Rd Toronto, ON M5P 1R3 Canada
Review:
My wife and I have been going to the place since 1998. And we have never been disappointed.

Nestled in Forest Hill Village, Banfi is one of my favorite pizza and pasta places. It’s a small, cozy place. You almost feel like you’re walking into someone’s living room.

Each and every visit , the owner has greeted us with a great and welcoming smile. They consistently serve great pasta and pizza, and the specials vary.

Best compliment I can pay to this place. In over 20 years of dining at this place, service, quality of food and overall experience has never disappointed.

And in my humble opinion, they serve the best Tiramisu in the city next two Terroni and Stock TC

Address: 333 Lonsdale Rd Toronto, ON M5P 1R3 Canada
Review:
My daughter and her husband booked their wedding reception here for 35 people.  While the restaurant is small, we all fit beautifully - and in very comfortable chairs I might add.

The food was traditionally Italian and of a super high quality, and beautifully laid out:  plates of bruschetta for starters and then several platters of seafood and antipasti were brought to each of the 7 group tables.

For the pasta course: cannelloni, which my brother said was among the best he had ever eaten.  I am severely gluten intolerant so they customized a penne plate for me with lots of veggies - delicious.

Then came a choice of Osso Bucco or salmon, or a vegetarian plate.  I chose the salmon which was a HUGE and perfect portion with lovely mango and baby tomato bits as a sauce.  It was perfectly seared, served alongside baby carrots and grilled asparagus.  Bottled flat and sparkling water was served, alongside choices of wine.

For dessert we had a customized gluten free wedding cake delivered, and they placed it on a dedicated table in the corner of the room near the light - beautiful.  Servers sliced and plated it at no extra charge.  Guests also ordered digestifs; our table had Amaretto with large orange slices - wow!

Everything was brilliant and service was impeccable - wine and water glasses were refilled and plates were cleared at a comfortable pace.  Staff was super professional and chatted with us in a friendly manner.

Few receptions are planned in small neighbourhood restaurants as people often turn to banquet halls or wedding-specific venues.  Several guests said this is what they would choose for their future weddings.

Thanks Banfi back-and-front-of-house staff - and owner!  My daughter was elated as everything went so well and the restaurant was beautifully set up with traditional thick crisp white linen tablecloths and huge linen napkins - so classy.

On each table was a glass with a large sprig of freesia in it - Banfi didn't know this, but that was the [memorial] flower of the day - and in my daughter's bridal bouquet as well.

Address: 333 Lonsdale Rd Toronto, ON M5P 1R3 Canada
Review: Absolutely stellar service, and amazing food. Will definitely be returning. Best dinner I've had out in a very very long time.

Address: 658 Bloor Street Toronto, ON M6G 1K9 Canada
Review: Pretty standard Korean fare, the quality of the meat was good, prepared food was tasty. Cozy interior with friendly service. Amazing that they are open late every night. Great place to cap off an evening out with friends or if you just want to grab a tasty meal. Minimum 2 orders of meat or vegan set per table!

Address: 658 Bloor Street Toronto, ON M6G 1K9 Canada
Review: The place was packed when we arrived but wait times were quick and we were seated within 10min.   Quick and attentive service by staff. High quality meats and vegetables paired with wonderful sides.   Atmosphere was clean and lively.  I would definitely recommend dining here again.

Address: 658 Bloor Street Toronto, ON M6G 1K9 Canada
Review:
Took a friend who has never had Korean food before. This place was very convinient & clean to introduce Korean table top cooking, all the side dishes, kimchi & Korean soybean stew all at once.
They loved everything especially the quality of meats, soybean stew & kimchi. My Korean food introduction dinner was such a success.

Although it was hard to get attention from the server because they were way too busy and I heard if we go during the weekend it could be even worse.

They also have 1.5 hours limited seating time due to the restaurant being so popular. For me I need minimum 2 hours to sit down and have a few drinks, chat, order more meats.

If you have any friends who would like to experience Korean food for the first time, this place might be it!

Address: 658 Bloor Street Toronto, ON M6G 1K9 Canada
Review: If you are looking for the best Korean barbecue in town, this is the place to be. It is not a very big place but it is one of the best. Pork and beef barbecue are delicious! All the complimentary sauces and side dishes are delicious. Of course order a pancake, it is a bit spicy but not really. The kimchi soup is moderate spicy as well and so so good. Comparing to the one I had in South Korea, i didn’t feel the difference. The staff is so friendly and helpful. There is a paid parking lot right behind the restaurent. Place is so busy all the time (evening time).

Address: 658 Bloor Street Toronto, ON M6G 1K9 Canada
Review:
Went there to have a soju and eat some good meat with my friends~

We got there RIGHT before the rush at 6pm, so I’d recommend to go around that time or you might have to wait.

Each meat comes in 200g worth, and I’d say that’s ABOUT one portion, but I also shared some seafood pancake and ate rice with it. So I’d say a minimum of $30 of food per person to get full.

This plays is famous for their infinite corn cheese, so take good advantage of that! You can always ask for more side dishes, and if you’re someone like me who likes kimchi at kbbq you can ask for extra :)

I feel like I should’ve drank another bottle of soju, I’ll do that next time LOL

Address: 606 Sherbourne Street Ground Level Toronto, ON M4X Canada
Review: A longtime favourite of mine for weekday lunches. Prices are extremely reasonable especially considering the quality and quantity you get. Their daily specials are all excellent - the spicy pork and bulgogi are my favourites. The fish katsu (only available on Thursdays) is also delicious and freshly fried to order. All hot foods come with side dishes (japchae, fried dumpling, spring roll, vegetables), which really round out the meal. Portions are big and I've never been able to finish it in one sitting. The owner is really nice as well and provides very quick service, so don't be intimidated by the lunch queue! Cash only.

Address: 606 Sherbourne Street Ground Level Toronto, ON M4X Canada
Review: Wow!! I’ve always wanted to try this place and finally was able to today. I went with the veggie bibimbap as it was the daily special and added beef bulgogi. The flavour is out of this world! Rice, veggies, beef, japchae, a spring roll, a dumpling, a fried egg all came in my order. Serious bang for your buck and the lady who served me was so kind and quick. 100% will return.

Address: 606 Sherbourne Street Ground Level Toronto, ON M4X Canada
Review: Food is so flavourful, fresh and delicious. woman that runs it always greets you with a big smile. My favourite is the chicken curry special!

Address: 606 Sherbourne Street Ground Level Toronto, ON M4X Canada
Review: I got the Chicken Curry and Spicy Pork. I like the spicy Pork very much Korean flavor.

Address: 606 Sherbourne Street Ground Level Toronto, ON M4X Canada
Review: My first time here getting take out and to be quite honest this place is probably one of the tastiest Korean places I’ve tried. I got the “bulgogi meal” that was packed with tons of food. The shop is ran by a kind and sweet lady that clearly puts all her love in her cooking! Will definitely come down here to have this place again!

Address: 335 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1W7 Canada
Review:
dinner menu during lunch time. tried almost everything. All of them are tasty. While all the beef and pork are good, other memorable ones are salmon, ajilo, bibimbap, pineapple.

Menu is not extensive but straightforward and covers all the things you might and might not expect, and none of them disappoints. It seems the current selection comes from years of experience, they left only most-demanded and truly popular delicious item. Very satisfying.
Comfy seating, quick attentive service

Address: 335 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1W7 Canada
Review: The Bloor location is my favourite in the Toronto area. The wait list isn't usually too long and the dining area is spacious and clean. The service is great as there are a good number number of servers, and they change your grill for you at a good frequency without you having to ask. The food here is always tasty as well. The meats are fresh and well seasoned, and I haven't had any complaints with the desserts or appetizers to date.

Address: 335 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1W7 Canada
Review: My cousins and I had a dinner last night. The restaurant and restroom are both clean. The staff is courteous and efficient. For a two-hour seating period, this is an all-you-can-eat restaurant. Fresh meat is provided. Dessert is also offered. The price is high, but the food is great. They also offer discount if you’re paying in cash. I highly recommended this restaurant.

Address: 335 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1W7 Canada
Review: My family had lunch today. The food is provided very quick after order. You just tell the server what you want, and the server will give to you soon. They deliver very excellent service. High efficient and friendly. I like the environment here, clean and neat.

Address: 335 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1W7 Canada
Review:
Very good deal for an all you can eat! The staff were all very nice and helpful, the service is quick too.

I really recommend the pork belly and beef brisket. Their soda drinks are very good as well, the best we had are: ume, yuzu, and peach soda. It’s also nice they give you a melons by the end of the meal :)

ご馳走様です！！

Address: 1158 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L9 Canada
Review: We initially had a reservation at another restaurant but decided to change it up last minute and we chose Sorrel. It did not disappoint at all. The atmosphere, the food and our server TJ were nothing short of amazing! Highly recommend

Address: 1158 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L9 Canada
Review: My friend and I came here for her birthday and we had a great experience! Our server was incredibly nice and informative of their special menu. I had the hanger steak and my friend had the duck confit and both meats were fresh and delicious. Definitely a spot to check out for a special occasion!

Address: 1158 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L9 Canada
Review: My husband and I dined here in February. It was a great romantic atmosphere with an amazing menu of delicious items and drinks. We sat at the bar and the staff were so accommodating and friendly. The food. Reasonable portions and flavourful. Can't get enough. Would definitely recommend and will visit again!

Address: 1158 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L9 Canada
Review: Came here to celebrate our anniversary. The ambience was really nice and I also like the bright and well-lit restaurant. For a Wednesday night in the middle of a storm, it was quite packed. Our host was alright, not very warm/helpful with suggestions but did his job well and was also kind to take photos for us. The food was quite good. The grilled octopus, linguine and duck confit stood out! We had a flourless chocolate cake and ice cream for dessert which was also nice. I had mentioned it was our anniversary dinner ahead and when we arrived but I still had to ask for a candle for the dessert; there was pretty much no acknowledgement of the celebration which is unlike other restaurants I've visited. Otherwise, it was a nice experience but I doubt I'll be back.

Address: 1158 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L9 Canada
Review: Sorrel with their French Mediterranean inspired menu, it’s a perfect spot to chill. All the dishes we tried were great. Amazing value for the $2 oyster (if that is your kinda thing) Reservation is highly recommended as they have a full house every time we went. Great atmosphere. Lunch from Mon-Fri. Dinner only for Sat and closed on Sunday.

Address: 3415 Bathurst Street Toronto, ON M6A 2C1 Canada
Review:
Got the chicken sandwich and it was delicious! Very juicy with a nice crunch to it. Perfect amount of sauce and the owner was awesome to talk to as well. It doesn't feel oily or greasy and the spicy mayo gives it a nice kick to it. Everything was packaged neatly and organized.

We were the first customer of the day and even got some free cookies! The chocolate chip cookie was so fresh and soft. I can eat a box of them.

Definitely would be back if I'm in the area again.

Address: 3415 Bathurst Street Toronto, ON M6A 2C1 Canada
Review:
Just had their food, and it’s amazing! All made in-house. Family-owned business.

Know of the place because of the folks at Dope Cannabis, located across the street. Ordered online and picked it up. Ordered the honey hot chicken sandwich, added on the rancheros fries. Also got the Kalbi burger.

The hot honey chicken sandwich was the perfect combination of crispy, juicy and flavorful. Expect a spicy kick with the sauce and jalapeños, and the bun is just the right amount of softness. This sandwich will not disappoint. Actually the best chicken sandwich I’ve had in a long time.

The rancheros fries was a nice side choice. Meat with the fries was yummy and the addition of sauce, jalapeños, onions, etc. was a great combination.

The Kalbi beef burger was juicy and flavorful, packed between two pillow soft buns.

Since I picked it up, I visited the store. Small, cozy spot for pickup. No seating in-store other than a two-seater bench. Delightfully decorated inside. Also, love the yellow “Believe” (Ted Lasso reference) above their kitchen doorway.

Excited to try their poke bowl and other items on the menu next time!

Address: 3415 Bathurst Street Toronto, ON M6A 2C1 Canada
Review: Love this place. Everything is amazing. Burgers are California style smash and oh so good and decadent. The poke bowls are fantastic. It all comes down to the best quality ingredients. Don’t leave without trying a homemade cookie.

Address: 3415 Bathurst Street Toronto, ON M6A 2C1 Canada
Review:
Absolutely amazing value for money! The food here is really tasty, good portion size, and won't make a dent on your wallet.

I've tried their chicken sandwhich and loved it: crispy skin, super tender meat l, nice springy bun, tangy secret sauce. Also tried the bulgogi bowl which I also enjoyed: sweet beef, good amount of side veggies.

Nozomi is a take-out spot so you'll been to grab and go. Despite that, the owners make it as welcoming and friendly an environment as any dine-in place. Male sure to stop by if you want a really tasty and affordable bite!

Address: 3415 Bathurst Street Toronto, ON M6A 2C1 Canada
Review: The food was pretty good.  They were kind enough to let me switch my order after the fact when I called them. Thankfully got the poke bowl because we like the tofu poke bowl better than the burger. The burger got too soggy by the time I got home. Should've asked to put the sauce on the side. Both are on the sweeter side. The cookie was ok because it was way too sweet. The owner was too busy to make a conversation with us but her husband was very sweet and even helped me put the food in my bag. The ambiance is very clean and they have a funny sign with a weighing scale!

Address: 456 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P4 Canada
Review: Always great food, fresh, vibrant, tasty. The staff is always very friendly and accommodating, even at their most busiest time. Highly recommended.

Address: 456 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P4 Canada
Review: One of my favourite Greek restaurants on the Danforth, we’ve been back multiple times and loved it every time! We typically get some skewers, dips (their pita bread with the dips are THE BEST) & a salad. This time we opted out for the seafood platter, which was delicious full of shrimp, calamari and grilled octopus! It was good, but definitely a lot for 2 people!!

Address: 456 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P4 Canada
Review:
The service here is top notch. The food arrives fast and hot, dishes are replaced instantly once finished, and the water does not stop flowing. The restaurant is lively and the prices are better than some of the competitors down the street.

The fried calamari was truly excellent. The squid was abundant, juicy, and seasoned and fried perfectly.

The Aegean Fare Special was loaded with savoury meats and veggies. Unfortunately the moussaka was dryer than I’d prefer.

Overall, it was a 4.5 for me.

Address: 456 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P4 Canada
Review:
been here one time before and the food is amazing! Saganaki and the chicken breast plate were so damn good!
Other items ordered: lamb chop by piece, dolmades, grilled octopus.
Our waiter did not smile once though and the service was so blah - not engagement or enthusiasm at all.

Address: 456 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P4 Canada
Review: It’s a pretty busy Greek restaurant. We tried their Lentil soup, grilled vegetables, grilled Octopus, and lamb chop. The food was good. The octopus had too much vinegar, and it became sour. It was cooked properly though, and not overbooked. We wanted the lamb chop to be medium rare, but it came out medium. It still tasted good. The staff was friendly; the place was clean and vibrant. Overall probably would go again.

Address: 1008 Queen Street E Toronto, ON M4M 1K1 Canada
Review:
Great place to watch the game and eat delicious food.  Loved that you could also see into the kitchen.

Tempura duck confit was tasty and crispy.
Dessert would have me returning.  It is big enough for 2, but I crushed it on my own. No complaints.

Address: 1008 Queen Street E Toronto, ON M4M 1K1 Canada
Review:
The vibe here was very good and I was overall a fan of the food. The kung pao broccoli was my favourite dish. I wasn’t expecting much from it but it was so tasty and the sauce was amazing. The tuna was also good although a small serving. All the appetizers were good to share.
My main was the fish and chips and that is the reason we are at 4 stars. It was genuinely nothing special but I had some of my wife’s  poke bowl and that was tasty. I would come back to try again and try something else next time.

Address: 1008 Queen Street E Toronto, ON M4M 1K1 Canada
Review:
We had a fantastic experience at the Eastside Social. Our party of 4 didn’t have a reservation on a Friday night and the busy Eastside social was so accommodating and lovely.

We had drinks by the bar while we waited for a table to become available and boy, let me tell you- they were so good!

Dinner was fantastic, definitely order the eggplant crisps! The olives were nostalgic, tasted just like my uncles olives from Italy. Our mains (pictured) were very satisfying, big portions, and had so much flavour.

Service was exceptional and so friendly - going above and beyond! Not to mention when we left, they still remembered our name.

We would definitely recommend the Eastside Social and can’t wait to come back!

Thanks for having us!

Address: 1008 Queen Street E Toronto, ON M4M 1K1 Canada
Review:
We would probably need to come back and try dinner menu.
Brunch was ok. Burger buns were cold.
The kiddo didn't like the kid's menu at all.
We didn't like that it was super noisy (all tables were occupied), can't hear each other.

Address: 1008 Queen Street E Toronto, ON M4M 1K1 Canada
Review: We ordered a smash burger and doner from their brunch menu. House-made aioli was amazing. The doner was definitely not your regular shawarma, it had a beef patty and and overwhelming sweet sauce. I still think the place is great, but i should have ordered something else.

Address: 3 Baldwin Street Toronto, ON M5T 1L1 Canada
Review: Fresh quality food and enjoyed every dish. Not the place if you want to be stomach full as it is on the pricey side. Definitely, will consider coming back and trying the tasting menu. The place is quite tight my elbows were already on each end of the table.

Address: 3 Baldwin Street Toronto, ON M5T 1L1 Canada
Review: Good food. On the pricey side as portion is small. Bring lots of people so you can try more items. Uni is recommended, tuna roll is bang for your buck.

Address: 3 Baldwin Street Toronto, ON M5T 1L1 Canada
Review:
Good food, slightly on the pricier side. Everything tasted nicely cooked and fresh. Service is great, attentive and friendly. We sat on the patio out front

Croquettes: nice and cheesy, crisp on the outside
Tomago temaki: the truffle overpowered the egg
Scallop temaki: our favorite bite
Bluefin futomaki: big pieces of tuna with freshly grated wasabi, really good
Omai futomaki: deluxe roll which are quite big

Could've done without the truffle flavor as it was quite strong that masked all the natural sense

Inside had a bar seating but felt very dark inside
They also have a tasting menu for $85/pp

Address: 3 Baldwin Street Toronto, ON M5T 1L1 Canada
Review: Bad quality fish. Overpriced. Worst uni ever had, especially considering the price. Other sashimi is very average, but when you look at the price, it really is worse. Service is good, atmosphere is great.

Address: 3 Baldwin Street Toronto, ON M5T 1L1 Canada
Review: Excellent combination of atmosphere, food, and knowledgeable service. Went here for dinner with my girlfriend and we ended spending about 140$ but everything was worth it all, we will return to try the tasting menu for sure. Highly recommend for enthusiasts for Japanese cuisine!

Address: 87 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3T7 Canada
Review: First time here and I have nothing bad to say. The location is perfect for anyone who lives in the midtown/east end area. The service was quick and the waitress was friendly. Price was reasonable, for 3 brisket tacos, fries and 1 single order of wings was around $50 plus tip.

Address: 87 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3T7 Canada
Review: Food was amazing, so was service. The only one area that could have given this location a fifth star, was the side plates were not clean, the server changed the plates.Good food and excellent service.

Address: 87 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3T7 Canada
Review:
We arrived late, and was informed that our dessert may be packed up. Everything came out very fast! I'm not a big fan of cauliflower, but fell in love with the Buffalo cauliflower!
We split a Tofu Pad Thai from the Summerlicious menu, and the mushroom sandwich. The amount of food was a lot, and it all tasted great.
The service was very kind.

Address: 87 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3T7 Canada
Review:
Nice service and ambiance. We ordered the chicken wings with apple butter sauce, brisket burger, and the pasta special (spicy sausage with penne). Overall, the food tasted good.

The chicken wings weren't worth it for its price. It's $17 for only 7 wings. They gave a lot of brisket for the burger which was great. The brisket can use a bit more sauce since it was a bit dry. The pasta was unremarkable.

Address: 87 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3T7 Canada
Review:
An amazing experience!

When you are planning a milestone event like a Retirement Party....you want a lovely setting with great food and wonderful staff....Trisha (Events Manager) and the team at the Amsterdam Barrelhouse delivered on all counts!

I was so thankful for Trisha's kindness and support...there was not one request that was met with a willingness to make it happen.  Trisha and the restaurant managers helped make every detail (including the showing of photos, a special film and our music) a reality.

All of the guests loved the beautiful upstairs patio setting, great food and atmosphere created....I loved the magical evening!

Many thanks to the Amsterdam Barrelhouse for helping to make my celebration so wonderful!  I highly recommend having your next special event there!

Sincerely,
Lisa R.

Address: 93 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V1 Canada
Review: Good food at reasonable prices. My only criticism is you have to completely exit the store again to get a cart if you want to do any grocery shopping at Longo’s but it’s a minor inconvenience there’s no easy solution for.

Address: 93 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V1 Canada
Review: Sadly it is closed due to covid, but when open it is a hidden gem of a restaurant. Good burger, salad, and steak sandwich. The pizza is also great. Situated in Longo's renovated historic building, it is a unique experience.

Address: 93 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V1 Canada
Review:
A great place to get a meal off the menu or from the prepared food section of Longos. Compliment the meal with drinks from the bar. All served by friendly and attentive staff. Portions are sized for sharing or if you're hungry they will fill the void.
Free wifi.

Address: 93 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V1 Canada
Review: I eat there once or twice a week with my team.  We love the food, drinks, and staff!!!

Address: 93 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V1 Canada
Review: Incredible value but servers are overworked and the atmosphere is to be desired. More staff, dinner lighting, and some background music would help a lot.

Address: 90 Bloor Street E 9th Floor Toronto, ON M4W 1A7 Canada
Review:
I love visiting this new hotel in downtown Toronto as they have a number of great venues, including the Skylight rooftop bar!
I recently brought a colleague for Summerlicious, and we had a great experience!
The portions and offerings for this menu are a bit different than the regular menu, but the quality and service are maintained. We weren’t able to enjoy the lovely patio given the weather, but it’s great if you have a chance!
You wouldn’t think that a typical hotel restaurant like this would be known for Middle Eastern fare, but it’s authentic  and delicious! We had the hummus with chicken, the baba ghanouj, as well as the Wagyu beef kebabs, and they were all very well presented, flavorful, and very filling!
They also make a mean, Paloma, which is my favourite beverage!
While you’re visiting, be sure to check out the beautiful library bar with a large open fireplace not to mention a Moët and Chandon vending machine!
Thank you, kindly and I’ll be back soon!

Address: 90 Bloor Street E 9th Floor Toronto, ON M4W 1A7 Canada
Review:
Great ambience, and great service by our host. We went for the “Taste of Mexico” menu (picture attached).

However, the food was below our expectations and even below average compared any Mexican restaurant in Toronto. The presentations were perfect yet they fail to make up for the taste.

I would recommend going only for drinks.

Address: 90 Bloor Street E 9th Floor Toronto, ON M4W 1A7 Canada
Review:
W Toronto's rooftop restaurant is a must-visit for all food and drink lovers. Located on the top floor of the hotel, the restaurant offers a breathtaking view of the city, making it the perfect place to enjoy a meal or drinks with friends.

The menu features a variety of contemporary dishes, with a focus on locally-sourced ingredients. The menu is constantly evolving, so there is always something new to try. The chefs take pride in their dishes, and it shows in the quality of the food.

The drinks menu is equally impressive, with a wide range of cocktails, beers, and wines to choose from. The bartenders are knowledgeable and can recommend the perfect drink to pair with your meal.

The atmosphere at the rooftop restaurant is lively and sophisticated. The design is modern and stylish, with plenty of seating options, including indoor and outdoor seating. Whether you are looking for a romantic dinner or a night out with friends, this rooftop restaurant is the perfect place to go.

Overall, W Toronto's rooftop restaurant is a fantastic experience. From the food and drinks to the atmosphere and view, everything is top-notch. I highly recommend visiting this restaurant for a memorable dining experience.

Address: 90 Bloor Street E 9th Floor Toronto, ON M4W 1A7 Canada
Review: Came here for drinks for my birthday on a Saturday with 2 girlfriends and it has a great atmosphere.  There's a DJ spinning mostly (what seems like) latin-inspired music and the venue is just beautiful.  Can't wait for the summer-time when the patio opens up.  I can't really speak to the food, as just one person ordered the octopus, but she said she enjoyed it.  I ordered the chocolate dessert and it was amazing.  Our waitress was so amazing and attentive to our needs and she was so sweet and put sparklers on my dessert and took it off the bill - it was really nice.  Cocktails were great!  Would definitely come back for drinks again.

Address: 90 Bloor Street E 9th Floor Toronto, ON M4W 1A7 Canada
Review:
The atmosphere here is great, it's beautiful inside. There selection of wine is interesting with some local choices from Ontario. Excellent customer service, cocktails are beautiful!! 👌🏼
The price was also reasonable.
Would go here again 10 out of 10.

Address: 157 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5B 1E4 Canada
Review: Service was super quick and very kind and helpful. Everyone there working was awesome and nice. The food was delicious. My only comment is that there wasnt that many options for chicken and meat. Not many cuts of protein for the lunch menu. Also not many sides or appetizers for the all you can eat lunch as well. But for the cuts and options there were, they were super good

Address: 157 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5B 1E4 Canada
Review:
Both take out and dine in are incredibly amazing! The quality of the food and the portions are both impressive pre and post covid, and I can't seem to get enough.

This spot is great for gathering, sharing and meat lovers. If you have dietary restrictions, I recommend you stay away from this place, given everything is shared and it gets quite hard to keep everything tidy.

I hope they keep it up and I will keep coming back/keep ordering delivery.

Address: 157 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5B 1E4 Canada
Review: Amazing service, food and atmosphere as always! Meat tastes very high quality and the servers are always on top of everything and very attentive brining you things immediately. We were a bit worried the lunch menu wouldn’t satisfy us as there are less options but it was still more than enough and you can still choose the dinner menu during lunch time if you really want. Beef is definitely our favourite as it’s a bit more marinated and we’d honestly be happy just getting it and skipping the pork. Hope to be back soon!

Address: 157 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5B 1E4 Canada
Review:
Very clean restaurant. It was nice to be able to eat unlimited refills at a reasonable price. The quality of the meat was good, and the side menu (grilled salmon, seaweed soup, and bibimbap) was also very tasty. As a restaurant where Korean and Japanese cuisines are well harmonized, I want to visit again next time. thank you

P.S. I was very satisfied with the way each individual was provided with convenient tongs to grill the meat.

Address: 157 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5B 1E4 Canada
Review:
Each table has rolled screen which makes private place for own group. Red meat we ordered is only beef which is very tasty. Cold noodle and bibim rice are strongly recommended. Every portion is small so we can try one each. After trying, we ordered literally unlimited times. Service is do good. They often came over our table and ask what we need. For dessert, cream brulee is must eat item.
I will visit again.

Address: 20 Charles Street E Toronto, ON M4Y 1T1 Canada
Review: Came in here after a friend suggested to try shrimp cream croquette .. could have known the taste better if it had not been burning hot… ps. Have patience before taking your first bite, patient and ever smiling servers, quite ambience.. good place for a restart if you are feeling low! :)

Address: 20 Charles Street E Toronto, ON M4Y 1T1 Canada
Review: This mom and pop Japanese restaurant is to die for.  Very good curry, and Bento boxes at a reasonable price.  I loved everything in the Bento, and I'm not usually a sashimi person!

Address: 20 Charles Street E Toronto, ON M4Y 1T1 Canada
Review:
Came for a weeknight dinner with a friend just before 6pm. The restaurant is quite small (although they do have patio seating once the weather warms up enough) and filled up quickly, so I'd recommend making a reservation if you can.

I ordered the pork katsu curry. Pork katsu was cooked well, very fresh and not dry at all. The curry was rich and came with chunks of beef. Rice was on the sticky side though. But overall, tasty and very good quality/quantity for the price.

Service is friendly although it was a bit difficult to get their attention at times. Would be helpful if they updated the menu on their website, as some items are no longer available.

Address: 20 Charles Street E Toronto, ON M4Y 1T1 Canada
Review: You need to make a reservation before coming!! We did not know this and came to Tokyo Kitchen on a Friday night as a party of 3. We made a reservation on the spot, but it took them about 20 minutes to seat us. Once we sat down, it felt like everything went really fast. We were served our meals and the side we ordered in a matter of minutes. We got a side of tempura, one sashimi don, one chicken katsu, and one beef sukiyako udon. The food was delicious, and even the atmosphere was really nice. The only thing is this place is really busy so make a reservation.

Address: 20 Charles Street E Toronto, ON M4Y 1T1 Canada
Review: The food tasted great and the portions are filling. We got the chicken katsudon, curry chicken, California roll, and korokke. I wasn't a big fan of the korokke but the curry was great. The staff were also very nice and the atmosphere was great. It was very homey and I enjoyed my time there

Address: 620 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1K7 Canada
Review:
Yummy is a pleasant surprise with good quality, big portions and low pricing. The Bulgogi on rice ($12) had a nice hint of smoke flavor but was dry. The noodle with red sauce and fish cake ($12) was a generous serving. Seafood pancake was my favorite - extra crispy and crunchy, although took time to come out.

Every table here is a large booth with high back rest, gives you lots of privacy.

Very low price point, and 10% discount when paying cash.

This has become my new go to for K-food.

Highly recommend.

Address: 620 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1K7 Canada
Review: This place is great. The restaurant name is great, because it's true. Yummy and cheap!! It's a nice comfy place for 2 -4 ppl. The tables are nice even if its only 1 or 2. If you come when it is busy, you have to wait at the front but the service is pretty fast and the one girl with the glasses is always very polite with me. I appreciate it very much. Food is delicious! Cheaper than majority of Korean restaurants I've been to. Great value for your dollar.

Address: 620 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1K7 Canada
Review:
I have been coming to this place (since the days at their old location) for more than 8 years.

This is the best Korean restaurant based on portion sizes, value-for-money, and flavors! And service is as good as humanly possible, given how busy this place is. It is always busy for a good reason!

The quality of the food has been very consistent over the years! Great job! And I must say I love all the Banchan.  The kimchi and the potatoes always hit the spot!

Yummy Korean Restaurant is an institution of Toronto like Swatow and Manpuku! ❤️

One thing I would suggest is to update a small portion of the tables to be 2-tops, so the flow of customers (especially solo diners and couples) can be managed more effectively.

Another thing is that I will recommend servers to ask about drinks orders, or at least mention both alcoholic and non-alcoholic options. This should help boost drink sales!

Last but not least, I recommend creating an Instagram page to connect with your fans! Yes, many Torontorians are your fans!

Address: 620 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1K7 Canada
Review:
I've heard of this popular Korean spot for a while as they're known to be a good bang for your buck spot.

My friend took me here on a Thursday night for dinner and it was really good! We ordered 3 dishes and had leftovers for tomorrow.

Highly recommend and I can't wait to come back. We arrived for 6:30pm on a Thursday and didn't have to wait. But prepared to wait as this place got really busy after we were seated.

Address: 620 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1K7 Canada
Review: Great place to have a Korean meal! Portions are large and prices are reasonable. We enjoyed Bulgogi Beef Bibimbap in a bowl and Shrimp Fried Rice. Side dishes are really good as well (amazing Japchae🙌) and you can request refills.

Address: 23 Charles Street W Toronto, ON M4Y 2R4 Canada
Review: I went here with a friend and we ordered a shrimp Japanese pancake and a chicken teriyaki. The shrimp Japanese pancake was delicious! It came with the right amount of fluffiness, sauce, and fillings. Definitely get the fish flakes as an addition, otherwise I feel like the pancake would be lacking such a vital component. The chicken teriyaki was pretty standard that you could find anywhere. However, their pancakes are certainly worth it - I find Japanese pancakes are also not always super common to find. The prices were also super reasonable, this place is definitely worth a try.

Address: 23 Charles Street W Toronto, ON M4Y 2R4 Canada
Review:
small inconspicuous storefront, that’s very very cozy and welcoming. friendly and helpful staff, overall great dinner ambiance.

osaka style okonomiyaki, that’s fairly priced and portioned. flavours were great and savoury, we tried the beef, squid, both great options! yakisoba was also memorable. definitely recommend to visit, just a heads up there can be a bit of wait during the evening! Also, I recommend the plum wine, it’s delicious!

Address: 23 Charles Street W Toronto, ON M4Y 2R4 Canada
Review:
It’s been ages since my last visit, as this used to be a frequent affordable go-to place for dinner since my student days. The food is still delicious with fast service while also being super busy. I ordered the scallop Okonomiyaki with seaweed and fish flakes. Yum!

Can’t wait to come back again.

Address: 23 Charles Street W Toronto, ON M4Y 2R4 Canada
Review: The squid okonomiyaki is decent. Highly recommend adding Katsuobushi flakes and seaweed for 50 cents. The yakisoba was too salty for my liking. The interior of the restaurant is a bit dated, but service was great and the staff were responsive and friendly. Decent food for a decent price.

Address: 23 Charles Street W Toronto, ON M4Y 2R4 Canada
Review: Came here for dinner and had a wonderful time! I loved the decor and the service was excellent. The real highlight is the food - super tasty and really well-priced. Each item was ~$10 and the portions were pretty big. This is one of the few restaurants left in Toronto where you can still get a filling meal for under $15. This is def worth the visit!

Address: 556 parliament st Toronto, ON M5S 1X2 Canada
Review:
From the moment you walk in the door, the atmosphere of this taco joint is welcoming and warm. The decor is fun and lively, with bright colors and unique artwork that make you feel like you've stumbled upon a hidden gem.

But let's talk about the real reason you're here - the tacos! The menu is full of delicious options that cater to all tastes and dietary needs. From traditional beef and chicken to fish, every taco is bursting with flavor and fresh ingredients.

What really sets this taco joint apart is the attention to detail. Each taco is made to order with care and precision, and the flavors and textures are perfectly balanced. Whether you're looking for something spicy and bold or mild and comforting, there's a taco here for you.

And let's not forget about the sides - the chips and guacamole are the perfect accompaniment to your meal. And if you're feeling thirsty, there's a great selection of drinks to choose from, including delicious margaritas and refreshing beers.

Overall, I highly recommend this taco joint to anyone looking for an unforgettable dining experience. The staff is friendly and attentive, the food is exceptional, and the atmosphere is unbeatable. Don't miss out on the best tacos in the city - head to this place today!

Address: 556 parliament st Toronto, ON M5S 1X2 Canada
Review:
(Edit: parliament location)Most toco joints are line quick and dirty, no frills. This place is a nice restaurant, but of an elevated atmosphere. I could take a date here for a nice dinner kinda vibe. Intimate. Staff are friendly and helpful.
Classic margarita on point.
Guacamole - tastier than most. Smooth not so chunky and you'll want to order 0ne for each individual.
Pastor, barbacoa, fish and steak (arrachera I think) all super flavorful.
House sauce is very flavorful, heat forward, but not there to punish you. White people may find it too much, but the heat does not linger long. I will 100% be back.

Address: 556 parliament st Toronto, ON M5S 1X2 Canada
Review:
We were pretty excited to try a new taco spot in Cabbagetown.

We ordered 3 tacos to go. The Al Pastor, Black Tiger Shrimp, and Fried Fish.

The tacos come with one tortilla and the size is just fine. Not too big, not too small. (More filling than Pastor Taco on Gerard St for comparison).

The Al Pastor - really dry. I was worried about this as other reviews state dry meat. I indeed, also received dry meat. There's potential with the flavours here, but the meat was dry and hard to enjoy.

Black Tiger Shrimp and Fish tacos were fine, but nothing memorable.

Considering this place's other location has great reviews and they are still working on opening their dine-in space, I plan to return in a couple months to give them another chance because this area needs more taco spots!

Address: 556 parliament st Toronto, ON M5S 1X2 Canada
Review: We ordered online for pick up. Pick up was fast. The tacos were tasty with a good amount of filling. The Cheese Quesadilla combo which comes with Tortilla chips was disappointing as the portions were very small and barely any chips. It was not filling. Expected them to be more generous from a so highly rated restaurant.

Address: 556 parliament st Toronto, ON M5S 1X2 Canada
Review: The food is good, for dine in it looks they take care of the ingredients and taste, as a Mexican I like it. but the service needs to be improve, we wait like an hour to complete the whole service and we didn’t ordered too much. The girl couldn’t explain what is the dish about, but probably she was not her fault, she was rushing, it was only one waitress for paying attention to the tables, take out, pick up and everything, maybe they need more staff to fill. From my point of view the price is so high 1 taco for $7.50+ tax but I guess they wanted to give Mexican gourmet food experience but as expensive gourmet food the customer service should be at the same level or above

Address: 218 Geary Avenue Toronto, ON M6H 2C3 Canada
Review:
This Gem has Amazing Portuguese Food with Amazing Prices!
-Good Quality Food
-Warm & Friendly Staff
-Awesome Food Portion
-Easy Parking

Photo: Salmon with Garden Salad & Steak w/egg Fries and Salad.

Address: 218 Geary Avenue Toronto, ON M6H 2C3 Canada
Review: Going to really miss this please it’s the best Portuguese chicken in town hands-down,  I think The next time I’ll eat Portuguese chicken is in Portugal lol that’s how good it is… can’t  forget the leitão either!!

Address: 218 Geary Avenue Toronto, ON M6H 2C3 Canada
Review: Amazing food every time, worth coming here if u love bbq.

Address: 218 Geary Avenue Toronto, ON M6H 2C3 Canada
Review: The fries are probably the best we have ever had! Portions are huge for the prices they charge. Really juicy Portuguese BBQ chicken. And inexpensive Great Lakes Brewery craft brew on tap. I was in heaven. Good espresso too! Don't pay attention to the decor. Go for the food and drink.

Address: 218 Geary Avenue Toronto, ON M6H 2C3 Canada
Review: Really good Portugese good at affordable prices. The sandwiches are a real bang for your buck. The Leitao is fantastic, super juicy and flavourful. Will continue to go here often! Staff are also very friendly.

Address: 3200 Dufferin Street Toronto, ON M6A 3B2 Canada
Review: Very popular restaurant with lots people waiting in line but waiting time is short. Lots of food variety and they are all delicious. Great portions as well! Bring couple friends if you wanna try multiple dishes.

Address: 3200 Dufferin Street Toronto, ON M6A 3B2 Canada
Review:
If you want to try a special pho, I highly recommend this place. Its certainly different from other pho restaurants as their soup was unique imo. If you prefer non greasy clean taste this is not the place for you. But if you love rich meaty flavour you should definitely give this place a try.
Price was cheap for the amt of food they serve. I felt like I shouldve brought 4 people to finish two bowls  of noodle.
*I really liked Hue special which they only sell on Fri, Sat and Sunday. Never had any bowl like this elsewhere. Broth was so rich w flavour and it had interesting toppings like crab cake, meat ball (which looked lik a spam) and variety of tendon, beef & more.
*Regular pho comes with huge chunks of beef with a bone. Broth was quite greasy with sooo much meat but because of that, its so rich w meaty flavour.

**be warned of the XXL portion. For ladies, I recommend sharing one bowl. I eat alot but I was defeated after eating 1/3 of the bowl.
**there will be a line but wait time is short, about 10mins or so.
**this place would be perfect esp during wintertime 👍👍

Address: 3200 Dufferin Street Toronto, ON M6A 3B2 Canada
Review:
A very busy and amazingly good Pho in North York :)
Pho Anh Vu opened in 2019 and it in my opinion is one of the  best Vietnamese Restaurants in North York.
If you have big parties or want to dine with your family, Pho Anh Vu offers the best Vietnamese is the right place.
the ingredients are fresh and good quality and the service is fast.

Address: 3200 Dufferin Street Toronto, ON M6A 3B2 Canada
Review:
Really big portion with sensible price.

I ordered their recommended vermicelli, it has grilled pork, sugar caned shrimp, peanuts and spring roll.

Their chilli sauces are top notch👍👍🌶

Address: 3200 Dufferin Street Toronto, ON M6A 3B2 Canada
Review: Was pricy. A bowl of Pho for twenty dollars. The food was good last time I went here  but this time was a bit disappointing. They only take debit or cash and not credit. There were many servers but they are not attentive. I order one coffee with condensed milk. They brought out two and I had to remind them that the meal is done and the coffee was not even served yet..:(

Address: 220 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3X2 Canada
Review: The food was really good!! We were four people and shared like 5 dishes plus some starters- was delicious and also very cheap and they were so nice. I would definitely recommend :)

Address: 220 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3X2 Canada
Review:
5 STAR - SERVICE EXCELLENCE! 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

*** 𝘕𝘖𝘛𝘌: 𝘐 𝘰𝘯𝘭𝘺 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘦 100% 𝘩𝘰𝘯𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘭𝘦𝘵𝘦𝘭𝘺 𝘶𝘯𝘣𝘪𝘢𝘴𝘦𝘥 𝘳𝘦𝘷𝘪𝘦𝘸𝘴. 𝘐𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘦 𝘪𝘴 𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘳𝘪𝘣𝘭𝘦, 𝘪𝘵 𝘸𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘣𝘦 𝘯𝘰𝘵𝘦𝘥. 𝘔𝘰𝘳𝘦 𝘴𝘱𝘦𝘤𝘪𝘧𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘭𝘭𝘺, 𝘪𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘪𝘴𝘩𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘥𝘰𝘦𝘴 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘮𝘦𝘦𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘩𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘲𝘶𝘢𝘭𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘥𝘢𝘳𝘥𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘢 𝘤𝘶𝘴𝘵𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘳 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘴, 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘸𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘢𝘭𝘴𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘯𝘰𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘢𝘭𝘰𝘯𝘨 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘱𝘪𝘤𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘦𝘴 & 𝘷𝘪𝘥𝘦𝘰𝘴.

Title: "A Culinary Journey to the Far East: Tao Northern Chinese Cuisine"

When seeking a dining experience that waltzes across the tightrope of exotic flavors, lavish presentation, and warm hospitality, one need look no further than Tao Northern Chinese Cuisine. Tucked away at 220 Laird Drive, this hidden gem is a veritable treasure trove of dishes that transport your taste buds to the mystical Far East.

Our culinary odyssey commenced with the Chicken Won Ton Noodle Soup, a soothing symphony of delicate flavors that nourished our souls. The Chicken Spring Rolls were next to grace our table; their golden, crispy exteriors revealing a delectable filling that married the playful textures of perfectly seasoned chicken with the earthy crunch of fresh vegetables.

Tao's Chicken Fried Rice danced on our palates, a whirlwind of flavors that united smoky, caramelized notes with the tangy sweetness of pineapple. The Lemon Chicken was a true masterpiece, as if Da Vinci himself had crafted the dish. Tender, succulent pieces of chicken were lightly battered, then bathed in a vibrant lemon sauce that dazzled the senses with its perfect balance of sweetness and acidity.

The Pepper Beef left us utterly speechless, with its tender morsels of beef that melted in our mouths, juxtaposed against the fiery heat of black pepper and the delicate sweetness of caramelized onions. The Assorted Seafood & Vegetables was a delightful marine medley, harmoniously combining the briny freshness of the ocean with the natural sweetness of colorful, crisp veggies.

As for the Chicken Singapore Vermicelli, it was a tantalizing fusion of textures and flavors, each strand of vermicelli expertly coated in a fragrant curry sauce that bewitched the senses.

Our adventure culminated in the sinfully delicious Deep Fried Bananas with Vanilla Ice Cream and strawberries. The bananas, enrobed in a feather-light batter and fried to crispy perfection, were the perfect accompaniment to the creamy, velvety ice cream, while the vibrant strawberries added a dash of color and tang to the exquisite dessert.

Throughout our epicurean escapade, we were guided by the ever-charming Lambert, whose genuine warmth and attentiveness elevated our dining experience to celestial heights. The ever-vigilant Manager Jackie ensured that every detail of our evening unfolded seamlessly, allowing us to fully immerse ourselves in the culinary wonderland that is Tao Northern Chinese Cuisine.

In a world of commonplace dining experiences, Tao Northern Chinese Cuisine is a beacon of culinary creativity and hospitality. It's not just a meal; it's an enchanting voyage to a land where flavors reign supreme and gastronomic dreams come true.

Address: 220 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3X2 Canada
Review:
Tried this spot as it’s close by and we were hoping to satisfy our dumpling craving. We tried the Xiao Long Bao (pork soup dumplings), steamed chicken dumplings, steamed pork & chive dumplings, and pan fried pork buns.

We felt satisfied with the amount we ordered due to the small sizes of the dumplings and we found the flavours to be quite fresh.

Our favourite dish was the pork bun- it was so warm, the filling was delicious, flavourful and fresh.

The dumplings we found to be just okay. All in all, we spent $40, which I think is definitely a little pricier than other dumpling options relative to quality. The soup dumplings were not comparable to others I’ve had - they were mediocre and just didn’t get the job done in my opinion. As well, we found the wrapping of the dumplings to be quite thick. I don’t think that we would order dumplings from this spot again; however seeing the reviews others have left, I’m definitely open to trying other dishes here.

The staff were very pleasant and friendly, and our order was ready in 15 minutes- quick and prompt!

Address: 220 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3X2 Canada
Review:
Usually order takeout from here which is consistently delicious.
This time we dined at the restaurant.
Everything was super tasty and the server was very attentive.
We ordered general tao chicken, sweet and sour shrimp, Shanghai noodles, rice, chilli cashew eggplant.

Address: 220 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3X2 Canada
Review: We tried the lunch menu and the food was a bit underwhelming, think a fast food place on the food court quality. The prices are reasonable though and the lunch combos include a choice of meat, soup, spring roll and rice. The service was good, so it is ok for what it is. If you are in the area and you want a quick Chinese meal, it is not too bad.

Address: 4704 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5M4 Canada
Review:
1st time trying this place during lunch. Had late lunch n restaurant still full. Was greeted by two amazing and smiling wait staff. Added nicely to the restaurant coziness.

Yellow curry was amazing n had right balance of Thai herbs which is hard to find in Toronto. Each lunch special also came with Thai spring roll...which came hot n freshly fried. Luv hot food! Slightly surprised with crispy pork as it was cooked in heavy sauce so the pork wasn't crispy but since sauce was good, dish was ok at the end. What was unexpected was the hot & sour soup which had enormous amount of black pepper. Was hoping Thai soup so surprised with Chinese. Just a note that there's limited parking space (only 1 spot in front and 3 paid street parking on the south Street beside Hero burger) so easier to take public transit/walk.

Address: 4704 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5M4 Canada
Review:
Excellent service, the waitress was super nice. She gave us plates for sharing and chopsticks before we asked.
Ordered Pad Thai and chicken satay, tasty and portion was decent.  Definitely will come back.

Address: 4704 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5M4 Canada
Review: Did take out from Eat BKK for a few times so had to go in and gran the Crispy Pork Pad Thai special which is one of my go to dishes. They could turn up the spice levels a lot more on the Pad See Ew we ordered that was the only miss. Chicken Wings Zaab was a decent appetitizer for flavor!

Address: 4704 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5M4 Canada
Review: It is a very cozy nice restaurant, if you like thai, you should try them. I got Khao soi, which is fried noodle and chicken within a coconut milk soup with vegetables as garnish. It was perfect! It would be better if the owner renovate the place, everything looked dull.

Address: 4704 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5M4 Canada
Review:
Oct 2022 edit/addition: they've changed their Khao Soi ingredients or presentation, tastes just as good. And also added the Laab grilled chicken! A must try. I always order the Laab wings and had asked if they had it in chicken form. They do. They have a cash discount available.

I ordered the braised beef with rice. My friend ordered the veg pad see ew. And we got wings.

My order had something wrong with it. Had to send it back and they corrected it. I hope. They sent us complimentary spring rolls for the experience. I cant dock them. Mistakes and accidents happen. They did well to make up for it.

Helpful staff, though they were slammed with many customers and pick ups.

These wings are on my top 5 list of best wings. A must try.

Restaurant_name: RH Courtyard Restaurant at RH Toronto
Address: 3401 Dufferin Street RH Toronto Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review: Yesterday we celebrated our First year Wedding Anniversary. The server was so sweet and she did everything for us to enjoy our dining experience. Excellent service. The food was just perfect. The ambiance of the restaurant was like wow. We felt like we were in Europe. The tour of the Gallery was impeccable.

Restaurant_name: RH Courtyard Restaurant at RH Toronto
Address: 3401 Dufferin Street RH Toronto Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
During our recent visit to the restaurant, my wife and I had a satisfying dining experience. I opted for the shaved prime rib sandwich and found it to be quite delicious. The flavors were well-balanced, and the meat was tender and flavorful. My wife, on the other hand, chose the quarter chicken, which was cooked to perfection. The chicken was juicy, tender, and had a delightful crispiness to the skin.

The restaurant itself had a charming and elegant ambiance. However, one minor downside was that the tables were positioned a bit too close together, which made it feel a bit cramped at times. On our way to the bathroom, we had the opportunity to browse the furniture they sell, which was a unique and interesting touch.

While the overall experience was enjoyable, we did find the service to be a little slow. It would have been great if the staff were more attentive and prompt in attending to our needs. Nevertheless, the friendly and accommodating nature of the staff made up for the slight delay in service.

In conclusion, the restaurant provided us with tasty food, a pleasant atmosphere, and a glimpse into their unique furniture offerings. Although the tables were a bit close together and the service was a touch slow, these minor drawbacks did not significantly impact our overall positive dining experience.

Restaurant_name: RH Courtyard Restaurant at RH Toronto
Address: 3401 Dufferin Street RH Toronto Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review: It is my first time to be there. The environment is really nice. It has a very tall and delicate ceiling and there also have a lot of green plants around you. The food presentation and portion is terrible. All of our main courses only have one piece of parsley as garnish. And for Salmon and lobster roll just have additional piece of lemon. There is no side dish with any of those main courses. I feel really disappointed about that because the price does not match with food quality. The only thing make me feel happy is their service. Our waiter is super nice, she pay attention to any details that we asked. Also, she replaced our steak after we told her that was over cooked. She said sorry to us because the steak was bad. I really appreciate for her service.

Restaurant_name: RH Courtyard Restaurant at RH Toronto
Address: 3401 Dufferin Street RH Toronto Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
If there is one place that you can take pictures worth posting to social media it is going to be at the RH Courtyard. The interior is decked out in the most beautiful and luxurious couches and chandeliers. The entirety of the main floor is just brightly lit with the warmth from the chandeliers and it makes the whole atmosphere so warm and inviting.

The food was also quite good too. We got the lobster roll, the half roasted chicken, and the gem lettuce salad, and all of them were superior. The price is a bit in the higher side but they really do give you an amazing experience, so I would say that it’s reasonable.

The waitstaff was also super nice and since we were celebrating a birthday they even came out towards the end to give us a celebration dessert (a chocolate chip cookie) it was so cute and unexpected and overall really made our day.

In short, if you get the chance to, please give this place a visit. The food is good and the atmosphere is even better, but just note that the price is on the higher side.

Restaurant_name: RH Courtyard Restaurant at RH Toronto
Address: 3401 Dufferin Street RH Toronto Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
A beautiful restaurant with excellent service. The staff is very professional and pretty prompt for the most part. Great place to go for brunch with friends.

The chicken was a bit dry in the caesar salad but the rest of the salad was fresh. The truffle fries are great to share.

Overall, the food tasted very good. With the pricing and atmosphere they’ve set, you do expect things to be high quality and to not miss a beat. It is expensive for brunch but makes for a solid outing once in a while. 4 stars.

Address: 1108 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A7 Canada
Review: Cano is always a vibe. If you’re looking for some great Italian food, this is the spot. The service is top notch and the staff is extremely friendly. I’ve been here quite a few times, so if you’re planning a trip here, make sure to order the Gnudi, and if you like fish, sharing the grilled seafood board is a must. The only downside this visit was the pizza was undercooked.. could’ve got a better char on it. Also, portion sizes are very generous so you are able to share everything with your table if you like to eat family style.

Address: 1108 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A7 Canada
Review:
Came for the first time back in April this year and can't believe it took me so long to come here- easily one of my fav restaurants after one visit 💕

Carpaccio di Manzo 💕
Grande Fritti di Mare 💕
Gnudi ai Funghi 👌
Pizza N'duja 💕
Tiramisu 💕

I order Calamari at most places I see it on the menu but I've got to say this is probably the best calamari I've ever had 🤤 it was so fresh and soft with a light crisp batter exterior! Carpaccio was very light and seasoned very well, topped with alot of parm & arugula and a soft and cheewy homemade bread. The gnudi (gnoochi) was melt in your mouth soft, I've never had it at such a soft texture before- very different but also so good with the mushroom truffle sauce! I'm very spicy sensitive and this was the first time I had a N'duja pizza I could handle, thanks to the great recommendation of our bar server! Spreading the burrata over the top of the pizza likely helped a lot. The tiramsu was rich and creamy, a bit thicker texture than others I'm used to and loved it!

We sat at the bar and our bar server was great, he provided the best recommendations and everything we had was amazing!

Can't wait to come back and try other dinner items and the brunch menu!

Address: 1108 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A7 Canada
Review: Ambiance was cute and great service. Food was finger licking good and we would go back to this place. It was a bit pricey, but everything tasted delicious from the nduja pizza, burrata cheese, kale salad, gnudi pasta. We definitely enjoyed the food even though it was super loud. We could barely hear each other. I’m not sure if the restaurant was too small with too many people, but it was loud and crowded.

Address: 1108 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A7 Canada
Review:
My friend and I grabbed drinks on the patio - Sunday May 14th (Mother's Day) around 2pm. We didn't catch our servers name but he was awesome! Super friendly, honesty, no fuss when we said we were just in for drinks (at first). Gave a great recommendation for food. Honestly, he was a big part of us enjoying our experience. It was refreshing to have such a memorable and pleasant server.

We enjoyed 2 rounds of the espresso martinis. We can't wait to come back on another weekend and enjoy the cocktail hour specials (I believe between 3-5pm!).

Address: 1108 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A7 Canada
Review: Amazing food! Service was good and atmosphere is nice. A bit loud inside and cramped but overall amazing experience!

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: Service was quick and staff are friendly. We ordered chicken and lamb skewers, braised beef noodle soup and chicken cutlet(or filet?) noodle soup. I’d say that the lamb skewers were my favourite, it was so tender and flavourful, perfectly seasoned. I knocked off a star because the soup/broth had no flavour to it.
