I ordered extra spicy because I love spicy foods and although it looks spicy, it wasn’t at all. Didn’t even get a little kick of spiciness which was a bit disappointing because I expected it to be spicy. Other than that, it was very filling and we really enjoyed our time dining here!

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: Very tasty food and cozy environment.  Read the reviews and decided to go and try the food.  The portion is not small, enough to fill up . Thanks to the staff who served us.  They are very kind and welcoming.  The guy gave us a fork so that we would not suffer with chopsticks :)

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
The portion is ridiculous- great for sharing for sure. The lame on a stick is delicious. The best thing there. I might go back for something else and try their other noodles. The non caffeinated drinks are also yummy. Great service.

Their noodle though is good but flavour wise is not very flavourful but maybe I should have ask them for something else on the side.

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: I came here because of a tiktok, the food was really good. The taste of the Dan Dan noodles were really good, not as spicy as I thought they would be. The beef noodle soup tasted like home, the beef was so tender, however I got the flat noodles which were too thick for my liking, but that was my fault. Overall, great service and the food was really nice!

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
Delicious food! Had the stir fried noodles with chicken (thick round noodle size) and it was delicious. Nice, large portion and the service was quick - I got take out and had the food within 10 mins.
Will definitely visit again.

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: Service was quick and staff are friendly. We ordered chicken and lamb skewers, braised beef noodle soup and chicken cutlet(or filet?) noodle soup. I’d say that the lamb skewers were my favourite, it was so tender and flavourful, perfectly seasoned. I knocked off a star because the soup/broth had no flavour to it. I ordered extra spicy because I love spicy foods and although it looks spicy, it wasn’t at all. Didn’t even get a little kick of spiciness which was a bit disappointing because I expected it to be spicy. Other than that, it was very filling and we really enjoyed our time dining here!

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: Very tasty food and cozy environment.  Read the reviews and decided to go and try the food.  The portion is not small, enough to fill up . Thanks to the staff who served us.  They are very kind and welcoming.  The guy gave us a fork so that we would not suffer with chopsticks :)

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
The portion is ridiculous- great for sharing for sure. The lame on a stick is delicious. The best thing there. I might go back for something else and try their other noodles. The non caffeinated drinks are also yummy. Great service.

Their noodle though is good but flavour wise is not very flavourful but maybe I should have ask them for something else on the side.

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: I came here because of a tiktok, the food was really good. The taste of the Dan Dan noodles were really good, not as spicy as I thought they would be. The beef noodle soup tasted like home, the beef was so tender, however I got the flat noodles which were too thick for my liking, but that was my fault. Overall, great service and the food was really nice!

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
Delicious food! Had the stir fried noodles with chicken (thick round noodle size) and it was delicious. Nice, large portion and the service was quick - I got take out and had the food within 10 mins.
Will definitely visit again.

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
I really wanted to like this place. Maybe i ordered the wrong thing. It was average. There were a few things I did not enjoy. But first, the restaurant itself was clean and bright. The tables small and enough for 2 people and two bowls of noodles. The service was good and i liked their bubble tea.
I ordered the pickled vegetable beef noodle soup. The beef was so overcooked it was all crumbling in my soup and there wasnt a lot. The noodle portion sizes were crazy big. CRAZY BIG. There were so many noodles in there it felt like the more I ate, the more noodles there were. The flavour was alright.
It was definitely something that can be shared among two people or they could even have a size small.

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
9.6/10
One of the best noodle dishes in the city for sure!!! Please visit the restaurant as well as it will enhance your experience.

Ordered through Doordash before once and enjoyed the beef noodles. This time tried the Braised Beef Noodles and it was delicious!! Reheated the broth but that was due to my dasher not putting in a heating bag. 9.2/10

Reply to owner: Hello! I just visited the restaurant and the noodles were absolutely delectable!! It's a different experience eating them fresh!! The waitress with glasses was very polite and accommodating. My impression has become even better now! 9.6/10
Theirs no such thing as a perfect dish, but this is close. 🙏🏽🙏🏽🤤🤤

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
This place is beyond amazing. I can’t put into words the noodles I had. I know it seems very menial however these noodles are some of the best noodles I’ve ever had! The combination of the love put into the hand pulling done by the chef and the seemingly handful yet carefully chosen spices blend perfectly into a medley of amazing taste!

I can’t wait to go back and try more of their food! 😭😍

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review: I have been here twice so far and have thoroughly enjoyed the food both the times! I would 100% recommend their braised beef noodle, stir fried chicken noodle and lamb skewers! The server Jay was so helpful and patient with our questions. Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant.

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
For the price you are paying you get a huge quantity! I ordered the braised beef noodle soup and you can choose your spice level. The beef was very tender and the broth very flavorful!

I also ordered the bean noodle which I thought was jellyfish at first. Really delicious appetizer! I think it was topped with chili oil.

Restaurant is relatively small but humble and I really enjoyed my meal! Fair price point for flavor and quantity. Definitely appreciated that!

Address: 1382 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1M9 Canada
Review: Great brunch place! We easily got a table and the service was so quick. Not to mention the staff was patient and friendly. We ordered their mimosas and they were so good. Reasonably priced as well. Their corn hummus is definitely a must try. Goes so well with the drinks. We tried their beef and chicken burgers which were delicious. I usually don’t like fries as sides, but their fries are so well seasoned. Definitely a must try! Great food options with their special menu available as well. Do give this place a try !

Address: 1382 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1M9 Canada
Review:
We have been wanting to try the Wren for several months now, but it has always been so crowded and the wait too long. Even in a Wednesday night, we had a 20 minute wait.
The service was excellent and the food super yummy. Everything was reasonably priced. Their beer list is extensive with a lot of yummy options on tap. Where they are lacking is their cocktail menu. They were unable to make several simple bar staples - but I suppose that’s just not their jam.
I had their special “chicken Big Mac burger” which was amazing. Their fries were excellent - although my DH found them too greasy.
If you’re a cocktail drinker, I’d say this is not your place- but if you’re a beer drinker and yummy food eater, absolutely go here!

Address: 1382 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1M9 Canada
Review:
This was our second time, my husband I really loved the food, we had this special skirt steak, we've had the mozzarella sticks and the burguer last time. Everything was absolutely delicious, can't believe this is a pub! We sat at the bar both times, the service was very good and friendly. We are definitely becoming regulars ;)
We also enjoyed the ambient, we are definitely coming back with some friends, music is not loud, great for enjoying a conversation.

Address: 1382 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1M9 Canada
Review: They were so welcoming and friendly. The beer was great. The food was great. The wine was great. They forgot to charge us for a glass of wine. When we mentioned it, they didn't charge us (we paid for it in the tip) 👍. I had the Big Ol' Dippa and my partner had the Chorizo burger. Both excellent.

Address: 1382 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1M9 Canada
Review:
Phenomenal menu! This place clearly has a very talented chef. They have a curated menu with probably 10-15 or so options yet somehow all of them sounded insanely delicious. In addition to that, if you check out their Instagram you’ll see they have a daily special. To come up with something of that caliber everyday is extremely impressive. The prices are very reasonable for the quality of the food and service.

The fish tacos are some of the best I’ve ever had, great fusion flavours. That being said, I’m confident that anything off this menu would be amazing. Everyone at our table was very happy with their meals, and they have a great drink menu to go with it. Definitely stop here for a meal if you’re in the area but it’s also worth going out of your way to get there.

Address: 954 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A1 Canada
Review: This place is the bomb dot com. I walked by many times but have never gone inside. My friend finally invited me to go there and I’ll be going back all the time food is sooooo good and so affordable. The people owners are so nice so sweet!!  :) also the fruit they gave with my meal is my favourite watermelon and pineapple! Thanks so much I’ll be coming back many times!

Address: 954 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A1 Canada
Review: Really wonderful spot! Owners are so sweet and the food was delicious. So excited to come back again!

Address: 954 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A1 Canada
Review: I wish i knew about this place 5 years ago. the owners are so sweet, and their food is simple and delicious. The way foods are supposed to be. Ill be there every Saturday morning for my breakfast from now on. My breakfast place used to be Boom. Bon voyage

Address: 954 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A1 Canada
Review: The people that run this place are very lovely and so sweet. The prices are awesome. The food is delicious. I hope they continue to prosper and do well in their business.

Address: 954 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A1 Canada
Review: The best, juiciest, most flavourful chicken shawarma in town. Comes with their homemade sauces and a hot sauce that’ll blow your socks off if you are a spice fan. 10/10 definitely try it if you haven’t.

Address: 4916 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N5 Canada
Review: This place is a new favourite spot for Korean noodles! The service is great and the food hits the spot on a cool evening. The soup noodles were spicy, brothy and perfectly cooked. We got two kinds of noodles with pork, pork bone and potatoes. The beef dumplings were crispy and a perfect side. A great place to grab a bite! The shares hot bowls great for sharing if you are hungry!

Address: 4916 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N5 Canada
Review: Recommended by a Korean friend that this is the go to place for Gamjatang. We ordered the large pot and is enough to feed 4-5 people. We also ordered Korean fried chicken with sweet glazed sauce and Tonkatsu. Would highly recommend.

Address: 4916 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N5 Canada
Review: Had my very first spicy pork bone soup in life and it was delicious! There were 4 pieces of meat in the bowl with soft potato and glass noodles. They also served unlimited side dishes if you need to devour a lot per your appetite. I got full just with my soup and rice. I’d love to come back again another time. The lady servers were very prompt and helpful. Thank you for the lovely experience!

Address: 4916 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N5 Canada
Review: Very tasty pork bone soup. It was served on butane gas stove to keep it hot. Korean side dishes were also amazing. Definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves Korean food.

Address: 4916 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N5 Canada
Review: Haven’t had gamjatang for a while out so we decided to try it here. I had an order that was less spicy but will try the regular spiced one next time. The flavours were on point. The pork neck bone was not boiled/simmered enough. The flavours of the broth was not infused enough into the bones as the pork bones didn’t break apart easily. Overall the flavour profile was there but just required a bit more time in the pot. The Kimchi that came with the side dishes were delicious. Service was fine since we went in the late afternoon. They are between a 3 - 4 star, I will make adjustments base upon my next visit.

Address: 575 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z3 Canada
Review:
Overall, Mabu Generation is rather mediocre all things considered. Although some menu items here do stand out, the majority are exceptionally overpriced. On busy nights, you can expect to join a virtual Queue and will have to go elsewhere and wait for a table to open meanwhile, which detracts from the experience.

The atmosphere is rather flashy and aesthetic, though not necessary comfortable. It feels more so like a trendy pub at times, as it can get quite crowded and loud.

Of the food, notable appetizers include the okonomiyaki fries and the Deep Fried Tofu with Garlic Sauce, both being exceptionally flavourful for the price. I don't recommend the BBQ crab sticks as they tasted as if they were overseasoned with pepper. Entree-wise, I highly recommend sharing the Mabu Egged Sukiyaki with Rice, although pricey, it is exceptionally filling and is definitely a meal fit for more than one person. I'd advise against getting the House Special Deep Fried Pork Chop with Mapo Tofu sauce on rice. For the price, it isn't really noteworthy, nor does it taste as spicy as one would expect of mapo Tofu and is overall a letdown.

I will note however that the rice bowls are decently filling, and probably one of the few decent recommendations at Mabu. Likewise, the only other solid options at Mabu are the desserts, but they are exceptionally overpriced. If you're fine with burning a bit of cash, sharing either the mango or matcha honey cube toast ice cream tower with friends is a solid choice, same applies to the Mabu House Special Grass Jelly with Brown Sugar Milk Tea.

To conclude, Mabu Generation is overpriced, underwhelming and overrated.

Address: 575 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z3 Canada
Review:
I dined at Mabu Generation 麻布 at the Yonge & Wellesley location. As its website sums it up, it's a trendy Taiwanese fusion cuisine. I found the staff provided excellent service and by default check on me to see if everything is ok and refilled my ice water by default. Interesting and unique decor with all the nostalgic artwork that reminds us back home and the memories.

I ordered the Tawianese spicy beef soup noodles. It's spicy, just the way it should be, spicy broth. $16.99 + tax isn't cheap per say but at downtown location and inflation, it's the norm nowadays.

Overall, I enjoyed my visit.

Address: 575 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z3 Canada
Review: Pretty good Taiwanese spot. I loved the decor and vibe. There were retro movie posters and a large cute mural on the opposite wall. Everything appeared to be made of wood. The food was fairly good. I really liked the hot plate. I found the hot pot to be just okay. The portion was good for 2 people. Taste-wise it was okay, not amazing. The desserts looked pretty ridiculous and very sweet. The service was very good and attentive. I would probably come for the other sizzling plates and maybe the dessert with a group.

Address: 575 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z3 Canada
Review:
I got many recommendations for this restaurant. The food was great: crispy chicken, soft and juicy pork feet. The cocktail was pretty and not strong.
But the customer service experience was not good:
1. the menu needed to scan QR code, while the network was super bad in the restaurant. I struggled for a while until I was told there was wifi available by waiters.
2. The crispy chicken rice actually included egg, but not mentioned on the menu. Then I added extra egg while ordering. At the end I got 2 eggs and no one reminded me of it…

Overall it’s great and some customer service experience can be improved.

Address: 575 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z3 Canada
Review: Went in to grab a small bite late at night. Now I think I found my new favourite! Their food is so delicious and so well seasoned. When I came in, the restaurant was PACKED, we sat after 10-15 mins and the wait was worth it, the manager even gave us free dessert as an apology for waiting. Their restaurant was closed when we ordered but they even waited for us until we finished. So happy about the service and the food, it’s rare but definitely  a gem

Address: 4848 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N2 Canada
Review:
So happy to be so close to one of my favourite spots for oysters, sushi rolls and other Japanese fares. Love the yuzu cocktails and unique take on dishes./ Absolutely love the salmon roll with asparagus and apple. Such an interesting flavour pairing and it was so filling!

Definitely love bringing folks here for the vibe and it’s so conveniently located right off Yonge and Sheppard, near the highway and transit. Parking is tricky if it’s full but other than that it’s a great location.

Make sure to try it out at least once and head over Tuesday and Wednesday for specials.

Address: 4848 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N2 Canada
Review: Had dinner with a group of 6 on their spacious patio. Pretty nice vibes but they had a mandatory 18% gratuity for a group our size. We tried various items. Their sushi rolls were not conventional but not my favourite. I liked the octo wasabi appetizer and it was pretty good with the oyster too.

Address: 4848 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N2 Canada
Review: Food tasted pretty good. We enjoyed the seared salmon roll the most. However menu prices are on the higher end. Service was good and ambience was also nice. They have $1 oysters on Tuesdays and Wednesdays!

Address: 4848 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N2 Canada
Review: What a susprised for this little izakaya.  We couple frds gather for drinks and food.  They have $1 per oyster, which is good for what we came.  We ordered 5 dozen with other food.  Food is acceptional good. Service is fast for the 1st round.  Abit slow for next round as the restaurant got busy at late night.  It is a good place for some drinkz Nd food. Chill and relax.  Highly recommeded.

Address: 4848 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N2 Canada
Review:
Definitely on the pricey side but loved the creative touches they added to the items on the menu and the quality of the food. Restaurant ambience was lovely  and felt classy.

We had the Seared Salmon roll, Cali Donburi, East and West Coast Oysters, Crispy Pork Belly, and their specialty sakes. Food took a bit to arrive but it was absolutely worth the wait.

Servers were also very friendly. Sometimes took a little to get their attention as it was busy  but generally very attentive.

Consider coming with a group of friends as they have many shareable options.

Overall a great experience, will be coming again in the future.

Address: 998 St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A2 Canada
Review: Probably the best tacos in Toronto. I’m not the biggest taco connoisseur but I think anyone that likes tacos and has a half decent palette would appreciate this place. This is a very small restaurant that is out of the way but it’s worth travelling to. Don’t expect a lot from the decor. It’s a food served on paper plates type of place. Incredibly nice staff. Everything I had was great.

Address: 998 St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A2 Canada
Review:
Chorilocos nachos were fantastic - just the right amount of heat, loads of flavour, and lots of crunch! Beware, you’re likely to fill up on these sausage-topped nachos before your tacos even arrive.

I really enjoyed the shrimp taco, but the volcan (steak), pastor (marinated pork), choriqueso (cheese and sausage), and pescado (fish) tacos tasted just alright.

Very limited indoor and outdoor seating. No frills, cash only, authentic and local.

Address: 998 St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A2 Canada
Review: An authentic, small and family run place. I loved their taco, very fresh and felt like a homemade one. It's cash only by the way, but they take e-transfer too.

Address: 998 St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A2 Canada
Review: Thought this place was a bit pricey for what you get. We ordered the torta sandwich with pork and it was very large and can be split between 2 people - very tasty. Opted out of the tacos since fancier dining establishments charge the same amount per taco if not less and this place is more of a take out or quick bites place. Also got the beef quesadilla and it was ok, wasn’t wowed by it.

Address: 998 St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A2 Canada
Review:
Itacate is a small, family-run taqueria on St. Clair West. We usually come to St. Clair for sushi (but Shunoko is gone now 😭), and always walked by Itacate on the way to get dessert at Futura.

There isn’t a lot of seating and a lot of people get their food to-go. However, we were able to grab a table near the door where there was additional window seating. Expect longer wait times during peak hours.

The place has a bunch of different luchador masks adorning the walls which were super cool. The kitchen is open and you can see them preparing the food right in front of you.

We got 7 tacos for $8 each, served with 2 hot sauces. It is on the pricier side compared to other Toronto taco places we’ve been to but the food was delicious nonetheless.

💵Cash and e-Transfer available for tax-free payment. Debit is also available +tax.

🌮3x Pastor (marinated pork, pineapple)
🌮Volcan (steak, onions, cheese)
🌮Suadero (beef)
🌮2x Camarones a la Mexicana (shrimp)

Address: 454 Parliament Street Toronto, ON M5A 3A2 Canada
Review:
Tried this pub for the first time, and we quite loved it! The staff were super friendly, and the food was great as well.
We tried the steak and wild mushroom pie, scotch egg, the parliament burger and steak sandwich. The steak sandwich was particularly good.

Address: 454 Parliament Street Toronto, ON M5A 3A2 Canada
Review:
A great experience as a whole!
Big portion plates, with super amazing taste.
Very friendly and attentive staff.
Loved all the details of design and space. This place is more than a pub/ restaurant, its a community space for the cool people of the block!

Address: 454 Parliament Street Toronto, ON M5A 3A2 Canada
Review: Love the location. Customer service was top notch. Food was hot, tasty, and excellent. Great beers! Highly recommended

Address: 454 Parliament Street Toronto, ON M5A 3A2 Canada
Review: I think it's the vibe and the friendly staff that always makes it a memorable visit. Good eclectic menu that tries to cater to different palates and needs. My friends loved the food. I felt it could have been a bit better in terms of the flavor. I got the coconut shrimp, chowder and the caramel/cake dessert. Nevertheless it was minor compared to the whole experience. The string of people that keep coming and the fact that its always packed is a testament to them being one of the best places to be in this area!

Address: 454 Parliament Street Toronto, ON M5A 3A2 Canada
Review: The decoration is amazing! Perfect place to go if you are looking for esthetic place. We ordered chicken wings with French fries. It tasted so good!  Highly recommended for you are looking for a nice place with good food. Staffs are exceptionally good. 10/10.

Address: 1744 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M1R 1R4 Canada
Review:
We pre booked a table for a group of six and got seats instantly. The inner decor looks great and the service was really nice.

Now coming to the food, it was refreshing and mouth watering. We tried multiple dishes like mango salad, chicken satay, beef salad, one shrimp dish, one crab dish, stir fried beef, stir fried chicken, green curry, iced tea and no complaints and a special thanks to the chef for the mango and beef salad. I would highly recommend this place and would love to be back again.

Address: 1744 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M1R 1R4 Canada
Review:
Love their Thai iced tea. Chicken pad thai and fish red curry weren’t spicy or maybe I should have asked but it was still great. And mango sticky rice was great too.
The staff and service were good too.

Address: 1744 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M1R 1R4 Canada
Review:
Great food but a bit too westernized. But take note that I just came back from Thailand few months ago so my tastebuds are tamed to real thai authentic cuisines. Pad thai and tom yum was good. Khao soi is very different from what I used to get in Northern Thailand. Tasted a bit too artificial.
Service is superb, nice smiley Thai staffs.

Address: 1744 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M1R 1R4 Canada
Review: Located in a strip mall, you wouldn't have guessed that they have a hidden beautifully renovated sitting area.  We ordered an array of different food and everything was delicious.  Service was friendly and prompt.

Address: 1744 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M1R 1R4 Canada
Review: Halal Thai Restaurant in Toronto. Their food is terrific when it served spicy. The mild option is pretty blunt. If you order mild, make sure you ask them to give you extra chilli paste on side. If you add their Thai Chilli in soup, it will make the soup 10 times better. You will get the kick. I loved their Mango Salad, Tom Kha, Pad Thai, Penang Curry the most.

Address: 1109 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M4B 2K2 Canada
Review: This place is a favourite for sure, the foods great, the vibe is great, and the waiters are very kind. It’s a tad bit disorganized if im being honest but I don’t mind cause it’s made up for overall with everything else. If you’re an impatient person or just very critical of the places you eat this might not be the place for you. If you’re looking for a casual place to eat some good food then it’s pretty great.

Address: 1109 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M4B 2K2 Canada
Review:
So so. Went here after a bad long day!
Heard their fish tacos was great however I will review on what I had. Fries with guac. Veggie tacos and veggie tostado. So so! Not the best. Beer was good.

Address: 1109 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M4B 2K2 Canada
Review:
Incredible experience tonight at Mexitaco. It was mine and my wife's first time and the food and drinks were great. I had the mexitaco beer which was a light tasting lager and my wife a strawberry margarita. Both drinks were brought instantly as well as the food. I cannot say how quick it was because we ordered it and less than 10 minutes later we had the food we ordered.

We ordered the nachos and tacos de birra. The chips were fresh tasting and crispy and delicious and I would definitely recommend them. 👌 The tacos de birra were phenomenal and I cannot say enough good about them I loved the flavourful beef, the complimentary sauces and the beef au jus wasn't necessary but a nice touch.

The food was so good we also tried the baja fish tacos and then shared the churros.

Overall the experience was great and all of the staff was so very friendly and helpful.

I will definitely return probably next weekend for the live music and more of their delicious food.

Address: 1109 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M4B 2K2 Canada
Review: Surprisingly very good fries and wings at this joint. Plantains left a lot to be desired.

Address: 1109 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M4B 2K2 Canada
Review: Fantastic service and the Birria tacos were amaaazing. Great guacamole and sangria too and the family I went with loved the fish tacos.

Address: 172 Main Street S Toronto, ON M4E 2W1 Canada
Review:
I have been working in the area for a month and I kept passing this place. It’s quite small and unassuming. As a veteran home smoker I’m often critical of smokehouse’s as “you can’t beat my own cooking”. Beach House Smokehouse does not disappoint! As soon as you walk in, the sweet aroma of authentic BBQ fills the air.
I’m greeted by people that are proud of they are serving. I ordered the ribs with the intention of bringing some home. They offered BBQ sauce. I took it just in case my ribs would be dry. That sauce remained untouched as the ribs were juicy and perfectly cooked. They let me try a piece of brisket and…. I have no words. Melt in your mouth.
I would highly recommend to any smoke enthusiasts and I will definitely be back!

Address: 172 Main Street S Toronto, ON M4E 2W1 Canada
Review:
It was awesome.
The ribs and the chicken were just juicy and insanely good.
We're pretty big smokehouse connoisseurs, and both left there pretty darn happy. Staff were real charming too.

A must-visit.

Address: 172 Main Street S Toronto, ON M4E 2W1 Canada
Review:
I was traveling in Toronto and took a train to this side of the down to try this restaurant. I ordered their ribs and brisket.

Ribs were very meaty (nearly St.Louis style) and prepared pretty well. I should say that they were cooked for enough time so they were tender. Yet, there was still too much fat that was oozing out, so overall they didn't taste very pleasant. Personally I would like them to be cooked a bit longer to render the fat.

The brisket was well trimmed and cooked. Yet, the brisket itself, especially the flat muscle, was very thin, feels like those cheaper ones from Walmart. And it had a bit weird taste at the first bite. I personally didn't enjoy that much, and I think it's related to the meat quality, not cooking skills. I also had a couple of slices of point muscle, they were okay. Afterall, they were not high-priced, though I would be willing to pay a bit more for slightly higher quality of meat.

Address: 172 Main Street S Toronto, ON M4E 2W1 Canada
Review: Fantastic location for me to meet clients. A short walk down Main Street. Food was delicious, lots of flavour. Reasonably priced and good portions. I will be back with my family.

Address: 172 Main Street S Toronto, ON M4E 2W1 Canada
Review: My first time here and I know I’m definitely coming back. The food is delicious and the attention was great, very attentive and helpful. The only think that I didn’t like is the price, it’s kind of overpriced.

Address: 1018 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A4 Canada
Review: The only place with Cambodian food in the city! So glad I came by. It’s take-out only for now, but it’s so worth it. Food is flavourful and delicious, and took me right back to Cambodia. Great service and lovely people. Will definitely be back for more. Au kun! 🤓

Address: 1018 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A4 Canada
Review: I wish I could give it 4.5 stars. The portions were good. The service was friendly. Everything was tasty but only 2/5 dishes were excellent. The decor inside is seriously lacking as well. #10 was really good! The cold rolls were a good size but were a bit bland compared to other places I've been. #12 had lots of veggies and good flavors. I didnt love the basil chicken.. Res curry was good too. I will go again and found prices to be fair.

Address: 1018 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A4 Canada
Review:
Really good quality Cambodian/Thai food. Fair price and great service. Plenty of options and you can not go wrong. The
Cambodian soup was rich and was my favorite.  I'd definitely come back

Address: 1018 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A4 Canada
Review: This is a beautiful place on St Clair West. The ambience was good and staff very friendly! The food was beyond awesome and so generous 😁😋 Be careful about the spice level, my friend found medium spicy also a lil over the top 😅 Definitely going to be a regular patron here for sure

Address: 1018 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A4 Canada
Review: There is a real authenticity and family run atmosphere here. The food looks and tastes homemade. It’s not too greasy or salty and my belly is happy :) the owner is friendly and personable. Combo #2 beef and sweet potato for my first time!

Address: 636 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1A9 Canada
Review:
Fish and chips is a classic dish that I hold near and dear to my heart. The perfect combination of fried fish, crispy fries, and tangy tartar sauce is hard to resist.

Sea Witch Fish and Chips boasts a welcoming atmosphere and friendly staff. The main staff members were knowledgeable and helpful, but I suspect the person who was battering and frying the fish that day may have been new to the job.

Their menu offers four different types of fish: halibut ($26), haddock ($17.50), trout ($18), and pickerel ($19). Although I typically prefer white fish, I decided to try the pickerel, and I was pleasantly surprised by the well-seasoned fish, despite the thick batter. The fries were decent, but a bit inconsistent in texture.

While my experience at Sea Witch Fish and Chips was good, I believe there is room for improvement. I would be willing to give it another try if I were in the area. Overall, I would give Sea Witch Fish and Chips a 3.5 out of 5 rating.

Address: 636 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1A9 Canada
Review:
We first came here because we learned they fry everything in tallow! Far better for you than seed oils (vege, canola etc), and the taste is better too. I do think the first time we visited - right as they opened for dinner - was the best visit. The fish wasn’t too greasy, fries were good. Since then we’ve visited a couple more times, some visits it felt a bit greasy with differing levels of batter.

That being said, still enjoy coming here. The service is so friendly, and love the atmosphere and unpretentious vintage decor.

Address: 636 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1A9 Canada
Review: One of the few excellent fish n chips places left. Great service in family friendly atmosphere. Almost forgot, generous portions of delicious fish!

Address: 636 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1A9 Canada
Review:
Amazing Fish & Chips! Saw this spot on ticktok and doordash and decided to dine in person. We were extremely hungry and ordered larger meals plus added gravy & coleslaw.  Portions are generous which is good given the pricing.  We could barely finish half a fish and some fries.
Worth every penny! Fish is fresh and crisp.

Address: 636 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1A9 Canada
Review: Quant and cute environment with a gorgeous mural outside. Their tartar sauce is great and their fish is cooked perfectly. If you're going for good Friday, get a Reservation!

Address: 4161 4 Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1J5 Canada
Review: Great all around experience. Every staff member we interacted with was friendly and helpful. Everyone went above and beyond to make sure we were completely satisfied. Every dish we ordered was delicious and well portioned. The food and beer menu was well rounded. They were great with the kids too.

Address: 4161 4 Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1J5 Canada
Review:
Finally had the chance to visit the new location and was really satisfied with both the food and service.
Cocktails were yum and so was the really thin pizza selection and nachos. The inside decor is also to die for and I did not hesitate to take photos at ALL.
Our server Teanna went out of her way to make my two kids feel special and seen which is rare to find at a restaurant in town. 10/10 atmosphere. Will definitely visit again soon

Address: 4161 4 Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1J5 Canada
Review: Amazing pizza and poutine. Service was outstanding. Bravo to the team.

Address: 4161 4 Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1J5 Canada
Review: I was here on the first day of what I believe was a re-opening. Everything was so tasty, you can tell it was homemade. Everyone I interacted with was very kind, and I could tell there were a lot of local folks there, which is a good sign in a big tourist area. The decor is really cool and modern, and the cocktail menu was super fun. I'm heading up to Alaska for the summer, but I'll be back on my way back down.

Address: 4161 4 Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1J5 Canada
Review: As always the food is amazing…. Our server Tianna must have been having a bad day and decided to take it out on us. She was very short and rude when asked simple questions like one would dining  out and not friendly at all. We got our amazing food (not all together but close enough) minus one persons meal being told it will be out shortly. After all four of the people finished eating and still no garlic fries to be found I told her we didn’t need the fries anymore as we are all finished and just the bill. I was then handed the interact machine with the total and when I asked for my bill with the items on it before I pay I was given a nasty look, she went and printed it and it was thrown on the table in front of me. The fries I never received was still on the bill even though she knew we haven’t received them. When I showed her that it was still on the bill it was then snatched out of my hand with another not so pleased look on her face. I have never been treated like that in any establishment and it was not the way we wanted our grad celebration to go for our daughter. Again food was amazing the the lady who sat us started off the evening wonderfully and was so nice just sucks it couldn’t continue. “Girls night grad fun” ruined by one person.

Address: 2112 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1B9 Canada
Review:
We love the maple infused bangers and eggs. My wife and I asked for well done eggs and potatoes (they call them hash browns), and they were cooked to perfection. Sooo tasty!!

This place was recommended by Northern Lights resort and they were exactly right, this place is amazing.

We thought we should arrive before the lunch rush, 11 am, but there was still a wait of 10 minutes. So, be prepared to wait, but it is worth it

Address: 2112 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1B9 Canada
Review: Super yummy breakfast. We were the first people in when they opened on a Sunday morning at 9:30. And they were completely full by ten. I loved my full breakfast. And my kids loved the French toast, then even split it into two plates for us without us having to ask. Coffee was yummy as well.

Address: 2112 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1B9 Canada
Review: I was visiting Whitehorse this week for a conference and Burnt Toast was on the list of recommended places to eat, and boy they were right! Visited one day for a simple yogurt breakfast that was lovely and came back for lunch another day and had the daily special (crab melt).  Would definitely recommend! Prices are reasonable and the staff are friendly!

Address: 2112 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1B9 Canada
Review: This place was super fantastic and one of the greatest. Huevos rancheros? Amazing. I forgot my purse  and didn’t notice till hours later, I called the restaurant asking about it and they kept it safe. I got to the restaurant and nothing was missing and the staff were really excellent. Highly recommend this place !!!!

Address: 2112 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1B9 Canada
Review:
Had breakfast there yesterday! Great service and great food.

I didn’t have any Canadian currency and server there lend me a looney. She was absolutely amazing! she was greeting everyone, fixing rocky tables, cleaning tables, taking orders, giving out food in time. I don’t think she stopped for a second. She worked her butt off.

Address: 309 Jarvis Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2H3 Canada
Review: Love the sushi rolls, menu items are impressive and reasonable. My server was nice and great service. Comfort seats and free parking outside.

Address: 309 Jarvis Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2H3 Canada
Review:
Appaled at the level of customer service at this restaurant.  See photo attached, ordered Boat B.

First bullet point specifies that the order comes with California roll, tuna roll or salmon roll.  I chose the tuna roll.  My order came with both a California roll and tuna roll even though the bulletpoint says "or".  I noted this to the waiter and said perhaps it was a misunderstanding of the menu and that I could not eat California roll due to dietary restrictions, and I had properly specified when giving the order that I wanted Tuna Roll.  The waitress indicated that she could change the order but it would be an extra $1.  She indicated that no one else has ever had this problem and that I am the only one.  Furthermore, she indicated that I should have told her about my dietary restriction.  Granted I should have done so, but a tuna roll doesn't go against my dietary restriction so I felt no need to indicate as such.  This was merely an error by the establishment in the grammatical structure/wording of their menu for Boat B.

I pointed my concern to the menu and the wording of the menu to my server.  I am sympathetic to the fact that it was a misunderstanding and miscommunication between both the server and I; however, the manner in which the menu miscommunication was dealt with by the server was subpar, including the adding of an additional $1.  I indicated to the server that I'll speak to her boss; however, no such manager addressed my concerns.

Address: 309 Jarvis Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2H3 Canada
Review:
I should give this rating a 5 however it wasn't perfect!
so on a Monday night , nothing special going on in town we decided to return as we have many times befor , we'll it was packed ! line ups on a Monday night ! go figure !
they did fantastic, service was great , food was better and the poor servers were run off their feet !
overall it was a 5 star service ! no way you could predict that many on a Monday!
see you again soon

Address: 309 Jarvis Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2H3 Canada
Review: Great service. Food was so-so. They have a really good selection, and everything was reasonably fresh, taking into account this isn't Toronto or Vancouver. I got the Alaska roll. There were 5 pieces in the roll, a decent lunch serving for me. The rice was a little wet and tasted rather bland. There were maybe 7 pieces of salmon roe in the whole roll. The chopsticks for takeaway were the flimsier ones that can give you splinters. The wasabi was good though.

Address: 309 Jarvis Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2H3 Canada
Review: Delicious dinner with quick and friendly service. Had the Crazy roll which is a deep fried california roll with spicy Mayo and some extra fish eggs. Also had the chicken yaki soba which was really tasty. Think this will be my new go to place.

Address: 209 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2B2 Canada
Review:
We had a great experience. Staff super friendly, great vibe and above all food was super delicious. The sea food linguine alfredo sauce was perfect!
In fact, we returned to the restaurant on our way back. Both times we had a great experience.

Address: 209 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2B2 Canada
Review:
We wandered into G/P on a Sunday evening while exploring Whitehorse.

The atmosphere was relaxed and enjoyable.

The staff managed by Megan were professional and attentive.
The pizza was top notch as was the pasta.
Megan recommended Burnt Toast for breakfast prior to our departure. We were so pleased with her service that we decided to give it a try.

Burnt Toast was packed and did not disappoint, service was great again the following day.

Thanks to Megan and the staff at both restaurants.

Both meals helped make Whitehorse even more memorable.

Address: 209 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2B2 Canada
Review:
The service at this establishment was nothing short of exceptional, and the culinary experience was simply out of this world, for  Whitehorse! The host and our server exuded a delightful blend of charm and professionalism, ensuring that our dining experience was nothing short of perfection.

We decided to quench our thirst with a local beer for  Yukon Brewery Company , the name of which eludes my memory, and a classic Moscow mule.  The bar tendered nailed the Moscow mule and the beer was the second best since we have been in the Yukon.

In the mood for some delectable pasta, we opted for the seafood fettuccine and rustic vegetarian pasta dish. Both dishes were a symphony of flavors, leaving our taste buds dancing with joy. My dish , the seafood fettuccine was a true masterpiece, with succulent seafood perfectly complementing the velvety pasta. As for the Vegetarian dish my friend described it as any explosion of flavors! We couldn't help but marvel at the expert seasoning and juicy tenderness of the dish.

While the pasta dishes were undeniably superb, I must admit that I have a knack for recreating pasta dishes at home, and I felt I could do better. Nevertheless, the experience was a culinary delight that I would highly recommend to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience, in Whitehorse. We will most certainly be returning for both of these exceptional dishes, if we ever come back to this part of the world.

Address: 209 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2B2 Canada
Review:
I just want to say not good experience tonight !
Being here before and it was nice great steak
Not tonight !!
Tonight The scallops ware Sooo goood!!! Salad excellent
Service perfect !!!
Steak not good at all this time
Send it back 2 times!!
Manger the worst !!!
If you ask me I will try again ?
No No !!  just only the way the manger treat us!

Address: 209 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2B2 Canada
Review:
I would not go anywhere else now that I found this little GEM.
The atmosphere, the soft music, the comfortable seating, the FANTASTIC FOOD and the wonderfully, tentative staff.
Meagan is the manager and served us on both occasions.
We are from Ontario and were there on a fishing trip and plan to return....I digress.
We returned, not only for the food but, because of Meagan. She also runs a breakfast restaurant called BURNT TOAST.....naturally we ate there too.
A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE !!
Joe

Address: 203 Hanson Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1Y3 Canada
Review:
This is definitely the best place in Whitehorse for a sandwich, a good variety of meat, the soups are very good. The salads are “ok” though.
I didn’t really enjoy the coleslaw or pasta salad’s, the beet and onion was good.

You definitely want to come here for a good sandwich, remember you need to come before 3pm otherwise sandwich bar is closed.

Address: 203 Hanson Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1Y3 Canada
Review: Great little neighbourhood deli, lots of options both hot and cold with numerous different ways to get your sandwich made fresh to order. Lots of different side salads as well as plenty of hot options, definitely going to be my new go-to lunch spot whenever I have time. Also many baked desserts and other things to enjoy for dessert.

Address: 203 Hanson Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1Y3 Canada
Review:
Amazing food, super friendly staff.
Working in town and the sadest days are the weekend when I can't get lunch at the Deli.

Specials are always amazing.

Sandwich counter is always delicious, but quality takes time so it's a bit slow even with the whole team working together.

Cannot recommend enough!

Address: 203 Hanson Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1Y3 Canada
Review: Great food. We had a workman’s lunch with local sausages and choice of salad, followed by triple layer chocolate cake. Delicious.

Address: 203 Hanson Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1Y3 Canada
Review: The sandwiches are so good here and will keep you full for a while. I always come here at least once every time I'm in Whitehorse for work. I haven't gotten their hot food items but they look delicious! The place is booming with people over lunch hour but don't worry, the line goes quickly.

Address: 2074 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1B1 Canada
Review:
Started with the mango smoothie which was very refreshing especially in this summer season!

For the main entree we ordered the spicy fish which hit the spot! The salad and fish was fresh and the rice is full of flavor and heavenly!!

The beef curry was also good and very tender.

We had the honor to meet the Master Chef Andrea and she makes everything with so much affection which shines through the wonderful flavors she is bringing to everyone.

They also have a fun table that showcases the visitors from all over the world- so when you stop by make sure to bring currency from your hometown to continue this fun tradition!

A must try when visiting Whitehorse!

Address: 2074 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1B1 Canada
Review:
Very tasty, and the custom spicy sauce we got was on point.

Had the jerk chicken roti, and it was quite tasty. The jerk chicken salad might be a good option too.

I'd go back to try the ox tail and goat for sure, I'd bet it would be very tasty and made authentic!

Address: 2074 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1B1 Canada
Review: Popped in for a quick dinner after work and was really surprised with how great the food was. Wasn't sure what to expect because I haven't had a lot of Jamaican food but the jerk chicken roti was fantastic and the rum balls I had for dessert were great too! Definitely gonna go back and try more of the menu.

Address: 2074 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1B1 Canada
Review: Jerk Chicken plate was the best meal I’d had in a long time. While no expert on Jamaican food, I have been to the island. Pickapeppa is superb. I wish I could hang around in this cool town to try some more dishes!

Address: 2074 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1B1 Canada
Review: I had the fried plantain and oxtail. Both were delicious. Great Caribbean food and flavours!

Address: 2190 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5N6 Canada
Review: Smaller diner with great food and service! Pho and Vermicelli Bowl were excellent! Will definitely return!

Address: 2190 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5N6 Canada
Review:
Just had a fantastic pho and iced coffee. The broth is delectable and the meat fresh. Fresh sprouts and lemon. Sriracha and Hoisin at the table so you can make it as spicy as you want. I had given up on this place but decided to give it another shot and I'm so glad I did.

Wish I could give 5 stars but sometimes the quality is world class, other times it'a like maybe the broth hasn't been prepared long enough and or the ingredients like bean sprouts aren't all that fresh

Address: 2190 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5N6 Canada
Review: Sept 16, arrived early at 11:28. The waitress saw us but didn’t come say hi or open the door. We wait till 11:40, she finally opened the door. Picked a little corner for us, we move the table a little bit but she stopped us right away with a condescending attitude towards us. We decided to step away from this trash attitude. Me and my friends in Whitehorse always come eat here, from now on, you will not see us ever again.

Address: 2190 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5N6 Canada
Review:
I've had a lot of Phõ in my time, even had it from a cart in Vietnam which I doubt was very clean or hygenic. But I am addicted to this awesome soup and have to try it everywhere I can.

Well this place was a huge mistake. Staff were unfriendly, couldn't get our orders right and then tried to serve me someone else's food. When I told the guy that's not what I ordered he started yelling and slammed the food down. I don't care if you're having a bad day, or you work in a Vietnamese restaurant where nobody is Vietnamese, in the Yukon of all places. Learn to behave yourself. Be professional.

And here's a tip, anytime you mention tips or say something about not getting one, you're getting nothing.

As for the food, the soup was bland and tasted like dollar store chicken stock watered down. The vermicelli noodles looked like they came from a pack of Mr. Noodles and tasted like soggy cardboard. The meat was mostly fat and what looked like dog food scraps they got on sale from a refinery.

I wouldn't feed this to prisoners and I'm pretty sure they eat better than THAT anyhow.

Address: 2190 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5N6 Canada
Review: Great chicken skewers and classic pho. Lemon soda was delicious.

Address: 206 Jarvis Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2H2 Canada
Review: Great but expensive for what it is. Would recommend. The food is good, and the service is awesome. Price is a little steep but still adequate

Address: 206 Jarvis Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2H2 Canada
Review:
I don’t often leave a bad review, but.
Upon arriving to our reservation at 7:30 we were waiting in the lobby for 35 minutes before getting sat. The table had been sitting empty otherwise. When we were sat it took about 15 minutes for our server to come and drop off waters and plates. She walked away before we could get a drink order in and one of the members of our party had to flag her down to order. We ended up ordering everything all at once because by this time it was 8:30 and we had no drinks or food. The appetizers came out quite quickly but by 9:45 we had still not eaten and we had at least 6 empty drinks piled to the end of the table(pictured below).
A member of the table asked to speak to management about the wait for our food and they said ‘yeah it’s ready it’s coming’. When they were setting down our food I had to ask them to actually clear the glasses so they could put the plate down. The manager or supervisor came over and gave us some wine but no apology, no reasoning, nothing. No water refills, no drink refills- super weird. We were really disappointed- a sorry goes a long way with bad service and as a server myself I just don’t think this is justified. The only reason I’m leaving two stars instead of one is because the food tasted good. I won’t be going back

Address: 206 Jarvis Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2H2 Canada
Review: Nice restaurant.. look classy. Great food, friendly staff but quite a while to get our food. For the price, I think still reasonable. This is better than Earl in Whitehorse. We ordered calamari,  steamed muscle and fettuccine for dinner.

Address: 206 Jarvis Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2H2 Canada
Review:
After a long day of cancelled flights and frustrations I decided to check out Giorgios Cuccina, it was a great pick!
Besides a small set back of waiting for someone to take my order (waiter came and apologized for a mis-communication between staff on who would be attending to my table) the food and drinks were delivered promptly, the food was delicious and well prepared, large serving of pasta and great dessert (I had the penne asparagus and berry new york cheesecake). Overall great service and food and next time I am in Whitehorse I would eat there again.

Address: 206 Jarvis Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2H2 Canada
Review:
Place was about 1/3 full.  I was seated and got a glass of water and menus immediately.  10-min later a table of about 12 shows up beside me.  I left 15-min later when the waitress started taking their order.  A few different waitresses walked by my table over a dozen times with hardly a glance in the 25-min I sat there.

Thanks for the bad experience on Thursday May 11th 2023 at 6pm.

I went to Tony's Pasta and Grill and got prompt service and great food.

Address: Best Western Gold Rush Inn 411 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2B6 Canada
Review: One of the only places open on a Sunday for breakfast, the Gold Pan Saloon has a decent selection of breakfast fare. The service and food were quick, the place was clean and the food was tasty. The portions were gargantuan. The omelette could have easily fed two people!

Address: Best Western Gold Rush Inn 411 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2B6 Canada
Review:
This is one of the rare places that open for lunch as the rather famous places for bison burger or food is only open for dinner till late. This place is located at the first level of the Best Western Inn and there are 2 ways to enter it, via the main entrance of Best Western Inn and then the side door which is the main entrance of Gold Pan Saloon or you can go by the back door which gets you to the restrooms (which was how I entered but it doesn't matter as they still checked your vaccination status and ID).

Do note that this place has a lot of regulars (given that Whitehorse downtown is a very small downtown and everyone kind of knows each other). Don't be upset if they don't service you immediately. I found that the regulars there know the menu better than the servers. My server actually didn't know the price of the special of the day and how much the beers cost so she had to return to the bar to ask and get a menu to show us the price instead. All in all service is not strong here for new customers, but regulars know the service staff by name.

The bison burger is pretty nice (first time for me), gamey, lean, tasty, well marinated and burger well made. The fries were pretty good as well. As for the special of the day, it was butter chicken (ended up being an Indian style of butter chicken which was fine).

Beer was really cold and nice in a retro looking plastic cup (probably because many customers broke them after too many a glass).

Given they are one of the few lunch joints, I'm pretty happy with what I got, and service was never my emphasis anyway so this place is worth my time and stomach.

Address: Best Western Gold Rush Inn 411 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2B6 Canada
Review: Had a bison burger and some wings for take-out one night while staying at the Gold Rush Inn. The waitresses/bartenders did not seem very welcoming but the food itself was quite good. The next morning, they had some issues with us borrowing a plate to use in our room to re-heat the leftovers...but it worked out in the end.

Address: Best Western Gold Rush Inn 411 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2B6 Canada
Review: Service was excellent! Very accommodating! Although the place looks very dated and in need of a renovation, the food and drinks were very good. We returned twice in the same trip. We tried a few beers, and tried a variety of food and starters from breakfast to dinner. The only dish we didn't care for was the Gold Nuggets from the dessert menu. Was hoping for more of a donut hole, and instead was more like fried pizza crust dipped in brown sugar/cinnamon. But everything else was great! Would gladly return of in the area! 🍻 If my review helped, please give me a 👍 Cheers 🍺

Address: Best Western Gold Rush Inn 411 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2B6 Canada
Review: I was here in Yukon for business. The food itself was decent, but literally the worst service i have ever witnessed, table was not clean when we were asked to sit down, our server never really checked in on us after food was brought out. When confronted about this, she complained that we ordered late and she’s handling 3 tables at once. You cannot just wave down any server, you have to wait for your own waiter who would disappear once they take your order. Our whole morning was ruined by her nonchalant attitude. We asked for takeout box and she almost threw the box on our table. Very disrespectful staff and entitled servers. When we asked for a manager to explain our situation better. She came back to our table and said ‘’I’m the manager and if we have any complains we could let her know’’, we asked if the owner is at the restraunt and her reply was (and i quote) this is a big establishment and the owner never comes at big restaurants like these. Which almost made us choke on our food lmao! we did not tip and told her that she’s the problem. I’m from Vancouver and sit at restaurants mostly for business meeting and never once had a complain from service. Not sure what was she trying to point out by bringing big establishment? 🤣 Would never recommend any visitors, not a worthwhile service for the money they’re charging.

Address: 211 Hanson Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1Y3 Canada
Review: Food was good, not the best ever but certainly decent for being in the Yukon. Our party had the barilla tacos special, a burrito, & nachos. Everything was satisfying but the nachos- skip those & opt for the nightly special perhaps. 5 stars for the friendly staff, presentation, and colorful Mexican dishes.

Address: 211 Hanson Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1Y3 Canada
Review:
The Mexican food was fantastic and tasted truly authentic, as if it was home made. I can't remember what I paid, but it seemed reasonable given the quality of the food we ordered.

The atmosphere was nice. They have a pleasant outdoor eating area, and everybody around me seemed to be enjoying themselves.

The only downside was how long it took for a server to take our order (20 minutes, estimated), especially since we had a toddler with us.

I hope to come back at some point this summer!

Address: 211 Hanson Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1Y3 Canada
Review:
If you are craving for some authentic Mexican cuisine, this is the place!

The staffs were friendly and helpful.

Food was more enjoyable out in the patio. A sparrow was trying to snatch our nachos.

Their portions weren’t generous but just enough to feel stuffed.

They have specials written on the whiteboard, so make sure you check it out.

They do not take Amex.

Address: 211 Hanson Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1Y3 Canada
Review: The best Mexican restaurant in Yukon. Authentic mexican food (no Tex-Mex). Nice place and great atmosphere, thanks!!

Address: 211 Hanson Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1Y3 Canada
Review: The best mexican food north of British Columbia! This authentic Mexican spot stands out for their traditional dishes and daily house specials (quite hard to find in this latitude). What I admired the most is the attention to detail for the best experience: beautiful decor and atmosphere, maximum sanitary measures (cleanest washroom in Whitehorse!) and top notch customer service! Thank you for an excellent evening!

Address: 404 Wood Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2E8 Canada
Review:
Came here for dinner earlier this month, during my first night in Whitehorse. The atmosphere was cozy and the service friendly, but the corners were a bit dark. The way to the washroom was not very well maintained.

We ordered a ramen, the firecracker roll and the BC salmon skin roll. The rolls tasted good and were reasonably priced, but they were poorly made. The rice was not rolled all the way around most of the rolls, causing many of them to be wackily shaped, and they disintegrated easily when picked up by my chopstick. I was honestly quite shocked at how easily they fell apart...They need to hold together as you dip them in soy sauce and then send them into your mouth...Hope the restaurant improves the roll-making.

Address: 404 Wood Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2E8 Canada
Review: A Japanese friend, recommended me this place for friendly price and good sushi. I think they accustomize the taste for Japanese food, more flavor. We able to get a seat once we enter the restaurant but took a while to get our foods.

Address: 404 Wood Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2E8 Canada
Review:
I used to eat here regularly and enjoyed it very much. Its been a while so I decided to take-out for the family. Wow has it gone down hill. Box A: zero teriyaki flavour on greesy chicken, rice was undercooked, dry and rubbery, and the California rolls fell apart and were stale as if they were made days ago. The wanton soup was just brown salt broth. Zero tofu and one tiny morsal of seaweed.

Beef Udon: noodle were good, beef and broth were super fatty and salty

I'm left feeling ill and like I should have ordered pizza.

I used to love sekura but won't be back again now that it has become quite terrible and not at all worth the $65 I just paid.

Sorry for the bad review as the staff were very friendly. I feel bad but I also feel slightly sick.

Address: 404 Wood Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2E8 Canada
Review: I ordered beef tataki and it came totally different from the picture. The meat is so thin and small. $18.95, really??? The ramen tasted like instant noodles. :( but salmon sashimi is good.

Address: 404 Wood Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2E8 Canada
Review:
If you like sushi, you’ll definitely like this place. It is one of the best sushi in Whitehorse.
Food here is reasonably priced compared to its competitors. Also, the quantity is more for same or lesser price.

In the picture is Firecracker Sushi roll and Boat 1. Firecracker was seriously good and I highly recommend it!

Address: 102 Wood St Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2E3 Canada
Review: Best Chinese food in Whitehorse!  Clean environment and very friendly and inviting staff!

Address: 102 Wood St Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2E3 Canada
Review:
Wor Wonton is a meal, better be hungry. Lots of flavour, you can taste every different meat, (pork, beef and chicken) crunchy veggies, prawns and lots of wonton.
Good service, friendly and engaging staff.

Address: 102 Wood St Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2E3 Canada
Review: Absolutely the best Chinese food takeout in Whitehorse. No matter what day of the week we place an takeout order. Always fresh ingredients. Amazing flavours! Fast friendly service. Thank you to the staff & chefs! ❤️😋👩🏻‍🍳

Address: 102 Wood St Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2E3 Canada
Review: TERRIBLE experience!  No wonder the place was empty and looked closed when I arrived.  Although it was fresh, the food was very plain tasting.  I don't think the waitress understood my English, because it was very difficult to communicate with her, and I never received the pork fried rice I ordered.  I received plain, steamed rice instead, and it was just easier to keep it.  There was another person in my party, but our meals weren't served at the same time.  They only offered canned soda to drink, so even refills weren't free, unless you just had water.  At the register, which was being run by the same person that was our waitress, I told her we didn't get fried rice, only steamed rice.  She seemed to insist that we received fried rice, and refused to adjust the total.  I just paid the check and will never go back again. Do yourself a favor and spend your funds elsewhere.

Address: 102 Wood St Whitehorse, YT Y1A 2E3 Canada
Review: Best Chinese food ever.. Seriously. This place has been open for over two years and this is the first time that I've been in there! Omg. My poor hips.. Stop what you're doing and get in there for dinner! Yum!

Address: 2241 2nd Ave Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5W1 Canada
Review: Yesterday was my first time to visit Boston Pizza in Whitehorse and I had an amazing experience with this restaurant. The customer service was outstanding especially to the staff named Jose he was so welcoming and very friendly! He is very knowledgeable about the products and helped me choose the perfect food and the product was exactly what I was looking for! He went above and beyond to help me find the perfect food and the service was very quick. It made me feel at home and I left the restaurant with a smile in my face and satisfied tummy! Thank you Jose! I will keep coming back to talk to you and of-course to try out  the other food you will recommend! Jose deserves a pat on the back for a great service! Boston Pizza is lucky to have you!

Address: 2241 2nd Ave Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5W1 Canada
Review: It was a great experience to have the robot, delivering my meal at the table. To view the robot, subscribe to my YouTube Channel Sandy's Shimmerz N Elegance Bridal Gifts And More. Thank you!

Address: 2241 2nd Ave Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5W1 Canada
Review: Food was good... had nachos with some special requests... everything came as ordered. Had to ask for refills on our drinks. Looks like this store is due for an update and some window washing. The nearest TV was washed out. Otherwise,  everything was fine.

Address: 2241 2nd Ave Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5W1 Canada
Review:
Was in Whitehorse visiting from out of town, went to Boston Pizza for supper because it’s familiar….. worst experience ever.
Took forever to before anyone came to take our order, then my family’s food came a good 10 min before mine did, in fact we had to ask waiter where my order was. It finally came out 5 min later and was soggy and ice cold.
Not once did waiter ask if we wanted any drink refills or about dessert but was very prompt to arrive with the bill and machine in hand.
Next time we visit, we will not eat at Boston Pizza.

Address: 2241 2nd Ave Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5W1 Canada
Review: Not great. The servers are inconsistent (some are great, some seat their friends when you're trying to pay the bill and delay your departure up to 10 minutes) and I find I need to check the bill to make sure things have been rung in properly. I've been to others and had far better experiences, but this is the only BPs this far north so I guess it is what it is.

Address: 2210 Second Ave Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8 Canada
Review: Came here early morning on Feb 19 for breakfast. The staff member on duty at the time was quite sweet, which really made a difference compared with other Tim's! (I should have asked for her name!) Efficient service and consistent quality. Nice to have a place opened early in the morning.

Address: 2210 Second Ave Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8 Canada
Review: Staff has no smile and greetings and no parting comments. No "thank you" after the transaction. Forgot to give my pastry but did not even apologize for the delay. Food is great as always.

Address: 2210 Second Ave Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8 Canada
Review: Service is so slow people are walking out. Busy morning and they have two staff working. They are trying their best but need more help!

Address: 2210 Second Ave Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8 Canada
Review: My car broke down in the middle and i went there to fix it. They said it need oil change i said ok go ahead after waiting for 30 minutes i didn't got my phone fix even i am paying $39 for the phone plus taxes. Even i gave him every document he asked for he still not able to file my taxes he just saying T4 is empty. They refused to retured my couch even they said return policy is 15 days i just bought it yesterday.

Address: 2210 Second Ave Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8 Canada
Review:
My to go places for snack and hot beverage, I like their fast services and the price way better than other coffee shop. This place open 6am to 7pm have free WiFi and located in down town next to BMO bank across the Starbucks.

The just serve brunch and light meal for breakfast so far I don’t complaints. It’s quick frozen food but it fresh. The serve sweet and savory snack I personally like Timbits the smaller size of donuts just to making sure that I don’t fee guilty to much eat a dozen of it if, if you fill in survey you get 10 for dollar, I recommend  honey dip  regular flavor always best

They need to have certain pic to make sure toilet clean

Address: 101 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 0G5 Canada
Review: Excellent breakfast, huge portions. Great service, everyone is very friendly.

Address: 101 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 0G5 Canada
Review: Service was fast, but ingredients quality average.

Address: 101 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 0G5 Canada
Review: This place is hit and miss. Depending on when you go, and depending what you get, it might be ok, or it might not be. I have enjoyed good, cheap food here in the past. Last time we went we had to wait almost an hour for our food, so we were all quite upset and ended up leaving before our food came. Our server understood though.

Address: 101 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 0G5 Canada
Review: Perfection! Best breakfast place in Whitehorse. The warm decor, the very mellow background music, excellent omelettes and great pan-fried grated potatoes (did not leave any on the plate, and the warm friendly service from Reimi (she is a PLUS FACTOR for Tonimoes!!). Strongly recommended. Marco and Leslie

Address: 101 Main Street Whitehorse, YT Y1A 0G5 Canada
Review: The food was terrible. Nachos were burnt so badly they couldn't be eaten. Fish was totally undercooked after informaing the wait staff. The cut piece of fish was just thrown back into the fryer. My vegatables were barely warm. Most of the food was uneaten. I've eaten there a few times now this will be the last. It was always OK. This was awful to put it mildly.

Address: Yukon Centre Mall 2190 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5N6 Canada
Review: Great Canadian club with onions, olives, green peppers and sriracha sauce and yellow mustard. Tasty.

Address: Yukon Centre Mall 2190 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5N6 Canada
Review: My husband bought 2 foot longs to bring home to atlin, he continued to ask for. More veges on both but he was ignored,if i spend damn near 40 bucks for 2 sandwiches they better be loaded not happy about having to reuild the sandwichs when he got home! Not happy not ever again cheap,cheap cheap!#!!

Address: Yukon Centre Mall 2190 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5N6 Canada
Review: Love their Sweet Onion Chicken Teriyaki sub.  The veggies are always fresh.  The sweet onion sauce adds a nice element to the sub.  The chocolate M&M cookies are soft like they just came out of the oven.  It makes for a delicious lunch.

Address: Yukon Centre Mall 2190 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5N6 Canada
Review: Food is great but customer service is really bad. Funny story, I ordered online for pick up for 1:20pm and set up the wrong address. Surely my mistake, I still bought another sandwich at the closer location from my work, I told them what happened but I still have to pay my food. Understandable. After I got my food, I made sure to call the other location no answer after 3 calls. I didnt even receive a call that my food is still sitting there after 5 hours. After my work, around 6pm, I went to the right location to see if possible to get a refund. The girl said no as the sandwich was built already. I said okay and left. I’ve been a manager to a fast food chain, and if I know my customers online order been sitting for more than 5 hours, I would offer a new sandwich if refund can’t be done. So probably the first and last ordering here. Good customer service helps if you want customers to come back.

Address: Yukon Centre Mall 2190 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 5N6 Canada
Review: Never again will I pay almost 40 dollars for two sandwiches and 2 apple juices. Psychotic

Address: 200 Hamilton Boulevard Whitehorse, YT Y1A 0A6 Canada
Review:
Subway has gotten very, very expensive. I was shocked and amazed to see a tip option on the payment terminal. Was this some kind of joke?

I think I'll go to Boston Pizza next time. I can get a nice lunch item with a side for about the same price as foot-long sub from Subway.

Address: 200 Hamilton Boulevard Whitehorse, YT Y1A 0A6 Canada
Review: They’re never open on Sunday’s, even during busy tournaments but their website always says they are. It’s wildly frustrating when you’re counting on them for food and need to leave the complex to feed your family between games with no parking.

Address: 200 Hamilton Boulevard Whitehorse, YT Y1A 0A6 Canada
Review: It's a convenient location and the employees are usually friendly and do a great job. The fella behind the counter on today's visit seemed annoyed that I was there. The plexiglass causes an issue for hearing, especially if you have hearing issues like me, so I couldn't hear what he was saying, maybe the annoyance. Nonetheless, I was the only customer at the time, no line up behind me and plenty of time until closing. I know it's hard to find skilled, committed workers. Doesn't make it okay to be rude to customers who pay your wages tho.

Address: 200 Hamilton Boulevard Whitehorse, YT Y1A 0A6 Canada
Review:
Asked for a melt. Unbeknownst to me, that no longer exists in the system, but there was no comment about it from the attendant.

When she rang it up? Over 20 dollars! For a sandwich that I've never paid more than 14 for. Because the melt isnt a thing, each ingredient was added as an add on!

Never coming back, what a s***show.

Address: 200 Hamilton Boulevard Whitehorse, YT Y1A 0A6 Canada
Review: I love their subs:)

Address: 2222 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8 Canada
Review: Pleasant experience. Great people working. Kim even told us that Root beer is free refill, which we are not aware. Keep the good vibes and smiles on your face, A&W crew.

Address: 2222 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8 Canada
Review:
I was charged $15+ for a teen burger combo. That's a lot of money for a burger combo. I won't be back anytime soon as it's too expensive for me, despite whatever rationale A&W has for the increased prices.

Service was great. Staff were friendly.

Address: 2222 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8 Canada
Review: Restaurant was very clean. Food was good, but did not serve the entire A&W menu even though there was signage present. My son wanted a Root Beer shake but not served at this location.

Address: 2222 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8 Canada
Review: Waited 15 minutes for 2 breakfast sandwiches and 3 scrambled eggs. When I asked whats taking so long you have served 10 people that ordered after me. They said it would be 4 more minutes. I asked for my money back. By the time they got to that my food was up. I still asked for my money back. To expensive for the amount of food you get. The english muffins are not toasted enuff and taste like sandpaper.

Address: 2222 2nd Avenue Whitehorse, YT Y1A 1C8 Canada
Review: First timer going to an A&W but I have to say the restaurant and bathroom is super clean! The food is delicious but the only reason I have to dock a star is because the price is a little higher than it's rivals aka McDonald's

Address: 2077 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 5J9 Canada
Review:
After a few days of running around getting stuff and organizing the new place, I finally got a chance to check out the new neighbourhood’s restaurants.

1st stop was the Sun Fortune Restaurant.

This restaurant has been around for many years now and was packed when we went there without a reservation. However,  the nice lady at the reception was nice enough to accommodate us.

The place was your typical nondescript Chinese restaurant - no fuss, simply decorated joint.  Prices were a little high for the small servings (smaller than I’m used to back in Calgary) but the real attractions were the amazing quality of food!

We ordered:
*** Cantonese Chow Mein - 9/10!
*** Crispy Pork Chop Topped with Dried Garlic - 9/10!
*** Deluxe Fried Rice - 9/10!
*** Deluxe Chop Suey - 7/10
*** Steamed Fish Fillet with Tofu - 10/10!😍😋
*** Beef Brisket Noodle Soup - 8/10

This place is highly recommended and will definitely be one of my go-to-places if I decided to move in the city permanently.

Address: 2077 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 5J9 Canada
Review: Highly recommend the Peking Duck, HK Milk Tea Tea, Spicy Pork Eggplant and Spicy Beef Tendon Hot Pot. Some days the food is too salty, so it is not always consistent. Service is good except from two visits, one of the servers demanded tip before we even got a chance to put tip on the table, it was quite rude.

Address: 2077 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 5J9 Canada
Review: Ordered for the first time and everything was exceptional. (Pictured : pearl beef, lemon chicken, Szechuan seafood hot pot, mixed vegetables, Cantonese chow mein, white rice, mushroom fried rice, chop suey, spare ribs with honey, spring rolls and sweet and sour shrimp)

Address: 2077 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 5J9 Canada
