Review: Good food at good price . Not so ample to accommodate more than 50 people at a time . Opening time for dine in only from 4-9pm. The Beijing duck is popular so usually out of stock.

Address: 2077 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 5J9 Canada
Review:
***Updated review

Protip: order the fried rice. I haven't been so excited about fried rice in awhile

They are one of the few places that do a Peking duck dinner. You need 24 hours advance notice to order it however.

Its a favorite of a lot of people.
Serving Hong Kong cafe style food.
It was popular to go there for Ying Yang (mix of hong kong style tea and coffee).
They have afternoon tea specials as well. $5.95 we did the fried rice with tomato sauce. It didn't really have much tomato but that was fine as it tasted delicious with a smoke flavor (Cantonese people call it wok hay)
We also did the lunch special which was breaded pork cutlet. $8.95
We upgraded and got spaghetti for $1.50 additional charge.

For this price it's great! If I come back soon I would upgrade to 5 stars if it stays consistent.

Parking is available in a large lot shared with other businesses.

Address: 1822 Grant Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0N3 Canada
Review: Very average food (both lunch box and the roll). Pretty pricey given the quality of the food. However, the ratings for their ramen seem better than their lunch box so I might come back to try their ramen and give an updated review but for now, 3 is pretty generous tbh. Service was fast tho.

Address: 1822 Grant Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0N3 Canada
Review:
This place has gotten a lot busier over the years. Majority the time it’s tough to get setting for lunch. Today was my birthday. One of my best friends made reservations in advance.

Me and the company I was with dine out frequently so here’s the feedback.  Raman and it’s main ingredients, egg, pork belly, noddle texture and soup flavour all great.

Seafood Tampera was lacking some crisp. And oil didn’t taste right.

Just had uni recently from Vancouver. Even though it was supposed to be super fresh here. It is pretty hard to beat.

Address: 1822 Grant Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0N3 Canada
Review:
Lovely ambience, the restaurant is a cozy size with about room to seat around maybe 10 groups of four plus a bar that sits about 6 or so. Its usually very busy, so if you want to get a seat you should reserve ahead!

Presentation is very aesthetic, food is tasty and light on the stomach. It does not feel like it weighs you down. Sushi rice on the rolls is a good texture and not too sticky.

If you are able to go for ramen, its one of the better bowls you can find in the city! They only offer these at lunch though, and they are limited, so be prepared!

Price point relative to other sushi restaurants is pretty average. Quality is definitely above average, but be prepared that I think the rolls are smaller than average and you may need to order more to be full.

Otherwise a good experience!

Address: 1822 Grant Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0N3 Canada
Review: Went to Winnipeg on my birthday for the weekend  & we did not plan ahead where to eat, just want to be spontaneous & we decided to have sushi. We checked online to see which one had the best reviews & saw Yujiro, we took chances because we did not have reservation but it was early so we had better chance. We got in, small restaurant outside downtown but it was clean, friendly staff. Everything we order in the menu was super good very very fresh. I think the best sushi & Japanese restaurant in Winnipeg, we would go back for sure.

Address: 1822 Grant Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0N3 Canada
Review: THE BEST Sushi in town!!!! Every visit there is top-notch! Great selection and perfect for any occasion! highly recommend!!

Address: 100 - 330 Main Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 0Y7 Canada
Review:
We went on a Sunday and it's busy so make sure to make a reservation. You can park in Winnipeg Square and OEB will validate your parking on the weekend.
This was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had! I got the lobster scramble and my husband got the get shorty rib. Food was fresh and extremely flavourful. We also shared a mimosa flight which was just average, while the coffee was very good. This isn't a budget saver breakfast, it was 89.00 after tip, but you get what you pay for here. Chelsea was a great sever and was able to give some great recommendations.  Will be back soon !

Address: 100 - 330 Main Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 0Y7 Canada
Review:
They cover your parking fee if you go on weekends and park in the building's underground parking!!! Make sure to add your name to the reservation list before you come!!!
I love their food and their menu. Honestly, you probably need more than 1 visit because all the items on their menu sound really good. The food is in a higher price range but I think it’s worth it. The service is fast and professional, the seating and restaurant interior design is really nice. We only had their coffee and it was tasty, will come back and try other drinks and update. Their short ribs on the poutine were so juicy and tender, definitely recommended.

Address: 100 - 330 Main Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 0Y7 Canada
Review:
Went here for Sunday breakfast, still early so the place wasn’t so busy.

I enjoyed the Eggs Benedict. Service was good too, our server was very attentive and checked on us regularly.

You can park on the street (like Pioneer) or in the parkade (OEB validates parking on weekends).

Address: 100 - 330 Main Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 0Y7 Canada
Review:
One of my favorite brunch spots in Winnipeg. Although it is a bit on the pricier side, I believe it is worth the treat as they use quality ingredients and techniques in their dishes.

The Duck Confit, French Toast Trifle & Duck and Pierogies are my favorite dishes! Highly recommend adding yourself waitlist on Yelp.

Address: 100 - 330 Main Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 0Y7 Canada
Review:
We heard a lot about this place and finally decided to check it out. The ambience and decor is great, the service is excellent and the staff is so friendly.

They also have underground parking which they validate on weekends, which is great, especially for downtown.

The only miss is the portion size, which is definitely on the smaller side, taking into account it is definitely on the pricier spectrum for brunch style food.

Address: 85 Princess Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 1K4 Canada
Review:
For a dining experience that surpasses all expectations, look no further than Deer + Almond. My most recent visit to this charming restaurant with a very special lady was nothing short of exceptional, thanks to the personalized menu and remarkable service that elevated our night to a whole new level.

From the moment we were greeted at the door, we were treated like royalty. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and keen to create a meal that would delight our palates and cater to our dietary restrictions. We could tell that they truly cared about curating a unique experience just for us.

We were blown away by every dish that came out and even though they looked too pretty to eat, it was like heaven on a fork. Pair that with some wonderfully curated wines and we felt lifted to a higher level of dining experience.

What really sets Deer + Almond apart is their commitment to catering to each and every guest's unique needs. Every detail, from the thoughtfully sourced ingredients to the stunning presentation of each dish, was taken care of to ensure our experience was nothing short of perfect. The cozy ambiance and dim lighting also added to the romantic atmosphere of the evening, making it a truly unforgettable evening.

In summary, Deer + Almond is a must-visit for anyone looking for exceptional food and a personalized dining experience.

Address: 85 Princess Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 1K4 Canada
Review:
We went there for a date night.
It’s a 4 course meal
77$ per person with no drinks and additional charge for specific dishes
The food, the best in Winnipeg.
Every dish was perfect.
The service was superb
The place looks nice but to fancy and it was noisy
Overall great experience, highly recommend

Address: 85 Princess Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 1K4 Canada
Review: Every detail was simply fantastic. The servers were so friendly and knowledgeable, sat down with us to chat with our kids and talk about the menu. Every dish so memorable and creative. This restaurant is top in Canada and a must visit on a trip to Winnipeg. My son ordered steak frites and the server said “best fries on the planet” and OMG…! 😀

Address: 85 Princess Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 1K4 Canada
Review: Really an outstanding restaurant! The service is awesome because they give you a wine tasting and also intricately explain the items you are ordering from the dining experience menu. Valpolicella Superiore and Deer Carpaccio are match made in heaven; it was my first time having a deer dish that too in carpaccio form - loved it and it was my favourite 😻 from the menu! Green Pappardelle was soft and tasty with a flavour bomb in that fiery chilli oil, wow 🤩🔥 Pork Schnitzel and Honey Custard had nice presentation but tastes ok compared to the first two dishes!! The restaurant is extremely hygienic and tip top with a casual ambience 🥰 Palette cleanser served at the end and complimentary starter received were also good 😌

Address: 85 Princess Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 1K4 Canada
Review: The best meal I've had in Winnipeg. Hands down. Loved the vibes, the server was fabulous and so knowledgeable, really so great at her job. Had a cocktail, wine and the set 4 course meal, which has more selection than the a la carte meal. Deer carpaccio was fabulous, the peanut semifreddo was also so wonderful. Would go back over and over!!

Address: 800 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3M 2M7 Canada
Review: We had an amazing time at Brazen Hall with our fur baby! The pet-friendly patio made it the perfect place for us to relax. The server was super nice and made sure our pups had fresh water too. Not to mention, the food and drinks were absolutely fantastic. We'll definitely be returning for more good times! Highly recommended!

Address: 800 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3M 2M7 Canada
Review: The place has a very nice atmosphere. A nice place for hang out with friends for dining and drinking. The fresh tap beer is really tasty. We got the special poutine, brazen bacon,bang bang shrimp, chicken wings,Kiki burger and the Mogu ramen and we weren’t disappointed. Specially the bacon, I also ordered for another one because it’s so good! The service was amazing, friendly and quick.We really enjoyed our time here.

Address: 800 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3M 2M7 Canada
Review: Thrilled the patio is dog friendly. The dinning was excellent. Really great hospitality! And our waitress even found us birthday candles! Truly "DINO-MITE"!

Address: 800 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3M 2M7 Canada
Review: Had dinner here for my brother's birthday and we had an amazing time! The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, the service was prompt and friendly. We ordered the burnt ends and a soft pretzel for our appetizers and I can't say enough good things about it. The pretzel was perfect, the hot mustard wasn't too spicy but still had a kick. The burnt ends were tender and flavorful. My friend ordered a whiskey sour which was delightful. All the flavors worked together very well. The Krakow burger came with a spicy beet sauce that was quite hot but still very tasty which is hard to get and my brother loved it. Our server was very friendly and knowledgeable. It really made the night special. 10/10, wonderful experience.

Address: 800 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3M 2M7 Canada
Review:
Had a pint of Raspy the Red Beard which was really enjoyable paired with the trio of Brisket Tacos which were also delicious.

Great service.

Address: 123 Princess Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 1K8 Canada
Review: Still my favorite brunch place of all time in Winnipeg. Amazing service, good vibes and they topped up my coffee :) nice and warm. Everything tastes fresh and delicious. Always fresh to order. My favorite no. 1 dish always the bacon Benedict. This time my friend picked all the dishes so I didn't get the Benedict. My friend ordered the matcha latte,  it looks so pretty. The side dish potato always steal the show. So crispy...Make sure u complete your meal with their waffle or other dessert. They have amazing creative dessert.  It's a full package date at Clementine. PS: We saw the wall decor has little duck and pup hidden in the crack, how cute :) We had a great time!!

Address: 123 Princess Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 1K8 Canada
Review:
Tried this place after seeing all the positive reviews.

I had the Fried Chicken on Toast which intrigued me as I typically love the waffle combination but also love sourdough. The toast was not soggy (which I was concerned about) and the chicken crispy. I prefer a thicker piece of chicken than when it is flattened down but good nonetheless. The Thom Bargen drip coffee was good.

My wife had the Brussels Style Waffle which had lemon curd, whipped cream, berries and hisbiscus syrup. There was waaaay too much whip cream which took away from the lemon curd and she didn't really notice the syrup.

It's a cute little restaurant down a flight of stairs that was nice and bright. Had to get the attention of a server to order and get refills.

Address: 123 Princess Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 1K8 Canada
Review:
One of the best places to go for brunch. The food is amazing, it’s flavourful, fresh, and very filling. I also love the vibe of the restaurant, it’s very cozy.

One small thing I noticed is that some of the chairs are tiny, so it may not be accessible to some people.

Address: 123 Princess Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 1K8 Canada
Review:
I decided to visit Clementine on my visit to Winnipeg, Manitoba. It was an amazing breakfast and brunch restaurant. One of the most famous items they have here is Fried Chicken on Toast. In fact, not only are they generally known for it, but there were people waiting in line to get into the restaurant talking about this menu item. Fried Chicken on Toast came with Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Dill Ranch, Maple Calypso, Pickles, and Sourdough Toast. The chicken was fresh, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and very nicely cooked. The flavour of the fried chicken was very unique, and absolutely delicious. It had a hint of spice and a decent amount of sweetness in the buttermilk batter which made it quite flavourful. The sourdough toast with maple calypso and dill ranch added a hint of sourness and some creaminess. The toast with maple calypso and dill ranch and the buttermilk chicken with sweetness and a hint of spice was just a fantastic combination of ingredients and flavours that made this dish absolutely outstanding! This is one of the best fried chicken dishes I’ve ever had.

I also had a side of Fried Potatoes which came with Chickpea Mayo, Bravas Sauce, and Green Onion. The potatoes were fresh and crispy and the sauces combined with the potatoes were absolutely delicious. I also enjoyed the cappuccino.

The staff were very friendly and the service was perfect. I am very happy I came to this restaurant in Winnipeg!

Address: 123 Princess Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 1K8 Canada
Review:
Wonderful brunch place tucked away in the downtown area.

Ive been to Clementine multiple times and have never been disappointed. Food always tastes fresh, is thoughtfully prepared and filling enough for brunch.

My favourite dish there is the fried chicken on toast. The batter is very crunchy and contrasted with a hot honey for a sweet and savory combo that does not disappoint. Menu size is small and focused. Many of their other dishes are also very good and I cannot think of any weaknesses in the menu.

Service is always professional and friendly.

This place is very busy, they do not take reservations, so if you arrive at a busier time for brunch you will be waiting for about an hour or more, so prepare accordingly!

Would strongly recommend this restaurant and will be back!

Address: 550 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0E3 Canada
Review: Edit- the achievements this place has also for the food and being local should speak for its self. Well after a lovely evening with lovely people and service the bison was amazing and the people where great as well. Will be going again in the near future as the price was also good. First time having mussles and wow superb.

Address: 550 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0E3 Canada
Review:
Our Server was fantastic, friendly and very knowledgeable.

The food... Amazing. Not often I find a place where I can, and want to try literally everything on it.

Duck Confit was super good. Fell off the bone.

Will definitely have to come back for the perogies and the Char and.... lol

Address: 550 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0E3 Canada
Review: One of the best meals my wife and I have had in a long time.  Everything we had from the menu was consistently delicious.  We started with the Northern Manitoba bruschetta with wild foraged & cultured mushrooms, fresh herbs, grilled focaccia, goat's cheese, truffle oil & white wine cream, then Caesar salad with romaine, creamy roast garlic anchovy emulsion, spiced croutons & asiago cheese.  Our entrees were the Grilled Manitoba bison saddled with a blue cheese compound butter, balsamic plum gastrique, popped wild rice potato gratin & seasonable vegetables, and Ice caught pickerel with ricotta stuffed ravioli & wild mushroom whisky cream.  For dessert we had Boreal Forest Cake with Bernard Callebaut dark chocolate, freshly whipped, Saskatoon berry compote and Baked cheesecake with Chaeban mascarpone cheese topped with a changing variety of local organic preparations.  Both the food and service were incredible.  We will definitely be back!

Address: 550 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0E3 Canada
Review: If you've never eaten at the Fusion Grill, you're depriving yourself of a glorious epicurean experience! The food was beyond delicious! I had the Angus tenderloin from Arborg...cooked to perfection! Atmosphere was great and the service impeccable.

Address: 550 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0E3 Canada
Review:
Unbelievably tasty boutique restaurant on Academy! So tasty I went twice last week. I had the pickerel cheeks, the bison steak and apple crumble. For me to leave a restaurant full is rare but that's because a lot of food these days is filled with preservatives. This is REAL FOOD so it fills you up. The tastes are unbelievably fresh.

I've never had Juniper slaw before and now that I have, I wish it was this instead of Frank's that was on everything.

Cooked to perfection, great ambience, helpful and wonderful staff. I'll be back many times over.

Address: 877 Waverley Street Winnipeg, MB R3T 5V3 Canada
Review: Finally got around to dining here! The food, the ambience, the service, everything was amazing! For the antipasto, the baked brie was top notch! And my personal favourite for the entrée has to be the Agnello, which was cooked to such perfection that the meat just fell off the bone. Definitely going back for more!

Address: 877 Waverley Street Winnipeg, MB R3T 5V3 Canada
Review: A trendy Italian style restaurant in the south side of Winnipeg that offers great pasta dishes and deserts. Nice atmosphere with great serving and great food. I wanted the lasagna but was told it would take fifty minutes so I went with the seafood pasta instead. It was really good but I would have liked a lemon wedge and some pepper. The rest of our group loved their food. All around great experience! Add a lemon wedge and maybe some ambient music? Not enough to lose a star though. Highly recommend!

Address: 877 Waverley Street Winnipeg, MB R3T 5V3 Canada
Review: Very happy with this visits meal. You can have a look at my picture. To get a visual. Scalps cooked to perfection. Just the perfect amount of sauce. Rich and creamy! It’s been over a decade since my last visit here. But since my last visit, my love for pasta has grown significantly. If I like this meal, you will also appreciate this meal

Address: 877 Waverley Street Winnipeg, MB R3T 5V3 Canada
Review: We had a great time at Bellissimo. Everything was great from the appetizers, entrée and desserts. We enjoyed the Aragosta the most. I had a cappuccino after my meal though not gonna lie but I was expecting coffee art on my cup as it was a bit overpriced.

Address: 877 Waverley Street Winnipeg, MB R3T 5V3 Canada
Review: The food was ok. Was a little disappointed with the sauce that accompanied my chicken, or lack thereof. The peacan crusted chicken was amazing. My sister had the special which was a lobster carbonara, had only a cpl pieces of lobster, the noodles were very chewy and when you are paying $$$ for a plate you expect the quality and quantity to come with it. The place was beautiful, the atmosphere was simple and elegant. The staff were outstanding. Very attentive and humorous. Everyone was having a good time. I would give this place another chance.

Address: 222 Osborne Street Unit 22 Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Z3 Canada
Review: We loved where we were seated. A cozy nook and it was such a romantic date spot. The food was very good. Our favourite dish was the potatoes dauphinoise. Our food was a little slow to come out that evening and they apologized and brought us some free drinks. We hadn't even noticed it was slow as we were just enjoying the relaxed pace. Will definitely return!

Address: 222 Osborne Street Unit 22 Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Z3 Canada
Review: The atmosphere and just the whole experience of this place is a must. Our server was very nice and very attentive with us thru out our whole time there. Food was plated really nicely and everything tasted real good. The potatoes are a must!! Definitely coming back here in summer with our pupper ☺️☺️

Address: 222 Osborne Street Unit 22 Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Z3 Canada
Review: Sous Sol has a really unique vibe (i.e: candles on the tables, decorations, furniture). The servers were friendly but nothing exceptional about the services. They will not check on you or your food after the food came or explain/make suggestions on the menu. We ordered quite a bit of different dishes but the highlight turned out to be the bread and butter. All the appetizers were decent, and the dessert was good. However, we were pretty disappointed with the main since they were too salty. The tenderloin was really juicy/tender/high quality but it was just too salty. However, given this amount of food/drink and the quality of their ingredients, the price is pretty good especially compared to other steakhouses in town (main reasons I gave 4 stars). I don’t think we will come back, but it’s good to try it out at least once. Our bill was about 200$/2person.

Address: 222 Osborne Street Unit 22 Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Z3 Canada
Review: Love coming here every time! Great feels and vibe for romantic night out or just casual drink night . Service is amazing and food is great! Keep in mind thursday is oyster night and every cocktails are all great!

Address: 222 Osborne Street Unit 22 Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Z3 Canada
Review:
I just visited this place for the first time, and I want to move in.
It's perfectly weird, but in a way that makes you feel comfortable, not uncool.
Everything was incredible. The food and drinks were amaze-balls but the biggest highlight was the service. The main person that took care of us was incredibly knowledgeable and attentive, but other staff members seamless stepped in to run food, refill drinks, and run payments. I love a good restaurant, but I don't know if I've ever had a better dining experience.
I can't wait to come back.

Address: 740 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W6 Canada
Review:
Their soup based tastes really flavourful and delicious. We had fun mixing in different sauces to come up with flavours that our tastebuds would love. Prices were a bit much. Paid $90 for two people. Not worth the price we paid.

Service 3/5  |   Food 4/5   |   Atmosphere 3/5

Address: 740 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W6 Canada
Review: We went there on Sunday night and it’s pretty busy. Decided to try this place simply because of the individual hot pot. You can mix you own sauces, which was really fun and everyone was meant to get their own broth,so that’s an additional cost on top of the AYCE price.Also the price not included any drinks and the broths didn’t have that much taste. The choices not as wide as some other hot pot places I have been to.

Address: 740 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W6 Canada
Review: hidden spot in winnipeg, definitely give it a try if you’re interested in asian cuisine, on another note go for lunch, it’ll be half the price. 80$ for two people… wasn’t expected and was hidden on the menu. service was 3.5/5, price was 3/5 but keep an open mind because 5/5 food. make sure not to over boil but meats boil for about 15 seconds and vegetables 30. it was absolutely delicious and i loved being able to cook it myself. it was cozy inside but another table made my stay less enjoyable as they were very noisy and provocative. overall definitely worth trying and i will be going back for the lunch specials.

Address: 740 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W6 Canada
Review: Nice idea poorly executed. Food is decent , service bad . Watch what you're ordering and check your receipt,  very misleading.  Not a place I would return for a meal .

Address: 740 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W6 Canada
Review: Absolutely fabulous place if you like soup! Good selection of broths from mild to spicy. Everything we tried was delicious. The veggies were fresh, the meat was good quality, and the selection of sauces was great.  Everything was very clean and the service was pleasant. The all you can eat is a great value if you come hungry!

Address: 314 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2B9 Canada
Review:
Scallops are delicious. I highly recommend them.
But the noodles were hard and a little raw.
The lemongrass tart has lavender flowers on it, which is very unique. Cocktails are refreshing.

Address: 314 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2B9 Canada
Review:
The food was good, we had wings which were delicious. We also tried the fried rice, the noodles and the tacos. Everything was good, the tacos are a bit expensive for the quantity but it was good. We also tried chocolat tart and lime tart, both were delicious. The wine is super expensive , good cocktails a bit expensive too. Overall a good experience.
But the place is very noisy which makes it hard to have a discussion with everyone at the table.
100 bucks for 1 cocktail, 1 beer, 1 glass 6oz wine, noodles, tacos and 1 dessert, is a bir pricey ( price for 2 ).
I'd still recommand, not sure I would go back because of the noise.

Address: 314 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2B9 Canada
Review: We had a great time in the restaurant. There are different dishes and drinks on the menu that are inspired by Latin American countries. The Chajá dessert was amazing. Great service and quick.

Address: 314 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2B9 Canada
Review: Very clean environment, friendly staff, wide variety of drinks, very delicious food.  Will definitely visit again.

Address: 314 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2B9 Canada
Review: Heard great things about this restaurant but found it to be somewhat average. Corn with nachos tasted like canned corn with some cheese on top. Korean chicken was basic fried chicken and nothing more. Dandan noodles were good again but nothing special except sauce was tasty. After hearing good reviews I was disappointed and found it pricey for what you received. Pleasant service

Address: 393 Marion Street Winnipeg, MB R2H Canada
Review:
Not knowing anything about this place was hesitant at first going to this eatery inside a hotel/casino but so glad we did.

This restaurant is nicely decorated and spacious which is a contrast from the hotel lobby we came through. The staff was very friendly and attentive to our kids. There is a nice kids menu.

All our dishes were excellent not a single complain. They were well done and very flavorful. We will definitely come back.

Address: 393 Marion Street Winnipeg, MB R2H Canada
Review: Marion might be the most delicious breakfast- brunch place in Canada. Waiters are friendly and kind, portions are more than fair and the food is just perfect every single time. Nowhere else you can get a well-served, tasty salad with pistachios sufficient for two with less than $20. Sweet potato fries are always fresh and perfectly crunchy. Their iced latte has no competition. Don't forget to order their weekly dessert special every time... I just wish they stayed forever in the menu.

Address: 393 Marion Street Winnipeg, MB R2H Canada
Review: Overall decent. I was so excited abt the mini pancake such a good idea, the cream wasn't airy and a bit bland, apple was crunchy like hard. It wasn't caramelized or cooked. Biscuit was good with nice texture but also bland. I think everything cooked well but missing flavor from herbs, garlic, shallots, pesto hit a hot pan & oil that kind of flavor. So overall cooked well but bland..Just something missing. Good menu and has potential. Nice place and service was pretty quick.

Address: 393 Marion Street Winnipeg, MB R2H Canada
Review:
The food was excellent and I was happy to see that they use high quality ingredients from a local bakery (Tall Grass Prairie) and dairy (Cheaban). I had the overnight oats and the dish was an easy competitor for the best oatmeal I have ever had.

The staff was friendly, efficient and helpful.  We sat at the counter and my coffee never made it to half empty before being topped up.

Ample parking out back.

Address: 393 Marion Street Winnipeg, MB R2H Canada
Review: Amazing food! Had broccoli cheese soup & beet salad and my son had spicy chicken wrap. Big portions and super good!

Address: 722 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L Canada
Review: I was extremely satisfied with these tacos!🌮🌮🌮 The tacos were a bit on the small side but they were also quite inexpensive. They are authentic Mexican not Tex-Mex (if that matters to you). I would most definitely go here again and would recommend it to everyone I know. The staff was friendly and service was quick. The closest thing I have to a complaint is the tacos were drippy (but I think that's better than them being too dry)

Address: 722 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L Canada
Review: I have gone here throughout the years and the restaurant has maintained making their tacos with homemade tortillas, great flavors, and low-pricing. I personally love the chorizo sausage and al pastor tacos. Service has always been fast and friendly.

Address: 722 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L Canada
Review: I came here 3x and loved it. We’d order 5 kinds of tacos as well as Hibiscus drinks. Recently they upped the prices of everything by a LOT (I understand a slight increase…but they still use paper plates) Sadly don’t think I will go back unless I am desperate craving it 💔

Address: 722 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L Canada
Review: Great Mexican restaurant.  Very authentic!!! When you see grandma in the kitchen,  you know the food will be 🤌🏾🤌🏾.

Address: 722 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L Canada
Review: Hot, fresh and filled with flavour. Great spot if you're looking for tacos that's not Taco Bell. Authentic food, including the tortillas made on the spot, per order. So good!

Address: 794 Sargent Avenue Suite 5 Winnipeg, MB R3E 0B7 Canada
Review:
This place is amazing for pho and anything else on the menu really.

Portions are massive compared to a lot of places I’ve tried prior.

Amazing service, they’re very quick with lots of staff and even with the restaurant full they don’t neglect tables.

At around 15$ per bowl it’s really worth the price.

Restaurant is clean and besides the urinal
being out of service I had no complaints.

Would 100% eat here again.

Address: 794 Sargent Avenue Suite 5 Winnipeg, MB R3E 0B7 Canada
Review: Google pho places in Winnipeg and a bunch came up. I pick this one as it's nearby, good review ,  good parking and lots of reviews. I must say for such a small town it had an Excellent selection and the pho was pretty good. The soup tasted like it's been simmering all day. I got the combination with extra meat plus a Vietnamese coffee which was freshly made on the table. Definitely recommended and would go back for a quick bite. The bowl was about $11.00.

Address: 794 Sargent Avenue Suite 5 Winnipeg, MB R3E 0B7 Canada
Review:
Love this place! They can definitely use better systems for ordering and seating but the food is excellent! Traditional pho without MSG (or so they tell me, the lady at the front didn’t know, but the cook said no) good size and priced right:)

The place is busy for lunch, looks like everything is fresh and they are friendly. I’d return for sure! Hopefully they can figure out how to organize the chaos by then. Thank you again!

Address: 794 Sargent Avenue Suite 5 Winnipeg, MB R3E 0B7 Canada
Review:
Our table got an assortment of things but I think everyone really enjoyed their meal! I've been here a few years ago and they have since renovated- which is very beautiful! The service was good, and the food was good!

Love the deluxe vermicelli!!

Address: 794 Sargent Avenue Suite 5 Winnipeg, MB R3E 0B7 Canada
Review: Their Sergeant location is my favorite place for lunch! Awesome meals with generous portions, quick service, decent prices and they make substitutions with no fuss.  Made fresh and not spicy - provide hot sauce on the side if ask. Very friendly staff and great atmosphere! Try the Salad Rolls with choice of filling (I do Grilled Pork!). Highly recommend!

Address: 926 Grosvenor Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 2W9 Canada
Review:
Amazing Italian cuisine! Always our go to for great Italian food and ambiance. I had the special of the day of shrimp and veg with wine sauce and a side of fettuccine Alfredo (Alfredo is always on point here) husband ordered lamb shank (so tender and succulent) and kids got gnocchi so creamy and always their order when we are in. For apps we had meatballs (moist and tender), calamari so tender and fresh and an order of focaccia which they make in house.
For dessert we did gelato (hazelnut, lemon and strawberry) all were delicious and I had tiramisu which was surprisingly light and airy yet creamy and decadent. Service was great and fast as always. Always love having family nights here!

Address: 926 Grosvenor Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 2W9 Canada
Review: I've been to Tre Visi Cafe a number of times, and it's always a delight. They really make some incredible pasta dishes and I love how you can order half portions of so many things. I had the tortellini on my last visit (half portion) and it was the perfect size and delicious. The focaccia is also a+.

Address: 926 Grosvenor Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 2W9 Canada
Review: Awesome Italian eatery with a nice variety of authentic, modern, italian pastas, pizzas, and mains.  I had the Fettucine alla Diva - it was delicious!  Take the spoon when they offer it to you so you can enjoy the delicious sauce to its fullest.  Serving staff were awesome.  Highly recommended!

Address: 926 Grosvenor Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 2W9 Canada
Review: Small restaurant on Stafford with 6-7 tables we had olives for appetizer and pasta. They were very flexible with changing the type of pasta from ribbon to spaghetti. Food was very good and lots of flavor and huge portions. Most of the pasta on the menu will come with half portion and full portion options. Half portion was still plenty of food for me - if you are indecisive and want to try out couple different pasta doing half portion would be a great idea. Most things on the menu can be done gluten free too.

Address: 926 Grosvenor Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 2W9 Canada
Review: Excellent as always. I've been here 3 times and have enjoyed the food every time. Great sauces, and although the pasta is made a little harder than I'd prefer, it's still great food. My current go to for pasta. The chicken is also quite good. Excellent service as well

Address: 670 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B9 Canada
Review: Delicious pizza. The salad was also reaaaally good. Friendly service. It’s a bit small and if all tables are occupied it’s extremely loud. Dough was a bit undercooked in the middle. There is an upper level, may be quieter.

Address: 670 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B9 Canada
Review:
There is a lot of street parking all around this restaurant.
This restaurant has a few tables and can be tricky getting a table. It is so worth the effort to get a table!
The pizzas are great, the dough/crust is thin light and chewy. The cheese was flavourful and tasty. Overall I found these pizzas pretty close to what I got in northern Italy.
The staff is wonderful they really made our visit great.
Definitely go and eat in.

Address: 670 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B9 Canada
Review: I heard that this place can have lines down the street so we had to give it a try. Luckily it wasn't too busy, and we were even able to sit on the patio. Service was quick and we got the food quickly too. I'm a believer that the crust makes the pizza, and the crust is crispy on the outside and has a nice chewy texture as well. The ingredients tasted fresh. Not a heavy pizza, which is always good.

Address: 670 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B9 Canada
Review: I have been going to Vera for several years now and it never fails to disappoint. Fantastic pizza, lovely atmosphere and a cute small patio in the summer. Definitely one of my go to pizza places.

Address: 670 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B9 Canada
Review: The prices were really good. The Staff was really quick and friendly. Dessert was refreshing ! The salad is huge. Such a good deal. They don't take reservations.

Address: 1433 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J2 Canada
Review: Friendly atmosphere with a great neo-Italian cuisine. Nicely portioned meals pleasing anyone with an appetite for the Italian flare. The specials are indeed special but don’t shy away from the traditional pizza- wood fired (dining mate really enjoyed it as it looked great as well). Don’t forget to have a dessert- the tarts were packed with flavour.

Address: 1433 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J2 Canada
Review: Bonfire bistro has amazing pizza and pasta.  I highly recommend.  We needed a reservation on a Monday to get in! I am glad we did because the atmosphere is lovely.  All in all I give this place a full star review and will recommend to everyone I meet. Only down side is the tables are a bit small. But we managed three people at a table so it worked out.

Address: 1433 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J2 Canada
Review: We had a family dinner, my 4 y.o. son went home telling us “that is the best pizza” :) the food is really delicious and the presentation is great. Desserts are well done and very tasty. (Photos included) the place looks very clean and quite. Staff are also friendly and very helpful.

Address: 1433 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J2 Canada
Review: Not a high-end restaurant, but the variety of food choices was very good and the wine selection limited but well chosen for any wine pallette. We enjoyed the pizza as well as a couple of other entrees. It was a nice environment and pleasant service.  Most importantly is that we'd go back again.

Address: 1433 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J2 Canada
Review: Excellent pizza, great service, and a great atmosphere for dates.

Address: 283 Bannatyne Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 1M3 Canada
Review: Had a great experience there, first time having a cheese charcuterie board, 10/10 love the flavours and selection given to us (we told them to surprise us). Fringe festival was going on on the other street, the atmosphere was amazing !

Address: 283 Bannatyne Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 1M3 Canada
Review:
Day 12 of my pre birthday celebrations and  in pursuit of discovering the new (possible) home city’s food.  Today  has been the best meal we’ve had so far.

This restaurant is in the historic Exchange District of YWG and housed  in one of the many turn-of-the-century beautifully preserved masonry structures in one of Canada’s designated historic sites.

The mode was casual and the ambiance had this quirky old world charm.

Service was outstanding! 10/10!

We ordered:
Starters:
*CHICKEN LIVERS. $19
Pan-fried with brandy peppercorn sauce, baguette toast. I hate liver but I loved the rich flavours of the sauce. WOWZA and YUMZA! The president said the livers had this amazing flavour profile and had beautiful texture. He finished the entire dish. 10/10!
* PORK DRY RIBS. $16
Baby back ribs braised then fried until crisp, with chili and lime. The ribs was soft but not fall-off-the-bone so they were just  perfect. The caramelized crust added more flavours and texture to these delectable bites. WOWZA and YUMZA! 10/10!
Mains:
*HOUSE SAUSAGE MEATBALL PAPPARDELLE. $28
Smoked tomato and pepper cream sauce, garlic, onions, arugula and chêvre cheese. The pasta was cooked to perfection and the sauce was a real winner. The meatballs were just ok. 8/10!
*PORK CHOP. $36
Roasted root vegetables, green beans, pickled apples and grainy mustard jus. The chop was pure perfection. So tender, juicy and just packed with incredible flavours. The mustard  jus elevated the sensational texture and flavours to another level. WOWZA and YUMZA 20/10!!! 🔥😍😋😱💕

A remarkable culinary experience for sure.

Address: 283 Bannatyne Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 1M3 Canada
Review:
We come here often for buck a shuck on Wednesday night! Sometimes for dinner but usually late night after kids activities. Great spot to unwind and have a few drinks and snacks! We had oysters, a cheese plate (which they always have an amazing selection) desserts and drinks. My husband always try’s all the beer they have on selection and I always get a glass of red which is reasonably priced at $14 for a 9oz and heavy pour at times! Great friendly service and food comes out fast. Ambiance is dimmed and great spot for conversations and good times!
Make sure to make a reservation for Wednesday’s as its always packed.

Address: 283 Bannatyne Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 1M3 Canada
Review:
Peasant Cookery is a delightful spot for charcuterie, oysters on the half shell, and classic French favorites.

The food is all presented beautifully, but only giving 4 stats as the French onion soup and gravy on the steak frites was very sweet. Sweet beyond normal French onion soup level of sweet.

On the other hand, the chicken liver paté with pickles and grainy mustard was out of this world, as was the escargot on puff pastry.

And, as it was Wednesday, it was buck-a-shuck oysters - well worth the visit.

The steak was cooked as requested, but the volume of fries was overwhelming - almost couldn't see the steak!

I'm sure if we go back it would be a 5 star experience. Service was great and interior is atmospheric.

Address: 283 Bannatyne Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 1M3 Canada
Review: Just to happened to discover this restaurant and our experience here was amazing. The service, the presentation and the vibe was great.The beef carpaccio absolutely was my favourite which was delicious and well presentation.Don’t forget to reserve a table as it might get really busy.

Address: 980 St Anne's Road Winnipeg, MB R2M 2X9 Canada
Review: One of the best restaurants in Winnipeg. Every dish we tried was incredible. The atmosphere is very welcoming and chic. Service was top-notch. Definitely not a cheap place to go out to eat at, but well worth the price!

Address: 980 St Anne's Road Winnipeg, MB R2M 2X9 Canada
Review:
Harth is… a gem. We’re so fortunate to live so close, it’s incredible every time.

We got the family style for my wife’s birthday last Tuesday and loved every bite.

There was a nice variety of items and they totally changed the menu since our last visit.

One minor critique, our break could have been a bit more hot and toasty.

We will be back, time and time again and continue to suggest and recommend Harth to our friends and family.

We hope you enjoy it as much as we do!

🙏

Address: 980 St Anne's Road Winnipeg, MB R2M 2X9 Canada
Review: Oh god I don't know where to start! One of the first things the server said to us was "if you don't know something on the menu, don't google it, ask me. Let me serve you". That left us an extremely impeccable first impression. Everything we had here was incredibly delicious and of high quality ingredients. The service, the presentation, the space, the vibe, the decoration,... Top notch! Harth is easily one of the finest restaurants in the prairie region of Canada (and I have been to and eaten at a lot of restaurants in all of the big cities - Regina/ Saskatoon/ Calgary/ Edmonton/ Winnipeg). Totally worth the drive all the way from Regina. 6 stars!

Address: 980 St Anne's Road Winnipeg, MB R2M 2X9 Canada
Review: Truly a romantic and amazing place. The pizza bar is perfect for a date because you can impress your date by pretending to know what the chef is doing when explaining make up cooking techniques to her. I also pretended to know my wine. I ordered white by mistake when my date asked for a recommendation for red. But this place is so nice with perfect ambience she forgave me and thought it was funny instead. Just make sure you book ahead cause that place is packed even on a Tuesday night.

Address: 980 St Anne's Road Winnipeg, MB R2M 2X9 Canada
Review: Celebrated our anniversary and booked a table for dinner, its our first time here and read a lot of food things on the reviews so we already know what we wanted to try out. Started out with a glass of Chianti and Prosecco and a Margherita pizza which had wonderful crust and rich cheese, lack a bit more of the basil flavor but still very good; lamb shank was good, succulent and flavorful; our favorite was the Tagliatelle which is a must have in my opinion! The pasta is perfect and the sauce is well balanced both savory and creamy and the delicious duck 😋 To end the meal we ordered the lemon curd but it took sometime before it was served so to apologize they just charged it on the house. We are already planning when to come back to try out the other dishes! Highly recommend this place 🥂

Address: 10-1875 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2G6 Canada
Review:
We tried avocado rolls, mushroom rolls and Vegetable Specials. My friends also ordered barbecue fish and many other items.

The server managed to understand our vegetarian needs and directed towards the best options.

Definitely worth exploring !!!

Address: 10-1875 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2G6 Canada
Review: The food was delicious. There is lots of variety. Sushi, tempura, rice.  Veggies, lamb, pork , beef , chicken, seafood.  The staff are very helpful and knowledgeable.  It was a fun time, and 2 hours flew by.  We will be for the supper menu next time, I think. We also had the peach flavored soju.  It was a great experience.

Address: 10-1875 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2G6 Canada
Review: First time having Korean BBQ. Normally I do a pros and cons list but no real cons. Delicious food, cool experience, very nice staff. More meat that I thought we could eat and it was all delicious. I guess the only cons is for people that don’t want to cook their meat themselves (but there’s a good list of sushi and other items anyway). Highly recommend, make sure to visit in an empty stomach!

Address: 10-1875 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2G6 Canada
Review:
Short and sweet review.
First time. Incredible experience and good way to try new food.
Staff is the best I've ever seen and very very friendly.   Expensive, but worth it.

Best in a group, but wow... Just wow.

Address: 10-1875 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2G6 Canada
Review:
Unfortunately I have to say all in all I’m disappointed with our experience.  The restaurant (right now at least) is reservations only.  I booked 2 weeks ahead of time and still didn’t get the desired dining time I wanted.
We got there and the place was packed and loud so if you want to have a conversation with someone, good luck.  Not a romantic couples date spot in the least.
We were seated and waited an awfully long time for someone to come to our table, keep in mind there’s a pretty strict 2 hour time limit in place here, your times are even scribbled on your order sheet as reference.  We finally had a server come and explain how the menu works after we explained it’s our first visit.  We ordered and waited a long time again to get our food delivered.  To the point that we were getting annoyed because several tables that arrived after us were getting heaps of food delivered and well into their meals.  Food finally came and honestly at the steep $40.95 per person price tag, it wasn’t worth it.  You can see from past reviews and my pictures that the price has literally skyrocketed.
They offer no guidance on cooking, you just toss things on your in table bbq and hope for the best.  I’d suggest skipping the sushi because it’s sloppy and just mediocre.  A lot of rice and seaweed and not much else.  So the sushi was a big disappointment.
The beer price tag was a bit of a shock too, at $10 for a single pint.
The bathrooms are pretty run down and gross.  Doors don’t latch and the toilet didn’t flush.  Our server was nice enough, not outstanding service or anything, just adequate.
The parking lot is atrocious with huge severe bumps and holes.  The parking spaces are a joke, so tiny, you can barely get in and out of your vehicle.
Overall I’m glad to have given this restaurant a shot but I was not wowed and am not in a rush to return.

Address: 349 York Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3C 3S9 Canada
Review:
This restaurant has so much history that it could be a museum. It was Winnipeg's first Indian restaurant in 1967 and from the moment you enter to this beautiful place, you can see a bunch of wooden sculptures which we were told were even 200 years old, probably more. The decoration alone is an amazing reason to come, but as if that was not enough, the food is just as good!
We tried to try everything from the bufette and no single dish disappointed us, there are many vegetarian and non vegetarian options for every taste. We were particular fans of the shrimp curry but every dish is worth trying.
The staff is amazingly friendly and attentive and take care of you really well.
This is a must visit place in Winnipeg!

Address: 349 York Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3C 3S9 Canada
Review: First time back in 3 years. Came in for a Sunday lunch. It’s $24.99 per person. We missed the food and interior. The food was basic. Use to be the best Indian restaurant and now just the average. Stand outs were salad bat and the basic mayo pasta salad. The samosa had good flavor, tandoori chicken was better than other offerings, and the eggplant dish. Things that weren’t great were butter chicken, palak paneer (no paneer) and the shrimp with creamy curry

Address: 349 York Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3C 3S9 Canada
Review:
Drive your car, fly your plane, sail your boat up the Red River! I don't care how you do it...drop everything and come eat here. Friendly staff, brilliant atmosphere, incredible food awaits! Order off the menu or sample a massive buffet option for under $30. And that buffet! So many options that the average human being simply cannot taste every offering without causing massive gastrointestinal trauma. It's just that good!

Seriously, this place is a hidden gem in Winnipeg's downtown. Get a Kingfisher, grab a plate and enjoy some of the best food you'll ever taste. Then tip the serving staff very well because they've done an incredible job taking care of you! 5* all around!

Address: 349 York Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3C 3S9 Canada
Review: Had an amazing night at this restaurant. There was a buffet with all kinds of starters, main course and desserts. Everything was delicious and the staffs are friendly. Will definitely come back soon.

Address: 349 York Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3C 3S9 Canada
Review:
Went on a Tuesday evening and it wasn’t too busy. There’s a large selection of East Indian food to try as it is a buffet style restaurant. I wasn’t familiar with East Indian food so I just tried a bunch of different things. It works out because you find out what you like and what you don’t like.

There are both vegan and meat options which are labeled accordingly which is helpful. To end the meal, there are yummy desert options. There was ice cream, jello and mousse among other things. The orange swirl ice cream and mango mousse were really good.

Indoor decor is pretty unique and interesting. Water service is very fast. Staff is pretty nice other than the odd looks some of them were giving, not too sure why. Despite the downtown location, there’s FREE convenient parking right across the street with dedicated spots.

Address: 1390 Erin Street Winnipeg, MB R3E 2S8 Canada
Review: My boyfriend  and I were there for his Birthday. Food was amazing. Well, the portion for appetizer and dessert is so small but the main food was awesome. I brought his Birthday cake over there and asked them to bring it after dinner and they surprised me with sparkles and my boyfriend  was so happy. Their staff are friendly.

Address: 1390 Erin Street Winnipeg, MB R3E 2S8 Canada
Review: A completely mellow atmosphere at lunch on a Thursday in late May.  Be aware, the outdoor patio can get warm, but it's a very nice space that continues the decor of the interior. We had the good fortune to have had Dario himself waiting today, so the interactions were lively and very engaging.  He is a master of the light hearted tease. The food as always was a fusion of flavors that meld into a most enjoyable gastronomic experience.  The spicy pork tenderloin with mango, lives up to it's spicy name, but is well worth a try. The presentation is whimsical, as always. Without question a reliable place to find delicious fare.

Address: 1390 Erin Street Winnipeg, MB R3E 2S8 Canada
Review:
Good service and good food

My appetiser escargot Diabolo was awesome, the spring rolls were delicious, the soup a five spice Asian beef soup was just ok my bowl had very little beef while my friends had chunks of beef.

The salad of mixed greens and berry vinegarete was delicious!

I chose the rack of lamb for my entrée, while it tasted fabulous the portion was extremely small. Friend ordered the chicken and she loved every bite. The mashed potatoes were excellent

Dessert was great however small

Overall it was. Good experience may or may not be back will have to see what the menu has at the time.

Address: 1390 Erin Street Winnipeg, MB R3E 2S8 Canada
Review:
I got the cheapest off the lunch menu thinking it might be subpar... I couldn't be more wrong! This stuffed chicken breast is absolutely fantastic. Might be too much to say this dish is life changing, but it is fair to say this is the best chicken breast dish I ever tasted! Found this place because of my gluten intolerant friend, and while it sounded wrong, today I thank him for that.
Second picture entrees is a beef tenderloin, so good!

Address: 1390 Erin Street Winnipeg, MB R3E 2S8 Canada
Review:
What a great restaurant! Dishes are presented beautifully and are flavourful.  The chef (Dario) comes out of the kitchen and explains dishes or just has fun with his guests.

I highly recommend this spot.

Address: 1631 St. Mary's Road Unit F Winnipeg, MB R2N 1Z4 Canada
Review:
This restaurant is in a strip mall but don't let the ordinary facade trick into thinking this is an ordinary pizza joint.

Located in the strip mall there is eay more parking than ever could be used. However there is a limited amount of seating inside so it would be prudent to reserve well ahead of the date you want.

Friendly staff sat us quickly.  They have comfortable seats in a lovely atmosphere.  They have decent sized menu  starters, pasta, pizzas and salads etc.

They had 11" wood fired pizza and 15" stone baked pizza, which we could have had thin crust or the regular (we chose the regular).

Both pizzas were cooked right, neither being doughy/undercooked nor charred/hard and dry.  Our loaded pizzas were just right.

The regular crust on the 15" was awesome. The crust wasn't greasy. The crust light and airy. It was cooked but neither doughy or tough. Even the edges didn't get hard or crusty, just the right amount of chew.

The wood fired 11" was very good, the dough handled the toppings without getting soggy and the crust wasn't burned or dried out.

The quality of the toppings were very tasty and the pizzas were very filling. Everything we saw that came out of the kitchen looked really tasty.

Don't let the exterior fool you, this is one great restaurant.
We will be back.

Address: 1631 St. Mary's Road Unit F Winnipeg, MB R2N 1Z4 Canada
Review: AMAZING CATERING! they catered for our place of work, first impressions hair and skin team. the owner was so nice and had an amazing personality! not only was the food amazing but the staff was friendly and helpful too. 5/5 we love santa ana!

Address: 1631 St. Mary's Road Unit F Winnipeg, MB R2N 1Z4 Canada
Review: Great restaurant for pizza in St. Vital.  Its a very small restaurant - so it fills up fast.  Best to call ahead by 1-3 weeks and make a reservation if you want a specific date for your outing.  We had an 11 inch woodfired pizza called the Roman.  It had prosciutto, roma tomatoes, green olives and asiago.  We also ordered a 15 inch Stone Baked Pizza - designed our own with pancetta, black olives, pineapple and cheddar and mozzarella cheeses.  Both were excellent.  Lots of choices on the menu for pizza lovers.  They also had starters, pasta, and salad on their menu - though we didn't try any this time.  Decent wine menu was available as well.  The decor was quite nice - thought the table lights inside the bottles were interesting and worked well.  Our server was friendly and took care of us very well.   Takeout is available.  Saw that they offer vegan and gluten free crusts as well.  We will certainly go to this restaurant again to try more of their menu - this was our first time there.

Address: 1631 St. Mary's Road Unit F Winnipeg, MB R2N 1Z4 Canada
Review:
Visiting my two cousins and they ordered from this place as they said it's amazing. Asked that I pick, looked at their menu online and decided on their Philadelphia Pizza; wood fired steak, mushroom, onion, garlic, cheddar & Pesto Pizza; chicken breast, roasted red pepper, asiago, basil pesto.
We picked them up ourselves so as to make sure that the profit goes only to the restaurant and not to a delivery service.
They looked amazing! The crust was crisp and chewy. They do not shy away on toppings, each piece was a meal. Soo hearty, flavorful and downright delicious!
Going to visit my cousins again before new years and hope order from them again while in town.

Address: 1631 St. Mary's Road Unit F Winnipeg, MB R2N 1Z4 Canada
Review: Was very put off by this place last time I picked up my order. The pizza is fine, but not worth the money (in my opinion). I'm mostly writing a critical review because the service I received was awful. I wasn't greeted when I came in. Instead, I was ignored and the couple that came in AFTER me, was helped. When I finally was helped, the lady was unfriendly and had no interest in helping me. Customer service goes a long way, so I don't plan on returning.

Address: 222 Broadway Winnipeg, MB R3C 0R3 Canada
Review: What can I say about the historic Fort Garry Hotel. The Oval Room has been refurbished to keep its integrity and it looks great. The food was spot on, and the delivery of appetizers and entrees was perfectly timed. The price is on the high end but if you are looking for a special evening this could be the place. I recommend reservations.

Address: 222 Broadway Winnipeg, MB R3C 0R3 Canada
Review:
Beautiful, elevated, cocktail and dinning experience at the Oval Room Brasserie located in the Hotel Fort Garry. Stopped in for impromptu cocktails (Yuk Yuk’s Comedy Club in Lowell level) and small bites. We didn’t have a reservation but were easily and amusingly accommodated by the lovely hostess.
Ambiance is of fine French decor. Elegant and vey comfortable. Cocktail book was extensive; you’d be hard pressed to not find something of your liking. This gin aficionado tried truffle gin and it was fantastic. Who knew?! Thoughtfully curated cocktail menu and dinning menu. Service was excellent, witty and entertaining.
Pickerel bites and mussels were well seasoned and delicious. Both prepared well. I have not had a terrible meal at the Fort Garry EVER. Should be on your dinning and cocktail list in Winnipeg.

Address: 222 Broadway Winnipeg, MB R3C 0R3 Canada
Review:
I have had take out here before, and today I had a sit down. The burger on take out a while back was great, and the manager Pauline helped me out tremendously although the dining room was full. I was so thankful.
However, the meatloaf I had today was awesome, actually the whole experience was elevated maybe not so much by the meatloaf, great taste, but more of the atmosphere and the people that worked there. I was greeted by Fran, a very pleasant person and a great server. She said she would look after me, and boy, did she! Not only did she put me in her favorite spot (ask her why that is), her recommendations were on point, everything from the margarita to the dessert, and who will ever forget the meatloaf wine combo?! Everything was absolutely wonderful.
Would I recommend this place? You bet! And I will be back, for sure!

Address: 222 Broadway Winnipeg, MB R3C 0R3 Canada
Review: A special date. I can't find the words to express how truly stunning the dining room is. The architecture is like no other restaurant in Winnipeg and there are no words to fully express my admiration of the atmosphere at Oval Room. The prices of the dishes were on the high side—to be expected. The mains are a la carte, and sides were pricy too. Regardless, the food was quite tasty and the gnocchi dish left me feeling full.  Service was kind and fast, a little rushed, but satisfactory. This restaurant is definitely a special occasion spot and I would recommend it to anyone who's looking for a very special date night out.

Address: 222 Broadway Winnipeg, MB R3C 0R3 Canada
Review:
The restaurant was beautiful!  There was so much character!  The food and drinks were also amazing!  What stood out to us was the exceptional service by our server Fran.  She was very personable and helpful all around.

Later on in the evening, we returned for cocktails.  While on her break, despite not being our server, Fran checked up on us.  This level of service and personability is very rarely seen.

Yes the food and drinks were great but it's hands down due to the service that I would recommend the Oval Room Brasserie.

Address: A-1670 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J7 Canada
Review:
A cozy and simple designed restaurant with a curated chef menu. The options are few but it should satisfy most pallets.

The plates are meant to be share so for a party of two we were recommended to get 4 dishes. Reservation at this place is pretty much a must for dinner as the place only hosts a handful of tables.

The food was pretty great but you must be open to enjoying more interesting flavors.

Address: A-1670 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J7 Canada
Review: I had the most amazing meal here! I sampled one dish from each "section" and loved all of them. The portion sizes were perfect and every bite was packed with flavour. The service was wonderful as well! The food is fairly priced for the quality. All around a fantastic experience and would recommend to anyone.

Address: A-1670 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J7 Canada
Review:
This restaurant uses actual magic to make their food. The service is perfect, the atmosphere is classy yet casual, and the food is sorcery.

Eat here if you love yourself and appreciate food as more than just sustenance. It's always a great experience and everyone should take the time to appreciate it.

Address: A-1670 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J7 Canada
Review: Small and intimate. Delicious food. Wonderful and attentive staff. Fried chicken here is top class.

Address: A-1670 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J7 Canada
Review: Wow wow wow this place is a GEM! ✨Food was done exquisitely by an obviously highly trained and talented chef. We got the beets, pork bellly and beef cheek, but I could have tried the whole menu. My husband and I were surprised at first at the presentation but a few bites in and we were amazed. Don’t be fooled you will leave happy, content and full. The foods flavours seriously blew us away, brining me back to my moms cooking, nostalgia is one thing a that not many people nail, but this was an experience we will remember for years to come. All this combined with a unique but incredible beer and wine list, and last but not least our server was nothing but but high class, efficient, and awonderful conversationalist. Highly reccomend to anyone coming to Winnipeg. If I could give 6 stars I would. Come here get that pork belly and never look back. 🤤🤤🤤

Address: 189 Carlton St Winnipeg, MB R3C 3H7 Canada
Review: Fantastic restaurant and has been for a long time. We had excellent service the entire evening. It's an experience our friends will not forget. Food is excellent and as fresh as one can get. Will be back again,  great job!

Address: 189 Carlton St Winnipeg, MB R3C 3H7 Canada
Review: We had a fabulous time, good food, great entertainment and just all around good experience.  Will definitely return.

Address: 189 Carlton St Winnipeg, MB R3C 3H7 Canada
Review: Amazing food and service! Roger the chef gave a splendid show! Only wish they had more of the drink mugs in stock but that simply means we will have to return.

Address: 189 Carlton St Winnipeg, MB R3C 3H7 Canada
Review:
I haven't gone out since December so this was pretty scary of an experience, but the atmosphere was so amazing that I felt entirely at ease. The prices are worth it for the quality of service and interactive experience alone, but the deal is sweetened by the large amount of food you get and the fact that it's seafood cooked literally perfectly. I don't think I've ever had scallops that were cooked to a perfect texture before I came here.
The hosts are super friendly and attentive and the cooks are all equally friendly and a whole lot of fun. The cook at our table was able to fit right into our group's sense of humor and it was like just adding another friend to the table.
I also absolutely LOVE the Geisha drink I got. Not only was it super tasty, but the glass was beautiful and I got to take it home. I want to come back to collect them all, especially the Lucky Cat.
Thank you for the lovely food, service and experience!

Address: 189 Carlton St Winnipeg, MB R3C 3H7 Canada
Review: Fun experience and yummy food. A little expensive, but you do get a ton of food. Only a few different meal options. Great place if you enjoy meat as you get chicken, steak, and then your choice of shrimp and giant scallops, or lobster. Warning, the comedy doesn’t change much as the jokes were all pretty much the same as my previous visit 12 years ago.

Address: 164 Stafford St Winnipeg, MB R3M 2V8 Canada
Review: One of my fave local spots. They have a fantastic bar, craft beer, attentive and friendly staff, and the food always works—there’s a little something for any mood.

Address: 164 Stafford St Winnipeg, MB R3M 2V8 Canada
Review: Was recommended the poutine…. it was amazing, some of the best gravy I’ve ever tasted, fries are excellent and nice portion or curds. Will be back as I’m already craving that gravy! Friendly staff, clean… an all around nice spot.

Address: 164 Stafford St Winnipeg, MB R3M 2V8 Canada
Review: The food and service were excellent. I had the burger w half Ceasar salad half fries. Both sides were excellent and the burger was delicious. Generous servings, excellent quality, great prices. We arrived for lunch early at 1130 and this seems like a good idea as it really filled up at lunch time. Even when it was very busy the wait staff were very present and friendly.

Address: 164 Stafford St Winnipeg, MB R3M 2V8 Canada
Review:
Came in on Sunday afternoon with a large party, and we were quickly seated to a table and we received waters, drinks and menus right away! The server we had was all smiles and she was welcoming to us without being "in your face" (like Earl's or similar chain-style banter).

We had a variety of food off of the menu and aside from there being almost only spicy dishes on the menu, we were accommodated by the cook for getting less spices.

The food came to us quickly from the kitchen, and our server was attentive to us, always checking in throughout our stay. She gave us a lot of choices and she seemed to know "a little something" about each of our dishes, drinks and the deserts.

Food was wonderful all the way around, and the service was above par. We really enjoyed our  afternoon, (we stayed quite long, and never felt rushed or pushed to leave the restaurant).

Thank you, I think I speak for everyone in saying that we will definitely return to the Grove.

Address: 164 Stafford St Winnipeg, MB R3M 2V8 Canada
Review:
The food was delicious, the atmosphere relaxed, an overall delightful experience.

We had the three weekend specials (see photos) and shared. We decided the pizza was the best of the three; the salmon and the lamb sandwich were really good but were surpassed by the pizza.

We ate on the patio and it wasn't too noisy  as it was on a side street. Not too crowded.

A little pricey but I would definitely recommend for a special night out.

Address: 635 Saint James St Winnipeg, MB R3G 3R4 Canada
Review: Initially was a little bit of a wait to get our order taken, but the staff were so kind and accommodating once the issue was brought to light. We enjoyed every single dish we ordered, and the food came out almost immediately. Our server, Noah B, stepped in when we were left waiting and was absolutely amazing. He was very efficient in taking our orders and bringing us our food, and was a joy to be around and talk to! He also went the extra mile in getting us free drinks and dessert because of the original wait. Plus, he went the extra mile in putting a sweet little message with our dessert when he found out it was our anniversary (pictured) :)

Address: 635 Saint James St Winnipeg, MB R3G 3R4 Canada
Review: Came here today for a date and celebration with my girlfriend this evening, and was immediately greeted and shown to a table. Our server (Emily T) was amazing and kind, helped a bunch with my shellfish allergy, great conversations, made our date feel complete and perfect. We will definitely be coming back soon! Thank you again!

Address: 635 Saint James St Winnipeg, MB R3G 3R4 Canada
Review:
Good restaurant!

Loved the presentation, taste of the food is ok. Had a good experience.

I just didn't like how they didn't have blinds to remove some bright outside light.

Food is a hit or miss sometimes, so go at times when not so busy

Also sushi cone sucks 90% rice, 10% fish

Address: 635 Saint James St Winnipeg, MB R3G 3R4 Canada
Review:
Always a great place to meet! Went for a friend’s birthday! Packed over st Patrick’s day but still great service. I ordered the herb salmon. Salmon was small but with recession I get the portion control. Mashed was awesome and veggies were still crunchy. Food came fast!
Always can count on some good food, ambiance and service!

Address: 635 Saint James St Winnipeg, MB R3G 3R4 Canada
Review: Good food and great service.  This chain is never a disappointment. We enjoyed our dinner.

Address: 285 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 2B4 Canada
Review: We had a great experience in this restaurant. We came late to our hotel and were looking for something to eat. The man at the restaurant was very friendly, gave us advice about the portions and we had a great meal. There was a good atmosphere. I would certainly recommend to go here.

Address: 285 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 2B4 Canada
Review: Great service from Adam.  Excellent beer.  I wish my burger was a little more "homemade"  It was better than fast food but not the burger joint style burger I was hoping for.  Fries were excellent!

Address: 285 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 2B4 Canada
Review: I had the burger and beer Tuesdays! It’s a nice burger.

Address: 285 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 2B4 Canada
Review: Really loved the burgers and poutine here! Hit this place up before two concerts now as it's across from Canada Life Centre, and will definitely be doing this before every concert in the future.

Address: 285 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 2B4 Canada
Review: We didn't eat this time. Menu looked awesome though!! We should have... Bartender was great! Beverages were wonderful. We will go back for food tomorrow.

Address: 3116 Roblin Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3R 0C1 Canada
Review:
Absolutely one.of the best restaurants I've ever been to.   Was lucky enough to roll the dice on a chance at supper, and ended up putting this place into our Google Maps.   Ended up coming to Capital Grill and Bar, and all I can say is what an incredible experience.

From the wait staff, hosts, and chef, we were amazingly surprised!
The service was incredible, and the food was that much better.

Winnipeg is lucky to have an incredible.resturant like this with so many unique flavours.

Thank you to the crew at Capital - can not wait to come back!

Address: 3116 Roblin Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3R 0C1 Canada
Review: The burger was great and the fries were amazing (crisp and well seasoned, with flakey salt finishing). The service was exceptional. One of the servers saw I had a cut finger and offered me a bandaid. We live in the area and yet we kept procrastinating to come here. We look forward to coming back.

Address: 3116 Roblin Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3R 0C1 Canada
Review: Always fabulous! Wonderful food & good times.

Address: 3116 Roblin Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3R 0C1 Canada
Review: I came here with a group of 7 for a bachelor party dinner. It was a busy day and they could not fit us inside, so the owner Greg asked us if we would be comfortable on the patio. The service he provided us was the best service I have ever received, we all were blown away. The food and drinks were excellent and came relatively quickly, and he checked on us frequently. He even pulled out a heater so we wouldn’t get cold. Not one of us had any complaints and we all will be back. Highly recommend this place.

Address: 3116 Roblin Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3R 0C1 Canada
Review: Pleasant experience, rechargeable. Quaint restaurant I’d recommend to couples for a romantic dinner lit by candles. Enjoy a relaxing evening here with outstanding food that hits all the right spots.

Address: 339 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0G8 Canada
Review: Food is always good. Atmosphere is great. Service is a bit slow, but I kind of like that in the way that your not rushed.

Address: 339 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0G8 Canada
Review: The cafe is very cozy and romantic, decorated with great taste. It has a warm atmosphere, suitable for romantic and for business meetings as well. Food is quite tasty. Especially, I enjoyed a chocolate cheesecake with salted caramel

Address: 339 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0G8 Canada
Review:
Great time! The place has a fascinating atmosphere, what makes you feel harmony and peace. It will take you away from daily routine and your problems.
Our today’s server - Alex was deeply knowledgeable and helpful. It was a prominent example  of professional service.
The food was delicious and drinks were tasty.
I truly recommend this place!

Address: 339 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0G8 Canada
Review:
This was my first time coming to this restaurant and it was great!
I came with a group of six, including myself, and I absolutely loved the table we were sat at. It was a triangle shape, which allowed us all to see each other and hold great conversations, unlike a rectangular table would.
Staff were very friendly and attentive as well.
The restaurant had a beautiful indoor atmosphere, which created a calm and relaxing environment.
My entree, the Scampi, was delicious! The Tiger Prawns are great quality. The pasta sauce was full of flavour with a little kick!
I was eager to try the raspberry cheesecake, but they unfortunately ran out and I resorted to a mocha cheesecake- which was delicious! Very rich and creamy.

Side note: the restroom is in the hotel across from the Cibo’s front entrance. Staff have to walk you to the hotel door to let you in!

Address: 339 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0G8 Canada
Review:
Their Carbonara didn’t taste like it used to so we asked the manager if they have changed their food, we were told it depends on how long the pasta is cooked with tomatoes but Carbonara doesn’t have tomatoes. Other tables had their water refilled multiple times but we only got a refill when we stopped the waiter and asked. We were happy to share our food with flies maybe they liked it?
They also need to have a more detailed menu as they have some ingredients that are in their food but not listed on their menu.

Address: 63 Sherbrook St Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B2 Canada
Review:
Excellent schnitzel!   We had one plate of pork schnitzel and one plate of chicken schnitzel.  The o’brine potatoes were delicious!  The bread basket was fantastic but could have used a bit more butter.  The service was shockingly fast!  The only thing I didn’t care for was the hazelnut pie, I felt like it was missing something like a gooey filling.  The eclair was very good.  We will definitely be back!

Tip: bathrooms are in the basement.

Address: 63 Sherbrook St Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B2 Canada
Review:
An underwhelming experience overall.

The chicken schnitzel with O'Brien potatoes and sweet and sour cabbage was definitely the highlight. All the flavors were excellent and the portions were generous. Very crisp and tasty schnitzel. On the other hand, the paprika chicken was disappointing. The portion size was generous again; however, the flavours were nothing special and the dish was overpriced in our opinion.

The server was curt throughout the meal and we felt like we were inconveniencing them. Not friendly and made no attempt at making it a personal experience. Besides this, it is a cozy little restaurant for a winter evening. The food also arrived quickly and drinks were refilled as needed.

I wouldn't call it a terrible experience by any means but I doubt we will be back. We have wanted to try Bistro Dansk for a few years after hearing many recommendations but our experience fell flat. 3 out of 5 stars.

Address: 63 Sherbrook St Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B2 Canada
Review:
Absolutely yes
Hype is real - get the pork schnitzel!

They were kind enough to allow us to dine in for lunch at 1:30p even though they closed between 2-5p. Crispiest schnitzel I’ve ever had, and the cabbage on the side is so tasty. Lunch plate is an excellent portion size - you get two schnitzels! (Lunch is also better priced than dinner)

I can see during busy services having one server might increase your wait time, but staff is extremely kind and humble, and I love that it’s a family business. Charming restaurant (it’s not very big) and was featured on “You Gotta Eat Here!”.

Address: 63 Sherbrook St Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B2 Canada
Review: I went here on a date a few weeks ago. The decor and ambiance is incredible! I really liked the homey feel of the restaurant. The staff were super friendly and personable. You can really tell the food is home style with good simple ingredients.
