For this reason, some dishes might take longer to come out (which they give proper notice of and is expected when items are prepared for you and not in mass). The chicken soup was pretty delicious and I liked the walnut stuffing in the chicken. I thought the schnitzel was impressively crispy and the sour kraut was good. The desserts are interesting, for example the hazel nut pie is made with a lot of actual hazel nuts as opposed to Nutella or extract (is what it seemed like). Flavor-wise, it tasted like my mom was in the kitchen, which is good, but flavors I can accomplish at home. Overall I'm glad we tried it!

Address: 63 Sherbrook St Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B2 Canada
Review: It's been years since I was last here.... Why did it take so long to return?? Delicious meal, friendly staff, cozy environment and enormous portions.  Reasonably priced for the amount of food you get.  The cabbage side dish is phenomenal as are the O'Brian potatoes.  Be sure to try the schnitzel! I won't wait this long for my next visit.

Address: 529 Wellington Cresent Winnipeg, MB R3M 0A1 Canada
Review:
One of the best steaks you will have hands down. This is a classic fine dining experience so be ready to pay for it. And pay well! But it's worth every penny and I fell in love with their rib eye steak. The service is top notch and the decor is super classy. It has the old school English vibe and it was great.

The steak was delicious. It was nicely pink in the middle and juicy. You have a ton of options for side dishes and we loved the spinach. However the mushroom wasn't all that and it felt a little oily. The star is the steak and you have to try it.

It's not just the food but an experience.

Address: 529 Wellington Cresent Winnipeg, MB R3M 0A1 Canada
Review:
My husband and I came for a date night after work. As construction season is here and traffic is bad everywhere, we decided to come to dinner straight from work. I’m not sure if it was because we weren’t dress up and came in work clothing, we felt our server wasn’t interested in serving us. Though we were willing to pay for the food!

He didn’t introduce their feature for the night when he first came over. We even asked for recommendation, he briefly mentioned a few appetizers and still did not mention their feature items. We overheard the feature items from the tables beside us. My husband wanted to order beef Wellington and didn’t see it in the menu so he thought they no longer carry this item. Imagine his surprise when he overheard the conversation in the next table! Overall, we felt judged. Our food was great, just disappointed at the service.

We were looking forward to dinner experience and left disappointed. We haven’t been to 529 Wellington since COVID. It was different a very different experience in comparison to when we last came here!

Address: 529 Wellington Cresent Winnipeg, MB R3M 0A1 Canada
Review:
529 is great. We love the food and the ambiance. Whether we are stopping in for a quick lunch or dinner, the service has always been wonderful.

The food isn’t groundbreaking, but they do serve classics and they serve them well.

If you intend to come for dinner, I would recommend making a reservation, esp on the weekends as they do tend to be busy.

We, personally, prefer the lunch ambiance because it’s not busy and super laid back.

Address: 529 Wellington Cresent Winnipeg, MB R3M 0A1 Canada
Review:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at 529 Wellington, and I have to say it was an absolutely amazing experience. From the moment we walked in, we were  greeted by the friendly and welcoming staff. The decor was beautiful and inviting, with a cozy and rustic feel.

The menu was extensive and had something for everyone, but I decided to try one of the their Canadian Prime steaks they are know for and I was not disappointed. The flavors were expertly balanced and the presentation was stunning. Each bite was a taste sensation, and I couldn't help but savor every mouthful.  The side dishes are also wonderful for sharing with the table and are portioned large enough for many to enjoy.

The service was top-notch, with the waitstaff being attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. They were happy to make recommendations and helped me pair my meal with the perfect wine. I also appreciated that they checked in on us multiple times throughout the meal to ensure everything was to our satisfaction.

The restaurant also had a great atmosphere, with a lively but not overwhelming buzz. It was the perfect spot for a date night or a special occasion. I also loved that they had a great selection of desserts, and I couldn't resist trying their homemade lemon cheesecake. It was the perfect ending to a perfect meal.

In conclusion, if you're looking for a fantastic fine dining experience, I highly recommend checking out 529 Wellington. The food, service, and atmosphere are all top-notch and I can't wait to go back and try more of their delicious dishes.

Address: 529 Wellington Cresent Winnipeg, MB R3M 0A1 Canada
Review: Amazing experience ….The food were delicious and the plating were amazing. Service exceptional…. Worth the price 😋

Address: 1031 Autumnwood Dr Winnipeg, MB R2J 1C6 Canada
Review:
This was the first time we had order, was recommended to us. Absolutely delicious and super friendly!
Our new place for Chinese!
They truly are a hidden gem!
Yum yum 😋 🤤🤤
Staff made us feel very welcomed. My husband is hard to empress and he sure was happy with the food and staff

Address: 1031 Autumnwood Dr Winnipeg, MB R2J 1C6 Canada
Review:
We had our food delivered. It was 15 minutes earlier than anticipated. The price is super good, excellent value. Portion sizes are very good, on the bigger side. spent about $80 and got a few things free, stuff they just threw in which is perfectly fine with me, very appreciated.
The food is super delicious, best I’ve had in a long time. It is now my favourite restaurant.

Address: 1031 Autumnwood Dr Winnipeg, MB R2J 1C6 Canada
Review: This was the first time we ordered take out Cantonese food from this restaurant and it was fantastic! they made sweet and sour fish especially for my wife that was not on their menu. So hospitable and accommodating. The chow mein was a revellation. It was not greasy at all! My daughter loved the wonton soup which was divine. They gave us free rice and soda too.

Address: 1031 Autumnwood Dr Winnipeg, MB R2J 1C6 Canada
Review: I rarely give 5 stars, but this place deserves it! The customer service is adorable, and the food is shockingly delicious and consistent. My 2 favorite dishes, are the Shanghai noodles (wish there was a bit more veggies, but still yummy) and the sauté mixed veggie dish.

Address: 1031 Autumnwood Dr Winnipeg, MB R2J 1C6 Canada
Review: This is our go to for Chinese pick up, family owned. price is just right, and portion and taste of the food is decent. You will have to try this little place!!!

Address: 112 Marion St Winnipeg, MB R2H 0T1 Canada
Review:
Dined here with a couple girlfriends the other evening. The restaurant is located in The Norwood Hotel. The restaurant itself is renovated and it looks great! The server, Alice, was very attentive and friendly. I got the Tacos and they were delicious. My girlfriends got the lettuce wraps and both added the protein to it. The portions for the lettuce wraps were tiny. Everything came in separate dishes and you had to construct it your own. Definitely recommend adding the protein because it is a very small portion.
All in all it was really good, and I would be back!

Address: 112 Marion St Winnipeg, MB R2H 0T1 Canada
Review: Really great burgers, Salads and soups! I would avoid the fish and chips, the fish was burned and over cooked. However the server was an absolute delight and was funny and caring and had great suggestions on food and drink options. Would definitely recommend it.

Address: 112 Marion St Winnipeg, MB R2H 0T1 Canada
112 Marion St Winnipeg, MB R2H 0T1 Canada
Review: My husband and I came in for lunch yesterday based on a SM video recommendation and we fully enjoyed the experience. The atmosphere is fabulous! I definitely value my surroundings almost as high as the food, it is all part of the experience in my opinion and I was not disappointed. The server was wonderful, attentive without too many interruptions and the food was very good. My husband said the fries were some of the best he has ever had and the steak sandwich hit the spot :) Thanks for a great lunch!

Address: 112 Marion St Winnipeg, MB R2H 0T1 Canada
Review:
An awesome place to celebrate any occasions here. The place has a warm ambience that you’ll feel delighted while you’re enjoying their eccentric and delectable dishes. My buddy and I had an amazing and enjoyable night in this place while catching up. Looking forward to try more interesting dishes next time.

Food 4/5 Service 5/5 Atmosphere 4/5

Address: 1393A Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B8 Canada
Review:
I enjoyed my quick stop here. The place has a big variety of noodle dishes and they are good, but what really stood out was their dumplings.

With a butterie and zesty flavour, dumplings were melting in my mouth. The place seems to be owned and managed by a family, grandma was in the front folding dumplings.

Wee bit of a suggestion, the dining area need a bit of... care. Making a few small improvements will make dine-in enjoyable.

Address: 1393A Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B8 Canada
Review: I am obsessed with Dancing Noodle. The curry Dan Dan hits every. single. time. The meat dumplings (get them spicy!) are also fantastic. Each dish goes for approximately $10. Consistency has never been an issue here, and everything’s packed really well for takeout. ☺️

Address: 1393A Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B8 Canada
Review:
We ordered off Skip the Dishes, and we were not disappointed. All our dishes were really tasty!
We ordered Curry Dandan, Handmade Dumplings, Steamed Pork Dim Sum, Hot Spicy Noodle and the Cucumber Salad. None of the dumplings/dim sum came with sauce, but we improvised and made our own!
We definitely recommend all the above dishes!!

Address: 1393A Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B8 Canada
Review: The chili oil wontons and Dan Dan is very good here. Also get the Curry Dan Dan if you like curry flavour! The service is very kind here.

Address: 1393A Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B8 Canada
Review: Had a delicious bowl of beef noodle soup. Very generous portions.

Address: 1979 Wellington Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3H 1H5 Canada
Review: Consistently great food and service! Every time we have gone here for dinner (I think this was our fourth time), the food has been prepared beautifully, the flavours paired nicely, the service polite and attentive, and the portions and prices impressive. I can honestly say that some of my favorite dishes I have ever had in Winnipeg have been at The Blue Marble. The atmosphere is very nice and calm, and I enjoyed the choice of music playing over the speaker while we dined, so that's a bonus. I will be thinking of that dessert for a long time: Banana bread french toast with apple cinnamon ice cream...mmmm! We will definitely be back.

Address: 1979 Wellington Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3H 1H5 Canada
Review:
My first visit at this restaurant and even though the food was pretty good I doubt I will be back. The airport location is a bit out of the way but the main deterrent for me was the complete lack of ambiance. The restaurant is right next to a fairly busy walkway and has windows all around. I felt pretty uncomfortable with people walking by and literally staring into my plate. Maybe tinting the windows might solve this problem? The restaurant had more of a cafeteria vibe rather than a higher scale restaurant.
The food...nice presentation, pretty good but nothing that made me say wow. The serving staff were very nice even when they were dealing with a extremely drunk and belligerent customer who was disturbing everyone.

Address: 1979 Wellington Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3H 1H5 Canada
Review: I stopped in to have a bite during an overnight layover while staying at a nearby hotel. It was a bit confusing whether or not I could seat myself, but the bartender came up and greeted me within a couple mins. The burger was spectacular and the fries were just right, i have another layover and will be coming back for it again! I had to ask for the bill but it was clear they were very busy so I didn't mind. They only had two people for a whole bar and 20+ tables...

Address: 1979 Wellington Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3H 1H5 Canada
Review: Small plate of Stuffed chicken was the perfect amount for us and delish and the burger was tasty. Blue Marble always has a fantastic wine list which is appreciated and it’s usually quiet but don’t let that fool you. It’s a great place to stop, even if not travelling.

Address: 1979 Wellington Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3H 1H5 Canada
Review: Well this was an unexpected surprise!  For those who want good food with exceptional flavor pairings and a vast & well-stocked wine room -- this is the place for you.  Will be coming back many more times, I would recommend you do the same. Pricey but worth every cent. Thanks Brett for taking the time to talk wine with me, and Chris for the fast service.

Address: 709 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W4 Canada
Review:
This is another instance that if I could give more stars, I would. Especially for the service. Our server did an excellent job helping us navigate the menu and suggest dishes we might enjoy. We were those people that asked to be moved after we had been sat and the server was very accommodating.
We ordered the meal for four and it was a LOT of food but if we hadn't done that we would have missed out on some excellent dishes. Like the bread. We would never have ordered the bread and most of the table voted it their favorite part of the meal.
It was not an inexpensive meal but definitely worth it.

Address: 709 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W4 Canada
Review:
We had a great  time at this place. It was our first visit there so we decided to order the most popular dishes- Khachapuri Adjaruli and Khinkali. We were really impressed, because those meals were so delicious and fulfilling and their price was quite reasonable. So we highly recommend them!!!

However, it should be mentioned that we also had Veal Shashlik which was really tasty, but portion is so small. We had a Large one for 28$ and it was only 6 small pieces, so consider your wishes before ordering Shashlik..

Also, we want to admit the professional and knowledgeable service of their waitress - Olya. She helped us with all inquiries and did the great job!

Overall, we do recommend this place. It is tasty and cosy.

Address: 709 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W4 Canada
Review:
If you’ve never tried Georgian food, do yourself a favour! Imagine meats marinated in the most flavourful mix of spices cooked over wood coals… side dishes and dips prepared from scratch with fresh veggies and herbs. The food here is of the best quality possible for the price and truly traditional and authentic.

Not only that, but the hospitality and consideration is incredible. Chris - the floor manager personally delivered an order for my mom’s birthday when the delivery apps were down - thank you SO much! My parents  (who never eat out and prefer to cook at home) really enjoyed the meals.

Can’t say enough great things about this place!

PS if you are into wine tasting, they have a great selection of imported Georgian wines.

Address: 709 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W4 Canada
Review: The food was great! I think it was a very good quality and well made food however the portions were very small compared to prices. Apart from the portion sizes i think it is a good place to go!

Address: 709 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W4 Canada
Review:
Recently went for dinner here and had a wonderful experience.

The food was simply amazing. So much flavour, but it all worked very well together, no one thing overpowering another. The portions were a good size as well.

The service was great, they timed things very well, so when we were almost done with an appetizer they bring the next item out, no need to sit and wait with empty plates.

The atmosphere was lovely for an evening meal,  close and comfortable without feeling cramped.

Address: 684 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B9 Canada
Review:
I will definitely be coming back. It took a second to find it, but I also was distracted for a second while looking but we arrived.
The food was spectacular. Great portion sizes for price, and it tasted delicious.
I went with my partner and he had the Stromboli, and he had plenty leftover, after he and I shared garlic knots and greek salad, and I had the chicken parmigiana.
Our server was super kind, she came by and kept note of our waters, and helped us a lot.
The tables and chairs were amazing. The place felt cozy and personal, and it felt like i could genuinely enjoy my time with my partner.

I will certainly be going back, and I can't wait til then.

Address: 684 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B9 Canada
Review: I ordered the chicken Parm. The Alfredo sauce was grainy and not outstanding. The chicken was great. We attended as a large group. We had multiple servers and sometimes requests were overlooked as the message didn't make it from one to the other. The atmosphere was great for a staff gathering.

Address: 684 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B9 Canada
Review: Amazing food! The focaccia was INCREDIBLE. The best I have ever had. The calzone was humongous and just as tasty as it was huge! It could easily feed 2 adults. Get ready to wait a bit longer than usual for food, but it is soooo worth it. The staff are competent and friendly, what more can you ask for in restaurant service?  The reason atmosphere loses points is because the event room near the front of the restaurant got really warm  as the sun filtered in and the people crowded in but it was a very hot day and what can you do? Also the bathroom was kinda dingy, but it was at least clean.

Address: 684 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B9 Canada
Review: Loved the food! Service was great too! One nitpick: the garlic breadknots we ordered were decisively less fresh than the complementary plain breadknots. That said, I feel like it's still a candidate for the best Italian food in Winnipeg.

Address: 684 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B9 Canada
Review: Very good Italian food! Highly recommend the fettuccini Alfredo!

Address: 8-1875 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2G7 Canada
Review:
This place is great! Tehran Cafe is the kind of place that you'll want to come back several times.
They have a bunch of traditional dishes from Iran and they are all amazing!
We enjoyed the Fesenjan and the Ghormeh Sabzi, both were really flavourful and unique, and we could tell that the ingredients used were top notch and the portions were really generous. For the Fesenjan they use a lot of walnuts and for the Ghormeh the beef is really tasty!
The place is also cozy and has a really nice decoration. The owner was really kind and explained us the menu and answered all of our questions. He also recommended us the persian baklava for dessert and we had to orden twice because it was delicious. You should also not miss the pistacho milkshake which I totally recommend.
Tehran Cafe is sure to give you a good experience. I totally recommend it!

Address: 8-1875 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2G7 Canada
Review: Great food, clean and delicious. Friendly people. I recommend to try this place.

Address: 8-1875 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2G7 Canada
Review: Food quality, quantity and taste was really good. However would have been better if there were more options in an affordable rate.

Address: 8-1875 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2G7 Canada
Review: Without any doubts, Best Kebab dishes I’ve ever had in Canada.

Address: 8-1875 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2G7 Canada
Review: Loved the food. The portions were great and they were equally tasty.

Restaurant_name: Fergies Fish N Chips & Seafood Market
Address: 1 Forks Market Road Suite 142 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4L9 Canada
Review:
Probably the best place in The Forks for food.

Three types of fish to choose from: Cod, Pickerel and Halibut. Everything is prepared on a regular basis, so everything is fresh and crispy.

We opted for cod and it was probably the best choice. The fish is juicy and delicious. We didn't find a single bone in any of the pieces. The dishes are served with tartar sauce and a piece of lemon. Additionally You can choose ketchup or HP sauce in the amount you need.

I highly recommend it, at these prices for a complete dish it is really good choice in The Forks.

Restaurant_name: Fergies Fish N Chips & Seafood Market
Address: 1 Forks Market Road Suite 142 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4L9 Canada
Review: The deep fried battered fish is okay. The fries for me needs to get replaced maybe use wedges.. they have seasonings so better use them because the fish and fries are pretty tasteless so it's up to you how you make it tasty.

Restaurant_name: Fergies Fish N Chips & Seafood Market
Address: 1 Forks Market Road Suite 142 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4L9 Canada
Review: I chose the cod. Fish was perfectly cooked! Lightly battered and seasoned incredibly well. The fries, while a little a little soggy when I started eating them, were still close to perfection. One of the best fish n’ chips I’ve had!

Restaurant_name: Fergies Fish N Chips & Seafood Market
Address: 1 Forks Market Road Suite 142 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4L9 Canada
Review: When I saw the long line up I knew I had to try it. The cod was really good, the batter is not thick unlike other places they put so much batter to make it look bigger. It was cook to perfection, so crispy and very tasty. My hubby had pickerel & stew/chowder  it was also very good & the fish chowder was loaded with fish  and it taste fresh season with like salt and pepper simple and tasty. The fries looks good but it was not really crispy even we eat it right away something that they can improve. The lady that help us was very energetic happy and friendly. The best Fish and Chips place that I have been.

Restaurant_name: Fergies Fish N Chips & Seafood Market
Address: 1 Forks Market Road Suite 142 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4L9 Canada
Review:
This fish n chips is good but not great. Had the single meal with chowder and fries. The chowder is a fish and shrimp stew. The taste is good but it’s not a “chowder”
Pickerel was small but good. Fries were good. I would gladly trade 2/3 of the fries for a bigger piece of fish
Fish not pictured

Address: 260 Saint Mary Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3C 0M6 Canada
Review: The pizza is absolutely deliciously!!! The crust was perfectly cooked. The service was superb! They have drink special for most nights and they are good, as well. The bathrooms were clean and tidy. If you are in the Winnipeg, you must stop here.

Address: 260 Saint Mary Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3C 0M6 Canada
Review: We had a sweet 16 party here. The staff went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. Food was great! They even stayed open an hour late for us! Highly recommend!!!

Address: 260 Saint Mary Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3C 0M6 Canada
Review:
The restaurant is really nice inside. Very modern, lots of TVs. The staff are very friendly.

Lunch prices are very reasonable. The beet salad is delicious.

Address: 260 Saint Mary Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3C 0M6 Canada
Review: Very nice server, I'm from the states and she, Anna, gave me a bunch of tips and places she likes to do. The soup pictured was one of the best I've had and the cocktail, red sky something, was incredibly tasty.  The bread was very fresh and the chicken was well seasoned. Will definitely be going back!

Address: 260 Saint Mary Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3C 0M6 Canada
Review:
Went for Le Burger week, excellent burger looked just like the photo. Everything tasted fresh, friendly and quick service.
Will definitely be back to try the pizza.

Address: 2855 Pembina Highway Unit 40 Winnipeg, MB R3T 2H5 Canada
Review: A friend recommended this place. I was initially skeptical since the place was inside a mall but I had a great experience. Friendly staff, great food with very appealing presentation. The portion was very sizable for the price.

Address: 2855 Pembina Highway Unit 40 Winnipeg, MB R3T 2H5 Canada
Review: Amazing authentic Korean food. Food comes with spice bottle on the side so you can adjust it to your liking.

Address: 2855 Pembina Highway Unit 40 Winnipeg, MB R3T 2H5 Canada
Review: Fresh and delicious sushi, their portions are very generous for the price. I also love the cozy atmosphere. Highly recommended

Address: 2855 Pembina Highway Unit 40 Winnipeg, MB R3T 2H5 Canada
Review:
Randomly headed here for a quick lunch while shopping at Richmond West. I was pleasantly surprised by the restaurant's amazing food and friendly service. I ordered Edamame for starter and a Salmon Donburi.
* Food *
- Edamame: Not overcooked, nice freshness and satisfyingly crunchy 😋.
- Salmon Donburi: Rice was cooked evenly, came out warm and had a tender texture with a slight chew. The salmon was decent quality with a very clean taste. Its coldness and rich, buttery flavor paired perfectly with the hot and fluffy rice 🤤. The baran was a little off putting but overall very nice dish.
* Atmosphere *
Loved it, very quiet and cozy. Staff were all very friendly.
Highly recommended

Address: 2855 Pembina Highway Unit 40 Winnipeg, MB R3T 2H5 Canada
Review:
Sudden plans are the best. Got out to have something light and ended up having the best Japanese and Korean food 🥰
They got this cute menu where you can see how the food will look like which is literally the same.
Service was amazing and people were very friendly. We had the Deep fried chicken dumplings, creamy tempura and mt Fuji.
Overall experience 9/10
So far the best sushi place ever! 🙌🏻

Address: 103 Sherbrook Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B5 Canada
Review: If you're craving fried chicken, this is the place to go! I had the Chicken and waffles and let me tell you, it was the best fried chicken I've ever had! So crispy and yet so flavourful, my mouth just drooling. And who would have guess it'd go so well on a fluffy Belgian waffle with Blueberry syrup?! The tallest poppy knew! Now add little hot sauce and you've got yourself a delectable orgasm for your tastebuds!

Address: 103 Sherbrook Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B5 Canada
Review: This place is great.  Hands down, the chicken and waffles (with two eggs on the side) was the best meal I've had at a restaurant in a long time.  I'm not great with names, so I can't remember our server's name, but she was great.  She offered drink suggestions since they were out of what we wanted, and they were really good.  I feel that she was perfectly attentive, sometimes you get servers that come by too often, or not enough.  But that wasn't the case.  Both her and the girl who cleaned our table and seated us were very friendly.  To say the least, our experience here was deserving of a good tip.  This is one of those restaurants I'm going to have to keep note of, I'd like to come back and try some more of the menu very soon.

Address: 103 Sherbrook Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B5 Canada
Review: I'm surprised that I haven't tried this place yet as I always passed by this area. It's a nice place to have brunch with friends. Though the service might be a little slow as most of the time they are busy. But thumbs up for the servers!

Address: 103 Sherbrook Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B5 Canada
Review: Get the fried chicken! I had the fried chicken sandwich with coleslaw—dang delicious. The fresh cheese bread and super crispy chicken make it next level. A creamy peppery coleslaw cut it perfectly. My wife enjoyed the motza soup with mashed potatoes, which she reported was really good, but she kept picking off my meal ;) Atmosphere is very funky and a bit bohemian with great wall art around. Friendly casual servers, limited beer selection but full bar. Eclectic music playing. Great spot!

Address: 103 Sherbrook Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B5 Canada
Review: The environment is pretty nice, I like the paintings and other decorations, staff are friendly and helpful. I ordered the fried chicken and waffles and I was a little disappointed with how crispy the chicken was but all in all it was still good. The mac and cheese though, that was one of the best I've tasted from a restaurant!

Address: 180 King Street Unit 107 Winnipeg, MB R3B 3G8 Canada
Review:
Tried out Noodle Express for the first time today, and I can see why they are one of the top 50 restaurants on Door Dash in all of Canada!

The food is absolutely incredible, and the portions are HUGE!!!  Extremely reasonably priced.  I promise that you will not be disappointed.

The Egg Tarts are RIDICULOUSLY amazing - I could eat a dozen!  We also had Taro Root Cake, Spring Rolls, Sesame Balls, Steamed Pork buns and a bunch of other delicious dishes!

The owners are very hard working, and run a wonderful establishment.  We will definitely be back!

Address: 180 King Street Unit 107 Winnipeg, MB R3B 3G8 Canada
Review:
One of the best Chinese restaurants in the city. Great prices and huge portions! They have the best BBQ Duck Soup I’ve had so far and their dim sum selection is good. Friendly and very nice staff. Will always come back for amazing Chinese food.

Their Mango Pudding is the best!

Address: 180 King Street Unit 107 Winnipeg, MB R3B 3G8 Canada
Review:
This review is for their dimsum as that's what we had and did not order from the other menu.
I did include pictures of both menus.

After 2pm this place is a great price as it's dim sum happy hour.

It has been around for a very long time. I came here as a child and they are still running. A long standing establishment that I enjoy going to. It's very much a hole in the wall place.

They do not push the food on carts. You order directly off the menu, but that ensures fresh food. Our meal was $62.83 for 4 people including tea and tax.

Address: 180 King Street Unit 107 Winnipeg, MB R3B 3G8 Canada
Review: One of those wonderful hole-in-the-wall restaurants that seems understated in decor but has exquisite food. The bean curd rolls were perfection, and I highly recommended the eggplant in garlic and black bean sauce.

Address: 180 King Street Unit 107 Winnipeg, MB R3B 3G8 Canada
Review: My 1st time and won't be my last.  Very authentic Chinese right in Chinatown!  Very casual eating, nothing fancy.  Today was Deluxe Shrmp dumplings and Pork Dumplings,  both were fresh and delicious!

Address: 258 Kennedy St Winnipeg, MB R3C 1T2 Canada
Review: I went here based on the reviews, and it was amazing!  Then the next day, I also happened to be downtown and I knew where I was taking my company.  This place is amazing, if you haven't tried it yet, you need to and won't be disappointed!!

Address: 258 Kennedy St Winnipeg, MB R3C 1T2 Canada
Review:
If only this place could be a little bit bigger with more seating options, this would get the full five stars from me! Their food embodies how all diner food should be: it's obvious how much care and effort goes into making these delicious meals. The seating area left a lot to be desired since it was only a handful of tables, booths, and counter seating. My husband needed to borrow a chair to sit comfortably, but the server was definitely friendly and helpful with us throughout the experience. The parking is just ok, but I can definitely see how people can get frustrated trying to find a parking spot nearby.
They have amazing shakes, and their poutine definitely lives up to the high ratings we had heard about! Definitely worth a stop!

Address: 258 Kennedy St Winnipeg, MB R3C 1T2 Canada
Review: If your looking for an old fashioned diner and your coming from out of town, this is the best place to come. Had the bacon, mushrooms cheese burger. You won't leave hungry that's for sure. Thank you for staying open and bring back memories of old fashioned burgers.

Address: 258 Kennedy St Winnipeg, MB R3C 1T2 Canada
Review:
Wonderful diner.  I had poutine with pulled pork.  The pulled pork was as good as any bbq place in America, tender and smoky.  Raegan had a great BLT.  We also had an amazing vanilla bean milk shake.

The owner was super friendly and the diner itself was decorated with White Star themed ocean liners.

We would go back anytime.

Address: 258 Kennedy St Winnipeg, MB R3C 1T2 Canada
Review: Good food. Milkshakes were great. Service was excellent

Address: 1425 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C2 Canada
Review: Omg the best soup we’ve ever had. You must try Beef Sate noodle soup! The other two dishes (pho and lemongrass chicken) we had were good but the beef sate noodle soup was very memorable.

Address: 1425 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C2 Canada
Review:
Food is actually very good and filling. I had the spicy vermicelli soup and spring rolls. Beef Pho is also good.
I think what could be better is the cleanliness, I could smell the washroom from were I was eating.

Address: 1425 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C2 Canada
Review: It was a nice small restaurant. My friend brought me there. We ordered fried chicken wings, salad spring rolls and some noodle soup. Everything was good. Didn't feel very thirsty after all. We came one hour before close but the waiter was still nice and patiently taking our orders.

Address: 1425 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C2 Canada
Review: Excellent meal! It was my first time trying Vietnamese Cuisine. It's totally worth it!

Address: 1425 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C2 Canada
Review: Tried the crispy spicy pork, deep fried spring rolls, Vietnamese style coffee, and our regular, deluxe beef pho. Best pho in Winnipeg with a great broth. Great flavor in the pork and spring rolls. The pork is pretty spicy so this dish is not for you if you can't handle high spice levels. First time trying Vietnamese style coffee and it was really good.

Address: 75 Forks Market Road Winnipeg, MB R3C 4Y3 Canada
Review: My family likes that the food on the menu tasted different. It was unique and gave an experience congruent to the vibe The Forks offers. We also likenthe dinner ware. We ordered mushroom toast with beets, lamb, pickerel, meat balls.

Address: 75 Forks Market Road Winnipeg, MB R3C 4Y3 Canada
Review: Had a great dinner full of laughs and delicious food. Our server was excellent and gave us some tips on new drinks to check out and was very informative about the food. Really enjoyed all of the dishes, I personally recommend the rack of lamb. Nice place for a date or just to go have some fancy cocktails.

Address: 75 Forks Market Road Winnipeg, MB R3C 4Y3 Canada
Review:
Visited just before the dinner rush.

Service was pretty good. We made a reservation for a certain number of people, and they gave us enough seats, but for some reason, we were missing two sets of flatware and napkins. It was corrected, but it felt like the server didn't believe us at first.

Aside from that, our server was really polite and accommodating the whole time. I appreciated her patience since we were a pretty big group. There is an 18% gratuity included for bigger groups.

I ordered the Pan Fried Bearcat Pickerel. The taste was very mild, and overall, it was just okay. There is nothing to write home about. I wouldn't really recommend it. My partner ordered the special, which was a modern surf and turf with pork belly and octopus. That was much more flavourful. I say to definitely try asking what the special is before ordering. Food is very pricey, but you can see that in their menu online.

Overall, it was a good experience, but I won't go out of my way to come back.

Address: 75 Forks Market Road Winnipeg, MB R3C 4Y3 Canada
Review: Excellent food and service yesterday! Definitely will come again. I recommend the buttermilk fried chicken with the Brussel sprouts as a side.

Address: 75 Forks Market Road Winnipeg, MB R3C 4Y3 Canada
Review:
I had a few hours to kill while I waited for people and wanted to try someplace new. And this place had eggs bennie. I'll just say that the only reason it got 4 stars instead of 5 was it was a really cold day and the tea for my Earl Grey came tepid. I really wanted hot tea and it doesn't take that long to preheat a cup. The eggs Benedict were good, not eggsellent but good. I loved the crunchy potatoes.
All in all, it was a good place for breakfast and to wait out a few hours watching people.

Address: 1084 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Z9 Canada
Review: Amazing restaurant. Food is always tasty and healthy. Owners are really nice. Great price and delivery option. Large menu selection. Thank you

Address: 1084 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Z9 Canada
Review:
I have been going here for years.  I can tell that the owners of old must have sold the restaurant to someone who hates their customers.
To start the rice was days old. They served us old rice they didnt want to throw out.  Then, We try to ordered chow mein.  The server asked if we meant bean sprouts with dry noodles.
I told her no, even argued that we wanted fried noodles.
Whoever took the order insisted we have bean sprout chop suey.  I told them I wanted chow mien noodles.   They sent me the bean sprout chop suey anyhow with dry noodles in a bag.
The beaf stew with bean cake had no meat in it. It was all cheap vegetables and tofu.   The real insult was the fact they used rotten bok choy that had black mold on it in the dish.   Something tasted off immediately.   By the time we noticed they had closed.  And we even tipped them for the abuse.  Not only would I not recommend anyone going here ever I will be reporting this establishment for their gross misconduct.

Address: 1084 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Z9 Canada
Review:
We ordered pic up some beef chow fun, Singapore noodles, and Cantonese Sweet and sour pork
The food was tasty and plentiful. I can’t believe how many times I have driven past it, and never ordered from it. I see there were some negative comments on delivery times. I ordered in person and waited, the food was ready in less than 15 min.
Give it a try!

Address: 1084 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Z9 Canada
Review:
Ordered the Cantonese chow mein for pick up. Haven’t ordered since Christmas
Used to be excellent
Wondered why it was so heavy
Must be a ton of noodles I thought
Yummy!
They filled it with gravy/ juice???? WTH????!!!!
No taste, very little noodles, minimal veggies
Drained out the “juice” container was less than 1/2 full 😡
Get your old chef back!

Address: 1084 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Z9 Canada
Review: My husband loves Chinese food with a passion. I'm not quite at his level of devotion, but this place is really good. The Golden Inn Beef is my favorite, and any of their hot plate choice are delicious. Word of warning: don't get the fried rice. There's absolutely nothing special about it, very bland and dry. Other than that, this is a great place.

Address: 670 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X7 Canada
Review:
The setting of places excellent, one can imagine that one is in Italy.
The seasoning of the food is very nice, the quality of the ingredients is good.
Unfortunately the service is terribly bad, the assignment of the table did not take long, but it took almost half an hour to take our order and almost an hour to serve us, then to ask for the bill was a similar story. It wasn't that there were many people, the service staff wasted a lot of time, joking with each other.

It's not a bad place when you have a lot of time to waste.

Address: 670 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X7 Canada
Review: This restaurant has the most cozy atmosphere and delicious food. It is filled with Italian and Roman decorations, which adds to the charm of dinning there. The menu has so many options but for us the standout dishes were the onion and seafood soups, which were delicious. Also, the pastas were fantastic, especially the Linguini alla Pescatora and Linguini al Vongole. Both had amazing sauces and were rich in flavour. The service was excellent, with attentive and really nice staff. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for delicious Italian food in a super cozy atmosphere.

Address: 670 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X7 Canada
Review:
Where do I start?

The first thing I thought when I was here with my partner was "I've always wanted to try this place out!". The second one was "I think I've seen this episode of Gordon Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares before". Some first impressions are the most important, but in this case, it was the second.

My partner got the pesto linguine, which as you can see from the attached photo, was drenched in oil. Immediately upon receiving the plate, pushing down gently on the noodles revealed a layer of oil underneath. Halfway through, as shown, the situation hadn't improved. I could picture Gordon Ramsay commenting about the quantity of oil, probably using language more colourful than the basil.

I had looked at the menu and saw "homemade pasta", with an entry for cannelloni. I make fresh pasta semi-regularly, so I was excited to try this entree. What I got was _not_ what I was anticipating. As before, images of Gordon Ramsay shouting "it's not fresh, it's frozen!" popped into my mind. The meat mixture alone was... off. The taste was acceptable but no more, but the texture was pasty at best. And the pasta. The pasta was well and truly bad. Fresh, homemade pasta is not a hard thing to make. Even just semolina and water can give excellent results. This, however, was not that. It had clearly been frozen at some point in it's lifecycle, perhaps long ago. It cracked a little from the dry interior as I cut through it with the knife. The flavor was off as well, in a way that I cannot explain. I've had better noodles from a grocery store box, by an order of magnitude. I've also had better frozen meat filled pasta dishes from a grocery store box as well.

And that's nothing to say of the overall experience. The staff cut my partner off twice when asking a question, put their hands on our shoulders without asking, and were the loudest fixture of the establishment. The guests were far quieter, and the only "ambience" was the staff joking with each other while sharing things on their phones.

Overall, this trip was characterized by regret. My stomach, not 30 minutes from my experience there, is gurgling and uncomfortable. My partner's is as well. For $30 a plate you would expect quality or at least quantity, but we received neither. I regret choosing to not waste the food, I regret making the choice to give it a try, and I regret mostly not having a personal tip line to Gordon Ramsay.

Edited to add: 2 hours after our seating my partner is now throwing up. 0 stars?

Address: 670 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X7 Canada
Review:
Honestly I can't find better pasta & pizza than Colosseo in Winnipeg. If I want some pizza or pasta, I literally only visit this restaurant.

A bit loud inside, so 3 stars for atmosphere, however except for that, everything is perfect!

Recommended 👍🏻

Address: 670 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X7 Canada
Review: Great food! Loved the pasta and pizza. Our server was energetic and enthusiastic while explaining the menu and serving. The only thing that didn't work for me was the atmosphere...almost dungeon-like interiors lighted with only artificial lighting. Patio seating may be better. A little on the pricey side but still worth it.

Address: 1406 Ellice Ave Winnipeg, MB R3G 0G4 Canada
Review:
When my wife asked for Jollibee for her birthday, I knew there was no denying that request. I mean, who am I to stand in the way of a Jollibee celebration?! Back in the Philippines, Jollibee was a staple for all our special occasions - birthdays, graduations, even just getting a good grade on a test. And let me tell you, every time I sink my teeth into their food, it's like a trip down memory lane to my childhood.

My go-to favorites are the Filipino-style spaghetti - sweet, meaty, and just like how I remember it; the Palabok Fiesta, which is a fiesta in my mouth with all its amazing flavors; and of course, the Spicy Chicken Joy - crispy, juicy, and oh so satisfying. Honestly, I could eat this every single day and never get tired of it.

So if you haven't tried Jollibee yet, consider this your official sign to go and check it out. You won't regret it - trust me, it's a whole experience in itself!"

Address: 1406 Ellice Ave Winnipeg, MB R3G 0G4 Canada
Review:
So this was my first time dining at Jollibee. I've always seen the very distinct signage and was curious about the place. My perspective of the place was that it was inviting when I first entered the establishment I quickly came to the realization that this place was very popular for many people. I like the relaxed feeling in the atmosphere. It wasn't congested, the staff were really relaxed and continually on the spot with their roles, this made it feel even more welcoming.

The seating was comfortable and not cramped.

The speed of the service was excellent. When I asked for extra napkins a staff member stopped what she was doing and kindly obliged.

I liked the chicken it was something new to me the way the chicken was really crispy.

I gave this rating a five in atmosphere and service and only a four for food because I just selected exactly what my friend was having. I'm sure if I picked what I would have really wanted I would have given it four stars.

I'm giving this a 5 star overall because I was so relieved that it wasn't one of those nightmare food runs.

Overall no complaints.

Address: 1406 Ellice Ave Winnipeg, MB R3G 0G4 Canada
Review:
Had the regular and spicy chicken, mashed potatoes and fries.

Really like the chicken.  Enjoyed it much better than KFC and Popeyes.

Kids really liked the pineapple quencher. Reminds me of drinking the pineapple juice of a can of dole pineapple.

Overall, very good for a fast food chain.

Address: 1406 Ellice Ave Winnipeg, MB R3G 0G4 Canada
Review:
Place is good, pleasant people, food is good but sometimes their chicken is  undercooked.

Parking is a challenge ;) which also means that the place is popular, especially to Filipinos.

Address: 1406 Ellice Ave Winnipeg, MB R3G 0G4 Canada
Review: Doesnt even taste and look like Jollibee anymore. The chicken was old and the batter was too hard on the outside and undercooked on the inside. Hope it was a one time thing.

Address: 730 St Anne's Rd Unit M Winnipeg, MB R2N 0A2 Canada
Review:
Delicious pupusas just like you'd get back home!

Only downside is that they're often very busy and it may take some time to get your order as everything is being made in the back from scratch.

I'd recommend getting a reservation and ordering appetizers. So you're not dissapointed.

Address: 730 St Anne's Rd Unit M Winnipeg, MB R2N 0A2 Canada
Review: Insanely good. Just at the restaurant with a full tummy but want to eat more because it is just simply too good. Ordered combination and a cerveza! Now I want to try all of their menu. Even in weekdays, it seems quite busy. Wouldn't hurt to make a reservation.

Address: 730 St Anne's Rd Unit M Winnipeg, MB R2N 0A2 Canada
Review: Authentic Salvadorian cuisine with many vegan and vegetarian options! Different days of the week have different specials. The owners are quite friendly. My favorite are the black bean pupusas with salsa and curtido. This place used to supply Mondragon with Corn Tamales and Bean Pupusas back when it existed.

Address: 730 St Anne's Rd Unit M Winnipeg, MB R2N 0A2 Canada
Review: These are the best pupusas in the city without a doubt! My wife and I make it a thing to come frequently. You will not be disappointed

Address: 730 St Anne's Rd Unit M Winnipeg, MB R2N 0A2 Canada
Review: So much fun! Delicious pupusas and tomales. Be sure to try the horchata drink. Very friendly staff. Wednesdays and Saturdays have live mariachi music. Can't wait to come back.

Address: 219 Saint Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J2 Canada
Review: Wow, amazing. Staff and food is so good!! Highly recommend the Chicken Cesar Sandwich.

Address: 219 Saint Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J2 Canada
Review:
An old time classic and iconic diner. An amazing "find" in THE PEG after a long road trip which ended here. Fortunately I have a life-long friend who resides here and knew I would LUUUUVVV this place.
Our gregarious server, Vickie was a joy and when I found out they served COKE FLOATS I was blown away. I have not had one in decades!!! The chocolate milkshake was a bit of a watery disappointment which did not taste like it was made with actual ice cream.
The GREEK CHICKEN BURGER was a lovely grilled breast but a bit smothered in too much tzatziki sauce which overpowered its flavour.The CHEEZ-BURGER was a delicious hand made pattie of flavourful juicy  meat, but, again, was a bit disappointing with the addition of a very smoky chili sauce which overpowered the burger. Apparently this is the house specialty which I did not know about and will know better the next visit.
A pleasure to see places like this still exist. And a great end to a sadly short visit.

Address: 219 Saint Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J2 Canada
Review:
It’s a very busy and highly popular restaurant. I mean not by the internet influence, but loved by local people.
You could be waiting for a while to get your meal, but definitely worth to wait.
I like the fried chicken and Bolognese pasta. I guess many people be here for the burger. Burgers are also good. And you could be very comfortable to have a meal with your family or closest friends.
I saw there’s a Christmas card send from a customer to the staff. You can see, neighbors loves it. And many people come to eat as a naturally choice.

Address: 219 Saint Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J2 Canada
Review: The food was absolutely Incredible big huge portions I will definitely be coming again and you spend half the money you would if you went to a fancy restaurant and you actually leave full !

Address: 219 Saint Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J2 Canada
Review: This place has been around for over 50 years and you can't beat that. Foods. Excellent atmosphere was good. Well worth the stop by.

Address: 99 Osborne Street Suite 102 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2R4 Canada
Review:
The food arrived hot, and tasted absolutely delicious!

I would highly recommend the sweet and sour chicken, as basic as that sounds it was probably the best sweet and sour chicken I have ever had.

The noodles were nice as well, veggies tasted fresh. Even the rice was soft and fresh which you don't see to often anymore. The satay sauce is also very tasty!

Will be ordering here again. Really impressed with the quality and price.

Address: 99 Osborne Street Suite 102 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2R4 Canada
Review: We’ve been ordering from Spicy Noodle House for over 20 years. Staff and service are the best. My favourites are soup A18 with #1 broth, deep fried shrimp, and honey garlic chicken. Our favourite Chinese food restaurant in Winnipeg.

Address: 99 Osborne Street Suite 102 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2R4 Canada
Review:
Large menu. All sorts of choices. Soups, noodle soups, other dishes which would be best to order a variety and share.
Friendly service. Was very quick with the food.

Address: 99 Osborne Street Suite 102 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2R4 Canada
Review:
Ordered on skip. Got the peanut soup. The broth was thin and there was a bad almost vinigar taste to it. If I had not paid money I would not have eaten it.
The spicy beef was okay.
We also got the curry chicken. It wasnt really a curry. The chicken was kind slimy. We did not eat it.
We wanted to try something new. We will never order from here again. Very expensive and we couldnt eat one dish, didnt really like but ate the soup. Only the beef was okay, but not that good.

Address: 99 Osborne Street Suite 102 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2R4 Canada
Review:
Whenever I'm sick I get soup here. The broth is full of flavour. Unfortunately I usually can't taste much else as when I'm sick my sinuses are blocked. Reasonably priced for Osborne village.
Also even though I haven't actually eaten here when I'm not sick, for the last 10 years, it's the Village! Every restaurant here is good! Most have some creative aspect to them because it's the Village! But it's Chinese food... The broth for soup is flavourful you know that the food is good.

Address: 598 Ebby Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M Canada
Review:
Don't come to this place for buffet!! Just don't!  We went there today for buffet and found out there was nothing.  Only 5 chicken pieces and 2 pieces of beef on the meat part. We paid 16.99 dollars and had nothing to eat. Only veggies. We asked them more than 3 times to refill but they did not. And all of them were inside the kitchen. I don't know what went wrong today. It was a dinner buffet. One of my friends didn't even get to eat a single chicken piece. There was no tandoori chicken available. The samosas were stale from the day before so we threw it away. We called the waiter n told her that samosas were stale but she kept on denying. Worst place
I'm sooo mad. Paid 16.99 dollars plus tax n got out starving. I hate myself for even coming here. Don't go. There are many other Indian places just go there if it comes for buffet!

Address: 598 Ebby Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M Canada
Review: Came here for their lunch buffet on a Sunday.  The food was good, the naan that comes with the bread was hot and crispy when it came.  Decent variety of meat and veggies dishes.

Address: 598 Ebby Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M Canada
Review:
Had the Buffett, meh.
The butter chicken isn't even decent.
The Nann bread is doughy.
The pea, corn, slime was acctualy food.
Service is weak, slow, impersonal but also it's kind of nice to be left alone.
The fruit plate you get for free is pretty ok.
The Indian pasta was edible.
The rice was good.
The Buffett price is was to high ($13.99) for what you get
I wouldn't go back.
I didn't even want to pay for the food.
My total for 2 was $31.64 the guy stood there staring at the money and eventually came to the conclusion the out of $40 my change would be $6.

Address: 598 Ebby Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M Canada
Review: It was a whole empty area. It was dead I understand the point cause may be it was not the peak time. But it was dead in a sense that someone wouldn't wanna go and sit there to feel more lonely. Apart from that the food wasn't good enough to substitute with loneliness. We ordered 2 things from the menu. One of them was Naan with Shahi paneer they served in a to go tray like the subway stores have for dinning inside. Pretty bad experience.. It wasn't worth it. If you can see in the picture that's how they served the food.

Address: 598 Ebby Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M Canada
Review: Been waiting over 20 for a pickup. Yet the dining room had only 2 table. Very slow.

Address: 43 Sherbrook Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B1 Canada
Review:
The Nook Diner does not pretend to be anything fancy, it's an old school family restaurant where portion sizes are generous and the menu is straightforward: breakfast all day, a few salads, burgers and sandwiches.
We were a large group on father's day and food arrived at the same time, and at the correct temperature. We had blueberry pancakes, grilled cheese sandwich, eggs benedict, a cheese dog, the chili cheeseburger and two eggs breakfast. Food was good, coffee was okay, service was excellent.
If you want a no fuzz diner, The Nook is a place you can consider.

Address: 43 Sherbrook Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B1 Canada
Review:
I’ve been going to the Nook for over 15 years and it’s always been 5/5 local diner quality. Sadly it has gone waaay down hill the last few years.
Last few visits were so disappointing that I don’t think I’ll go again. The prices have more than doubled (I can understand some increased pricing due to inflation, but the quality has also gone way down) - and 20.00 for a Benedict felt excessive for a locally owned diner. More expensive than Stella’s or Clementine! For a humble diner! Portion sizes are smaller and there were what seemed to be eyelashes or small hairs on my plate and my partner’s plate (??) careless presentation. Very sad!!! I’m so sorry to leave this review but I’m just so disappointed.

Address: 43 Sherbrook Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B1 Canada
Review: Was my favourite and most reliable breakfast spot in WPG. Great staff. I’m all for price adjustments, but my go-to omelette went up by $5.50 last time I stopped in. Hard to justify an omelette for $17.50. Will miss this spot, thanks for years of good food at reasonable prices.

Address: 43 Sherbrook Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B1 Canada
Review: Food is fine, no frills good portion. But after tax and tip an omelette and coffee came to over $25 which is more than a breakfast at Frenchway Cafe, Stellas or Miss Browns.

Address: 43 Sherbrook Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B1 Canada
Review: Food and service was excellent, our server Jaiden was particularly friendly and super helpful. Four stars due to the rude manager with the black hair that sat in the corner and berated her staff. Super unprofessional of her to be openly mean to her staff who are working hard and doing well.

Address: 1038 St James Street Suite C1 Winnipeg, MB R3H 0K5 Canada
Review: Good amount of seating for dine in experience, however I got take out this time and food was amazing for a second visit.

Address: 1038 St James Street Suite C1 Winnipeg, MB R3H 0K5 Canada
Review: One of the best Shawarmas in north America. Their Saj is always fresh and tasty and the meat is perfect. I always enjoy their Shawarma when I am in town. I highly recommend!

Address: 1038 St James Street Suite C1 Winnipeg, MB R3H 0K5 Canada
Review: Delicious food, and the kindest staff. You can tell they love their food and value their customers. I've been eating here for years, and have never been disappointed! Highly recommend.

Address: 1038 St James Street Suite C1 Winnipeg, MB R3H 0K5 Canada
Review: Found this hidden gem on St. James St while visiting Winnipeg. Wonderful, healthy, tasty food. Really enjoyed the Falafel wrap my first visit. 2nd visit I ordered the chicken platter which was excellent.

Address: 1038 St James Street Suite C1 Winnipeg, MB R3H 0K5 Canada
Review: Great beef rice bowl and friendly staff. But the mango drink was not best recommend basil seed drink.

Address: 1697 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J9 Canada
Review: I’m happy to have dined at an Italian restaurant which has certificate of authenticity by government of Italy 🇮🇹! I ordered Gnocchi Al Tartufo but Gnocchi ran out so I got it substituted with Capellini. Then had a tiramisu. Finally tried a cappuccino with amaretto and topped it all off with a pistachio gelato. Cappuccino, gelato, wines were awesome, service was wonderful, ambience was spectacular (I sat outside, Al-fresco)!!! However the pasta dish and tiramisu were just okay, because the taste was bland! They mention the use of truffle oil but I could not smell it or taste it in the dish…moreover the tiramisu was dry and had a very subtle hint of espresso; so these dishes should have been flavourful for the appreciation!

Address: 1697 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J9 Canada
Review: Was here for a staff gathering during their regularly closed hours. We were able to eat and then play bocci ball on their courts which was super fun!  Service was perfect and the wine selection was great!  Very very helpful staff!  I’ve been her before and this just solidified my reasons for liking it. We had a buffet style meal which was really good and they looked after all the special diets in our group very nicely. I think this is a guaranteed great place to go if you want a nice evening out!

Address: 1697 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J9 Canada
Review:
The front of the house was totally disorganized. Our server was doing the best he could with his workload being half the restaurant. The owner was walking around oblivious to the patrons trying to catch her eye for help. When I finally stopped another woman working there asking questions about dessert she had no clue. Would I go back? Never. Was the food good? Absolutely. I think the young family who took the restaurant over from their retired parents need to keep their eye on their customers and stop walking around like we should be grateful we are allowed into their restaurant. And the gelato was so cold the flavour could not be determined, my partner’s gelato was filled with ice crystals.
Our bill for 2 was just under 200.00.
My opinion.

Update. I was not complaining about our server he was doing his best.  I was pointing out the owner never took the time to actually see what was happening in her restaurant. The two ladies at the table behind us who had different server were having the same issues.

Address: 1697 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J9 Canada
Review: Simply the best!! I bought their pizza kit!!!! It comes as you see on pictures, in a box, every ingredients separately!!! About the quality?? IMPRESSIVE!!!! All fresh!!!!!!! It is kit for you to open the dough!!!!!! The flavour of it is absolutely fantastic, you feel you are in Italy!!!! Price super fair! Worth every cent!

Address: 1697 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J9 Canada
Review:
I haven't been here in years....
The pizza was exceptional...
Sat on the patio..it was a perfect evening..
Mona Lisa is on my list to visit more often...
Well worth the trip...👍👍👍👍🥂

Address: 2169 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3J 0L7 Canada
Review: Great food. Excellent service. Good vibes. Both French Onion Soup and Clam Chowder are exceptional! Beef ribs is a bit spicy but tastes great. Kid menu offers lots of choices, and we particularly like the pasta – a bit under-seasoned for adults, but just right for kids or toddlers. The creamy crab dip with crostini (forgot the official name on menu) was a bit salty, but is still fine. Overall a great dining experience. Will definitely go again.

Address: 2169 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3J 0L7 Canada
Review: Lovely dinner on a saturday night at this restaurant.  The special included a half rack of ribs, chicken breast and prawns, your choice of carbohydrate - mashed potato, baked potato, fries or rice, plus vegetables and a salad or soup to start.  We had the mashed potatoes with gravy - was very creamy.  Started with a tossed salad- lots of salad dressings to choose from.  Fantastic flavours with this meal - the breading on the large prawns was crunchy and well seasoned.  Really enjoyed it.  BBQ sauce on the chicken and ribs was perfect.  Rib meat feel off the bone.  The chicken was fantastic.  Green beans were seasoned with a herb vinaigrette- was very nice.  The restaurant was very busy that night, but our server was attentive, friendly and helpful.  Great experience at this local restaurant.   Would definitely go there again.

Address: 2169 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3J 0L7 Canada
Review:
An old-school beef meat place.  If you're old enough to remember when "steak houses" were a thing you'll feel right at home.  If you're not, this place will make you wish you were sixty so you could have the memory of simple, generously-proportioned food served by smiling staff.

We had the ribs - bravely advertised as "the best ribs in town" - and were not disappointed.  Our small sample size precludes confirming they're the best ribs in Winnipeg, but brothers and sisters, they were EXCELLENT ribs - tangy, fall off the bone masterpiece work.  Lots of flavour, lots of volume.  Ribs are very rich.  Lots of tasty fat.  A few ribs are a LOT of ribs.  Show up hungry, don't fill up on the buns, and when the ribs show up tuck in like Fred Flintstone and go HARD.  Well worth the money.

Vegetarian options are, ha ha, ha HA HA HA HA "limited".  If you came to a rib place for the salads, you done messed up. :)

Address: 2169 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3J 0L7 Canada
Review: I joined my friends for an evening at the lounge, where we were greeted by an exceptional waitress. The ambiance transported me to a charming European bar, enhancing the overall experience. While the menu boasted an extensive selection, I found the prices to be slightly higher than my personal preference. Opting for the prime rib, I discovered that it fell short of the high standards I typically associate with renowned establishments like The Keg. This aspect was somewhat disappointing, particularly considering the comparable prices. However, I must emphasize that a lower price point would have greatly contributed to my overall satisfaction.

Address: 2169 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3J 0L7 Canada
Review:
Our party was 13 of us! Paid $40 for a 10 oz Steak, maybe 7 ounces! Potato was baked but had to wait way to long to get sour cream and butter! Potato was warm when I finally did get it! The Cesar salad was so small. I first thought it was a joke! I’m not even five bytes of salad and croutons were rockhard. I saw no value in this meal, there is no way there was maybe $8 dollars of food cost but the charge $40 dollars for it!
Not going back! And yes other meals were not good also! So it’s just not me!
It’s to bad because I thought it was going to be a great night out with all of my family!!

Address: 277 Rupert Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 0N5 Canada
Review: Met up with friends over lunch here and had great food with the great company. When we visited this place, it was operating in a more a la carte style than the cart style dim sum places I am more familiar with, but that didn't deter from how good and reasonably priced the food was (this visit was over a month ago).

Address: 277 Rupert Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 0N5 Canada
Review:
Went to sampo dim sum this morning and it was not really good. The shrimp rolls were very bad, the fried calamari were just a lot of fried batter…the only thing that was good was the beef balls and the pea tips in garlic. Turnip cake was mushy and the eggplant was also not so good… I wouldn’t go again I prefer by far Kumkoon…
It was also so silent with zero ambiance and the service was also bad and you have to order with a menu for dim sum..

Address: 277 Rupert Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 0N5 Canada
Review: We got to this place when it just opened at 11am and it got busy real quick on a Tuesday too. Parking was free right next to building so that was good. Service was quick and good. Dim sum was good, but only thing they didn't have was the chili sauce we get in US.

Address: 277 Rupert Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 0N5 Canada
Review: Very tasty dimsums! And service was also good. It was a bit dirty on the table and on the floor. But food is delicious.

Address: 277 Rupert Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 0N5 Canada
Review:
My family and I frequent here often, and it is often a good experience. There were four of us and we asked if we could sit at a table that seats 6 as we order lots. There was a family of 3 sitting at a 10 person table.
The employee told us that with a rude expression on her face that it was reserved.
She then returned to give us our plates, utensils etc. and we  showed our order. We asked again if we could move because we were sitting in a tight corner table, and we ordered a lot of food. She rolled her eyes and walked away.

We sat at the new table. Our ordersheet was full and the two employees looked at us and mumbled something and walked away. They passed by us a few times, and have not asked for our order sheet. It was the first that I can recall experiencing a negative experience here as we have been regulars since the 90s. We walked out and went to Dim Sum Garden across the street. Way better service and and treatment from the get go.

Address: 155 Scurfield Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1L6 Canada
Review: First breakfast experience in Canada and it was great.! We went mid week so it wasn’t busy. The service was friendly and helpful. It was hard to choose what to have but I landed on the Banana & Chocolate crepe which was like a 3 course meal in one..! Crispy bacon with added maple syrup, eggs, sausage and potato. Then the highlight of the dish being the banana and chocolate filled crepe. This made my stomach very happy lol. Just a note.. I ordered a coffee. I am used to ordering a large in Australia so went for the “bowl” which was the larger of the 2 sizes. They aren’t wrong. It is a bowl of coffee..! Just be thirsty.. Thanks for a great experience. Will be back next time I’m back in Winnipeg.

Address: 155 Scurfield Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1L6 Canada
Review:
This was our first time here and it was easily the best breakfast place we've tried in Winnipeg and maybe anywhere (we've traveled around the world). We enjoyed this more than The Original Pancake House and IHOP in Winnipeg. Also better than Denny's and Smitty's. We haven't tried other breakfast places in Winnipeg. TOPH and IHOP have this beat hugely in terms of atmosphere and decor, but not in food IMHO.

Our server was very busy as someone had called in sick, but she was lovely and attentive. We were there during the Saturday breakfast rush (9am) but easily found seating for 4 and our food came out incredibly quick.

My meal (the first picture) was sooooo delicious and unique. The Old-fashioned Ham & Cheese Curds Skillet. It was described as: "Shredded old-fashioned ham, mixed peppers, red onions and cheese curds. Covered with a mix of Hollandaise sauce and pure maple syrup."

Ohhh it was good. Not remotely healthy but fun for every now and then. Our entire party thoroughly enjoyed their meals and we will return.

Address: 155 Scurfield Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1L6 Canada
Review: My first time visiting Ben & Florentine on Kenaston.  The service was awesome, the breakfast options varied and delicious, spacious and clean environment and very good covid measures in place.  The only thing I would have liked was if my coffee was served in a tea mug that was warm because hot coffee in a cold mug makes your coffee cold before two sips.  Prices for breakfast items range between $12.95 to 17.95 approximately.

Address: 155 Scurfield Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1L6 Canada
Review:
My sister and I were not impressed by the cleanliness of the food we were serviced. (Both were on our cantaloupes and eggs).

This has not happened to me before and I have been coming to this location often. Not entirely sure if it is someone’s dog hair or  improper wear of hair nets.

I don’t recommended to go to this location.

Address: 155 Scurfield Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1L6 Canada
Review: Incredible eggs benedict! They have many different options to choose from. Their hollandaise sauce is spot on. Their BBQ version is slightly spicy with with meaty toppings. I wasn’t a huge fan of the goat cheese but it went well with the rest of the flavours. Their eggs Benedict also comes with a good portion of hash browns and fruit. I ordered a side of Crispy French Toast & Caramelized Apples which was very large. The topping was like apple pie filling with almonds. Very tasty… Their service great as well. Server was very attentive and polite. We also preferred a booth and appreciate how they made that happen. Will definitely be going back!

Address: 500 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0P1 Canada
Review:
The food was the highlight of the experience, whereas some of the servers seemed to be new to the serving world, but were kind all the same.  One can simply tell when there is an experienced server vs when they're new; we found ourselves waiting for things like water refills and more drinks.
They also didn't have garlic bread available.. which I found almost shocking.    It's like a restaurant staple.. how do you not serve garlic bread?
In any case, the food wait was to be expected, and well worth it;  my partner and I absolutely loved the bruschetta, I had a cup of French onion soup, the steak sandwich and he had one of their burgers, all of which was absolutely fantastic.

During another visit, I tried their chicken tenders which are easily the best I have ever had.  And their parmesan fries are delectable.

Address: 500 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0P1 Canada
Review: We had Abby as our server. A wonderful young lady was a pleasure for my wife and I to spend some time with her. The Fish and Chips and Sangria we're wonderful. Will be back again. Great atmosphere as also

Address: 500 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0P1 Canada
Review: Food was great, I had tacos and my friend chicken finger (portion was a good size). Service was fine, fairly quick as well. I think I like interior better before the renovation, unfortunately it lost the vibe and looks more like a bistro now. I think the wall behind the bar was making the space look bigger. Anyhow, good location, enough parking and good food, so what else one needs? :)

Address: 500 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0P1 Canada
Review: Chicken Parm sandwich.  Delicious!  Great suggestion by my server.   I came in about 7:30 and the bar staff spent more time talking to co-workers who were getting off shift than checking back with me, my meal, and drink.  All good though, overall very good meal, chill vibe.  I'd come back.  I'm sure service is usually good.

Address: 500 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0P1 Canada
Review: Most of the time we go places not just for foods but also because of people...:)) Good Service! All servers are all friendly, smiling and asking if there is anything they can offer ..:) I came there to decorate but since Im with the kids needed to order some foods... 👌👌👌👌⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Address: 1101 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X3 Canada
Review: I haven’t been here in probably close to 20 years. Will not be waiting that long to go again, it’s fantastic!! The food is delicious. Prices are very reasonable with large portions. Our food came out very fast and it was hot and fresh upon arrival. Friendly staff and busy right up to closing. Go early, they close at 2 pm. I can’t wait to go back again. The yam hash mix with the Vegan Heaven Breakfast is to die for!!

Address: 1101 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X3 Canada
Review: I didn't enjoy the food (some were greasy and salty, some were too dried) but they did give really good portions for the price. Staffs are nice and fast. This is a small family-owned restaurant so I might give them another chance to support their business and if you never try, you should come and give them a chance, I didn't like their food but you might still like it.

Address: 1101 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X3 Canada
Review: I have visited Falafel Place on two occasions and thoroughly enjoyed my breakfast. For a lighter fare, I suggest trying the cheese blintzes. On my second visit, I was a little more hungry and tackled the salami mix. Oh the salami was delicious. Attentive service on both occasions with pretty quick service even when busy. Busy place so you may have to wait (well worth it) Definitely recommend

Address: 1101 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X3 Canada
Review:
Food was fantastic.  Glasses were dirty and the clean replacements didn't smell that great. 5 for food, 1 for cleanliness.

Update. Went again after a long hiatus. It was much cleaner this time, the food was still amazing, but the wait time to get the food was really pronounced. I'd say the 3* rating holds. Food is still a 5 tho, if you've got the time! The breakfast brisket is divine.

Address: 1101 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X3 Canada
Review:
“It was okay.” Was the consensus for each of our party for breakfast. I like that it’s local. Potato Pancakes are great as is the house hot sauce.
Welcome Service is good but turned mediocre after food arrived. Coffee cups are very small- only got a half-cup refill and they never came back or checked in after food arrived.
Eggs and bacon were blackened- presumably from a dirty grill with burned grease. Bacon was very dried out. Almost as if it were precooked and put back on the grill. Falafel Balls were good but are much smaller than their early days.
Water tastes odd-like well water. No ice.
They don’t give you an itemized receipt-only the total owed at the til.

Address: 30-2583 Pembina hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T Canada
Review:
Second time here and came based off a recommendation. The ramen itself- spicy fried chicken ramen 4.5/5 (was good and spicy!!, the fried chicken was good but obviously gets soggy really quickly) and 5/5 for the black garlic tonkatsu. We got seated very quickly, and service was good but we never did get our waters refilled- it was fairly busy but we ended up calling them over several times near the end- nothing horrible but I think filling of water should be expected. Takoyaki was very good and served quickly.

Sushi is pretty pricey but looked well made!

However, we would probably come back on a Tuesday because they have specials where ramen is 12.95!

Address: 30-2583 Pembina hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T Canada
Review: Fabulous hangover cure. As you can see I completely devoured my bowl of Raman. Broth was great.  The pork was was ok. But I’m not complaining. The chicken was tender and juicy. The egg was not the right Color but still tasted great.

Address: 30-2583 Pembina hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T Canada
Review: I got the Tonkatsu ramen and spicy salmon roll. I loved the pork slices, but the rest wasn't anything to write home about. Loved the service and overall atmosphere though!

Address: 30-2583 Pembina hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T Canada
Review: June 28th, 2023. Ordered Black Gatlic Tonkostu Ramen, salmon Sashimi, white Dragon Roll. The food was fresh and very tasty. Would recommend this place. Priced a bit high but worth it.

Address: 30-2583 Pembina hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T Canada
Review:
Ordered the Tiger Roll and Smoked Salmon roll.

It was a fairly slow day, service was very quick and I had my food within 5 minutes of ordering it.

The Tiger Roll was amazing, a must have if you order.

Address: 238 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2T3 Canada
Review:
Everything I had was so good with good price. I had Pharaoh's Vacation and Opera cake. The plate is so filling and filled with loads of veggies!  Hummus was little bit salty but it perfectly matched with eggs and garlic bread.

Opera cake was beyond my expectations! I thought it would be too sweet  to me but it had perfect balance of sweetness and bitterness. And it was so creamy!

I got raspberry cheese brownie for my kids, they loved it too.
I would definitely go back again as I would love to try out crepes, croissant and more.

Staff are so friendly and approachable :)

Address: 238 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2T3 Canada
Review:
I went for the first time in November, then went back three days later to order the exact same meal because I could NOT stop thinking about how delicious it was. Everything I’ve tried since has been incredible!

The staff I’ve engaged with have all been so lovely and friendly, even when they’re incredibly busy. The sweets and pastries are fantastic and it’s so fun to look at them all in the display at the counter!

I love the variety of art that’s on display, and for sale!! It’s very fun to look at the pieces while enjoying your meal, it all felt creative and interesting. Lots of good conversation pieces, I really loved that aspect of the physical space itself.

They also collect donations for local women’s centres (or possibly women’s shelters specifically, I can’t remember). I asked someone behind the counter about where the donations go since they didn’t have a specific location listed, and they explained that they distribute donations to several resources in the area. It’s great to see a local business taking that initiative and very cool that staff are engaged with it enough that they can answer questions and have a conversation about it, I really appreciated that.

Can’t wait to go back again soon!

Address: 238 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2T3 Canada
