Review: Cute little cafe just off Corydon. There was lots of seating and parking right beside the building. I tried the Spec-taco-lar burger (bean burger) which was really good. The combination of flavors worked well. I also tried the fruit tart which was okay, but the tart shell was overcooked and hard. Definitely would come back here to grab a bite and coffee with a friend.

Address: 238 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2T3 Canada
Review: We come here regularly and the food is consistently delicious. I think they also have the best croissants in town. The staff is wonderful. There is something special about this place. If you haven’t been, you’re missing out!

Address: 238 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2T3 Canada
Review:
I love the food here, but I wouldn't describe the dine-in experience as welcoming or friendly.

For example, when I walked in with a friend today, there were at least three people working the front with no customers in line, and they didn't even glance at us. Unsure what to do, we decided to wait by the entrance to check out the hot menu (the only signage posted by the entrance). When my friend I were finally acknowledged, it was to tersely inform us that the kitchen was closed. We chose to eat elsewhere.

Address: 1270 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B1 Canada
Review: We went there to see some good photos and reviews to try their Kimchi fried rice and udon. But we were very disappointed with the taste, quantity and the price but the atmosphere and the staff was very good and polite. Wasn’t happy with their food taste and quantity at all. We also ordered Sushi (which was so good), but spent $50 with tips on those foods wasn’t a great choice for us to do as we were very hungry after the day of hiking.

Address: 1270 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B1 Canada
Review: Always enjoy coming to eat here at kimichi. Foor is good and service is great. No complaints from me. We ordered sushi and boku boku. It was delicious

Address: 1270 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B1 Canada
Review: Visited on a whim as I was walking back to my hotel. I was alone and got seated in a totally separate room from all of the other diners and in the corner, it was fine but I just thought it was a bit strange. My “19oz” draft pint as stated on the menu was more like a sad 12oz. I ordered the sashimi salad and some steamed rice. “Assorted” sashimi is a stretch when you only include 2 kinds of fish. The amount of fish was disappointing. It looked like they took 2 pieces of sashimi MAX, and cut them into tiny cubes and spread them out all over the salad. Flavour was good, but the salad was merely empty, nothing but spring mix, dressing, the sad portion of fish, and a few pieces of cubed mango that was starting to go bad. Dumping my entire bowl of rice on the salad honestly saved it. However, the server was excellent and he was very polite, he did ask if I enjoyed the food and everything was ok. Which again, the flavour was good, and honestly I hadn’t eaten all day so I wasn’t going to complain about something I finished. But I do think the portion of fish was sad.

Address: 1270 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B1 Canada
Review: Located on Pembina near Jubilee, this sushi place has quite an easy excess with tons of parking spots. The interior is beautiful and has dividers between tables to give you more private dining experience. The menu is really big and has quite a lot of selections for fish and rolls. Also has specialty section and korean food. We didn't get to try to Korean food but the sushi we ordered was very fresh and delicious. They serve fresh oysters here as well which were amazing! Definitely order a house hot sake!!

Address: 1270 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B1 Canada
Review: Great place to mellow down and have some good soul food. Had some noodles with Korean Fried Chicken. Will definitely knock you out when you get home. Just overall great dishes

Address: 350 St Mary Ave Winnipeg, MB R3C 3J2 Canada
Review: Went here for dinner once while I was staying at the Delta and it was not bad. I feel like my expectations for the food was higher based on the pictures. The pie flight I ordered was good, but not really spectacular. We also ordered a side of the meatballs wrapped in puff pastry and they were a bit on the bland side for my taste. It looked like it was missing parsley or some sort of garnish based on one other picture I saw. I do like the underground, British decor and the service was pretty average. Convenient place to get food if you're staying at the hotel though.

Address: 350 St Mary Ave Winnipeg, MB R3C 3J2 Canada
Review: Oh My Gosh!! This place is so awesome! The food was out of this world! Truly a slice of England landed in Manitoba! The Most Delicious meal ever! The service was brilliant!

Address: 350 St Mary Ave Winnipeg, MB R3C 3J2 Canada
Review:
This was the first restaurant I ate at when I visited Winnipeg. I stayed at the Delta Hotel Marriott and I liked the convenience that it was right next door to the hotel.

[VIBE]
The vibe of the pub was a British underground space and pretty spacious at the time I went, which was late dinner.
[SERVICE]
A little slow and not busy at all. I went late evening so there weren't many servers around that time.
[FOOD]
The Sunday Roast - Turned out to be a huge meal for one. It came with a puff pastry on top, mash, long beans and cooked carrots, and some thin slices of roast beef. It wasn't bad for the price point!

Mini-Sausage Rolls - This one was probably my favorite. It seemed to have missed it's garnish in another review I saw, but other than that, it was the sauce which made it tasty. It came with a chutney like sweet sauce to dip the rolls in. It had a decent portion to share between 2-3 people.

The Wee Pie Flight - This was small enough to taste test each of the savory pies, but I didn't find anything too special with them.

Overall, food was not bad for a late night snack or meal! I would go again just for the sausage rolls. I found them addicting.

IG: missasia.pattyc

Address: 350 St Mary Ave Winnipeg, MB R3C 3J2 Canada
Review:
I heard that Honey Dill sauce is unique to Manitoba so I had to try it out.....
I just came in for an after work conference glass of wine. JUST made it in time to order a happy hour glass of wine. Happy hour is until 6:00 pm unlike BC.Thank you Braydon for the quick pleasant service. Back to the honey dill sauce... it was sweet, tasty with just the right creaminess. Definitely a great pairing with salty fries (peal on) or chicken strips! Thank you Braydon for providing me with a unique Manitoba experience!

Address: 350 St Mary Ave Winnipeg, MB R3C 3J2 Canada
Review: Lovely laid back atmosphere, grate music and with excellent friendly staff. Definitely a place to try and will be going back soon.

Address: 100 King Street Unit A Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review: Love this place, love sushi burritos. Delicious every time! I wish they didn’t close at 7, it’s a big early but that’s okay.

Address: 100 King Street Unit A Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
I’ve eaten by delivery a handful of times. This is some of the best quick food I’ve had in Winnipeg. Tastes fresh, and the service is very good. I always get a sushi burrito. (I will note that sometimes it can taste a bit bland) They recently called me on my last order in regards to the gluten allergy I noted. Makes me feel safe to eat the food they make!!
Thank you Chosabi!

Address: 100 King Street Unit A Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review: I used to eat here all the time I loved the family that worked here. Not very happy how things were handled and they flat out lied to me on the phone saying they washed their vegetables but feel free to look at the picture below. There is still the sticker on the red pepper which has just been cut into slices and served into my bowl. Not only does that mean they didn't take the plastic sticker off but they probably didn't wash their vegetables. Sadly I can't find the remainder of the sticker which means I probably ate it....

Address: 100 King Street Unit A Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review: similar to other Chosabis with limited menu but you can build you own bowl. great service.

Address: 100 King Street Unit A Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
Best date night take-out on your way to the movies.
Grab a sushi burrito on your way to the theater; you're full all evening.

I always get the Happy Buddha, my partner loves the California Sumo on brown rice.

Address: 1045 St James Street Unit - K Winnipeg, MB R3H Canada
Review:
Took my family of 5 plus 3 others here for a dinner, and oh boy was it ever delicious! They have lots of rolls to choose from (as well as non sushi options if that's your thing). Everything was fairly priced and super fresh.
They have something for everyone! Highly recommend checking them out, you won't regret it 😉 👌

Address: 1045 St James Street Unit - K Winnipeg, MB R3H Canada
Review:
Delicious flavors at a reasonable price, the service time is acceptable and the attention is very good.

Definitely goes on my favorites list and we will be back soon

Address: 1045 St James Street Unit - K Winnipeg, MB R3H Canada
Review: Ordered after reading the good reviews and unfortunately it was the worst sushi I’ve ever had in my life…The rice was crispy either not well cooked or old one of the two. The rolls were not properly rolled and would break every time we tried to eat. The shrimp had shell residues in the roll… the soya came in small bag packs and was so salty non edible. The ginger tasted like plastic, not exaggerating. I do not recommend for take-out.

Address: 1045 St James Street Unit - K Winnipeg, MB R3H Canada
Review: Sushi is fairly priced. Tastes delicious. It has always been busy when we came to visit but service is prompt.

Address: 1045 St James Street Unit - K Winnipeg, MB R3H Canada
Review: Got in early so it wasn't very busy. By the time we left there was a lineup. Great service. Food was very well prepared and presented. The "Veggie Caterpillar" was extremely cute.

Address: 100 King Street Unit D Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
On road trips I try to sample local sandwich shops.

This one came highly recommended per reviews. Originally wanted to try Hoagie Boyz but they were closed on Monday. I’m glad they were because I would’ve missed out on one of the best places I’ve been to. I couldn’t decide which sandwich to get and I saw them putting the cheese sauce on a sandwich they were making for someone else. Can’t say no to cheese sauce. That turned out to be the Philly sandwich! I was intrigued by the smoked Buffalo chicken so I got both. One for lunch one for later.

Exceptional flavour. The bread was so soft and fresh. Unbelievable. A little pricy but you get what you pay for. I opted for their jalapeño Mac n cheese. It was alright. Their coleslaw was outta world. Hella fresh and packed with flavour. When I’m in Winnipeg again I’m definitely stopping by again.

Address: 100 King Street Unit D Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
$15 for a small sandwich? OK better be the best sandwich ever... Sadly, it was not.
King + Bannatyne has limited menu options and it's over-priced. I got the roast sweet potato + hummus— disappointing. They didn't make it properly.
Really good customer service though!!

Address: 100 King Street Unit D Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review: Brisket Sammich was weak on meat (but tasty). Tomato soup was good. You can use all that extra bread for dunking. Staff courteous but not overly helpful. Pricey.

Address: 100 King Street Unit D Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
The atmosphere is great. The bread to filling ratio of the sandwich is not. Too much bread not enough meat/veggies especially considering the price. Side potato salad was good.

They don't serve their sandwiches on plates. This leads to quite a mess as you eat since the fixings fall/roll right off the boards. Not ideal when you need to look professional after lunch.

Address: 100 King Street Unit D Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
Great staff and great sandwich.
Didn’t have their regular sandwich bread avail so they made mine on a Kaiser bun and it was still so so good.
Highly recommend the Carolina bbq sandwich. Each sando approx $16, all sides extra.

September 2022

Address: 248 Avenue de la Cathedrale Winnipeg, MB R2H 2V9 Canada
Review: Very cute, little place. Tried a corned beef sandwich and a tart? with Earl Grey tea( I don't remember the name of that dessert, but, it was so yummy!

Address: 248 Avenue de la Cathedrale Winnipeg, MB R2H 2V9 Canada
Review: I happened upon this bakery by accident as I was walking my dog. As I passed, I saw the place was full of people. The next morning on my walk, I stopped by to see what the hype was about… and now I know. Exceptional service, beautiful looking and tasting pastries. Next time, I am visiting Winnipeg, this place will be one that I stop by again.

Address: 248 Avenue de la Cathedrale Winnipeg, MB R2H 2V9 Canada
Review:
Service was great but the amount of chocolate in the chocolate croissant is unreal.
Why was the chocolate croissant so low on chocolate?
I will make sure to drive to **à l'épic de blé** next time to get my chocolate croissante at least there i know i will get what i paid for.
Very disappointed

Address: 248 Avenue de la Cathedrale Winnipeg, MB R2H 2V9 Canada
Review: Great little French bakery in the heart of St Boniface. Great selection of tasty treats and make sure to try the bread pudding and strawberry croissant!

Address: 248 Avenue de la Cathedrale Winnipeg, MB R2H 2V9 Canada
Review: Great desserts as always. Was there at a busy time but the line moved quickly and the staff were friendly.

Address: 230 Dalhousie Drive Winnipeg, MB R3T 2Z1 Canada
Review: Wow this place is insane. $14 for a dish you should know the quantity of food you pay for.  What a scam! I won’t be going back and I strongly do not recommended anyone to support this place.  I phoned in and spoke with the owner regarding to the food portion we paid for, wow the owner admit their portion is small and this is how it is she said. ZERO star for this place. SCAM!!!

Address: 230 Dalhousie Drive Winnipeg, MB R3T 2Z1 Canada
Review:
Very good Taiwanese food.
My families favorites are the sour cabbage and pork noodle soup and the shrimp pancake?
I don't know if that's it's name because they just order it when we go. I didn't look at the menu.

They also have bubble tea. In the past they did not use a powder and used real whipping cream, which made it stand out for me.

Address: 230 Dalhousie Drive Winnipeg, MB R3T 2Z1 Canada
Review: The food was so tasteless and soupy. We ordered a stir vegetables and stir fried lamb with cumin&onions. Looks like the vegetables was boiled and put in some stock and the lamb was boiled and sautéed with onions in a stock!! Food portion is very small as well. We called to let them know and the owner just said they are sorry! Really bad experience overall!!!!

Address: 230 Dalhousie Drive Winnipeg, MB R3T 2Z1 Canada
Review: If it’s available, I will choose 0. They made the worst Chinese food which I experienced before.

Address: 230 Dalhousie Drive Winnipeg, MB R3T 2Z1 Canada
Review: Food are good but service could be better

Address: 660 Osborne Street Unit 4 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B6 Canada
Review: Love this place! Don’t know why we haven’t gone more often. I had the Cauliflower Pakora Burger with Fries and it was DELICIOUS! Smashing it before eating is a must, it’s huge and messy but worth it. We all LOVED our meals and we can’t wait to go back and try more menu items. Oh and the cake… homemade that day and YUM! HIGHly recommend getting dessert.

Address: 660 Osborne Street Unit 4 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B6 Canada
Review: The Oakwood has a breakfast/brunch/dinner dish for an array of tastes. Family Easter brunch for eight was easily accommodated (no one wanted to cook 😂). we had our stretchy pants on and were looking forward to the eats from others who highly recommended Oakwood. Our table had the Crown burger with fries, Feta, Tomato and Avo eggs benny, chicken chorizo waffles, French toast patty melt and bacon and eggs breakfast. All plates demolished! Delicious and large portions. Coffee was really good I think it is Bob Marley Blue Mountain. Not sure why it took me forever to eat here. Must add to your casual diner eats list. Most definitely will be back. Licensed, with mimosas or breakfast beers if that tickles your fancy. They also sell pre-made meals to go.

Address: 660 Osborne Street Unit 4 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B6 Canada
Review:
Really great place! The servers are great and the menu has lots to choose from. My boyfriend and I got the Salmon dill benny and Johan’s club. I was expecting to taste a bit more of the dill in the dill hollandaise but other than that, it’s a solid benny. My boyfriend said the club was solid too.

Will be back to try other stuff in the future!

Address: 660 Osborne Street Unit 4 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B6 Canada
Review: The food here was excellent. I was very happy with the portion size as well. The servers were friendly and fast. The inside was clean and felt spacious considering its size. I felt it was moderately priced, especially considering the quality and quantity of food I received. I would most definitely go here again and recommend it to friends. I look forward to trying more of the menu. 😎

Address: 660 Osborne Street Unit 4 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B6 Canada
Review: Friendly and quick service. Decent selection of items to order. Reasonably priced.

Address: 404 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0B8 Canada
Review:
Great Neapolitan style pizza. Bright and modernly designed dinning room. Seating at the bar, pizza bar, window, and patio. We had the Don which was all meat no veg (husband staple) and the Rustica (no meat all veg). They have about 4 vegetarian pizza options but you can always omit the meat on any pizza. Beer menu is small (sorry beer lovers), cocktail menu had about 8 options, with a focus an a larger wine menu.
If you have a love for the za and want an upscale pizza dinning experience. This would be your jam. Highly recommend making a rezo during prime time.

Address: 404 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0B8 Canada
Review: Amazing spot for lunch. Great menu, great staff in a professional and modern setting. We were seated as a large group in the private room and it was perfect.  Downstairs, quiet and with a great feel and style.  The menu had the usual goodies like meatballs, caprese salad and the incredible mushroom risotto!

Address: 404 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0B8 Canada
Review: Had our team holiday dinner here and super glad we picked this spot to try out. We got a few items to share, starting with the caesar salad and following with 3 pizzas: The Don, Margherita and Pollo Dolce. All delicious and fresh! We were very pleased at how quick and friendly the service was. Looking forward to coming back and trying out the rest of the menu!

Address: 404 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0B8 Canada
Review: Oh my the pizza here is to die for! We had the Lucia and the combination of flavors is incredible. Kudos to whoever thought that one up!👏

Address: 404 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0B8 Canada
Review:
This is an awesome destination restaurant!  My siblings and I from across Canada met here for a reunion meal and loved it.  Great food and wine and dessert!  And great and friendly service.

I had one of my best-ever Caesar salads!  And the Margherita pizza was very tasty ..... and straight from the wood-burning pizza ovens.

And of course we had a few bottles of red wine from their terrific wine list.

Although the prices are a smidge higher, the delicious meal and ambience are well worth the cost.

This restaurant is wheel-chair accessible and has a great outdoor patio.  It is also LGBTQ friendly.

Try it!  You will like it!

Address: 1235 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2A9 Canada
Review: Wonderful little sushi shop! Super kind staff, wonderfully decorated interior, and incredible service. Was faster than any fast food place I've been too, and much healthier. I would absolutely recommend them if you need some quick, tasty sushi, or a place to sit down and hang out for a minute with some great ambiance.

Address: 1235 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2A9 Canada
Review: I have been ordering from here for years. It’s always so fresh and so delicious. Service is great. Definitely recommend.

Address: 1235 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2A9 Canada
Review: I ordered medium sushi party tray first time. Processing time was fast. The sushi was delicious. Combination of sushi mix is just right for family(with child). I am so happy to find out this nice sushi take out place in Winnipeg. Staffs are also very friendly. If you want to taste decent quality of sushi with good price in winnipeg, this is the right place. Additionally, Fried spring rolls were exceptionally crisp and warm!

Address: 1235 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2A9 Canada
Review: Kind of average sushi flavor.  It’s what you get everywhere. The rice was flavorless and the fish was not great.  I am not in love. Very average and can’t eat inside. Not worth it.

Address: 1235 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2A9 Canada
Review: I came here for dinner and ordered Alaska roll, shrimp tempura roll, and salmon sashimi. I opened the box and had them immediately when I return to my car. As a sushi chef who had 2 years experience, I would say the experience is good(compare to the price). I feel everything I ordered worth the money I paid(except the miso soup). If you are looking for a sushi place where you spent little but can get a good portion of sushi(the quality is above the average), maybe give it try. Suggestion: removing the tail crust of shrimp when you guys make the shrimp tempura roll. I know it looks good but uneatable.

Address: 159 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y7 Canada
Review:
The go-to place in Winnipeg for sushi. The Naru Roll is the best sushi roll I've ever eaten. Creamy house sauce, fish eggs, crispy pawn. YUM.
The sushi boats are highly recommended for shareables. The nigiri is fresh and tasty. Cheap drinks are the cherry on top. Service is fast. Highly recommend.

Address: 159 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y7 Canada
Review: Top 3 in Winnipeg! Atmosphere is great and the sushi is very high quality, fresh and fairly priced. Their service is also excellent, my friend and I can’t eat mirin, and they made a batch of rice for us without it so we can eat as well.

Address: 159 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y7 Canada
Review: Dinner for two platter was amazing. It comes with a fantastic variety of rolls. The rolls are have lots of filling compared to the amount of rice which is very enjoyable.

Address: 159 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y7 Canada
Review: This used to one of my favorite sushi places in Osborne village. In the last 5 years, it has gone downhill and tonight was my final visit. Do not waste your time eating their less than fresh fish and dealing with the alarmingly rude staff. Walk 5 minutes away to Akindo Sushi bistro where you will have the most delicious food and kind servers. Zero stars.

Address: 159 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y7 Canada
Review: Naru sushi had very fresh sashimi and great rolls that were big in size without too much rice in the rolls. We ordered the medium sushi boat which ended up being too much food for three people.

Address: 270 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0L4 Canada
Review:
What a cool experience!
We did the upstairs dining area where it’s all you can eat.  Basically you order sides (I loved the cheese balls), and then someone comes around with a giant skewer of meat and offers it to you. As long as your card is green they’ll keep coming with various cuts on repeat. Turn your card to red when you need a break or are done. Flip as desired.
The meat was cooked to perfection and I honestly enjoyed it so much.
You get some pretty tasty dipping sauces to try as well.
For dessert I tried the cheesecake and I did not like that- it tasted like coconut but was supposed to be berry?

Expensive but for the unique experience and food quality, it was fun and worth it.

Address: 270 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0L4 Canada
Review:
The food was so good. I even got to try lamb for the first time, and it was really good. Only draw back is because of the open ceiling concept it makes voices travel a lot . It was hard at times to carry a conversation because of the echoing of the dining area, and the restaurant wasn't that busy.
Prices are a tad high, $14.00 for drink. The meal ranges from $49.00 - $70.00 per person. Did give a senior discount, which was nice.
It's an experience for some special fine dining.
Once again, awesome service and staff.

Address: 270 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0L4 Canada
Review: If you`re a hungry carnivore, then this is the dinner place for you! Tons of meat selections that are brought and carved at your table. Lots of sides to choose from. Did find the food quite salty, but the accompanying drinks were delightful! You need to try the one in the pineapple. The price for the dinner all you can eat is a little steep, but definitely an experience you should have if you`re going anyway. There is a separate menu for downstairs that includes individual items.

Address: 270 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0L4 Canada
Review:
All I can say is wow... come hungry, wear a loose pair of pants and be ready for a taste of heaven.
The food is excellent, the staff are friendly.

Let me add... Gordon Ramsey would be seriously proud with this place... they wiped down every nook and cranny including the ventilation!

A+

Address: 270 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0L4 Canada
Review: WOW! Epic food and even more epic service. Great ambience. The lounge is the perfect place to watch the game, enjoy great eats and a solid selection of local IPAs. Highly recommended. #supportlocalwinnipeg #localgood2go #greateats

Address: 386 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2J2 Canada
Review: Date night with the hubby and stopped at Yellow Dog Tavern as we were driving around. Delicious food, super nice staff, great night!

Address: 386 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2J2 Canada
Review: A classic downtown pub. Food was all homemade and delicious. Server was fun and efficient. She even looked up ingredients in their home cookbook for us. Service speed was moderate but we felt very welcome in our large group. I will definitely be going back.

Address: 386 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2J2 Canada
Review: Love this spot. Ordered an ok Cesar and a messy nacho plater with out spoons or forks but the staff were awesome and upbeat. It was hopping

Address: 386 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2J2 Canada
Review: This bison burger has ruined all other burgers for me. I will be thinking about it for the rest of my life. Absolutely amazing. This was my second visit and both times the food and drinks have been amazing.

Address: 386 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2J2 Canada
Review: Great customer service. The food is awesome, the perogies and garlic sausage are the best! Good prices and great selection on tap!

Address: 157 Provencher Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2H 0G2 Canada
Review: Would love to give this place 5 stars because it's so cute inside, but the karaage don was good, not amazing. I would still go here again though to try other stuff on the menu. They have really cool ideas for drinks. I love the Zelda themed drinks, they were adorable. But there was a mix up when I tried to order the apricot Zelda drink. On the online menu it was red, but when I received it, the drink was blue which caused some confusion, hopefully that gets fixed in their menu. Overall I enjoyed my visit here.

Address: 157 Provencher Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2H 0G2 Canada
Review:
Great Japanese food in St Boniface with a cute gift shop above.

The menu is extensive with many different Japanese plates to choose from. We had the Green Onion & Sesame Sauce Takoyaki, Spicy Chicken Katsu Yakisoba, and Teriyaki Mayo Karaage Don. The highlight was the spicy chicken katsu, the sauce was excellent and the breading was just the right amount of crispy.

The portion sizes were large and ended up taking enough home another full meal. The prices were affordable, especially given the amount of food. For two people, it would be reasonable to share one appetizer and one main dish.

The staff were very friendly and the food was served impressively fast. The decor is an eclectic mix and the furniture was a bit uncomfortable; however, this was not an issue. We enjoyed taking a walk through the gift shop upstairs after our dinner.

We look forward to returning to Dwarf no Cachette to try more of their menu, including their ramen and okinomoyaki. Based on our first experience, we recommend it!

Address: 157 Provencher Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2H 0G2 Canada
Review:
I visited this restaurant by a recommendation for Japanese Izakaya food. There were about 10 of us and was pleasantly surprised that they had room when we showed up at around 6-7pm. I made sure to call beforehand though just in case.

[VIBE]
It's a cute and quirky little restaurant featuring gnomes and dwarf decor arrangements. It was cozy inside and on the top floor, there was a local gift shop. The shop sold cute little knick-knacks from handmade jewelry, pins, to anime buttons and stickers.

[SERVICE]
The service was pretty good for having to deal with all 10 of us and we didn't have to wait too long to get seated. The only downfall was that one of the drinks we ordered didn't quite match up to the description of the menu on their website we ordered from. Some of the food items or specials on the website were not on the menu either but were still available to order.

[FOOD]
What we were intentionally drawn with by choosing to eat at this restaurant were the playful drinks. The Zelda themed drinks were fun and we would have no idea about these drinks if not for checking the website.

Onigiri Combo (Takoyaki) - 3 choices of onigiri which I chose 1.tuna mayo, 2. karage, 3. shrimp tempura and it came with a miso soup and 6 pieces of regular takoyaki. The onigiris were HUGE and I ended up only being able to finish one and taking the rest home to go. The takoyaki came out with floating pieces of the bonito flakes waving in the air, as expected. The miso soup was very rich in flavor and I don't think I ever had sesame in miso soup before.

[DRINKS]
Milkshake Shingen-mochi with Black Sugar Syrup - This drink is very delicious and sweet with the black sugar syrup and chewy mochis.

Master Sword - Cold sake, Calpico, and club soda mix with a master sword iced jelly. The master sword jelly gets floppy pretty quickly when left out too long, so it's best to take the pics quick and then stir the drink with the master sword.

Hearty Elixir - Peach Redbull and red coloring. It's a tangy and pretty refreshing drink for the summer.

Blue Jelly Sake Soda - I found the blue jelly was fun to stir around in my drink, but the blue jelly itself tasted pretty bland and not that great with the sake. It's nice for photos only.

Apple Popping Boba Sake - This was an alright tasting drink and it only made it better with the popping bobas! The light hitting the bobas made the drink look radioactive and was fun to take pics of.

I would go here again just to try their other dishes. Everything looked and sounded so good, we all had trouble choosing what to get!

IG:missasia.pattyc

Address: 157 Provencher Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2H 0G2 Canada
Review: Absolute gem of Winnipeg. Quite a varied menu of Japanese dishes anywhere from ramen, don buri, curry rice, yakisoba and the gamut of appetizers. The food portions were on the more plentiful side. The service was so pleasant and the cute decor really enhanced the experience.

Address: 157 Provencher Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2H 0G2 Canada
Review:
Went here for the first time. The service was good and we really liked the tempura but on our second visit, the shrimp tempura had too much flour.

On a side note, they had big portions of their ramen. The broth was good but it wasn’t the best in my opinion.

Address: 243 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2S2 Canada
Review: Service was excellent, personable and efficient. We had calamari and salad, but it looked so good we ate it before taking a picture. Fantastic presentation and taste was incredible for everything. Ordered Fett Chile and Pappardelle. If the picture looks good, it’s because it is. Had crème brûlée and espresso for dessert and it could not have been better.

Address: 243 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2S2 Canada
Review: A good place to enjoy your food! We went as a family of 6, made reservations ahead of time. No hassle at all! We went right as it opened and got busy very quick! With that being said, food came out slow but there it was a full house. Food was good! Nothing overly memorable for me but I definitely enjoyed it!

Address: 243 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2S2 Canada
Review:
We really enjoyed the ambience and the hospitality from the staff, but we are a little picky when it comes to restaurant food because I have an amazing chef at home. Still a great place for a romantic date.

Atmosphere 5
Food 3
Overall 4

Address: 243 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2S2 Canada
Review:
Our server (apologies for the forgotten name) was absolutely fantastic! Attentive, accommodating, and impressively knowledgeable about the menu and pairings.

The bruschetta appetizer was a delightful 10/10, bursting with flavor! We couldn't resist trying the famous Fett Chile, a unique creation of Cafe Carlo, along with the Meaty Penne. Despite the warning of spiciness, these dishes didn't set our tongues on fire.

While the Meaty Penne was a bit saucy and lacked some flavor to my personal preference, the sausages in both pasta dishes were slightly firm. Regrettably, the main dishes didn't quite live up to expectations considering the price.

The atmosphere was elegant with dim lighting, and each table was beautifully set with forks, knives, and glassware.

Kudos to our server for sharing info about the cool artwork for sale and the talented artist behind them. By the way, that Alicia Keys piece? Mind-blowing!

Recommendations: try the Bruschetta and Fett Chile!

Address: 243 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2S2 Canada
Review: Great place, lovely ambiance, friendly and professional staff. Would recommend the Fett Chile (without sausages) as the sausage taste could dominate and ruin the dish, and the Pappardelle is just heavenly!

Address: 120 Donald Street Suite 2 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4G2 Canada
Review:
What a disappointing experience. 40 minutes to get an omelette and corned beef hash, and when breakfast comes it's unsalted, bland, and with a genuine slice of Kraft cheese on the egg. Cold toast, boiled tasteless potato, and dry eggs.

The service is also brutal. We waited 20 minutes for our server to even acknowledge we were sitting at the table, and then another 40 for our food to arrive. Barely interested staff providing a truly disengaged and uninspired experience. I'll never be back, and I recommend the place to nobody.

Address: 120 Donald Street Suite 2 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4G2 Canada
Review: We, twelve people, visited here. I ordered the farmers sausage omelette. Wonderful choice! Very delicious. The staff were very kind. And clean restaurant. I love here and will come back again.

Address: 120 Donald Street Suite 2 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4G2 Canada
Review: Tasty quick place for breakfast. Was in and out in less than 45 mins and the breakfast was really good!

Address: 120 Donald Street Suite 2 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4G2 Canada
Review: Slow & inattentive service, however the staff were very friendly when they did come by.  The Benedict felt incomplete, like it was missing some fruits or vegetables on the side, but it was a pretty decent meal.  I'd imagine you could probably order something like that on the side if you wanted.

Address: 120 Donald Street Suite 2 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4G2 Canada
Review: Excellent breakfast, service, and prices. Recommended!

Address: 630 Des Meurons Street Winnipeg, MB R2H 2P9 Canada
Review:
We had a work event here recently (~30 people) and the food was fantastic! Quality ingredients and everything was cooked perfectly.

Drink and food orders took quite a while as they only scheduled one server for the event - but he remained in good spirits and helped out the best he could!

Address: 630 Des Meurons Street Winnipeg, MB R2H 2P9 Canada
Review: Really good food and reasonably cheap for what you get. Ate in the train car which was a cool atmosphere but can get quite loud. Tip for management, should have Kronesberg 1664 on the beer list if you are a french restaurant.

Address: 630 Des Meurons Street Winnipeg, MB R2H 2P9 Canada
Review: Perfect date night with the option of dining in an amazing old train car, outside patio or in a gorgeous dining room. Food was spectacular! We had the special prime rib with Yorkshire pudding. Parking is tight, but they worked with the area that they got!

Address: 630 Des Meurons Street Winnipeg, MB R2H 2P9 Canada
Review:
We popped in on a whim looking to kill some time before our next appointment...and we were not disappointed.  We were delighted with the decor and atmosphere, it's a train!
We ordered an entrée and glass of wine to share and they were gracious enough to give us two glasses.
The food was delicious and after reading other reviews I'm sad I didn't get to try the brulé...next time...

Address: 630 Des Meurons Street Winnipeg, MB R2H 2P9 Canada
Review: This place was a great experience for a small group. I feel as though 2-4 people would be the ideal amount, especially if you’re looking for seating in the train. It would get a little cramped for space otherwise. Great food, well worth the price. The only criticism would be the servers and staff, they could have been more hospitable, but we came in on a very busy evening so its justified. I wish they had live jazz on more nights throughout the week, I feel as though that’d be a great addition. Got the beef bourguignon, and escargot, would highly recommend. Would gladly come back and try out different items on their menu.

Address: 1360 Taylor Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 3Z1 Canada
Review: Met some people here for a dinner event, and though the food came out quickly, it was a little hard to get drinks, or the bills or any service after the meal.   The food that was got was okay but not as good as I remember, and extremely expensive now compared to a few years ago. Did enjoy the crazy 88 roll and tempura prawns, but some of the others missed the mark.

Address: 1360 Taylor Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 3Z1 Canada
Review: Still a good place to go for sushi, although their prices are quite high. They've reduced their menu compared to prior years so I wasn't as impressed on this last visit. Spicy Mango Prawns is still one of my fave dishes.

Address: 1360 Taylor Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 3Z1 Canada
Review:
Been coming to this place (on and off, as we now live out of town) for 15+ years now. I can't say many bad things about it - still probably the best sushi in Winnipeg - but the quality does seem to have gone generally down over the years.
.
They've also removed some of the best items from the menu, like the sushi pizza and the prairie fire roll.
.
It's also *very* expensive. If it wasn't for the nostalgia factor I'd probably rate lower - but yeah, still a great place worth visiting.

Address: 1360 Taylor Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 3Z1 Canada
Review: Very good food. Lots of drink options too. Service is a bit slow although very accommodating. Enjoyed.

Address: 1360 Taylor Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 3Z1 Canada
Review: We came in with out a reservation. We had to wait even tho the restaurant was nearly empty. (During the no covid, no mask, no sitting restrictions month). The place was freezing cold. Service was a bit slow and the server wasn’t friendly. The food was really good, we were able to see the chef and cooks are pros and enjoyed our appetizers and sushi rolls very much.

Address: 875 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W7 Canada
Review:
The Maki Lover deal is pretty good. 5 rolls $22. Decent list to chose from.
The rolls themselves had WAY too much rice. They were so big, hardly taste anything else, just dense rice. The tempura flakes were hard and over cooked. Hurt to chew, as they were kinda rock hard. Should be light and fluffy.
Asked for extra soy sauce. See photo to see what they consider extra soy sauce. Two tiny cups 1/4 full. Might as well just filler one half full…….

Address: 875 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W7 Canada
Review: Could be the best sushi in the world ( trust me it’s not) and I would still never come back here. To the guy at the front. Your customer service and how you treat paying customers is absolutely pathetic. End of story.

Address: 875 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W7 Canada
Review: I have been a customer since they opened. No more. The guy at the front and answering the phone does no good for this business. All 3 rolls were loaded with rice lacking the fish. Yokohama roll was deep fried shrimp with some avocado and cucumbers very little salmon or tuna. Called to let them know, he said they have a machine to roll, pretty sure the machine doesn’t add the fish. Don’t waste your money.

Address: 875 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W7 Canada
Review:
Was trying to place my order over the phone employee who I was only on the phone with for a min (as I want back to check) asked me to hurry us as there were people in the store like I was about to place a platter order for pick up
If you can’t use the numbers to place the orders then remove the numbers maybe 🤔
Used to come here all the time ultimately told him I’ll maybe call back but after that interaction I’m now going to place an order with a different sushi place in Osborne. I’ll also not be recommending this place to me staff anymore either

Address: 875 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M 0W7 Canada
Review: They are NOT open for dine in! We've had them delivered and it's usually good. But if you want dine in, try Sushi Ya further down Corydon.

Address: 191 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Z2 Canada
Review: We enjoyed the food and the pleasant, friendly service from our waitress and from the owner. This was our 2nd visit to this excellent restaurant. I particularly liked the Tom Kha soup, Massam curry, and the Pad Thai. We ordered a lot of different dishes and enjoyed them all!

Address: 191 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Z2 Canada
Review: Always our Thai food go to in the city! Everything we order is great always. Restaurant is clean and great ambiance for small groups or larger, quick and super friendly service. Doesn’t not disappoint!

Address: 191 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Z2 Canada
Review: The service was good but the food was kind of slow , super busy at weekend . The coconut rice was super sweet and aroma we love this .

Address: 191 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Z2 Canada
Review:
Edit: change your google hours

One of my favorite spots for food.
Delicious assortment of stir fry, curries abs soups. Also good selection of appetizers; rice rolls, spring rolls, lettuce wraps etc. prices range from $12-17 for main dishes. Soups around around $11-15. Friendly good service.

Address: 191 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Z2 Canada
Review: I love the food here! It's so savory! They'll ask you on a scale of 1-10 on how spicy you want your dishes to be, and I recommend going for 9 or 10 if you like spicy dishes. The service is also very nice.

Address: 1 Portage Avenue E 3rd Floor Winnipeg, MB R3B 3N3 Canada
Review: The Clay Oven has got many franchises in the city of Winnipeg, I visited the one downtown at Shaw Park. The place is well connected by public transport and has ample parking space outside. It's located at Shaw Park. A day of a baseball match you can enjoy the match and have lunch with family and friends. You can take the elevator to reach the 3rd floor where it's located. But yeah, you need to wait for a while to get into the elevator during rush hours. The ambiance inside the restaurant is extraordinary. The staff is very approachable and friendly. The price in the restaurant is decent among all other contemporaries. I tasted the non veg thali, the portion was enough for a single person. The mango lassi was absolutely delicious. Would highly recommend this place for authentic Indian food.

Address: 1 Portage Avenue E 3rd Floor Winnipeg, MB R3B 3N3 Canada
Review: Great dining experience and delicious, flavorful food. Has halal meat options, along with vegetarian options. Also, many Gluten-free options available. The portion size for entrees is large and easily can be shared. Service was great with wait staff frequently checking in. Clean and spacious dining restaurant with a nice view from 3rd floor.

Address: 1 Portage Avenue E 3rd Floor Winnipeg, MB R3B 3N3 Canada
Review: I ordered the goat biryani with Indian Iced coffee. I asked for extra spicy and was pleased it was not mild. Coffee was very flavourful. Paper straw was the only issue.

Address: 1 Portage Avenue E 3rd Floor Winnipeg, MB R3B 3N3 Canada
Review: Recently visited this place for my hubby’s birthday. We ordered tandori chicken, Hakka chicken dumplings, chicken biryani & drinks. Chicken was very dry, biryani was also ok but I loved the hakka chicken dumplings. Ambience is good, staff is very polite. I would visit again for the dumplings & will try more things.

Address: 1 Portage Avenue E 3rd Floor Winnipeg, MB R3B 3N3 Canada
Review:
The menu was well put together, easy to understand and detailed. Various choices, love Indian restaurants for their vegan options and this one didn't disappoint. The food was divine, even after I reheated my leftovers at home.
The servers were friendly and quick, the food didn't take long at all. The place is a bit loud inside and outside. Outside you get to watch a game if one is on. Inside the staff may have been a bit overwhelmed at the time, there was a food spill that wasn't cleaned for an extended period and the smoke from the kitchen irritated my throat when I passed too close.
All in all a good restaurant experience.

Address: 472 Stradbrook Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0J9 Canada
Review: Had “The Mac” also have good vegetarian options. Great food, great service and a dog friendly patio.

Address: 472 Stradbrook Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0J9 Canada
Review:
My wife and I recently had the pleasure of dining at Nuburger, and we were thoroughly impressed by the exceptional experience it offered, especially for vegetarian options. As a vegetarian, my wife often faces challenges finding restaurants that provide both delectable flavors and affordability, but Nuburger exceeded her expectations on both fronts.

Nuburger's commitment to catering to vegetarians is commendable. Their diverse range of veggie burgers truly stood out. My wife had previously visited Nuburger and loved it, so we decided to give it a try together. I ordered a traditional burger, which was nothing short of fantastic. The patty was perfectly cooked, juicy, and packed with flavor. The accompanying toppings and condiments were thoughtfully selected, adding a delightful harmony to the overall experience.

Address: 472 Stradbrook Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0J9 Canada
Review: We ordered through door dash and were very satisfied with our order. the fries were amazing, the burger could use a little bit more sauce, overall good food. we will need to come into the resturant at some point. they also provided good delivery, with cute stickers and a cute little insert. Recommend getting something to eat from here!!!

Address: 472 Stradbrook Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0J9 Canada
Review: Great spot in Osborne Village for high-quality burgers and quick service. Everything tasted fresh and the staff were very friendly. Highly recommend checking out Nuburger!

Address: 472 Stradbrook Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0J9 Canada
Review: I love the veggie burgers here. They do a great falafel patty. I have ordered here often, it's always worthwhile.

Address: 100 Osborne Street Suite 208,Floor 2 Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y5 Canada
Review: Had some Pad Peanut Sauce for lunch, and it was amazing! Definitely recommending to my friends

Address: 100 Osborne Street Suite 208,Floor 2 Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y5 Canada
Review:
Little gem of a place located with a wonderful view of the city.  Food was fresh, unique and satisfying. Every mouth watering dish bursting with subtle, yet somehow bold and distinctive tastes, true to the Thai flavor one would expect.
Portions were generous, prices very reasonable and the service outstanding!
Our server Ava was expertly attentive, efficient and well mannered!
Kudos to the management for a great hire in this young lady! Would return 10 out of 10x!
DavMar ~ Texas

Address: 100 Osborne Street Suite 208,Floor 2 Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y5 Canada
Review: Food here is really good, had an incredible green curry. Mango salad and stir fry were average but perfectly good. Seems like a lovely family business. Dining room is dated but has a character to it.

Address: 100 Osborne Street Suite 208,Floor 2 Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y5 Canada
Review:
THIS IS PROBABLY THE BEST THAI FOOD I HAVE EVER TASTED! I highly recommend this restaurant! Absolutely delicious food, wonderful service, clean and all around amazing dining experience.
100% recommend. So delicious. You won't regret it!

Address: 100 Osborne Street Suite 208,Floor 2 Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y5 Canada
Review:
Delightful server, awesome food. Had spiced eggplant and Panang curry.

Highly recommend.

Address: 12-208 Marion Street Winnipeg, MB R2H 0T6 Canada
Review: You can customize the level of heat/spice in your meals at this restaurant- ranging from 1-10.  We ordered 2 dishes- both 5/10 heat.  Turned out it was good for my husband but a little too high for me - would go with level 3 or 4 next time.  Our friends had a level 7 for one of theirs.  Beef basil and deep fried fish were our 2 orders.  We had a calamari appetizer which was very good.  Great service and friendly staff.  Good place for Laotian and Thai food.

Address: 12-208 Marion Street Winnipeg, MB R2H 0T6 Canada
Review:
This restaurant has parking in front, there was ample parking when we went. The restaurant was pretty empty.
The staff was fast and friendly.
The food was quick and tasty.
They offered a spice scale of 1 to 10.  We had a 5 and it was spicy, my friends had a very spicy 8 and enjoyed the heat that it was.
We had the beef and basil, a fish dish and calamari.
Prices and flavours were excellent.
Definitely worth going, we will be back.

Address: 12-208 Marion Street Winnipeg, MB R2H 0T6 Canada
Review: I came here for lunch and was not disappointed. Although the decor is in need of an update (paint peeling off the walls, old tables and chairs) I was more interested in the food and that did not disappoint. We had the coconut shrimp as an appetizer and the large green curry soup with a side of rice as well as the pad nut. The shrimp was good in fact so good we ate it before I thought of taking a picture. The soup was excellent! A very generous portion full of vegetables and chicken. We selected spice level 5 and it was fine for me however my lunch partner  fond it very spicy so be aware of that. We had to pack up the pad nut but when I finally got to it it was delicious. Very good sauce, lots of veggies another excellent choice. The restaurant has some parking but with the other businesses around it can be tough to find a spot.

Address: 12-208 Marion Street Winnipeg, MB R2H 0T6 Canada
Review:
Have a new favourite place for coconut curry soup!
Was absolutely delicious, spice was as requested and rice rolls were delicious as well.
Person who served us was very good, very professional.
Very clean inside and well maintained.
Highly recommend!

Address: 12-208 Marion Street Winnipeg, MB R2H 0T6 Canada
Review: The food is absolutely AMAZING! Best Thai in the city. However, if you get take out, be CAREFUL! They package it so full of sauce that when I opened it it spilled ALL over my leg and burnt me! And it’s scalding hot! My suggestion: put it all in a large mixing bowl and eat it safely lol. Other than that, wow the food is fantastic! Try the Meekrob!

Address: 1467 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C5 Canada
Review:
The food is INCREDIBLE. Portions are large, and price is reasonable. In the photo is deep fried mushrooms and peanut tofu. So delicious! Staff are very friendly, helpful, and nice.

Make sure you bring a mask, cash or a visa credit card to pay

Address: 1467 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C5 Canada
Review:
If you love Chinese, look no further. Absolutely scrumptious Chinese food, all 100% vegetarian and full of flavour. Delicious has been around for a long time and they have consistently delivered high quality and great tasting food that comes in good serving size and won’t break the bank. The customer service is very good and personalized just as it comes with small businesses. I asked lots of questions before placing my order and they answered patiently and explained everything. The items I tried (pictured) are item#6: wonton in chillie garlic sauce; 25: deep fried mushrooms with spicy salt; 31: sweet and sour gluten balls; 70: Hong Kong style chow mein and vegetable fried rice.
I ordered the HK chowmein because the google pictures made it look like the Cantonese soy sauce chowmein and I was not disappointed. Absolutely delicious. The highlight of my order were the mounds of deep fried crispy mushrooms. They come piled high and are addictive. Overall very happy with my order and will be back to try more. The only regret I have is that I forgot to ask for a copy of takeout menu for next time.

Something to be aware of: They are only offering takeout at the moment, must be wearing mask when going to pickup and they only accept Visa (CC) or cash.  Debit and MasterCard are not accepted.

Address: 1467 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C5 Canada
Review: Been going to this place since I was very young, can honestly say my favourite restaurant in Winnipeg 💕 with growing up vegetarian eating out normally wasn’t easy but Delicious was vegan since before it’s was wildly accepted and has always been consistently amazing food. The folks that work here are lovely and kind. Their deep fried “eel” is what made me like mushrooms.

Address: 1467 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C5 Canada
Review:
Delicious is a great vegan option.
They say vegetarian but all the dishes are vegan.

Deep Fried mushrooms - 5 🌟  wonderful flavor on them. Texture was a bit thicker and chewier than I would like, but some might enjoy it

"Beef" with ginger and green onions 4 🌟 - when I brought the leftovers to my friend he questioned if it was actual beef. This was my least favorite dish however out of what we tried

Hot and sour soup 4 🌟 - it was very good, but I didn't prefer how sweet it was. If the added sweetness wasn't there I would have done a 5

Tofu with peanut sauce 5 🌟 - I was but expecting to like this as much as I did.

They had a decaf tea that was roasted rice and ginger which was very pleasant. It is a hint of ginger flavoring.

Service was excellent 5 🌟 with the server on top of the leftovers and the bill.

The interior is much slicker looking then what I remember. It is modern and does not resemble your typical Chinese restaurant.
It is located right on pembina, near the Stella's. Parking is available on the street and side streets.

If you liked this review please hit the 👍
Thanks!

Address: 1467 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C5 Canada
Review: Lives up to its name! My family ordered a large take-out order for a special occasion and we were not disappointed! The food was so good and the service was wonderful. I was especially a fan of the Deep Fried Tofu with Spicy Salt and the Wontons in Chili Garlic Sauce, but all of it was so good! We will definitely be ordering from here again!

Address: 628A St Anne's Rd Winnipeg, MB R2C 0A1 Canada
Review: I love your Fish Pakora and Jalebi. I took it during breaking my fasting. Both items were too good. Going to order next week for the IFTAAR

Address: 628A St Anne's Rd Winnipeg, MB R2C 0A1 Canada
Review:
I am so sorry to put this negative comment but you guys deserve it.
Come on guys, this is not a chicken soup. This looks like chicken curry cooked with just oil.
Don’t you know what soup looks like🤦🏻‍♂️??
When I complained, the lady was so arrogant and said this is our style. WTH

Address: 628A St Anne's Rd Winnipeg, MB R2C 0A1 Canada
Review: We ordered take out and we’re very disappointed by the taste and quality of the food. We used to eat here all the time before Covid but have not had their food for a couple of years. Not sure if ownership has changed or different staff is cooking the dishes but food was lacking flavour and creaminess that you usually get, almost as if it was watered down? We will have to seek out a new Indian food restaurant.

Address: 628A St Anne's Rd Winnipeg, MB R2C 0A1 Canada
Review:
I had ordered 24 samosas from this restaurant and they were uncooked. When I tried to tell them they are uncooked, they did not accept and started quarrelling with us. This was very unprofessional. I was talking to that lady there and all of a sudden a guy came and started arguing. I had guests to attend and they refused to refund the money or deliver to my address. At first they said they will deliver but the guy pitched in who was very rude and refused to deliver. I would have given 0 rating if that was an option. Now I also doubt the hygen as the samosas were not cooked from inside and it's very unhealthy with oil getting inside and the dough stretchy and uncooked, and I doubt if it was fresh.

I completely boycott the rude and arrogant behavior of the people working there that they don't know how to talk to the customers. Sadly this was my one of the worst experience in Winnipeg.

I highly request the people who read reviews not to go to the restaurant.

Address: 628A St Anne's Rd Winnipeg, MB R2C 0A1 Canada
Review:
One of the best Jalebi in town, it was not there as I visited with my friend but quick chat with future owner 😀 made my day. We ended up having samosas and samosas plate (samosas with chick pea curry , onions,  tomatoes, and secret sauce).
Samosas were great but very filling. I like crunch more than the filling but it's personal preference.
I think restaurants shall introduce blank samosas 😃 options too to just enjoy the crunch.
It was sad experience to miss Jalebi as Master chef was on vacations and no one else dared to mess up with the recipe. May be next time. A small shop with good taste wonders.

Address: 115 Garry St Winnipeg, MB R3C 1G5 Canada
Review: We visit The Keg on Garry for special occasions and we always have a great time. Excellent servers, beautiful location inside and out - especially the patio in the evenings. Always great to see a seasonally changing menu with specialty drinks to match whatever you order. You won’t be disappointed!

Address: 115 Garry St Winnipeg, MB R3C 1G5 Canada
Review: My family and I recently had the pleasure of celebrating a birthday at The Keg Restaurant, and it was a truly wonderful experience. The restaurant staff was friendly and accommodating, and the kids menu was a hit with the little ones. The baked brie was simply delicious, and the rib steak was cooked to perfection and came with some delicious roasted beets and green beans. Unfortunately, my wife wasn't happy with her sirloin, but we were pleasantly surprised when the manager went above and beyond to make it right. Overall, The Keg Restaurant is an excellent choice for special occasions and we will definitely be returning in the future.

Address: 115 Garry St Winnipeg, MB R3C 1G5 Canada
Review: I would recommend Gruyere Mushroom Dip (holiday feature), Calamari, Ribs and the Billy Miner Pie. We did have to stand and wait for about 25 minutes in order to be seated, despite having made a reservation - just something to keep in mind if you're going there on a weekend. Great service.

Address: 115 Garry St Winnipeg, MB R3C 1G5 Canada
Review:
Does not disappoint. Always go
To the keg for steak! Consistent cook, service and ambiance. I had the classic strip loin,
Scallops for appies and billy Milner for dessert! Had a bottle of j lohr which is amazing they carry cause not many do.. food came out quickly. Steak is always cooked perfectly z Few things missed, hot sauce and steak knives which we had to ask for a second time but other than it was great!
They have a parking lot not you can park at for cheap. Reservations done online is a must as it gets packed on the weekends.

Address: 115 Garry St Winnipeg, MB R3C 1G5 Canada
Review: My Girlfriend and I came in for a late anniversary dinner on Thursday, February 16th. Our server, a young man named Evan, was fun, professional, attentive, and timely. Our entire meal, including 2 steaks, and dessert, was completed within 90 minutes of us sitting down, and all of the food was excellent. 5 stars, couldn’t recommend more, Evan was awesome !

Address: 35 Lakewood Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2J 2M8 Canada
Review: Really enjoyed breakfast here. A delicious omelette.  The place was quite busy and the food took a while but the staff were very attentive and apologized for the delay. Would definitely keep supporting this establishment.

Address: 35 Lakewood Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2J 2M8 Canada
Review: While visiting Winnipeg, the Canadian Mint was one if our must see locations. Looking for a restaurant after our tour, we discovered this little gem. Although it was very busy over lunch, the staff appeared to be a well oiled machine. From start to finish, we were very impressed with this restaurant. Judging by their clientele, they must have a lot of repeat customers. Another positive sign of a great place to eat.

Address: 35 Lakewood Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2J 2M8 Canada
Review: My wife and I love this place. Friendly service, great food and a community-like atmosphere.  If you haven't been here yet you're missing out.

Address: 35 Lakewood Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2J 2M8 Canada
Review: The service is very good. The waitresses are very friendly and helpful. The food is so very good. I have the roast beef dinners for seniors and it’s so tasty and the presentation makes the food very yummy!

Address: 35 Lakewood Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2J 2M8 Canada
Review: 2 breakfast specials with coffee was $25+. Nothing fancy or special about it as the potatoes definitely need dome onions/ spice.  Pricey for what you get .

Address: 587 Ellice Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 1Z7 Canada
Review: This was our first time at Feast. We went for lunch, and the food (Pickerel Sliders / Bison Chili) was excellent!  The portions were generous for the price paid, and the Bannock was some of the best I've had.  The service was quick but friendly, and we didn't feel rushed. The ambiance is nicer than I expected, and it feels more spacious than it actually is. Overall it was an excellent experience, and we will definitely go back to try some of the other dishes.

Address: 587 Ellice Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 1Z7 Canada
Review:
Tried this place for the first time tonight for date night. Lovely little place! Cozy and intimate.

Had the bison ribs which were incredibly tender. Not a huge serving, but WELL worth it! Enjoy every bite! Savour it.

Wife had the Feast Bannock pizza, which was also delightful. Great bannock crust, wonderful toppings.

Looking forward to making a return and trying some other menu items!

Oh. Also, London Fogs are just great.

Address: 587 Ellice Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 1Z7 Canada
Review: What a lovely place! I’ve never really been exposed to Indigenous Canadian food so I was really excited to try Feast Cafe. I was not disappointed…the use of Bannock for the delicious Tipi taco to the amazing Bannock pizza. It is a gorgeous little spot with lovely service too. Recommend completely!!!

Address: 587 Ellice Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 1Z7 Canada
Review: Great food with amazing service. I had the braised bison rib and it was one of the best meals I had in Winnipeg. Sweet grass and blueberry ice cream is also great. Prices are also great.

Address: 587 Ellice Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 1Z7 Canada
Review:
While in Winnipeg, I visited Feast Cafe Bistro. This is a unique Indigenous restaurant with amazing food.

I started off with the Butternut Squash Soup with coconut milk and a hint of ginger with corn chips. This was one of the best soups I’ve ever had! The combination was fantastic and it was very flavourful.

I then had the Slow-Roasted Rosemary Manitoba Bison, served with potato squash mash, seasonal vegetables, horseradish, gravy jus, & wild blueberry compote. It was without a doubt an outstanding dish. The bison was soft, lean, and very rich in flavour, and the combination of the mashed potatoes and the wild blueberry compote skyrocketed the flavour of the dish because it added a bit of sourness and sweetness to activate all the flavours of the mouth.

The service was outstanding and the establishment was clean. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who visits or lives in Winnipeg, Manitoba!

Address: 241 St Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J4 Canada
Review:
I had to edit this review as a lot of things I had originally posted became outdated after a month. (I was here more than once in that month since I did enjoy it) So this is an amalgamated review.

I debated between 3 and 4 on this visit, but ultimately went with a 4. The service was fine on this visit from our server. She took direction but not initiative. The food is generally good. I'm still waiting to find that dish that I have fall in love with and crave all the time.

It didn't start out well. They had a water issue, which was the same water issue that was there from a month before that I guess is still not resolved. The water is yellow. They could not serve tap water or make tea. If tea, hot water, etc is important to you, you are out of luck.

On this visit, I had brought a group of people from out of town to try Helios. Originally they had platters which were priced well for their assortment of items to try. We were told they no longer have them. They were meant for customers to try everything and get a taste of the food, but since they have been here long enough, they felt it was no longer necessary. We were disappointed to hear that as it made for great presentation and was nice to have a sampling.

Portion sizes are large for everything.

When we went originally there seemed to be 3 sizes for salads. Half salad is not the same as a starter. (Pictures below show the difference). We used the Pellegrino can to help show size. However I am unsure if they changed that since.

We went for lunch this time (the other times it was dinner)
If you order the fries with fish expect a lot of fries and only a little fish. The full serving of calamari I felt was not as good as the side that you add to your meal. Its almost the same in value, but half portions often cost more. So if you do want all that calamari go ahead, but half portions are equally fine.
The slouvaki lunches seemed to be the best value and looked well balanced.
The caviar dip this time was not as good as the first time we tried it.
Highlights was flaming cheese because... Flames. The pan is larger where the cheese is a smaller piece in the center. It comes served with pita bread.
There was a lot of dressing on our half salad and a more moderate amount (I preferred this one) on our starter, which makes me feel it can be inconsistent.

Service is standard. Some are better than others. They usually did not go out of their way, but they were friendly and did their job.
I feel like the pricing is fair for what you get.
I appreciated everything came out piping hot.

Address: 241 St Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J4 Canada
Review:
First time eating here, and I was very satisfied with the experience. The two appetizers (calamari and deep fried zucchini) were served hot to our table and tasted freshly breaded. The Greek salad and garlic bread as starters were very tasty and good portion. Greek salad only had 2 black olives, but I didn't mind because I don't like them myself. The feta wasn't quite the best to me but still good.

The entrees (pork tenderloin skewers, and stuffed pepper) arrived at our table after a short wait and we're hot. The meals themselves were very tasty. The lemon potatoes were very good and a nice bite. The tenderloin was very tangy and super tender.

Overall it's a premium meal at a premium price that's well earned. We ordered 2 entrees, 2 appetizers, and a drink each and the total was 84$. Or 42$ a person. Not bad considering the quality and quantity of food we recieved. Would definitely come again, next time I'm looking for a premium dining experience.

Address: 241 St Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J4 Canada
Review:
You won't be leaving hungry here!!!! Amazing food, generous portions, friendly welcoming service and great daily specials! All the appitizers are delicious, the deepfried mushrooms and pickles are heavenly and the humas is very tasty and one of the better I've had while eating out.
The Greek salad pictured with garlic bread is only a side salad, I cannot imagine a full sized one!
Two chicken breasts stone cooked with spinach and feta.
Stuffed pepper with spiced ground beef, both come with lemon potatoes, rice and grilled vegetables.
Crazy reasonable prices, do not pass this up!

Address: 241 St Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J4 Canada
Review: Brings back our Greece trip memories. Good food. Staff is very friendly. The owner oversees the operation like an OG greek.

Address: 241 St Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J4 Canada
Review: Got chicken souvlaki. Came with greek salad and toast and they were both great! Chicken was tender and nicely grilled. The meal came with roasted veggies and lemony potatoes (which my husband didn’t like too much but I loved it!) Their tzatziki sauce is not too garlicky (which may be good or bad for you depending on your preference.) The inside is clean and warm especially since it was -1 outside.

Address: 330 Assiniboine Park Drive Winnipeg, MB R3P 2N6 Canada
Review: The atmosphere was superb but food was so-so! Had smoked salmon benedicts but the salmon was too salty. The pancakes were good nonetheless and price was reasonable.

Address: 330 Assiniboine Park Drive Winnipeg, MB R3P 2N6 Canada
Review: We dropped into the Park Cafe to escape a rather cold wind. Good service.  Good food. The kids loved the fries but thought the grilled cheese was over cheesy. I really enjoyed the smoked salmon salad. The lighting is great with huge windows overlooking the duck pond.

Address: 330 Assiniboine Park Drive Winnipeg, MB R3P 2N6 Canada
Review:
Located within the Assiniboine Park, the Park Cafe offers its visitors with plenty of options.

I opted for a tasty House Park Burger. I added cheese and bacon to compliment a well cooked burger. It was topped with lettuce, tomato and grilled onions, as well as, a spiced aioli. Mmm!

The hand cut fries were golden and crispy and well portioned.

While I didn’t eat the banana bread pudding, it looked wonderful and got a hearty thumbs up.

Address: 330 Assiniboine Park Drive Winnipeg, MB R3P 2N6 Canada
Review: Sat on the patio and it was very comfortable seating, was thankful for umbrellas that provided ample shade. The pork belly eggs Benny was amazing and quite possibly my favourite eggs Benny in the city. The potatoes were amazing and perfectly crispy.

Address: 330 Assiniboine Park Drive Winnipeg, MB R3P 2N6 Canada
Review: Lovely patio breakfast to celebrate our grandsons 13th birthday. Great service and delicious food. Very pleased we choose outside. The indoor dining area is very loud.

Address: 570 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0E3 Canada
Review: The service was great.  My salmon eggs Benny was brought out quickly and was delicious.  Our server kept the mimosas flowing. Everything was great

Address: 570 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0E3 Canada
Review: The staff were friendly and personable, and the food was really good.  I have the veggie benedict, and as someone who had never had a benedict before, it was a great first.

Address: 570 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0E3 Canada
Review: My absolute favourite restaurant of all time! The Chicken Adobo sandwich is to die for! Sooo good! The deserts are pretty amazing too. The staff are friendly too. Love the environment. Have been 3 times and plan to go again!

Address: 570 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0E3 Canada
Review:
Amazing food. Great atmosphere. Great employees. The broccoli and cheddar soup is second to none!

Cheers,

Address: 570 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0E3 Canada
Review:
I love coming to Saucers. Staff are always super friendly and I've never been disappointed with the food or drinks. Always delicious.

I dined in once pre-pandemic during a really busy lunch rush and remember the waitress still going above and beyond for my table. The customer service really is fantastic!

A great little cafe that I definitely recommend checking out.

Address: 1340 Ellice Ave Unit 1 Winnipeg, MB R3G 0E9 Canada
Review: Second time we ordered and food substandard. Tonight it was delivered to another place as we did not get it. So we dealt with that and reordered. The corn chips that were in our meals and side bag were so salty i would consider it toxic- and i like salt! You can visibly see more salt than chips on them. It ruined the meal entirely as they were in it too. May be hard to see in photo but white crust of salt is there. Probably will never order from them again.  Too expensive for mush and salt!

Address: 1340 Ellice Ave Unit 1 Winnipeg, MB R3G 0E9 Canada
Review: Our Monday just got a whole lot better!  Impossible quesadillas are out of this world and the service here is top notch!  ❤️

Address: 1340 Ellice Ave Unit 1 Winnipeg, MB R3G 0E9 Canada
Review:
They finally tried to address issue only because I left a “1 star review”.
I Keep having the same issue since this employee has been hired.
For 2-3 years. Anytime she is there I don’t even get food. I just leave. Way Too stressful. Except on 5/28/23 as I was way to hungry. Didn’t wanna turn around and leave this time.
I have emailed Corporate and none of them including the owner have done nothing to address it.

District manager didn’t address any of the  issues. Blamed me and said I had a personal vendetta.
I didn’t even know her name till today..
Very biased and prejudice employees here.
I can see why this place is very low quality. Even Ryan Morton who’s suppose to be district manager has a “vendetta” against me.
He blamed me for their mistakes. Said they offered a free burrito. How’s that gonna fox the ongoing issue?
She Can give away free food and cups and food containers but can’t give me a 5 cent bag.
Place is a joke.
No wonder the employees are always so sad.
Nobody wants to work under incompetence.

Address: 1340 Ellice Ave Unit 1 Winnipeg, MB R3G 0E9 Canada
Review: Way too pricey for what it is - stale chips, fatty chunks in the meat, veggies not prepped well (big pieces of bell pepper was off-putting with every bite). I will say, the queso dip is pretty good, however,  will not be returning. Could not finish burrito (rare for me!!!)

Address: 1340 Ellice Ave Unit 1 Winnipeg, MB R3G 0E9 Canada
Review: Sunny and all staff was excellent ! Really clean restaurant and friendly staff! They were quick to help and really patient as I took forever ordering and asking what was what. Really appreciated how awesome the service was and how my borrito was soo goood. Thanks all, see you again!

Address: 1715 Kenaston Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1V5 Canada
Review:
We have passed by this place so many times and saw the patio packed, so we finally decided to try it out.

The patio is excellent, they had Caesar’s on special on Saturday and the buffalo chicken we tried was great !

The only slight miss are the chairs on patio have marks on them and look kinda old, but it’s a kinda minor as everything else is pretty great !

Address: 1715 Kenaston Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1V5 Canada
Review: A real ‘come as you are’ sports bar with great beverages and possibly the city’s best nachos. It’s a pretty big place so we got in right away. Stanley cup finals had the joint jumping. My wife said it was the best Cesar she ever had. Massive beer selection but I didn’t see any local options. Overall really great!

Address: 1715 Kenaston Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1V5 Canada
Review: I had booked a reservation for my birthday at this location and upon arrival, we weren’t provided any menus. I grabbed some off the bar and didn’t think this was a huge deal. As we started to order - the server began coming back and fourth to our table saying they were out of certain things (a total of 3 times - no stir fry, no Alfredo sauce for the kid pasta, no noodles for the kid pasta). The server wanted to check on the noodles because “they might have frozen ones”….. no thanks. We had ordered the kids each a pop (total of 2 kid pops) and 4 adult pops. When we were unable to order meals that the children wanted, I wanted, or my dad wanted, I kindly asked for the bill for the pops and advised the server this wasn’t going to work. She brought a bill for 4 pops (2 were completely untouched and not consumed in any way) and 2 kid pops (that are complimentary with kid meals, AND untouched). The restaurant offers a great selection of food and kid menu items but no stock for items sucked. The servers attitude changed drastically as she had to continue telling us they were out of items as if we had annoyed her…. My apologies girlie. If I return in the future, I would return with no children as this isn’t the best place to take them, but great atmosphere for adults if they could adequately staff the kitchen!

Address: 1715 Kenaston Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1V5 Canada
Review:
Nice space, friendly service. Gets packed in there so best to make reservation. The guys we were with did the Burger challenge. Eat the whole burger (6 Patties and poutine) in an hour and it’s free.
The quesadilla was not great….  It had some weird tangy sauce in it. Didn’t stay together. Was a mess. The poutines are horrible. Crinkle fries out of a bag? The gravy tastes like hospital or powdered gravy. Hardly any cheese. Hard pass.  The nachoes were decent. Jalapeños poppers decent.
The food is basically edible here, better if your two drinks in.

Address: 1715 Kenaston Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1V5 Canada
Review: Came in on a busy night and sat on patio, but service was still great. My server was Jade and she was very polite, super nice, made great conversation and food came in reasonable time. I had the spinach dip but with mini bread instead of the chips and it was delicious, recommended by jade. Drinks were also amazing and made quickly too. Highly recommend for a nice summer night, especially on patio.

Address: 570-C Sargent Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3E 0A2 Canada
Review: Good authentic food.  Limited drink selection, almost all high sugar pop. Only diet coke in non sugar dept.  Could use some light latin music, atmosphere was quite & boring. You can hear other patrons talking in detail from across room. Store is a little sad, has very limited items.

Address: 570-C Sargent Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3E 0A2 Canada
Review: I've never had Salvadorian food before but when I asked on a forum for allergen friendly restaurants in Winnipeg, this place was suggested. The yuca frita con chicharron was incredible, and all recognizable ingredients. I had it boiled, just to be safe. It was also AIP compliant! My spouse had the pupusas. Very happy.
