Restaurant was nice and quiet, no loud music. Owner very friendly.

Address: 570-C Sargent Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3E 0A2 Canada
Review: I love this place! This is a cute little Latino spot serving a wide variety of dishes from all over Latin America with a Salvadoreño twist. The environment is very nice and cozy and made me feel home. There is also a small market within the restaurant selling a bunch of Latino products. I was impressed with the amount of vegan and vegetarian options available. Would 100% recommend and come back!

Address: 570-C Sargent Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3E 0A2 Canada
Review: Tried the pupusas from this restaurant. I got one order of chicharron (ground pork) and another order of revuelta (mix of beans and cheese). They were delicious! Each order came with 3 pupusas, salsa and curtido. Las pupusas eran deliciosas. Por seguro voy a regresar.

Address: 570-C Sargent Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3E 0A2 Canada
Review:
This small restaurant has made te top of my list.
People saying it takes long to get your food? Hello!! This isn't McDonald's!
Price is high? Best joke I heard this year!
This food is underpriced. The service is great!
The highest price for a meal is 13.95$, and there's only one, everything else is 11.95$ and under.
These meals were huge, 11.95$ wait time was about 18 minutes. Just Amazing!!

Address: 490 Des Meurons Street Unit 1 Winnipeg, MB R2H 2P5 Canada
Review:
Such a lovely place ❤️ Definitely a place for people to dwell in fellowship,just like how the name of the restaurant symbolizes
💛 Unique Ambience! Well drafted menu with some amazing classics that you don't find , like the Reuben sandwich! 💛
Love spinach? Then ,try the spinwich!
Special mention about their fresh fruit juices! These are definitely a must try, carrot juice, papaya and mango! 💛
Amazing staff, so humble and hospitable! Every table is curated with details to give you an amazing dining experience!
💛The Yellow deli in Winnipeg is one many the many outlets that's found all around the world! Visiting this restaurant, doesn't just satisfy a hungry tummy, but a hungry soul and a hungry mind- you have so much to learn from the it's history! 💛

Address: 490 Des Meurons Street Unit 1 Winnipeg, MB R2H 2P5 Canada
Review: They were able to accommodate our group of 10. Easy to customize sandwiches. Don't expect a normal soft drink as they only have their own brews. The closest thing to a normal soft drink is their root beer. They do have a couple of fresh fruit smoothies and various teas. They heard it was a birthday and offered a free piece of carrot cake to the birthday people, complete with candle. The staff brought them out and sang happy birthday.

Address: 490 Des Meurons Street Unit 1 Winnipeg, MB R2H 2P5 Canada
Review: Literally the best restaurant! I went there with a couple buddies and the service was amazing. Food came out fast and was absolutely delicious. Everything tasted fresh and amazing! I would definitely recommend coming here for a delicious meal.

Address: 490 Des Meurons Street Unit 1 Winnipeg, MB R2H 2P5 Canada
Review:
I would have never known about this place had I not tried it out today. They serve everything fresh. They bake their own bread. They have gluten free and vegetarian/vegan options.
They have a large outdoor patio to host large groups(15 people comfortably)
The atmosphere is welcoming.
The restaurant sells their bread and they have assorted goods for sale in their store area.
Very welcoming environment.

Address: 490 Des Meurons Street Unit 1 Winnipeg, MB R2H 2P5 Canada
Review:
This man is one of a kind.

I've been going around to places, asking people for recommendations, asking them to making fun chef's choice meals.

So far, this man is the only man that when I asked for recommendations, told me straight up, no hesitation, the listed sandwiches were his recommendations.

I chose the Ruben.

He was right.

That is all.

Thanks, sir. You're awesome.

Address: 1639 Kenaston Boulevard Building F Winnipeg, MB R3P Canada
Review: Consistently delicious Greek fast food. Great for if you’re looking for a fresh option. The platter makes a great dinner (choice of Greek or Cesar salad, rice, lemon potato, skewer, pita and two tzatziki sauce). Highly recommend the spanakopita too! If you have any space left, get yourself a piece of baklava (sometimes available in chocolate!)

Address: 1639 Kenaston Boulevard Building F Winnipeg, MB R3P Canada
Review: I have been to Greek restaurants that serves lot better Chicken skewers and salad.  This is place is not value for money; paid $15 for 1 chicken skewer for 4 small pieces and 1 BIG SIZE Potato. I rather recommend visiting local Greek restaurant. Rice is bland with no seasoning and flavor.

Address: 1639 Kenaston Boulevard Building F Winnipeg, MB R3P Canada
Review:
The food lacks seasoning, is very dry and not up to my expectations, as I paid 26$ for my meal and couldn’t even finish this small plate to satisfy my hunger. The staff was careless and rude. Not a word of thank you/ have a good day/ enjoy.. etc. customer service here is awful. They know the food is so dry so they charge an extra 50c for some Walmart tzatziki sauce.

Overall I’d give it 0/5 if I could but I am only allowed to give lowest one star. Please go next door to Freshii, much better place, cheater and much tastier.

Address: 1639 Kenaston Boulevard Building F Winnipeg, MB R3P Canada
Review: Extremely disappointed. I haven’t been to Opa in a little over a month. Noticed prices were a little higher (nothing new with inflation) but the portion and quantity was extremely disappointing. I asked for the opa platter with no potatos. So when she was making my salad, I asked for extra salad because I kid you not, i recieved 7 pieces of lettuce. I asked for more lettuce and she said this is what you get. Then proceeds to remind me that I didn’t get potato so I can get more salad. SHe gives me TWO more pieces of lettuce. She then burns my pita on the grill and half of it is black! I get home only to see the chicken on the skewer is what I would feed my 4lb dog. Extremely shocked with this whole ex pierce I decided to write this. Don’t recommend going here .

Address: 1639 Kenaston Boulevard Building F Winnipeg, MB R3P Canada
Review:
I had a ceasar salad & skewer delivered and was quite disappointed. The salad was pre-dressed but also had a side of dressing ? Which made the lettuce and croutons extremely soggy by the time I received and ate it, and of course the side dressing went to waste as it was already dressed..

I had to force myself to eat it because I had no other food. I honestly think the salad was old/sitting for a very long time as I don’t understand why anyone would send a salad for delivery pre-dressed and how it could be so soggy. Any restaurant you go to will send dry salad with dressing on the side. It tasted old, and not a single crunchy crouton could be found. Just gross mush.

The chicken skewer was also burnt and tough. I won’t be trying this place again. ): If I had any other option besides starving myself, I would have thrown it in the garbage.

Address: 4910-49 Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1P3 Canada
Review:
Great fish taco special. The young waitress is not very engaging with customers. The food was great.

The interior is tired. Still nice overall.

Address: 4910-49 Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1P3 Canada
Review: The bar tender girl is amazing at appearing busy while you wait 15 minutes for a tepid beer.  Great atmosphere and overpriced average food.  Short hair manager girl is just angry.  Off we go to the Woodlot pub for some Yellowknife IPA.. :-)

Address: 4910-49 Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1P3 Canada
Review: The beer was cold and the waitress was excellent plus very informative. As it turned out the Black Knight seemed to be a very popular spot with the locals as the crowd increased in time. Compared with some other places in Old Town the prices were more reasonable for beer and food. As a bonus, we happened to be there at the same time that the band The Sheepdogs were practicing upstairs. They were in Yellowknife for a show later that evening upstairs and the sound was great downstairs in the bar. As for food the onion rings were good, unfortunately the chicken wings tasted like they had freezer burn. All in all a very pleasant experience.

Address: 4910-49 Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1P3 Canada
Review: After the initial shock wore off with the rude waitress, we actually enjoyed ourselves. She came around eventually and the food was excellent. Great burgers and awesome wings. One complaint tho for sure, an English strike pub that has only one type of Canadian beer on tap, pretty odd.

Address: 4910-49 Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1P3 Canada
Review: We sat at the bar. Really like the vibe. Our bartender was great. Delicious burgers, onions rings and poutine. The wings were also very good.

Address: 5019 49 Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1P5 Canada
Review:
Their noodles were much better than their rice. The pork chops that came with the rice were a little thin and dry. If you're coming here, their noodles would be a better choice.

Their shrimp stuffed chicken wings were pretty good.

Address: 5019 49 Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1P5 Canada
Review: This is a good spot for Vietnamese in Yellowknife. It has a big menu with all the typical options. Food came fast and it was fresh. Service was great. Prices are decent. Would definitely recommend!

Address: 5019 49 Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1P5 Canada
Review:
BEST Vietnamese Pho in town!!
We ordered beef and chicken pho, fried wonton and also a fresh salad roll. The taste was very nice and very warm. The staff is friendly and if you find yourself so cold in YK, please pay a visit and enjoy a warm soup here!

Address: 5019 49 Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1P5 Canada
Review: Tasty Pho, the salad rolls on the other hand not so much, tasteless meat and a sliver of prawn inside. The peanut sauce was the same, no flavor and watered down. I will have to return tho since the menu looked good for other dishes.

Address: 5019 49 Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1P5 Canada
Review: This is always a solid choice for a meal. Food is consistently good and lots of choice on the menu to scratch whatever hungry itch you might have. Sometimes can be a little slow with service, but that’s usually beachside they are almost always pretty busy over lunch hour, which tells you something in and of itself

Address: 4913 50th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 2P7 Canada
Review:
Their noodles were much better than their rice. The pork chops that came with the rice were a little thin and dry. If you're coming here, their noodles would be a better choice.

Their shrimp stuffed chicken wings were pretty good.

Address: 4913 50th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 2P7 Canada
Review: This is a good spot for Vietnamese in Yellowknife. It has a big menu with all the typical options. Food came fast and it was fresh. Service was great. Prices are decent. Would definitely recommend!

Address: 4913 50th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 2P7 Canada
Review:
BEST Vietnamese Pho in town!!
We ordered beef and chicken pho, fried wonton and also a fresh salad roll. The taste was very nice and very warm. The staff is friendly and if you find yourself so cold in YK, please pay a visit and enjoy a warm soup here!

Address: 4913 50th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 2P7 Canada
Review: Tasty Pho, the salad rolls on the other hand not so much, tasteless meat and a sliver of prawn inside. The peanut sauce was the same, no flavor and watered down. I will have to return tho since the menu looked good for other dishes.

Address: 4913 50th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 2P7 Canada
Review: This is always a solid choice for a meal. Food is consistently good and lots of choice on the menu to scratch whatever hungry itch you might have. Sometimes can be a little slow with service, but that’s usually beachside they are almost always pretty busy over lunch hour, which tells you something in and of itself

Address: 4701 Franklin Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 1N2 Canada
Review: The Red Apple Restaurant has a wonderful variety of Chinese and Western cuisines. It's located in the core downtown Yellowknife at Franklin Road. The staff is extremely courteous, warm and friendly. The food platter is delicious and the portions are massive compared to any other restaurants. Would highly recommend it if you're craving for some Chinese and Western cuisine in Yellowknife.

Address: 4701 Franklin Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 1N2 Canada
Review: place is a bit stuck in the past atmosphere wise, the food makes up for it. Decent Chinese food, spring rolls very tasty filling if a tiny bit over fried, dumplings were great, duck very tasty some pieces were again slightly over done but the crispy skin was divine, the star of the meal was the pork chow mein with noodles, (piping hot, tasty and chock full of vegetables). Go for this dish if nothing else. Reasonable priced and good service.

Address: 4701 Franklin Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 1N2 Canada
Review: The red apple. I was here when I was 2 years old and I just brought my 5 month old to the exact same place. It's reliable, the staff are amazing, the food is 100% what you always expect. The red apple is awesome. It's a Yellowknife institution and I hope it never changes.

Address: 4701 Franklin Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 1N2 Canada
Review: Easily the best restaurant in Yellowknife as a tourist. The food is fresh and well seasoned not to mention great and quick service. The restaurant is quite large and houses a lot of food options from traditional western to chinese cuisines. The buffet was unfortunately closed due to covid restrictions but this is still a very good place to dine out with very good prices.

Address: 4701 Franklin Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 1N2 Canada
Review: Very authentic Chinese food. Excellent customer service and friendly staff. Will definitely come again!

Address: 3904 Wiley Rd Yellowknife, NT X1A Canada
Review: Excellent atmosphere, historic building and a legend in YK. Well worth a visit. Some food was excellent (dip, wings), some really not good (poutine) - but still visit, it’s a fascinating place.

Address: 3904 Wiley Rd Yellowknife, NT X1A Canada
Review: Great historical place for one time visit when you're in Yellowknife. We were lucky enough to be there on their closing day. They're only open through summer and early fall so do visit when you're in town. It has a nice cabin-like vibe overlooking the Great Slave Lake and a very nice atmosphere.

Address: 3904 Wiley Rd Yellowknife, NT X1A Canada
Review:
The deck at the Wildcat may be the best in Yellowknife on a nice day.  Service was really good.  Food is great.
Really, the only negative is the portion to price ratio - its way off and not in a good way.  Wings are top notch but by far the most expensive in Yellowknife.

Address: 3904 Wiley Rd Yellowknife, NT X1A Canada
Review: Dinner was delicious and the bread pudding was perfect.

Address: 3904 Wiley Rd Yellowknife, NT X1A Canada
Review: Lovely place, I wish the menu had more options but you know when there are a few selections, those meals are mastered down to a science! Staff were friendly and food was delicious and extremely filling!

Address: 4905 50th Ave Yellowknife, NT X1A 3X8 Canada
Review: This is probably one of the best shawarma places in all NWT =)  really like the fact they have their own signature wrap comes with fries inside the wrap. Service is great but when it gets busy one man show is no longer becomes tolerable. The food is super tasty and highly recommend this place. specially their flafel and babaganoush.

Address: 4905 50th Ave Yellowknife, NT X1A 3X8 Canada
Review: Had the chicken and beef platter. Blew my expectations out of the water. Amazing food and great service.

Address: 4905 50th Ave Yellowknife, NT X1A 3X8 Canada
Review: Had an amazing dinner at this Shawarma joint! The food was delicious, you should try their Chicken Shawarma platter. It comes with hummus and falafel. You can also substitute hummus for Baba ganoush. Portion size was apt. Our server was very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend!

Address: 4905 50th Ave Yellowknife, NT X1A 3X8 Canada
Review: Delicious falafel for lunch, served promptly. The host and service were welcoming and friendly.

Address: 4905 50th Ave Yellowknife, NT X1A 3X8 Canada
Review: We are visiting Yellowknife from Toronto, and we were quite surprised to find a Middle Eastern restaurant here, but I have to say the food and customer service is excellent!! We loved it so much that we ate here two times within 3 days! The food is very authentic and the owners are lovely, we highly recommend this spot!

Address: 5030 50th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 3R8 Canada
Review: Delicious Ethiopian food in the middle of Yellowknife, who would of guessed? This place is absolutely worth a visit. Yes the prices are quite high, but this is Yellowknife we are talking about, so it’s relative to the remote location. Excellent flavors, friendly service and in the middle of town.

Address: 5030 50th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 3R8 Canada
Review: I’m rating such because it’s very very expensive.. place was almost empty .. food is unique and good service. Served in beautiful containers, though I did not particularly enjoy the taste as much of some of the salad and coffee , it takes some adaptation, but worth a visit for authentic try of Ethiopian food.

Address: 5030 50th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 3R8 Canada
Review: Delicious food and good atmosphere to this place. Really enjoyed the goat curry and my fam enjoyed their food as well (chicken curry, beef special, and a lentil dish). Would recommend it for a good meal. Portion size was large and none of us could finish before getting full.

Address: 5030 50th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 3R8 Canada
Review: Went for lunch even though we're not very hungry but wanted to try the food. Wrong move - the food was amazing but the portion size is just too big! I think the portion size works for two moderately hungry people. I ordered the curry chicken and rice platter which comes with a vegetable salad. The food is very flavoursome and irresistible. Warning, if you feel the food is hot don't try the sauce/chutney served with the platter thinking it'll make things cooler - it's HOT!😁 I also tried some stuff from the Mahiberawi Combination that my friend got and instantly regretted that I didn't get it. I'd totally try that with rice!

Address: 5030 50th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 3R8 Canada
Review:
Good authentic Ethiopian cuisine. Food is flavourful.

I had the Zehabesha TIBS; I'm not a fan of the bone-in meat (lamb) pieces, but otherwise it's tasty.

Address: 4825 49th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 2R3 Canada
Review:
The Bison ribeye was perfect, and the service was exemplary.
My wife had the Ming Ling Cod and thoroughly enjoyed it (A Japanese friendly flavour).
A fantastic meal, I highly recommend this restaurant.

Address: 4825 49th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 2R3 Canada
Review: Underwhelmed by this place for the price. Ordered a mushroom and prosciutto stuffed chicken thigh in an orange sauce. The sauce was overly sweet and wasn't counterbalanced with a savoury enough filling. I couldn't find any trace of prosciutto in the stuffing, and if it was there I couldn't taste it. I mentioned my thoughts to the waiter, who said he's inform the chef, but I never heard back. Others in our party also didn't feel they received value for their money.

Address: 4825 49th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 2R3 Canada
Review: I love eating at the Traders Grill. Good food every time, although expensive. Today I had the Vindaloo chicken curry. Served with garlic infused rice and naan bread. This is not the creamy curry you may be expecting. It's chicken and rice has a nice broth with fresh tomatoes. A healthy choice that hits the curry craving perfectly. Loved it.

Address: 4825 49th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 2R3 Canada
Review: Food was okay tasting, but they gave me six baby potatoes. SIX! An insulting amount of potatoes. So much empty space on the plate. I had to drink all the ketchup and cream to be full by the end of the meal. I just think people should know how many potatoes they can expect so they aren't let down like me. Thank you please.

Address: 4825 49th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 2R3 Canada
Review: Do not eat here. very unimpressed with service. Waited over 5 minutes for a host to seat us when it was not busy. After being seated for 5 min waiter asked what we would like to eat. Didn't start with drinks or apps. Over priced, all mains 45$. I had the boar tenderloin and rabbit casserole. tenderloin its self was good, however they give you pretty much hickory sticks and this corn cheese puree as sides which were very under seasoned no flavour. The rabbit casserole had good flavour after spending 5 minutes picking out all the bones. The entire time no one asked how everything was, if we wanted more drinks, even when paying didn't ask how meal was. 2 people, 107$ very unhappy.

Address: 100 Borden Drive Unit 1 Yellowknife, NT X0E 3W1 Canada
Review: Really good burger, big, well cooked, not dry. Fries were hot and fresh. Pop didn't have much taste, but whatever. It's all about the burger!

Address: 100 Borden Drive Unit 1 Yellowknife, NT X0E 3W1 Canada
Review: We came in from out of town, and decided on fat burger for lunch. We ordered from the app and arrived at the time specified. The food was on the counter and it took a good few minutes for someone to acknowledge we were, so we had to flag someone down from the kitchen to get our order. We sat down and it seemed all the tables were dirty or had something on them. The food was not very good, considering what you pay for it and most of the normally amazing chicken strips were uneatable and the poutine was flavourless. The food used to be really good, but I’m sad to say we won’t be going back.

Address: 100 Borden Drive Unit 1 Yellowknife, NT X0E 3W1 Canada
Review: It's one of the very few restaurants that you can find, if you want to have Sandwich for breakfast. The food is pretty decent. The buffalo chicken burger from here, was my go-to food, during the days I visited Yellowknife. But please try to avoid the carbonated drinks as they all taste like sugar water and are not carbonated at all.

Address: 100 Borden Drive Unit 1 Yellowknife, NT X0E 3W1 Canada
Review:
Place is okay. Bit more greasy than the fatburger in Vancouver I find. Good fries.

Advertised beer but when I ordered a corona I was told they didn't have any beer. Also, fountain drink machine wasn't working.

Address: 100 Borden Drive Unit 1 Yellowknife, NT X0E 3W1 Canada
Review: It was a lovely surprise to find a Fatburger here in Yellowknife. As the first time trying their food, I can say this is definitely of my top 5 burger joints.

Address: 5309 Franklin Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 1E3 Canada
Review: Such a fabulous spot! The owners are amazing. The food is so great! The sushi is absolutely delicious. The atmosphere to dine in is perfect! Definitely one of the best places to eat in YK! :)

Address: 5309 Franklin Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 1E3 Canada
Review: Forced to charge 15% tips, without prior notice, the food is very bad

Address: 5309 Franklin Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 1E3 Canada
Review: The food was served fresh and was pretty good. We had ginger beef, edamame, mixed tempura, chicken skewers, gyoza, and a few different maki rolls with sake to drink. The food was prepared fresh and the ginger beef was great, the only thing I'd change about it is a little less sauce so it didn't pool at the bottom of the dish when you were getting to the end. The service was quite good. They refilled our drinks promptly, were pleasant to deal with, and even advised us that we might have ordered too much food even though it meant a bigger bill. I would recommend trying this place out.

Address: 5309 Franklin Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 1E3 Canada
Review:
- Take out lunch for 2 people
- Sushi Rolls (Vegan)
- just after lunch rush

Symmary:  Great food, and service.  Will return and recommend. 4/5

Address: 5309 Franklin Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 1E3 Canada
Review: I’ve been there basically once a year and this is the first time that I’m giving it a bad review, the quality has gone down dramatically over the last two years and the prices are outrageous. My friend and I spent nearly $80 for two people and we still want to McDonald’s afterwards to fill up.

Address: 200 4910 50th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 3M3 Canada
Review: This restaurant was bit pricey but very kind and we could eat so tasty sushi

Address: 200 4910 50th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 3M3 Canada
Review: Made my order super fast when I was in a hurry.  Food was fresh and fantastic.  Sushi is traditional sushi so there were no surprises.  Prices were reasonable.  Service was fast!

Address: 200 4910 50th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 3M3 Canada
Review: The sushi is pretty good here. Very limited types of fish. I did not enjoy the lettuce in the rolls, I just have never had that before.

Address: 200 4910 50th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 3M3 Canada
Review: Pleasantly surprised that there is sushi in Yellowknife. Service was quick and friendly. Considering where we are, I can only assume prices are reasonable. I had an Arctic char platter with 3 nigiris, 3 pc roles, and 6 maki pieces for $20. I wish they would be a little more generous with the portions, but in the context of where we are, it's fair.

Address: 200 4910 50th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 3M3 Canada
Review: Despite operated by Japanese staffs, the overall experience was disappointing. Pricy but what I got was tasteless and overcooked udon, poorly made sushi.

Address: 483 Range Lake Road Yellowknife, NT X1A 3R9 Canada
Review: Don't let reviews by drama queens scare you away. The staff are quite pleasant, helpful and accommodating without being uppity. We both had the Friday prime rib special and it was good. Portions are large. I had a rather unique drink and it was a refreshing one. I've only been to this restaurant four times in the more than 25 that it has been here and it has always been fine. Yes, prices definitely are higher than drive-through.

Address: 483 Range Lake Road Yellowknife, NT X1A 3R9 Canada
Review: The food here is delicious (house made pasta), they are great with kids, and on Friday and Saturdays they have a pianist! Such a wonderful comfortable atmosphere.

Address: 483 Range Lake Road Yellowknife, NT X1A 3R9 Canada
Review: Wonderful service and great live music (piano). Food was pretty good, everything (especially the sauces) was a bit salty though.

Address: 483 Range Lake Road Yellowknife, NT X1A 3R9 Canada
Review: Went on a Friday with a piano player great romantic atmosphere very cute and intimate venue.

Address: 483 Range Lake Road Yellowknife, NT X1A 3R9 Canada
Review: Food was amazing! Nice staff. Seafood Linguine is sooooo good!

Address: 5102 48th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1N6 Canada
Review:
Successfully delivers on the Boston Pizza experience. Would come back again.

Also learned if you pet the robot that delivers food it will react lol

Address: 5102 48th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1N6 Canada
Review: This is got to be THE worst sports bar in the country.  They might play the game but will NOT turn up the volume and the waiter is somewhat rude and very quick with you if you ask for a particular game. For $10 a beer and not cheap food you would think they would be more willing to make your experience better. If you want to watch the playoffs, save you $$ and stay home!

Address: 5102 48th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1N6 Canada
Review: We had a bad experience with one waiter in the bar. he treated us in a strange way. but restaurant food was very good and have big portions too

Address: 5102 48th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1N6 Canada
Review: BPs is reliable to have good food and mediocre service. Not necessarily bad service, but nothing extraordinary. Loved the Cactus cuts and Thai Chili Chicken bites, the nachos were lacking

Address: 5102 48th Street Yellowknife, NT X1A 1N6 Canada
Review: Today I visted here for just drinks around 10 and the place was bit busy on bar side. The server checked our ids and never came back to take order. He should have notified us that its gonna take a while as it was more than 20 mins already as we were trying to make some eye contact to order. If someone cannot handle the work then they should not take the table. We had to get up and move to the family side to get our drinks. The server at the other side was really good and servered us nicely.

Address: 5201 50th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 3S9 Canada
Review: Nestled in the heart of Yellowknife's old town, this charming sit-out spot captures the hearts of tourists and locals alike. Its ideal location within walking distance of several tourist hotels adds to its convenience. With prices comparable to Starbucks, it offers a sweet respite in the chilly Yellowknife weather. The hot beverages are truly refreshing, and we particularly enjoyed their delectable sandwiches. However, we weren't as fond of their soup. Despite this minor setback, this spot remains a captivating haven for a cozy break in Yellowknife.

Address: 5201 50th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 3S9 Canada
Review: Nice place. Modern atmosphere. Feels a bit generic. The latte is surprisingly good and i like the fact that this place opens late. No complaints, yet nothing really stands out. This is a bit of a shame, as i would not have given it a second look in passing. This is a bit of a hidden gem. To nit pick, the coke fridge looks out of place.

Address: 5201 50th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 3S9 Canada
Review: This place is good & the staff were friendly. I inly tried a latte & it was good. Will try something different & update if I go here again.

Address: 5201 50th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 3S9 Canada
Review: Loved our lattes and the cranberry muffin  .     We tried two places on the day we went   and  the lattes here at  javoroma  were alot better then the other place we tried .

Address: 5201 50th Avenue Yellowknife, NT X1A 3S9 Canada
Review: This is one of the nice, cozy sit out place for the tourists and locals in Yellowknife. It’s located right in the centre of the old town and is at walkable distance from the tourist hotels. We had been there twice during our stay in YK and had some refreshing, hot brews.

Address: 312 D Old Airport Road Yellowknife, NT X1A 3T3 Canada
Review: Not even close to the standard expected from Pizza Hut elsewhere. Pan pizza crust was soggy and none of the specials offered elsewhere were honoured. Trying to order online in disabled as the website does not recognize addresses and tells you to call in.

Address: 312 D Old Airport Road Yellowknife, NT X1A 3T3 Canada
Review: Too expensive and most of the time poor service edit. we called pizza hut to place an order for delivery. This was our order one large half pepperoni half Hawaiian pizza and one large bread sticks with cheese the total without tax was $72.00 and when we tried to order the exact samething on the pizza hut app it was only 57.00 something why such a price difference

Address: 312 D Old Airport Road Yellowknife, NT X1A 3T3 Canada
Review: We ordered from here twice, only bcuz we gave it a 2nd chance, and it was bad both times. We normally prefer Pizza Hut but this location leaves the pan crust Pizza extremely doughy, the inside of the crust both times was almost raw dough, and its not like they're the cheapest either.  Unfortunate since it would only take a few more minutes in the oven to make it a great Pizza.

Address: 312 D Old Airport Road Yellowknife, NT X1A 3T3 Canada
Review: Tried to order after having multiple errors using the app was instructed to call the store. After waiting on hold for 15 minutes was told by the employee that they couldn't do anything and that a manager would help then promptly hung up on me. Had to deny the payment through my credit card company.

Address: 312 D Old Airport Road Yellowknife, NT X1A 3T3 Canada
Review: Pizza a bit tooooo greasy I've had some looking like it was dipped in oil/butter ....and prices are steeper than other spots in town, guess it depends what type of taste your into too.....staff also is quit unfriendly and always seem upset 🤦🏻‍♀️ and operating hours can be good to closed. I've driven there a few times only to find it closed so had to head to dominos 🤷🏻‍♀️

Address: 100 Borden Drive Unit 21 Yellowknife, NT X1A 3W6 Canada
Review: Worst sandwich ever. Given a 6' veggie with finger picked lettuce from the old tray (redish strains, discolored lettuce) and a full load of jalapeños. The customer just before me gets a big bowl of fresh lettuce from a fresh tray. I don't know why the difference ? Was my sandwich cheaper, lol Or they decide on whos who ? I would have asked for more however, gave up and decided wont come back. Wonder if anyone does any surprise checks on their quality.

Address: 100 Borden Drive Unit 21 Yellowknife, NT X1A 3W6 Canada
Review: Subway is another must stop for my family when we are in YK. It's quick, and the service is great. The food is always good, IMO. If you like subs, definitely check it out as an alternative to other fast food restaurants. Eat in or take out, subway is great.

Address: 100 Borden Drive Unit 21 Yellowknife, NT X1A 3W6 Canada
Review: The service here has been on the decline for some time. Three staff behind the counter loading the cooler with drinks. Stood there without acknowledgement. In my opinion someone should at least let you know that they will be a minute. Waited a few minutes.  Not until I said Really? Did someone say anything. Then the response was almost passive aggressive. “We will be there in a minute”. Left promptly. Will NOT be returning.

Address: 100 Borden Drive Unit 21 Yellowknife, NT X1A 3W6 Canada
Review:
This place has gone downhill and staff don’t care. 6” tuna sub for $9 and they gave less than a full one scoop of tuna. Let her know it’s supposed to be 2 full scoops and she gave attitude and added the rest of the 1/4 of the first scoop even though another staff told her it’s 2 (she ignored it).
Continued to do a sloppy job of veggies, sauce and wrapping and pretended she didn’t know better when I called her out on it.
Nowhere to put a complaint forward to management so you get an online review instead. Do better.

Address: 100 Borden Drive Unit 21 Yellowknife, NT X1A 3W6 Canada
Review: I've only been here twice, both times ordered the same thing. A mini bun sandwich and soup. And it was so friggn good. Same guy made my food both times too. Don't drink from the fountain drink machine though. We got sprite and a bunch of black debris  was floating around so we got a bottled beverage instead.

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review: The vibe of the place is simply amazing. We were seated inside which was so convenient as you can enjoy the atmosphere and stay warm in the cool nights. The server was so helpful with his suggestions. The food is so tasty! Full of flavor, properly served and you will be waiting for the next bite to indulge on the combination of flavors. The dessert is simply prefect, not too sweet yet memorable! We went late night so there were out of paella on a busy Sunday night yet it looked so good and I would definitely recommend giving it a try!

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review: Very attentive staff! Very good food and a wonderful atmosphere! Had the daily paella, and the patatas bravas, both were exceptional!! Slightly expensive but definitely worthwhile if youre uncertain :)

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review:
The seafood in the daily Paella was so fresh and delicious! I thought I would pack some to go, as it's a portion for 2, but I couldn't stop eating it.. Tinto de Verano was exactly the same as I had it in Spain! I definitely will be coming back to try more dishes.
It's a romantic date spot, especially in the summer!
The service was fantastic, thank you, ladies!
See you soon!

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review:
Food is fantastic and service is great!
I love chicharrones so much!! Paella is on point as well! Paella is good for two people.

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review:
Great little place, enjoyed the food and the sangria,  the paella was quite good and not overly salty like some other places.
Busy place better make a  reservation before u go.

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review: I ordered a Flat White and it was the best coffee I’ve had so far. The food is tasty and the raspberry tart is nice. Staff are so friendly. The cafe is small but it still could cater for around 14 people. It’s a very nice place to have a lunch and coffee in a cozy afternoon.

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review:
We are extremely disappointed with our experience today with the manager of this coffee shop. We bought their coffee and canelé (the pastry in the picture) and got something from the coffee shop next door then picked a outside seat at Mon Pitou. The manager rudely kicked us out because we had something which is not from them placed on the table. They must have the sign if they don't allow outside food/drink. But we respected it and moved to  a table of the shop next door. He clearly looked down on us. He suddenly touched (tapped) my boyfriend's shoulder without asking and interrupted him. By the way, the canelé tastes bad. It seemed old, dry and over-burned. I will never come back here again.
Today we were able to experience food/ drink and service of Mon Pitou and Wicked Cafe. If you were to choose between two, we would recommend Wicked Cafe.

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review: The brunch here is exceptional. Without a doubt, the hollandaise sauce is the finest I've ever tasted. The ambiance is simply delightful, reminiscent of the beautiful southern region of France. Furthermore, the staff are incredibly kind and hospitable. If you're in Vancouver, you simply must come here. This is a charming location to enjoy Sunday brunch. The quality of the ingredients is excellent, and the washroom is beautifully designed. Despite the focus on French cuisine, there are also vegan choices available.

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review:
Mon Pitou is perfection. The ambience is so carefully thought out and fun, the coffee is spectacular and full of flavor, and the food is outstanding! You really can’t ask for more, Vancouver is lucky to have a French cafe of this quality.

I got the ham and cheese danish and a cortado and couldn’t have been more pleased. Can’t wait to come back to try more things. The music and atmosphere is so relaxing 🙏🏽 🇫🇷

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review: The food is always fantastic, and the staff are so great. My husband and I often stop by for their breakfast sandwiches, but their actual brunch is really good. Pricey, but all brunch places are getting to be pricier these days, so it isn't really surprising or unexpected.  My only complaint is that it feels a bit cramped when it gets busy, but it can't be helped given the constraints of the location.

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review: I visited this restaurant several times already and I really like the food and drinks they serve, and the service provided in this place. The interior is very modern and nice. So if you are interested to taste a Ukrainian food prepared with some modern flavour then this is one of the best places to go in Vancouver.  You can also purchase some very nice bread and home made cookies there as well!

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review:
This is the perfect place to go to have a nice dinner with friends! The restaurant is busy but not too full (reservations available), the staff are quite friendly, the food is very pleasant and the atmosphere is comfortable.

We had the chicken kyiv and cabbage rolls (the rolls were juicy and stoodout most).

The real showstopper was the bakery! So fresh and delicious. We really enjoyed the double chocolate chip cookie, the pistachio chocolate chip cookie and the BABKA dark chocolate slice. Absolutely delightful. We will get the full babka loaf for a family special occasion!

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review: Delicious food and very attentive employees. My family and I had a wonderful experience trying the diffrent Ukrainian foods they had to offer. I would totally recommend the beet salad and the mushroom & chicken crepes. Overall it was a great experience.

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review:
A fantastic restaurant, genuine European food. Good selection of beers and wine fantastic cocktails.  They have a bakery onsite and delicious cakes.

Great area with Irish pubs and bars nearby. And a very stylish interior.

Highly recommended  I visited twice!

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review:
The food was extremely delicious. We usually make Gulash at home, but always wanted to try Borsch and it was fantastic.

Rita, our waitress, was very nice and attentive. Service was excellent and fast.

The desserts are to die for.

You must try it. You won't be dissapointed

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
Best Poké I’ve had. And I’ve had a lot…

I got the Island Bowl and was seriously impressed… the fish just tastes so fresh and has an irresistible marinade coating. All the ingredients were bursting with flavor and worked together so well… was a bit steep at $15-20 per bowl but ended up being so good that I’d go again.

Definitely recommend trying this place!

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: Delicious poke with crunchy and umami toppings. Requested the tangerines on the side and the service kindly put the portion into small containers.

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
“When life gives you lemons… squeeze them, add salt, garlic, oils, honey, and create a marinade for cubed fish”…….this is what I imagine the owners think at Island Poke.

Very fresh and bright ingredients. I had the Ohana bowl for lunch. A great size and prepared by friendly staff. I will be back. Yum.

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: I can't say enough about how great this gem is. I go almost every day because the food is so good and affordable with hearty portions and delicious recipes. The staff are friendly, they remember your name, and always go the extra mile.

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
The food was exceptionally fresh and excellent tasting. I ordered a bowl 🥣.
All kinds of choices for your bowl. You can pretty much have it made the way you want it. The service was great we got to watch our food be made right in front of us. Stayed at the restaurant to eat, and this little place was cozy.
I'm not much for raw sushi type foods. I'll tell you one thing,, I was impressed and probably will go back.

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: This is the second time I've stayed here. I love it, the rooms are small and still use the old style hot water heating radiator so if it's cold in there it will take a bit to heat up. There is no AC so I'd expect it can get hot in the summer. The hotel has a colourful history and is over 100 years old. The hallways are adorned with Emily Carr Paintings (she died there) also the hotel supposedly is one of the most haunted in Canada although I haven't experienced anything while there.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you're into older style hotels that aren't just another boring place then this place is for you.

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review:
This is one of my favorite spots for dinner when in town.  I’ve tried almost everything on the menu and have yet to find something I didn’t enjoy.

In addition to the regular menu, they have specials each evening, which typically include a pasta and a main entree.  These can sell out quickly on busy nights.

The Caesar salad is amazing and I always get one!

There are several vegetarian options and the veggie burger is great.

Bar options are limited in the restaurant but you can enjoy beer or wine with your meal.

Service is always friendly and attentive and the atmosphere is cozy.

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: Nice old place in the heart of James bay 10 min walk from down town no line up big and roomy  ordered a full candaron breakfast first bite amazing. Tastes like home made bread  vary happy with the size of the breakfast. The service is good. If you like a place for breakfast without a line up  this is your place parking is easy too

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: Overall good!  Food was good proportions generous,  tasted pretty good although my steak sandwich could use more seasoning and less cooking.  Service was excellent, atmosphere was excellent both restaurant and pub, prices very reasonable. Would like to try again.

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: Can't say enough great things about this hotel! Immaculately clean. Roy at the desk was a gem. Dinner in the bar was great with friendly conversation, and they accommodated us when we said we needed our breakfast to be quick. Great location to visit the stunning Beacon Hill Park. Rooms are small, but that's to be expected for an historic hotel like this. Highly recommend!

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: We stopped here for an early dinner to wait out rush hour on the Malahat Highway. So glad we did! The food (especially the bisque!), atmosphere on the outdoor patio, and eagerness of staff to please were stellar . . .  Five stars PLUS. Service, despite the shortage of wait staff, was good. Will definitely visit here again.

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review:
1. chicken supreme
- so good! soft n tender, mushroom sauce and cabbage was right on the point 10/10!
2. lobster bisque
- amazingly good and i love the texture, could be more salty and richer though
3. french fries
- hot and crispy just perfecto

in general: very good service, there was a bit of waiting for the food but that’s fine, dinners good!

ratings: 9/10

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: This is a cozy little restaurant very warm atmosphere, the food is amazing we came for breakfast several times while on vacation in Victoria.

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: Very nice patio and two different menus options ( you can also order from The Penny Farthing menu). I only don’t give them a 5 star review because the menu doesn’t specify what the gluten free options or any other dietary options are. The service was good and they are pet friendly at the patio. I had a gluten free Brie pear prosciutto chicken burger. It was good but later on I realized that I could have opted for lettuce wrap and my server didn’t even mentioned anything. Anyway we enjoy our food and will definitely come back. 😊

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: First time dining here this weekend and was very pleasantly surprised it lived up to the hype! Best french onion soup I've ever had and escargot was fantastic. Will definitely be back!

Restaurant_name: Lady of the Lake Cafe & Pub
Address: 135 17th Street N Brandon, MB R7A 1G6 Canada
Review:
Great vibe here, Delicious food and great social times.  The entire staff is so welcoming and friendly.

Love the beer that they serve and make me go to the local store to get more during the trip. The small vintage shop next to the restaurant do have a lot of item that's nice to pick up as a souvenir for friend. Great restaurant and must try if you are in the area.

Restaurant_name: Lady of the Lake Cafe & Pub
Address: 135 17th Street N Brandon, MB R7A 1G6 Canada
Review:
It’s a lovely morning to be here for breakfast (or brunch) with my friends!! Everything is delicious and so fresh! I like their cheesecake, too! So full and happy, also they have a lot of decors in the store, you can find some good staff for your sweet home!! Christmas is coming soon, why not take a look, Right?
✅ Parking Lot
✅ Kids meal
✅ Wheel chair
✅ Family restaurant
✅ Shopping
✅ Coffee and drinks
✅ Home Decor

Restaurant_name: Lady of the Lake Cafe & Pub
Address: 135 17th Street N Brandon, MB R7A 1G6 Canada
Review: I recently travelled from BC to visit family , my grandma brought us here for lunch and we were blown away. I am vegan and was treated with the most respect. Our server went above and beyond for me to create meals I could eat and without even asking checked on what desserts were vegan. The waitress was incredible , kind and truly gave the atmosphere a beautiful ambiance. I got the falafel wrap with hummus , the best wrap I’ve had in a restaurant!! The food here was so incredible beautiful and fresh , if you are wanting a place to eat that will make you feel nourished come here. Thank you for the outstanding service , it truly meant the world🤍

Restaurant_name: Lady of the Lake Cafe & Pub
Address: 135 17th Street N Brandon, MB R7A 1G6 Canada
Review: AMAZING!!!! Great place to hang out and get a tea or coffee, I loved it! I got the Earl Grey tea and a cinnamon roll and it was amazing! The shop next to it was a lot of fun to look around to!

Restaurant_name: Lady of the Lake Cafe & Pub
Address: 135 17th Street N Brandon, MB R7A 1G6 Canada
Review: We thought we'd treat ourselves today and go to The Lady of the Lake. Hot chocolate,  giggle juice, pineapple juice and coffee, all excellent. The girls had the pizza which was the perfect portion for them, the ice cream and cookie were lovely additions as well. Prairie fries, Thai wraps and curry chicken sandwiches were also ordered and enjoyed. All in all, this is a great place to eat, you get what you pay for and the ambiance is definitely part of the experience.

Address: 555 34 Street Brandon, MB R7B 3P8 Canada
Review: Went for the Buffet that other day. Food was great. My wife was happy as they had some gluten free options. Will be back.

Address: 555 34 Street Brandon, MB R7B 3P8 Canada
Review:
Dahi bhalla was too good ✨
Other things were extra spicy so the flavours were not balanced.

Address: 555 34 Street Brandon, MB R7B 3P8 Canada
Review: On our way from Edmonton to Winnipeg we enjoyed a very delicious lunch here. Everything including service is very good

Address: 555 34 Street Brandon, MB R7B 3P8 Canada
Review: Arrived at 6:30pm and was looking forward to a delicious dinner. My parents ordered off the menu, while I explored the buffet. Sadly the buffet featured many items that were overcooked, dried, or inedible.  The shrimp was awesome. The butter chicken dry.  The onion pakora was so dried-out it was impossible to chew. Same with the Potato Pakora. Staff were kind and attentive.  Both of my parents menu ordered items were excellent.  I do NOT recommend the buffet.

Address: 555 34 Street Brandon, MB R7B 3P8 Canada
Review: Meet my parents for dinner here on a trip through the province of Manitoba, and had no idea how good it would be. My wife and I regularly eat at traditional Indian restaurants, and wow! It made everything tp perfection in a buffet setting. Even though tonight's selections were missing samosas, 😕,  I still give them 5 stars across the board. Well done!

Address: 1133 Princess Avenue Brandon, MB R7A 0R1 Canada
Review:
I cannot really rate on atmosphere as I did not eat in the restaurant. I was at section 6 which has their menu on each table and you have to order through the brewery. The food was horrible. We waited over an hour for our food. I know we were not priority as we were not in the restaurant but if you are taking my money as a take out order I think you should treat me as a paying customer. We finally had the brewery call the dock to see if our food was coming. Within minute our food was there. Cold and terrible.
I will never be back. Love the dock as a customer when I'm in the restaurant so disappointing when they know I've paid for my food and can't complain to the brewery. If I had more time I would have walked over and said something to the management. If you want your menu displayed on a table treat the customer with a bit of respect . We all work hard for our money. I would have had no problem walking over and picking up my food 30 minutes earlier when it was ready. Places get busy and staff is hard to come by but if you don't have the staff to manage don't put it a service you really can't provide. Look up all my reviews I don't just put the bad places up I love writing a good review 😌. I have been a business owner for over 27 years...

Address: 1133 Princess Avenue Brandon, MB R7A 0R1 Canada
Review: This was my first time coming here, and it did not disappoint. Came with a couple co-workers and it was very busy and obviously short-staffed, as most places nowadays. We were also on a very limited time crunch. The wait was getting long, over 30 min, but when we expressed how we were needing to leave to get back to work, the staff moved our order up., without us even asking! We may have speed-ate our lunch, but it was absolutely delicious!! The prices were a bit high, but that's seen at every place nowadays. I'd recommend this place for a get-together with friends for sure! This is a pub-type environment, which is excellent for a great time with the gang.

Address: 1133 Princess Avenue Brandon, MB R7A 0R1 Canada
Review: Had a great lunch and couple drinks I've never tried before. Great food, friendly service & overall nice atmosphere. We were charged couple dollars more for our meal than what was on the menu & also for the side, but no biggie.

Address: 1133 Princess Avenue Brandon, MB R7A 0R1 Canada
Review:
Chicken wings are my favorite ❤️ It's a lovely place to have dinner with friends!! Beer, wine, cocktail 🍹 everything is perfect for me!! The staff is friendly👍
🚙 parking lots, yes.
🎱 pool with friends, yes.
🍔 Food, fresh and tasty.
🍺 Alcohol, absolutely 👍👍👍👍👍

Address: 1133 Princess Avenue Brandon, MB R7A 0R1 Canada
Review: Love The Dock, I go here with my family for supper nearly anytime I'm in town.  They have a very tasty menu that includes locally sourced ingredients.  If you like a good burger and/or fries, give this place a shot!

Address: 1836 Brandon Ave Brandon, MB R7B 3G8 Canada
Review:
It's really unfortunate that food prices have gotten so horrible that it's being seen in restaurants all over because, I absolutely love The Keg! Aside from what they can't control, this place is still the most amazing places for a romantic dinner. The dishes are still to die for and always the perfect steak! The service is always over-the-top exceptional and without being annoyed by constant interruptions. Beautiful location!
So aside from the prices going up, which they can't control, this is the greatest place to enjoy a nice meal with your partner or staff get-together.

Address: 1836 Brandon Ave Brandon, MB R7B 3G8 Canada
Review:
A truly ‘safe bet’ for a great meal. The restaurant was busy but not packed (that’s a good thing). Very clean. Excellent staff and service. Our waitress (Jocelyn) was attentive and had a great sense of humor.
We were there during their Summer Lobster special menu. The lobster bisque was possibly the best I’ve ever tasted. Everyone had a steak combo and all were very good (as you’d expect).
Dessert was a shared ‘Billy Miner pie’ and strongly suggest saving room for this (best to share…it’s quite generous).
Lots of parking and clean washrooms.

Address: 1836 Brandon Ave Brandon, MB R7B 3G8 Canada
Review:
Maybe The Keg isn't somewhere you'd think to go for good wings, but you'd be mistaken! The Three Pepper Wings are only on their bar menu and not always available. I had the chance to try them a week or so ago and was not disappointed. The chicken was crispy and without all of the fat that some wings can have. They were served with what I'm assuming was a three pepper sauce, which was a mild heat but gave a good kick at times, along with a light blue cheese dressing. There were plenty of blue cheese crumbles on top. I thought the sliced celery was a nice touch because it was incorporated into the dish rather than an afterthought on the side. It's a great dish for those who want to take "wings with a side of blue cheese" to the next level! -1 because I think $17 for 8 wings is expensive, but still something that I'd want to order every so often.

UPDATE: I highly recommend the Prime Rib Sandwich as an alternative to the traditional dinner menu items -- it's less spendy and just as tasty! The tender meat, strong horseradish (it's the best at The Keg), and generous portion of red wine herb jus were all very flavourful. I substituted a Caesar salad instead of fries at no additional cost. It's only $16 during cocktail hour on the bar side. I'll be going back for it again very soon!

Address: 1836 Brandon Ave Brandon, MB R7B 3G8 Canada
Review: Stopped in at The Keg for the first time on a trip thru. Service was phenomenal. Prompt, friendly, food was ready fairly quickly. Serving size is on the small side and price is very high. It's not difficult to approach $80 for one person.

Address: 1836 Brandon Ave Brandon, MB R7B 3G8 Canada
Review: Met up with friends and everyone enjoyed their meals. I didn’t like seeing two of the gals having to struggle cutting their sirloin steaks so I assumed the meat was tough. I never order steak anymore as the last two times I ordered the filet. there was gristle in it. Yum! I like it when the BM pie has some structure to it as ours were sitting out too long before it was served to us.

Address: 2-1830 Park Ave Brandon, MB R7B 0R9 Canada
Review: Rushed our order,  missed many toppings we would love to have. They have a really good and fresh option of food but now I start to feel that your experience and value for money totally depends on the person serving you..

Address: 2-1830 Park Ave Brandon, MB R7B 0R9 Canada
Review: The visit was okay!! I have to wait for 2 mintues to get attended by someone. There was no one on line. I asked for Extra hot salsa they gave me hot. salsa. Food was okay too.

Address: 2-1830 Park Ave Brandon, MB R7B 0R9 Canada
Review:
Great food, excellent quality meat choices cooked and seasoned properly.

Fast service (wasn't very accommodating/not interested in educating me in the options, seemed very bored).  Building "my own burrito" was very quick overall.

However, the prices were way too high. Over 20 bucks for a wrap with mostly rice and corn? Maybe don't have 6 staff on with no customers present, and the prices could be changed. At this price, the food becomes a treat more than a regular go-to for a meal.

Address: 2-1830 Park Ave Brandon, MB R7B 0R9 Canada
Review: Impossible meat is here! All vegans and vegetarians try this in your bowl or burrito you don't be disappointed and don't call to ask if they are sure it's beef ha ha its not it is just cooked perfectly very very filling burrito! Came back again for a veggie burrito so tasty. #Qdoba #burrito #brandon

Address: 2-1830 Park Ave Brandon, MB R7B 0R9 Canada
Review:
I cannot fault the staff or the facility, great people, I mean, really good people work here,  it's clean, that's about it. 33 bucks for a mini burrito bowl and 3 tacos with beverage, no chips, extra anything..... I'd pay that any day of the week... EXCEPT this day. Tiny tacos, they were out of Mini bowls so they used a regular bowl and put the tiniest amount in it. My wife had snacks at work thankfully to hold her thru the day, I hit Burger King on the way to work to fill up.
Pretty disappointed, I don't think I'll ever eat lunch here again, too expensive for what you receive.

Address: Clarion Hotel & Suites 3130 Victoria Avenue Brandon, MB R7B 3Y3 Canada
Review: Staff were awesome service was too didn't find anything wrong with my food ! Atmosphere was nice a little on the cool side but tolerable

Address: Clarion Hotel & Suites 3130 Victoria Avenue Brandon, MB R7B 3Y3 Canada
Review: The beer was great, unfortunately 2 dinners at this place and both were fails. First was the pasta : it is billed as fresh pasta made daily , perhaps it was, but it was swimming in a diluted, weak, Kraft dinner tasting sauce. All there was for veggies was red and green pepper. I know there was other veggies in the kitchen as my wife's steak came with a side of carrots. Second dinner was burger and fries : obviously fries went down at same time as burger,  because fries were plated first and were cold upon arrival. Burger was good tasting, but red peppers ( which are wet, right ? ) don't belong on the bottom bun, because...wait for it, they get soggy. Put them on top of the chicken , this is cooking 101. If you are staying in the hotel, and are being lazy its OK, but don't make an effort to go here....

Address: Clarion Hotel & Suites 3130 Victoria Avenue Brandon, MB R7B 3Y3 Canada
Review: I had "The Hangover" burger and was not disappointed. I would definitely order it again, the burger was juicy and bun was soft.

Address: Clarion Hotel & Suites 3130 Victoria Avenue Brandon, MB R7B 3Y3 Canada
Review: The cinnamon french toast was insanely good. Wish we had this place in Winnipeg. Service was outstanding. Thank you so much!

Address: Clarion Hotel & Suites 3130 Victoria Avenue Brandon, MB R7B 3Y3 Canada
Review: We are staying at the Clarion which also includes the Echo Restaurant. We have eaten there three times, including a party of 8 today. Our server was fantastic, even when we asked to move tables to better accommodate the group. She was on point throughout the meal. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals. We have another night here, and will be going to the Echo for breakfast tomorrow. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay great. One note though, you may want to consider installing large overhead fans to assist the AC, which wasn't able to keep the restaurant comfortably cool. Other than that A++.

Address: 302 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4G1 Canada
Review:
This is a true gem of a place.
The minute you walk in you feel transported to an amazing destination.
The music and decorations in the venue provide the perfect atmosphere for the amazing food that is about to arrive.

The prices were very reasonable. The owners were very friendly and helpful with explaining the menu as I am new to Ethiopian food.

I ordered the beef cha cha and it was phenomenal.. it arrives on a cast iron skillet and is sizzling with the most satisfying of sounds.

The coffee is a must try as well if you stop in here

Address: 302 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4G1 Canada
Review: Friendly service and delicious food. The Tibs beef could be a staple to my diet if I lived closer. We've eaten here more than half a dozen times now and it was great every time. Get it spicy!

Address: 302 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4G1 Canada
Review: What an amazing gem this place is in Brandon. You really have to respect this mom-and-son-owned and operated restaurant because they put their heart and soul into the business of delighting every single customer. We tried Tana combo meat. Food is phenomenal with delightful flavors and aromas that transport you to Ethiopia. Friendly and kind service, and prices are so reasonable. Would definitely come back when in town.

Address: 302 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4G1 Canada
Review:
The most unexpected small town jewel is in Brandon!

In this restaurant you will find the best soulful cuisine and a lovely owner. The flavours and spices were also perfect for me. I was just passing by on my way to Vancouver, and I’m so happy I stumbled on this place. If I can find an Ethiopian restaurant half as good in BC I’ll be blessed!

Thank you for this wonderful and yet so simple experience.

Address: 302 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4G1 Canada
Review: I got the Tana mix combo beef with injera today. The food was so delicious 😋. They also gave me 2 slice of yummy Ethiopian bread, I wish I could know the secret of that bread. Overall 100% recommended. I love it. Thank you so much for your service.

Address: 1300 18th Street Suite 20 Brandon, MB R7A 6X7 Canada
Review:
My first time here was a couple years ago when a few of us drove out from Winnipeg to try their perogy poutine. It was very flavourful and huge portions even with takeout being the only option at the time.

I was finally in the area again recently and decided to give the pretzel "charcuterie" board a try. Everything was delicious but sadly didn't really taste any of the garlic butter that was supposed to be on the pretzel... which was pretty disappointing. Although the candied bacon was great, kettle chips had the perfect crunch, sauce variety was fantastic. Overall it was satisfying but the pretzel itself needs more work. Between two people it was a very filling lunch and could definitely be shared with three!

Customer service was fantastic during both visits. Will definitely be back again.

Address: 1300 18th Street Suite 20 Brandon, MB R7A 6X7 Canada
Review: I ordered the BBQ pulled pork poutine and it's defiantly not just a side. It's more of a meal on its own. I shared with my daughter because the portion was so big. As far as flavor goes, the BBQ sauce wasn't overpowering. The sauce was sweet and tangy but there was hardly no curds and that's what makes a true poutine. Other than that it was still good.

Address: 1300 18th Street Suite 20 Brandon, MB R7A 6X7 Canada
Review: Had the 204 burger and my buddy had the canadian burger and we both agreed it was flavorless. Went here years ago and it was fire, not sure what happened 😕.  For 30 bucks I was expecting better, not even a discount offered so i guess they are hard up. Dont think ill be going here again anytime soon

Address: 1300 18th Street Suite 20 Brandon, MB R7A 6X7 Canada
Review: We came to a soccer tournament in Yorkton and decided to come to Joe beeverz the food was incredible and the beverages were great. The waiter and waitress were friendly and hospitable. We are very pleased with the great service and food was awesome. Thank you for the wonderful time spent at your Bar.

Address: 1300 18th Street Suite 20 Brandon, MB R7A 6X7 Canada
Review: Been wanting to try this restaurant for a few year.  it did not disappoint.  Sports themed.  Great food and service.  The Mushroom Bombs are to to die for.

Address: 39 9th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4A3 Canada
Review:
Fantastic Pizza! In from Ontario and first had it last year, so good I had to order on my repeat visit to Brandon.

Don't be discouraged by the prices, the amount of toppings more than make this worth it.

If you are looking for one of the best pizzas out there definitely order from here

Address: 39 9th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4A3 Canada
Review: Pizza was amazing! We drove to Brandon just to try it. There is no dine in unfortunately, but the man at the counter directed us to a park up the road where we ate at some picnic tables.

Address: 39 9th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4A3 Canada
Review: Good pizza. Lots and lots of toppings but I didn’t like the bacon they used. Great Caesar salad!

Address: 39 9th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4A3 Canada
Review: One of the best pizzas I ever had, quality meats and ingredients. Soo good 🤤

Address: 39 9th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4A3 Canada
Review: Didn't take any photos as there was no dine in option due to renos being done. The food here is absolutely the best omg I've been to a lot of pizza joints and they don't compare to this one. Price is decent and I gotta say the chicken fettuccine Alfredo is hands down the most tastiest I've ever had. Used to be my go to place for pregnancy cravings. My little guy loved it. If your looking for a great pizza and pasta place this is it. I always wished for other locations to be opened but unfortunately the only way to experience the Romanas cuisine is to head to Brandon. I'll have to take some pictures next time as we were on a little road trip and ate in the vehicle. Staff is really friendly very well mannered and polite. Thank you my compliments to the chef very delicious 😋💯❤️💯

Address: 360 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4G1 Canada
Review: Good pizza and service, but only for take out.

Address: 360 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4G1 Canada
Review:
Top quality pizza loaded, and I mean loaded with quality toppings.  Not sure how they get this light, crispy crust to hold up to all the toppings, but they do.  Appreciate that the pizza was not too salty, and how quickly it was delivered.  One of the best in Brandon!
Need to add that Marco might consider wiping their hand prior to closing the box - see photo…

Address: 360 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4G1 Canada
Review: Food used to be so good from here, but the few times we have ordered since the other location open in Winnipeg, not sure if this is a coincidence or not, if all the good cooks are in Winnipeg or something? But once again, this is the 3rd time we’ve had a terrible meal. Not impressed, considering the price we pay. Even the Caesar salad had a weird taste, the lettuce taste almost like fish.

Address: 360 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4G1 Canada
Review: Food is inconsistent...you never know what quality you are going to get. Ingredients vary on the subs that have been on the menu for decades! Prices seem to constantly rise.  Been eating here for over 30 years so it is disappointing.  Not the same place it used to be.

Address: 360 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4G1 Canada
Review: My partner and I frequent pizza express as our go to take out. My partner is gluten free and loves the hot chicken caesar salad without croutons while I enjoy the pierogi pizza! If you are planning on delivery I would suggest calling direct rather than using snappy eats. Unfortunately although requested the salad contained croutons and my partner could not eat it and my pizza contained no chives or green onions. We will still frequent pizza express but will only call from here on out!

Address: 1060 18th Street Brandon, MB R7A 5C1 Canada
Review: Had no cheese I wanted and my sub had very little meat on it compared to usual basically eating a veggie sub

Address: 1060 18th Street Brandon, MB R7A 5C1 Canada
Review:
Excellent, amazing service. The fella who served me remembered who I was and what I liked on my sandwich even though I had not seen him in 6 months.
Will definitely be making all my Subway trips to the mall from now on.
The sandwich was perfect and he did not skimp on the sauce or my toppings. It was the first time in a long time I actually felt full eating a sub.

Far better experience than at the Corral Center location.

Address: 1060 18th Street Brandon, MB R7A 5C1 Canada
Review: Worse experience ordered for sandwich and front side spinach was empty and I asked for spinach and that guy didn’t listen me and said me it’s empty but other guy brought spinach from back side to front and just put it on my sandwich I appreciate other guy

Address: 1060 18th Street Brandon, MB R7A 5C1 Canada
Review: Rude staff and manager. The manager working closing today had the nerve to speak ill about my order under his breath when I was leaving, when I asked What he said, he said "nothing dont worry about it". Not only is this manager rude but dishonest as he lied about what he said. I reccomend any other subway.

Address: 1060 18th Street Brandon, MB R7A 5C1 Canada
Review: Worker cut his finger trying to make sub, then didn't change the bread.

Address: 2-1140 Richmond Avenue Brandon, MB R7A 1M6 Canada
Review: Husband picked up take-out from Boston Pizza tonight. We haven't had BP for a long time and I've always liked their Crispy chicken pecan salad in the past. This time, so disappointing, the salad was definitely not worth the $20 for only two tiny chicken fingers and 11 pecans. I realize food has gone up in price but this was ridiculous. Won't be ordering from BP again anytime soon. Not worth the money.

Address: 2-1140 Richmond Avenue Brandon, MB R7A 1M6 Canada
Review:
Friendly staff, restaurant was very clean, food was okay. I had the spaghetti with meatballs and cheese, but weirdly enough they didn't have a big enough bowl to serve it in. So they served me a 2 meatball plate and a kids sized 1 meatball one. Very strange to have two bowls in front of you. Just order bigger bowls!

It was a large serving but not too tasty. Meatballs were not fresh, spaghetti sauce tasted like a canned sauce, pasta slightly overcooked. Wouldn't order that again.

The kid's food was okay, he had chicken strips with fries.
Appetizers we're alright for the price.

The restaurant had TV's everywhere and the kids menus came with a coloring book and crayons.

Overall verdict: fun for kids but don't go out of your way for the food.

Address: 2-1140 Richmond Avenue Brandon, MB R7A 1M6 Canada
Review: The staff are great and always rechecks your experience by genuinely asking how you enjoyed your order. They show appreciation for your experience and response by quickly making other suggestions for your dessert if you did not like your order. I liked this personal attention.

Address: 2-1140 Richmond Avenue Brandon, MB R7A 1M6 Canada
Review: I have to say, 5 star all the way to taste and service. Absolutely fantastic meal.

Address: 2-1140 Richmond Avenue Brandon, MB R7A 1M6 Canada
Review:
I had an interview at this location, when i arrived, i had to wait 20 minutes for a manager to come out and greet me.
Once she arrived, she seemed very unorganized. She didn't know my name, knew nothing about my past work experience, and was hesitant about taking my references. After our interview, she ensured me I would be getting a call by the end of the week or the start of the next. 2 weeks go by and i hear nothing. I called the location for any updates on my application. The worker who picked up told me the manager at store was in a meeting, she told me to leave a message and that I'd get a call back soon. Another hour goes by, still nothing, so i call again.
A different worker picks up the phone but she tells me that there hasn't been a manager at the restaurant all day. I leave a message again and i still haven't gotten a call back. I am extremely disappointed by the unprofessionalism shown by the staff and management.

Address: 2040 Marshall Lane Brandon, MB R7C 0C9 Canada
Review: Enjoyed the server who was working really hard at accommodating all the customers in the bar area. I thought the lasagna with additional meatballs was not great but ok (it had been a while I think BP had changed the recipe). The Mac and cheese were ok as well. The beer was great, lol. Overall though a positive experience.

Address: 2040 Marshall Lane Brandon, MB R7C 0C9 Canada
Review: We always enjoy ourselves at Boston Pizza in Brandon Manitoba. We purchased hot wings, onion soup, and salad. Really good. They need a pool table though. Only complaint about atmosphere.

Address: 2040 Marshall Lane Brandon, MB R7C 0C9 Canada
Review: Always loved Boston pizza. I think fresh their pizza is among the best in the business. Expensive but good. Anyway today the pizza I had was ALL sauce. No toppings really just sauce. And then 4.50 for a bottled water is a hard price gauge.  Even the carnival ( an event where you expect to pay $) charges 4 bucks flat

Address: 2040 Marshall Lane Brandon, MB R7C 0C9 Canada
Review: My husband got stuck in Brandon for a few days due to icy road conditions and had dined in this restaurant all 3 days. 5-star food, nice people. Soup was delicious (every day they make different soup), ribs were superb, wings were amazing. They serve beer and offer takeout as well. We will stop by this place every time when travelling on highway 1, top notch dining experience!

Address: 2040 Marshall Lane Brandon, MB R7C 0C9 Canada
Review:
Amazing pizza and service!  Boston Pizza is one of my favourite pizzas, but over the past year or so we have stopped going to Boston Pizza is Winnipeg, due to low food quality.
So pleased that the pizza at this north Brandon location was just perfect.  Awesome crust, sauce and fresh toppings.  Service was outstanding!

Address: 2-1350 18th Street Brandon, MB R7A 5C4 Canada
Review: Had a $70 order I did online for delivery.  After 2 hours no food still.  Went in to the store and they were just about to finally leave with my order. Had to ask for the driver cost back as they were just going to keep that and the tip.  Food was cold after assured it was still fresh.  Head office wouldn’t return my calls and I only got a cheesy email for a free small popcorn chicken.

Address: 2-1350 18th Street Brandon, MB R7A 5C4 Canada
Review: Chicken was flavorless and greasy. Fries were stone cold upon delivery. The "gravy" was basically brown water with ZERO flavor. I remember now why I stopped ordering from you guys and from now on, Mary Brown's will get all my business. Teach your cook how to properly mix your gravy and how to properly bread the chicken. It isn't THAT difficult. Terrible terrible.

Address: 2-1350 18th Street Brandon, MB R7A 5C4 Canada
Review: In some desperate need of better management. Wrong orders, miscommunication, lots of confusion between staff. Tastes nothing like what KFC used to taste like.

Address: 2-1350 18th Street Brandon, MB R7A 5C4 Canada
Review:
Missing several items from order. This is by far the worst KFC I've ever been to. Managment needs to change.

How hard is it for them to read an itemized receipt? 4pc does not mean 2pc. Check your order before you leave.

Address: 2-1350 18th Street Brandon, MB R7A 5C4 Canada
Review: Your Store closes at 9pm, came in at 8:50 to buy a bucket of chicken and said to us, we don't have any cooked chicken left? So cook some chicken you lazy........ if you are open till 9pm have chicken, that's what u sell!

Address: 305 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4E9 Canada
Review: I ordered pasta deal, 2 lasagna,  2 cheese cake, 6 garlic breads, 2 can coke for pick up. They have the best lasagna in town. The guy at the counter was very pleasant, and the staff all looked happy to be there. This will be my first choice the next time I decide to order food. Good value , and everything was super delicious.

Address: 305 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4E9 Canada
Review: Haven't been in Little Italy pizzeria for a few years. We ordered over the phone and had issues right away on trying to understand what we wanted. So after that order was placed and we walk into the store.  MY F.G... so dirty gross floors and walls and nobody wear gloves that were preparing the food. Some touching their face all huddled over food being made.. gross.  We bought 4 meals and only got 1 drink and chips.. should have been 4 drinks 4 bag of chips. Gross if I could give zero stars I would.. disappointing when did they change owners???

Address: 305 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4E9 Canada
Review: Came in from Regina around 1am had our pizza by 1:20 and was absolutely amazing would definitely recommend

Address: 305 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4E9 Canada
Review:
It’s hard to pick a starting point for this review.  But in order of importance I guess haha 😛

The Caesar dressing 🥺 not sure what makes it so good but I could drink it. 10/10

Saki is great! (My usual delivery pal) Always so polite and smiling. 10/10

Quality of food 10/10

Speed of delivery 10/10 because I KNOW you’re always busy.

Address: 305 10th Street Brandon, MB R7A 4E9 Canada
